Summary: Great stay . Perfect location. Clean rooms. Staff superb. We stayed in Club and would highly recommend. Lovely food and wine and you don’t have to leave the hotel. Staff were great we made great friends with Glynndanna , Shane , Robert and Dustin. There is building work all around so beware but it didn’t intrude as we were at t the park all day as it was too cold to use the pool  We left here to go to the Roosevelt Hotel in LA. On our last Disney day we were told RH were giving our rooms away to some Oscar luvvies and we were banned from the pool. Currently here being moved to a bigger room - big deal still no pool /This is the worst hotel I ve been in. Review to follow

We took advantage of a late winter special, but still paid more than the comparable sites in the area.   The good: - We appreciated the monorail close by that saved us time and distance (also see below) - The rooms were nice and clean and the property was well kept - Goofys kitchen (on-site) has great character interaction if you’re into that  The not-so-good - The staff at check in seemed very tired, slow and uninterested. Not the happiest place on earth by any stretch and the check in line was long - The Early Entry really only applies to less than half the park - the Monorail was down for half of our stay, making the walk similar to most hotels near the park entrance  - The internet was down for half of our stay - The signage around the Hotel’s 3 towers is so bad. Many signs

Summary Heading: just the same as its always been.
Summary: second visit here and its still the same, the problem is i came here 5 years ago with my son, and nothing has changed except for the building work. ( i knew about it beforehand.  now you definitely need to make food reservations before you arrive, so a quick hack, be downstairs in goofy kitchen before 7 am and you stand a chance of just  walking in at the front ith no reservation.  to get your room cleaned bung the cleaner a 50 for the week then good service. be proactive if you see the cart in the corridor grab some milk for coffee.   remember nobody from Disney staff has ever read these reviews or replied to them, so you can be blunt.   the rooms. i stayed in room 2382, its a double queen on the fifth floor, and the view is out over the swimming pool, i asked for a day bed and

Currently still at the Disneyland Hotel but have to say how disappointed I am in this experience. My husband and I have stayed here several times and this is the first time the customer service has been lacking. Check in was ok. We paid for a premium view room, $600/night, and we’re placed on the sixth floor. Pool view room but mostly saw buildings and large trees. When we first checked in we found a container of some kind on sauce on the floor. No big deal. But then 30 min after we checked in, a housekeeper knocked on our door asking to fill the soap dispensers in the shower. We said no problem we were leaving for the parks. The next morning we left for the parks, came back and saw our room had not been cleaned. We called housekeeping before we left to go back to the parks and

Summary Heading: $9000 for a 5 day stay last December
Summary: We gave them $9000.00 for a 5 day stay last December. We couldn't make it. No refund, no credit, not even a future stay? How greedy can you get? They were happy to take my $9000.00.  Rude customer service people, not at all helpful. On hold for hours. Happiest place on Earth?  I don't think so

Summary Heading: We’ll be Back. Love this hotel!
Summary: Great hotel, not cheap but nice and well-themed. We had a great stay and like it better than the Grand Californian. The only real drawback to this hotel is the walk to the parks, that said, we’ll stay here again. Love the music box/bed lights! The Grand Californian is fancier and closer to the parks but this hotel has the Disney magic.

Summary Heading: Indifferent management to lost and found items in hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for our daughter’s birthday. We checked out on Sunday, January 29. After getting home a couple of hours later, we realized that my daughter had left her iWatch in the hotel room. We knew where the item was left and promptly called the hotel to alert them.  Rather than have housekeeping go search the room, we were directed to the general lost and found office for Disneyland as a whole. We filed a report with lost and found and still as of now, Wednesday, February 1 have not heard anything regarding the iWatch. We did contact the hotel guest services out of frustration and told them exactly which room the iWatch was left in and asked them to please check the room. All that happened was we were referred back to lost and found.   We can see from

Summary Heading: Expensive but for our first trip - worth the money
Summary: We had a king room in the Adventure Tower. We were next to the elevator but did not find our room noisy and it was a good location to get in and out of the hotel.   The entrance through to security from just outside the adventure tower is really helpful to save some time in the morning.   Room was in good condition, comfortable and loved the subtle Disney touches and magic headboard (light and sound effects). The theming in lobby areas is retro and nostalgic for the innovation and design of the parks.   The construction of the new DVC tower was not disruptive for us.   We used the pool twice- it was heated and a nice way to cool off in the middle of the day when it was quite warm. The loungers are comfortable and the pool side service friendly and efficient. The cocktails were
Room tip: Use the second set of elevators if the middle ones are busy at peak times

Summary: Many-time visitor to Disneyland, first time stayer at the Disneyland Hotel.  Pros: Early Entry!  30 minutes early is a game changer for the parks. It is very close to Disneyland. Fun views of the parks if you want. All-encompassing Disney vibe.  Music, service, grounds.  It keeps you "in universe." Lightup headboard with a lullaby lamp.  Very fun.    Cons: Expen$ive.  It's Disney.  You can stay in other walkable hotels for half the price. No breakfast included.

Pros:  Location, on site restaurants, on site parking, friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms  Cons:  A little spendy  We stayed in August after completing a stay at another hotel.   Traveling with kids can be a lot and as soon as we walked in the door we felt a giant sigh of relief.  The service is so amazing.  We splurged for club level and arrived at 1pm.   They stored our bags and a cast member escorted us to the E Ticket lounge.  We lounged in air conditioned comfort and enjoyed mimosas, beer, snacks and views of downtown Disney and the parks while we waited for our room to be ready.   We didn't wait long - it was ready around 2:30pm.  The room was well appointed for a family, we were in the Adventure Tower so the rooms are a little smaller than Frontier tower but they
Room tip: Check-in early to enjoy time at the pool while you wait for your room

Summary Heading: Retro nostalgia worth experiencing once, location great, but this is a very basic hotel
Summary: The first and probably last time I'll stay at this on-property Disney hotel. Not because the experience was particularly terrible, but it is really not worth the price. I grew up in Los Angeles and came to Disneyland many times; usually just driving from home in the early morning. I have to admit being a little bit curious about staying in the legendary Disneyland Hotel, part of the original resort concept of Walt Disney. In some respects it doesn't disappoint: the styling is retro and fits the time period the hotel was built, there are of course Disney touches all over, here and there, you get a 30 minute head start on entering the park, etc. But, let's get real - I paid $423 for one night here, except that I bought them via Underground Tourist, a Disney specialist third party

Summary Heading: Don’t stay At Disneyland Hotel!! 0 help is available!
Summary: Where do I start! I mailed a package to the front desk United States post office  several weeks in advanced it was a box containing approximately 45 van Holtens pickles. Why you ask would I send so many? were a group of 6 in the parks they’re outrageously priced! My package came I have proof! Upon checking in I discovered my box of pickles was missing! 1st of all they tried telling me they didn’t receive it! Totally not true, as I have the mailing slip that it was delivered! Next I was told that the box was destroyed, upon arrival! Then I was told sorry! The cast members claim they threw it away! Let’s be real they ate my pickles! They gave me a credit of200.00 not enough compensation for all the hassle I went through! Moving on my 3 bedroom suite bathtub was not working

This was our first trip to Disneyland and staying at the Disneyland Hotel. We were in the adventure tower, floor 7 with a pool view. Our room was great with 2 beds and a sleeper couch. Beds were comfortable and housekeeping was very attentive. The location of the hotel was convenient and close to many restaurant options. The one downside was the eating selection (we have a 6 year old) within the Hotel but it was easy to use Uber eats if you like.

What an expensive disgrace of a hotel  We spent 2 night at the most expensive hotel we have stayed at on a 2 week tour of wonderful California. Check in - we arrive at 3.30 ( check in is 3pm) room is not ready, told we will receive an email as this international hotel ( and only one we encountered in Cali) can’t cope with international phone numbers. At 5 pm we check and indeed the room is ready- no email was EVER delivered.  We booked a a premium downtown view and our view is of an empty lot prepared for construction- photo attached. At no time have housekeeping been seen and our room has not been serviced- the hallway is littered with rubbish and old room service. I call guest services and am left on hold for 20 mins, so I go to front desk where there is a massive queue and

Summary Heading: Great location, although there are a couple of downfalls
Summary: We love this hotel, being the second time we have stayed here. If you are after the whole Disneyland experience this is definitely for you! The beds are comfortable, room sizes reasonable and bathroom well appointed. In terms of eating options though, it is extremely limited if fresh fruit and vege's as well as salads are more your thing. We found the eating options both expensive and too heavy for us. There are much more options eating outside of the whole Disneyland complex.

This hotel is 10 stars if you are a big Disney fan.  Hubby and I stayed one night and loved every second.  Beds are ultra comfy and I loved all the Disney touches.  I’m not sure I recommend for families with younger kids just because the food options aren’t super accessible but highly recommend for everyone else.

Summary Heading: Room requests were ignored and incorrect and unhelpful information was provided
Summary: Planning our family trip to Disneyland with an infant, I wanted to be sure to get a larger sized room so we could fit a pack n' play. I called 3 separate times to ask for a larger room and was told all of the rooms are the same size. This is not true. I ended up reserving a "Deluxe" view room, hoping that with a better view might come a larger room. In addition to calling 3 times to make a request for a larger room, and paying for a "deluxe" view, I got the smallest room size. Our children's godmother who came with us, paid for the same room type, was 2 doors down and had a significantly larger room. We were both in the fantasy tower on floor 4. My sister who also came paid extra for the Downtown Disney view and had an even larger room. So there are at least 3 different room

Summary Heading: Not a good choice for families with younger children
Summary: Well, I should've done my research.  We're a family of three (two parents and a 4 year old) and since our child finally was vaccinated for COVID, we thought a magical trip to the happiest place on earth was a great way to enjoy a bit more freedom.  Unfortunately, I did not do any real research on here or elsewhere and assumed (yes, I know what they say about assuming...) that any Disney property hotel would be child-friendly at a minimum.  Honestly, I still find myself scratching my head trying to figure out what the heck happened here.  So here's the rundown:  1) FOOD - As others have said, your options for food are limited at best, non-existent at worst.  No room service, no food or water included (there was a Keurig with coffee and tea), no preferential treatment for those

We loved this hotel! We got a room in the Frontier Tower & even though it’s further away from everything, we still loved it.   The room was HUGE. 2 big beds, a lovely easy chair, a large TV and we liked the Keurig coffee maker & the fridge stored plenty of bottles of water. The theming here is fantastic! We really liked the separate vanity and bathroom with Mickey taps.   The resort is gorgeous. Even though building work was taking place, it did not impact our stay. We truly loved this hotel & hope to return.   Only negatives: the beds are really high up, the self park is quite a distance from our tower & to get to California Adventure you have to do through downtown Disney which isn’t a short walk. You can get the monorail to Disneyland, but it isn’t running very often. It gets

Summary Heading: Good experience although on the pricey side
Summary: Very convenient to the park. The hotel has been updated and is pretty clean. Overall was quiet even though it was a very busy weekend. The room was perfectly adequate but it is more expensive that other equivalent hotels nearby. You are definitely paying for the experience of being close to the parks and downtown Disney.

We had the privilege of staying at the Disneyland Hotel Executive Floor last month. Our room was celebratory, yet restful. The wall of floor-to-ceiling windows overlooked the Park and Downtown Disney. We watched the gorgeous fireworks display from the comfort of our very spacious room. The real magic, however, was in a huge wooden headboard that spanned the wall behind both beds. The Magic Kingdom, castle and all, was carved into it. With a click of a switch, the headboard lit up with fireworks and stars above the castle, bright enough to be seen through the pinprick holes in the carved wood, but dim enough to serve as a nightlight. The subtle Disney references and hidden Mickeys all around delighted me, but were unobtrusive to my husband. We were invited to enjoy the “ETicket

Summary Heading: Have to do it once to experience it
Summary: I have always wanted to stay here at The Disneyland hotel.  However the price to stay here is insane, Then you factor in the exchange rate and it really is insane prices.  In saying that we stayed here 2 nights at the end of our Disney stay. Prior to staying here we stayed 6 nights elsewhere.  The room was an okay size. What I liked was that it had the bathroom with toilet,shower/tub combo on one side in one room and on the other side was the wardrobe and sink.  We stayed in the frontier tower and on the last day they had tapped up our window as were doing some work outside.  There is currently renovation building work going on which I knew about for the new DVC tower that is being built. There is some noise but not enough to ruin your holiday. I never heard it from our room.  I

Summary Heading: Clean - Spacious - Short Walk to Park Gates & Downtown Disney
Summary: We have stayed at both the Disneyland Hotel & the Paradise Pier Hotel. The Disneyland Hotel was much superior.  The rooms were nicer although not significantly larger, better equipped and overall the Hotel staff were more helpful (front desk & housekeeping).  We ate breakfast one day at the Tangaroa Terrace. Great staff found here as well.  The quick walk/short proximity to the Park Gates & to Downtown Disney are well worth the stay here.  Special mention to the following staff to make our time at Disneyland extra special.  - Carlos @ Rise of the Resistance - Mary - La Mirada CA @ Park Gates - Brennan - Anaheim CA @ Disneyland Hotel Front Desk - Myra, Guest Services @ Disneyland Hotel Front Desk

We just returned from a three day stay at the Disneyland hotel and It was a wonderful experience and we really had a great time to celebrate my wife’s birthday. The check in was great and Penny was a rockstar checking us in. Our room that we booked had some issues with plumbing and she moved us to another wing at the property. We were located in the adventure building on the eighth floor with a gorgeous pool view.   The only hiccup we had was when my wife and I were sitting at the pool we ordered one ice tea and one water. We just checked into our hotel and trying to pay for it with our key card And the supervisor came to us and said that it was not working. For the price we paid for the room that should’ve been complementary. But don’t tell me something is not working that is

The service was amazing, as expected with Disney. Its not cheap, but worth every penny. We had an amazing trip-  11 people total ranging from 2yrs to 72yrs. The 3-bdrm suite was a great space to spread out. The cabana had entertainment by the pool and great service for ordering food, drinks. Its close to downtown disney which is a quick walk or monorail trip to the parks. Overall service was excellent and it was a really fun experience!

We stayed in the Fantasy tower for 2 nights with 2 adults and 3 older kids. We absolutely loved everything about it. The atmosphere was just magical. Staff always super friendly and helpful. The beds were lovely and comfy and the air con was quiet. Loved that we could put all our luggage under the beds. The sleeper sofa was great because it was an extra bed without taking up precious floor space.   I was very surprised how big the room actually was and I felt like they had thought of everything.   Loved how close it was to the action and the pools were so beautiful.  The gym was well equipped.  Only thing I'd say is it probably need another food option or two to cater for all the guests.  We didn't want to leave and the next hotel felt pathetic after staying here.

Summary Heading: Weekend getaway to celebrate a friend's special occassion
Summary: The fireworks headboard was a nice touch and the bed was comfy. The Disney hotel complex needs better outdoor signage as to what's where.   If you arrived before check-in (3 pm), stow your luggage with the hotel's bell hop service and visit downtown Disney for eateries, entertainment activities (e.g., bowling) and retail shopping. Also, if the weather is forecasted to be really hot and humid, do yourself a favor and pick up things from the shops inside the hotel.

First, I just want to remind people before I start my review to always keep in mind that people more frequently take the time to write reviews who have had negative experiences than positive ones. When all goes well, we forget to take the time to write a positive review. But when something goes wrong, you betcha, we will sit down and write about it!   So I am here to write about my positive experience at the Disneyland Hotel. We stayed as a family of 5 for three nights at the end of August, 2022. We came from New York and it was definitely a big splurge to stay here. We upgraded to a Junior 1BR suite. We had a FANTASTIC time.  We checked in at 6:30am on a Wednesday. No problem at all. Our room wasn't ready but the kind and attentive desk agent showed me how to access early park

Sorry for the long post but I hope this helps someone. I read a ton of reviews and really debated whether to stay here or off property like we did on our last visit and decided to go for it when they brought back morning hours. Our stay was fine but the hotel was nothing special. Like the previous review our premium view room was also oversold. Loss of view wasn’t a huge deal for us and we got money back but I was disappointed to only find out when I checked to see where we could leave our bags when we arrived early. The front desk staff was very helpful though and able to get us into a room with two queen beds with pullout. The staff was all friendly and the room was spotless and roomy but nothing special. The “magical” headboard was cool but was it really worth hundreds more

Experience started with our room at the fantasy building being oversold and sending us to adventure tower. Only gave an arbitrary amount back cuz b-day...     This change included no vending machines  in the building. Spent an hour or so looking for drinks on floors to take meds. Called front desk and had to wait for cast to bring water bottles. They apparently don't know they don't have vending machines.       Weird rusty tube protruding from shower ceiling      And hair and old food crumbs around bathroom and room.      Cast said we could take our time leaving and thought she understood, but got a call an hour later saying they need to clean the room and if we left.  Very rude, we were packin anyway.

This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel and it was exactly what we could have hoped for. Not only is the location ideal for accessing the parks/downtown Disney, but it was also only a 15-minute walk from the convention center which we had to go to over the weekend for the D23 Expo. While there was a glitch in the text message notifying when our room was ready, the overall stay was magical. We were in a 2-queen bed w/pullout couch room in the Fantasy Tower. The firework headboard was amazing and just the right touch of magic in the room. The room was spacious enough for 3 adults. While it didn't have a microwave (which would have been nice), the Keurig and fridge was a nice touch and highly utilized. The beds were comfortable and after packed days at the convention or

Nice hotel and room .. easy check in .. helpful reception to change room to connected.. only the supervisor i think she hate Arab or muslim as she saw my son and he is 4 yers old and first visit to Disney he smile to her and wave and she didn’t even smile or ask if he is first visit as she did with the other children.    no room service which it should be only 3 stars for that.. but u have the restaurant next to the hotel in the park. Recommended yes to enjoying the park for 2 nights.

Summary Heading: Overrated - terrible service , rooms are meh
Summary: Let’s start by saying my 3 year old loved breakfast with characters which at 3 years old we all wanted to meet Pluto and goofy etc..  besides that , on a family kids oriented hotel like Disney is supposed to be .. they do not have milk anywhere for sale at 9pm.   They do not have room service At any time , if you order food you must pick it up across the hotel at a restaurant  or at the lobby area  (which means leaving your kids or dragging everyone with you ) .  Parking is $50 for valet, but when we went downstairs to get our car to go outside the property to get milk since the hotel didn’t have it , the valet you guessed it, was closed and we couldn’t get our car so had to Uber …   Seems unreasonable that they close things down while the park still open and they lack basic

Summary Heading: Good location but behind Orlando quality of Disney hotels
Summary: Location remains the draw and ability to get what is now a magic 30 minutes (down from a magic hour). Room was comfortable. Safety deposit in rooms are impractical shape/size. Pool area is chaotic and unless you get there in the morning you will struggle for a sunbed. Overall it could do with a refresh.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE STAYING AT THE DISNEYLAND HOTEL.  What was supposed to be a magical experience turned into a nightmare.    Here’s what you should know:  1) Dining options are next to impossible to reserve.  There is no room service at this hotel and food delivery services are not allowed to deliver to the room.  You must meet the driver in the “main tower”, which may be different than where your room is located….there are 3 separate towers that surround the pool.  This is particularly problematic if you are a single parent or traveling alone with a little one.    2) The monorail that takes you in/out of the park closes between noon and 7:00 pm, so if you want to take the kids back to the hotel for pool time and a nap you will need to exit the main entrance and walk through

The hotel itself is fine. Stayed in the Fantasy Tower. Our room was fine. Beds are a little small but requested a roll away bed. Room was clean and housekeeping comes daily to remove trash, refresh towels and make beds. Other services upon request. I gave it a 3 because the pool area is a chaotic mess. No chairs. Super crowded. And the cushions on the chairs are falling apart. For the price people pay, you’d think these cushions would be updated. The Tangaroa Terrace’s food is absolutely disgusting.  Cold, hard long beans. Runny scrambled eggs. Inedible pineapple. One of the only mobile order places at this hotel. Unless you walk over to Downtown Disney. I would not return to this hotel simply because of the pool situation. You get anxiety the second you find chairs, and if you

We had a lovely 3 night stay at the hotel. Room was large and clean. The pool is fantastic. We had a room with the pool view. The guest concierge sorted out a dinner booking we wanted to cancel. There was a cancellation fees from the restaurant and guest services kindly credited the fee to our account. I would have given them a 5star but felt the hotel was just too expensive and we did not get early access to the park. However it is a 10 min walk to the park.

Summary Heading: Still Nice but Losing It’s Magic!
Summary: I really like this hotel and wanted to write a great review.  However I felt the hotel is not up to the caliber it was in the past.  Still a nice property and my biggest complaint is the price range isn’t in-line with the product.  It is difficult to justify $600+ when no extra perks into the parks or even anything that justifies these prices.  It felt like I paid double for half as much  product.  The rooms are still nice but on the small side and housekeeping was quite good.  Characters are no longer around the hotel and the pool was crazy busy.  Tangiora was just plain horrible with only two items on the menu in the middle of the day and service was just plain horrible.  Even items like park tickets not linked to the account even though they were bought at the same time of

When reserving 2 rooms, request was made to be in the Fantasy Tower, farthest from the construction of the new tower, in order to have a quiet room and a view of anything but the parking lot. We were assigned  the Frontier Tower which is next to the construction zone, with a wide view of an enormous parking lot. The Frontier Tower is quite a walk from the Fantasy Tower which is where registration and Uber/Lyft drop off & pick up are located. Considering I prepaid $1420 for the 2 rooms, my expectations were deflated with great dissatisfaction. After returning back to the Fantasy Tower to get in line to speak with someone at the Registration counter, I was intercepted by a very large, dark haired woman who was with a trainee. I told her the situation and said I would gladly pay to

Clean, excellent service, and all the good that is standard when you are in a Disney owned place. Clean rooms, good amenities, good food, and California prices in this case.  From the hotel you walk to Downtown Disney and from there you either walk to California Adventure or take the monorail to Disneyland.

We stayed in a suite with our college aged kids and were happy with our stay. I will start off by saying that we usually go to Disney world and stay at Yacht club and this doesn’t compare. However it was clean, staff helpful and suite was spacious though bathroom is on the smaller side. Pool was very nice and easy access to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. We would never consider staying off property at either Disney location- just so convenient. We ate at the other more upscale Disney resort and it had a lot more atmosphere but since we weren’t going to the adventure park it didn’t make sense to pay the upcharge

Summary Heading: Decent at best. Not worth the price
Summary: Me and my girlfriend made a trip to Disneyland to celebrate our 9 month anniversary. The tickets to the park were a gift for my birthday, so we decided since we weren't paying to enter the park, we'd spend the money on something else. We decided to book a stay at the Disneyland Hotel, since 1) it was close to the park and didn't require driving or extensive walking, and 2) the hotel is a classic part of Disneyland history and it would be fun to stay somewhere as historically vintage as this hotel. Let's start with the positives. The property itself is lovely to look at if you're interested in the history of Disneyland. Plenty of historic pictures, as well as recreations of old scale sets used by Walt Disney when designing the actual theme park. The hotel being so close to the

Having read many reviews , was a little concerned as to what this would be like . Pleased to say we had a great stay . We were in the Frontier Tower , close to all amenities . Room was a great size , beds comfy , we were on the 7th floor and had a view of Downtown Disney through some trees. Staff on the whole were excellent , we had a problem with the headboard lights and a bulb in the bathroom , both were sorted quickly once reported . My only staff disappointment was in checking in . Got to the front of the queue and four staff members had no one in front of them and chose to ignore me and tap away on their computers , not the Disney service I’m used to receiving . Hotel is expensive and is quite a walk through downtown Disney from the parks , you do have the choice of the

Summary Heading: Hotel a convenient walk from Disneyland
Summary: Hotel right by Downtown Disney and a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Stayed here for two nights with a friend and it was a pleasant stay. The convenience of being close to the parks definitely was the main perk. There’s paid self and valet parking available. There was a Keurig with coffee and tea options. The toiletries were standard and there is a safe in the closet.   The beds were comfy and I liked the Disney touches (i.e., the Mickey hands for the faucet handles). We got room on the 8th floor and the main view was of the parking lot, but you could also see Splash Mountain and the Matterhorn in the distance. There is a pool. No late night food options but there was a gift shop in the lobby.

We recently stayed for two nights in a premium view club level room. The room was immaculate and the views were some of the best I’ve ever seen on property.  The club level lounge was amazing and provided food and drinks throughout the day.  The pools were busy but we were able to get chairs without a problem. If you can swing a club level room you will not be disappointed as the staff was wonderful!

Overall, I would say that our stay at the Disneyland Hotel was better than I expected. Recent reviews haven’t been great and I know they’re still adjusting to post Covid crowds but it really wasn’t bad at all. We arrived about one hour early and valet promptly took our car and we entered the lobby. There is a separate stand for those of us who had checked in online so we didn’t have to go to the main front desk. The very nice lady who handled our check-in was quick polite and very knowledgeable. She answered all of our questions about the restaurants,the pool, etc. We had a very nice room that overlooks the parking lot, some thing I didn’t think much about until the evening firework show which are perfect to view from a room like this. The bed was comfortable, we had a coffee

Summary Heading: Can't wait to visit again next year!
Summary: I have visited Disneyland over 20 times before but have never stayed at a Disney hotel until this trip because I'm too cheap.  I have to say, I'm now a fan and prob won't be able to stay anywhere else again.  We started at the Paradise Pier hotel because this hotel was sold out the first night.  I do not recommend the Paradise Pier hotel to anyone so it was such a relief to check into the Disney hotel after.  We stayed on the 10th floor in the Fantasy tower facing the parking lot.  If you want to watch the fireworks from your hotel room, then you will want the parking lot view.  The beds were super comfy, room was clean and updated but my fav part was the monorail.  It was disappointing though that the monorail closed down Fri night at 7pm so we had to walk all the way back thru

My family of five stayed in 10th floor in frontier tower facing the pool. We had a choice to choose from pool view or downtown Disney view. We should have requested to stay in adventure tower racing downtown Disney. We could have seen fireworks from the room if we had done it. From 10th floor in frontier tower, you still get a glimpse of the fireworks display from the room but again I’d recommend adventure tower downtown Disney view if you want to see display from your own room. Check-in policy is 3pm. Your room will not be ready until 3pm and there is no late check-out option. Every day is a busy day at the Disneyland hotel. Vacation club is currently in construction so if you are sensitive to noise, this may not be the hotel to stay in. The monorail slide pool was ok. Everyone

Such a different experience from 5 years ago. This time we rented a 1 bedroom suite to celebrate our twins turning 3 and my oldest turning 18. We were placed in frontier tower, 12th floor. There's construction next door. Suite was nice. Had a small refrigerator w no freezer, a keurig  but no microwave. However the bathroom smelled like sewage and laundry facilities were closed. Nothing was done to remedy the situation besides maintenance will check it out. After complaining we were told there was a shuttle available to go to the pier hotel for laundry facilities.  Not exactly convenient after 12 hr days at the park with toddlers. Pool areas are nice. You need to mobile order coffee and/or food and still wait for 40 minutes. Food reservations are nearly impossible to get. Not the

In the old days, “this” hotel was “the” place to stay. No longer. While it is a very nice hotel and pretty close to the theme parks. It has few extras, and if you spend all your time at the parks you have no time to enjoy the pool and other amenities. If you want experience a nice hotel, with NO in hotel dinig, this the place. Otherwise, nothing special.

Just stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights and was disappointed. We paid $700/night for our room and it was substandard to say the least. The bathroom was very old and the shower head leaked the whole time we were there. Housekeeping services were only available by request and the 2 times we requested it they either came at an awkward time while we were still in the room or didn’t come at all.   For $700 per night I expected a lot more out of this hotel. Other than location it offers nothing. I recommend either paying a bit more to stay at Grand Californian or saving your money to stay at the Courtyard park entrance.

Summary Heading: A Few Blips But Still Good
Summary: Had our annual visit to Disneyland and as always enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The front desk was really helpful in allowing us to stay in our same room for all three nights even though it was under two separate reservations and different room classes (my husband originally only booked us for two nights instead of three and they were sold out online when he went back to book the third night).  Anyway they were very helpful and got us taken care of.  The pool area was nice for the kids but the service and cleanliness is not up to historical standards.  Even the lifeguards were not pleasant in their interactions with other guests.  The in-room phones don't really work in terms of all you can hear is static and the buttons on the phone do not match up with the labels.

Taking the time to share feedback for fellow travelers. Headline: If money is a consideration, avoid staying on Disney property while visiting Disneyland Resort in LA. Not worth it.   We have been going to Disney almost every year since I was little. I’m now in my 50’s, so that’s a lot of trips to the mouse. This time, for the first time ever, we decided to splurge and stay at a Disney property. Usually we stay in close walking distance, at the Candy Cane (which was closed for remodeling), the Howard Johnson, or one of those others across the street - some are ok, others not so much. You have to do your homework. Anyway, Paradise Pier was the cheapest of the three, but further away and a bit dated. The Grand Californian is closest and newest. I went for the Disneyland hotel as

Three stars only for location and cleanliness on arrival. Plus attention to Disney character details in the furnishings, without being garish. That’s about where the good stuff ends. The cleanliness doesn’t last long when you’re travelling with a family of four and there’s no room service. Apparently it’s every other day, but that means, after a long haul flight and two solid jet-lagged 14 hour+ days at the happiest place on Earth, you arrive back at your hotel room to unmade beds, damp towels, used paper coffee cups (yes, paper) and used plastic water cups which you filled with $5 vending machine water, because there’s no water provided. Nor is there any in-room dining, so you can’t even have any water sent up from guest services (please do not consider even for one moment that

We stayed 3 days in this hotel and they never cleaned the room, and the day we were leaving the cleaning lady came 3 times before the check out! Its for covid or something but almost nobody were with masks other than us,so I really dont get it. The hotel was fully booked, the parks were like a million people so you have to get back from hours of lines in the park to clean your room, not fear!  Nos quedamos 3 dias en este hotel y nunca hicieron limpieza del cuarto y el dia que nos ibamos la señorita de limpieza fue 3 veces antes de la hora de salida, dicen que es por medidas de covid o algo asi pero nadie tenia colubrebocas nada mas nosotros! El hotel lleno en su totalidad los parques llenisimos y despues de hacer filas por horas tienes que llegar a hacer tu cuarto, no me parece

Summary Heading: The pools, slides, and grounds make up for the slightly longer walk over the Californian
Summary: I'm not sure what can justify >$600/night for a simple room that's not on a coast someplace tropical - but it's Disney, so you have to do it! Especially if it's your first time at Disneyland like it was ours. It was me, my husband, and our almost seven-year-old daughter. We had two queen beds in the Fantasy tower on the 11th floor for two nights and our room view - at first sight - was disappointing because of the parking lot below. Little did we knowww... come nine o'clock the nightly fireworks were on prime display outside of our room window! Simply magical! The headboards light up, and the lamp plays music, adding to the magic! The beds are super comfortable and the detail in the decor at this place is everything. We loved being able to take a midday break from the park and

I wrote a review of this hotel several years ago and loved it. It was hands down my favorite place to stay at Disneyland and I have stayed there multiple times over the years  in king rooms, queen bed rooms, one bedroom suits, and two bedroom suites and I have always loved the experience until now.   The magic was still there when we pulled up to the front. The music was playing and bell services unloaded our luggage and stored it. I checked in and did not realize it at  the time but they did not place a card on file so we could charge things to our room. I found out later when I attempted to do just that. I went to the front desk to correct that, saw the line at the time, and decided it wasn’t worth it. The grounds, pool, and hallways were immaculate.   Then we saw our king

Excellent service from check-in to check-out! The hotel itself is nothing to write home about, however the service is too notch. An honorable mention to Noe in Guest Services for helping track down my daughter’s post sweatshirt. He spent probably 15 minutes helping me, and couldn’t have been nicer! I’m happy to report the staff did find it, and I had a happy little girl.

The Disneyland Hotel is about the best location you can get on a trip to Disneyland. Located at the entrance to Downtown Disney and very close to the monorail, it's a perfect location for easy access to the parks, particularly with young kids. Because of the location we were able to come back to the hotel and rest mid day, take a swim in the pool and have some lunch. The positives for this hotel end with the convenience and location of the hotel. The room did have a good view of the fireworks at night.   The prices at this hotel are truly outrageous for what you get. I'm sure this hotel at one time was "premium", but it certainly hasn't kept up with the modern era of hotel accommodation. This is a property with 5-Star prices but 2 star accommodation. The rooms are on par with a

Took my family to Disneyland for Spring Break and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 3 days.  The Disneyland Hotel was a pleasant surprise.  The front desk staff was smiling, courteous, and attentive.  They're still a little bit rusty, but their willingness to help overcomes any deficiencies.  Check-In was easy, but access to rooms was very limited between 10AM and 2PM.  After that, it seemed many more rooms became available.  The facility was clean and comfortable, as were the rooms.    The on-site dining options were limited, but the proximity to Downtown Disney offered many varied food options.  The outdoor areas and pool facilities helped our experience feel like a true vacation.  You can tell the hotel is starting to get back into the swing of things and back to its glory

Enjoyable stay at the Disneyland resort in Anaheim. The location is perfect if you are looking to maximize your time in the Disney parks near by.  Great pools with slides for the kids or big kids! Room was clean and had all needed amenities. There were some things that could use an upgrade, specifically in the bathrooms. Overall, no complaints at all!

I've never been disappointed staying at the Disneyland Hotel. The service is always impeccable. This time we stayed in the Adventureland Suite. It was a once in a lifetime treat. The concierge service was included with the room and now we will be adding this option evertime we stay at DLR. The service and snacks in the concierge suite was top notch. Robert treated us like family. When I checked in we were warned that due to the pandemic, the housekeeping staff was minimal. Honestly we didn't notice any slack. They were polite and helpful.

Nobody says a Disneyland vacation is cheap.   Its not.  Ive stayed at the Dianeyland hotel and Grand Californian several times pre-covid.     The disneyland hotel was renovated later and more updated and cheaper most times then the grand Californian.   Closer to entering the park if u enter thru the monorail and less crowded.  These usually are the good things.  Ive ponyed up the additional cost due to convenience.  This is the last time  This trip.    3 night stay in Feb ‘22   They didnt clean the room once while here.    After calling housekeeping on day two, they inform me that due to covid they only clean rooms every other day.   On the third day when they didnt do it….  They brought me new towels 45 min later.   Room service is not avail, but u can order take out from

Summary Heading: 1st Class “Guest” Experience at a perfect place for a “Enchanting & Restful Stay!”
Summary: Once again, we had the opportunity to stay at a longtime family favorite, the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim, CA, which is the perfect way to start your visit to the Magic Kingdom.    Quite simply, this hotel has become our family's’ “home away from home” each time we visit Disneyland and it is without a doubt, it’s because of fabulous Guest Experience Managers like Ms. Nati Herrera Garcia and her all-star front desk team.    The hotel is immaculate; having a restful night is at the top of their priority to ensure their guests are fully recharged for their incredible visit to the Enchanted Kingdom the following day! And there is no doubt that it will remain at this “World Class Hospitality Level” under the leadership of Disney leaders like Ms. Herrera Garcia who embraces the

Disneyland parks were great, however the hotel Is not worth the money. Be ready for housekeeping to be at your door by 8 using a key to enter if you don’t answer the tiny knock they do. The pool was closed due to the weather, however by 6 the weather was perfect and they still kept it closed (kids were bummed)… I asked if they had anything else for kids to do besides sit in the room and their answer was a quick “no”. The front desk lady told us we could get food delivered to our rooms from any of the restaurants in downtown Disney so we left the park, (in the rain) and went back to our hotel just to find out we had to walk all the way down to downtown Disney to grab food. In the morning the pool opens at 10- and checkout is 11, so if they close the pool the night prior you have

Stayed at the Disneyland hotel Mid October 2021 and was here for 3 nights. We had a Downtown Disney View. We loved the experience here. My husband and I have been going to Disneyland for the past 10 years and never had the chance to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, we finally did it and loved the time spent. One thing that we really really appreciated was the proximity to the parks. After a long day of walking Disneyland and with it being our first visit to the park since Covid hit we were so glad to be staying so close to the park. Glancing down DD and seeing our hotel at the end of the block was relieving. Everything is Disney’d out. Attention to detail In every aspect, everything’s on brand! Rooms are simple but very cute. We went after the upgrade and got the room with the new

First timers at Disney Cali.  We had a 5 day stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  Adult daughter, husband (uses oxygen and scooter) and myself.  We had a great stay, hotel very nice but a little expensive.  Disney is normally over the top with theming so a little disappointed (did see the other reviews).  Asked for Fantasyland or Adventureland, but ended up in Frontierland (front desk said they couldn't accommodate, ?why).  A little cumbersome as it was the farthest from everything - husband didn't get scooter until 2nd day of stay - resort is bigger than it looks.  Amenities great, staff wonderful, clean room and well laid out.  Nightlight/musical headboard a great added feature! Husband needed plugs for bipap sleep machine and oxygen concentrator - cumbersome no plugs at

Our family of 7 adults and 4 toddlers stayed in the 3 bedroom suite in the Fantasy Tower ($1,600 per night). We requested an early check-in, but we’re told most likely it would not be accommodated. Our room was finally ready at 4:15 pm which was passed the typical check-in time. Once we were in the room, we loved the layout and roominess. Staff were all friendly and efficient. The bonus was the close proximity to Downtown Disney and the park itself.

Stayed here for a week in October with my family and had a blast. The pool is great for kids and love the waterslides. Room was newly renovated in the Frontier tower. Was very pleased our room was ready when we arrived a bit early from Canada. Can’t wait to stay again!

Summary Heading: Loved it, but a little spendy!
Summary: We decided to splurge for a last minute trip for my niece's Birthday. We had never stayed at one of the Disneyland hotels and chose the original. I can tell you, we loved every minute of it, but it was spendy! We stayed in the club tower and were able to see the fireworks each night. We had an amazing view. The breakfast and snacks were wonderful. The proximity to the parks was great. The room was a tad small. We had beds for 5 but they kept bringing us only 4 towels, not a huge deal. When we called they always came right up with more. It was very clean, the staff was friendly. I don't have a complaint other than the price. Would I stay again? I won't say never, but I have stayed at some great places for a lot less.

Summary Heading: Very nice but not sure it’s worth it
Summary: The hotel is obviously a classic. But at $450 a night is there not enough money to make the bed and wipe down the sink daily?  They will take out the trash and drop off new towels and coffee every other day, so on your first day be sure call the front desk for coffee so you’ll have enough for your second morning.

This was the first time I have been back for an actual stay at the Disneyland Hotel in over 30 years!  My family and I went during the Christmas break, and it was truly the most magical time.  I have 2 young boys (8 & 4) and to see the joy and magic through their eyes was unlike anything else.    What made this stay complete was the staff. Everything was so helpful and truly made us feel so special in every way.  We had dinner at Storytellers, and if you have not been it is a must. The food was absolutely terrific. And again, the staff made the whole experience that much more special.  Chef Vincent, his team, Chef Amiee went above and beyond.  And we cannot forget our server Carlos, who we quite frankly wanted to steal for the rest of the weekend :)   We also have to mention

Spent five nights at the Disneyland hotel, family of four.  I poured over the details, how to book tickets, which hotel, finances etc.. Ultimately chose the DLH for the wow factor and the experience. I am so thankful for the trip and my family loved the parks.  We were underwhelmed with the hotel for sure. If we could do it over again we would spend half as much on a room at a good neighbor hotel and likely be happier.   Positives-  Room was clean upon check-in.   The parking attendant was the nicest cast member we interacted with during the trip. Didn’t catch his name, but super helpful as we arrived.   The waitress at the pool was so smiley and very happy.   Huge shout out to the lifeguards at the pool. They were really attentive and were not messing around!   Negatives-  Due

Summary Heading: Save your time and money - Disney is out
Summary: We were underwhelmed by Disney.  We spent $525 a night and had to adhere to very strict COVID rules.  In this day and age we say save your money and do something 100% outdoors.   The crowds were still there and the people just lost their spark.   We highly recommend The Unicorn Experience north of LA if you can go.  We believe this outdoor imaginar world where we met real life unicorns is the future.  Disney is so last century. (lol)

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel: 5 Star Prices with 3 Star Amenities
Summary: Twenty years since our last stay at DL Hotel. This was a special visit with our 7 & 9 year old granddaughters. We wanted to give them a first class experience. Surprise 1. Great Bell Service. Just what you expect with a first class resort. Early arrival and prompt dispatch of our luggage when our rooms were ready. Surprise 2.  Basically NO personal service.  We had plenty of questions at check in. No facility maps, no explanation of amenities. We felt that we were imposing on their time. Everyone was super nice wishing us a "magical day"; but it seemed like a rehearsed line with little sincerity. Surprise 3. Paper coffee cups, plastic glasses, no daily maid service, unreliable vending machines...and this was on the premium floor! Surprise 4. No shuttles offered between hotel and

Summary Heading: Not quite as magical as we’d hoped
Summary: We just left our 4 night stay at the Disneyland hotel. It’s been about 8 years since we last stayed here and we just stayed at the Grand CA hotel in May. We stayed at the Disneyland hotel to celebrate our daughters 10th birthday because we thought she’d like that pool better than she liked the pool at the Grand Californian. Spoiler Alert, she liked the pools better at the Disneyland hotel, but that was about it.  The check-in process was straight-forward. We checked-in around 4pm, so there was quite a line of people waiting. I find it interesting that you can do an online check-in at the Disneyworld hotels, but not the Disneyland hotels. What’s up with that?!  We mentioned we were celebrating our daughters birthday and the cast member, Sam, was kind enough to move us to a room

My family (2 older girls, my wife and I) decided to splurge and stay on resort. Our check-in was quick (we had pre-checked in using the app) so almost painless - we just had room cards printed by a friendly front desk staff. Our standard room was very small (especially because we had 4 suitcases) but was as expected.  However, there were so many disappointments. Room service was not available and deliveries were restricted to the main tower lobby. Housecleaning was “light service” every second day—but by Saturday evening (more than 48 hours after our arrival Thursday afternoon), we had seen no one, had no toilet paper, overflowing garbage cans, etc. A call to Front Desk finally got us some housekeeping.  We had advised the hotel during reservation (they ask if you are

Summary Heading: Not Back to Pre Pandemic Magic At All
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights in December 2021.  This is my third visit and the worst by far.  I like staying on property because I like staying in the magic.  I know it costs more, but I like walking right into downtown Disney and the number of homeless people I passed on the way to the park was zero.  When I first arrived, I dropped a rental off at Alamo on Katella, and on the walk back to the park, I passed two.  I'm paying for location and safety.  However, I'm also paying for a bit of an experience and that was missing.  I had requested a room in the Adventure Tower before arriving and it was NOT honoured and I was in the Frontier Tower.  Not the best, but it was fine.  However, the lack of housekeeping was disappointing.  I was paying the same $500+ a night

The Disneyland Hotel was one of the most beautiful hotels I’ve ever stayed at. My husband and I got married here and stayed for 3 nights. The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly and helped us stay in contact with our wedding coordinator when we were running late. I personally think the price is pretty steep, but it’s very unique and has lots of details. The headboard even lights up and plays music. The only downside was the limited food options (Trader Sam’s or Goofy’s Kitchen) and the fact you have to walk entirely through Downtown Disney to get to the parks. I would stay here again though.

Summary Heading: Disneyland back open better than ever
Summary: Great to see Disneyland and the Hotel back open and better than ever. New Star Wars rides and Comic experiences are awesome. Great for the whole family. Safe, friendly well run. Stat from 2 to 5 days to enjor the park.

Summary Heading: A ways to go before the magic is rekindled
Summary: My husband and I just got back from a weekend splurge at the Disneyland Resort. We were very much looking forward to the start of Holiday Time and to our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Unfortunately, our experience didn't live up to my expectations.  The property itself is nice. The towers are nice and well apportioned. The rooms are clean and festive, though a bit on the small side. However the touches they added during the pandemic... new carpets, drapes and bedding, along with new beds... were wonderful. The beds themselves however are a bit on the hard side and I found it a challenge to get a decent nights sleep.  The hotel seems to continue having difficulties with staffing as everywhere we went, waits were excruciating. In fact, on one occasion, when my husband and I

Our family recently stayed in a two bedroom suite on the 9th floor at Disneyland Hotel.  The views of the pool area were great and the six of us (two adults and four 10/11 year olds) had plenty of room.    Unlike other hotel experiences, where you can easily call the front desk and get information or even email the concierge desk, the Disneyland Hotel can be a bit more difficult to get in touch with.  The main Disney Resorts booking number left me waiting for an agent over an hour one day, before hanging up.  The wait time to call the hotel directly was significantly less and put me in touch with Brandon F. My intentions were to simply ensure that we were getting the room configuration that we booked and see if there was anything special they could offer for my daughters

This hotel was one of the cutest I have ever stayed in. I absolutely loved the decor, and the carpeting appeared to be new. I loved all of the Disney details. I did not have a chance to swim, but The monorail pool looks nice and fun for everyone. The grounds were easy to navigate and it was easy to walk to the park or monorail station.

I always wanted to stay at Disneyland’s Disneyland Hotel growing up. It was a dream come true to do so. The hotel was beautiful, and most of the customer service was brilliant. The only exception would be when the front desk agent wanted to emphasis that they were a “family’s hotel and I was there with my partner. I have so much respect for the Disney Brand that I just let that slide, and the rest was an amazing experience

Summary Heading: Don’t waste your money - stay somewhere else!
Summary: Other than the convenience of being close to the parks there is nothing else exciting or worthwhile to even write about in regard to the hotel.   This is the most overpriced hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were outdated and in need of repair. For $570 a night I expected so much more. You couldn’t even get in and out of the bathroom if the tiny closet doors were open. The beds were so high off the ground that my son fell out and smashed his face. Nothing in these rooms were geared around kids which is pretty much the reason we chose to stay there.   The TV on the room didn’t even have Disney movies.   No waters or snacks in the room.   The only reason I gave the stars I did was because of the pool. My kids loved the water slides.   The pool food was also terrible and

Summary Heading: Loved the location and the surroundings
Summary: We enjoyed the close location to downtown disney and were really impressed by the grounds.  Lots of great plantings and well laid out.  The room had some nice touches, like the fireworks headboard.  Overall, great location..we are really glad we stayed here.

Always enjoy Disney properties.  Room was beautiful, large and great view of Down Town Disney.  However no housekeeping.  They said they don't do any housekeeping only bring towels and empty garbage every other day.  We had 5 people in our room  All 5 were registered so no cheating from us.  We needed extra towels first day.  They brought them.  Next day nothing, next day nothing.  We finally put our dirty towels and overflowing garbage cans in hall.  They emptied cans and took towels.  No clean towels until we requested them.  If there is no housekeeping I would hope for a discount not price increases.  Still love Disney properties.

Another great stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Love the vibe here and feeling apart of the Disney magic. Due to covid, the housekeeping isn’t ideal… we had new towels once on our 5 night stay and no changing of the sheets. Maybe we have to request that, I’m not sure? But overall, we had a great stay and hope to return soon.

We had a great view of Downtown Disney on the tenth floor. We could see the hustle & bustle of the shoppers and the fireworks. We could also hear the band playing pretty late into the night. Probably ok if you stay at the park late. Next time I’ll ask for a pool view. My bad. The beds are wonderful. Tv is ok. I wish it would let me stream my shows though. The elevator broke on us once. It was ok going up, but going down would stop on every floor. I like the system at Paradise Pier much better. The pool is great for kids. I never had a problem finding a chair like at the Grand. The food service was also quicker and friendlier than the Grand. Over all , I will always choose the Grand over this hotel if given the choice.

Great experience in 2-room suite!  We stayed in a two-room suite for a one-day trip to Disneyland (5 adults, 1 kid, 1 baby). The rooms had cute Disney touches, and were very clean and spacious. There were two bedrooms with queen beds, and a living room with a bar/eating area (including mini fridge and sink) and a pull out sofa bed.  In addition to two full bathrooms, there was a powder room which made getting ready in the morning easy.

Summary Heading: Great stay but room was cleaned once
Summary: We chose Disneyland hotel because we wanted to make our vacation magical. Which yes it was magical, not complaining but the price for the room wasnt what I expected, smaller then expected. I could of got a hotel suite at another hotel near by with the same price I got for a regular room at disney. But it’s okay, Customer service was great, the restaurant was great. The pool is awesome, the kids loved it and the back walk way to Disney downtown remind me of a jungle. Beautiful. The walk to Disney is about 10-15 minutes which also was great. Only complaint I have is that our room was never cleaned UNTIL the last day of our stay. No towel or toilet was renewed. We had to get towels and toilets on our own first few nights.

The hotel is immaculate! The staff is superb! The second you walk into the "Disney Bubble" you should be able to forget the world beyond and I  was never let down.  The refurbishment to the rooms looks wonderful. Housekeeping services were only every other day but they did such a great job when they were there my room always looked fresh and clean. I was sad about having no room service, especially  with the closure of Steakhouse 55.(Huge mistake, Disney) Hopefully next visit it will be back.

i had the best time room was very clean pool was excellent with slides three or four pools it was fantastic im going again everything from checking in to going to disneyland was so spectacular im booking another trip i had the best time of my life the check in was easy and they were so nice to us i loved every minute of my stay at this hotel best trip ever

Summary Heading: Only stay here for easy Disney access
Summary: The only reason to stay at this hotel is for easy access to Disneyland. We stayed here for the magic hour in the park however that is not happening anymore..We came from an extremely luxurious hotel in Cabo so that doesn’t help our review however they could do better..The rooms are totally ok for a family of 4. The pool is so basic, not enough seats and food is terrible fried rubbish you find all over the park. They should make this pool fun like the Disney theme portrays!! The other concern is COVID. There is no distancing (crammed in better described the pool area) and the disclaimer at the front passing on responsibility says it all.

We enjoyed our stayed so much, room was great, very clean, we could see the fireworks, it was quite and so close to walk into Disneyland!   I can't wait to return, this is our favorite hotel in the area.

My son & I stayed for a week, July 29-August 5.  We checked in at 1:45 & our room wasn't ready and they said they'd text when it was.  That was fine, however, they never texted.  By 4:30, I called & they claim they texted at 3:50.  Not the case cuz I had my phone in my hand the whole time waiting.  Turns out the following morning I turned my phone on & they texted at 3:01AM..Whatever!!  Not happy about that!  Room was nice.  They did tell us that maid service was every other day but to call if we needed towels.  Again, I was fine w/ that. Out of the week we were there, they made the beds (2 Queens) once.  They never vacuumed or took away used wash cloths or towels.   There was hair on the floor which got kind of gross.  I do have long hair, but I feel they should have vacuumed

Summary Heading: Worth the money to stay here
Summary: We had a great time staying in the Fantasy Tower of the Disneyland Hotel. Our room was good sized, 2 queen beds, a desk/chair, decent sized area for the bathroom with an additional mirror/vanity. We also had a nice view of the pool area. My daughter loved the musical headboard and lights, and we all thought the Mickey themed bathroom was cute. The air conditioning in the room was also really great, especially after being in the hot sun all day.   The best part about the hotel was the staff. Everyone was so nice and helpful, all the time, from the bell staff to the front desk to the severs at the pool. We were also able to swim for a little while at the pool after we checked out of the hotel, which was a nice way to extend our trip a bit! My only complaint would be that with the

Summary Heading: Family Vacation at Disneyland Hotel, California July 23-27, 2021
Summary: We recently stayed at Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim,  .  We booked 3 rooms- overall stay was very disappointing and felt let down with our overall experience.  I don’t see the value of the money we spent for the rooms; we paid full price!  We were at another hotel prior and paid half the price and received better service!  1) Out of the 3 rooms booked & confirmed, only 1 room had 2 beds plus sofa bed; had to move rooms when we should be relaxing and enjoying.  The type of room/bedding booked and confirmed was not delivered! 2) Problem with our Disneyland tickets at the park which caused delay & embarrassment for us. 3) They forgot to clean our room even after we asked front desk & housekeeping.  Imagine coming back to your room at the end of the day to find out it was not cleaned,

Summary Heading: Fantastic Stay! Spend the money and do it. It’s Disney.
Summary: We don’t normally splurge on a vacation but everyone says stay on the property for Disney- so glad I did! It’s across the street to downtown Disney. I only stayed 2 nights and to do it again, I would do at least 2 days at Disney and 3-4 days here.  Recommendation: book through Disney if you can- I had a mess up with an online booking and it’s been a mess! But it’s also more expensive to walk in and reserve a room. Like $300. If I had booked with Disney it wouldn’t have been an issue or an extra 1K.  The people are SO friendly. I was overwhelmed at how kind and helpful they ALL are.  Carve out time away from the park for the hotel pool and water slide. Know you can stay and swim even after checkout.  Be ready for $20 burger from the Tiki-bar and fantastic poolside drinks!  The

Hotel was nice but nothing special, standard hotel room amenities and everything you could get from another reputable chain.  Staff/Cast member were absolutely wonderful and friendly and would go out of their way to help.  Hotel does come with free wifi, that is worthless and we could never get to actually work properly.  Rooms come with a mini frig but no microwave to warm anything up, no room service available either.  Can order from a couple restaurants around Downtown Disney that will bring your food to the lobby.  The pools felt like taking a bath because the water was so warm and not refreshing at all so we only used them once out of the 5 days we were there.  My daughter told me she would rather take a cold shower then go in the pool.  Good luck trying to get a

Went to Disneyland for a quick birthday trip and my daughter booked us here for the first time. It was a WOW experience. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty, everyone was so so friendly and helpful and asked us over and over if we needed anything. Rooms in the Fantasyland Tower are all updated, even down to the last detail as you can see in the photos here. Headboard lights up and plays music so we slept under the fireworks!  Pool was awesome and clean as was everything else. Our room on the 8th floor was solid and we heard nothing from other rooms as others have stated. Disney sure knows how to do it right, so ignore any negatives you read in reviews. This is a top notich hotel with both service and cleanliness. Everything seemed brand new!  Even the carpet

Summary Heading: Newly refurbished and re-opened Disneyland Hotel visit
Summary: We booked a rather spontaneous trip to Disneyland (we're from Georgia) for July 2021. We chose the Disneyland Hotel because it looked really cool and is centered very well around everything we wanted to do because we flew and didn't get a rental car. (Don't need one if you stay on site.)  The hotel had just re-opened the week before and the rooms were refurbished. This made me feel really good during pandemic time. It felt very clean and fresh.  I'm not going to compare to WDW because that's not fair. So I'll just give my thoughts.  1. Check-in The check-in line was quick. They were very, very helpful. I do wish you could have your hotel info. in the app and use the app as a room key.  2. Rooms This is the oldest hotel and it feels like a Hilton or other standard hotel. It was

Love everything about this hotel. I stayed 5 nights in July 2021 and it’s the best on site hotel if you ask me. The pool was wonderful, the food at Tangaroa Terrace was good, and the updated rooms are super nice! Walk to the parks is about 10 minutes. The best part is the security entrance is always so quick and easy. I will always stay here when I visit Disneyland!

When you hear the work Disneyland, it conjures up images of magic and excitement. Unfortunately their accommodation does not fit those images. Plain, old and boring. The room was clean and decent but for Disney brand, you will be highly disappointed.   The positive is the service. It’s top notch and the staff will go to extra lengths to assist you.

It was great i really enjoy it. Its a very very good habbit for spending time with family and friends even solo travel. It looks awesome and i want to travel there many times. I really fall in love with this place

Summary Heading: Great hotel but it's not disneyworld.
Summary: I have stayed at Disneyworld on site three times:  The carribean beach, Art of Animation, and Animal kingdom-kidani village.  My experience at all these three hotels were better than it was at the Disneyland hotel.  It was not a bad hotel (same price as the disneyworld hotels), but it misses the "disney magic" that the Disneyworld hotels provide.  I traveled with a family of 7 (6-16 years old).  The pool was adequate and they had a spash zone, however it was a bit cold, so we were not able to take full advantage.  Also, it is great that we can walk through downtown disney on the way to the park.

This was just the right choice for taking two kids (6 and 8) to Disneyland for the first time. The hotel is close enough (a leisurely 10-minute walk through Downtown Disney) from the park entrances to make it easy to come and go throughout the day, and the hotel has fun features like a monorail waterslide at the pool. Rooms were clean and fairly modern, with Disney touches that delighted the kids. And from our room, we could see the fireworks, which was great because at the end of the day, we were too tired to stay in the park to see them.

Hotel was very nice and very expensive but the proximity to downtown Disney and the parks were worth it, I thought the hotel was awesome until you go see the other two Disney hotels, the Floridian and can’t recall the other one but they are gorgeous and have a much more vacation type vibe than the main hotel, however they are more expensive as but you can’t go wrong if you have the money to spare and the extra magic hours for resort guests gave  us a huge head start on those days, Rode some premium rides two or three times before the lines became crazy long.  If not driving recommend hiring a shuttle service that will let you make a grocery store stop.  You can save a ton of money that way.

Summary Heading: °o° Expensive but more fun than you can shake a stick at °o°
Summary: We stayed in the Frontier Tower during this trip and we enjoyed every minute of it. The Room cost is EXPENSIVE but it is worth it. You are paying the extra money to ensure you do not leave the Disney magic during your entire stay. The room is honestly very average but has a ton of Disney character hidden throughout. The hotel is noisy, but what can you expect with all the children there to see Mickey Mouse. There are tons of fun things to do within steps of your hotel room. Including Trader Sam's Tiki Bar, see my other review on that one.

The hotel was average. It needs to be updated. The lobby was very plain. I did however enjoy the outside area at trader sam's especially when the torches are lit at night. The location is convenient, right next to the monorail. I wish the hotel room window opened. That would have been so much nicer.  Many people said it was very nostalgic,  I thought it was very plain and very expensive especially the food. We ordered 3 donuts thinking they were donuts but they actually were donut holes for the bargain price of $6.50. The sodas were $4.19. Wow. I'm glad I visited the hotel but I wont stay there again.

Summary Heading: Neverland never again - REMOVED - DO NOT DISTURB PRIVACY
Summary: Never-land never again. If you select this hotel then when checking in ask if they have DO NO DISTURB SIGNS.   Disney is ignoring the fact that sleep deprived parents and long distance travelers need a DO NOT DISTURB SIGN to enjoy an afternoon nap. Young children need afternoon naps.    So Warning to all jet lagged international travelers and parents who like to get an undisturbed afternoon nap. Most vacationers I know like to have the option of an afternoon nap without interruption. Not at Disney.   Check out the photos I have uploaded revealing their ROOM OCCUPIED SIGN & THE SMALL PRINT ON IT. This proves Disney leadership have chosen to destroy and replace the travel industry expected norm of having a ‘do not disturb’ sign.   Disney door signs state that even after you pay

Summary Heading: Lovely stay for a Disney loving family
Summary: There are so many points about the Disneyland Hotel that make this place a great stay. Firstly the location is great - walking distance to the parks through Downtown Disney or catch the monorail.  The rooms are neatly appointed and the kids love the magical headboards. Staff are always kind and helpful. We stayed in a three bedroom suite which had plenty of room for 8 of us. The room included a kitchenette that was quite big and was a shame that it didn’t have extra kitchen things like a microwave, plates and cutlery.  Comfortable lounge which turned into a sleeper.  Rooms don’t include washer and dryer but they were only a short stroll over towards the gym. Finding hidden Mickeys entertains the kids. Love this place because it embodies the Disney feels

I will start in order of events from arrival.   1. Arrival, took 10 minutes to get a bellhop to take bags into hotel. There are no luggage carts for self service, they are locked up. It was not busy, and they where all just standing around talking. Our driver finally went over and ~5 minutes after one came over. He thought it strange also as he hadn't seen that before. Checkin took far longer than a Disney World hotel. No line, just a longer process.  2. Rooms - Basic hotel rooms. Cheapest of cheap coffee makers. Definitely "old" with dings and such. But it  was clean. There was no fan in the bathrooms. After a shower it got pretty steamy and you had to leave door open to air it out. Also generic office ceiling tiles in the bathroom, with black fungus or something on them.

Summary Heading: Wish I could stay here more! Loved it
Summary: It was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel. My husband and I treated ourselves to one night stay while making a quick solo trip to Disneyland. I really wish it was more affordable to come here every time we came to Disneyland (few times a year)...! Check in was a breeze, we were able to get a room right away so we could get on with our Disney day. The details are top notch. Room was quiet and spacious. Hope to stay again one day!

I organized my only daughter quinceanera in the Disneyland Hotel. They breach 2 of my contracts 1 of the contracts was the prop of the Cinderella glass slipper it was supposed to be present during pictures, was not there never get a explanation why was not there the 2nd contract the trumpets there guide entertainment says can Reserve trumpets for pre-reception up to two hours I reserve them for my daughters grand entrance but never was informed that They where reserved them for 10 to 15 minutes. We where running behind the trumpet left I had a meltdown the Disney cast to claim me down they intoxicated me. With 3-4 tequila shots I was on a empty stomach I missed 3 hours of my only daughter party was not able to say thank you to our love ones. Plus my daughter humiliated by her

Summary Heading: Don't let Disney ruin your vacation!
Summary: I have just left Disneyland today, March 5th. I arrived on Monday, the 2nd, meeting up with a group of 8 children and 6 adults. We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel - very nice and wonderful staff, but I was shocked to see absolutely nothing about precautions to take to reduce the spread of illness. There was no signage to remind people to wash their hands, there was no extra hand sanitizer stations, nothing to remind people to not touch their faces, cover coughs, etc., no mention AT ALL about a public health emergency; you would never know there was a virulent, very nasty and potentially deadly illness rapidly spreading worldwide.  Clearly Disney doesn’t want people to have to think about such things on vacation at the “happiest place on earth” - understandable - but totally

Summary Heading: Frontier Tower, 2nd Floor, Near Ice Machine = Quiet Room, Great Beds
Summary: Congratulations to Disneyland Hotel for managing to give us quiet relaxing rooms even though, we truly had the bad location in a hotel setting. I booked directly with a Hotel, last minute arrangements so I took what I could get. 5 Adults in our group and we all found the room very comfortable and very quiet. Remember....it’s Disneyland so plenty of little ones making all kinds of happy noises.  The FOOD! Very good, such an improvement over past visits. Now there is plenty of fresh food, healthy quality food choices.

The Disneyland hotel is definitely in need of a revamp and not as glamorous as some of the hotels in WDW. The rooms are small but have nice disney touches. You can’t beat being on property and being able to take the monorail right into Tomorrowland or a simple walk through downtown Disney to get to DCA. If you’re looking to stay on property it’s definitely a step up from Paradise Pier.

Summary Heading: Over priced , slow room service  good location
Summary: What can you say - they kinda have you here with location .. The room service is beyond slow , overpriced , not great food . The rooms are ok for a family of 4 or 5 . Two doubles and a sofa .. It’s really the location to get into park . The early entrance thing on Tuesday and Thursday is so busy it takes 20 minutes to get into the park .. Our family had a fabulous time , again they kinda got you if you want location .

It is pricey but the service is excellent and its proximity to everything is second to none. Just be ready to pay a premium to everything. If you want some outside food, buy outside ahead of time because once you’re inside, the magic spell starts and you’d not want to go out anymore!
