Summary Heading: Property is magnificent, Service was great, but food was good too
Summary: Who doesn't love the happiest place on earth.  Super convenient to Downtown Disney and the parks and the property is absolutely magnificent.  I was here for a state awards dinner and look forward to returning to an upcoming conference.  Thoroughly enjoyed my breakfast at Tangaroa Terrace as well as my poke the evening before enjoying the Kalama Brothers entertain the crowd.  I was disappointed only at my Pago Pago cocktail which was in my humble opinion not a great representation of my homeland, but the crowd made me feel the aloha spirit.  I passed the Time share staff numerous times during my visit and not once was I approached by them to seek my interest as I was actually quite interested.  Each time I passed by I was literally dismissed even when no one else was around - it

The hotel is located in down town Anaheim. Very easy to use the park, come back to the hotel for a few minutes rest. Price is reasonable. Staff are helpful to accommodate. You will meet new people since everyone is happy

close to everything, nice rooms, top notch hotel staff, good food and very very helpful to make your day easy and fun. we spent little time with the various hotel benefits like health club and big swimming pool.  we felt that everything we wanted was walking distance so we didn't rent a car and had a "magical" time throughout our Disney experiences.  we didn't go for the rides but, oh my, have they upgraded them.. a guaranteed "awesome"day

Nice hotel. Convenient access to parks and downtown Disney. You may find characters walking around the hotel! On the pricey side but location is everything and the Disney touches make it special.  Nice pool and restaurants. The landscaping gave it a tropical feel.  So while Mickey and friends were just yards away you also felt like you were on a true getaway if you needed a break from the walking and crowds!

Overall we loved the hotel, the location, being in the middle of it all can’t be beat. We felt safe and well looked after. The staff are prompt with requests(our fridge wasn’t working and was replaced promptly). The pool!!!! Amazing and not hard to find a good seat by the pool with lots of shade or sunshine. The rooms are neat with little Disney touches. We had a room that connected to the room next door, and the neighbours woke us up at 5:30am as they were not trying to be quiet and likely didn’t know how loud they were and that there was no insulation between the rooms lol.  My kids and I loved looking around the hotel at the different buildings. The restaurants are pricy and we never ate at them cause of this. The Disneyland experience is more fun than meeting a character

Summary Heading: The Best Way to See Disney!
Summary: Its being in the Magical World of Disney the entire time... 24 hours a day! We have to say though, that all of the Disney Hotels are amazing... and there is a reason they sell out fast. Book early. And they have huge rooms with multiple rooms and beds so you can bring large families.

Summary Heading: A great base for visiting Disneyland
Summary: A great base for visiting Disneyland. The monorail to Tomorrow Land is very close. The guest relations staff in particular were excellent (they sorted a problem for us with a booking elsewhere) but we were impressed by all the Disneyland staff. Our only improvement suggestion is to add a better fine dining location.

Honestly I had never really thought of staying at the Disneyland Hotel when the Grand Californian was so much closer, until I did stay there and wow; it was amazing!   First the rooms were amazing.  They felt so much bigger than the Grand Californian (GC) and they are!  Now most do not have balconies so that may be a little of the space, but with floor to ceiling windows you don’t need a balcony!  The beds here were the most comfortable beds I have slept on in any hotel I’ve ever stayed at.  The bathroom was awesome how it had a separate room just for the potty, the counter was huge, and there was a shelf to put things on below it too.  My only negative was there isn’t really places to sit outside the bed, but I’m ok with that.  Next the proximity to Disneyland and Disney

I stayed for the second time & was very disappointed. The last time I stayed was about 12 years ago. Back then you could feel the Disney Magic. Characters walking around greeting the kids. The pool was a pirate ship, the toilets were called Lost boys etc etc etc. The bathroom products were small bottles with Mickey Heads on them. This time there were hardly any characters around (we were there for 3 days). The swimming pool was just a pool. The bath products were just products,.... I feel for the money that we paid it was not good value & very overrated ....Would not stay again

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in early January 2020. The staff were so friendly and accomodating it truly is a magical place. All our needs were attended to and the ability to charge everything back to the room was very handy. The early access 7am to California Disney Park on the 2nd morning allowed us to use our fast pass and tick off all rides we wanted at both the theme parks. Thanks for an amazing 2 nights.

Summary Heading: Brilliant location, but boy do you pay for it
Summary: You are 1 min from the security check point (that everyone has to go through), to enter the parks and the hotel and facilities are good, but be ready to spend big for the privilege. Staying also gives you early access to the parks which is awesome, as you’ll later be standing in very long queues for everything. Expensive as hell, but worth the money if you’re into Disney

We visited Disney for NYE and stayed at this hotel for the second time as had been a few years ago. Great location and easy to get to the parks and backing you want a bit of a break before returning for more rides. Room service is quite expensive and the food just ok . We arrived late and famished so RS was the only option. Improvement required. The room was tidy and clean but do need to be refurbished and a couple bottles of water to be provided complementary would be great. Staff are very friendly / helpful and service is great.

This place is way to crowded and way to expensive. You will need to have very careful control of your young in this place. No room to move and the cost is out of line with the experience. Why someone would want to experience this is beyond me.

Summary Heading: great location, good amenities. nice staff
Summary: we just spent six nights at this 5 star hotel right in the middle of Disneyland. so there is lots to tell. first of all checking in, we arrived at 7pm after a short flight from arizona, as our trip was prolonged almost a month we had lots of luggage but the porters were most helpfull, bell boys took the luggage and delivered it promptly all 8 pieces...   check in took a few minutes as we had tickets max passes and such to go through and lots of badges ( and i mean lots ) badges seem to be their own currency here!.   any way checked in to room 2012 it looks over the pool area and had two queen beds. a bathroom with bath and shower as long as you can climb in coffee set with ok tea and coffee. a fridge ( empty ) tv and the usual other things. we had requested a crib for junior and

We always have fun at Disneyland, and love to stay on the property. it is easy access to Downtown Disney,and both parks..The rooms are always clean and Love the fireworks wall in the evening. So worth it if you have smaller children, because you can go back mid day and nap! Friendly staff and great gardens.

Great turnout! It is very good, but at the same time, very expensive. Nice pool, nice rooms, and just a great hotel all together. It is also a nice quick way to get to Disneyland at the opening time! I totally reccomend it!

The concierge level is what you want when traveling with family, children especially.  It is extremely convenient and the view is beautiful. The room and bathroom is big with a his and her sink.  The cast members in the concierge room were very friendly, accommodating, and attentive.  The meals make all the difference when traveling with family!

Went to make reservations at hotel when I tried to also make a character dinning when staff told me and I quote “I should have died “ as I am recovering from a stroke. When I asked her to speak to supervisor she abruptly terminated call. That was so inappropriate. Going to celebrate and they make you feel very unwelcome.

Great location. Parks are good but we expected more. Hotel made a mistake with our tickets and we had to spend more than one hour to solve it. The fastpass for Disney Adventure is not worthy, many rides with no fastpass availability.

We are staying in Disneyland hotel. Because of some booking issue we were downgraded. After making us wait for an hour with 3 of us sick in the family, we were offered fast passes and shopping and dining card.dining card was not accepted for dinner at downtown Disney!! Fast passes are offered to all hotel guests anyway!! We have traveled all the way from Singapore and Disneyland was our main highlight. Because kids fell sick we had to come back to LA and cut short our days in other locations. Ended up booking hotels twice for the three days. But are spending 3 nights in the smallest room with a bathroom that is tiny.  We also offered to pay for upgrade as we wanted Disneyland experience to be special for our kids.  Extremely disappointed that the reception desk could not even

Stayed here one night to get an extra early morning hour.   The pool area was lots of fun for the kids. They loved the waterslides, although they seemed to be frequently closed throughout the day. For an expensive hotel the pool amenities should have been open more.   The room was small but had a nice partial view of the park and we loved the little details like the light-up headboard! Also liked the other little details like the movie room for kids while you wait for dinner seating.  Staff were very helpful just like everywhere else in Disneyland. They are a great resource if you have last minute Disneyland organization issues.   Not enough breakfast options for families leaving in the wee morning hours for early entry line-up Ended up having to grab cereal in boxes and bananas

If you are a Disney fan and can afford to - stay at the Disneyland Hotel! Yes the surrounding hotels are easy walking distance, cheaper and you do spend most of your time in the parks, rather than your hotel room, but the magic of the Disneyland Hotel is worth every dollar. We stayed in the Fantasy Tower and had a good view of the fireworks every night. It rained two out of the three days we were there, so to be able to take the monorail back to the doorstep of the hotel to dry off quickly, was welcomed. The theme of the hotel is just wonderful for Disney fans - lots of nice touches from the light fixtures to the pillows. We received great service on check in - unfortunately don't recall the women's name who looked after us but she made sure we were decked out in Disney pins for

Don’t get me wrong, I love staying here and our family has stayed in several rooms every year in December for many. BUT, since Walt Disney died and it was sold it’s clearly all about $$$ now. Their rates increase to over $400 a night in December. They only reserve a very small number of rooms for military , which is horrible! Customer service is no longer excellent. Our room’s heater was broken (stayed at 84 degrees) and they still reserved it for us. Our door lock was not working properly and had to get new keys 3 times in 2 days. They finally moved us. The rooms are really nice, housekeepers are excellent. But it is no longer worth the money. It’s sad that I have to say that. But Steakhouse 55, breakfast at the hotel, remains our favorite restaurant. JJ, Mari, Chelsea, Karla

Summary Heading: Hands down best out of the three Disney Resort Hotels!
Summary: We have stayed at Paradise Pier, California Grand Hotel, and the Disneyland Hotel, and it our opinion Disneyland Hotel is the best.  It's like the three bears fairy tale: Paradise Pier is too inconvenient, California Grand Hotel doesn't live up to the hype for the cost, and the Disneyland Hotel, while a bit dated as some say, is just right.  It has the most Disney feel. I like that it has coffee in the room, unlike California Grand Hotel, which is at least $100.00 more, and it has a private separate toilet in the bathroom, which I like.  Grand Hotel and Paradise Pier do not have those things.  It is the most conveniently located to Disneyland, and as I said before, it's the only hotel with the Disney magic.

Everything went very smooth we had a 2 day package for room and admission  Registration clerk was very helpful and polite Getting to Disneyland was also easy as monorail is close by I would recommend going during Christmas as the Decor Is delightful

While the location is great if you want to visit the Disney parks, this hotel is in desperate need of improvement. The rooms are plain and lack the charm of Disney Hotel Paris. Customer service was superficially friendly, but had no substance. For example, we checked in early but our room wasn’t ready (which was fine) but nobody contacted us to tell us when it was ready. Plus we had a rollaway bed as part of our reservation and when we arrived back to our room at 11.30pm the rollaway still has not arrived and we had to call to get it done. There were almost no food options unless you booked prior, no room service, no information sheets in the room to tell us about the facilities. Just a really disappointing stay

Summary Heading: Convenient location but the rooms are looking dated.
Summary: Cons:  Price, dated location, small inconvenient bathroom, obnoxious parking fee.  Pros:  Nostalgia, decent sized rooms overall, availability of 5th sleeper bed, quiet, comfortable beds, location/access to parks, EMH perks.    Details:  Our family of 6 stayed in 2 rooms over the Thanksgiving break.  Since each room holds a maximum of 5 people, we needed 2 rooms, which leads to my first major MAJOR con:  The price.  It's just obnoxiously expensive for what you get.  On the other hand, I can't imagine having more than 4 people in one room, so I was happy to have the second room (and second bathroom!).  We have stayed before with 5 in a room, but when they were small children.  Adults would be very uncomfortable to have more than 4 people in one of these rooms.  The rooms are

This was my fourth visit to Anaheim, and the first time I decided to splurge on a Disney hotel. I was not disappointed. From the moment we checked in we felt the Disney magic instantly. Our room had some beautiful Disney touches and we had a lovely view over the gardens. We were a short walk through downtown Disney to both parks. Unfortunately our children fell very ill with stomach flu during our stay, the hotel cast members went above & beyond the call of duty to look after us, including the in-house nurse. I was so appreciative of the kindness we experienced.

Our Sunday flight home from Anaheim was delayed by 3 hours.  Why is that relevant to the hotel?  We'd ordered Pokemon Sword and Shield to the hotel from Amazon. The game arrived on Friday, apparently after their mailroom closed. They normally reopen on Monday.  We were ready for disappointment, but late on Saturday night we got a call - apparently they'd phoned in somebody to retrieve our package from the mailroom on the weekend.  Thanks to them, we barely noticed the 3-hour flight delay as we engrossed ourselves in a new game.

We had a Convention at this hotel. Composed of several towers with the swimming pool and the Tiki Bar at the center. Good service and good food. Staff are friendly and efficient. The Convention Center was impressive.

We absolutely loved it, our family has been to Disneyland 3 times. We've stayed in 3 different hotels. I would pick this one every time! We have a large family so getting a room for 6 children + 2 adults has been some what of a nightmare in the past. We stayed at the portofino inn before and house keeping cleaned out our room, took my purse, clothes, EVERYTHING! we couldn't fly home with out IDs but the portofino still but us out on our butts. This hotel stepped up to fix the problem. Let's us stayed until we figured out how to get home.

Loved this hotel, so close to the park, and the rooms were wonderful, the staff were happy and helpful.   Loved  that the characters are right there when we were checking into the hotel.   Clean and comfy beds, bathroom was clean, a definite place to stay.

Great and most magical place to be for the whole family. It’s everything that is as advertised! Most fun and awesome experience you can ever have. The excitement is never going to be done. It just keeps going on and on.

We stayed 3 nights mid-week and had a great time. Things are pretty expensive, but anyone going there knows this already.  Great service, super friendly staff.  The hotel is located just next to downtown disney, and is in easy walking distance of both Disneyland and California Adventure.

Overall a positive experience, wonderful meeting rooms, great place for an expo, nice fitness center and pools, but... The check-in was difficult, not super friendly, and early check-in was not possible even though requested in advance. In addition, the food was excessively expensive on site (i.e.) a 20 oz bottle of Dasani water, $5.25. For a convention, especially at a venue like this, surprised to see such small projection screens what you would find in your home or in a conference room at work. Not in a big ballroom which made viewing very difficult. Not a lot of sophistication and decreased quality.

Summary Heading: Really pricey for not a whole lot
Summary: Paid close to $600 for one night in July. The hotel was nothing fancy and it was really not worth the price tag. Plus parking at the hotel is super pricey as well and they get you because I got charged for 2 days when we weren’t even there for a full 24 hours. Staff were nice but it’s literally $100’s of dollars for the Disney name not the experience

How is the Disneyland Hotel only rated 4 stars on TripAdvisor?  10 stars from a Disney-lover!  Maybe you need to be a little Disney-crazy to fully appreciate it and experience value for your $?  Disneyland Hotel is pure Disney magic!  Service, grounds, pools, amenities, activities, characters, music piped in.  Staying there totally extends the magic from being in the parks.  If you want to immerse yourself as much as possible in pixie dust, stay at a Disney resort.  We especially loved taking the monorail from Downtown Disney for Early Magic Hours.  The monorail is restricted to hotel guests at that time so we totally missed the giant lines at the main entrance.  For breakfast, I grabbed us coffee and bagels/pastries from the Coffee House.  Not a huge selection but worked.  Two

Perfect location and hotel was sooo nice. Maybe a bit dated but true Disney magic throughout 😊 Magic hour are a bonus to max ride potential. Love the Disneyland shop too, some bits I had not seen in the park too

Okay to begin with this place is pricey!  It is not cheap but well worth the splurge.  We really enjoyed it!  We went to Disneyland for three days with our teenage children and they loved the room.  There is a button on the lamp that makes the lights twinkle above the bed and it sings a lullaby.  The room was also very spacious.  So it accommodated us easily.  Downstairs there is a Tiki Bar and a cute restaurant to eat at.  We went to the Tiki Bar a couple of times because it is just so entertaining. The bathroom was separated and the toilet had a door to close it off.  The shower had hidden Mickey Mouse heads in the tile and the sink nobs were also Mickey heads.  Best of all if you buy something in the park you can have it sent back to the hotel so you don't have to carry it

I have been to Disneyland several times, but not stayed at a Disney hotel, so this was a special treat.  It is expensive, but worth it!  The rooms were large, and well-appointed, and we enjoyed views over Downtown Disney.  All staff were very helpful, and nothing was too much trouble.  We really enjoyed the "pixie dust" function on the bedside lamp!  It was very convenient, to be able to walk out of the Adventure Tower, down a path, and straight into Downtown Disney.  The lines for the security checkpoint were much shorter than those at the far end of Downtown Disney.  During our stay we enjoyed a breakfast with Goofy.  Both my friend and I are in our 50s, but we really enjoyed playing kids again!  Dining with characters is a financial indulgence, but something we are very

Having read some of the reviews on here I was a little worried that I'd made a mistake booking Disneyland Hotel, but the family (2A + 3C) had an amazing time. We booked the Premium View, Club Level room and although a little small I was impressed with the cleanliness and special touches. There is a reasonably priced laundry, and in fact was the cheapest laundry we found in the 5 weeks traveling the US. The access to Disneyland and California Adventure Park, and the perks of staying in a Disney hotel definitely made our trip that little bit more special and enjoyable.  The only negative was the size of the e-Ticket Club. It was difficult finding a table for our family and we had to be there right on opening time for breakfast in order to do so. The food here is decent though, and

Parking a good deal when staying ( and allows in/out privilegages). Right outside the door (1 block) is the gate to Disney Street and walk by the stores and you’re in the park(s). Pool is decent but quickly will get crowded when warm. Slides are fun though the top most was down for repairs. Lobby had teacups and a Disney TV program playing with two shops. Toilets hidden downstairs. Room was clean with great AC and empty fridge to store things. Soaps and shampoo nice quality. Beds comfy. Gym, who knows! Front Desk staff efficient and friendly but. Or many smiles-

My sister & I stayed for 3 nights in memory of a visit with our parents 43 years ago.  The   staff were wonderful & welcoming (even surprising us with balloons & treats in our room). The location is fantastic being so close to downtown Disney & the mono rail into Disneyland.  The cost was on the high side but was well worth it.

We arrived just before 3pm, room not ready. We were told it wouldn’t be long and to wait. 1 hr later still waiting, we ask again and the guest services  suddenly have a room ready. We cart 5 bags with kids across to the furthest tower and fine they had linked our room keys to a different room.  We rang from the tower and all we got was, well you need to come back to reception and get keys redone.  So off my husband goes, no apology and another hour later we get into our room.  We quickly charge phones and head into the park after losing over 2 hours  Emailed the resort to let them know, response was we will follow this up and never heard a thing.  This was our first time on a Disney property and we were looking forward to the magic 😢

My family and I spent our vacation in Disneyland, we stayed 5 nights at the Disneyland Hotel. We have stayed there on previous trips and are never disappointed. Our room was a deluxe view that overlooked the pool. There where 4 of us in the room (two double beds), but there was also a fold out bed, so lots of room (children are 7 and 9). As always, the rooms where clean and had all of the amenities we needed. We love the closeness of the hotel to the Park and the fact we get “magic morning” park entrance every morning while staying there. My family also love’s the pool at the hotel. It is nice to go back to the hotel after being in the parks all morning for a quick afternoon swim or even going in the evening. The water slide is a big hit with my kids.  The coffee house and

It's been a while since I last stayed on the resort property. Compared to places around the resort, their prices are on the very high side for the type of room you get. So I will only stay if I get a good rate. That said, I did get one and did not expect much more than one of their basic standard rooms.   Upon check in, I politely inquired if it would be possible to get a room in the Fantasy Tower (generally great views), or top floor of the Frontier Tower (taller rooms, balconies). Neither was available. But the castmember checking me in, was able to create a little Disney magic and said she thought I would appreciate the room she was able to select for me. It would be in the Frontier Tower, but on the 10th floor.   When I got to my room I was very happily surprised to find

We had a bumpy stay at this hotel last year but I’m happy to report that things have considerably improved and the value is now much better.   We requested and received an Adventure tower room, which was very clean, and beautifully decorated. We arrived at noon and had to wait until 2pm for the room, but they said there were other rooms available in other towers if we didn’t want to wait. We had a lovely view of the fireworks, so it was worth the wait.  There was turndown service each night, which was a nice amenity. We didn’t use the pool as much as expected because it was chilly, but the hot tub was fantastic.   We had three adults and two small children in the room, and it never felt crowded, which is miraculous. While the bathroom furniture was a bit worn, the rest of the

This is simply a must do for families visiting Disneyland, the experience and memories it creates is amazing!   Having stayed at this hotel before we knew what to expect, close proximity to Downtown Disney and right next to the Monorail.   Having always purchased park ticket packages through the hotel, we noticed this time round at check in, not much time goes into running through the fine details of the tickets and how to best utilise the Disneyland app to take advantage of meeting characters and booking dining experiences. When we made the reservation online, we were told this would happen, but it didn’t.  That and of course the cost of staying at the hotel is really the only downside.   The rooms are great, cute and comfy. The staff are very friendly, not a fan of the

This is my third time staying at this hotel. Of the three Disneyland hotels, this is my favorite. It’s an easy walk to the parks. The room was clean and everything worked. The cast members were very friendly and attentive. I’d definitely stay again.

I was lucky enough to get to stay 3 days at the Disneyland Hotel in a luxury room  that had access to the E-ticket lounge.  What a great  place that was.  Our room key got us in and we enjoyed eating breakfast there each morning.  During the day they served various snacks and finger food  around dinner time. There was a fridge full of various drinks...if you wanted wine or beer they were happy to get it for you.  We were encouraged to eat as much as we wanted and to even take some back to the room or into the park.  Besides the  E-ticket lounge it was great to walk out , cross a driveway and we were at the security gates to Downtown Disney.  Couldn't be any handier.  Being a guest there also gave you the privilege of certain days of early entry to the park, which is always nice.

Disneyland hotel was the best. Expensive but worth it. If you have small children  it’s great. You can go back to your rooms then back to the park. Your within Disneyland Park so no entry fee as you have your pass (which you do pay for) to go in and out as much as you want. Restaurants and food outlets plenty.  Shops. Get early access to park. Great Goofy restaurant. All staff friendly.  Rooms A1. 3 swimming pools. Monorail into park if you don’t want to walk. There are 2 other hotels within the park. They looked nice and are a bit less expensive. The “cars ride” was unbelievable. You can swipe your Disney pass  and get access to the front of the line. That’s a must for some rides.  Start your day when the park opens. People staying at Disney hotels are the only ones allowed in

Well I have this a 4 star for the following reasons: toddler & walking. This hotel is expensive for the quality it offers. The issue is that at this price point you expect better room amenities, bathroom too small, cupboard too small, room just too small. The only reason we stayed here was the the convenience and proximity to parks. Next time I would rather stay outside of parks and stay in a 5 star with better rooms and costs a lot less.

It’s such a beautiful and magical place for everyone in the family. The staff was so kind, always willing to help. The food was delicious and there was something for everyone there. We loved it and will be coming back.

Summary Heading: Considering the price point-should be much better
Summary: Let's be honest, this hotel isn't cheap. But, it rivals some low end motels out there. First of all, the check in process is brutal and takes almost 15 min. No reason for that. My room was nice and clean. Sadly, that's where the "happiness" ended. My sink was blocked up. After the water ran for 5 seconds the sink filled up and took hours to drain. So nice to brush your teeth or shave in those conditions. They did fix it promptly but, it should have been like that to begin with. The shower...does not stay at a consistent temp. Gets very hot, very cold, very hot and the cycle goes on and on. I would not stay there again.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for a visit to Disneyland California
Summary: There are 3 hotels that form part of the Disneyland Resort.  In order of cost (most to least) they are Grand California Hotel, Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier Hotel.  We stayed at DL Hotel for 7 nights, with 4-Day ParkHopper tickets (see separate review) and we also went to Legoland during this time, it's about an hour's drive south.  The DL Hotel has 3 towers - Fantasy Tower, Adventure Tower and Frontier Tower.  The Fantasy Tower also has reception, the shops, etc, etc...  As a result of this the Adventure and Frontier Towers are much quieter and calmer.  I cannot speak highly enough about this hotel, for our family (2 Ad, 2 Kids 10yo & 11yo) it was perfect.  It is located at the beginning of Downtown Disney & is about 10-15 minutes walk from both the Theme Parks themselves.

The hotel was in a perfect location. Easy to get to downtown Disney. The room was ok but there were little things that could be improved on. Not good to be cornered just after checkin for the Disney vacation club which meant the next several days we avoided the lobby. Little decorations on the doors and little touches with positioning / folding towels like we have seen at other Disney hotels would be good. The tiki bar was great with nice food and drinks. It would be good to see you able to have soda fountain refills for when you get back from the park.

Summary Heading: This hotel made the happiest place on earth a nightmare!!!!
Summary: My soster and I went with four boys to Disney and we stayed at the hotel. We booked through disney.go a family suite (hence we asked if it was better for two rooms or a suite and the disney operator told us a family suite would be perfect since it sleeps 6). We told the reception desk that we needed a spotless room since one in our party was going through a cancer treatment. First we arrive and the tv was full of dust. WRONG! Next we go into the shower and hairs in the bathroom. SUPER WRONG!!!  We go to have a break at the pool the waterslides do not work ... TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT .. but oh well we jump into the pool next to the waterslides and it smelled like pee so we decides to go to the largest pool. We go out and onviously one ofnus gets a skin rash.. not even in a 1 star

Came for a conference that was being held mid September. Having stayed at many Disney World Resort hotels I was happy the level of service in Disneyland was just as great. The only thing that was a bit odd was the check in process. The woman who checked me in was very flustered and unorganized for reasons beyond my understanding. She seemed very hung up on checking me in using a bizarre script and when I asked her about room location and upgrading my park tickets she got very visibly anxious. In fact, she after I asked she took my park tickets and disappeared for about 10 minutes for no apparent reason pretty much mid-sentence. Had to ask a manager to find her and when she reappeared she said she was checking on our room...but that doesn't explain why she took the tickets?

We stayed for 4 nights as part of our family vacation in September 2019. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and were assigned room 2956 on the 11th floor. Check-in was easy, the clerk was friendly and informative without overwhelming us. I received a text when our room was ready, as we went straight to enjoy the parks. Bell services delivered our bags to our room for us so that was nice and easy as well. The room was clean and had plenty of space for our party of 5. Beds were comfortable. There were 3 bathrooms total in the suite. Pool area could use a few more chairs as it was pretty crowded most afternoons. But we managed to find 2 beside each other to set up as a base for our group to share. Our only issue was with at the TikiBar, they did not accept our Canadian driver's

For $1700 a night I wanted my family to be transported to a magical suite! Sitting in the living room enough for the eight of us, maybe a table to eat on? I don’t know things you would think you’d get....nope. This were three separate rooms that we had to prop the doors open so my family could come and go. Let’s call it what it really is..three rooms they call one. If needed they just rent the three separate rooms and close the connector doors. NEVER, EVER AGAIN!  We will spend that kind of money at a REAL suite. Lots of choices around the park.

Would have loved to stay longer at the Disneyland Hotel as this was a special celebration but we were actally staying in San Diego and had a room there.  Anyway, check in was quick.  We arrived mid morning and they had a room for us.  They asked if we were celebrating anything and said we were celebrating an anniversary and birthday, so they upgraded our room.  Had an amazing view, the room was really nice, no complaints whatsoever.  So convenient and so close to Disneyland/California Adventure.  Would love to stay here again!

They messed up not putting all the names on the reservation, and now the people who arrived early can’t check in and there is nothing they will do about it. Manager also wouldn’t even come over and talk. Just kept telling her employee to come tell me no and wouldn’t talk to me herself. Now I have to wait hours until the rest of the party arrives. Not even apologetic for screwing up our reservation. Never coming back here again. Horrible customer service. No amenities offered while I wait either. Just have to sit in the lobby. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

I have enjoyed the stay at Disneyland Hotel. The room is clean and has a wall that lights Up.The room accommodated 4 adults and a young child and any concerns was quickly solved. The  The cast members are really nice along with the pool.

We had a wonderful buffet breakfast. The food was plentiful, and a wide variety. However: we were there to see Goofy & friends. We had Goofy, Mini Mouse, Chip & Dale, and that was it. Sad really. We expected at least a couple of more characters. For the amount of money spent (over $100 for 2 people) to only have 4 characters show up was disappointing.

This review is strictly for their Afternoon Tea at Steakhouse 55 inside the hotel. I booked this reservation back in July because it's a pretty popular event. September was the earliest they had. I didn't know the theme was The Haunted Mansion's 50th Anniversary, so all the treats were ghoulishly fun! Service was great, typical Disney. 3hr validated parking is included. My daughter had a delightful time. Adults $55, Child $25. It's not cheap so definitely not something I would do often.

Was hopeful this would be my first 5 star and it was so so close.  The biggest negative was the view.  Paid a significant amount for an upgraded Premium Room view and was placed on the 4th floor of the Adventure Tower, right next to the elevator and was staring at the top of the Tiki Bar.  Very disappointing for the money spent.  The room lacked a bit of the Disney magic I had anticipated. Staff was very polite with the exception of a return at the store on property.  I purchased a pair of pants and while they didn't have a changing room confirmed before my purchase that I could return them if they didn't fit and when I went back the next morning and was hassled a bit for why I was returning.  Not a great experience. The location is iiiiideal and was thrilled to use the

I have only positive comments. Hotel is beautiful and very clean, the pool area with the slides are amazing, the staff is beyond professional, service is great, and everything is very well organized. We had a pool view room two queen beds, it was large enough although bathroom a bit small and pillows could be more comfortable. It does not matter much as you will rarely be in your room! Short 8min walk to both park entrance. I highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Tired feel but in good location
Summary: We were club class and without it my score would have been lower. Our room was a decent size and faced the parks so we were able to watch the fireworks from our room.  If we were in another tower or just faced the pool without club class, the hotel would have felt like your average Travelodge but with a pool.  Location at the end of Diwntown Disney is great, but it is not as "magical" as the Florida deluxe resorts.  For the price you pay I expected more than a good location with a decent pools (with out of order slides!!!)

Loved the Disneyland hotel! Loved the lighted fireworks on the headboards.  The rooms were very clean.  Super friendly staff! Concierge lounge was fantastic. The staff were very accommodating. I cannot say enough good.  Will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Loved the Short Walk to The Parks!! Pleasant Room.
Summary: Our 4th floor room was convenient to the elevators, pool, walkway to Downtown Disney. We were only 2, but were given a sizeable room with 2 queen beds and a sofa. Very comfortable. Only wish there was a microwave.....We walked through the Grand Floridian Hotel to get to CA Adventure Park. Very nice timesaver!! The walk to Disneyland Park was about 10 minutes, or you can catch the Monorail and ride across to the far side of the park in a few minutes. My granddaughter enjoyed the hotel pool, we enjoyed Goofy's Character Breakfast at our hotel, with a nice selection of breakfast and lunch foods.The food service at the pool was excruciatingly slow, expensive, and truly not worth the cost. Overall, good stay, friendly and helpful staff.

The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable with friendly staff and great service. Easy access to the parks by Monorail, and there is always a security check. Also a short walk to the parks with great shopping and restaurants.

Summary Heading: All we had hoped and worth the price.
Summary: We booked a 3-bedroom suite and it included a living space.The total was less that 3 rooms on their own. We planned a pool day on either end of our trip and the kids played for hours! We finally found the microwave at the end of our trip, in the 1st floor concession area. It would be ideal if each room or at least the suite included a microwave. It also allowed our family with a 7 and 9 year old to take a break midday so we could head back to the parks for the evening-invaluable!

We had limited time and specific needs for our trip to Disney - including the need to get back to our room so my granddaughter could take a nap so she could return to the park in the late afternoon.  It was expensive, but it helped ensure that we were able to make the most out of our Disney experience. Memories of childhood shared with the next generation....

I stayed here during the 2019 Labor day long weekend and it far beyond my expectations.  I have stayed previously before at Grand Californian many times but it was my first time at the Disneyland Hotel!   The rooms have been recently refurbished and it was extremely well kept and clean. There was a long line at check in but the CM's were very accommodating for requests (I wanted a room with the bathroom all in one space) and I even got to stay at the Fantasy tower, which is the closest to DTD / Monorial for DLR.  I was able to fly solo with my kid and it wasn't too difficult getting around.  Pros: - Amazing staff are super helpful and sweet. Props to all the CMS working and putting up with all the guests there! - Rooms were beautifully themed and tastefully decorate. Lots of

Summary Heading: Closest of the 3 Disney hotels to the Disneyland Monorail.
Summary: Four updated Disney themed towers with floor to ceiling hotel room windows.  Fantasy tower includes the bell/valet, resort concierge/guest services, sundry shop & souvenir store.  Rooms overlook the pool or parking.  Adventure tower includes the Concierge Level Lounge on the 11th of 11 floors.  Views of pool or Downtown Disney/Disneyland.  7th floor and above overlook the trees that will block views from lower floors.  9th-11th floors are Lounge level rooms costing $100+ per person per day for continental breakfast, snacks, sodas, evening drinks & fireworks viewing.  Rooms at the north end have a better Disneyland view.  South end has more of a Downtown Disney view and a bit of California Adventure.  We have stayed many times in all 3 Disney hotels.  The Adventure tower with

My husband and I enjoyed 3 nights at this hotel. I was impressed with the size of the room and the Walt Disney touches. The view we had of the pool area was lovely.  The rooms are in need of a refurb pretty soon as there are small defects here and there, but overall they are up to Disney standard.  Cast members in the hotel were all very friendly and helpful.   The walk to the parks was very short and convenient.

This hotel is beyond compare when it comes to experiencing Disneyland - there is simply no better way to do it if you're visiting from afar. But, purely comparing this as a high end hotel, it fall short for the price compared to what would be expected of similarity priced hotels in other places. The staff are courteous, but I would say overall they just seem to be doing their job. I have stayed at hotels where the staff have been the absolute highlight of the stay (four seasons Seattle for example.) The pool staff are very relaxed - you can wait quite a while for a fresh drink unless you go and find someone and give them a healthy tip, and basically ask them to make sure your beer doesn't run dry. This is okay - I appreciate that they are not in your face but I noticed a lot of

Summary Heading: A little pricey but a good experience
Summary: Things we loved: - The location can't be beat! The hotel is directly across from the security check-point into downtown Disney. Staying here saved us a LOT of walking. - The room was huge, clean, and had all of the Disney touches one would expect. The headboard lit up, the lamp had a music box option, even the taps & lamps were Mickey themed. Our room had two queen beds and a day bed with still plenty of room to move around and store our suitcases. - The beds & linen were soooo comfortable.  - It was very quiet and the blackout drapes were so effective that you could sleep in the middle of the day no problem if need be.  - The bathroom was huge, had two sinks, and a separate wash closet. The toiletries were of very high quality and were very well stocked.  -The room had a mini

Me and my wife stayed at Disney Land Resort for three nights. We stayed in the frontier tower which is located to the rear of the resort. Our room was lovely and Disney themed. The resort itself had a great pool and food. The resort was walking distance to both Disneyland and the adventure park. We also loved the high quality shower products provided. Loved our stay.

Summary Heading: Gonna have the name....step up your game!
Summary: Maybe I’m more used to Disney World where everyone is friendly and they go out of their way to help and make it a magical trip. At $600 per night I wasn’t very impressed. Yes the room was clean...very small. The shower is getting old and not great water pressure. They said we had a downtown Disney and fireworks view. Except the trees in front of our window we would of had a great fireworks view. The cleaning staff are always yelling throughout the hallways throughout the day. Maybe they assumed everyone was gone to the theme park during the day but we weren’t. My daughter was sick and I thought it was rude. We asked a lady that was cleaning across the hall if we could get our room cleaned at 1 pm. She told me it wasn’t her job. I asked can you please tell someone as the house

Summary Heading: Loved the Disney magic in this hotel!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of my daughter's 16 birthday present (went to LA afterwards).  We are from the East Coast so we normally go to Disneyworld.  I had stayed here when I was younger so it had been quite a while since I was there.  I would have loved to stay an additional day or 2 so we could have experienced the hotel as we did 2 full park days.  We didn't stay any additional nights due to the price of the hotel and parking fees (they add up).  That is the only reason I removed a star was the price per night.  The room wasn't that big as our next hotel after this in Los Angeles was much more spacious.   I loved the Mickey touches throughout this hotel.  You don't see as many in the Disneyworld hotels any more.  From the tea cup couches in the lobby to the Mickey

From the moment we were greeted from our long journey to the happiest place on Earth, till the moment we left, the staff at Disneyland Hotel made our family feel like superstars.  Upon checking in, we were greeted by Ernie, who went above and beyond to cater for us due to our room not being ready. We are truly grateful for the hospitality shown.   Our room had a fantastic view overlooking the parks and we got to see the fireworks from our room.  I would love to know what kind of matress's are on the beds because i had the most incredible sleep. Super comfy.  Nothing was ever too much trouble for any of the staff and they were always so friendly and helpful.   I can not wait to get back to Disneyland Hotel, my stay here was perfect.

Summary Heading: A great pleasure for me and my family
Summary: IT is a very well organized hotel with very dedicated staff people. The fact of being located practically inside the Disney complex makes you have a real fantastic Disney experience.  The food options are good with a Hawaiian restaurant by the pool, a small  coffee shop and the guff breakfast restaurant. The location is strategic for you to come and go around and even to the beach or LA by car.  The swimming pool is great with a salted water care. Important ... No noise at the rooms because of a heavy door and thick walls. Seems that everything was very well thought for you

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but a bit noisy
Summary: We spent 5 days at Disneyland and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. I liked the original atmosphere which reflected the 1950s when Disneyland opened. On the other hand the hotel could use some updating. The hotel staff was very nice. The only real issue was the noise. We could hear every bathroom activity happening in the neighbouring rooms, the toilet flushing were extremely annoying to listen to.

Having stayed in many of the Disneyland partner hotels we decided that we would try the Disneyland hotel  What an amazing choice we made The hotel is fantastic, very clean, well dressed themed staff, very helpful, the room was fantastic and the food outstanding with plenty of choice for everyone  The characters come around the tables in the evening to make the stay even more magical  Highly recommend and we won’t be staying in any other hotel on our annual holidays to Disneyland

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel as part of a honeymoon trip (apparently we are a pair of the "childless millennials" that are ruining the experience for everyone!). It was our first time at Disneyland, and our visit was exactly what we anticipated it would be: plenty of fun in an overpriced wrapper.   There are indeed whimsical Disney touches throughout the hotel and in your room (the fireworks display over the bed set to a music-box melody brought a nostalgic tear to my eye). However I have to disagree with other reviewers who report that the Disneyand Hotel is "packed" with magic. Outside of the teacup chairs in the lobby and the colorful scenery at the pool, the property felt basic and industrial to me. Our room was dimly lit (especially in the shower) and the hallways even

My husband and I had the pleasure of staying here in a concierge level king bed room for 4 nights in mid-July. We were on the 10th floor of the Adventure Tower, with the E-Ticket Lounge for Concierge being located on the 11th, or top, floor of the Adventure Tower. Although we are DVC members, we did not use our points for this stay, opting to pay cash. We truly enjoyed our stay, celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary in magical accommodations. Pros:  - Check-in was effortless, efficient, and informative. We were escorted up to the concierge lounge to complete check in and were given information in regards to when food and beverages would be available. The lounge overlooks the Downtown Disney area, with views of California Adventure's Pixar Pier and parts of Disneyland park as

We went here after always dreaming of going to Disneyland when kids... and it definitely lived up to expectations. The rides at Disneyland weren’t thrilling for mid-twenties people (us), however were still fun as we were reliving our childhood. Only problem is the skip the queues option (fastpass, express etc) isn’t that great... so be prepared to be standing in queues for most the day. Get in early, as you’ll easy take 12 hours to do the park, after spending hours in queues. Download the app to check updated wait times.  Disney California adventure is better for our age group, as the rides are more age appropriate. The incredibles roller coaster, guardians of the galaxy, and cars rides were awesome.   The character photo stops (Mickey, Minnie, Donald Duck, toy story etc) are

I live 10 minutes from Disneyland and this is our second stay here. I always feel like were in a vacation when staying here. The kids loved the pool. It was warm and centrally located. We ate at Tonga terrace and it has dole whip! The best part is th view to fireworks. If you’re lucky to get a room which faces the fireworks, remember to turn on tv for matching music during fireworks.

Fantastic Hotel with great restaurants.  Trader Sam's is a must.  The Jr Suites are primarily located in the Fantasy Tower and face north.  The rooms consist of an entrance hall leading to a central living room flanked by two bedrooms with full baths.  The living room comes equipped with a small refrigerator, a pull out coach and a flip down kids twin bed.  The bedrooms in our unit contained 2 queens and a King in the master.   The King/Master is in a smaller room, but it's adequate considering the living room next door and does come equipped with a mini fridge.    I highly recommend this hotel.  It's location is perfect, with a 100 yard walk to the monorail station.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Disneyland Hotel.
Summary: Stayed 3 nights and had a great stay. Check in was easy and fast. We arrived early in the day so they stored our baggage. Only took a couple minutes that evening to get the bags brought up to the room. Staff was amazing. The room was comfortable and had plenty of room. The headboard for the beds is a nice touch and makes a great nightlight for kids. The pool area is huge and beautiful.   The security check into Downtown Disney is much shorter than the entrance from Harbor Blvd.  Tip. If you have mobility issues like my wife, you can rent a scooter at the hotel for less than the park scooters and have it all the way back to the hotel instead of just the park.

Our kids picked this one out of the three Disney properties.  Turns out they made a good call.  We were willing to pay the premium to stay on property, and have spent three weeks at WDW over the years so knew what we were getting into.  The Disney service, small touches, and Magic Hours are worth the extra cash in our view, but your mileage may vary.  The small touches part worked great.  The pools were high quality and our kids liked the slides.  Bar service at the pool helped, and was reasonable given the size of the place.  The rooms were clean and had a lot of small delights - the fireworks display over the bed was unique.  Disney has upped their room quality game.  The service part... some good, some bad.  The usual cheerful cast members throughout, particularly the

Summary Heading: Great location for a family of 5
Summary: We are DVC members and used points for this stay. Loved the location with easy access to Downtown Disney and the parks. If you have the option, would recommend the Fantasy tower to Adventure tower. Both are closer to the downtown Disney than the Frontier tower. Our room in the Adventure tower faced Downtown Disney so we could hear some noise during the day with some of the music being played at the live stage and of course we could hear the fireworks at night. Neither bothered us at all.  Our room comfortable accommodated a family of five with three teenagers. The couch folded down into a twin sized bed and we had two additional queen beds. We would definitely stay here again!

We stayed in the Disneyland hotel on our last visit to Disneyland.The lobby was magical with holiday decorations and even a Santa visiting. The room was more usual and did not seem too special but it was nice and clean but not as nice as I would think for the price. We walked through Downtown Disney to get to the parks and even took the monorail a couple times which is located pretty close to the hotel. It was really hot so we used the pool one day, which my family looooooved. There are beautiful pool with slides. I would stay here again if it wasn't so pricey!

We have stayed on Harbor Blvd. before and it was a dream to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It was $560 a night which was a lot and my expectations were set high. The room was amazing with the Disney touches. I loved walking through dowtown disney to get to the parks - it helped feel like you were in the disney bubble:-) They did not let us know but the monorail waterslide was closed for repair. They were also doing work at the pool and we would have to listen to a jackhammer while at the pool. We could never find pool chairs and waited for over 30 minutes at the pool if we ordered a drink.  We called for a wine glass to be delivered to the room and they said they would have to charge a delivery fee and it would be 60 minutes. We ran out of toilet paper in our bathroom. they were

I have several concerns about my recent stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  In hindsight, I wish I would have stayed at a good neighbor hotel.  The mattresses were horrible.  Even my 14 year old complained about back pain the first morning before we had even been to the park.  There was quite a bit of noise on our floor so we asked for a floor fan to add drown out the sound.  The front desk told us no, but housekeeping said yes but never delivered it.  We didn’t rent a car so I ended up ordering a fan to be delivered through Post-mates.  My husband called the front desk to explain the expected delivery, but when Post-mates showed up, the Front desk wouldn’t accept the delivery.  It was a fiasco and ended with me having to give the delivery driver my first name, last name, and room

Such a great time at the Disneyland Hotel from Parking to check in, to getting into our room and then jumping in the pool.  We have never had a bad experience at the Disneyland Hotel and if we ever had an issue it was straightened out right away without questions or problems.   I would definitely recommend the Disneyland Hotel as a couples getaway retreat or a family fun filled short vacation with all the amenities around the property including early access to both Disneyland and California adventure.

Summary Heading: Disney Vacation with Family and Friends
Summary: We had a visit to the hotel and park that began on a Friday and went until Sunday at the Disneyland hotel. Check in is 3pm when the room is guaranteed to be ready. Following arrival early, we waited until 3pm to check in. Then we were told we would get a text message when the room was ready as it wasn't ready at 3pm. The cast me ever stated they had anywhere from 3-4 to get the room. That wasn't accurate. 350pm comes around and my entire group has been just waiting in the lobby. Then I go to the counter again and am told it will likely be another 45 minutes! It ess a horrible experience overall. Disney allowed me to then pay for an upgrade to get in sooner. Just a horrible experience. I spoke with a supervisor and they helped address the concerns layer that evening after we

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Very Convenient - Great Staff
Summary: The hotel was very convenient to the parks and it was great to get the extra hour of park access early in the day. They could use a little updating in the rooms (USB ports, microwaves in the suites) but when the TV quit they had a new one for us within a half hour. I recommend valet parking if you don't intend to leave for a few days. We had the 2-bedroom suite for a family of 6 and it worked out great. Be prepared for some big $ to cover the room and tickets for a couple of days. The restaurant selection at the hotel is limited - plan on going to Downtown Disney for that - it's a 7 minute walk but you have to go through security.

Summary Heading: A nice hotel missing the magic of Disney World
Summary: The actual property is nice enough, the rooms were well-maintained and comfortable, and the beds were nice.  The lighting in the rooms, however, was terrible.    The problem is that all of Disneyland is missing the magic 'wow' of Disney World.  There is no charm and no magic.  Not in the employees themselves and not in the property. Disneyland Hotel is just a hotel and Disneyland is just an amusement park.   If you want a hotel close to DL and CA, this fits the bill.  If you are looking for a Disney experience, go to Florida.

Summary Heading: What a disappointment for the amount paid
Summary: It has been years since I have stayed at the Disneyland hotel.  I was really looking forward to this visit.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower third floor.  The room was tiny! Two queen beds and the bathroom was split, and was so small they had to have pocket doors.  A sink on one side with virtually no counter space and the toilet and shower on the other.  We overlooked the parking lot and were right next to an elevator and generator.  I am usually very proactive about a different room, but fortunately we were only there for one night.  The pool area was under construction, with all the slides closed and a huge half wall erected.  They claim this was communicated when booking, but I did not see it and I would think in the heart of summer this large of a project should be

Excellent first time stay! It was great to be in the Disney bubble and stay at this historic hotel and we were only a 5-7 minute walk from the park gates (we speed walk!).  There was never much of a line to go through security at DTD, which is a noticeable bonus compared to coming in from Harbor Blvd, so this sped up our early morning starts!  Our room was spacious and the bed very comfortable and we loved the headboard! Small Disney touches in the room were great too - look out for hidden Mickeys! We were high up in Fantasy Tower overlooking the pool, which was a nice view and we didn’t hear any noise from DTD or the eatery/bar either.   General decor in the hotel is great, with historic photos of Walt and DLR. The tea cup seats in the lobby are awesome too!  CM’s were friendly

Location can't be beat, but it's the little things for the kids that make this place.  My 4 year old didn't want to leave to go to the park.  The pool and amenities are amazing.  Yes, it's over-priced, but the effort is there, and the convenience to the parks can't be beat.

I’ve been a pass holder for 15 years, grew up in OC and never stayed a Disney Hotel. This was my first time. What can I say it’s Disney, if your like Disney, it won’t disappoint. We had a room in the frontier tower, had a view of everything. The complaints I have is it’s noisy. I could hear music all night long. The fridge in the room was loud when it would turn on in the middle of the night. Also I booked my room with the intentions that the water slides were just redone. Got there and were told they were closed and we could walk 10min to Paradise pier to use the slides. Bummer. I will stay at the property again.

Summary Heading: Loved the Disneyness of this Hotel.
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights. Very well located hotel in the center of Disneyland Resort.  Reasonably sized room in great condition.   Better sized and condition than rooms in Disney Grand California.   The Great Bits: The Disneyness of the Hotel.     The Good Bits:  Very well located near downtown Disney and 2 x parks. The Bad Bits:  None. It’s Disneyland.

The rooms are dated but you are paying for convenience of the location and amenities like the pool.  The check-in/Guest Service process is insanely long and labored.  I only booked a room in order to secure a Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge reservation, which was worth it BUT since I told everyone I spoke with this was a special trip you'd think they would have given me much needed details about the Galaxy's Edge reservation center. NOPE. The hotel staff also sold me the wrong park tickets which resulted in a waste of my Magic Hour the next morning and another hour in that damn lobby line!

Summary Heading: Location is great but is very overpriced for the quality of the room
Summary: I stayed here for two nights with my family for our summer vacation and opening of Star Wars. We arrived early and our room was available for us. Our room was location was acceptable and easy to get too. However, the furniture was damaged, sheets were stained and wallpaper was peeling. All items were operational. When I called to let the hotel know about the damage the person answering the phone said ok. When we requested a manager come to the room to see the damage we were told no one is available and to come to the lobby to wait to see someone. Once in the lobby I shared my issues with the guest services worker. The manager of maintenance cane to the room to see the issues. After seeing the damage he did everything he could to remedy the situation. We moved rooms at nearly 9

I stayed with three of my girlfriends in mid-May 2019, prior to the opening of Galaxy's Edge.  One of the things I enjoy so much about Disney are the "little touches" that make your stay a wonderful one; the atmosphere that Disney cultivates.  Our room was in the Frontier Tower facing the parking lot.  The standard two Queen room ended up being decently spacious for four adult women, surprisingly; and with the tub/toilet area being totally separate from the sink/vanity, we were all able to get ready in the mornings without much hassle.  The hotel was very quiet - we never even heard the ice machine which was RIGHT next to our room.  We slept wonderfully and the beds were insanely comfortable.  On one of the longer park days, two of us caught a few hours sleep after taking a dip

It’s location makes this a good choice. Otherwise it’s an average hotel it’s not the best location that goes the Grand Californian. Our room was plagued with problems. No hot water TV remote doesn’t work another tv goes on but not off. In our 2 day stay it took so long for things to get fixed we just didn’t bother. Yes if traveling again to Disney and we can’t get into the Grand Californian we will stay here again and hope for a better experience.

Our recent stay at Disneyland Hotel and visit to Disneyland, Disney’s California Adventure and Galaxy’s Edge with MaxPass was underwhelming. The hotel room was clean, but there was a centipede that crawled across the lobby as we checked in and the pool and restaurants were “meh”, outdated and bland.  Our main concern before heading to Disneyland was lines, but with MaxPass, we were able to visit both parks and try all the major rides on the first day.   The rides at Disneyland and Disney’s California Adventure were outdated and at times, almost sad; definitely not the Happiest Place on Earth. The only places that felt new were the shops filled with merch and more merch.   Our Galaxy’s Edge reservation was from 11AM to 3PM the second day. At the main Disneyland entrance, we asked

The 2BR, 2.5 Bath was perfect for our family of six.  Layout was perfect, with a large living/ dining room in the center between two bedrooms.  The half bath was another nice extra.  The refrigerator and bar area was great, just wish that there had been a microwave as well to heat up leftovers. The Disney touches were fun and thrilled our grand- daughter.  All of the staff members that we encountered were pleasant and willing to go the extra mile to make sure that we were happy.  Pools are great, could use some additional seating during warm weather. Would stay here again, the convenience is priceless!

Summary Heading: You can put lipstick on a pig... this is a review of the Disneyland Hotel and not Disneyland
Summary: From the moment we checked in to the Disneyland Hotel it was a disappointment. The building itself looks like a 1980's commission home complex (projects for those in the US). The front desk 'Cast' member was terrible. He was robotic, void of personality and appeared to be in a rush to move us on. There was no hint of “The Happiest Place on Earth” and he didn't explain anything about the hotel or help set up the Disneyland FAST PASS. The rooms are dated and our view of Disneyland Main Street was no where to be seen. Instead we had a view of a building and the carpark next door. This, when we paid extra for the view and mentioned it was our 25th wedding anniversary.   The facilities around the hotel are lacking. The swimming pool is much smaller than appear on the pictures and a

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel just for one night so that we could get reservations for the Star Wars Galaxy's Edge. We (me, my sister, and my nephew) had some doors open to make this quick overnight trip possible. We checked in on a Sunday afternoon and were given an upgrade to a deluxe view instead of standard. Our room overlooked the pool area and hub of the hotel (essentially a massive courtyard if you will surrounded by all 3 towers). Room was clean and the in room amenities were great. There touches of Disney magic throughout the room. The bell service we used was very prompt, bringing the bags to the room within 10 minutes of calling. Room had a lot more space that I had imagined. The mini fridge worked very nice to chill bottles of water and juice to take into the park

I was the event planner and attendee of a small meeting at the Disneyland Hotel.  The great thing about Disney is they know their stuff so you can execute on a last minute event fairly easily- two week's notice.  Staff were all professional and helpful.  Event went smoothly, though there was an extremely loud group next door to us so keep in mind if you're in a room with movable walls, noise may be an issue.    Just like the park though, F&B was on the higher side with extra fees because we were a small group - always frustrating.  They wanted to charge $100 for a carafe of hot water.  What?  Presentation of food was excellent.  I wish they'd get an app to help with contacting during an event when you need help with something rather than sending an email and hoping someone will

Summary Heading: An experience for a life time
Summary: I spend three wonderful nights with my family at this property. Every member of the staff (cast members) who served us did so with upmost courtesy. Disneyland is still the friendlies place on Earth. Also, our suite was immaculately clean, quiet, and spacious. When visiting Disneyland one must stay at their hotels. Guests have access to the "Magic Hour". This happens between 7 and 8 am when only Disney property guests may enjoy one of the parks' attractions without having to stand in line. Actually, the Magic Hour extends for another hour while the regular visitors begin to arrive and the facilities begin to face their daily demand.

We have stayed here several times now and it’s definitely our favourite.   It’s very Disney, through and through. Family-oriented, great pools and slide, great amenities, great nostalgic touches.   Rooms are nice and big and well laid out. I especially appreciate the little coffee bar area across from the closet where my daughter and I could do our hair and not take up the bathroom.   The beds are so comfortable and the beautiful headboard is a nice touch!   The ambiance is just amazing from the beautiful blues, tiki torches, abundant palm trees, outdoor fireplace, spouting geyser, manicured green lawns all the way to the Sorcerer Mickey hat that sparkles at night.   The location at the end of Downtown Disney is great too.   Some minor things...hot water was hard to come by

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for the Christmas/New Year Holiday.  The walk from the hotel to park was painless and convenient. We had access to the Monorail which made the back and forth even easier for late nights at the park or rest breaks. The rooms were clean, with all the Disney touches that make a stay at one of their resorts a touch above the rest.

Summary Heading: Close to all of the magic
Summary: We loved our stay at the Disneyland Hotel. We had high expectations after staying at the Grand Californian a few years ago, and Disney met them. While a family can find more affordable options in the immediate area, the Disneyland Hotel is worth the premium for location, access to the theme parks, and the resort vibe. We loved the monorail pool (best non-water park water slide at a Disney resort pool).

I take my family to Disneyland once a year for three days.  This is our fourth year now at Disneyland Hotel and we love it.  The hotel is very clean, staff is efficient, has all the "magical" touches (light-up headboards, music, Mickey hands, etc) for the kids while still low-key enough for the parents, and is perfectly situated.  Our favorite of the three onsite hotels for sure.  If you go during "pool" season (and the pools are open) they are great.  Not sure why they seem to have been under construction for the last year or so but a day in the pool there is a great way to break up a Disneyland trip.  Would it be worth the price if located anywhere else in America?  Obviously not, but for what it is and where it is, I don't think you can ask for more.

Summary Heading: Walt knows how to do it Right!
Summary: wonderful family gig for 5 days at Disneyland Hotel!  4 kids and spouses, 3 grandchildren and a 4-Day park hopper Max pass, with a lucky last day for the Star Wars grand opening.  WOOHOO!!!!  Make sure to stay at the Disneyland Hotel!

Summary Heading: Outdated Hotel but perfectly located for Disneyland
Summary: Our last two nights of our SocCal holidays we spent at Disneyland Hotel. It goes without saying that this hotel is perfectly located to enter the two Disneyland parks. Staying at the property allows you to enter the parks an hour before the official opening. And frankly speaking this was exactly the reason why we chose this hotel. However, the hotel is a little outdated. The three large buildings lack of charm. The rooms are rather small and hardly fit a family of four. Unfortunately, the water slides were under construction and therefore could not be used. Nevertheless, the pool was large with a nice surrounding garden. And the gym was great too.  There might be better option in town in particular as the hotel is quite pricey.

We got the chance to stay here for 2 nights during our recent stay.  This was our first time and a surprise to our kids.  We thought the hotel was great.  The pools were just redone and were great for the kids.  Our room was big, 2 queens and a sofa couch.  We were in the Adventure Tower in room 2441.  It faced Downtown Disney with CA on one side and DL on the other.  We had a great view of the fireworks show going on in DL.  Down fall to facing Downtown Disney is the noise from the live entertainment.  It was not a huge issue, just our first night, we tucked in early as were were pooped and the music was going until about 9:45pm, again not a huge deal just annoying our first night being super tired.  Everyone was so nice, from check in to the maid checking on us. Definitely

Summary Heading: Expected much more from a Disney Hotel, they even lost my mail
Summary: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel and expected much more from it since this is a Disney hotel.  To begin with, the day I arrived there was no water in my minibar, I called room service and they took around 50 min to get me 2 bottles of water, not to say that the price was outrageous, at least the employee that brought me the water was kind enough to tell me there was a vending machine downsatirs which was cheaper and I would not have to wait 45 min. Second issue was with my mail, I did some online shopping on Amazon and when packages arrived they left a voice mail in my room phone which made a red light blink.  So when I went down to the front desk, I was surprised as they then said my mail wasn´t there because packages have to go though security and this delays them 1 full day!

Great place,  we were here for a dance competition.  The Goofy Kitchen is where we ate breakfast and my daughter is surly to never forget!  People were amazing and characters at the Kitchen were so nice!

It was a great experience! Your pay for the experience.  We did the goofy brunch, come hungry so you get your money's worth.  The large pool was heated (thank god) even in may it the air was a little cool.  Only thing as an improvement. Coffee in the room. Hilton and Westin has amazing coffee and condiments in the room for half the price of the room. I wish we could kick this up a little bit quality wise.   Room had a day bed! If you need a pack and play they have them for free.. just call down to services.   Latest check out possible is noon so plan accordingly.   Great visit

We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite (11 of us). The room was nice enough, but set up kind of strangely -- 2 bedrooms had king beds, and 1 had 2 queens. Suites like this would be much better suited for big groups if all rooms had 2 queens (or maybe 1 had a king). It was a bit difficult with our group, and there were no other options to speak of. We had tried to specify prior to check in, and they told us we had no options until check in. Decor looks pretty dated and lackluster (other than the awesome headboards!). Also, there was a kitchenette, but no microwave, silverware or plates/cups.   Beds were comfortable, and bedrooms were large. Location is good -- it's at the very end of Downtown Disney (which feels like a looooooong walk at the end of the day!), but the Monorail is a short

This the second time I’ve stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. The first time we were assigned the Adventure Tower and this time the Frontier.  Both were great.  Didn’t get a great view this time however it was booked late so no problem. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Amenities include refrigerator, coffee maker and large tv.  Check in was a dream as we arrived early and was given a room at check in. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Only issue was I wish the lobby store was open later as I forgot a couple of things and it would have been appreciated to get items.

We had a great time.  The facilities were perfect for families with children.  The food was great and the restaurants at the hotel seemed diverse.  It was much better than I expected it to be.  Disney did it right here!

We had a business conference here which was a great place to come. The music playing was awesome from various Disney movies. The walk between the Grand Californian hotel and Disneyland Hotel was absolutely beautiful. The grounds on Disneyland Hotel are gorgeous. The larger gazebo with the flowers are a great place for a wedding and pictures.

My husband,his parents, his sister and 2 kids just spent 3 nights at The Disneyland Hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The rooms were very nice. The beds were surprisingly comfortable.      What I liked most about staying here was probably the convenience. It was nice to stroll back to our room during the afternoon to rest or even to go off property to go shopping. Then go back to Disneyland or California adventure for the rest of the day. We already decided if we go back to Disneyland, this is where we’re staying from now on.      The staff at check in was very welcoming and helpful. Willing to answer any questions we had.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for a number of reasons: - Convenience of being able to walk to and from the parks - Magic Hour - A complete Disney experience  The hotel and our room was spotless and well appointed. The kids loved the light up headboard (I did too just quietly). Staff were professional and very obliging.   Dinner at Goofy's Kitchen was great fun, and definitely a good way to meet some of the characters to allow more time to do other things in the park.  The Hotel is not that far from the parks - a 5-7 minute walk. The monorail station is a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel. Being so close to Downtown Disney is very convenient for shopping and dining. If you are intending on dining in Downtown Disney, its best to phone ahead and book a table. It gets busy at night!

This is my first experience in a Disney hotel and other than the paintings in the room, the Disney themed headboard, and the mickey mouse styled taps, there is not much else in the room that differs it from a normal hotel room. I would have preferred themed rooms.   Check in was very fast and the lady who dealt with us was sooooo enthusiastic and friendly.   The main advantage is the extra hour that we get in the mornings before the official opening time (which park you get the extra hour for depends on the day of the week). However i would recommend leaving a lot of time to get through security as i did not get in until 8.20am on my first day (i left my room at 7.50am). The extra time before the parks became crazy busy was a real advantage for me.

I took my four year old grandson for a week vacation just to get away.  What a wonderful spot to hang out!  The pool cabanas were excellent options for the day to add comfort to our day and personal service for food and drinks.  The disney characters came out to the pool area often.  Clean, friendly and relaxing.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay when visiting the parks
Summary: It was nice to be so close to DL and DCA so we could just walk in ans out each day.  And staying in the hotel meant we had early access to the parks each day. The rooms were nice - nothing spectacular, but clean and spacious.

We have a little one so did not want to travel far between the park and hotel everyday. This comes at a price of course.
