The Disneyland Hotel for three nights cost about the same as the Courtyard across from the main entrance. So my husband wanted to try a more “magical experience”. They let us checked in early (about noon), got key cards but no room number. Check in was super easy and fast. All our luggage was stored with the bell service. The bell service was great. The hotel texted me when the room was ready, which was at 2:51PM. We didn’t bother coming back until 8PM. Our room was in the Frontier Tower on the 8th floor. It was very comfortable, clean and pleasantly modern. It is the furthest of the 3 Towers but it’s not too bad of a walk. It took us over an hour and three

Summary Heading: Enjoyable conference and location for vacation
Summary: First stay at Disney resort in California.  Most enjoyable.  Very good location for a conference, then Downtown Disney was nice to walk through and the parks are at the other end, so things are all well located.  Not cheap, but worth it.

Nothing like the original Disneyland Hotel... We go at least 3 times a year for birthdays... always fun, relaxing and great food!  Staff very helpful and some great perks if you decide to spend extra for concierge level!

My husband splurged on this trip to Disneyland by getting our Hotel at the original Disneyland Hotel ! The Park opened 3 yrs. after I was born & as a kid my parents took me there for vacations numerous times ! Then I took myself as a young woman & had then passed this tradition on to our children , whom are now adults ! Well this was our 1st trip ALONE , so we splurged ! I could have & did just relax in our wonderful Disneyland Hotel as well as the easiness of getting into the Park ! Everything was just a dream come true to me as I’ve always wanted to stay at the original hotel (but could never justify the costs) believe me we were not disappointed ! And now I fear I can never stay anywhere else , it certainly spoiled not only me but my hubs , whom always grew up having Magical

To start, this has been the best trip to the Disneyland Resort, and the best stay I've ever had at any of the three hotels. The Disneyland Hotel will now be our go to hotel when staying on property.   My family and I booked a spur of the moment trip on 5/1, and stayed 5/3 to 5/4. We booked a Standard View, Club Level room. Our stay started at 6:00 AM on 5/3, and ended at 11:00 AM on 5/4.  6:00 AM - "Guard-Shack" : Pulling up to the hotel at such an early time, I expected some of the cast members to maybe be a little tired; still waking up. That was not the case, we were greeted by an amazing cast member (I wish I remembered her name) who was so friendly and so excited for our arrival. She pointed us to the correct locations and was so helpful. Amazing job by this cast member.

After a long time we visited Disnyland and stayed here. Everything was wonderful! Very nice rooms and everyone was helpful.  Easy access to Disney downtown and Disneyland. The pool was awsome and we all had a great time. Fireworks from our Room.

Our room has 2 queen size bed, refrigerator & coffee maker.  We had standard room but still has a lot of space for a family of five.  We are 2 adults & 3 kids ages 12, 7, & 2. Room is always clean.  Room service food is good.

I’ve only stayed here once before, and remember it as ok but somewhat overpriced. I could not be more wrong after this trip and the hotel and staff exceeded my expectations in every way.  I checked in at 11am and was shocked to find my room ready for me, and upgraded to a premium king size view. My building was literally steps away from Downtown Disney which made dining a breeze when I wasn’t in the mood for something on the hotel grounds.  As I was only here for some event nights at Disneyland I was worried that I’d be bored at this hotel. It turned out to be the most relaxing Disney Resort I’ve ever stayed in. There were plenty of tucked away lounge area to relax, read, or just unplug. Completely away from the noise and bustle I expected at a Disneyland hotel.  Had I been able

the aventure tower.. I got to say it’s a dusty and a bit dirty . We’re on a three day stay we got in on Tuesday and went to Straight to Disney. When we got back and turned on the light omg Dust everywhere .. we found a  it’s my birthday button from the guest before and a board with nails sticking out that my 3 year old pick up, it looks like it came from behind the bed. The Negligence from the cleaning staff is unacceptable.  The tub was dirty. Inspect what you expect is my best advice at least for the “ Adventure tower” Very dissatisfied!

Summary Heading: Third and favorite with one draw back
Summary: Having stayed at Paradise Pier (2013) and Grand Californian (2018) we decided that this trip should include a stay at the third of the onsite hotels.   The room provided a large wardrobe, a comfortable sized bathroom (with a separately doored toilet), an additional area outside the bathroom with mirrors and lights, a dresser/tv/desk unit with a chair, two double beds and an armchair.   Our view was down to the water features near the convention center.   The room itself was (with the exception of the Asian Disney resorts) the best we have stayed in. There was a degree of warmth to the furniture that made it feel less spartan than some of the rooms can tend to feel.   It was also very quiet, making it it a great spot to sleep off our flights.   The down side was the odor. There

When you get to a Disney hotel, you expect some special, now I have been missing this ! For me a normal hotel, not even 5 star level, everything is nice and clean, but as said nothing special and you pay a high price ! Advantage is that is on walking distance from Disney Downtown ! Reception hosts were friendly and helpful. Hotel is not real modern any more.

My wife and I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel once almost every year for the past 15 years or so, as we go for an annual business conference held at the hotel. Disney hotels are necessarily the most luxurious, but they are usually very guest-conscious, and while they tend more towards anonymous, yet friendly efficiency, than "white glove" service, they are usually pleasant places to stay. Our most recent visit, though was disappointing.  First, the hotel itself is getting a little long in the tooth. The TV in our room was old and relatively small by today's standards. Our refrigerator didn't work. The toilet seat in our room was not securely fastened, and swiveled as you sat on it. Our bed was comfy enough, but the thermostat seemed to have little to no effect, so the room

I overall love Disney, it’s relaxing and worth every moment. I do believe that this is a hotel how it all started for me with Disney. The gift shops are always a joy to check out and the front desk seemed simple enough and friendly. Thank you for the nice experience! I do look forward to my next visits!

Summary Heading: Not as friendly as it used to be.
Summary: Past visits we where always greeted with a smile but not this time. Asked for a room that was not in the Frontier Tower and of course was given a room there. Went back to front desk and the man who checked us in, saw us coming and went in the barroom, a lady then helped us and was told they just gave away the last room in the other tower. Went to our room and the safe did not work. Also the room itself while very nice is starting to show its age and the lighted back board didn’t work right.  The reason to stay here is it’s location. Close to Disneyland monorail station enter Disneyland, otherwise a significant walk to the main gates of Disneyland and California Adventure.

Summary Heading: You're paying for the location, not so much "magic"
Summary: The staff are great.  The location is convenient to Downtown Disney and a reasonable walk to the parks.  The room was nice enough (we were in the Adventure Tower) but on the small side.  It was clean and comfortable, but given the price point, I expect more "magic" than just a light-up LED headboard.  You're going to pay 4-star luxury prices for a Hampton Inn-quality room.  For ease, the hotel is tops, for value, not so much.  Also, for what it's worth, the character breakfast at the Terrance Inn inside Disneyland was about $30 less in total for 2 adults than the one in the hotel.  The Terrance Inn had a wider range of characters but not as large a variety of food.

We had connecting rooms both had king beds  Full length windows with view of palm trees and side walk people walking by We were on second floor end unite. Room was nice with lighted headboard My only complaint is at night you could hear music from Down Town Disney It stays open late. We were convienient to monorail or entrance to Disneyland. One of the best trips we have had. Food is pricey

They are building huge building's, Hotels and shops that have obstructed views. It no longer has the Disneyeskness that I loved!!! Plus all the noise from construction..  I'll have to try another place.

I’ve gave the Disneyland hotel a five ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Wished I could have given more, this hotel meet my ecxpectations in everything it had to offer, hotel room had everything TV, coffee machine, ice bucket, hairdryer, chocolate on pillows every night, fresh towels every day, free safe for valuable, swimming pool and sauna, jacuzzi, plus you get to meet Disney character’s, food is amazing ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️  I cannot fault this hotel.

Summary Heading: Very magical and has great features - but falls short in some areas.
Summary: This hotel is quintessential Disney magic. The twinkling lights on the headboard, all the little Disney details in the room, and the ultra-comfortable beds and pillows in the rooms keep you enveloped in the history and fantasy of Disneyland. The pool is set at a perfect temperature, the lifeguards and employees at the tangaroa terrace were all phenomenal, and it's so much fun to walk around the different towers and look at the little dioramas and listen to the music. That being said, we had a few hiccups. First of all, Monica at the front desk got our trip off to the wrong start. She was completely misinformed and she passed on that misinformation to me which sent me into a panic thinking that I was going to be charged double what I had booked. After 40 minutes of being at the

Summary Heading: Great for families. For business eh
Summary: Disneyland Hotel is very convenient for people who are coming to visit the theme park. It’s right across the street from downtown Disney. The rooms feature lots of Disney touches.   I’m here for a work conference for the second time in two months. From my standpoint the rooms are dated. They lack what a business traveler needs (ample power outlets and a good desk). Very limited food options nearby as downtown Disney closed a few restaurants last year and replaced them with rotating food trucks.   Personally I don’t care for this as a conference destination.  But conferences come here because people bring their families and go to the park.  For that it is perfect.

We had a wonderful stay at Disneyland Hotel! The price we paid for our stay was well worth the accommodations, amenities, and service level. I have to give special thanks to the hotel staff, especially the front desk staff, which made our stay a truly magical time. You always hear about the Disney magic, but when you truly experience that excellent level of service, it's a wonderful and unforgettable experience. The staff was amazing! Everyone was so courteous and friendly. The hotel room was beautiful and spacious. Love that headboard! The pools were nice and the hotel grounds were very well kept. The onsite restaurant experience was awesome as well. Our only regret  was not staying for longer. Can't wait to go back one day!

We had an awesome stay at this hotel. We will stay here as many times as we can. The staff is very friendly and always smiling. They truly share the magic of Disney. We stayed 5 nights and loved the view from our room. You will love it here.

It could be magical but the check in staff kill the magic.   So we love Disney, we stay at the Disneyhotel a number of time each time it leave me wonder why.    So let me go into the issue we arrival the hotel sparkles of magic of Disney you can feel your inner child coming out you walk up to the front disk to check in and its like they have no idea what to do, no rooms are assigned they always have you wait a minute as they go to the back which take a great deal of time.   I might note this has happen every time we have stay here same thing different staff, about 15-20 min later they come back and how found a room. Wow how nice as I revered one the front desk staff pretty much make you step in grumpy adult mood the inner child is gone.  The check process is about 2 hrs each

Summary Heading: A good stay at the Disneyland hotel
Summary: Stayed 8 nights in a standard room in the adventure tower. Stayed between 24/10/18 – 1/11/18.   Arrived in the morning, Check in was slow, as this was their first day using their new operating system, it did take 45mins to check in, but I put this down to first day teething issues, which I understand and the person organising the check in was very nice and explained what was happening and I wasn’t in a rush, so no big deal at all. A room wasn’t ready at the time of check in, which again was understandable, as it was 8:30am, well before check-in time, plus we were planning to be off site for most of the day to swap over hire cars and shopping at the outlets nearby, so that was fine with us and we were able to leave our bags at the hotel, which was our main goal have arriving at

It is the BEST place to stay if you are a family with Children.  We looked at both the Grand Californian hotel and the Disneyland Hotel.  We are so happy with our choice of the Disneyland Hotel.  The staff was very helpful and friendly, the pools are so much fun for the kids, and it really does feel like a resort.  It is a bit pricey, but the extra dollars are worth it to stay on the property next to Disneyland.  I would use the Disneyland Hotel again!

The Disneyland Hotel lived up the hype for our family. Yes, it is very expensive. But, you are paying for location and added amenities that are really helpful, especially when traveling with kids. Our room was in Frontier Tower. The view was of a parking lot, but it was spacious and very clean. Had beautiful decor and everything was maintained well.  The pool was under construction,  but we loved using the open areas. Lifeguards are on duty, they have comfortable chairs and lots of space for kids to play. They even offer life jackets.  The tiki bar offers dole whip with no line!  The entrance is just outside Downtown Disney with easy access to the monorail.  All in all, amazing stay. So glad we were able to splurge on this experience.

Summary Heading: You pay for the location and the Disney name
Summary: We had two rooms for 3 nights. The staff is very friendly and check in was easy.  The rooms were in the Fantasyland tower which was very convenient and getting to the parks is so easy.  Plus you do get into the parks one hour early each day you are there. I love the shampoo and conditioner that they use in the rooms, I know that seems silly but it is really nice and there is plenty of it. Our refrigerator did not keep things cold and we ended up throwing away quite a bit of food.  The room connected to ours had a really noisy fan.  When you pay this much for a room you expect that the appliances and ac/furnace is working properly and up to date.  I gave it 3 stars because of these things vs. the price.  The valet service was great.  Next time I will stay at a nearby hotel and

The Disneyland Hotel has been a dream of mine for as long as I can remember. So this visit I decided to make this a bucket list vacation and spend four nights at the Disneyland Hotel while we visited the parks this year.  From the minute we arrived we were treated so very well by the cast we arrived early at 10:30 in the morning planning to check our bags and go to the park, but to our surprise the room was ready. And what a room we had the cast upgraded us to a prime location without me even knowing we were at the Adventure Tower with a full view of downtown Disney, that night we were treated to a great view of the fireworks show at Disneyland.  The room was clean with a lot of special decor, the grandkids made a game of finding the hidden Mickey's. And at night that special

Summary Heading: Definitely NOT the happiest place on earth!
Summary: On the plus side - First, very comfy beds, nice cotton sheets and good pillows. Second, great location for proximity to the parks! You’re a few mins walk to the turnstiles going into Downtown Disney and the monorail so that’s easy. And that’s where “easy” ends.  The service at Disneyland Hotel was so sub-par I think Disney needs to rethink owning hotels. The overall impression was being nickel and dimed out of everything. For starters, we have an electric vehicle and while they do have a few charging outlets, they charge you to use them. We are paying nearly $400 per night for an outdated room AND you pay to charge your car as well? I stay at a lot of hotels and this is a first - I’ve never encountered a hotel that charges for EV charging (and shame on you Disney for not

Summary Heading: Love the Theming and the Staff...oh yeah and the location
Summary: Okay let's get the big thing out of the way first...are you going to pay more for this hotel? Yes. Is it worth it? YES. Not only do you get some very nicely themed rooms (headboard anyone?), but you get a nice short security line when heading into the parks in the morning...which are right there.  My room was in the Adventureland Tower, (love the theming in there too).  The staff in the hotel were great, and we had a great time at Trader Sam's in the evening. A very nice spot after a long day of park exploring. Would definitely recommend.

How does the saying go? Fool me once...  Well shame on me because I’ve stayed here twice and was duped twice. The first stay was September 2018 in the Frontier Tower. We had no hot water during most days, or the water went from ice cold to scalding got in seconds. Not ideal for showering (sarcasm) and especially dangerous as we had a baby who needed baths. Every day, we called the front desk who said that Engineering would fix it. Every evening, we were told they did - but they didn’t. We were finally moved to a new room in the Fantasy Tower after I threw a fit. At ~$400/night, this horrible level of service is unacceptable.   Last week, we stayed there again after the manager assured us this problem would be fixed and told us it was an issue with the Frontier Tower - not just

Even with discounts and sales this hotel is very expensive for large family groups.  I rate it average on value but overall very good because the location is hard to beat.   View rooms overlooking the pool  in Fantasy Tower were spacious and clean. You can hear the toilets flushing from room above you and room next to you.  If you are in a lower floor ( we were on floor 3) and you're leaving around 6:45am for the Magic Hour at Disneyland the elevators will be full of folks coming down from the upper floors. We took the stairs. Reception and Guest Services staff were very helpful and patient with us - excellent staff.  House cleaning staff did an excellent job. Goofy's Kitchen is great for kids to meet many characters during a dinner - expansive and tasty buffet food selections

We stayed in a preferred view room, adventure tower, on the 10th floor and we ended up upgrading to the concierge level package which included snacks throughout the day, continental style breakfast in the AM, and all you can drink alcoholic beverages. There was a huge fridge with can Coca-Cola brand drinks and juice boxes you could take to the park. Early afternoon there were small snacks, granola bars, uncrustables , gold fish, etc so you could take them to the park if you wanted. It also included turn down service and DVD rentals. I thought for what we paid for the upgrade was worth it because we take breaks from the park. Our room was next to the elevator so we were literally at the security checkpoint from our room in about 1 minute. Then another 1-1.5 minutes and you’re at

This hotel was amazing so close to the downtown Disney and the kids loved all the little Disney touches. I would also recommend going to goofys kitchen for a meal if you with young children, it wS expansive but the food was good and the kids loved it.

I and my wife stayed at Disneyland hotel for one night to celebrate our honeymoon. This is our first time here and it was amazing.  We went there at about 10a.m, after dropped luggage at bell, we went to Disneyland and come back about 11p.m.   Our view from the room(fantastic tower) is facing downtown Disneyland which is nice. Hotel very close to Disneyland, just a few minutes walk. My wife really enjoyed it!!

Hotel was up to Disney standards. Very convenient for walking to the park. Only drawback is guest services/ front desk is not in some of the towers, but no big deal. You can watch the fireworks if you book on the right side of the towers. Service was great.

My wife and I celebrated our birthdays with a 3 night stay in the Adventure Tower and had a great stay. The checkin was quick even though we requested and received a room change to this tower. Our room overlooked the pool and no problems with noise. We appreciated the convenience of hotel to the parks, as well as the resort amenities such as restaurants.

Very disappointing experience for a first-time stay in this hotel.  To begin with, I had specifically booked a room with two queen beds for my travel companion and me but when we checked in, we were told a room had already been assigned to us and the hotel was full. It was a room with just one king-sized bed, which was a very uncomfortable arrangement for my room mate.  Even getting to the room with our bags was a struggle as it was in a different building, and signage was confusing. No one offered help.  For a full hotel, the place seemed deserted - no characters walking around, no magic in sight, and no sense of celebration. Public restrooms were down in the basement, small, and dank and smelly. Even check out was not clearly explained or notified. This, coupled with a

We stayed at the Disneyland resort and it was amazing! It was so easy to pull in and park compared and just walk a few feet to the resort. At check-in Justin was so helpful and genuinely friendly. He started off our mini vaction on a great note.We were surprised to find out he upgraded our room to a suite at no extra cost. The room was spacious and I loved all the vintage pictures of Disneyland hung around the room. We had a great view of the pool, however it was under renovation so the model of the monorail was covered up. There are msny tastey resturants to eat at durring your stay so you don't even have to leave the property.It is a short walk to both Disneyland Parks. It was nice not having to drive all the way home after a long day visiting DCA food and wine festival. We

My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 5 nights last week. Check in was very easy, they had a cast member going through the line to gather the necessary information so when you got to the desk it was very easy and simple. We told them that I was celebrating my birthday and they had a birthday pin waiting for me.   Our room was of the front of the hotel in the Fantasy Tower and even though it was a Standard Room, we had a great view of the soon to be “Galaxy’s Edge” and the “mountains” of Disneyland - Matterhorn, Splash Mountain and Big Thunder. Water pressure was not the best in the shower but we made it work.   We had thought about staying an extra night and we went to the front desk and they were able to offer us a room at our current rate even though the website

Stayed here for Expo West with a corporate rate. The best thing about it is the proximity to Downtown Disney and the in-house restaurant Steakhouse-55 which was superb. But the rooms are nicely appointed and the service is good enough.

For the price of the rooms they are average and we were in a  "premium" room. There was left over spoiled food in our fridge. How the front desk "fixed it" was disappointing. They're loosing customer focus and remain focused on money. I'll never stay there again.

The highlights of this hotel are definitely its location (about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, through Downtown Disney) and the magical Disney touches in the room and lobby (the fireworks on the headboard are a delightful touch). But the mattress were some of the worst I've ever slept on, and the cleanliness of the room could definitely be improved. The walls are thin, and the wait for check-in or to speak to anyone at the front desk was long... and we were there at a slow time for Disney. Overall we were definitely disappointed in what we got for the price point of this hotel.

Check in was great with fantastic staff or cast member, but from that point on the hotel was let down badly by the rest of the team. The room was fine, albeit on the small size, and housekeeping did a good enough job and were pleasant throughout. However staff within the rest of the resort were terrible. Staff in trader sam’s were slow and I had to wait for at least 20 mins to get change on one occasion. Staff at the bell desk were the absolute worst I have come across - rude and unhelpful. One cast member at the sundries gift shop on the late shift complained about the way the money I paid for my items was folded! Disney clearly has very inclusive employment policies, with jobs for all ages which is a great thing, but the staff are not trained and with the exception of

Summary Heading: Worth it for the magic hour
Summary: Check in was fast and easy and the staff was very friendly. Fantasy tower (where you check in) had a fun atmosphere but we were in the Frontier tower all the way across the other side which felt very disconnected from the actual hotel and all of the ammenities (other than the pool). We would stay here again but not in Frontier Tower... there's no desk, no "Disney Resort" feel...it feels like a hotel next door to a cooler hotel. And walking all the way across to the other side to the coffee shop was a bit annoying. It would be nice if Frontier Tower felt more like part of the hotel. Spectacular views of the employee parking lot, though. :) Our room was very clean and comfortable. The pool is convenient to all towers however it's under construction. We enjoyed the part that was

The hotel is of course ideally place for people who want to visit the Disneyland Park. But even the convention facilities are good, big rooms that can be used separately or jointly. The small pool in the middle of the hotel facilities is in the best case suitable for children - I would not use it. The rooms are aged though still ok. Disturbing is that what ever your rooms neighbors above or beside do, you will hear. I even do not like if windows cannot be opened. For breakfast you better go to downtown Disneyland. The service though is great!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Pricey, but you will get the Disney Vibe and experience
Summary: This hotel is very convenient to both parks and particularly Downtown Disney, in fact it is very short walk to Downtown Disney.  The pool was under construction during my stay, so I can't comment, but it looked spacious and had cabanas and a water slide.  Pool was located just steps away from the hotel.  Check In was very easy and staff was very nice with that Disney Charm that I was expecting.   Meal options are limited at the hotel, but again there are more located at nearby Downtown Disney.  The rooms were great, clean, and modern.  I enjoyed my stay.  It was a little pricey, but almost everything in Disney is.  I really enjoyed trader sams.

I stayed here for a conference. Hotel makes impression of being old. Check-in was slow     Construction all over hotel grounds. Location is nice - just a short walk to the parks and restaurants. Food in Tiki bar on the property is terrible. Equipment in the fitness room , elliptical is pretty old. Overall impression -average. We have paid group rates which were ok for the quality of stay, but I would not bother to pay their regular rates. I am sure there are better places to stay around Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great on-resort option - really nice rooms!
Summary: We typically stay at the Grand California, but this time decided to try Disneyland Hotel.  It was very nice, the rooms were super clean and well appointed.  We also really loved being close to Trader Sam's, one of our favorite spots.  We were there in December, so it was too chilly to try the pool.  We always walk in and out of the park (rather than take the monorail) and the walk was a lot farther, so we had to account for that in terms of scheduling, but we did get a lot of extra steps in each day.  I would absolutely go back to this hotel!

Summary Heading: Worth it for the Magic Hour
Summary: It is probably worth the expense to stay at a Disneyland Resort hotel just to benefit from the extra time guests get before the rest of the hordes can enter the park. Did more rides in that one hour than the rest of the morning.  The hotel itself was fine, but had some odd quirks - we were in Adventure Tower, which did not have hotel staff in the lobby. There wasn't really a lobby except in the main tower. We had room service bring breakfast, but they would call the room ahead of time instead of just coming and tapping on the door. We were in a suite, which had a nice counter area, mini fridge, and sink, but no microwave or utensils which felt odd.  The blackout curtains were excellent (we have small kids, so we are always interested in a nice dark room for naps and bedtime.

This hotel was probably once a nice place to stay. It is in need of some care. The fitness center is not maintained with broken and dirty equipment. They had two antibacterial wipe dispensers that were empty at 7:00 this morning. Clearly, MRSA is not a concern.  The personnel at the hotel are burned out and definitely do not seem they are working at the “Happiest place on earth”. My room was not ready until well past 4:00 pm.  If you stay at the Adventure Tower, it truly is an adventure. You can hear Downtown Disney music bumping well into the night. When I tried to call to inquire about what time it would stop, I was told it’s over by midnight but can go until two in the morning. No one told me it would be like being at a club all night. The walls are paper thin and every sound

Great location & helpfull staff. The room itself is pretty dated & could do with an upgrade however it was clean & had everything we needed for a few days of visiting Disneyland. Think for the money they ask it is time for a makeover.

Stayed here for 1 week in January with grand kids. What a great time. Thank you to the people at front desk and maid service. Grand kids want to go again. Felt very exclusive coming down and having entrance to the park. It was very convenient for my wife and I in our late 60s. Thank you

Just wanted to thank the Disneyland Hotel for an amazing vacation. This hotel used to be a dream, and now via a turn of events it has Bros reality. 100% worth he price paid. Definitely not cheap. But the smiles on the faces of my two kids and my wife make me impervious to sticker shock.

Summary Heading: Convenient to Downtown Disney and the Disney parks
Summary: I stayed in the Frontier Building (there are 3 buildings: Fantasyland and Adventure tower, and Frontier tower) on the 8th floor.  I got the Standard room, which meant that I had a complete view of the huge parking lot.  The room was fine, I thought the carpets and the furniture were a bit dated.  Really liked the huge wooden headboard that lights up and plays music.  The Frontier building was nice, it is the one that is in the back of the lot, past the swimming pool.  There pool area is very nice, very tropical looking with palm trees, pretty lighting, and a tropical themed restaurant. The self parking lot was convenient (for Frontier tower guests), there is a small parking lot right by the building, so that was convenient as opposed to parking in the main parking lot which is a

We took our kids to Disneyland and was our youngest’s first time, so we decided to go all out and stay on property this time. We had a wonderful experience at the parks and in general. We had an early breakfast at Goofy’s Kitchen one morning. The food was average but my daughter LOVED the experience and that is what matters.   As for the hotel itself, the rooms were very average in size and amenities. The TV was tiny (though we didn’t spend much time watching it anyway), the beds and pillows were comfortable. But the water for showers was very lukewarm at best, and there was a tiny closet and three drawers, despite being a room for four people.   I was not overly impressed with the staff of the hotel, except the nice woman at the larger gift shop and the one who gave my daughter

Summary Heading: Worth the expense for those with small children
Summary: My husband and I debated for a long time before booking this hotel for our trip to Disneyland. We could stay at a nearby hotel for 1/3 the cost but ultimately the convenience factor won out. We have a 2 year old and were worried about naps and him getting worn out at the park. We decided to go ahead and pay the premium for the Disneyland Hotel.  The monorail is just outside of the hotel in Downtown Disney and it was extremely convenient when we wanted to come/go into Disneyland. For those with little ones, especially toddlers, this is huge. When my son got tired, we could have him out of the park and into the room in 10 minutes, using the monorail. And of course there is the additional perk of being able to get into the park an hour early.  We enjoyed that the hotel was right

We had a fabulous time with kids and grandkids we stayed in a suite perfect accommodations we were on the top floor and got to see the fireworks Sunday and Monday evening quite a show at 9:35pm  Love love loved it

We were hoping this hotel would be amazing and a vacation to remember. But unfortunately the Disneyland hotel was not the greatest experience. First it was a far walk to the lobby, no help no greetings, very blunt in conversation. They gave away our room then said we were bumped up to a better room little did we know it was the farthest room away in another building🤦🏼‍♂️  The room was cool and nice. The food at the tiki type restaurant was awful, way over flavored and the cocktails were the same. I’m only speaking from my wife and I experience. It was not fun bottom line.

Summary Heading: Crowded, dirty and not so magical,
Summary: There was nothing I looked forward to more than our annual trip to Disneyland in the 1960’s, it was truly a magical place, but 50 years later it’s tired, dirty and crowded and the magic is gone. Lots of the rides are the same but that’s where any similarity to the beautiful place it once was stops. So disappointing. Walt would be so angry.....

Just completed a week stay here for a work function. The grounds were well-kept, and the queen room was well-appointed. Whatever mattresses are used...I want one. However, the pillows that were spec’d were awful. Imagine bags of concrete with pillow cases on them. I ended up emptying my backpack each night and stuffing it with towels instead.   I can’t write this review without mentioning the front desk staff. They were a gem. I had been traveling all day and they were exactly what I needed when I walked in the front door. Kudos to them and their trainer. One gripe, though...they asked me if I wanted my invoice emailed to me at checkout rather than me standing in line. So I chose that option. Never saw an invoice. I called a day later asking if it could please be emailed. That

My family and I visit Disneyland 3 or 4 times a year and up until now have always stayed off-site. When a group of friends visited from out-of-state, they wanted to stay at a Disney resort and we booked a 3-bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel for the whole group consisting of 5 adults, 1 teenager, 3 preschoolers, and 1 baby. The layout was essentially two standard rooms connected to a 1-bedroom suite. Two of the rooms had direct access to the living room, but the other had to be entered either from the hallway or through the second room. That worked out just fine for us, but parents who may put young children to bed in the farthest room should note that a monitor is necessary. The rooms are spacious and we were able to set up two pack n' plays in one room without a problem.

Summary Heading: There's no place like a Disney home
Summary: This hotel is the perfect place to call home during your stay in Anaheim/Disneyland.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower and had a Junior suite (4 adults and 1 child).  The excitement began with an in-room experience organised beforehand and our room afforded the perfect view of the evening fireworks - accompanied by the in-room television channel tuned to coincide with the fireworks.  Breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen is a must during your stay as well as taking advantage of the "Magic Mornings" both in Disneyland and California Adventure.  The staff service was impeccable even assisting above and beyond when our "little one" was ill.  The cast members responsible for the cleaning of the rooms did an amazing job - there were always plenty of towels.  We did miss a microwave however

This was our first visit to Disney land with our adult children sicne we are from the East Coast and have been to Disney World but were in LA for a family wedding and decided to visit. We had a two bedroom suite for five of us and it was very spacious and well appointed and on the top floor with nice views. Early and easy access to the parks is a nice feature. You can enter Disneyland at the monorail station which is close to the hotel and its takes you directly to tomorrowland which is a good place to start or end your day. The dining at Disneyland is good but expensive. However, we arrived there for super bowl Sunday and used uber eats to get chicken wings delivered from Hooters at a reasonable price and enyoed the game in our suite.

The Disneyland hotel was the perfect place for our family’s first Disney adventure. We enjoyed the Disney atmosphere on the grounds, in the lobby and the magical headboard and special Disney details in the room decor. The staff gave special attention to our kids with it being their first Disney trip including complimentary welcome gifts on our arrival. It was fun to be so close to downtown Disney with ease of getting to the park. Still a long walk back for an exhausted 5 year old after a day at the park , so plan accordingly. The rooms were clean and amenities were typical for this level hotel. Bathrooms could use some minor updating. We ate dinner at goofy’s kitchen one night. This is an expensive buffet and food is average but you are really paying for the entertainment and we

What a pity that a Hotel with such a great location has such poor service. Here you are just a number! The staff are "Robots" and will not even try to do something extra for you. However, it has all amenities like great slides for children, Laundry Room, Gymnasium and Club facilities. Our room was in the Adventure Tower and the view over Downtown Disney was awesome. The fireworks was amazing to watch from our room. The extra that we paid for Club Level though wasn't worth it. The dining facilities at Club Level was always overcrowded and we had to sit on the floor to watch the Fireworks on the first night we were there. All the restaurants on the Hotel premises were below average. The worst thing is that the windows in the rooms don't open and being an old building it suffers

Hotel for the most part was great. Great location and great service for the most part. They have wheelchairs for rental right there at the front desk which was super helpful for my wife who was here with a sprained ankle for Disneyland.   The rooms themselves were also great except one major flaw. Comfortable beds, a fancy light up headboard, nice bathrooms, but the shower. Water pressure was ok but we didn't get hot water a single day of our 3 day stay. This is unforgivable for a hotel that was 350 dollars a night on a deal. It seems like we weren't the only ones either. Multiple people we talked to asked us if we had hot water. Like we didn't know them at all and they asked us randomly in the hallway. So I'm going to take that as a relatively widespread issue for our floor.

I know this is an older hotel, but I’ve never stayed here and thought I’d splurge.   Room view is good - Downtown Disney.  Room is adequate.   No vending machines in hotel, gift shop only ..... but... the worst part, and unacceptable is the headboard on the bed in the room. (See Pics)  For this price.... I expected better.

This will be my one and only review ever at or above 3 stars where the beds are awful.   First, the cons-  -shower never gets hot and has little pressure -bed is harder to sleep in than a park bench -no microwave -small TV with limited channels -no access control on elevators-public can access guest floors  Pro- -Pretty much on the park -staff are all awesome -good fire of fireworks even in a non view room -safe in room, good for small to medium laptop -Good amenities, leave soap, shampoo at home, no need to buy when you arrive  Considering all Disney properties were slammed during my stay I was amazed at how they maintained service levels.  That said, the bed would kill me if I had to work in the AM - was stiff every single day.  Nice touches: hidden Mickey mouse everywhere and

Was here two years ago and had a somewhat dirty room.  This time around clean and with a great view.  On the 11th floor of the main building and a great view of the fireworks in the evening. Lousy sleeping, don't know if it was the super soft pillows or just being in a strange bed, but it was still a nice trip.

Summary Heading: Will recommend this hotel to anyone with kids
Summary: This was our 2nd time visiting Disneyland and we loved that this hotel is just right next to Disneyland. The monorail is a 3-minute walk from the hotel. We were able to watch the fireworks from our hotel room every night during our stay. The room is plenty big to sleep the 5 of us and to store our big luggages. There is a laundry room by Goofy's Kitchen, with about 8 washers and 8 dryers, all operated by debit/credit card. This was essential as we had 3 little kids for a few days at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Comfortable sleep and Disney filled Experience!
Summary: It's Disneyland...how much time do you spend in your room?!?  I'd read some reviews and was concerned the bed wouldn't be comfortable...it was DREAMY (literally) with fun headboard.  The walk to Disneyland is as far as if you stayed out on the main hotel drive, and the Monorail CLOSES if it's too hot (we stayed her summer 2018).  The Monorail was closed frequently, so we had to walk back through downtown Disney.  Many places were closed for the now defunct plan of a new hotel.  So...end of the walk was non-functional eateries.  I LOVED the proximity to Trader Sam's and the pools were lovely.  The room was functional, nice to have the sink separate from shower/toilet so one person could shower while the other did make-up, brushed teeth, etc.   We had a small balcony overlooking

As always we had another fantastic stay at the Disneyland Hotel. They know how to run this place. The service is top notch. The food delivery room service for breakfast was perfect and the rooms are spacious. We had a three bedroom suite, more than enough room for my wife and I and our four kids. We had three and half bathroom, a balcony, sitting area, it is just so nice to come back to when you have been on your feet walking around Disney all day long. We hated to leave and wish it would have been warm enough to swim in the cool looking pool they have.

Hotel is convenient to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure.  Check in at the hotel is difficult - long lines and limited Cast members at Registration.  We initially had a view of the parking lot, a quick call and upgrade allowed for a better view; but we were not notified when room was ready, so we spent a fair amount of time at Downtown Disney.  There was limited hot water in the Frontier Tower, every morning.  Nice touches built in to headboard lights and music, and Mickey hands and shapes everywhere.  Our Granddaughter loved it and that's what counts!!

We absolutely loved our time at Disney never fails us a family of 6 it can get spendy but we think it's worth it personally ...thank you for always being helpful innovative and super friendly!!! We try to visit yearly upon our family vacation and hope to do the same again next year, kids always have a blast and we never are ready to get back to reality ....

We had a 2 bedroom suite for 2 nights, when we checked in our room wasn't ready, no problem we headed to Disneyland, unfortunately our room wasn't made available until close to 6.00pm, not good enough. We found the bell staff rude and uninterested in providing our luggage, not a great start. Management really need to address the attitude or lack of friendliness at this property, for what you pay for there rooms, the staff seem uninterested and poorly presented, with unironed uniforms and a curt attitude.

Hi everyone- thank you again to all who have given reviews.. it was part of the reason we stayed at the hotel for 2 days. We live in BH/Hollywood so while a hotel isn't necessary it's so nice when going for a special occasion or really just going to D-land ;) Last year we stayed at the Grand California (the other disney hotel)- and have yet to stay at Paradise Pier. I did like the hotel. It's not as nice as Grand Ca... but is a little cheaper. I have to say that staying so close to the park is so nice and otherwise you have to walk on really busy roads and I know my husband wouldn't go for that with our 5 yr old. Tip the coffee shop in the hotel is nice (next to goofys kitchen) and they have DOLE WHIP!!  Going in jan it was pretty cold- we got into the room at it was 60 degrees.

The hotel is very clean, conveniently located, and has great amenities. Our standard view view overlooked the pool area. The room was well appointed to Disney standards. The only drawback is the check in process. For those used to Disney World where you check in online, skip the front desk, and unlock your room with your magic band, standing in line for 15-20 minutes seems archaic! The good news is that after standing in line, the front desk greets you with Disney warmth and positivity.   pros: location (walk to the parks!!!), amenities (Goofy's Kitchen, Coffee Shop, gift shops), well-appointed rooms  cons: minor and not a deal-breaker - the check in process  pro tip: The Yellow Cab company offers a flat rate of $40 (plus tip) from John Wayne Airport directly to the hotel. For a

Summary Heading: Amazing location, clean hotel friendly staff
Summary: Hotel is good, location is fantastic. Staff are friendly. Gift shops are well priced. Great place for kids. Pool looked amazing, but was a little too cold to go for a swim. The bathrooms could do with a makeover as they are a little dated. But overall a great experience.

we stayed in the pirates of the caribbean suite...the biggest suite we have ever stayed in...we were there at christmas and there was a pirate christmas tree in our room!  the 'food kitchen' was just across the hall and we could bring food to our pirates table which seated 8 in huge pirate chairs...it was magical...a once in a lifetime experience that tops them all...my granddaughter amazed...we could watch the fireworks from our room...the food across the hall was nothing normal...smoked salmon and the works, deviled eggs, mickey waffles and strong mimosa's...all the usual bath amenities plus more...it was a wonderful weekend...memorable to say the least...

Summary Heading: Great accommodation option when visiting Disneyland
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel when visiting with my teenage children from Australia in January 2019. It would be difficult to beat the Disneyland Hotels in terms of their proximity to the Theme Parks and Downtown Disney. I left the immediate Disneyland precinct whilst we were there (to go to a pharmacy) and felt that the other nearby hotels really seemed a long way away. It is a lot of fun to exit Disneyland late at night (still pumped from the rides), walk down Downtown Disney and straight into the Hotel. Disneyland Hotel itself is great, but I wouldn't necessarily describe it as exceptional. Perhaps a summer visit (so you make use of the pools) would allow guests to enjoy more. We had dinner at a restaurant at one of the other Disney hotels one night (Disneyland California

Summary Heading: Convenience and efficiency is what staying on-site is all about
Summary: In line with Disney's hotel pricing, I would view this as the second best of the three on-site hotels (i.e., Grand Californian is #1, this is #2 and Paradise Pier is a distant #3 -- elevators there are terrible).  The room had very nice touches (Mickey gloves holding wall lamps; headboard lit up with the Disney castle and "fireworks" along with music). Again in line with the price points, the finishing was not as nice as the Grand Californian, but better than Paradise Pier.  The key with any of the on-site hotels is the ability to get into the park one hour before the general open and you can get a lot done in that hour (call it more like 1.5 hours before things get busy -- then you go grab breakfast!).  If there was anything somewhat negative to point out, the front desk is

Summary Heading: Favorite place to stay but so expensive!
Summary: I’ve stayed at A LOT of different hotels in the Anaheim Resort Area, and Disneyland Hotel is definitely my favorite. But it is soooo expensive...it has to be for a “special” trip and not for a semi-annual trek.  The rooms are standard size and shape, but  sprinkled with Disney magic!  The pool is AMAZING, and the tiki bar adjacent to pool is AMAZING. I loved catching the monorail into Disneyland, or cutting through The Grand Californian to get to California Adventure. The biggest drawback is that nothing here is free....it is outrageously expensive.  But it’s worth the splurge at least once, especially for the nap/swim/cocktail options when everyone is having a meltdown :)

We stayed here for 4 days after Christmas to celebrate my daughter's birthday at Disneyland. The grounds to this hotel are impeccable and beautifully manicured.  We just got the basic room with 2 queen sized beds and we were surprised that it didn't quite live up to the beautiful surroundings of the hotel.  It was small and with the exception of the headboard that lit up and played songs it could of been any hotel room across the street.   There was a mini-fridge and a coffee-maker in the room.  Our room was on the upper levels and overlooked a parking lot.   It was very quiet and we didn't hear any noise from the hall or elevators.    The wifi is free and works great.  The  pools were busy but closed at 8 and we were are the parks during this time so we never put them to use.

We stopped in a shop and enjoyed our time with Tanya as much as our entire night at Disneyland. She informed us how we can see Walt Disney’s apartment! All about hidden mickies and more. She sold watches and gave us that history as well. The best!

My family stayed here for four days during the Christmas weekend.  It was very nice with plenty of towels and comfortable accommodations.  Unfortunately, upon arrival to the room, the sink and toilet were obviously not cleaned. There was stool in the toilet and hairs and other debris in the sink.  A call into housekeeping and it was taken care of.  The rest of the stay was so nice and the staff was so pleasant.

We stayed in the ambassador suite for $1400.00 per night since all the other signature suites were taken and boy did we get taken advantage of. This signature suite has 8 ft ceilings and is located on the 2 nd floor over the main air conditioner that had steam poring out which was right over the master room. The room number was 2098 do not rent this room is the biggest scam. The hotel ironically has no pictures on their website for our viewing pleasure. I do not write reviews unless it is warranted and I dont want any of the hard working Americans to have their dram vacation ruined. My stay was 12-22-18  Fyi when I called the front desk manager it almost seemed like I was bothering her. I am sure all the money they are making I am just a peon. So sad I love Disney Land  Happy

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for four nights the beginning of December 2018. We chose this hotel because my daughter was dancing in the Disneyland Merry Holiday Parade and it was close enough to walk to the parks.   Our room was just the basic 2 queen room with couch that flipped over to be a bed.  The size of the room was decent and didn’t feel overly small for our family of 4. There was plenty of space to fit our suitcases and not trip over them. There wasn’t much drawer space if you wanted to put things away though. I like the full length windows and although our view was only of the roof below us we did get to see the Disneyland fireworks each night from our room. The room had a mini fridge but no microwave and the coffee machine was only a two cupper. We really liked

Stayed at the Disneyland hotel for three days while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. Traveled with my daughter (5) and mother (68). The hotel worked for all of us. It was great to be able to walk to the parks and to have the early park access. Having good on-site food options made dinner/bedtime easy. My daughter loved the pool as much as Disneyland. My mom enjoyed the watersides! Something for everyone. The room was large, had everything we needed and the beds were comfortable. Best of all we could see the fireworks from the room so we didn’t have to go out all of the nights to feel like we were having an experience which was great with a little one. I’d recommend staying here if you want a convenient and comfortable hotel!

We enjoyed staying at the hotel since it is in walking distance to the park.  Nice hotel with great food and shops on site.  The staff was excellent.  The actual hotel room to me was nothing special.  For the cost of one night, I have stayed in better hotels that cost much less.  I guess you are truly paying for the location.  It would be great if they had a playground for the kids to burn off some steam when we aren't going to the park for a while.

We Reserved 2 Queen bed Adjoining Rooms.The waiting room had a Alice in wonderland theme. The Hotel Staff was super accommodating. They offered us to listen to a short 30 minute meeting about Disney Shares. We got 20 Fast Passes and a 100 Dollar Gift Card. We never had to wait in line for a ride, it was Awesome! And It was well worth the Short Visit, plus it was totally no pressure. The Rooms were Absolutely amazing with a Great view! The rooms are Clean and Functional. They were a bit smaller then expected but made up for it in all the fine details. The Room had many hidden Mikey's and an Amazing Headboard. It lights up and plays a tune. They Hotel has Different Buildings and some Themed rooms as Well. Goofy's Kitchen was so Expensive and Packed we decided  to Pass. The Hotel

Taking a trip to Disneyland should always consist of the Disneyland Hotel. Not only is it close and convenient it provides access directly to the monorail to get into the park and downtown Disney. The rooms were clean and the beds and pillows amazing.  Yes you will spend a load more staying at this hotel but well worth it.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, Not Enough Food Options
Summary: Lovely Hotel, charming decor, soft beds, really beautiful. What I missed was a cafeteria type restaurant for breakfast, like at Disney World All Star Resorts. Goofy's Restaurant was reservation only (basically) and the coffee stand was the other option. It had a nice breakfast platter, but lines were long, and I had to sit in the cold outdoors or take it back to my room.     For lunch, we went to the pool side Tiki Restaurant, which is a bar, and the waiter was not helpful with helping us find seats. We finally sat with some folks waiting for their check, and then were able order food. The food was good, but there were no other lunch options.      The Downtown Disney section is about a block away and has options (mostly with reservations), but those with small children taking a

My girls absolutely love the Disneyland hotel. The room is big and comfortable. There's a wall panel that lights up and plays music that was a huge hit with my girls. Room service is great. And the pool, oh the pool, the kids wanted to spend the entire day there sliding and exploring the different ones. Plan to spend a lot of time in the pool, maybe even skip a day at the park for that!

Staying here for a conference and they stuck me in probably one of the worst rooms in the hotel - 2nd floor overlooking the noisy service area and parking lot. The hotel is old - they have done a decent job of refurbishing, but the rooms are pricy for pretty average  rooms. When I checked in I wasn't told anything about the hotel or amenities, so I wasn't very impressed with the service.  It's nice that it is right next door to downtown Disney. I wouldn't stay here again as part of a leisure trip.

It's the history here. If you haven't been-go and experience the fun. The room was clean, the service was great. The prices are high, but that's to be expected when you stay on property at any of the Disney Resorts. During the year there are discounts for annual passholders and for certain events so do your research.

The rooms and decor are old. We got stuck in the elevator twice. They painted the hallway and the paint smell was so bad that we had to leave the room. Even the bed which was supposed to play the Cinderella song was of tune. The pool has very limited hours - making it impossible to go in after a long day at the park. Save your money and stay elsewhere

Had a week stay in the Disneyland hotel. Everything is nice except the food is super way expensive. It is close to the areas where cheap food is available.  I'd like to come back and will take my son with me one time.

We have stayed at the paradise pier several times and decided to upgrade. I’ve walked through the Disneyland hotel grounds many times over the years and noticed how much “Disney”there is compared to Paradise Pier. We were not disappointed. We were on the 10th floor near the elevator. It was very quiet. Only on the second day did I notice the elevator sound. I thought it was gusts of wind! On the 10th floor not every elevator trip goes by you anyway. Very nice and quiet. The room was comfortable and suited the two of us perfectly. We really liked the subtle Disney touches- the headboard, the hidden Mickeys, etc. this is not over the top, garish Disney decor.  There was coffee and a maker in the room for tea & coffee. Ice bucket and they furnished water bottles. There was a hair

We went to Disneyland to get into the Christmas spirit, and it worked. We enjoyed every minute  Lots of Christmas trees, the parade was great  The castle looked amazing  The line ups for the rides were not to long

It's so magical during Christmas time. All decorations and multiple Christmas trees. It's a must to visit during the holiday.  Your hotel stay comes with, ~ magic hour , one extra hour inside the park. ~ Fast pass for any ride ~ pool access and water slides  It was a blast looking for all the hidden mickeys inside the room and around the lobby.  Definitely a must stay during the Christmas holiday.  The pool was fantastic. Soo many lifeguards. They also offer drink and food service, which was delicious.

We stay the first week of November, family of 5 in a standard room. The whole experience was great. There is some differences with WDW the most important: The check in. The line was way longer than WDW, but the front desk personal was the same, super pro.Also if you need/want to do the check out by your self at the front desk you will need some patience.  We get a room with an amazing view of the garden and pools at the frontier tower and the best part it was on the 2nd floor, so no worries about the kids running or jumping around.  The room was big enough for us 5, 3 kids of 8, 6 and 2,5 years old. 2 big beds plus a daybed. A regular bathroom and a big space for luggage. A nice sitting area. When we have some issues in the room: our shower broke up and our telephone didn't work

This was our second visit to the Disneyland Hotel. Safe to say it will be our last. This place is extremely dated and actually quite boring. We we're in the exact same room as last time. 2780 is a premium room with two queen beds and roll in shower. The mattresses are worn out. No premium coffee maker/coffee. Just an old coffee mate coffee maker. The fridge will hold a couple cans of soda/water and 1 quart of milk. EXTREMELY small. NO microwave in room. However, you can carry your food downstairs and use the community microwave in the vending machine room. How convient! You get 3 drawers for clothes and one SMALL closet. No sofa, one chair and a desk with a chair. All of this can be yours for a mere $600+ per night! Our stay was 7 nights and once again, we saw NO one except

This was our first stay at a Disney property. Every staff member that we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Fantasy tower with a beautiful view of the pool. It was so convenient to walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland & California Adventure Park. The Holiday Season is the most beautiful time of the year to visit and we weren’t disappointed with the decorations. We choose to ride the monorail back one night from Disneyland to Downtown Disney. After a long day at the park, it was wonderful to be so close to our hotel. Too cold for us to enjoy the pool but there were people out there.

Checked in, room smelt strongly of cigarette smoke, over 1 and a half hours told to stay in the room while they checked and found us a new room.  During this time housekeeping came and said we definitely need to move and they would sort it and then nothing happened.  2 young kids coughing from the smoke and my wife’s allergies set off.  Only after demanding to speak to a manager did they sort a new room.  Was told they would move the bags so took the kids swimming.  1 hour 40 minutes later returned to the new room, still no bags, 20 minutes on the phone they brought the wrong bags.  Demanded to speak to the hotel duty manager, got put on to the housekeeping manager who explained smoke comes through the ventilation system so my whole family had been exposed to significant amounts

We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our California road trip. A great choice. Yes it’s more expensive that others in the Anaheim area but it’s convenient, with great food options , fab pools and is sprinkled with Disney Magic-from the great cast members,to bumping into Goofy and Pluto around the pool and the light up headrest above the bed. Rooms were larger than expected with lovely Disney touches. Would stay here again for sure

Disney crazed Americans everywhere at check in I wondered if it was all a little much but to my surprise the Disney themed hotel and clever Mickey inspired  rooms where decorated tastefully. The grounds were flanked with lush tropical gardens, the 3 pools and water slides were my kids favourite (even wanting to head back to the pool in the middle of the day whilst at Disneyland) super friendly staff and close to Downtown Disney (a pedestrian street full of restaurants and shops all things Disney) and monorail this place was a winner.  To top it off, the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in!

Spent 4 nights in the disneyland hotel's fairy tale suite.  This is a unique suite that is on the top lvl (11) of the adventure tower. This room is simply impressive! Just wow.  The room comes with great benefits as well.  - VIP guest services (so VIP seats for shows - fireworks, paint the night and fantasmic for example)  - Access to the disneyland e ticket lounge, this has breakfast, snack food and drinks between 630am to 10pm.  - The room has plenty of luxury features with great views. - Guest services dropped off a present to my wife for her birthday, other days they dropped of some extra food. - The room is expensive, but is special and in my mind is worth the cost.

Stayed this past week for the beginning of the Christmas decor. Loved this hotel and the proximity to park. Short walk to shopping and restaurants. Tiki bar on premises is so fun at night. Loved all the little Mickey details in room. Comfortable bed and nice clean rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

My family of four (2 children) booked in to stay at the Disneyland Hotel to get the whole Disney experience and we certainly did.  Rooms were great, view was fantastic and the check-in was just ok as they made us upgrade in order to get a interconnecting room (a little disappointing). The pools were heated but could have been a bit warmer, that said the kids didn’t care and really enjoyed the slides.  Goofy’s Kitchen is not as good as it used to be (character wise) so I would no longer recommend it considering how expensive it is.  Overall though, a great stay in a fantastic Disney Hotel with down-town Disney right outside your door step.

After 4 days of convention business it was time for Disney Fun with co-workers. The check in service and valet service was exceptional. Rooms where spacious and comfortable. However the park rides and company was the best. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: My favorite Disney resort. SO magical!
Summary: This resort is so magical and incredible. The rooms are so comfortable and I love that there are robes available for use in the closet. The beds are heavenly, and I love that everywhere you look in the rooms and common areas there is mid-century Disney magic and details to be found. You feel totally immersed in the magic of Disneyland and the history of it all. Just a few steps away is Downtown Disney and we really loved being able to hop on the monorail which takes you right to Tomorrowland inside Disneyland Park. If you're visiting Disneyland Resort, definitely stay here! You won't regret it!

This is the second time we have visited this hotel with kids!  It is great because it is within walking distance to both parks.  The shopping in Downtown Disney was appreciated for a late afternoon walk after a day of rides!

Stayed for the Halloween week, and chose the holiday solely for the Magic Hour into Disneyland.  The pool is good, but always packed. The room was functional but dated. The staff were helpful and friendly. Luckily Downtown Disney is close by for dinner.  In my opinion, only for Disney diehards.

Great hotel with proximity to Disneyland. Reasonable pricing. Amenities such as food are costly. It is Disney. Computer systems are weak and appear to crash often. WiFi sketchy in rooms but when up, is strong. Great place to be if going to the parks or even an Angels game.

Very convenient. You can leave the hotel in two different places. One puts you in the middle of downtown Disney, the other puts you in California adventure. Rooms are clean and comfy. Service is not quite the same as in Florida. If you are used to cast members going above and beyond, don’t expect it in California.

This is our second time to Disneyland Anaheim but first visit to this hotel. We stayed across the street the year before and we much appreciated the convenience of this hotel. Security check lines to Disneyland were super short, monorail was just a 1-2 min walk from the hotel and it takes you right into the hearts of Disneyland. We took the suite which was large and super comfy. Our kids loved the head board that lights up with pictures of fireworks. Breakfast with goofy was really fun with for our kids too.  Pool was heated and the slides were amazing. Lifeguards were all over the place and swim vests for the younger kids were provided for free.  Highly recommend and will return for sure !!

Summary Heading: Over priced , run down , not the same
Summary: We’ve been coming here for 25 years and most often in put in frontier tower, which we were this time .. Check in was beyond slow!!! 30 minutes to get checked in. The room with tax etc etc was over $600/night, and was $800 on weekend . Now keep in mind this room hasn’t changed in over 10 years! Our room was missing shower curtain .. And was run down.. The Mickey Mouse amenities , and now h20 ??? Probably an affiliate company .. Any how absolutely saddened at what has happened here !!! Clearly all about return to shareholders and NOT return to customer.. Very very expensive and sooooo not worth it.. Only benefit is the closeness to the park ..

Summary Heading: This is not the Disney I know and love.
Summary: After 6 trips to Disney World and 3 Disney cruises, I considered myself a devoted fan. We booked on the Disney webpage, and later discovered we overpaid by over $600 compared to friends staying at the same time. The receptionist actually went to talk to a manager to see why we overpaid (her initiative after seeing what we were paying, not our request), and came back saying that just was the actual price leaving us very confused (and honestly like we were cheated). The second night I tried to order room service and waiting on hold for 20 minutes.  An automated message came up saying I could just press 1 and leave a message for room service to call me back.  I pressed one and got the front desk instead.  She was confused and said they didn't have a system to call me back and that

Wow! I can’t say enough about our experience at the Disneyland Hotel and Resort! Magical, romantic, breathtaking... etc... I had the pleasure of staying in the Fairytale Suite on the 11th floor in the Adventure Tour with club level service! What an experience and view! The staff at the resort go above and beyond in meeting all your needs and ensuring that you’re stay is wonderful! The e ticket lounge is incredible and you’re able to eat and drink as much as your heart desires and rent Disney movies anytime of the day! Also the view of Downtown Disney is gorgeous and really makes you feel like you’re floating in a fairytale! My husband and I can’t wait to stay here again! Thanks again, Disneyland!

I was treated to a night in the Fairytale Suite for my birthday.  The room was around $1440 for the night, definitely a splurge for a hotel for 1 night, but it is as much about the experience as it is about the room. There are 4 or 5 signature (themed) suites including a pirates of the Caribbean, a mountain railroad one, Mickey mouse themed suite etc, but these all go for 2 - 2 1/2 times as much due to there being two bedrooms. The fairytale suite is one room with a HUGE bathroom and is ideal for couples. You are given free access to the executive club which is right beside the room and gives you free snacks and drinks (you can ask for beer, wine and champagne and they'll being it out to you), parking is included and you receive gifts from the hotel which included a lovely tote

Ok folks if you can’t make it to Disneyworld, Disneyland is a nice substitute.  It’s not nearly as large or as nice; but, it’s not bad.    The food needs an overhaul as it’s high priced and mediocre at best.    The Disneyland Hotel is kept very clean and you get a feeling of being fairly safe and secure.     Downtown Disney is nothing like Disney springs in Florida; but, it has a few nice shops and places to dine.   Sadly Rainforest Cafe and ESPN zone have closed in Disneyland.     Service is OK.   Doesn’t seem to have the same level of Magic per se as Disneyworld; but, I may be partial.      The pool at Disneyland Hotel is wonderful.  Great poolside furniture and they serve food and drinks.       Overall I give it four out of five stars.   It’s cool to know this was Walt’s

Passing through Anaheim, we decided to stay here before heading further, it was a fantastic place to stay, the rooms were clean and comfy for the 3 of us. the gardens were really clean and lovely to walk around and easy acces to Downtown Disney

Although not the original hotel, still a nice place to visit.    Old photographs on the wall was a bonus.   This was my first visit to Disneyland, and had a great but came to this hotel for breakfast on our last day.   So worth it, loved the food and the history that I learned about.    The grounds were beautiful.

I have to start this review by stating that the staff at the Disneyland hotel have somewhat compensated me for this trip. But, I still feel it is important that there is a review posted.  I booked a suite for my beat friend's bachelorette party in mid August. I made the reservation over the phone with the Disneyland hotel a few months before arriving (appx. in April) and I called to pay off the room in full 2 days before the reservation as I would be arriving later than the rest of my party and I didn't want there to be any issue. I recieved a phone call from my friend the morning of checkin stating that there was no suite for us and that they would move us over to the Grand Californian for one night then we could come back. Ummm, no. She was able to talk to a manager  at the

Dinner was great  Hospitality was wonderful Pool was always clean  And loved the dinner kids had a good time very close to Disney  And the experience was once in a lifetime for all of us  Housekeeping was always there at our room

The room and service were stellar. You cannot beat a musical headboard.   We didn't use the pool or the sit-down restaurant but the cafe was really nice and has some light bites as well. The pool looked really really nice...just didn't have time to go in.  The lobby is lovely - such cute themeing with the little teacup seats. Everything was clean and pristine and so magical...and the location just can't be beat...which is what you are paying for.  The regular room rates are super pricey...if budget isn't a concern, definitely stay here.

I want to love this hotel for the name and historical significance, but it does lack in many areas.   First off, the pros... Like many have stated, the location is great. You’re right outside downtown Disney and within a short walk to California Adventure, and an even shorter monorail ride to Disneyland.   The pool is fantastic. No other Disney hotel can even compare. My 5 year old son enjoyed the slides, my daughter and I relaxed in the hot tub, and my wife took advantage of the “halfway decent” pool service.   The grounds are immaculate as they are every where you go in Disneyland.    Cons... Let’s face it, the Disney customer service is lacking. It’s not just this hotel, but Disney in general is beginning to miss the mark. One example from our stay, our walk from the parking

We stayed here for 9 days and had the best time.  Rooms are so comfy and one of our favorite memories is watching the fireworks from our bed!!!! So magical and so worth the money to stay here.  Spend a day at the pool and you will be relaxed for a month.  Loved it!

We stayed here Sep 8-12th. We got a very discounted rate otherwise we would not have been able to afford it. Nephew and his wife and 2 yr old stayed with us, but the room was large enough for us all!  It had two very comfortable Queen size beds and a sleeper sofa. They upgraded us to a wonderful Theme Park View, and we watched the Fireworks from our room Sat and Sunday night.  We spent the whole day Sunday at the pools and they were very clean and beautiful!  We did the parks Monday and Tuesday before leaving to our next destination.  I would highly recommend this hotel IF you can afford it.

The hotel really enhances your Disneyland experience. It is a short walk to the parks through Downtown Disney or you can hop on the monorail. The hotel was clean and well fitted out. We utilised the Coffee House for breakfast and also the various shops. The pool was heated and the monorail slides were fun. Our daughter (10) loved the castle themed bedhead and the wake up call from Pooh Bear. While there are cheaper options in Anaheim this hotel really added to our first family holiday to Disneyland and may convince us to return. Highly recommended

5X's Higher than any other Hotel in the "Resort" Area, The amenities are not that many and are not that great. Watch your spending here at any store or eatery in the Disney Complex, it's really up there. Most all the Hotels are Pricy, not like Disney or it Resturants.

This was a special trip to celebrate my son's 25th birthday, wanted to make it a memorable occasion. Loved the junior suite, plenty of room for 3 of us. Bedroom had a lovely, soft king bed. Linens were beautiful, nicely decorated room too. The sofa/bed was quite comfortable. The rooms were all clean & tidey, bathroom had double sinks, the toilet and bathtub/shower had separate doors for additional privacy. Had plenty of towels, lots of complimentary accoutrements. The suite was well insulated so didn't pick up much sound from the hallway or adjacent rooms. Our room overlooked the lobby side which turned out to be a bonus, being 8 stories up, we had a marvelous view of the evening fireworks show at Disneyland. l Loved all the shops, restaurants on the grounds, check in/out was

I thought this hotel was pretty nice for an older Disney hotel, they do a good job maintaining the outside and surrounding area. A few benefits to this resort is that it’s located right next to downtown Disney and it’s walking distance to the parks. The monorail is located just as you enter downtown Disney and it will take you to Disneyland park only. Rooms: make sure you ask for a room facing either the pool, or downtown Disney, all other views are terrible, I got a room facing downtown Anaheim, however all I could see is parking garages and trees. They are building a new parking structure nearby and I hope they pit some sort of Disney touch to it so That guest aren’t staring at concrete. I choose this hotel because it was the only one I felts had a Disney feel to it. The other

We've been to Disneyland in California twice and have stayed once at Disneyland Hotel and once at the Grand Californian.  The properties have different advantages.  We enjoyed both, would recommend both, and would not hesitate to return to either.  Here are some of the pros and cons of each.  The Disneyland Hotel has larger rooms.  We liked the Disney theming of the Disneyland Hotel; there was a great nostalgic feel that comes from staying at the first hotel in Disneyland.  The Disneyland Hotel also has two of the best restaurants in all of Disney California: Steakhouse 55 and Trader Sam's Enchanted Tiki Bar.  Steakhouse 55 is a classic and elegant steakhouse.  Trader Sam's is a fun and classic Disney experience for a light lunch or snacks.  The convenience to both of these

They have worked on many things and remodeled the rooms look great and there staff has a great team, only thing housekeepers need some training.Otherwise really top notch!! I love the Disney pixie dust headboard and club level was pretty good I would like to see some more adult choices in there.

Summary Heading: I was expecting more, but it was nice
