Summary: We stayed at the disneyland hotel last week for 2 nights.  This was our first trip to Disneyland and to the hotel.  It was a very good room and had all that we needed.  We are DVC members- so we used our points to book it.  I come from only staying at DVC resorts- so I was expecting that level.    The hotel just did not feel Disney-esque to me.  There were a few touches here and there (the headboard, obviously)- but that was really all.  I am not sure if I would have been as happy if we had paid cash for the room.    It was nice to be able to walk directly to downtown disney and only be 10-15 minutes from the parks.

Its Disneyland how can you go wrong. Everything we needed was in our room. Easy access to elevators and property was very clean. Bar was especially nice...lol. Characters are always areond to take picures with. he pol was the best fun ever for the kids and us adults.

We were there on 9/24/18 (we went to Mickey’s Halloween Party) to say  the least we were Not impressed with the service that one would expect from Disneyland Hotel.  They made us wait more than 1 hr to get our luggage (they didn’t allow us to carry the luggage car ourselves because it was a “full service”) We were trying to make the most of our stay and enjoy the pool before heading over to the parks but as I mentioned couldn’t get our luggage.  Secondly to get a hold from Front Desk....well good luck; it took 2 hrs to get someone on the line.  Honestly save yourself $400 and stay at a good neighbor hotel you get the same if not more quality service elsewhere.  Very disappointed from our stay at Disneyland Hotel :(

Summary Heading: Good but I think we expected more
Summary: I'll start this by stating that our expectations were "in your face Disney".  It was not.  It was understated in some cases and extremely tasteful.  The property is much nicer than you would think from the external view of the hotel from afar.    Because of the time of year I'm sure we saw lighter occupancy.  Navigating the property was easy and it was nice to see historical Disney info.  Getting to the park was straightforward.    Where expectations fell short were the rooms themselves.  I didn't feel the mattress quality matched the price point.  I've experienced more comfortable rest at Holiday Inns and Hiltons.  The other issue were drapes and carpet that needed serious cleaning.  Seeing my child come out of the space between the bed and drapes covered in dust.  Not cool.

Summary Heading: Great time and right in the midst
Summary: The hotel itself is nothing special, but the grounds and the experience are!  Plus, you are next to downtown disney & can wal to disneyland or california adventure. The rooms are spacious, but the bathrooms are small (like a cruise ship).

We decided to check out what all the hype was about for this hotel. First off, it IS DEFINITELY pricier than the neighboring "non" Disney hotels but if you're comparing between the Grand Californian and Paradise Pier, this hotel's price range falls in the middle of those 2 with the Grand Californian being the luxury class.   Room detail - We loved the Disney themed rooms and details with everything found in the room. For example, the sink handle ends were shaped like Mickey Mouse ears. These kind of attention to detail designs are found everywhere throughout the room. The headboard was gorgeously designed and I loved the wooden carvings and inserted star lights (along with the theme song played each time you turn it on) to make the stay so much more magical.   Pool/Play Area -

We stayed for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. Every cast member we encountered was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable with added disney touches throughout. My only complaint as that the bathroom was very small, much to small for more than one person to get ready at a time which made mornings challenging. The pool areas were amazing with plenty of lifeguards. We were in the frontier tower which is the farthest from the parks but close enough to return to the room in the afternoons for a nice rest. All in all a magical hotel for a magical vacation and we will return.

Summary Heading: We are so glad we stayed here.
Summary: This was my first experience in a Disney resort.  I loved the hospitality and attention to detail; from the parking lot attendants, the front desk staff, security to housekeeping.  The walk to the park was so easy.  I loved our room's little Disney details and view of the pool area.  The bed was very comfortable and the shower had great water pressure.  I'm going to miss all the Disney details.

I attended a recent conference at this hotel and was thrilled with my stay.  This was my first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel and couldn't be more pleased.  This hotel truly feels like the magic of Disney and I felt like a child again while here.   First of all, the service is just what you expect from Disney.  Staff members are hard-working, friendly and helpful.  All I encountered, greeted me and seemed to be happy they're at work.    Secondly, the rooms are loaded with Disney touches.  I loved the light up headboard, the Mickey's scattered throughout the room and the beautiful, comfortable furnishings. The rooms are very clean and well maintained.  Housekeeping does a great job!   I was in the Fantasy Tower and really liked the proximity to my conference, the

Stayed at this motel for a business trip.  I can see the benefit of staying here for families visiting Disneyland.   Walking distance to parks and interaction with characters seemed to be something the kids enjoyed.  The hotel is large with 3 towers and the pool area situated in the middle.  I was in a 5th floor room in the Frontier tower facing the pool.  Didn’t have any problems with noises.  Beds were comfortable. Rooms were large. Had a mini fridge and coffee pot.   The only thing I thought would be a plus is a couple bottles of complimentary water.  Really enjoyed the stay here

Summary Heading: Comfortable rooms, long walk to Disneyland
Summary: I picked this hotel because a lot of reviews talked about the rooms being Disney themed. We stayed in the Frontier tower and the only thing that was Disney themed was the headboard so I wasn't that impressed, especially with a 2 yr old. Rooms were clean but just kind of old-timey feeling. We had a 2 room suite with a living space in the center and that was great for our family, 2 adult kids, 1 grandchild and 2 of us. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom vanity had a lot of counter space. The shower was in the tub like 3 star hotel would have. The blow dryer was a really cheap one that smelled like it was going to catch on fire, you may want to bring your own. The room was the best part of our stay because it was relaxing and quiet. The pool was just normal, had a few slides

I love this hotel! I stayed at the Grand Californian and would recommend this hotel more. The rooms are beautiful and I love all the Mickey handles in the bathroom and shower. The room was quiet and it was a nice easy walk to my convention. The customer service as always is on point. I highly recommend this hotel loved every minute of it.

A true Disney fan will love this hotel! The first of the Disney hotel properties, it’s full of nostalgia without being dated. In the rooms, you can find hidden Mickeys or watch the headboard light up and play music at the touch of a button. As with all Disney properties, customer service and cleanliness are second to none. The hotel is also in a great location, very close to the parks.

The Disneyland Hotel was wonderful.  Downtown Disney and Disneyland are a short walk from the hotel.  Everything very nice and compact.  The room was very spacious and the beds were very comfortable.  As I was turning on the light on the nightstand I noticed another button that I pushed which lit up the headboard.  What a nice surprise.  I wish that they would have mentioned this during the check-in process.  I'm not sure how many people would have noticed it and it is a lovely touch to the room.  They have a coffee shop for quick breakfast bites such as yogurt, fruit plate, donuts, etc.  We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for the first time together and it didn’t disappoint! We arrived at the hotel around 8:30am and we were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. We purchased a Standard View room so we figured we’d have a view of a parking lot but we were pleasantly surprised again to have a pool view. The room was spotless and we loved all of the magical touches. We were able to still enter Disneyland during Early Entry the first day which was a great perk. The grounds of the hotel are immaculate and the Disney music playing all around made us feel like we were in the Disney bubble constantly. We visited Trader Sams and the pool one day and enjoyed both! We will definitely be back for another stay!

We stayed here for our most recent visit to the Disneyland parks. We drove in and arrived earlier then check in “no problem your room is ready” was the perfect start to our stay. They also made sure we knew where to go how to get there etc.  We were in the Fantasy tower 3rd floor. The toilets were loud but everything else about the room was great.  The room was clean and comfortable. We opted for not an upgraded view. It was beautiful palm trees. The head board lit up which was fun. To our surprise we had front row seats for the fireworks show.  I was pleasantly surprised by the coffee shop just feet away from the tower with dole whips and bakery goodies.  Bagels are great and cream cheese were super reasonable.  The gift shops had cute things and were super accommodating.  The

All is perfect but you need to much money for everything  Is too expensive for a normal person.  The staff was great and everything look clean but the money problem was too much for me, if you come bring a lot of cash

I was at a conference at the Disneyland Hotel in August 2018.  The weather was perfect as usual in California.  But it was a disappointing experience at the Disneyland Hotel on Magic’s Way.  The check-in process was long and quite frustrating.  I arrived at my room to relax because I had a long flight and so I unpacked.  I figured I would watch some TV but I didn’t get all the channels.  Very frustrating.  I understand Disney is making a lot of money but they may need to look at the customer experience.    Since I was there for work doesn’t mean I am not worried about my stay, my next vacation and possibly bringing my family.  They smile and have a “forced” pleasant attitude (not all) which will only go so far.  Please Disney don’t loose sight of the little things that made it

The hotel is a close walk to the parks and you get early admission into them - which is great. The rooms are clean and have some fun perks for kids. But the service in this hotel is awful. I’ve stayed in hotels 1/4 the cost with better service. Stay here if you want to be close but don’t expect anything else. They have a monopoly and they know it.

Summary Heading: Plumbing kept us awake at night
Summary: Really wish our trip for my Fiancée's birthday was magical instead of a shabby hotel experience.  Paid over $1,600 for 4 nights for what feels like a regular motel with more floors.  The plumbing has a terrible screeching sound that never stops.  We were in Frontier Tower, floor 11, room 2971.   Disneyland, this room needs to be checked out, please.  The Toilet plumbing pipes just keep screaming 24/7.  Really didnt figure to ask to be moved to another room because we were told the hotel was fully booked. Goofy's Kitchen was about $90 for 2 people for breakfast.  They asked if we were celebrating anything special and we told them it was my Fiancée's Birthday, Characters went to the other tables and sang for birthdays but never came to ours.  I was embarrassed to call this trip my

So this was my first stay. I went into this 3 night stay expecting an overpriced hotel close to Disney but totally fine with all of it since I didn’t want to shuttle around from a cheaper location. I ended up having a great stay. They upgraded our room, location was very convenient, pools were so much fun. And the icing on the cake? My son left his Nintendo switch with games on a concrete ledge outside of the hotel as we caught our lyft ride to the airport. We didn’t realize until we got out of the car and called the hotel. To my disbelief, the hotel staff found another kid walking away with it, confronted him and got I back and are UPSing it to us at no charge. Yep, I’ll be back.

This hotel has been around for many years & is an icon at Disneyland. Our room was spacious & had been newly remodeled, but our bed needed to be replaced. It was an old spring mattress & we prefer the newer foam mattress models. We were on the eighth floor & had great views of the parks, Downtown Disney & the Grand Californian hotel. Had a front row seat for the nightly park fireworks which were impressive! We were here for a conference, not to go to the parks. Steakhouse 55 had a great breakfast, we didn't eat there at lunch or dinner. I recommend venturing outside the park area to eat for cheaper & better food.

This hotel has spacious suites that are well maintained and clean. It has everything you need and close to Disneyland. The staff is friendly and answered all my questions about the location and nearby tourist places to dine at. I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Noisy during early morning and Strangely soul-less
Summary: My wife was stuck in an elevator for 15 mins. I alerted the hotel and they called their engineering staff, but no follow up to check on guests. I passed on the comment to the front desk where they offered me a complimentary bottle of water (??!!).  Dined at chef Goofey, where a woman became unresponsive. Medics and police were called immediately but it felt as if the incident was all just unwelcome and bad for business.  Since guests get Magic Mornings at the park many guests are up by 7am. If you don’t want to get up that early expect to be awoken anyways, you can hear all the toilets flushing (next door, above, below … ) and I'm not a light sleeper.  To balance my review some positives: Rooms are clean and comfortable and don’t feel worn despite the high traffic that the place

We usually stay at the Disneyland resort hotels whenever we go to Disneyland. We are always happy afterwards but it didn't happen this time.We are Disney Vacation club members and pay a lot of money to be so which I am starting to regret now. We went to the disneyland hotel in august and the service was unbelievably tragic. We came back to the hotel the first night after the park around midnight tired and ready to go to bed. The key card wasn't working. So we walked all the way across the resort to the lobby to get a new set. We walked back to the hotel and the new key cards weren't working as well. My kids were tired so I went alone all the way back to the lobby for another set and to complain. They sent the maintenance crew to open the door which took another hour. They

This is my #1 hotel that I love to stay at... Love the look and feel and closeness to Disneyland... and Trader Sam's is a must at night. I stay here everytime I am in California...  Steakhouse 55 located in the hotel is also a top notice Restaurant.

Just returned from a weeks stay at the hotel. Before arriving I asked for a firework view room and was told no guarantees but they would see what they could do. We checked in after 10pm and the staff were cheerful and very helpful, our room was in the frontier tower and was a great size but the bathroom tiny and a bit dirty but nothing major. Room was quiet and a bit dated but the headboard really is fantastic. We had a great view of the fireworks every night! The hotel also has characters that walk around the lobby in the afternoon which is a nice touch and they are around for a good while. The pool is great and the water slides are fab if you can get a lounger, we found by 1/2pm it was packed and struggled to get a seat. This is an expensive hotel but the extra magic morning

Unless you want and can use the Magic morning or priority for restaurant reservations, Disneyland hotel is overrated. The hotel is dated and not any better than a 3-Star hotel. You can find much better service and value in other neighborhood hotels just as close to Disneyland.

We love the Disneyland Hotel! We have stayed there twice, each time has been wonderful. Beautiful rooms, great customer service and lots of Disney magic 😊❤️ Looking forward to staying there again soon.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed another fantastic trip to Disneyland
Summary: We had another great stay at the Disneyland Hotel and my Family even enjoyed the pool even though it was unseasonably cold. We had a great casual dinner at theTangaroaTerrace. The guest rooms are always clean and comfortable.  It is great to be so close to the Disney District.  We always play hard in Disneyland and it's nice to go back to the guest room and relax.

My 4 year old little girl loves Disneyland so we are always spending a night or 2 at nearby hotels. It's just more convenient for us. We stayed here on August 11. We checked in late and the front desk staff was very rude. I could tell she had a long day but we were there to destress so she should not have taken it out on her guests. The room was a little small but clean and has the Disney atmosphere. We slept ok but were awaken too early by someone hammering next door and this was at around 7-7:30'sh. My husband came out and found a maintenance guy fixing the wall 2 rooms away from us.We did not get a good night sleep so I called front desk and asked for a late check out since we checked in late and was told they don't offer late check out. Front desk person also told me she

My young daughter and I just returned from a trip to Disneyland. We spent three nights at the Grand and one night here at the Disneyland Hotel. The Grand is beautiful, but the Disneyland Hotel felt like pure magic! The pathways surrounding the grounds are incredible beautiful and impeccably manicured. We had a premium view king room in the Adventure tower that overlooked the pools. One entire wall was a huge window that gave for an amazing view. We even looked out right after we checked in and saw Pluto by the pool waving to everyone! The light up headboard is what dreams are made of and I cannot wait to return!

I would recommend going to a Disney hotel in Florida if you want to experience the real magic of Disney. This hotel lacks all the magic for kids. There are very few extra activities going on in the lobby or pool area, and the extra activities are mostly aimed around fitness for adults. When we stayed at Animal Kingdom lodge and Yacht Club there was so much going on each day that it really made it feel special and different from a standard hotel experience.   The staff here are OK by most hotel standards, however again they were not true Disney staff. They just don't have that extra helpfulness that you find in all Disney hotels and parks in Florida.   We were happy with our room in the Frontier tower, although the view of the parking lot was not a nice view. The standard rooms

Well our day started out at the pool area near the slides. First it took about 40 minutes to get a drink then beer was hot and flat. Waitress in our area was leaving drinks to wrong people. But still I thought mistake happen but when we got to our room it had a chair in the corner that look like s chair from a dark alley. I had to put a sheet over it as my daughter had brought her Disney princess and had put them all there to sleep. I was so upset that a hotel would allow a dirty chair to be in a guest room. Which I must say  for the price that I paid to stay a night. I would expect much more out it being a Disney hotel.  I will never bring my children to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Happiest place on Earth for a girls trip
Summary: It's been over 20 years since I've stayed at the Disneyland Resort. While so many things are different, everything is the same.  Everything is Disney. Which I loved. Walking up, check in is a friendly fun area, that even has character visits for the kids, well for all of us.  The agent checking me was super sweet and very friendly. After finding out we were celebrating she gave us buttons to wear so everyone could share our celebration. Our room wasn't ready. I gave my phone number(they text when your room is ready) and they give you your room number and keys. I took my bags to the bell hop and was given tags and instructions to call when I'm in my room and the bags will be brought up. The whole experience was super easy, seamless and well thought out. I was prepared to meander.

We stayed here for 5 days with our grandsons as we have with our grown children who now range up to 45 years of age.The hotel is bright interesting and with great access walking to the attractions.Rooms are large and easily accommodated our party of four in comfort.Housekeeping was great.We went out early morning and on our return around noon for a nap our room was cleaned, beds made and with fresh towels.Well worth a tip to our housekeeper.We rented a cabana by the pool.Our grandsons went swimming and enjoyed the slides while my wife and I lay in comfort sipping on adult beverages.Service at the cabanas was excellent and we were asked if we had any needs at least every 15 minutes.Prices at the pool for drinks and food was remarkably reasonable.If I had to criticize I would

The only reason we paid $500 per night because it is only 5 mins walk to the park. And we can go back to the room and take a rest in the afternoon.   Outdoor pool is nice the pool side service staff is good and friendly .  The front desk check in staff is professional (no smile on their face).    The H2O shampoo and shower gel are good but the bathroom is dark and outdated.   The only reason we will stay here again is because it is close to the park.

Summary Heading: Family of 10 - 2 rooms - Adventure Tower - E-Ticket Club Access -AWESOME!!!
Summary: First time here. View of park and nighttime fireworks from this Tower is NICE. Access to club for breakfast and snacks -- great staff and light foods and refreshments. Easy walk to both parks. Terrific pools and Trader Sams food and drinks nearby are great.  This is a grand destination. Grounds are incredibly clean and safe. Plantings and trees are gorgeous.  This is truly a luxury experience - a bucket list item for sure. Loved the historic photos on the walls.

There were parts of the hotel and stay that were a 4 or 5 and parts that were a 2.  My advice would be to stay away from the standard room.  It was okay but for the price I'd upgrade so you're not looking at the parking lot like we were.  The room was nice but not roomy.  Very few outlets for charging, tight bathroom with okay shower.  Handles on sink were loose.  A pile of chips were spread out in the hallway near the elevators when we came home from the park Friday night and were still there at 10am the next morning.  The nice parts were the pool and restaurants.

I just got back from a vacation at the Disneyland hotel. The staff everywhere was so friendly and always so helpful. The pools and monorail water slides were heavenly. Housekeeping was always on top of things and neatly made our beds every day. The food at Steakhouse 55 was delicious and the servers were so friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The ONLY downside was the monorail was always down.

Though we did not find Disneyland Anaheim to be nearly as magical as Walt Disney World Orlando, my husband and I did enjoy our one night stay in the Disneyland Hotel. We had a standard king room in Adventure Tower. We had a lovely view of the pool though I did not request a room with a view so that was a plus. Our room was nicely appointed and had nice toiletries which I utilized. It was also very nicely themed and both he and I got a kick out of the light up singing headboard. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant Tangaroa Terrace had more diverse and healthier options than what we found at Walt Disney World in past years. It was also a quick walk to the parks. There is shuttle service from LAX for $50 per person but we landed at LAX without prearranged transport and were able to

Summary Heading: Great base for trip to Disney
Summary: We arrived early and checked in which was not so busy at 745 am...the receptionist said return about 4pm and room would be ready..which it was. Room was great clean and well presented ..comfy beds to sleep in after hard day playing in park. Had a great two days here enjoying the magic and fun that you always get at Disney. Great to relax by pool in afternoon when park at its busiest ...no problem getting a seat. Teenage kids loved the pool. We then had dinner in Goofy’s Kitchen ..food ok but great opportunity to get pics with all the characters. It is quite a walk to the park's but through downtown so lots to see as you walk.

Summary Heading: One night with a lot of pixie dust
Summary: We were visiting Palm Springs in July 2018 and made an escape-from-the-heat visit to Disney for two days with our two kids (age 10/12). We have only stayed at the Disney Grand before and were curious about the classic Disneyland Hotel. We had booked at the last minute whatever room was available at the time, a premium view I think. We checked in early (6am!) to take advantage of the extra magic hour in the park, dumped our bags, and took off to the park. We returned to the hotel at 4pm to check in to our room. To our great surprise, we were upgraded to the Adventureland Suite on the 11th floor! Complete with door bell, vintage artwork and memorabilia, multiple bathrooms, hidden spa, dining room, and unlimited features that epitomize the Disney magical experience. Great photos of

First time staying at Disneyland parks in Anaheim and it was lovely. We arrived late afternoon and there was a long queue for check in but thankfully we’d paid for concierge service and so got to check straight in at the top of adventure tower. It’s a bit strange to have that check in desk and concierge on floor 11 and I think it would help to let customers know that’s where they go for check in as we didn’t realise until we ask one of the hotel staff. Anyway our rooms was ready early so we could go straight in and it was magical. So many hidden mickeys and we loved the light and sound display in the head board for the bed. Very spacious and a great view of the park but we did pay extra for this and I guess if you are coming for a short trip then you don’t really need a view of

Had to make last minute changes for a family camping trip that was cancelled for Yosemite at the housekeeping campsite. My husband and I have stayed with our kids at this hotel before but this time it was a nice treat to actually untilized the pool.

What a great experience. I had an amazing stay here. The pool is great along with the restaurants here. Entertaining long with magical and beautiful to look at. It may be far from the parks, but that doesn’t say a whole lot when literally everything else about it is great, and it’s easy to get around.

We stayed here four nights while visiting Disneyland with family. The hotel public areas and rooms are kept in immaculate condition. The king size bed was very comfortable and welcome after each day in the park.  We liked being close to Downtown Disney where we went for dinner every night. Hope to stay again some day.

We had a few hiccups with miss information from the front desk staff but we always find it to be a real treat to stay at Disneyland Hotel. The hotel is beautiful, the pools are amazing, and the rooms are very comfortable.  This trip we got a room in the Frontier Tower, not my favorite but still very nice. It is the quietest tower away from the main lobby or the entrance to Downtown Disney. Our room was a weird one right off the elevators so we had a wall/parking lot view. Not great. Maid service starts early because they have a lot to do so remember to put out your do not disturb if you plan to sleep in.  Construction has started at Downtown Disney with the closure of ESPN, AMC, Earl of Sandwich, and Starbucks (so very sad) so getting to other food options is a longer trek. Once

We were located in the Frontier Tower (South side) with a premium view on the 11th floor facing the pool area.  We could see over the other towers and could see into Disneyland park and into California Adventure park. At night we had a great view of the fireworks over Sleeping Beauty’s Castle.    The room held 5 adults with 2 queen size beds and a single sofa sleeper.  The entry area was large and had a desk and large closet. The bathroom was average size, but could really only hold one person.  There was able free space for the scooter and the windows on the far end of the room went from the ceiling to the floor.  Overall the room was perfect for our group.   Over the beds was a headboard that would play music and light up, it was truly magical. Of the 3 Disney hotels this room

Summary Heading: Convenience of staying in the park.
Summary: This trip we stayed at the Disneyland hotel for the Halloween event in the park. The ease of the location of the hotel is worth the cost. You can hope the monorail and be in the park in minutes. The rooms are nicely decorated to continue the Disney theme. The pool is fun for everyone. When you stay at a Disney hotel you also get early admission into the parks. Be sure to utilize this benefit. The cost is up there but I feel the convenience I’d worth it.

As with all Disney properties, this hotel is very clean and kept up. The pool area is nice and the grounds are close to Downtown Disney. We had a convention on site and it was good facilities for it. Still not on par with Disney World properties but still nice.

We stayed at the Grand Californian on August 3.  After we checked out, due to a course of events, we needed to extend our stay through August 4.  We visited the front desk and were told the hotel (entire resort) was sold out. We engaged the front desk manager (Jacy) and he worked some magic.  He made some phone calls, visited the back office, (did a lot of typing) and finally shared the good news that he could get us a room at the Disneyland Hotel, although it wouldn't fit the 5 of us very comfortably.  No problem, we needed a room.  The hotel proceeded to pack our luggage in a Suburban and drove us to the Disneyland Hotel.  Once we arrived and started the check-in process, the experience was even more magical.  Alyssa from Austin and Rachel from Snoqualmie tag teamed and got us

Booked 2 days, to make trip to Disneyland more convenient,  the hotel is close to downtown Disney and a 10 minute walk to the entrance of both parks.  We were booked on the Frontier land building,  we had a view of the pool. Service was good,  the room was average,  the paints on the bathroom doors were chipping.     Housekeeping had great service,  the kids love the magical feel.  We booked thinking of the convenience but there are hotels nearby across the entrance which are as convenient,  as SPG member I would most likely booked on a nearby Sheraton next time because there are better perks.

We stayed in the main tower (above loddy) and had a view of the pool. The room was exceptional and the layout allowed us to have the crib around the corner in the little nook by the bathroom. The headboard was so amazing, the service was excellent, the grounds were beautiful, being so close to the park made it feel like we were IN Disneyland, the pools were perfect and Trader Sam's was tasty. Not an affordable option every visit, but definitely worth the splurge when you can.

Summary Heading: Disneyland hotel towers very dated... not worth the money
Summary: Dated towers in need of paint and maintenance. One microwave in tower in loby... really as much as they charge. Pool very nasty don't get the water in your mouth, smells like piss, as well as kids poop in water. Wow yuck. Drinks are too much. Goto a surrounding hotel for half the price or less you won't feel gross and your wallet won't feel raped

Summary Heading: Great place to hang out, day and night.
Summary: Great pools, a fabulous Tiki bar, and easy access to Disney's Downtown District. Three different themed towers provide almost any Disney experience you could dream up. Grab breakfast, lunch or dinner from three different restaurants on site.

Summary Heading: Love the hotel and what it has to offer
Summary: We love to go to the Character breakfast/dinners at this hotel for special family occasions. The atmosphere is so inviting. The hotel has been beautifully updated and the grounds are georgous. We always feel like we are on a vacation whenever we visit the hotel and park.

As soon as we arrived the magic started!  We were given a room upgrade with a great view of the pool area!  Staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel room was clean and comfy.  Easy access to both parks, about a 10 minute walk to each.   Grounds are kept up and landscaped nicely also.  Pictures in lobby show all the famous people that have visited since the hotel has been opened.  Yes, it’s expensive but this was on our bucket list so.... I would stay again!

We had a 3rd floor room in Adventure Tower facing the pool.  We got a substantial military discount, which I was not expecting, but it was honestly still a little expensive. We splurged anyway because we wanted to try it, and were not disappointed.  Every staff member we encountered on property was great.  The rooms are nice and the bed was really comfortable.  I was expecting a little pool noise, with it being a lower floor room next to the pool and all, but the room was surprisingly quiet.  They do play Disney music 24/7 in the pool area though, but It didn't affect our ability to sleep.  The room kept sounds out pretty well, so it was more like you could feel the vibrations of the sound waves more than you could hear it.  Like I said, didn't affect our sleep, it was just a

We had a wonderful visit to Disneyland.  Staying at the Disneyland Resort was a highlight.  Very clean and decorated!  We loved our pool view room (surprise upgrade).  The staff was attentive, although we waited almost 30 minutes in a line to check in.  The pool area is great with fun slides!

We had a nice room which looked to have been recently updated.  The bed was very comfortable.  The hotel was directly connected to Downtown Disney which led to the parks.  Pools seemed to be crowded in the afternoon, as expected (we didn't use the pools).  Nice breakfast place.

Loved this hotel so much more than I ever expected I would.  I really felt immersed in Disney Magic the whole time.  Spacious room.  Comfy beds.  Easy walk to the park.  Friendly, helpful, and available staff.  Grounds were immaculate.  Loved it!  First trip to Disneyland and would definitely return and stay here again.

Summary Heading: Club Level will transform your experience!  Worth the upgrade!
Summary: We've stayed at all 3 onsite Disneyland options multiples times but this is the first time we actually splurged for Club Level at the Disneyland Hotel.  Oh my...I don't think I can ever stay here at without doing so.  We got in at 7:45am, way too early for a typical check-in.  However, upon pulling up to the lobby, a man in a suit greets us with a binder, "Welcome!  We have everything ready for you, Mr and Mrs Lo."  The bellhop takes the luggage, the valet drives the car away.  Slips are handed to this Club Level representative.  We are then escorted to the top of one of the towers where Club Level sits and given Mimosas and chocolate milk, juice, muffins for the kids, as check-in details are managed.  Tickets, wrist bands, special passes, coupons are given to us at that time.

Perfect way to top off the perfect disney visit!   The Hotel is lovely, well appointed, and centers around everything Disney. And, you get special first access to shows and events to really top off the stay.   I have stayed at local Hotels across the street, and I promise this is the worth the price.

My company had a huge event at their hotel and it was fabulous. They can really set up great places for event parties. Everything was fantastic. First night buffet was great. Second night was tenderloins with the BEST mushroom risotto I’ve ever eaten!! If you are looking at a venue to do a business event this is it! All details were fantastic. Fun for adults and kids. A must do for business!!

Room was a great size for 2 adults and 2kids. Unfortunately we were the far from the entry but still so close to walk. Food was great, super clean and beautiful view. We were at end of hall, very quiet.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It’s location enabled us to do a stint at the parks in the morning, return for lunch, a swim and a rest to back up until midnight at the parks. The pool and other hotel facilities were fantastic. The ‘magic hour’ (entry 1 hour prior to the official opening) was good. However, we weren’t told that only a small section of the parks are open for magic hour. However, we were also not informed that Goofy’s Kitchen (character dining) do not take same day bookings and need to be fine through the app. We learned the hard way in our 5th and final night at the resort as they were booked out and didn’t take walk ins that night. Highly disappointing and polite a dampener on our stay.

If you are a vet Disney offers great discounts. Our room had a great view of the swim pool and water slides. The room was large and had everything you would want in your stay. You walk outside and your in downtown Disney.

The only down fall I have to this hotel is, the beds were not comfortable. ( to some xtra, xtra firm mattress are tolerable. not so much for myself.) Great view of the fireworks, friendly staff, over all super clean make up for the uncomfortable beds.

Summary Heading: For the price we were a bit disappointed
Summary: Just stayed here this month and we were saddened by the accommodations at this hotel since it has been awhile since we have stayed here. The bed that I slept in a huge dip in the side of it, the bathroom was always fogging up even if you took just a warm shower. The slides were pathetic in the pool area. Both my husband and I stopped completely in the slides, while our kids just slowed way down to a crawl. Overall, I would not suggest staying at this hotel for the money as well as the length away it is from the Disney Parks there are better options out there.

Stayed at the hotel for my nieces dance competition and to celebrate my brothers birthday. The hotel is nicely situated and the staff is okay. I was at the pool and wanted to order drinks, it took over an hour to get my order in and to get my drinks. You’re paying for location but the customer service can be better. The hotel is in need of some updates.

Summary Heading: Choose elsewhere if you want to sleep
Summary: This is the third time I have brought my children to Disneyland, and the first and last time I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. Previously we stayed at Paradise Pier, which is the least expensive of the Disney Hotels. I would 100% recommend that over the DH. I am laying in bed here and I can hear someone in the room above me urinating, the walls are so thin. I hear every time anyone around me flushes a toilet or showers or just washes their hands. The room I am in, 2160, was a Pool View upgrade. The pool is visible if you look to the far right. The room is actually across from the Tiki Tiki bar.  Fake Polynesian music plays from there until midnight. Today for some reason it turned on again at 5:30 am. The Grand Californian looks like a nice hotel. Paradise Pier is not fancy

Stayed 3 nights during our kids ski week in Feb.   The rooms and the corridors definitely show their age.  The price is a premium, definitely pay for the name.  Regarding guest service, there's much to be desired.  The kids loved the pool. Proximity to Downtown Disney is a plus.  Would I stay here again? Its a possibility....after a renovation.

Summary Heading: Our favorite hotel of all the resorts!!
Summary: I take my three children (who are adults now) to a three day Disneyland trip every year for the past 14 years. We have stayed at all three resort hotels more than once. But our most favorite and most visited is the Disneyland hotel. The location is the best of the three. A short walk from the monterail is so welcoming at the end of a long day in the parks. Believe me, your feet will thank you. The room are prestine and adorable. Everything you would hope or expect from Disney. Beds are heavenly and welcoming. Service could not be better. In the future, adult children willing, we will be staying at this hotel for our future visits to the happiest place on earth!!

Summary Heading: Poor service and lack of essential information
Summary: This is like cattle being driven to the slaughterhouse. They are only interested in your money. The reception was at best without a smile and welcome. There was no information about the options, such as 15% discount on all restaurants in Down Town Disney when staying at one of their resorts. In my opinion this hotel is way too expensive compared to their service. We were given incorrect times to the Disney parade of 2 different co-workers, which meant we arrived late for the parade and our daughter was crying and unhappy. That kind of error can not be reversed. I noticed our dissatisfaction on our departure and the receptionist was totally indifferent.

Summary Heading: A Nice Room, Nice Features, Some Glitches
Summary: We were going to do a 1 Day Disney tour, and figured staying in the hotel would be the best way to get the most out of the trip.  The cost of this hotel is high, and is based on the proximity to the park entrance, as well as the available options (pools with water slides, Disney dining nearby - the usual Disney "belt and suspenders" intended to keep you and your money, in house.  We were traveling with people with an Annual Pass ($1000 / year, with free parking, and 15% discounts for food in the park, unlimited visits), so the parking worked out.  We did a "drop the bags with the concierge" trip (you pull a ticket on pulling in, and then as long as you exit within a predetermined time limit (ours was 20 minutes, but we were there early - it was longer when we left), no charge.

Summary Heading: Lacking magical staff, postage stamp sized rooms not suitable for families
Summary: We booked this hotel based on the water slides and proximity to Disney. I paid 500 dollars a night and got a room that 4 people (2 of whom were kids 4 and 7 years) could not fit comfortably into. The sink smelled of backed up drains and the view was of the parking lot. We thought the hotel would be in close proximity to the park but it appears that anytime it is more than 85 degrees, the monorail which makes the park a closer distance, is shut down due to high temperatures. Do not book this hotel based on proximity to the park entrance. My sister stayed at a hotel 2 miles away and could take an Uber from her hotel to the gates faster than I strollered my 2 kids 25 mins walking into the park.  Next, NONE of the staff seem happy to be working here. Not a single “cast member” who I

Summary Heading: Some of the Magic is going away.....
Summary: This was our second stay in a year at the Disneyland Hotel. We had two rooms for a party of 8. This hotel is very pricey so you expect the best in all areas. Let me start by saying the you cant beat the location of the hotel. It is within walking distance to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. Which if you have teen children and older, this is great because they meet you at the park or go back to the room when needed. The convenience is Awesome and the room sizes cant be beat. But you can begin to notice the need for possible renovation touch ups again (which I know were just completed recently) With a hotel this size I understand with people in and out all the time, but at this price you have to do a little better. The staff also seemed a lot more

For our first trip to Disneyland I wanted to stay at a Disney resort. We always stay on property at Walt Disney World and it is more magical for us.  Pros: The room was huge and we could see fireworks perfectly from our room. Nice pool area. Nice view from the room. Character walking around the lobby.   Cons: One of the beds smelled like pee really bad so we had them switch the matress and that one didn’t smell so great either. The walks to the park felt pretty long, especially after a long day at the park. On the hottest day (100 degrees) we left for a midday break and the pool was closed for hours due to a kid pooping in the pool. Overall I don’t think it was worth the price.

I really enjoyed staying at the Disneyland Hotel. This is a nice walk to Disneyland/Magic Kingdom and California adventure. Request a view of Downtown Disney. The rooms are beautifully appointed. The themed pool and the entire complex is a destination in of itself. This hotel added to the Magical Experience!! Castmembers are first rate!!

Summary Heading: Great staff with seriously  flawed accommodations
Summary: The  hotel staff could not be more helpful.  EVERYONE did all they could do to make the stay great......alas, the hotel itself has a huge problem.  The hot water in the tub was merely luke warm.  Not cold, but luke warm.  I called down on Sunday and they immediatelly sent someone to "work on it".  He was kind and said he fixed things.  No such luck.  Ii called on Tuesday and they immediately sent engineer again who left a message that it was fixed.  Still no luck.  Now, here is the rub.  The hot water in the SINK was extremely hot so it wasn't a matter of not having hot water, it was a matter of the mixing valve on the tub (IMHO).  I am at a conference and asked others if they were having problems, and in a class of 30 there were 3 others with the exact same problem.  And, to

My family enjoyed our stay at this iconic hotel. There are three towers in this hotel.  We stayed in the Fantasy tower and had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks.  Plus 2 great restaurants to enjoy. The pools and slides made for a great escape on the hottest days of the trip.  P.s.: Channel 16 has the fireworks show audio playing in your room during the fireworks display.

WOW. We were really impressed by the Disneyland Hotel. We're definitely snobs when it comes to hotels, and expect the best. Disney did not disappoint, giving us a magical experience throughout our stay.  Check-In: We decided to do valet, and it was as expected - a lot of eager help, happy workers, and an easy experience. The check-in line was fairly long when we got there, but they had numerous workers manning the desk so it wasn't too bad. Our check-in experience was very smooth and everything was ready to go for us. Pleasant experience.  Hotel: The hotel, while slightly dated, still has a great setup, including restaurants, gift shops, AMAZING pools (noted later in this review), and a great location, at one end of Downtown Disney.  Room: Our room was really nice, with some

Everybody was so Friendly, from check-in to those hospitality workers that make sure your room stays fresh and clean.  The Hotel itself was immaculate - I Love it there.  The Pool area was very clean and personnel always present.  The Hotel is at the end of Downtown Disney - which makes for Good Shopping on the way to Disneyland/California Adventure or do it on the way back.  I Love being able to go to Disney and being able to take a short walk vs having to drive home or to another hotel.

Two night stay in a hotel built when Disney was a great adventure.  It has been now outstripped by much better hotels for much less money.  A two nite stay was more that 4 nights in a better hotel on Coronado Island!.  Hotel needs some real work to update it.  I haven't been in a hotel lately that was luxury level that had a shower/ bathtub combination!!.  Baths are small.  Rooms average size.  Staff, and there are lots of them are most helpful.  The only advantage to staying here is you can walk to the theme parks and you can get in 1 hour before the park opens to the general public.

We decided to stay here due to the age of our youngest children 3 & 4 and for them to get the complete Disney experience. However,  it wasn’t as close to Disneyland as what we thought a good 15min walk, you could take the monorail but that seem to take longer sometimes, and to be honest I can’t say it provided a better experience. The Hotel itself was clean and comfortable it had a swimming pool with a great kids area with slide and a shallow pool to play in. They also have Goofy’s Kitchen at this Hotel which we did for lunch with the Disney characters the kids loved this and the food was good, however you don’t need to be staying at the Hotel to attend Goofy’s Kitchen. It’s expensive to stay here and to be honest you spend your entire day at Disneyland and don’t really spend a

We chose this hotel based on the pool area and the park access.  Park access was very easy and convenient....literally steps away from Downtown Disney.  Our deluxe room had a great pool view.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Only reason for not having five stars was the food selection at a reasonable rate for breakfast. Not many breakfast options here at a decent price.  Room was nice, but could use a little updating for the price.  Overall, we would stay here again....great hotel!!

Disneyland hotel is just wonderfully over the top!! Every detail is just gorgeous!! The plants are well pruned, the pool is very clean, and the rooms are just beautiful!! I am a huge Disney gal and this hotel satisfies my needs while visiting the Disney park. I wouldn’t change a thing about the hotel!! I love you Disney!!

This resort is the ultimate in the Disney experience. Rooms are magical, clean and the hospitality is top notch. While we were here, my husband came down with the flu. Not only is there a doctor on call, but a nurse checks in by phone every two hours. If medication is needed, they deliver it to your room, along with water and ginger ale. All with no charge to us. Amazing hospitality and care. We enjoyed hanging out at the beautiful pool and eating at the restaurants. We would stay on this resort property again for sure. Thanks  Mickey!

We were warmly greeted at check in. We chose valet parking which was convenient. Very clean & comfortable room 2 queen beds with a day bed. Adorable musical night light :) Location to the parks is great! Took advantage of the early morning entrance. Goofy’s Kitchen is very fun. Lots of choices! We saw so many characters several times as they danced around our table. Our server Pamela was so sweet and helpful. Her beautiful smile really made my day.  *An item we had purchased at one of the parks didn’t get the security ink tag removed. We didn’t notice until morning of check out. The hotel shop removed it for us. Luckily we had the receipt! Keep your receipts*

This was our third visit to the Disneyland hotel. The service and experience were both excellent. Tori at the front desk made our stay exceptionally magical! She was especially kind to my son and went above and beyond to make him feel special. The accommodations and amenities are of the high quality one expects from Disney, but it is truly the staff that makes the magic happen!

What a FABULOUS Hotel, ALL Staff were full of smiles and very very helpful in everyday possible.  I never once saw a Staff member from the Hotel or Disneyland have a frown or rude...NEVER ONCE!   The rooms were amazing!  The rooms were very clean and smelt Refreshing  and can I just say it was 5 Stars from top to bottom.  It over exceeded my expectations.   Patty the Manager was such a delight.  She was so helpful and very quick on her feet and just was the BEST!   THANK YOU PATTY and STAFF FOR MAKING OUR STAY AT DISNEYLAND A PLEASURABLE ONE.  WE WILL BE BACK   SMILE BIG !!!!  Lisa, Lane and Esmarelda !!

The Disneyland Hotel exceeded my expectations and they were pretty high! If you are a Disney fan I definitely recommend this hotel. There’s Disney magic at every turn. It’s very close to the parks and is beautiful!

Very nice hotel, rooms and grounds are immaculate, service is top notch. Very expensive but you get what you pay for it. Swimming pool in the center of the three buildings is nice  and relaxing. Just be prepare to open your wallet, everything around it it is Disney priced. Location is excellent to go to the parks.

Last stayed in the hotel about 8 years ago as they were renovating to the current decor etc.   They have scrapped the turn down service where they left little Disney chocolates on the bed. Not a big deal but the kids loved it every night but they no longer do it apparently.   I just thought as the price has gone up the benifits and perks haven’t. The luggage tags they give you now are cheap and no it’s not a big deal but it certainly has changed and these little differences are why people stay on Disney property.

To charge over $500 a night on days when the So Cal Resident pass can be used is a complete rip off.  Stay away. Can’t even walk in the park. They let the residents in for next to nothing to fill the park but don’t lower the hotel rates to compensate.  Too many vacation options to waste money on this one.

There is nothing to beat the convenience of staying at the park as one can come back halfway. This place also has a very nice swimming pool and hot spa area which is highly recommended - bring the swimsuit! The water is heated. If I could I would still stay here again especially since the park has such long opening hours. What I wish would have been would be :  1. better check in - arrive late and so many instructions etc  2. reservations required for the restaurants and spa.

My experience here was not good,before i even got to the damn hotel. watch out for the rude  carpark gate trying to ramp up $35 carpark prices, must be getting kick backs.  You have been warned, i wont be back

Perfect location for families to rest and revive before and during the exhausting days at Disneyland.  Although rooms could do with an update they were clean and comfortable.  Best part is the convenience of walking to Disneyland gates (especially the extra hour morning access) and walking back to the room for an afternoon rest before going back for the evening.  Lots of restaurants to pick from in the village however advise to book in advance otherwise the wait can be long (for those with young families).  Wish we had more time to use the other hotel facilities.

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel in April/May this year. It is amazing it has great food options, character dining, big pools and great service. The ambience and detail is fantastic. We particularly enjoyed the light up firework bedhead! The magic is unreal including in the bathroom and all the fixtures! Close walk to dinner and drinks in downtown Disney and a short walk to the parks. Cast members were very helpful and attentive. We will definitely be staying here again.

Firstly after travelling all night we reached and we were told the rooms wont be given to us till 3pm... tired yet how to kill time we head to disneyland... for food vegetarian options are very limited... very expensive too... Nothing as such entertaining in the hotel for the kids and even the rooms are average...

Summary Heading: Great location for a complete Disney trip!
Summary: First of all, it's Disney, so they are going to do thing right. The location next to Downtown Disney is awesome, so you can walk to the parks with ease or hang out downtown and enjoy, shop, eat, etc. We didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice. Goofy's Kitchen was very good for the breakfast premium character dining. I would recommend that you are interested. They characters come right up to your table and take pictures with you. Parking is not included, but I wish it was for hotel guests. It was $20 a day, which is okay I guess. All the staff was very friendly.

My family and I stayed here during our recent trip to Disneyland. We had a two bedroom suite which was very nice as it had a couch and a bar to sit at to eat breakfast in the morning before heading off to the parks. We had 2 full baths and a half bath which was nice since there were 7 of us. The kitchen had a fridge and a Keurig which was very nice. We loved how 2 of the beds had switches you could turn on to hear a Dream is a Wish your heart makes as the fireworks light up on the headboard. It was a very nice touch. We also enjoyed how close it was to the parks. Definitely somewhere we would stay again.

My family was fortunate to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for the first time in the many years. Having stayed on many Disney properties, I must say this is one of the best. Service was first class.  Room was clean and modern and the headboard illumination was magical. Dole whips were available at the coffee shop and Trader Sams Tiki bar is aways a hit. If you have a choice, Disneyland Hotel is a sure winner.

My expectations weren't met. Check--in seemed automated with the staff just going through the motions. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The air conditioner in room 2567 was so noisy that we had to turn it off at night. The view of the fireworks from the room was great. The proximity to the parks was great but I feel that the cost is too high. The pool was great and the food and drinks prices were OK. The occasional Disney character wandering around was fun. All in all, an overpriced hotel with a great location.

Summary Heading: The Happiest Hotel in the World
Summary: Stayed three nights with my husband and 2 year old so we could be near Disneyland and the California Adventure Park.  We had a great time staying in the hotel. Every little detail is amazingly Disney, from the water tap in the shape of Mickey Mouse’s head to the beautifully elegant wood carving on the head board that lights up with a switch and a music. The rooms are spacious and could fit up to 6 people or more with kids as the room had 2 queen beds and 1 double sofa bed.  The restaurants are also very themed and theatrical and kids just loved it. Only setback was that we didn’t know Goffy’s kitchen is actually very busy and that a booking was required so we missed dining there as we didn’t really go until our last night to try. We will come back someday to try it.  There was

My family and I stayed in the Adventure tower and enjoyed being able to go to the park an hour earlier before the public but the hotel was just okay for the price.  The room had nice touches of Disney with the headboard carving and gloved hands on lights but not sure I would stay again.  The hotel seems to be in need of a renovation as the carpets in the halls seem worn and dated.  My daughter enjoyed the pool and water slides but I am into more modern hotels and would likely opt for that style in the future.

The room was really nice.  The cast member at the front desk spent 20 minutes with us explaining how everything works and what do to do and how the map works and explained the Disneyland app too.  He was so helpful.

I really loved staying at the hotel. It was super convenient right after a long visit at the Disneyland park. The monorail is a couple of feet away from the hotel and it takes you straight into Tomorrowland! Extra perk, is that you get a magical morning for every night stay. I will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but no magic here!
Summary: This is a lovely hotel, with a fabulous pool area.  There are lots of Disney touches that remind you where you are (and why you are paying as much as you are) eg. little mickeys in the carpets, on the bedding etc.  A few of the characters can also been seen wandering around the pool area, which is a nice touch.  So, it could be amazing.  But it's not.  The staff are really below average, here in the hotel and across the parks.  Our experience was staff who were downright grumpy, really didn't know what they were talking about, tried to sell us tickets that were far more expensive than necessary and did all they could to make our stay as uncomfortable as they possibly could.  I'm sure guests will continue to visit, just because it's Disney. But be warned the pixie dust hasn't

It had been a long time since I had been to Disneyland, probably about 10 years or so. Growing up I had gone a ton of times and always had fond memories of the park, rides and overall experience. Since it had been so long, I decided to try something I have never done yet always wanted to do...book a room at the Disneyland hotel. So i booked a room for a Saturday evening visit. The plan was for my girlfriend and I to arrive early in order to drop off our bags and get to the park for the "magic hour" in which the park is only open to guests of the hotel. We both figured that our room would NOT be ready when we arrived at 7 AM. We were wrong. NOT ONLY was the room ready...they hotel had a concierge person WAITING for us in the lobby!!! This totally blew us away and got our day

I can now finally say I've stayed at all 3 Disneyland resort hotels! The Disneyland hotel was the last hotel I needed to stay at and it did not disappoint. It was by far the most magical of all 3 hotels.  My family and I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and we were lucky enough to get a room with the view of the fireworks.  The suite had all the right touches of Disney magic, I would stay here again but very interested to stay at one of the fantasy suites in the Disneyland hotel 🤞

When I entered the lobby of this Hotel, I was honoring Jack and Bonita Wrather, the original owners of this magical place. After seeing pictures of famous Disneyland guests enjoying themselves, I know it's place in U.S. History.

Summary Heading: Need New Management: First Horrible Disney Experience from AP Holder
Summary: We have had Annual Passes for approx. 8 years and have stayed at all the Dland Hotel well over 10 times. For the first time EVER, I give a TERRIBLE review and would not recommend staying here to anyone until they change management. We paid well over $500 per night for this bad experience. Please see my pictures. (Stayed 4 days 5/25-5/28) The valet and front desk staff were overwhelmed and not prepared for the number of guests at check in that Friday. Our room, which was a 2 Queen Deluxe in the Frontier Tower 3rd Floor, had a window view of the pool and TOILET PAPER in a tree. Even after complaining. Our TOILET PAPER view stayed there through the ENTIRE 4 days we were there. The shower clothes line was broken (which they finally fixed). The leather bed headboard was BADLY

We've stayed here for my son's 2nd birthday and for family get-aways. All times, I thought the hotel was great... to the point where I probably teared up at some point (especially when you switch on the head board for your 2 year old). The hotel makes it easy for your kids to visit with characters and not have to wait in a line. But the real reason I stay here is to be walking distance to Trader Sam's... that's where the real magic happens. Heh heh. Oh, Goofy's Kitchen is fun to experience at least once if you have young children.

Check in process was quick easy. Our room was in the Adventure Tower on the 8th floor overlooking the pool. The decor is very nice. Loved the Mickey faucet handsand light holders. My last visit in 1996 the water was terrible. That problem has been corrected. Not great, but managable. The bed was very comfortable. Signing for Ice and Vending is incorrect. Vending is only on the odd floors. The walk to the monorail is short. The walk to the park is killer. They need monorail stops at the Califorian and in California Adventure! The Goofy's Kitchen was nice. Package pick up was handy as well. The Grand Califorian is the better hotel, but you will have a nice stay here too.

I decided to stay here since I was running the Disneyland Half Marathon.  Staying here made things really convenient since most of the events for the marathon was on the Disney property.  When I first came in I definitely saw the Disney magic.  The staff were all friendly and we got our rooms pretty fast considering the long line.   And the Extra Magic hours were pretty awesome if you want to avoid the crowds and get an early start at Disneyland.  As an added bonus, if you buy anything from the park, you can have the items sent to your room so you won't have to drag anything while you're enjoying Disneyland.  Pros: Disney Magic!           Extra Magic Hours           Delivery service           Friendly Staff  Cons: Business center says 24 hours, but was kicked out after 11pm

The hotel was good but booking online was a nightmare. This was the only hotel in our US trip that asked for a full advance payment about 30 days before stay. But you can’t make the advance payment through the website, you have to call them and speak to an operator as there is no IVR. We gave them a credit card at the time of check in for covering incidentals, but despite that when we ordered room service they agreed to serve only if we paid in cash or gave credit card details again to the front desk!! Went to the front desk again with the details, but they didn’t communicate to room service and room service wrote down all our card details on the bill with no regard for security!!

we were placed in a room on the fifth floor, with a stunning view of the staff car park.The room itself was fine,clean and tidy. There is only one bar to get a drink,other than Trader Sams(which is loud and noisy and cramped),but that bar closes at 10.00 pm.Poor by any standards,and this is supposed to be the most magical place in the world.

Unfortunately, we had the worst experience. Check in was a nightmare, We had to move rooms with no where to go in between. They gave away our reserved cabana. Couldn't even get a cork screw brought up to the room. For $1400/$900 a night, you can certainly get a much nicer room and better customer service almost anywhere. Don't waste your money.

Summary Heading: Fantastic - for young and the “young at heart”
Summary: A family trip to teh USA - and where else could you go but stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It was a fantastic experience. The atmosphere and facilities made it feel like we were at Disneyland itself 24/7. The kids thoroughly enjoyed the themed restaurants - and we would recommend this to anyone. For me - it was better than the Fountain of Youth !!

The Disneyland Hotel is a great place to stay for a Disney trip- worth the extra in my opinion!  I felt the pixie dust from the moment I arrived.  Jackie made my check in experience truly magical- connecting in a friendly way that I love so much about Disney customer service.  I really loved the little perks of booking a package through Disney too- just great!  Thanks for a magical birthday celebration!!

Summary Heading: The Headboard Alone is Worth the Price! I promise!
Summary: Once the Disneyland Hotel upgraded its rooms, it has been by far my favorite hotel! Not just for the proximity when I visit Disneyland, but in general. I love the staff so greatly, and always feel magic when I walk around. You'll sleep like a baby, and dream like a princess with the magnificent light up castle headboard. I cannot rave about this headboard enough - you just have to experience! Have a magical day :)

We stayed here in April 2018 for 5 nights (2 adults, 1 toddler) in a Downtown Disney Premium view room in the Adventure Tower on the 7th floor. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon to a long queue, but there were a lot of staff checking people in so it moved quite quickly. Some of the staff seemed super happy and friendly but the one that checked us in was just going through the motions. I asked about pins for our first visit and she mumbled they were out of them. We had our keys and were on our way. It was exciting to walk into our very first Disney property, and our 4 year old was enchanted by the light up headboard. I was too, and then eyes go down to the vinyl peeling off the bed heads, lamps crooked and not working, wall paper peeling. Throughout our stay we discovered bulbs

Summary Heading: Nice but underwhelming for a Disney hotel
Summary: I stayed here in May 2018 to attend a business conference. For purposes of a conference, the hotel is nice. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Lots of nearby dining options within easy walking distance. Pretty hotel grounds. There’s nothing special however about the convention center space. And, if I was traveling on a vacation with my family, this property would have disappointed me. It does not have all of the bells and whistle‘s and wow factor that a Disney hotel in Florida would have.

It seems as though the Disneyland Hotel has been around for forever.... but the hotel has been well maintained and renovated over the years, so it is hiding its age well. The room decor has been updated over the years and has a fun feeling to it.  The staff is always very friendly, accommodating and helpful...  Our room had a great view of the fireworks in the evening...  A great place to make memories...

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at this magical hotel!
Summary: This was our first visit to Disneyland resort and we had the best time! Our stay at the Disneyland hotel was truly wonderful! All the staff were amazingly friendly and accommodating from start to finish! I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to experience the magic of Disneyland! If you are a Disney buff then this is the hotel for you!

Had not stayed at the Disneyland hotel since about 1998 or so. Was thrilled to experience it again. Top notch service and amenities. Next to Downtown Disney and everything else. Can be quite expensive, but as they say, you get what you pay for. Outstanding experience.

Summary Heading: Great pool, and proximity to the park
Summary: I'm glad we stayed here. Disney is exhausting, its nice to have a place close by to rest up. The pool is awesome, and close by is Trader Sams where you can get a drink by the pool. Its no designer boutique hotel, but works great for kids, with bright colors and lots of food options close by. Super clean.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel-friendly staff-very easy to walk to parks
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights-very easy to walk to parks.  Got room facing park presumably to be able to watch fireworks from room.  One problem-tress growing in front of window completely block view.  Pool is very nice-room is very nice-nicely stocked with towels and coffee.  Room is a decent size-comfortable beds and nice bathroom.  We could hear quite a bit of noise from the room that we shared a door with though.  Check-in very friendly although quite slow.  Middle of day very few staff actually serving line.

What a fantastic place to stay and embrace the Disney magic. We loved everything about the hotel - the history, restaurants, the room decor (light up, musical headboards) and the beds were possibly the comfiest we’ve ever slept in! Highly recommend to all Disney fans!!

Second time staying here and the place excelled! The place was clean, staff were helpful and as a Disney property it didn’t disappoint!  It’s close to both Disneyland and California adventure park! The pool was superb and downtown Disney is right at the doorstep!  Will be back! Thank you again.

I wrote This as I stood in line in the lobby waiting for my room key after having checked in. There is absolutely no one working decide to hotel clerk’s. The lobby is full, no one is working, and having checked online and run my credit card I am stuck waiting for 20 minutes for a key. This is the most inefficient hotel on earth. Do not stay here.  Grand Californian is worth the extra spend. This hotel is also totally dated, the pool is small, and the food questionable at best.

This was our third year in a row to go to Disneyland but the first time we stayed on property instead of a good neighbor hotel. Yes it is more expensive but it is worth it. The pool area is amazing. The rooms are nice with a lot of Disney touched including a headboard of the castle that lights up and plays a lullabye. The tiki bar was alot of fun and the food at Tangaroa terrace was affordable and yummy. We did not try Goofy's Kitchen. The service was wonderful. I will definitely stay here when I return.

It's so nice to stay at the hotel and enter the park one hour before it opens.  Staying at the hotel is getting more and more expensive, but so we don't splurge often. But we had a great time. Goofy's kitchen, early entrance to the park, and beautiful hotel/resort. It doesn't get much better than that.

Summary Heading: Great for those Disney touches, but you pay for it.
Summary: We have always wanted to stay on Disney property, but couldn't really afford it. This time, there were some really good deals which we took advantage of and spent 3 nights here (before moving to another hotel for an additional 6 nights). The Disney touches are amazing, from the lighted up headboard to the hidden Mickeys everywhere (although they aren't really hidden). This hotel has great facilities from Tangaroa Terrace, Trader Sams and Goofy's Kitchen. Plus it has an express entry into the Downtown Disney District (definitely much quicker going into that area from the Disney hotel, than from the South Harbor Boulevard entrance). The other nice touch about staying here, is the Magic Morning entrance to the parks (where you get to enter the park an hour before it opens to the

First off, I believe this to be the best of the three "on-site" properties having stayed at both the Paradise Pier and Grand Californian with my wife and daughters.  This was actually our second time at the Disneyland Hotel and it did not disappoint.  Check-in was easy, the staff was all very pleasant, and the rooms are clean and well enough appointed that you can actually relax and get your mind right after a long day at the parks with small children.  The beds were incredibly comfortable this visit so I'm wondering if they replaced the mattresses.  Either way, we enjoyed great sleep both nights.  The first time we took our kids do D-Land we stayed at Paradise Pier (not happening again), the second time we thought we were going "first-class" by staying at the Grand Californian

The hotel looks great, love the magical headboards, with great staff, service, selections of restaurants and quick bites. Close to the parks with early access and character breakfasts as well. Enjoyed my stay very much.

First of all, the check in was like a Disneyland Park ride.  Easily 15-20 minute wait in line.  Second, the fitness center is outside of the main hotel site. I think. Third, the front desk couldn’t give basic information like where the conference was being held. Fourth, restaurants are plenty but expensive and not that great of food.  I stayed in the fantasy tower and thought the food options were super expensive.  Very frustrating. My room was on the 4th floor 2227.  The view is of the parking and loading lot.  The room smelled musky damp.  The beds are hard as a rock.  No, seriously some of the most uncomfortable hotel beds for side sleepers.  However, the bathroom amenities are excellent.  There is a mini fridge.  And a lullaby and lit up headboard at a flick of a switch.

Okay, this hotel was beautiful and so convenient to downtown Disney- but you already knew that. The room was whimsical and the beds were very comfy, however, one of our party slept on the daybed and she did not sleep well at all because it was so uncomfortable. So I deducted one star for that because at this price point all the beds should be fantastic!  The fireworks headboards were nice though :)

Summary Heading: Caper 2018- Paul Mitchell Schools Student Conference for Future Great Success
Summary: It’s was amazing, Disney created a fairytale environment for all students,speakers and school instructors for this annual event held by Paul Mitchell Schools for Cosmetology, encourage, inspiration and creativity at its best, the park and hotel hostessed a wonderful event

Yes the hotel will cost you a bit more money than staying off property but if you can make it work, do it. Disney runs the hotel much like Disneyland. Everyone is nice, helpful and accommodating as possible.  The rooms were nice enough with very comfortable bedding and pretty good on the sound. The pools were fun for everyone and the lounge very comfortable. Being able to access the park an hour early allowed is to get a few extra runs on our favorite rides. Not having to rent a car was a plus and having amazon deliver food and water to our rooms for a $5 fee was a bonus along with with the prime now service we had an amazing Mexican meal from Mia Casa delivered to the pool for $5 also. Worth the money in my opinion.

Summary Heading: Still a great place to stay
Summary: Overall a great place to stay.  Walking distance away from Downtown Disney (maybe 5 minutes). You can get to the park entrance in 10 minutes. Stay here and you can get into the park earlier.  We arrived at 8 am and preregistered to our rooms so we could get into the park one hour before the regular opening. Meals seem overpriced except if you hit the coffee shop.  Coffee drinks were reasonably priced. Pastries were top notch and cheaper than if you went to your favorite national chain coffee shop with a name starting with St or Pe.

This was the last stop on a world disney tour covering all the asia parks and hotels and what a disappointment! The line to checkin was almost out the front door as the check in desk must have had a dozen stations and only 4 people working. I thought I was at the Post Office at lunch time! After enough people complained they filled the stations. The room wasn’t ready so they texted me several hours later with a room number but no indication which of the several buildings it was in. When we ask a cast member, we get sent to a building and although the room number says 5227, there’s no such number on the fifth floor, so we hunt down another cast member who says “Oh, they add the first two numbers to get the floor number.” Huh??? When we find the room, the head board looks like

Summary Heading: Magical memories at the Disneyland Hotel, one of the Greatest hotels to stay in, especially for a first time visit!
Summary: Want to have a great Disney experience then stay at the Disneyland hotel. I love the  architect because it’s full of hidden Mickeys from the taps, the carpet and even the bedhead. The castmembers are friendly and helpful. The rooms luxurious and very comfortable beds. 2 large beds in our room. Just a few yards from the park entrance so jump out of bed and straight into the park and it also allows you to have magical hours at the park entering one hour earlier and sometimes staying one hour later.  Not the cheapest place to stay but worth the price if you are sharing the costs.  Thanks Disneyland!

We enjoy staying here. It is an easy walk to the park and there is plenty to do. In fact we just ubered from the airport, no need for a car. We enjoyed Trader Sam's before our room was ready. I also liked the dole whip from the coffee bar. Our room had a view of the fireworks, so we turned on the fireworks music station on the tv and just kicked back on the bed and enjoyed

This is a hotel for a families first visit to the Disneyland Resort. It’s a must. The hotel staff make you feel like you are the only guest to serve. They go above and beyond.
