Yes it’s crazy expensive to stay, but you get the Disney experience that you will not find at any of the “neighbors hotels”.  The pool is a magical place for the whole family. Slides for little and bigger kids. Lots of room to roam in the pool area. Goof’s kitchen for breakfast was wonderful, we actually got to see some characters that come to your table. Awesome! We didn’t have to wait in line to take a picture with them, that was great. Also expensive, but you get your money’s worth with the character experience and the food was really good.

Today, April 21st, we decided to hang out at the pool and met the best lifeguard Garret. He was just so helpful and sweet it made it all so worth it. He answered all our questions and made our stay so magical! This is what it’s all about. Thank you Garrett & Kayla & Gabby for making our trip Magical 😊

On the second day of our staycation we went to the pool! It was so amazing there is a lifeguard named  Garrett, he made our vacation so amazing. I can’t say enough! He just went above and beyond! It just maid our awesome vacation over the top. I can’t say enough good things about him!! He was kind and he really listened to all of our questions! Really  Just an amazing cast member! He deserves all of the praise! Thank you thank you thank you!!!

This was a “bucket list” stay for me.  As a kid I always wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  It was my ideal childhood honeymoon destination.     Unfortunately, it was the worst night sleep I have had in years.  The bed was so squeaky!   Every time my husband would move, even slightly, it would wake me up.     All I could think each time I woke up was, “I can’t believe this is what Disney has to offer for this price.”   I mentioned the loud bed to a cast member a checkout.  She didn’t offer any concessions or apology.  But said she would have it fixed.  Hopefully they fix it for the next guest to stay in that room.   Other then the squeaky bed, the bed was  also very uncomfortable. You would think for the price they charge they could offer a comfortable bed, at minimum a

Paid for club level.  Lounge was small and attendant was unfriendly.  Very small room but was clean. Very outdated hotel with overly expensive prices.  No magic here!  For the price and the extra resort tax one would expect better!

Summary Heading: Try to time your check in
Summary: This a great place, excellent guest experience. The rooms are filled with wonderful touches that enhance the overall experience. Six adults and six children, ages 2 to 7, had a fun time. It is a little surprising how long the check in line is, and how slow it moves, particularly when there a convention being held here — management could have anticipate the onslaught of newly arriving guests and been better prepared.

We have stayed at Disney Land Orlando and Paris this was very dated and tried !!  the best thing is the location and access to magic hours in the park.  We booked the Goofy dinning and to honest it was a waste of money the food was horrible and cold and the floor was so dirty my feet where sticking to it.  The pool area was great lots of places sit and lots of lifeguards.  We stayed in the club level rooms this was good as they allowed everyone to take food and drink out of the lounge although the choices were limited it was the same food everyday.  we dont think i would stay here again, we didnt feel the magic !!

Great experience for my family. Location was my reason for my five star rating. The only closer hotel was the Grand Californian Hotel and Spa which was half the distance to the entrance 940 feet (1/5 of a mile) to Disneyland and California Adventure. The Disneyland Hotel is still a long walk through Downtown Disney at 2,610 feet (half a mile) to the entrance of Disneyland. We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier two years before this stay which was 2,530 feet (half a mile) through the Grand Californian Hotel as a short cut. I would compare Paradise Pier to the Disneyland Hotel as equal for accommodations with Disneyland Hotel being a better experience slightly.  Since our son was under three, he had free entrance into the hotel and Disneyland. Before we checked in, we ate lunch at

The Disneyland Hotel was definitely a treat, but quite pricey for what you get. This place is definitely convenient, being only a few steps from downtown Disney, and a few minute walk to the parks. There were also quite a few magical touches throughout the hotel, such as Mickey hands holding the lamps in the bathrooms, and Disney sayings on the pillows, as well as a light switch that plays music and lights up the fireworks in the headboards.   But, at $700+ per night, I felt like the rooms were quite small, and not quite worth the price. I can say that the beds and pillows were quite nice though.

Stayed 5 nights.  Had 2 bedroom suite in Frontier tower.  Rooms were very nice and spacious, some wear and tear.  Most disappointing thing was there was no microwave in our small kitchen to heat up children food leftovers from PRICEY restaurants on site and off.  Ended up throwing out at least $100 in food that we couldn't reheat.  Check-in was kinda slow but I think we showed up at prime check-in.  Very nice cast members, very helpful.  Close to Downtown Disney and parks.  Enjoyed early morning entry ~ awesome for getting those long-line rides accomplished!  Character Breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen was big hit and fun.  Lots of food selections.  Another disappointment was did not use pool area as the water was not heated and was cold.  Very pricey and, while had good experience,

This trip was our third visit to the Disneyland Hotel in the past year. The location simply can not be beat and our daughter is over the moon when she sees the characters wondering around the lobby and pool area. "Magical" touches are sprinkled all throughout the property, from the tea cup seats in the lobby to the giant Disneyland map in the entry way to the firework headboards in the rooms. Nothing beats a Disney property!   If this is your first time booking at the Disneyland Hotel, please be aware you are only able to book a "level" of room. You aren't able to book or prearrange a King vs Double Queen Room. This has proven problematic for us on all 3 of our stays. This stay in particular, we had booked a Premium View and upon check in, they only had a Double Queen and we had

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel. Short Distance to Downtown Disneyland
Summary: Room is quite small and outdated for the offered rate. Bed was surprisingly comfortable. Took the pool view at Adventure Tower which was good. There are 2 Disney stores at the hotel. Goofy's Kitchen is worth the price, as you will see some of the Disney Characters (Goofy, Minnie, Pluto, Chip & Dale), book way in advance as it is always crowded.   5 minutes walk to Downtown Disney which is a big plus.   Had a mixed up with the receptionist during checkout but it was quickly sorted out by the management which really appreciated.

I stay at the Disneyland Hotel at least once a year, and I will be going again this year. The hotel is an absolutely magical experience, from the moment you walk into the lobby. The lobby is Disney themed from every aspect, and all of the employees are super friendly. There are three different towers, each themed after one of the lands in Disneyland. I have heard a lot of people complain about the Frontier Tower because of "how far away it is from Downtown Disney". In reality, it's not far away at all, but it is much quieter and peaceful than the other two towers. It is my choice tower, and I ask for it every time. And then there's the pool...which happens to be the most amazing pool EVER. Here's a tip: rent a cabana; waiters will serve you and the service is much better than

I had stayed here many years ago before it was updated. We usually stay at Paradise Pier but now you can’t cut through the Grand Californian to get to the parks we thought we would try this hotel again.  We checked in early and our room was ready. In addition my request for a room with a pull out bed was met (this has never been met at the Grand Californian) The room was spacious and with two teenagers, we really appreciated a bathroom with 2 sinks.  We loved the “twinkling headboard” and all the Disney touches.  The pool area is great.  My only issue was trying to get into the bar to meet a friend i hadn’t seen for several years, a cast member was limiting who could go in the bar and said only one of us could go in as people weren’t allowed to stand at the bar. This seemed

I love the Disneyland Hotel. They have great little magical features such as Mickey Mouse hands holding the light fixtures and headboards that have fireworks that light up and twinkle. The Bell Services does a great job and the theming of the monorail pool is adorable.

We stayed at Disneyland Hotel for my daughters 16th Birthday. We were in the Adventure Tower which was recently remodeled, boy was it gorgeous! Beautiful decor, plush beds, full sized bathroom(great for 3 teenage girls!!) and a view of Downtown Disney. We weren’t able to use the Disneyland Hotel pool, due to a toddler bathroom accident. So they were super accommodating and let us use the fabulous pool at the Grand Californian. Both pools were amazing! Early entry into the park helped make the girls day a success. Staff was friendly, and helpful. Planning my next stay there as we speak!!!!

Our family stayed in Club Level Premier Theme Park view room at Disneyland Hotel. Excellent View of Disneyland Fireworks at night. Was a little loud being directly over Downtown Disney though but nothing that would prevent us from staying there again

What an absolutely amazing stay!!! My family and I thoroughly enjoyed everything from our rooms to Goofys Kitchen, and ofcourse the two oversized pools with slides. My grand-daughter who is only three came for a visit for a few days and had such a great time and did not want the day or night to end because she was having so much fun. The breakfast buffet at Goofys Kitchen had made to order omelettes with everything and anything you could imagine for breakfast and a few items for lunch too! We loved how all the characters came to visit us while we ate our breakfast was just the topper! Only Disney can do a stay where we felt as though we were kids again and enjoyed every minute! Thank you for the experience and we will see you again in the near future.

I stayed at this hotel as a child for every family trip to Disneyland and now stay here every time we take my children to Disneyland. It's a great base for trips to the parks. Rooms are spacious and have the magic Disney touches, the walk to the parks is short enough to come back to the room or pool midday when the children can no longer handle the crowds, and food choices are good for children. We used the pools more on this trip and found the life guards to be very attentive, much more than any other resort we have ever been to. Security presence has increased dramatically at the entrance to Downtown Disney since our last trip 4 years ago but we found this reassuring, not unsettling.

Staff was helpful and courteous.  Room was clean and beds were comfortable.  Bathroom was a little small.  Loved the location for visiting the parks.  Great view of the awesome pool area.  Great food options.

Prior to our arrival we had booked and paid for in full a two bedroom suite and our park hooper passes. We arrived at  the Disneyland hotel 11:00 AM knowing that check in was not until 3:00 PM.  I told the gentleman at the front desk that I knew we could not check into our room but asked if we could have our Hooper passes. He said “no, your reservation does not allow me to give them to you until you get your room”.  I asked what were the six of us to do for 4 hours and reminded him that we had PAID for the passes.  With no positive result  I was able to find a manager who was able to get us our passes.  All was good again until we got into our room.  OMG, the furniture was as old as Walt Disney himself. The beds were uncomfortable and creaked.  The couch and chairs were old and

My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and loved the Disneyland Hotel.  The bellmen were friendly and quick to drop off and pick up our luggage.  Our room was very large and very nicely, classically decorated.  The food tasted great at the quick service restaurant.  The pool area is large and we enjoyed using the hot tub.  The Disneyland Hotel is conveniently located at the entrance to the Downtown Disney District, so it is SO easy to walk there and to the Disneyland and California Adventure parks.  Plus we used the Extra Magic Hour to get into the parks early, which was a major benefit.  Even though you know the hotel has to be busy and full of people at all times, it really didn't feel that way thanks to the layout of the property.  It was relaxing and enjoyable to stay at the

We almost didn't stay here since there were mixed reviews and many other resorts are just as close to the Disney Parks. However, we found a great rate and decided to try on-property. Totally worth it! The magic hour alone was worth it! Our family arrived at 7 a.m. each morning and was able to squeeze in many popular attractions before the crowds hit. So wonderful to have the immersion experience of Disney by walking through Downtown Disney each day and not having to see the "real world!" The details of each room was great for Disney fans. Hidden mickeys at the pool (The pool alone is worth staying here), mickey-shaped faucets in the bathroom, and the light-up headboard singing "When You wish upon a star." We loved our stay and would go back here in a heartbeat!

This was our 4th trip to Disneyland, and we have stayed in the Grand and the Disneyland Hotel.   While the Grand is very nice, the cost is a bit hard to take. The Disneyland Hotel is excellent value. We find the proximity to the monorail is well worth the money. As is the Magic Morning access.   We stayed on the 8th floor this trip, Standard Room and we were surprised by how well we could see the fireworks from the room.   Spend the extra and stay on site. Well worth it.

After reading some reviews, I was a little hesitant about booking accomodation here, however, was pleasantly surprised. Our check in was excellent, we were served straight away and the staff member was cheerful and helpful. As we had travelled from NZ for my partners 40th birthday, the staff member happily made a Disney badge which was a nice touch! We stayed in Adventure Tower and it was nice. We had a deluxe room with a view of Downtown Disney and we could see some of the park. The room was spacious with a comfortable king bed and it was nice having a separate toilet from the bathroom. The bathroom amenities were branded Disney. The shower was over the bath but that was fine. We were located away from the main passage way (had 2 doors to get to our room) so was quiet. We went

Loved our suite (free upgrade--hotel was crowded with convention). Pool excellent and loved the onsite Tiki Bar and their food. Cannot wait to go back.  Very short walk to monorail that took us right to the submarine ride line.

We had such a blast!  A very diverse buffet with the Mickey waffles!  The characters parade around the dining room and are wonderful with taking pictures.  I would definitely go again!  They made my birthday breakfast special!

Came from Australia for our honeymoon and loved it. Spent 5 nights at Disneyland Hotel and 4 days in the parks - loved every second. I would suggest wearing runners not hiking shoes as i did and did not last. Bit disappointed in the staff - the bell service made us feel like checking our bags was a hassle and would not smile and the security at the check point near the hotel for down town disney were a bit rude and lazy. But not the hotels fault. Pools were great even in the cooler weather nice and warm. I WILL BE BACK AGAIN!!

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights.  Upon arrival, the front desk were very helpful and courteous.  We checked in around 10am, and since our room was not ready, we checked our bags in with the Bell desk.  We were given our tickets and vouchers, and everything was explained to us, and all of our questions answered, since we had not been to Disneyland in over 20 years.  We received a text that our room was ready by 1pm, which was great! Our luggage was delivered promptly after we called the bell desk.  We even saw Goofy in the lobby, and he spent quite a bit of time playing with our grandchildren and taking pictures with them.  It was such a nice way to start our vacation.    We stayed in the Frontier Tower on the 8th floor, and we had a premium pool view.  The room

This was our second time at the Disneyland Hotel and while we still like it, we'll probably give another hotel a try next time.   The front desk had some trouble finding a room that was ready at 3pm (check-in time) and after a wait we ended up on the 2nd floor of the fantasy tower, with a view of the ugly roof over the hotel entrance. Our room felt dark and there was a large wet spot in the carpet that took 2 days to dry. Other than the wet floor, our room was clean and well maintained.   The Fantasy Tower is great in the winter, because you're close to restaurants and can get to stores without going outside. The two stores had a wide range of practical and fun stuff and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We bought a bottle of surprisingly good wine, snacks, and

I have stayed at this hotel twice, the first time it was quiet, and we had a comfortable room overlooking downtown Disney, it was a very long walk but nice and quiet. The second visit we got nearly the same room but the music from downtown Disney was so loud we could hear it in the shower with the water running and tv on. It was terrible, management would not listen or help we finally got rooms at Motel 6 which was a huge step up. For the price I expect better service than Motel 6, considering the $400 a night price difference I was deeply disappointed, this hotel did not treat us as guests or paying customers. I will never stay here again or at any Disneyland property I want to have fun and be treated fairly and kindly as we all should.

My family and I attended a wedding held at the Disneyland Hotel during mid-March 2018. The experience was terrible.  The wedding was to be held outside at the Rose Court Garden.   Five minutes before the start of the wedding we stepped out of our Lyft ride near the front desk.  It was raining hard.  The Disneyland staff knew about the wedding and directed us to walk to the Rose Court Garden.  After a five minute walk in the rain with suits and dresses and no umbrella we arrived at the venue.  There was no one there and no signage.  As we were perplexed we walked in the rain back to the front desk.  The clerk there said that the wedding was probably moved.  She provided us with complex directions (no escort?).  Our clothes were soaked through.  My family found the wedding

It was a surprise for my family. We have been many times to Disneyland but never stayed on site. We went during Christmas/New years. We were in the frontier tower. Nice quiet. It was so nice to just walk back to the hotel when ever we wanted or go downtown. It made the trip more relaxing. Will be staying ere again for sure!! My daughter was really happy and the pool is great they have life vest and life guards for the kids. Trader Sams is nearby.

Great stay in the Adventure Tower at the Disneyland Hotel with our adult daughter. Room was very spacious and mousekeeping did an excellent job.  We experienced top notch service from check in to check out. All the staff we interacted with at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. In short, it was the magical stay we had hoped to experience.

Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable but my little boy didnt find the folding sofa bed very comfortable. The rooms are decent size and the themed rooms are great. The kids love the light up headboard. The rest of the hotel grounds were clean and well kept.   The walk to the main entrance is not bad at all but walking to the monorail station is super close!  Overall it was a great place to stay.

We have stayed at this property a number of times and always love it. The pool is so great and our kids just love the water slides. Its also a very nice perk that they have food and drink service at the pool. The rooms are very clean and a good size. We love all the Disney details in the rooms and the headboards that light up and play music are beautiful. The staff is friendly and always smiling. My daughter got sick with a fever on our trip and was not able to go to the park for a couple of days. My parents ordered breakfast one morning while my daughter was still sick, the hotel staff knowing she was sick sent up a bowl of chicken soup for her as well. It was just so nice and thoughtful of them. Its the little things that make the room cost worth it.

Disneyland Hotel is a Must! This was my family's second trip to Disney Land.  The first time we stayed across the street at the Courtyard Theme Park entrance.  We had a nice time and loved our rooms and the pool-so much so I had a hard time splurging on the Disney Hotel.  After reading some of the reviews I was worried that the rooms would be small and dated and that the location wouldn't make a difference.  Boy was I wrong.    This was by far our best trip to Disney.  It wasn't so much the staff, the decor, the rooms or even the pool but once you put everything together it was magical.   Even my husband, who is doesn't like to splurge said he didn't want to leave.  We loved the ease of taking the monorail to and from the park, being able to come back and use the pools (even in

The staff here are excellent, very helpful, they really seem to care about your experience. The walk to the parks wasn’t too far, just through the shops and restaurants. You are security checked as you leave the hotel, which works really well, we never had to queue and everyone goes through a metal detector. Our room was clean and comfortable and the headboard lights up with a firework display, nice little touch. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, recently updated, with great meeting facilities, attentive staff and comfortable rooms
Summary: I attended a professional society meeting here and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the meeting facilities and the professionalism of the meeting staff.  This is not just a playtime resort. My room was very comfortable.  The catered meals were just so-so.  The fitness center is woefully inadequate for the size of the resort and not very well maintained.  As you would expect, lots of kids running around.  Front desk staff are very cordial but slow.

Summary Heading: Customer Service was above and beyond
Summary: I decided to book a last minute stay for one night at the Disneyland Hotel. I booked the the room through Orbitz, however when we attempted to check in, there was no record of my booking. The clerk at the front desk spent almost two hours trying to figure out what had happened. Turns out orbitz never actually made a booking for me even though they had already charged my credit card for the stay. The employee at the Disneyland Hotel went above and beyond to help us find a room, obtain a refund for the non-booking,  and make sure that our trip was not ruined because of the orbitz  mistake. My friend and I were extremely appreciative of how the front desk staff handled the situation, and made us feel at ease considering that this error was something that was not their fault.  I

I did not stay at the Disneyland hotel, but attended a conference at the conference facilities.  Overall, this was a great facility.  The exhibit hall was large, and the meeting rooms more than held the large crowds.  The main banquet room was also inviting, and worked out great.  I was impressed with the food throughout this event.

Stayed at Paradise Pier, the Grand Californian, and finally the elusive Disneyland Hotel in the adventure tower. Loved the room, the pool, the closeness of the steakhouse for breakfast and dinner and of course Trader Sam's. Only complaint is the very small tub and shower forcing you to touch the shower curtain and wall! (Shudder.) In retrospect it makes me appreciate the Californian more, but when I stayed there the pool was closed and we had to schlepp to the pool here and it was much more expensive.

It's hard to say I don't love everything about this hotel but I feel like you get a lot more bang for your buck at others in the area. The hotel is beautiful, Trader Sams is a huge plus. With the rates you are paying the very least they coudl do is include parking! I love you Disney but help a girl out!

Since I was a little kid, I have always dreamed of staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  I can honestly say, this met my expectations and I would stay here again.  From the start, you are greeted by the parking attendant and either directed to self-parking or valet.  We chose self-parking which was a closely located lot in front of the hotel.  The front desk person Andrew was very attentive and informative and let me know the lay of the land.  We were placed in the Adventure Tower and it seemed clean and updated.  The room was quite large and overlooked the pool.  I suppose if I had thought about it I might have asked for a view of Downtown Disney and the park since I heard you can see the fireworks at night.  At first I was a tad annoyed at how slow the two elevators were each day

Summary Heading: Very good hotel with great access to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel met our needs and was comfortable. It wasn't the best hotel I have ever stayed at and definitely not the worse. The location to the park is the best perk along with the Magic Morning extra hour. Not only do you get in the parks early and a chance to get on a few extra attractions you avoid what can easily be up to an hour wait in line to get into the park.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money ... Just gross!
Summary: I've stayed in all three Disney hotels in Anaheim many times over but this hotel was always our favorite because of its larger rooms, the pool with slides, and closer proximity to the parks. The hotel is old and was renovated a few years back but seriously it needs a real upgrade given the $400+/per night price tag. The quality and service of the hotel has gone down the drain over the years. We arrived late afternoon, I was with three kids, they made us unload infront of the hotel in the middle lane then they left me with several suitcases in my hands in middle of the street without a cart or help to move them to the hotel. I had to go inside and ask for bellboy to bring a cart and take our luggage for hold.  Check in took forever but they have have enough distractions for kids

I always to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and see the Disney magic.  I booked a one night stay.  I had the most perfect room with a great view of the pools.  The hotel was simply amazing and the decor was truly magical.

Summary Heading: OK - Special Place to stay Twice!
Summary: I honestly didn't think I would stay here again given the price, but the $311 mid week off season rate was too good to pass up.  A 4 night stay was the perfect amount of time. We booked a deluxe room - higher up in the tower, slightly larger with a pool view. Our first  "deluxe" room in the Adventure Tower was anything but. Next to the elevator, shabby and very disappointing. I called the front desk straight away and they immediately assigned us a room in the Fantasy Tower - well appointed, clean, large, much more of what we were expecting. Tip - don't settle! Rooms are expensive and they value customer service so let them serve you. Note: the pool opens at 10am and closes at 8pm so its a little hard to use when you get to the park early and have a long day. Also, make use

We had stayed at the grand California adventure hotel. It’s newer. The Disney hotel property had a dance event when we visited. Lots of dancers and we watched one night of performances.   We were upgraded to a one bedroom villa before we got to the property from a rack rate of 579$ so this was a good value.   The pool slides at Disney hotel are more elaborate then the grand California. The frontier building seems to be the only one with balconies.   Add the first two numbers of your room to find your level. 57XX is 12th floor.  68xx is 14th floor. Wish the front desk had told us the level and the building. It was a struggle to find the room. Even with multiple people on the property helping us. Originally we were directed to 11th floor.   But once we found our room the size and

Summary Heading: Stayed here for event hosted on property
Summary: Clean. Great room and housekeeping service. Comfy beds with nice linens. Quiet and not disrupted by hallway noise.  Public restrooms don’t appear to have been updated like the guest rooms. Gorgeous pool and entrance to Downtown Disney was convenient.

The Disneyland Hotel is an icon, rich with Disney Magic. I love staying here when I visit Disneyland. The cast members are so friendly and helpful. Club level service is amazing and the view from the concierge lounge “E” ticket will take your breath away.  The accommodations are luxury at its finest.  Be sure to check out the pool and by the way, you can get a Dole Whip on property!!!

For the exorbitant cost, I was expecting more magic. The room was nice but plain, clean but worn. The magic hour is a bonus to staying on property... and with little kids, that early hour was our very best time of day. However, I would definitely not stay here again, the cost is simply not worth it.

We had always wanted to do Disneyland with the whole complete deal. Stay at the hotel and all. So, we decided to go for it. We had to get a suite because if you want any kind of privacy if there is more than 2 in your group than the suite is your only option.  Suite had mini kitchen and a half bathroom and then a full bathroom in the bedroom with a king size bed. Anyway, other than a couple of Disney touches here and there....not very magical. Oh, the headboard that lights up? Yeah... kinda creepy tinkling like a music box sound. I kept on expecting scary clowns to come out from under the bed. Lots of $$$ for just an average room. Long walk to main entrance. Only other option is to take the monorail into the park but that drops you off in tomorrow land inside Disneyland and you

This is our second Christmas celebrated Disney style. This Hotel is a little more expensive during the holidays but definitely the whole family would enjoy. The dining is great in most restaurants with Disney Characters all around the restaurant. A must for families with small kids even the not so young would truly feel the magic. Hope this helps

I have just arrived at this hotel with my husband and two children and brother and my first reaction was of heart sinking disappointment. This place is utilitarian and run down. I’ve seen nicer holiday inns and if this weren’t Disneyland it wouldn’t scrape a 4 star rating. We had booked a three room suite. After a long walk to our ‘tower’ we found that 2 out of three key cards didn’t work we waited 40 minutes to rectify this. At that point (10pm) we called for room service - the only option as the restaurants are closed. We were told the wait was an hour but that we could get snacks at the tiki bar. We walked down there to find a line of people waiting to get in to the ‘full’ bar. We came back to our rooms via a vending machine on our floor. Broken. At this point my daughter was

My husband has always dreamed of staying at the Disneyland Hotel so we splurged for his 50th birthday year and finally did it. Well, we are spoiled for any future visits, that's all I can say. This hotel was perfect! Everything was amazing and beyond even our pretty high expectations. The fireworks on the headboard and the subtle Mickey touches were excellently done. Room was very spacious, as was the bathroom. The pools and hot tubs were excellent - it was so nice to actually enjoy them, as opposed to just peeking enviously over the fence! The Disneyland memorabilia in the lobbies of the towers were a wonderful touch, especially for my husband who loves Disneyland history. We loved the perks of early entry into the parks and sending our shopping back to be picked up at the

We were excited for our stay and weren't disappointed. The proximity to Disneyland and the atmosphere was perfect.  We took advantage of the magic morning early access for Disneyland hotel guests, and started our mornings early, returning to the hotel for a midday rest before returning at night. Great service and choices.  Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great, first choice for Disney Resorts
Summary: The kids loved it and the Disney touches throughout.  It is a quick walk to downtown Disney, and we ended up in downtown Disney every day anyway to get food.  A short walk to a monorail right into the Magic Kingdom.

The Disneyland Hotel is a beautiful amazing hotel with friendly staff. It is also the closest hotel to downtown Disney. Would recommend eating in Disneyland and not in the Disneyland hotel unless with kids at goofy kitchen

My husband and I had a quick weekend trip to Anaheim to see a concert at the House of Blues and decided to stay here again.  We last stayed here two years ago. Before that time, I hadn't stayed there since I was little.  I really enjoy this hotel, and I think it might be my favorite of the three Disney hotels in Anaheim.  It has nicely appointed rooms, great on-site amenities and I found the customer service to be just as great as last time.  The pool area is a lot of fun (since is was 86 degrees in Anaheim in January, I was more than happy to try it out).  My absolute favorite thing about this hotel is the vintage Disney feel.  I like all of the historical displays and the teacup tables in the lobby.  I also like walking the grounds and looking at the topiary, and of course I

I’m a huge fan of Disney and the great experiences they are able to provide, so much so I pay premium price for any extra “magic.” The Disneyland Hotel is usually one of my favorites because it’s classic Disney. It makes the whole Disneyland experience complete for me.   We recently stayed 3 nights at club level while visiting the parks to celebrate my son’s birthday. At check-in we waited for our greeter Darrell who wasn’t super friendly, but not exactly rude. Not exactly what I would consider a Disney-level employee. Meh.  The concierge employees in the lounge were always friendly and open to questions and accommodations. The trick was to try to get them when they had a free moment as the lounge was busy most during most of our visits.   Food is always great in the lounge!

Summary Heading: Incredibly disappointed....will not stay here again
Summary: After much deliberation we decided to stay at a Disney hotel for the weekend whilst visiting the park. Excited by the prospect of water slides at the hotel for our children and close proximity to the park we thought this would be our ideal hotel. Unfortunately utterly terrible customer service ruined our stay. The hotel itself is very average - rooms standard and certainly nothing to rave about. However, where we were really let down was service. Almost every answer to every question was “no”. No you can’t have a late check out. No you can’t put the umbrella up at the pool. No you can’t stand there whilst watching your children come down the water slides. It felt like a prison with a million rules that needed to be followed. From the moment of check in when I had to find a bell

I am writing this as I approach 40 minutes in line just to check in.  Seriously? No apologies, no  entertaining kids while waiting in line. Nothing. This place is completely incompetent and so far a horrific Disney experience with a Four Seasons price tag.

We stayed at the hotel to celebrate our kid's birthday . Apart from the Disney name this hotel has nothing to offer.Overly priced for being in neverland.  For anything to everything they charge you extra except for the over chlorinated so called monorail slide( which you can find in your local neighborhood).   Everyone told me about the Disney magical experience, I didn't felt any. Except that they packed all the magic in boxes and put a hefty price tag to it. Starting with balloons priced @ $15.   Everyone in our family including our kid was bored.  We   reserved ahead for character breakfast @ goofy's kitchen. The food was horrible, experience was medicore. Mind you they charge you extra even for latte, above the overly priced buffet and pictures with goofy.  Bottom line:

Loved the 2 King size beds in every room, not something you normally see and just adds that something extra to your stay. Every single staff member was amazing, can;t wait to bring the kids back for a much longer stay!

From the time we walked in until the time we left it was magical.  The entire staff was friendly. We visit often but this time received an upgrade which was much appreciated.  Brandon from Modesto checked us in.  He was amazing. He set the tone for our visit.  I have rarely had a more enjoyable experience with registration. I hope he is recognized for his outstanding customer service.  The room was very clean. Fresh flowers and all.  We enjoyed room service for dinner. The food delivery was prompt and the food hot and delicious.  We had breakfast with the characters. It is expensive and chaotic and wonderful.  Yes the hotel seems expensive but for the convenience and hospitality it is worth every penny.

Over priced and over rated, but probably worth staying once in a life time.  Close to the parks, despite the chore of having to walk the super retail gauntlet of downtown disney.  Lines are long to check in, and unless you purchase the extras of "concierge" services (?) you will wait for everything.

Summary Heading: Dated and Small, But Well Maintained
Summary: When people travel to Disneyland, part of the "magic" is staying at the park in one of the three resort hotels.  Of course, this always includes a premium price.  I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel many times over the decades since it was first built.  On the positive side, this property is always well maintained, the rooms are spotless, and the staff is courteous.  The grounds are attractive, and the pools fun.    The downside is the rooms are small, and lack items like USB charging ports and convenient outlets.  In today's travel market, a family can obtain a more spacious room for about half the cost.  Dining at the hotel is somewhat limited, but guests can walk to the adjacent Downtown Disney for dining, shopping, and entertainment.  This area was built on what used to be

Summary Heading: Check in needs help. Greal pools and slides
Summary: Our stay started off on a bit of a rocky start. When we checked in the staff member did not explain to us how the hotel numbers worked or which tower we were in. I had paid for a room with a pool view and 2 queens beds. We got our card keys and went up to the Fantasy Towers. After wandering around for a while we couldn't find our room. I used a phone in the hallway to call the front desk and asked about our hotel room. I was told our room was in the Adventure Tower. So now we walked all the way over there. The room we received only had one bed, small, and the view of the pool was covered by palm trees. You could barely see the pool. I called the front desk again and explained I had paid for 2 queen beds and an actual view. I was told I had been "upgraded" to this room. I told

Summary Heading: Loved the actual hotel... What happened to the cast members??
Summary: For our 25th wedding anniversary, my wife and I decided to celebrate in Disneyland!  The Good: 1.  The room was large and had a partial view of fireworks every night... Kinda glad it wasn't straight on since they were audible and being from the east coast, we were hitting the sack well before the 12am show (3am EST). 2.  The headboard has this super cool fireworks display with sound, it's a really nice touch. 3.  2 adults and 3 teens comfortably fit and slept in the room. 4.  The pool area was large, fun and not very crowded in the final week of August. 5.  The extra magic hours were fabulous.  The Bad: 1.  Over all, the service definitely did not feel like Disney.  Quite sad actually, as we are HUGE fans. We had two instances:  When we checked in, we mentioned our anniversary

Awesome hotel! Clean and close to monorail I loved the Disney feeling after leaving the park and entering the hotel it continued  Definitely would stay here again! So close to downtown Disney too which is great because who want to carry stuff miles if you buy stuff!

This was my first stay at the Disneyland Hotel since 1979 when the third Bonita Tower opened.  There have been many changes to the Disneyland Hotel over the years so I really wanted to stay there again.  I had stayed at the Grand California the year before and enjoyed it!  I was going to the Disneyland After Dark event which ended at 1am and really didn't want to walk the streets of Anaheim that late.   Check in to the hotel was easy and my room was ready. I had called ahead to request a King bed and that is what I got in the Adventure Tower facing the pool on the 6th floor. The room was not as spacious as the Grand Californian but knowing my Disney history this was the first tower build back in the early 1960's.   I am not crazy that the windows don't open as the room can get

This was our third time staying at The Disneyland Hotel and it was, once again, perfect. If you love classic Disney this hotel is for you!  First off upon check in we were assigned a room in the Frontier Tower. We preferred the Fantasy Tower as it is the only tower we had not stayed in and wanted to try them all. The front desk person not only granted our request but we were placed in a premium room that overlooked the pool at no additional cost. Magical! We have always been pleased with the room quality, cleanliness and the beds/linens. This stay was no exception.  The walk from the hotel to Disneyland's front gate is safe and quick. We left the parks each afternoon to walk back to the hotel to swim, change clothes, charge phones.  The pool was fairly crowded but that was to be

Upon entry to the hotel lobby, I was expecting something iconic and extravagant.  We have stayed at many Disney hotels in Florida and the hotel lobby's are always beautiful and the cast members are there to greet you, but we didn't find that welcoming entry here.  Our room was nice.  I liked that the toilet area had its own door so someone could use the toilet while someone else was showering.  It was so quiet.  We never heard anyone in the hallways or in the rooms around us.  That was amazing since people are coming and going at all hours.  Beds were comfortable.  We had two queens and a daybed in the room and it was perfect. Bedding and towels were great quality.  So comfortable!  Even the shampoo and conditioner were great. My daughter enjoyed watching the princess bed time

OK, it seems sort of unAmerican to "dis on Disney" but this place was just OK.  I was a bit disappointed, actually.  Sure, it's a convenient walk to the parks; sure, it has historical value; sure; it was visionary at the time (but that was 50+ years ago).  Now it's just an OK hotel.  Consists of 4 towers (I was in frontier, which is farthest away from check-in, the convention center, etc. If you want anything, like sundries, snacks, etc, you have to walk back up to the main tower.  We arrive very late night so there was not a crowd.  Still, we waited about 10 min before we could check in.  The front desk person we worked with did not exactly seem thrilled to be there sort of had a "forced happy face." The rooms were clean but not particularly roomy. There was a central pool

The Disneyland Hotel whisks you away from the outside world and transports you to a magical place.  I stayed in the Adventureland tower with Club-Level service with my family.  The Club level is great because it has free snacks, drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic), and a great view of the fireworks with the music piped in.  The property itself as some pretty good restaurants and lounges.  I ate at Goofy’s kitchen, which is really good with little kids.  I would’ve really like to have tried the slide and the pool if it wasn’t so cold.    The room itself was spacious.  Pretty quiet.  I had a good night sleep there.  I don’t think there was anything special other than the head board that plays a musical box of “When you Wish Upon a Star”.  It had a mini fridge and a standard flat

Summary Heading: great location but not too impressed
Summary: ok so location, location, location thats all I can say really. it was nice walk everyday to the park, I can say its the easier when you come with kids because you can do quick round trips for naps without walking miles long. the room was basic, the headboard was loved by the kids of course. not movies available like I thought, for the price I would imagine it would be round clock Disney movies for evening but no.  it was pretty noisy as there is a lot of in and out from people to their rooms. we did ask for some milk at room service and snacks in evening and were told it was a 45 miss wait minimum so maybe the hotel could catch on for room service to measure to the size of the hotel, we met another family that were told there food would come within an hour at least. and it was a

When visiting Disneyland no better place to stay than the Disneyland Hotel. Fill your inner child with all the fun and imagination that only Disneyland and the Disneyland Hotel can offer. The Hotel is located right next to the amusement park.

Perfect stay, no issues at all. The hotel is up to Disney standards and the room was great. Nice size and little Disney touches through out the room.  This hotel is better than Paradise Pier...if you are comparing the two. Not as nice as Grand Californian but still great. Highly recommend staying on property if you are visiting Disney for a couple days.

Summary Heading: It's Not Average, It's Not Very Good, It's Good
Summary: You are coming to this hotel because you have kids, try and get one of the upgraded rooms with the light up bed heads, those are cool. The hotel is handy for Disneyland and riding on the train to the park from the hotel is cool.  They also have swimming pools so you can do the park in the morning then around two leave, go have some lunch relax and let the kids play in the pool and then let them have a nap.  They'll protest a bit but believe me well rested will mean a much better nighttime park experience for all of you.  Then go back to the park at night refreshed and ready to have more fun.  It's a very nice way to do Disneyland.  Enjoy.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights after staying 8 at a Hyatt hotel. The hotel was lovely. It was decorated for Christmas with its large ginger bread house. We used the pool area and used the conveniently located bar and cafe. It was lovely cared at the top of Downtown Disney which was convenient for us as the kids loved shopping too and from the hotel. You can always use the Monorail if you don’t want to walk. The rooms are on the smaller side but big enough as most of your time is spent out of the room. It is decorated with cute Mickey features everywhere and a fabulous lit bed head that plays music when First turned on. The Staff were fabulous and helped us when ever needed. I still prefer the Grand Californian Hotel and Spa because of its traditional genre/style but

This was a surprise birthday trip for my daughter, we were both having our birthdays at Disneyland!   So happy to get the fantasy tower once more!  The room was clean and comfortable and quiet,fantastic for people that need some rest after a long flight from western Australia!   It was better when the security check point was closer to the parks, I couldn’t just duck in to get a takeaway coffee without having to empty my pockets.  I don’t feel it’s increased security, it’s just moved further out so you have a long wait to even get into downtown Disney.   I think the cast members of this hotel have lost a lot of their “magic” the reason I chose the Disneyland hotel over the paradise pier, was because I felt that it’d be a touch more special as previous visits to the Disneyland

If you are a Disney fan, there is no other place to stay when visiting. I have now stayed at all three hotels on the property and I like this the best for theme. I was worried that I would feel like it was too far from the parks, but by using the monorail it was a fast way into the park. The pools were great, and even though it is a big property, you feel like you are in the park. The stores inside are good. We didn't eat at the hotel, but there are options. We were able to get a room with two queens and a daybed which served us nicely. The woman who checked us in couldn't have been more nice and accommodating. The room did have some stains on the headboard, but it was kept clean for us while we were there. New added security measures make things go slower though. You have to

We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Disneyland hotel, and I have now recovered enough from the jet lag from flying back to Australia to write the review.  This hotel is at the end of the downtown disney (DD) strip from the parks, personally we found it quite a short fun pleasant walk with a 10 year old. People who say it is a long walk might have small kids.  At check in we asked for a room with 2 queens and a day bed and were granted our wish. We didn't ask for a view as we never spend anytime looking out the window, but we got quite a nice look out to the pool area (blocked a bit by trees) on level 3 in the Adventureland tower. Previous reviewers have said this tower is noisy from DD but we didn't find it to be so.  The room was quite large and the 3 of us had

Summary Heading: Classic doesn't have to mean outdated...
Summary: My husband and I hadn't been to Disneyland since the early 1980's as little kids and decided it was time to return with our own kids.  We only stayed three days so made the most of our time by leaving early and returning late every day.  Every time we came/left the hotel the parking lot was a nightmare.  Cars were sitting for extended period of times, it took our Uber driver 30 minutes to reach us on two separate occasions which seems ridiculous.  For such a well known, large hotel I would have thought it would have been much more organized and thought out.  The check-in/out process was easy and helpful and the property was clean but the rooms seem pretty outdated and the room service was over-priced and less than appetizing unfortunately.  We also waited well over an hour for

Summary Heading: Great location- not as magical as I hoped
Summary: I've stayed at Disneyland hotel in October with my husband.  Our first impression was the bellmen were the most miserable people I have seen! Not a great first impression.  The rest of the staff were lovely, great location for the parks, room was clean... but it wasn't amazing. We have stayed at Disneyland Hotel in Paris and that had more of a special feel to it. This was just a hotel with the odd Mickey decoration.   Not bad, but very expensive for what it is.

After many visits to Walt Disney World (WDW), we decided to visit Disneyland (DL). A FB Disneyland group recommended Disneyland Hotel because it was the original hotel on the property. Lodging at DL (traditional hotel inside corridors) is very different from WDW (outdoor entrances to all rooms in resorts at which we have stayed). The hotel was great. We would have liked more Disney-themed decor around the registration desk, but theming in our room was wonderful: both obvious and subtle. Cast Member who checked us in was professional and knowledgeable. He formerly had worked at WDW, so was a great resource for comparing rides, attractions, and procedures at the two locations. We returned to him, specifically, a few times with questions or to ask for advice. We did not use pools

We are frequent travelers to WDW, and this was our third trip to the Disneyland Resort.  On prior trips, we stayed at the Grand Californian and off site, so this time we thought we'd try the Disneyland Hotel.  We are a family of five (kids 6, 10 and 14), and we tend to stay in suite/multi-bedroom accomodations.  However, we found that our Disneyland Hotel room in the Frontier Tower had plenty of room, with the exception of the bathroom.  The bathroom was TINY!  You pretty much had to shut the door to do anything in the bathroom.  There was a lack of counter space as well.  However, the beds were comfortable, my 14 year old was fine with the day bed, and we had a great view of the pool and the park in the distance.  We had no problems with noise.  Some people have commented that

Summary Heading: Great hotel on the Disney property
Summary: This is a great Disney hotel. I'd say it's solidly in between the Paradise Pier and the Grand Californian. The rooms are super clean and well kept, as you'd expect from a Disney property. We got a "deluxe" view room which pointed us toward the pool area which was nice. The pools were great with a really cool water slide and a baby pool for the ultra little ones.   Every employee we ran into was friendly and helpful if we needed anything. Our three year old got a bloody nose one night and turned one of the beds in to a crime scene and they had it cleaned up as soon as we called the front desk.   I relly can't say enough about Disney hotels as a whole. I know they're more expensive, but when you take the whole experience in, and really take advantage of all the discounts available

We loved our stay here many years ago. Spend extra and stay on club level. You need club level key to access the floor. Club level includes breakfast, snacks, drinks (even alcohol), hot appetizers and desserts. You also get to to view the fireworks with the music streaming in from the club room. They also have movies available to take to your room and games for the kids. We enjoyed Goofy’s cafe in the hotel for lunch. And the pool with the slides and Mickey shaped jacuzzis were fun. One of these days I’d love to stay in one of their themed suites. Early entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure is also a perk.

I had stayed at Paradise Pier several times, but this was my first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  Everything was perfect!  The lobby was beautiful and full of historical pics and props from the hotel's history.  Check in was a breeze,and the staff seemed genuinely glad to be there.  My room was perfect. Everything seemed new and in perfect working order.  The bed was soft and comfortable.  I will definitely be staying here again in the future.

I can't tell you how many times I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. It's always our go to place for Disneyland lodging. The experience is special from the start where you walk into the lobby to find a big gingerbread house! The cast members at the front desk are always attentive and you never have to wait in line to speak to anyone. The room was nice and quiet on the 6th floor. It is wonderful to have your hotel so close to the parks so you can go back during the day and take a nap! :)

We absolutely loved the Disneyland Hotel and were very pleased with our choice. All of the staff were so friendly and accommodating, and the location was perfect for easy access to Downtown Disney and the theme parks. My daughter loved the lamp that played a lullaby and all of the Disney features in our room, as well as the pool and fabulous water slides. We felt perfectly at home and will definitely stay here again!

My wife, son and I stayed here during a mini staycation at the end of October around Halloween.  We booked directly through the Disneyland website, and also booked the e-Ticket club lounge.  We checked in around 2pm, but our room wasn't quite ready, so we decided to go down to the pool for a little bit.  They promised to text me when the room was ready.  The pool area is in between the three main towers of Adventure, Fantasy, and Frontier Tower.  The pools get heated, and there were two large pools, hot tub, and a monorail themed play area.  The waterslides were a load of fun for my son and I.  Lifevests are provided, as well as easy access to chairs.  In about an hour and a half, I got a text saying my room was ready.  We had already picked up the keys when I had checked in, so

I was very disappointed in our room at the hotel.. we were so excited to be staying at the Disneyland Hotel for our honeymoon. We checked in and since our room wasn’t ready we headed down to the park, we didn’t get back to our room until 11:45ish pm, we were exhausted as we flew in early in the morning. When i went to get into bed and i pulled the comforter back there were 2 actual blood stains one on the sheet and one big one on the pillow! It was so disgusting i wanted to gag! this was not the disneyland hotel experience i wanted. We have stayed and many hotels around the area, and even the Travelodge was cleaner! For the price i definitely expect better. The headboard to the bed looked like an animal attacked it. They did come and put all new bedding on which made me feel a

we come here every year at Christmas. love the holiday feel and festive food and drinks and decorations! the employees are very nice and if you love Disney you feel immersed in a magical place during your stay.

Next to Disneyland Theme park with less than five minutes walking distance. Surrounding area full of restaurant. Room was big and clean. It's nice place to stay after meeting and when you had fun at Disneyland.

Good room well maintained though a little dated. Staff are very helpful and friendly. I thought the prices for things were a little costly for what you were getting, maybe capitalizing on a captive audience. We found the lack of signage, stating processes or rules that only the staff seemed to know, a little confusing.

The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were spotless and the beds were very comforting after a long day in the park. The small Disney details throughout the room made it feel Disney and the nightlight above the bed was beautiful the kids loved the display.  We stayed in a standard room for two nights and decided to stay a third night and they upgraded us to a suite room. Both rooms were great! We came here to spend time just at Disney the proximity of the hotel was very convenient.  The hotel is pricey but compared to other hotels in the area, I don’t think the price is outrageous for the quality and experience you get.

The travel agency I work for, Get Away Today, stayed here for three nights in Oct. during a familiarization trip. The rooms are large and spacious. The room had two queens and a twin sized sofa pull down. The beds and bedding at this hotel were amazing. We all missed them when we moved on during our trip. The room had many Disney touches. I also really enjoyed the theme of each tower lobby. The main lobby located in the Fantasy tower also had a lot of historical Disney photos and art. This hotel is located at the end of Downtown Disney. The area is very secure, many officers on the short walk between Downtown Disney and the hotel. This hotel is also the closest to the Downtown Disney monorail station. One of the biggest, underated, advantages of staying on property is the

We stayed for 1 quick night and it was awesome. First off, the pool area is fantastic for kids and adults. Secondly, Trader Sam's is a must if you manage to get in during happy hour. The rooms were well appointed and very quiet which we appreciated and had a lot of Disney touches. I recommend you stay here if its in your budget because it really saves you time since you can walk to the parks and Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Staff, Clean Rooms, but food is over priced--$5.50 for a single doughnut
Summary: I stayed in The Frontier Tower, which is the farthest one that faces the pool or employee parking lot.  The room was clean, house keeping was great, front desk staff was very pleasant & helpful, quick luggage service, and, overall, nice environment.  Parking is $18 a day for guests, but it was easy to get in and out of the uncovered lot.  My biggest issue was with the food--$10 for a single sandwich--no chips, $5.50 for a single doughnut, $4 for a single croissant.  I get that there is a mark up at hotels, but some of those seemed a few dollars too high.  On the positive, Downtown Disney is easily within walking distance; the food is expensive there, too.  A small, basic Jamba Juice is $6.  I would encourage you to go off campus to a grocery store and stock up items in your

For the ultimate Disneyland experience, the Disneyland Hotel is a must! We just stayed there for 7 nights, and everything about it was absolutely perfect! We had a room on the 4th floor in the Fantasy tower right off the elevator, which can cause problems with traffic noise in the hallway, but we didn't hear a peep while in our rooms! We had a spacious double queen, and the beds were extremely clean and comfortable. The headboard above the bed, which lights up and plays music, was the perfect touch to the end of our long days in the parks! We enjoyed room service every morning, which had a great menu with plenty of choices. Housekeeping was amazing, and even brought us a generous amount of extra toiletries and coffee upon request. The front desk staff was absolutely amazing! I

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for a business convention. The service was top notch. From check-in to check-out, the hotel was 100% service oriented. Many thanks to Shanna (from TN) for providing excellent customer service. Because I was there for business, I didn't get to experience much of the amenities. It is nice to be able to walk to Downtown Disney which is just across the street. One of my favorite activities was the early morning power walk through Disney California adventure (which is only available to guests at the 3 Disney hotels).  The room was super comfortable with good soundproofing. The small details were amazing with mickey mouse objects everywhere. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds ever.  We would absolutely return to the Disneyland Hotel in

There are a lot of places to stay around the Disneyland Resort area, especially the hotels/motels that are along Harbor Drive, Katella Ave, and the surrounding Anaheim area.  The Disneyland Hotel is the ultimate place to stay for nostalgia, magic, and memories.   The Disneyland Hotel stands out from the rest of the lodging options offered in the local area, as quietness, cleanliness, and hotel amenities are among the reasons to stay here.  It's one of the few hotels that truly have a luxury hotel feel offered throughout the room and the facilities.   Don't forget about the coveted early magic hour that's offered in both parks exclusively for those who are staying in either Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier, or the Grand Californian.   Although very pricey to stay here, there are

The Disneyland Hotel is finished with all the refurbishments. It is a wonderful place to stay if you're going to the resort. You are on Disneyland property right next to Downtown Disney. The rooms are large comfortable and magical. The concierge floor is worth the extra money and I would encourage you to book your room on one of these floors especially if you have children with you the room has special touches like a magical headboard that plays a dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes Atwal the headboards light up a castle fireworks and stars. The concierge floor has a large area that you just use your room key to enter it's called I believe the e-ticket Club you can relax there have wonderful nipples. As a matter of fact you can have a decent breakfast there's a variety of foods all

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for four nights in November for the (last) Disneyland Super Hero's Half Marathon Weekend.  This is a great hotel to stay at if you are participating in Disneyland races (which are currently on hiatus) as the start line and finish line are basically outside your door.  It's also a great hotel also if you are visiting the parks as it took me 10 minutes to get to my room after exiting Disneyland. (Note: they haven't begun construction on the new hotel so I cannot comment how that will affect a visit to this resort in the near future).  I had a king bed room in the Adventure Tower on the sixth floor.  The view was great.  The room had a decent sized bathroom (considering the age of the hotel)  and a mini fridge which I used to store the water I

Summary Heading: When entering the lobby you are greeted by 6 foot statue of Goofy, and that represents your stay.
Summary: This is a place for families with a dozen rug rats. Unfortunately I had to stay here for business meetings.  The restaurant has 6 tables and very limited menu, the bar has 5 barstools and closes at 10.  You are a 2 block walk to get out of this Disneyhell.    This is a perfect place to stay if you are taking your kids to the Magic Kingdom.   This is a business traveler's nightmare.

Stayed in this hotel for one night 5 November 2017. The room was very nice looking but aside the 3 Disney things in the room I would never guessed it was a Disney hotel it was clean, Pool area was very nice heated water and plenty of places to sit. The hot tub was nice after a long day. The staff was great checking in and out no problems. We paid for the club level which means food drinks and etc through out the day. The breakfast was good lots of stuff. However after the morning stuff was taken away the rest of the afternoon and evening food was not. we went several times thinking it would get better it was not they had to small desert trays that went so fast by the time we were able to get to the plates that meant there was never any food. A few time nothing at all was out 1/2

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel Frontier Tower  in room 2780 from November 3rd thru November 10th. We requested an ADA room with a roll in shower and 2 queen beds. The room was nice but nothing special. To be honest I didn't "feel" the magic 😓. We paid for a premium view. We were on the 9th floor and had a slight view of the fireworks and a good view of the pools. We also had excellent handicapped parking right outside the lobby door. The rooms are kind of dull, small fridge, nice tv, 3 dresser drawers and a small closet. The bath towels are huge and they do have 2 guest robes. Nice desk and chair. Strange thing we never saw anyone except housekeeping. The main floor has some sofas and chairs but NO guest services. Apparently the Fantasy Tower has a small gift shop and store

Summary Heading: Great hotel with the added luxury of the pool on your doorstep.
Summary: A great hotel with the added luxury of the pool on your doorstep. Access to the lounge was a god send as we used it to grab snacks for the day and have a cold beer at the end of the day. Great hotel which is so close to the parks.

Summary Heading: Happiest place on Earth for all ages
Summary: My wife and I are annual pass holders and go to Disneyland at least once a month.   Some tips to make your trip more fun. -Go inside the enchanted tiki room for the shorter dole whip line. -right line is faster for Pirates. -Rainy days are the best time to go to Disneyland. Rain scares all the tourists away!

We arrived before check in. We were told that we would have our room information at least by 3. Ummm didn't happen. After 5, we were finally able to get a room number. Claimed I must have been on a ride, which wasn't even close to the truth as I was just walking for 5 1/2 hours because I was worried I would miss their call/text if I got on a ride. Our bags were still being kept for us, no offer to have them put in our room. Then I was fortunate enough to get a room in the building furthest away from the front. Room was nice but hot and I in no way enjoyed the time with no electric or water which we did not know would happen until the night they did it. Sadly I was up for half of it, as my body was still on east coast time and I couldn't sleep. So overcharged, ignored, none of my

Very large rooms and great pool area. On the door step of Downtown Disney but still a 5-7 min walk to Disneyland - Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa is much closer to the parks.   Service was good, grounds and rooms very clean - great stay.

Expensive, but worth it. I took my kids (5 & 7) and my parents for a 5 day stay. It's close to the park, not too far away, but we do feel very tired to walk back after a long day in the park.   Rooms are clean, love the castle head board.

Summary Heading: Great stay but where is the Magic?
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Disneyland hotel for 1 night as part of our honeymoon. The room was £400 for the night but with it being a special occasion and being huge Disney fans we decided we would do it. We arrived at the hotel slightly early and were able to use the pools. The pools are great and open until 10.00pm. Our room was lovely with a view of Downtown Disney which meant we could watch the fireworks at night in bed.   Points to improve on Having been a cast member with Disney I know how high the standards of service should be. Upon checking in the staff member wasn't over friendly. There was no congratulations on our marriage and no Disney welcome! It felt like any normal hotel not a Disney hotel.   The biggest downside was waiting in the wrong queue the next morning.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, too much Mickey overall
Summary: The hotel and area are comfortable and very well maintained. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Everything quite expensive. However, for an adult traveller there is too much Mickey in every single details, from room carpet to lamps etc.

This is the first time that we stayed at a Disneyland Hotel in Los Angeles. Since we are a family with 2 young kids, we decided to choose Disneyland Hotel because of the character dining at Goofy's Kitchen. We booked an early dinner at 5:10 PM and were not disappointed since Goofy's Kitchen had numerous characters from Goofy, Pluto, Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Dale, and Donald Duck. It was worth the dining experience for the kids. At other Disneyland (i.e. Chef Mickey in Hong Kong), we only get to see about 2 characters during dining. But be sure to make advance reservation either by e-mail or phone. We chose a normal room. The room is of average size. The service is of high standard as seen at other Disney hotels. The location is good. Before we booked this hotel, we thought

I stayed here on a recommendation because it had a water slide and was close to Disneyland.  I really hate to give any hotel a 1 star but in this particular case I feel like I have to for those who don't have tons of money.    There really is nothing wrong with the hotel, it is clean, the hotel room was ok (although it was small in my opinion as others seemed to think it was large), and the staff was great. The problem here and what I base my reviews on is value.  I got I think 25% off and my room was still almost $400 a night.  It is a typical hotel room other than some lights on the headboard that weren't really that impressive to me.  Sure, you might see Goofy walking around the lobby but you can see that in Disneyland.    The pool was ok and the slide was ok but nothing

Our room was ready at 11 am. We stayed in the Frontier tower and thoroughly enjoyed our trip. Although the Frontier tower is the furthest from the theme parks, it really isn't that much further- maybe an extra minute of walking. Our children really enjoyed the model mountain/train track in the Frontier tower lobby. Our two queen bed and pullout couch room was spacious and clean. You could hear muffled sounds of toilet flushing in adjacent rooms, but it didn't bother us because we had a sound machine for our toddler. The cleaners did a great job and had the room cleaned by 1pm everyday, which was fantastic, as that is when we came back to the room to take a break. We swam in the pool on the warmest day, and the kids had fun although it was a bit cold. I can't see swimming in the

Our stay was just okay. We frequently stay in the area for Disneyland and have been really wowed by some of the new hotels in the area, however we wanted to stay here one time for the experience. The room was just fine, however not very big, or with any amenities or details that set it apart aside from the decor. When leaving this review I am also factoring in price, and at double or triple the cost of other local hotels that in my opinion are even more family friendly including bigger rooms and bathrooms with in room dining area, activities, etc. I do not think the extra cost amounted to anything other than saying we stayed there. It's not even as close to the main gate as other local hotels, and had very few options for a quick bite, room service options were meh and

Wonderful to go back to a resort and to a Theme Park that I hadn't visited in years. The service was outstanding.  The Cast Members from the moment we arrived asked us what we were celebrating and what our needs were. The desk clerk changed our room to one with a daybed and one that was closest to the path to the Theme Parks, as that was our main reason for visiting.  The pool area was an excellent mix of relaxation and activity.  Hidden Mickeys and history in every building.  The fitness center was spacious and clean, but it did have a few treadmills that were down. Be sure to visit Trader Sam's for a drink and for a "volcano alert".  They keep the grounds well. The room was very clean and it was a truly magical experience.

My wife and I spent 3 nights here while attending a conference. The conference facilities are good, including good food/service and close proximity to the rooms. The rooms are good also. However, on our final morning, two things occurred which soured us on the place. While my wife was showering, the water went cold. We never had hot water again. An engineer came up and said he needed to get some parts to fix it, and check out time is 11am so it never got repaired before we left. At about 8:30 AM, a housekeeper knocked on our door and got us out of bed to ask us when she could clean the room! On our last day. How come they don't know that your'll be checking out and they can come after 11am? The on-line after visit survey has a hard stop in the beginning asking for your exact

Summary Heading: First, but not the last, stay at DLH
Summary: Overdue review... stayed here end of May/beginning of June. Hadn’t been to DL in over 25 years!  First time staying at a Disneyland Resort Hotel.  The DLH... was worth every penny!  The pool, the staff, the well maintained rooms (we stayed in the Fantasy Tower), fireworks view from our room, the headboards... immersion in the magic!  Short stroll thru DD to the front gates of both parks.  Our daughter loved our Goofy’s Kitchen experience!  Already booked our next stay!  I know there are more practical options, but I don’t see us staying anywhere else when in DL!

We stayed at Disneyland Hotel for our first trip to Disneyland (we are regulars of Disney World). The service was excellent. When we arrived, our room was not ready at 3 pm. After waiting 40 minutes, we were ready to get to our rooms. The front desk apologized for the wait and offered compensation with fast passes that can be used anytime for any attraction. Shortly afterwards our room was ready. The room itself was quite large. The Queen beds were comfortable with nice linens and the sofa bed was better than most. The location is perfect as the hotel is adjacent to Downtown Disney. It is a very short walk to the parks. The monorail is an option as well, although we didn't use it.  Our room was always cleaned in a timely fashion. Any housekeeping request we had (such as more

Paying 1800 USD a night for a three bedroom suite, you expect a 1800 USD suite... not three connecting rooms with parking view and a painted wall. Calling front desk they have NO solution. Ohhh, and we can’t order room service because their kitchen is not working... what a terrible experience.

This hotel is in a great location if you are visiting the parks.  Downtown Disney is right outside of my hotel and I can listen to the live music in the lobby.  Room service does not have enough healthy options but hey I guess thats part of the Disney mystique.  Great place for conferences which is why i am here but the location is really fun.

This hotel is fabulous and prestigious  The rooms are super clean and fancy There are many outside swimming poles with jackosy . The place just fantastic with trees, grass, and all green Recommended for romantic or families

This hotel is pricey. Yes, you do expect to pay more for Disney, but you also expect a certain level of hotel facility and service for this cost. Unfortunately, for us, the Disneyland Hotel did not deliver. Firstly, the rooms are SMALL. The ceilings are low and there is a ridiculous bathroom set up that just made life difficult and uncomfortable for us. The room was claustrophobic with really nowhere to store our suitcases and purchases. Reading conflicting reviews regarding the rooms, I think that there are two different sizes and we drew the short straw. When I asked about this, no assistance or care factor was offered. If this hotel was not linked to the WONDERFUL Disneyland experience, it would not survive.  Pros - early hour entry, ability to walk everywhere, pools, lovely

This was our second visit to Disneyland and we were glad we stayed at this Hotel.  On our last visit we stayed at the Grand Californian which felt quite dark compared to this Hotel.  The Disneyland Hotel was our favourite of the two. It was light and airy, quite well designed and really close to the parks (a 15 min stroll through Downtown Disney - our kids are 15 and 13 yo). We stayed in the Frontier Tower which felt a little dated but it was clean and quiet with good views across the resort from our balcony. Room servicing was efficient. The bathroom could have been a little larger (the toilet was squashed right next to the shower and basin, but there was a second basin).  The coffee shop was handy with nice coffee.  Although, we visited Goofy's Kitchen and the food quality was

Check in: 5 September 2017 Check out: 9 September 2017  VERY AVERAGE !! Yes its close to Disneyland theme park....thats about it  The headboard looks cool, but the room looks old (outdated). We want to borrow a plate, but that's not possible at all. For the price we paid....our opinion its not wort it. (You only pay for the location).  Pro: Location close to theme park, Staff member friendly and helpful.

My family loved our second floor room in the Fantasy Tower overlooking the pool which we enjoyed using daily. Great gift and coffee shop. Easy access to Downtown Disney and the monorail to Disneyland.

We have traveled twice before to Disney World properties, but this was our first experience with Disneyland.  We stayed for two nights in a one-bedroom suite in Frontier Tower.  This is the only tower where the suites have balconies - and we really enjoyed spending time on ours.  Our room was quite lovely and spacious, with wonderful views of the pool area and downtown Disney.  We could even see the nighttime fireworks from our window!
