Compared to some of the sprawling Disney World properties, this was quite compact - both the hotel amenities themselves, as well as the proximity to the parks, dining, and shopping.    The age of the property shows only in it's layout:  three tall towers that look like traditional hotels, surrounding a series of pools nestled in greenery.  So,

This was our first week at this Disney hotel and it was awesome! I love the twinkling fireworks on the headboard! The rooms are well appointed and spacious. There are classic touches but not too much, it's just right. It was nice to be able to walk back to the hotel at the end of the night. We spent one day at the pool and I loved the Hawaiian cheeseburgers!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and close to everything!
Summary: We stayed in the adventure tower 3 bedroom suite. The room was very spacious and the view was fantastic. From the 10th floor we could see both Disney parks and walk to them! The parks are a 7 minute walk.

Summary Heading: Great property, was upgraded a few years ago.
Summary: This is a great property, was upgraded a few years ago. Very clean and well maintained. Hard to go wrong here.   This is a great way to see Disneyland.  Stay here, and you can get away from the park for naps, a swim, etc.

Summary Heading: Loved our stay at the DL Hotel!
Summary: My wife and two kids (age 6 and 3) stayed 4 nights here as part of our week-long vacation in the LA area.  We are Disney fanatics and have stayed at various resorts at WDW over many years.  This was our 2nd visit to DL and the 1st with our kids.  The hotel was very nice.  We enjoyed drinks at the poolside tiki bar when we arrived which was a lot of fun.  The pool was nice but it was April so it was a little too chilly to swim one or two of the days.  The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Downtown Disney and the park entrances.  We were disappointed we didn't get to ride the monorail into the park as the wait time was always 45+ minutes (people just sit and ride it around and it has limited capacity).  Our room overlooked Downtown Disney, the Grand

Summary Heading: Lack of places to eat lunch at Disneyland hotel
Summary: I am attending a business convention at the Disneyland hotel and was appalled at the lack of places to eat for lunch. Keep in mind that the hotel also has its own convention center yet there is only one , yes 1, place to eat lunch . And when I went at 1 pm, there were no places to sit . I ended up getting  it go and eating in my booth . I hears people saying they had waited 45 minutes and had to leave for a Meeting.  Finally I had a basic salad with chopped chicken that was below average in size and cost $11.  There are other places to eat in Downtown Disney but that takes time to get there. In fairness , there was a Goofy restaurant but they told me I could not there. On the minus side,  they have a steak restaurant but it is not open for lunch

Disneyland hotel is such a beautiful hotel. Rooms are extremely clean and the mattresses were very comfortable!  Disneyland hotel is within walking distance to downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure. Pool was beautiful and relaxing!

We only got to stay in the hotel for one night, but we had a great stay. Our room was large and beautiful. We loved the picture of the castle over the bed with light up fireworks. We got dinner and drinks at Trader Sam's on the hotel grounds which had a fun tiki theme. The bed was comfortable and we were able to get into the park first thing in the morning before the crowds. It was a magical stay

Summary Heading: Poor customer service, exhorbitant prices at restaurants, long wait for customer service
Summary: *Poor customer service -long wait times to access a manager about a problem  *Limited choices for room service and ridiculous prices/service charges *antiquated phones in the room - no speaker so you have to keep the phone to your ear for the duration of the call to room service/manager to complain (close to a half an hour now my order for room service) *Internet goes in and out

-Delay room service It took them more than 30 mints to answer the call and finally -No changing room or shower in the pool. Most people wants to relax the last day beside the pool after check out and before they depart. Theres no changing room or shower

Stayed here for 5 nights for a conference onsite.   Checking was fast.  Was given a building and room number. When we got there, we notice a do not disturb sign and our keycard did not work. The gal gave us the wrong information.  Ended up calling the front desk to get the correct information.  This time our keycard worked.  Odd, the first information wasn't even close; completely different building and number.   The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Had no problem with noise since we knew kids were about. The conference provided all meals and they were pretty good.  Didn't leave hungry at all. The Staff/Cast Members were very friendly and always had a smile on their face.  Did not use any other facilities while we were there since most of our time was at the

Convenient location next to Downtown Disney. Professional and courteous staff at valet, front desk, and room service.  Restaurants had great food and characters were fun.  Be sure to make advance reservations (do it from your phone or laptop, you'll be on hold forever if you call).  You will have to head to the Paradise if you want to use the fitness room as they are renovating right now.

Summary Heading: Close to the Park, Great for Families
Summary: Albeit slightly dated, this large, busy, multi-building hotel delivers as promised and is a good bet for families with kids.  Close to Disneyland and California Adventure, the staff provide great service and is helpful with advice, directions, etc.  Everything is “tourist” priced here, and in the parks, so just expect higher prices than you’d find elsewhere.  Parking is plentiful and convenient, and there is an onsite guest laundry, a bar, restaurant, and other amenities.   The kids will love the large pool on the property, and you have everything you need to make for a great vacation or visit.

Summary Heading: Great location and service, needs a little tweaking
Summary: We stayed with our family in a 2 bedroom suite. It was furnished lovely and we had plenty of room. It also was pricey, but worth the convenience and location. We chose the club floor option since our youngest grandson was just two. We had to walk over to another tower and it wasn't bad. The breakfast was great , but the lunch and dinner was not too sufficient. They had pop and juice that you could take to the park. It was a large room with a great view of the park,and you can see the fireworks at night and snack on yummy desserts. The best part was that our little one could walk around or sit at a small table watching Disney shows while we ate. The service was excellent. Our bathroom was adequate, however it was hard to locate a nice hot water setting for your shower. It was

We stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. This hotel was perfect for our family of five. The location can’t be beat! It was next to downtown Disney which was great for dining and extra evening entertainment. We were only steps away from the monorail which dropped us off inside Disneyland. You need a park ticket to get on the monorail. The hotel was beautiful! We also enjoyed the gift shops and eating at Goofy’s Kitchen which is inside the hotel. The room was a generous size for five people. We loved the headboards that light up and play music! We could even see the fireworks from our standard view room. The pool area was a lot of fun with the monorail slide. It reminded us of the pool area at the Polynesian at WDW Resort. If you want to stay on-site, this is an excellent

Ok so you know the price is going to be at the high end but the place is worth the stay just for the history and its history as part if the disneyland story. Add in the nice way the rooms were returned and how the redid the pool area and you're onto a winner

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel. A must for Walt Disney fans.
Summary: We moved to this hotel from the Hilton and what an amazing difference.  The hotel is beautifully furnished and themed around Fantasyland, Adventureland, and Frontierland.  Our room was clean and beautiful (as were the corridors) with lot of Disneyland history included in the detail.  The rooms are spacious with a separate bathroom and toilet; we had a stunning view overlooking the pool area and then theres the amazing bed headboards that light up and play 'A dream is a with your heart makes'. There was so much I loved about this hotel I could go on forever.  We ate at Steakhouse 55 several times.  This restaurant blew me away; it's art deco style with Jazz music and relaxing atmosphere.  We also enjoyed the bar - (I don't even drink!) it was just incredibly relaxing.   The pool

This is our 4th trip to DL from Australia. We have been to Orlando DW 4 times and have done 4 Disney Cruises. We usually rent a house in Anaheim or stay at a hotel offsite but thought we would give this hotel a go now our children are older and all being crammed into one room is not an issue. I was really wanting to love the Disneyland Hotel having read mixed reviews on TA but sadly it came up short for me. Having been on a week long Disney Cruise just prior to our stay I guess we had gotten used to exceptional Disney service. There were a couple of  issues that are too long and tedious to go into, which when raised with the staff were meet with a very lack lustre, coukdn't care less response. The lifts were SO slow, the rooms ok but for the money there could have been a few

We took our two teenagers (15 & 13) and although we enjoyed the time, we don’t think staying at the Disneyland Hotel was worth it. To be fair, it is a good hotel with spacious rooms (and awesome headboards!) and there was nothing wrong during our stay, in hindsight, we think it would be better to stay in a better hotel (for the same price) outside Disneyland. Everything (even bottled water) is heavily overpriced and we ended up going for dinner outside Disneyland, which we thought was much better.  What was a bit disappointing was that one could not arrange a late checkout in advance (one had to call on the morning of checkout!) and even then checking out an hour later was not possible.  Our Disney/theme park days are over.......

Summary Heading: Poolside Perfection right next to Downtown Disney
Summary: The pool, waterslides & spas are large enough to service all the guests at once! Great way to release the bit of ache from days walking through the Disney Parks. Entrance to both parks is right out the Hotel lobby and just a scenic stroll through Downtown Disney. This hotel accomodates young and old with great food, both poolside and at the PCGrill dining. We were pleased with room decor, staff and quality of service. We will return soon!!!

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel 17th Sept-22nd Sept. I had visited Disneyland as a child and always hoped to stay at one of the Disneyland hotels. We loved all the Disney touches and the service was impeccable. Highlight was Goofy’s Kitchen for dinner-such fun, highly recommend! Only drawback was the laundry was being refurbished and I had to drag the family’s washing over to paradise pier where 2 of the 4 available washing machines were out of order! I spoke to reception and they apologised for the time spent away from my family and compensated us-overall could not be happier-I will not wait another 34 years before I visit again. Thank you for making my dreams a reality!

Love this first time at the Disneyland Hotel. All the years I have been going to the park and never stayed here. GREAT! experience. Wonderful food friendly staff and just the right amount of Disney. Not too much like the parks.  Will 100% stay again.  My only suggestion is they need new mattresses. A little lumpy.

Everything was ok,staff is very friendly,breakfast bufet is good,everything is so clean.,,but in the room for four people the wardrobe is so small and we must hold our clothes in a suitcase,and there is no miror in the room.. But the main reason because i giving a 3 stars to this hotel is a pool area, it is freezing ..it is writen that the water in the pool is 28 degrese hahahahaha  and the air teperature is so low so if you go there prepare to freez yourself...exept it the jacuzzi which is warm..that is all..we will come back for sure but we will not go in the pool

Room really comfortable and clean.  I think we were in the adventure tower, overlooking the pool.  Kids loved the pools, slide and restaurants.  The whole hotel had a nice feel.  Staff amzaing.    Connie in the club was very professional and extremely thoughtful when my daughter was very tired and jet lagged when we initially arrived at the hotel.  All of the the club servers were fabulous.  Robert was fabulous too. Club was a fabulous escape from the  craziness.  Definitely not sufficient for a dinner or lunch, but good snacks and drinks.  We couldn't decide between the Disney Hotel and the Grand Californian.  We were very happy with our decision.  A couple of things that perhaps worth noting: *Fitness centre is being renovated.  They do allow you to use the Paradise Pier hotel

We had a one bedroom suite in the Fantasy Tower and it was huge! This was a great location for a Disney vacation, yes there is a 10 minute walk to the park entrances but you can avoid that with the monorail (right outside the hotel) or we actually enjoyed picking up a coffee and some lunch on the walk back to the hotel after a busy morning in the parks with two young kids. Plus the Lego store is in downtown Disney on the way back and our sons loved the interactive lego tables outside for some quiet time building lego after the parks. The best thing about staying on site is extra magic hour, we walked on to almost every ride in that first hour before the parks started to fill up. The pools are great, the queue for waterslides was quite long on the weekend but fine during the

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to while visiting the parks
Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel. The room, the grounds and all the cast members were wonderful.  All of the wonderful Disney touches were there on the grounds in the rooms.  The beds were comfortable and the room was very quiet.  Even with all the families staying there we hardly ever heard anyone else when we were in our rooms.  I have never had so many happy people to work with when I've checked into a hotel, from check in to check out everyone was wonderful to work with.  There is something wonderful about staying on site of the parks and have all the extra perks that go along with it.

Summary Heading: If I could give it 3.5 stars it would be more accurate
Summary: So let me start by saying this. I'm a huge Disney fan and have been to Orlando parks many many times and the California parks a few times. The Disneyland hotel is nice. Nothing really wrong with it at all. Rooms are nice. Hotel interior and exterior are nice. Location is great walking into downtown disney and the parks. It just doesn't have that 'Disney Welcome Home' feeling. Those of you who go to the Florida parks or are DVC members will completely understand that statement.  I didn't get a map of the hotel grounds at check-in. Wasn't explained where breakfast was, getting to the parks, etc. And no, I didn't necessarily NEED that information but it was just a glaring omission compared to Florida check-in. When I did ask about breakfast I was told there is the character buffet

Our family stays here every September and it continues to be magical.   You feel like you are immersed in all things Disney. From the teacups in the lobby to the fireworks on the headboards!   The customer service is Disney all the way.  We always plan an extra day just to spend at the pools.  We love the monorail slides and pool side food and drinks!   While this hotel is the farthest from the parks, its just a few extra steps.

This was a family trip for a birthday and in true Disney Style it was wonderful!!! We were welcomed to the hotel by Goofy and it only got better. the staff worked to get us connecting rooms and helped us suggestions for breakfast lunch and dinner. The rooms were wonderful and the magic head boards are a nice touch. I could go on and on but I suggest that you check it out and see what I'm talking about.

We took our two daughters and their families to Disneyland as a surprise for the 4 kids (ages 7-9).  This hotel is not inexpensive but then what is in Disneyland.  We requested 3 rooms as near to each other as possible.  They managed two rooms side by side and one across the hall.  We did have to give up a pull out couch in one room to make it work but it was more important to be near each other.  Well done front desk!  It's an easy walk to the park with plenty of restaurants along the way for breakfast or dinner.  There are a series of water slides in the pool, each one higher than the other (again, something for everyone).  The lifeguard to guest ratio was impressive and they took their jobs seriously and kept the pool area safe for everyone.  They have poolside service and so

Summary Heading: 4 Stars- knocked a star off because...
Summary: First of all I will say there is nothing quite as special as staying at the Disneyland Hotel or the Disney Grand Californian due to the fact that you are actually staying AT DISNEYLAND. You are immersed in the Disney magic from the time you get out of your car until the time that you leave.  THE HOTEL & ROOMS-The Disneyland Hotel offers all the things you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. When you walk into the lobby you immediately feel like you have arrived at Disneyland!The rooms are Disney themed, fun, clean and well done.  Are the rooms alone worth the high price during peak seasons? I would say most likely not if you are on a budget.  During peak season you can stay 3 nights vs the price of one night at The Disneyland Hotel at a nearby hotel with rooms of the same

I never want to stay at another hotel in Anaheim again! This hotel is amazing. Loved seeing the hidden mickeys in the guest rooms and walking around the hotel! Their pool area is a great place to relax and the water slides are very kid friendly! Can’t wait to stay here again!

Every time, we go to Disneyland, I now booked at the Disney hotel, the best feature beside the pool and historically, the room have the neatest headboard, I wish they would sell it , all thru the night you have those little led lights behind you twinkling, the room are fine, when we requested an extra robe, it finally came the next day, after a second phone call, the extra cup and coffee, never arrived. Checking is always a tad slow, the breakfast are outrageously expensive but that is Disney, you can find other options nearby. Love the hotel for the headboard

Summary Heading: Well-Appointed Rooms and Close to the Action
Summary: We spent five nights here and really enjoyed the hospitality that is Disney, as well as the access to the parks and Downtown Disney. The rooms are a little dated and the ceilings are a little low but the pool area is awesome and the staff was wonderful! We had to joining rooms which felt more like a sweet and ended up with an upgraded view of the pool. This you view also afforded us a great view of the fireworks at Disneyland each night. The beds were VERY comfortable, even the day bed.

Two years ago my daughter and I took our first mother/daughter trip to Disneyland!  We ended up changing hotels half way through our trip and spent two nights at the Disneyland Hotel!  At that time we rated the hotel 5 stars.  This time I'm rating it only 4.  I booked one second mother/daughter trip again through Costco Travel and originally booked the Paradise Pier.  I really wanted to book the Disneyland Hotel again, but there was a difference of $350, I figured that extra money could go towards food and drinks!  Anyway after I had made my final payment I noticed Disney was offering 30% off rooms during our travel dates, and I was able to upgrade to the Disneyland Hotel for $63!!!  So, be on the look out for fall reduced room rates if you travel in September! We stayed in the

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for one night in a King suite. The room was clean and bright with a large window. We had a view of the swimming pool and monorail water slides. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well.

Had the best time! The hotel is pure Disney! We ran into Goofy in the elevator! Where else can you take a elevator ride with Goofy! Our room was sooooo magical and comfortable And LARGE!! We had a panel above the bed that had "fireworks" to the tune of Disney.  The room decor was beautiful! Beds so comfy! Hotel nice and quiet, and within walking distance of both parks. That's the best part, you don't need to hassle with waiting in line to get to your parked car-at the end of the day you can just walk to your hotel and relax! As a guest of the hotel you have all kinds of perks-for example if you buy items in the park you can have them delivered to your Disney hotel! Best place to stay!!! Highly recommend!!!

Summary Heading: Super disappointed - don't really cater to kids and super long walk to park
Summary: We live in LA so we come to Disneyland often, but this is our first time staying overnight.  So not worth it.  The hotel is incredibly run down and doesn't do anything "extra" to cater to kids.  It took us 40 minutes to check in (2 toddlers who couldn't wait to get to the park).  The tubs are so slippery that both my 2 year old son and 3 year old nephew slipped and fell (separately) and hit their heads.  The bathroom is tiny, the kids menu options are super limited etc.  And the room itself is so small that we had nowhere to put the stroller.  And it takes like 20 minutes (at least) to walk to the park itself.  It's faster to stay at the Hilton and Uber.   We could've been at any generic 3 star hotel and my kids wouldn't have had a clue we were at Disney.  The only thing

The room is large and the bathroom has a seperate water closet for the toilet, so someone can be brushing their teeth while someone is using the facilities.  The pool is large and has 3 water slides.  It is great to be able to leave the park and swim during the hottest part of the day.    Mini fridge and coffee maker in the room.  Quiet rooms and hallways.  We were RIGHT next to the elevator and had no problems with noise.

Lovely hotel.  Rooms are very big and pool area is great.  Characters roam around the hotel ALL the time like its no big deal.  The walk to the parks from this hotel is pretty long, you have to traverse all of downtown Disney to get to the parks. The monorail is really close but it's down 80% of the time so don't count on using it especially when the temp is past 85 degrees.  Parking is charged at $20 per day or $30 for valet.  Would recommend hotel for families with small kids because pool area is more fun for them with 2 large slides, 2 small slides and a small wading area about 10-18 deep and the vast array of character sightings makes it extremely magical.  With older kids like teenagers or just adults I would rather stay at Grand California due to its proximity to parks.

Best place to stay at when visiting Disneyland!!  It's within walking distance to the 2 parks & Downtown Disney. We didn't need a car rental which saved us lots of money. The staff here is AWESOME! They are very well informed & are quick to assist you when needed. We stayed in the Adventure Tower w/an Amazing view of the pool! You have to have Breakfast @ Goofy's Kitchen! Make sure you make a Reservation to avoid long waits!  We stayed at the Grand Californian before but Disney Resort will be where we'll always stay when going back!

We had a short notice trip to California & decided to use our Disney Vacation Club points here. First time at any California Disney property.  The housekeeping and valet drivers were fantastic, as were the store personnel, but we encountered more than a few at the front desk and guest services who had less than Disney-like mannerisms.   We've been going to Disney properties regularly for 10+ years and both my husband & I were disappointed with some of the attitudes we witnessed and experienced here. While we understand they deal with a lot of people, the disingenuous friendliness and snobbery isn't what we're used to at the Florida locales.  That said, the rooms were comfortable and clean.   Laundry and fitness were closed due to refurbishment, something that wasn't mentioned by

The check in process was quick, and the employee was engaging and sympathetic to our needs being 77 years old. It is so much easier to operate out of the Hotel than to be somewhere else, and have to wait for shuttles. The rooms and bath are spectacular,especially the Tinkerbell lighting in the headboard. We never had to wait for an elevator. The whole week the just seemed to be their very quickly! The temperature in the room is so easy to regulate. A truly Magical adventure!

Someone asked me today the highlight of my vacation and my response was the hotel! I just loved all the details and fun features: from the teacup chairs in the lobby & the light up, firework headboards to the Mickey handle sink/tub fixtures in the bathroom.  The pools and grounds are beautiful.  We took a day away from the parks to swim and play on the waterslides.  The room was spacious and the bathroom large. And there were robes in the closet!

Summary Heading: Fun family trip for Labor Day
Summary: We love this hotel.  This was our fourth time staying here.  We used our AP and got 30% off the nightly rate.  Booked for the holiday weekend/marathon weekend.  The pool is our favorite because of the monorail water slides.  Took full advantage of the magic morning hours each day.  Ate at the character breakfast at story tellers.  Had a romantic kid-free dinner at steakhouse 55.  Upgraded to a premium pool view room in the frontier tower, that was a lovely surprise.   Top notch service!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel to Stay while at Disney
Summary: Awesome hotel and the best hotel to stay if you are traveling to Disneyland. Love the service, theme and location overall. Its nearby the Disney theme park and the service is second to none. Kids and adults love it. Highly recommended if you can budget it into your finances.

We went for our sons 2nd bday, I think that's too young for Disneyland, but it was nice to get him to see and experience something different. But we decided on the Disneyland Hotel because we could get into the park 1hr earlier and it was close by way of monorail (which is closed if it gets too hot, it looked like it opened back up for one more trip to downtown Disney before closing.) The hotel was great, our 2 year old loves to swim so the pools they have were perfect and the pools restroom attendant made sure the floors were always dry. I thought their food prices at the terrace were reasonable and they were open late which is great. The staff upgraded our room for our sons bday so we got a great view of the pools from the 8th floor. The beds were so comfortable I am now on a

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights for our families first visit to Disneyland.  We had the Premium Pool view which was okay, but not sure if it is really worth the extra money. We were on a higher floor which was nice, but would prefer a view of the fireworks which people on the other side of my floor could see. Tried to leave the park before the fireworks since I found the park too crowded, and for my taste.    The hotel is nicely decorated, and nice size room.  The bathroom is also a good size.  The bed was very comfortable!  I really did enjoy my stay!  Next stay, I may want to stay at the Grand Californian since it was a much shorter walk to California Adventure Park which is definitely my favorite park to visit.  Really nice stay for me and my family!  Ate at Steak 55, very

I loved the Disneyland Hotel. I have read some of the so-so reviews but that was not my experience - we found the location, atmosphere and service to be top notch.  Service: Great and responsive. If you have a problem, say so. Disney will help you. Don't expect them to read your mind. Ask for what you want.  Atmosphere: We loved the room theming. The headboards that light up are a magical touch. Our room was always cleaned expertly.  Location: 10-15 minutes from gates (kids walk slower; an adult should make it in 10 or less). The property has a lot of great amenities, such as Trader Sam's (and kids are allowed in there until 8pm).  This is a spectacular property and keeps you immersed in the Disney experience. The price is high but so are the benefits.

We are part of the Disney Vacation Club and had the need to stay in LA overnight. Wow is all you can say when you stay at the Disneyland hotel. Completely rebuilt and modern. Comfortable rooms, good food, and the pool is fantastic. Minimal chlorine combined with minimal salt water makes swimming this pool a dream. No chlorine smell, no dry skin, fun for the children without the burning eyes. Towel service and pool side food & beverage service makes your stay here great. It's all thumbs up at Disney one more time.

This is a great choice for visiting Disneyland.  I am in my mind comparing this to Disneyland Paris hotels and this is far superior.  I was really impressed by the room, the themed decor - our child loved the headboard and actually it's really sweet and far better than expected.  There are small touches with the taps and lights and the hallway and it all adds up to a very nicely themed hotel.    The housekeeping is very good and the check in was excellent with us picking up the tickets we had pre ordered.  Also was especially pleased that our room was already available two hours before check in on our arrival.  The self parking is very convenient too and I don't think to harshly priced.  The location is actually much further away than you think from the park entrance.  It's a

If you have the chance to stay here, I highly recommend that you do! This was a once in a lifetime stay for my family and it was perfect from check in to check out. No one beats Disney in attention to detail and these rooms are so magically detailed. If you're looking for the full Disney experience, look no further. Immaculate rooms, comfortable beds, beautiful decor and the headboards!! Without giving the surprise away, the headboards are very special. It's a 3 minute walk to downtown Disney and the pool is beautiful. We loved everything about our stay.

We loved this hotel - a seamless, high quality Disney experience from park to room.  Lots of nit-picking on various reviews that miss the big picture - this is a fabulous place to be.  Room & pool areas luxurious, immaculate, recently refurbished, and Disney-themed, with great attention to detail (we loved the illuminated headboard).   Tiki bar was fun too.  We looked around the Grand Californian and whilst bigger, somehow it lacked the "magic".   The Disneyland Hotel is a special place.

This hotel is perfect when going to Disneyland because you can easily park your car at the hotel and then walk everywhere.  Short walking distance to the parks and downtown Disney. Easy to hop on the Monorail in downtown Disney straight to Tomorrowland in the Magic Kingdom. The hotel rooms were laid out great for our needs (10th floor Frontier Tower) – 4 adults and 3 children in a “2 bedroom suite” which was basically 2 adjoining rooms with a small vestibule in between and one of them being larger with living room & bar area with small fridge.  There were 2 pullout sofas for plenty of sleeping areas. There were also nice, small balconies deep enough for a chair and ability to walk in front of it with views of Downtown Disney towards CA Adventure & Disneyland – great for viewing

Our trip started out with some hiccups, but the Disneyland helped smooth those bumps out. They were great with the kids, clean rooms, and helped to coordinate with the airlines for our lost luggage. Thanks Disney!

This hotel is always a magical experience.  The room in the Adventureland Tower was clean and very convenient.  We pay for the concierge service which is a convenient addition for our family.  The hotel is a little pricey and some of their hotels in Florida that are the same price point are much nicer.  Disappointed for the price of the room per night that we still had to pay for parking.  I know parking space is at a premium but for the amount paid for the room parking should be included.   The pool was nice early in the morning, but later in the day it was very crowded, there weren't too many umbrellas for shade, and not many available chairs.  Many had towel on the chairs with no people.  The pool area was also dirty in the afternoon as many people left their trash all over

Yes. 2. But let me explain. The hotel was clean, tidy, good service-ish. (The sink stank really badly and we asked for it to be sorted out. It never was.) Comfortable and all the things you expect from a hotel. But that's just it. It is JUST a hotel. It is no different than a travel lodge or a best western, which are great hotels, nothing wrong with that. It's just you're paying 3-4x the price. The positives are 1. You are nearby the park, I say nearby because it is still a bit of a hike to get there. 2. You get the golden hour before the park opens. This is great but not worth paying the extra money for. The negatives. 1. the sink issue as mentioned above. 2. The walls are thin. I could hear and listen to quite clearly the conversation going on next door at 6am. 3. The service

Summary Heading: I really wanted to LOVE this hotel
Summary: I have to say, I was really excited about booking this hotel.  However, this hotel was just 'ok'.  The room was nice, but we really didn't spend that much time there.  Our room wasn't ready until almost 5pm on check-in day.  We went down to the pool after we checked in and it was crazy! There were barely any chairs and there certainly wasn't anything near where our children wanted to swim. We finally flagged down a server and it took 20 minutes to get our drinks.  The next day when we went to the pool it was equally busy, except this time we never saw a server for 30 minutes, so I decided to go up to the Tiki bar and order my own drinks. When we later saw a server he didn't ask us if there was anything we needed or offer to bring us a menu or anything. The pool service was a BIG

Our family of 5 just completed an amazing 3 day stay at the Disneyland Hotel! Our kids absolutely loved the pool and slides, and the location in relation to Disneyland / Downtown Disney  is unbeatable  (especially if you take advantage of the monorail). We were also able to take full advantage of the Magic Mornings and the "Extra Magic" Guardians of the Galaxy ride evening perks which were both an awesome part of our vacation experience.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower on level 8 with a great pool view (in this "pool view" room we also had a great view of the theme parks and could clearly see the Fantasmic Fireworks). The hotel staff was super accommodating - they consistently provided an extremely high level of service during our stay!!!  Overall we had a great experience, but

Summary Heading: Clean, nice hotel with friendly staff
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel while he attended a conference.  The hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice.  The beds are comfortable and they provide a lot of pillows.  We found it to be quiet and easy to sleep at night.   The bathrooms and showers are nice and also very clean.   The wifi worked well no matter where I was in the park.    The pools were nice but I would suggest getting there no later than 10am if you want a front row seat.  They could provide more chairs at different locations around the pool.  Most are congregated in 2 main areas, which gets crowded and loud.  They do provide beverage and food service around the pool near lunch time.  My only real complaint about the hotel is the way the outlets are in the room.  There were none close to

my family and i just stayed at the Disneyland hotel.  I think that this hotel has the best rooms out of the 3 hotels at Disneyland. The hotel is across the street from downtown disney...the rooms were a good size.  we had a view of the pool which was nice.  the room has cute "magic' lights in the headboard of the bed. I was disappointed the room had no water or treats in the room...for the money, you don't get a lot.  the bathroom is pretty basic.  the beds were comfortable.  there aren't many outlets to charge phones etc...there are 3 restaurants...goofys, which is impossible to get into without a reservation...the steak house which is pretty expensive...and the terrace which was pretty good...we went to the pool which is nice with a big slide etc...not a lot of lounge chairs

We stayed for 1 night in July 17. I have to say i expected a bit more magic or something special and i was disappointed. For the price (which was a lot) the rooms and the service don't really come close. The room is spacious and clean and it has cute disney features but it could do with a spruce up. Our room had a sofa in it with rips. After a day of walking we came to the room to freshen up and grab a drink but lack of mini bar was annoying. When we called to order a couple beers they estimated the wait time to be 45mins. I also think for the price, complimentary bottles of water would have been nice.  Overall.. the convenience is great but I'm not sure the price justofies it.

It was our second time staying at the Disneyland hotel.  The staff are very efficient, pleasant and helpful. The pool is amazing and is wonderful to hang out at when you're not at the parks.  Love the feeling of magic and nostalgia of the hotel.  Great location too for both park entrances.

Difficult start to our stay. Had booked a Premium Room with Downtown Disney/Park view, asking for one of the larger rooms with sofa to accommodate our family of four, including 2 teenagers. Allocated a smaller room, so returned to reception to be told there is no guarantee of room size, it's based on the number of people and we would need 5 to qualify for the larger room. Then told we were lucky as we had already been upgraded to a Downtown Disney view which we hadn't paid for! Got quite cross at this point. Luckily I had all the paperwork to prove we had paid for the view etc and eventually we were given a larger room, but the whole situation could have been handled much better. Not what you expect from Disney.  Everything improved from here. Great just to stroll through

Summary Heading: Classic Disney Service and Beautiful Hotel
Summary: The hotel and rooms are well appointed, clean, welcoming, and have great Disney touches.  We have stayed here many times and found the staff very friendly and accommodating.  The pool and slides can't be beat, and we love the restaurants and the walking distance to Disney.  And even in spite of how large the hotel is, I never feel like a number and always have my needs and issues addressed.  Only reason for not five stars is that it is quite pricey.

I was attending a conference at the convention center and this hotel was offered on the room block list.  I am not a Disney person nor have I ever gone to any of the parks.  I was a little concerned that it would be so much Disney and troops of children running rapid. I WAS SO WRONG!!! I had a delightful stay and would come back for sure!   Upon arrival I checked in, I knew I was early but hey at least they could of taken my bag for me.  Instead the gal was so kind to actually get me into a clean room and room with a view of the pool! She was super helpful and made sure that I had a map and all of my questions answered.   The room was great, We had a full house with adults and a children.  The kids went on the pull out sleeper which was amazing how it flipped out and the adults

About 6 months ago my wife informs me that she will be attending a 3 day conference at the Anahiem Convention Center and has the option oif staying at the Disneyland hotel at a discounted price due to the convention. Now thge last time I stayed at a Disney property (Paradise Pier) I was completely unimpressed and vowed to never waste my money on a Disney property again. But based on the discount and having never stayed at this property we decided we would accompany her and book the hotel.   So to start off, we arrived on a Thursday morning and preregistered. The process was fairly quick even though the cast member was in training (earning their ears). The problem occurred later when I returned to get keys and rest for a bit in the room (at this point I had been up for over 32

Summary Heading: Business Trip 3 Nights Fun Place to Stay
Summary: Stayed her for a national business meeting, so a lot of indoor time. The grounds are beautiful and a lot of Disney memorabilia.  Half the pool was being renovated but I wasn't there to swim.  For families it looks like fun with the Disney characters walking around the property.  Big gift store.  The property was old and worn, but still nice. Room was ok size for a Disney hotel.

Disney delivered with this Frontier Tower 11th floor room...view of the pool area, Downtown Disney, and the Matterhorn at Disneyland!  The sink/mirror was outside the bathroom, which made showering & getting ready a lot easier for our family of four.  The lobby of this tower had a miniature display of Frontierland at Disneyland--including a scale model of Big Thunder Mountain!  Best surprise of all? The leather headboard over the (full-size?) beds played "When You Wish Upon A Star" as the lights would sparkle (see attached photo).  Only concern? The battery on our room safe was dead, so we couldn't lock up our valuables. (Nothing was stolen, but a working safe would've lessened any worry to store mobile devices and camera equipment.)

We stayed here for 3 nights and absolutely loved it! Becky who checked us in was delightful our booking agent made some mistakes with our hopper pass and she was just so lovely to deal with. She had us into the park a day earlier and checked us into our room early. We were so grateful. We were in the Frontier Tower high up looking over the pool. The room was fabulous the beds and linen are a 10/10! Everything is spotless and themed spot on. We enjoyed Goofy's kitchen that was a lot of fun. So convenient to stay right near the parks and go back and fourth. Would not hesitate to stay again! Thanks for helping us create great memories.

This hotel is closest to downtown Disney shopping. The pool properties are great and the restaurants are good. The headboards are amazing with the lights of Disneyland on it. Go off-season, though, because rooms are pricey.

Sorry to say, but you really need to consider staying elsewhere. A few pros and cons for you to consider when making a decision:  Pros: - Proximity to downtown Disney, monorail - Pools, water slides - Magic hour access and Guardians ride availability after "official" close of the park  Con: - Rude staff - Dated and expensive rooms - Poor customer service and experience   We are frequent Disney visitors and Disney properties, so we are very accustomed to the brand and expected level of customer service. This property fails to meet that experience on so  many levels.   Room Availability/ Selection  My wife called a few weeks in advance and then the day before arrival to make sure that we either had adjacent rooms (we booked two of them) or at least on the same floor. She also

We enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland hotel. The grounds and pool area are beautiful. No it was not brand new and perfect there was a place in the bathroom where the wallpaper was peeling and some of the carpets in the halls were stained but this is a hotel that has thousands of kids running through it every day and it was very clean and felt luxurious. We loved having the daybed in addition to the 2 queens it worked out perfectly for our family. People complain about it being older and the cost but if Disney can get $600+ a night and sell out why shouldn't they?  It is a great location right next to downtown Disney and about an 8 minute walk to the parks. Also I noticed the staff at the pool was very attentive watching kids while most of the parents were no where to be seen as

As first time visitors to Disneyland and seasoned veterans of Disney World we really took our time choosing where to stay so we would not be disappointed with our first visit. Overall we were pleased with our stay. Our room was in the Frontier tower and was clean and appeared to be recently remodeled. We enjoyed staying in the original Disneyland hotel and seeing all of the memorabilia . It was about a 15 minute walk to the park. Our children loved the monorail slides and poolside service was excellent. We considered the Grand Californian because it's a shorter walk but I'm glad we chose this hotel. Our only issue was that our room keys did not work and we had to have them replaced 3 times during a four night stay. All other criticism lies with the fact that you can not compare

In my 50+ years of travel, the Disneyland Hotel far surpasses any - for overall comfort, service, friendliness, and professionalism.   It is also appealing to the eye, and the food is delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay - a family group with ages 5 through 82 !  It was wonderful for all.  Thank you, Disney !!  We shall definitely return.

Summary Heading: First all adult trip to Disneyland
Summary: This was my first time to stay on property when visiting Disneyland. I was thrilled we had chosen to stay here! I'm a huge Disney fan! The property is just a short walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney! We had recived a large discount for our length of stay. I can't say without that that I would have chosen this hotel. It's very exspenive. It is so amazing walking around and seeing the wonderful displays of Disney memoriblila! The pool areas are well maintained and staffed. Trader Sams bar is fun for late night treats with friends. It's located in the center of the 4 towers. The Rose Garden was beautiful for an event we attended. Steakhouse 55 is here at the hotel also! (Make reservations in advance!)  It was delishous! Goofy's Kitchen is also right here for a character

Very nice hotel.  Don't agree with some of the reviews that say the rooms are dated.  We had a double queen room on the 9th floor with club access.   It was spacious, clean, and in excellent condition.  Not dated at all.  Was by far the nicest hotel we stayed in on this trip compared to the Ramada, Hyatt, and Marriott hotels.  We checked in at 7:30 am.  Our room wasn't ready but they gave us keys.  They texted us with the room number when it was ready, around 1:30pm.  We went back around 3pm. I'm glad we checked in early as the registration  line was very, very LONG. Pros - easy 10-15 walk to the park, plenty of parking, early check-in even if room isn't ready, great fireworks viewing from the lounge on the 11th floor, Magic Hours.  Cons - not enough seating space in the pool

Great vacation but the lines were crazy and we had two rides break down after standing in line for an hour. Other then that the kids had a great time and the grounds were immaculately kept. Pools were great, food was just ok in the park.

Convenient location to Downtown Disney and parks.  Rooms in the Fantasy and Adventure towers are closest to the Downtown Disney promenade, Frontier tower has the same types of rooms just a bit further.  Each tower has loads of memorabilia about Disneyland and the respective lands each represents.  Granted it's expensive, but if you want an on property hotel there really aren't inexpensive options.  The pool is fun, just know that folks will reserve chairs early on and it really isn't monitored by the hotel.  So if you go - go early if you want chairs.  Trader Sam's is also nearby and another place you'll need to visit early if you want to eat/drink inside.  Even outside seating fills up in the early evening and late afternoon.  There are two Starbucks locations inside Downtown

Summary Heading: Comfy Rooms, Need More Pool Chairs
Summary: My family stayed here for 9 days recently and we thrilled we got a room with a "day bed" as my 10-yo son didn't want to share a bed with anyone so he got his own little space. Perfect! We were also lucky to get a room with the view of the fireworks. Lovely! We loved the convenience of the location, the room amenities were good, the air conditioning worked great (thankfully because it was so hot outside) and I used the free coffee maker in the room everyday. The kids and I shopped in their two onsite shops everyday for more than souvenirs - we needed to top up our toiletries and medicines too. The little coffee shop on site was super handy to buy muffins or pastries for our early morning starts and the quick service restaurant (Tarangoa Terrace) was a life saver a few times. Look

Guests are allowed to reserve lounge chairs around the pool for guests who are not there. Leaving parents who actually are there to sit on the floor to watch their kids in the pool. Management doesn't seem to do anything about it.

My family of six stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for a week in a two bedroom suite. It was beautifully  furnished with dark timber furniture, spacious, with a lounge area in between the two bedrooms. A single bed pulled out from in the TV unit in the lounge, plus there was a sofa bed as well as king bed and two queens. The bathrooms were quite small, but nice. It doesn't have a kitchenette, but most time is spent at the parks ,anyway and there are fabulous food choices at Downtown Disney. There is a coin laundry at the hotel when staying for a while with family.  It is about a ten minute walk through Downtown Disney to the main Disneyland entrance or you can catch the monorail by presenting your Disneyland tickets a little  inside Downtown Disney. The Hotel pools are fabulous.

This short couple-day stop at Disneyland brought back wonderful memories of spending my honeymoon there in 1964. Of course it has expanded more than 1000%!  We had a fun time enjoying the rides plus Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Nice resort in a great location
Summary: Our family of four, with a teenage son and daughter, stayed at this property for a few nights in July on mini-vacation. We are DVC members and relatively local, so we usually come here twice a year. This is a nice, pretty basic resort hotel but of course location is everything and its’ location adjacent to Downtown Disney and within a monorail ride or a walk to the parks is what sets it apart. The monorail is pretty reliable and reasonably uncrowded in the outbound direction, but the return trip is often overcrowded and the service closes on and off during certain events such as fireworks.  The walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland takes about ten minutes. We typically do walk, sometimes stopping to shop or snack. It is a pleasant stroll. We self-park the day we show up and

We used to come here and enjoy it. This time was different. We heard the rooms were renovated. They seem actually smaller to me, and dated. I see no evidence of an upgrade.    Our room service was late and then my daughter had an allergic reaction to it and broke into hives. The woman at the front desk smiled and said sorry, and offered to call the resort nurse. Not helpful.   Let me say that the service staff - those cleaning the rooms - were very kind, as were the clerks at the Disney store in the hotel lobby. They all showed concern and compassion for my daughter and told me to report the food allergy incident to the kitchen. Thanks to them!   Disneyland - you make enough money to care more about your guests. If someone left my home broken out in allergic hives, I would do

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for the Disney Experience
Summary: We throughly enjoyed our stay here!   The rooms were clean and well maintained and the hotel offered all the ammenities you would expect. It was really helpful to be so close to the parks too.  The kids loved the swimming pool and water slides.   The staff were friendly and helpful. We did the character dining experience at Goofy's kitchen and it was a great way for the kids to meet the original Disney characters.  Overall, a great place to stay!

Summary Heading: Hotel was meh, great location though
Summary: This hotel looks way more magical on the website photos and YouTube videos than it really is. I convinced my husband to stay here rather than Grand Californian because of it! I know it's the classic original Disney hotel, so that is cool, but the lobby and grounds are unimpressive at best. We had a park view room in Adventure tower, but it was at a far distance and beyond a parking lot and entrance to Downtown Disney. We could see the fireworks, though. My kids liked the firework lights over the bed (a fun touch!) but overall the place was average and the bathrooms and fixtures need updating. The location was very convenient to Downtown Disney and also the monorail. Can't beat it! I was also impressed by the amount of life guards at the pool, all rotating stations every 10

We had a wonderful stay in a one-bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel. The six of us in our party fit very comfortably into the spacious room with my husband and two daughters (ages 2 and 6) staying in the bedroom with two queens and my parents taking the fold out couch in the living room. Our room looked out over the pool area and inner courtyard which was a welcome view every morning and afternoon. And while it would have been nice to have two showers we were able to make due with the one as at least there were two toilets, one for the main living space and one for the bedroom. Oh and then there's the cool headboard in the bedroom with the light up castle and music that comes on with the press of a button. Very magical!  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower which is where reception

Summary Heading: One of the best holidays i've had!
Summary: we stayed in the Froniter tower at disneyland hotel. There were three towers and a amazing pool and waterslides that all of us really enjoyed. the pools were all different and the restaurants were great and all had really great food.

Great hotel. 10min walk to both disneyland parks. Stayed here 2 years ago and its still a very clean friendly place. A little dated but great pools and waterslides for all ages. Didnt think the club (they call it a concierge) lounge was worth it. Total lack of food -crackers and fruit apart from a basic breakfast and a canapes hour at night.

I recently visited the Disneyland hotel in Anaheim for a work conference. I hate to say this (because my experience was positive overall) but, I was not happy with the standard of the room. I was fortunate to have a discount conference rate. The rooms are what you would expect from a standard UK hotel chain. Twin queen beds, nice comfy bed and pillows, a tv, ample wardrobe space and a bathroom with a separate toilet. That being said, the facilities were not premium standard or the type I have experienced elsewhere in the world for that price.  I found the resort restaurants and shops to be quite pricey. If you are visiting for more than 3 days I think it would be difficult to find healthier options.  I want to highlight the exceptional service that I received from all of the

Summary Heading: The TRAN and The LOWERY Family Trips
Summary: The hotels was great, right in the heart of the Disneyland resort and the pool was awesome,they had a kids pool with slides and the only thing I would hope they fix is the monorail,  we were there two days in a row and both times it was broken

We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in the Frontier tower.  We originally requested one bedroom with 2 queens but got a king in each bedroom.   Disappointing one teenage boy had to sleep on the sofa but they survived and otherwise a beautiful well appointed and updated suite.  We also were supposed to have a downtown disney view - but what they call a view was suspect.   Housekeeping was fantastic and efficient.  Amenities ( pool, restaurants) looked amazing but we didn't get a chance to use them as we only had 2 days   Would definitely stay again on next trip.

The Disney Faithful will be thrilled with the Disneyland Hotel...there are all sorts of hidden Mickeys to look for in your room.  A headboard that lights up and plays the Disney theme tune with animated fireworks.  Pictures of Walt Disney all over the place.    The biggest attraction for me is the proximity to the tiki bar.  The monorail was closed during our visit, so we didn't save any steps being at this hotel.  It was comfortable, the beds are so sleep inducing (!), but there's not tons of  space in these rooms.  We had a nice view of the grounds....but I'm not one of the Disney Faithful...so I'd rather stay at the Hilton by the Convention Center (super sleek) or Candy Cane Inn (super quaint & well priced).

Summary Heading: Best Disney Hotel in Anaheim with Old School Cool
Summary: We've been to Disneyland (DL) every year for about 8 years in a row, since our littlest was 3. We've stayed at nearby neighborhood hotels, but mainly Disney's Grand Californian. This was our first time at the Disneyland Hotel. Given our propensity for staying at Disney properties, and assuming you, dear reader, are considering whether to go to the Grand or DL Hotel as well, this review focuses on the differences between the 2.   Let's be honest upfront, if price is a gating factor, go to a neighborhood hotel. Many are great. Some are just fine and great for the price. (I reviewed one about 6 years ago if interested just peruse my reviews.) The Disney hotels cost. Depending on time of year and day of week, prices will fluctuate but with these hotels you pay for experience. And by

We are staying here currently and while the proximity to the park is good, there is very little else going else for this hotel.   "Family rooms" at $500 a night are small and only top floors have balconies - need to request well in advance so we missed out. Cannot open windows so rooms are stuffy.  Also the monorail to the park is not regular and we were told coming home we would need to wait 45 mins so naturally we dragged our kids back on foot - annoying.   The food is just appalling. We are not used to eating sugary, fattening food every single meal. There is no healthy, tasty, alternatives here yet there doesn't seem to be the demand either.   No supermarket or convenience store nearby so bring supplies if you are going to be staying here.   Pool area is nice for kids but

We stayed here for one night and splurged on concierge level. It was so worth it for me. We arrived on a day that we did not plan on going into the parks so that we could enjoy the E-ticket lounge. We arrived just before their nightly snack time and planned it as just a snack. We ate so much that we just a snack later. My daughter said that she was in heaven with the fruit and meat skewers. We then visited the pool and monorail water slides areas. They were so much fun! Our room was super Disneyfied, and we loved it. Our windows were full length, and we had a great view of the pool.  Our family enjoyed looking for all of the Mickeys in our room. We also visited the e-ticket lounge for fireworks and dessert. We had our own dessert party, and it was perfect to only have to go down

I was recently diagnosed with ALS.  Travel has become much more difficult, but the hotel was very accommodating!  We also had great view of the fireworks from our 10th floor room!  The staff worked hard to make our trip special!

My husband and I enjoy several trips to Disneyland each year but our splurge is always for our anniversary. We've stayed at both Paradise Pier and the Grand Californian but the Disneyland Hotel is the one we feel a special connection to. It has a nostalgic feel but everything is updated. We enjoy being able to hop onto the Monorail so conveniently to either go into the park or get back to the hotel after walking all day. It can be a bit of a hike from the hotel to California Adventure but not bad if you're a hardcore Disneyland person. The rooms are always clean, the pool is spacious, and the restaurants are all very good. My favorite part is the magical headboard. °o°

On my recent girl's trip to Disneyland with four of my best friends, we decided to stay at the slightly less expensive Disneyland Hotel, which is still onsite but not inside the park like The Grand Californian. My favorite thing about the Disneyland Hotel hands-down is the magical headboard. If it was appropriate for grown women to have such a headboard, we all agreed we would want one. With the touch of a button, the fireworks light up, the stars twinkle, and it sings you a lullaby. Can you say magical? My niece would go bananas! The Disney touches all over the hotel are really adorable.  The layout of the room was superb for a group of women too. There was actually a well-lit vanity area in the hallway, a large desk with mirror next to the TV, and the toilet separate from the

Summary Heading: Disney Magic Made a Believer Out of Me
Summary: I went to Disneyland for the first time last July, when I was 46 years old. My daughter had been with her dad for one-day trips, and my husband grew up in L.A., so they were both familiar. I grew up on Disney, the Wonderful World of Disney on ABC, I had the subscription Disney books of the 70’s, saw all of the movies, had all of the toys.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and were there for 5 magical days. We had difficulty with our flights and missed our first day at the hotel, during the busy season.   Not only did they extend my night missed to add another day, but they upgraded us to a premium room because of our woes.  That was the beginning of what was one of our best family memories.  To be immersed in a place where I had no worries, where everyone seems in a good mood,

Summary Heading: A Good Stay -- But not a "Magical" One
Summary: Our stay began with a 20 minute wait at check-in, at which we were assigned an occupied room.  We waited in line for 20 minutes a second time to get this corrected, as cast members appeared from behind the check-in desk...only to scurry back into hiding.  Once checked in, the stay went better.  However, even though the monorail was closed, the hotel offered no transportation to the park.  As two members of our party are partially disabled, the 1.1 mile walk to the parks was inconvenient, and had we stayed at one of the "neighborhood hotels" we would have saved about $300/night and had a shorter hike to the parks.  Guests should check the monorail status at the time of booking.  While most of the service was up to Disney standards, there were occasional glitches with housekeeping

We normally stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel and enjoy our time there very much. However, this year with the new security areas in place, staying at the Paradise Pier Hotel would have cost about 15 more minutes of walking to get to the parks. You can no longer walk through The Grand Californian from there, so we opted to stay at The Disneyland Hotel for a little more money. My husband is a big fan of Disney history, so he was excited to stay in the hotel that was original to the park. Since we need a room with a Daybed, we chose the Disneyland Hotel over the Grand Californian. We heard it is sometimes not possible to get that extra bed there, and we have 5 people so we definitely need it.  In the Fantasy Tower of the Disneyland Hotel, there are many pictures and shadow boxes

Summary Heading: Spacious Room in the Heart of the Magic
Summary: Our family of 4, including 16yo daughter and 15yo son, stayed at the DisneyLand Hotel for 3 nights. We found the room to be spacious and modern with plenty of room for the four of us.   We stayed in the Frontier Tower and had two double beds and one fold-out couch that was quite comfortable so our son and daughter did not have to share a bed. The design of the fold-out bed left plenty of room to move around. Room included a small fridge, separate desk and closet area so our daughter/son could dress with some privacy, and a great view of the pool.   Bathroom is a good size but would be a little more manageable for a family of four if it had dual sinks. But there is a storage shelf under the sink with plenty of space and a large vanity for everyone's toiletries.  The hotel is just

The room was large and the beds comfortable.  The backboard was fun as it lit up  The bathroom was large & beautiful.  Housekeeping was great.  The Hotel is beautiful and the restaurant was very good.  Had a memorable time!!!

My boyfriend an I stayed at the adventure tower Disneyland hotel last week and it was great! We were on the 9th floor with such a nice view overlooking the pools An such. The room was spacious with a big king bed an it was so comfy. There's a lil fridge An big tv.. on the beds headboard there are fireworks and you press the button on the lamp an it lights them up and plays music! We were late checking out but we called them an they were very nice about it and said 20 mins was not a problem at all.. they are very nice staff! And the walk to downtown Disney is not bad at all it's maybe 5-8 minute walk, an then Disney parks are prob like a 15-20 min walk if the monorail isnt working..Overall was a great stay deff want to go back!

We booked this knowing the reviews were only okay but felt it was a must for our first family vacation to Disneyland. The Hotel is only ok and we were surprised with the lack of Disney activities at the property, we expected to see characters etc. Having said that Goofy's Restaurant was great fun. I'm sure there are better properties close by (which we would consider for a second visit) but the hotel is convenient to Downtown Disney and we are still glad we chose this hotel.

Summary Heading: Wonderful location, nice rooms, customer service needs some work
Summary: Our party of seven arrived early. We were greeted promptly at the front desk and left our luggage with the bellhop. After having lunch and spending some time in Downtown Disney, the resort texted that our rooms were ready. Five of us were staying in a three-bedroom suite. I did not care for their suite set up as it was basically one suite with two adjoining bedrooms. Having two children, 5 years old and 2 years old, did not work well with the room layout. One evening they accidentally closed one of the adjoining doors locking us all out of that bedroom, which happened to be the one they were sleeping in. Luckily, they were locked on the same side as the adults because it took a long time before anyone arrived to help us get back in. Since the deadbolt to the main door was

Recently stayed 5 days at Disneyland Hotel. a great experience, the hotel has two types of staff, those that care and those that think and act as if the guest is an interruption to their work. Went for dinner one night at 7pm and advised by a staff member " come back at 8pm and I will let you know if a table will be available, about to leave very disappointed with that staff members attitude when Jeremy stepped in suggested we have a drink and a snack at the bar and as soon as a table was available he would let us know, 20 minute's later we were sitting down at a table, Jeremy really cared about his guests, it was a really pleasant experience and Jeremy also provide two glasses of fine wine gratis. Next morning went down for breakfast at 10.50am to a restaurant tat advertised

We stayed there as a part of a business conference.  The staff was very friendly.  The room was spacious and had lots of space for sharing with other family members (if necessary).  My only complaint was with the prices for small stuff like water.  I spent  $4 for a bottle of water.

Summary Heading: Kid friendly, adult friendly..... GREAT STAY!
Summary: We had a great experience that last few days at the Disneyland Hotel. Upon arrival, we were treated as "special guests" and were addressed immediately by the Valet Service and the Bell Service. Check in was smooth but it did take a few hours to wait for our room. Just be forewarned: the hotel is a bit pricey (a bit overpriced in my opinion since you don't spend that much time in the room......)  The room was quite large, with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. We had terrific views of Downtown Disney. The beds were very comfortable and the room was impeccably clean.  The pool area was GREAT! (One day, the larger of the 2 pools was closed due to an unknown reasons, but they did explain the pool would reopen in due time, which it did). There were 2 hot tubs and 2 waterslides for

Staying at a hotel that's a stroll away from Disneyland is located made me feel like  a little kid again. It is totally wonderful and exciting, Anyone who has been to Disneyland would for sure feel the same way I do. Disneyland Hotel is great; however, a little flaw from the service desk needs improvement. The room that was reserved for us was apparently given to another guests who were shocked to see us unlocking the door. What a mess!

We had a fantastic experience in the Fantasy Tower.  Very comfortable, quiet and clean room, and excellent customer service.  We arrived from the airport around 11am, expecting to store our luggage until check-in time at 4pm, and much to my shock, they had our room ready for us!  Dinner at Goofy's Kitchen was a highlight of our trip for my 10 year old son as was swimming in the pools with the monorail water slides!  It is expensive, but keep in mind, this a resort, with resort amenities and park perks, not just a basic hotel.

We stayed here for a short visit to California adventure with my 11 and 9 yr old. They did us an early check in. Room was full of interesting Mickey details. Loved the pool area although we did not have time to jump in it.  When i booked standard view it though I was getting a parking lot view... we got a nice pool view instead. The headboard plays music and illuminates at night!  A bit on the high price, but we got extra magical hours which are so worth it, we got a 10% discount coupon for several restaurants and also lanyards, souvenir tickets and free 7x5 picture. We got a spring offer with tickets included. We did not eat at the hotel so I'm not sure how the restaurants are.  Would definitely stay here again.

The Disneyland Hotel, being the medium priced Disney hotel option, is a good choice for being near the parks.  The rooms and pretty, very Disney-esque (lovely light up mural of Magic Kingdom for the headboard), and practical for even 4 people in the room.  Their bathrooms are wisely appointed w/ opaque shower curtain, door for toilet room, and multiple mirrors so several people can use it at once w/ a little coordination.  The pool area is lovely w/ lots of mature tropical growth.  They also provide life jackets, and since the pool is around 4' deep, is very good for youngsters.  I was surprised one day when the main pool was closed for the entire day that they did not offer guests keys to either the Grand CA or the Paradise Pier hotel.  The PP hotel is also a lovely option for

Summary Heading: Going downhill but prices still going up
Summary: We have been staying at the Disneyland Hotel for the past 18 yrs and have noticed the decline in friendliness, cleanliness, and the overall Disney experience.  This last stay May 10th - 13th, 2017 was the same.  Stains on my bedsheets (reddish, gross) and it was around 1am when I returned, husband was already asleep on his side so I didn't want to call housekeeping to come change it. I did however go to the front desk to advise, was nice enough to do a one time credit on our bill.  We also tried to have dinner at Trader Sams, waited over 15 min, no help,so we left.  Manager didn't do or say anything which is not what we experienced in the early visits.  Was still a nice little vacation. They just have to get that Disney way back!!! They should issue a voucher discount for guests

When judging a hotel, I look at four things: 1) quietness, 2) bed comfort, 3) location and access, and 4) cleanliness.  On our recent stay, Disneyland Hotel score low on all of these.    On our second day, we were awakened at 4:00 am by loud music and amplified yelling.  Apparently, races were scheduled that weekend and both the start and finish lines were below our room.  We requested to be placed in a new room that was not near an elevator and quiet.  After waiting 12 hours, we were given a new room.  Unfortunately, the noise from upstairs was very loud, as we could hear constant running and banging.    Bed comfort was not great.  In our original room were well-worn, and sloped in the middle.  It was apparent that the mattresses had not been changed in a long time.    While

Summary Heading: Usual great Disney service, hotel needs a bit of work
Summary: Was attending a business convention in this hotel.  The highlight of staying in a Disney hotel is always the good level of service from the staff.  This time it was no different - everybody is very helpful and efficient.   Example was that when I checked out I left something in my room - when I went back to the front desk (a few hours later) they had the item for me instantly.  The room had some interesting Disney touches - the illuminated castle above the bed was interesting (if a little surprising the first time you think you are going to switch on the bedside lamp).   The level of "Disney" in the rooms was about right - not too overdone like some of the hotels in Florida.     The facilities were good - nice pool area, good cafe and restaurant (if a little too small for the

I've never stay here. This a great hotel. It's quite. I see so many baby strollers. The front desk was outstanding. They were a great help to me. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were soft. The bathroom is what I desired access able bathroom.

We are from Florida and used to staying at Disney properties in Orlando so we decided to spend a little more and stay at a Disney resort rather than one of the non Disney properties. The main reason was we wanted to be able to go for the magic hour which was great. We checked in around 4 PM and the process was quick and our room was ready. We had a corner room in the Frontier Tower that was really nice. We went to the pools a few times which were busy during the day, but you could always find chairs. Only downside was the monorail was down during our stay, so we had to do some additional walking to get to the parks. Overall the resort is what we expected from Disney and glad we stayed there.

Summary Heading: Exceedingly expensive, but probably worth it
Summary: We stayed one night with our 3 kids in the room with us. We did not have dinner or breakfast at the hotel.   Kids loved the pool and the slides. Water warm and pleasant. The weather was overcast and cook when we there so the warmth of the water was very much appreciated. We wish we had gone to Goofy's kitchen. When we walked by we say the restaurant full of Disney characters and the kids were mesmerized. We had already eaten, sadly.   We felt Disney had done a pretty good job of turning 3 old fashioned ugly hotel towers into something approaching what you would expect. Cool carpets and fittings. But its still a dumpy hotel tower from bygone times with tiny bathroom and low ceilings.  Hotel really very situated for park access. A short walk from the room and you are in the

Summary Heading: The Original is still the Best
Summary: If you want relaxation after the chaos of the parks, the first hotel at the Disneyland Resort is your best bet.  Spacious and beautiful rooms that are well appointed and tastefully decorated based upon the tower that you are staying.  Lots of nostalgia to be found for the Walt Disney fan. Trader Sam's is great for a quick and tasty bite.  The terrace bar overlooks the pool and is lively with great food and drinks and all with an Adventureland vibe.  An easy walk to the parks or take the monorail into Disneyland.  Great resort for couples or families.

They had updated the rooms and 5 slept quite well in the room.  The front concierge was more than helpful in getting organized and getting what we wanted.  There are 3 pools.  Not huge, but offer a decent variety.  Water slide is not crazy, but fun.  THe hot tubs are like most hot tubs, crowded with kids who have no reason to take a bathroom break.  The lifeguards are very serious and keep a keen eye on the pool. The hotel is located right outside Downtown Disney.  So, plenty of places to pick to eat.  It helps to get in an hour earlier.  Hotel was clean and easy to navigate.  Bathroom's updated.  It was a different angle to watch the fireworks, but the music on the fireworks channel syncs to the fireworks.  Stars for ceiling lights and headboards are just some of the nice

Summary Heading: Clean and tidy, helpful staff loved magic mornings.
Summary: We got exactly as we were expecting for Disneyland hotel. Room was tidy and clean, fantastic view over the pool area from the frontier tower. Fantastic little Mickey features throughout the room. Kids all loved the pool area.  The biggest benefit of staying onsite is definitely magic mornings at the park and while we liked the hotel this would be the biggest reason we would come back to any Disneyland hotel onsite.

From May 23 - 25, we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, for the first time. As this was for two intense days of meetings for my wife, we did not go to visit Disneyland, and did not even get beyond the hotel property, and “Downtown Disney.”  We were to arrive late, so had a late check-in scheduled. Southwest Airlines had issues with our flight, so “late” became “very late,” and we called to confirm that with the hotel. Confirmation acknowledged. We had a room waiting for us, but the beds were wrong, so the agent spent some time on the computer, and found us a room with a King bed. Nice service, especially considering the hour.  We were assigned room 2246, on the 4th floor of the Adventure Tower. The Disneyland Hotel is historic, in that it was the first motel/hotel property to bear

This place is wonderful. My family arrived Friday and stayed for about a week. Everyone is so kind and welcoming. The staff helped answer our many questions and gave us great recommendations. The hotel itself was beautiful and family friendly, obviously! I cannot wait to visit again.

We loved our stay at the Disney land Hotel.  We chose it for its close proximity to Disneyland, so we could walk to all the parks and Downtown Disney, and for its pools and water slides.  The water was a little cool in January so it would have been better if it was heated.  My son enjoyed the pools still but it was a little cool for us the parents.  The room we had was very spacious and we loved the views over the pools towards Disneyland.  The musical headboards were a great touch.  We enjoyed a meal at Goofy''s Kitchen and this being located in the hotel made it so easy for a family with young kids.  We loved the very helpful staff and the large gift shop as well.  We would definitely recommend this hotel to any family going to Disneyland.

Booked this hotel for 2 nights using 40% off offer from Disney.  This was our 2nd stay at this property.  Arrived on a Sunday morning, check in didn't take more than 20 minutes including the purchase of our park tickets and complimentary  special photo and pin for my daughter's birthday.
