Received "room ready" text almost immediately but headed to the park to get the day started. There is an entrance to Downtown Disney right near the hotel, and we found that security moved quicker since they moved the checkpoints to the Downtown Disney entrances  vs. the main gates.   We found the room to be spacious and clean. We stayed in the Fantasy Tower, room overlooked the pool. Everything in the room was in working order and housekeeping on point. No issues with elevator availability at

Summary Heading: One Advantage I Hadn't Seen Others Mention in the Pro/Con Lists
Summary: As anyone who has spent 2 seconds researching hotel options around Disneyland can tell you, there are endless debates about whether it is worth it to stay at a Disney property vs somewhere else.  No question, cost is a major contributing factor in the decision making process, but I'm going to by-pass a discussion specifically about price and move on to other comments.  After all, "worth it" is relative and completely up to you.  My husband and I came to southern California for a specific event and decided to be shameless tourists for a few extra days for our visit.  I suggested Disneyland and he couldn't have been more resistant to the idea.  He was firmly of the opinion that Disneyland is for young kids, or families with young kids, only.  However, we had settled on Anaheim as

As summer approaches, many families are planning a visit to the Magic Kingdom in Anaheim, CA.  Our advice is to stay at a Disney property!  We used to recommend The Grand Californian, but our last visit there was a big let down.  We do not know what changed from our previous, excellent experiences (management maybe?) but we knew that we did not want to return (paying top dollar) for a stay and not be happy.  Last year we tried The Disneyland Hotel, recently redone, and loved it.  So, this year we returned and, again, we had another wonderful experience.  Staying at any of the three Disney properties is a little more costly than the neighboring motels/hotels but it is worth every penny for the location and the service.  The Disneyland Hotel is ideal for families (we were visiting

First time staying at Disneyland hotel and first time at Disneyland. The staff were fantastic from checkin, mousekeeping and anyone in between. When we arrived it was a bit early for checkin but the lady managed to find a room for us as we had travelled from Aus and gave all of us a first time Disney pin.  Location was fantastic, close to everything. Rooms were spacious for a family of 4 with 10 and 15 yr, layout great and very quite. Rooms were very clean. The best was meeting some of the Disney characters and getting an autograph and photo. Pool area was great for kids, especially the slide and there was also spots for mum and dad to sit back, relax and watch the kids. We will definitely return.

I thought the hotel overall was quite nice. It was convenient to the 2 parks and the restaurants on-site were good. The pool looked amazing and the lobby was quite fun. We took pictures in the giant tea cups and looked at the nostalgic memorabilia. The character buffet was very good and the coffee shop now sells dole whips with rum. The staff were friendly and everyone was accommodating. Now for the room. We paid for a room with 2 beds and a Downtown Disney view. The view was great. We were able to see the fire works and California Adventure all lit up. The headboard that sings and lights up is quite cute. The Wi-Fi is super crappy. It just hardly works. The beds were a bit on the soft side. I was quite disappointed they gave me a handicap room. The shower was confusing to

We stayed in Frontier Tower and we were really happy because we got a view of the waterpark and it was amazing. It has great service and you get your one souvenir room key and the adults can use there key to be a credit card. It was one of the best hotels.

Jeff B has already written THE definitive review of the Disneyland Hotel (see below and take notes) .....well done Jeff!....so I won't repeat.  However, the Disneyland Hotel is the perfect choice for a Disneyland vacation. You just can't get more conveniently close to the action, yet it's a thoroughly relaxing, comfortable, clean, amenities-full hotel with a staff that is friendly, responsive, efficient and accommodating.Contrary to what happens in many large theme park hotels, our room was cleaned and replenished every morning without fail and always ready for our return.  As runners in the Pixie Dust Challenge we could not believe how convenient this hotel was for the 5:30 am start of the races; nor how great it was to be back at our hotel within minutes to change. En route to

We stayed in the Adventure wing, which is the closest to the park entrance of the four buildings.  The room was very comfortable, though pricey.  We were glad to be close by when the kids got tired though.  There was adequate room in the bathroom for toiletries, the bed was very comfortable.  We had a view of the pool so we could not see the fireworks from our room.  The kids loved the pool- there were several lifeguards available too so there was no rough housing at the pool.

Summary Heading: A Stay at the Magic Kingdom
Summary: If you're a big Disney fan, and I'm guessing you are, since you've read this far; A stay at the Disneyland Hotel is a must.   At least once in your life.  Plan your visit wisely, though, since there are some perks in the hotel, and definitely perks for staying at the hotel.  We stayed in a King room in the Frontier Tower.   It's at the 'back' of the property, but it doesn't feel like it.    From the front of the Fantasy tower, which is the main building, you go straight through the lobby to the courtyard, then keep walking; either left past the Adventure Tower and Trader Sams (more about that later) or right past the coffee shop, where you can buy Dole Whip, with rum.    Yes!   With Rum!   But only until 4:00pm, so you may have to start your day with this delight.  Here's some

In March, 2017 my husband and I took our daughter, son-in-law and two kids, ages 7 and 4 to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite with two queen beds and a pull out couch.  My daughter and her family stayed in the bedroom and my husband and I slept on the pull out couch.  I must say I wasn't too excited to sleep on the pull out couch but It was pretty comfy. it had a memory foam mattress.  I woke up with no pain.  Yeah!!.  It was the perfect place to say for our two nights.  The room was clean and the location was close enough to walk to the park.  I wish we could have stayed longer because the pool looked amazing but it was expensive. Two nights and then we were off to San Diego.  I would defiantly stay again.  I would suggest that if

Summary Heading: Very comfortable rooms and great views
Summary: We got a room in the Adventure Tower and were really happy, until a "horrible band" was playing at downtown Disney, they relied on base for their music vice talent and it reverberated throughout the hotel. Many of the guest we talked to wished they would stop.  Great location, comfortable beds.  Not as accessible as the Grand Californian, but still an outstanding hotel.  If you can, stay here.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, walking distance to everything
Summary: Our room was elegant and spacious, with a touch of Disney magic. We arrived early and asked to store our luggage. The staff found a room and allowed us to check in early so we could enjoy the park. We needed a handicap accessible room, and it had everything we needed, including enough space to accommodate a motorized wheelchair. Nice pool and several restaurants to choose from. We ate at the Tikki themed one that was open late. If you want to have breakfast at Goofy's kitchen, make reservations in advance as it is popular. Walking distance to Downtown Disney and the entrance to both Disneyland and California Adventure. Room service was friendly and the food was good.

Although this is a really nice hotel is it very expensive.  If you are just after a room to lay your head, then I would go for some of the neighborhood hotels that are way cheaper and can be closer to walk to the parks. I like to enter Disneyland from the front entrance to get the full experience, but you can go by monorail which is closer. Stayed here once for the experience but will return to my regular hotel due to price.  If you're not worried about price, then this hotel is a really nice and clean place.

Magical, beautiful, True Disney Style!! Disney is all about giving their "guests" a Magical service. here you can become a kid again and enjoy your kids, make beautiful memories together that will last you a life time, enjoy  & share childhood TOGETHER!... This place is beautiful, staff very helpful, beds are very comfortable, you are one step away from downtown Disney so everything is very convenient, Goofy's kitchen is a great experience specially for breakfast when Characters come to your table, & at times perform and dance with the kids! Staying here is truly doing a Disney trip the way it should be done...  here you can really feel that you are living a dream, submerged in  a Disneyland Fantasy, we all need to disconnect from all the stress in our daily lives (at least for

Family trip to Disneyland in April. Stayed in a 3 bedroom suite. Always a delight, grandkids loved the pool. Wonderful access to parks and downtown Disney. Quite and comfortable, slept like a rock...of course 10 miles walking each day probably helped also. First choice for trips to D-land.

Excellent hotel. Staff was always very pleasant.Room was large, with 2 queen size beds, and it was clean. Very quiet, even though we were close to the elevators. Food at Goofy's Kitchen was excellent. We were there once for breakfast and once for dinner and were very pleased with food and service.  Very close to Downtown Disney and to the parks.

The hotel staff was amazing!! We arrived early and didn't expect our room to be ready so we were just going to leave our bags and begin exploring but instead we were told there was a room ready that we could have that would be an upgrade with no charge! Love the unexpected magic. Having Downtown Disney right outside of the hotel was so convenient and then the parks were a little bit further but all within walking distance, was perfect. There is a large store that we did our last minute shopping at before going home. Very nice selection of items. We also tried Goofys Kitchen for breakfast with the characters because it is right in the Disneyland Hotel. Good food, fun time, great memories! We would definitely go back to this hotel.

We got a suite for our family. The rooms were clean the hotel personnel were very helpful. We arrived after 9:00pm and had requested late check in. It took us a few minutes for the manager to arrive and give us our room. Once we were in it was magical. Located a few steps to Disneyland, very convenient.  You have to make reservation for Goofy's Kitchen, it is a blast.

Summary Heading: A really great location for a magical family vacation
Summary: We traveled with small children to Disneyland in May, we selected this hotel because of the location and with the hope that we could return and give the two smaller  children a nap.  Upon check in we were given the opportunity to select a tower, not knowing which to select we went with the Fantasy tower, which is where the main check in desk is.  The rooms were adjoining to facilitate our group and really very spacious.  Keeping the hallway door closed for security and propping open our two doors allowed the two year old twins room to play and run.  We never did return to the room for naps but we did return for swimsuits because the pools are awesome!  The four kids must have used the slides 100 times.  Even the two year old's were able to go down the slides, I was impressed

Summary Heading: Disney Magic touches thoughout your stay with easy access to park and early park entry
Summary: We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before several years ago the headboard with lights that look like fireworks and play when you wish upon a star really add that special touch, like mickey's everywhere from the faucets to being part of the carpet design. Goofy's kitchen and the 55 steakhouse were both excellent.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, room service needs some help...
Summary: We had a standard view room with a view of the parking lot.  We could see the top of Space Mountain off to one side.  We tried to order room service, but gave up after calling repeatedly and never getting through to someone to place our order.  The walk to the park is about 10 minutes.  There was some sort of cheerleader competition at Disneyland while we were there, so the hotel was very full.

Great stay. You definitely get the Disney feel when you walk in. Location is great, not as great as the Grand Californian but almost there. The rooms and common areas are really good (magical feeling) Staff is nice but I feel they could do a little bit more to get you a room a little bit earlier than 3PM. Specially when you are checking in at 7am with small children. At the Grand Californian we got a room at 11am while at DH is always right after 3pm. Expensive of course but completely worth it.

On our trip to Disneyland we decided to try this hotel for the first time. Not a disappointment. The rooms were neat and clean. Food options for breakfast were close and good. Highly recommend this hotel.

When we arrived the room we had booked wasn't available and the only option staff (rudely) provided was to take a smaller room that didn't work well for our family. Despite staying on weekdays out of school holidays the main restaurants at the hotel (Goofy's Kitchen and Steakhouse 55) were fully booked both nights and we couldn't get into either. Likewise when we tried to book a Canbana by the pool and a late checkout, fully booked / too hard. This place is a holiday factory with huge throughput. Staff were generally frazzled and rude when we asked for help. The rooms are now quite dated and need a refresh. Most of the hotel waterpark was closed due to water quality issues on the afternoon we tried to use it. The hotel location is great, just across the road from Downtown

Summary Heading: The only way to vacation at Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is classic and magic! I spent my young life visiting Disneyland at a local hotel to avoid "high priced" stays. As an adult, I got an opportunity to spend my honeymoon at the Disneyland Resort Hotel and I was HOOKED. The price is not exceptional for the amenities you receive. The premium Downtown Disney view room is the BEST for the money. You get all the accomidations (terry cloth robe, cable tv, refrigerator, and exceptionally large bathroom) plus an amazing view of downtown Disney! What does that mean? Music! People! And the glowing ambiance of both Disneyland and California Adventure. The best part?! If you get tuckered out before the midnight fireworks...you can enjoy them from the comfort of your hotel room! The window is the best seat in the house! I highly

Very nice hotel with a hefty price tag.  Service is excellent. Front desk cast member Peggy went above and beyond to assist me.    we have a nice view of Downtown Disney.  Close to the parks as well.  Room is good size, double sinks in bathroom.  Mini fridge and coffee/tea in room.?

Summary Heading: Short business trip to the magical kingdom
Summary: The Check-in was super, I gt a whole bunch of extra stuff for my non-present kids which was extremely nice of them. However, breakfast at Trader Sam was awful... WiFi good throughout. The continuous happy music being played slowly grinds you down and as I was there without my kids it started getting really annoying after three days! The Bar was very good with three draft beers and good snacks.

Summary Heading: Fun family trip to a Disneyland,
Summary: A magical place!  Great proximity to the parks- very convenient.  We had 3 adjoining rooms on the 11 th floor and we took advantage of the E Ticket room right down the hall.  It was $225 a extra day but we had breakfast (continental style each am, they had peanut butter jelly sandwich and snacks to take to the park, they had cold water and ice to fill our water bottles for the day-when we returned they had cookies, beer, wine and appetizers.  Our rooms were nice-a tad dated-carpet in the halls is a little worn but overall nice.  We were in the middle room and our bathroom was a little small but it worked.  One room had a living/ dining type room which was good for our group of 6 adults and 2 kids.  We watched the firework show in the park from our room the 1st night-great view.

Summary Heading: Dreams are what the Heart wishes for :)
Summary: The location of the property is excellent , especially if you want to reach the park early to beat the lines . The room was very clean and well appointed . It had some fantastic touches like the Mickey Mouse taps, the lighted up Disney castle bed head board , Pillows with Disney quotes etc ...We could also see the evening fireworks from our room . The staff at check in was super helpful and the B/f at Goofy's  kitchen was fantastic. Where else can you eat a choclate nutella pizza :) . Its worth the extra $$ if you traveling with family just for the convenience. Like they say Dreams are what the heart wishes for !

It is a dream come true at the Disneyland Hotel They went all out to make you have a magical experience even when your tired and ready for dreams  So neat and tidy friendly staff always there in a flash  We stayed at the pioneer it gave a touch of the OLD style Disney I remember from the 70s  Goofy 's Kitchen is there for a character breakfast fit for everyone  Lots of little surprises and they never stop  Worth the $

Cons: Does not feel like Disney at all, the lobby could be any hotel. Disney hotels in Orlando are over the top Disney, this is what you want. Not here. Storage space in the room was crazy small, barely enough for 2 people, just a small cupboard and a few drawers.  The rooms have no Disney feel at all, it is such dark furniture and fittings you really have to look to find the Disney decor. The sink is not in the bathroom, very strange idea. Bathroom decor very dated. The lovely Tiki bar with live music, impossible to get a seat. The music is outside, only a handful of seats outside, and you can't reserve them. Parking cost is crazy for hotel guests, especially when we already paid over $3000 to stay there. They want to make your celebration special, ask if you are celebrating,

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for three days.  Including ourselves we had nine family members with us and we booked a three bedroom suite.  The room was absolutely perfect as it provided each of three families with their own room, shower and bathroom and a large common area with couch, kitchen and living room and desk so we could all be together.  The rooms were of a sufficient size.    I highly recommend staying at this hotel and its convenience makes it easy to make multiple trips to and from the park throughout the day and evening.  The staff has been incredible.  We also added on access for the club lounge which they refer to a E Ticket Lounge.  They have expanded their breakfast offerings since we stayed here last year and a big hit with the children are the Mickey

It was wonderful from beginning to end. My sister and I took a sister's trip to Disneyland in January 2017. We stayed in the Adventure tower on the sixth floor with a view of the pool. We found an elevator at the far end of the hallway which was closer to our room and much faster than the main elevator because no one seemed to know that the elevator was there.The room was large. It could accommodate two electric scooters charging at night without being in the way. We ordered scooters from a local company and they were waiting for us when we arrived. The view of the pool and the grounds at the hotel was beautiful. We did not swim because it was January! But we did see a few people swimming. The bag check for Disneyland is right outside the hotel before you enter Downtown Disney.

First off, the check -in guy that helped us was completely rude.  He didn't seem like he wanted to help us, and when we asked him questions about the magic hour, he referred us to the brochure.  When we asked about the 1st time visit button, he told us to go to the pin store.  We then asked a female staff member who gladly explained everything to us, and even gave my kids the 1st visit button.  As for the room, it was small.  We booked a premium downtown Disney view room with 2 queen beds.  We opened our curtains and saw that 4 huge palm trees were directly in our view.  We barely could even see downtown Disney.  The beds were terrible, both of them sloop to one side.    For the amount of money you fork over to stay at a Disney Resort, it was not worth it.

This is very much a Park resort hotel, but we were there for business, so you never feel quite the same as the people on holiday. However, the room was excellent, large and had everything we wanted. The quality of amenities and furnishing were good.   We had an issue with a bad odour in the toilet, it improved when engineering attended to it, but did not fully disappear. Our room was on the corner facing Downtown Disney, so very noisy at night until the bands finished. Would not recommend this corner of the hotel.   I had to print a document and felt that $7 for two sheets of paper was a bit steep, not used to having to pay for printing in hotels.  The resort amenities are generally good and we were pleased that breakfast was served in the Steak House for those that just wanted

Summary Heading: Mickey and magic are hidden everywhere
Summary: Great stay, awesome location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable beds.  Look it's expensive for what it is, but this was our first visit to Disneyland and we were very happy.  The reception was lack lustre, but that had more to do with the shouting guest and lack of double double rooms for her party than my receptionist. It for take the shine off the arrival. However, that was the last of it... Very happy with everything after that.  Goofy's breakfast was incredible (and sickening sweet) but do much fun. Had the kids with us, would recommend pre booking. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Definitely go on an empty stomach with no subsequent food plans, as ttys is an indulgent breakfast buffet with an opportunity to meet lots of characters.  We also had drinks and food at Trader Sam's.

Clean hotel within a reasonable walk to the theme parks through Downtown Disney.   I liked that it was an easy walk to Disneyland without having to take the monorail or bus like at Disney World.   The other nice feature is that hotel guests go through security to the parks before entering Downtown Disney so there is no wait with the day trippers.   The hotel room was clean but we had a not so nice view of a roof.  The pool area was nice, but it had to be closed twice because of ducks flying into the pool.   Also, the pool slide area was closed because of a private party which was a bummer because we really only had one free afternoon at the pool.

Nice, comfortable, clean, close to the park. I enjoyed the pool area and the outdoor bar/patio area at night.  This is a great  place.  I have since stayed at the Grand Californian which was awesome, but the disneyland hotel is more affordable and not that much further.  There's a monorail that will take you into tomorrow land.

I had read all the reviews before going and found this resort to be perfect! We had an amazing view and the rooms were quiet and secluded. I adored the artful headboards and the lullaby music when the lights were off! They brought the magic into the rooms and we enjoyed our stay here very much.

Summary Heading: A great hotel that cares for its guests
Summary: We often check in late and the night crew are great at getting us to our room quickly so we can get to sleep and into the parks the next day (really the same day!). This trip Jennifer helped much as our requested room type wasn't available so she set us up with another room and a room-change in the morning, along with a sincere apology for the mixup. Ends up the new room was even nicer than what we had requested, leaving us happy to stay in our new room.

Stayed here for one night. The hotel looks like an office building (inside and out). Rooms are fine. Location is good - it's at the entrance to Downtown Disney, and a short walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. Service was pretty bad. When checking in, desk clerk informed me that my "room had been downgraded". I booked a specific room months ago, but apparently they overbooked and gave me a suboptimal room, because that's what they had left. I was very surprised, and the desk clerk couldn't have cared less. I bought park tickets from him, and he provided a very confusing explanation of when the parks opened. When staying @ the hotel, you can get in to California Adventure an hour before it's open to the public. Clerk failed to mention that you need your room key, as well

Summary Heading: Based on Nostalgia this is My Favorite Disney Hotel
Summary: Believe it or not my first experience with the Disneyland Hotel was in the late 1970s when I could spot the actors from the New Mickey Mouse Club walking by the pool. It only had the main building.  I have watched two renovations as an adult with the most recent being the relatively new Monorail slide area and the loss of the waterfalls and Peter Pan theming.  This trip we stayed in the Frontier Tower although I have also enjoyed the Adventure Tower.  Although it was spring break we did not find it overly crowded.  We ate dinner at Tangaroa Terrace but could easily have snacked and drank from the adjacent tables at Trader Sam's.  I am a vegetarian and found healthy as well as tasty options.  The pools were full but we found lounge chairs easily.  Starbucks at Downtown Disney was

Summary Heading: It ain't cheap, but a must do for any hard core Disney fan
Summary: When you are a Disney junky like me, you are typically visiting the mouse every three or four years. Knowing that we were only going to be there for a few days, I wanted to make the most out of every minute.  Sure, we could have went Good neighbor, but if you are going the most OG of Disney parks, it just felt right to check out the most OG of Disney hotels. So we booked the Disneyland hotel and I'm glad we did.  Comfort, service and Disney immersion punches you right in the face when you walk in. Just checking into the hotel, my 2 year old met Goofy and got an autograph of Tinkerbell while we were getting our room sorted with the most gracious and courteous staff. Shout out to Tori and Holly.  Our room was very nice. Not large, but comfortable, spotless and themed to the nines.

Room was a little cramped and small and not a lot to offer by way of eating places at hotel other than steakhouse 55 and Trader Sam's both were a little expensive and could get better value in the restaurants on the strip.  Staff were pleasant and very helpful, and attentive to needs. Nothing was a problem to them.  Stayed in club room - well recommended for facilities and being able to watch fireworks.

Stayed here with my wife for a quick jaunt to Disneyland. Large rooms with all those Disney touches. Very clean. Excellent hotel staff and great access to Downtown Disney and Disneyland/California Adventure Park. Flawless stay. I have stayed at many Disney hotels and they never disappoint.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money this time
Summary: We've stayed here many times before and always felt that the conveniences outweighed the concerns - we've always had great service, the proximity to the monorail is convenient, and we've enjoyed many memorable times at Trader Sam's and Steakhouse 55.  This time around, though, we could not even get in the door at Trader Sam's despite three attempts at different times of day - including when it opens at 11:30 am!!  Every time there were long lines down the stairs and out into the grounds.  How disappointing.  I never did get my mai tai.  :(  We also tried to visit the lounge at Steakhouse 55 after striking out at Trader Sam's on Saturday night.  The website says it closes at 10:30, and it was about three minutes after 10, so we figured we were all set.  Maybe no mai tai, but at

Got a super deal with advance booking.  They went out of their way for our grandsons birthday.  The top floor fireworks show and food spread was impressive.  Loved the "When You Wish Upon  Star" headboard.  Park access was easy and many places to eat.  The Tiki Bar is a riot and a must for adults.

I liked this hotel, but it is not for everyone. Yes, it is kid oriented. BUT BE PREPARED to pay. For instance, the laundry area (the do it yourself area) only takes credit cards. It would have been nice if there was something mentioned in the map that you receive at check in. 3 bucks a load each wash or dry. If the machines in the tiny room were like most places you could at least do a double load, but not here. . oh well.  The hotel itself was clean and not visible of wear or tear. DIsney is run pretty well. It is about a 15 minute walk to the parks, but it is a nice stroll. The food and pool areas were well done . The place was pretty quiet-and good thick walls are always a good thing.

Summary Heading: Multiple Visits, Multiple Opportunities for Improvement
Summary: It's a nice enough hotel, it's close to the Park, and I realize they deal with many visitors...but: Guest Service and resulting experience is erratic.  This time check in was great, last time not so much. The room was a bit older this time and a little more worn. It's nice being on property, but if I paid the same rate for a hotel anywhere else, I'd be less OK about everything.

We spent six nights here as a family and had a wonderful time.   As other posts mention, the hotel is considerably more expensive than non-Disney hotels, but the location and service really do speak for itself.   The easy 5 to 10 minutes walk to the parks through downtown Disney makes it easy to head back to the hotel for a rest. The rooms were large and block out curtains made sleeping easy.   We had club level access and found it to be good value. To grab a quick, included breakfast was great, and easy access to drinks and snacks during the day was nice.   Service all around was wonderful.

There is no disputing the fact that staying on Disney property will be more expensive than other options.  Once you put that aside, you will have a great time.  To be able to enjoy the Disney theming and experience once you leave the parks, and take it back to your room, is part of the magic.  We had a wonderful room on a high floor, in the Adventureland tower, overlooking Downtown Disney.  Being on property right before Thanksgiving, with all of the holiday decorations starting to go up, made it even better.  A great special treat.

We had a 6 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel in Jan 2017. Staying at a Disney Hotel was one thing that my husband and I had always wanted to do so we were very excited to finally be able to do it.   Check in was nice and easy, the gentleman who helped us was lovely. Goofy was also wandering the lobby with was pretty cool.  We stayed in the adventure tower and had a king room that overlooked the pool area which was lovely.   The room itself was quite nice and had lots of special Disney touches to it. From the carpet to the bathroom fixtures, it was quite nice and added an extra magical touch.  I must say that for the insane price per night I would have expected the shower to have a door rather than a crummy shower curtain. I really think a shower curtain cheapens the look and

This was our first time staying at a Disneyland resort as we usually go to Disney World.   It was great.  The room wasn't big but it overlooked Downtown Disney and the parks.  It was new, well decorated and the bed was super comfortable.   The location is great and the extra magic hour was important.   The pool area is great with cute monorail water slides.    The staff is wonderful and Downtown Disney is much better than its Florida counterpart.    Two negatives,  the pool was crowded and it was hard to find seating but I think one of the other hotels was sharing the pool because of a renovation.  The only other negative was there is not enough food service at the pool.  There should be more people helping out.  Other than those two small things, it was wonderful.

Summary Heading: No Power all night until morning at the remodeled Disneyand Hotel
Summary: The front Desk was not like they said it was going to be, They were unfriendly and we had to wait over an hour and go put our luggage outside with the concierge's and then we had had to get our own luggage because they were too busy to bring it up to the room.We get there and have chocolates on the bed, It was around 300 square feet it was a two queen room small and dated, the only thing cool was the backboard of the bed that lights up and has music.The bathroom was small and the bathtub was small if your average good luck.Then we get ready to go to the park and it was a 25-minute walk because the monorail was closed every day except one time, as having a disabled adult child with us this was very inconvenient.We expected a better ADA system than the last we went.The Fastpass

We have not been back to the Disneyland Hotel since the mid-90s. The lobby is magic, and the pools are fabulous. Easy access to the parks-- including Magic Mornings during your stay -- is a bonus.   We added the e-Ticket Lounge for the breakfast, snack and appetizer offerings. Ask for a mimosa or prosecco cocktail for brunch, and enjoy. We appreciated the high-level of protein in the evening appetizers, which made for a good "dinner" option.

We stayed 6 nights and had a wonderful experience. The rooms were magical. Beds and pillows extremely comfortable. Vending machines and ice machines on each floor. The hotel was a short walk to Disneyland and just metres from downtown Disney. Trader Sams is a must for at least one speciality cocktail. The pool area was supervised by many life guards with life jackets available for the little ones. Loved our stay and would stay there again.

Summary Heading: No reson not to stay here if you can afford it
Summary: We have previously stayed at the Grand Californian at the entrance to the Californian Adventure Park and at the Candy Cane Motel, the latter is a 'partner hotel' just outside the park complex.  Having stayed at the GC I was surprised how great the rooms were at the Disneyland Hotel. From memory our room cost $650 per night, which is clearly expensive for the type of room you get, but its all part of the Disney experience and room prices turn out to be a rounding number in the cost of the whole thing.   We had a premium level room on a higher floor in the main building, which overlooked the pool. If we go again, we will go for the same room type. Its a standard conference hotel room fit with the nice embellishment of a magic kingdom night time sky fireworks lighting feature as a

My family and I spent five nights at the Disneyland Hotel in April. Our room was ready earlier than quoted and the Bellhop had no issues holding and delivering our bags. The hotel room was roomy and clean. A micro fridge is included in your room as well as a pack and play (in the closet). All the perks make this pricey hotel well worth it. The proximity to Downtown Disney and all the magic morning access is awesome. I would recommend and definitely stay here again!

The fireworks and the atmosphere in the late afternoon was awesome. Too crowded, not easy to move around with a little child. They are trying to organise the traffic of people around but still too hard

Summary Heading: Always full of magic and wonder!
Summary: My family and I were driving down to Disneyland to spend one day in the park to see the electric light parade. We chose the Disneyland Hotel because of its close proximity to the Monorail station and to the park itself. Plus we were traveling with our nephews and it's been more than 10 years since they stay there and before they grew up completely I wanted to stay there again for them. Pulling up to the building is always magical. They always make you feel like you're actually somebody special. Checking in with a breeze and getting our luggage loaded by the Bell service was also a breeze as well. One negative that always gets me is the cost to park your car there. It's one thing if you are asking for valet service it's another when you're parking your own car and you have to pay

I had a great Disney visit as always, but that being said I thought the hotel was just average.  The standard rooms seemed a little small but everything was clean and nice and we loved the pool view. I loved the convenience of being so close to everything and all the added perks of staying.  Service was great, the pool was great and Trader Sam's is always amazing.   Looking forward to trying the Grand Californian to really be in the middle of everything.

Having visited Disneyland on 5 other family holidays. We thought this would be our last visit as our children are hitting the "this is uncool" teen stage, we decided to have a final farewell stay at the Disneyland hotel. Well, all I can say is it was totally worth it.  The staff are amazing and every little touch throughout the hotel is spot on.  The room was great, good sized overlooking the pool.   The only gripe I had was along with the stay, you receive entry to the parks "Magic Morning".  This is where you get to enter the hotel 1 hour before the public.  We had the misconception that in this one hour we would be able to blitz the rides.  However with soooo many guests from all the combined Disney hotels and deals to be done,  Found ourselfs in a 3000 plus que to enter the

From the moment I pulled up to the drive of the hotel, it was perfect. Joe at the front desk let me check in early to a gorgeous suite. The remodeling they undertook has super comfy beds, quiet rooms and everything is high end and spotlessly clean. Goofy and Chip & Dale were greeting kids in the lobby. I didn't use the pool but looked like the kids were having a great time on the monorail slide. It's steps to jump on the real monorail to get to the parks.

Hello we stayed at the   Disneyland hotel from April 2-  April 6th concierge level room   7240. The other morning in the   E ticket lounge I realized that I had forgotten to put my fit bit Alta on. I know and my husband can verify, that it was on the bathroom counter. When I went back to the room, housekeeping was there, my fit bit was not. I asked the front desk what to do, they had my file a lost n found report. I am very upset about this. We spent over 5,000 just for the lodging and park tickets. Plus 2k more on food and souvenirs. I expect my items to be safe in my hotel suite. I will wait for your response. The rest of our stay and accommodations were amazing. The pool was awesome, the e ticket lounge even had Mickey waffles for breakfast. I would defiantly stay here again.

Summary Heading: There's really no better place to stay if you're visiting both parks
Summary: We've stayed here a few times and it's really a special place.  The rooms are amazing.  We've stayed in the suite which is huge.  They beds and beddings are high quality.  The headboards on the beds light up and play Disney music which is super special for the kids.  You can watch the fireworks at night from your room which is a plus if the kids are exhausted from visiting the parks.  The location is ideal as you are walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure.  The fun thing about being so close is you're able to go back and forth to the park if your kid's need a break.  Staying at the hotel allows you to enter the parks early for magic mornings.  The pools are super family friendly and fun after a long day at the park.  Eating at Goofy's Kitchen makes for a magical

We stayed in the Frontier Tower and we had spacious bedroom with 2 queen beds. The room was beautiful and of course Disney paid a lot of attentions to the details. It was a 8 to 10 minute walk from Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. Downtown Disney was right in the backyard. I definitely recommend this hotel and will be back in the future!

We booked a two night stay at the Disneyland Hotel for our last trip to Disneyland. We're frequent visitors of the parks, but rarely stay at the resort hotels because of the cost. I had stayed at the Disneyland Hotel almost 10 years ago, prior to their refurb (when the rooms were more blonde wood). We were SO excited to stay here and use all the amenities - which did not disappoint.  First off, check in - we stayed at different area hotel the night before since we arrived so late. I called the hotel to verify when we could actually check in/drop off luggage since we intended to go to the parks and didn't really want to lug everything around. They said you can check in anytime after 6:30 AM the day of your stay. We checked in at about 7:45 AM and they kindly took our luggage and

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for - Amazing Hotel
Summary: The magic of Disney lives in this hotel.  It is an amazing place.  The service we received was outstanding, and far exceeded our already high expectations for Disney.  From check-in to the cleaning staff to room service and the pool staff, everyone we encountered was helpful, kind, and genuinely there to help as needed.  The pool area for toddlers was wonderful and safe.  The amount of lifeguards there was more than you normally see, which is nice.  You can never be too safe with water.  The water was kept warm so even on a 70 degree day, we enjoyed swimming for 2 hours.  Although the spa helped with that as well.  For the toddler/slide area, there was plenty of shade with the surrounding trees and the waterslides, which is a plus when worrying about sunburn.

Late review. We stayed at this hotel with my family (5 ppl), and we were very satisfied with the experience. Clean, well located, walking distance to Disney parks & downtown. The decor of the room was super nice. I loved the headboard of my bed: Sleeping Beauty castle, and I can go to sleep everyday with the beautiful music and tiny lights... highly recommended.

Booked a last minute trip to DL and decided to try staying on-sight.   The room was nice.  The pull out couch was a bonus and fit my 4 year old perfectly.  The bathroom was a very nice size and the desk area was a bonus for storing our luggage and stroller. It was too cold for the pool so we did not try it.   We ate at the park or Downtown Disney. I would stay here again but only if I could not find a better deal off sight that made it worth it.  The price is high for what you get.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, great location, comfortable room
Summary: My 8 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. Check in was easy with very friendly service and added extras: a badge and signed photo for my daughter. We were given a room on the 11th floor of the Frontier Tower. I liked the decoration of the Tower (western) and the room. Our room (with 2 queen beds) wasn't the largest we had during our US trip but a good size. The beds were very comfortable, the furnishings in excellent condition, and the room very clean. The bathroom was small but clean. We especially loved the pools at Disneyland Hotel. There are 3 pools, all with very vigilant lifeguards, meaning I felt comfortable sitting pool side while my daughter swam. She spent hours and hours in the pool. I enjoyed the poolside lunch service from the

The Disney Hotel was ok but I expected more. My first issue is that the Disney Hotel is not directly connected to Disneyland, you have to walk more than a mile to get to the entrance of Disneyland and it is a crowded walk through all the restaurants etc. Seems like they did that on purpose so you can't just go back to your hotel if you need something and will probably end up buying it at the theme park instead. The room was also unimpressive, considering how much they charge I thought the room would be accommodating for kids but it's not. It looked like a room someone on a business trip would love not a family fun trip, kinda weird considering Disneyland is all about kids and fun right? You pay an arm and a leg, get a less than basic room, eat less than average food at the

Everything was wonderful!  Check-in was a breeze, the room was clean, the proximity to the parks is excellent.  The headboards that light up and play music are so much fun. It's also just steps from Downtown Disney.  Hope to return soon!

It didn't give us the Disney feeling I expected as we drove up ( like the Grand California ) but once we where checking in the experience started . The kids loved it . The goofy breakfast is a must do but you have to book as very busy . Call guest services . Pool area is great and the Sam bar is a good place for a drink while the kids go swimming . It also gets rocking after dinner but no kids after 8pm  7 min walk to Disney front entry , you can also go in to Disney California to the grand California hotel.   Magic hour is the best worth staying at the hotel just for this

We felt we got what we hoped for. The rooms we clean and comfortable. Our view from the room was identical to what they show online. Could see fireworks and pool (although balcony would be nice!) Service was good and room decor was really clever with Disney touch without being overdone. My only complaint is small. The sink was very difficult fir my 5 year old to reach. A step stool would have been a nice touch for a family hotel. I'm sure I could have called the front desk for one, I just never did. There was a pack and play already in the closet. We did not need it, but that was a nice touch for little ones. Being on the property with small kids was worth the extra money for sure. We could go take a rest from the parks very easily. I would for sure stay again!

Summary Heading: Did not seem like a Disney Resort
Summary: Lack of transportation from SNA or LAX is a critical shortcoming for a hotel bearing the Disney name. For transportation, the hotel website links you to a lousy third party coach bus line (for a fee) that doesn't operate after 7pm.  I was surprised considering Disney World hotels all include transportation.  More embarrassingly for the Disney Land Hotel was that competing hotels such as Hilton had complimentary transportation from the the ground transportation center at SNA.   I have stayed at several Disney World Hotels and this hotel just missed the mark. Check in was inefficient and staff ranging from groundskeepers to restaurant staff were not as welcoming. The physical grounds and rooms were adequate though.

I had booked this hotel believing it was situated in the Disneyland Park itself however it is actually at the end of the Downtown Disney District.  The Downtown Disney District is  a strip of shops and restaurants that commence where California Park and Disneyland Park meet and finish at the Disneyland Resort Hotel. It took us approx 10 mins to walk from the hotel to the parks but it is a very lively and fun walk in typical Disney architecture and style.  The hotel has an amazing heated swimming pool complete with fantastic water slides and Life Savers at every corner marching a particular routine to ensure between them they cover every square inch of the pool and water slide area.  This in itself was fun to watch and comforting that the little ones are well taken care of.  At

Summary Heading: Fun experience but would only do once
Summary: They Disneyland hotel was clean, fun, and a really cool experience, but I wouldn't spend the money to stay there again.   The rooms are pretty typical hotel rooms. Clean, big bathroom area. The really neat part is the wall behind the beds... it lights up and plays "when you wish upon a star." Felt really magical.  Staff was great. We did the goofy kitchen breakfast which was good and is a great opportunity to see some of the characters. I highly recommend this since seeing characters in the park takes a lot of time. (though Mickey is not there, nor were there any princesses so maybe ask when you book which characters you can expect.)  The pool area seems like it's great, however the weather wasn't really condusive of playing in the water on our trip, so we weren't able to take

Like any on-property hotel, it's not a cheap stay, but the fact that you're on-property makes up for that.  Overall, we had a great time and really enjoyed the perks that come with an on-property hotel, like early admission, collector pins, and other little things that just make the stay a bit more enjoyable.  Our 7 year old highly recommends staying here!

I didn't know how to rank this hotel.  It has to be rated on two levels.   Location is everything.   If you want a hotel close to the park that has magical park hours this is it.  It's 1/2 mile walk from the Disney park entrances.  It's nice that you can walk to the parks come back rest and go back.  There isn't much in terms of the " resort life for the children".   Of course Disney wants you to spend $$ at the parks so I get that there isn't much.  No arcade, no children's activity center, No sports court, etc....   but the location is everything.  If I am rating this just on location it gets 5 stars.  But if I am rating this for amenities,  it gets three.   I am comparing this to the Disney Polynesian and Art of Animation in Orlando. This has an advantage to those properties

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for the first time on a trip with my four year old daughter. We had never been to a Disney hotel before or to another hotel in Anaheim, so I have nothing to compare it to in those arenas. It was a nice, clean hotel with a pool my daughter loved. However, for the price (I think we paid $450 a night for a standard room), it isn't what I would consider a high-end luxury hotel. You are obviously paying for the early entry (which in retrospect, I think I would go without because of how crowded the parks were the rest of the day), and Disney theming, but would consider trying another new hotel if I were to return to Disneyland.

I love this hotel! It was perfect in every way. When we drove up in the taxi you get hit with that Disney magic. The staff from the valet to the check in were professional and made us feel special. The room was bright and airy, exceptionally clean and large. We could have happily stayed in there all day.   Walking through the grounds is so peaceful and relaxing and a wonderful way to start and finish the day. I never want to stay anywhere else at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: LOVE. LOVE. LOVE. Fantastic hotel, excellent service and superb location!
Summary: We stay at The Disneyland Hotel every year. We have seen it go through major renovations over the years. Some are great improvements and some we were very sad to see go. We LOVED the koi fish ponds and the beach with volleyball nets that used to be on the property. Our kids also have great memories of the old arcade that used to be there too. We also loved the balconies that the rooms used to have, they removed the balconies after the last major reno.   Anyway, enough about what we miss. We still LOVE staying here and still choose to stay here over any other hotel in Anaheim. We have also stayed at the Hilton and the Marriott by the convention centre and many other Hotels in that area so we know the options :). This year our colleagues all stayed at the Disney Grand Californian

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for three nights and it was magical.  Check in, there were a ton of people there that were getting everyone in quickly. We checked in and then had someone come out to greet us and explain our room. We were staying on the concierge level and had access to the e-ticket club. The greeter was very nice and showed us the pool and our tower, the adventure tower.   The concierge level allowed us to go up to a little area that had windows facing downtown disney and the parks. We were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from there as we had snacks, desserts, and wine. They had the music piped in so it was like you were there. We actually didn't get to watch the fireworks up there because our room faced downtown disney and who doesn't want to watch the

We had stayed at the GC last  year which was in dire need of major renovations so we settled on the Disneyland hotel this year... Like any other Disney property, it is totally overpriced and you have to set your expectations right... You are basically paying for the premium location and the magic hour early access to parks... the room is OK and clean but pretty much a standard hotel room with few Disney details here and there (the klds loved the bed headboard with the castle and the music or the bathroom lamps that are held by big Mickey's hands)...  but staying here gives you the peace of mind which is key to a great time at Disneyland: your room key is all you need to pay for anything inside and outside the parks (which can be dangerous ;-)), you get extra hour access which is

Let me start by saying that we are definitely a "Disney" family. We love just about everything Disney but the Disneyland Hotel fell FAR short of the Disney experience. We found only three staff members that were friendly and we spoke or interacted with dozens. Most acted as if they did not care to be there. The hotel room was average but you are definitely paying a premium to have a headboard that lights-up and plays a short song and a few Disney decorations. As expected, everything was priced high from the food to the shopping, but again, this part was expected before we booked the room. (Although their coffee shop was very reasonable and was one of the few pleasant people that we interacted with). The room was old but clean. (Outside of the windows definitely needed attention

Summary Heading: Expensive stay, but what an awesome stay!
Summary: You can find good OC hotels for like $300/night cheaper, but it's not the "official Disney experience." We wanted to give it a try and forked over more cash, but my family thought it was worth it. Being able to crawl out of bed and walk to the parks was really convenient, and you were able to enter the parks 1 hour earlier if you wanted.   Check in was a bit slow, but there is a TV area with DIsney cartoons for the kids, and also visits from characters.   We had a regular room with 1 King bed in the Adventure Tower. There was a mini fridge in the room, which was a lifesaver for our toddler's food. A microwave would have been nice too, but the room had limited space. The bed was very comfy but rocked a bit when one of us moved. The bathroom was spacious and modern. As others have

We are a big Disneyworld family, have been 5 times, 3 x Yacht Club, once Animal Kingdom and Polynesian, and the Disneyland hotel ranks right up there will all of them. Rooms were quite big, and loved being walking distance to parks. Though we very much enjoyed the parks at Disneyland, the variety in Disney World  is certainly better. We always stay club level, and my one quibble is that unlike the Disney World  resorts you do not have access to the club level after you check out. This was something we had expected, as even after we check out we still spend most of  our last day  at the hotel before officially leaving and not having access to club level made stay less enjoyable. However, it was  a great hotel, and would certainly go back.

I read tons of reviews and having just stayed for 2 days during our first visit with our 2 year old I have nothing but great things to say. We stayed in the Frontier tower and I must say all the comments on boards about it being too far are completely false, it's literally a 5 minute walk between towers. Then it's a 5 min walk to downtown Disney, about 10 total to the monorail (which we never took because walking even at 6m pregnant was faster and easier than a 30 min wait). All in all maybe 20 min total strolling to the front gates. Could not be more convenient. Tangaroa terrace was great for lunch on arrival day and breakfast on day 2, inexpensive and not crowded. We saw chip n dale in the lobby upon arrival, super fun. We got a 1 bedroom suite which was huge, clean and

I was here for the NYLC Conference and of course the fact I could be at work attending a conference and at Disneyland was a plus. Stayed here years ago when the kids were young and it has been redone.  The rooms have a cute headboard that lights up wth Fireworks when you turn on the bedside table I am sure kids love this it also plays a little song. The room has some cute Disney touches. We were in the adventure tower and had a view of the pool which was nice. Food at the resort was good and while it is pricey i will say it was tasty.   Set a wake up call if you have kids with you because Mickey calls to wake you up in the am and that is pretty cute.

I've stayed at all 3 official Disneyland hotels several times now and this one is my favorite. While it's further from the parks than Grand Californian, the atmosphere and experience is better at this hotel. The Disney touches throughout the room are amazing, especially the light-up, musical castle headboard. The hotel also has a more sophisticated vibe than the other hotels. The monorail pool is definitely the best Disney pool as well.

Check in was a breeze, room was ready early (1p)  Stayed in Fantasy Tower on the 6th floor overlooking the pool...Two queen beds with the headboard that has fiber optic fireworks that play "A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes" so cool.  Room was very modern, clean with an in room fridge and comfortable bed. Don't know if it's the norm but we didn't order them and cookies (mickey/minnie head shaped ) and milk were left in the room when we returned from the parks the first day. Second time we have stayed here and will definitely not be our last

We recently stayed here for Spring Break with the kids.  We asked for an early check in, but had to wait 3 hours for a room!  Room was average.  Not updated at all.  We had a view of the fireworks, which was great, however, it was so noisy.  My kids were woken up at 10:30pm by glass breaking and loud noises.  We called front desk, and they did nothing to help out.  I also broke out in bed bug bites all over my ankles.  We had switched from Grand Californian to the Disney hotel due to construction, and realized we made a mistake.   Sad that a Disney hotel did nothing to make up for our complaints.

I stayed here for a conference for two nights. This was my second stay here. My first stay was 2 years ago for the same conference. My room was much larger than before which was great. But my bed was so uncomfortable that it made me look forward to checking out on the second day. Everything else was great but the bed was very soft and lumpy and sagged in the center. Seemed like a very old, worn mattress. The pillows were just as bad. I don't recall being so uncomfortable during my first visit. I'd give 5 stars if bed was comfy. Housekeeping staff was friendly, close location the downtown Disney was awesome.

This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel since 2004 and the renovations since that time have elevated the Hotel.  We stayed on the E-Ticket Club level which provides a number of benefits, including free pops and juices all day, breakfast buffet, mid-day snacks, hot appetizers from 5-7 and desserts thereafter.  You also check-in at the E-Ticket lounge instead of main hotel lobby. There is also a massive free DVD library.  We had a single room for two adults and three children and were concerned about space, but upon getting our room those fears were laid to rest.  The rooms was considerably larger than a standard hotel room and easily accommodated two queen beds and a day bed.  We never felt crowded during our stay.  The positives of e-ticket:  1. Private check-in with an

To pay close to $500 a night and to be unable to get through to room service is unacceptable. I finally ended up going through the front desk and they were even disconnected same as I was. Then finally after 20 minutes I get to speak with someone who tells me it will be 45 minutes before I can get food. They indicate room service is available until 1:00 am, and I called more than 2 hours prior. However, Regardless of what time you call, this shouldn't happen.

I have stayed at this property 4 times in the past 2 years and I love this place. My kids adore everything, the location is perfect for a weekend get away. I can not wait to be back again in the summer.

My daughter and I visit Disneyland every year as our special vacation.  Usually we stay in the Grand Californian but this year because of renovations to the hotel we decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and we are glad we did.  The Disneyland Hotel is all Disney from the tea cup seats in the reception area to the headboard in the room.  The grounds are beautifully tropical with Disney characters made out of flowers.  The Tiki Bar is a must!  Make sure you stay to see the extra bling when someone orders a special drink.  We will definitely stay here again.

We recently spent four nights in the Ambassador Suite at the Disneyland Hotel.  It isn't a themed suite like the other five signature suites but does come with the same amenities as they do.  The decor is similar to that of the one, two and three bedroom suites.  There's two bedrooms both with King beds and a queen sofa bed in the living room.  Two full bathrooms in each bedroom and a half bath in between the two bedrooms.  The master bedroom has a balcony.  There's a table with six chairs in the dining room and a balcony off the dining room.  A kitchenette with mini fridge, Keurig beverage station and bar with three luxurious bar chairs and of course concierge privileges come with the suite.  It's located on the second floor of the Frontier Tower.  The E Ticket lounge is in the

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel vs. Grand California - now we've done both!
Summary: Having just returned from our first stay (2 nights) at the somewhat recently remodeled Disneyland Hotel, hubby and I can now share our thoughts with those trying to decide whether to choose D-land Hotel vs. Grand Californian:  Disneyland Hotel in March 2017:  Room:  We were given a fifth floor room with (shock) just a king bed (yay) at the south end of Adventure Tower, facing the park.  We could spy the Matterhorn from this room and were able to see the fireworks (which only blast Friday-Sunday).  The room was super cute, not cutesy, very nostalgic with lovely b&w photos of Walt and the old days.  Bathroom was small but serviceable, with a nice heavy door between WC/tub shower and the single sink area (promoted privacy).  Lighting OK, these are old rooms.  Our tub/shower drain

We were left stranded at the airport by this company that our hotel recommended called "Disney Express Shuttle".  When I contacted the company they denied a refund.   We ended up taking a cab which cost double.  So $200 later and an hour and a half after our plane landed we arrived at our hotel.  There was a small line, like 2 people in front of me, and these 2 check-in agents were giggling and talking amongst each other instead of helping the next people in line.  I stayed at the Californian and I can say the level of service is much higher.  This hotel is kid friendlier but the service is neglectful.

We spent 5 days in the Adventure Tower of this hotel and had an absolute blast!!! Everything from the staff to the shower was amazing and enjoyable. Each tower has a themed lobby of its own and overly fun to inspect what they have on display just going to and from your room before heading out to the park for the day. This is a must stay at hotel with easy access to the Monorail and Downtown Disney!!! Go! Leave the kids at home next time!

Summary Heading: Great to be onsite for once!
Summary: I have been going to D-land since 1968, took our daughter there when she was a kid, came back and did an adult-only trip - which was a complete blast - and finally stayed onsite at the Disneyland Hotel. It's the only way to go and doesn't have to break the bank. Just watch for deals. Since that trip, we have stayed at the Grand Californian too and it's just so much more enjoyable to step out the door right into the parks....no waiting for a shuttle (been there, done that).

Finally did it ! Oh so glad. I've been going to Disneyland since it's opening in 1955. At 70 yrs old I finally cracked open my piggy bank and splurged to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It was Great! Do prepare for 'sticker shock'. Both the parks and hotel are pricey. Some 'inside info'. A friend who works for Disney said to me..They keep raising the prices to try to cut down on crowds. It never seems to work. It is an Amazing place and millions from around the world will pay whatever it takes.  The hotel and park are awesome BUT...some FYI's  1)Their website is horrible. Call them buy phone (save frustration) 2) Expect high prices (If you are able to walk...stay nearby) 3) Most Important...You are about to share the Happiest place on earth !!!!! 4) Absolute MUST !!! Do NOT miss

Awesome place to stay. There were 12 family members. 7 adults and 5 children. Best location, through the gates and straight into down town Disney. Loved it. Would definitely stay here again.   Great proximity to restaurants and all of the character breakfasts.   Room service was fast and good. We all had coffee, juices and snacks delivered to our rooms in the morning.

Amazing hotel with great service. Check in was a breeze. Room wad ready in the tower that we requested  (adventure tower was only a 15 second walk to downtown disney). We had a pool view.  Windows are huge. Lots of natural light. Rooms are huge as well. Separate room for toilet is great for larger families. Maid service was great- always lots of towels etc  room was VERY clean. Never had to wait for the elevator. The Pools and water slides were amazing.  Tons of life guards at the pools and life jackets etc. Not a bad thing to say. Great stay. Magic mornings are totally worth the extra  $ for staying on site at disneyland

I like that the resort is st the Disneytown, you can walk around at night and there are so many thing to do. Still have some walk to the park. Small rooms but quiet. The pool was a blast during spring and summer but not for the other season. If you on a budget this is not really worth the money if your going to be in the parks most of the day. But 1-2 night stay for the experience is ok. Nothing special in the resort, don't expect to see characters just shops to spend more money

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel via a Costco package in October 2016. The package offered great bonuses which made the overall cost worthwhile (Disneyland hopper tickets for all of us, a Disney gift card of $40, free lanyard/pin for each of us, character dining and hotel).  Check in was smooth and quick. We were upgraded to a Downtown/California Adventure view which we LOVED. We got to watch the nightly fireworks from the comfort of our room.  Cute hidden Mickey's everywhere. Room was large and comfortable and the location was unbeatable! The hotel is right next to the monorail. Which is perfect for those that don't want to walk to the gate. For us, we opted for the walk to get our exercise in. About a 8-10 minute walk for us.  Two Starbucks are also nearby. One of which is

Summary Heading: Average hotel for an above average price
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights in March. As with anything Disney we knew what we were getting into before we booked. That being said the hotel has been kept up over the years and even though it was built a long time ago, the rooms have all modern amenities.   Positives: Staying on Disney property allows early access to the parks. This is definitely a bonus and may be worth the price depending on how long you are wanting to stay at the parks. As I mentioned earlier the room has modern amenities and overall is a "nice" hotel room. Trader Sam's at the Disneyland Hotel is definitely a treasure. Excellent drinks and atmosphere.  Negatives: the price is definitely outrageous for what you get. But compared to other hotels in the neighborhood, there are not a lot of comparable options that

Summary Heading: Great to be on property but amenities only so-so
Summary: This was my first time staying on property at Disneyland since I have relatives that live only 20 minutes away. My husband and I stayed here for two weeknights. I was very excited to be staying on property for the first time. Check-in was a breeze but we were disappointed that we were not given the king bed we had booked. However, I did appreciate they upgraded us to a pool view room.  Pros: - Room was clean - Staff very friendly -Beautiful pool and grounds -Tiki bar at the hotel was SO fun and drinks very reasonable for Disney. It does get crowded so try to get there early!  Cons: - Only TWO elevators for the whole of adventure tower. Trying to get downstairs in the morning was a nightmare. The stairs were marked emergency exit only so that wasn't an option. It took my husband

My niece and sister took me on a trip to Disneyland.  I told them I wanted to stay at the hotel where the headboard had fireworks, so Disneyland Hotel it was!  Room was spacious, clean. Beds were comfortable.  There was a little wear and tear on the headboards.  Cleaning on some of the bathroom fixtures could have been a little bit better, but it was a great stay!  Hotel staff was wonderful!

I was there for a conference but went a couple of days early with the family to let my 4 year old experience the Disney magic for the first time. Check in was very smooth and staff were extremely friendly. Even though we arrived at 8am on a Saturday, they had a room ready for us. My daughter was even provided with a pin that said "First Visit", which she thought was very special.   The room was clean and spacious enough. We had two queen beds and a view of the courtyard/pool area in the Frontier tower. My 4 year old got a huge kick out of the headboard that lights up and plays music, however as a parent I would suggest that the sound level on the music could be turned way down. It was quite obnoxious at first. Fortunately the lights continue while the music ends after a minute

Summary Heading: Great hotel! But staff could have been honest!
Summary: Great hotel. The pool was heated and the staff there extremely friendly and helpful. I didn't have my key to the pool and they let me in. The check in was very easy. Except, the front desk gave us a room facing parking lot. I was told that the hotel (3 buildings) were sold out. I did not believe them. Not a lot of cars in parking lot. I do not understand why we did not get a pool view. Or even a downtown Disney view. Anyway, I tried to upgrade via the phone and I kept getting the same person who kept apologizing that the rooms were "at capacity." Coffee affordable.

Stayed for one night on a Monday to Tuesday in Feb. Got to use the early magic hour on both the day we checked in and the day we checked out. Excellent night!  Check in and early magic hour: You can check in any time. We checked in at 630am, then got to use the early magic hour for that morning at DCA. They give you your keys (one for each guest staying at the hotel) when you check in so you can use the early magic hour, then go back to the hotel reception in the afternoon (around 3pm) and they will tell you your room number.   Check out: Check out is by 11am. If you go to the conciege desk they will give you a pool access key for the day you check out, and you then have access to the pool the whole day after you check out.  The concierge desk can give you attraction trivia

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with your kids!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in early February 2017 with our 2 boys ages 4 & 5 for 3 nights. We loved it! We received an upgraded view on check in. Our 4 year old thought it was fun to turn off the headboard every time we lit it up saying "no fireworks ". All the staff were very friendly and the convenience to the park and downtown Disney made it worth it.        We ate breakfast the second morning in Goofys Kitchen and the boys loved meeting all the characters. Although for 2 adults and one kid to eat it was $118! The other breakfast options are either the Steakhouse 55 restaurant which is also expensive or the Tahitian grab and go which is much more budget friendly. If you want a less pricey sit down breakfast that is also very good, go to the Rainforest

We stayed 3 nights in February and had a wonderful experience. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by Goofy, Chip and Dale. The magical experience continued throughout our trip despite being there during some of California's historic rainfall.   We elected to upgrade at check in to a view of downtown Disney and the parks. It was definitely worth the upgrade, however the rooms are, as other stated, a bit dated. Our bathroom was ridiculously dark with only one light fixture. You can barely see in the shower/bath which is bizarre with so many little ones obviously using the bathrooms. It's an old hotel which could use some updates, but the close proximity to the parks and enjoying the Magical Hour (1 hour early access for hotel guests) make it worth the inflated rate.   I thought

Nice hotel and in close proximity of the Disneyland park and California park. You have 2 options one is the monorail the other is to walk. We were happy with the room but 2 kingsize beds just wish it was 2 separate beds for the kids rather than sharing. We had breakfast with goofy and friends which was magical put boy incredibly expensive which is around $250, but you get a massive selection of food and characters walking around.  This is not a complaint but When your paying this amount of money staff could stand around less talking about there weekend but getting involved with people or the kids  with choosing the breakfast making a song a dance, goofy and the characters were fantastic. There was a gated swimming pool with the use of buoyancy aids. But most of our time was hip

Stayed 1 week.  Our overall experience was good; the most obvious advantage was being right next to Downtown Disney and the parks.  Cleanliness and layout of the rooms was ok; however, I must mention that the matresses and pillows are way to soft and mushy, this must be addressed.  Another thing I must mention is having to pay for the use of the business center and for each page you print.  In all hotels we've stayed at this cost is included in the overall hotel rate.

Excellent service.  Pricey,   Could update furniture.  Very clean.  Rooms were spacious.   Comfortable beds. The decor was disney themed.  Beautiful headboards that lightup and play disney themes. Kids loved that. We had rooms with the view overlooking the pool area.  Made reservations at the last minute because we stayed at a Park friendly hotel and was disappointed so we decided to book at disneyland hotel.  Took a while to get reservations because we rented 3 rooms.  Disney store in hotel.  Would stay again...  After check out we were able to pickup luggage after finishing our stay at the park.   Parking is $20 per night.  Caught in a down pour of rain in the park.  Went straight to hotel did not have to drive back to another hotel soaking wet.  Very close to everything.

Summary Heading: Room Reservation is No Guarantee of Room Type
Summary: Visited Disney for 3 nights with my son. Reserved (and paid for) 2 queen beds at a fairly high price. Upon arrival at 3:00PM (weeks later), we're given a single King room. The reasoning? "The computer automatically assigns the bed type by number of people in the room." Keep this in mind if you're reserving a room.   I've never run into this issue before even with hotels that allow you to cancel your reservation 24 hours ahead of arrival.   My son ended up sleeping on a rollaway cot bed. For what we paid, I find this unacceptable. The rest of the resort was fine, however.   We've stayed at nearby properties when visiting Disneyland. We'll be reverting back to that strategy since these hotels give you the room you reserved at much lower cost.

Summary Heading: Skip the premium for Downtown Disney review, WiFi improved but not great
Summary: We normally stay at the Grand Californian (due to it's location next to California Adventure), but we stopped going as the GC was in need of a room refresh (which is underway).  The last several visits we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, and this visit we paid to upgrade to a view of DisneyTown.  It's really not worth the money as the view is pretty lacking (you are looking that the entrance to the theaters).    One thing we did note is that the WiFi improved, that is a constant problem w/ all the Disney properties (including the Aulani in Oahu).  This time I brought my own WiFi router and was able to plug into the hardwired network connection in the room.  We had a full strength signal and were averaging 10MBPS to our phone and computer.   As stated before - what you are paying

First off, this is by far the most I've ever spent on a hotel and I've m been fortunate enough to stay at some beautiful hotels in North America, South America and Europe. There is absolutely no reason why this hotel should cost this much money, but I digress..   We arrived early and were able to check in at 945am - check in was smooth and the staff were what you expect from Disney - efficient, friendly and professional.   Our room was in the Frontier Tower which is the furthest from the main building but still only 3 mins away on foot - the room was large and clean and everything Disney. Our son loved it.  Enjoy the pools if you can - we did and enjoyed them very much. Lots of towels and chairs (even though some leave their towels on chairs and disappear for hours).  Downtown

We loved our Disneyland weekend!  We paid a bit more for a room with a view of downtown Disney in the Adventure Tower.  The view was fantastic at night (though drab during the day) as we could see the color show in the California Adventure park and the fireworks over Disneyland.  The hotel was busy, as a dance competition was held there, but our tower was quiet.  The room details were nice -- the sconces in the bathroom, Mickey tiles, and the headboard which lit up to reveal fireworks over Cinderella's castle.  The beds/pillows were very comfortable.  (As I write this I am missing the hotel and our Disney experience!). We enjoyed the retro look of the hotel -- it is unassuming and looks like a standard 1960's office building, but much attention and maintenance has been given to

Summary Heading: Happiest Hotel at the Happiest Place on Earth!
Summary: It brings me so much nostalgia back when i was a kid, i remember the monorail taking us to this hotel, i was sad when it closed in around 1997, they replaced it with Downtown Disney, but it's back, in a new location, sure there is no monorail, but it brings nostalgia to all ages!

Lovely room for 2 moms with their child (6 & 12). Able to access California Adventure an hour early and get some rides in! We were upgraded to a suite because our room was not available.  Close to Napa Rose, Downtown Disney Goofy's kitchen etc. Kids loved the pool and room service.

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel Right there with all the Magic
