Summary: Stayed there last week on a family vacation along with our son, daughter-in-law, and toddler granddaughter.  Had booked adjoining rooms -- the rooms were adjoining and their room was nice and spacious, with two big beds, a sofa and double sinks in the bathroom.  Our room was quite small, with one king size bed, no sofa, and one sink.  Our bathroom was divided between the sink and the toilet and tub area, with the tub and toilet area being rather dark.  I had expected the rooms to be equal, but at that point, it was too much of a hassle requesting room changes with a toddler.  The Disney theming was nice -- our granddaughter loved turning the headboard lights on and off.  The room was cleaned well and all of the staff we encountered were very nice and friendly.  We had a view of

I live pretty close to Disneyland - maybe 40 minutes away so I've never stayed at the hotel but I had a fancy dinner dance to go to for my industry and since we have passes to the park I figured what better reason to stay overnight! It was pretty great to wake up next to Disneyland too.  The room was nice- cozy and intricate with Mickeys and Disney attributes like the pillows and the lights. Some tiles in the bathroom, hidden I imagine. The beds were not as comfortable as some other hotels I've stayed but they weren't uncomfortable either. The tv seemed oddly small to me, but you don't really have time or energy to watch tv when Disneyland is in your plans so no big deal to me. I liked that there was a mini fridge in the room- empty so you can stock it. Which is a nice plus when

Summary Heading: Amazingly Quite in Rooms, versus Cowboy Music on Loop everywhere else
Summary: Plain and dated hotel, but the bed and room were great.  I was a little confused at how quiet it was in my room at night.  I figured I would hear kids, crying, etc - but nope, nothing.  Very good nights sleep.  Now everywhere else there is this wild west cowboy roundup music on continuous loop.  When you see kids enjoying it, it's fine, but otherwise it's kind of annoying.  Food options onsite are kind of poor - but downtown disney is a short walk and has lots of options.  Coffee shop on site has weak coffee, but Starbuck in downtown disney is close by.

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 5 nights.  Was in the Fantasy Tower.  While most of my view was of the front parking lot and the Mickey & Friends Parking structure, I had a pretty good view of Disneyland.  So I was able to watch Fireworks from my room and see the Matterhorn.  The extra touches that this room have are truly magical.  The bed was super comfortable and Mousekeeping was wonderful.  The location to Downtown Disney and the theme parks was superb.

The customer service was excellent. The room was very clean. The headboard lighting up with music was a fantastic touch! We had a wonderful breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen, which in my opinion, was worth the money. Only bad thing I can say is that I wish the room had a bit more of a Disney touch. It was like Disney business decor vs. Disney Vacation decor.

Summary Heading: Great location for Star Wars Marathon
Summary: We stayed here because my husband was participating in the Star Wars Half Marathon. The Expo was at the hotel so it was very convenient. We had a great time and the hotel was in the perfect location. An easy walking distance to the parks.

Summary Heading: A good experience, but overpriced and not as convenient as expected
Summary: We spent ten nights in the Disneyland Hotel, partly to attend a conference event and partly for holiday.  Our room was spacious and appeared to be recently decorated, albeit in a fairly old-fashioned style, but there were plenty of nice Disney touches too. The hotel was next to the conference venue so very convenient for that, but accessing the parks was a long walk through the always-crowded Downtown Disney so actually not much quicker than walking in from some of the closer off-park hotels.  Our experience with staff throughout our stay was very positive, always friendly and welcoming. The pool area was also good and right on the doorstep, well-staffed and clean.  The early access to the parks (one hour earlier than the general public each morning) was a good bonus, one of the

We love the Disneyland Hotel - the atmosphere, the location,the staff, the pool - everything. We had a fantastic trip - returning after also visiting in August 2015. Early entry into the parks is a great benefit too. Wonderful holiday

Summary Heading: One of our Favs.. some improvements needed
Summary: Over the last 7 years we have stayed 4 times in this hotel.. Our visit on this occasion although was a comfortable stay, well appointed rooms and general cleaning is done thoroughly .. we have found it's loosing the Disney magic feel.. there were no characters around the hotel grounds during the day/evening ;(in the past that's what they did & why we keep returning) the sky high pricing is becoming a little steep if they are going to lessen the Disney feel .. Character Dinning.. we had a less than poor experience and actually asked for our money back on this occasion.. we have never had to do that ever!!  Staff were not very friendly as usual.  Location is a plus being short distance to parks & shopping district.  I am unsure if we would stay here for our next visit

Summary Heading: Average at a very high price
Summary: I stayed with family for one night and was beyond disappointed!  The outside of the hotel looked run down and old.  The room was very basic and small.  The bathroom was very tiny, the door could barely close because the toilet was right there.  The beds are very hard and uncomfortable.  We were treated rudely at Goody's Kitchen.  We were told they had no space.  We were hotel guests and couldn't eat in the hotel restaurant.  To top it off, parking at the hotel is $18/night.  For $400+resort fee a night I would have expected a larger room, maybe a free breakfast, free parking and WiFi that worked.  I've stayed at other hotels near Disney for way cheaper and received 200% better service and a better room.  Very disappointed in this hotel!

Summary Heading: A short walk away from Disney Land...
Summary: This Hotel is very nice, and offers good food, and rooms. It is clean and spacious, and is a short walk to Disney, which is a must for all ages, not just the Kids, Try the roller coaster through space, Magic mountain etc and plan on a 2 day 3 night visit. The hotel staff are great, and discreet and the rooms have all the mod' coms' and air conditioning. The rates are very reasonable considering its location, and the food is great, enjoy...

Yes it is hard to review this place. So many positive things and they did a great job hosting a very large conference but as much as I love children they make using some of the facilities as an adult impossible. The spa being a big example.

Second time in a two bedroom suite (two nights).  These rooms are exceptionally expensive but they are an option if you want to guarantee connecting rooms.  In our case we were able to comfortably put two kids in the living room, two parents in one bedroom and two parents and a young child in the third bedroom.  If you price out three equivalent rooms (all with the same view category) you end up spending a bit less for the 2 bed suite.    This time we were in the Frontier Tower.  We were on the second from the top floor at the end of the hall facing away from the parks - so we had the whole end-side of the building.  This was far from the elevators and so very quite - never heard anything from other rooms and the hotel was full the weekend we were there.    This setup has you

Summary Heading: Average room - Sky High Cost - But Can't Beat the Location or Disney Service...
Summary: So my family and I arrived in late January 2017 for a 3 night stay. We arrived around 2 pm and unfortunately, their computer system was down, so we didn't get personalized keys and they had a very hard time finding my reservation. However, after about 15 minutes they located my reservation and I was given a room on the 7th floor in the Fantasy tower and our room faced the parking lot. The service was excellent and the clerk at the front desk was very apologetic.  The room was a good size, we had two double beds and a couch. The room had a number of small Disney features, which I loved. Plenty of closet space and I loved the bathroom set up. You have a vanity outside of the bathroom, and in the bathroom, a door separates the toilet from the sink mirror and shower. So with a

Summary Heading: Not worthy of a Conde Nast rating!
Summary: I was there for the NAMM convention in Anaheim. The wifi was the worst (found it impossible to work on my laptop), the tv was unplugged from the cable upon discovery on the first night, when attached the channels pixelated the whole trip. Housekeeping vacuumed the floor above me at 5am. The hotel staff was plenty but not any different from a three star hotel. For the price of the rooms I was very surprised to find no beverage in the lobby, free coffee or the like and there wasn't any creamer in the room. I can honestly say the only good thing about this hotel was the bedding. Breakfast in the Tiki was typical of a diner. Total disappointment. Next time in town a hotel with amenities that match the price will be the one for me. Not recommended for business travelers.

The hotel is very nice. You walk in and the staff is very helpful and accommodating. We wanted the adjoining room next to ours; we asked the front desk if we could have it and they worked their magic to get that room clean and ready for us in a timely manner.  I was also pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the bathroom and overall state of the room. Our room was next to the elevators which I was a little hesitant about at first due to the possible noise. However, our entire stay was very peaceful - if there was noise we didn't hear it.

My husband and I snuck to Disneyland for the weekend after a conference in Long Beach. Spent two days at the Disneyland Hotel and it was perfect! I've stayed at all of the properties at Disneyland, and the Disneyland Hotel is by far my favorite! This stay was on the 12th floor of the Adventure Tower and we had a great view of the pool! The only "hiccup" we had was a very early check-in and we never got notified our room was ready. Not a big deal, and we had a wonderful, laugh filled time despite the rain! Would book again in a heartbeat! Thank you! #Disneyfanatic

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Stay EVER truly MAGIC
Summary: From the moment we walked in the customer service was top notch. Upon check in we discovered they had us in the wrong type of room I went downstairs and they immediately rectified the issue. Our room was very clean and spacious. I LOVED the Disney themed decorations. My Grandson loved the lighted head board that could be turned on with the song of "When you wish upon a star" playing. When we went to use the pool we were happy to fine life vests for my grandson.  They had all sizes for the kids. The water slides were great. On our way back to our room from the pool we ran into Goofy he spent several minutes playing with my grandson.

I came here for a trip to Disneyland with the family, although it wasn't cheap, it was worth it. The hotel was clean, staff was amazing and helpful, and the beds were comfy. The best thing was it was right next to Disneyland. Would stay again just to experience the nice hotel

Summary Heading: No problems but lacks the magic for price paid.
Summary: After staying at the grand Californian several times and properties in Florida like the spectacular beach club, I would consider this a second string Disney hotel and if the price difference is not significant I would strongly recommend the grand Californian instead.  Apart from the Disney touches like the gardening including sculpted figures of various characters this place has a definite 1970s office building vibe.  The slides were closed but the remaining pool areas rather ordinary, without the slides probably only slightly better than the pools at the Howard Johnson.  The hotel staff was close to perfect, the rooms were cleaned to a high standard, we had one maintenance issue with a towel rail but this was fixed promptly when reported.  The size of the standard room was good

Summary Heading: Great hotel, even for Non-Disney fanatics
Summary: We had our first visit to the Disneyland hotel last month. Despite many trips to Disneyland and living in Southern California for many years I had never stayed here.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is updated with what I would call a retro-contemporary style. The rooms are very nice, not overly flashy, but have some nice Disney touches (cool light up over the beds that plays Disney music, Mickey mouse faucet handles). There is a pull -out day bed for a 5th person. It is not super comfortable. They have a few fun pools for the kids and several eating options.  Self-parking and valet are available and you can check your stuff with the concierege and then walk right into to Downtown Disney and to the parks.  We did have a special offer for pricing. I know regular rates can

Super expensive and a bit small and run down. Paid extra for a suite and it was not a suite the two rooms were extremely tiny. The beds aren't very comfortable. The couch was torn. No microwave and the fridge just froze everything! Won't stay here again. Better options closer to the entrance!! I am a huge Disney fan and this one let me down.

Summary Heading: Furthest hotel from the Park & not much for kids to do on property.
Summary: We recently visited Disney and wanted to stay on the property.  Disneyland hotel is one of few hotels on property but it isn't the furthest away from the park and the monorail. It was a manageable walk to downtown Disney and monorail however there are closer properties. The hotel itself was decent. Rooms were clean and you receive the expected Disney service throughout the hotel.  This was an average hotel experience due to the fact that there weren't as many activities as I would have expected form a Disney property (we've stayed at the grand Floridian in Florida and Aulani in Hawaii). Other than character dining (which was just 'ok') there weren't many things for kids to do.  I would suggest the grand California. Once it I see renovated as an alternative to this hotel.

Summary Heading: What a fun place to stay
Summary: Everything about this hotel is fantastic. It's right there at Disneyland for easy access. Everyone is exceptionally nice and helpful. The Goofy Restaurant is lots of fun for the kids, and adults, with all of the Disney characters "goofing" around with everyone. We were there for a gymnastics competition and staying there right in the hotel was a plus. We absolutely love it, all six of six. The rooms were so nice and housekeeping was great. Can't say enough about this hotel.

It's always magical staying at a Disney resort. This was the first time in a long while we went to Disneyland and not Disneyworld. We loved that Downtown Disney was steps from the hotel and that you pass through security at that point (instead of having to go through it at each park separately), and that both Disneyland and California Adventure were an easy walk from the hotel. We did take the monorail back the last night, because everyone was exhausted and it was fun. The only negative I have is that the staff wasn't nearly as exuberant and helpful as in other Disney hotels.

Worth the price.  Early entrance to park was really nice.  When the kids got tired back for swim or nap.  would recommend. We used the Costco Disney package and was well worth all the extras they included.

This hotel is just a hotel, nothing special.  Service is great, location is great, beds and pillows comfortable, it is clean and tidy and so convenient to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure.  They do not provide anything other than coffee, tea and shampoo. TV options are terrible, although you are not supposed to be there to watch TV. Stairs can only be used to go down, you cannot get onto a floor if you walk up them.  We stayed 4 nights, and no hot water for 2 of those days.   House Keeping come at the crack of dawn, because you should be up and at the park for magic hour.  We had booked an extra half day, however housekeeping didn't get the message, so no sleep in.  Rooms are reasonably sound proofed although we could hear people in the hall and families with

Summary Heading: Great Disney experience - BETTER than Grand Californian
Summary: We just go back from a great 2 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel.   Our family of 3 stayed in a 2 Queen bedded standard room.  The room was excellent, spacious and was perfect for a couple of days.  Each of us commented that we preferred the room over our higher category Grand Californian room last year...I think this was due to the room being more recently renovated, as well as the bed setup and lovely lighted headboard.  We had an excellent room service breakfast one morning so we were ready to take advantage of the early magic hour at the Parks.  The food was plentiful, good quality and well priced.  Highly recommend if you are getting up early to do the extra magic hours.  Highlight of the stay was dinner at Goofey's Kitchen. This was a great character experience.  We had

Summary Heading: If a Quiet location is important read this.
Summary: There are lots of reviews saying that the Adventure Tower is a 'preferred' spot at the DHL.  I would like to share a (in my opinion) huge drawback to the Adventure Tower location.  The Adventure Tower certainly has great park views and closest to Downtown Disney, however..the HUGE drawback is the very LOUD band that plays nearly every night (aprox 7:30PM to 10:30PM). There is a stage set up right by the Rain Forrest Cafe (its been there for years).  I couldn't stand the loud thumping of the band so luckily the front desk could move us to the Frontier Tower and it was very quiet.   For people who don't have young children, and plan to be out late anyway, this might not be a factor like it was for us.  If, on the other hand, you have little ones or just like to know you can go

As expected Disneyland Hotel is nothing but spectacular! It was clean and the room service was wonderful as opposed to the outside of the hotel  where our luggage was uncared for and nobody really bothered to help...considering this is Disneyland and we expected it to be smiles cheer and laughter all the way... Having said that, once again my 5 stars go to the concierge who gave us a spectacular;ar room and kept our son entertained with little trans and fun stories while we waited for the room to be allowed. It was a brilliant room that has a headboard that lights up and do ask a room from which you can view the fireworks. Having had so much to do during the day you just want to head back to your room so you catch some early shut eye and wake up all fresh and rosey but you still

First time I have stayed at the hotel and was very impressed by the up-keep to this relic.  We were put in the Adventure Tower.  Although the room looked clean to the average eye, the wife whose OCD got the Lysol wipes out and found the sample shampoo dish and the shelf under the sink fairly dusty.  Previous posts talked about not enough hot water.  I think there is enough, you just have to crank the handle all the way over. Fortunately I was there for a convention and the price was $200 nightly plus $18 for normal parking.  It is very convenient staying on property and this probably would be the most I would pay because I noticed several other hotels nearby that would be cheaper and in January you really don't use the pool and being in the park all day $250 a day gets pricey.

Bed 4/5Mattress firm/soft-in the firm side.  Room 5/5 room is clean.  Good number of outlets and lights.  Room has a flat screen TV. There is a desk area. Shower warmed up quick  and has  great pressure. Central air conditioner.  Price $$$ Proximity 5/5. Super close to the parks. Hotel has several restaurants. If you stay at a Disney resort take advantage of the magic hours offered daily at each park. The selected park will open earlier or later for Disney resort guests only.  ***Don't forget to turn on the headboard!  ***Great drinks and atmosphere at Trader Sam's!!!

Our stay was our first and was for my Son's 4th birthday. The hotel met every expectation we had plus more. Upon arrival Goofy happened to be greeting people outside the main door and helped my son carry in his bag. This start to our vacation was the perfect beginning and alone would have made the hotel worth it's steep price. Check in was smooth and we even got a room with a partial fireworks view. The room was clean and put you in a Disney mood. Loved the light up headboard. We spent the rest of our first day at the pool where my kids enjoyed the water slides and we lounged in the sun. Then we had Dinner at Goofy's Kitchen located in the hotel which was perfect. The hotel is a comfortable walking distance from the front gates of Disneyland (the monorail was down during our

I am here with my husband and our two year old. We heard mixed reviews of the hotel but decided to try it out for the location.The hotel is nice. Not a four or five diamond by any means but a nice property. The unfortunate part from my experience is the mixed bag of the staffing. Some employees are GREAT and some are not even remotely living up to the Disney experience. I assume it is very hard to staff this organization and you get what you get, but for the hotel enterprise, it really showed. I kept seeing so many opportunities to do things better. There is a stigma and a customer service Brand associated with Disney but we did not see many people that resembled this.   Let me start with the good. We liked the location. We don't mind walking and loved how close we were to

We were here for a one night stay to celebrate my 12 year old's birthday. I rented a cabana at the pool a few weeks ahead and we planned to enjoy a full day by the pool, as we are local and did not plan to visit the theme parks for this weekend. We arrived at 9am, checked our bags, and headed to the pool. What a fabulous, relaxing day! The pool and water slides are so much fun, my kids didn't want to stop to eat, and luckily the weather was just perfect for us, even late October. Food service at the pool was quick, and fine for pool food. I was able to set up a pack and play for my 12 month old in the cabana and still had plenty of room for the 2 sofas and table. We received a text that our room was ready 2 hour early, so when we were tuckered out from the pool we headed up to

It is the world of Disney and you have to accept all the nice music running in speakers all around the area, and in between you can jump into Goofy and the Chipmunks. But beside that the Disneyland Hotel is a very good stay. This was my second stay at the Frontier tower and it is absolute perfect, great rooms well maintained. A great place to stay when you are attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. highly recommend

The renovations have made this stay so magical. The little touches help make the experience amazing. Inculding the bed board nighlights, it was all amazing. I ran the 5k and the hotel was so accommodating. My family had the best time at the pool and the service was wonderful.

Booked this hotel for the NAMM convention. Loved the proximity to Downtown Disney. It was great to be able to walk there to eat, shop and hang out. The beds were very comfortable and the room was great. Loved all the Mickeys!  The parks were just on the other side of Downtown Disney and a nice stroll from the Disneyland Hotel.  Will for sure stay here again when returning to NAMM or visiting Disneyland.

Ok  So I chose this hotel as the original one booked was being renovated  I'm lucky to be able to stay in great hotels around the world so I know my stuff  Old shabby poor service room service takes 1 hour  No mini bar coffee making in room is circa 1970 s  Heard of Nespresso guys ?  Also no milk for said crap coffee  Food in restaurants is heart attack territory just screams yesteryear  Bell desk was not interested just poor all round  Why am I complaining ?  Because they charge the same price as a 5 star hotel in any major city in the world but deliver far less

We stayed for 2 nights in January and could not have asked for a better experience.....  Stayed in the adventure tower with views over Downtown Disney and the whole park in the distance. 2 min walk to downtown Disney and less then 10 mins to gates. As we only had 2 days, loved how close we were to the action.  Room big enough, considering there where 4 of us, with all the Disney touches. Service great.   Thanks Disneyland Hotel, we highly recommend everyone stay here.

We stayed here for 8 nights my kids loved the hotel and it's great to be so close to the theme parks. The rooms are clean, well maintained and super comfy beds. The only reason I have given 4 stars is the food is very expensive and so is downtown Disney. Also we checked out when it was raining and our transport were not allowed to pick us up out the front of the hotel so my 3 kids, my mother whom can't walk too far and myself had to walk out in the rain across the driveway to the car park to get picked with and wait for the bell service to bring our 11 bags to the transport so disappointed when you pay $$ to stay here. The bell service just said it's there rules however taxis are welcome to pick up people.

Staff at Hotel was Fantastic great get away!!!!! From start to finish everything was great no hassle no problems. One of the best vacations we have had in a very long time. Goofy' kitchen staff was great food cooked properly

I booked a club level room for 3 night to participate in the Star Wars Light Side Half Marathon weekend. We got to the hotel just after noon. We were pleasantly surprised when we were told they had a room ready for us. I had originally booked a room with 2 beds. The one they had ready was a King bed room. My Sister-in-law and I both agreed we could share a bed and gladly accepted the ready room. They brought out our greeter since we were club level. She showed us around and walked us up to our room. We were located in the Adventure tower on the 10th floor. She then took us to the E-ticket club on the 11th floor of the same tower. We grabbed some snacks and drinks and then went back to our room. During our 3 night stay, we visited the club many times including watching the

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel November 13-17, 2016. Traveling in mid-November the parks and hotels were preparing for the Holiday Season. Christmas decorations were just starting to go up and everyday we saw something new added to the resort area.  We loved staying on site because of the location and benefits. It was an easy walk through the Downtown Disney District to either park. It was convenient to enter California Adventure through the Grand Hotel and we entered Disneyland from the monorail. We used the Magic Morning Hour every day of our stay. Some of our group wanted to go back to the hotel during the day to use the pools and relax. You really feel a part of the magic!  We traveled as a family of four (2 adults, 15, 13). We enjoyed a standard view room in the

We spent four nights at the Disneyland Hotel, and we loved the proximity to the park. It was a quick walk to security, then a bit longer walk through Downtown Disney. However, we didn't mind the walk as Downtown Disney was quite interesting with various acts performing most of the time. The service at the hotel was excellent. We did stay at the concierge level, so perhaps that was a factor. None-the-less, the service was excellent. Our only negative ... The facility has obviously been renovated a few times, but it is starting to show its age.

We've stayed at Paradise Pier, the lowest-cost Disney hotel for Disneyland, and the Disneyland Hotel is really worth the extra money for the added Disney magic!  First of all, the rooms are lovely, but most of all, the grounds and pools are outstanding.  The pool at Paradise Pier is very plain and there isn't much too it.  The pools at the Disneyland hotel are amazing and really make you feel like you are at a tropical resort!  Also, there are often characters in the lobby available for pictures, without a long line.  The whole feel of the hotel is just magical!

The room was lovely and clean, pretty spacious too. Our complaint is that there was a shortage of hot water. Two of our three mornings there, the water was too cold to shower between 6 and 7 am. I would think that a hotel that charges as much as they do could afford to kick up the capacity of their water heaters! Also, there are two sinks in the room, which is nice, but one of ours was not working properly. I reported it when we left, so hopefully it will be fixed for the next occupants. We upgraded to a Downtown Disney view which I did not think was worth the extra money. Mostly all we saw was the roof of the AMC theater because we were on the far right facing Downtown Disney. I would definitely go for the pool view next time.

We had an amazing time at the Disneyland Hotel. Overall, I definitely recommend staying here for your Disney vacation.   Pros: - Magic Hour The extra hour in the park makes such a difference! -Convince -Never leaving the "Disney magic" -Room services was so amazing and a great way to start the day -The headboards were so fun! My son loved it. -Staff was top notch -The monorail taking you directly back and forth between Disneyland really helped for naps and on rainy days  -The hotel's onsite restaurants were very nice  Cons: -Price -Our room wasn't the cleanest. There was a lot of dust on all of our lamps for example -Our fridge was broken which was a bummer because we brought drinks and snacks for our son -The walls are very thin and you can hear EVERYTHING. Rest is minimal if

The hotel is the mini-showcase of what you expect at Disney, everything is carefully crafted to match the Disney charm. Right from washroom tap to lamp shade design, the decor has Disney touch. I liked the wooden carving of Disneyland on the bedside artwork. It is located right at the entrance of Downtown Disney, where you can enjoy lovely evenings. Attentive staff. Top floors have better views.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel close to theme parks
Summary: I wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised, well maintained hotel within great proximity to Disneyland. Clean rooms, well maintained to a high standard. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, some things to bring it to Five
Summary: Hello, if you follow my reviews am now disabled due to numerous heart operations and was going to stay at home. I cannot take the rides so felt be waste, it was not. We arrived on a 80*F day, The next 84F very nice. The restaurants inside the hotel were fantastic, the Steak house and Goofies restaurant, excellent buffet. Do not eat a week before departure.  I also used the outside pools. I think if one could be covered that would be great. I rolled in an electric stroller and talked to folks from around the world and enjoyed the views. My daughter was to tired for the fireworks, then it rained and rained and rained no fireworks heavy winds.

Summary Heading: First time stay at the the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: My wife and I came stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We have come to Disneyland many times but decided this time to stay at this hotel for the first time.   PRO's:  - Great overall Disney vibe - Good restaurants nearby. (Note that if you plan on eating at Steakhouse 55, you should make a reservation a week in advance) - Location to Downtown Disney and the park itself. Monorail is nearby to take you into the park. You could also walk to either entrance which is what we mostly did. - The bed is extremely comfortable and so are the pillows. We both woke up each morning complimenting how comfortable the bed was. - The hotel and room was really clean.  Cons: - The room was small. I believe somewhere around 258 sq ft.  - We upgraded to the deluxe room and I wish we hadn't. All we had

Grand Californian was being renovated and pools were closed so we stayed here.  It was probably renovated a couple years ago so it's in good shape, not as fancy as the Grand.  Nothing bad to say about the hotel, food not the best and you won't find any better in the park.  Monorail is close by and it takes you into Tomorrow Land.  Even though the hotel next to Downtown disney, it is still a 10 min walk to the theme parks if you have young kids. Kids liked the water slides and pool.

Completed my training with Disney Cruise Line at this Hotel! Very convenient access to Downtown Disney, and beautiful views of the sight in Paradise Pier.   Recommend: Calling in and making special requests for Pins, balloons, etc. The  hotel staff will go above and beyond to make things happen for you! Like 3 am Mickey Bars via Room service.

I stayed here for my 27th birthday, and we were lucky to have a view of Downtown Disney. It was my first time staying at a Disney hotel and I'm glad it was a great experience. The most memorable of all was coming back at around 9pm the day of my birthday, opening the curtains of my hotel room and watching the fireworks display. We turned off all the lights and watched the fireworks from the comfort of our room. I'm sure it would've been fine standing with everyone on Main Street, but I was happy to be away from the crowds and still able to watch the display from inside the room.

We stayed Club Level in November.  We were so happy with the location and the service.  It's a short walk through Downtown Disney to get to the parks.  The pool with the monorail slides were a hit for the whole family.  It was super clean!  Highly recommend!

You really  feel at the heart of all things Disney when staying here . We stayed for three nights . Comfy beds, great pools and having  dinner at Goofys kitchen was a massive highlight . If you can afford it spend at least part of your Disney experience here .

My husband & I always visit Disneyland at Christmas (it's the most Christmasy place around), and we usually stay at the wonderful Grand Californian. This time we stayed at The Disneyland Hotel, which was terrific.  It's more affordable than The Grand, more contemporary and just as convenient. Great staff, rooms, food and location.  It also seems a little more quiet than the Grand and the other hotels. Downtown Disney is right at your door, as is the monorail into the park.

My fiance and I made the 2nd trip to Disneyland in 2016 to watch our daughter dance in the Dance the Magic performances at Disneyland this November.  We got an amazing rate through the website for our hotel and immediately fell in love.  I have been wanting to stay at this hotel since I made my maiden voyage to the Happiest Place on Earth with my grandparents back in the 1980s.   My fiance and I agreed that we are hooked and it will only be Disney properties from now on for us.  You get early access to either California Adventure or Disneyland (depending on what day of the week it is) every morning during your stay.  We loved the little Mickey touches in the room and fell head over heels for the Tiki Bar on the property...In this hotel you are never away from the Disney magic.

I've gone to Disneyland for 30 years now with my family and have stayed at this hotel many times.  I do highly recommend it. The walk through  Downtown Disney gets you into the park easily. The hotel staff are polite and helpful . The pools and hot tubs are a welcome break when the parks get crowded.  We have stayed off property and on and despite the larger expense ultimately return there.  Just a few things this time  The location of security into the park has changes, as of last spring when we went, security was right before the  entrance at the park  Now security sits right at Disneyland Hotel  as one enters downtown Disney. We found no issue with this, I fact we found security more professional than before.   The hotel is older. We are from a different time zone and seemed

Summary Heading: Disney Hotel what more to say!!!
Summary: Stayed here for our Annual visit to Mickey's Halloween Party. This is the middle between casual Disney Paradise Pier and the extravagant Disney California.   Distance: This Hotel is situated at the other end of Downtown Disney. Although it is not as close as Disney Cali. but it is closer than Disney Pier.   Lobby and Hotel: Lobby is minimal, our check in date was quite hectic, but you can still expect Disney quality. This is composed of different buildings so expect and each will have a mini lounge lobby. Our bellboy was great, and as expected from Disney he was very helpful in showing us our room features.  Room: Everyone in my family, even our family friend that was 28 fell in love w/ the room experience that we converted her to be a Disney fan. The details from the bathroom

Summary Heading: Amazing place to stay on NYE
Summary: If you want to enjoy and feel the excitement of NYE ,this is the place. Room is comfortable . Staff is accommodating . Very convenient to Disney city walk where bars and restaurants are abundant. You can get drunk with no prob of DUI.  It's very nice place for a family to celebrate NYE.

We stayed there for three nights right before Christmas.  We had a 'standard view' room, but we could see Matterhorn mountain from our room.  It is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the park, but it does not seem that far because you are walking through Downtown Disney.  We ate at the casual restaurant by the pool which had limited food choices, but the prices were fairly reasonable by Disney standards.  Our daughter loved the headboard in the room - it lights up and plays music which is nice.  It is not an inexpensive hotel by any means, but it is nice to splurge once in a while.

Great Disney hotel -- large comfortable rooms with tons of "hidden Mickeys" to add to the atmosphere.  A short walk to the parks and even shorter to downtown Disney. Cost was a bit high but since I was there solo I appreciated being on property.  Also staying at the rooms allows guests to enter the park earlier.  FYI the hotel consists of  3 separate buildings and the buildings other than the building you check into do not have any lobby services -- no stores or staffing -- which could make some single guests uncomfortable.

Summary Heading: Definitely Disney and Worth the extra cost
Summary: This hotel is on the property and gives early access to the park.  It was well worth the extra cost given that it was easy to take a break and return to the hotel without too much hassle.  Large room and very comfortable beds.  Would return again.  Did not use pool given it was cold most of the days we were there.  Staff was very pleasant and even gave us a upgraded room without asking.  This is our first stay at this hotel, we have stayed at the Grand Californian in the past and don't think it was any significantly different.

We were so glad we chose this hotel.  Downtown Disney is less than 2 minutes away, the monorail is a further minute, and the parks are another 8 minutes walk.  The hotel was clean and service was amazing.  Checkin was fast - there were at least 4 cast members available to help with check in. We were located on the 2nd floor facing the pool area.  Being lower we could not see much but we didn't mind.  The head boards in the room - wow - I was in awe.  Great attention to detail. House keeping was amazing - rooms always cleaned well.  Towels and supplies replenished. The onsite gift stores are great.  Breakfast choices are adequate - they had one by the pool and a bagel shop nears Goofys Kitchen. We had breakfast at Goofys Kitchen.  Great food but it took a long time for all the

Summary Heading: It's Disneyland and yes everything is amazing
Summary: The hotel itself is a regular hotel but the things that go along with the hotel are Disney Magic! We loved Goofy's Kitchen for the entertainment for our daughter.  The food is nothing to go crazy over but we were not there for the food but rather to meet the characters!  Our room was a standard level room in the Adventure tower....BE CAREFUL if you have young children that go to bed early!!  downtown Disney is literally a 60 second walk which is fantastic but they have live music from 7-10pm that you can hear in your room so falling asleep was a bit of a challenge for our family.  The Cast Members (staff) were all a delight and very helpful if we needed anything.  Staying on property is totally worth it because of the quick walk to Downtown Disney and to the parks themselves.

I have wanted to stay at this a Hotel since I was a kid. Since we have two toddlers we did the valet parking the guys that helped us were so friendly and helpful. We arrived very early but they had our room ready and checked us in. Later that day I could not find my room key so I went to the front desk. I waited for a few seconds until the girls at front desk stopped their conversation about another employee. The two girls behind the girl helping  me kept talking about another employee the girl helping me would say a thing or two to contribute to their conversation. I did not like that.  I had a cold that day, I asked where I could find medicine. She said she didn't know and turned around and left.  Rooms are super nice and clean my kids loved it.  Loved that Goofys kitchen is

Summary Heading: First Visit-Christmas time-Magical experience for all!
Summary: My wife and I decided that we would surprise our kids (ages 9 and 6) with a trip to Disneyland for Christmas.  Being locals, from the Pasadena area, we only stayed one night but we had the best experience.  We splurged for a Premium View, Club Level Room and it was well worth it.  While the room itself is what I would describe as your typical hotel room (with the exception of the nice Disney/Mickey touches throughout), the service is First Rate.  Our family appreciates service above all else and the service at the Disneyland Hotel matches any we have received anywhere.  Of particular note was our Check In Assistant Tina who greeted us warmly when we arrived and even went out of her way to find us at lunch in Downtown Disney to give our kids their "First Visit to Disneyland"

Visited Disneyland from December 14th to 18th.  The weather was cooler and wetter than expected.  The Disneyland Hotel is just outside Downtown Disney.  Our room was in the Fantasy Tower.  The room was large and comfortable with nice furnishings.  There was a gingerbread house in the entry and across from the elevators were pictures of many famous persons who stayed at the hotel.  The nearness of the hotel to Disneyland meant that we could benefit from the extra magic hour, go back to our room to recover then go back at night to watch the fireworks.

Disneyland at Christmas is a great time to experience this wonderland of entertainment for all ages.   Almost all the rides are open, but realize it is one of the busiest times of the year. It is decorated to display the essence of the holiday season. Hotels are full, so reservations should be done well in advance. There are excellent options for hotels bot on and off property. Disneyland Hotels are at the high end of expense, even with their packages. There are numerous excellent Hotels, Motels, .etc. close to Disneyland which are quality properties and easier on the budget. Determine the quality of the property you wish to stay at and develop your budget. Some of the properties offer free parking and transportation to Disneyland, so it would be wise to consider those

Stayed here with my family (2 young children) and they were so welcome and accommodating of our needs. We booked a Club level room which meant we were greeted at our car and brought straight up to our room for check in. The E club upstairs is great as they have food and drink all day so it was great to be able to pop up and get a coffee. Fab view of the park and the fireworks at night too

My family and I had an amazing time!  When you first walk into the hotel, a large ginger bread house greets you.  The lobby was fun with the teacup chairs and overall very festive since we visited in December.  The grounds were amazing.  The way the property was set up, it reminded me of the Flamingo in Las Vegas.  The room was very comfortable and the little "Mickey" touches added a special flair.  Like the sink handles being Mickey shaped and the lights in the bathroom were being held by large Mickey hands.  Even though the pool is heated and opened year around, it felt too cold to swim but we did get to enjoy the hot top.  The hotels proximity to Downtown Disney is literally steps away.  We took advantage of this multiple times.  Goofy's kitchen is pretty pricey but

Summary Heading: The best hotel for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Friendly comfortable hotel which is obviously super convenient for a visit to Disneyland or Disney's California Adventure.  Helpful, efficient and friendly service at the check-in desk.  Fun character buffet restaurant.  Convenient in-hotel Disney store if you did not get in enough shopping in the parks.

Summary Heading: An indispensable part of the whole Disney experience
Summary: If you have kids and are wanting the whole Disney experience this hotel really should be a part of it.  With decor that is pure Disney (including taps shaped like Mickey and a bedhead with a reproduction in fairy lights of fireworks over the Magic Kingdom).  With pool and character breakfasts plus great access to all that Downtown Disney has to offer in shops and dining it's perfectly located.  And for anyone wanting to stay fit (not always the No. 1 priority when you see the state of many of the guests) there is an onsite gym that's more than adequately equipped.  Basically you stay here so you can immerse in the whole experience - and even for a seasoned traveller like me and my 23 year old daughter, she still squeals whenever she sees the front door :-)

Three magical nights we got to stay here at the hotel during our trip to Disneyland. Even before we arrived they took care of all our needs & then some through a package they mailed to us with maps, details of our room & hotel plus collectible pins, lanyards & a bag celebrating the "60 Disneyland Diamond Celebration!" How cool is that! Everything was fresh, clean & in its place every time we came back to our room. We had a great view from our bedroom on the 7th floor facing the pools. Access to the Disneyland theme park was a very short & pleasant walk thru "Downtown Disney." Our family enjoyed every minute. Great nights sleep every night! We will have fond memories for the rest of our lives.

The first time at the hotel was an amazing magical experience. My husband and I stayed last year after our wedding and the staff made us feel so special. We returned for our one year anniversary and I felt the magic was gone. The room was dingy and not clean. The staff was less than friendly and not helpful at all. The only good thing about staying here is the extra magic morning hour, which lets you get into the park before the general public.

I stayed in this hotel last month as part of a celebration recognition trip for my team.  It is a BEAUTIFUL hotel, we had phenomenal service.  CAREY DRISCOLL from BEACHBUM VACATIONS booked this trip for us. It required a LOT of work and dealing with details / logistics and she nailed it as always.  The details in the Disneyland Hotel are AMAZING -- so incredibly themed, so much history.  I highly recommend it!

The hotel is fun and keeps you in the Disney feeling all the time. The walk into Disneyland is just through the downtown Disney area, or getting on the monarail. Convenient especially with children! I can't wait to go back!

We were on a vacation with our family. Such a fun trip. The only problem was the hotel. The room we stayed in was slightly dirty. No problem after they came and cleaned it. Except for that one time, it was a great trip for the whole family!

Just got back from a stay at the hotel I have to stay every time I go it's less and less magical. First thing is the magic morning is about the best thing they have going other then that eh. The club level is also a nice break from the parks but seems to be much more busier then before.  The rooms you can't go wrong with. Very beautiful and totally the Disney touch all the way.  I think my biggest complaint is just the service is awful. No one that works their seems to care and even told us that the hotel has "changed" a lot in the last couple years. They use to go out of their way to make sure you were completely happy with your stay. I've stayed at this hotel my entire life with my parents and now with my family and it has changed a lot.  I did want to say that the staff in

While the lobby is updated and bright the rooms are TIRED! Old colors, old lighting, old furniture. But worse than that is how much they charge for these rooms. The monorail was not convenient and that's where you encounter your first line. The took our self-stick and said we are relinquishing it.  My biggest complaint was when I booked this through the Disney vacations they said my 2 room suite included the club level with had snacks and happy hour. I got there and the club level was under construction and what they offered me in its place was for an additional $250/night they will offer us a club level at the other hotel. We paid $1300 a night for a 2 room suite and then to be told we needed to pay $250 more to get a service that was suppose to be included. What is wrong with

Summary Heading: Disney Touches Everywhere - Made Our Anniversary Special
Summary: When coming back to the area, we usually stay at Grand Californian, so this was our first time staying at DLH. We were here for the fall dapper day expo, which is here at the hotel, so being close to that was very convenient. We were upgraded to 11th floor double queen room. We could see some views of Disneyland (Matterhorn, Thundermountain) but most important was being able to see fireworks from our room each and every night. You can even turn on the fireworks channel and have the music piped into your room simultaneously during the fireworks show. Room was standard size hotel room, but with many Disney & Mickey Mouse touches (hidden mickeys on the carpet, mickey hands holding the light sconces, mickey handles for sink and shower, etc.) Rooms have a fridge and small sitting

Hotel location is average.  Whilst within the Disney park area, it is still about 15 min walk to the park entrance.  There is monorail station 5 min walk away but that gets you to Disneyland only and not to California Adventure.  Hotel is located at the end of Downtown Disney strip.  Lots of eating options nearby which is a plus.  Downside is there is no supermarket or pharmacy nearby with closest about 5 min taxi ride out.  Rooms are decent and good sized (we took the standard room for 4 - 2 adults and 2 young kids).  Beds are quite firm. No separate shower cubicle though with shower and bathtub together.  Concierge is helpful but could be better.  I had asked for help on getting transport to Sea World and was give a brochure for bus service and number for taxi service and

Yes, staying at the Disneyland Hotel is more expensive than staying at a non-Disney hotel, but it is well worth the investment.  Having stayed elsewhere on previous trips, the convenience of the location (not to mention the magic for the kids) made a big difference.  The pool is divine and there are so many lifeguards on duty - it was very impressive.  We made full use of the extra hour in the parks, which we found especially valuable for the super popular rides, like Radiator Springs, Space Mountain and Indiana Jones.  Our rooms were impeccably maintained and the Disney shop in the hotel was very useful.  The wait at the registration desk / guest services was pretty long at times, but that's a minor blemish in an otherwise awesome experience.

Been to Disneyland several times and once we stayed here we won't go anywhere else.  So convenient and comfy.  Other places are nicer and less expensive but the convenient location is worth every cent. The magic hour is priceless.

Gave my G/son and daughter an early Christmas prestent and took them to Disneyland, and stayed at this wonderful hotel. From the check in to, sadly, checkout the experience was wonderful. The room, delux, overlooked the pool, and was laid out with all the creature comforts one would expect from Disney. My G/som loved the lighted Headboard... Very spacious, clean, quiet, and the maids were som accomadating, as was the valet service... We slept like babes after a full day and night at the park... Thanks for everything.... We will be back.....

This was our first time staying in the original tower. Absolutely fantastic two room suite. Plenty of room to spread out after a long day at the parks. Really good view of the fireworks from our rooms. Staff were all great. My family really loves staying here. This is really worth the stay for many reasons. Really close to parks.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel helped us in our time of need!
Summary: We had an unfortunate incident at a hotel in Anaheim on December 6th.  I called the Disneyland Hotel and explained our plight at 7:30 AM on December 7th.  We had a two year old in our party who would need to nap later in the morning but we had to vacate the hotel we had reserved due to bed bugs being found.  Normally D H  does not allow early check in before 3:00 PM but given our situation they were able to offer a room and we were checked in and settled by 8:30 AM.  The staff was amazing and so helpful.  What a magical end to an unfortunate situation.

Spent one here as we enjoyed Disneyland at the most beautiful time of the year! Front desk staff excellent, room excellent, room service excellent !!! All what you expect when your doing Disney 😱  Hotel is within walking distance to all the park has to offer. You can also take the tram into Tomorrowland to access park and miss a little of the lines that are at the main entrance. Would like to stay here again!

We usually stay at the Grand Californian when we come to Disneyland, but decided to give the Flagship a try. Unlike the Grand Californian, you know where you are. It is not subtle, but then that's why you are there, right? The room had a king size bed, but was smallish. Hot water in the tub was hot for the first shower, but not so much for subsequent morning showers. Room was clean, but given the price and staying on the Club level, I expected more. No slippers, but the robes were nice. Towels were scratchy and the towel paper was wafer thin. The E-Ticket club was nice and had lots of snacks and helpful staff. It was a great place to view the fireworks. While it was nice, I'll stay at the Grand Californian in the future.

Love the fibre optic head boards!  This is the first Disney hotel ever built and it still has so much of the Classic Disney nostalgia.  We liked the early park hours and the parcel delivery.  The pool was great but a bit too heavy on the chlorine.   Worth every penny but if you can wait till the end of the summer, you can get the discount rate.

Summary Heading: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
Summary: You are probably asking what would have possessed me to take off a mark from a Disney property? Am I crazy? Well hang on to your mouse ears because we'll go right on through this. I am currently typing this in my room in the Adventure tower of the Disneyland hotel. This is one of three towers as I understand it that make up this particular hotel. As my title stated, let's go through the good, the bad, and the ugly.   The Good: This is my first time visiting Disneyland itself, as I live on the east coast and have frequented the World many times. As spread out as that is, my initial impression of the proximity of the hotel to the parks was pretty good, considering. Yes, it's a 5-10 minute walk, but in my book that's pretty good. In the afternoon/evening it's a bit of a workout as

Summary Heading: Great Room, Fun Experience, Not as Close to the Parks as you might think
Summary: When I visited Disneyland as a kid I always dreamed of someday staying at the Disneyland HOTEL.  In those days the hotel was right off the park and you could take the monorail directly to the hotel.  Times have changed.  The Disneyland hotel is completely redone and one of three hotels at the Disneyland resort.    Pros:  1) Cool, modern room with all the amenities you'd expect and  2) Small touches that Disney does that make it unique and special, especially for kids (they loved the twinkle light-up wall).   3) The pool is nice.   4) The "character-dining" restaurant is attached to the hotel. 5) Parking is free and easy  Cons: the biggest negative is the distance you have to walk to get to the park.  It's a 5-10 minute walk through Downtown Disney (depending on your pace), but

We recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel with our almost two year old. We loved all of the decorations in the lobby and the closeness to Downtown Disney and the parks. It was great to come back to our room for nap time.  The room was a little bit dated and had a funny smell that we got used to after being in it for a while. We probably should have called to have someone fix it but we weren't really in our room very much.

After leaving the hotel, discovered I had left my wallet and passport in the room safe. Contacted the hotel who were less than helpful. Would not visit the room or call before 10am. We drove 2 hours back, knocked on the room door, very helpful occupant.  I opened the safe and we were gone in less than 5 minutes. Never heard back from the hotel.

We decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for an event we were attending there and the proximity to the parks. It is pricey compared to neighboring hotels but there is magic here.   Parking is easy, we decided to self park and they give you a little card to place in your window for in and out purposes. If you self park I would suggest unloading the car in the valet area and then parking since it's a little walk but hard with a lot of luggage.   Check-in was simple. We arrived around 1pm the day the big marathon was just wrapping up so it was a little busy. Our room wasn't ready just yet but they give you rooms keys and inform you they will send a text when it was ready. We hung out in the lobby seating area until then.  I did notice I didn't have any cash on hand to tip the

Summary Heading: Spectacular Views, Pricey, But very Clean and Comfortable
Summary: First, be aware the pricing at the Disneyland Hotel has changed with higher prices for the Adventure Tower that overlooks Downtown Disney. But there is another option . . . We stayed in the Frontier Tower on an upper 11th floor (Room 2974) and we had amazing views of Disneyland, Downtown Disney, and importantly, the fireworks at night! It is considered a pool view room, but is les expensive than the downtown Disney view. You need to be on the 11th floor as far toward Downtown Disney as possible so you can see over the Adventure Tower that is only 11 stories tall (versus 13 for the Frontier Tower). This was peak Thanksgiving time so prices were also higher than normal (about $500 per night with tax).  We got to the hotel very early (about 8:00 AM). The check in process was

Summary Heading: A Great Stay and Terrific Staff
Summary: My recent stay at the Disneyland Hotel was incredible.  From the moment I stepped into the hotel I was greeted warmly, and all the cast members made me feel welcome.  The room was large for a standard room, and even though it was a standard view, I still could see Downtown Disney fairly easily.  Even though there was a convention at the Hotel, I did not hear any sound from my room.  The room was also spotless, and all the special touches were amazing.

stayed here with the kids, was pricey but worth it, they loved it. The headboards on the beds even lit up like fireworks. Only issue was construction noise outside at Downtown Disney prevented afternoon naps.

I woul recommend this hotel.... Perfect location to visit Disney.... Beautiful rooms, beautiful people, including the services.   Big room and the pictures in the room was the tip of the room, they light up.  Beautiful birthday to my grandaughter.

I was hesitant to splurge on the Disneyland Hotel. However, based on the location and the service, it was well worth the value. The seating area and fireplace just outside the pool area was so inviting. Room service was reasonably priced and a much needed convenience when we were tired from walking all day. But I really new it was well worth the cost when my 4 year old got tired and made me carry her all the way back to the hotel. The proximity of the hotel was priceless!

Summary Heading: Good location, didn't live up to the location's promise
Summary: We go to Disneyland every year for the RunDisney event. Usually, we stay off grounds at a hotel that has a kitchen. But that is often a two mile or more walk.  This year, we decided to splurge and stay on the Disney property so that we could take advantage of the Monorail entrance and the California Adventure hotel entrance.  We were there from Tuesday - Monday. On Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, during the day, the monorail operators told us it was too hot to run the monorail. Really? Then Friday, when the park was packed for Veteran's Day and it was HOTTER, the monorail was running all the time. Conclusion: Disney lied. This, of course, meant quite a long walk to the park and going through the regular security lines that were at least an hour wait.   We feel really cheated.

The best reason to stay here is for the location. The price of course is more expensive than nearby hotels, but being steps away from Downtown Disney and the very close proximity to the theme parks has its advantages. While at the park, and if you forgot something or want to go back to your room and rest for a bit, it's nice to be able to just walk back to your hotel room. Staying at the the Disney resort hotels, you can also take advantage of early admission one hour before opening on select days. The staff was friendly. Rooms were clean and sufficiently sized. Theres self parking and valet and the walk isn't too far. Pretty happy with my stay here.

This hotel is classic Disney with many Mickey Mouse touches in each room.  The lobby has an adorable tea-cup lounge, plenty of little shops and places to eat.  Our room was nice, had a Downtown Disney view which was nice for watching nightly fireworks.  The furniture is a bit dated but the bed was super comfortable.  The pool area was nice as well, lots of life guards carefully watching children abs especially close to the waterside area.  Location was good as well - it's at the end of Downtown Disney near ESPN Zone and more importantly, near the monorail station so you can easily go into the park and bypass entry gate lines.  Don't forget - staying at any Disney hotel means you get to enter the park one hour earlier than the general public.  Parking - $18 per car and plenty of

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in November 2016 for the Super Heroes Half Marathon Weekend.  The location for this race could not be beat.  We were able to walk out of the door and within less than ten minutes, we were in our corral for the start of the race.  If you are travelling for a Run Disney Weekend, I can't recommend a hotel more!  This is our second trip to Disneyland, but our first staying on property and I wouldn't dream of staying off property again.  We were able to leave the parks at the end of the night and be back in our room in 10 minutes.    Check in was no problem.  Originally we were assigned the Frontier Tower, but I requested a room in the Adventure Tower and they were able to accommodate.  The tower is right near the entrance to Downtown Disney.

Staying here is very convenient to the park and the hotel is very nice, but it is double or triple the price of others a block or two away. Headboard lights up and plays soft Disney music which is a nice touch but I'm not sure it was worth $300 extra night

Summary Heading: Excellent Place to Stay, Especially if You Love Disney Nostalgia
Summary: We spent four nights at the Disneyland Hotel Nov 4-8.  The hotel was amazing.  We checked-in at 10am, and the nice cast member said that (of course) our room was not ready yet.  Then she said wait, let me check something, give me a minute.  She found a king room was that was unoccupied the night before so she checked us in at 10am!  Typical Disney Castmember customer service at its finest.   We made our way to the Adventure Tower for our pool view room.  We were on the 7th floor and the view of the pool complex was perfect.  We were a bit nervous of the location of the room just to the right of the elevator because of possible noise.  However, the room was quiet as could be.  We never heard anyone.  The room A/C kicks off when you leave, but as soon as you return, it cools the

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but price preformance level is a little low.
Summary: I stayed here with my wife and 3 year old daughter. My first impression is that it is a little run down for the price but after the first night that impression turned and the magic of the place prevailed. We arrived early and our room was ready. We booked a room with a better view and it was worth it. Our room was on the 8th floor of the fantasy tower overlooking the pool. The room was a good size for the three of us.  The first thing we did when we arrived is went swimming. The pools were nice with a great water slide. They had life vests the correct size for my daughter. After swimming we had time for shopping and dinner in downtown Disney. It was a great start to a wonderful 3 night stay. With the hotel comes early admission. Plan around this as they alternate which parks you

We are checkin gout of the Disneyland Hotel today after having stayed for four nights.  And last week we spent on night at the Disney Grand Californian.  Both were nice, and are rated aas four star htoels an i think this is acurate - they are very solid four star hotels, (with five star beds.)   In a five star hotel, you expect marble everywhere and some decadence in the decor, and this doesn't have that, but what it is is great.  The Disneyland Hotel rooms are very nice...pretty matching clean functional tile (not marble) bathrooms, nice layout, no extra breakable extra decadence making the room un-kid-friendly (important if you have toddlers.)  The beds here are FIVE STAR - same as any Four Seasons I've stayed at, and great to come back to with tired feet after a long day at

Summary Heading: First stay at the Disneyland Hotel and I loved it!
Summary: My husband and I went to DLR, just the two of us. We have stayed at the Paradise Hotel and Grand California before and decided to try the Disneyland Hotel. We LOVED it. We booked a standard view room.  We got a beautiful king room on the second floor in the Adventure Tower with a pool view. It was lovely. The headboard was especially nice. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and a nice size.  I especially liked the ability to skip the long bag check lines and use the monorail or Grand California entrances. You had to present a room key prior to 11 am and the lines were much more manageable. I am already looking to book my next trip to DLR and staying at the Disneyland Hotel again!

My family and I were able to get a room at the Disneyland Hotel, with an upgrade to concierge level.  The room did not disappoint whatsoever. The staff was so over the top helpful it was amazing.  From the front desk, the bellman, the guest services to the poolside service, everyone was amazing. I would highly recommend concierge level to everyone, as free food and drinks are always a welcome respite after pounding the pavement at Disneyland all day.  However, even a regular room would have sufficed to take part in the lovely atmosphere. The hotel has great views, beautiful grounds and an awesome pool.  I didn't get to try out the restaurants, but we will next time for certain.  My wife and kids loved it and we will be back!  Thanks for the pixie dusted treatment.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel to celebrate our daughter's fourth birthday (and let me say, four is the most PERFECT age to bring a child to Disney - IMO).  We got two adjoining rooms and it was our little family of three (Mom, Dad and kid), my mother and my sister.  We checked in a little bit early (2pm) and the girl at the front desk was fantastic at finding us rooms that would allow us to check into one of them at that time so our daughter could nap.  She also gave our daughter a Happy Birthday picture from all the characters.  I loved the style of the hotel.  It's light and cheery, very clean and comfortable.  It's slightly farther to walk to from the parks, but as an able bodied person, we certainly didn't mind.  The "Dream Is A Wish" headboard and hidden Mickey Mouse

Summary Heading: You Never Go Wrong with Disney!
Summary: We attended a business convention that was held at the Disneyland Hotel, but we elected to go a few days early to enjoy sunny California!  The hotel was straight Disney brand!  Everything was extraordinarily clean and the rooms were "roomy".  I hate hotels where you are tripping over your luggage to get to the other side of the room! These rooms were very nice.  There were several towers, and the lobby areas of each one was all "Disney".  The pool with the slides was awesome as well!

Summary Heading: A few misses but still a great vacation
Summary: We stayed a week at the hotel and it is a very impressive property. Lots of fun things to see but there were a few things I was disappointed with. It might sound funny but I was hoping for more "magic", I mean it's Disneyland right? When we checked in staff was friendly and helpful, the young lady who check us in was great. My first issue was the Costco/Disney connection-it was interrupted. When we had booked, it became cheaper right before we left. It lead to me being on the phone with Costco for long periods of time. One of those long phone calls, the person said he was going to leave a package for my daughter and I would get it at check in. The last time I called to make my final payment, the package to be left was brought up and the person I spoke with sounded unhappy with

We loved the Disneyland Hotel. Short walk to the park entrances. Loved the magic hour everyday that we got for being hotel guests - best way to get to those rides with the long wait. Pool was fun. Room was lovely - liked all the Mickey Mouse touches around the room - my kids loved the light up head board on the bed. Staff were friendly and helpful. We loved immersing in the Disney bubble for our stay. Loved Goofys Restaurant on site too. Would definitely stay again next time we go to Disneyland.

We booked a double queen room, when arriving they wanted to change it to a  one queen or king, we said no and they were argumentative asking why? When we refused they talked to the manager, then we got place in the building that was being remodeled , the room was old and dirty and very noisey .. it was a shame to be treated like that at Disneyland.  I had to pick a date but didnt go back far enough ..didnt think to complain, till this popped up and asked me to review our stay

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights.  We were a combined family of 10 with 6 kids ages 4-17 years.  I got a separate room for my husband and I with a Downtown Disney view.  We were on the 7th floor and the palm trees block the view of Downtown Disney.  Some of the fireworks shows were visible in the evenings.  This week was also the week of the Disney Marathon and the route was just outside our window with loud motivating music at 0600.   My brother had a pool view room in the Adventure Tower that was beautiful.  We loved the decor.  Very clean rooms and comfortable beds.  Friendly staff.  I REALLY wish there were microwaves available in the rooms.

We are annual visitors to Disneyland, and over the past 15 years have stayed at the Grand Californian each time. We have been hearing such good things about the Disneyland Hotel, and the price was right this year so we decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised by how much we loved it!  The grounds were beautiful, with lush tropical greens. The swimming pool had, in my opinion, a much better waterslide and play area than the GC. Trader Sam's makes you feel like you are on a Hawaiian vacation!  Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to a room with a pool view versus the parking lot view in Frontierland tower (for approximately $30 more per night). It also included a daybed which would free up more sleeping space for our party of three. The room was far superior to an

Summary Heading: Great Place to Mix Business and Pleasure
Summary: In October, I attended a work conference at the Disneyland Hotel. Granted the discounted room rate probably has slanted my room but I was really surprised by how much I liked it. I had been to Disneyworld a number of times for business and pleasure but never Disneyland. This was by far my favorite of the two. It just has the great old school vibe, the pool area is awesome in the middle and Downtown Disney is just steps away. I actual walked out and hit the Earl of Sandwich two different nights. It was awesome you could sit outside and listen to live music and then head back to your room. I also have to see an amazing fireworks display one night while walking around.  I thought the rooms were really nice plenty of room for a family (if you had one) and the mural above the beds

Loved it! First time staying here, I've stayed Grand CA previously. The walk to the front of the parks is about 10-15 mins, really not bad & if you're in Disneyland or going to Disneyland you can take the monorail and that's less than 5 mins from the Disneyland Hotel. There's a new Starbucks by the monorail so you can order your morning coffee to pick up on your way to the parks in the morning & enjoy it on your walk through Downtown Disney- loved that! Our room was in good shape, not perfect, it could use a bit of TLC but everything worked, bed felt fine. Compared to the Grand, the biggest downside to the room was the sink is not separate from the shower area. With only 2 people that was fine, but with more that could slow up your morning. Pools were fine, fwiw we never had a

This is my second time staying here (my first was back in 1996 before all of the renovations). The rooms are huge in this hotel and have many magical features, like the headboard lighting up and playing music, and the Mickey Mouse hand wall sconces in the bathroom.   The bathroom was fairly well designed in that the toilet is in a separate room from the shower; the only downside was the toilet room was a little small. I had an amazing night of sleep here and didn't want to leave!!!!!

Summary Heading: Must Experience to Complete Disneyland Theme Party Visit
Summary: We booked this hotel for a friend for an inclusive experience primary for their children but how everyone including adults enjoyed their stay was a huge bonus also makes me happy for making the right choice for their visit.  Don't compare the room with new modern hotels instead for the historical landmark building and the intimate atmosphere of the great world of Disney, this is a must for every person to do it at least once a lifetime.

Did not stay at this one our last visit but we have stayed in the past.  We did go visit the renovated pool area and it was fantastic.  Also the best non ride attraction is located just off the pool area and that is Trader Sams it is a must visit while at DLR.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and My Favorite of the Resorts!
Summary: This is my second stay at the Disneyland Hotel and my first since the remodel a few years ago.  We have stayed at all three of the Disneyland Hotels and this one is my favorite because of the Disney nostalgia, the characters roaming and the lovely large rooms with the magical headboards and subtle hidden mickeys.  Trader Sam's in a blast, with late night music and drinks on the Terrace. Be sure to have breakfast at the Steakhouse, it is lovely, the portions are huge, and the prices are reasonable!

Summary Heading: High Price for an Underwhelming Experience
Summary: I travel often and I've never spent the time to write one of these before - which should show you just how my whole experience with the DLH went. When we arrived at the park last week we decided it would be fun to stay the night. We went to the front desk at which point they told us they were sold out, but could put us on a waitlist and would call us if a room became available. They were understandably busy that day, but by 3:30 I hadn't heard anything back. I spent about 20 minutes on hold with Disney's reservation line before being connected to the front desk - at which point they told me rooms had been available for hours.   Keep in mind we were in the park at this point. We walked all the way back to the hotel from Disneyland (not that far of a walk) and went to the front

Summary Heading: DISNEY HOTEL -- goods for kids and family for relaxation
Summary: Disney Hotel is the excellent in location in which you could walk to Theme Parks via pass through Disney Downtown in 10 minutes in which so fun because there are many shops and restaurants on the way.  At Disney Hotel, kids could enjoy the pool in which so fun and I love it.

I have always wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and this year I did.  My grandson will be 3 years old in March, and my son-in-law who is in the military qualified for a military discount which is quite a savings for families.  Together we planned a family trip to Disneyland and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.   Parkhopper tickets are available at Guest Services, including the military discount tickets.  When entering Disneyland you will need a military ID holder in your party.  We reserved Club Level rooms and had access to the E-Ticket room.  The E-Ticket room provides snacks and beverages for guests, and beer and wine in the evenings.  The first night we viewed the fireworks from there.  There is an Nespresso machine available to make cappuccinos.  You can also check out

We stayed in the Fantasy Tower for two nights. My daughter was a 'cast member' for the weekend at Disneyland Park!   The most outstandingly my part of our first-ever stay at a Disney hotel was how friendly EVERY single cast member was; from valet to front desk to client services to janitorial - even to the guy who came to fix our tv at 10pm at night. Our Bellman even sang to us as he delivered the bags to our room! If you want to be treated really, really well on vacation, then the extra $$$ are definitely worth it!  The hotel itself, while amazingly appointed with Disney knick knacks throughout, was really just a place to sleep after making day. So for us, with teens who wanted to be in the parks, the pool and other on-site amenities weren't used.   We stayed in a deluxe suite.

Stayed here November 1-3 on a family vacation. There was 6 adults, 4 kids and a 2 month old baby. So we ended up splurging and getting the 3 bedroom suite which was amazing. We figured we would spend just as much if we would have gotten 3 different rooms. At least this way we would be together and the kids would be able to play with each other.
