The 3 bedroom suite was a little different then I imagined it to be. Because it was one room with 2 queen beds with a adjoining door to a king bedroom (with a balcony & couch) that was separated by another door to a living room (with another balcony & couch) that also had another king bedroom.  Kinda hard to explain the layout. But pretty much it was 3 rooms all adjoined. So we just put door stoppers on all the doors to leave the rooms

Our family of 5 stayed here to we could do the Halloween party until late. 5 of us easily fit in the room with 2 queen beds and a couch that converted to a daybed. The giant headboard lit up and sang us off to sleep. You could easily see the fireworks from the room. The hotel let us continue to park there even after we checked out and stored our bags. Souvenirs bought in the park could be sent to our room. I absolutely loved staying here. It's the best way to experience Disneyland.

It was great experiencing this place. The check-in was smooth. We came around noon, spent the first day exploring the area, came back and rested, and spent the next day exploring Disneyland! The hotel was cozy and had the luxurious feel to it. I loved everything about it! Would definitely recommend this to anyone!

What can I say? I had a magical trip.Lets just get one thing straight, IT IS EXPENSIVE. You know that during booking! Nobody forces you to book it and if you can "get a better deal across the street" then do it! Save the rest of us from your complaining.  Moving on, I booked 3 nights and 4 days at The Disneyland Hotel after adamantly saying I was gonna save money this trip (Whoops!). I booked a premium view room (not DtD view) from 10/30-11/2 my birthday was on Halloween so it was a gift for me! We got a corner room on the 9th floor which was just gorgeous. We had a view of the whole resort, the pools and a corner panorama view. Thankfully our request for a king bed was granted  and goodness it was the most comfortable bed ever. The room was very clean (we checked) the light up

Summary Heading: Excellent stay but admin needs improving
Summary: Did 7 nights at the Disneyland Hotel, 3 adults and 2 kids in a premium downtown view. Hotel is beautiful but expensive, but it is Disney! Grounds are immaculate and room comfortably accommodating 5 of us with nightly fireworks viewing. Early magic hour was excellent for DCA, but the Disneyland early hour was very crowded and didn't feel that special - DCA early hour is for Disney guests only for their 3 hotels whereas Disneyland early hour is for anyone who purchases a 3 days pass or more hence why it was more crowded.  The only problems we encountered was from the admin side of things. When first checking in they couldn't find our reservation, only to be told that it was cancelled and reissued to a pool view, even though my paperwork said downtown view. Then made me feel like

Check in was smooth, friendly staff, bellman were great! Would love to see golf cart service to the Disney Land Hotel or Disney Whilderness lodge when pool at the Pier is shut down for service.   I have never seen the pool at the Pier. Of the few times that I have Visited it has always been down!

The location to the park is good but it's still a long walk through Downtown Disney.  Next time I will probably try the Grand Californian--it's closer.  Both are very expensive places to stay.  The rooms were very clean and nice, well appointed, and I have to say had the best in-room coffee I have had in awhile... The Steakhouse 55 restaurant is absolutely superb, you must have dinner there.  If you can handle the cost, this is "the" place to stay--you can get in the park an hour early and they throw in a few other extras.  If you're on a budget, forget it.

Fantastic experience as part of our south California tour.  Three nights in a club level room meant access to the lounge for breakfast and snacks throughout the day- which was a lovely base after a long tiring day in the parks.  We had fantastic views of Downtown and fireworks (but we missed them as too busy!). The service at Disney is so friendly and welcoming- and so very accepting of our four year old son. We even managed to fit in a quick swim in the massive pool- the only negative in the whole experience was that it was a bit cold!

Check In very easy we were early but they had our rooms ready for us just after 12 pm. Staff were very nice and explained everything to us. However it is very expensive for what you get. There were 7 of us and we had a two bedroom suite. The room was very dated and the foldout bed in one of the Lounges very uncomfortable. The children loved that the lights lit up on the bed heads. I thought for a Disney hotel it would have had more Disney things around the place we had Mickey Mouse head on our taps but that was all. We brought a bottle of wine from a local shop and we realised we needs a corkscrew. We were told room service would charge $3.50 for us to use one this was after the bar downstairs said they would charge $25.00 for us to borrow one from them. We also asked for a

I liked this hotel for its good location but we paid a ton of money and would have rather stayed at Grand California, better location and looks to be much nicer. It was nice but more of a 3 star and for the price that we paid for a two bedroom suite I expected much nicer. Food was good. Charter breakfast was really good. Location good and rooms clean but don't expect 5 star. If you go to the pool don't get a cabana. The service is not good. Not worth the money.

We selected to stay here rather than The Grand Californian where we stayed for our last visit.  The hotel was clean, modern, and had the perfect location for us.  It was so easy to use the monorail into the park each morning.  The lines were shorter than the main entrance into Disneyland.  When it was time to go to California Adventure we took the monorail into Disneyland, pick up a fast pass and then headed over to CA Adventure.  We also just walked the 7 minute walk through downtown Disney to get there.  We were even able to use the pool and slide after a long morning of fun.  Great facilities!

Summary Heading: Nostalgic and convenient..for a premium of course
Summary: We just finished our third stay in the Disneyland Hotel - the second since the renovation a few years ago.  There are plenty of alternatives in the area but I wanted the Disney feel/nostalgia for my youngest daughter's first trip to Disneyland.  There are often discounts for certain times of the year - especially mid week - so I was surprised there wasn't one for a Wed and Thu of the 3rd week of October.  It was a good stay with a nice view of the pool area (which was a hit with my kids) but at nearly $500 per night, I might consider some alternatives in the area such as the Residence Inn or Springhill Suites to the south of California Adventure.  I like the convenience to Downtown Disney but alternatives on the S/SE of the Disneyland resort are close to GardenWalk and the walk

Amazing!  From start to finish our visit was magical!  As soon as we checked in we were greeted by Minnie, Pluto and gang. My daughters were in awe. The room was beautiful-clean and spacious. The Disney theme was everywhere. The pool was great- kids loved the water slides.  On the pricey side but definitely worth the money

Disneyland Hotel located in Anaheim, California consists of 3 towers, Fantasy, Adventure, and Frontier, wrapped around the swimming pool and the Monorail water slide. Disney Convention Center is attached to the Fantasy Tower. There are several onsite restaurants. One of the restaurants has Disney characters roaming inside to greet you while you are eating. Also on site is the gazebo and garden that are used for Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings. We came across one during our stay. You can easily walk from the hotel to Downtown Disney.   The entire complex's common areas and rooms have the whimsical touches of Disney everywhere. The hotel was not high end by any means. Furnishings were adequate, though our room had a pretty scruffy sofa and a noisy refrigerator. The headboard has the

Fantastic stay . The Hotel room was top shelf . Very clean ,great service .I could not highly recommend it enough as a great family holiday .The only thing I will add is .Dont take the front desks word for restaurant bookings . We tried to book characters dinning in " Goofys Kitchen " for breakfast through Hotel reception they said it was booked out but I went down to the restaurant and asked and they good fit our family in if we came at 7am . We did and it was great the kids had a ball. The biggest tip is make sure you book well ahead for dinning or anything really.  Plan your trip to Disneyland well ahead and you will have a great time.

The hotel is right next to Downtown Disney and walking distance to the parks. Rooms are nice size. I appreciated the friendliness of the staff and the fact that they seems to go out of their way to be helpful. I'm planning on coming back soon!

Summary Heading: very good location, clean and easier to navigate than Grand California
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights for a business conference. Out the door and you are at Downtown Disney, entrance to the park, a pool and out door dining. This is a good thing because unlike most visitors, I ordered room service twice. My dinners both nights were pretty awful. Delivery was reasonable as was the price- the food was not good. I ordered a club sandwich one night, and roasted chicken the next night. Huge portions of food that was cold, and not tasty. Walk outside to the restaurants or bring someone thing in if you need to eat in your room.

Summary Heading: Where else can you stay when at Disney?
Summary: Check in was easy, staff were spot on, as you would expect from Disney. Be ready, as they give you a lot of info when you arrive.  Rooms will be based in one of the towers, we stayed in Frontier Tower - themed around the Wild West. Apparently Adventure tower is the original one!  Rooms and guest areas were immaculate.   Location - perfect for the parks, so nice walking back to our room at the end of the day, avoiding all those queues for the car parks.  We had a balcony, which was nice, however view was of the car park. Still we were on the 14th floor, so it was still an impressive view.  Downside is that this hotel is big, so things do feel a little impersonal, you are one of many, but all the little touches make up for it.    Extra time in the parks was great, make the most of

GREAT Hotel stay and perfect service here. We had previously always stayed at the Grand Californian but after a less than top notch room experience and laissez-faire Mgt. we defected. I'm so glad we did. I loved the attention to detail in the entry with the retro looking grid plantings. They've done a great job keeping everything fresh and modern but still with a nod to the past. Details like Mary Blair inspo Carpet in the Lobby don't get past me!!  Reception was fast and friendly without much of a queue. Everything was in order and the rooms and grounds here are super nice. Bonus points for the Tiki Bar which we've thoroughly enjoyed during previous visits. DH does a great job of making this both a fantastic couples or adults getaway as well as a family friendly Resort without

Stayed here for the second time! Last visited Disneyland during our honeymoon 2 years ago!  Love the small mickey details in the room but most of all- there is a Disney lullaby switch at the end of the bed .. I've turned it on multiple times at night!!  Best of all the 1 HR magic hour that you get from staying at the Disney hotel was well worth it!  It allowed us to get in the parks early!!! And we manage to ride the tower of terror ride twice!  Dining with goofy downstairs at the goofy's kitchen would be a great way to round off a trip to Disneyland!!!!

Traveling with 7 people- had a suite in the hotel. Everything is a little over-priced, but hey- its Disney! The weather was a little drizzly so we had to spend $50 on ponchos.  The pool would've been more fun if weather was better, but hot tub was still excellent!  The laundry facility is nearby. They have character dining on site, but we didn't stay long enough to try it out.  Looked like kids were having a blast with the characters in there.  We asked for early check-in and pre-registered for the room at 9am.  Came back just before 3pm and it wasn't ready. We had to wait until well after 4pm to get a room. They did give us a credit and fast passes, so I guess it all worked out in the end.  We saw the fireworks from our room one night-  spectacular! Short walk to monorail.

We are frequent visitors to Disney World but went to California this year. The hotel was great, room was big. Mousekeeping had room made up early and clean. We were in Adventure tower facing Downtown Disney.  I rented a scooter since I had recent surgery. It was a hike to the parks but nothing compared to Florida. We went to pools once, the kids were disappointed the slide was closed. The hot tub was big but full of young unsupervised children. We didn't eat at the hotel, we ate in parks or downtown.

Summary Heading: All things Disney: fun, clean, organized
Summary: We stayed one night at the 525.00 a night Disneyland Hotel so that we could spend time with our granddaughters, who were staying there with their parents. Everything--from the valet staff (excellent, excellent, especially Jordan) to the check-in to everyone in stores, around the pool, and in restaurants was efficient. The only downside is that the hotel represents itself as on park property, which it is (when compared to all the hotels on Harbor Blvd) but be advised that you will walk about 20 minutes through Downtown Disney to get to the park entrance. Now I understand why the Grand Californian is even more expensive: it is right there by the entrance. We are in good shape and able to walk back and forth in the heat (it was 95 degrees) but watching obese people trundle back and

The Disneyland Hotel is conveniently located at the end of Downtown Disney. There are four towers built around a lagoon with two pools and a bar. The pools were outfitted with handicapped lifts. We stayed in the Adventure Tower which is located closest to Downtown Disney. This was a plus but also a minus as there are bands that play loud music just up the street unti 10 pm. Our corner room was large and well appointed with a desk, sofabed and a chair and ottoman. There were no USB outlets near the bed but there are plenty of electrical outlets in the room. There was a nice flat screen tv. The bathroom contained double sinks and a separate water closet. The convention center is located next door. Goofy's Kitchen is also located in this hotel and is a fun place to eat dinner.

A great trip, really loved the hotel, we used the e-ticket club with the lounge and concierge service, that was great. The lounge was perfect place to escape after a long day in the parks. We ate at Goofy's kitchen for one breakfast and one dinner, the kids loved the characters and that is all part of the experience but I wouldn't rush back there, I have to say it had a rather unpleasant smell when we were there.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, kids loved it, very convenient!
Summary: This is our fourth trip in four years to Disneyland, but the first time we stayed at the Disneyland hotel. Our whole family loved it! You may see some reviews here saying it's the farthest from the parks, but honestly it's about three minutes extra of a walk compared to the other parks, and there's an option to take the Monorail right into Disneyland that's kind of fun. The pools and waterslides were awesome- my 6 year old daughter went down one of the slides about 10 times in a row before stopping! Since it was super hot, we ended up coming back to the hotel in the middle of the day to cool off and relax a bit before heading back into the parks. Of course Magic Morning is great- we used it at California Adventure and got 3-4 rides in before the park officially opened. The room

Had a great time, we were here for 2 days as the last bit of our honeymoon. We ate at Goofy's Kitchen for brunch which is always amazing, food and service wise. Staff was great with every encounter for the most part, my husband was a little unimpressed with the service of housekeeping and room service over the phone, he felt rushed and that they didn't want to take his call. Over all, great stay though!

We stayed in a one bedroom suite for two nights. The suite was incredibly clean and spacious. We didn't have to call for anything towels in the room for all 6 of us. It would be nice to have a tram to take you to the parks but the walk wasn't that bad. We loved the balconies outside of both the bedroom and the living room. Having the dvd player in the room was great for the two year old. It was also nice having the kitchenette with a refrigerator and microwave. The kids (two teenagers and a two year old) Liked the tea cup seating area and the kid sized "thrones" in the lobby. We had been unable to get tickets to Mickey's Halloween before arriving but were able to get them at the hotel when we checked in. We didn't get a chance to use the pool this visit but would love to come

This hotel was so nice , it was a nice Disney themed hotel and not to mention it is so close by. The only thing is it can be so much money just for one night . If there is a great deal I'd go for it but if not I don't think it's worth it .

My family (kids 4 & 6) stayed for 6 nights at the DL hotel. As an Australian family, it was quite expensive after the currency conversion but we had decided that we were always going to stay there. If your budget doesn't stretch that far, there are plenty of other hotels much cheaper offering similar amenities.  However, we are glad that we stayed here to capture the "whole" DL experience.  We had a view of downtown Disney and could see the fireworks. We always felt like we were in the parks. Proximity to downtown Disney also helped with access to lots of restaurants and monorail entry to Disneyland was a 1 min walk.  The kids loved the pool and we would often swim, waterslide and rest before heading into the parks at night.  Room was spacious but nothing special. Well themed,

Summary Heading: Wonderful property, great place for conferences
Summary: I love this property. There is so much for families to do on site without even heading to the park. If you stay here I suggest you plan one day to enjoy the pools with your kids and explore Downtown Disney. It is great rest during a busy vacation and the pool area is stunning.  I enjoy conferences here. It is great to have your family with you and combine some work and play.  The rooms are so beautifully Disney - full of hidden mickeys and lots of magical details.  There are fridges in the rooms and coffee pot but not microwave.

Absolutely LOVED our experience.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower - beautiful room with light up headboard.  Overlooked part of Disneyland Park.  Were able to see fireworks from Disneyland Park.  Pool was amazing, best part of our stay.  Weren't so impressed with restaurants but loved seeing Disney characters practically every time we were in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Perfect for the Disney Fan or Family
Summary: If you are a big Disney fan, or visiting Disneyland for multiple days, then the Disneyland Hotel is obviously the perfect place to stay. It is convenient and enhances the Disney experience.  My stay was for business, so my take was a little bit different. I booked a standard room, but was upgraded to a view room in the Frontier Tower. The room was nice but slightly tired. The decor was dark and the carpet seemed a bit worn. The room was large and had a sitting area with a sofa bed, and two queen size beds. The room also had a small refrigerator. It seemed to be suited for cramming in a family with a bunch of kids. The TV and media system was outdated, and the bathroom was a standard small size basic, with tub/shower, toilet, and sink nearly side by side. Disney themed lighting

Check in was fine. Requested a tower but did not get it. Stayed in frontier tower, paid for upgrade of pool view and was able to see fireworks from room. Rooms are nice. Bed are comfy.  I am giving this a 4  because nothing over the top for the money you spend. Good things are you do get that early hour at one of the parks. Pool is nice. You are close to everything, but good neighbor hotels have easy access also.  Things that could be better. Carpets were a bit sticky.  They offer nothing other that walking to get from hotel to park. You use to be able to board the monorail to get around. They could offer a shuttle or something.  It is a 7-10 min. Walk but not everyone is able to do that walk. They do not bring packages you buy at the park to your room, you have to remember to

Since we have been coming to Disneyland we like to stay at the Grand Californian because it is closer to the parks but I'm glad we stayed at the Disneyland hotel this time because it seems to capture the magic more. The rooms are bigger than the other resorts and the headboards are beautiful. During our stay there was a wedding everyday and one of the weddings had a  Cinderella chariot escort the bride. Our party had two rooms; a two queen beds room facing Downtown Disney located by the elevators and one corner King Bed room facing the pools. The two queen bed room was very noisy not because it was by the elevator but because the neighboring rooms had kids jumping and playing at all hours. The corner king room was quiet and seemed roomier because and it had a pull out couch and

Summary Heading: Some nice features but overall a disappointment
Summary: I picked the Disneyland Hotel for 2 reasons:  first, because I thought it would give me quick and easy access to Disneyland Park.  This could not be further from the truth.  It takes 15 minutes to walk to the Disney gates.  I was given a pass that would permit entry to the California Adventure Park (NOT Disneyland) through the Grand California Hotel, but it still took 10 minutes to get to that point.  For some not a long walk, but for a senior and small child under a hot sun not so good.  Another reason I chose this hotel was because I thought my granddaughter would have lots of opportunity to meet Disney characters.  We never saw ANY — they are only located in Goofy’s Kitchen - unless you count the Mickey and Minnie Mouse metal statues outside the entrance.  On our 3rd and

Sad, this place only cares about your $$$. Horrible customer service and very condescending attitudes. I could never give my money to a place that treats people so poorly. There are a lot of hotels to chose from that are less expensive and know how to properly treat a guest. They are far from the "Happiest Place on Earth". I'd rather visit the Mojave desert in August.

Super clean hotel! Love all the Mickey details and the headboard lights up with led lights to look like fireworks above the castle! Nice restaurants to choose from and an awesome pool! My kids loved it and we spent a day at the pool just swimming and playing. Short walk to the middle of downtown Disney with tons to do! Highly recommend Goofy's Kitchen character breakfast! Food is amazing and fun with all the characters. Perfect opportunity for photos!

Stayed in this property for 2 nights with 2 of our kids. We had a 1 bedroom suite with adjacent living area + 1/2 bathroom. I think the suite was pretty spacious. The bed was comfortable and we had plenty of towels. The hotel itself has a rather simple lobby if you compare it  with like The Californian. As matter of fact, even if it  wasn't too bad of a walk, if I come back I'd like to stay in the Californian as it is just off the entrance to downtown, just in the lobby there's a bar. The Goofy kitchen (Mickey mouse characters)  for breakfast and Steak 55 for dinner are great options to eat just a few steps from the lobby. I'll give it 4 because i can't compare it to other high end properties I've stayed, but again, it is a good value.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, not the best location
Summary: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel other than the location is not the best offered for the parks. Clean, friendly staff, well decorated, fun hidden Mickeys to find, and an awesome headboard. The pool is great as well as a couple different places to eat in the courtyard. My kids loved Goofy's Kitchen. The worst thing was the eight minute walk through Downtown Disney to get to the park entrances. The best located hotel is the Grand California because it has its own entrance to the park that only resort guests can use.

Summary Heading: Honestly, I think I expected more
Summary: Having stayed at a lower rated Disney hotel in Hong Kong, I was expecting an amazing experience staying here.    The rooms were lovely, the back wall behind the bed played "A dream is a wish your heart makes" when the bedside light was turned on which was gorgeous.  The rooms were not huge but they did have an empty fridge, which was a HUGE plus for a family travelling to Disney Parks for the day because we could chill water and take it with us.   But overall it wasn't the experience I was expecting.    Out of 3 nights we stayed there were "scheduled power outages", where we were left glow sticks for lighting.  That's fine, but when you are paying AUD$600 a night, you kind of expect everything to be tip top.    Also, when we stayed in the HK Disney hotel, the staff made the face

Summary Heading: Be Careful When Booking at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: It has been about 14 years since our least trip to Disneyland Anaheim.  This was our 104th trip to a Disney park - so we are big fans, always have been.    We booked two "Deluxe View" rooms, and were placed in the Adventure Tower.  Our first room was wedged between the ice maker and the elevator, and looked at Trader Sam's roof.  We complained and they moved us to another room - behind a palm tree, so we could see nothing.  When we complained at the front desk (again), the desk agent told us that the deluxe views in the Adventure Tower are all pretty poor - far less good than the other towers.  Nice.  For $630 per night, one expects a lot more.  They did upgrade our second room to a concierge floor (10th floor), which was nice - but make sure you keep out of Adventure Tower if

Summary Heading: Teenager Disney hotel feelings. Nice stay with higher budget, of course
Summary: For disney experience, any of disney hotel would be fine. Strong point of disneyland hotel is that it locate next to downtown disneyland, just cross the lane from main entrance then you arrive downtown disneyland.  You can get all the benefits as Disney hotel guests, you will find disney inspired decorations in every details and moment.   Upon check-in you will get disney card (that link with your credit card) which you can use it to pay everything in disneyland resort. And that is so convenient, you don't need to carry cash and card with you around especially when you are having fun in the park. And the night before checking out, total amount will be sent to your room as guest folio, easy brrezy isn't it?   Back to our experience in the hotel, staffs are really friendly and

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland California
Summary: My wife, 9 year old son and I stayed here for 5 nights during a recent trip. Despite arriving early, we were able to check into our room straight away and they even upgraded us! We ended up with a Premium room overlooking the swimming pool, plus a view towards Disneyland (which was great to see the fireworks at night!). Our room was huge with 2 queen size beds and large bathroom. All the staff were friendly, and the food on offer at the various restaurants was also excellent, especially Steakhouse 55. The swimming pools (3 in total) are big and clean with lifeguards always on duty. This hotel is also an easy walk to Disneyland and California Adventure Park via Downtown Disney. As an extra bonus, people staying at the Disneyland Hotel can also enter the Adventure Park via the

Summary Heading: Very nice and very expensive  - Fantasy tower
Summary: Stayed for 5 nights in Fantasy tower, very nice rooms, clean, maintained well, excellent location, comfortable beds and premium price. It was business visit for me, so I didn't visit parks, I can see convenience for guests staying few nights and have direct access to both parks, however, it is very pricey. On top of accomodation cost, you are pretty much staying in closed resort, with limited number of shops and restaurants, so, if you need to go somewhere else for a dinner, your only solution is to take a cab. Hotel is great, staff polite, my check in was very quick, overall - very nice experience.

Summary Heading: Good Choice for Conveneient Entry to Park
Summary: I was pleased that we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for four nights because of the convenience of entering the park, also having a fridge and in room coffee. Early entry to the theme parks with your hotel stay is an awesome perk. Our room was in the Adventureland Tower with view of the fireworks for those that did not want to go back into the park. The room is an average hotel room with the exception of the light up musical headboard and creepy Micky hands on lamps in the bathroom. An issue with one sink not draining was resolved quickly. Air conditioner had a mind of it's own causing a major annoyance to the female suffering her "personal summer."  Teenagers loved the pool & slide. The adults liked the drink service at the pool.   Make advance reservations for breakfast &

Summary Heading: Thank you Disney for offering military discount
Summary: This review is based on our 9.25.16-10.01.16 birthday stay.   So you pay and arm and a leg to stay at a Disney resort for the location, the magic hour,  and the customer service. You got to appreciate these extras to be willing to pay for this. Check-in was okay. A little long but I was mainly put off that other guests were offered pins and a signed autograph picture of a Disney character but my daughters were not. Kind of felt discriminated but I didn't want to dwell on it. I had my husband ask for our girls in case it was a race issue.  Room was decent but not worth the price tag. We've stayed in much nicer rooms for way less but we're paying for the brand. Rooms were always nice and clean with the temp set at a comfortable level. I only had one noise complaint and that was

This was my fourth stay at the Disneyland Hotel. I stayed 5 days.  I had a third floor room in the Frontier Tower (room 2182). It was somewhat convenient in that it was close to the elevators. The room itself was very comfortable and spacious. A slightly different layout than I usually have. This one came with a sleeper sofa, and a semi-separate desk/closet area. (see photos). This room also had a nice view of the pool area.  The furnishings were very comfortable and did not overpower the room. No need to mention the wonderful castle headboard, if you are reading these reviews, you seen it mentioned enough. :)  Room includes a nice mini-refrigerator that kept drinks nicely chilled, pod style coffe maker, a nice 32" flat screen TV, small safe, and plenty of storage space for

We stayed here 3 nights and booked through Costco Travel (Which provided a lot of awesome extras like Disney Gift cards) Our room was very clean and spacious. I loved the magic headboard with the LED Castle fireworks show and song. There were wonderful little Mickey details everywhere. We stayed in the Frontierland tower and found the walk to Downtown Disney very easy. The pools along with the Monorail waterslides are awesome. We also enjoyed a wonderful meal at Steakhouse 55 on property. I have stayed at all 3 Disneyland properties and I would say Disneyland Hotel is my favorite.

I will still give this hotel 5 stars as we had an awesome time here, though staff member at check in wasn't very friendly at all, especially considering we were about to go to the 'Happiest Place on Earth' We had booked and paid for a deluxe room a few months beforehand online through the Walt Disney Travel Company - on the Disneyland website. This included 4 days entry to both Disneyland and California Adventure Park. When we arrived (after 32 hours travel time) the man at reception  checked to 'see if any rooms of our description' were available as they were very busy that day.. What??? We had already booked and PAID for this type of room?? luckily there was one available (so why even put doubt in our minds) anyway, he gave us our room keys and went to send us on our way, when

We had an accessible room and the bathroom was exceptional. The decor was really nice, slightly subdued by Disney standards, more geared toward adults if I had to guess but I loved it. We had a courtyard view room, on the 3rd floor so the evening outdoor entertainment carried into the room. It was a bit confusing finding your way around the property at first but we got used to it. Check-in was a bit slow in my opinion. Overall I really liked the property.

We had the most wonderful time at this hotel. We booked a premium double room that faced the gorgeous pool. The hotel is a 10 min walk to the main entrance of both Disneyland and California parks. So convenient to be at the footsteps of downtown Disney. Our boys loved the pool and after spending the day at the parks, they would look forward to the pool. In the evenings the pool was heated so we had great evenings. Also awesome to have Goofys kitchen at the hotel which boys thoroughly enjoyed. Rooms were not big but we hardly spend anytime in them so it didn't bother us. Main thing was that we were happy room was always clean and tidy. The bedhead that lights up is truly magical. Next trip we will definitely return to this hotel and it's worth the extra money. We had a memorable

We have just completed an 8 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  We are a family of 6 and for 7 of those nights my sister stayed with us too, so we were a party of 7.  My husband and I spent 'hours' on the phone to the DH prior to our stay, making sure everything was going to be magical and perfect and this was SUPER expensive for us as we live in Australia.  To be honest it was anything but magical or perfect.  This was meant to be a very special visit as my daughter was celebrating her Sweet 16th during our stay and also my sister is terminally ill with cancer and we really wanted her to see all things Disney.  My sisters very first experience of the DH was being greeted by an exceptionally rude bellman. He entered the lift before her, did not greet her hello and rather than

Summary Heading: It's Disney, of course it will be good!
Summary: My family and I travel to Disneyland about once a year. We have stayed in Good Neighbor hotels a few times, but really enjoy staying at the Disney brand hotels. We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel last time we visited the park. The Disneyland Hotel has the best pools for family/kid activity. Having Goofy's Kitchen restaurant onsight was also very convenient. Our room was spacious and had a great view of the pool-which has really cool lights at night! There is also a bar onsite that is Tiki themed-yummy drinks for mom and dad after all that family time :) There is a shuttle from the airport you can pay extra for-it was worth it. No stops at other hotels. The check in process would be my only complaint. It was busy and even with multiple registrars-it took about 20 minutes to get to

Summary Heading: Great family hotel where you know that you are in Disneyland
Summary: The staff were great from the moment we arrived at the door to loading the bags in the boot upon departure!  Our connecting spacious double queen rooms had Disney decorations and a view of pool area (with large water slide).  Everything, including the wall safe, phone, and amusing bed lamps worked well.  Bathroom was adequate sized with shower/tub combo.  All were clean.  The tasteful wood trim in the halls seemed a little strange given the age and style of the building, and the updated facade colour was an improvement.  We found two restaurants in the hotel Goofy's Kitchen and Steakhouse 55;  in the former we had a great highly recommended character breakfast (big plus for five year old), and in the latter we had an excellent steak dinner in quiet environment to be pleasant

Just back from Disney and had a great time, it was an amazing place.  We stayed at the Disneyland hotel and paid for club access. The hotel appeared to be busy upon arrival but as we had club access we were met on arrival and had access to the eticket lounge while we waited for our room.  The hotel room was nice with Disney touches the kids enjoyed, for the price I had expected more than just a room but it was adequate.  The best part was access to the lounge, the kids had other kids about to talk to and play with, continental breakfast was good. Snacks throughout the day if you took a break from the parks were great and a cold beverage in the evening was very welcome after some long days.  The service team in the lounge was outstanding, every request was dealt with quickly and

Stayed here for the first time 9/27 to 9/29 for my daughters birthday. It was a great experience and I would definitely do it again. I didn't give it 5 stars only because I think the lobby areas of the various towers should be nicer... more plush given the price of the rooms but overall I loved this hotel. We checked in at like 9am and conveniently stored our luggage and headed to the park. We got our room keys at check in and at about noon we received a text letting us know our room was ready. We paid for a standard room and were very pleased when we walked in and realized we had what I believe was a premium view. We were able to see the pool, downtown Disney and some of the park. At night we were able to see Disneylands Fireworks from our room. The pool was great and so was

2 nites at the Disney hotel and resort, great customer service, we used the pool, kids loved it, had dinner at the cafe restaurant and had a delicious corn chowder. Parking is not free, even though u stay in hotel, we paid 18.00 per nite, plenty of restaurants to choose from in downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: A  classic, but no WOW factor...
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for runDIsney's Disneyland half marathon weekend.  I chose the hotel based on it's proximity to the start/finish lines.  We stayed in the Frontier building, one of three buildings that make up guest accommodations.  Our room was clean and while it slept five guests (2 queens and a daybed), the bathroom tiny! Rooms were updated, but in general the resort has a bit of a dated feel.  Lots of dining options on property and close to many more in Downtown Disney.

We stayed in a premium view room with e-ticket lounge access for 3 nights. Room was spacious with everything you could need. The kids were a little disappointed as the room lacked some of the Disney Magic they saw in Tokyo Disney Hilton last year. Re e-ticket lounge was OK - service was great, food was very average. The big draw card is the location, where you can easily escape for a couple of hours by the pool in the heat of the day. If you want direct access to the parks you need to stay at the Grand California.

Great first trip to Disneyland.  Rooms are big, clean, and comfortable, just be ready for the Disney pricing.  Close walk to downtown Disney and parks.  Expected parking to be included, however, its another $17 a day for self-park.  Pools are big and clean, but, as stated in other reviews, there is not enough seating for number of guests.  Overall good experience, would stay again.

While unplanned, this was our third trip to Disneyland in three years. On previous visits we stayed first at Paradise Pier and then The Grand Californian.  We were completely underwhelmed with both of those choices but the third time was the charm as we stayed at Disneyland Hotel!  The rooms were definitely nicer than the other two resort hotels as was the hotel in general.  The staff was awesome, rooms were clean and not run down, the pool was amazing for the kids and we really couldn't have asked for any more. From valet, to busboy, to pool attendants, to front desk, to housekeeping, they were all on point.  Kids had an absolute blast in the pools and with all the lifeguards on duty and free life jackets they provide, mom and dad were able to relax a bit too.  The room was

We stayed here to celebrate Halloweentime in Disneyland and were just thrilled with the experience! We have not stayed at the other 2 on-site properties but I doubt we will after staying at the Disneyland Hotel. We had a premium level view with concierge service and man was it worth the money! Our room was on the 9th floor and had an amazing view! The room itself was very comfortable and the beds were nice. Love the light up head board and the music made it even more magical! The concierge service was just amazing, great breakfast and snacks and all of the employees were extremely helpful! The pool was simply amazing and the kids loved the waterslides! We would highly recommend staying here if you are heading the Disneyland.

This is the best place to stay in Disneyland. It is within the park itself and only a very short walk along Downtown Disneyland to the main entrances. Their are four blocks. The best one is Adventureland Tower which has views over  Downtown Disneyland and you can also see the fireworks from the windows. Great pool area too.

We loved staying at the Disneyland Hotel. When we arrived, our room wasn't ready despite being 7pm at night, but the staff quickly fixed that situation for us, finding us a new room. The room itself was great! We didn't mind that it looked out over the carpark as we were not there to look out the window! The light up, musical headboard was a magical surprise, and the Disney-esque bathroom light fittings made it special. The close proximity to Downtown Disney was really good; you felt like you were close to the action and it really immersed you in the Disney magic. Our child loved the amazing pool and slides, too. We live on the other side of the world but would love to return some day. Would definitely stay here again if we did.

We extremely enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel last week.  It was our first time staying there, and we couldn't have had a better experience.  Yes, it's a little pricey, but we were celebrating some very special things, so we indulged ourselves.   The staff was fantastic, the room we had was wonderful, the food at the different locations we dined in were great, the cleanliness was 5star * and that is one of my pet peeves!  The convenience to the parks was wonderful.  I just can't say enough!! We will for sure stay here again if/when we get back to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: New favorite DL hotel... For 2 unique reasons
Summary: Decided to stay here as 1) it was literally steps from the RunDisney start line and 2) we always come to DL when it is cooler out and newer have been able to take advantage of the pool in our hotel.  Stayed in the Frontier tower, 5th floor. View of "Anaheim" was really a view of the parking lot but we didn't care enough to to pay the $25/day to upgrade to a pool view which was offered at checkin.  Room was nice and clean. Musical bed headboard was cute! Have stayed at Paradise Pier and thought this would seem further from the entrance to DL. But surprisingly convenient. 11yo thought there was way too much chlorine in the water slide area (and we really concur) so we ended up spending the very hot afternoons poolside just reading. Absolutely loved that there were trees

Spacious, clean and workers are friendly. We saw Goofy wandering around a few times throughout our stay. The pools were nice with lots of lifeguards around but kids are everywhere. We went in the 3rd week of September, after school has usually already started but there were still tons of kids. Otherwise, the hotel was nice and comfortable and I'm sure we'd stay here again when we come back.

My husband woke me at 6.30am on a Sunday morning by throwing a suitcase on the bed and telling me I had 20 minutes to pack for Disneyland. I had no idea he had also booked us to stay in the Disneyland Hotel, considering that our previous visit was at the Candy Cane Inn. Our stay was for a Sunday and Monday night in September, he had also upgraded to the e-ticket club so we could have breakfast and snacks during the day. We arrived for check in on the Sunday at 11.30am and our room was not ready - so we made our way to the e-ticket club for snacks and to rest. Our keycards that Check in gave us didn't work so we had to be let in by the staff there.  We still hadn't been contacted regarding our room at 4.00pm, so visited check in where they said they had forgotten to contact us.

This is a fun and clean hotel close to the action! Walk out the doors to Downtown Disney! Our family enjoyed the fun pool area with slide to make it look like a monorail! Elevators were terrible though, took forever to get up to our room on the top floor! We had a great view of the pool area and parks. We loved all of the Disney history and memorabilia throughout the property!  Would stay here again even though it's kind if pricey....like everything Disney!

Summary Heading: Loved Disneyland. Service not so great.
Summary: My partner & I had booked 2 nights accom at this hotel, with our printed booking confirmation details & emails on hand, but upon check in, I reconfirmed that our booked room was wheelchair accessible (my partner is disabled) to be told that we had not specified that when booking, I shown the papers to the woman clearly confirming 'wheelchair accessible room + roll-in shower' to have her rudely tell us 'she would see whether there was anything still available'. We were then made to wait 3+ hours for our room to be ready, we were told we would receive a text msg notification when our room was ready he decided to check again after the long wait, to be told it had been ready & waiting for us. The staff were generally nice but not overly great, and once we arrived to our room it was

Summary Heading: Must Stay Once to be there. ! Says TripAdvisor Top 1# World. Other Attractions close
Summary: The positive was it so great to be right there, go to the park, or Disney walk, and return for a rest real close. I would refer eating at the fancy looking Restaurant near Goofeys, looks expensive, but was not, great food there. Goofeys was a money drain, and needs a new direction. the Characters need to appear More and Disney needs to pay more attention to these Factors as Donald was there, Mickey never was. The rooms were nice comfortable, staff nice, but check in was quite slow.  As TripAdvisor Top 1# World, Disney needs to be more on Top of entertainment value here, not just at the park, we Loved the park, and have friends on upper staff there.  Also close to Knotts Barry Farm Buena Park, Mr David Minkin Magic and Wine Anaheim Voted Top Magician World, Superior Show !!

This was my first time back to Disneyland in about 10 years.  My girlfriend and I wanted to take a Cali trip, and decided to do a few nights at the Disneyland Hotel, thanks to the recommendations of my Travel agent Ryan of VIP Vacations.  The Disneyland Hotel boasts a modern feel, with the Disney Magic added.  In the lobby you will find tea-cup waiting chairs (Alice in Wonderland), and great decor.  I loved the pool area with jacuzzis, and some waterslides that I even took advantage of (amongst the handful of kids repeatedly running up the stairs, and down the water slides).  The rooms are very basic, but depending on your view you can see downtown disney, some of the amusement parks, or the parking lot from high up.  I loved the walking distance to downtown disney, and the

We stayed for a week and the location is unbeatable, since the parks are right next door. However, service is poor: every day we had to ask for extra towels, the soap dish was not cleaned once during our stay, room service took an hour, and the concierge had no idea about the airport shuttle or the photo services, it was unbelievable. Don't expect luxury, just convenience and nothing more.

We stayed in a club level room and found the extra amenities to be worth it.  Breakfast was light but enough to get your day started (cereal, fruit oatmeal).  Snacks throughout the day were really great uncrustables, sodas, juice boxes which you could bring to go with you, chips, salsa, and BEER AND WINE upon request throughout the day.  Evening happy hour was a bit disappointing I expected the appetizers to be a little more upscale then mini corndogs, but the kids loved them!  View of the fireworks was on point but it is something about being outside watching them that is just better.  Pool is really great for smaller kids maybe ages 1-7, also had a pool party with Goofy which was fun for the kiddos.

Summary Heading: Great Stay Minus the Housekeeping Issues
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The grounds are lovely and the staff was very nice. I felt the walk to our room in the Fantasy Tower was as close as our room was the last time we stayed at the Grand Californian. My only issue was the room did not feel clean. The counters and floors were sticky. There was a big brown stain on the carpet and fortunately housekeeping did come in and shampoo that spot. How it differs from the Grand Californian is no turndown service, we did not have a DVD player in the room, they did not have a basket in the bathroom for dirty towels, and the desk area seemed smaller. The room did look tired. All that said, we would stay at the hotel again!

Summary Heading: High Quality Hotel at a Fair Price
Summary: Love the layout of the 3 buildings.  Greta hotel pool.  Rooms are large and recently renovated.  Steakhouse 55 and Trader Sams make this a prime location for a fun evening for adults!  Early entry to the theme parks with your hotel stay is an awesome perk.

We booked through the Disney website.  The hotel is updated and very clean.  We have an 18 and 19 year old son and daughter.  They loved that the room slept five (comfortably) so they each had their own bed.  The staff are outgoing and friendly.  The pool area and slide is so nice especially when we needed a break in the afternoon.  You get early entrance and other perks because you stay on site.  We have been spoilt and would definitely stay there again.

Stayed for 3 nights last week on a trip round California. Check in was efficient, and we were in Frontier Building. David delivered our bags and got us some ice without asking and was very helpful. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. Ate at Goofys Kitchen one night, service good, but food mediocre and is served on plastic plates. Hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Disney parks and you have magic hours. There is a fee for parking your car at 18 dollars. The biggest negative is the pool. Last Wednesday we were unable to find any sun beds or chairs, seemed to be taken up with people from the Farmers Insurance. We were unable to use the pool as well as a child had decided to use it as a toilet. On walking round, we noticed dirty plates piled up on tables and bins of rubbish.

We opted for the upsell to the concierge rooms. We received a warm welcome and were shown around the property. The pools really are amazing. I only wished for poolside beverage service. Check in was fast. The EClub hosts were super nice. The wine and light dinner selections were amazing. And soft drinks....I've never seen so many so perfectly organized! The grounds are well maintained. We really enjoyed having champagne and watching the fireworks. The room service was good. Gift shop was nice. I thought it had an excellent location and we enjoyed downtown Disney (no park admission required). Breakfast in the club was good too. They had an espresso machine and a cappuccino maker if that's your thing. We weren't overly impressed with the food, drinks or service at the Tiki bar on

The Disneyland hotel is everything the Grand Californian is not. If you want to be in downtown Disney, the DH is worth it! Last time we were at the grand Californian (see review) and it was disappointing. The DH is clean, updated and great location. If back I would not hesitate to book here.

We normally stay across the street at a normal priced hotel, but I wanted to be fancy. Check in was ok. Our room wasn't ready so we went to Trader Sam's to kill time. They said they'd text when the room was ready, but my phone service is terrible in that bar. So afterwards I went back to the desk and voilà! my room was ready & upgraded! Yay! It was a nice suite with a full living room, bedroom with king bed and big bathroom. View of the parking lot, but oh well. It was nice. The big lit headboard is a nice touch. I almost didn't wanna go to the park! As we walked to the elevator I could see into a few of the "regular" rooms that were being cleaned & they are just small normal rooms facing a parking lot. If I had gotten one of those rooms I would have been sad. They are like $400

Very expensive but convenient. Don't let them put you next to the elevators. Very noisy. Disney Corp has gotten very greedy. The service is going down for what they charge. Walt would be upset if he knew what they turned his park into.

So we picked this hotel since most of run events were happening here. We ran the 10k run over labor day weekend. This location is fabulous. It has the disneyrun exp in it. It is also right next to the finish/start line. It was wonderful walking back from the race and having the closes hotel to get cleaned up at after being tired. It also meant you did not have to wake up as early to get to the starting line. We were in the Frontier tower which is a little farther away than other towers but really it was just a couple of steps farther. We got upgraded to courtyard room and we got to see the little mini old faithful erupt right in front of our window! The beds and pillows are super comfortable. There is plenty of room to spread out.We loved the headboards little light up show,

Trade Sams, Magical Head Board, and the Monorail best parts of the Disneyland Hotel. The Decor, history on the walls, and lush vegetation are great as well. The rooms are large and were very clean and for Disney nerds hidden Mickeys everywhere. My negative comments are obviously COST and parking.

My family and I visited the Disney Hotel in July, nice and hot in California at the time. Our initial reception to the resort was not very Disney, I was scolded by a man directing traffic just as we approached the hotel because I stopped two meters passed him, the thing is he made no indication to stop, he just stood there in the blistering heat acting all confused and gave me a proper how to stop for a man with an umbrella and blue striped shirt standing in sun lecture before showing where the hotel was. At the check in it was the average, passports credit card here's your key, not like Disney in France, Orlando or HK they're so excited to see you, and you so happy you came. So it's not bad, it's just not Disney. Very serious. They managed to get me a double room as I booked

If you're looking for the all out most magical experience, this is your hotel! While there are tons of great hotels in the area, the Disneyland Hotel incorporates the old school Disneyland history feel with the modern luxury hotel experience of today. All the hotel towers are themed, the character meals at Goofy's kitchen can be fun for anyone, and the Tiki lounge is probably the only place where you can still find life after 11pm.

The place is close to disneyland. Nice and big bedroom with nice beds and pillows. The bathroom is also good. Breakfast with bread, waffle and fruits. Employees helped us contacting nearby restaurant.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel over the Marathon weekend participating in a RunDisney event weekend.  The hotel is very clean, even though the high volume and traffic is apparent and does show on some of the areas.  The room service and maid service is excellent, striving to make sure you get anything you request, extra towels, extra soap, quickly.  The Disney theme is carried throughout the hotel in fun and unique ways - the mural behind our bed played music and lit up with tiny LED lights in the form of Cinderella's castle and fireworks. The location is walking distance to the RunDisney events - but so are other hotels and accommodations nearby.  The beds, bathrooms and sitting areas are small by most hotel standards - and pricey.  Most rooms offer scenic views, but with so

Best place for fun with the family Our room looked into Disney land We could see hear and smell all the fun from our room This is a nice but busy hotel  You get bio entrance to the park Great pool good food  Great service  We had a great time here  Very expensive but for a once in a life time holiday the kids will never forget stay here  The rooms where ok Remover this place is out of the city Not much else to do when there  Great holiday spot for the well do to family

It was my wife's 50th birthday and she wanted to spend it at Disneyland / California adventure. We decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and what a magical 50th it was. The room was nice the view was nice and of course the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.it was nice to enter the parks early and come back to take a nap and than venture back to the parks. (Although the beds were sooooo comfortable and the room temperature was spot on, we found it hard to want to leave the room)What a fabulous time.we can't wait to do this again!

Clean and nice pleasant atmosphere a good place totake your family. I would recommend  it to anyone that wants to have both hotel and activities close. I am looking forward to going again and so is the family

Stayed here for 3 nights whilst visiting disneyland with my family and two young boys. I would class this as a 3.5 star or 4 star hotel. It's very clean and no issues with the room or amenities. It's a great hotel to stay if you want to be close to disneyland.  Stay at the Grand California hotel and spa if you want to be even closer to the park butbit costs more.  The restraints are quite poor here. Had dinner at the tiki lounge and it was just extremely basic food. The character dining at goofy breakfast was sub part as well. Our expectations were that the characters would at least spend a fee minutes at our table but they would have spent max 30 seconds for a quick hug and a photo. We had more interactive time inside the park with characters so the character dining was a MAJOR

Summary Heading: Great Resort Feel Close to Disneyland
Summary: Have stayed here a few times, always consistently great. Beautiful rooms, well kept lush green resort grounds, huge pool (which is heated in the colder months), great front desk staff.  We had one problem with the hotel during a week long stay last summer and they went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of.  Also, some of the best restaurants at Disney property are on the grounds of this hotel - Goofy's for a character breakfast, Steakhouse 55 (beautiful! try the breakfast if you don't want to spend the $$ on dinner) and the Tangaroa Terrace for delicious quick service (even has real plates and actual metal utensils! High class for quick service). Although not as well advertised as the lobby of the far inferior Grand Californian Hotel, the decorations for Christmas

This is our second visit to Disneyland but our first stay at a Disney hotel and it has been an absolute game changer. Sure, it's significantly more expensive than staying off property but it adds so much more value added to the whole Disney experience, the parks are just a short stroll away through Downtown Disney and the extra hour in the parks in the morning is a massive bonus.  We stayed in the Adventure Tower, 7th floor with a pool view. Despite being just a few minutes away from Downtown Disney and being next to the elevator (one of my pet hates), the room was super quiet. In fact, during our 5 night stay, we heard almost no outside noise from either Downtown Disney or other guests. I'd go so far as to say, it's one of the most well soundproofed hotels I've ever stayed in.

So, if you're looking to do a Disneyland inexpensively, this is not the place.  Let's get that out of the way.  That said, if you are coming at certain times of the year and/or get lucky, you can still snag a rate that's more reasonable, at least on par with nicer hotels in big cities.  We were able to do that and decided to splurge, and I'm glad we did.  The hotel itself has been around a long time, and has a nostalgic feel to it.  Over the years there have of course been many changes, and the place is in great shape.  We stayed in Fantasy Tower, which I thought was the best because it had the main shopping areas in the lobby and was also on the walkway side of the property.  During the time we visited, the pools were drained for maintenance though the slides were still open.

Summary Heading: Has to be Worth the Price
Summary: You cannot beat the location as far as being able to walk to the Disneyland Park. The pools and waterpark were incredibly busy from sun-up to sundown. I was surprised that the room was no different than an average double hotel room anywhere else I have stayed. i believe if you are traveling on a budget, you can find much better value off Disney's property yet still within easy walking distance. If I returned, I would not stay there again. Another extremely annoying circumstance was the incredibly long waits for the elevators just to get to and from your floor.

Summary Heading: favorite hotel on Disneyland property-Mickey Penthouse
Summary: I love the theming in the lobby and the rooms so this is my favorite hotel on Disneyland Property. But it kicked up a notch this trip. My great aunt is the one who inspired my love of travel. She passed away a few months before the trip. She did not leave me much but she left enough to stay one night at the Mickey Mouse Penthouse. It was incredible. Mickey in all of the decor, all THREE of the bathrooms, every little detail, including the sound of the doorbell.  We didn't go to the park that day so we could spend every minute in the room. It's on the concierge floor so we enjoyed that too. We watched the fireworks from our room. After our great night we checked out and into a regular room because were were there to do a Half Marathon.  We were in the Frontier Tower. I like the

Summary Heading: We love Disneyland but it's gotten too expensive for us
Summary: All in all I cannot say more wonderful things about the Disneyland Hotel. It has always been an amazing adventure for my family. Great customer service even swim diapers for the baby at the pool. Awesome dining the kids are happy so I'm happy what more can I say as a mommy. The kids can certainly spend the whole day at the pool one of the days he joined the park and they won't even want to go to Disneyland it is just so amazing! So worth the splurge we just probably won't be going back because they raise ticket prices so much! So sorry to hear about that. Before now we were always annual pass holders. We would often spend thousands of dollars visiting the park in between

The Disneyland Hotel is magical. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The hotel offers early admission to the park which is a huge benefit.  Definitely a place to stay. Lots of eateries to choose from at the hotel and Downtown Disney.

This was our first visit to Disneyland, we decided to stay on property to be closer to the parks and shopping.  We arrived a few hours before check-in and were greeted at the entrance by the bell staff and Goofy!  We went to check in and the service was great.  Quick, and very detailed information regarding the hotel, rooms, amenities, and the parks were shared. They were able to find an available room, and we checked in early.  We chose to self park, and that was a short walk back to the entrance. Bags arrived quickly to our room.   The room was spacious and very clean.  Robes in the closet, accent pillows on the beds, and mini fridge.  It was definitely Disney with the Mickey ears, and shapes all around the room.  The headboard had an outline of the castle and fireworks, and

The Disneyland Hotel is first rate as is all of Disneyland. Bring the whole family and see Mickey, Minnie and all their friends while enjoying the rides, exhibits, weather and all of Disneyland. A treat for the whole family indeed.

Summary Heading: Great stay as expected.....a few tips
Summary: 2 nights at Disneyland Hotel with wife and our 2 daughters (ages 2 and 4) last two weeks of August  Overall wonderful stay, but a few comments:  1) I was slightly disappointed with the 3pm check-in, but was able to secure an extra hour on checkout so we left at 12pm vs 11am.  Were able to check our bags in storage and access them easily whenever we needed.  2) Self-parking is at the actual hotel itself, and is not part of the general Disneyland parking structure where the tens of thousands of other visitors park.  This is a significant benefit as it avoids crowds, etc. and is cheaper at $18 per day....you can come in and out.  3) Disneyland Hotel is a farther walk than the other Disney Hotels from the actual parks, but it is still part of the Disneyland Town and the monorail is

Summary Heading: My daughter's first stay at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We are here now. We've been anticipating our relaxing day at the resort. After 4 days in the parks we are beat. So we decided to spend our last day in California here at the Disneylamd Hotel Water Park. My adult daughter has autism and doesn't swim but she loves water slides. The only water  slide she can go on they shut down for the day.  Sadly. I called and no one knows why it's  closed down. No one is looking at it to fix it. No one acts like they care. So she is standing around with nothing to do. Thanks Disney! I really expected more. I wish we we were back at the Howard Johnson Hotel. She loves that waterslide and the people who work there are much friendlier then anyone I've talked to here today. Just a sad ending to our week long vacation. A ridiculous amount of money to

Spent two days with my wife and kids for my 40th bday..just amazing to see it all dressed up for its 60th..was concerned about wait times but was pleasantly surprised with the rides we wanted no more than 30 minutes wait..this is my third visit and still more to see cant wait till next time

The moment we arrived was magical. We met Minnie, Goofy, Chip and Dale in the lobby before checking in.  The room was very clean and had touches of Disney everywhere. We loved our comfy king bed with the headboard that played music and lit up. The only thing we missed was not having a balcony like we had at the Grand Californian. We found the service, decor and pool area better at the Disneyland hotel than the Grand Californian. Everyone was so nice at this hotel and we loved the Disney touches everywhere. It was faster and easier to walk to the parks than to take the monorail as the lineups were always so long and people were doing round trips on the monorail and not getting off so that made the wait even longer. Afternoon Tea was so scrumptious at Steakhouse 55.

I've been to this hotel 3 times with my family of 4 . I come here for my oldest daughter on her birthday and this is her favorite hotel. When i tell you its magical it is. The room is amazing! The pool is amazing ! so much fun things to do. Goofy's Kitchen is awesome. i love going there to get all my character picture in before the park so we don't have to stop as much at disneyland for a picture with character. i would say its worth it get a good meal in before you head to the park :) My daughter loves going to sleep to "when you wish upon a star" bed frame has light and the song plays . so thats cool. It's a nice walk to downey and disneypark not far at all and the kids love looking around ;]  so far we had great views rather its a view of the lovely pool...ive had the parking

My wife and I were there at the Disneyland Hotel attending a conference and celebrating our anniversary. We stayed in the hotel for five days. We absolutely love Disneyland and all that Walt created.  Of course, our expectations are pretty high, as are Disneyland prices. However, when Disney is Disney, it is worth it!  We had to overnight a very important item to the Hotel. It was to be shown all week at the conference. It arrived Tuesday morning as intended, but we were not notified it had arrived. Wednesday, we checked at the Bell Station and were told they did not have our package. Thursday we checked again and were told they did not have it even though UPS said it had arrived Tuesday and was signed for. After 30 minutes of discussion, I suggested they look for a box with my

We stayed here and would definitely stay again. The rooms were normal sized and everything was in working order and comfortable. Loved the musical headboards. My kids especially loved the pool and water slides. The service was amazing from the minute you drive up and they take your bags. This hotel isn't super close to the main entrance, it's a little walk, but you can get on at the tram which is close by and it takes you to tomorrow land. I loved feeling submerged in Disney and will come again if we can afford it, it's a little spendy but worth it at least once if you can.

Summary Heading: Ausome can't ask for much more!
Summary: We were in Frontier Land 11th floor, we had a great view of the pools and could see the fireworks from our room. I don't know how to explain the room except it's Mickey everywhere! The bathrooms have Mickey everywhere including the faucets! The headboard is definitely a surprise that you have to experience. We also had a frig in the rooms, which really made a difference for drinks and snacks.  Service is over the top! And your room key allows you to charge to it and have everything delivered to your room. You also can use the Monorail to  enter the park 1 hour early, plus you get dropped off into Tomorrowland. NO LINES!!

A very nice property with well appointed rooms. Not sure how many years ago the Disneyland Hotel was upgraded, but they did a nice job of it. Check-in was seamless, front desk personnel were quite friendly and helpful. Plenty to see and do around the hotel; pools, restaurants, gift shops galore, and one could break the bank here before ever setting foot into Disneyland itself.

We stayed one night during a short family trip to SoCal. Very expensive but let's have reasonable expectations about where we are. (Thus the 4 stars vs 5) The room was lovely and clean. Experience at the front desk was good. Facilities were in good order. Food choices were reasonable for 1 night but not so sure how I would feel after 3 nights. It seemed odd to me that they charged you for parking after you've already spent $500+for a room. Hide that cost somewhere and make me think I'm getting something for free. We are frequent visitors to Disney World so this was an interesting comparative experience.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 3 days and 2 nights. Just enough time for us to enjoy our 3 Day Park Hopper tickets. We requested the Frontier Tower, word on the street was that you can see the fireworks show from there. Which you can!   The headboards in our rooms lit up with Disney Magic fireworks show. Our son requested them every night before bed.   We had plenty of space in a Standard Room with 2 Queen Beds. Hospitality is incredible!   We loved that we can enter the Park through a special entrance, just a couple of minutes away through Downtown Disney.   You can not go wrong with Disney! It's worth every penny!

A classic, yes, but still felt that it was not worth it's price point. Club level was not at the same class as Disneyworld resort club levels. Have stayed so many times at Disneyworld and had such a great time, thought we'd try Disneyland for the 60th celebration. A bit disappointed. Staff seemed "tired" and not very helpful.

Overall had an enjoyable stay. We were 4 adults and 2 kids. We booked a suite and the extra room afforded was well worth the expense. Checkin was somewhat confused, took awhile but we got what we booked and then we got upgraded later to a suite with great views. The hotel itself is divided into a number of towers around the pool and a restaurant, and thus never seems particularly overcrowded. Enjoyed the proximity to the park. We had an amazing view of the fireworks display in the evening from our rooms.  My wife felt the rooms were a bit dated from a decorative point of view. But I thought they were more than adequate.  There were a plethora of eateries in close proximity. Beware of Goofy's restaurant on the property. It's a kids trap with expensive food which you could get for

Summary Heading: Here you leave today and enter the world of yesterday, tomorrow, and fantasy- Walt Disney Company
Summary: We stayed in the resort from August 12th thru till August 20th in the Fantasy Tower 7th floor. Once we arrived at the airport and headed toward the shuttle stands we were bombarded with a vast amount of shuttles that claim to be part of the resort but they weren't (figured out after we arrived at the resort.). Upon arrival at the resort, our room was ready for us and when we asked about the shuttle to and from the airport we found out that Disney has one of their own but it costs like 35$/per person. On our last day we decided to just take an uber as it was a lot cheaper.  Now for the amenities. The pool area was well equipped, the resort provided swim diapers for young children, they provided sunscreen and they provided bandages. The pools were salt based and for the most part

We've stayed at all 3 Disneyland resorts and they all have their advantages. This time we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. The check in  staff is very friendly and goes above and beyond. The grounds are beautiful especially at night. We also love the pool area, but can get extremely crowded in the afternoon. The kids especially like the slides. The rooms are always nice and clean. The standard rooms are kinda tight when you have 2 adults and 2 teens. The light up head board is such a fun welcome to the room. We stayed in the Frontier tower which is the furthest tower. I only mention the distance because if you spend all day at the park, and the monorail isn't working, you quickly realize that this tower is the furthest out of all of them and including the other 2 Disneyland

Hong Kong is WAY better. The aneheim hotel is very, very dated & was disappointing. 50+ min drive 2 hollywood $$$ (taxi etc.) this Disneyland was very sad :( high expectations, but didn't Deliver 1 bit.  If ur an Aussie don't go cracking the Indianna whips

This was our first time at Disneyland, you will see in my reviews that we did Disneyworld a few months ago. The hotel was nice, very close to the parks and downtown Disney. We were in the fantasy tower, it was very clean, everything in the room worked and housekeeping was thorough. No complaints at all. We could see the fireworks out the window which was amazing every night at 9.30pm. Do not worry if you have kids, my 5 yr old slept right through and it never bothered him. If you like to turn in early then maybe look for a different tower or room view.   There is a mini fridge in the room and we ordered groceries from Von's. I highly recommend and delivery is free with first order. The fridge is big enough to get about 10 items in including milk etc. We had both breakfast and

We stayed in a one bedroom suite in Frontier Tower (12th floor), with Club Level Service. Positives: Reception Staff Helpful & Welcoming Characters walking around the park were brilliant On-Site shops great and lots of choice Pool Cabana brilliant and a great way to spend a day relaxing View from our window was great (the pool) and we could see the fireworks at night Fabulous location, 6-10 walk to the Parks Valet Service professional, swift and professional Bathroom amenities plentiful and lots of towels Negatives: Check-in not available until 4pm. I was told they were going to call or text and received neither, prompting me to have to return to Guest Services and ask what was going on. Both bed sheets covered in blood spots Dust in room unacceptable One night light and one bar

JULY 2015 !! We stayed here during the 60th Anniversary, and was in awe! Just walking into the lobby felt special! We had a problem at a different non Disney hotel we we suppose to be staying at (booked through Disney) so Disney came to our rescue! They gave us a great discount to stay with them. The rooms were just amazing! Total luxury! We had dressing gowns and slippers. We wore the dressing gowns, we just had to! The headboard of the bed lit up with fireworks and Sleeping Beauty Castle and played the famous wish upon a star jingle! Being huge Disney fans, that was incredible! We only stayed one night, but it was total bliss! Comfy beds, lots of pillows, nice smells and, just special! Breakfast was at Goofy's Kitchen with the characters, and was great. Buffet style with

This is our third year to visit Disneyland/Cali Adventure and is a special trip my son and I take together.  We have stayed at Grand Californian but have found we prefer the Disneyland Hotel.  Unfortunately, this year was a bust.  We were on the 11th floor (an upgrade on Disney's part-very nice).  The problem was the central elevator (Adventure Tower-closest to Downtown Disney) had a cute sign saying it was having issues and to please use the other elevator down the hall (we never saw anyone working on it and a cast member said it had been down for months).  In non- Disney terms - one working main elevator, no sign pointing to any other elevator.  Right down the way was the one for "Cast Members" which was great because it was literally next door to our room.  It was great -

This hotel far exceeded our expectations. We had a club level room and the services provided at club level are certainly worth the extra money. Our room had a perfect view of the evening fireworks and Downtown Disney. Staff couldn't do enough for us, amazing!!We stayed her for a full week and loved every minute of it.Kids enjoyed the heated pool. Fantastic place to stay.

I was disappointed at the quality of this hotel. It is Disney, so I was expecting more. The lobby is very basic, the rooms ok but the pressure in the shower was terrible and the drains didn't work so the tub filled with water, very noisy in the walls.  When we booked online initially we booked three nights and two days at the parks. Then I tried to cancel one park day, and no refund.  I did get promised a refund for cancelling one night at the hotel, but it takes 4-6 weeks! Not acceptable! The good news is that the hotel was right at Disneyland, and if you stay at the hotel you can enter the park an hour early which was amazing! A total plus!  Disappointed at a few things but we still had a great time.

We stayed in the main building and the room was clean and comfortable with nice Disney touches.  The view was not great - they were working on the pool so it was drained and we were looking at rooftops of other buildings.  Also the lobby is not as welcoming as other Disney properties we've stayed at.  That being said, we wouldn't hesitate to stay again, but having stayed at the Grand Californian before, we would likely pick that for the atmosphere and closer proximity to the park.
