We stayed in the Main building/Fantasy tower-what a wonderful Mickey decor/ loved the room'/bathroom/dressing area set up. Very clean cozy room. Location, Location was just perfect. Loved the strolls through Downtown Disney-easy eats. Pool area and Tonga Lounge were nice on a hot day.

We are big fans of Disney. We have stayed on site at Disney world a few times and at Disneyland we decided to do the same. We were not disappointed with the site. The hotel is very nice and clean and for those who don't want to feel like you're in Disney 24 hrs a day- the theme is classical and shows memorabilias from Walt Disney. The rooms are very nice, spacious enough and clean with a beautiful Disney touch (the bed board that lights up with music, the little Mickey hands in the bathroom,etc). The pool was nice although crowded, we ended up finding chairs where the slides are so that was nice. The only thing and I am being picky, was I found the staff to be not as friendly as the employees who work at the Walt Disney resort in Florida. In Florida they really treated our kids

Great pool and slides for the kids.  Bar nearby for adults.  Easy walk to the park with plenty of restaurants on the way.  Rooms are nice, we had 2 queen beds and a great view.  Pricey but less than the Grand California.

Rooms is clean and in the right temperature when we arrive, pretty much standard size room with a sofa. A 2 cups coffee maker, a mini refrigerator and good size bathroom. The room has a closet but lacks dresser drawer for a family.  Main elevator is not working properly, a warning note posted next to it. Valet parking people not very courteous if your doing self parking. Front office is pretty much standard like a regular hotel in comparison with other hotels that charges $500+ nightly. First 2 nights of our stay a buzzing noise emanating somewhere in the building, our first night is fine and ignore it, but the second night it's getting pervasive and we have to call guest services to rectify the problem. Problem solved thereafter. Grounds is wonderfully landscaped and the family

The rooms were clean as expected but showing the signs of age. It could do with a complete renovation, not what I would expect for any Disney property. Perhaps we have been spoiled by the new resorts in Florida. If we came back we would stay in the Disney Californian instead or out of Disney all together.

Stayed here for 4 days with family. Requested rooms on the same floor but actually got side by side rooms that had a small foyer with an additional locked door. Awesome! Check in and check out super easy. Valet parking , pricey,but really the best option. Every encounter with staff was always pleasant! Never ordered room service. Housekeeping (Ana) was amazing and so very sweet. Rooms were very clean, water was hot (water has a smell but I was informed that was typical for 'Disney water'), beds were comfortable, rooms were super quiet (literally never heard any noise from other rooms or hallway). The hotel is old, but very updated, clean and immaculately maintained! Pool area is huge, fun slides but good luck finding a chair, lounger or even a place to put your stuff...which is

Summary Heading: Excellent location,friendly staff,starting to show its age
Summary: We've recently returned from here , a one-week stay at this hotel with our family and grandchildren. The location is excellent just a short walk to downtown Disney which has many restaurants shops and attractions. The pool area is very clean and well maintained. the pool staff are friendly and helpful. Housekeeping and  room service staff were very accommodating. We were more than disappointed in the rooms that we had due to the fact that they were right next to the ice machine and faced greenery that prohibited us from seeing any of Downtown Disney. We had an extremely obstructed view of the fireworks as well. Our rooms were overdue for some Renovations as they were starting to show their usage. We were pleased that the room had a small refrigerator and coffee maker even though

This was our 2nd time at the hotel and it was great! We came with our 2 kids in tow. Got a nice room watching the nightly fireworks. I think it's the Fantasy wing of the hotel facing parking lot.  Totally awesome if you want to watch the 9:30 fireworks from your room.   Pool is very orderly. Lots of rules and lifeguards, which is good for so many kids in the pool. They have floaties and lifevests for those who can't swim. And also free swim diapers for the babies. No pool toys or snorkels but little balls are okay.  Con: People save quite a bit of pool seats even though they aren't there.   Goofy a kitchen was a great dinner buffet with character dining for the kids.  Fun meal menus for the kids.   Hotels is pricey and you pay for conveniences and in this case with 2 children,

Summary Heading: Great hotel from which to explore Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for one night on a club level floor due to a flight cancellation, and used this as a base to explore Disneyland.  Pro's:  1.  Location - can't beat a 5 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland.  Lots of restaurants and cafes and shops on the way there.  2.  Club lounge (I think its called E-ticket) - good base for breakfast and snacks/coffee throughout the day.  Also had excellent staff on hand to help plan your visit to the park.  Great place to view the evening fireworks from too.  3.  Room was large with space for a full size singe bed for our toddler in addition to the king size bed.  4.  Pool is pretty amazing - two waterslides, and lots of pool lounges.  Con's:  1.  Price - we stayed last minute and there was very little available, but it was still US$700+/night

This hotel just radiates Disney Magic! Little features around every corner, like hidden Mickeys, mouse hands holding light fixtures, ears everywhere and more! Not to mention tea cups in the lobby as chairs and characters often make appearances in the lobby. Staff members are beyond helpful and friendly. We have stayed at this hotel every year for the last 6 years and will continue to do so!! Each tower has a theme (adventure, frontier, and fantasy) Fantasy tower has the hotel lobby and gift shops. Adventure is closest to Downtown disney. Our favorites are these 2 because of these reasons listed.

We stayed one night in the Disneyland Hotel on our last trip to California. We spent the day at one of Disney's California parks. Great time.   We hold ownership in the Disney Vacation Club and use it for every opportunity while traveling.   Not only does it keep traveling costs down, but it assures that every stay, we will be wrapped in typical Disney flair.   This hotel is no different. We usually travel the right coast of America, mostly up and down U.S. 95. And Disney has several hotels outside of Orlando. When we drive to Florida, our first stop is in Hilton Head South Carolina. Then to our destination in the South West coast of Florida. On our way home we usually stop in Orlando for a few days at one of Disney's amazing resorts, then home.   We have yet to be disappointed

Summary Heading: High quality hotel with nice pools and good room
Summary: The hotel is conveniently located from the parking lot for anyone that brings a car. The check in was quick and the pool is centrally located between the hotel buildings and was quite popular. Wrt the restaurants by the hotel they have a limited menu so check whether you want to eat in Disneyland instead. The hotel room itself was very clean, well kept with perfect beds including some really cool decor that the boys loved. The bathroom was set up in a way that made it easy to share. The distance to downtown Disney is short and it is easy to get into the park. Those staying in Disney hotels get early access to the park, and it pays off to decide how to use that hour.

Summary Heading: What is the "story" of the Disneyland Hotel?
Summary: Everything at Disney is supposed to evoke a story.    Is the story of the Disneyland Hotel simply "business hotel"?  It is a very nice business hotel.    But it does not have the theming and storytelling of the California Adventure Hotel.   The hotels at Disney World in Florida also have more theming and storytelling.

Summary Heading: Great Location - age is beginning to show!
Summary: I understand that Disney announced last month about building a new hotel- it is time!  Location: fantastic!!!  At the end of downtown Disneyland and about 0.4 miles from the park gates.   Building: very very busy with guests coming and going. If you want a little upscale, consider the Grand California - you also get early access to the park from GC.   Rooms: I was in a 1 BR with a king bed, a sofa bed and a portable crib. Although efforts have been made, it requires updates like the shower, lamps etc.   Staff: very friendly and helpful.   Food: lots of options in the hotel as well as in Downtown Disneyland. Snacks are expensive so stock up outside.

The Disneyland Hotel is a very nice hotel but a bit over priced.  Let's go over the Disneyland Hotel shall we!!!  CHECK IN - The Check in process is easy and simple.  Each time my family and I have stayed there, there is hardly a line and all the Cast Members are friendly.  What has been an issue in the past is the room availability.  Check in is anytime after 3:00 p.m.  There may be times when you check in at 3:00 p.m. but your room isn't ready till 4 or 5:00 p.m.  Not exactly a great value if you are just staying over night and you have to check out at 11:00 a.m. the next day.  You may get lucky and have a room ready if you check in early.  Depends on the season.  Overall though, Cast Members are nice and check in process EASY!  Look out for Goofy hanging out in the lobby

Summary Heading: Very well maintained, up-to-date, Disney property!
Summary: This is a well maintained, up-to-date Disney property with a GREAT location. You can walk to Downtown Disney as well as the park. The grounds are well maintained with a large pool area between the two hotel buildings. The rooms are big, sound proofed with comfortable beds. They have coffee in room and a mini fridge -wish they had a mini bar, but it is Disney, right? The restaurants onsite were just OK though they did have a character breakfast, but I didn't go there so can't really review. The characters are at check in which the kids love. This is the quietest Disney property I have ever stayed at - I didn't have my kids with me as I was at a conference so I LOVED it, but not sure if it is maybe the "kiddest" place I have ever been. My room in the Frontier tower, 2699, had a

I came for a conference. The rooms are spacious and the beds were comfortable.  I used the gym and it was sufficient for running and weight training. The pools were really a treat. They had 3 pools and one of them had waterslides.   The pools were a wonderful temperature not too high not too cold.  The food was also top notch.  The resort is conveniently located next to downtown Disney and within a short distance to Starbucks.

I brought my family along for a 4-day business trip. The hotel itself was excellent and nothing to complain. I presume given the location, everything was expensive. Even the restaurants close by on downtown disney were very much on the higher side. Of course that should not come as a surprise, but I thought it would be good to know in advance. The disney attractions are a short walk from downtown disney. The 1-hour early entry was really useful. We went during end of May and it was cold. We even had to buy a jacket. We did not use the pool, but I think it would be fabulous in peak summer. Food options in the hotel are limited but not too bad. We did not go to the eating-with-character but tried the others. If you are directionally challenged, this could be a little tricky the

Summary Heading: Awesome time at the Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: We stayed July 6-8, 2016. The hospitality of the Disney resorts are unparalleled! Check in was a breeze, even the scare from Pluto added to the experience! We booked a club level room and in my opinion it was well worth it. There was never a shortage of snacks and beverages. The pool area was fun. The location to Disneyland was excellent! A short walk down the path and you're in Downtown Disney! Just a hop skip and jump to the gates! Take advantage of the Magic Mornings and get to the gates 15-30min early. Have fun!

The hotel was conveniently located to walk to the park.  With your stay you get admission an hour earlier at one of the parks each day. That hour alone *might* be worth the high price tag.  Our room in the Frontier Tower was relatively quiet, except near the connecting door to our neighbors. The room was clean and relatively up to date. We are used to visiting Disney in Florida and staying at the Wilderness Lodge. There really is no comparison in terms of theming and "magic." The Disneyland Hotel fell a little flat in comparison. Also of note the business center charged something like a dollar a page to print something out. We felt the charges were a little extreme.

I LOVE Disney and I look away at a lot of expensive things because after all it's magic but gosh darn it, $500+ for a night is a lot to cough up when you live nearby in LA.  I had never stayed in a hotel at DL before so this was a first for me.    I came here as a very special treat for my daughter's birthday. We are a big Disney family and we wanted to spend our daughter's magical day at the Magic Kingdom so since she was small and we wanted to enjoy as much time as possible at DL we booked a room.   We drove in and were greeted with the most wonderful holiday decorations.  When you step into the hotel lobby you are transported into magic.  It took a little bit of time to check in and for them to verify our annual pass discount and do all that paperwork.    We were given a key

We stayed here for 5 nights and it was great for the kids and wasn't to far to walk to either of the parks. I actually enjoyed walking through downtown Disneyland each day. The character breakfast is a must do for the kids. The bar shack next to the pool area was awesome!! The sound effects really add to the great vibe (you'll understand when you get there)It's hard to get a seat in there, so get in early. Pool and spa are good too...although the water was a little chilly for me

This is an awesome hotel and I loved being right outside the park!! We had the chance to go back to the room and relax whenever we wanted. I also love love love the pool area! We sat poolside shipping cocktails while the kids swam the day away.

During our visit to Southern Cal this summer, we stopped by Disneyland and stayed for the first time at Disneyland Hotel. The rooms are nice, clean and well appointed. Very easy walk to Disneyland/California Adventure. As guest at DL Hotel, we were able to get in Cal Adventure through the back gate - allowing us to by pass the large security line in the mornings. The pool has been updated and has fun slides for the kids. Lots of lifeguards, so I felt safe that the kids were been watched well while I took a little break poolside. Very $$$ for what you do get but its Disney and we were their during peak time, so we knew this going in.

My family was very satisfied with everything. Good was great and very good. Was a little over prices but we can't complain when it's at the Disney land resort. The customer service was great and the room service was good. We had a problem with our air but they fixed it right way

My daughter and I are Disney lovers. We are annual pass holders so we frequent the parks at least 1 a month if not more. I decided to do an overnight trip with her the last time we went and she was in Heaven. Keep in mind, you're going to pay more for a room here than most places it's the Disneyland Hotel, that's what you're paying for. You're also getting great service and are super close to the park. I think it really comes down to personal preference and what you are able/willing to spend.  It's magical and fun for kids. They love it. Mine for sure did.  The only negative thing I would say from this past time at the hotel was the room service. They have cards you can fill out and put on your door for breakfast the next morning. It gives you options for time, food, drinks,

This is a great hotel to be at.  Is a Resort property, with activities for all.  They have 3 pools, a waterslide and the staff is exceptional.  They truly are a part of the Disney family.    We went there to celebrate 30 year anniversery, and a 60th birthday and a 21st birthday.    All and all a very special time

Booked this hotel purely to be walking distance to parks and early access. Its convenience is worth it and rooms spacious. Just have to get over the price you are paying for the room.  Beds are comfortable and pool fun for kids. Recommend if you are going to disney land parks.

Not my first stay at Disneyland Hotel and won't be my last. Disney is known for its magic and it definitely feels magical staying here. As with all Disney properties, the cast members are top notch! Always going out of the way to make your stay better, helpful and kind. The hotel, the rooms, the property is all beautiful and special. Every touch in the rooms from the mickey faucets to the beautiful light up musical headboard is amazing! Never a disappointment, always beautiful views. Just magical!

This was our second stay here. We had family in town and the kids decided we should stay here, as it was their favorite of all the Disneyland Resorts.   The first time we were completely mesmerized by the view of Downtown Disney. This time we had a pool view and it was just as great! The kids loved looking out of the window to see what was going on at the pool.   For the room, I was not as impressed this time as I was the first time. Almost hakf of the things in the room were not working properly. Our phone was broken, the music that came on when you turned on the headboard fireworks sounded horrible, the fridge kept cutting out when it got to hot in the cabinet and the bathroom had horrible ventilation. The steam never seemed to clear out! Oh, and the windows were very dirty on

We were able to secure a cabana reservation for July on our first day at the resort. It was a great way to spend an afternoon after a day of travel. We found the physical arrangements to be as noted. The chairs were comfy and the curtains could be drawn for privacy. The service was a little slow and the fruit/water were not in the cabana when we arrived (5 minutes early). Having the refrigerator and guaranteed shade were nice on a busy day at the pool. The pools were warm and shallow at 4 feet, which was good for young swimmers and provided enough depth for experienced swimmers. The pool slides seem to be worn with rough joints, but it didn't seem to bother the children. The medium height slide was the quicker of the 2 full sized slides.  If you have children who want to swim

This hotel is amazing!  I was here for a conference and brought my family with me. The customer service was amazing.  Our "mouse"keeper was constantly checking on us when we saw her in the hallways and always offered to help push the strollers when my wife was by herself trying to get from the elevator to the room.  When we first entered our room, we noticed the fridge was not working well.  Within an hour, we had a brand new fridge and they even put all of our drinks and things in there for us.  The room was bigger than I expected and very clean.  The pool area was great too!  It's a very easy walk from the hotel to the parks, and there are tons of food options with downtown disney connected to the hotel property!  This was one of the best hotel experiences I have had!

Summary Heading: Disney Immersive and down the street from the Theme Park!
Summary: Disneyland Hotel is an attraction all to itself! The pool is it's own attraction and not to mention Trader Sams right in the middle of the complex! The hotel has a huge ballroom to host events and it has it's valet right in front of the main tower. The rooms are awesome, we got a bed frame that lights up and plays When You Wish Upon a Star! great location down the walk way from Downtown Disney! Everything is within walking distance to this iconic hotel!

As always, The Disney name prides itself of service and the Disneyland Hotel is no different - all staff, from check-in staff, to cafe staff to the maintenance staff - everyone is incredibly helpful and friendly.  Rooms were ok, pool area was great for kids and convenient location to Disneyland entrance.  Another great attraction, is the 'Magic Morning' entry to the Disneyland park.  Would recommend staying here for sure!

Check in was crazy, room wasn't ready until almost 5:45 pm that day! The gentleman that brung our bags up was rude, threw them around like he didn't care! We are staying on the side with a fireworks view, that is cool especially for the kids to see and they play the music for the show over the t.v. The room is very spacious, and comfortable for our family of 6. The staff around the hotel are very nice, the pool is great and fun for the kids. Close walk to Disneyland through downtown Disney. It's nice to have the ability for early magic hour staying at a Disneyland hotel.

Summary Heading: extremely disappointed and a waste of money
Summary: I am so disappointed to have to write this. We are a family travelling from the UK with 4 kids for a once in a lifetime experience and have just arrived at the Disneyland hotel.  Like so many of you I have agonised over our Disneyland trip and read all the trip advisor reviews covering many hotel options.  Finally I concluded that for the best experience we should pay extra (considerably so) and book the Disneyland hotel and request the Adventure tower and avoid the Frontier tower (it being the furthest from the parks -a consideration with small kids- and with the worst views). So when making our reservation we explained all this (lifetime experience, small kids, views etc etc). It was explained that whilst a view of the park from the Adventure Tower couldn't be guaranteed, if

We had a great stay at the Disneyland hotel. We spent more time at the theme parks to be honest, but having the pools there as an afternoon activity with young children was great. There was 2 pools one for little kids and then one which was good for approx. 5 and up. The hotel provides life jacket type things the kids can wear in the pool. Only downside with the pool was it was really hard to get a pool chair, which we where ok with as we sat on the side of the pool to supervise our kids. But it meant they wouldn't serve us any food or drinks unless we had a seat.  Housekeeping was really good and our room was always cleaned well. Guest services and check in staff are all very helpful.  Our room had 2 queen beds and also a fold out sofa. Which worked well for our family of 4.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for convention and large family vacation !
Summary: My husband had a convention to attend and we decided to bring the family along for vacation, got two adjoining rooms for large growing teenagers which was perfect to have the two bathrooms and four queen beds! My husband forgot a book he was reading on the bedside table and we were called that night after driving home from the airport to let us know they would be mailing the book to us free of charge!  So nice!  The housekeepers do an amazing job of making rooms look wonderfully clean after spending long days at the park or at the pool with the delightful splash pool and slides- fun for all my kids ages 10-18!  Don't go through California Hotel for early morning, just go straight to the main gate and you'll get in MUCH faster!

Summary Heading: Not as good as previous visits
Summary: We have stayed here before a few times but this time it wasn't as great. Two days the housekeeper didn't finish our rooms and left pillows and towels on the floor. Then one day the housekeeper didn't latch the door when she left so our room was basically open all day. The hotel itself is nice but very expensive.

I got to stay with a friend who works at Disney World. He got a great rate. We had a basic view of the parking lot, but being close to the park was worth it. We were able to come back when we were tired to take a break before heading back to the parks for the night time shows. The beds were super comfy, even the pull out sofa bed. I love the light up headboards. We ate at the steakhouse in the hotel too and it was delicious. Hope I get to stay here again one day!!

Stayed here for 2 nights with husband and two teenage kids. Liked the ambiance of the hotel but was expensive for what it is. Enjoyed my stay but would probably go back to one of the cheaper hotels across the street from the main entrance next time.

My family and I recently stayed in the Disneyland Hotel and enjoyed everything about it! We were celebrating our anniversary and the hotel sent us a rose to our room as well as an autograph photo of Mickey & Minnie. We stayed for five nights, but the first night they put us in the main tower (Fantasy). We had stayed in the Adventure Tower in times previous. We noticed the bathroom in the Adventure Tower were much roomier and the view more pleasant. With three daughters a more spacious bathroom can make all of the difference. We asked to be switched to the Adventure Tower, but there was no room the first night. The front desk was so sweet and apologetic, but assured us we could move over the next night. For the "inconvenience" they sent us a plate of yummy treats to our room!

This was my first trip to Disneyland. I have always been to World. I loved the hotel we were in the Fantasy Tower. This hotel was much better then the AllStar ones we stayed in at World. Very clean and room was quite. Only thing I missed was the cafeteria style dining like all star has a Disney World. Would go again.

Summary Heading: Great service but rooms a little tired.
Summary: This is probably the mid-range hotel on Disney property and the oldest.  It's been a while since the place has been updated and the hallways smelled a bit dusty.  Our rooms were spacious and there was good attention to detail.  It was nicely furnished and we had a tropical view from our window.  Maid service was efficient and the concierge was exceptional.  Our granddaughter loved the tea cup chairs in the lobby.  We all enjoyed the spacious pools.  As this was a family trip, we had adjoining rooms which was very nice.  Our daughter's room was lovely and spacious.

I grew up in Southern California and went to Disneyland frequently but never got to or even had the occasion to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Now I live out of state and was visiting with my daughter and decided to stay at the hotel in order to go to both parks more easily over two days.  I will say I was shocked at how much a room costs per night then I checked other hotels within walking distance of Disneyland and realized, the Disneyland Hotel was cheaper. I received a substantial military discount so the cost was not unreasonable. The room was very nice, with two queen beds which my daughter could not stop talking about because they were so comfortable. We loved the music box which played "A dream is a wish your heart makes" while the board above the beds lights up. The

I stay here a lot - it's less expensive than the Grand Californian and you can use their private access to the park (and use their pools, spa, etc. if you like). Pros include: themed buildings," firework s"headboards, character interaction, Trader Sam's by the pool (have to go into the bar for the "show"), and access to other Disney hotel amenities. Cons are that the pool area is small and always crowded, and it is a bit of a hike through Downtown Disney to the parks...

Summary Heading: Not the magic I had expected
Summary: Well overpriced.  Adequate accommodation but not worthy of its price.  We had no chair in the room, rang the front desk to ask why not and were told that no chairs were providedn in any room. Fair enough. Until housekeeping checked that everything was OK a few minutes later and ... We got a chair and apology for front desk inaccuracy (!) Go figure.  Ifyou're moneys to burn,  stay here. If you're not, don't.  You'll be disappointed.

From the great swimming pools to the friendly staff & great breakfast in the quiet restaurant to the hidden Mickey's in our bathroom, this place was a delight!!! We dropped our bags off early and got a phone call when we were in the park saying our rooms were ready. Our suite accommodated 6 adults and 2 little ones (we brought Pack & Play and a cot). Go for it!!

So if you have never been to the Original Disneyland resort it is important that you understand this is a very compact resort and this is one of only three official Disney Hotels. You Could definitely stay at what are considered "Good Neighbor" hotels some of which offer shuttles to the property. This hotel is really right there in Downtown Disney steps away from both Disneyland and California Adventure which is why I prefer it. Disney will give you early Morning entrance for staying at one of there hotels so you defiantly get perks. The two other Disney hotels are Grand Californian (which is well out of my price range) and Paradise pier which is kind of off in a weird spot.

We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel a few times. Each time has given us special memories. We recently stayed for a combination of celebrations. A first time visit for one member, two college graduations, and celebrating "life" as I was near death only a year ago. This was possibly my last visit to Disneyland and I wanted it to be special. They didn't disappoint. The staff was superb, the room and view excellent, the grounds spotless, the pool fantastic. It gave us very special memories of a very special time. If I am fortunate enough to make another trip, there is nowhere else I want to stay.

I recently stayed here for 2 nights en route to New York.  We arrived early in the morning after a 16 hour flight and then the drive to Anaheim from LAX. As expected our room was not ready however the staff were as accommodating as possible and enabled us to change , store our bags and then explore the parks. I was sent an text message as soon as our room was ready ( about 2 pm ) There were 3 adults staying in the room which was an appropriate size and clean. Being so close to the park is a bonus and that is what you pay for. You spend little time in the room and it was perfectly adequate for our purpose. we were there in late June and it was quite warm. At the end of each day we went for a swim in the pool . My only criticism is that there is nowhere near enough shade or

Summary Heading: Compared to other Disney properties . . . meh
Summary: Ok, I know we are never, ever supposed to compare Disneyland and Disney World.  We knew going into this that the Disneyland hotels were not going to be comparable to the WDW resorts that we are used to.  We understood from the get-go that Disneyland does not have the sprawling resort grounds and amenities that WDW has.  But, even with all those disclaimers, it is hard to give this hotel a stellar rating when compared even with its neighbor Disney property, The Grand Californian.  We stayed for eight total nights --- four at the Disneyland Hotel and four at the Grand Californian.  I am really glad that we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel first, because it would have been a bit of a letdown after the Grand Californian.  Don't get me wrong --- the Disneyland Hotel is not terrible by

We paid $1,200 a night for a two bedroom suite.  For that nightly rate, the nightstand should have outlets in them.  I shouldn't have to pull furniture away from the wall and unplug the alarm clock just so I can charge my phone on my nightstand.  They should include qtips and cotton balls etc with the toiletries.  There should be turn down service.  Disney knows they have a captive audience and gets away with offering basic hotel services at a high price.  My kids did love the characters breakfast though my husband did suffer a severe allergy attack likely from preservatives used in the buffet food.  I would probably stay at the courtyard Marriott next time.

Summary Heading: I would NOT stay here again
Summary: we just finished a 5 night stay at this hotel.  The pool for the kids and the proximity to the park is the only advantage.  Our room is just an average hotel room despite being 450+ per night, the carpet was actually sticky in areas.  we had to put towels down or wear socks...but the aspect that killed it for us was the noise.  you can hear the noise at the pool until very late and the music they pump around the grounds 24/7 can be heard in the room.  We asked to be moved and were told we'd have to get out of ours (luggage and all) and then a new room would be ready after 3.  That seemed harsh to us as we have little kids and we didn't want to be without the room for most of the day.  One night i had to call security at 245 am because the room above us was being so loud.

We stayed in the Adventure Tower and the room itself was fine. We had a king sized bed and there was still lots of space to move even with our luggage. There's a mini fridge that comes in handy. As for the bathroom, it wasn't particularly well lit even after their recent renovations.   The pool and landscaping around the resort was fantastic. There's a hot tub but it's always packed!   The hotel isn't too far from the parks and but you still need to walk. Downtown Disney is just 5 minutes away by foot so you can get most food/items that you would need.   In all, staying near the park and getting the magic hour for being a guest is a major plus. However, be prepared to pay for it!

Summary Heading: Nice, but not as Magical as you would think
Summary: Before I start reviewing, I have to say that the whole experience is indeed Magical. With all the crowds, and the lines, and the little disappointment I'm going to express, it was still an experience we will never forget. It's Disney after all, the home of Magic that made us all dream growing up.  I wanted this to be as perfect as possible. So before I booked I called the Disney hotline for information, and then went into chat with one of their support officers on their website to get the best advice on how to go about the Disney part of my vacation in the U.S.  We saw the hotels, researched rides and experiences etc..  My requirements were simple and clear: I'm fine with the fact that the Disney hotels are 200% more expensive than the surrounding hotels (which are rated above

Checked in Friday July first. No line at check in. Never a wait for elevators. Stayed in adventure tower. Beds were very comfortable.We all loved the castle carved headboard that lit up and played music. Early admission every morning of your stay definitely makes paying extra for the disneyland hotel well worth the price. Pool and slides really fun and relaxing. About a 10 minute easy walk through Downtown Disney to reach the parks or you can walk 5 minutes to the monorail station. Was hesitant to book because of the cost and some negative reviews but we all agreed our stay was magical and would definitely stay at the Disneyland Hotel again.

*The rooms are very clean, modern, and up to date.  *The fireworks light up headboard is a unique feature. *We had adjoining rooms in the Fantasy Tower. The second room was a little larger with a sofa bed and a second vanity area, which was nice.  *The beds/pillows are very comfortable. *The rooms are very quiet/soundproof. Rarely did we hear anyone else even walking by. *You can't beat the location!!! You can't beat the location!! *The kids enjoyed the pool area and monorail slides. *We used SuperShuttle to/from SNA, which was waiting for us in both directions. *The AC works well and cooled off the rooms quickly.  As far as value, we used our DVC vacation points for this property since the Grand Californian is next to impossible to book. The number of vacation points needed for

Summary Heading: A touch of the Disney Magic in one hotel.
Summary: Grand building, great service and staff, and wonderful family themes.   A touch of pixy dust around every corner., from nice displays of  the magic Kingdom Castle in the main lobby to a Disney character buffet. Wifi available throughout the entire resort, Tiki bar and a giant pool themed to the Disneyland monorail just behind the resort in a courtyard setting.

Summary Heading: The charm of Disney but the age is showing
Summary: Staying with Disney makes you part of the magic 24/7 but when the magic starts to show its age it can be a little bit of a let down. Disney stands for so many good things but to neglect basic maintenance will only come back to bite in the end

The one-bedroom suites are large and comfortable.  The queen sofa bed is comfortable. (I love the smell of the complimentary shampoo and conditioner.)  Staying in a Disney hotel comes with perks - like complimentary monorail rides into Disneyland.  The hotels are also adjacent to the parks - convenient when you have a tired family.

As it was our first time in Disneyland we decided to stay in the Fairytale Suite at the Disneyland Hotel.  The staff at the VIP desk were very helpful and courteous. Dave from the E-lounge was tremendously helpful with following through on resolving itinerary issues. I was quite impressed with his initiative.  Great things about the room: + size is spacious + bathroom is impressive + good view of fireworks + daily gifts from the cast members  + magic hour + VIP viewing area for World of Colour + automatic greeting in the room door (you'll know what I mean when you get there)  Negatives - magic hour is too short- you can't cover many rides in an hour as there's already quite a bit of a queue with all the people attending magic hour. An idea would be to give theme suite guests the

We stayed here to splurge and get the magic hour and it was the last hotel on property that was available. Only through Trip Advisor though. The property itself was sold out if you called them directly.  The room was comfortable although I wish we had been able to get a view over the Disney Downtown area where we would have been able to see the fireworks too. There was a great cut through to the CA Adventure Park through the Grand Californian entrance to the park. It's good to get there early to stand in line and have someone pick up the fast breakfast options in the cafe around the corner form the entrance line.  The pool slide was much fun and was able to do multiple runs on it with practically no line. It was nice to be able to keep the car there with out having to move it

Our family enjoyed a 4 night Disneyland Resort stay at the Disneyland Hotel in June. We stayed in the concierge portion of the Adventure Tower and it was very nice. At check in, a friendly cast member, A.J., took us to the E Ticket Club room to explain things about the hotel and parks. Although we had booked a standard pool/garden view room, we were upgraded to what Disney called a Downtown Disney view room. We found that this description was not accurate. The view actually was of Disneyland!. The view at night was great because it enabled us to watch the fireworks from our room, complete with the actual music piped in on the TV. Robert, one of the food attendants in the concierge area, was very nice and entertaining with our children and our whole family. He made eating

We stayed 7 nights in a 2 bedroom suite (one king, 2 queens, and a pull out sofa).  We had plenty of room for the 7 of us. It is basically a one bedroom suite with an adjoining standard room.  We were in the Fantasy Tower with a view of the fireworks. No complaints! We loved this room. (well...maybe one! Why no microwave Disney???). Our family left and we stayed a little longer, so we checked into a standard room overlooking the pool.  Rm. 2034 had no hot water and the tub drain wasn't working well.  Big bummer! The pool was super busy when we came back to the hotel in the afternoon. Maybe a cabana next time? We did laundry but was disappointed when there was only 5 washers and 6 dryers for the whole entire hotel. Nothing like what they picture on their website. It was

Stayed 4 nights at this iconic property. *Main lobby was meh. Check-in line was slow but Cast were great. *Location is fantastic with a short walk to monorail or both park entrances. *Had a premium downtown Disney view in adventure tower which allowed for fireworks viewing. *CAUTION: Live music each night outside of ESPN is loud and can easily be heard in these rooms. It ends at 10pm. *Reasonable view from 7th floor but you'll want higher to get above trees blocking some views. *Elevators are slowest I've ever experience and stairs are not an option - stairwell doors are locked. *Room was incredibly spacious and tastefully decorated with Disney touches throughout - 2 queen beds, sofa sleeper, desk and chair, and chair near window. Floor to ceiling windows are amazing! Not your

Pros: The rooms were clean and the pool area was well maintained. The location is great for people that can handle some walking since you can walk through Downtown Disney into the parks. We also used the monorail which was convenient.  The monorail slides were fun.  Cons:  The pool area needed a water station. The in-room dining food was bland.

Summary Heading: Nice, but lacking the Disney Magic
Summary: I grew up in Arizona, frequenting Disneyland- never stayed at the hotel, but was always walking around the grounds and shopping.  Then I started going to Orlando, stayed onsite multiple times.  Now, when I returned to DLH, I was disappointed.  The grounds were nice and well kept, but not special. The rooms had hidden Mickeys and a few nice touches, but not Magic.  If it wasn't for the cast member discount, it would be way too expensive for what we got.  Maybe the Frontier Tower was old, but I was not impressed.  Needs some work.  Even the lobby was disappointing.  The room was tired and in need of an upgrade.

Summary Heading: Lots of Details, Lots of Fun
Summary: While in CA visiting some relatives, my 9yo and I spent 3 nights at DL hotel.  We stayed in one of the Concierge rooms at the hotel and were able to enjoy the lounge in the hotel.  Our room was generously spacious for the two of us, and would have been still very roomy if the rest of my family had been with us.   The room was spotless, and we only had an issue with one drawer in the dresser that did not want to stay shut.  Given the placement of the dresser, it was a potential hazard since it would have been easy to hurt ones self on the drawer.  I contacted the staff in the lounge and the dresser was fixed by the time we got back to the room.   We loved the light up headboards and used them each night.  I loved the floor to ceiling windows - it really added to the modern style

When at Disneyland, why not stay at the Disneyland hotel?  Convenient, quick and comfortable.  While not cheap,  the location makes up for the costs.  Given the crowds and the traffic,  better to stay here and enjoy pool time faster than fighting the infamous line-ups

Just spent 3 nights in a Resort/pool view room on the 4th floor of the Frontier tower. The room was spacious for the two queen beds and the desk/chair area in front of the bathroom and closet was partially partitioned off. Useful as I got up earlier to get breakfast while others continued to sleep. Note that Starbucks next to Sunglass Hut towards end of Downtown Disney next to the World of Disney opens at 5am which was very handy to get coffee and breakfast sandwiches before park 7am early entry. Yes there was a coffee shop that opened at 6am next to the pool and next to the base of Fantasy tower but nothing beats Starbucks coffee to start an early Disney park day.  Don't forget to give time for all kinds of lines - Starbucks, security, then ticket line.

Summary Heading: Fantasy Tower, Nice pool, small walk to parks
Summary: We stayed here as a Staycation after a volleyball tournament. We checked in late after a day in the parks, and were put in the Fantasy Tower. The room was spacious. I had three kids with me, and the pullout sofa was a nice surprise. We had a short walk to the room, and got in just under the gun to order room service. We got up the next morning and walked across the way to Goofy's kitchen. After lunch we spent the day at the pool. Plenty of shade, I even took a little nap. The poolside service was decent. The kids took a break and walked to downtown Disney to catch a movie. Valet and Bell services were quick and convenient. No complaints, other then the Monorail was down our entire stay. That was annoying.

We recently finished our stay at the Disneyland Hotel (June 21-23) and enjoyed most of the experiences we had during our time there. The hotel offered lots of shops, a cafe, a fitness center, and some neat aestetics. We purchased a package the included 3 day tickets with magic morning early access to the parks, and really enjoyed being able to access the park an hour earlier. The room was very spacious and offered some cool aspects like mickey hands as towel holders, a seperate toilet room from the shower room, a vanity area, and 2 queen beds with a very neat headboard.  On the downside, for the price of the ticket I would expect some type of breakfast to be incuded, and a better deal for parking but found neither to be true. I was unable to visit the pool area however it looked

Summary Heading: Dated interior and annoyingly loud films shown outside the hotel late into night
Summary: I am writing this at Disneyland hotel, it is our last night here. Our rooms are in the Fortune Tower and view is toward hotel's garden and pool area. The view is fine, but unfortunately films shown at the garden area between 9 and 11-1130 pm are played at high volume which makes it hard to catch sleep (which is sorely needed after 630am start at Disneyland). And our three bedroom suite is on 10th floor, usual noises do not reach this high. The service is quite sufficient and some of the personnel are really friendly. The rooms are spacious but the low ceiling height might feel claustrophopic to some. And coming from Finland where nobody has wall-to-wall carpets  a busy hotel room with thick ones makes me wonder about the cleanliness of the rooms. Which is not an issue for adults

Summary Heading: Al the Magic lives at the Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: When you visit the Happiest Place on Earth, try to spring for staying ON PROPERTY! Even though you can save a little money and stay just across the road, the hassle of traveling back and forth can drain lot of time and energy. The magical Disneyland Hotel is right on the monorail line and keeps you surrounded in the magic! Plus then you qualify for early morning entrees, purchase delivery and mush more! We highly, highly recommend it!

We had a good stay.. The room was clean, and the location was nice... We're from Florida and have stayed in all Disney World resorts, and we thought this place was on par     The pool area was great for the kids, and great bar area "trader SAMs" was good for the adults

We are former Southern CA residents, and so our previous experiences of visiting Disney were day trips.  Having relocated east, we decided this visit to stay in style, and book a room at the Disneyland Hotel to allow us "early access" to the park.  What a great decision.  Let's start with the property itself: built as several towers, at the center of which sits a wonderful pool complex, the site is large without being overwhelming. There is an adequately-sized check-in area, and a few shops--one for souveniers and the other for sundries.  We had a room with Concierge privileges--which I recommend.  Not only does the lounge provide food (breakfasts, snacks and desserts), drinks are included; all of which provides a nice break from the constant nickel-and-diming of a day in the

We are originally from Orlando so I grew up at DisneyWorld  and I haven't been to Disneyland in over 30 years , It was fun to see and to stay on property so we could be close to all the action . The hotel is very nice , rooms are a good size and beds were comfy . The only issue we had was with maid service . My husband watched me move the do not disturb sign from the outside to the inside so we could get our room serviced , however when we returned our sign was back out and room was not cleaned :/ and the day before we had sign out and maid came in and cleaned  and the other family traveling with us had asked for service directly to maid but again no service when we returned to rooms. Just a little strange . We had rooms facing downtown Disney in the adventure tower  which was

I'm an adult with no children but I love Disneyland!  The details and care that they do in all of their facilities and theme parks and the excellent customer service made the experience magical. I was attending a conference and had the pleasure of spending the night at this hotel.  The rooms are really well appointed and comfortable.  When I was walking through the gift shop some of the Disney characters were walking through the lobby and around the property taking pictures with people.  I loved it!  Great experience and I would go back!

We had the most perfect stay here! Rooms are beyond anything we could have wanted! We stayed here many years ago and were very pleased. It has only gotten better!!! Most comfortable, enjoyable, beautiful room ever! Well worth it!!!

Our stay at the Disneyland Hotel was nice and fun. We absolutely loved all of the amazing room decorations. They make you feel the Disney hype. If you are planning on going to the parks, and don't want long wait times, we recommend taking advantage of the extra magic hour. Wake up early and go to a fast food breakfast restaurant at the Disneyland Hotel. It is a coffee shop and next to the Goofy's Kitchen restaurant.

It's so clean and totally Disney. You can't go wrong staying here. Yes it's pricey but sometimes pricey is worth it. The pool is amazing and although can get crowded it never seems crowded. Cast members are so helpful. We mentioned it was a child's birthday and we came back to our room to cookies and milk and autographed pictures wishing us a happy birthday.

We stayed in the Adventure Tower for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay! The beds were very comfortable with a larger room space. The staff was very accommodating and the location was very close to Downtown Disney and the parks. Pools were clean and the grounds were very well kept. It is worth the extra to stay so close to all the Disney action!

This trip was so much fun and this hotel room was very nice. Everything in there was decorated very cutely and the beds were comfortable. The walk to the park was not very long at all and that was the best part. You are walking all day the last thing you want to do is more walking. They have a nice pool for when it is too hot outside so you can go cool down. There are also different packages that you can get for staying in this hotel which make the trip more easy on you and more enjoyable. Your children will definitely get worn out at some point throughout the day so having that quick walk will make it easy for getting to the hotel during nap time. I recommend this to any family who had small children and can not walk far.

I stayed three nights with my two 14 year olds for a birthday/grad celebration.  I told them on the phone when I booked it would be their birthday.  When we checked in, there was no mention of anything birthday related.  On that note when,  we arrived at 11;00 AM and check-in was not until 3.  However, the lovely Sara at the desk was able to find us a room right away!!  What a wonderful desk clerk she was.   The room was nice and we had a lovely view of the palm trees.  There were some items in the room that didn't feel clean, i.e. the glass surfaces in the room. The outlets in the bathroom didn't work,  As for location, we were in the Adventure Tower and near a nightly concert each night.  The music was very loud and kept us up until they were done.  We were tired and

We stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom suite on the 8th floor of the Frontier Tower.  It was fabulous.  We had a balcony with amazing views of the fireworks each night.  The beds were comfy and the kids loved the headboards.  The whole property is beautifully maintained and the staff friendly and helpful.  We had some trouble with water pressure in the showers, but that was fixed while we were there.  We enjoyed the pools, especially the water slides, and getting to meet with Goofy in the front lobby (ask when they think he'll be by again!)  We really enjoyed that we would walk from our room all the way to the park gates and never realize we were in the middle of a busy city!

Summary Heading: Near Park was Best Benefit of staying here
Summary: Our family stayed here 6 nights in three different rooms last week.  Check in was a bit frustrating.  We booked this trip 10 months ago and asked that we all be on the same floor close to each other, which did not happen.  They did not block off rooms we requested at all and then told us since we were late checking in all rooms were taken. Check in was after 3 pm but our rooms were still not ready even though check out was at 11am.  The rooms were adequate size, beds and linens comfortable.  Air conditioner worked well.  Lighting was terrible especially in the bathroom. Trash cans were tiny so we had trash all on the floor. No view for us as we were on the second floor so all we saw was jungle.  Elevators vey slow at peak times.  Food was terrible everywhere and way overpriced

Summary Heading: Will never stay anywhere else when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel twice now, and I have to say we are pretty impressed. It's amazing how well-kept and clean the rooms and property are for the amount of business they must see at all times.  We have three children varying in age from elementary to high school, and after a ton of research, we decided on the Disneyland Hotel. Yes, it's quite a bit more expensive than other hotels in the area, but it's well worth it. Here's why:  From the minute you check in, the service is top quality. Both times they made our kids feel very special and were very accommodating of all of our special requests. The rooms were on the more impressive side for cleanliness (a few things were missed - finger prints all over the windows, some smudges here and there, but overall

Having gone to Disneyland my entire life it is surprising that this is my 1st stay at this resort and honestly will probably be my last.  The hotel is nice enough but I still prefer the convenience of Grand Californian.  After reading reviews previous to our vacation about the distance of certain Towers I was hoping to not get rooms in the Frontier Tower but of course that is right where we ended up.  The tower seems to be a bit dated and it is also farther than if you were to stay at Paradise Pier, which we have done before.  The monorail was convenient although was not always running so the jaunt into the parks with little ones can be a tiring start to the day.  The rooms are clean and good sized with Disney touches.  We used the pool and cabanas and enjoyed it very much.

Summary Heading: Exactly what you would expect from a Disney Hotel
Summary: There is absolutely nothing to complain about with this hotel.  That said I am not sure there is anything to rave about either.  The staff were nice (as one would expect on a Disney property), the rooms and hallways were clean (as one would expect), the room was a fair size.  Enjoyed seeing fireworks from our room (and loved the headboard.

The rooms were nice and for a conference the food was really good. You are close to the park and there is a fun pool at the hotel. The staff is also very friendly. The downside is that there are only two bars and they fill up quickly at night so you have to wait in line. The service at the bars is also very slow. There is a fire pit near the pool that is a nice place to sit.  The rates are reasonable but drinks and amenities are pricey.

Love this place, best hotel at Disneyland. Love the location and fab pool, great rooms, comfortable beds. Must stay here. This is prob my fav hotel anywhere. Stayed here many times over past 7 years. Will stay again. Can't wait to go back.

This was a fabulous vacation. Disney always delivers the magic. We stayed on 10th floor with an over view of the park. We could whatch the fireworks in our room looking out the picture window. I love Disneyland and always will. Nothing at all was out of place with this report.  This is easily the most expensive vacation place of all time. You pay for the magic. With that being said I will go again and I will pay because there is no magic like Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Top floor two bedroom suite is a good overall room.
Summary: Stayed here in a top floor two bedroom suite in the Adventure Tower facing downtown Disney and the parks.  This building does not have any balconies but the rooms are larger for it and overall very good.  The views were quite good and you could see the fireworks at night.    We paid a bit over $1200 per night which on one hand is is fairly expensive.  However, two regular rooms with this view would cost about the same and you would not have the very large shared living room.  So overall I think the suites at this property are under-priced and are definitely worth it if you're in this general price range.    We're coming back again this year and will either get the same room type or we might get a three bedroom if we have any family friend kids who want to stay with us.  If we

My husband and I visited the Disneyland Hotel in conjunction with a business conference.  The conference facilities were great!  The meeting rooms were close to the guest rooms, no matter where you were located.  The hotel food served for the conference was very good. From a business perspective, this was a success.  We had a meal at Steakhouse 55, which was fantastic.  We ate several times at the Tangaroa Terrace, breakfast and lunch. I read another review that talked about the lack of restaurants on site.  There are several places onsite, but more importantly, there are many restaurants a short walk away at Downtown Disney.  All the employees were courteous and willing to serve. We had a good experience on multiple occasions with cleaning service, restaurant service, front

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for Mother's Day weekend. We were there for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon. I had stayed at the Disneyland hotel back in 1976 and had such wonderful memories of the monorail and how beautiful the hotel was so we decided to splurge and pay the higher price for this hotel.  Check in was fast and easy. The hotel was completely booked and our room was not ready. We were traveling with my 5 year old niece. The agent asked if it was her first visit and who her favorite character was. She walked away for a minute and came back with a signed picture of Anna and Elsa for my niece and told us she moved us to a different room that was ready for us. This was a great way to start our vacation! Room: We were in the fantasy tower overlooking the pool. We loved

This was my family's first stay at the Disneyland Hotel. We just loved the whole experience. We were there for our daughter's dance competition. The atmosphere at the hotel is great. The room was fabulous. Our view was of Downtown Disney. Even though there were long waits at the elevator it still did not spoil our stay here. We definitely will be staying here again next year.

We had a room in the adventure tower overlooking the main pool. the rooms are very spacious and bathrooms are huge, the beds are comfortable. My son went to look for the pop machines and get us some drinks but he needed change, instead of giving him change for his 10.00 they just asked him what he was needing and gave him a ice bucket   full of pops for us for free. The walk to the park is short. The kids met 5 different characters in the lobby, and we also had breakfast at goofys kitchen. The pools where a good mid afternoon  break from the parks. we used orbitz to book a killer deal for the room

Stayed here for a week to attend a business conference. It was a beautiful resort. The rooms were nice and full of Disney finishing touches. The pool areas and bar were fantastic. Conference facilities were nice, all the meals were great. I would love to go back with my family and enjoy the area for pleasure soon!!

Summary Heading: Convenient location, nice pool, average hotel
Summary: It was my 2 1/2 years old first Disneyland visit, and my first return after 8 years. We decided to stay at Disneyland hotel because it is close to the parks, and we were hoping for the Disney experience here. Our room is spacious and had a nice view of the swimming pool. The staff were nice. The pool, kid water slide and hot tub were great. The distance to the park down town Disneyland was great. But it is lacking the magical experience I was hoping for. This was just an average 3.5-4 stars hotel. We didn't see any characters until 30 minutes before we check out of the hotel. There were no extended check out time. We were told we can still use the pool after check out, but there were no facility with hot shower and room to change out clothes. This is the most frustrating part

We decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel because of the iconic nature of this property.  I first visited this hotel in 1975 on my first visit to the USA and Disneyland. My friend and I rode the monorail into the Hotel lobby and were enthralled. We had never seen anything like this hotel, we were, of course young and poor and were staying in one of the cheaper properties in the area.  The next time I visited Disneyland was with my husband and children in 1991. We still couldn't afford to stay at the Disneyland Hotel but took the children to visit and have dinner. Our hotel, next door is now the Paradise Pier Hotel and has been given the Disney make over. This time we took our 3 grandchildren and we didn't even consider staying anywhere else. I must admit, I was very

This was our first trip with a 3.5 yr old to Disneyland.  We checked in quite late (11pm) and it was a bit confusing as there was no one at the gate and nothing was coming out of the ticket machine.  So, we just pulled forward. Short term parking is still a bit of a haul if you have luggage and a kiddo and no help was to be found.  Somehow we dragged it all over. At check-in, I was a bit frustrated with the staff person that assisted me because she just wanted to hand me a bunch of papers and send me on my way even though I had questions.  The room was fine, but I was expecting more of a Disney theme - it seemed very minimal.  Some things in the room were not obvious.  For example I ran all over the room looking for tissues when I kid sneezed an explosion of snot.  Eventually I

Second Time Staying at this hotel. Stayed Premium Club Level Month of May Okay I will admit this is not a biased review, it is a review based on experience with Disney. Please let me provide a bit of background, stayed at most deluxe Disney hotels in Fla and Ca. Beach Club is my all time favorite, until our second stay at Dland Hotel, the OG. The rooms are AWESOME. They are huge and can fit a family of four comfortably, they are clean, they are themed. Of course I play the Resort Video Guide the entire time, drives the family crazy, however I love me some Disney commercial TV. The room is not a question and much roomier than GCH. The pool is AWESOME, it does not have a sand bottom like BC, but it is large, has plenty of room, you can rent a cabana, it has slides and Goofy is

Summary Heading: Convenient  location, great staff, nice accommodations
Summary: Family of 5 stayed in one room.  It was roomy with two queen beds and a sleeper couch that was a pull out bed.  I appreciate the fact that the bathroom had a separate toilet room, so that two people could be in the bathroom if necessary.  The room had a small refrigerator and a room safe.  The headboard was a nice night light and when turned on played a short tune.  The beds were very comfortable and had extra pillows with quality bedding. When we called for more towels they were brought up promptly. Staying on the property we had opportunities to see characters without standing in long lines at the park.   The pools were nice as there were pools for smaller toddler and kids that had little slides and less than a foot of water, then two other larger pools for bigger kids and

Summary Heading: It was OK but wasn't Wowed!
Summary: First impressions were great. Drove in and welcomed by the security guy in his hut who gave us a card for our car. Drove up to the Hotel and were greeted by a nice guy who corralled our luggage. The front desk guy was efficient and friendly. Gave us our Disney package and explained the tickets etc. Our room wasn't available as we were early which was fine as we just headed for Disneyland. So excited.  After leaving the park we headed back to the hotel and called for our room number which was now available. Bell services delivered our bags in prompt fashion when called.  The room was OK. Two queen size beds, view out over the pool area. Smallish bathroom area though. Linens and towels etc were good quality.  Room had the usual TV channels, coffee maker etc.  Disappointed the next

My husband and I are on a mission to stay at all three of the Disney resort hotels. We have now stayed at two out of the three. We had an amazing time however there was nothing superb about this room. The room was small however it was a decent size bathroom. It would have been nice to have a king size bed and. It two queens. The light up headboards were cool, however I would recommend wiping them down a little more often..... It was kind of disgusting to look up and see all the handprints and smudges all over the place. Same goes for the Windows. There were handprints and smudges all over the place. I guess I was just expecting a little more from the original resort hotel and especially for the price we paid. We won't be staying at this particular one again.

We stayed club level with a view of the parks.  The check in process was efficient - the front desk called for a concierge representative while we checked in and we were escorted to our room and then to the lounge.  The rep explained all the features in the room and the lounge and made sure we had everything we needed.    The room itself was big enough but not huge.  Kids loved finding the hidden Mickeys and the fireworks headboard.  The view of the fireworks was amazing and they play the soundtrack on Channel 16 on the tv.  The walk to the parks was less then 10 minutes and Downtown Disney was a really pleasant way to walk up.  The pools were nice if a little average.  The first afternoon we had a great time, the next afternoon the pool was overrun with preteen girls due to a

Great place to stay at Disneyland.  It was expensive, but we loved it.  It was luxurious, clean, comfortable, and filled with little details. Felt like home away from home.  Everyone was so helpful and accommodation.    The monorail is not too far (2 minutes or less walk) from the hotel, but we used it twice only.  We walked to Disneyland and California Adventure the rest of the time. It's great walk to pass through Downtown Disney, maybe we crossed it in less than 7-10 minutes.  The only bad side is getting through security.  The line was long at the main entrance at Disney & California Adventure, maybe 10 minutes to get through it.  Once we passed security then it was quick to get in the park.  The line was very short at the monorail.

The hotel was nice, but nothing special. It really has the appearance of a 60's hotel. The grounds were clean and well-kept. The service was great and the room had a mini-fridge that was convenient.   Pros:  - Mini-fridge - Light up display in headboard was great - Clean - Convenient to downtown Disney (but Californian hotel was better)  Cons: - Instead of two types of pillows on bed. All pillows were the same type (and not one I liked). - Could not use the stairs. They are only available for emergency use.  - Long walk to Disney parks.  - Our room in the Adventure tower overlooked the parking lot.

Summary Heading: The best place to stay for the full Disney experience!
Summary: We booked our travel package through CostCo which included 3 night accommodations at the Disneyland Hotel, 3 Day Park Hopper, Extra Magic Morning, and a $50 Disney Gift Card.  We chose the Disneyland Hotel because it was the original hotel when Disneyland was built and wanted the complete Disney experience and it was magical!  The front desk was amazing when we checked in meeting all of our requests and we got a couple of free gifts including "1st Visit" and "Happily Ever After" buttons, and my daughter got an autographed picture of Rapunzel. :)  The rooms were very nice, not necessarily luxurious... but still very nice and clean.   The walk to Downtown Disney is about 10 minutes, another 5 minutes to Disneyland and California Adventure Parks... so very convenient. We loved the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a conference
Summary: The hotel is quite nice, and has the typical Disney feel: safe, clean, friendly. The best part of the hotel has to be its convenient location--right next to Downtown Disney, thus just walking distance from tons of restaurants, shops, and the monorail to the theme parks.

Summary Heading: If you have a conference at the Disneyland Hotel--STAY HERE!
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel while attending a conference held at the Disneyland Hotel.  The hotel itself was great, but my experience at the conference was a million times better than my poor students who stayed off property at a nearby cheaper hotel.  My students got caught in a huge security line each morning as they had to pass through the Disneyland/California Adventure entrance to get to the hotel.  The convenience of being 3 minutes from my room and a 7 minute walk from Disneyland and California Adventure was amazing.  The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the convenience can't be beat.  Oh, and a mere hop skip and a jump from Earl of Sandwich made for many inexpensive and yummy lunches.   Check out the Enchanted Tiki Bar while you're there, the bar tenders

The good: Beds!!! So comfortable! Haven't stayed in a hotel or resort with comfortable beds recently. Didn't went to the pool, but my roommate said it was really good. Also they showed movies outside every night we stayed there, with complementary popcorn!  The bad: Service personnel could do way better. They look at you like crazy half the time, even when you ask for something like, "Could I have an extra coffee?" Miscommunication, stayed for a conference and my roommate had a different checkout than me, they didn't clean my room that day. Complete disappointment on that aspect!  Bonus: Pretty room! Extra magic hour for the parks. Didn't eat there, is a Disney restaurant in CA, is obviously expensive (don't sure why that comes as a surprise for some).

I Choose This hotel Because it is in the Disneyland Paris .İt is very convinient with kids.And beds were good.The room size is good.But rooms Dont have any significant specialities that can Show that you are in Disneyland hotel.But the hotel gives very good enterance time .And free fastpasses. The Area of This hotel is So beautiful. So if you are Gonna stay in Disneyland This is good..

Summary Heading: Expensive But Worth It For A Little Indulgence
Summary: It may be expensive but the Disneyland Hotel is excellent and worth it for a couple days of Disney indulgence and immersion in the Disney experience. The rooms are very good quality, comfortable and feature quality décor and fittings.   There are many subtle Disney or Mickey Mouse flourishes throughout the hotel and around the rooms, such as the Disney mural above the bed or the taps featuring Mickey Mouse’s head profile. However, everything is done with quality and style.  The pools have lifeguards on duty, safety vests are provided for children and pool towels are located near the entrances.  Disney characters stroll around the hotel and interact with guests. I first bumped into Goofy when walking near the pool and then a little later in the hotel reception area.  There is a

This hotel is totally over-rated and overpriced there are many more options in the area with a lower price tag.  Hotel needs updating and there was only two lifts which meant waiting for lifts constantly.  There are some advantages like getting into the park an hour earlier than other visitors not staying at the resort.  We found the staff friendly generally but they could not help out when we missed the easter egg hunt due to jet lag - maybe my expectations were too high but that probably has something to do with how they promote and charge.  It was helpful to be close to the park but there are plenty of car parks and taxi access to drop off to the park providing all the same access.  Room was quiet, beds comfortable and blackout curtains did their job.  We had a great time at

I visited for work recently and per usual the Disney experience is beyond compare! You won't regret the extra cost especially with kids.  From the magical musical headboards to the Mickey accents EVERYWHERE...You will truly be enveloped by the Disney spirit!  The pool is clean and beautiful! The water slide looks fun and the proximity to park activities is great!

When I arrived, I waited for one hour to assign a room to me. I was so tired so I called and asked for my room. They just told me the room number without saying which floor. I tried different floors to find my room. the bathroom sink was smelling bad. Everything is so expensive there.

I enjoyed my stay here very much! Loved the staff, and the room.  The characters from Goofy's Kitchen greeted my girls outside when we checked in, they were so surprised!  Good location to the Monorail, Downtown Disney and the Parks.  Only complaint was that housekeeping didn't come until well after 5pm.

We stayed at Disneyland Hotel with our two teenage kids to be close to the park for our two day stay. The hotel service was good and rooms were reasonable although a little small compared to most other comparable hotels. Although the rooms were apparently recently renovated they were looking a little tired and in need of a makeover, but the Disney theme throughout the furniture and other room fixtures was what we have come to expect at a Disney hotel and didn't disappoint. The family lounge available on one of the floors was handy for breakfast and snacks as well as having a Disney person there to assist with any theme park queries which was very useful. Above all, being able to walk to the theme park next door and return if you had to was just so convenient for us and the main

Summary Heading: Faith, Trust and just little bit of Pixie Dust!
Summary: I really shouldn't get too gushy about Disneyland Resort/Hotel but I decided that if there's someone out there wondering if it's really worth the $ they needed to know...ABSOLUTELY!   Every inch of the 160 acre resort is sprinkled with pixie dust! From hidden mickeys all over the hotels, carpets walls,smells, smiles,service...sorry I'll calm down. After our last trip to the park we've decided to just save all recreational monies and give it to Uncle Walt! It's worth every momentary memory!!  I also appreciated being able to duck back to the hotel (between 2-4) when it gets PRETTY crowded and relax around the pool or go to the the tiki lounge which let you take your drink back to your room, relaxing:-) Then back to the park for dinner, shows and fireworks.....worth every dime. So

Took grandchildren to Disneyland and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel thinking that this would enhance their experience. Unfortunately I was very wrong as the hotel completely lacked the Disney atmosphere I was expecting and it provided very little that could not be obtained by staying at hotels nearby for far less cost. The whole area is tired and in need of a facelift despite us being told it had recently undergone renovations. Even the monorail was out of order. Would definitely not go out of my way to recommend the hotel to anybody. Very disappointing.

Staying here is worth the extra cost as every day you can enter one of the parks earlier than the public. The staff are fantastic and so helpful. When using the magic hour or hours Go for the most popular rides we got around 90/ of the rides in 2 days.  Downtown Disney is fantastic at night with lots of entertainment and places to eat.  I would stay again just for that

Summary Heading: A surprise upgrade of a lifetime
Summary: Our family booked one night at our usual and beloved Disneyland Hotel after a week by the coast. In all honesty, we were all a little reluctant to end our coastal vacation, it had been so wonderful! But hearing the 2 year old granddaughter's excitement as the hotel came into view, made us glad we were there. We use valet parking because I have mobility issues (and after the 1st time using it, hubs didn't have to be coerced), and as we did our clown car routine we noticed there were two hotel employees standing at the curb. I'm not going to lie-my 1st thought was,  "Oh no. They're going to formally evict us for eating too much at the E Ticket lounge!" Instead, they greeted us by our names, and said they were going to escort us to our room and finish the check in there. Now, two

Summary Heading: No kids. still a great hotel
Summary: My wife was there for a conference. we still enjoyed the amenities. the rooms are great, the fitness center worked just fine and food choices are great on site and at the adjacent Disneyland downtown. we had a great time.

Half the time the television in the room had no signal.  You could hear the elevators and water in the pipes all night.  The vending machine took my $2.00 and didn't dispense a Coke.  Staff stated they would sent one up, never did.  You could hear everything outside from the room.  Apparently their was a wrestling match hoping on in the room next to me and above me.  Prices were very high for drinks, food, etc.  Disney world is much, much better.  Go to Disney world instead of Disneyland. If you're not riding in a scooter,  you're in the minority.

As a seasoned Walt Disney World resort guest I had high hopes for the Disneyland hotel and it blew them out of the water. This was a perfectly themed hotel with excellent staff and a beautiful property just steps from Disneyland, DCA and Downtown Disney. We checked in around 7am with fingers crossed in having a room available. We did not luck out (although the cast member searched for about 10 min trying to find something) so we opted to check our bags with the bell staff and hit DCA with the extra magic hours! This alone was worth the hotel stay. We were able to knock out 4 rides in the extra hour.  We received a text that our room was ready about 10:30am but did not arrive back to the hotel until 11pm. We were given a phone number to call once we received the text to find out

Summary Heading: Disneyland is wonderful - there are a few opportunities for easy fixes at the hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Californian a few years ago but decided on the Disneyland Hotel because the pool seemed more fun for the kids.
