And it is, although they will not allow snorkel masks there so don't bring them. The waterslides are cool, although not as big and major as they appear in photos. The pool area is really nice though. Overall, the hotel was nice. We didn't spend much time there and it was clean and quiet and the room was great. The fold out couch was awesome (3 kids so much needed), the floor to ceiling windows allowed a view of the fireworks in the distance (even in a 'standard' room), and the lighted headboard with music was incredibly awesome. The little hidden Mickeys around the room were also fun. Areas for improvement: check-in was long, and we had to wait a

We have family coming from Australia, hoping to let them see and feel the Disney Magic, only to get very disappointed.  The monorail was under repair for the week we were here. The train inside Disneyland park was also under repair. Though Aussies were outdoorsy types, they were really exhausted with the loooong walk back and forth from hotel to park (crossing across Downtown Disney all the time). And there was no Fantasmic which would not be included in this review.  We were at the Adventures tower (one of the three towers of Disneyland hotel. The 1st floor were rooms for meetings, business and HR meetings where we bump to people who were formally dressed while we were on our swim suit attire. Yep, that's where the elevators were, that's why. And one more, lugging our dirty

Summary Heading: Great hotel with service to match
Summary: From the moment that we arrived until we left we had an amazing time!  The customer service at the hotel was exceptional, at check in we were made to feel so welcome. The foyer is great with the TV for the kids to watch whilst you check in and we were lucky enough to have Goofy join us.  Our room was a premium view room in the fantasy tower and we looked over the pool on the 8th floor.  I was a little confused as when I booked the hotel I could see that there was a standard view, pool view and premium view.  I assumed from what I read is that we would have a view of the park/downtown Disney but we were told on questioning it that no rooms can see the park and premium just means that you are higher up the tower.  I think this could be made more clear on the website.  We ate at

We took our daughter in law and two of our grandchildren on this trip. Our room was large and we fit very comfortable.  The girls loved the headboard which lit up and played music. We love the Disneland hotel, always very clean and the staff are amazing. Every time we come to Disneyland which we come a lot we always stay on property.

Summary Heading: Definitely not worth it for Club / Concierge Level Upgrade at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: It has always been a dream of mine since little to go to the Disneyland hotel. However. I was incredibly disappointed by our recent trip. I thought I would focus on all the reasons I do not think that club level or concierge level is worth it.  I would have had a far happier stay if we had not paid for the upgrade. I should put this in the context of having stayed at (and loved) the concierge upgrade at the Wilderness Lodge, Contemporary, Grand Floridian  and Yacht Club at WDW.   - The check-in procedure was a disaster. At WDW you are taken quickly away to the concierge level to complete checkin. At the Disneyland hotel you first have to checkin (and line up at) at the regular checkin desk and give your credit card and phone  number etc.  Then you have to wait for them to page

Our First visit to Disneyland as family of five from Australia was a very happy one. The hotel was clean and modern with lots of special Disney touches. We visited the other Disney hotels but we felt we had chosen the right one for us  . We had a pool view premium room on the 7th floor . We all loved the musical headboard - it was a very special touch. Our daughters had lots of fun in the pool and on the waterslides It was a great way to have some down time from Disneyland .

Summary Heading: Wish we booked an extra day !
Summary: Just returned from a weekend at Disneyland with my boyfriend, niece and his Grandson. It was my first time staying at a Disney property and my boyfriend had not visited since the 90's ! We had such an amazing stay, the staff at the Hotel were incredible, they allowed us "nap time" late check out too ! We were very impressed with the quality of the food and surprised at how many affordable healthy options we had to choose from. We now wish we had booked an additional day, to relax by the pool, hang out at Trader Sam's and just enjoy being away ! I just finished booking our return trip !! I highly recommend the Character Breakfast at the Paradise Pier Hotel too 👍🏼

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel to attend a conference taking place at the convention center on the grounds and I have to say that the staff appear to really enjoy their work.  From check-in to gift shops, and restaurants, floor greeters, to check-out, everyone made me feel that they genuinely were happy that I was there with them.  The rooms are pretty nice with rich woods and nice Disney touches all round but not at all gaudy.  My favorite is the headboard that lights up  (see the pic) while a lullaby plays when a not-so obvious button on the nightstand lamp is activated.  And, of course, since it's at Disneyland and Disneyland is the happiest place on earth, all of the guests are happy too.  I'd like to go back to stay when I'm not on business.

We checked into the Disneyland Hotel for Mother's Day weekend and the big Tinkerbell half-marathon. Our room was ready, and the view was absolutely spectacular! We were so impressed by all the darling details in our spacious room. I've stayed at the hotel before many years ago, and had a view of the parking lot.  I fully expected another one, which was fine with us.  We just love the hotel.  So needless to say, our room was a magnificent surprise! The staff there was so incredibly friendly and so accommodating. Our room would be made up as soon as we'd leave. I've stayed at a lot of nice hotels, and come back at 4 in the afternoon, and the beds haven't even been made yet.  Our room was sparkling!  The maids there are awesome!  Loved Trader Sam's bar and the whole tiki polynesian

For our very first trip to anything Disney we chose to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and I'm so glad we did. We were traveling with a 1 year old and a 5 year old. The hotel was so beautiful and spotless. All staff were amazingly welcoming and always helpful. Our room was huge and had a wonderful view of the pools.the rooms are decorated in a lovely classy disney theme. Everything is beautiful and the musical lighted headboards were a great treat.  And our room was wonderfully quiet, we couldn't hear any noise from the hall or other rooms at all, which was great with small ones napping. Iwas concerned about cleanliness having a baby crawling around and possibly putting stuff in his mouth but our room was spotless, there wasn't a speck anywhere. He could crawl anywhere he wanted,

Summary Heading: Under staffed sets tone for poor service...
Summary: We travel a ton both domestically and abroad. I know good/great/average service. Here is very poor.  This hotel which costs a lot is under staffed and also overrated. I feel bad even the employees told me this as I commented to them. The staff tries to make it right, they really do and that is why I said poor.   All the money this hotel corporation receives from duped Disney patriots and they can't do more for the staff and service in order to make our hotel stay a true Disney memory?   We are leaving this hotel a day early. Better to be home than at the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: What can you say. It's Disney
Summary: Disney has it all the way. I loved this hotel. Everywhere you go it is Disney. I saw goofy six times the same day. Just wandering around giving high five and taking photos. Lots of families and Micky galore. Food is good. Little expensive but it is Disney. $3 for a 20oz coke. But she did give me a free cup of ice.

Summary Heading: Tips on this First Class Hotel
Summary: Staying with a family of five in two adjoining rooms offered an opportunity to review this hotel with some tips that were not fully addressed in some of the prior reviews.  1.  WestJet offered the Karmel Shuttle option on booking. They were on time at the LAX airport and subsequent pickup at the Disneyland Hotel (DLH) when we left. The ride was 30 minutes on a semi-private small bus...an effortless start and finish to a great trip.  2.  The free Wi-Fi was previously described as slow in the room...it was not...fast downloads were the norm. The pool had slower streaming, however.  3.  All the three pools were heated and the two hot tubs were hot, hot, hot. The lifeguards  (five by the lower two pools and three by the kiddies and one by each waterslide) were oversold. I thought,

Despite multiple trips to Disneyland over the years, we had never stayed at one of the Disney properties, but decided to do so this time.  So glad we did.  Starting with arrival, when the bell staff unloaded the car and gave us directions to have the luggage delivered directly to the room--this was great since my stuff was awfully heavy!  Check in was easy; we were in the Frontier Tower, which was fine for us, with a room overlooking a huge (staff, I presume) parking lot, but who cares, we were there for FUN at the parks, not looking out the hotel window!  The room was clean, well appointed, and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Love it, almost all of it.
Summary: This hotel had three different hotels on the property which all faced the pool area. I believe they were named Fantasyland, Adventure Land, and Frontier Land or something similar to that.  Fantasyland was the main hotel that you checked into upon arrival.  This hotel is where the main lobby is and has the gift shops, front desk, and conference rooms (there may be more conference rooms in the other hotels, but not stores).  The front desk person was absolutely in keeping with the expected Disney courtesy.  I was treated well, was let in early, was set up in the tower I chose, and was given a free upgrade.  Right off the bat, I felt instantly better from the horrible air and shuttle commute I had getting here. The staff was so friendly and inviting.  One of the nights, my Son took

I had been wanting to stay here for years.  I finally recently had the opportunity to stay here for a business trip.  It did not disappoint.  The room was well appointed.  It was nice to have the vanity separate for the shower / toilet.    The headboard of the bed was so beautiful with the song and "fireworks".  I really loved the decorative pillows on the bed.  Very nice touch.  I wished that the slides to the pools didn't close so early.  And only one of the pools seemed to be heated which was really odd.  Overall, it was a great stay and I look forward to the change to stay there again.

Summary Heading: We will never stay at another hotel at the park!
Summary: As you can imagine, this hotel is all Disney! Perfect in every way! A 10 minute walk to the park and 2 minute walk to Downtown Disney!  The grounds are amazing with pools, lawn and stores to spend time in while not at the parks. Characters popped up every couple hours which had our 4 year old in awe. The rooms are spacious and clean... and i recommend the pool view if they can accommodate, looks awesome at night. The coffee shop was perfect for before Disneyland opened and Traders Sam's was a must for afternoon drinks or an evening night cap...  We are already planning our next visit and will definetly stay at the Disneyland Hotel!

Summary Heading: It can't get any better than this
Summary: For my first time in Disneyland, staying at this beautiful hotel was icing on the cake. From the impeccable service, the immaculate rooms, the cleanliness of the entire place and the easy access to Downtown Disney and the two parks. We were lucky enough to stay in a large suite as we were a group of 7 and I must say that the accommodations were on point. 4 large beds and a pullout sofa bed that was extremely comfortable. The pools and spas were clean and easy to access. Lots of things to do if you have children.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay and play
Summary: We loved our stay. Everyone was amazing during our stay from valet to our room attendant. The location can't be beat. Can't wait to come back. The room we had was very large two queen beds and a daybed. The bathroom had the all inpmporant private toilet.

This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel after staying several times at the Grand Californian across the street. Since the recent refurb, we would actually recommend this over the Grand. The rooms are more comfortable and steeped in Disney lore, with the headboards being a highlight. The pools are also more engaging for kids. Highly recommended.

We never stay in fancy hotels, so this was a major treat for us!! Disneyland Hotel is incredible - spotlessly clean everywhere, beautiful rooms, awesome outdoor pool area, restaurants, location, staff...all perfect!!

Visited from the UK, there is a real magical feel here, something about it being the original Disneyland Hotel. Refurbished rooms are perfect, we were overlooking downtown Disney in the Jungle Tower, plenty of hidden magic in the rooms and Steakhouse 55 is a hidden gem!

Really great! Unfortunately, the monorail is down for refitting this time of the year so you have a bit of a walk to the front gates.....it's not bad unless you are walking with a 2 year old....the restaurants are quite expensive, especially the steakhouse which is way overpriced.....but the food quality is top notch. The characters do visit your table at Goofy's kitchen on a regular basis, so you tend to get your money's worth, even if you don't eat plentifully. The hotel itself is very clean, and not too overbooked this time of year......the staff are as happy to serve you as the staff(cast) in the park itself.

Summary Heading: Would stay again but hopefully at another tower
Summary: This is our third stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is composed of three different towers. Fantasy Tower being the main tower. It includes the main entrance, check-in desk, bellhop services convenience, store gift shop and   it is the closest to Goofy's Kitchen, Steakhouse 55 and the swimming pool. We ended up this time in Frontier Tower, the tower farthest away from everything, but not far enough to really be a big deal. In our  opinion it needs to be freshened up. The lobby was absolutely tired-looking, very blah and barly reflected the frontier theme. As far as access to the park by the time we made our way from the tower to the entrance of Downtown Disney and from then to the front Gates of the parks it was a bit of a walk but very manageable but perhaps commensurate with

Summary Heading: First time back since hotel refurb
Summary: Disney did a great job with the refurb here, but more on that later.  We arrived a couple of hours early from San Diego so were hoping they would have a room available for us to throw our bags into before hitting the park.  We were not disappointed and was given a pool facing room in the frontier tower.  The room was excellent in terms of comfort, was super-clean and had lots of lovely disney touches throughout - our favourites being the musical headboard than spanned both beds and lit up with hundreds of tiny stars at night, and the Mickey theme in the bathroom.  Really made it special for our kids 14, 11 and 6.  Maids and housekeeping staff were always friendly and we never had any problems with noise from other rooms.  The pool area has changed a lot and the kids enjoyed the

This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel and it was magical.  It is well worth the extra money to stay onsite.  We arrived at 2p.  Our room was not ready, but it was nice to walk around the resort and they did hold our luggage.  Goofy was at the entrance when we arrived which was a nice surprise.  We stayed four nights in a deluxe view.  Our view was not great, I even called and asked if it was a deluxe view room as it overlooked the roof to the Tiki Bar, but I guess it was better than the parking lot.  Maid service was always early and spot on.  It was fun to receive a wake up call from Mickey every morning.  The room isn't huge, but has enough room for two.  There was a fridge with a coffee maker.  The bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom was split, shower & toilet

This hotel is connected to the convention center on one side and Downtown Disney on the other.  Because of this, it is very busy.  Lots of people everywhere and quite bustling.  The staff appears used to this though and certainly knows how to hustle, even better is that they hustle with a smile on their face.  They do not lose site of the fact that this is the "Happiest Place on Earth".  They were a little late getting the room to us but we checked in on a Sunday and that is a tough day for most hotels.  We went to Disneyland that day anyway so it was no biggie.  They held our bags and got the bags promptly to our rooms once requested.  The rooms are a little tight and there are no plugs near the beds which drives me crazy, but it's an old (but updated) hotel.  People didn't

Summary Heading: Wish we could have stayed longer!
Summary: We checked in at 3 pm and there were teacup seats in the lobby, the cast member at the front desk gave my 6 year old a signed Minnie Mouse picture, which was great. Then we were told it would be another 15 minutes before our room was ready and they would send a text, so we walked around, but half an hour later, no text. The website says rooms are ready at 3. We called the front desk and they said yes, it finally is ready (no call or text sent though). We quickly changed and went to the pool for a bit. Our room was great. We got a wake up call from Mickey, and checkout was easy. We stored our bags the last day with the Bell Hop while we spent the day in the parks.   Aside from a hard time getting notified our room was ready late, it was a great experience. My son loved it!

Summary Heading: Always a magical stay at the original Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: There are so many wonderful write-ups on TripAdvisor, so I'll just list some tips.  - Use the Bellhop. Why carry all of your junk when the fantastic bellhop can do it for you. You're on holiday, relax and tip well! - Not enough towels in your room? Go to the pool, there's plenty of towels. - Clean up after yourself in the hotel gym. Wipe down the equipment...your elf slave is at Hogwarts, plus it's just gross. - Avoid rooms next to an elevator in the Magic Tower! They charge you for the cost of a standard room, but these rooms are like shoeboxes. A standard room has two queen beds and a sofa bed. The rooms next to the elevator ONLY have two queen beds and a chair. You cannot fit a rollaway either--we tried and even the hotel cast member couldn't figure out how to fit it. No

Summary Heading: Fantastic for work and family pleasure
Summary: The feel of the original. The magic swept the family away when we arrived. The kids could not stop looking up Mickey's cap on the way to the Magical Kingdom. When taking a break from the parks the pool area did not disappoint! Depending on where you are and what tower will change your experience, We were fortunate to have a park facing view on the 10th floor and the view of the fireworks show was just fantastic. The conference rooms and food provided was great and the Cast was more than welcoming! Out of the three hotels at DLR this tends to be in the middle, it really depends on the experience you'd like for the kids!

Summary Heading: Elevators and Dirty Diapers Don't make for a Magical experience
Summary: We are huge Disney fans, usually in Florida. A Family reunion of sorts brought us to Disneyland for a dream trip for the kids.  All the Disney travel tools were helpful for our reservations at dinning and hotel, once we arrived however, the magic was less than apparent.  Nothing on the service at check in, or first greetings were out of ordinary.  We tried to upgrade one of our party into a club level room, so the kids could enjoy the extra goodies there, but we could not be accommodated.  OK we thought.  Assigned to 3 rooms on same floor of the Adventureland tower, we were not impressed with the lobby area, the elevators only running on partial service and the general cleanliness.  The Rooms themselves are nicely appointed and generally clean, bathrooms are also above average.

This was my first time staying at Disneyland Hotel.  We chose it because we thought it would be easy to come and go to the parks.  First we checked in but since it was early morning we left our luggage with the Bell desk.  We went to Disneyland and then got a text message of our room number.  We came back, picked up our luggage, went to the room and found someone else's luggage there.  Called the front desk and they checked with their manager and decide we should be the ones to move.  For an expensive hotel,  I expected better service.  I was tired from walking back from the park and just wanted to lie on the bed and not have to move room.  We had to walk because the monorail wasn't working for renovation in Tomorrow Land.  That was one of the disappointments of staying on

We stayed at Disneyland Hotel from April 16 to April 20 (at the Fantasy Tower), this was our 3rd stay in this hotel in the past 4 years and was by far the worst. The hotel has clear signs of deferred maintenance and as a guest you left to desl with issues that you don't expect to deal with when you pay nearly $500 per night. In our room, the telephone did not work,  the TV food not work and needed to be repaired, and the shower head was dirty and leaking, splashing water all over the floor. On the 2nd day we ordered room service, however, it took 1 hour and 20 minutes for the food to arrive. The iver-priced food was cold and of poor quality. At Goofy's kitchen restaurant (at Disneyland Hotel), we were seated at a table that had 3 burnt lights above it, which resulted in us

Our experience at the Disneyland Hotel was amazing. The front desk staff were polite, friendly, and extremely helpful. They got us a great room in Fantasy Tower (as we requested) and were quick to provide information and answer our questions as first time visitors.   Our room was beautiful and we even had a view of the Matterhorn out the window! We loved the convenience of the hotel location in relation to the parks - it took us about 10-15 minutes to walk there each day. This hotel is NOT the closest to the parks, but the distance is so close that we didn't mind taking the short walk through Downtown Disney each day.   The hotel is in excellent condition with beautiful decor and a classic Disney feel. We loved how much the history of the resort was represented in the decor and

We are annual passholders and we make it point to stay at the Disneyland Hotel twice a year.   There is so much activities to do at the hotel that you really don't even have to go into the park.   We usually reserve a cabana in front of the monorail pool and relax all day and then head into the park in the evening.  Their raspberry pina coladas are the best.    You can also find characters roaming around the hotel.   If you do stay make it point to reserve a day just to relax at the resort.

Summary Heading: So much fun to be able to stay in the Park
Summary: This is a lovely hotel within walking distance to both of the Disney Parks.  Hotel was clean and very comfortable.  The staff wax very helpful!!!  The grounds are lovely - Clean and lovely flowers just like Disney!! I would recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: You only stay here for the one hour early access to Disneyland
Summary: The reason I labelled this average is because it is super expensive for what it is. It is a very, very basic hotel with the Disney name thrown at it to give it some glamour.  The pool is definitely the highlight, and my 8 year old twins loved it. Rooms are basic, but some cute Disney features such as Mickey style lamp shade hands, and a cute musical light to go to sleep at night with at least make you feel like you are in Disneyland. It is walking distance from the theme parks, which is great and has a monorail to take you there which was not working when we stayed.  There are a few options for breakfast - Goofy's breakfast is VERY expensive, and the food is appalling if you are healthy conscious - chocolate ice cream, waffles, pancakes, biscuits and sugar abound. But hanging

Surely... It is because it is the closest that it is the more expensive one...the hotel and the service are not at the level of the price! The swimming pool was pretty cold but the jacuzzi was find. Good to be by foot to the park but bad if you like fancy and nice room...

Friendly people and great family trip!   I would definitely take my family there again and stay at this hotel.  Great location and convenient for my family.  It was expensive, but well worth the money so that we could enjoy the whole experience.

Summary Heading: Once in a Lifetime Family Vacation
Summary: Amazing trip. Staff was so friendly. We had a party of 5, 1 senior, 2 adults, 2 children (ages 6 & 11) in one room. Perfect for saving money and didn't seem too crowded. Beds were very comfortable, and the room was quiet.   We would go EARLY to Disneyland or California Adventure, and it was so easy to come right back to the hotel in the afternoon (when the crowds were the worst)  to swim/lounge/relax (Beautiful pool plus 2 great waterslides with tons of lifeguards made adults and the children happy)   Booking the e-ticket club level was SO worth the extra money. (Book the Adventureland Tower for easy access) Most of what we ate/drank was from the club, saving so much TIME (waiting at restaurants) AND money, so we highly recommend this great feature. Breakfast had bagels,

Spring for concierge level... in 2014 did a  suite BUT one has to check in at regular front desk and service was a NIGHTMARE all around- all week-  Decided to give one more try so , the next  year, 2015, did a SMALL room on concierge level instead ... they escort you up to check you in, you only deal with that staff ALL week- and great food and views- What a HUGE difference staff and service makes! I would NEVER deal with normal front desk again- NIGHTMARE... if they did not have the concierge service, I would go to a diff hotel

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: A few years ago we decided to "splurge" and stay here on our annual Disneyland trip. Now we can't stay anywhere else. There's something about the friendly staff, musical headboard, proximity to the parks and extra magic hours that just can't be beat. We feel this resort has more of the Disney magic than Paradise Pier and is more age appropriate to our kids (ages 2-8) than the Grand Californian.   We prefer to arrive at the hotel in the afternoon for some swimming in the great pools and then enjoy dinner at Goofy's Kitchen before starting at the parks the next day. It's the perfect kick-off to our Disneyland adventure.   If you are a Costco member, check out their vacation packages. Their Disneyland Hotel package often includes extra like a free character meal for everyone in

We took our two children (6 and 4) and stayed here. We had previously stayed at the Grand Californian, and we found the Disneyland Hotel to be superior in nearly every way. The hotel staff was excellent and friendly. Our standard room was at least as spacious as the Grand Californian, and better set up thanks to the recent renovation. We found the pool area to be much better, especially for little kids. The foo options at Tangeroa Terrace and Goofy's Kitchen were big hits with our kids. We did have to walk farther to get to the parks, especially since the monorail to Tommorrowland was closed while we were there. This really didn't impact us much, however. Also, the entrance to California Adventure park from the Grand Californian hotel was so packed in the morning it was actually

Summary Heading: Lovely end to a trip of a lifetime
Summary: We stayed here as a splurge at the end of a trip of a lifetime to Disneyland with two grand-children. The price tag is definitely hefty and there are many good off-park properties at less than 1/2 the price. But this was something special and worth it. This is a wonderful hotel with amazing facilities in a prime location. The kids loved it. We spent the morning in the Parks and the afternoon at the pools. We had a spacious room in Adventure Tower with a great view of the fireworks and of Downtown Disney. There were 2 Queens and a day bed. As one would expect at this level, service was great, facilities and rooms were spotless. I hope to return one day.

I stayed here for 3 days and the rooms where so beautiful, we had an amazing pool view room and the bed heads were so cute. After spending all day at Disneyland it was great knowing we can catch the monorail or easily walk back to the hotel in 10 minutes, would stay here again

Hotel is right on the park.  Room was very clean, modern and from the hotel room,  we could see the fireworks every night.   Check in was smooth,  staff were very courteous and professional.   Lots to do,  shopping, restaurants and terrific pool as well as hot tub.

It was my three year old son's first visit. We absolutely loved it. The employees were great and very attentive. The room was clean and the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable I almost wanted to just spend the day in bed. I have no complaints. I would definitely come back and stay here.

Summary Heading: Great customer service, Safety for the Kids and Lots of Fun. A parents dream!
Summary: Hi  We live locally and stayed for a new experience for my toddler. Best thing ever! Main point, Great customer service... and safety. This is the best of the 3 hotels if your kids loves the water slides. There are so many life guards there that you will be amazed. That was my selling point despite my daughter was too little to swim unattended. I saw  at least 6+ of them around the pool area and slides. Awesome! The rest is the wonder of Disney and you will be more than  satisfied.. We went to Goofy's Kitchen for Breakfast and she had more one on one than at the Breakfast at  Chef Mickey's. Dinner we went to Steakhouse 55 and had great food and a wonderful plating for the toddler too. Great trip will go again ...

My daughter and her two daughters and I had a lovely time! The only problem we had with our room was that the carpet was sticky in spots. We reported this twice bur it never was really cleaned. We thank you for a fine visit to my granddaughters favortie place.

Summary Heading: You Should Try and Stay Here At Least Once!
Summary: You can't beat the original! We checked in at about 4:00PM during Spring Break with no wait at the front desk. All the cast members we encountered were great! Our room, the hallway to our room, the lobby, the pool and the quick service restaurant we ate at were all clean. We loved the short walk to parks. We stayed in the main tower on the third floor. We never waited for an elevator. I was looking forward to seeing characters in our lobby and we were losing hope that we would catch them until our last day, we were passing through the lobby to get our car and there they were! No wait to see them and lots of interaction. We would love to stay here again! The light up music playing head  board is an awesome touch!

We secured a three-bedroom suite for four adults and two children.  We were greeted by a clean and well-appointed room that had an excellent layout.  Grandma and grandpa got the king-size bedroom off the sitting area.  Mom and dad also got a king-size bed and their room was adjoined by a room with two queen beds for the kids - perfect.  The sitting room came with a fridge, but no microwave.  Lots of counter space that could have easily included a microwave. Like other hotels in California (and elsewhere), Disney has a printed plea to use water wisely.  Unfortunately, the water dripped endlessly from the bathtub and was not fixed until day four.  Also, the air conditioning in one of the bedrooms did not work (85+ degrees outside) and we were promised it would be fixed on day

Returning to Disneyland after many years was a treat at the Disneyland Hotel. The rooms are much nicer than they were in the earlier version but the Park proximity is still just a modest walk. The surrounding retail/restaurants are very nice and the hotel pools and slides offer a variety of options for kids of all ages. A stay at Disneyland is not cheap after all costs but it still is a very special time.

My husband and I have recently returned from our adults-only honeymoon trip to Disneyland. And let me tell you.. it was certainly magical! We’d never stayed on property at any of the Disney resorts and decided to splurge on this trip. As such, we booked (through Costco travel) a premium view at the concierge level. A couple of weeks before our trip, I called to request a king bed.  Upon our arrival, check in was very quick and efficient. They are supposed to have a designated concierge check-in, however, that person was busy at the time of our arrival. No issues whatsoever. They also gave us a couple of “Happily Ever After” buttons when we told them we were there for our anniversary. That was a nice touch!  Our room (2676) was on the 9th floor and was a corner room. We were

I recently spent two nights at the Disnelyand Hotel. It was great. The location was convenient to the park and allowed us to come and go throughout the day without the need of a shuttle bus. The pool was fun for the kids with two waterslides and we bumped into a few characters while on site.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a Disneyland Vacation.

This hotel is on the expensive side, but it is absolutely amazing. It encompasses all that disney has to offer. The whole time service was great and the rooms were unbelievably clean. We had a balcony with our room and the view was unbelievable. The great part about this hotel is the location. No need to park in the morning and take the tram into the park. Just a nice walk through downtown disney and you're there. Another plus is the magic hours which allows you to get into one of the parks an hour early. You definitely have to take advantage of that!

Great location,really pleasant and clean rooms.The food was all very nice..but the thing that makes this such a good place to stay are the staff.....We so enjoyed our stay there and i hope to return...

Nothing like staying in a Disney hotel while at Disney....and upgrading to concierge. A heavenly Haven to come back and recharge and take in history while at it.  All the small touches makes big difference. Even with 5 of us we were comfortable.

For what you pay, i feel like there shouldn't be issues with your room. 3 stars is solely for the fact that you get into the park an hour early when you stay here, which is totally worth it. The walk isn't far, but after a long day at Disneyland its not the best either. The Monorail typically had a long wait, so it didn't seem worth waiting. Our room was a standard room. Upon arrival, i notice empty food wrappers on the floor from the previous guest. We also went to use the extra blanket in the closet to find a big sticky stain. The next day we came back to our room from the parks to use the pool. My son happened to try to open the door, when he did, it opened up without the room key. We closed the door and opened several times and the door did open without a room key. We called

This last family vacation to Disneyland we decided to take advantage of the AP discounted rate at the Disneyland hotel for  3 nights and once again this hotel is does not disappoint. Arrived early on a weekday morning and was able to check in with no trouble. Our room wouldn't be ready until the afternoon which was fine since we planned to hit up the parks and would be texted once our room was ready. We were accommodated on the 3rd floor of the adventure tower facing downtown disney with a view of the  tree line, which was expected as I asked for a standard room. This room location ended up to be perfect especially since we were located close to the stairs for quick access out of the tower. The elevator wait in that tower was super slow. Access from room to Disneyland took

We last stayed at this Hotel around 20 years ago.  It is very much they way that we remembered it but even nicer.  We were with our daughter and grandson and had a two bedroom suite which could have accommodated four more people for a total of eight people.  In addition to the two bedroom suite with each one including a shower/bath tub and sink and toilet the suite also included a very large living area including pullout sofa and murphy bed, television and dining area along with desk and refrigerator.  The staff was very accommodating and we also enjoyed nice views from our window where one could watch the nightly fireworks.    We did upgrade and selected the concierge club room.  We thought it was fairly pricey for the quantity and quality of food served.  We though that

Summary Heading: Had a great time, great service
Summary: We had a great time at this beautiful hotel.  It's old, but has been renovated.  I like the style and the amazing landscaping.  The water slides were awesome, the pools were warm which was great since it was a little cold outside.  When the monorail is running, it's a great perk to be able to avoid the metal detectors and the long lines.  It was closed on the last day of our trip.  We booked through a big travel site with a discount code and it saved us about $80 a night.

The location can't be beat.... well, maybe the Grande California, but this really is a good spot a in a lot quieter location than the traffic around Downtown Disney and the Grande California.  We had a room in the Frontier tower which was great.  Away from the main lobby, and easy 2 min stroll to the start of Downtown Disney and 5 mins to the Monorail.  A great location to base yourself of good Disney fun.  The restaurants were disappointing.  The Tiki for breakfast is a no go zone.  Horrible. However, Goofy's Kitchen was ok for breakfast buffet.  Didn't have dinner on the Hotel grounds as the Stokehouse was quite expensive.  Heaps of other great places to eat though out on Downtown Disney strip

The Disneyland Hotel is amazing. Great service, great location and great rooms. Is it expensive? In my mind, yes, but there are ways to mitigate that and make it manageable. My only minor issue is with parking, but I understand everything is "monetized" once you get to the Disney properties and parks.  The hotel main restaurant was very nice and the service was very good. With six adults and four small kids, the waiter was very patient and service-oriented, even allowing two of the kids to eat "free" off the buffet with one paying adult. And one of us even did the dessert buffet and shared...he was cool with that.  The rooms are very nice and we loved the bunk beds for our grandkids! They loved them and fought over the top bunk.  Didn't get to the pool as the weather was cool,

Summary Heading: Standard hotel with a great pool
Summary: For the price the rooms were very small. But overall nice and clean and the headboard was a big win for the kiddo. The pool was the best part of the trip. My son could've done the water slides all day. The location was excellent. We liked being close to the monorail. Also walking through downtown Disney gave you a lot of food options that are cheaper and tastier then in the park. If I feel like a splurge again I would stay for the convince and the pool.

don't get me wrong it's a nice hotel, However I felt it was over priced for what we got.  It felt like any other hotel.  The beds where average for comfort,the bathroom could have used a good scrub hair on the floor and what looked like dirt along the edge of the tub and wall. The thermostat didn't work in one of our rooms, the couch in the adjoined rooms was ratty and dirty looking.   The little touches like the tea cup shaped chairs in the lobby and, the Mickey and Minnie shaped bushes in the court yard was a nice added touch.  I get that you are paying for the Disney Brand when booking there, how ever I found that we can stay at an other hotel that's the same walking distance to the main gate for half of what we paid and got bigger rooms that had been better kept.

Our family recently visited the Disneyland resort over spring break.  Although my wife and i both have extensive individual disney memories, our 13 year old son has never been. My wife went every summer when she was a kid, and i lived in southern cal for my early 20s and had a passport to the parks. neither of us had stayed on property before, so we decided to do it for our son's first trip.  When researching the three hotels, we got the general message that Disneyland hotel was best for keeping the family "in the magic," and it did not disappoint.  We went during spring break but got very lucky as the hotel was hosting a convention, so most of the hotel guests were in the convention center all day.  it was an absolutely peaceful treat when the heat and spring break crowds in

Back in the day this was the place. It's been renovated and my standard room on 2nd floor Adventure Tower was clean and acceptable. It was a bonus to have connecting family units. Disneyland characters that appeared at check-in was a thrill for the kids.   Regretfully, I witnessed 2 incidents of general rudeness by staff to guests. One staff member was in such a hurry close down umbrellas at the pool she literally shut the umbrella on my grown son's head. She did the same with another without so much as an excuse me. Most extraordinary.   One elevator was out of commission in our tower which meant long waits or a trek down a long hall to get to our rooms. That's not what you need after 10 hours of park walking with the Monorail AND the train out of commission too.   It was an OK

3500.00 for standard, small and disappointing rooms.  Monorail down for the entire stay. Just s disappointment from beginning to end. Stay somewhere else!   Room small, overlooking parking lot. Rooms not what I booked and staff unable, unwilling to assist.

Summary Heading: Some good. Some not so good
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights. I'm used to going to DisneyWorld and staying on site there so that is what I am comparing to. We stayed concierge level but don't waste the money. The concierge rooms are in the Adventure tower on the 9, 10 and 11 floors. The lounge is on the 11th floor. We were on the 9th floor. The floors aren't secured or any different. The breakfast offerings are like a regular hotel with instant oatmeal, fruit, bagels, there are some thin ham slices. The evening deserts are nothing special either so I would skip it for 200$ plus per day up charge. We moved to a regular room after the first day. There are three buildings. The quick service restaurant is really not quick service. You order and then wait for your food. There is a lot of walking. It's right next to

A truly remarkable hotel. I love being near the center of everything. The resort permits you to enter the parks 1 hour early by showing your room key. Having an hour head start on the masses was great. The hotel itself is fancy, magical and breath-taking. A one of a kind experience.

We spent two nights at the Disney resort and stayed in a King bed room in the Adventure tower. The staff takes the time to treat everyone like a king, Queen, Prince and Princess! Clean, well appointed and laid out the way a hotel should be.  The staff answered every question we had, and knew the best route for every situation!

The Disneyland hotel was perfect.  The room we stayed in was immaculate. The staff was amazing.  The bed was comfortable.  We will be back for sure.  The only complaint is some of the elevators weren't working.

Wish I could stay here year round and visit the parks everyday!  I'd even settle for a one week stay!  We arrived early hours before check in and I wanted to pre-register and our room was ready!  Our room was in the Frontier tower. It's the south tower. It's a good walk from self or valet parking which is below north tower. There is a small limited self parking lot right below the Frontier tower. You have to enter through Paradise Pier and drive past the security booth. I chose valet instead for the safety of vehicle and the valet parking lot is right in front of valet staff and lobby. The hotel lobby and grounds are very clean. Rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable. All the staff are polite and courteous. I can't wait for the next magical stay!

Summary Heading: Not as special as it used to be.
Summary: My family loves all things Disney.  We used to look forward to staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  This last time, we were all disappointed and unanimously decided that it would probably be our last trip to the hotel.  The check in was okay, nothing special.  We were given our keys (5 for 4 guests, the cast member couldn't get the names straight even though they were on the reservation) and went straight to our room which overlooked the pool.  The room was clean but the lower parts of the dresser were dusty and the top of the dresser had been wiped but not cleaned because it had dried soda rings on it.  The beds were hard and not "soft as a cloud" like they used to be.  I woke up with a back ache.  Overall the stay was alright, but not anything over and above what we would get at

I'm a DVC member that tried a themed hotel for the first time and there are lots of things I miss about being "Welcomed Home" like being welcomed home. We reserved a premium view hoping to see fireworks but we received a pool view. Because our kids were so excited about the pool we did not complain. And because of the weather there weren't any fireworks most nights so it worked out.  The best part was having Goofy greet us a check-in. And of course the distance to Downtown Disney and the parks is a plus!  The worst part was the pools itself due to the amount of chlorine that is needed as we did see the staff scooping something foreign from the bigger pool. Poolside service is hit or miss too.  Overall we enjoyed our stay and the kids had lots of fun.

I have stayed here previously and will continue to stay here each time I go to Disneyland.  The rooms are beautifully appointed, the staff is amazingly friendly and helpful and the best part - within walking distance of Disneyland and California Adventure. Definitely worth the money!!

We never thought it would make such a big difference to stay onsite, but it does and is worth the extra spend on hotel. Of all the Disney hotels you can choose this one is your 'cheapest' but with all the benefits including: access to California Park via the Grand California hotel entrance - amazing for early access (get in line 20 mins early), and unbeatable for guaranteed ride on Cars without having to run for it. Easy drop backs during day to relax at pool, and then go back into parks. Easy parking, comfy rooms, ability to have anything you buy in Park sent to your hotel. AND the only Disney hotel to not have park or down town noise 🌟

The room itself was very clean and well maintained. The halls and buildings outside showed some wear but that expected with the large crowds that come thru each year. Overall the entire property was very clean. The headboards light up in the standard rooms and the table lamp plays a song while the lights flicker. That was our favorite part of the room.

The most fantastic Vacation ever! Disney Hotel is awesome, great view, personal attention, and nice rooms!  Pools are great, great restaurants, downtown disney, around the corner, great merchandise, and fantastic team parks.

I thing everyone should stay here with their kids at least once to get the true Disneyland experience! A little pricey, but worth it! Pool is great and restaurants and entertainment are great as well! Rooms were very roomy and comfy! Had a wonderful experience not to mention its within a few feet of Downtown Disney!

We stayed on March 17, 2016 in the Adventureland Tower, Room 2598. The hotel has three themed powers, Adventureland, Fantasyland, and Frontierland, as well as convention places. Each tower had distinctive lobby features.The thing that we liked the most was the fact that there was nostalgia yet everything was up-to-date. We also enjoyed the attention to detail and the fantastic soaps and shampoos. Our tower is towards the back so we had a fantastic view of the restaurants and pools, yet we were still close enough to all the action but not to close. We were treated very well by most of the staff, and actually enjoyed the hotels amenities so much that we spent the better part of the day just at the hotel. There was even a hotel tour, were which we unfortunately missed, to show

Summary Heading: Still a good option but showing its age
Summary: My previous review still applies, for the most part.  I still think Disneyland Hotel has the nicest (and largest) rooms and pools among the on-property hotels. However, Disneyland Hotel is starting to show its age since its last major remodel, which makes it a slightly worse value overall. I'd still give it 4 stars overall for its awesome pools, theming, and convenience. I'd still opt for the Grand Californian during the hot summer months, as it is closer to both parks, and is literally attached to California Adventure. However, Disneyland Hotel is a better option for spring, winter, and fall, and for those who will spend most of their time at Disneyland, for which the nearby monorail is a convenient option.

I absolutely loved staying at this hotel ! the rooms are amazing and so are the on site restaurants and bars; Even the quick service place was great to eat breakfast at.  You have to go to the Enchanted Tiki Bar and order the tuna poke... its delicious.  The hotel is located very close to downtown disney which was great for us.. it is not a long walk like others are stating.  This was the nicest disney hotel that I have ever stayed at.

There are so many hotels around Disneyland, but in my view, the original is still the best. Of course, it has been remodeled, and beautifully so. We stayed in the Adventure Tower, which meant that we were closest to the Downtown Disney walkway. This was super convenient for going to dinner, shopping, and of course the park. Just three minutes from leaving our room to being in Downtown Disney. The room was lovely. One really special touch: a special switch on the bedside lamp played a quiet, music box version of "A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes" from Cinderella. And while it played, the full-wall artwork of Sleeping Beauty's Castle lit up with tiny fireworks. My only gripes were that during peak morning hours the hot water was tepid ( Big hotel with many people showering at

We love comming here once a year it is so much fun the staff is friendly the food is good in some places. When it's really hot it's bad to be here so just look at the weather before you come. But it's a great place for family fun. The characters are always super happy. Love it

Rented a 2 bedroom suite for a visit with our Girl Scout Troop (high school seniors), for their last event together before graduating. 7 people total in the suite, was very spacious.  For the high price, in hindsight, 2 connecting rooms would have sufficed, but the extra living space was handy. While the room was over $1,000 a night, it did not offer any different level of comfort or quality than the $400 a night rooms – just larger in size.  I was kind of hoping it would feel a little fancier, or there were some perks to paying that much, other than mere space. The girls had a GREAT time, and that is why we went!

I always prefer to stay on property when going to Disneyland.  It is easier with kids, and the Extra Magic Hours is a great plus.  However, it is getting to the point where the cost associated with staying on property is no longer worth it.  Don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful, nicely upgraded, clean and quiet.  The service is impeccable as you would expect with Disney.  There are a variety of shops, places to eat, etc.  The issue I am having is the costs continuing to rise.  We went in February, which is the slower period for Disney.  The average cost for hotels in the area was in the $100-$200 range per night.  $100 being the lower end hotels, and $200 for the nicer ones.  Disneyland hotel cost us over $400/night.  Unfortunately, like I stated earlier, I am finding that

Summary Heading: The Happiest Hotel to Stay At in Anaheim!
Summary: My wife and I had a wonderful time the four-day weekend we spent at the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim.  Literally across the street from the Disneyland amusement park, it was quite convenient to hop on the Monorail (which connects to the hotel) and take it to and fro the park each day.  But the hotel itself has a lot of activities to provide in addition to Disneyland.  The evening water show is spectacular, as a lot of fun are the outdoor nightclubs in the huge square that is surrounded by the equally huge hotel.    Our room was quite spacious, well furnished and top of the line.  And room service was excellent as well the several breakfasts and one dinner meal we ordered during our stay.  The food was excellent and well worth the price.  Overall, service at the hotel was also

Summary Heading: Our first on property experience at the Disneyland Resort
Summary: We have visited Disneyland many times but this was our first time staying on property and it was so worth it! We were in the Adventure building, 2 queen & single flip couch for 3 adults and 2 kids (3&6). The room was lovely with a gorgeous wood cut headboard (spanning both queens) with the castle carved in it and by accident (thank goodness) we discovered a switch on the table lamp that turned on the fireworks and melody within the headboard. Each bedside has a reading light as well. Softest sheets and really comfy beds. Adjoining rooms an option. Tv, fridge, coffee maker, desk, play and pack in the closet, safe, robes, double sink, separate toilet, shower/tub (not a soaker just a regular tub) and lots of great little details. Also, free wifi.      The pools were a highlight -

Out of all the hotels I have stayed in, this is my favorite.  It's even better than any of the Disney World Resorts.  Disneyland resort is within walking distance to California adventure and Disneyland.  The room we stayed in was huge.  It had 2 beds and a sofa.  The Disney property was very pretty with lots of nice landscaping.  The headboard of the beds had a fiber optic Disney Castle with fireworks.  If you turn it on, it plays "When You Wish Upon a Star" and the fireworks flicker.  The music eventually stops but the lights stay on.  The bathrooms were nice size. The lights were Mickey hands holding lights.  The pool was nice.  The slides were monorails.  Goofy's kitchen was located at this hotel.  The breakfast was nice.  We had a blast.  I would love to stay here every time

We always love a Disney hotel - Disney does service like no others.  At this hotel, we particularly enjoyed the Trader Sam's restaurant - a welcome late-night food source after arriving from the east coast.  Most important, the hotel has a nurse on call, who made a "house call" for our child, who somehow got a piece of metal in her eye.  We did end up needing to take her to the local emergency room, but it was great to have the nurse come to triage and see if she could do anything to help.

We are from Orlando, so Disney World is our benchmark. This hotel honestly exceeded my expectations. The property was very nice, rooms big and extremely comfortable. Nice to be able to walk to the parks in the morning and still close enough to the 'LA' sights to make a day trip.

We stayed in the Adventure Tower, and was initially disappointed that we has been placed in a room nestled between the elevators and the ice machine.  I fully expected to request a room-change, but we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was. I understand that the rooms have recently been renovated, and they were nice.  There is a small refrigerator in each room for breakfast food and snacks (beer fits as well).  The hotel is conveniently located near Downtown Disney and entrances to both parks.  You can also use a shortcut through the Grand Californian to go to the California Adventure park.  The pool is nothing special, nothing like that of the Grand California Hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice but it feels a little old
Summary: Stayed for one night. Very nice and kind staff. Fast check in and check out. Did not use the pool because we spent all our time at the parks. Hotel feels a little old because it is old. Room size was ok and bed was very comfortable. Room service is a bit over priced.

Very convenient if you want to visit the parks.  Rooms are nice and newly renovated.  Not a ton of Disneyland touches compared to the resorts at Disney World, but overall, it's a great place to stay if you're looking to be close to Disneyland and California adventure.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel just ok for us, monorail often down for repairs so Disney entry not convenient
Summary: The hotel was fine but the monorail was broken down A LOT while we were there, so access to Disneyland often required a half mile schlep through Downtown Disney to the standard park check in (where the lines were HUGE to have bags checked at security checkpoint).  We had an early entry pass and arrived at the monorail station at 7 am, and found a large line there so went to the Disney Park entry.  We started out at 7 am and finally gained access to the park at 7:40 am.  Hardly the "Early Entry" we expected when we booked our stay.  Another serious problem related to the monorail, when you want to leave the park.  There is NO SHADE when you have to wait in line to get on the monorail until you are right up to the station platform.  At 2 pm, when we wanted to get on the monorail

I stayed here for 5-nights in February with my wife and daughter to celebrate her 4th birthday.  It was my first stay at the Disneyland Hotel (and visit to Disneyland) since I was 5-years old so I don't have much to compare to.  But the location, staff, and facility were amazing.  I can't image having had a better time.  One of the biggest highlights was the second we walked in to the hotel as I was checking in Goofy came out and my daughter pretty much got an personal welcome to the hotel as there was no one else around.  She was ecstatic and it was a wonderful way to start our trip.  We spent a bit of time in the pools and on the monorail slides which all of us enjoyed, and we also did breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen which is located at the hotel.  One of the main downsides is

Summary Heading: Expensive, but so convenient and magical.
Summary: Stay two nights in May and will absolutely go back. Paid the extra to stay on the Club floor and I would say it was worth it.  Got an incredible tour from Nati, our personal concierge who met us at the hotel entrance as soon as we walked in from valet.  It was our first time staying onsite, so we were so impressed with the customer service and how everything is coordinated.  She must have liked our kids so much that she even had a special gift sent up by room service our first evening.  Made the whole trip magical to get that special treatment -- kids couldn't stop talking about it, and still can't. If you're going to spend that much to go to DL, why not go all out -- this is the way to go!

We went as a family to celebrate my daughter's 9th birthday and the hotel was perfect! The pool was clean and fun with waterslides and hot tub. Location is great since you can easily walk to the tram,  Disney parks, restaurants and shopping. This was our 2nd time staying at the Disneyland Hotel and it definitely won't be our last.

My wife and I spent a night here for her birthday. We had a great, although limited, time at the hotel. The staff we had contact with were professional, courteous and helpful.  Our room had a fantastic view of the city, overlooking Downtown Disney looking out east over Anaheim.   Trader Sam's was a good time. The bartenders were definitely jumping, but the service, and experience, were great.   We had a really good time overall and would definitely consider staying again.

Summary Heading: Nice facilities, close to Downtown Disney and the Parks
Summary: It has been many years since we visited when our kids were young  This time, as seniors we were looking forward to the newer, renovated Disneyland Hotel. We weren't disappointed. The rooms are large, the headboards are great and its so close to Downtown Disney, the monorail and the two parks, the convenience can't be beat.  The room prices are quite high for basic accomodations- no frills but you're paying for convenience and access to the park.  We like using our room key to charge items in the park and to have free delivery to our room. Additionally, the one hour magic hour to enter the parks is another plus.  The self parking is just a stones throw from the hotel. We stayed in the Adventureland tower which is closest to Downtown Disney.  Really love having the convenience of

I was in town on business and decided to stay here as it was close to the convention centre. Incredibly comfortable beds, nicely renovated room with all amenities. I can see this being a great hotel for families as well. Bathtub is smaller for children and the there was a pack n play in the closet. Great food service. I ordered breakfast which was well priced. Eggs, toast, coffee, bacon $14. not bad for being a stones throw from the resort. Highly recommend this hotel .

Summary Heading: Always great time at a Disney Resort
Summary: Great resort can't beat the Downtown Disney access have stayed at all 3 Disney resorts in Anaheim multiple times this is always our fave the pool remodel is fantastic kids loved it even the older ones.  We ususally do the concierge level which is pricey but a must with 3 kids two of which are starving teenage boys and the staff treats you like GOLD. Wish I had the gentleman's name that always helped us on the concierge level he was fantastic my daughter still talks about how nice he was.  You also have a spot for fireworks viewing which is priceless and special treats to go with.  You can also take drinks back to your room or in your stroller for the park which helps with your in park spending. Rooms aren't huge next time I'll probably spring for a suite for 5 of us.

Summary Heading: Security issues and high levels of chlorine in pools
Summary: Stayed here for a week in July 2015.  My wife was taking her CME course.  We got a discounted room and discounted tickets for D. Land. Our room was on 3rd floor with view of trees.   We do not get good upper level rooms or rooms with a nice view with the CME courses.   We stayed in Sierra building which was nice because it was easy to walk our luggage over.  We had a couch in the room and two beds.  We had 4 kids with us and we were not charged extra.  Parking is a bother here because you do have to park far away from the building and God forbid you forget something in the car.  Pool is excellent but the chlorine level is super high (due to high amounts of poop and pee in the water-they close the pool at least once a day due to poop or something in the water -with lots of little

We had a good time during our stay. You can have an hour exclusive-to-hotel-guests entrance prior to park opening hours to the Disneyland and California adventure if you stay here. The parks are walking distance from the hotel so time-saving too.

We booked a standard room but the flight was delayed and we arrived very late (after midnight) and maybe because of this we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, which was fantastic, and we had a balcony too.  The bed was so comfortable, the bathroom fairly large.  The only problem we found was the shower took so long to supply the hot water - not eco-friendly!  We found the staff really friendly and Cecelia on reception that night was lovely.

We stay at the Disneyland Hotel in the frontier tower in a suite on the 14th floor over looking the pool and Disneyland great for the fireworks and it has the best views.nice room with 2 sinks in the bathroom and nice bar in the living room with sofa bed .

Stsyed on the 7th floor in the three bedroom suite. Five adults and one child. Was very nice and clean.  Also bought the eTicket lounge which was worth it. Could watch the fireworks and eat every night in comfort.  Loved the vacation and walk into Disneytown and both parks.

Summary Heading: The magical and the not so magical stay at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: First time staying at the Disneyland hotel . The room was awesome with Mickey/Disney touches all around . Valet and front desk cast members very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately that's the magical part of our stay.    We checked in late on a Sat night went to parks first thing SUNDAY morning upon our return back to our room late in the evening received a message that we would not be having HOT water for the night and several restaurants would be closing early . O well we are at Disney all is good . We thought for only a night it would be fine.   Housekeeping wasn't consistent on the 6 nights we stayed one day room would be great the next day we would have no towels, shampoo ..ect .   only beds made up even forgot trash .   3 out of 6 nights we had NO HOT water I called front

We stayed here for 3 nights and the location is perfect!  Our room could view the fireworks every night in Disneyland!  The beds were soft and comfortable.  We had a bathroom with 2 sinks and the toilet in a separate room - this was very convenient.  We had 5 people so really liked the 2 beds and 1 daybed setup.  Would recommend this hotel!  By staying at a Disney hotel, you get into the park an hour early - this was awesome.  In that hour we rode 4 of the most popular rides.  It is literally a 10 minute or less walk into the park.  One tip - as you are walking through downtown Disney, go into the other Disney hotel (the more upscale one).  You can cut through here to enter California Adventure park - the lines are much less at this entrance and I think it cuts off some walking.

Once again I had a good experience here.  I traveled with my 6 year old son this time and it was just about perfect.  The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the cost.  Room was clean, nice, and no real serious complaints.  The staff was friendly and my boy loved the pools/slides.  Part of the pool area is undergoing renovations, but the slides are open, and they opened earlier than usual because of this, which was a plus on the day we were checking out because he got to spend quality time there before leaving.  Very good hotel, great access to Downtown Disney and very nearby Monorail access to the park.  We have stayed at the Grand in the past, and I actually think that for the kids, this is the better hotel on account of the pools and slides.  If you are a grown up couple,

Spend 4 nights here with family end of February.  Room on the 9th floor was fine but for sure not 4 or 5 star level.  Nice amenities and comfortable beds.  Only issue I really had was I purchased a package from Costco and received a standard room.  The view from the standard rooms is a massive parking lot as far as you could see.   I called down to desk to change rooms as even a room with a view of tree tops would be better.  They explained to me that any room with a view other than a standard view would cost more.  I agree to move and pay extra (room was that bad) but the hotel was booked during parts of our 5 day stay and they could not move us.  A great hotel would have figured out a compromise with a little bit of work.  We just kept the window curtains closed and it was

Summary Heading: Most Magical Place I've Ever Stayed
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is pure magic! I would stay here every time if I could afford it. It is pretty expensive but worth it to stay here at least once. We stayed in the Adventure Tower on the 3rd floor. We had a standard 2 queen room, but they gave us a pool view room. The beds are super comfortable, the rooms are nice and updated and the toiletries were from H20. There are nice Disney touches throughout the room but its not overkill. They have a mini fridge and coffee maker in the room. And don't forget, before you go to bed at night, the Kiss Goodnight lights up the headboard and sings you a song.   We only went to Trader Sam's enchanted tiki bar and the Tangaroa Terrace restaurants. Trader Sam's is a must see! It's small and fills up quickly at night, so go for lunch. They

We decided to splurge and stay two nights at the Disneyland Hotel.  It's one of my bucket list items to stay at a resort at the park.  We went with the "mid range" hotel, less than the Grand Californian, more than Paradise Pier.  The lobby, staff, grounds, gardens, all perfect.  The staff members were eager to help.  They were professional and courteous.    I never knew there were gardens at the property so it was fun to walk around and see the different areas.  It was very impressive.  The common areas and the rooms were sparkling clean.  The fixtures were a nice touch.  But given the fact that we spent most of the time at the Parks, it's hard to justify paying that price more than once in my life.  We didn't spend much time in the room, or even on the hotel property.  Plus,

We stayed here for four nights while visiting Disneyland. We loved everything a about this hotel!  It is right by downtown Disney, has a fanatic pool, great restaurants and a yummy coffee shop!  This hotel had lots of lovely details!  The hidden mickeys in the carpet, on the sink handles, lamp posts... Our daughter loved the fireworks above the bed!  We walked to and from Disney each day and loved being so close.   The Grand Califorian is closer, and connects to Disney.  However, we heard the rooms were smaller.  (And the Disneyland hotel rooms were a great size!!) While the lobby was gorgeous of the GC, we agreed we wouldn't want the Disney guests to be in our hotel.   If you are trying to decide between Disneyland hotel and grand Californian, like we were, book this one!  Much

The Disneyland Hotel was a nice hotel, but not very extravagant or impressive for the cost. The headboard was cool and the rooms were spacious, but I honestly thought it was going to be more exciting than it was. It is definitely better than some hotels and the convenience of it being so close to Disneyland was a plus.

Check in was quick and easy!  We were upgraded from standard view to a view of the pool, Downtown Disney & Fireworks at no charge!  We stayed in the Frontier Tower which I have stayed in before.  It is closest to the monorail/waterslide pool!  The waterslide pools are heated, felt like bath water.  My kids absolutely loved it!  They have life jackets of all sizes by the pool for use at no charge.  They also are fully staffed with multiple lifeguards.   If you have a baby and need a pack & play dont worry about packing yours!  Each room has one in the closet.   The rooms are nice size, I have stayed at Grand Californian and the rooms at Disneyland Hotel are larger.   You can easily sleep a family of 5 + a baby in crib/pack & play, and have room where you aren't stepping over each

Summary Heading: First Time Staying at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: It did not disappoint.   I haven't been to Disneyland since the early 90s!  This was our first stay and the Disneyland Hotel and loved the convenience of the location and the accommodations were wonderful!  The staff was nothing but helpful and very organized.  We will be back!

Summary Heading: love the hotel, starting to hate the land
Summary: The Disneyland hotel is always a joy, it feels so special just to be there, we get a suite on the top floor, watch fireworks on the deck.  But the Land, the land is just getting out of control.  Don't know when I'll be back cause I'm just that disgusted.  Sorry Mickey, it's been fun, but the waits, the crowd and the utter rudeness of guests (and I realize Disney has no control on the lack of manners) have just outweighed the fun.

I have wanted to stay here since I was a child and finally got to take my daughter and granddaughter. We walked in and check in was fast and friendly. The main hotel is the fantasy tower and is open and bright and has a sundry store and a fairly large gift shop.  Our room was in the adventure tower and we had a wonderful view of Downtown Disney and an amazing view of the fireworks at nite. There are winding pathways that are lined with trees and it's just beautiful!   I've stayed at the Grand California but although a beautiful hotel, I really enjoyed the Disneyland hotel much better. I would recommend this hotel in a hot minute!!  Loved everything. Could have used a little more storage tho.

I absolutely LOVE this hotel!  Once again, I had a wonderful stay.  My son and I arrived for a 3 day stay and arrived around 7:30am.  My room wasn't ready yet so my son and I decided to head to the park.  About 3 hours later, my son wasn't feeling good so we went back to see if we could get into our room early.  Our room still wasn't ready, but when they found out my son wasn't feeling well, they went above and beyond and put us into a room that was ready instead of making us wait until our room was ready.  They even moved us into the main hotel tower.  The staff is always extremely polite and make me feel like family.  I love ordering room service for lunch and the Steakhouse 55 has a wonderful breakfast!  When you stay here, you get early entry into the parks everyday that

I love this hotel! I've stayed here more times than I can count, and have never had a bad experience. The rooms are comfortable, with fabulous floor-to-ceiling views of Downtown Disney, and so many Mickey Mouse-ified details. Also love the proximity to Steakhouse 55 (one of my favorite Disneyland restaurants) and the Tiki Bar (amazing piña coladas). It's a little bit of a walk into the Disneyland park, especially when Downtown Disney is crowded and you're weaving in and out of a zillion people, but there's always the Monorail option. Plus you have the amazing pools - complete with Monorail slide - if you want to escape the crowds of the parks.

We stayed 2 nights from 2/25-2/27 in the Main Tower. The room was beautiful. We had a nice view of the pool. The room was nicely furnished and the beds were extremely comfortable. On our last morning we enjoyed room service for breakfast. They brought a white clothed table into our room and put it in between our 2 queen beds. My 9 year old girls sat in each bed and ate. They thought that this was the best meal they'd ever had. It was a fun way to finish off the trip. We also ate at Goofy's Kitchen for dinner one night. It was a fun experience, but the food is nothing special. The kids enjoyed the buffet, but I would not eat there without children. I was impressed with the pool area and the comfy lounge chairs.  ***Wifi was free, but never worked. If you need wifi during your

Summary Heading: A great way to visit Disneyland
Summary: As with Disney in general, the price is a little more than you'd like, but it has a lot of value.  We stayed two nights in the Adventure tower, on the 11th floor, with a room facing the pools.  The room looked recently-updated. Also, when you stay at the DH, you can leave your car in the hotel lot all day the day you check out, if you're going to go to a park that day.  We bought our tickets at the lobby--hassle-free.   It was SO nice to be able to go back to the room & rest for a little bit when the long day of wandering around gets to you.  You also get to go to one of the parks an hour early.  I recommend paying for the hopper ticket.

Absolutely loved it here. It's perfectly placed, it has everything you could need and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The headboard was beautiful! If you press a switch on the lamp the headboard lights up and plays music, so pretty! That made my week! The staff were helpful and checked us into a room early as we had done a lot of travelling so we could leave our stuff, freshen up and go out for the day! And it's so close to everything you could need. Love this hotel

Summary Heading: Great Home Base for Disney Trips!
Summary: Easy park access, newly renovated rooms, and that special Disney charm makes the updated Disnleyland Hotel a great place to stay if you want to make a multi-day trip to the parks.  Some rooms have firework views, so try to request that if possible.  Rooms are solid, but nothing fancy.  There are cheaper options than Disneyland Hotel, but as far as quality for the price goes, it can't be beat.

I was unsure about returning, my last stay the hotel badly needed an update. With this renovation the Rooms look great- and not over the top with theme. My only complaint- I had to wait almost 2 hours past check in to get my room. Staff is great and location is great. In Anaheim - stay on Disney property- the rest of the city is not very magical.

Stayed 7 nights. Asked for standard view, got preferred. Watched fireworks from our room a few mights. Had dinner 1 night at Tangaroa Terrace, enjoyed it very much. Ate at Goofy's Kitchen 2 mornings, 2nd morning had early seating 7:30 character interaction was awesome. Staff was friendly. Nice gift shop. Wifi was absolutely horrible. Not just at the hotel but everywhere on property. They have on of the best  app I've ever used, the Disneyland app, and they don't have useable wifi on property, had to use data instead.

We arrived almost three hours prior to normal check in time so that we could park and start exploring Downtown Disney. To our delight, Veronica at the front desk was kind and engaging despite how early we were. After just briefly mentioning that it was my husband's first Disneyland visit, her eyes lit up and she said she would look "extra hard" for a room that was available right away. And she did! A gorgeous King bed room in the Adventure Tower with the super unexpected benefit of a partial Fireworks view, as well as great view of Downtown Disney. This excellent service made our stay that much more special. Some of the onsite pools were closed and under construction, wifi was a bit spotty, and onsite parking cost is pretty ridiculous BUT none of those impacted our overall

I was hesitant on getting this room for my family.  We have a teenage daughter and a 4 year old son.  Didn't know how this was going to play out for them.  But to our dismay they loved the rooms as well as the friendly staff.  It was as if we were in the park, the staff was so perky and made us feel welcomed.. Even though this probably placed a hole in my pocket, I can say we will be back! As long as you go and are treated kindly it's always make you feel welcomed.

Summary Heading: Celebrating Disneyland's 60th at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel from February 14-20.   Overall, it was a great stay.  When your only complaint is that the free wireless Internet wasn’t always quick to connect to, it is a good stay.  Check In – We arrived around 10:30pm after a flight from the East Coast.  It seemed strange that no one greeted us when we exited our shuttle, but we were so happy to be there, it didn’t really faze us.
