The cast members at check in were very friendly and helpful giving us everything we needed – room keys, maps, show times, character photos and first visit buttons.    Room – Our travel agent just flat out rocks.  She got us upgraded to a room on a concierge floor with a premium view.  We were on the 9th floor in the adventure tower overlooking Downtown Disney and the parks.  There

Look, you know why you pay more to stay here especially as one will be going to the parks. We stayed in a two bedroom suite in the frontier tower overlooking the pools. Overall nice rooms, great housekeeping. Some pros and cons:  Cons first so we can finish on a high: - no microwave, glasses or anything else eat food with - the suite opens from carded double doors into a small fore room, where you have to use your cards to get into respective rooms. Not a problem if you have door stops, which we weren't given until our last day in the hotel - the suite has a bit of a "naked" feel to it. Probably because the kitchen area was really only a bar - both pools were closed at the same time  Given the amount one pays (1000 per night, close to) one can easily expect the about to not be

We have stayed many times in the Anaheim area to visit Disneyland and this trip, with family members, including grandkids, we decided to stay on site, We had three large rooms and they were comfortable and suited our needs very well. However, we soon discovered the downside of staying in a Disneyland hotel. We were isolated from the many restaurants in the area outside Disneyland, unless we wished to get our cars out of valet parking and travel. On site dining was limited and expensive, especially breakfast with the Stars. Downtown Disney is fine, but again limited and expensive eating. The early entrance tickets into Disneyland were a fizzer with some rides not yet operating, so we did not have any real advantage. As we had a late night flight home to Sydney, Australia, we

Summary Heading: Happiest Place on Earth -- Happiest Hotel
Summary: There are three times in one's life that they should go to Disneyland.  As a kid, when in love and with your kids.  I've had the privilege of experiencing all three.  And, if you're lucky enough to stay at one of the Disneyland Hotels, you're really in for a treat for an experience that extends the magic of Disneyland outside the amusement park's gates.  The staff (or cast members) deliver exceptional service.  While dining options are limited on the property, steps away is Downtown Disney with plenty of food, drink and shopping opportunities (there's even a movie theater).  Each morning, hotel guests receive a magic hour (7:00 a.m.) -- a one hour in the park to cram in as many attractions as one can until the gates open to the masses.  That alone is worth the experience.

Our friend enjoyed his stay at the Disneyland Hotel so much he highly recommended we stay for our family vacation. Upon our request, they were able to give us a room in the Fantasy Tower on the 6th floor with a view of Downtown Disney. There were two queen sized beds with one oversized headboard above both that lit up and played a music box type song when you pushed the button. One reviewer warned that the music was "insanely creepy" and another said it was "grating", but we found it to be delightful, not too loud and a great way to help the kids drift off to sleep.  Despite the amenities, I don't think we would stay again if we had the choice between the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand Californian. It's a bit of a walk from the Disneyland Hotel (which is at the end of the

Summary Heading: Great Location with Disney Flair at an Outrageous Price
Summary: Though definitely a step up from Disney's (awful) Paradise Pier hotel, the Disneyland Hotel is really a 3-star hotel wrapped in Disney characters with a stellar location and a ridiculous price tag.  Luckily, I was attending a trade show at the nearby Anaheim Convention Center and got heavily discounted rates (about $193/night)... but I still think that was high for the quality and size of the rooms.    My bed was alright and I slept well enough... but the pillows were another story.  I had to pile up pillows from both queen beds before I had enough support to sleep comfortably.  ...and I know they created the light-up headboard and music box lamp as a treat for kids, but it comes off as insanely creepy.  I left that alone after the first try.   lol  The shower was really nice...

Summary Heading: Wow, not what I expected for $390 a night.  Very disappointed.
Summary: Staying at the resort for a graduation event and was thinking they place would be great due to the high cost and being at Disneyland.  Upon check in, I noticed they have the motion sensor thermostat.  I hate those, when you come back to your room from being away it goes back to the default temp they set it at.  Next the internet was down.  I have tried for 6 hours the first day to get it corrected.  Nope lied to multiple times about what they were doing to help, but no.  No wireless for $395 a night!  Having to give a powerpoint presentation the next day, no internet access for my Mac was a no go.  The rooms bed were comfortable but had lint and other reminates of fabric on it.  The glass top table was dirty and the edges of the wall in the bathroom had rust visible.  Then they

Summary Heading: Great for families...not great if you want a decent bed!
Summary: Ok here's the deal - having stayed at the Grand Californian a number of times, this was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel so I feel like I can give a really good comparison between the two properties if you are deciding between the two.  The good: The Disneyland Hotel is the original hotel of the Disneyland park and the first to bear the Disney name. Since then they have added various towers and amenities and you'll find that the hotel and the rooms are updated to modern standards. It's relatively close to both parks located at the end of Downtown Disney and the monorail is steps away from the hotel so easy access to Disneyland. Just a bit further from the monorail you can take the side entrance to California Adventures in the Grand Californian (GC) that is a

There were 6 of us staying in a 2-bedroom suite.  $675 a night, plus valet parking.  Room had a huge bar in it, with cabinets, but we had no idea what you would put in all of those cabinets as there was no way to cook in the room, not even a microwave.  Weren't enough pillows and we had to make our own beds up.  Couldn't access the room until 3:00, then it took forever for the luggage to arrive.  Staff was very nice upon arrival--front desk, bellman, valet.  All professional and helpful, but it seemed like when you pay to stay in a suite, there should be more attention to detail.

Summary Heading: Still my favorite place to stay at Disneyland- but........
Summary: I am handicapped and was given the accessible room as requested for my 4 day stay. The door was so heavy I couldn't open it without assistance (I was alone in my room). There were many things broken in my room such as lights, the bathroom door would not close, etc. on top of that the bedding was badly wrinkled, such as the spread and bed ruffle. The housekeeping staff was marvelous and went above and beyond. I just don't think it was a Proper Disney experience. The front desk shrugged me off and nothing got fixed. Too bad. I hope they get their act together as it is much more expensive than all the other close by hotels.

THE place to stay for time at Disneyland. Comfortable, quiet and a delight to have the grand kids in a connecting room. The ability to duck back to the hotel for a short afternoon nap makes the time at Disney much more comfortable. A bit pricey, but it is only money.

The room size for 3 people was great.  2 double beds and plenty of room for clothes etc.  Good size bathroom with separate toilet.  Staff are very helpful and shops on site for the odds and ends you need to buy. Just a short stroll and your in Downtown Disney which has everything you need from food to gifts. Love the light up headboard that has music to it when you first turn it on. Would recommend to anyone no matter how old you are!!

Summary Heading: If you love Disney you must stay here
Summary: Staying at one of the resort hotels is on my bucket list. We were going down for 9 nights to celebrate my birthday so I suggested we stay a couple nights here. We ended up booking 3 nights. Yes it was VERY expensive (there were no discounts available at the time). We chose valet parking when we arrived - awesome service. There was no line to check in - awesome CM that helped us. Made sure I got my birthday pin. Now we were early because of the check out time at our other hotel. No problem - we head to the parks. Told we will get a text when our room is ready. Fast forward to about 4:00pm and still no text (should be ready by 3:00pm). I call the hotel and of course our room is ready. Head back and are blown away with the room. They put us in the frontier tower...facing the pool

My family of four stayed for seven nights, half was a convention and the rest for vacation.  Check in was very simple, staff was extremely friendly, they responded to and met all requests very graciously.   We lucked out staying in the Adventure tower.  I would highly recommend it as its closest to the park so a little less walking for the kids, we got a room that faced downtown Disney and on the sixth floor so we could also see the fireworks.  Only change would be to stay a little higher for a slightly better view as we were palm tree level.  Overall a great stay!

I was really torn about this review.  I think if I could give 2.5 stars (somewhere between poor and average), I would.  I believe I've reviewed the DL Hotel 3 times now, and I've given them a lower a rating each time.  I think that is fair, and I will explain why.  Starting from 2013, this was my 5th stay here.  If we visit DLand, we usually stay at this property.  I will start my review with the specifics of this stay, and then give a more overall picture of this hotel.  We checked in quite early, around noon.  Room was not ready, so we were told we would get a text when it was.  Not a huge problem.  However, the Cast Member who checked us in was quite curt, and not very friendly.  To make things worse, we had booked the Annual Passholder offer which comes with 2 fast passes at

We stayed on the 10th floor and had an amazing view of downtown disney with the whole wall being a window. We were even able to watch the fireworks from our room! Amazing experience and defiantly worth the extra money for the premium view

Summary Heading: A Great Place if You Are Visiting Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here on business (for a Disney Institute class) in January.  PROS: Excellent location if you are planning spending time at the theme parks. Walk to everything location. Extremely clean Mostly very good staff - the woman that checked me in...not so much but everyone else was really pretty good Spacious room Decent lighting Comfortable bed Large vanity area - separate from the toilet/shower room In room coffee service, refrigerator, vanity mirror (unlighted), ironing board, porta crib HVAC worked well and was not noisy Fun, light up headboard set up that plays Disney music  Decent work area Plenty of hot water and gets hot fast "Tower style" hotel set up...different towers that are separate from one another so nothing super crowded (although it was January) Comfortable

This is my absolute favorite hotel! The Disneyland hotel. If doing a family vacation to Disneyland this hotel is the best. It's very conveniently located at the end of downtown Disney. The monorail which takes you into the park is located very close to this hotel . Goofys kitchen is also located at this hotel. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. They have a newly renovated pool which is great for the whole family. This is the best hotel to stay at when at Disney. They have a little store you can get water or snacks if you need it.They also have their own Disney store here which makes grabbing last minute gifts very convenient . I've always had a pleasant stay here.

I stayed here on business for a conference in January 2016, for 5 nights.  The hotel is obviously for families visiting Disney. I'm not a Disney fan - at all - so the constant playing of Disney Music, appearance of characters in costume, Disney stores, Disney patterns in the carpet...was a bit much. But, I'm not the target market!  That aside, the hotel was clean and my room was spotless and well maintained. Staff were usually pretty friendly and I used the laundry services which were super fast. There is no on site restaurant and the pools were closed for renovation at the time of visiting. That means you have to eat at Downtown Disney if you're saying on site, and that's a pretty terrible selection of chain restaurants and bad food that's massively overpriced.  It's fine for a

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disney trip
Summary: We stayed here on an adult only Disney trip.  We arrived to check in and found that even though there were no lines for check in, they had plenty of cast member to take care of several people.  The cast member that checked us in was very friendly and helpful and made sure that we were able to be located near some other members of our party.  Once in the room, in the Adventure Tower, we found a room with great dedication to theming.  Everywhere you looked you were reminded that you were at a Disney property, from photos on the wall to the lighted headboard.  The bed was very comfortable and we had a view of the pool area.  This was our first stay on property, and I would do it again.  The convenience of walking to the monorail to go to the park in the morning and return at night

We stayed here the last week of January.  I haven't stayed here in 30-some years and really didn't know what to expect.  We normally stay at the Grand Californian, but decided we wanted to compare the two.  What I really liked about this hotel is the size of the rooms.  They are bigger than most modern hotel rooms.   The bathrooms were large and well-appointed.  Our room also had a single pull-out bed which was great for our pre-teen son to sleep on.    While we visited, a couple of the pools were being repaired so they were drained, but they have several really nice pool areas.  The hotel lobby is very nice (I absolutely loved the vintage Disney prints and the teacup tables) and the staff was incredibly helpful the handful of times we needed to talk with them. If you want to

Summary Heading: if you plan your trip right you can get these rooms as low as $240 a night
Summary: I love the convenience of staying here, especially off peak when disneyland closes at 8pm cause the Disney district is still open and they have musicians playing and the hotel pool stays open till 11pm. The poolside snack bar here has the best steak nachos too. Turn down service, no need to take shuttles cause you are at the disney district.

We stayed in January and overall had a good experience at this hotel.   We were in a 3 bedroom suite (or actually is was three adjoining rooms with one common door and one common entry way). At first it wasn't what we were hoping for but actually, when we got settled, it worked out nicely. We were able to prop the doors open and all be together during the day but at night close the doors and each have a little privacy.  The rooms were clean and comfy. (Nice cushy comforters!) I wished it was a little bit more "disney decorated" but it was still nice with standard hotel decor with some cute firework headboard nightlights that played music.   The pool play area and slides were fun for the kids. About half of the pools were closed for renovation when we were there but from what was

Summary Heading: Sorry....but this is not all that great
Summary: We travel and maybe we are spoiled we have stayed at some super amazing properties and this hotel needs a shot of Botox. The rooms are at best on the same level as holiday inn. Your paying for premium - your paying for premium because your on property and the convenience. For the amount of money you pay a night it is quite unimpressive. We got a 2 bedroom suite and it was basic. The cleaning/housekeeping could be a bit more on point. I know that your at Disney and will not spend a whole lot of time in the room but sorry Disney you need to upgrade to the future. Some of the cast members also need a bit of an attitude adjustment of your not going to be happy the happiest place on earth should not be your place of employment.  Overall it was a good visit but it will be a long while

Summary Heading: We had a great week visiting Disneyland while staying at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We bought a 5 day park hopper pass and decided we wanted to be as close to the parks as we could, so that we were not wasting time traveling to our hotel via shuttles and/or walking. The Disneyland Hotel was a great choice. Most days we just jumped on the Monorail and within 2 minutes were were in the Disney Park. Loved that we were able to get in early each day (alternate between Disney and California Adventures). The room was average yet clean. We loved the light up/musical headboard and the mini fridge to store our water bottles and snacks. Wi-Fi was free however it wasn't great. We've stayed at other hotels with continental breakfast however this hotel did not have anything like that. The coffee shop on site was average. The pricing a bit high however given the location, to

Summary Heading: Great location for the park, food service not so great
Summary: Our room is nice, clean, quiet, all good things.  Our experience with food service has been average, at best, especially considering that we're paying inflated prices for Disney.  We couldn't get a table in the Steak 55 restaurant, but could get the full menu at the bar, so we went that route. My order was wrong, and it took a long time to get the right order.  My husband had already finished his meal by the time I got mine. To the bartender's credit, he gave me an extra cocktail at no charge.  Room service.  Ugh!  If you want room service between 7:30 & 8, tell them you want it between 7 & 7:30. Both days we ordered room service for breakfast, that was the case--half an hour late. One guest was on the phone on hold with room service for over 10 minutes.  If you're coming for

I am on my way back home after 4 nights at the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim, where I attended a conference.  I attend some 20+ conferences a year and I can't think of a worse venue for a business conference.  The place is run down, worn out, and the service stinks. The main restaurant is closed for renovation, and the quality of food where available stinks.  Had a steak at the steak house last night and it was tough as leather.

Summary Heading: Convenient Hotel to spend 2 Disneyland Days
Summary: If you're traveling with small children, probably this is the most convenient way to spend your 2 full Disneyland days which is just a step away. Other than that, everything is standard and not bad. The hotel is quite old but ok

After 3 years I'm back for the NAMM show at the Anaheim Convention Centre. The hotel is now my first choice when coming here as the location is ideal for both the show and after show activities. As usual the service is great from reception to the rest of the hotel. The room is well set up with all the necessities and very importantly a very comfortable bed. Although this is a solo business trip it is a spacious room with a very well appointed bathroom. The free wifi is good for  catching up on work before and after the show. A very good hotel in this area.

The Disneyland Hotel is a very nice hotel. It has a great location at the end of Downtown Disney. It's very near many shops and restaurants. The hotel grounds are very nice with a large swimming pool and Monorail water slides. The hotel lobby is fun with many vintage pictures, decorations, and fun things to look at it.  That being said the hotel isn't overly Disney. That could be a plus or a negative depending on your point of view. If you are a Disney fanatic, you might be a little let down. Having been to Disney World where almost all of their hotels are intensely themed, I was a little let down by the lack of theming here. There are other hotels in the area with similar (or better) accommodations. You pay (significantly) more than most other places to "stay in the magic" and

Summary Heading: Great for After a Long Day of Fun
Summary: The rooms are extremely clean, and as with anything Disney each have their own unique theme.  The beds were great and made it easy to get rested up after a long day of fun.  The room service is great, and the rest of the staff were extremely helpful as well.  Cant wait until we are able to visit this magical place again.

We stayed there while visiting Disneyland after new year's day and it was truly magical. The room was beautiful and really comfortable. It is connected to the downtown disney which connects to the parks so you can walk to the parks instead of taking the car, that is a major benefit. The people is super friendly(as you would expect at a Disney location) as well.

My partner and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in December 2015. We stayed for 4 nights. The room was very big although it was quite run down and not what I was expecting for Disneyland, especially considering how much they charge. We had also booked it 12 months in advance and requested a King Size bed, and noted that we were celebrating our anniversary - despite this we got a room with 2 double beds, and the double beds felt like 2 single beds pushed together. The breakfast options aren't great, with the buffet costing $70 for 2 people. On the plus side, the magic morning and convenience of staying in downtown Disney is really good. I don't think I would stay again unless I came with children.

The hotel's location is very convenient, you can easily walk to downtown disney or walk to the parks. The rooms were clean. I didnt enjoy the restaurants specially the goofy restaurant but it was a good experience for my son.

A very impressive hotel, as soon as you walk in the door the decor etc was amazing. The corridors were wide with Disney displays to look at. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were kept clean with plenty of bathroom products, tea and coffee.  The breakfast was adequate with two dining rooms. There were Disney characters to meet outside one dining room with minimal if any queue. So convenient to be just outside the parks so you can come and go, especially with young children. No waiting for transfer buses.

I had a fall before our trip to America and was in a mobility boot and on crutches.  When we arrived I asked about mobility scooter hire.  I was surprised to hear I could hire one at the hotel for use here and in the parks.  Brilliant.  This made life so much easier.  I also asked if we could change our booking to a room with a park view.  They were able to accommodate this as well.  This made our trip so much more enjoyable and comfortable.  Staff here were also helpful with suggestions for supermarkets and other things near the resort.  Would definitely stay again - may be pricy but convenience , size of rooms and staff make it a highlight of the trip to the US.  Thanks

I love this hotel   The rooms are nice and newly updated and a nice touch of Disney everywhere the hotel lobby is huge and staff are friendly and welcoming as soon as you walk in...  The headboard with the lights are nice touch to the room and the pool is a lot of fun for the kiddos... there is a nice little bar on the grounds for adult time which was nice to wind down with

We really enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel; the small Disney-themed touches throughout the grounds and in the rooms make the experience that much more exciting for the kids. The headboard that lights up and plays music was a big hit, as was the Mickey shaped handles for the sink. Note the pool area is currently under construction; the only areas you can use are the central wading pool with the two water slides and the jacuzzi tub; the other two pools are closed for refurbishment. Goofy's Kitchen is also closed for refurbishment as well. The hotel is pricey but worth it if you can swing it; take advantage of the magic morning early opening every day you are going to the park.

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in mid January, 2016 for 3 nights.  They were nice enough to give us our room early after a long flight in from Australia and we had a fantastic view of the car park from our room (not the theme park as suggested at the front desk).  Staying at DLH is great for easy and early access to the theme parks, but that's about it.  The bed head lit up and played a tune and the taps were Mickey Mouse heads but thats where the magic ended.  And so much for being family friendly.  If you want milk for your baby, you need to hunt it down (there's a CVS Pharmacy down the road) and the microwave is in the lobby of your tower.  But don't go down there late at night with your baby in a pram (so the rest of your family can sleep) because sitting in the lobby,

Summary Heading: Disney quality and service, but a bit small.
Summary: Our daughter came for a conference and we stayed with her for four nights. We had stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before, but in the Fantasy Tower. This room was in the Frontier Tower and was considerably smaller. On the other hand, the conference rate was $195 per night, less than half the price we paid last time. The entire resort is pristine and filled with the usual top-notch personnel. Proximity to Downtown Disney gave us many dining options and the parks are just a short walk. The room was quiet and clean.

Summary Heading: Really, really, REALLY over-priced for what it is.........
Summary: Ok, so, let me start with this - I didn't stay here for a trip to the "Park" - I stayed here because I spent the day at Knotts Berry Park and this was close, and I'd never seen Downtown Disney so I thought it could be interesting.  Considering I had just left the Ritz Carlton, and was paying the same amount for a waterfront suite at the Ritz as I was for a "Premium" room at this hotel - I expected something reasonably decent - I didn't get it.  This is a very, very dated hotel that has old bones that they have done a masterful job of keeping current through paint and surface renovations - but it just isn't that nice a hotel anymore.  I wouldn't go again.

If you have a family put this on your bucket list...and theirs. Know why you're there and go with it. There are more affordable, and even better traveler's hotels in the immediate area to be sure. But, this is the one with the magic, the one with the monorail. We made our first stay 40 years ago with our kids, and the memory is priceless. Makes you wistful to come back. Never felt that way about a Marriott

I’m a huge Disney fan, so when it came time to take our daughter to her first trip to Disneyland we decided to splurge and stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  Mainly for convenience with a 15 month old, but also because we haven’t stayed there since we were kids and you can’t go wrong with Disney right?    Of course everything was very clean and in working order.  When we arrived the valet parking attendant was very nice and inviting.  We walked into the lobby and it was a bit unorganized.  There was no clear place/area to form a line; there were a few people in front of us so naturally we got in line behind them.  The front desk is pretty long so in the meantime others had walked in and ended up walking straight up to the check in desk rather than waiting in line.  Once we got to

If you are at the Disneyland Hotel for business and can live with all the fantasy music playing all over and families dressed like Goofy's the hotel is high value. Great room with everything you need. Good wifi connection etc. The Gym is good. Very friendly staff. All in all a great hotel

Let me just say please please please that I am not one of those cynical people and I only speak the truth.  I was here with my girlfriend (now fiancé) for two reasons. 1/ for a work conference and 2/ my hidden agenda was to propose at Disney because it's a magical place and we both love everything to do with Disney. Let's just say you have to bring your own magic here. I will explain everything we loved and everything we didn't.   WHAT WE LOVED  Disney, everything to do with it which is what saved us. We have a few good tips as we figured it out and was a blast. Fast pass is awesome. You can only have one pass per person but it works perfectly. You go to the longest line ride, grab a fast pass and it tells you to come back within a certain time frame. We would then (slowly) walk

On my family's last trip to Disneyland, we had no idea our dad planned to surprise us with a stay here! We always stay for a week, and the first two days were in a normal hotel. But on our third day, my dad dropped us at the park (claiming that the bus system was too expensive) and said he'd bring us back pizza for lunch. So my mom and the rest of us went around riding rides and such, and my dad came back with Pizza for lunch like he said. He then surprised us with a dinner at Goofy's kitchen, and said he wanted to walk around the Disneyland Hotel area just to look around. We went inside of the Frontierland hotel, and he said he had to use the bathroom. And just walked right into a room! We all looked at our mom to try to stop him, but then we realized that we were going to stay

Pros: -great location -plenty of food choices within hotel and downtown disney (but very pricey) -adequate parking for guests -nice rooms  Cons: -we stayed for 7 nights, but our room was never vacuumed. By the last 2 nights, Crumbs all over the carpet. Housekeeping just makes up bed. And nothing else. Disappointing for a luxury property. Not the type to make a fuss with the manager so we just let it go.

Summary Heading: Had been looking forward to staying here for decades.
Summary: I had always said one day we would stay at this hotel and was looking forward to it.  Maybe my expectations were too high but it was a huge disappointment  we had planned to stay here twice on our visit but after the first stay i cancelled and extended our stay at Homewood suites Anaheim convention.   It was very cold and clinical and staff made you feel like a number,  you had to have a credit card to be able to get a drink from a machine and even do the washing no cash. We also stayed at Grand Floridian at WDW as part of this trip and they could definitely teach Disneyland Hotel a lot. The staff seemed to dealing with everything according to a script and cannot stray from it and cannot deal with things that are not on their script.  The wifi was the worst we experienced in any

We had an amazing time here. Great location and very convinient. Clean rooms and great service. Friendly staff. Will stay here again as we had a great time. Parking is very convenient too. Kids will love the lights in the rooms.

We have stayed here a half a dozen times in the last 4 years. The location is tough to beat, and the pool here is the best out of the three Disney hotels. Our first visit was right after they had renovated the Frontier tower. Our room was magical. I ALWAYS request a higher floor because it is loud. With the nature of Disney, the nights are late and the guests are excited, and therefore loud. So the higher up you can get, the better. This was a last minute trip and we were just lucky to get a room. It was louder than I ever remember, but the rooms are still magical, and that location is still tough to beat! You can easily walk to park entrances in 5-10 minutes, or you can hop the monorail to DL park. Again, the pool at this hotel is a great one, so don't forget your swimsuits.

We stayed here New Years weekend. We arrived before check in time. When we pulled up we were directed to the front and bell services took our luggage. The self park parking lot is not too far from the front of the hotel. Check in was smooth and they went over everything with us. We booked a room with a view and it didn't disappoint. We were in the furthest tower (Frontier) but it wasn't much more of a walk then the others. The room was a good size (more than enough room for 3 adults). Loved the headboards! Even had a good experience with one of the painters there (I took a picture of a cute wet paint sign and he gave me one). On check out day we got a letter and were offered the same room for an extra night for an amazing rate so we took them up on their offer. Have previously

The hotel was amazing. The staff were attentive and friendly. We stayed on the concierge level in the Adventureland tower. I highly recommend this, the snacks and breakfast were great. You can watch the firework display from Disneyland park from concierge club, they actually dim the lights and play the music to the show. The rooms were amazing, I loved the musical and lighted display above the beds. The parks and downtown Disney are a quick walk from the hotel.

We have been to Disney World countless times. But this was our first time at Disneyland and the Disneyland Hotel did not disappoint.  It definitely met the 'Disney' standard that we are used to.  The customer service was perfectly Disney.  The location was good. Right next to Downtown Disney, so easy access to everything. (Though in Disneyland everything is pretty close - nothing like the hugeness of Disney World). However, the rooms themselves were a little tired. You can definitely tell it is an older hotel that has been renovated over and over.  The bathrooms are small.  But the rooms are decorated very Disney and the fireworks nightlight headboard is extra special. Plus the fridge and microwave was nice to have, especially with a toddler.  I think next time we would try the

Summary Heading: Not the target audience for this hotel
Summary: We stayed here as a couple.  We were given a room that had a king bed, but was off a connecting hallway to another room.  Obviously designed for large family groups, we were luckily that the family in the other room were fairly quiet.  We asked to change, but the very helpful staff member who helped we explained that all the rooms with King beds were like that.  I guess the hotel is family orientated.  Which is fine, but not for us.  The restaurants we did not try, but the bar we did. It was small and packed, and staff there were not much help.    The property was undergoing some renovation on the outside, not really a problem, but we weren't told until a short time before we arrived.  Don't stay there for the next couple of months is you want a pool.  Not for us.

We enjoyed the stay in Disney hotel. The room is spacious enough for 5 people and very convenient to go back and forth to the parks. Goofy's kitchen has all their food free of tree nuts which is great for people who has nuts allergies. Only thing I feel they could improve is the variety of the foods. Most restaurants there mainly have burgers.( I don't know whether I missed other restaurants but that is my impression).

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel at Christmas 2015.  Great location if you're doing the parks,  but extremely overpriced for the amenities.  Towels in rooms were literally threadbare.  You could see through them.  For over $400 per night I expect plush towels and better in room amenities.  And be aware that Disneyland has increased the number of people they let in before cutting off ticket sales by upwards of 25,000 more than in the past.  The park was literally too crowded to enjoy between Christmas and New Year's.  Shoulder to shoulder and zipper to rear end type crowds.  Every adult was griping and kids were whining.  Definitely no longer the "happiest place on Earth" but certainly the greediest.  Really horrible experience, and I have been to Disneyland 100+ times.  We have

We love Disneyland and probably go once a month. We only splurge a couple times a year and stay at the Disneyland Resort. It is in the perfect location to downtown Disney, and the monorail that drops your right in to Disneyland.  Our favorite bar, Trader Sam's, is on the Disneyland Hotel property.  The rooms are super cute and have a nightlight in the bed's headrest. If you love Disneyland this is the hotel for you!

It's tough to beat being able to walk from the park right to your hotel without having to dealing with parking. The hotel was clean and well taken care of. Desk and cleaning was top notch. As for the room, very nice but not that large for what you pay. Tiki resturant had great food but bar was extremely small. Liked it but at around $400 a night and & 18 dollars parking, I wouldnt repeat. Enjoyed Grand Californian a few years back better if one has to chose.

we stayed in a "suite" in the frontier tower - agree with another reviewer that the main tower is the one to stay in. If you use the  "club" service ( at 200.00+per night) the club is on the 14th floor of the main tower. Limited breakfast/snacks/ drinks in the evening and desserts....good value for the adults - and you can watch the fireworks - but it gets REALLY busy with families early evening. The suite was ok - but had to ask & pay for plates/flatware & glasses. Also 1 tiny coffee maker - nothing else!  But , yes a very cool light up headboard   ( not sure if it was worth 1100.00 per night!)

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disney, but the tower you are in matters.
Summary: We stayed here the week between Christmas and NYE.  We have stayed at all 3 Disneyland resort hotels.  The main tower is very nice -- great lobby, restaurants, festive decor.  We were in the Frontier tower, which has a lobby that could be anywhere and no amenities.  We had a vending machine on our floor that didn't work.  Our room was great -- a really cool nightlight headboard, plenty of room, but there weren't any amenities in the tower.  Also, the pool slide closed at 5 pm.  This is the same as at the Grand Californian.  I don't understand why the slide closes so early.  My kids want to stay at the park until almost dinner then swim.  We also ran into a customer service person who was not very helpful in helping us purchase an extra ticket for a local friend and adding park

Summary Heading: The start of your magical Disney trip
Summary: The bed has a firework design on the frame which can be lighted up, and when you press another button, Disney musicbox-like music will start playing. Plenty of soft pillows to hug with. The bathrooms could do with a little bit of revamping though as it looks old but it has a separate cubicle for the toilet which I like. The room and bathroom was very clean. My room had a pool view which I loved. It was a fun experience. I was given an Olaf card for my room key!  The hotel itself is very close to Downtown Disney.

Family of 3 with a 2 year old and we stayed at in one of the standard rooms with two Queen beds. Renovation was ongoing but it didnt disturb our stay. We had a view out the back but were on the 10th floor so it was nice and got lots of sun in the afternoon. Its not a 5 star resort but the rooms were clean, well laid out and beds comfortable. Pools were warm enough to swim in during Winter and the staff were excellent. Everything is going to be slightly over price because its Disneyland but we came expecting that and it wasnt rediculous. Steakhouse restaurant is a great Place to get away from the noise of the kids for a quiet breakfast as well. Right at the end of Downtown Disney and an easy walk to the parks. Can definitely recommend.

This is our second stay in 6 months We brought our service manager and his daughter this stay as a celebration for a great year  We reserved a suite because we have a baby that needs a separate  room to fall asleep so we can stay up later than 8 pm And a regular room for them  Unfortunately we ended up in separate towers far away  The pool is closed for construction but it's too cold in my opinion to enjoy it anyway We stayed in the suite with the fireworks  view and it was an amazing view!!  The front desk people were very confused as to which tower our room was in and our friends had to basically guess where their tower was!  I'm not sure why they separated us when we booked so far in advance but that's how it goes We asked which view we had and were told it was a pool view

Summary Heading: As expensive as it is, they could have removed the graffiti from the wall
Summary: My husband and I were quite shocked that the Disneyland Hotel is not maintained at a higher standard. The hotel clearly needs to be renovated. The corridors were raggedy.  Our room was outdated and there was evidence of graffiti on our wall that was scrubbed but not truly repaired.  Guests should not need to wonder what transpired earlier in their room.  The carpet smelled like a wet dog. Thank goodness my 4 year old daughter didnt understand any of this and just found it wonderful.

Summary Heading: Your Key to the Magic Kingdom
Summary: Compared with the new Californian hotel this is the poorer older sister but don't let that put you off - the prices are significantly cheaper and this hotel is great for what you want - in fact it provided more than what we wanted in terms of space, facilities and cleanliness. We were three generations travelling together so the suite of two bedrooms, 3 bath, kitchen and spacious lounge was perfect - the hotel is not tired but retro and no longer has the monorail running through it or the old pirate bar but it is right beside the Downtown Disney where restaurants, bars etc are aplenty. It is quiet and restful after a day in the Park!! I recommend it for families and those not wishing to pay the higher prices of the more luxurious hotel. I was impressed with our stay.

Summary Heading: An Average, Very Over Priced Hotel
Summary: We took our 5 year old grandson to Disneyland just before Christmas. We generally go to Disneyland once a year. In the past we have stayed at the Grand Californian but because of a bad experience there last year we tried the Disneyland Hotel. We paid for a deluxe room with a pool view. We were assigned the Fantasy Tower. The room was just OK. The beds were comfortable. There was just one stuffed chair in the room with a floor lamp that looked like it came from a thrift store. One day we were in the park from 7am until 4 pm and returned to find our room had not been serviced. Really? Gone all day and they couldn't get to our room. There have been some really nice places built up around Disneyland but the problem is you don't get the early morning entry unless you stay at one of

Summary Heading: Clean, basic amenities, pool is closed
Summary: Cheaper than some of the other hotels on Disneyland property, especially the Californian, it is equally close to downtown Disney and the entrance to the park.  Really super close to California adventure, if that's your destination.  Bigger rooms that some of the other "themed" hotels.  Clean with nice decor and basic amenities, like a fridge in each room and a separate toilet stall area in the bathrooms.  Helpful and courteous staff.  It's totally worth it to spend a little extra to be able to walk out of your hotel onto park property directly, save you energy for walking around the park and enjoying yourself.  Currently the pool area (but not the hot tubs) is closed, which was a bummer but it's outside anyways and it was too cold for swimming when we visited.

As you approach the hotel you could tell that there was magic in the air. The bell service was quick and courteous and checking in was a breeze. our room wasn't quite ready yet so waited around the hotel until we got the notification that it was done. When we got to the room we realized that it was the same exact room we had 10 years ago when we were on our honeymoon. We were blown away by that coincidence. It was interesting to see how the room changed since we last stayed there. They had just recently cleaned the carpets and so there was kind of a musty smell but after a day it ended up going away. Turn down service was amazing and the little chocolates on our pillows maid coming back special. The room was very well decorated and the bathroom large. I really wish they kept

Summary Heading: Not the Experience we Hoped for
Summary: While we enjoyed the 3 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel, like everything else at Disneyland it is over priced for what you get.  The service is good, they have amenities such as restaurants, gift shops, pools, etc. but it left me wanting more.  First of all, the restaurants that we tried were just ok, although we didn't try the steakhouse.  They lacked a good family restaurant that served quality diner type food all day.  Instead, you had to go through room service for sandwiches, etc.  The rooms were nicely appointed but nothing special.  And the hotel was a fair walk to the park through Downtown Disney.  I think the next time we would pay the extra to stay at the California Adventure just to compare.

My family & I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel June 2015 for 2 nights. We really liked how convenient the location is to the park. I have never been to Downtown Disney but being right next door was the best! We also enjoyed the swimming pool & slides & eating at Goofy's Kitchen. If you have kids, doing character dining is a must! It was pretty expensive which is why I didn't give the hotel 5 stars but it is an experience everyone should have atleast once in a lifetime!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in the ideal location
Summary: Disneyland hotel is awesome.  It puts you conveniently close to all the action including Grand Californian, the two theme parks and you get to walk to it all.    The rooms are nice and large -- they are built in the 60s -- and updated to modern standards.    Room service and cleaning just great.    No noise from other rooms.

What a wonderful stay!  More than we usually pay for a hotel room especially when we don't spend much time in the room however the convenience of being close the park and downtown Disney was so worth it!  My kids (15,17) loved the room décor right down to the lights on the headboard!  I only have two complaints about our stay 1. the first day we came back at 3:00 to nap and housekeeping was just getting to our room (thought that was pretty late) 2. housekeeping didn't replenish tea or leave more than 1 coffee packet even though she saw we were using them.  So really if those are my biggest complaints!

Summary Heading: Great experience, we will be back!
Summary: First time staying at the Disneyland hotel. My 2 year old son saw Goofy in the lobby during check in and exclaimed "Wow, I love it!"  That kicked us off for a great stay. The room was nice. The music box and lights (over the bed) were in-room treats for my son that he really enjoyed. Great to be so close to the park during our stay. Monorail to Disneyland was convenient. Dined at Goofy's Kitchen on property - another hit with my son who loved seeing all the Disney characters during breakfast. We will be back for sure!

My wife and I have stayed here many times. It is pricey but when you only visit once a year sometimes it's worth it to splurge. In June last year we decided to stay at the DH and it was awesome. THe new pool area is spectacular and our grandkids loved the place. Goofy's Kitchen is also a must-do activity.

If you want to keep the magic alive even after the parks have closed, stay at a disney property. They could not be more convenient location wise, especially with the perk of magic morning access. Check in took a while, but there were so many people in line, i can't really fault the employees who were doing their best. The gift/sundry shop in the lobby has a pretty great selection of drugstore needs. Access to the parks was a breeze, the hotel had great air conditioning, necessary for the time of year i was there, and the staff was lovely. Have stayed here before, will stay here again for sure.

Stayed for one night after the Rose Bowl.  Traffic to Downtown Disney and the Hotel was terrible but that's just bad timing and no reflection on the hotel.  The Disneyland Hotel just screams Disney to me.  We are very loyal WDW people and we loved the hotel.  The refurbishments they have made makes this a wonderful place to stay.  I actually used DVC points for our stay. Not the best use of points but worked out great.  The rooms are very large and have everything you'd need.   The proximity to Downtown Disney and the park entrance was wonderful. My son and I walked over to DTD and checked out the shops and ate at ESPNZone.  The next morning got up early and walked to the park.  Took us 7 1/2 minutes from front of hotel to park entrance.  It was a breeze.  Would stay here again

We have the suite in Frontier. It was awesome because we could watch the fireworks from our room.  The service was great and everyone was cheerful and friendly. I would highly recommend staying there.  It is a bit spendy for someone worth my salary but it is a trip of a lifetime!  So glad I could come with my daughter and her family.

Summary Heading: Great views and quick park access
Summary: Just finished our first visit to Disneyland. This resort is great for quick access and extra magic hours. We stayed premium room frontier tower. Had a balcony of resort pool view and partial theme park view. This allowed us to see the nightly fireworks from our room. The laundry facilities on site are very convenient. The beds are comfortable and rooms updated. Only negative was the noise from downtown disney that carries up to the rooms late into night. Other than that it was a great trip and will stay again!

Summary Heading: Ok it's still a Disney Hotel but...
Summary: Stayed at the Fantasy Tower for 2 nights between 2 and 4 Jan. We were a bit disappointed with the outdated hotel, from the lobby to the room.  It's sill very 70/80s and require a major refurbishment.  Given that we paid almost USD 500 a night we expected more  But after all it's Disney Hotel right on Dismaland Park.

Great rooms with nice detailing includomg mickey mouse bed spread, mickey mouse shower and cute light up sign above the bed. Super close if you are spending time at disneyland, and friendly staff. Awesome pool and waterslides for the kids :).

I LOVE this hotel! It does cost more than others but it is worth the money. There are little Disney touches ever where. Customer service was fantastic. We did have an issue with the power going out and not having the front desk notify us, we had a dialysis machine that then reset. They were very kind in helping us and rectifying the situation. I have stayed at other resort hotels and this is by far my favorite. The rooms are much larger than the other hotels. We have stayed here several times and we keep coming back.

I took my daughter and my niece to this hotel for the D23 convention in August.  We get there and we want to check in, but they said "it was too early".  I figure it was summer and a convention going on so I paid it no mind.  We come back at 4:00 to check in, they send us on the way to our room.  The hotel room was not my standard, but I guess I didn't make specific accommodation for when I reserved it. Most hotels would have said that is your problem.  I called to see if I could change it, but fearing the summer crowd and D23 I would not get anything better. They said we can do a better view upgrade with better bed accommodations.  I felt special like Disney does.  We moved and it had what I wanted and for no extra charge.

We typically stay at the Grand California when we stay over at Disney, but this winter we decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  I was a great choice!  I love all the little Disney touches, especially the light-up headboard!

I've visited this hotel twice for business events and have enjoyed the Adventure Tower both times.  Rooms facing Downtown Disney have a great view of the fireworks each night.  Other rooms have a nice view of the resort and pool area.  It is a very short walk to the lobby and restaurants.  I would dart out the back for a quick walk to Downtown Disney for lunch.  The rooms are exceptionally clean and the music box and lighted headboards are the stars.

It sounds like the "music" from downtown Disney is right underneath us. We plan on going to the park early but we will be wiped out due to the inability to sleep. We are paying a lot for this trip (duh- it's Disney) and it is being completely ruined. Very much not like Disney. Not to mention the room is loud anyway with maybe the pipes or something - can't quite figure it out. Instead of sleeping, all we get is this reverberating noise of a band constantly. Maybe stay somewhere else if you desire to sleep in your very expensive hotel room.

Our family got connected rooms and stayed as a group. We were happily surprised with the level of care and service they staff give. Also, I highly recommend getting the concierge service. The extras are well worth the money. You'll save enough just on the free breakfast each day to make it pay for itself.

We decided to give Disneyland a try the day after Christmas. We knew we were going to have a ton of company, but the crowds were a little overwhelming. Most rides averaged between 45 minutes and 1 1/2 hours. With that being said my daughter enjoyed the Pirates of the Carribean, Mr. Toad, Alice in Wonderland, Jungle Cruise, Snow White, and Tarzans treehouse. Her favorite ride was Pirates, but she loved the parade. I would recommend that Disney have a limit to the number of people in the park at one time.

Got the one bedroom suite.  Wonderful!  TV's are outdated.  Great views of fireworks.  The concierge package is 200 a night - not worth it unless you drunk a lot of wine.  Continental breakfast was horrible.  They have loads of sodas etc but no bottled water.  That's all we drink.  Loads of staff in concierge which could be why it's so expensive.  I did call and explain my unhappiness - they took care of me.  This room rocks!!

Summary Heading: Always fun to stay in Disneyland Hotel.
Summary: The convenience and perks of staying in a disneyland hotel have always been my top priority when visiting the parks. Although, I would say this is the least likable among 2 of their other properties I've stayed in - Orlando and HongKong.  Maybe because they have limited complimentary (no slippers, no water, etc.). Don't get me wrong, the overall experience is always a pleasure especially if you're a first timer.

After hearing about Disney renovating this hotel and with full occupancy at the Grand California Resort, I decided to stay here versus Paradise Pier Hotel. We had a car service so I did not experience parking or valet services. Upon walking in you are greeted by a large gingerbread house where typical every Disney property has one including a unique holiday tree.  We arrived late Sunday night and seemed pretty dead here but was checked in quickly.  Since Disneyland Resort is not setup for MagicBands I was given key cards with our names printed on it. I already received a card for park passes and gift card via mail from Disney so was already set for tomorrow morning. Disneyland is not setup easily like WDW where all you information is accessed by your MagicBand and My Disney

As a longtime Disney lover I had always only been to Orlando. Last year we came to CA to experience Disneyland. We stayed at this hotel and loved it so much that we came back for spring back a second year in a row. The Disneyland Hotel is traditonal Disney. The rooms have amazing mickey detail and luxury. The pool.....monorail waterslides....need I say more?!?? The kids spend hours hanging out here.  We love the quick walk to downtown Disney for shopping and restaurants and of course the parks are minutes away! Would highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Below par service and facilities. Poor experience.
Summary: Recently stayed for 4 nights in a 2 room family suite, just before Christmas. Having paid more than double for the equivalent room in a 5 star Sheraton or Marriott hotel, I was very disappointed with the service and condition of the hotel. When we arrived after a 16 hour flight, there was no one to help up with our bags. Then, the reception staff sent us to the wrong tower, still with no offer to get help for our several large bags.... And they want gratuities! When we finally got to our room it was basically stocked. Minimal toiletries, despite being a room for 6 people. No slippers, no kettle, no spoons, cutlery or plates, etc. At the least the room had a nice view, but only after we kept requesting.  Breakfast at Goofys Kitchen was a let down. The food was more like a candy

Summary Heading: Disney, what more can I say
Summary: Nice visit, staff extremely helpful.  We arrived early and we given a room straight away.  Rooms a good size and the beds Coffey.  Short stroll to the parks. With the bonus of seeing Goofy at the hotel.    The early entry to the parks is great, we stayed at Christmas so this really helped

For our second trip to Disneyland we thought long and hard about staying at a Disney resort and finaly went with it. The extra cost was well worth it for a number of reasons: 1) Location - we paid extra for a premium room and it was worth it. We had front row seat for the fireworks every night and the hotel is close enough to take a break when the parks are at their busiest in mid afternoon. Monorail is a minute walk from front of hotel and security lines were always much smaller here too 2) Service - coming from Australia I always notice service when coming to USA but they have it in spades here. Nothing is too much bother for any staff member and the proactive greetings and smiles make for a truly happy experience 3) Room size - travelling with two boys aged 13 and 9 itvwas a

In Downtown Disney , Beautiful Hotel since you open the door you feel the Disney Magic, I went there on October with my son for his birthday, The front desk lady was sooo swet and friendly we talk about the mickeys halloween party and She told my son that when he was ready with his costume he should go and show it to her so we did she was the kindest and sweetest she took photos with us! lovely location you just walk thru downtown disney and you get to the parks, my son love the pools, everything was perfect until the made came and knock on the door every 5 minutes that was the only thing that I didnt like. Very Big rooms and comfortable , it is the best place to stay if you are going to the disney parks

This is my second stay at the hotel over the last couple of years and the service is still the same. Instead of canceling our trip to Disneyland, I spent my time in my room convalescing while the family went to the parks. What made my stay less than pleasant was, I called down to room service for a teaspoon to take my medicine, and the answer that came back is they "do not have any spoons" they can bring me. I was informed, I could walk over to the bar and ask them for one there; which I did. What was odd is when I ordered some soup for late night dinner, guess what utensils they brought up. The wait for room service is ridiculous over 90 minutes at midnight. On such a busy time period you would think they would staff better; it is not like the room are cheap $389.00 a night.

Stayed here for 4 nights with our 2 kids. It was our first visit and we had a 4 day park hopper ticket.  Magic morning was great especially for cars land.  Guest laundry was a great feature and the bells desk was very efficient in terms of receiving packages sent to the hotel. Hotel also located close to the downtown monorail which ends up in tomorrow land. Entrance into Californian adventure park via resort guest entrance of the grand Californian hotel.  Highly recommended

This was our second time staying at this beautiful property this year and it was as magical and perfect as the first stay.  We had a standard view room (employee parking lot) in the Frontier Tower. The room was spacious and elegantly decorated with wonderful comfy beds with nice linens. The tower is a short walk to Downtown Disney which leads you directly to the entrance of the parks in 15 minutes or so, depending on how fast you walk. The walk is safe as you never leave the Disney property.  In my opinion the cost of staying here is well worth it for several reasons: Early Morning Entry! Gaining entry to the parks an hour before the general public is a definite must. Location! Completely safe, short walk to the front gates of the parks or even shorter walk to Monorail. Pools!

Adult life taking a toll? Disneyland is the perfect escape! Disneyland is not just for the kids. Being a couple with no kids, I would have to say this was by far the most excitement we have had on a vacation in awhile. Imagine strolling hand in hand down  Main Street with all the lights on and sounds of excitement surrounding you... Simply Amazing. Disneyland is somewhere you can relax and just let everything else go. Forget about work, forget about the daily struggles and just enjoy your time in the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: Great service, nice surroundings, close to Downtown Disney.
Summary: We just returned from a trip to Disneyland and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for the first time in many years. It's been nicely updated and is very close to Downtown Disney and places like the Rain Forest Cafe, ESPN Zone, Earl of Sandwich and the movie theater, but is at the opposite end of Downtown Disney from the park entrances and security check points. You can ride the Monorail to Disneyland though which is closer to the Hotel and go through security there before boarding. There is an elevator to get up to the Monorail. All in all it was a great location and hotel experience and we could see the nightly fireworks from our room in the Fantasy (main) tower. Not sure about the view from other towers. Parking is not far away but is not free unless you're staying with Disney

I stayed here with some family and it was great. Top notch service. The pool is amazing and so is the on site dining and bars. The firework view rooms are totally worth the price, I guess, though I have no idea how much that is.

The last time we were at Disneyland, we stayed at a Good Neighbor Hotel, but learned that if you want the true Disney experience, you stay on-property. This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel and the experience was fantastic. We had a room that overlooked the pool. The room was very large and the hotel convenient to everything. A lot of excellent restaurants nearby, especially The Earl of Sandwich.

Great rooms and services available at the Disneyland Hotel.  Fantastic pool area and very close to the monorail that will take you straight into Disneyland Park. Staying at a Disney property also gives the added bonus of early entry into the park for everyday you have a valid ticket. It is just a fun and magical place, you may even get to meet some characters just walking through the lobby, one day I saw Minnie, Goofy and Pluto.

Summary Heading: Always wanted to stay at the original Disney Hotel!
Summary: The Disneyland hotel has lots to offer, clean, spacious, themed rooms,  a large pool area to include hot tubs and water slides, multiple on site dining options including Trader Sams for drinks, and most importantly it allows you a straight shot to the Disney parks via Downtown Disney.  This review will break down in more detail some of the Pros and Cons.  Rooms:  The room we had consisted of two comfortable queen sized beds connected by a single head board that had LED lighting that could display the castle and fireworks.  This was a very cool detail the kids enjoyed having on as they fell asleep each day.  The pillows and sheets were good quality, but the mattress was firmer than our liking, just barely though.  The walls had a good thickness, we rarely heard anyone outside of

The family really enjoyed this hotel. The pool's great the rooms are fun and the restaurant at the hotel are excellent. Access to the monorail was great. I only have two wishes for this hotel one that they get new shower heads and that they open up their restaurants an hour before park opens we could not enjoy breakfast at the hotel as much as we would have liked because of this. Room service was good but too expensive to do everyday.

Summary Heading: Cross this hotel off the bucket list!
Summary: Ever since I was a kid I've wanted to stay at the Disneyland hotel and ride the monorail to the parks but it was always completely booked because the times we visited coincided with events or peak seasons. Fortunately this time around, my family was lucky enough to get a room in the adventure tower and from there we could see downtown Disney and part of the California adventure park.  If you've read some of my other reviews you'll notice a trend: clean room, clean bathroom and reasonable price. This hotel was able to fulfil all 3 (bear with me on the last one). The room comfortably fit the 4 of us, everything was clean and mousekeeping did a great job of keeping it that way. All staff we encountered were professional and friendly even when faced with animated guests.  Location

We were greeting with a special signed photo from Minnie to our Granddaughter....everything was just perfect.  The only thing that wasn't so great was that there was no water available in the hotel floor vending machines!  And all the vending machines required credit cards.

Not only is this an iconic hotel, but it is also beautiful.  From the LED/musical headboard to the mickey shaped faucet handles, not an item is overlooked.  The room was clean and spacious and in a perfect location.

We stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights at the end of our Honeymoon. We are big Disney fans and wanted to stay on site to make our trip as easy as possible. The hotel staff were very friendly in traditional Disney style and it was about a 10 minute walk to the park entrance through Downtown Disney. The room was lovely and clean with Disney touches (we loved the light up, musical headboard). Would definitely stay here again.

I visited Disneyland with my sister and decided to splurge and stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It was a walk down memory land since my sister is ill and I thought having a place to take a nap in the afternoon would help our visit. This hotel is first class from the greeting at the guard gate, to the front desk check in, to the lobby helper to the car attendants. We were so impressed with everyone we interacted with I never expected that at the Disneyland Hotel. Every request we made was responded to with a positive helpful attitude and everyone went out of their way to make our visit special. The floor maid made sure we found the ice we needed and went out of her way to be helpful. The room was comfortable and the bed and linens outstanding. What a view of the Park and of

The hotel is not worth the price we paid for a premium view. At first they tried to sell the pool view as premium but with a simple request for a view of Downtown Disney , the desk clerk disappeared in the back to ask their supervisor if they could change our room. We then ended up with a 7th floor view of Disney.    The room is comfortable, clean and comes with multiple Disney channels including a storytelling channel with some scary princesses reading the stories.  For a mere 200.00 more we could have had the concierge floor.  Prices have risen since we stayed 3 yrs ago, no surprise there.  You are paying for the convience of staying close to the park and getting in 1 hour early with everyone else.  The magic has left Disney, someone just needs to close the door.

Decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, I must say they have kicked it up a notch, the rooms are nice, I wish they have more in the lobby of the towers but all in all it was very nice.   Accessing California Adventure through the California Grand was a big plus.  If you look around the hotel they offer a number of things to do, trader sams in the evening was great.   There is alot of walking from the hotel to the entrance of the park with no transporation offered, I did miss all the holiday decoration within the hotel Christmas seem to take a back seat.  I talk to a hotel staff member that stated they put less than 10 percent of what they typically  put out mainly they are still in the daimond celebration.   Maybe next year things will go back to celebrating Christmas.  If the

Nothing beats the magic of Disney! I stayed in a standard room, but ended up with a great view of the Matterhorn and the fireworks show. I went for Christmas, and the hotel had beautiful decorations for the holiday.   The only thing I would change would be to skip on the room service. It was convenient, but so is the small coffee shop near Goofy's Kitchen. I ended up spending way more than I planned!   It was definitely cool getting to send stuff back to the hotel instead of carrying it around all day.   I loved the pool! Even in the middle of December the water was perfect. My 3 yr old was able to splash in the small wading pool, which was really fun for him. There is a cute little area near the pool to sit in front of a fire and maybe catch live music from the little tiki

Summary Heading: This hotel probably doesn't need another review, but here goes.
Summary: I had people tell me that this hotel wasn't worth the price. I really disagree. The rooms were fabulous with great decor and comfy beds. The hotel itself is also gorgeous, but the real star is the service. If you have the means to go there, do it.

If mold on the floor, pubic hairs in your bath tub (upon arrival) and foul smelling and harsh water is your idea of a complementary place to stay while you dare the race against wait times in line to melt downs then the Disneyland hotel is for you.  Couple the aforementioned with nightly rates upward of $500/night and well... it's a match made in heaven.  The foul smelling water was REALLY awful and just down right harsh on all of our hands and faces!  No thank you!

This hotel is very magical and I have stayed here 3 times now. Yes it is expensive but we all know that when we book it so I don't know why people complain about the price. The best parts are - the headboards in the bedrooms! Gorgeous song plays and lights up the room. So magical. Pool area was pretty cool and the kids loved it! Having the characters in the lobby on arrival was awesome. No lines just 8-10 people with Chip and Dale, Minnie, Pluto and Goofy. Fabulous and was a highlight for myself and the kids. Early Entry was so good!! Pretty much walked onto all the long line rides at 8am like Cars. It was so fabulous walking past all the public and hour before it opened. Truly special. The not so good parts - this hotel is a good 15min walk to the gates. It was so much better

We both turned 60 this year but got horribly sick for the original date planned. At first the travel portion of Disney was unwilling to change the date but finally agreed to. This cost a lot of money to say the least. Very glad we upgraded to the "executive" floor to allow access to the hospitality suite. It has a great view of downtown Disney and a decent selection of nibbles including beer and wine and champagne. The room was nice and we loved all the extra Disney decor. It was a great time and would definitely return if we did the same thing, easy access to both parks, if you like a brisk walk, which we do. Lots of steps that weekend!

We decided to take our boys 4 and 6 for their first visit to Disneyland.  We booked our trip rather last minute thru Costco and got a regular room with parking lot view.  There were no other options available.   The room was clean and well kept.  Given the number of kids that went thru this place, it was very clean.  The hotel itself is walking distance to the two parks, but it is a far walk for a 4 year old.  We jumped on the Monorail a few times but it only takes you directly into Tomorrow Land.   The hotel itself was very peaceful and quite, unlike the zoo that is Downtown Disney.  We ate in Goofy's Kitchen for the Character breakfast.  The food was ok.  However the Banana Fosters Crepe is awesome.  There were not to many characters that came around either.  We had done a

This is a 3-star hotel, but not at 3-star prices.  It is a pretty far walk to/from the park, and you have to go thru a 1/2 mile retail-gauntlet to get there.  Not all rooms have wi-fi, mediocre bathrooms and bad water pressure.  The pools were nice, and the staff was friendly.  It was fine, but I would probably not stay here again.

Stayed for one night while visiting Palm Springs. Very easy to navigate. The property was quiet and comfortable. The unit was a little small and being on a high floor, the floor to ceiling windows made me a little uneasy. The room was stunning though. Absolutely perfect. If you're a fan of hot showers, like I am, test out the faucet before getting in. I spent 3/4 of my shower freezing before I finally had it figured out! The theming throughout the property was lovely. Wish we could've spent more time there for sure.

We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel ever year since 2010.  Clean rooms, great location, big pool with monorail slide, two hot tubs.  It is a older hotel that I remember staying at as a kid.  It was redone in the last 7 years.  We had twin beds and pull out sofa.  Slept 5 well.   It is a step below the grand Californian hotel.  Grand Californian is a better hotel and located at California Adventure. Not sure worth the extra price. A lot of walking to and from parks from the Disneyland hotel.  Monorail is quickest but only goes to tomorrow land. We keep staying here yearly so should say enough.

We checked in on November 26, 2015, thanksgiving day. We stayed one night in a Premium View Club Level room. When we arrived our front desk agent, Violent, had a bit of an attitude when checking us in. I did cut some slack due to the fact that it was a holiday. Next, club level or the E Ticket Club. The E Ticket club located in the Adventureland Tower, is open from 6:30 AM to 10:00 PM. The agents upon arrival were very friendly and professional. The main cast member we enjoyed for the morning shift was Daminique. He was very funny and great with my teenagers. Also Robert, our food and beverage server was absolutely great. Next, the room. Upon entering the room, the room had a very putrid smell. It had a bleach and human feces smell. We had to go to the concierge and ask for a

Ever since I was a little kid, I have always wanted to stay at he Disneyland Hotel. The thing that had always prevented me was the cost. This time though, I decided to finally do it and I was not disappointed. The first thing I have to say is how grateful I was that after paying the down payment, I was able to make payments for the rest of the trip which was a huge help. The valets were so incredibly nice and took such great care of my car and I appreciated them having to bring back to me a couple times when some items were forgotten. The room was so beautiful and he beds so comftorable and we loved all the little details in the room like he light up headboard and the Mickey head handles in the bathroom. The only two minor complaints I had were that the Wi-Fi wasn't very good

If you're going to Disneyland you may as well do it properly, and the Disneyland Hotel didn't disappoint.  Great rooms enjoyable for kids of all ages, wonderful pool even in winter. Good dining options and a close walk to the park. The magic hour access was valued and allowed us to get more out of our visit. Room service was expensive with additional charges but high quality. Wouldn't stay here every weekend but for a once (or twice) in a lifetime experience it's highly recommended.

Very good for a family with many Disney touches. Valet, Bell, HSKP and Room Service were fine as well as the check-in process. Water in bathroom had a bad smell, TV did not work properly and clock was not set. Seems like the room needed inspecting prior to sending guests. Aside from this, it still is a great place to stay.

I love the lobby here where you can sit in tea cups (like the ride).  It is great for the random character appearances.  Walking into Downtown Disney for meals or the monorail into Disneyland is super close.

Summary Heading: 4.5/5 Overall great, the location is excellent
Summary: Ok, off the bat the reasons I didn't give 5/5 were this: the free wifi was horrible and the water that came from our bathroom tap smelled like burning. I know other reviews have said it smells like sulphur, but our water smelled like something was burning. Obviously not the end of the world, but.. weird.. especially when you are paying high dollar for a room.   Our experience here was great. We did valet parking the day we arrived (a Saturday around 11am) for ease of getting bags and not wanting to waste time then switched to self parking for the rest of our stay the next day. Valet parking was $28/day, self park is $18/day.  We checked in just after 11 and the girl who looked after us, Reiley I believe her name was, was great. She was friendly, helpful and sweet with our

This was not my first visit to this hotel. I have stayed at this resort hotel over the past 10 years. As I have said before Disneyland is not in the business of hotels, they are in the entertainment business and what you are paying for is the convenience of staying on site.   For the amount of money you pay I did find the bed and pillows to be very comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful and the location to be of value since you are a short walking distance to the Monorail which whisks you away to Tomorrowland and the Disney Railroad where you can access Main St, New Orleans Sq, and Toontown while saving your poor tired feet and aching back for the lines.   The hair care products are average, the room was spacious, the view is nice and the hotel and surrounding area is kept

For the cost was very disappointing. No customer service in fact we didn't see a hotel staff member after we checked. Was also not warned that to make the most of the magic hour (which was a big incentive to stay) to get there half hour early. Hence we queued for 45 minutes which wasted most of the magic hour. Also we weren't told there was a event on on the Tuesday which meant you could not move in the park.  The wallpaper was peeling of the walls, the shower head leaked. Was told we could use our charge card everywhere in the hotel but you can't use it in the laundry or with any of the vending machines. Very disappointing to have saved for 5 years to come from Wetsern Australia to do this experience. Wifi was a joke and didn't work everyone was complaining about it. It made it

Summary Heading: Another fun trip after a Disney Run
Summary: Love to stay at the hotel after the Disney Run's. The room is expensive compared to the good neighbor hotels, but it's nice to have the magic hour, but I still say, stay one day just by the pool. The kids will love it, it's relaxing they have so many lifeguards and it's just well run and safe. Your able to actually have a drink and enjoy yourself.

I love Disney, and everything about it!  I will almost always stay at a Disney property when i go because you just can't beat the convenience of being so close to the parks.  Last time we went, we stayed at the Grand Californian and it was amazing. We stayed at the Disneyland hotel this time, and it was our first time back there since they remodeled.
