I have to say, i was a little disappointed in the rooms, which pains me to say because I've  never been disappointed in Disney...ever.  Maybe my expectations were a little too high before I got there, which is totally possible.  The headboard lit up which was fun, and the lamp that you switched on to turn on the lights also played "A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes" but i think the batteries were going bad or something because it

We have stayed in this hotel be fair and like it because of its great location within the OC and our son can get Disney interaction without going into the Disney parks.  The rooms are clean and spacious enough and have food and shopping nearby to satisfy everyone in the family.  Yes, the room rates are high and the parking fee is outrageous, but where else can you stay and hang out with Goofy and Mickey in front of a roaring fire.

My husband and I took a spontaneous trip to disney. The valets were polite and the front desk staff were helpful enough. Our room had a king bed with large windows that looked out over downtown disney. The room was clean and had some fun Mickey accents. This Hotel has a lovely pool area and is kept nice and clean. During our stay I noticed that the pool area was never crowded, which is nice if you are the type that likes to relax by the pool ( we were also there in january but the temps were 75 degrees plus during our stay). We enjoyed the walk through downtown disney on our way to and from the park. I rate the hotel as "very good".  * * My biggest complaint is with the booking of our room which we did over the phone and this is a BIG deal to me as an American: I called the

We, (daughter, sister and myself) arrived at the hotel close to 9am after a very long flight from the West Coast of Australia. Check in was efficient but not much else, maybe because I was checking into a Disneyland hotel I expected friendly, unfortunately the gentleman checking us in was a bit of a grumpy bum, we were told our room would not be ready until 3pm but if our room was ready before we would receive a text. We were then directed back outside so we could store our bags, no help offered with our cases but that's ok you don't travel to the other side of the world and not be able to handle your own bags, I just thought it might be a nice touch. We headed straight out to the parks to fill our day and by 2pm exhaustion had set in so headed back to see if there was any

True to Disney form much attention is paid to every detail and therefore it's a great place to stay. It is clean, fun, and it makes a Disney trip easy with the kids with the proximity to the park. I have a so-cal select pass so when I go to Disneyland with my nephews we like to go to the hotel on Sunday and spend time at the pool, it's fun for the kids and adults. The walk to downtown Disney is so easy and the monorail station is pretty close by if you don't want to walk all the way to the park entrance. The restaurants are pricey and reservations are highly recommended.

This hotel is in a great location if you are visiting Disneyland. The rooms are spacious and clean. The Disney theming is fairly subtle. Staff (cast) were friendly and helpful.   My only issue with the hotel was the hot water in the shower. It was pretty cool the days I was there, so I wanted a hot shower. Unfortunately, when you try to have a shower in the mornings a lukewarm shower was the best you could get. Not sure if that was just because of demand on the hot water at that hour or if they use a solar system. It was fine in the evening.   The soundproofing is not great, so more than once I got woken up by excited kids running up and down the corridor late at night (which wasn't appreciated given I was there for the half marathon weekend and had three days with 4am starts).

Even as a former Disney cast member this place chokes me up a bit. It's full of history and the magic that made Disney such a great place. Just walking the halls is amazing thanks to the concept art and memorabilia that hangs everywhere. Everyone should stay here at least once or just take a stroll here on the way to one of the restaurants.

Disneyland Hotel is the ideal place to stay!  Receive early admission to the parks!  Ease to get in and out; proximity to Downtown Disney.  Was here for a RunDisney event. We stay on the concierge level and receive access to the E-Ticket Lounge.  Breakfast, snacks during the day, adult beverages and light appetizers, dessert.  Yes, you pay a little more for this service, but is simplifies things.  The staff at the lounge is there to assist you in every way.  Matt was one of the concierge there that i want to recognize!  Thank you

This was our 2nd trip to the Disneyland Hotel.  For anyone that is visiting Disneyland, you have to stay at this hotel at least once.  Customer service is incredible!  Our room was beautiful and there are hints of Disney throughout the room.  The wall above the beds is a beautiful display of the Disney castle.  For anyone with younger kids, I'd recommend a wake-up call (which is Mickey calling).

We had a fantastic stay at the hotel during our most recent trip to Disneyland. You are definitely paying for and getting a fully immersive disney experience when you stay at a resort hotel. The whole atmosphere is awesome as was the staff. we stayed in the Frontier Tower and each tower lobby is decorated to reflect that land in DL ( also fantasy tower and adventure tower.) our room was so nice we got the light up headboard with a picture of the castle (that made my whole trip!) cute disney touches all over the room and bathroom too. one of the best things about the DLH hotel compared to Paradise Pier Hotel is that is a very short walk into Downtown disney and a very short walk to the monorail to go directly inside the park to Tomorrowland. also our room had a great view of the

This was a great hotel to stay in for our first trip to Disneyland.   Our flight had been bumped up about two hours earlier than we had planned, so we actually arrived in Anaheim by around noon. When we got to the hotel, we were greeted by Kevin, who assured us that there were no problems with getting us checked in. He was even nice enough to offer us a Fireworks view, free of charge. I made sure to call the front desk back and ask Guest Services to thank Kevin again for me. Our room was also very nice. The light up headboard was a great touch. Our view not only gave us a view of the Disneyland fireworks every night, but we could also see the Matterhorn and Sleeping Beauty castle from our window. If I can also give my thanks to Maria A, the housekeeper, who took care of our room

Absolutely love staying at this hotel !!!! I've stayed here 2 times now and it will always be my first choice of places to stay at Disneyland 😊 Staff are great and the rooms are comfortable and have lovely touches of Disney throughout !!! We LOVE the twinkling headboards ❤️

Summary Heading: What you should expect from Disney!
Summary: Absolutely enjoyed our time. Had an internal debate about the concierge level service. We chose it ad sincerely did not regret it. Had breakfast and supper there when we were not at a specific restaurant - personnel are top notch - "Mousekeeping" staff did an outstanding job and everyone was so well suited to their position relative to outlook and temperament - from the ride personnel to the folks at the front desk-  they deeply enhanced our time with. Them through their courteous attention to details and obvious low off the facility... Cannot recommend it enough - and if you can definitively get one of the top floors facing downtown for a great view of the fireworks most evenings (look to the Matterhorn)!

The workers are very good at work. The room was cleaned every day. It was easy to find. I love that it was close to the attraction. Love the elevator how you can see the view of the monorail, Disneyland and Resort.

This hotel is incredibly dated for the price! It actually feels like you are stepping back into the 1980s. Room facilities are terrible! Not even a kettle or a crockery cup to have a cup of tea. Rather, there are cardboard cups with plastic sticks.   The location is great though, so I guess that is why you have to pay so much.   We stated there for 7 days in November 2015, and could not once get a table in the restaurant for breakfast. There were 20-30 min wait times for everything!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a great location
Summary: Disneyland hotel is just a short walk through downtown Disney to the parks. The hotel is great. The room was very clean and my kids loved the light up head board. The slide at the pool was closed for renovation, but the rest of the pool was nice. There are several interesting bars and restaurants on the property. I will stay here again next time I go to Disneyland.

Just returned from spending 6 nights at Disneyland Hotel.  We usually stay at the Grand Californian but it was full.  The travel agent assured us Disneyland Hotel was just as close to the park.  Not true.  It was much further to walk and we weren't sure we could even make it on some days.  And every time we passed the Grand Californian we thought how nice it would be to have a room there as we would finally be home for the night.  Disneyland Hotel lacked many features of the Grand Californian.  The bathroom could only be used by one person at a time whereas at the GC two sinks are outside the bathroom for three people can be getting ready at the same time.  Disneyland Hotel has futons rather than day beds and they were very uncomfortable.  And there is nothing comparable to

I highly recommend this place to all Disney fans of all kinds! All the hotel rooms are very amusing and really have an authentic Disney theme. The signature suites were my favorites, my favorite being the Mickey Mouse Penthouse Suite. The staff are very attractive and amusing to everyone. Even though this hotel is expensive, it is worth the money because you get to have an authentic life experience of staying in Disneyland Resort and experiencing Disney  theme and magic!

Worth the extra money staying on property. Got to go into the park earlier. Got a booklet of coupons for discounts and freebies. Convience of everything being right there. Something for everybody.  Enjoyed down town Disney with the great food and entertainment.

Summary Heading: stayed there with a toddler and it was great
Summary: We stayed here with a toddler (19 month old), obviously the location was great, as we would easily walk back to the hotel for her nap time and after we would take her to the pool which she really enjoyed and then back to the park. We were checked in by Ron, such a nice and polite person, our room had a great view of the fireworks, thank you Ron. We didn't go to the Goofy s restaurant as our daughter is still not big on the characters and somewhat weary of them. There was a fast food place by the pool which I disliked the quality of food, so low. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, the view, proximity to the parks and the pool was great. However I do think it is too expensive.

I am a huge Disney fan and this was my eight trip so far and I finally decided I just had to stay at this historic location. First, yes it is expensive, very expensive but I felt that it was worth every single penny.  First, it is (along with Paradise Pier and The Grand Californian) the closest you will come at Disneyland to the all encompassing experience of Disneyworld. The hotel while I was there was, in some parts, under construction as they constantly are in the process of making it better.  The rooms little touches were outstanding. You'll find a small switch on the lamp with a picture of tinkerbell on it. If the room is dark and you flip the switch the backboard of the beds lights up with Disney fireworks.  Just one of those small touches.   There are is fancy sit down

Our room was very comfortable with views over the pool area. The walk to the parks was easy and this was a big plus after being in the park for hours. Close to lots of restaurants and a couple of good eating places within the hotel grounds we did not know about. We stayed at the Grand Californian on our last visit which is amazing but as it was booked out we booked this hotel and saved allot of money. Very happy with our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: First stay in a Disney hotel!
Summary: This was my first time staying in a Disney hotel. We stayed for the Disneyland Halloween Party weekend Oct 31- Nov 1. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. We used the valet and bellman service because we had lots of bags and they helped us get everything (valet parking was $28.00). Check-in was a breeze. We arrived a few hours early, and they were able to let us check in early to our room. Since it was my nephew's first time at Disneyland the woman at check in gave him a special mickey Halloween necklace that he loved.   Our hotel room was located in the "Frontier Tower" which was the 3rd tower past the pool. Our room had a direct downward view of the pool/water park area. Everything was spotless in the room and bathroom. There is a hair dryer under the cabinet of the

Summary Heading: Great location, well thought out theme/ experience, great for people who highly value Disney
Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights recently as part of a company trip. The hotel's location is unbeatable and the front desk staff were very thoughtful and friendly. Special thanks to Katie for helping me with copies I needed to make at the last minute. The hotel room is standard and nice. The extra Disney touches include hidden Mickeys throughout the room and headboard that lights up and plays music. Bottles of water would have been a nicer touch. Overall the room and service met expectations but for the price, I do wish I had seen more value. I will admit I'm not in their target market, and if I was, I'd probably give 5 stars. I suppose its all about the memories vs. the price. Happy travels!

Summary Heading: Not the best, not the worst...
Summary: Stayed 4 nights for a conference in November 2015. The room was ok - comfortable enough and well maintained. The rest of the hotel seemed like it needed a little TLC - a few maintenance issues I noticed around the hotel, and some of the furniture looked a little long in the tooth.   I'm sure there are great views to be had, but sadly from mine the only view was of a construction site. Having Downtown Disney on your doorstep is very useful for dining options.   I had a special rate for my conference around the $200 mark, which felt like decent value. I believe the standard rack rate is north of $300, which would feel like poor value.

Our visit was actually in August of 2014, but there was no option for this date. The Disneyland hotel had been on my bucket list since I was a child, as I'm sure many people would love to go there at least once in their lives, but in Sept 2013, I went with my wife and oldest for my 40th, and we would return a year later. The hotel is truly an amazing experience. A great pool, great views, and WORLD CLASS service. You are truly meant to feel special here. Try Steakhouse 55 for a great meal too. There are 3 towers to the hotel, we have stayed at 2. Adventure land tower, and frontier, I preferred the Frontier land tower just over Adventure land. Try to get a resort facing view. Yes, it is more, but the view of the aprks, and fireworks is SPECTACULAR!!

The Disneyland hotel is quite nice, but the ambiance is not like the Grand Californian or like other Disney resort hotels. It seemed like something was missing but can't quite identify what it was. We were there for Halloween but the hotel wasn't decorated like GC. There were characters out in the lobby during check-in, which was quite entertaining.The staff was alright but not as friendly or accommodating as other Disney resort hotel staff. Ended up getting a room on the 7th floor of the Adventure Tower, overlooking Downtown Disney and part of DCA. The room was clean, and the display above the bed was cute. The bed though, seemed to be lopsided and was slightly uncomfortable due to the mattress being very uneven. Housekeeping did a good job and was very tentative when we needed

Traveled down to Disney to celebrate a 50th birthday.  Hotel was clean and appears to have been recently refurbished.  We stayed in the Adventure Tower 10th Floor.  Had a great view of downtown Disney.  We had club access which was nice to get a snack or a glass of wine / beer when we needed a break from the park.

The best reason to stay here is the location.  You can walk through Downtown Disney right into the parks.  The rooms are on the small side, but you don't stay here to hang in the room.  The beds were very comfortable, nice mix of soft/firm pillows. The temperature was easily controlled. It has great huge windows (that don't open) but many of the rooms only look to the parking lots.  The pool area was very nice, big slide, good size pools.  The hotel food is nothing spectacular, the food in Downtown is a better bet.  The room safe was really small, I don't know that you'd get a laptop into it, I just locked mine in my suitcase.  Also, the sink area was small, not a lot of places to put things.  Was ok for 1 but a family might have more trouble.  It's one of the cleanest places

This hotel is beautiful, very expensive but worth every cent. The staff is amazing. I can not say enough about my experience I had. Next time I will want to try one of the sister hotels at the resort but I would not doubt me coming back here just because of the service. Thank you!!

My family and I stayed at here for 8 nights and we never left the Disneyland environment, i.e. Downtown, California Adventure and Disneyland itself.  Our room was on the 14th floor of the Frontier Tower and it was awesome.  Staff were so friendly, we came back to an immaculate room.  We just felt spoilt, for a better word.  Loved the fact we could do our own washing and it was easy.  The pool had an overload of life guards and they were vigilant about their duties, not overwhelming in your face, but you knew you were safe.  And the characters, WOW...love the Goofies Kitchen breakfast.  It is a heaven for little people.  Parents, you may have a heart attack.  There is every piece of food you would not have for breakfast, and some... cookies, ice cream, peanut butter pizza, hot

Summary Heading: Great family stay with all the Disney you want
Summary: This was a four night stay at the Disney Hotel with wife and eight year old daughter. We checked in very easily and everything was organised quickly including any park tickets.  As with any Disney hotel the service was friendly and helpful, there are all the Disney touches here from the decor of the lobby all the way to the rooms. The room itself was spacious for the three of us and we enjoyed the Disney touches like the light holders as Mickey's hands and the over bed lit display you can turn on. Room was in good repair, all worked and it was cleaned well.  We were in the Adventure Tower and had requested a view over Downtown Disney that afforded us a pretty good view of the fireworks (music via your TV) and you could just make out California Adventure water and light show.

Great hotel if you are travelling to Disneyland.Location is great since it is at the very entrance of Downtown Disney and only 10 min walk to the entrance of both Disney Parks.I had a family room for 5 which was ok and extremely clean.Pool is also a good size.Breakfast at Goofys Cafe was brilliant.Staff very helpful and cheerful as ysual in any Disney you go to.

We booked a premium view, club level room for 5 people. In typical Disneyland style the room was very well maintained. The free Wi-Fi was great and connection was good. We had a great view over Downtown Disney and could watch the fireworks from our room.  We also had access to the E-Ticket club which I wasn't sure about when booking but was definitely worth it. Would recommend to anyone to pay the extra for access to this area. A breakfast and good range of snacks and drinks all day. You could also take food and drinks back to your room. The Disneyland restaurants were ok but nothing wonderful so we made the most of what was available at the club.  The hotel is convenient to the parks so we could take a break during the day. The pool area at the hotel was great and we made the

My partner and I stayed here for two nights for a portion of our anniversary trip. Being at Disneyland, while I wouldn't call the hotel or the room very romantic, it was still a good room for two adults. Undeniably, however, this property is catered to families. The location is prime for anyone that plans on spending their days at the Disney parks and are a short walk from the park entrances and an even shorter walk to the monorail that goes directly to Tomorrowland. It's intensely convenient  if you plan to get to the park early and stay until close, and the proximity to Downtown Disney makes it a good place even if you don't go into the parks. The rooms are a good size for two adults, but I would imagine it being a bit of  problem as more people stay in the space. The bed was

I would recommend if you have little kids.  If your kids are 7+ then I would recommend you aim to stay at the California hotel connected to the park.   The rooms target the dream of Disney.  They are not over the top, but very classical feel.   The pool area is great and Goofy's kitchen is worth a visit.   Hard to find anything wrong with this hotel other than it is a big walk to the parks.  You get to walk through downtown Disney.  However with little kids be mindful of the distance given you will be walking a lot in the parks.

Summary Heading: Giving the price of the stay I was shocked at the smell of the running water at the sink.
Summary: This was my first time to California and my very first Disneyland experience ever.  The hotel stay is rather expensive.  I was shocked at the smell of the running water.  It smelled of Sulfer.  I would think Disneyland Hotel could afford to have water treatment at their hotel.  You gagged when you brushed your teeth from the smell of the water!  Also, your shower was a nightmare.  You start off with the right temperature you selected and immediately it would be as though someone shut the cold water off!  This is very bad when you think of children or elderly using the showers.

Peggy will check you in and make sure you have everything you need.  Catherine will make sure you find everything you need to bring quality gifts home.  The excellent client services at this hotel was exceptional.  Even though Cast Members in Disneyland yelled at us and it was not the least magical time, the hotel is great and I'd go back.

We stayed at the Disney hotel for 6 nights -2 adults 2 children (7,1) and although slightly pricey wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!  From the little disney touches through the room to the light up/musical headboard - it made our stay in Anaheim perfect!  We stayed in the Frontier tower with a view of the pool and the fireworks.  It was maybe a 10 minute walk to both park entrances but walking through downtown disney was just as magical!  We cannot stop raving about it to anyone who asks!!!!

It has been a number of years since we've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and being DVC we usually stay at the Grand Californian.  With the 60th happening and the property being remodeled not too long ago we decided to use our points to stay here.  Some may not think it is the best use of points, but we were happy with what we got.  We booked a premium room and were very happy with the large corner room with balcony that we received.  From our room we could see both Disneyland and a lot of California Adventure.  The king bed had the new headboard that included music and "fireworks" very cute.  The room also included a small fridge which is hand for both medicine (I'm a diabetic) as well as keeping some drinks cold.  The room had a modern feel with just enough Disney touches.  We

Our check in was quick and easy, the property was beautiful and our room was clean and modern.  The beds were very comfortable and adequately large for our family with 2 young childern.  Goofy shows up in the hotel lobby in the afternoons and it's a great time to get photos with your children and him without long lines of people.

Summary Heading: A Not-so-Happy Place in the Magic Kingdom
Summary: This should be a happy place. Then why only two "stars"? We scheduled a 4 day stay for a large meeting, making reservations 5 months in advance. We specifically requested room locations & accommodations due to age & disability factors. To make certain, we called several times including earlier on the day of arrival. Always told our request would be honored. We arrived shortly before midnight, exhausted after an 8 hour trip. We were told they were all sold out in the building we requested but id have a room in another distant building. This was not what we requested. This had major negative impact on our well being. The shift manager repeatedly said he was sorry but could do nothing. Finally after some 20 minutes he relinquished by assuring us that he would have a room as

This was the 6th time we have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and I think it may be the last until they do some changes. We stayed on a concierge floor and all of those offerings were exactly the same. But the hotel needs to upgrade for the price. It's a solid B Hotel and yes location is everything but so is luxury at these prices. We also dealt with having no power our last night from 1-5am. We of course had a 6am flight and woke to a stuffy sweaty room and took dark showers with sad little glow sticks provided by housekeeping. I barely slept because the room was so stuffy with no windows to open. I love Disney and I think Mr. Disney would be really sad to see his famous fancy hotel turn into a glorified Best Western. PLEASE respect this hotel and bring back the glamour and

Summary Heading: The hotel to stay at for an incredible Disney experience
Summary: We love the Disneyland hotel. It is our favorite hotel of all Disney properties in Anaheim. All the Disney properties are excellent. The staff has the Disney magic, the rooms are great for families and the pool is fun. We just visited DisneyWorld and we missed the quality experience of Disneyland. We stayed at the Dolphin and Swan hotel here. The Dolphin earns  a "D" for "Don't stay here". The Swan is ok (staff moved us there after 2 bad nights) but does not compare to the Disneyland hotel. The price might be high but it is worth it if you want to have an excellent family experience.

I've been wanting to stay here since I was little. That being said, they really need to update their beds. I felt like I was sleeping on a hill. When we checked in, my reservation was for a king bed, we were given two queens. We had called the front desk and they changed it for us That was the only issues we had. The room was always clean. Loved all the Disney touches. We never had a chance to use the pool or gym,  never had the time. Can't say we will stay there again due to the price but I enjoyed my stay while we were there.

Loved the generous sized room and proximity to both parks. Bed linens were so soft. Comfy beds. Goofy's Kitchen was awesome. Costco travel pkg was a great buy!! Loved. Been to Disney at least a dozen times and still did so many firsts. Elevators so slow - tip: Go to ones at end of hallway. Magic mornings make it worth the extra $$. We did the Cars ride 3X in a row! Would have given a five if the elevators weren't so slow. Sometimes a 5-10 min wait.

We stayed at Disneyland hotel for 3 nights in October 2015 for my birthday. After waking from an afternoon nap, I pulled back the sheets to find a full size bed bug in my bed! I'm still having nightmares about it. NOT what I expect to find at a Disneyland Hotel.  I took the critter to Guest Services. They apologized and offered to clean the room, gave us a $50 credit and left Mickey mouse cookies in our room with a Happy Birthday note. I'm hoping we didn't bring any bedbugs back home to our  house.   It was our 10th wedding anniversary, and my birthday. We were given a room at the back of the Frontier hotel, overlooking an ugly parking lot. NOT MEMORABLE.   On hold a long time to try to get Guest Services.

Although our tenth trip to Disneyland this was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel. And probably won't be our last.  We stayed in a two bedroom suite on the 7th floor of the Frontier Tower and we added Concierge Club to our booking upon arrival.  The suite was superb, both bedrooms were huge and the extra lounge space was very useful. Eticket lounge was great to see the fireworks one night and also a very handy place to collect drinks from.  We did eat breakfast only once as it was a bit over crowded with a lot of people eager to get a 'free breakfast'.  The distance to the park is a bit longer than from our normal hotel on Harbor Blvd but the convenience of the Monorail just outside the hotel made up for that. So easy to catch that and be in Tomorrowland before we

Found the hotel has slipped from prior visits in a few areas.  Room service needs some immediate attention from management.  We were on hold for over 20 minutes and just gave up.  No one should be on hold for more than 5 minutes for any hotel service request.  The second issue was that we returned to our room at 3 pm so our grandchildren could have a short nap before going back to the parks and the room had not been cleaned.   Housekeeping showed up around 3 pm preventing the much needed naps.    Again all contacts with Disney personnel was just excellent.

We stayed on the 10th floor of the Adventure Tower in a premium view room. The view is of Downtown Disney. You really can't see much of the 2 parks, although you can see the fireworks and the music is played through the television. I was expecting a better view of disneyland as when we stayed in a premium view room at Disneyworld, we had a view of Cinderella's castle and I was expecting a similar view. Club level allows access to the Eticket lounge. This lounge has a lovely selection of refreshments all day long including a continental breakfast. If you were a light eater, you could probably get away with not having to purchase many meals at all (although you really should try Goofy's Kitchen). The concierge in the lounge will assist with any holiday planning, dinner

We had a wonderful family trip, but after checking in housekeeping walked in to our room without knocking. We were on edge for the three days we were there. Keep your "do not disturb" tag on the door people...

From check in to check out it was wonderful.  Let's see, characters, pretty much always one by check in.  We saw goofy, chip,dale, Minnie, and Pluto. Great room- clean, headboard was very cool, Mickie's everywhere.  The pool and waterslides were fantastic. My kids loved them. And no need to worry because there are tons of lifeguards.  We ordered room service, my daughter says they were the best hamburgers she's ever had! We stayed in the adventure tower overlooking downtown Disney. It was plenty quiet. No trouble with sleeping.  It was great being right next to downtown Disney. So much just a step away. We took the monorail back to the hotel every time, so close.  Yes, it's more expensive, but I'm a cheapskate and this was worth every penny!  I would never stay anywhere else.

I spent and AMAZING few days at The Disneyland Hotel with a few friends as a "girls weekend" (in the middle of the week! HEHE) We had nothing but a good time! our room was FANTASTIC, just enough room for 5 ladies and all of our accoutrements (PS the room we had in Fantasy Tower has and AMAZING view for fireworks!) We were there obviously to go to the park, but I couldn't say enough about the hotel! the beds were so comfy, all of the magical little mickey touches were so cute and the headboard... (if I could pack that home I totally would!!) the staff was fantastic, always so helpful whenever we had a question or concerns, the ONLY reason for only give 4 stars instead of 5 was the WiFi was spotty, but oh well!  All In all... I'm hooked! I'll be staying at the Disneyland Hotel for

We have visited Anaheim a few times now and this time chose to end our family holiday on a high.  We spent 5 nights (of 13) at Disneyland Hotel (2 rooms for 2 families) which we were very excited about.  Who doesn't want to live the dream and stay at a Disney property? The hotel and its facilities were great, there's no doubt (love the bed heads) but what disappointed me was that you really don't receive any kind of perk or discount for choosing to stay at a Disney property.  Wait, no, we got to keep our personalised room keys and could visit the parks at 7am - um who gets up that early when on holiday? We had magic morning entry with our 5 day hopper passes anyway, so pretty much got room keys.   It kind of ruined the magic for me I have to say.  Wifi was terrible and though

This hotel has 3 separate towers.  We stayed in the Frontier tower which provided very little separation from the next room.  Yes I know we are in Disneyland and there are kids in Disneyland, but to have our whole family woken up every morning at 6am is unforgivable.  The room next to us had kids that would scream and cry at the stroke of 6am.  The walls were not thick enough to shield us from this assault.  The beds were horribly uncomfortable.  I realize that when I check into a hotel that my sleep isn't going to be as comfortable as home.  But this was bordering on ridiculous!  We woke up every morning with sore backs.  The beds are terrible!  The pool is good.  The cabana's are better (at $125 a pop).    On checkout, the clerks do not inquire about your stay and do not

Summary Heading: If this fits your budget i totally recommend!!!
Summary: After reading other reviews i was a little worried but after our trip i wonder if some of these people are ever happy! Ive traveled all over and stayed in hundreds of hotels and i was beyond happy with our experience as a whole!  We were a party of 5. Four adults and a three year old. We were in the frontier tower with two beds and a sofa sleeper. I was afraid of the frontier tower because of reviews but if we stay here again i will request it! We had a beautiful view of the pool and parking was directly at the back door by elevator couldn't get better! Everyone was wonderful from front desk to housekeeping! The room was so spacious we never felt crowded i wish i had pictures when you walk in there is a little office and closet area and bathroom. This made all the difference

Summary Heading: Best hotel out of the 3 on property.
Summary: First off, we love Disneyland. We've stayed at all 3 on site Disney properties over the years with our last visit on Sept 28 - 30, 2015. The original Disneyland hotel is the best in my opinion. Their are lots of guest rooms and more elevators per building, so getting on one is not an issue (Uh-hem Paradise Pier). We could stay off property and it will be ALOT cheaper but, I like the fact that no matter what time it is there is always an employee around. Whether it be a maid, security, maintenance etc. An employee is there so it feels safer. I love it and wouldn't want to stay any where else. The Grand is beautiful but always busy. Maybe a little to busy :)

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but didn't meet expectations
Summary: Our room was nice but nothing fancy.  Room didn't get cleaned one day. There was nothing special here making it feel like a Disney hotel. Bell service was not very helpful when asked about shuttle to airport. Long walk to Disneyland and California Adventure Park entrance. Overall, pretty disappointed.

Even though the grounds have been updated, the Frontier Tower still feels old. The strands of dental floss stayed on the hall carpet the 4 days that I was there. They have some parts of the lobby barricaded off. Check out bill left on our door, and no one ever asked us about our stay. It is a very impersonal experience.

Summary Heading: Great convenience, but Disney pared down
Summary: My 14 year old son and I were visiting my adult daughter in Los Angeles. We all love Disney and wanted to do some things we knew my son would enjoy, so I booked 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel. I knew it would be on the property and very convenient, and from past Disney experiences I knew it would include some extras, specifically the  "Magic extra hour" they offer for guests staying on property. This allows you to get to one of the parks an hour before it's open to the general public.  The hotel was clean, updated, and the staff was top notch, similar to what I have found at my many stays in Disney World in Florida. However if you are used to the Disney World top tier hotels, this one is a bit pared down. I enjoyed the references to its history, but felt it was pretty basic.

I stayed with my family at Disneyland Hotel during 2 weeks in january. Our room was at Adventure Tower and had a fantastic view from Downtown Disney Area and Disneyland's fireworks. The room is very comfortable with sufficient space for 2 adults and 1 kid (2 queens beds). The staff was very polite and helped us when we needed. This hotel is very well located since it is a walk distance from Downtown Disney, Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. A day, we were at Disneyland and started to rain a lot. We just went back to our hotel and waited. It was so convenient! After that, we went back to the park. My only complain is that it doesn't have a counter service for breakfast.

Summary Heading: Housekeeping missed a day of cleaning...but cleaned our friends room right next door...
Summary: Surprised to find no little extra's...i.e  ...No candy on pillows, and no special folded towels  like the Grand Floridian. No water bottles in room. Lobby was very plain. Staff member's were nice and courteous. Housekeeping for our room didn't speak English., and had to get someone to speak to us.Housekeeping also missed a day of cleaning our room.One queen bed was very squeaky every time you rolled over. Air conditioner in the room was very quiet and worked great! Hotel was quite a distance to the entrance, and the monorail was shut down for various reasons the 3 times we wanted to ride it. The value for this hotel just isn't worth the $400.00 a night we paid. We've stayed at various neighboring hotels that offer free breakfast and are a fraction of the price. Sorry, but we

Summary Heading: The best way to experience Disneyland
Summary: Sure it's getting on a bit, but the rooms are still very, very nice and it just feels Disney from the moment you pull up and with every nook and cranny.  I stayed there with my wife, 2 kids (6 and 4) and mother-in-law and we were all very comfortable. The beds are big and comfy, and we had a stunning view o f Downtown Disney and could see the fireworks every night (when we weren't there ourselves).  Speaking of Downtown Disney, the other two Disney properties are closer to the parks and with easier access but there's something about walking through Downtown Disney every morning and evening to get you in the mood and keep your spirits high, especially at Christmas time. We managed to check out quite a few eateries and bars Downtown which we probably wouldn't have done if we

Summary Heading: No pixie dust for my birthday 😞
Summary: I had the worse expirence in this hotel as. i payed for my son me my sister and her bbf asa sungle mom clise to 5000 for 5 days as i arrived having 2 elderlys they forgot about us so the promised a room with view handicaped  not i got a basic room with a tiny corner of fireworks check in was after 5 housekeepers were not clean for my birthday i had a great plan never celebrated it well since i didnt get the handicaped room the bath tub was so. Slipery no mats at all inside or out my sisters bbf fell out bath tub went to hospital i told them it was my birthday no reconsition not even with a birthday button they promised 2 day refund for 4 people as my elderly needed help with 1 down my child was not going to be stressed what i get after calling them lots times a miserable 300

Summary Heading: Comfy room, expensive property, bit of a walk to the park, great pool area!
Summary: We stayed here for a week in late Sept.  The hotel is/was dated, but has obviously been updated.  The price is steep for what you get, but what do you expect when staying at a Disneyland hotel?  The hotel was a further walk from the park than expected.  The Grand Californian is much closer but costs even more.  That said, we'd probably stay there next time instead (just for proximity).  This hotel has a GREAT pool area and the kids loved the waterslides and pool areas.  It was a good break from the park.  Also down on the main floor is Goofy's kitchen.  The kids LOVED breakfast there with the characters.    Service in this hotel was excellent (we used the front desk for info and assistance).  The gal who checked us in was possibly the most helpful front desk agent I've ever met.

Summary Heading: Great location but definitely needs some updating
Summary: We stayed in a one bedroom at the Disneyland hotel. As one reviewer noted, this place needs a little "pixie dust". Overall, I felt the staff was nice but nearly as over the top Disney as in Orlando. Our floor hallway needed a good cleaning. We found utensils one day and broken glass outside of our door (neither was ours). Our room was spacious and the light up headboard was a special touch. Our stay was nice, but it didn't leave me wanting to come back...

We have high expectations with Disney and in so many ways Disney delivers. But this reception and front staff make you feel like you are at an understaffed, under trained, cheap hotel. Sorry. No smile, excitement, glad you are here, or even - "I'll be right with you." Two people and a long line. No eye contact or feeling of understanding. Then when it is your turn- more of the same- beyond the check in we waited a couple more times- different days and different times of the day- and it was always the same lack luster experience.  Disney- send a secret "guests" and you will know just what to do to fix this. We don't recommend coming back to this hotel.   We are glad this was our second time to Disney. Our first time was at Wilderness Lodge in Fl. Sure was a total opposite

Summary Heading: Request a room facing the nightly fireworks
Summary: Not much to add here that hasn't been said.   I have two main points.  Stay here if you have young ones.  It's close enough to take lunch/afternoon breaks/naps and still go back for evening activities.  This was our saving grace especially coming from the east coast.  Try to get a room facing the nightly fireworks.  This way even if you can't get in the park, you can enjoy from your room.    Lastly, take time to walk the entire hotel grounds.  There are many cool retro Disney things to enjoy.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and paid over $350/night.  The room was just okay. We were originally checked into a room that was supposed to be on the maintenance list -- we called down to complain about the condition of the room and were moved pretty quickly to an upgraded room in another building. There are a few employees that were "Disneyfied" and provided the expected Disney experience and customer service. Other just went through the motions. After two nights we moved to the Candy Cane Inn for less than half the price and a much nicer stay.  A fantastic breakfast was included in the rate at Candy Cane Inn which saved around $30 for the two of us for breakfast at the Disneyland Hotel.  We always wanted to stay there and now that we have, we will definitely go back to

Our family group of 7 recently stayed In a 3 bedroom suite at the Disneyland Resort hotel. The checkin was effortless, extremely friendly and we were on our way to our rooms in minutes. We opted for the concierge eticket option which, if you have a larger family, is well worth the extra $200 . Includes breakfast, everything you could fit in a backpack to take to Disneyland is encouraged! Pastries and snacks all day long, hot appies in the later afternoon, and beer, wine and champagne! Our rooms were spacious and anything we needed was just a phone call away. The pool area is great especially if you have kids and you have extra time to have a pool day. It's only about a five minute walk to Downtown Disney and the park. Would definitely stay again!

We stayed in a two bedroom suite for a week.  It was wonderful having all the room with spare storage cupboards and a large living area.  It was a little strange that the bedrooms slept 6, but there was only enough seating in the living area for 4.  We got the package with included access to the lounge for breakfast and snacks and drinks etc.  We found that very handy with the children who seemed to eat sporadically throughout the day.  You are permitted to bring drinks from the lounge to the pool.  This was great, the kids brought some soft drinks and chips and peanut and jelly sandwiches to snack on.  You can also bring supplies from the lounge into the park.  The pool area was very very busy all the time, but be warned, there are some staff with serious 'rule' issues staffing

We ate at the Steakhouse at the Disneyland Hotel.   The name escapes me....It was sub-par.  Prices were high as expected at Disney but we had pretty decent food everywhere and we were not impressed by the quality here

Very clean and comfortable. Rooms are a little on the small size and the resort is old. It didn't have the sparkle that I thought it would have. The staff were excellent helped us with all we needed. The walk from the hotel to Disneyland took about 15 mins and Downtown Disney is great.

We stayed in a suite and got a deal for friends and family.  The room was clean, the beds very comfy with plenty of space.  The pool was cold but the jacuzzi's and slides were fun.  I found the pools to be ok.  The hotel was ok.  The walls between the rooms seemed to be paper thin.  I could hear people talking next door and had to complain about babies and children crying a couple nights we were there.  I had to get ear plugs.

Summary Heading: was OK but nothing compared to the grand californian
Summary: It was about a 6-7 minute stroll from the park entrance down the downtown Disney strip. I stayed here after needing an additional night at the park and the grand Californian that I was staying at previously was all booked. The two can't even compare. The Disneyland hotel cost just as much (maybe because it was so last minute) it was a premium room (view of the pool- which I wouldn't consider "premium") but it was surely a downgrade from the Californian. The bell staff was nice and very helpful but when we checked in at 4:00 our room wasn't ready and we had to wait in the lobby for about 45 minutes with a toddler in complete melt-down mode in desperate need of a nap. The positive is that the mattress was more comfortable than the Californian but everything else was a bit

My girlfriend and I stayed at Disneyland Hotel and truly loved everything about it! The hotel is conveniently located a short ten minute walk from the park which makes it easy to get to the park quickly and easily. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The decor in the room is all about Disney including the headboard on the bed which has a beautiful carving of the castle and has a fireworks light effect with music when you click a button. The hotel is amazing and allows you to continue your Disney experience after leaving the park, given the hotel has awesome experiences that can only be done if staying on property (such as tours and the amazing pool). I strongly suggest staying at this hotel if you want to have a true Disney experience, easy access to the park, and a

My wife & I stayed here.   Obviously lots of kids around.  (including room next door)  Overall we liked the hotel and being close to downtown Disney. Wifi was good. We had a fridge brought to our room.  We got a higher room with view of fireworks -- nice.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Resort within Walking Distance of the Parks
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here.  The rooms were tight, but easily fit four people (two queen beds).  They had a lot of nice little touches that Disney fans will appreciate.  The location was great too - not as good as the Grand Californian, but good.  You are about a short 10 minute walk to either park through downtown Disney, or less if you take the Monorail into Tomorrowland.  I really enjoyed the pools as well.  They have a great kids area with slides and waterfalls.  There is also a separate area with two good sized pools.  Probably the only very minor downside was the service at the pool was very slow - took over 30 minutes to get a drink on day after we ordered it, and the staff did not keep the water station by the pool filled, though in their defense the weather was

There is the coolest carved headboard above both beds and a switch on the nightstand lamp that lights the wall up with fiber optic lights imbedded in a hand carved wood castle and the fireworks surrounding . It also plays a bedtime tune that sounds like and old music box playing wish upon a star. I admit being two older gay men it had us at hello! Very cute decor ,beds were great . Nice view of the park. Definitely nice staying on property after a long day in the park it was really nice walking back. We went for Mickeys Halloween party, and it was truly amazing. The haunted mansion nightmare before christmas is done to the nines. Not just decorating but a lot of big changes including a talking animated Jack. Don't miss the singing ghost's on the fogged river,cool! The fireworks

Myself, my fiance, my in-laws, and my parents, as well as a few other guests stayed at this hotel. My now husband and I were getting married in the hotel's secluded Rose Court Garden and having the reception in the lovely Sleeping Beauty Pavilion so it made sense to stay at the hotel.  I have stayed here countless times already and always have a good time. The rooms and the hotel itself are magical and very family oriented. However if you want something a little more high end I'd head to the Grand Californian hotel. A lot of my qualms with the hotel stem from my experience at the Grand Californian.  I think the Disneyland hotel could use a better quick service food stop since the Grand Californian has a great quick service restaurant and it's also in the heart of Downtown Disney

Loved staying here. The house keeping service was impeccable!!! Thank you ladies for keeping everything in tip top shape during my stay! The price was a little high but the service was always friendly and willing to help! I'll be back for another family vacation!

We stayed here for 2 nights for a conference being held at Disneyland Park.  We booked a standard room, but were given a free upgrade to a suite.  The suite had amazing views, from floor-to-ceiling windows on three sides overlooking Downtown Disney.  The room was furnished in modern, high-end furniture.  Our room had a large wet bar and two bathrooms, complete with Mickey Mouse ear shaped faucet handles.  The headboard on the King Bed lit up in the pattern of the Cinderella Castle, while playing Disney music, and was controlled by the Tinkerbell shaped lamp on the side table.  Room security was great, as there were two doors you had to unlock.   The staff was friendly, and the multiple pools were great.  Keep in mind that the suite we had would normally be about $700/night, so

The Disneyland Hotel is classic "magic".   I had a pool view room in the Adventure Tower, and it was great.  The staff was top notch.  The room was comfortable.   The area was very nice.  It is very expensive for what you get.  But, it's also a part of the "Disneyland experience".

Summary Heading: Very expensive and NOT worth it!
Summary: We spent four nights at the Disneyland Hotel and found it to be amazingly expensive, yet quite ordinary and old feeling.  When we arrived to check-in, we were told that we could NOT have a room with a view of the parks, nor the king bed we requested, even though we paid for an upgrade to a "Premium View".  Check-in took about 45 minutes and we wound up with a room in the Frontier Tower with 2 queen beds and a partial view of Downtown Disney.  At least we could see the Disneyland fireworks at night.  For $500/night, we felt (and still feel) robbed.  I think we should have been given a partial refund, but no--that didn't happen.  The room was comfortable, clean and cozy (meaning it was pretty small).  The bathroom was the size of a postage stamp, and only one of us could be in

Summary Heading: OK Hotel but Infrastructure Is Weak
Summary: I spent a week at the Disneyland Hotel for business.   It was fun seeing all the families and little ones scurrying around.  For me, however, the setup was not ideal.   Cell phone coverage was spotty.   The internet was often overloaded.   And the TV was problematic.   Not only was there an overabundance of Disney channels (and not enough regular channels) some of the regular channels came and went (a few minutes on, a few minutes off).

We stayed five nights at the Disneyland Hotel and had a great time. It was our second time there and where happy to see that the same great service was provided. Our two kids loved the pool area and slides, it was a great break from the park during the afternoon. The coffee shop was very convenient, it wasn't as busy as our last trip (assuming a lot more business going to the new Starbucks),which was nice for grabbing a quick muffin on the way to the parks. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Highly recommend The Disney Hotel. It is Disney after all! The staff/cast members were all so kind and helpful.  I had a ball by myself while my husband was working.  The rooms are so clean and well appointed. Just walk out the back of the hotel and boom, you are headed to downtown Disney!  We absolutely loved it!!

I visited this hotel as part of a Senior trip with my daughter. I wanted this trip to be special for her, and it was. All the special touches make this hotel a winner. Beautiful grounds, inexpensive food options close by. We both loved the musical headboard and the Mickey's glove light fixture. Very comfortable beds and Mickey everywhere. Expensive but worth the money.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel--A must for any Disney fan!
Summary: My husband and I left The Disneyland Hotel yesterday after a wonderful week long stay. A lifelong Disney fan, I was immediately impressed with the attention to detail and nostalgia the hotel has. The first thing you see when you walk in is a floor to ceiling map of Disneyland. The hotel is broken up into three towers (Fantasyland, Adventureland, and Frontierland) each being decorated to fit their theme accordingly. We stayed in the Fantasyland tower,  where you also will find the gift shop and front desk.   Throughout the hotel you will find unique pieces of Disney nostaliga: Photos of celebrities and dignitaries visiting Disneyland during the 50s and 60s, an entire wall of vintage Disneyland merchandise, framed illustrations of what each land at Disneyland was meant to look

Summary Heading: Christian in parking booth is manager material
Summary: Crazy drive into Anaheim - traffic pattern on Disneyland Drive from freeway totally 3rd world in design.  Wanted to leave Anaheim the second I arrived.  But the welcome I received from Christian actually had the power to turn it all around.  He was thoughtful enough to ask the question 'how is your day?'  And when he heard the answer, he was sensitive enough (and empowered enough) to actually make a difference.  All of a sudden, I was welcomed.  And I was smiling.  And I was on vacation.  Just because ONE human being cared in the midst of total mayhem.  If you don't believe it is mayhem, try ordering food and a beverage at Trader Sam's on property.  Saves you a trip to Hawai'i - it is that disorganized and depressing from a service standpoint.  But the quality of Disney is very,

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel while attending a conference. The pro's: The hotel is well-located for access to Disneyland town center and park gates (though the walk back from the furthest most point of the park is ~35 minutes); room was clean and ran hot water.  Con's: This property is very old and has had little done to it; rooms are super-dated; throughout the hotel you're followed by eery Disney soundtrack music which wears thin after a couple of days;  the fitness center is very out of date and consists of a few treadmills and a pull-up bar;  hotel bar staff do not recognise non-US driver's licenses, just international passports, which for a conference centre is ludicrous.  Pro tip if you must visit: There is one coffee bar on-site, avoid this and find Starbucks in

We have been to the Disneyland parks many times but this was our first stay in a Disney hotel. There are many reviews online so I had a good idea what to expect before getting there.    Everything was perfect and very Disney which is perfect for us. We had a standard room and it was better than I thought it would be.  Larger than I was expecting, perfectly clean and detailed with many Disney details.  It was so nice to finally stay in the Disney Hotel.    I have nothing negative to say about it except the price and the wifi didn't work in our room.  The price is why we do not normally stay there.  I get that to be so nice costs money and that there is a demand for it, however the cost is up there.  We will stay there again if we can get a deal of some sort otherwise we will stay

Amazing service, Amazing view, Amazing time.... Everything about the Disneyland  hotel is 5 star. The pools were wonderful and they went above and beyond to make my special girl's birthday the best day ever. I cannot say enough wonderful things about the Disneyland Hotel and I cannot imagine how we will go back and want to stay anywhere else. The view from our room was so great and we could see the amazing fireworks every night from our room. Extremely comfortable beds, very clean rooms, and delicious room service! You owe it to yourself to stay there if possible.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel - Is this the best there is at the Park?
Summary: My adult daughters and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 days this September.  It was nice.  The front desk staff tried to go out of their way to help us enjoy our stay.  The wall carving in the room of the park that lit up and played music was a happy surprise.  But it wasn't great.  Problems.  There are four different towers.  The back tower is the newest, but also farthest from the park.  THERE IS NO TRANSPORTATION TO THE PARK FROM THE HOTEL!  Instead, you walk about 5 long city blocks through the stores of Downtown Disney, a retail assault I rather skip, especially if you have children.  And when it is over 95 degrees as it was during our visit, that's a lot of extra walking to add to the end of your day.   When I asked for transportation alternatives, I was told I

Let me start by saying that this was for a romantic trip on a special occasion.  If you are traveling with your family, the rating should probably be higher.  It is extremely conveniently located and that can be a lot more important to a family traveling with kids.  The hotel is priced at luxury rates, but does not come with luxury accommodations.  As you would expect, the pools are all geared towards the kids.  It would be nice if one of the three pools was quieter and geared more towards adults.  All that said, the staff was still great.  One thing you can always say about Disney is that their "cast members" go above and beyond most of the time.

Summary Heading: Close to the action - Maybe too close
Summary: We stayed here as it since it worked out financially into our schedule.  The check-in staff was very friendly and helpful.  Even though the room we requested was not what we received (requested King) it was clean, comfortable and well maintained.  We had a park view room and it was ok, but wish we had done more research as we had booked during grad week and had to endure the noise of teenagers partying until the wee hours.  I you check the other Disney properties in the area or have ever stayed at a Disney property previous to this, you can immediately tell that it is a conversion from something else, not an original and some of that, unfortunately, can be seen in the staff that are working there.  We had limited success with the restaurant there as well as the concierge service

My family and I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel a handful of times during our 15+ years as pass holders and we have a magical experience every time. This trip we stayed in the adventure tower with a beautiful view of Downtown Disney with Space Mountain and Grizzly Peak visible in the distance. The room was very comfortable and clean with a lot of subtle Disney touches to make our stay even more magical! Our only complaint is that the wifi service was awful...for the price you pay for the rooms we expected all aspects to be perfect...hopefully this will be fixed before our next trip.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel is nice but not outstanding
Summary: We stayed in the Fantasyland Tower.  This is a convenient location for the front desk, pool, and on-site stores.  The room had great theming with the lighted headboards and musical accompaniment when the button is pressed (others call this feature the "Kiss Goodnight" and bathroom sink handles, etc. were all Mickey Mouse themed.  Very cute!!   However, there is room for improvement here.  Our check-in was slow and greatly lacking in details- especially since this was our 1st time staying in this hotel. The desk person was anxious to provide us with the pool hours (which we did not ask about) and that was about it. Perhaps we were unlucky as I overhead another desk employee doing a much better job explaining the property and parks.  Our DisneyWorld experience at the Beach Club

Disneyland Hotel was the perfect place to stay for myself, my husband and our 7 year old daughter. I could go on and on about this hotel and the beautiful rooms but I want to hone in on the main points/attributes that really did it for us personally without repeating what a million other people have already reviewed on here. Just look up all the other 5 star ratings and our opinion will be the same. Aside from this, the first thing I want to say is that I'm a smoker so fear not fellow smokers - there are 2 locations at this hotel where you can smoke. One is standing only outside Goofy's Kitchen, the other is near the tiki bar and has nice comfy lounge seats and a fireplace. Next, onto the laundry. They have a laundromat onsite for guests to use - brilliant if you don't want to

Summary Heading: Lovely for our first visit to Disneyland
Summary: We liked our large room and my six year old was throughly charmed by the light up headboard that played when you wish upon  a star. The pool and slides were also big hits. The staff were friendly and room service was appreciated after coming home from long days at the parks. Goofy's breakfast was a great way for our daughter to meet characters and get their autographs , they were happy to spend a lot of time with her on their rounds of the tables.

We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel a few times over the last 15 years and have always enjoyed our stays.   This time we stayed in a two bedroom suite as we had two young children, grandparents and parents travelling together. Although a bit ridiculously expensive, it was a great idea to have a suite for the 6 of us.   The suites could do with more amenities like a toaster, microwave, cups, cutlery etc to make the stay a bit easier for families.   The set up of the suite was good although I was told there were no single beds available in suites which wasn't ideal for the children.   It's good to have a laundry on site but it is very small and cramped!  The pool is great. Lots of lifeguards on duty.   Guest services are very obliging.   We even had a view of the fireworks

We had a wonderful stay here. We got to the Disneyland Hotel at 10 AM and are room was ready. The pool was beautiful and the monorail slides were fast and fun. Goofy's Kitchen was also a blast with pretty good food, and the Hotel is so close to monorail which is great to pop in an out of Disneyland. If you want to be immersed in the disney experience at Disneyland, stay at the Disneyland Hotel.

"Best Western Premier standard" is how I would describe the hotel. Very well trained staff throughout hotel. Food was surprisingly good by the pool and through room service. Steakhouse was disappointing, but service was good there. Very conveniently located to the park. Room was clean, and well appointed. Good bedding and linens. (Room was non Club, in the Adventure tower.)  Be sure to request a king bed in advance, as they are the exception!

It is AWESOME!!! Just remember to explore the whole room and hotel and make a reservation on " Goofy´s kitchen". if you are just going to disneyland or california andventure I suggest you to purchase the standard view, and, if traveling with family, don´t buy a bed for each one of you.

Summary Heading: Convenient place to stay in the heart of Disney
Summary: We had a wonderful couple of days staying at the Disneyland hotel. We arrived at 8.30am after a 14 hour flight from Australia to find a wonderfully pleasant lady checking us in immediately to our room which was so greatly appreciated having 2 very tired children on our hands. The location couldn't have been better. Situated at the end of Downtown Disney, you really feel part of the 2 theme parks and the Disney "bubble". It is only about a 10  minute stroll to the parks or you can take the monorail which takes you into Tomorrowland at Disneyland.  The hotel room was nicely furnished without being too "Disney" and was quite spacious for our family of 4 with 2 queen beds.We had a sensational view of the fireworks at night which was very cool. The pool area was great with a number

We booked three nights here to celebrate our first wedding anniversary at the end of the Disneyland Half Marathon weekend.  Our check-in experience was great, with Becky really taking the time to make us feel welcome and give us lots of advice about the parks and restaurants since it was our first visit.  We received a free upgrade to a Pool View room in the Adventure Tower which was beautiful, clean, and spacious!  The room has so many lovely touches and after our stay there we felt completely spoiled.  The hotel grounds are also wonderful and I regret not bringing my swimsuit to enjoy the pool area.  Hopefully I can give it a try during a future stay!  The dining options provided a great variety within quick walking distance of our room no matter what time we were hungry.

As a large family the best time we had was at the hotel, the rooms were clean and big. We also went to eat at Goofys kitchen which was the highlight of our trip. The characters would come visit us at the table while we ate. All my children loved that ages 3-14.  Also a highlight was the swimming pool and waterslides. Swimmerets were available which was great and there was plenty of space to find and sit.  All in all I have nothing negative to say about the hotel, we enjoyed it more than Disneyland itself.

We went to the Disneyland Resort over the first "Halloween Season" weekend in Disneyland and had a fantastic time. The Hotel is beautiful, well appointed, and staffed by employees completely committed to The Disney Way. The beds are very comfortable with soft and plush linens and a good assortment of pillows. There is an in-room safe (small) and a small minifridge in addition to a desk, wifi or hard line internet connections and a TV. There are two adult size robes available in the room to use along with high quality bath products. The shower/tub area is closed from the room via a door, and the toilet room inside is also separated by a door. Finally, there is a closet and a vanity available outside the bathroom area, so an entire family could get ready at the same time, in

Upon arriving at the Disneyland Hotel, you are greeted by some very friendly staff. The grounds are lovely.  We checked in and checked our bags until they could get us a room.  Off we went to the Disney park.  They texted us as they said they would when our room was ready.  It was an extremely hot day, so we decided to go back and use the fantastic pool they have.  Only problem, apparently the monorail does not run on a very hot day due to the fact it is not air conditioned.  One point of staying at the DL hotel is to use the monorail to get back to the hotel.  It is the farthest hotel on DL property from the park. We got our room after walking back in 102 heat.  Our room overlooked the pool area. Very nice view as we were on the 10th floor.  Pool area is amazing, and the kids

Summary Heading: Excellent splurge during a Disneyland visit
Summary: While there is better value at the Good Neighbor properties nearby, there's nothing like staying on property for a Disneyland visit. Had a premium view of Downtown Disney which afforded a view of the Disneyland fireworks. Room was comfortable though the king-size bed had a bit of a "hump" in the middle like a lot of hotel  beds. This was offset by the amazing headboard that lit up with an LED firework show. Headboard is controlled by a 2nd switch on one of the end table lamps. Staff was nice though check-in was a bit disorganized as it is the only part of the park that doesn't have queuing ropes. Overall: pricey but worth it. Wifi is free but absolutely terrible. Cellular coverage in room is also terrible often dropping to 3G. The 3G was faster than the wifi.

I have wanted to stay at the Disneyland hotel my whole life - and my daughter only had to wait until her 10th birthday.  Lovely room with view of the pool.  You are paying for proximity to the parks which is wonderful.  Nothing like taking a mid-day break to take a swim.  The pool area is a bit chaotic, but that's what one should expect at a family resort.  We were lucky enough to be selected as the "e-ticket family" and were invited to watch the fireworks from a lovely hospitality suite.  This will be a birthday my daughter will always remember.

My nearly 20 year old daughter and I recently returned from our very first mother-daughter vacation.  We tried to be frugal and decided that spending extra money on food would be a better option for us as my daughter has a gluten allergy so we chose to stay in a good neighbor hotel as our family has done previously.  Our family has also stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier and the Grand Californian in the past (we've also stayed at the Candy Cane Inn a couple of times and once at the Marriott Fairfeild Inn).  This trip we chose the Best Western Anaheim Inn...We chose poorly.  I wasn't sure if we would be able to change hotels, but thankfully after a quick phone call to Costco Travel we were able to switch hotels!  We packed our bags, checked out of the Best Western, called an Uber

I stayed for two nights while traveling through southern California with two boys, ages 8 and 4. This hotel impressed all of us. The pool area has plenty to do for kids of all ages, and my son even said the pool and water slides (not Disneyland!) were the highlight of the trip. The early entrance to the parks, before the large crowds, was worth the added expense of staying on Disney property.  The rooms are spacious and very comfortable with modern amenities including free wifi. Each room includes numerous tasteful Disney touches, such as Mickey-shaped shower handles, which my children loved finding.   There are numerous dining options; Tangeroa Terrace is a good casual stop and the food is priced well considering it's on Disney property. And it's a very short walk to several

Summary Heading: Close to the park but not much else......
Summary: We visited this hotel in mid September (spring break for those of us in the Southern Hemisphere) with our kids, 6, 6, and 3 as well as my dad and step mother.  The rooms were fantastic - comfy beds, refrigerators, and special Disney touches.  However, the food selection and service was terrible.  We waited 1.5 hours for drinks at the pool and over an hour to pay our bill in the cocktail lounge!  Also, the room service food quality was poor (but plentiful) and the breakfast was pretty awful unless you were paying for the the character buffet.  The pool was great, with life jackets for smaller kids wanting to swim or ride the slides and the proximity to the parks and the daily "magic hour" we're big pluses.  We buoyed our trip, but didn't think we got the best value from this

I just love the hotel! I had an amazing time. Everyone was super sweet and friendly. Even the cleaners were amazing! The only down side was the hot water in the shower, if you travel with a large party, be the first to take a shower or you will end up taking a cold shower.   I cannot wait to go back but next time I am staying in the Grand!

I was super excited to stay at this hotel and I was not let down. Everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful (but when are they not at ANY place Disney?!). Our room had a view of Downtown Disney and as we were on the 11th floor, our view was pretty awesome! We could even watch the fireworks at Disneyland from our hotel room! All of the touches in the room were perfect, from the light up/musical headboard to the Mickey hands holding the lights in the bathroom. The pool was also very nice, the water was a little too cold for my taste, but I enjoyed the sun on a lounge chair.   I also loved that the walk to Disneyland and California Adventure was very easy. Probably the #1 thing we loved about this Disney trip was the fact that getting to the parks was super easy (and a heck of

We had a wonderful weekend.  We had a family of runners in so we got the 3 bedroom suite.  The room was perfect.  Plenty of room for all of us.  Cookies and milk were delivered for the kids arrival.  Room was clean and well maintained.  Housekeeping was spotless.   Check in was quick and painless.  All needs were met quickly (needed a shower chair.)  Hotel was perfect location to get to the run easily.  Nice walk through DTD for trips to the park.  And when we wanted to stay in for the evening, there is always room service!!

Spent the past 4 days at this hotel ! Wonderful stay just as I  expect from Disney hotels! Great location with  a short walk through Downtown Disney to get to The parks. Staff very pleasant and helpful . Rooms very nice . I would certainly recommend this property if you are visiting Disneyland !

Wow!  Our stay here made our Disneyland vacation perfect!  The walk to the parks was pleasant (we actually liked the location better than the Grand).  The room was very clean, loved the Disney touches (preferred Disneyland Hotel decor over the woodland decor of the Grand)!  We requested a connecting room with firework view and were given both.  Loved the pools.  The kids (2 and 4) thoroughly enjoyed the water slides.  Early entry is definitely a perk for California Adventure but not so much at Disneyland (the lines were still pretty significant).  We loved that we could pick up a bottle of wine from the bar or store on site and take back to the room.  We also like picking up take out from Downtown Disney.  When you travel with small children, these two things are essential! ;)

We have been to Disneyland every two years for the past 25 and have never splurged on this hotel. We have always stayed at a Good Neighbor Hotel with very satisfactory results. This was a first time trip with just my husband and I without the kids and I wanted to surprise him with staying here. We arrived on Labor Day for a week long visit to the horrid traffic trying to get into the resort. The lines were tremendous and luckily I know my way around SOCAL so I decided to take another way, get on the 5 and take the dedicated exit and just like that the magic began. From the guard gate check in to the valet and all the welcome smiles it was a great start. Check in was a breeze and the ability to have the bell desk bring up the bags was awesome. Trader Sams was packed almost every

We stayed here for 2 nights and it was very convenient to the parks! We were able to come back during the day and rest as it was blistering hot and then go back out by just walking into the parks. The convenience was worth thehigh cost of the room

The Disneyland Hotel is not as glamorous as her Grand Californian neighbor, but is an excellent place to stay. The rooms are spacious enough and well decorated, especially the headboard in the standard rooms. The pools are good and the slide is fun, but the real reason to stay is to keep the Disney magic going throughout your entire vacation. The staff are all absolutely professional, with the special Disney touch of being tirelessly cheerful. The AC in our room wasn't working properly, but the front desk sorted us out with reasonable speed and exceptional care. Having stayed at the GC in the past, I now think that the DH will be my choice for future trips to Disneyland.

We have just enjoyed another fun visit to the iconic Disneyland Hotel. We love this hotel, it's well appointed rooms, pools & proximity to the parks & Downtown Disney make it our first choice each visit. The character breakfast at Goofey's kitchen could use a complete re-do of the menu & decor however. Not great, unless you enjoy sugary, high fat fast food style offerings in a 90's inspired setting. The character breakfast at Storytellers cafe in Grand Cali hotel is much much better quality.  Still love the hotel though.

Summary Heading: Would stay at a Disney Resort again
Summary: The rooms have fun touches - a kinda find the hidden Mickeys in them. However, they are fairly pricey for what you get. Nevertheless we would stay again in order to gain the early entry into the park - which is what we were there for after all. Huge difference in the numbers of people before an after that early entry. The pool is great, but again, it is all about Disney. I cannot comment on what P Pier would be like or whether it would be more worthwhile to stay there as you would still get the early entry. The DL Resort is not a close walk to the park so I would rent a stroller from City Strollers (we loved them - they even delivered water and snacks to the hotel with the stroller).  Even if your kids are good walkers and are a bit older, go for a stroller for sure.

The room was great everyone loved it. The pools were big enough for everyone there, There weren't too many shaded areas to sit, wish there were more.  Had dinner at Goofy's kitchens the girls loved it.  Overall a great experience would definitely go again.

After visiting Walt Disney World in FL many times we finally made it to Disneyland.  The hotel was fun, with Disney memorabilia in the lobby and a monorail pool.  We were on the 7th floor of the Adventure Tower with a Premium View of Downtown Disney, and we were able to see the fireworks, which was a highlight of our trip. They supposedly have free wi-fi, but it was terribly slow.

What a truly "magical" place to stay! Our rooms were very comfortable, had a mini fridge and coffee maker.  The headboard is exquisite!
