There is a scene of the castle with fireworks which light up when you turn on the lamp and it plays a melody. The kids really thought that was something! We purchased the concierge level which was so helpful. Very convenient to have snacks and drinks at your disposal 630AM-10PM. Special thanks to Robert, our host at the concierge room.  He was fabulous! Right outside the hotel is Downtown Disney and the entrance to the monorail. The pools are great and even have a mini water park.  The staff is friendly and ready to help.  I highly recommend staying here.  Great value, comfort and convenience!

We had very high expectations of the Disneyland Hotel I haven't stayed here in 31 years so it's been awhile. When we checked in there were huge lines because of an event group was checking in so that took around 15mins just to get to the desk. The man we encountered was pleasant but seemed to have a slight stick up his butt kinda snotty for a Disney employee. Didn't ask about the trip down or about our daughters it was a very cold exchange. The other lady emp next to him was asking her folks all these questions about who the kids favorite princesses were and I they wanted a princess to call them , my kids got no questions at all and this was their first time ever at the hotel. I told him that and he said ok...So for the amount of money I shelled out for us and my mother in law

The location of the hotel is at the end of Downtown Disney so it is very close to dining, shopping, and the parks. The rooms were well air conditioned, comfy bed, quiet, and clean (not immaculate). The standard rooms keep well to the Disney theme with the light up castle head board, Mickey hands on the light fixtures in the bathroom, hidden mickeys in the shower tiles & carpet, Disney toiletries, Mickey mouse wake up calls, and of course Disneyland pictures on the walls.  The pools looked great but we did not use them as we did not feel comfortable utilizing them... we were visiting on our honeymoon and have no children... the pools were all families so we felt awkward. The gift shops were good, you could buy lots of the same merchandise from the park as well as some amenities

Summary Heading: Great Stay, but Have had Better
Summary: Stayed for 5 days, 4 nights the end of July. I requested an Upper Level Premium View Room with a Downtown Disney view, and with two queen beds, a day bed, and a bathroom with doubles sinks. When I checked in, I was told there were no rooms available with two beds AND a Downtown Disney view. Basically, if I wanted two beds, I’d have to have a pool view, and if I wanted a Downtown Disney view, I’d only have one bed. I was very disappointed, as the rooms with two beds are much bigger, and having double sinks in the bathroom is huge, AND I booked a very early morning flight in order to be one of the first to check-in for the day. Plus, that was the exact type of room I had when I stayed at this hotel last year, and it was so wonderful; I very much wanted the same accommodations this

What a great place! Close to Disney , shopping and eating. Makes a great vacation for everyone! The rooms are wonderful, pool is great and bar is awesome. We had connecting rooms that is was great! The lobby shop had cold beer and wine, nice touch.

We spent four days at Disneyland and had a great time. We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. The hotel has 3 towers. They are Fantasy, Adventure and Frontier. We stayed at Frontier, which is the further of the towers (only about 2 minutes from Adventure, which is where you check in).  The rooms are nice, big and the area is very clean.     We like staying there and it is an easy walk to the parks and to the Downtown Disney District. The pool has a slide and kids area as well as 2 other areas for adults and older children. They offer food and beverage service too.  So why the tittle. This room is right by the Service Elevator Shaft and the noise is present 24 hours a day. If you are going to spend time in your room and are a light sleeper, then do not stay in this room. We managed

You get what you pay for here - full on Disney with an amazing location.  Young families should give this some serious thought, even at the Disney premium.  It is close to the parks and Downtown Disney and it has a great pool area.  We stayed here as a family during the September DisneyRun events and it was a treat to be so close to the Expo and the run event start/finish lines.

The price was very expensive. Being out of town we wanted to stay on the property. The location was great to walk to any part of Disneyland. We stayed for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend and could easily get around. The staff was great and rooms were clean.

This was our first Disneyland experience and we will/would stay in the hotel again!! From start to finish, the whole experience was magical for adults & children and the hotel just adds to the adventure.  Plus, so many benefits of staying at the hotel.  Fabulous!!!!

Summary Heading: Basic hotel, but very conveniently located to Disneyland (duh!)
Summary: I spend five nights at Disney hotel due to a conference at the premises. This was my fifth time at the same hotel and unfortunately not too much to brag about.   Rooms are big, quiet, clean and wifi works well, but that is pretty much it. If I would bring my family to the resort, this hotel would be fine, but for a conference guest and for a grown-up business visitor, the grounds could have at least one decent hotel that targets grown-ups. As a father of four, I definitely dont mind seeing happy children around premises, but perhaps a separate hotel or even a wing might be nice.   Regarding the restaurant services in the area, Tiki bar is great, but service lags behind and waiting in line for 10-15 minutes to get a drink is frustrating.   PS. Having a "Magical moment" is far

I always wanted to stay here. Been to Disneyland several times and this time I wanted to be closer to the Park.. I was not.   I thought the monorail was closer to the park. A lot of walking for me I was tired before I got to the park. Room was dated  nothing special. small,pool was awesome when it was open  a lot of people don't put swim diapers on toddlers too much pixie dust in the pool . Room service was good. Check in was easy, WiFi  was horrible,slow  rooms were clean didn't see any security people wandering the property at night too easy access for non guests

Summary Heading: Not Worth The Price! Book Somewhere Else
Summary: It was too expensive compared to what the hotel provided. The system was down when we checked in. The room was ordinary. What's worse, there was even some dust in the bathroom.  PS.You will have to check The Magic Hour in advance since it is for particular time and park.  簡而言之，住這裡唯一的好處就是走路就可以到迪士尼園區；壞處就是太貴了，然後要收停車費、沒有附早餐，所以價錢又會比定價還高。建議直接訂Airbnb民宿或附近的飯店!!

A dream trip finally happened! We booked a stay at The Disneyland Hotel and paid extra for a premium view. We were put in the Adventure Tower and had a wonderful view of the pool and grounds. Not exactly a park view but apparently that's a super premium view? Anyway, we were fine with it and it didn't disappoint. Transportation from the airport to the hotel left us missing Disney WORLD and their magical express terribly. No one seemed to know where to go after exiting the terminal and we waited outside, in the blazing heat for about 40 minutes for a bus. After one false alarm, we finally boarded the bus and it was disappointing that it was not more 'magical.' Oh well.  Check-in was easy and the cast member was friendly. Our room was lovely with lots of hidden Mickeys. The beds

Summary Heading: Very good, but not good enough to return.
Summary: We normally stay at a location on the other side of the park and decided to try something new... to splurge. DL Hotel was most certainly clean, comfortable and close. But for the money we think that we will be returning to our normal, "not so exorbitant" location on the other side of the park. Being a hotel guest does get you in for the magic mornings which is excellent if you are looking for as much time within the park as possible. The pools were clean and a great diversion for when the kid's feet are sore from walking. The rooms were clean and had nice DL themed photographs. The beds were great (the pillows were all fluff, though). The bath was also clean and very comfortable. If you are OK with the price-tag, you won't be disappointed. It just wasn't for us. FYI: the rooms

I only stayed here for one night, because frankly, it was too expensive to stay longer than that. The lobby area was huge. I loved the tea cup sitting area. Check in was a breeze, and the staff were very friendly. The room itself was very small, but what it lacked for insize, it made up for in details! The best part of the room was the headboard with the Disney carving that lit up when you turned it on and played "When you wish upon a star" melody. The property itself was huge, and right across from DTD which had a monorail that took you to Disneyland. The drinks at Trader Sam's Enchanted Tiki bar were amazing! Didn't get to swim in the pool, but it looked nice. I stay at resorts all the time at Disney World, this was my first time staying at a Disneyland resort (My first time

We have just returned from the Run Disney Half-Marathon four days.  Our daughter, her boyfriend, two kids and us were in a family suite on the tenth floor.  It was a nice set-up - adjoining rooms - one that slept the kids and the parents connected to one that housed my husband and self. Three bathrooms total along with two fridges, flat screen televisions and separate exit doors were perfect for our group.  Even though the hotel was full with the Labor Day holiday and the runners - the pools weren't overly crowded - very nice for the five and eight year old kiddos.  Staff were very nice all around - from the hotel maids, check-in personnel and pool attendants.   I was very impressed with all the lifeguards walking around proactively.  Room decors were nice - every thing very

We stayed here 2 years ago and had a wonderful experience. 2 years later and I still think it is one of and possibly the best Disney resort in all of Disneyland and Disney World. We love the pools, the cabanas, and Trader Sam's. It is an awesome place to stay with or without kids. The only thing that could be considered a negative is having to walk through Downtown Disney to get to either Disneyland or Disney California adventure as he music and vibe isn't very "Disney" but it's a small complaint. We'll be back here next year for sure.

This was a great place to stay in as you are right next to the park and downtown Disney.  The room was lovely and we loved the Mickey Mouse faucets. The bed was very comfy and the room had a fridge which is a nice touch. We were in frontier tower so we only heard the fireworks so stay in adventure tower so you have great park view at night. Hotel cost was ok but we only used the pool which was packed as was a holiday weekend. Never ate at hotel only at downtown Disney.

As first time visitors to DLR and WDW veterans we were very impressed with this property. Amazing location- walking distance to DTD and both parks. Rooms were very clean and spacious with lots of magical touches like the light-up musical headboard and mickey handles in the bathroom. Standard view room ended up having a view of both DTD and Paradise Pier. Our favorite thing about this resort was the characters roaming freely around the property- by the pool and in the lobby. They were super interactive and friendly- we enjoyed them so much! Also loved all the artwork and photos around the resort- reminders of the property's history. The pool was also great- very large with two water slides and great theming. Didn't get to take advantage of all the restaurants but the ones we did

This was our first time staying on property, overall it was magical as Disney does not disappoint. The hotel lobby and grounds were beautiful and the room was a good size and we loved that the couch folded out to a twin bed. The beds were very comfortable too!  Our room overlooked downtown Disney and overall it was a nice stay and a very short walk to the parks. I am not sure its a shorter walk than staying off property... but its a more pleasant stroll than walking along Harbor Blvd. Our one beef is that the hotel is really an extension of the park, meaning its busy and crowded all the time. It was hard to really unwind from the parks. The pool was amazing but crowded, the lines for the slide were long and there is not enough chairs for the guests. I don't know that it is worth

A really gorgeous property. I love the theming throughout. (Although I could have done without the music on continuous loop at the Frontier Tower.) Everyone was very pleasant. From the front desk staff to the gardeners.  The room was a nice size. I was disappointed that we only had two queens. I had assumed all the standard room had two queens and a sofa bed. Extremely clean, This is what I love about Disney. You always see someone cleaning something. I enjoyed the pool. You can find an area to relax and a server will take care of your food and beverage needs. Room service is touch and go. Kids meals were terrible, but breakfast was great. Restaurants were great, but pricey. ($2 for a banana?! That's Disney for ya!) WiFi touch and go. No rhyme or reason to how fast it will be.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel at the Happiest Place on Earth!
Summary: I have been staying at the Disneyland Hotel since i was young. It is a modern and fresh today as it was in 1957. Over the years it has been updated and modernized and this trip did not disappoint. The grounds and pool were beautiful, the room impeccable, room service decent and timely and the staff outstanding! The beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Planning my next trip back soon! If only they had a snack bar and foot massage available at 1am when returning from 15-16 hour days in the park!

Last year we went to Disney & I reviewed the Hilton in Anaheim. This year we decided to stay at the park. We booked the Disneyland Hotel, based on the reviews on TA. We arrived on August 31 & stayed until Sept 4th. Check in was a bit slow, & painful. However the week we were there the property was packed & very busy, So I cant really complain. We were on the 4th floor facing the pool....a great spot. The entire week, the hotel staff were awesome, every time we passed an employee in the hall or lobby, they would always greet our daughter with a quick "Hello Princess". A small but nice touch, our daughter always felt special. Our room was quiet & very clean...great sleeps all week. We only ate on the property a couple of times. Breakfast was good & quick service. We had dinner at

Just come back from a three night stay here. We had a premium double room. Room was really big and clean. And the special headboard was a great magical touch. Bathroom was slightly dated but still clean. 5 of us stayed in one room and was enough for us. The service at the hotel was great. Don't expect to see any characters there unless you eat at goofy kitchen which is around 55 dollars each. The swimming pool was great with water slides. It was around a 15 minute walk from the hotel to the parks which was quite nice as the walk was through downtown Disney with all the shops and restaurants. I would say three nights is enough to see everything.

5 of us stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  The room was very spacious and decorated with Disney flair.  We had 2 double beds and a sofa bed which is only a single.  We asked for a roll a way which fit in the corner conveniently.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower with a pool view.   The TV has of course the Disney channel and story time for the little ones.  It is a quick walk to Downtown Disney for food or you can stay on the premises but the restaurants are very pricey.  All in all in was fun for the kids but as an I would stay somewhere else because of the price.

Summary Heading: Still great hotel and great experience, but...
Summary: Just came back from our 4th stay here in 2 years.  Thought it was time to write another review updating my first one from late 2013.  Most of the positives are still there.  The hotel is fairly clean, and the cast members all professional.    However, there are some negatives I am going to point out now.  I think this was the first time I was not fully satisfied with the cast member at the front desk who helped us out.  He was definitely not rude or unprofessional, but he seemed like he was in a hurry for no reason (it was not busy and there wasn't a line at check-in).  After he had finished checking us in and giving us the room keys, I double checked that it was a king bed, and he said no it was 2 queens, which was not what I had booked.  If I had not taken the time to double

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with a few minus
Summary: It is a very nice hotel overall. We were welcomed by a friendly receptionist on our arrival and we were given a lovely package with little gifts celebrating the 60th anniversary. The hotel is within walking distance from the parks, with lots of restaurants and shops nearby.  Our room was in a different tower from the main hotel which is ok but not very nice when you are walking with the luggage even though it was a short 5 min. walk. Our bedroom was quite big, with a comfy bed and a sofa which can turn into a bed (not that we needed it). The room has a lot of features from disney from the lamp posts at the bedroom, to the taps, quirky mirror etc. Overall these features were very cute and a nice surprise. The bathroom looks slightly dated but not ugly to the eye so ok. There's

Summary Heading: Birthday not so special at the most magical place
Summary: I arrive to the disney hotel, after being stuck in Valencia for 2 hours getting my car repaired, then on the freeway in stop and go traffic for 2 hours without air, car was not totally fixed. I pull up to front of hotel and step out, say to the attendant I am not sure I am in the right lane.....he responds well, you are here and so am i.  I open my trunk, to be unloaded and he says all of this?  Yes, because I have all the birthday surprise stuff for my granddaughters 16th birthday.  Get to the room and things are better.  Day 2 up in the room resting before dinner with my daughter and young granddaughter, when noise from the fridge start and then smoke.  The room fills with smoke.  We run out in the hall get house keeping and call the front desk.  We have fire department,

I booked this hotel to celebrate my daughters sweet 16 in hopes of making it extra special and one to remember . Booked 2 rooms for two nights with deluxe view in hopes of a great weekend with my daughter and her friends . As pass holders we visit Disney often but figured this time we would splurge to make it extra special . At check in , it was love at first sight for the Disney lovers that we are . Greeted by Goofy , full of playful fun with the teenagers and my little one . He was great. Our rooms were decorated very cute with the great view we were promised . (6th floor) We are very excited for the weekend ahead . That was day 1.  Then the not so sweet part . Day 2 we returned from the park to rest , enjoy the pool . Half our group is napping in adjoining room . A loud

I'm a little confused as to the raving reviews of this hotel. We decided to stay one night since our only daughter was turning 1. Check in, mediocre (not the usual Disney pizzaz), we arrived at our room and it was clean, but nothing special (for almost $500/night on a Monday) and an awful view of the parking lot, you can also hear all the noise and running around from the room above. The pool was small considering the number of guests the hotel accommodates. I have NEVER seen a pool this crowded before! There were no pool chairs left, people were leaving their personal belongings on the wall running along the pool the service in the pool area was practically non-existent, took 30 minutes to flag down a waitress for a food order and forget the drinks, she never came back!!

We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights.  It's been 6 years since we visited the parks so decided to stay on property to enhance the trip.  The hotel was wonderful. We stayed on the 9th floor of the Adventure Tower and had a terrific pool view.  We were steps away from Downtown Disney and took advantage of entering into California Adventure park through the Grand Californian (much quieter entrance into the park).   We, like many, left the parks mid-day to enjoy the hotel pool; there is a lack of beach lounge chairs so it was difficult finding 4 chairs together.  Goofy's Kitchen was surprisingly fun & had great food. If/when we decide to return, we would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Years ago as parents taking our kids to Disneyland we couldn't afford to stay on the Disneyland property. Now as grandparents we were able to take the family and enjoy all the perks that go along with staying at the Disneyland Hotel. The convenience, especially with small children, is invaluable. The rooms are huge and spacious and you are able to get family suites.   My only criticism was that the lobby looked more like a W Hotel then what I pictured the Disneyland Hotel lobby would/should look like. If Goofy and Chip and Dale had not come in you could have been in any lobby.

Summary Heading: Location is the best part of the Hotel
Summary: I have to say that the Disneyland Hotel did not live up to the Disney standard.  We have stayed at several properties at Walt Disney World (Contemporary, Grand Floridian, Beach & Yacht Club) and this was not nearly as good.  In particular the service was not to the same level.  In fact the parking staff were rude and unhelpful.  At WDW everyone greets you with a friendly hello and are clearly there to help.  Here the service was more functional.  The pool area, with a monorail theme slide, was great and the service in there was also much better.  The hotel is a short walk through Downtown Disney to get to Disneyland or California Adventure.    The rooms were large and very clean.  However unlike in WDW they did not also have a sofa in the room.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay but

The Disneyland hotel is the perfect place to stay when traveling to the Disneyland Resort. When we arrived we were greeted by Pluto! Every hotel cast member we met offered exceptional guest service. Also when you stay at the hotel you can take advantage of magic hours, which allows you to enter into the park an hour early before opening to the public. Overall our time at the Disneyland Hotel was magical.

This was a dream trip staying at the hotel for 2 weeks from the UK and I was a little worried due to the expense of it all but I'm so pleased that it really was a magical place. The staff were always so pleasant and even when our room was slightly late at being ready they kindly gave us complimentary vouchers for Goofys Kitchen. The room was spacious and overlooked downtown Disney and we could see some of California Adventure. Even with my two children having a day bed was great so they didn't have to share. The pool was great with lots of lifeguards and we splashed out on a cabana one afternoon which was certainly worthwhile. The monorail was near and the walk to the parks wasn't too far and nice to walk through Downtown Disney. Two things I would say is that didn't find the

Stayed here with my family over Christmas holidays. Check in was a breeze, our son even got a welcome present! Rooms were very clean and the staff were super accommodating and helpful! This hotel is very close to the park and has Goofy's kitchen attached to it. It was too bad that Anaheim was experiencing records cold snaps when we were there because we would have loved to tried out the pool. Unfortunately it was too cold. I also had a package dropped off at this hotel and it arrived hassle-free. This hotel is priced a little higher than the rest of Anaheim, but as the saying goes: you get what you pay for!

My son and I visited Disneyland in July and overall had a wonderful experience.  The first night we stayed at the Candy Cane Inn.  Nights 2 and 3 were at the Paradise Pier Hotel and then 4th and 5th at Disneyland Hotel.   The Good--Disneyland Hotel is a great property with Disney theming throughout.  Our hotel room was very spacious and comfortable.  The beds were comfy, bathroom nice (loved the separate closed off toilet) , good location in the main building.  The Disney cast members were all friendly and accommodating.  They were able to check us in early (10:00am) and helped to find some lost sunglasses.  The property was nice and close to downtown Disney.  We used the monorail several times to save our feet!  The early magic hour everyday was invaluable-definitely take

Summary Heading: Really fun for our first time in a Disney hotel
Summary: My wife and I grew up in LA, and always dreamed of staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  So this was a dream come true, and it really was fun.  We stayed for 2 nights with our kids, 7 and 9.  We all loved it.  The pools were fun for when we took breaks from the theme parks. And the hotel is very convenient for getting into the parks at all hours.  The Grand Californian is more convenient for getting into both parks, especially California Adventure, but the Disneyland Hotel isn't too much more of a walk, and it has much more nostalgic charm.  It's pricey, but worth it for a nice one time experience.    But if we go back and stay in a Disney hotel again, we'll probably do the Paradise Pier next time - cause it's cheaper.

we have been to disneyland many times and stayed at many good neighbor hotels, many being pretty nice(see my other reviews).  We wanted to stay at disneyland hotel for a long time and finally bit the bullet.  If money is no object definitely stay here or better yet at the grand californian.  I glad we stayed here once, but might not ever go back.  We did not have any issues, i just feel that for the money you don't get a good value.  the pool is excellent and nothing compares except maybe howard johnson.  the proximity to trader sams and goofys kitchen makes for an almost requisite visit to each.  the grounds are beautiful as well as the rooms(although the basic roooms are not big by any means).  there are small touches everywhere.  being close to the monorail is the saving

Summary Heading: I don't know what room my wife booked...
Summary: But it was on the 11th floor directly overlooking the park and the fireworks at night = expensive! It was Concierge level so we had full use of the services of the lounge, and the very extensive snack buffet. Was excellent.   On check in we were greeted by a very helpful employee who walked us to our room and explained everything to us. The room was large, spotless, and had a full wall of glass looking due east over the Grand Californian Hotel, Downtown Disney, both parks, and half of southern California. The hotel grounds are magnificent. A real spacious upscale 70's feel to it, but utterly perfect. Gorgeous.  Wifi was spotty. Not good. As usual.  There is a dive bar next to the pool. Trader Sams (?) Service is non existent if you want to eat there. It is just a watering hole

We arrived on Wednesday late afternoon on August 19th.  This is our fourth time on property.  We walked immediately up to the counter and check in was a breeze.  We stayed in the Fantasy tower, 4th floor, standard view.  Our room was fantastic as usual.  We are annual pass holders and we always enjoy the perks of the magic morning hour, and the hotel pool/water slides.  Our kids ages 6 and 4 had a great time.   We ate at Minnie and Friends breakfast inside Disneyland park.  I prefer Goofy's kitchen or Mickey's surf up breakfast.  We enjoyed the world of color dining package on saturday night.

Disneyland Hotels are an excellent way to make a Disney trip feel like a true vacation. The close proximity allows for easy naps/rests, etc for your little ones and is the perfect location to be able to enjoy Downtown Disney stores and restaurants.

Summary Heading: All I can say is WOW!
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel, well managed and clean.  Next to Downtown Disney and within a short walk to the park, you can't go wrong with this property.  I was there for a week at a conference and love it; pool looked very kid and adult friendly.  Staff was excellent, rooms  were clean and comfy.  Nice job!

Summary Heading: Better than the Grand Californian Hotel!
Summary: We stayed here August 19-21, 2015.  I traveled with my 2 teenagers for a last hurrah of summer before school began.  Even though this hotel is slightly further away from Disneyland resort, I think it is well worth it!    We have stayed at the Grand Californian hotel a few times and have decided we like the Disneyland Hotel better.  If you want quiet, well done rooms you will LOVE this hotel.  The rooms are quiet and the furnishings soothe you the minute you walk in.  The subtle blues and golds make this the best choice after a long day at the parks.    We were fortunate enough to have a window that faced the park.  We could turn on the music every night in our room for the fireworks and enjoy them from our room without being with hoards of crowds!  It was amazing!!    The

We stayed there for 1 night and experienced why people pay the money to stay there. Check in was smooth, and we didn't have a reservation. Rooms were a decent size with comfortable beds and we had a pool view, which was great.  The easy access to Disneyland is one of the biggest perks along with the extra time you receive. It was nice to shop and ride without major line ups, as it was at 90% capacity while we were there. It was also wonderful to see the characters at the hotel as there were no line ups. Much more personal experience. Housekeeping standards need to be updated. Also the soda machines need to accept bills, and if there is a sign for one on the floor then it needs to be there, not every other floor. We would stay there again with the understanding we are paying a

We had a wonderful time on our Thanksgiving vacation. Staying at the Disneyland hotel even made it that much better.  The rooms were very clean, and we had everything we could want at our hotel.  I like the fact that you can walk out of the hotel and go to the monorail or stroll through downtown Disney to enter either one of the Disney Parks. It makes coming back in the afternoon for a swim or nap very convenient.

We love to stay at Disney properties when we can and being AP holders we try to take advantage of their passholder offers, which we did, 4 nights this time with a deluxe view, of the pool. Room was ready upon arrival, and we were very happy with our view.  The staff here are very friendly and are all willing to help. We had a break from the parks one day and spent it at the pool in a cabana, (well worth the cost as it was so hot) service there was excellent, we received a large fruit platter and a fridge full of bottled waters, we ordered lunch, which came from the tiki bar, it was amazing. Due to the hot summer heat we found the walk back to the hotel from the parks was too long, (monorail was down due to the heat one day) we vowed to only come back to this particular Disney

Summary Heading: Good location, great pool and slides for kids
Summary: The hotel was lovely and located just at the beginning of Downtown Disney, so you were about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  Given the heat at this time of the year, the walk could be exhausting especially navigating through the crowds with kids in tow. The hotel was clean, the service impeccable as with all Disney properties.  The rooms however are very small, so 4 in a double bed room was cramped.  The decor and comfort of the room was lovely. The pool area was a great respite for the kids, especially the awesome slides for all ages.   Prices are high, room rates, food etc., be prepared to shell out a small fortune to eat. But you would expect that staying in a Disney property.

Be fully prepared to be (financially) spanked by Mickey and his gang. However, the memories and the convenience will be well worth it! Last year, I stayed at an off-site property a few blocks from Disneyland, and the experience was vastly different. Here are the pros of staying on an on-site property. magical early hour (for guests only) was California Adventure during our stay.  This meant no lines for my favorite ride, Toy Story Mania (I rode it three times)! The Park was so enjoyable without the lines and crowds. (a 20 minute wait at Cars Land). The fun pool with its water slides for all ages is in itself a good excuse to stay there. A viewing of Pixars Finding Nemo at night on the lawn. Convenience to the park. For example, when I was starting to feel overwhelmed at

Summary Heading: Nice part of the whole Disneyland visit
Summary: Stayed here because it was cheaper than the Marriott.  It also provided immediate access into the parks, early entry in the mornings, the only thing resembling a water park with two nice slides in the hotel pool area, and from our 10th floor room we had ideal viewing of the fireworks every night (3 nights here) complete with the accompanying music on the Disney audio channel.  The eTicket lounge was nice with healthy offerings for snacks all day, breakfast basics, bottled water for the park, modest quality wine on demand, etc.  The staff were always smiling and pleasant and quite accommodating.  The room was thoroughly "Disney-fied" with Mickey Mouse faucets, musical light up fireworks graphic backboard on the bed etc. which pleased the grandson.

Summary Heading: Just as awesome as the first time...
Summary: This is just a really cool place to lay your head after a long day at the parks. The service from pickup at LAX to drop off at the same is impeccable. Check-In is simple and met with a friendly welcome. The room is comforting and lets you know you are in Disney, even down to the headboard with fireworks and music. We had 5 in this party, 3 adults, a child, a toddler and a double wide stroller. We all fit very comfortably with room to spare. There were 2 queen beds and 1 is in need of replacement badly. That will be my only complaint. Our second morning there was spent at Goofy's Kitchen which was pricey but very enjoyable. The pools are fantastic, even my toddler, who doesn't really like to swim had a great time. From the hotel to the parks is a really nice and relatively short

Summary Heading: Introduce "Front of the Line" Passes please!
Summary: We are a family with 3 young children and going to the original disneyland was one of their biggest wishes for the summer break...so our trip to Disney haopppend and what could be a better place to stay while visiting Disneyland, than one of the Disney Hotels itself!!!  Would I still say that after having stayed there for a week? Maybe yes, but surely with a few qualifications! Disney no doubt is a marketing Genius when it comes to entertainment, creativity and out of the box thinking....nut my experience with the hospitality side of its empire wasn’t as excellent, as so usually expected (and usually delivered too) from Disney!  This hotel is situated right next to the main Disney downtown, so it was easy for us to enter the parks and come back to the hotel to rest a little bit,

Summary Heading: 5 star luxury prices for 3 star basic accommodations
Summary: I recently stayed in a 2 bedroom suite (really a one-bedroom suite with an adjoining room) for the weekend to attend a wedding at the hotel. Even with the group discount, the room was about $1000 a night, and for that price, I expect to have top quality service and luxury accommodations. This hotel is nothing like that. The service was friendly but understaffed. At check-out the wait for a bellman was so long that we opted to carry our bags down ourselves in 3 trips. Our first day at the hotel pool, there was only one waitress for the entire, large pool area, and the wait to get food or beverage service was laughable. Eventually we gave up and went to the nearby cafe to get take-out food and drinks. The room decor is fine, but nothing fancy, and the bathrooms are pretty

I've had the pleasure of staying at many Disney World Hotels over the years however last week I spent 3 nights at the Disneyland Hotel for my first trip to Disneyland and I was absolutely blown away! Everything about the Hotel was simply phenomenal from the level of service, to the room (even the headboards have a special kiss goodnight), the Food ,we enjoyed a fantastic meal at Steakhouse 55 and Trader Sam's is one of my favorite bars ever! Not to mention that you are only a 10 minute walk from Disneyland and California Adventure! Overall I wholeheartedly recommend staying at the Disneyland Hotel when visiting Disneyland!

Stayed here in 2013 (2 adults, 1 child and 1 teenager)  and again this August with (4 adults, 1 child and 1 toddler).  Checked in around 5pm- no wait!  Friendly staff were welcoming and helpful.  Room was on 6th floor in the Fantasy Tower which we now prefer as we had a perfect view (and sound) of the nightly fireworks from Disneyland.  The room had ample space - adults on beds, toddler in the pack and play (standard in each room) and child slept on pull out couch that turned into a full size bed.  Had to get a bit creative with drawer and closet space but the overall room, fridge and counter area was spacious.  Beds are very comfortable as is the feeling of the room itself.  DOWNSIDE:  No microwave so in order to warm my toddler's milk,  I had to use either the microwaves in

Loved the themes of the hotel.  Loved the fireworks on the headboards.  Room was clean and had everything I needed.  Didn't love the shower head and low water pressure but that would be my only complaint. Loved the ease of the self park and short walk into Disneyland and California Adventure.  Wish the price was lower but its California and Disney so you know you are going to pay.

My family and I are Disney Vacation Club members and we decided to use our points as cash and stay over at the Disneyland hotel for the first time. We arrived by private transfer from LAX and we had a grand welcome.  As we opened the car doors Minnie Mouse was waiting and she came over to greet my daughter who was standing with her Minnie mouse hand luggage (perfect picture opportunity).  We arrived just after lunch so the outside entrance was basically empty so we got all of Minnie’s attention.  After enjoying our welcome other characters such as Goofy and Mickey also joined and proceeded to enter the lobby.  The lobby isn’t overly big and fancy but it the highlight is the teacups that entertain your children while you check in. At check in they asked me if we were celebrating

Clean rooms awesome service and great location! Will come back again and again! (: child friendly, characters came out to greet us when we arrived and checked in. Truly a magical experience for the whole family!

My colleague and I stayed at this hotel in July - it was lovely! The staff were very hospitable and the hotel was very clean and spacious. The rooms were large and comfortable - the bathroom was great as well! I loved the Disney theme throughout, it was very cheerful. The courtyards were scenic to walk through and very safe. The pool at the hotel was large, great temperature and had good hours of operation. It was sometimes hard to find a Lounge chair poolside. I would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity! Ps - you can send postcards for free from the customer service desk!

Love love love this Hotel. We have stayed here a couple times and have enjoyed all of the details that bring out the little kid in me! I love the lights in the head board and the music that plays. The hidden Mickeys all over the room, and the view from the towers, no matter which one you are in. The Steakhouse 55 restaurant is a must while you are there as well. Great food and the Trader Sam's tiki bar. Its a bit more expensive to stay here, but absolutely worth it for the magical feeling!

Summary Heading: Great stay with a few minor hiccups.
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the years and it really never disappoints.  We are always torn between this hotel and the Californian just because the location is so fantastic at the Californian.  We paid for a premium room whereas in the past we paid for the deluxe room - I could see no difference.  We were in the fantasy tower, 7th floor with a view of the pool.  Everything was great - rooms are nice, staff is so friendly, pool was especially refreshing as it was so hot that we spent the afternoons swimming to get relief and recharge for the parks.  Went to Goofy's Kitchen and spent too much money but had fun---food was good.  The only negatives:  water in shower would run ice cold repeatedly and the wifi never really worked for us.

This hotel was convenient to the parks, period. Very expensive, tired furnishings, premium room not worth the extra $$. Room service shut down early on Sunday night and forgot to tell the Guest Services folks. Inconsistent  info provided by cast members. Scott from Guest Services was the only one who was genuinely helpful.  No response from the exiting comment card left at the front desk when departing.

It was a stretch for us to afford this hotel but there is no way I could visit Disneyland again and not stay here. We stayed at the Grand Californian last year and the Disneyland Hotel is by far a better experience. Mickey Mouse decorations in the rooms including the sheets, being greeted by Goofy as you arrive,, the magical light up headboard - it all goes towards creating a truly Disney experience. We had a room in the Fantasy Tower and it was excellent. Very spacious and clean with every amenity. We loved the pool area and the water slides are awesome. I had the chance to go into Trader Sam's to order a drink and loved the experience - felt just like being in a Disney ride at one point when we were sprayed with water as it felt like we were sailing through a storm! But the

The Disneyland Hotel has Mickey magical touches everywhere!  The main Lobby with huge light up Disneyland Map, always fascinates, the Fantasy Gift shop & Small World Gift Shop offer wonderful Disney merchandise, the large comfortable guest rooms ooze Mickey charm, and the pool slides & great restaurants are top notch!

Summary Heading: Very convenient with small kids for Disneyland
Summary: Since we have young kids ages 5 and 7 and wanted to take advantage of entering the parks one hour earlier, we decided to stay at the Disneyland hotel. As it turned out, on two occasions out of four days, the extra magic hour was useless as the rides (Cars Land race, Indiana Jones) were closed until after the parks were open to the public. The rooms are okay although we (and the room next to us) had faucets that made strange noises when in use. The pools are great, the kids loved the slides. Very convenient even if you are not doing the magic hour. We stayed here for seven days and asked a room with view to the fireworks but this could not be done and the explanation was that because we are staying so long. I found that odd...

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 3 nights with my sister and 5 year old niece. Getting out of the car to see Chip n Dale and Minnie Mouse solidified the reason we were staying on property.    The rooms are SMALL, but well layed out and the Disney-fied touches like the headboards twinkling with fireworks and the Mickey hands holding the lights were sweet.    We ate at Goofy's Kitchen and it was surprisingly good (I was a little worried eating at a child's character buffet) actually ALL the food we had in the hotel was excellent.    Being close to the monorail and the extra magic hours at the parks really made our trip magical.    All in all; the hotel is more expensive- but WORTH IT! If you are trying to have a "magical vacation" this is the place to do it. Staying at the

My husband recently had a work retreat at Disneyland and I was able to join him for one night at the end of his week. I'm a huge Disney fan ( long time AP holder), but being local, I could never justify staying at the hotel. I was super excited for this experience and we planned to not even go into the parks, just spend the entire day enjoying the hotel.  I arrived at eleven, parking my car with the valet, which was a breeze. My husband met me at the valet and took me up to his room. We had a room in the Fantasy Tower, with our view facing the Mickey and Friend's lot, but we could still see the fireworks. The room was clean and spacious, with a really cool nighttime feature over the bed. When you pressed a button on the lamp, over the bed was a mini-light display that created

We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of August on a travel agent rate I was lucky to secure. Otherwise, this hotel goes for $500+/night. Pretty pricy. It is great if you are a lover of Disneyland nostalgia, though. Tangaroa Terrace (quick service) is not bad, but they don't open until 7am, so getting breakfast before the early entry hour wasn't happening. The Coffee Shop opens at 6, though. Of course, Trader Sam's is the best!  The room was very spacious (there were 5 of us) and despite having just a standard view, we were able to see some of the fireworks from the Disneyland Forever show. The light up headboards were lovely, and the beds were really comfortable. We did not receive any towel animals, which was a little bit of a bummer, but that's an extra, of course--never

My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon in 2014. Although one of the lifts was not working for the duration of our stay I could not fault this hotel. Its clean, the staff are friendly and its a short walk into downtown disney and to the parks. The room is a perfect size for a couple with a sofa, bed, chairs, desk and wardrobe. The room and bathroom is beautifully decorated and we had a view which over looked the park so got to see the fireworks when we landed. The pool and lobby are magically decorated and always clean. We did not eat or drink on the grounds as we decided to go into Anaheim into the evenings as it a short drive 100% will stay here again.

Almost impossible for fault the Disneyland Hotel - this place is extremely well run, rooms are brilliant, the pool is fantastic. We had a ball.   Be sure to book the 'character dining' breakfast well in advance - at least a month if not more.   It's only a short 6 minute walk to the park entrance, via Downtown Disney, and staying here really enhanced our overall Disney experience. Highly highly highly recommended and great with young kids.

Yes, it is worth the money if you have it. I have only been able to budget for this hotel once. We loved it and it was really was nice. We stayed in the Frontierland tower facing the pool. We could see fireworks from our room at night and the hotel grounds were so relaxing (lots of green grass and trees).   The beds were VERY comfortable. Probably the most comfortable beds I have slept in outside of home. The room was spacious and had a fridge. There was a little desk in an office area and the closet had two comfy robes to use. The room was updated and immaculately clean. We grabbed coffee in the morning from the coffee shop near Goofy's kitchen. We did ride the monorail (there is an elevator to use for strollers) to get back at night but enjoyed walking through Downtown Disney

Summary Heading: Love Staying Here When We Come To Disneyland!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a few times.  We really enjoy the convenience to Downtown Disney and the entrance to both Disney parks.  We like to stay in the Adventure tower.  This is certainly more expensive then off property hotels, but planning in advance can often help out with the price!  When you stay here, you are paying for the Disney experience, cleanliness, location and service.  We have seen Goofy strolling around here many times.  So fun! The rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable.  The twinkling, musical headboards are such a nice touch!  We have never had a problem with noise here from other guests.  The pool area is really nice.  The kids really enjoy it as do we.   Can't wait until next time!

If you have young children in your group, stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The Grand Californian is a tranquil, quiet place. The Disneyland Hotel has a much better pool for kids and the rooms evoke the Disney Magic much more than the Grand Californian. Take the monorail into Disneyland or the Grand Californian private entrance into California Adventure. It really isn't second best. It's a totally different experience. Having said that, if it's all adults, I would choose the Grand Californian. Quieter, peaceful and attached to California Adventure.

I would definitely recommend this hotel for a Disneyland visit.  We were able to walk to Downtown Disney as well as both Disney parks.  We parked our car and never had to use it, which was great.  They have a little cafe by the pool where we had a very reasonable breakfast.  Our room was spacious and wonderfully decorated.  The beds were just okay, but they were queen size.  There was also a couch that folded into a twin bed, which my son loved.  There are several restaurants, including Goofy's Kitchen which has character meals.  The pool area has slides and two nice size pools.  It was pretty busy the day we spent there, but we were impressed with how many life-guards they had.  The only disappointment we had was when we wanted to add another night.  The cost was much higher

Location: if you are visiting Disney Land and California Adventure its perfect.  Room: There are three towers around the pool. I think we were unlucky - we were on the 2nd floor of Adventure Tower and literally looked into the service area of the tikki pool bar. Also next to the elevator and ice machine.  When we asked to relocate we were told that wasn't possible.  (That was the first example of "No can do!" that we experienced! Not magical!  When you check in make sure they give you anything above 4th floor.    Service:  This is the reason for two stars.  There were so many examples of 'Sorry, we can't do that" from trying to get a drink by the fireplace, in the bar, or at the pool. It was just not very friendly.  Summary, not a bad hotel, just not a great one.  And the

Summary Heading: Nice little stay for a few days
Summary: We stopped at the Disneyland hotel for 4 days on our way to Hawaii. As frequent visitors of Disney World we couldn't skip up trying it. The hotel was very nice and the staff was friendly and great. There was a mixup with our tickets and package and Ashley took great care of us at the front desk. The rooms were spacious and the headboard added a nice little touch. Easy walk to Downtown Disney and both parks. we enjoyed our stay.

Our family of two adults and two teens stayed at the Disneyland Hotel last year and two nights this July. We were there on the 60th Anniversary of Disneyland and saw the ceremonies and got free cupcakes!  The night before on Main Street we watched the parade and then the fireworks with a light show.  While playing music from Frozen it magically began to snow!.    The hotel consist of 3 different towers.  This year we stayed in the Fantasy Tower which has the registration desk and the luggage drop off out front. There is also a gift shop and small store off the lobby. Self park parking is also close by. All three towers are within a short walking distance to Downtown Disney and once through Downtown Disney to Disneyland Park.  There is a large swimming pool shared by all 3

My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 6 days in July.  Some Disney employees say that the Disneyland hotel is considered their mid-range hotel, with the Grand Californian being the premier. I've stayed at both, and while the Grand is an incredible hotel, Disneyland hotel is equally as amazing.  We stayed in the adventure tower, there are 3 total.  I've read most recent reviews about the hotel, so was expecting somewhere between the motel 6 and the Ritz.  Disneyland hotel, does amazing right, and customer service right.  Other reviewers mentioned the water.  I wouldn't drink the water.  The first night we were there, I noticed an extremely weird smell coming from the water, almost like smoke. Since other reviewers mentioned this, I wasn't overly concerned.  However,

If you want to be in a place where people care about you and want you to have a fun, this is the place. Disneyland Hotel exceeded my expectations, we went on a scavenger hunt that took us to all three Disney Resort Hotels, and Downtown Disney, it was loads of fun. The Eticket room is a must, if you just want to relax and enjoy some snacks this is the place, at night you can see the fireworks from Disneyland. The staff were amazing, we had a slight problem real late in the night with no stores open and the staff took are of the problem. The cleaning staff are the best, they kept the room very clean and stocked love these women!! The bed-WOW!! so comfortable it was like sleeping on a cloud.

My family had quite a pleasant stay. The room was adorable and easy to access which is always a plus. Staff was very nice and everything was very clean. In terms of noise, children tend to go to bed late and get up very early, so much noise. Overall, magical and really made our stay nice.

We came for my daughters 8th birthday. We started our day with breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen. There was a wide variety of food. Food quality was good and tasted delicious. The characters all came out to say hello.  We had an excellent experience at the hotel.  It accommodated my family well. Plenty of room. The beds were comfortable. We spent one day at the parks and the next day hanging out at the pool. Loved that the pool area was adequate on staff and life guard services. It gives you a piece of mind knowing that there are extra eyes on the safety of the kids. Would definitely come back.

Our family of four 2 adults 2 children ages 4 and 8 loved our stay here. We stayed 3 nights and were hoping for a fourth, but unfortunately the weekend and week after the 60th was completely sold out. We had a double queen with ample space in the fantasy tower near the elevators. Everything was clean and in working order. I loved the head board. I wish I could've taken the entire bed home with us because we slept through magic hour our sleep was so good. I bumped into the manager our first day going in the parks and she was friendly informative and joy to speak with. We also enjoyed the pools especially the heated one! The kiddie slides were great and I loved that there are lifeguards everywhere near those slides. There are two small ones that kids who can't swim can use. I also

I was just here and it was so fun in the lobby was Disney characters throughout the day. The rooms were great and very spacious. You get the magic hour for staying on property I suggest you use it. Overall great hotel and rooms and its Disney who wouldn't love it!

It is hard to fault a hotel when it is located in Disneyland. The rooms were a bit outdated but very spacious and functional and the pool area was huge and a lot of fun. Only issue is that it is an extra 7 minute walk to Disney and that is a great of 35 degree heat with exhausted kids after a few hours in the theme park.  I will stay at the grand next time I make it there which is slightly closer to the park and im sure it is as family friendly as Disneyland Hotel

We stayed at the disneyland hotel for one night and everyone was very great. They let us check in at 6am for that we could have two magic mornings instead of just one. I would love to stay here again and for more days. If only it wasn't so expensive.

Stay here recently, lovely hotel close to Disneyland and Disney downtown is pretty much right out the door.  Room very nice, we had one over looking the pool.  Would recommend to anyone wanting to go to Disneyland.. As a shot walk there. Had breakfast at Goofys kitchen was nice had a good selection for food was buffet style. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

As a child visiting Disney land I always wished we could stay here. Our first stay at Disneyland Hotel was more wonderful than I could imagine. First the service at the check in tower was wonderful. I requested Club service (or Concierge) upgrade and was given that with no problem. Then I was told we would be on the 12 th floor in the frontier tower with a view of the nightly fireworks and the pool. How perfect was that. We were staying in a 1 bedroom suite and with 3 adults and 2 children. The Club service was in a different tower, but on the way to and from downtown Disney. I highly recommend it, besides eating ALL our meals there they supplied us with water ,sodas and snacks we could take to the park everyday. What a savings. Did I mention there was free wine/beer and

Summary Heading: Best rooms and pool area; second best location
Summary: My family has stayed at all three Disneyland Hotels (Disneyland Hotel, Grand Californian, Paradise Pier).  Overall, the Disneyland Hotel is the best themed of the three and has the nicest rooms and pool area.  However, it is also the farthest of the three from the gates of Disneyland and California Adventure.  While this hotel is the closest of the three to the monorail (when it's in operation), the extra walking distance through Downtown Disney definitely DOES matter when it's hot outside and you have kids in tow.   Many people ask to compare the Disneyland Hotel with the Grand Californian.  Although my family prefers the Grand Californian for its location and convenience (and it's become our Disney hotel of choice), if I'm being totally objective, I'd have to say that the

This is probably a very good hotel if you and your family are actually there to enjoy Disneyland but it is not convenient as a venue for a technical conference (which I was) because it is too spread out.  The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: The start to a perfect honeymoon
Summary: We arrived just before midnight on the first stop of our honeymoon. I had dreamed of this place since I was a little girl and right from Check in, it was the best dream come true ever! Lovely Staff, easy access to the parks, gorgeous room and great room service. I would recommend wear your newlyweds button!!! We lived the congratulations over and over again whilst waiting for rides!! We loved it. I hope to bring a family back here when we have children. Thank you Disneyland and Disneyland Resort for making this princesses dream come true!!!

Disclaimer:  We are huge Disney fans! We go to Walt Disney World every two months from Virginia Beach.  We almost always stay on property and we love it!     Overview:  This hotel is amazing and has so many magical surprises in it that there are too many to name.  Room:  We stayed in the Fantasy tower.  Our room was wonderful.  At first we were a little bummed that we overlooked the parking lot.  By night fall you could not see the parking lot. We just saw an amazing view.  At 9:30 we turned on the TV to channel 16 (plays the fireworks audio from the show) and watched the fireworks right out our window. They were AMAZING!   The room was so nice and specious.  Wonderful hidden pixie dust everywhere.  The beds were soft and smelled fresh.   We felt like we won the lottery with our

Summary Heading: Magical Stay to end our Honeymoon!
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights last week and had a wonderful time!  When we checked in we asked if there was any chance of an upgrade, and there was!  We were upgraded to a view of the pool, which was beautiful!  The staff were very kind and our room was very nice and very clean.  The huge windows were just beautiful!  We stayed in the Adventure Tower.  The proximity to Downtown Disney, the monorail and the parks was wonderful!  They even sent strawberries, chocolate and whipped cream to our room for our honeymoon....such a sweet touch!  The housekeeper was so nice when we ran into her in the hallway too!  We couldn't have had a better experience!!

Summary Heading: Still some magic, but the edges are fraying.
Summary: We've been taking our kids to Disneyland every year for the last 6 years.  We are experts and we do it right:  Disneyland hotel, multi-day stay, character dining and a healthy bit of shopping to top it off.  We always choose the Disneyland hotel because of its history, proximity to the park and seamless customer service and bit of magic dust.  It seems that the magic is starting to fade.  This year, there was no single cue at check-in / check-out, which left us rushing around from desk to desk, only to get turned down by several who were busy doing "other things."  Not only is it unacceptable to be working at an outward-facing service desk while not offering services, but the explanation was handled in a very abrupt way ... no magic here at all.  Our request for a late check-out

It is worth it to stay in one of the Disneyland hotels. I want to tell you that staying outside of the park is just as great, but I can't. Yes, there are some phenomenonal hotels that offer great packages and are extremely accomadating to Disneyland goers, but if this is your once in a lifetime trip I would absolutely stay in the Disneyland hotel.   Paradise Pier hotel is a little more affordable, and it's really great. If you can, get a view of California Adventure so you can see World of Color. The Grand Californian is insane. It's amazingly wonderful, but it's unattainabley expensive (of course, do it if you can).  Disneyland Hotel is magical. If you are coming for the Disney experience, this is it. If you think you're going to be sick and tired of Mickey Mouse at the end of

When my son and I arrived at the entrance to the hotel, we were greeted by Disney employees who answered my question that we wanted to self park ($17 a day) and where was it located (valet was more expensive). They directed us to the 20-minute parking area where we could go into the hotel and check in and then retrieve our luggage (if we wanted to do it ourselves, which we did) and go straight up to our room. At the counter, it took a little time to be acknowledged and greeted by an employee, who -- after reviewing our reservation -- saw that we were only issued a king bed. Of course the person saw I was traveling with my adult son and must have figured out this would not do. Thus, we were moved from the main hotel to the Frontier part of the hotel. I was hoping to stay in the

It was a very nice way to start our vacation.  Pluto and Minnie were in the lobby when we checked in.  We had a great view from our room and it was a comfortable stay.  It is an expensive place to stay but the perks you receive really do make you feel like it is worth it.  We stayed at a good neighbour hotel at the end of our trip and there was definitely a difference. Wifi is included but it isn't the best.  That was probably the only negative.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable room- great location and wonderful pool area. Did not regret booking this!
Summary: Very comfortable room for our family of 2 adults and 2 girls. Good room layout with a separate WC which comes in handy. It is peak season so the hotel is at peak capacity and this is reflected when trying to find a sun lounger by the pool, or waiting for a lift at meals times etc. The only downside is the noise levels when everyone wakes up early to take advantage of the extra early magic hour openings at the parks - dont bother trying to sleep in.

Summary Heading: Truly Magical, The Perfect Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: We had a great experience at the Disneyland Hotel!  We've been to the parks many times but have never stayed at a Disney property.  This time, we really wanted to take advantage of Magic Hour, so we decided to bite the bullet and stay at Disneyland Hotel.  Magic Hour alone is worth the cost of staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  That extra hour in the park each morning means you can get through all of the rides that usually have huge lines very quickly.  It really enhanced our whole experience at the parks.  It makes for early mornings, but I would do it again on any future visits.  The hotel itself is quite nice.  The bell staff and valets were very helpful.  Check-in was quick and easy.  We were assigned Frontier Tower, which is the furthest from the parks.  I had wanted

We spent 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Fantasy Tower. We got an upgrade to room with 2 queen beds and a daybed. The rooms were very nice size and clean. Loved the headboards! We had view of the pool. Normally go to Disney World and this was first trip to Disneyland. The characters wander through the lobby of the hotel and this was great to see!

Good rate. This time Frontier tower.. Further away but larger room and view of fireworks at night:) good breakfast options at cafe / bakery. Bar and cafe offered good options also. Goofus kitchen was always busy and the stark house was always booked out when we wanted to go. Nice pool and convenient to parks.

We have been to Disney world before but never on site.  this was our first time traveling to Disneyland and staying on site.  The very first impression I had of the hotel was that it was everything I hoped for.  Staff was amazingly friendly and happy, the tea cup seats in the lounge were adorable and Goofy met us in the lobby.  We opened the door to our hotel room and our kids immediately discovered the fabulous headboard.  I miss that light up musical head board.  It was so sweet.  The pool is great with 2 slides for the kids. I loved the Disney music playing 24/7 as you walk the grounds.  I even used the laundry room our last night there and it was really easy to use and reasonably priced.  Everything is within walking distance to the hotel ....downtown Disney is about 2

This is our 3rd time staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  We prefer the location to that of the Grand Californian.  It's at the end of Downtown Disney and just a short walk to the Monorail.  The perks are nice, primarily Magic Morning Hours.  Take advantage of these precious 60 minutes!  They can save you hours in line!  I rated the Disneyland Hotel 4 stars because there were some errors with our stay.  First, the room category we book and paid for was supposed to be a "prime" view.  During our past stays that has meant a view of the pool as well as the fireworks at night.  Not so this time.  Upon check in we were told it was simply a view of the pool.  When we checked into our room we did have a view of the pool, but it was mostly of a multi-story parking structure.  Definitely

The Disneyland hotel was amazing  When we arrived valet was fast and they got us help for our luggage  Very clean and everyone is friendly at the shops and restaurants  The hotel has everything you could want breakfast lunch snacks and most important coffee in the am before your long walk through downtown Disney to the parks  It is at the very end of downtown Disney so it's a trek every day keep that in mind The rooms were very clean and maid service was prompt and always on time  The bathroom has cool touches like Mickey hands holding the lights and little things like that Also we loved breakfast with goofy  A must if you can fit it in  The pools and slides are lots of fun for the family too  We will return soon!

My wife, 5-year old daughter and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for our 7 day Disney trip in April. All three of us gave it thumbs up. We stayed in the Frontier Tower with a view of the pool (requested when we booked the room). The hotel is steps away from Downtown Disney and is pretty close to the Monorail stop that takes you to and from Tomorrow Land. Staying "on property" includes the opportunity to enjoy "magic hours" where the parks open to hotel guests 1 hour prior to being opened to the general public. Only one park has magic hours each day...the hotel does a great job of posting which park has magic hours for the next day and the exact time that park will open. The room was plenty big enough for the three of us, included a small fridge, was clean and well kept, and was

It's been several years since staying at the Disneyland Hotel. The most recent trip was great, mostly due to the excellent customer service. Disney makes sure you are treated well in all areas of the resort. My only complaint would be the wifi. It didn't work in the room or in most areas.

Not sure that it's worth the extra cost of staying on site. The convenience was good, the room was clean and a had a few cute features like Mickey Mouse light fittings and the light-up bedhead, but it was small for a family of five, the hotel is older-style and the on-site food offerings were not great (either very crowded or very fried). Glad we did it, but wouldn't do it again. Big group of party-plan style conference delegates didn't help in setting the right atmosphere.

Summary Heading: Disney Experience is Expensive but Unforgettable
Summary: We love Disneyland. We've visited resorts in Hong Kong, Tokyo, Florida and now Anaheim. We've stayed in and outside the resort and staying at a Disney Resort is definitely the way to go (but it's expensive). And the expense isn't so much in the room rate but in everything else Disney. The character breakfast and gift shop and pool side bars and ...well, I think you know what I mean. Saying Disney is like saying Baby or Wedding - the price is tripled!  Despite the expense, we would stay again in a heart beat. We booked a premium room over looking the pool and we were accommodated in the Frontier Building (there are 3 buildings, Frontier, Adventure and Fantasy - and I think Fantasy overlooking the pool would probably be best as its closest to everything). We had 2 Queen beds (not

Although this hotel is park oriented with characters and Disney pictures everywhere it is still a great place to stay for families on aDisney Park vacation. The hotel is just a few steps from downtown Disney and I mean it! The monorail drops right besides the hotel as well. The pool has been remodeled last year so it gives young and old enough to look forward to. It can get a little crowded in the afternoons. For folks from out of town remember that Southern California is fogged in with a marine layer for most of the morning. It burns off mostly by noon. That said go enjoy the parks under a cloud cover and hop in the pool around 3:00pm. Remember that everything from food, lodging and parking is a little pricey in Southern Cal compared to some rural places in the USA but this is

Once you get over the sticker shock of the room, you can enjoy your stay. The pool area is great for kids- sometimes they want to spend more time there than in the theme parks. The gift shop always has a couple of unique items too. The rooms are a nice size- and always clean. It's a great place to stay if you are there for any of the Disney runs- the Expo is right there on premises- and the start and finish lines are not far away either.

We stayed two nights in early July this year.  Hotel is wonderful but way too expensive.  You can stay at a number of nice places that are close by for a small fraction.  You are able to get into the parks 1hr early but only a portion of the park is open at the time.  Not worth the extra money unless it's just a night or two.  Felt bad we didn't use the pool more.  They have a great water slide area.  Glad we did it but will not be back.

We stayed here in June and LOVED how convenient it was to everything.  It was very clean and quiet and had a great view of the pool. My only complaint was the WIFI, which I found out that they still don't have it through the parks. Was use to it in Disneyworld where it was everywhere on the grounds and parks. Would definitely stay here again.

It's very convenient to stay do close to the parks. However you go pay through the nose for the convenience. The rooms are nice and very spacious, especially if you get one of the recently renovated rooms. The rooms are much larger than the ones at the Grand Californian. Sound insulation is also better. Great pool but very crowded on high season days. The beds are very comfortable.

Yes, pricey rates, but felt it was so worth it for the kids' first visit to Disneyland! Special touches from being greeted by a friendly cast member upon driving into the property's parking area and presented with a personalized parking pass to receiving room keys even for the kids (yes, personalized also) to seeing the hidden Mickey touches on the furniture, carpet, and fixtures & fireworks display headboard just added to the magic that is Disney! Our room -  2 queen beds and a twin day bed on a high floor in the Adventure Tower had an awesome view of Downtown Disney and toward the parks. Liked the bathroom layout. When traveling with kids, it's always great to have double sinks and a separate private area for the toilet.  Great location. The hotel is still a short walk to the

First, a quick tip we figured out unfortunately on our last day:  the gift shop in the hotel is huge, way less busy, and has almost everything any gift shop in the park has, AND at better prices in some instances!  My wife got a 60th anniversary hoodie for $64 after tax.  The exact same hoodie at the shop inside the park was $75!  Now to the review:  My wife and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in the Fairytale Suite this past weekend.  She had no idea that we were doing this.  She thought we were just getting a normal room.  It turned out to be the best surprise as she claimed it was her most favorite hotel room we've ever stayed in (and we've stayed in some pretty good one's I think.)  Having her tell me over and over she loved the room and texting her friends and family about

Last year my family and I stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier hotel. It was AMAZING!!! The only thing I could find that was not 100% was that late at night, with two dragging kids and a tired mom and Nana, the hotel was a bit of a walk. So this year, we decided to try out the Disney Hotel, it is a bit closer and let's be honest, it's the first Disney hotel on site, so of course it's got to be the best, right? It was wonderful! The lit headboard is so sweet, such a cool touch! We stayed there 07/06-07/07. The staff was so friendly, and so helpful! I loved that there were lifeguards all over the pool area, even though my girls are 10 and 12, it's still very comforting. The Weather was great, in the mid to high 70's, but the pool was still VERY crowded, we didn't stay too long. The

Summary Heading: Luxurious Hotel & Property; Excellent Service & Location; Very Pricy
Summary: Stayed here in June and absolutely loved it!  The moment you enter the property, it is magical!  Gorgeous lobby with plenty of Disney touches.  Excellent front desk service.  When we checked in, the clerk said she had something in her mailbox waiting for my boys and she brought out an autographed picture of Mickey Mouse for each of them. Lots of special touches like that throughout our stay that made it really special.   We had a room in the Fantasy Tower 4th floor overlooking the pool area.  It was a beautiful view.  Room was good size for our family of 4 and was quiet even though it was 2 rooms away from the elevators.  We all loved the special headboard.  Pool area is very well done.  We rented a cabana for 1/2 a day which was 100% worth the extra cost to have a private

It is pricey. I like this hotel better than the Paradise Pier. You stay here because it is close, the magic is here. We have stayed in two of the towers. The fantasy tower with the kids and the adventure tower for our anniversary. Both are super cool. Magic everywhere. When we stay at this hotel we don't feel like we have to stay in the park the whole time. The hot tub is a must. I am never as sore the next day when we use the hot tub. Goofys Kitchen is a must. It is right there. Make your reservations weeks before you come. The hotel is clean, the people are wonderful. If you want the magic this is the hotel to stay in.

Summary Heading: Not worth it Stay somewhere else.
Summary: Probably the worst run hotel that I have ever stayed in.  We arrived around 9:30 pm and the hotel's computers were down (I have never seen that in 35 years of travel) so with 5 people milling about smartly behind the desk only one is talking to customers. We had a long wait in line and then they can't find our reservation.  I showed it to them (prepaid) on my iPhone but no help.  I suggested that they get our physical welcome package from the back but with no computers they said they don't know how to do that.  We finally get a room.  Then the next morning we order room service and when it arrives we are told we need to pay cash??  They wrote down my credit card information at check in - but 12 hours later their computers are still down.  Later we go to the front desk and even

Summary Heading: Convenient Location but So So Room
Summary: First off the location of the Disneyland Hotel is perfect and the monorail station is just steps away. The staff at check-in was extremely friendly and prompt. Our room was just ok, an average run of the mill hotel room. The bathroom was very dated and overall  a little drab. There were a few special Disney touches here and there but overall we felt the room was overpriced. You are paying location and that is it.

Summary Heading: Being in the resort is worth it.
Summary: As a Disney Vacation Club member trying to get into the villas is almost impossible if its not your home resort so staying at the Disneyland hotel or Paradise Pier are excellent options. I prefer the Fantasy tower bc its the main tower.  Rooms and beds are comfortable and bathrooms are nice with a vanity area just outside the bathroom.  Have stayed here many times and the staff is very nice and accommodating.

We took our two little girls all the way from Europe to Disneyland Anaheim and it was worth it! It was our first visit, everything was flawless, easy parking, easy check-in, room (with view of the pool) ready in minutes. The girls spent some time in the pool every day, they were so happy with the whole experience. The room and bathroom were clean, the air con worked well. The location is perfect, we walked to the parks in the morning and to disney downtown for dinner. We loved it. Wi-fi was a bit hit and miss.

Perks: 1) disney characters showing up around the hotel, you get to take pictures with the characters without having to wait in long line ups in the park  2) easy shopping returns: buy from gift shops from either one of the parks or in DT disney and you can return items no questions asked at the gift store INSIDE the hotel. The exchnage/return policy is 30 days?.... also ,FREE DELIVERY of gifts from park stores to hotel bell desk (but it takes one day to deliver so don't use this service on your last day at the hotel)  3) Free ice in hotel. Ice water and towel at the pool. TIP: fill in room ice bucket with ice in the evening, next morning you have melted ice water to fill water bottles to drink for the day.   4) no extra/room charge for pool side dinning. have lunch at the pool

My daughter and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel from June 28-30th. We arrived around check in time, 3pm, and our room was not ready. We went to grab something to eat and came back - 2 hours later we still had not been assigned a room.
