The guest services CM that spoke with found that we had been waiting 2 hours past the normal check in time (we weren't making a big deal about it) and upgraded our room as well as gave us 2 complimentary dinners to use during our stay. I felt this went above and beyond. We found the room to be an amazingly large corner room, quiet with a lovely view of the trees and landscape of the Disneyland Hotel. During our stay we had room service for breakfast and our room was made up in the late morning hours. We found the hotel to be convenient to catch

Summary Heading: Our favorite hotel when in the park.
Summary: We go to Disneyland at least once a year, often more. This is our favorite hotel. Sadly we went a few weeks ago but weren't able to stay here because they have really priced themselves out of a reasonable rate. That being said and for the first time in over 10 years, we stayed at a good neighbor hotel across the street. There is no comparison.   My family has stayed at all the resort hotels at Disneyland. Regardless of price, our next trip will be at one of them again. The Paradise Pier is the least expensive, and so much better then the off site hotel we stayed at this time. If you can afford it, I would highly recommend this hotel first. The magic touches and just the fact that everything works, (air conditioning, windows, room size, location) makes it a much more enjoyable

We stayed here for New Year's, arriving on the 29 December for 3 nights. It was our first time staying at a Disneyland hotel. We have stayed at Good Neighbour places previously. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We are a family of 4 with 2 teenagers. Our room had 2 queen beds and a day bed, so our kids didn't have to share. we found the room big enough for our purposes - sleeping. Even though it was a busy time it was very quiet and we hardly ever saw anyone else. To get to Disneyland we used the monorail. To get to California Adventure we entered through the Grand Californian Resort. It was great to not leave the Disney bubble and be able to charge anything we bought to our room. It was also close enough to walk back to the room if we needed to.

Loved the convenient location here, to go in and out of the park at one's convenience.  No problem with anything, and loved the themed accessories in the rooms.  A bit pricey but worth it for the accessibility.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: My 4-year old son and I stayed here for 4 nights with my best friend and her family of 3 kids, husband and sitter.  We had an adjoining suite (1 room with 2 queens adjoining a suite with living room, kitchen, fold out couch and bedroom with 2 queens) which was perfect.  The location is awesome - a 10 minute walk to either Disneyland or California Adventure park.  The early entry options were key - I recommend them.  Also recommend being in line by 6;30am - we ate breakfast in line ;-)   The hotel was great - very nicely appointed rooms, and the pool area was good.  The kids loved the waterslides.  Note that they provide life jackets, although the smallest size was hard to find.  We brought our own floatie but my son had to wear a hotel life jacket on the waterslides.   We also

I have been debating this review for a bit, but I think the overall experience at the disneyland hotel was excellent.  They do make you feel "magical" from check in, to bag check, to checkout. A short walk to Downtown disney and the monorail stop, a bit of a hike to the actual park gates.   Magic Hour definitly made this stay worthwhile.  An hour before the park opens to the general public means you get a lot done  :)  Clean rooms.  Fully expected everything to be sticky and gross due to all the kids.  If you get a back tower, be prepared, it is a bit of a walk from the lobby.  Wish we didn't spend all the time in the park, and got to enjoy more of the ammenities.

Summary Heading: Great stay even with the price.  Worth to see, even just once.
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland hotel a few months back.  Overall it was a nice experience.  It was east to get to, check in was a breeze.  Our room over looked downtown Disney and was well decorated with Disney decor.  They have an awesome light up headboard that plays music.  I wish they sold them!  Here are a few drawbacks.  One, you have to pay for parking and it's behind the hotel.  When we went they were doing work so unless you drop your stuff off at the front you have to carry/wheel your things from the garage all the way around to the front of the hotel.  as annual pass holders I was annoyed that we still had to pay for parking.  Secondly, they are not super close to the park.  You have to walk through all of Downtown Disney to get to the gates, OR you can take the Monorail

The best thing about this Hotel is the location. If you want to get into the spirit of things when at Disneyland, you need to stay here. The best location-wise is the California Spa. But that is a resort and to really get your monies worth, you need to spend time at the hotel. Well you wont when you are in Disneyland! I did not stay there but did go for a visit. This Hotel has the next best location. It is at the other end of downtown Disney to the parks. A 5 min walk will get you to the park. You could also go through California as they have their own enterance to the park. I stayed in the main building overlooking the pools. The pools are great. It is so good to be able to come back to the hotel and have a swim and rest before going back to the park. Things are expensive at

We have stayed here multiple times and love it. This most recent time we stayed 4 nights in a room in the frontier tower. Our room had a fireworks view which my boys love. They are age 2.5 and 5.5 and always look forward to a trip to Disneyland and the fabulous headboards in the room. The ability to get into the park with a double stroller easily is something I love, no folding it up and lugging it on a tram or shuttle. We spent every afternoon in the pool area, my boys loved the small waterslide and fountains. The hotel provided life vests and attentive lifeguards which is great with so many little ones splashing around. I had fun too on the large monorail slide! You can often see characters in the lobby with little to no line which is great for the kids. The food is OK,

We visited here recently & we're disappointed!  The fast pass system was anything but. You can only have one pass at a time & most had run out by lunchtime. Luckily some of the rides were only 20 minute waiting time but others were 45 minutes.  Very limited food selection-burgers or hot dogs & limited places to sit & eat. Very expensive too. By contrast universal studios knows how it should be done!

Summary Heading: You pay for the location and Disney perks
Summary: We paid extra for a club level room; I'm not sure it was worth it. When you arrive, you have to wait for Disney to dispatch a special representative to take you to the club level to check in. We arrived an hour prior to check in and our room wasn't ready (but would be in an hour), but we were told they would take our luggage and store it and we could call them to deliver it once our room was ready.  We signed the paperwork and headed to Tortilla Jo's for a late lunch. After fighting through large crowds (it was the Avenger's marathon weekend), I received a call from the club level representative telling me that we were supposed to wait and sign some additional papers for the folks to take and store our luggage (this was NEVER mentioned to us). The representative was rude and

Summary Heading: Just looking at pictures doesn't do this Hotel Justice
Summary: We were on a 25 day cross country family trip and we are "Disney World  - Orlando" junkies and knew we wanted a couple of days at Disneyland.  My wife and I had stayed here before many years ago and just remembered it being quality Disney stay.  Yes you are paying the Disney price tag but the room was one of our favorites of the 25 day trip (to our 18 year old daughter it was #1).  We got to the hotel very early and expected to have to walk around and enjoy the grounds for awhile but the room was ready.  The pools and grounds were awesome and the short walk to Downtown Disney next door and the parks were great.  We spent 2 nights here but could easily see flying back out and spending many more days here.  There was so much about our visit here that reminded me of "old school"

This place has been around as long as Disneyland, and, like Disneyland, it's family friendly, a total sensory overload, and overpriced. Still, you need to try it once, especially if you're visiting the theme parks for a couple of days. A wide variety of restaurants are on the property, so you can sit down for a meal and avoid the hustle and bustle of eating in the parks, and just about anything you could need can be procured for a price. But the price is a bit off-putting. Definitely not a budget spot, but you can walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. The rooms are kind of cool, especially if you're a huge Disney fan - or an 8-year old.

Summary Heading: Convenient and that is what you pay for.
Summary: Spent the start of our vacation at the Disneyland Hotel. We love Disney and the whole vibe but the value is hard to see, accommodation was priced at 5 star rates but is not by any measure, don't get me wrong, it is comfortable and adequate but certainly not 5 star. Staff are good but incredibly busy to go the extra yard.   The Parks live up to all your expectations with one exception - the food! It is poor. They could make it so much better so easily.   No doubt we will return but unlikely to the Hotel!

This is Disney Magic at its best - the new rooms with the musical and light up headboards are lovely. Wish it was not 3 towers as it loses a little of the magic that the Grand Californian has. Loved Goofy's Kitchen.

Summary Heading: The place to stay at Disney
Summary: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. The short ride from John Wayne Airport put me in the heart of Disneyland. The lobby was spacious and tastefully decorated. The staff was friendly, courteous and most welcoming. The rooms were larger than I anticipated. I enjoyed finding hidden Mickey's throughout the room and hotel. There are some amazing hidden Mickey's in the conference center. My room on the sixth floor (2419) gave me a great view of the fireworks at nighttime from the window. By dialing in the one of the channels on the television you could hear the music along with watching the fireworks. The bathroom was huge and well stocked with Disney toiletries. Also enjoyable was a large headboard with Sleeping Beauty's Castle. When you flip on a switch fireworks

First of all, we checked in early and the staff was incredibly helpful and got us squared away efficiently and to our room, even though we were early.  The staff was courteous and kind, and even acknowledged my mother's first return visit to the hotel since 1962! They made such a big deal, you would have thought we were the only people checking in that day. Our room was spacious (get over it people who complain--this place was built in 1955's room specs), clean, and welcoming, and I loved all the little Disney touches.  I won't even get into my love of the headboard.  During our stay we enjoyed the close proximity to the parks--Walt Disney World can't touch this perk--and the characters who appeared in the lobby spontaneously.  The staff was so kind, especially housekeeping, who

Have just left this property after a three night stay.   Plus points 1) It is SO close After long hot days and lots of walking it was awesome to stay so close to the parks.   2) the early morning magic hour  Before the park opened it was great to have some time without masses of people or queues.   3) the pool So great to have a cool off in the afternoon heat - even if it was packed with kids!  4) the E club A couple of times we had tired hungry kids and free fruit and pastries was appreciated.   Other comments  Room was basic. Bit dated.  Bed was a bit sloping on one side.  Did it matter? No! Kids didn't care.  Most important thing was when it was 10pm and we had sore feet it wasn't far to go.

Yes it's expensive and you can stay at several other locations for a lot less but its magical, it has the Disney signature charm, friendly happy staff and is very clean.  What you get for the high price is early park admission, signature Disney hospitality, some really fun pools, great character dinning on property and convenience. I took my kids to Disneyland for the first time so staying somewhere else was not an option, we wanted the experience and they delivered.  I am not sure if I will stay there every time I go but since my kids are very young the convenience and memories are priceless.

The location on the park grounds can't be beat for the price, but there are much better values off property that are almost as close.   Great service with the concierge option, but I overheard the front desk talking rates for groups (5k runners) that were half the price of what we paid. A senior employee was teaching a trainee how to get the most money from guests checking in, and it completely turned my stomach to see the steps taken by this Disney hotel to make you part with your money.

I love the convenience of staying at the Disneyland Hotel. It is within walking distance of everything and the conceirge service was excellent. I recommend this to everyone. The food is great. I recommend the Rainforest Cafe on Downtown Disney and we love the ESPN Zone too.

My family just left from a 5 day vacation late June. Reasons to stay here:  1) magic hour. You'll get in the park every single day of your stay one hour before it opens to the public. Worth every single penny. We rode every ride we wanted to. Some 2 or 3 times in a row.  2)it's so freaking close. the location allowed us to leave the park many times and still have energy to good back for more rides. Even close both parks out.  3)if you have kids, stay here. My 4 year old needed nap time from all the heat. It was nice to not walk far to get a break. We even let our 10 & 14 yr old explore the park while we took breaks.  4)your feet will LOVE you. Stay here for the convenience. Staying so close will make you get the bang for your buck as far as both parks go.   Now service from the

Summary Heading: Disney Magic, convenience and comfort just as expected!
Summary: We took our granddaughters to Disneyland this June with a 5-day park-hopper ticket.  We chose the Disneyland Hotel for the convenience to the parks, the early admission, the pools, and the Disney theme.  We tried the e-Club at the hotel for the first time, since we were travelling with young children who can be picky about what, where and when to eat.  It was a perfect solution for grandparents!!  We stopped in early each morning for a quick breakfast with good choices for the girls.  We gathered fruit, water, and juices at the e-Club for our days in the parks.  It worked so well!!  I would highly recommend the hotel and e-Club . . . top notch service and hospitality early in the morning . . . until fireworks (excellent view)!  Noise was not an issue . . . even during the summer

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay but overpriced!
Summary: Stayed at the DL hotel with the kiddo after graduation.  It's proximity to the park is fun but  the hotel is not worth the $$$$ we spent.  We looked online for rooms and it showed they were all sold out.  We called the Disney Land Hotel Customer Service and they got us right in a room, on the dates we wanted even though their website said they were sold out.  I don't know that I would spend the money to stay here again especially since there are such nice hotels in the area for a lot cheaper.

The last time I stayed here was over 30 years ago.      This hotel has 3 towers now and the rooms are pretty spacious.  We had a room with 2 beds and one sofa bed.  the sofa bed is not the type you pull-out but you pull down the back rest to get the sofa bed. Rooms are clean and there is a small fridge in the room as well.    This hotel used to have 1 tower and I thought the monorail used to stop in front of the hotel.  Things have sure changed in 30+ years.    The downside to this is the price.  Rooms can go from $300 and up

Summary Heading: All about that magic, bout that magic, no worries!
Summary: I usually stay at the good-neighbor hotels because lets be honest, the resort hotels are pricey. Since a kid I've always wanted to stay here and 15yrs+ later, my wish finally came true :)   The hotel itself definitely has that magical Disney touch every where you go, but it's not smacking you in the face either. Very subtle touches in the room and I loved the light up head board! Our room was on the 8th floor in the Fantasy tower and had a great view of the pool but was a bit small for 4 people. The service was great, for both checkin/checkout. Everyone always has a smile on their face and very helpful and accommodating. The pool area is spacious and there are multiple 4ft pools to choose from. Towels are available and there is bar service at the pool until 5:30pm. There was

This is a splurge but you won't find better staff or a more authentic disney experience. There are so many wonderful touches of Disney in the rooms. I've found room service to be wonderful and very accommodating of special food requirements. I prefer this hotel over the Grand. Spectacular pool for the littles too.  The rooms are a bit small.

Summary Heading: Kick starts the magic of Disney
Summary: Enjoyed by my daughter and I (she's 22) - a FREE accommodation as part of an incentive trip I earned thru my job and when my daughter discovered the singing headboard, she squealed like she was 2!!!!  LOVED the Disney touch in the room - just the right amount without being tacky and so convenient to access the pool, downtown Disney and the park.  We enjoyed a view from the 12th floor and the room was spacious and clean.  Staff were AWESOME!

My husband is attending a conference this weekend at the Disneyland Hotel.  I spent last night with him - we were both impressed by this hotel.  It's an older Disney property, so I wasn't sure how up-to-date it would be, but it's been updated nicely.  Our room was in the Adventure Tower (one of 3 towers).  We were located right next to the elevators, which concerned me at first (noise), but we didn't hear it at all in the bedroom and only very little from our bathroom.  The room was spacious and very clean with a nice pool view.  Overall quiet, but had sounds of plumbing from other rooms.  Staff was very nice.  Had some difficulty finding the front desk to check in (a different tower), but otherwise had easy time finding self parking and generally getting around.  Disneyland

We travelled all the way from Australia and with young kids ages 3 & 6 we wanted to be close as possible to the Disneyland Parks. Staying at the Disneyland Hotel really did complete our entire Disney experience. Rooms were on the smaller side but clean, well kept and had a lovely dreamy feel. Everywhere you turned, there were glimpses of Mickey.. on the lamps, taps, carpets, bedding! We were even able to see the fireworks from our room. We went all out and got the " Concierge Premium Package" which for the most part included free food. There was a small exclusive room, which was nice and quiet. We were able to have a simple breakfast and pack snacks and drinks for our day ahead. We had a 2-day pass and spent a day each in both parks. The grounds were amazingly clean, the parks

These rooms will make the magic of Disney come to life!  There are flashes of mickey everywhere!  The detail in the rooms and décor throughout the hotel were impressive to me!  Staying here gives you an extra hour into the parks early in the morning... this is AMAZING!  No lines or very short wait times before the heat of the day.... very awesome perk.  Staying here gives you many perks.  The water slides are great for a huge range of ages, the staff are friendly and helpful. We never heard anyone around us when we were in our room.  Beds were comfy and the headboard was an awesome touch!  My kids loved it and we loved the spacious room and bathroom! I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in the Disney Tradition
Summary: Our extended family has stayed at the Disneyland Hotel many times in regular rooms, view rooms, and most recently in a two bedroom suite.  We are always happy with the rooms, the service, and the overall experience.  The kids are big fans of the pool with the fancy slides. The hotel is situated at one end of Downtown Disney and the entrances to the parks are at the other end of Downtown Disney.  If you want to ride the monorail directly into Tomorrowland, the monorail entrance is very close.  There are many restaurants, shops, and even a movie theater close by.  We all enjoy the Disney themed decor and the way every guest is treated like a special guest.

Summary Heading: Told they had no room for us!
Summary: Our son's Graduation trip was planned around 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel, and we were all so excited! Checked out of our other (perfectly good) hotel to move over to Disneyland Hotel at noon for a day of lounging by the pool & enjoying the hotel. At check in the gentleman said "I will be right back" and my son and I thought something good was about to happen...NOPE! He returned to tell us that they had overbooked and did not have a room for us, but could probably find us one at the Paradise Pier! After an hour of conversation & tears, and two different managers, we were sent on our unhappy way to PP. We have stayed at PP in the past and would not choose it again. The 2 star rating I gave is only for the help of the manager who did her best to accommodate us and make up for

Summary Heading: Had a great trip to Disney!
Summary: The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was more spacious than expected.  The pools were fun, although one day they were crowded.  Enjoyed the slides!  Amazingly close to downtown Disney and the parks.  Enjoyed lunch by the pool!  We will try to come back.  Definitely recommend for families!

We stayed for 6 nights and had a wonderful time. The service that Disney gives is outstanding. We were so impressed! Each and every person goes above and beyond to help their guests! Our room was cozy and clean. We loved coming back to our room every day and seeing our clean room and how the house keeping staff had situated our childrens stuffed animals each day. It made us smile :) The pool is awesome for small kids (however we barely used it since we were at parks most of our stay). The restaurant by the pool was so delicious and had a great view of the pool. Probably my favorite restaurant during our whole trip. The walk to Downtown Disney was close. One thing I would have done was requested a room with a view of the pool or downtown Disney, not a parking lot. :)

Recently stayed for a week at the Disneyland hotel with my husband and our toddler. Overall the hotel is beautiful, the renovations are lovely, and it definitely feels like you are on vacation. Hotel staff was excellent at attending to our needs.   Rooms: In Adventure tower. Had a king bed standard room overlooking a building and the pool. Room was lovely and comfortable. Mattress sloped a little in the middle so it was a little uncomfortable at times. Pillows were another matter- so thick and fluffy that we actually went to a nearby store and bought cheap thinner pillows because our necks and backs hurt in the morning. Mini-fridge was nice, but would also be nice if room had microwave. Our room was by the second set of elevators, but found our room to be very quiet.

Summary Heading: All is all zero complaints and many smiles....Disneyland Hotel the happiest and cleanest place on Earth
Summary: In Disney style and fashion, this hotel is charming and styled according to a theme.  We stayed in the Wilderness Resort.  It was adorable, but not kitsch.  Top service. The decor was subtle, yet whimsical.  So Disney.  Nicely located as well.  Great security.  Super clean.  Not one thing wrong.  Plenty of amenities, polite and efficient staff.  Just a bit of a cranky check-in hostess, which surprised me.  She was not impolite, but she was not perky or friendly, which is unusual for Disney.  Food was yummy.  All is all zero complaints and many smiles.

Summary Heading: Its not flash but its close to the action!
Summary: My family of 4 stayed in a premium view room, club level which means we had a view of downtown Disney and access to the club lounge. Don’t expect much from the room- there were 2 double beds, a tv, teeny tiny fridge, closet and bathroom… But lets face it, you don’t come here to spend time in your room, and for us, the close proximity to the parks was worth it. (Although I must mention the bathrooms are not amazing! The bathtub is tiny!) Having club access meant that we had free snacks morning, noon & night and even wine/beer in the evenings up in the club lounge. The breakfast was definitely worth it, although I was in complete shock that the fridge was full to the brim of soda. (in my family we do not drink soda) You have to ask the servers for bottled water and you will only

I forgot to review this when we visited. This was there first time I had stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. We had gotten to LA at about 10;00 p.m. and didn't arrive at the hotel until midnight. The kids were all tired but as soon as we pulled up, there energy went right back up! From the moment you walk into the lobby, to the moment you leave, it's truly magical. The lobby has seating in the form of teacups, a disney film is playing 24/7, it has an LED backdrop, and mickey and minnie statuettes welcome you! The magic continues into your hotel room too! The beds have headboards that lights up and play "A dream is a wish your heart makes" when you flip a switch. The kids really loved that. And the bathroom has mickey hands holding the lights. The pool had monorail themed slides, and

Having gone to Disneyland 4 times in the past year and half, and having stayed at four different hotels/motels in the Disneyland vicinity, I had decided early on for this trip it was paramount that we stay at a place that would provide added comfort for my wife and our five month old baby girl.  I didn’t necessarily envision them spending every day at the park with me and my 5 year old son, going on ride after ride.  So early on I looked at the Disneyland Hotel.  When I first started looking the cost seemed prohibitive; twice what The Fairfield Inn charged for one of their top floor, Disney themed, park facing rooms.  So I booked the Fairfield and waited to see if Disneyland offered any AP or Visa cardholder, and just as I suspected, they offered on both accounts, what amounted

My son, his fiancé & I stayed here 3 days. This was my son's treat as he wanted me to experience this hotel since I had never stayed there when we have visited. We had a standard view of the parking lot with 2 queen beds. The room was decorated nicely and was roomy. My bed however was very uncomfortable. The only locations I could get fairly comfortable was close to the end. I've stayed at other off site hotels and found their convenience as good as the Disneyland Hotel for much less. I couldn't get over the $17 a day parking fee, especially when we came from an off site hotel that had free parking. I think I'll stick with the off site hotels and save some money.

Summary Heading: Great base for exploring the parks
Summary: Great hotel adjacent to Downtown Disney and a few blocks from the parks. Rooms are a little on the small side, but enough room considering you won't spend much time in them. Beds are extremely comfortable, and the headboards are a really nice touch. Check-in and check-out was easy, arrived a little late so no problems with lines. Great gym facility with the latest equipment allowed me to keep to a decent workout schedule while on vacation. Didn't spend any time at the pool, but it looked like a lot of fun.   Stayed at the Grand Californian the last time, but for the amount of time spent in the room or on-property, decided the Disneyland Hotel was a better fit.

Loved loved the location!!!! I have stayed at hojo, embassy suites and Hilton and the Disney hotel blows them away due to location! It was so nice not to have to take a bus or walk so far for anything. The hotel room was nice and roomy and had a refrig which is great! I loved the bar downstairs cool Live Hawiian music that our son loved. If you can afford it at least once in your life this is a must do! The pool water was a little cold because it was cool this week. Also you could hear people in hall sometimes but thank god we were at the end so not much noise for us.  Our son  also loved the music and headboard lights so cool! I loved everything because it was close to great restaurants in downtown Disney and close to monorail to get you to the other side of Disneyland Park

The disneyland hotel is a classic. While the modern updates have refreshed the hotel, the classic nature of the this hotel still comes through. The only complaint. Is that this hotel, like many upscale hotels currently, nickels and dimes you with up charges for so many things.

We've stayed here twice now & love this hotel. We always get great service, the rooms are clean & modern with a tasteful touch of Disney. The light up headboard is a treat & my 8 year old swears they have the most comfortable beds ever. Easy walk to the parks & the early park admittance makes the higher cost of staying on property worth it.

Summary Heading: very magical stay for our three year old
Summary: Loved the special small details that made a small hotel room cozy. The wall behind our bed lit up with the castle with fireworks. Kind of a big night light. Very clean. The travel be was not the best, but worked. No matress in it so our four month old didn'twant to sleep in it. Staff very nice. Used the in room coffee machine to heat water for baby bottles.

Disney knows customer service unlike any other vacation organization.  Our first night's room though magical was a bit uncomfortable, so we asked for a room change.  Although they were booked close to capacity, they found us a spectacular room with a view.  Both rooms we stayed in had fun disney decor and the pool area has a monorail slide.  I  never spend so much money for accommodations but the Disneyland hotel was worth the splurge.

What can I say that we don't already know about Disney - they are fabulous at what they do - help families make memories in fabulous locations. This hotel is clean and bright and the staff is extremely friendly.  Would I stay here again – YEAH! Would I recommend this location to others – YEAH! So what are you waiting for? Book it ASAP! 

Our family goes to Disneyland every other year, always staying in one of the three resort hotels at Disneyland. We hadn't stayed in the Disneyland hotel in a while due to the renovations and we were very excited to see what it looked like after. From the moment we walked in we knew this would be an enjoyable stay. The staff was friendly and energetic. There was a gift shop right when you walked in, great! The rooms were magical in themselves. The beds were quite comfortable and the room was very nice and super spacious. The view of the pool was great! We loved how the wall lit up- such a nice touch! The bathroom had two sinks, not common in most hotels, and we really appreciated having 2! We loved this hotel and all it had to offer, it is on the expensive side but it was 100

We have wanted to stay at a Disney property for years. It is so expensive that we usually stay at one of the properties across from the main entrance. We finally decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for one night just to see how it was. It was an amazing experience for sure! I would highly suggest staying here if you can. Every staff member we ran into was fantastic as you'd expect. The check in process was painless and everybody gets their own personalized room key which the kids (and parents) thought was fantastic. The room itself was pretty standard for a nice hotel. The headboards did light up and play music which was a hit with our girls. The pool area was great. We were there during a refurbishment for the water slide unfortunately though. It was still fun for the kids.

Summary Heading: Love the location and the remodel of DH!
Summary: Absolutely love the remodel and getting in early to the park doesn't hurt.  We were here celebrating our daughters birthday.  Everything was a magical experience for her, us and all that joined us for the week of fun and festivities. Enjoyed hanging poolside a few times as we took breaks from the parks to give the little ones some down time.  The DH makes it easy to take young ones back to the room for naps and adults to recharge (nap as well) before going back out to close the parks. Take advantage of the free things you can do as well. .

Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids 9 and 12) stayed at the DH for a 5 night stay at the end of May. Our previous 2 trips to DL we stayed at the Hojo Anaheim. The DL hotel is very nice, don't get me wrong. We booked our trip package through Coscto Travel so I am not sure what price we paid per night but my guess from checking the website directly is around $350/nt. We received great treatment at check-in (took Disneyland Resort Express from SNA - I will review in a separate review) didn't see one character upon check in or any other time during our visit which was disappointing. We stayed in room #2475 on the 6th floor of the Adventure Tower (we had a peek view of the fireworks & obstructed view of pool from pine trees). This tower is the furthest away from the lobby and the

Last hoorah for my daughter as she is leaving for college, as we got there greeted by goofy and played with my kids for a while.  stayed at adventure tower.  There's five in our party so we had 2 queen bed & a couch that turns into a single bed.  Room is nice & clean I have a view overlooking the district and also can see fireworks in this room(2545).  Went to the swimming pool area, water slide, jacuzzis, kids loved it.  Thanks Disneyland for a gifts & memorable vacation. Definitely will come back and spend more days.  There is a restaurant called Tongaroa next to the swimming pool area & across from the hotel

My family has been fortunate enough to stay at the Disneyland hotel quite a few times, and we all just love it there.  We have always had excellent and friendly service, and the hotel is very charming.  There are lots of special Disney touches everywhere and the pool area is amazing.  My kids are 11 and 16 and still love going swimming at the "monorail" pool!  It is great to be directly next to Downtown Disney as well- there are so many choices available for food and shopping, and all within easy walking distance. The convenience of being on the property cannot be beat, we don't even use our car during our stay.  We have also stayed at the California Grand, which is beautiful- but in comparison the Disneyland Hotel just has the edge on Disney Magic!

Summary Heading: Well worth the money for the perks and convenience
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is a marvelous place to stay especially with young children. There are cute features in the rooms that delight.  We stayed in the Club level with our grandchildren and it was perfect. The staff are so solicitous of the children and go the extra mile for them. The convenience of the Club lounge for breakfast, snacks and drinks throughout the day and then the evening appetizers make the extra cost worth it (as long as you utilize it).  We love the pool area, extra time in the parks and the convenience of the Monorail.  This is one of the top hotels in the area and well worth the cost for extras and perks you get.

My husband and I stayed here in March of 2015. I phoned ahead months before to say what we needed. A very late check in and a king size bed, as we don't have kids with us this trip. After a long day of flying, we finally arrived at the hotel about 1:00am. First minor annoyance was that we were given two double beds...because we didn't get there early enough in the day.  Next, we were hungry. No room service after midnight, no restaurants open and no stores in the vicinity.  We were Told that there were vending machine in some other tower, but not ours. As a diabetic, this is not great.  We were very tired. So just went to our room.  No over priced food options there either, believe me, I would have paid at that point! For $300+ a night, this is unacceptable.  Save your money and

We had an awesome 4-night stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The room was very nice (as it should be for the cost) and we lucked out and could see the fireworks even from our standard room on the second floor. The room had bits of Disney Magic sprinked throughout with a light-up, musical headboard and subtle Mickey features. It was expensive but I was impressed with the room and consider it worth the splurge!

Summary Heading: Disneyland hotels fun but room to improve
Summary: A family trip from New Zealand to Anaheim to visit Disneyland . So we picked the Disneyland hotel, layout of hotel is great taking you into wings of the hotel labeled by Disneyland park areas (frontier land) room was clean and tidy with a small fridge . Beds were super comfy after the third night we had a issue with our air con after complaining we were directed to another room as they could not fix the air-con(thank you). Would be great to have a better play area for kids, we loved the characters walking around and dining at the on site goofy s kitchen was a blast. Pool area fun also

We stayed at Disneyland Hotel for one evening. Had an amazing room on the top floor and could watch the fireworks from there. The room was darling, with many Disney-isms, like Mickey hands holding the lights, Disney writing on the shower for "hot" and "cold", etc.   But there were times the service, while pretty good, was not up to a Disney standard. Not super attentive, cheerful, going that extra step. And they just didn't all seem happy to be there...  We really enjoyed ourselves...might come again...always nice to stay on Disney property.

There is lots to love about this hotel including •	Very large rooms that cater for families and hoards of luggage •	The resort style pool(s) and spa areas complete with a number of water slides •	Lovely manicured gardens •	Classic Disney touches in rooms including the light-up headboards  •	Good eating options -  •	The outdoor fireplace – great for evening cocktails •	Great location at the end of Downtown Disney with an approximate 7 mins walk to the park entrance. Downtown Disney has lots of eating and drinking options (love the Jazz Kitchen) •	Very friendly and accommodating Staff from the moment you enter the property. •	Magic Morning privileges (however I did notice the park that did not have the magic morning tended to be less crowded once both park gates officially opened

Two night stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Room was Disneyfied in a comfortable way. Access to the various areas of the Hotel grounds was a bit of a walk as was the walk to the Mono-Rail or Downtown Disney. Could really use a transportation mode for access to the various parks or downtown (Disney World has Mono-Rail right to the Hotels). Overall, staff was excellent and supportive. Food accessible.

I celebrated my birthday with my family on January 6, 2015.  Every minute of it was TRULY MAGICAL! We received a surprise upgrade from Paradise Pier to the Disneyland Hotel.  We had EXCELLENT service the entire stay!  We had dinner at Steakhouse 55.  Our dining experience was fabulous! The hotel is truly Disney through and through!  The room was spacious, very clean, and quiet!  We shopped throughout Downtown Disney. We took advantage of the early hour into Disneyland and stayed until closing.  It was the last day that it was decorated for the holidays.  Thank you Disney for an exceptional birthday celebration!

Disneyland Hotel has a very magical feel to it. We have stayed at all three Disneyland Resorts and love them all. There is no wrong choice. Personally, I just love the pool view from the Disneyland Hotel. You will feel like you are inside of a postcard. The resort has everything at your fingertips. It's all right there. It is a quick walk right into Disneyland and Downtown Disney, too. My favorite part of the room is the headboard. it makes this hotel resort unique. There is just something magical about having fireworks right on your headboard. By the way, our room faced the fireworks! Beautiful! We also were traveling without a car and surprised at how easy you could grab a taxi from the resort. My daughter became sick and needed to go to the emergency room during our stay.

We actually stayed in May of 2014 for our wedding night, I'm just writing this review a little late. We had a pool view room and it was so beautiful. We were so busy in the parks that we are bummed we didn't get a chance to spend a little more time in our room and at the hotels pools. Next time we will have to make sure we do. The bed was comfortable and the fireworks headboard and disney touches to the room were beautiful. We really enjoyed our stay. It is a little pricey and I wish they had cheaper options like they do in Disneyworld. That's the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5

The hotel is just perfect for kids.  We had a 2-bedroom suite and it was perfect for 5 of us.  The pool, with all the slides, is great for the kids. There were a nice restaurant/bar at the pool.  The pool service was quite slow, though; it's better to go and get your own order.  Disney characters come out in the afternoon.

Summary Heading: Definitely worth it, very special and unforgettable
Summary: This was our first visit to Disneyland Resort and we weren't disappointed. The hotel room was lovely, we especially loved the headboard with the fireworks lighting and music. We had requested the Fantasy Tower which we got, but we didn't get our view of Disneyland. Still, it was a big week at Disneyland (60th) so we didn't expect everything.  The Extra Magic Hour was one of the reasons this hotel stay is worth the price paid. We were able to get a lot of rides done with virtually no queues in this hour, especially Radiator Springs Racers. We liked being able to charge things back to our room using the hotel room card.   There was a very special bonus given to us in staying at the hotel. That was - on the 60th (22nd May) we made the silly decision to go back to the hotel room to

This the second time we stayed here and both times I was disappointed.  The customer service is not at all up to par with the price that you pay.  "No" is the typical answer at the front desk and they don't budge at all.  I would never stay here again. Also, you can hear your next door neighbors.  Your neighbors may end up being your alarm clock whether you like it or not.  On the positive side, the water slides are really fun.  It's nice that you are within walking distance to DL and CA Adventure.

Disneyland was my favourite part of our 3 week USA trip, and the hotel was also my favourite accomodation of the trip. Great location in the park, far enough away from the hustle but close enough to walk to the restaurants, shops, parks. And the pool is amazing!   Rooms are a great size, musical lit up headboard is an amazing touch, bathrooms are a good size and beds are very comfy. Great 4 star accomodation!

Well worth the money upgrading to Felix rooms etc are worth it resort views are good and so is park views beautiful pool and water slides for kids as well as hot tubs and private cabanas lots of room beautiful wood decoration in room on wall lights up plays music kids loved it.. World of color was a must

We usually spend a couple of nights here once a year with my son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandsons.  I reserve adjoining rooms.......one for their family, and one room for my husband and me.  It is 2 days and nights of Disneyland magic.  Rooms overlooking the pools are nice. The hotel and premises are well kept; clean and pleasant.  The staff is always very helpful and pleasant.  Food is available from expensive to reasonable......something for every pocketbook.  Downtown Disney  is right there with additional restaurants to choose from.  As well as, a short walk to Disneyland/California Adventure.  It's a very special time for us.

We returned for our second trip to Disneyland this January. After a satisfactory stay at the Paradise Pier last year, we decided to try the Disneyland Hotel out instead. We aren't in our rooms much while we are at Disney, so our enjoyment tends to be based on other factors such as hotel location and amenities.  The room was great. Beds were comfy, everything was clean, and my daughter enjoyed the light up headboard. It was perfect for a family of 3 or 4. Might have been a little cramped for more than that. Overall a little nicer feel than Paradise Pier, but otherwise pretty similar.  My daughter loved the pool area, which had a lot more to do than the one we went to last year. We were there in January so we didn't spend a ton of time there, but I think she would have happily

Summary Heading: Old Review for October 2012 - Awesome stay!
Summary: We won a trip and we were fortunate enough to stay here for 2 nights. I have to say it was pretty amazing. Super clean, friendly staff, great amenities. I knocked of a point for 2 reasons, the walk to Disneyland it terrible and the price. We couldn’t afford to stay 2 extra nights and had to go to a lesser hotel. But, If I had the money, I would definitely stay here!

We recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  It was my 3rd stay at the hotel and my 2nd stay in the Adventure Tower with a pool view.  I love that the rooms have a Disney feel, but not an "in your face" feeling.  The grandkids love the headboards that light up with fireworks and music.  The Adventure Tower is the closest tower to Downtown Disney, the Monorail and the park entrances, but still quite a long walk.  On our last visit we stayed at the Grand Californian which was much more convenient to the parks and Downtown Disney, but just too much of a price difference to justify it this trip.  The staff here is always amazing!

Summary Heading: Best Place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Simply the best place to stay for a trip to Disneyland. Especially with young children. Facilities are wonderful and the convenience cannot be beat. Beds are comfortable and  the ambiance is special. Yes, it is pricey, but well worth it.

The room was very clean and comfortable with a beautiful pool view. The staff was friendly and the hotel had all the Disneyland 60th decor to go along with all the excitement. My favorite part about the hotel was the couch that turned into a bed and the headboard that lit up and played the tune "When you wish upon a star." MAGICAL...

Convenient to parks, food was so so, character dining at Goofy's overpriced for poor quality fare but little kids absolutely adore the theme dining. Service staff were Disneyesque and wonderful. Was not impressed since you really dont get any benefts for spending 2-3X what you get outside but I guess they can gouge you for the convenience.

Summary Heading: Amazing Stay, beautiful hotel, phenomenal staff
Summary: We stayed in the Disneyland Hotel for our most recent visit to Disneyland. Having the hotel that close to the park was so great. We didn't need our vehicle at all. The walk to the parks was short and filled with shopping, restaurants and great people watching. The extra magic hour was a great amenity of our stay as well. Our room was spacious and the view was great. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  We utilized the pool as well. The water slides were great fun. We also went to Goofy's kitchen for dinner. The food was incredible and having the characters come to our table during the meal just made my daughter's world. She was so excited to see all of her "friends". Honestly, one of the best experiences of our lives. I couldn't recommend Disneyland Hotel more.

We stayed at the Fantasy Tower (each tower is themed) and had the pool view. The decor is quite whimsical at this tower. Unlike the Grand Californian, the Disney theme is more pronounced in the decor at the Disney Hotel. This hotel is also more reasonably priced than the Grand Californian. The rooms, bathroom, and pool are recently renovated. The rooms are spacious, with wall to wall windows. The upgraded rooms and pool, details in the design (please see photos), attentive and very friendly customer service, kid focused activities, easy access to the park make for a magical experience and are worth the expense.

We stayed in the Fantasy Tower of the Disneyland Hotel for our first-ever trip to Disneyland CA (we're super veterans of the Florida parks and hotels). It was everything we expected - and quite a bit more.   ROOMS - Very spacious, stylish, comfortable, quiet, and outfitted with everything you could possibly need (robes, hair dryers, iron, coffee, mini-fridge for your personal use (not mini bar), super yummy-smelling shampoos and bath products. The magical light up mural on the wall, vintage pictures of Walt and the parks, and the convenient adjustable reading lamps for either bed were all extra special touches.   HOTEL PROPERTY - Pieces of classic Disneyland are everywhere here. Amazing vintage photos of the earliest days of the resorts. Actual sketches from before the parks

I've been to stay at the Disneyland Hotel a total of 2 times in my life. The most recent was last week and WOW. Talk about a wonderful experience. Disney really knows how to make a hotel someplace you want to stay, no matter he price. The rooms are really lovely. The headboards are definitely a hit with all of my family, we may or may not have turned them on and off repeatedly to hear the music! And the view of Downtown Disney was spectacular! We had the best view-some of our group actually stayed in the hotel to watch fireworks one night and said it was better than being in the actual park. The pool area was also a hit! My younger sister loved the water slides and I enjoyed the pools and jacuzzi. The way they themed this hotel is something I really enjoyed. So much so we've

Summary Heading: Beautiful property close to park. Fun stay!
Summary: Ok, i don't know where to start. Thinking about Disneyland always has me at a loss for words. I've been an annual Disneyland goer since 2011. And let me say, you NEED to stay at this hotel at  least once in your life. It really feels like you don't leave the Disney atmosphere even after you've left the park. The hotel is only a short walk from the park entrance. You just need to walk through Downtown Disneyland to get there which is honestly a super short walk.   The nightly rate for the hotel in October for us was more than $300 when my boyfriend and I stayed there in October of 2014. We spent $3,000 for only 2 adults for one week and a week of park hopper tickets were included. Keep in mind that this was during Halloween season. Just to add a child would cost and extra $500.

This place was exactly what I expected it to be. A big hotel with cool Disney amenities. The water slides here are nothing short of amazing, as are the pools and spas. The rooms are large and the headboards are really cool. We really enjoyed being able to take the monorail at the end of the night and "skip" the traffic coming out of the parks, not to mention save our legs a little. We did get a great rate for a conference. That's the only we could ever stay here. If we payed full rack rate, I'd probably want a lot more.

Anytime it's Disney, it's over the top. I love being able to walk to Downtown Disney in a split second.  The monorail is right there also,  The best part is early morning admission. This allows you to get into the park one hour earlier than guests at the gate. Staying at the Disneyland Hotel is much better than Paradise Pier, it's much closer to everything and the difference in cost was 1.00.  Tiki Bar was very crowded every night and right next to the swimming pool. The room as usual was very nice and clean, staff as always is amazing.  Pretty pricey, but we loved it.   The headboard lights up and plays a song.   Just a very cool place to stay.

Summary Heading: Close and an enjoyable easy walk to the Parks (by an old grandpa with a bad back)
Summary: When I was told that we couldn't get rooms at The Grand Californian for our recent trip to Disneyland I was disappointed. I'm an older man with a bad back and it was so close and convenient staying at the GC. The closest place we could get was The Disneyland Hotel. The monorail used to stop there but it doesn't any more and I was worried about the longer walk to the Parks it would be.  I am happy to report that it was no problem at all. It is a longer walk to the Parks but the walk is entirely on "Main Street, USA". It is an enjoyable walk with all the shops and places to stop if needed. There were no streets to cross and no big parking lots to walk through. You step off the hotel grounds and you are right in the middle of the exciting adventure of visiting Disneyland.  The

Summary Heading: First time in a Disney Hotel
Summary: So now the kids are grown and we went by ourselves to Disneyland and splurged by staying at the Disneyland Hotel, something we could not afford with three kids before. I got a great military rate which  I appreciated but make no mistake, it still costs twice as much as good neighbor hotels.  The room was large and comfortable and had several reminders that you were in Disneyland. I guess that's why you stay there! The staff were all excellent and we had a good time. The DLH has three towers and we were in the Frontier tower which is the farthest away from the downtown Disney entrance but still not bad. The pool area looks great but we did not have time to hang out there. You do get to use the extra magic hours if you stay in one of their properties.  If you have extra cash you

We've stayed at this hotel a couple of times with our kids. And each time it's been a great experience. The hotel brings the magical feeling to your room. With all the small attention to detail, it will make your stay a memorable one.

Stayed with friends and family Great location to enter downtown Disney and parks Clean grounds and hotel Pricey.. But why wouldn't it be Restaurants $$$$ Nice pool. Easy parking Easy and friendly check in Convenient souvenir shopping Big spacious rooms 10 th fl facing pools was nice

I am a premium annual pass holder and had been planning this weekend for a long time. I ended up booking it through Costco Travel because it came with character dining for everyone in the group ($45 per person), a lanyard with pin, free photo and a bag tag for everyone. It was my daughters magic birthday (15 on the 15th) and she wanted to spend it at her favorite place. We pulled up to the hotel and there are characters everywhere!! What a great start. We were upgraded to a pool view room, but couldn't see the pool because we were on the second floor and there was a bunch of trees in the way. Not a big deal since we didn't pay for the upgrade. At $452 per night, I expected to be wowed by the room. It was very spacious and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was small. Only

My brother and I stay here every time we come to Disneyland (3-4 times a year, we are annual pass holders). You simply cannot beat the location, it is minutes away from the monorail and downtown Disney is just steps away from the pool. Normally, we arrive at around 3pm and request that we stay in the Adventureland tower because it is closest to the monorail and we like the decorations. This time, however, we arrived at around 11pm and we were put in Frontierland tower. This is a newer tower than the other two and the rooms are slightly larger, but it is a bit more of a walk around the pool and Trader Sam's to get back to the room. That all being said, the room was clean and comfortable and still much closer than any other hotel would be. We'll always be back for the Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great Family Trip (3Bed 3 and half Bath)
Summary: A short family trip to Disneyland. 6 adults, 1 teen and 2 kids. We booked a 3 bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel. We have stayed here before but not with this size group. It was perfect. I couldn't find a layout of the room before I booked so I have attached badly drawn layout :) sorry I didn't take pics. The layout is a 2bedroom suite with a foyer that connects one bedroom that is completely separate. The view was great, we watched fireworks from the living room. It was nice to have a main area where we could hang out watch tv and eat. It was great to have the space to spread out. The Living room had the small fridge, large dining table with 4 chairs, large tv with DVD player pullout sofa, 2 club chairs and coffee table. My husband, 2 kids and I took the 2 queen room with

I stayed at this hotel overnight and found the rooms to be spacious and modern. I was on the top floor which I think was the 29th, with views of the car park. The only thing  I would have changed was that the room was supplied by vending machines in the hall for light snacks and water or soft drinks. There was no free bottles of water in room and no signs to say the tap water was not suitable for drinking. I only found this out after using it to make a cup of coffee and noticing an unusual smell. I asked one of the attendants  in reception if the water was sanitary and he said he would not advise anyone to drink it. I feel there should have been signs in the room to inform guests of this, as you would not expect one of the richest nations in the world to have sub standard water

If you want the full experience of Disneyland with the convenience of being on property for your stay, choose this hotel.  Despite the Grand Californian and Paradise Pier being other obvious choices, this hotel was THE original where the monorail passed by to pick up and drop off guests.  Every inch of the rooms and towers are covered in magic touches, from hidden mickeys in the carpet to mickey hands as the light fixtures.  Even the magical backboard amazes me with every visit.  The hotel provides amenities like baggage transfers for when you move from one park hotel to another (which we did on this last stay), as well as valet service, room service, and more.  Each room holds up to 4 adults or 3 adults and 2 children, maximum.  Standard views are of the parking lots, with

Summary Heading: A little expensive but it's hard to beat the location
Summary: We've stayed at The Grand Californian several times and loved it but on this last trip, I just didn't want to pay that rate so opted for the Disneyland Hotel. With 2 teenagers who want to roam freely between the parks and stay out til the park closes, you can't beat staying on the property. The pool is great and allowed the adults to relax while the kids enjoyed the park. The hotel is clean and nice. The pool service was really slow - it appeared they only had 1 pool waitress and even though it wasn't crowded, it took forever to place an order for a drink so we ended up walking up to the bar instead.

We had a great time at the Disneyland hotel. Fantastic view of downtown Disney. Really good view of fireworks from our rooms large windows. Great service from all the staff. Really close to everything the park has to offer. Trader SAMs for a beverage and some appetizers. Goofus kitchen for a really nice character dinner. Large pools. Very relaxing place to get away from the "real world".

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for Tinkerbell Run weekend
Summary: Our weekend could have been ruined when we arrived at the hotel and realized that our reservations didn't start until the next night...however, Stuart at the check in desk, went straight to work to help us with our reservation problem, going above and beyond to get us checked in to our room after flying from the East Coast.  All of the team members did their best to make our stay the absolute best.  The location to the parks and the start line was fantastic!!  We loved going to our first character breakfast at the hotel with Goofy (wonderful breakfast!!) I loved the Disney touches in the room from the headboard that would light up with the castle and fireworks, to the Mickey hand scones.  There are lots of restaurants nearby at Downtown Disney, and the walk to the park was fine.

I traveled to Anaheim to attend two, one-day Disney Institute sessions in Anaheim and spent three of my nights at the Disneyland Hotel.  I rented a car at the John Wayne airport, as I wanted the flexibility not available with the Disney transportation that was available (self-parking was $15 per day in their private lot).  I was a bit concerned with being able to find the hotel, but after turning onto Disneyland Drive, those concerns were alleviated as there was excellent signage.  Check-in was easy, and the front desk staff gave me a map and information about where I would be staying.  There are three towers at the Disneyland Hotel, and I was in the Adventureland Tower (the middle one), with a room on the fourth floor with a view at the tree-line looking toward Downtown Disney.

The rooms are nice and big, comfy beds, not the warmest pool, very quiet considering you're at disneyland! It's become very expensive though. If you walk to the main entrance it's the same distance from the cheap hotels. You do get magic hour (get in park hour early) most of the park isn't open though. No free breakfast like the cheaper hotels. You pay for parking.

Summary Heading: Loved it, but it is the farthest of the Disney Hotels.
Summary: Stayed first weekend in May 2015 with 4 adults in a 2 queen bed and 1 pull out bed room.  Room size was great - the extra space by the closet and desk in the entry way was helpful.  I have mixed feelings about whether or not I prefer the vanity to be in the bathroom or on the outside.  There were no fans in the bathroom and having the vanity in the bathroom made it more crowded in there and hard for multiple people to get ready while one is showering.   Loved the decor - classic magic.    Only CON in my opinion is the distance.  I would rather stay at Grand Californian because of the location.    I have stayed at all three Disney property hotels and I would rank them in this order: 1) Grand Californian 2) Paradise Pier 3) Disneyland Hotel   Location is important to me.  All

My stay here and visit to Disneyland was the primary reason for my "bucket list" trip. The hotel was wonderful and I was extremely glad I chose Disneyland hotel for my stay while visiting Disneyland. The magic hour for resort guests at Disneyland was fabulous, and I loved being able to walk back to the hotel for a midday nap during long Disney days. the room was very nice, I loved the light up bed head and adored all the Mickey touches. the room was spacious and the bed very comfortable.  I did ask for a quiet room and was given one next to the entry corridor so I could hear kids running up the corridor, which was occasionally annoying. The thing that really let this hotel down was the staff. Room service was unpredictable, and they even tried to service the room an hour before

Summary Heading: Clean, Friendly, and LOTS of Fun
Summary: I took my mom on a trip to California and this was our first stop. We had never been to Disneyland before, but have been to Disney World over a hundred times (we used to live close by WDW). We have always loved Disney World and we feel like we are returning home when we visit there, but we were excited to try something new and visit Disneyland. We LOVED it! Sure the castle is smaller, but the closeness of everything, the plentiful amount of old traditional dark rides, and the classic feel make Disneyland such a magical place to see.  We stayed two nights in a premium view room and had three days of park hopper passes. We felt that was the perfect amount of time to spend. The hotel room was gorgeous and so clean. We had a view into both theme parks which was breathtaking. We

I stayed here for 5 nights.  I'd asked to have a room in the fantasy tower or adventure tower as I had 2 small children with me and the less walking the better.  I was put in the front tower in the back which had the longest walk. The plus to this was it was closest to the water slides in the pool.  After we checked in in I literally never talked to a cm. I felt like we were just stuck in the back and forgotten. I had to hunt someone down after 2 days of our lightbulb in the bathroom being burnt out to have it replaced.   I got sick. From either a stomach bug or food poisoning. For 2 days at disneyland by myself with 2 young kids this really put a damper on our vacation.  I liked the Disney touches in the room, I liked the pool areas and the beds were super comfy. I expected

I think out of the three hotels on the property, the Disneyland Hotel is my favorite. The Grand Californian is more luxurious, and Paradise Pier is a better deal but this one screams Disney with every detail. If you're like me and mouse shaped soap, characters in the lobby, and themed dining is your thing than this is perfect hotel! Make sure to carve out some time by the newly renovated pool and stop by the enchanted tiki bar for a drink! A truly magical stay.

We have stayed before and after the renovation a few years ago. This is about post-renovation. Anyway, it's a lovely hotel. You can't go wrong with Disney theming and service, can you? I've never had a bad experience. We've never gone with our three year old, but we are next week and I'm looking forward to another great trip. Rooms are clean, beds comfy, service stellar. It's quite a splurge, even with the annual passholder discount, but worth it every once in awhile to have a really great Disney time. Have dinner at Steakhouse 55!

Summary Heading: Nothing better than staying on Property!!
Summary: I cant say enough good things about this Hotel. When feet are tired (can happen soon and often).....There is a wonderful; comfortable place you can walk to for a power nap or simply just to rest. Room service is great and tasty. Staff are friendly and helpful. Highly recommend concierge level rooms for free wine and cheese in the evenings.

We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Anaheim, staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  The room was upscale, large and accommodated our 4 adults with ease.  It would be nice to have a sink outside of the bathroom, and possibly a microwave, but everything else was good.  The room was quiet, had a lovely view of the weekend fireworks.  Best of all the hotel is a very convenient 5 minute walk to the Monorail entrance to Disneyland and a 10 minute walk to the other entrances of either Disneyland or California Adventure.  The big downsize is the extreme cost, at least 3 times the price you would spend at one of the many family oriented hotels a few blocks away.

This entire vacation was completely magical. Starting with the check in process. Goofy helped us check in. My kids were going crazy. We've never had that kind of character experience before at a Disney resort. The pool was fun with the monorail slide.  Trader sams is a great themes bar. That was my personal favorite location. We stayed in the fantasy tower. The rooms were very "Disney". This resort is classic Disney and great for families.

Absoluetly worth ever penny. We would go back today if we could. Everything from check in to check out was magical. We arrived early 11:00 a.m but our room was ready. The kids were thrilled to be able to hit the pools right away. The water slides are a blast!!! Our room was a standard room with a pool view. There was plenty of space for us (two adults 3 kids). The bathroom had plenty of counterspace and the pull out clothesline in the shower was great for hanging wet bathing suits. Housekeeping was fantastic. We always came back to a spotless room and they were great at honoring our request for extra towels, toliet paper and tolitries. We stayed in the adventure tower which meant if we walked out the front door we were at the pool and if we walked out the back we were at

Summary Heading: Horrible broken bed ruined the whole trip
Summary: We have stayed at this location multiple times now. I believe in the last three years we have probably stayed at the Disneyland Hotel approximately 15 times. We love the atmosphere, proximity to the parks (being able to get right on the Monorail and be in the park), and especially the pool for the kids. We paid for a room with a premium view. We received exactly what we paid for. A room that overlooked the pool and was a perfect view of the fireworks in Disneyland. We checked in early as we were going in the park and were given our keys early as always and they texted us the room number within a couple of hours. Everything was perfect at that point. We went into the room and it was very clean and everything seemed to be perfect. Some of us went back to the park, while a couple

My family and I arrived at the Disneyland Hotel for spring break with some hesitation.  We'd been coming up the pacific coast staying at "branded" hotels which left us highly underwhelmed.  When we got to the Disneyland hotel it was like getting to a little oasis.  And it's not just the fact they have parks and downtown disney nearby, its the fact they take care of the little details that make a hotel stay surpass your expectations.  Take for example a simple thing like the towels.  The towels at disney are way better than the typical towels we had at Hilton's or Hyatts and other hotels. They're both softer and newer and cleaner...so you walk away thinking....if they put that much thought into the towels, i'm sure they're doing a great job in everything else.  And they do, we

Pool can't be beat here. Staff is super nice and friendly. Rooms are small but clean and nicely decorated. Always a good time when we stay here. Lots of restaurants and shops on the property and the monorail is not far to get you straight into Disneyland.

The hotel room wasn't the cleanest and our AC was broken. Not really worth the money. The convenience to the park was great and the staff was very pleasant, but the rooms were very dirty and not "magical" for the price.

This hotel was fabulous for our family (three kids age 13, 6, and 5). Characters greeted us in the lobby and the light up headboard was a big hit! The pool area was perfect for my two boys that aren't strong swimmers. The shallow toddler play area is separated from the other pools and three lifeguards were manning it constantly so I didn't have to panic.... We ate at the Terratoga Terrace on site many times during our stay: convenient, good food, decent prices, and outdoor seating. The only other restaurant onsite is the character (expensive) dining at Goofy's Kitchen.   Be aware that you DO have to walk THROUGH Downtown Disney to the entrance of California Adventure Themepark. The Monorail ONLY stops at Disneyland's Tomorrowland. We love to walk and he Downtown area has much

We really like this property right in the middle of everything nice rooms good service very nice recreation area with the Peter Pan theme pool they also have the Disney characters restaurant, I would say that the hotel is a bit pricey but the good think about it is that the parks are within a walking distance you can also take the tramp is about 200 yards from the hotel overall very nice hotel we will definitely going back there Downtown Disney right outside of the hotel  LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!!!!!

Summary Heading: Missed out on expected Disney magic
Summary: + Rooms nice and spacious. We were upgraded on check in and received Just Married badges. Very close to parks and given we were in LA for 2 nights just to do Disney it was worth it just for accessibility.   - Honestly I thought the hotels were a bit bland - we were in the frontier land tower and apart from a miniature model of Big Thunder Mountain in the lobby it could have been any land. I thought that the hotels would be a lot more cartoony / jazzed up to showcase Disney.   We were told our room key also could be used throughout the park including in shops and restaurants. The first bar we went to didn't accept it then the restaurant we went to (Blues one) also didn't which meant that I had to walk back to the room to grab my actual credit card.   We were under the impression

We had s great stay, location first class, character breakfast awesome BUT most expensive breakfast we had in the USA, by some way...rooms OK, but service was middle of the road. Struggled to even order food to room after a long day at the park. No one picked up the phone?

All of the Disney hotels are grossly overpriced.  They also cater to families with children which is very understandable but a real problem for those who are looking for a little peace and quiet after a long day at the Park.  We asked for a room with a single king bet and got one right by the elevators and were told that was all there was.  Great customer service.

We chose this hotel because it's the best one geared for little ones. I give this hotel 1 star because  #1 I contracted hot tub rash despite wearing a clean bathing suit and thoroughly showering immediately after. When I called the hotel to let them know they should investigate the issue, they did nothing to acknowledge any concern nor apology. For the money I spent and a 1st time Disneyland and Hotel guest, I'm appalled and very disappointed in the lack of customer service that I know Disney prides itself in. #2 We ate at the restaurant by the pool and were served a salad with brown lettuce and a chicken sandwich that wasn't cooked thoroughly (you could tell it wasn't fresh) and cold fries. I would maybe understood if it was busy but we were the only ones in the restaurant :(

For a 5th year anniversary surprise, some friends and I met and reserved suites in the Adventure Land Tower. We set aside the Fairytale Suite overlooking the entrance to the Disneyland park for the celebrating couple and reserved a three-room suite for the rest of us. Rooms were very clean, plenty of amenities, places to gather, eat and loved the concierge club room on the top floor! Breakfast, snacks and even evening wine, etc. were offered. Perfect to plan the day or relax before dinner. And the staff were extremely gracious and attentive!   I must say the Fairytale Suite blew my mind! From Tinkerbell appearing on the walls in the foyer to light a crystal castle to the canopy bed with luxury linens to the huge whirlpool tub and amazing shower! Oh, and the counters in the suite

Summary Heading: Mágic to disappear your hard earn money
Summary: The beds are confortable however We paíd 586 plus tax and parking per night For the "VIP rooms"King size bed". What did we Get? A standard two Full size beds. When we call the front desk we were told that the Was the only room available. BIG FAT LIERS!!! My Friend call an hour later and ask if they had any rooms available in a King size bed and he Was told they had plenty Of rooms. The VIP LOUNGE had very little variety Of food to give they have a couple Of cold meats cut and two different breads But no mayonaisse available i guess they need to charge more to be able to Buy the condiments For sándwiches. Total disappointment. You Will be better off to Get another near by hotel For half the price. I guess they are into the mágic Of making your money disappear. Will Not return to

I have been to Disneyworld and thought that I would have a similar magical experience in Disneyland, but I was VERY wrong. The people were rude and not helpful. The room was clean but that is all. The front-desk staff were abrasive. I was a nursing mom who was on a business trip so I was unable to bring my infant and they made NO effort to be even a little accommodating. Asking for small bags to transport my milk to the bell hop desk multiple times a day because they refused to give me a fridge with a small freezer compartment was like asking for a gold plated Mickey.  I was expecting the same exemplary service that I received in Disneyworld, but I received better service in Vegas as a nursing mother! I was there for a conference and the service at the conference was pitiful.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and requested a king size bed and were given a standard room with two full size beds. We paid for VIP service $586 per night plus tax and parking and were given one of the worst rooms. When I complained I was told that it was the only room available. BIG FAT LAIERS we were given access to the VIP LOUNGE which is open from 6 am to 10 pm they give you very few food variety. They put cold meats for sandwiches but no mayonnaise is available for preparation of the sandwiches. I guess they need to charge extra in order to put more ingredients and serve better food. There are other hotels nearby that give you better continental breakfast for a lot less for the service. PLEASE DONT WAIST YOUR MONEY. Look for something better.  The magic they use is to

Our stay at the Disneyland Hotel was great! The rooms were very clean and comfortable, with classy furniture and amenities. We really liked how the entire room was Disney themed, from the bathroom sink faucet to the bedsheets and the amazing Disneyland Castle wood carving on the wall. The hotel looked very new and exceed our expectations.  While it is a 20 minute or so walk to Disneyland from the hotel, the walk is pleasant since it goes through Downtown Disney. While more expensive than other hotels in the area, I would say the cost is worth it to get the full Disney experience from start to finish. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and pools with safety in mind
Summary: It was not our first time staying at this hotel, but it was our first time staying in the Fantasyland Tower. Our room number was 2919 on the 11th floor. At night, we were able to see the fireworks from Disneyland. You can tune the TV channel to the Fireworks channel so that you can hear the music in our room to accompany the fireworks.  We were a family of four staying at the hotel, and they only had 1 set of towels, so we had to request it. It took about 30 minutes for the additional sets to arrive, but it was also close to 10 pm.  We used the swimming pool, and it was amazing. All the pools were 4 feet deep, and there were lifeguards everywhere. I felt very safe having my kids there (a 6 and 3 year old). They also provided life vests, so you don't have to bring your own. In

I have stayed at almost every hotel on Harbor Blvd.  Three weeks before our arrival Disneyland offered a discounted rate on their hotel rooms.  Normally I can't afford their rates but with the $100 a night savings we jumped on the opportunity.  We had such a great trip.  We loved the hotel.  The rooms were very spacious for a family of 5.  The daybed was perfect for our oldest daughter to sleep on.  Their is a refrigerator in the room but no microwave which we greatly missed as all other hotels we have stayed at always had a microwave.  We loved all the mickey details in the room and of course the girls loved the lighted headboard and music.  I really loved being able to walk through down town disney to go to the park each day.  It really made you feel like you were at
