Brought my family here last year and we enjoyed being close to the theme park, and sort of expected so-so service, because of the amount of people they have to deal with on a daily basis. The service was great, from check in to check out and there are several restaurants close by, and if you go to the top of the hotel, at night you can see the fireworks in the park with out a gazzilon people around.  A little more expensive than some of the surrounding hotels, but to me well worth it.

We had a great stay at this hotel the room for 6 nights it was very spacious and comfortable, the view of the over pool and water slides was lovely to wake up to everyday. A real Disney touch with the magical headboard that lights up and the bedtime story channel.  The kids used the water slides and the pool a couple of times and really enjoyed themselves. One of the dinners we enjoyed at Goofys Kitchen  located at the hotel $40 for adults bit pricey but a great Buffet especially the desserts! Goofy, chip and Pluto we're our guests and we hardly had anytime to eat the kids were so entertained.  There is a quick breakfast bar near the pool but not much to offer and you have to pay. For the price of the hotel some breakfast would have been nice.  My biggest disappointment at this

I've been going to this hotel since the 70s and every year, as I bring more and more grandchildren, it gets less and less Disney and more and more corporate America. All of the fun things are gone, replaced by a faux monorail at the pool to let people know it is a Disney establishment. Other than the paintings in the Convention Center, and a few around the lobbies of the towers, almost all vestige of Disney is gone, even the Disneyland Hotel sign on the top of the towers. Every year, it gets more prohibitively expensive and less Disney-like. Go there for business, but not with the kids. As a Disney lover for almost 50 years, I want to love this hotel, remembering how it was in the 70s, but I just can't. Much too sterile...

Though a little pricey, it is worth every penny.  As with all things Disney, the quality standards are a cut above everyone else's.  You owe it to yourself to stay here... It is most magical!  Plan your stay before the crowds of summer descend... then simply enjoy the magic....

I know that we will be staying here again. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. We all loved the pool and the convenience to the parks. My children loved all of the mickeyness in the room, it was very subtle but noticeable to them right away.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location and the Disneyland spirit!
Summary: Honestly, this hotel is overpriced. However, everything within the Disneyland vicinity is overpriced so once you get over that mental hurdle, then you can just enjoy the hotel and all that it offers. The best things about the hotel is the location, the special events they offer for kids (best for kids probably 4+) and then the swimming pool area. It's about a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland Park and you have early entrance to the park - can't beat that - especially when kids have to go back for naps. For special events - they have such cool things like movies on the lawn at night, access to the character breakfast (additional charge), story time on the movie channels. Lastly, the swimming pool area is the absolute best and that is compared to every single resort/hotel I have

This is the hotel where you can experience the Disney Magic, more than the Disney Grand Californian & Paradise Pier,  The magic that Disneyland Resort created in each room of The Disneyland Hotel is much much better. The suites are beautiful and have the Mickey's Touch.  It is very expensive but I think you get what you pay.  Congrats!  Joab

My  husband and I stayed with our 8-year-old daughter in a one-bedroom suite with two queen beds.  The suite was surprisingly large and we were very comfortable.  We were in the Frontier Tower on the end closest to and facing Disney, and we would wake our daughter up for the fireworks -- we had a great view -- watch them in bed with her, then she'd go back to sleep.  My husband said to write that the toilet was "great," so there's that  from him.  It was clean, quiet, and worth the money to us to stay immersed in the Disney experience.  Bell service was prompt and cheerful with our bags and grocery delivery.  Pools were fabulous fun for our kiddo.  The staff, from desk clerks to Mousekeeping, was friendly and helpful.  Goofy's Kitchen for dinner was an absolute blast and I'm a

Basically this is a 3 and a half star hotel that is almost as nice as most Hilton's, and if you did not know better you would easily mistake it as one. There is nothing "magical" about staying here versus any other nicer off property hotel, the only advantage is  staying here gets you into one of the parks an hour earily. For us that meant we got into Disneyland early, but ONLY for Fantasyland and Futureland...

Even though I was there for work, this was an amazing stay!  Disneyland Hotel does it best when it comes to the thematics without it being cheesy or overdone.  Small touches everywhere (even the headboard lit up with stars and the wood was etched with Disneyland - gorgeous).  Loved it.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel provides all that one can wish for...
Summary: We just returned from staying at this hotel for 5 days.  It was bliss.  The hotel is beautifully redone, spotless and very user-friendly.  The beds were so comfortable!  My daughter and I loved this hotel and even after seeing the closer location of the other hotel to the parks, it is a mere few steps more to the Disneyland Hotel.  Our room overlooked the gorgeous pool and even though it was always busy with kids having a great time, one could not hear noise coming from the pool.  The restaurant was an easy walk and provided all that one could need for quick bites.  Earl of Sandwich was a mere few steps away and it was fun to try their sandwiches!  The theming in the hotel was perfectly done, and the rooms are very well appointed and large.  It was more than we could have asked

I suppose that it might be considered a little unfair to write a review about a place I love so much, but then the hotel is not the park. My wife and I decided that we were going to do the tourist thing one year for our anniversary and stay at the hotel for the weekend, while going to the park, even though we just live a few miles away. The idea seemed a little silly at first but the more we looked into thing the more it seemed like a cool idea.  We checked in around 10am on a Friday when things were in full swing for the tourist trade, and the staff managed the entire process of our arrival flawlessly. They got us and our luggage out of the car and into the lobby very efficiently. We were then checked into our room and provided with directions. No bellhops here, its a get you

Summary Heading: You can walk to Disneyland through Downtown Disney!
Summary: It's been years since I've been to Disneyland - gotta go back soon.  This hotel is convenient - Mickey everywhere - so much fun.  The handles on the taps of the sink have classic Mickeyears - Mickey's hand holds the wall sconces - it is amazing!  I had no children with me and still had a great time.

Summary Heading: Not worth the price but nice...
Summary: My 3 year old and I were here just before Hallowe'en. The hotel is nice but certainly not worth $550/night. It was nice to be able to walk into Disneyland and walk back for a break in the pool but the price is high. We were able to see the fireworks from our room given downtown Disney view, which was nice.

Stayed at adventure land tower. It's great but music is loud at night and can hear above guests (which can be bad for sleeping). Bring a fan!  Cleaning was ok. They kept taking stuff we were still using. Love the magical disney singing headboard.  Easy check in and out and good pool.

For the sheer cost that was paid, it was not really worth it.  The rooms are very nice and clean, with adequate room for the two of us. There are cute little touches of Mickey all over the place.  We had numerous inconveniences at Disneyland hotel. Our keys did not work and had to be replaced late at night, our jackets were misplaced during bell service (later found, but we needed them) and the wifi is just hilariously terrible. For the NZ$500 a night you're paying you'd expect to be able to talk to your mom on Facebook.   The location and magic hour is pretty convenient, but staying nearby and arriving at opening will get you pretty much the same experience and save you $300 a night.

Disney takes family entertainment very seriously and this hotel delivers. We had a gorgeous two bedroom suite that was generous and wonderful to come back to each day after the parks. The location is excellent - convenient to the monorail and downtown disney. The kids loved the water slides and pool - it was nice to give them a break to swim and for us to have a rest too! There were lots of lifeguards around the pool, and it is entirely child/parent friendly. This place is really part of the "happiest place on earth". It is convenient that you can charge anything in the park to the room, and magic hour was fabulous. We would definitely stay here again. It was expensive, but we loved the experience, and it was like you never had to leave the parks.

Summary Heading: Nice, well themed but expensive at peak times
Summary: Stayed here during a Run Disney event.  The rooms are nice, even for families without small children.  Typical Disney- runs like clockwork, organized and clean.  I travel a lot for business, so I really appreciate the attention to detail when I'm on my own time.  Staying during Run Disney is pretty expensive, but the hotel sells out so that must be a "fair" price.  And I think it's worth staying there when the start of the run is so very early...who wants to find a place to park and fight getting to the starting line? Not me.  And that's why we pay the price.  And it is FUN!

Stayed here whilst on honeymoon and visiting the Theme Parks for 5 days. The hotel is very well maintained and is very close to the parks, the service was great, we arrived early from a flight from vegas and there was a room already for us at the time, which was good. Plus there is extra park benefits for staying at a Disney hotel whilst visiting the parks, the biggest benefit is early entry in to DCA (Disney California Adventure) which can only occur if staying at a Disney property and have a valid park ticket, so you can get on the Radiator Springs Racers in Carsland before the crowds start rolling in. Otherwise it’s a 1-2hr wait and fast passes run out really quickly for this ride. Also other benefits are where you can charge any purchases at the hotel or either parks to your

Summary Heading: Disneyland Resort Hotel - Convenient and very nice place for a family to stay
Summary: Lovely place to stay.  So convenient to Disneyland.  Rooms were spacious.  Staff were gracious and courteous.  Pool area was vey nice.  Goofy Restaurant was wonderful - so many breakfast choices.  Was costly however.  Wifi was free as was parking.

First stay at the Disneyland Hotel, it was truly magical. I have stayed at several Disney properties in Florida and nothing comes close to the magic that this hotel holds. Walt and Mickey are everywhere. If you are a true fan of Disney then this hotel is for you. The beds were incredibly comfortable, the nightlight spectacular! The room was clean, for the most part quiet, old hotel although remodeled only so much they can do to cut down on the sound from other rooms. I will be staying here again, loved everything about it!

Summary Heading: Pool View and Disneyland resort left my parents speechless
Summary: Treated my parents to a surprise stay at the Disneyland hotel over Easter weekend - they had never stayed at the resort even though we visit Disneyland at least once per year.  From the valet to check in to room service; every single cast member treated us like royalty.  We were given cute Disney buttons to wear showing we were celebrating my birthday and my parents first Disneyland hotel stay.  Our room overlooking the pool was lovely.  We left the curtains open each night to enjoy the beautiful view and bluish hue cast from the lights of the pool.  The hotel gym is nice with many treadmills, ellipticals, free weights and open 24/7 - though the hotel grounds, walkways, and Downtown Disney were a treat to use for morning cardio.  The walkways are stunning, Disney music is played

It is more expensive than off property locations, but the customer service and proximity to the park is worth it.  Any purchase you make in the park will be sent to the bell desk at the hotel, you get early entry into the park, no need to move the car ever, the tv has a princess channel that has the princess's reading bedtime stories, and being able to have close access to your room is awesome.  Yes, it costs more, but Disney always does it right.  If there are any concerns, the staff will do whatever it takes to make your visit one you won't forget.  Not sure I will ever be able to stay anywhere else again.

Stayed in the Mickey Mouse Suite - wonderful.  Everything was Mickey: recessed lighting, fixtures,shadow boxes, decor., etc.   It was a child's delight.  Breakfast, snacks and "happy hour" were included.  Also event planning, parade seating etc.and  we were close to the monorail.  The experience was enjoyable.

My wife and I decided to stay at the Disneyland hotel with our family despite the cost.  It is expensive, but it was a great experience.  The food at Goofy's Kitchen was excellent and the kids had a good time.  All of the restaurants at the hotel are good quality. The room was very nice and had a nice view.  The pools were fun. It is a bit of a walk to the parks, but not too bad.  We loved being able to walk back to the hotel during the day for a break.  Another great perk was being able to send all of your purchases in the park back to the hotel at no cost.  Just do it at least once and don't worry about the cost.

Summary Heading: A roller coaster feeling on the place
Summary: Check in was quick and easy, staff was friendly. The hotel is split into three different buildings. We got room 2192 in the Frontier Tower with a view of the pool area. It is about a 5 minute walk from the check in area in the main tower, to the Frontier tower. There was a pretty basic lobby area in this tower. Up to the third floor where we found our room. I envisioned a magical room with lots of Disney décor and touches. The only Disney touches in the room were small accent pillow that say "A dream is a wish your heart makes", a light up headboard of fireworks, and mickey mouse faucets. Sounds pretty magnificent, but it was pretty tame. The room smelled old.... the bathroom was TINY, and there was not adequate lighting. Wifi was slow, none of our phones got good reception. The

Start with the not so good, being a disney resort hotel You would think you would get easier access to the parks. If you dont want to walk, stay at the Grand Californian. I love the disney atmosphere, and the service with a smile even at midnight! Food was great at Tangaroa, pool was great, and I loved the Bar!

We reserved a large room with a sofa/day bed and two queen beds.  We got the queen beds but no day bed...for $620!!!  After some protest we were offered to move, to another building, but insisted on a credit instead as we wanted to get to the parks.  What we got, but didn't need, for our room rate was a tiny room, tiny bathroom, wafer thin walls, very loud neighbors late into the evening and hearing multiple toilets flush multi times...not the happiest place on earth for us.  Room service was respectable - but what was truly outstanding was our turndown service as, because we mentioned it, we told them it was our son's first visit...so they made him adorable animals made out of towels, signed photos of Disney characters and a very cozy feeling overall.  Undoubtedly, Disney

We chose this hotel because we have never stayed here. It was nice, monorail trip in and out of the park was convenient. It was more of a walk than other places you could stay at. You pay for disneyland perks, but they can be worth it. The service was friendly and we had no problems during our visit. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay, relaxing and comfortable room
Summary: My husband and I and our two children (ages 3 and 5) stayed at the Diseyland Hotel in November 2014--this was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel. I have stayed at a couple of other motels in the area and was not looking forward to their noisy air conditioners, bedspreads from the 70s and dirty carpets that turn your while socks black, so we decided to splurge on the Disneyland Hotel for our 3 night getaway.   We had a very nice 7th floor room in the Frontier Tower. The beds were comfortable, the headboard lights--magical, and the peek of the fireworks at night--memorable. We took advantage of the pools, nice temperature and clean, and appreciated the short walk or tram ride into Disneyland. Overall, I can't fault anything about our stay, except for the price being a

Over the years I've learned how nice it is to actually stay on Disney property. Disneyland Hotel is no exception. In fact, the cost isn't that exorbitant and, by far, is made up in sheer convenience. The hotel is lovely, the staff is great & the location is perfect. After spending several days there, I never experienced a single issue & enjoyed every minute. Love this place!!

My family gave me the BEST surprise for my birthday this year.  We are Disney Annual Passholders and we go to the parks about a dozen or more times a year, so a day at Disney is FUN, but not necessarily super special.   We usually stay off-property, or just drive in for the day and drive home that night.  But, my wonderful husband reserved a room at the Disneyland Hotel. But not JUST a room.. the Mickey Mouse Penthouse. Omigoodness - it was over the top! TWO bedrooms, one with a round and beautifully decorated with Disneyana.  A Dining Room with a beautiful chandelier, a living room, a bar/kitchen area.... it was amazing!  Situated on the 11th floor and with windows facing Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure, the suite was a perfect vantage point to watch the

After dozens of trips to Walt Disney World we finally made the trek to Disneyland in Anaheim. We were told to expect disappointment compared to its Florida's counterpart. We actually felt the complete opposite. It was a great hotel! My kids loved it and so did my husband and I. There was great attention to detail with the "Mickey" and "Walt" themes and the kids loved the lighted headboard. We also appreciated the proximity to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. Everything was within a 10 minute walk. The staff was very helpful and friendly. While we were there we experienced a medical emergency and they were all very understanding and helpful in helping us reschedule our reservations and activities. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were spacious. The pool is excellent

Summary Heading: Endorsed by Goofy, Mickey and Minnie Mouse
Summary: I have never entered the Disneyland Park, but this is the fifth time I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for business. There are kids aplenty with as many varieties of mouse ears and princess fashion as the stars that light up on the headboards in the sleeping rooms. What's to recommend: the quiet that surprisingly allows one to work and sleep comfortably in your room. The secluded lounge and dining area near Goofy's Kitchen. The wall lights in the bathroom shaped like Mickey's hands and likewise, the tub and sink fixtures, as well as images of Mickey's ears in the tiles that border the shower. The Disney characters who are only to happy to allow joint photos that you can tweet even to business colleagues. Proximity to the park and Downtown Disney. What's not: Service is

We had an amazing stay at the hotel! We loved the early entrance perk, and that the monorail is so close! Our room was large, and we loved the special headboard! The staff are so nice, and even accommodated getting us cutlery and bowls for our room! We will be back! Loved it!

Summary Heading: Disney all the way, but expensive
Summary: This is the hotel to be at if you want to experience the full Disney experience in California. Goofy in the lobby, Disney embellishments throughout the room, personalised Disney room access card. Magic morning, where you can enter the theme park 1 hour before the rest of the world. Much more Disney than Paradise Pier, and cheaper than the Grand Californian (haven't stay there, but I believe it's less "Disney" than either). However, there are a few "but's" here:  1) It's really expensive- it's double (or more) than other hotels within walking distance to Disneyland 2) It's another $17 per day to park your car, on top of the room rate 3) The pool is really crowded, and very hard to find an empty sun lounge 4) The guest laundry ($2 per load) is located off the towers, so you'll

Summary Heading: Disneyland magic not what it once was
Summary: We spent the last five nights in the Disneyland hotel.  there is no doubt that the convenience of the hotel to the parks is a real advantage, we were able to come back for a swim/siesta in the heat of the day. And the early park admissions every day was also a plus.  On the negative side, the service was only mediocre.  We showed up at 11:30 am and were told that they would text us when our room was ready, and if we did not hear from them to check back around 2:00.  We never got a text.  Check in was to be at 3;00.  By 4:00, after checking back with them every half hour from 2:00, we finally got our room.  The rooms were showing their age.  We had peeling wallpaper in our bathrooms , and the showers did not produce any hot water in one of our rooms.  Sometimes our dirty towels

If Disneyland is the happiest place on earth, this hotel is the second happiest. Everywhere you look they have considered it. From the Mickey Mouse shaped bathroom taps to the twinkling fireworks lights in the bed heads, truly great. We stayed in a double room in the fantasy tower above the reception. The room was clean & tidy, if not a little dated, and the service can't be faulted. The walls were a little thin and we could here the people sneezing in the adjacent rooms, but it isn't too bad. The walk to the Disneyland gates is about 10 mins via Down town Disney which is full of cool restaurants and places to eat. The pool is great for kids. They have two water slides and pool side food service. We had an e-ticket upgrade which entitled us to enjoy complimentary drinks from the

Summary Heading: Best hotel for the full Disney experience!
Summary: This is by far one of the better hotels I've stayed in. Such a friendly resort. I visited in August 2014 for 5 nights and couldn't be happier with my stay here. The Disney cast members were always happy and welcoming. We asked to be in rooms with a nice view and the lady at the desk assigned us a room in the Fantasy Tower with a view overlooking the pool. Disneyland and California Adventure are less than a 10 minute walk away or you can take the monorail which takes around 5 minutes. Downtown Disney is less than a 2 minute walk away from the hotel.   We dined at Goofy's Kitched during our stay which was a great experience with delicious food and we met many characters. There are 2 main pools, 2 hot tubs and a waterslide area. We went in two of the pools and the hot tubs but

We initially booked this hotel through expedia a 1.5 months before our actual stay. Expedia called us about a week before our travel to notify us that the hotel was sold out and their system and Disney hotel system were having issues. Expedia tried their best but could not get me back into the hotel. i called the hotel directly spoke to someone at the desk who went above and beyond to get us a room at the same price we paid on expedia.. Great Service !!.   Our check-in time was 3pm but we arrived at the hotel 10am and they were able to get us a room. The Room was nice, clean and comfortable but you are truly paying for the location. It is a 10 minute walk to disney - Great Location !

Ever since we came here last year we could not help but visit again! The Staff here is fantastic and the nicest you will ever meet! This hotel gets dressed so nicely for Christmas and has a HUGE gingerbread house in the lobby! This hotel also has lots to explore around the grounds and the history walls from the very first Disneyland hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know! Tip: If you are able to spend a little more, get the concierge room. This room has different appetizer food for every meal of day, free bottled and canned drinks, packaged food for the park, and the best view of the fireworks every night! You can save money by eating here for breakfast and spending less money at the park! Stay at this hotel, you won't regret it!

Great hotel, have been staying here for 30 years. Love watching the nightly fireworks from the room. Very nice restaurants on site. Little bit of a trek to the monorail entrance but Downtown Disney is nice. Miss when the monorail came right to the hotel. Prices getting a little hefty, might be trying Paradise Pier next trip. Nothing like staying at a Disney hotel,  the neighborhood hotels just don't feel the same. Nice perks as well, early entrance time etc.

Summary Heading: Visited Disneyland Hotel to attend a conference.
Summary: The hotel staff are extremely well trained and friendly. This is a delightful place to stay for both business and leisure travel. Everything is designed to enhance guest experience. The hotel is adjacent to Downtown Disney which offers wonderful shopping, dining and entertainment venues.

I love this hotel for the following reasons: 1) It is within walking distance of everything....downtown disney, restaurants, the parks. It makes it very easy to be in the park in the AM, then swim in the afternoon. 2) It is old school Disney! I love the pics of Walt in the room, the retro feel to the hotel, the simplicity of it all. 3) The pool! How cool is the monorail slide?!?!?! The water was warm on a cool day and as a parent I felt safe as the lifegaurds were always watching. 4) It was nice having a coffee shop on-site so you didn't have to wait in the really long line at starbucks.  I would continue to stay here year after year. I love Disney!

My family and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for the first time this trip, and only one word describes the experience: enchanting. To start of, the check in was flawless. The crew was very accommodating and kind. They even updated our deluxe room to a premium! Then, after requesting the adventure tower, we were given specialized room keys with our names on them. A day in the park left us worn out, but our walk back was short and sweet through downtown disney. We could have taken the monorail if we had gone back at 11:30, the last time to take it unfortunately, but an extra half our in the park was worth it. Besides having great employees and convenient location, the hotel also provides a beautiful area. Rose gardens, waterslides, restaraunts, you name it and it was there and

Summary Heading: Not the Disney Theme I was expecting.
Summary: Personally I think this is overpriced for what it is.  It is a nice quality hotel, however it is not themed even half as much as I was expecting.  I was expecting it to be really colorful with pictures and decorations of all the characters etc.  However it is more a sophisticated Disney theme which is very subtle, not really aimed to please the young children.  We stayed one night here and one night at a different hotel that was the same distance away yet one third of the cost.  In future I would rather put that money towards other things.

Summary Heading: Nice and not over the top!
Summary: The staff was friendly, the room was very clean and the pool area was very nice. I lIve in Orlando and am surrounded by Disney stuff all the time. I appreciated that the hotel was subtle with its Disney decor.  My only complaint is the free WiFi. I would much rather pay For the service and have it work than have free service that barely worked.

The Disneyland Hotel is well positioned and cleaned. We were there in winter so it was pretty quiet around the Hotel and there was not much to do at night at the Hotel - the shopping and restaurant precinct next door was the only option. Was a bit surprised that there was no kids activity room like at Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel.  Overall a good hotel but I think you could find better value for money from some of the neighbouring hotels.

I took my daughter to Disneyland for her birthday and thought maybe I could walk in to the Disney Hotel just to see how the prices were for that Friday night.The price was a little high, but I was sold when I saw their pools and beautiful lobby on my way to the front desk. The front desk receptionist was really nice, she even gave my daughter a photograph of all the characters and their autographs as a birthday present. That really made my daughter smile. Because we were not planning on spending the night at Anaheim, the receptionist made it so easy for us to relax. She even sent us toothbrushes to our room without us having to ask. The room was like any other room at a 3 star hotel. What made it special was the firework lighting on the headboard and the shower and sink fixtures

I was debating on The Grand or this hotel but opted for this since I read reviews and it's says room wise, it's much better... I booked through Costco travel which you get more extras than booking it direct from Disney with spending the same amount of money. Cotsco travel gives u free character dining (about $200) for 4 people plus some other stuff. I booked for premium view club level and stayed at Adventure tower on the 10th floor. Club room is on the same tower and 11thfloor. So for me, that was very very convenient. We had downtown Disney view which also gave us view of the fireworks show every night. Although, booking club room gives u access to the same view but it's convenient to not leave your room. Club room was great. They offer diff kinds of food on certain hours. You

I was here for a business trip without the kids.  I must say that the staff were all very friendly and always made me feel welcome.  The building and property are certainly a step above the area and show very clean and well maintained.  The room itself was clean and quiet with everything you need within walking distance.  That said the area is less than desirable... as soon as you leave the park property it is very dirty and unappealing.  If you stay on the property then be prepared to pay for it.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel.  Manicured landscaping.  Excellent hotel
Summary: Loved this place.  Just filled with Walt's charm and presence.   Rooms was very comfortable and the beds were too.  Extra friendly staff.  Short walk to the parks.  My only complaint is there was really no where to eat at the hotel.  It was difficult to get a snack or lunch.  They told us to go to Downtown Disney.  This was just a short walk, but it would have been nice if they had something at the hotel.  Its not comfortable walking for 15 minutes in your bathing suit to get a ham sandwich.  I think they need to have a quick and easy place to grab a bite when not at the parks or downtown Disney.  Everything else was spot on.  That's why I gave it a 4 star instead of 5.

We stayed at Disneyland Hotel late October 2014. We knew it would be cheesy and expensive and that our three small children (6,4,18mths) would love everything about it! It really completed the whole experience for them and made life easier for us. We stayed in a club level room (all five squeezed in one room - DO NOT TRY IT!) which gave us pretty much round the clock snacks (made leaving for the park easier as we grabbed breakfast type snacks and munched on the walk through downtown disney), also allowed us a few drinks in the evening.  Checkin was a bit crazy, but the staff are trying their best, so allow extra time, pack iPads or other entertainment for the kids while you get through that.  This hotel is a fair hike to the parks, so make use of the monorail or just be

Hotel has very good and polite stuff that are professionals. For me and my family it was a huge pleasure to stay there to experience this truly wonderful vacation. The rooms were always clean, as well as the design of the rooms are really cozy for staying. If you are planning to come with your family or with your loved one. This is the place to stay!!! :)

This was our best trip to Disneyland ever! We stayed in the Frontier Tower and had a great view of the pool and the fireworks at night. The monorail is very close, in Downtown Disney, and takes you right into Tomorrowland inside the park. We LOVED the pool and the waterslides...a welcome break when the crowd got to big at Disneyland. Trader Sam's was amazing, get a drink there before you leave.

I stayed here with my husband and 2 children (4 and 3) for 3 nights in the Fantasy Tower. It is the perfect place to stay for a Disneyland trip. Rooms are spacious enough for a family of 4, they are clean, reasonably modern and we had a lovely view overlooking the pool. This hotel is also the location for Goofy's Kitchen (Character Dining) which was a wonderful way to start our Disney experience. You must book Goofy's Kitchen! It was a short and easy 10 min walk through Downtown Disney to get to the park gates and the added advantage of the early opening hours for hotel guests was a wonderful way to get on rides before the parks got too busy! The gym at the hotel was well equipped and well maintained. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again without

I absolutely love staying at the Disneyland hotel.  My husband and I stayed there Dec 11- Dec 15th 2014 to celebrate his safe return from deployment to the desert.  When we checked in, the desk clerk thanked him for his service!  She asked us to wait a moment then returned with a folder that said we had been chosen as the Disneyland Hotel's family of the day.  How cool is that?!  We hadn't been back to the hotel since the remodel and I was blown away by the remodeled rooms.  I loved the little headboard with the lights that play music before you go to bed.  The beds and pillows were so comfortable and it was very clean.  The only drawback was the bathroom area was pretty small, but perfect for just getting ready to go to the park.  There was only one incident that really

We stayed here two nights on our way to Hawaii to surprise the kids with a day in Disney.  This did not disappoint! Wonderful room, starlit headboard and great location!  This resort is just a short walk to both Disney parks.

The staff is phenomenal! Very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to visit again. I would recommend getting the standard room. We had a pool view and i would of much rather had no view or a view of fireworks or world of color. Still great fun!

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel - On Business but feeling like on vacation
Summary: The stay was restful and enjoyable. I was there for business; however, I did feel like being on a vacation. I spent time at their formal dining restaurant, as well as, the quick service by the pool and both provided delicious food for my taste buds.  The staff was very friendly and serviceable. The rooms are very comfortable and I could not hear the noise of the room next door or the pool - very insulated. Easy access to Downtown Disney and the parks.

Summary Heading: The Perfect Hotel to visit the Disneyland Resort
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for two nights in March.  My main objective was to visit the parks and there is no better place than the Disneyland Hotel.  I arrived from the airport around 6 PM and was checked in very quickly by the cast member.  I was also able to purchase my park pass right there and then, which was very convenient.  My room was on the 8th floor overlooking the pools and other towers, which was pretty cool.  The room was very large and clean.  Everything worked.  Free WiFi was available and worked fine.  The hotel is a short walk to the Disney Parks via Downtown Disney.  The monorail was also available to Disneyland's Tomorrowland area, which was a time saver in the afternoon and evening.  I had a very nice dinner at Tangaroa Terrace, as well as a fantastic

Since they've done renovations, this is by far the best hotel to stay on Disney property.  The rooms are gorgeous, the service is excellent  and the experience there is "magical. ". It is very expensive though.

This was my first time ever staying at the Disneyland Hotel. I have stayed at the other two hotels on the Disneyland property years back and always loved the Grand Californian. I remember people saying that the Disneyland Hotel used to be a bit run down, but all the refurbishments they have done and renovations to rooms are quite nice.   There are three towers at the Disneyland Hotel, and I am glad we were in the same tower as reception. A walk across the hotel property to the far tower wouldn’t have been horrible, just not ideal. So if you want convenience, request the Fantasy Tower.  Our room had 2 queen beds and was quite spacious. We overlooked the pool which was nice (I think they consider this some sort of “premium view”). Bell service was speedy and like a breeze. We

We are a family of four, the kids 5  & 8. The room was kind of tight for all of us if no one was sitting on a bed. There were only two drawers available to put clothing in so my husband and Igad to leave our clothes in the bag. There was a good size mini fridge but very little counter space anywhere.   The beds were kinda hard and the blankets were hot for 95 degrees outside. Cool Reading light; headboard and pillows were nice. The bathroom was small but worked. Nice soaps and body wash etc. and the water pressure was great.  TV channels were horrible for the price of the room. We took a break mid day and not having a movie channel was a bummer. I actually figured there might be a channel with only disney movies and cartoons, but no such luck.  The pool was perfect for

**This review will focus strictly on the hotel and not the larger resort other than how it pertains to the resort layout. My advice and reviews for the Disneyland Resort and attraction can be seen in a previous review.**  This is, plain and simple, a beautiful hotel with a GREAT pool section. The hotel itself has is made up of three separate guest buildings and a convention center. The room was good sized with plenty of room for storage for a couple or small family. The common areas are always kept clean and they have a couple of gift shops in the hotel lobby. They also have a small coffee shop as well as character dining and the best restaurant on property (Steakhouse 55, reviewed earlier). Having Having Steakhouse 55 close is nice because it is the only table service

We have wanted to stay at this hotel for a long time, especially after they did the renovations a couple years ago.  We finally stayed here after getting a good discount, and thoroughly enjoyed it.  We loved the light-up headboard and used that for a night light.  It was nice to have the refrigerator.  Our room had the sink separate from the toilet and tub/shower which we really like for getting ready.  The beds and pillows were comfortable.  We loved the subtle Mickey touches, and it was fun to stay in the Disney bubble.  It was a great stay and we're glad we finally got to do this!

Magic comes with a price tag. And staying on-property at Disneyland isn't cheap, but it really is worth the expense if you're looking for a seamless vacation. I've stayed at several Good Neighbor Hotels, but it just added extra hassles that I'd rather avoid on a short vacation.   While both of Disneyland's premium  hotels are excellent (I've never stayed at Paradise Pier) the Disneyland Hotel seems to have just a bit extra "magic" that makes it my first choice while visiting the parks. Yes, Grand Cali has an impressive lobby, fancier restaurant, and a spa. But the average family vacation may not deem those things as important, especially  with the higher price tag.  As expected,  the staff at Disneyland Hotel is excellent,  helpful,  and always cheery from the reception desk at

Loved it here. We stayed 6 nights and couldn't fault the location. We had booked a queen room with premium or pool view for 2 adults and 1 infant. When we arrived Peggy convinced us to have a king room as it was all ready to go otherwise we'd have to wait until 3 To check in. And after a 13 hour flight from Australia, and the offer of a bigger bed, this sounded fine with us. We were put on the 7th floor in the adventure tower with a pool view. On the 3rd night I called the hotel front desk to ask if all the rooms were the same as the one we got, as our room, although nice, was quite small and was right next to the elevator which took up a 3rd of our room. Aston took the call at guest services and moved us straight away to a queen room in the fantasy tower which was much bigger

We chose to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for our trip this time instead of the good neighbor hotels. Partly due to proximity of the hotel to the parks, partly for the overall Disney experience.  It was a wonderful stay. Hotel is clean, comfortable. Staff is welcoming and accommodating.  Kids loved the heated pools, and it was great that the hotel provided complimentary life jackets for the kiddos. All in all, we would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great room very clean very comfortable
Summary: This hotel is great. Ask for a room at the end of the hallways away from the elevators and it will be much more relaxing. The room was super clean. Room service was good and quick although the added fees and tip increase the price. But it is worth it to relax on your room. Downtown Disney is right next to the hotel and has many food choices. Traveled alone as female and felt safe in the hotel and walking around Disney. The beds are really comfortable and with room at end of the hallway,sleeping was great. Internet is a bit slow at times but is acceptable for hotel. Bellman service  very efficient and friendly. Bring your own water and snacks if u can as they are quite expensive at the hotel and very limited selection.

Summary Heading: Great for the perfect Disney Experience
Summary: The Disneyland hotel makes for the perfect disneyland experience. Convenient to the park, early access to the park, not to mention keeping the disney vibe going for the whole trip. The staff are excellent and really make celebrating a special occasion awesome. They sent up Mickey cookies and milk to help celebrate a birthday in our group. The special night lights in the room are a lovely added touch. It's pricy but worth it for an all around memorable disney trip!

My favorite all time hotel. Clean and  family friendly. With a great pool and hot tub as well as nice grounds to explore with a safe and awesome Disney feel. I cannot wait to return! There is also shopping at downtown Disney which is only a short walk from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Not the cheapest but worth it for the experience!
Summary: You can't get past the location of this place if you were having a "Disney-experience". It is perfect to visit the parks and even nip the little ones home for the day. It certainly isn't the cheapest property but the excitement in my son's eyes when he saw characters as we checked in and then later roaming the hotel was priceless!  The staff were very accommodating with our requests and room and we found that a king and fold out suited the three of us fine!  Bathrooms were good (could've done with more towels), good coffee in the room, clean and neat. The cutest was the light up bed head!!!!! Wifi was patchy though! Pools were great fun for all and Mr 5yo loved the waterslide.  As for dining we were pretty shocked at the price & variety of Goofy's Kitchen so gave that a miss and

From having the valet call us by our name to the check-in process with individual keepsake room keys with our names printed on them (kids really liked that), to seeing Goofy in the lobby, you can feel the Disney magic even before stepping foot into the room. The room was very spacious and included a pack & play for our baby. The hidden mickeys throughout the room were tasteful and not overly done. The castle & fireworks headboard was amazing and the photos in the room were beautiful. Having an extra hour to enjoy the parks is a nice perk, but one we did not take advantage of... a bit too early for my girls. Like Disneyland itself, the hotel may be more expensive than others in the area, but the magical touches and atmosphere makes it worth the extra costs.

As soon as you pull into the hotel the amazing service starts. We pulled up to valet and they opened the doors for us and got our luggage out really quick. They even set up the strollers when they took them out. The lobby was spacious and welcoming. The chairs were teacups which I thought was a nice touch. The staff was super friendly. The cast member even made custom keys for my kids (1 and 2) as a keepsake. This was not only their first visit to Disneyland, but also mine. (I have been to Disney World numerous times). The room was a basic hotel room, but the conference I was attending must have reserved premium view rooms for attendees. We looked right down on the pool area. I loved the touch of Mickey ears on the faucets and lamp shades in the bathroom. His hands/gloves held

My family of 5 (2 adults, 3 kids) stayed for 2 nights this past weekend and it was magical! We drove our car up to the lobby, handed it over to Valet, and the cast members took care of our luggage. We walked in and the kids were so happy to see Goofy in the lobby! Upon checking in, we were told that our room wasn't ready. The helpful castmember then said he would be right back . He came back and told us he had a great room available for us with an upgraded view and daybed. Perfect! Our room was on the 6th floor of the Frontier Tower, facing the pool/waterslides, and had a view of the Matterhorn!  Our room was beautiful! The kids loved the wooden headboard with a carving of Sleeping Beauty's castle. It also lit up and played 'when you wish upon a star'. We loved all the Disney

The hotel is newly renovated.  Beautiful spacious room. We got an adjoining room with our friends and we had a cute little entryway between them so we could open our doors and have a joint room when we wanted. Everything was taken care of for us. We pulled up. They unloaded our car and stored our bags for us so we could go straight to the park. When we were ready, they brought all of our luggage and our ice chest to our room for us. Our head boards lit up and played music. We could watch the fireworks from our room at night. Room service was awesome also. Less than a quarter mile from the team that takes you into Tomorrowland.  Perfect place to stay. Well worth the money.

I was on a business trip and all of the hotels were sold out except for the Disneyland Hotel. Since it was close to the convention center I said I would give it a try. Not expecting too much, I checked in and went to the room. It was really well appointed and very comfortable. Nice work area and very well lite for business work. My most favorite part of the room was a twinkling sky night light built In above the headboards.  The staff was great and I found the food to be very good and really beyond my expectations.  Try it, you won't be sorry!

We stayed 5 nights in February and what an amazing experience! We had a premium view room in the Adventure Tower and it was well worth the price. Our view was of Downtown Disney. We could even see Mickey's Fun Wheel and Tower of Terror. The Adventure Tower was steps away from Downtown Disney which made for an easy safe stroll each morning to the park's entrance. Again, well worth the price to be close and safe as husband stayed home so just Mom and kiddos. The room was huge and elegantly decorated with subtle Mickey touches throughout. The bed was comfortable and the linens clean and crisp. The Sleeping Beauty Castle light up headboard and music were so magical :) Housekeeping came each day while we were at the parks and arranged my child's stuffed animals on the bed. A nice

We had two rooms at the Disneyland Hotel.  The check in was very nice.  We asked for adjoining rooms and got them.  Good size rooms.  We were in Frontier Tower....very noisy.  We woke to the parking lot being vacuumed. And there was a constant A/C noise. We had cheerleaders from Sacramento staying on our floor who were allowed to run up and down the hall.  They also kept opening and closing their doors and it was quite annoying.  We called downstairs to complain and we think security may have come to see, but the problem persisted.  I had a room to myself, and my sister and BIL stayed in the adjoining room  We have stayed at the Grand for other trips and I would stay there again, I don't think I would return to DLH.

My husband and I visited this hotel, arriving the Week of February 23rd for his business conference.  We arrived late almost midnight due to delayed flight.  Upon arrival we were told that we would be put into a room with two queen size beds.  I asked at that time if they had any rooms with a king size bed and they told us that those rooms are very limited and none were available.  I said well if you don't have a room with a king sized bed could we at least get a room with a decent view.  Again, the front desk agent said no, we have no rooms left with a view.  I stated that not only were we staying at this hotel for my husband to attend a conference but also to celebrate my birthday as well as our anniversary.  The agent didn't seem to care.  I asked if it might be possible to

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel Excels In All Areas
Summary: Simply Amazing! That is the short hand answer to how our stay was at the Resort. It was easily the best Disney vacation I have ever taken and may actually be the best vacation I've ever had period.  Traveling with me on this trip was my wife and our 2.5 year old son.   We arrived a little after 2pm on a Sunday, the valet and bellman were quick to greet us as we arrived and promptly assisted with our luggage.  I was excited to see there was no wait for checkin and the process went smoothly.   The bellman were quick to our room with our luggage and was courteous in informing us of different amenities at the hotel.  The room was very comfortable and once again the headboard that had fireworks and stars inlaid in it was a huge hit with my son.  The WOW factors:  The pools: Amazingly

Summary Heading: A lot of Disney touches to make your stay unique!
Summary: This was a great vacation, just as one would expect from Disney.  Very attentive service from all the Hotel staff-front desk, housekeeping, maintance, bell captains...all!  Great room- very good size.  I was amazed at the quiet! after a full day at the parks, nice to come back to.

Absolutely loved my 2 night stay at Disneyland Hotel! I wish it was longer. The light up, musical bed head was very cool, the rooms were large & beds were very comfortable! It's about a 5-10 min walk to the parks but the monorail is an option if you didn't want to walk - but walking through Downtown Disney added to the fun! It was so convenient to shop in the parks, go back to the hotel to drop off the bags then go back. I had room service for breakfast both mornings - first morning I couldn't go past the Mickey Mouse waffles - amazing!! Loved the souvenir store next to the lobby - very helpful on the last morning to buy last minute gifts for people. Staff very friendly & helpful. Can't wait to return to the hotel in the future!

We had three rooms in the Frontier Tower. Everything from the Valet and check in is first class. Beautiful grounds and multiple swimming pools for all ages, even some large slides. The rooms are spacious, immaculate, very quiet and beautiful. Great things is you walk right out of your room and in about 1 minute you are in Downtown Disney. Was it worth the huge price tag... probably not but we decided to splurge for one night and we're happy we did.

The Disney Hotel is a great place to stay while enjoying Disneyland. The kids will love it. The adults will love it.The hotel is nice and clean. Very friendly staff. An all around nice place to stay. Makes the visit to Disneyland even more enjoyable.

The title says it all.  Great staff (cast members), all the characters come through.  The gym was nicely equipped.  You never have to leave the magic of Disneyland when you stay here.  The magic is everywhere you look.  The grounds are amazing.  The one downside was the price, it is expensive.  After a long day of traveling, when we walked through the main doors, instant smile.

Disney Magic 24/7 while staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  Stay here at least once in your lifetime.  This is a bucket list kind of hotel and experience.  Check!  I've stayed here though many times at the Disneyland Hotel both before and after renovations and updates.  Goofy in the lobby at check-in is the ultimate welcome.  Tea cup ride chairs in the lobby sets the stage of the fun that is to come.  The history of a bygone era of many celebrities staying here over the years makes one feel like part of a magical fraternity.   The carved out topiery trees are so Disney as they line the walkways.  Feel like a kid again as a grown up having the backboard of your bed light up with twinkling bulbs to a Disney song.  Where else can one find Mickey's gloved hand holding the light in

My husband & I spent one night at the Disneyland Hotel during our honeymoon.  What an amazing time we had.  We were treated like royalty.  The staff were all friendly & helpful, the rooms are beautiful & very clean.....I especially loved the pillow with "a dream is a wish your heart makes when you're fast asleep".  The Mickey's hidden everywhere in our room were an added bonus.  I didn't even realize most of them were there until the next morning.  The bed was so comfortable.  We sunk into it after a long day at Disneyland.  The closeness to the monorail made it so easy to get back to Disneyland anytime we wanted.  A little pricey, yes, but well worth it.  The Disneyland Hotel made our honeymoon extra special.   We can't wait to go back.

I stayed here for 6 nights on business. The experience was as good as any other top hotel and was not diminished by the fact I was not interested in "doing Disney". Hotel staff was friendly and professional (grounds staff were not as much) and the room accommodations were good quality and clean. My only complaint is that the television signal did not always receive basic cable channels like ESPN and TWC. The hotel staff does turn-down service and was very attentive to any needs or requests. I was in the Adventure Tower and had a view of Downtown Disney. It was good for the fireworks on the weekend but pretty noisy at night with live bands playing. Last recommendation is to get access to the E-Ticket Lounge on the top floor. Breakfast, snacks and drinks are available here and it

Stayed with my family at the DLH in February. Absolutely amazing place. You really do stay in the Disney bubble and we didn't mind the walk through Downton Disney. I'd rather walk in the crowds of Downtown Disney to get to the hotel then on Harbor Blvd. Having the monorail to use at night was really helpful and I used it to make a midday break to the hotel one day to change my shoes and jacket. Everything you could possibly need is right there onsite and you really do feel like you are more on vacation when you don't have to go out onto Harbor Blvd at all.   The pool area is fantastic for kids. My son loved the slides. But take note that the slide area does close down early, I think it was around 5. I scoped out the cabana right there by the slides and I'm going to book one on

We usually stay at the California Grand, but got a deal with DLH for "dapper days".  Upon check in, Marrisa at the front desk was very kind and typical jovial Disney Service oriented. We were early like 1030am, yet she checked us in and upgraded us to a pool/park view room at the Frontier tower on the 10th floor. Score!!! It's nice to be close to the monorail and downtown disney. The pool areas look fun, but it was a bit cold to swim. I was really tempted to go down the monorail slide at the pool though. Just to try it.. anway...DLH upgraded, food choices are great, they have a little coffee shop avail for you for grab and go stuff, and I really liked the room size and the little surprise in the wall over the headboard. Disney Magic strikes again.

Summary Heading: Worth Every Penny and then some
Summary: My daughter,son, wife and me just returned from by far the best family vacation we've ever shared. The staff great, the room great,the location fantastic. The most important thing we can do is share time with our children and that's what The Disneyland Hotel allows you to do, forget about the stress of transporting your kids and wife to and from the park, the stroller saga, the car seat rodeo, the stress and the hours of your life you'll never get back searching for your car, dealing with traffic and stressing out ruining the mood before the vacation has even started. All of those things is why we stayed onsite at The Disneyland Hotel. Have Fun, Smile, Joke, Laugh, Talk. Spend that valuable time with your family.

We stayed for 4 nights and it was fantastic!  I would never stay anywhere else when visiting Disneyland with little ones.  Our kids were 4 & 6 and it was perfect being so close to the hotel when we were at the park and needed to run back for something.  We used the hotel guest entrance through the Grand Californian and it was so nice!  We only ever had a few people ahead of us going into California Adventure that way.  And taking the mono rail into Disneyland was like a ride in itself, like it was taking us to another world!  The hotel had such cute touches like Mickey Mouse shaped taps, and his glove holding the sconce on the wall & Mickeys in the patterns on the tile of the bathroom wall or in the carpet.  Best of all was the light up headboard!  Our kids (boy & girl) both

After our first visit last year, we immediately began planning for a second trip. This stay did not disappoint. The rooms were clean and comfortable! The staff was warm and friendly throughout the resort. Our last visit, we stayed on the 14th floor facing the parking lot. This room was QUIET, but lacked a view. This visit, we upgraded to the pool view and we got a 4th floor room. If I had to choose again, I would pick the 14th floor facing away from the resort. The view is beautiful, but when you are all tuckered out from a day at Disneyland, you want peaceful sleep. Instead, we heard (barely, but I am such a light sleeper) the music from the Tiki bar.  Also, being on the 4th floor, we heard noises from above us. Again, not a huge deal - simply because we were ALL tired and

Stayed at this hotel for a week while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Centre.   Being a Disney owned property / hotel. this hotel is obviously laden with everything disney that you can ever imagine… from the amenities provided in the bathroom, to the headboard of the bed.. (check out the photo!)  Rooms are spacious and the beds are comfy and most importantly, clean! Wi-fi is complimentary too!   The in-room safe deposit box is a tad smaller than the other hotels that i’ve stayed in, but that’s not a problem for the majority of the visitors (unless you want to store your DSLR cameras and other larger objects)  I was initially slightly concerned that there might be excessive noise coming from the tiki bar located just across this hotel tower (see that building

Summary Heading: Great place unless you want hot water for your shower
Summary: I was there for business so you should have hot water all other times except between 7 AM - 8 AM.  There was plenty of hot water when I took one at 4 AM but alas no water pressure.    Other than the cold shower, the beds were very comfortable, and the room was very clean.  There was a cool carving on the wall that lights up (fun for the kids).  Every thing had a Mickey theme down to the faucets.  The location is great with a short walk to downtown Disney and the parks.  The service is fantastic (as it would be expected at a Disney resort), but as I was in a conference they might have had extra help.  There was no wifi in the Conference area which is a major bummer when you are there on business.  The resort amenities looked like a lot of fun with 2 pools and a cool water slide.

First of all this place does provide the 'Disney' experience. Great location next to down town disney and short walk to both the parks. Front counter staff were great. Early check in was no fuss and at 9:30am. Pool area was awesome and extra security of all the life savers. Characters walking around the facility was a very welcomed extra from my son.  Although the down side was room service wait time was appalling over 40 minutes on hold to order meal and then another 45-60mins for food to be delivered, all this on a Tuesday night. Shower was terrible no pressure and hot water was lousy. Wifi is also a joke, drops in and out.

Debated staying on the Disney property this trip versus staying nearby for a fraction of the cost at a potentially nicer hotel. LOVED staying here. I preferred The Disneyland Hotel to The Grand Californian where we stayed last year. It doesn't feel worn down in the slightest like I felt the Grand Californian did. Location? Fantastic. Pools? Great. I would totally stay here again! Oh! And there is a Target about 5 minute drive from the hotel. It was perfect for us to stock up on snacks, fruit and drinks for the Park. The Target also sells a plethora of Disney merchandise ranging from tee shirts and sweatshirts to key chains, postcards, stuffed animals and basically everything you could ever imagine at a fraction of what you'll pay in the Park.

Stayed here over the President's Day weekend as my daughters were competing in a dance competition at the hotel's convention center.  Convenient for the dance competition, but otherwise, not worth the money.  Still have to pay $24/day for valet parking.  The rooms were so-so, somewhere along the lines of a $150-200/night hotel.  Pool was average, but did have a water slide area.  Pool service was exceedingly slow; my friends ordered food from the server.  I ended up going to the restaurant above the pool.  About 1/2 hour AFTER I'd eaten my food, the poolside server showed up with my friends' food.  The hotel is not really close to the entrance to the amusement parks as it is at the opposite end of Downtown Disney.  Friendly and helpful staff.

Magical!! Loved the drawings and photos of Walt everwhere you look.  Big rooms very comfy and upscale.  Headboards have tasteful fiber optics emulating fireworks in a soft nightlight manner.  Under five minutes walk to the parks.  Simply perfect.

This is definitely a great place to stay if you want the all around Disney experience.  Yes, it is pricey.  Yes, it's not a Four Seasons.  Yes, there are kids everywhere (it's Disneyland!)  But you truly stay within the "Disney bubble" the entire time!  There are tea cup chairs in the lobby when you check in.  Kids get their own room key which my son LOVED and was so proud of!  The room is a good size with 2 queen (felt more like full) beds, a sitting chair, a sofa, and small desk.  I would have preferred a small table for snacking but I'm sure Mickey would prefer you to eat outside at the many restaurants!  My son was delighted by the light up musical headboard.  He would play it several times each night.  He also enjoyed the little Mickey ears all over the room (carpet,

Summary Heading: Top notch and totally worth the money!
Summary: This was my first stay at the Disneyland Hotel and it was totally worth it! The rooms were so magical! The headboard lights up and plays music! The handle on the sink were Mickey hands! The lights in the bathroom were held with Mickey hands! We weren't expecting a refrigerator since it wasn't in the description of the room, but we opened a cabinet and there it was! The service was excellent and on par with the Disney Signature Service. The pool was pretty awesome. My kids especially enjoyed Goofy's Kitchen which is the character dining experience at this hotel. We loved that it was a short walk to the monorail which takes you directly into Tomorrowland. This hotel has it all!

What a fantastic hotel!  It was worth all the money - great location, spacious room and nice staff.  Loved the headboard with the fireworks!  It was amazing.  One staff member did walk in our room unannounced while we were changing which was weird, but we would definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For And In This Case, It's Excellence
Summary: I'm a Disney fan, so maybe I'm a little biased, but during a recent trip to Disneyland, I decided to stay within the Disneyland "bubble" and chose the Disneyland Hotel based on previous reviews. And although the hotel is pricey, especially compared to other nearby hotels, the truth is that you get what you pay for: an excellent Disney-filled experienced with great customer service.  When we arrived at the Disneyland Hotel, we were checked in quickly and were given a room in the Frontier Tower. The room itself was spacious, with all the magical touches (not to mention a lot of hidden Mickeys that we had fun finding). Rooms were exceptionally clean and meticulously maintained, as were the hotel grounds themselves.  Also, the location can't be beat. It's only a 10 minute walk to

Best hotel stay ever. It was a bit pricier, but worth every penny. The hotel and room felt like an extension of the park itself.  The headboard lit up and played music; the faucet heads were Mickey Mouse-shaped; and the pillows had little quotes from Disney movies on them (don't ask me the movie). I never wanted to leave.

Our family of 4 stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for the first time. I booked this hotel because it had the best reviews of the Disneyland resorts and for the proximity to the park. The best part of this stay was how close it was to the park. The rooms were comfy and quiet and the headboard everyone is talking about was cool for about 2 minutes. I understand we payed for the Disney experience but we saw none of that. I thought that this also would be the best hotel for us because of the pool area and monorail waterslides.... When we arrived the watersides were closed. For the whole 4 days we were there! So disappointing...I did not see any Disney characters, no service by the pool and the room service food was sub par at best. We did enjoy being so close to the park but save on

Great location .. Super friendly staff.. The pool is awesome.. Rooms are what you would expect from Disneyland .. Pool side service is just an extra treat .. Goofys kitchen is super fun.  We thought maybe it would be a bit young for our girls but it was fun for all ages..

Good experience. Everyone is friendly and the grounds are clean. The view from the 14th floor balcony is very nice. Our bathroom even had a rotating shower head. I couldn't have asked for a better experience!

We booked a room at the Disneyland Hotel because we wanted to experience the total Disney package.  The room was lovely and had several Disney touches we found added to our fun.  All of the 'cast members'  (Disneyspeak for  employees) we met were very friendly and seemed to be pleased we were there.

Summary Heading: Table service for drinks and snacks at pool
Summary: Just had to correct another reviewer's error. We just returned yesterday and enjoyed table service for drinks and snacks at the pool. We were there with our three year old and really enjoyed this hotel: better than the Grand Californian in my opinion (other family members stayed there concurrently.) We were happy with the room. The kids had a great time dancing to the live music at Trader Sam's. We stayed in the Frontier tower -- it was quiet and restful. My 3 year old loved the music box head board. You cannot beat the location if you are going to Disneyland.

We are Disney enthusiasts. We love Disneyland Park, California Adventure Park and Walt Disney World. We are Disney Vacation Club Members (live the value and accommodations). This trip we stayed in a beautiful, two bedroom suite in the Adventure Tower at the Disneyland Hotel. The room and attention to service was outstanding. Although Disney is gearing up for their 60th Birthday celebration in May, 2015, and several of the attractions and rides were closed for refurbishing...we still had a Magical time!

Summary Heading: Return visit to the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: After having a great stay here for our Honeymoon in dec 2013 we decided to come back and bring some of my family.   We stayed 3-7 feb in a pool view room in the frontier tower. I prefered the Adventure tower which we stayed in last time due to proximity to Downtown Disney and for a better view.  The staff were very accommodating and allowed us to check in 2 hours early and gave us connecting rooms. Since our last stay we found that the shower water pressure is fantastic!  My family loved all of the Disney touches including the princess castle headboard (we all slept with it on every night!) and my 9 year old cousin ran around the room trying to find all of the Mickey ears.  Thanks for another great stay!

Summary Heading: The Holiday Inn Service with Ritz-Carlton Prices
Summary: Being a native of Georgia and Florida, this was my first visit to Disneyland. I have been to Disney World and its resorts many times as a child and as an adult, and have never disappointed. The Disneyland Hotel experience was unfortunately not the same. Firstly, the accommodations are dated and compact. While the hotel staff is friendly, the service and the dollars associated with this establishment do not match. My husband was traveling on business, while my little one and I were there on pleasure, so we specifically asked for a quiet room. The first room offered was stationed up against a housekeeping closet; hardly quiet. So, we had to go back downstairs and request a different room. The next room was quieter, but because it was a corner-end room, it had an extremely weak

This is the third time we are staying in this hotel..This year was the final stay.All of the family members we agreed on not to come ever again. Rooms are old fashioned never been updated since we first started to come.Goofy kitchen restaurant has a very bad smell..You pay a lot of money like 5 star hotel in Beverly Hills and you receive nothing fancy.

This hotel is by far one of the most magical hotels I've ever stayed in. Check in was flawless and they let us check in at 8am which was perfect. We scored a free room upgrade overlooking the pool and would be back in a heartbeat ! If you're not sure where to stay pay the little extra to stay here you won't regret it !!!

Summary Heading: 1 of the best i have ever stayed in!
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel. It has a nice spacious bathroom, with a external small room with a toilet for more privacy. The beds were very comfortable, the view was beautiful and had a light up bed head that made this hotel feel very magical! This is truly a magical hotel and you should stay here.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel the first week of February with a family group of 20.  Great rooms, great location.  Not much of a lobby and one night of noisy neighbors was the only down side.  The staff was mostly very helpful, we only dealt with one negative staff member.  She told us there was nothing that could be done about three kids and one bed.  The next day when our daughter went down to ask for extra blankets and pillows for the bed she made on the floor for the nine year old the wonderful lady at the front desk had a bed sent up.  Guess you just have to get the right person or be pushy which we aren't.  The character breakfast at Goofy's Diner was so fun for the kids and the food was excellent.  Also had great food in the Steak house.  All in all a great vacation

Family of 4 kids 4th & 6th grades. Excellent service, clean rooms well appointed, 2 Queen beds with daybed/couch, small fridge,  coffee maker, no micro and bathroom amenities. Fun pools although waterside was down for maintenance. Great restaurants & bars on property and excellent lifeguards in pool area which is half salt water & half fresh water. 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney & Monorail. 10 minute walk to both parks.  Tips: Frontier Tower was most quiet. Earl of Sandwich was phenomenal & cheap, Grand Californian has private entrance shortcut into California Adventure you can utilize, All 3 resort hotels reciprocate pool use. Dining is alot more reasonable in Downtown Disney. It's worth the extra money to stay at Grand Californian and we LOVED the Disneyland Hotel but will

I stayed here with my wife and two children and found it an excellent base for a few days at Disneyland and California Adventure. The rooms are large enough for four people and their luggage. We all thought that the Disney Décor was great. It is situated at the end of the Downtown Disney and only requires a ten/fifteen minute walk to Disneyland. When in Disneyland you can purchase things and charge them back to your room which saves lots of small charges.

Summary Heading: You can't go wrong with a Disney property
Summary: Just returned from a trip to Disneyland staying at the Disneyland Hotel. I love the Grand Californian but have to say that we were upgraded to a  suite and it was beautiful, big with the best view of the fireworks. Disneyland properties are kept very clean with very helpful cast members for all your needs. I was given incorrect information about how and when we  could use our tickets and Disneyland was very quick to correct the problem. They are pricey but worth it.

I attend a conference her annually and I always prefer staying at the Disneyland Hotel over any of the other Disney properties.  They recently remodeled the rooms and they are really nice.  The hotel staff is friendly and helpful.  My agenda is different then most as I was here for business and not on vacation like the masses.  Great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Extraordinarily overpriced for what it is.
Summary: I guess what you pay for is the extra hour in the parks. Other than that, the price tag is laughable for what it is.  Paper walls mean you can hear your neighbour's every cough and movement. The music outside will keep you awake till late. The "premium view" contains a whole lot of parking lot. Service is absent: from no baggage assistance to patchy housekeeping. Isn't it a little crazy to have turndown service show up at 10pm in a hotel oriented to children?! I guess that's what happens when you have just one person doing it for the whole place! You're also on your own to figure out how a lot of things work vis-a-vis visiting the park. On the plus, the rooms are comfortable, the headboards are special and lovely, and the room service food was consistently tasty albeit brought

Summary Heading: Convenient location for your Disney vacation
Summary: Convenient location with price cheaper than Grand Californian hotel. Hotel shown aged. Pool is just OK. It was raining The Day we stayed so they did not have the pool party. But overall clean and has Disney character decorations in the room. At night you can go to the pool area and watch the fireworks there. Walking distance to downtown Disney and theme parks. Leave your car in the hotel. Unless those above are important to you, I suggest you stay somewhere else cheaper or if you can afford, go to Grand Californian, which is way cooler than this one.

What a great experience.  Booked through Costco and couldn't be happier.  We had stayed here a few years ago and it was worn out.  Disney has done a great job with the renovation.  My 10 year old loved everything about it.  From the magical musical light up headboard to early entry to Goofys Kitchen.  Not much to say other than we loved it.  Accommodated us getting in early.  Checked in at 10:30 am.  On the rides in California Adventure by 11.  Early entry to the park is invaluable.  I know there are other places to stay for less.  But everyone should stay at a Disney property once.  The magic and convenience is worth the money.

Our family just visited Disneyland and California Adventure, and stayed in the Disneyland Hotel.  We had not been there in 25 years.  There are 3 towers in the hotel; Frontier, Adventure, and Fantasy.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower, but in the future we would stay in the Adventure Tower as it's closer to Downtown Disney and has a better view over Downtown Disney and both Parks.  Even closer to everything is the Grand Californian Hotel, but be prepared to pay $200 - $300 more per night.    The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating, although the lady that checked us in had a bad cold and wasn't overly friendly.  Everyone else though were excellent.  We purchased our 3 day hopper tickets at check-in.

Everything Super: location, rooms, staff, restaurants. We stayed at the adventure tower, so we could see the fireworks from our room every night! Every day Goofy came to visit us at the lobby, it's amazing!!!! I highly recomend!

We have just got back from staying at the Disneyland Hotel and it was amazing.  From the staff that greet you when you arrive to the reception you are treated like you are royalty.  The rooms are amazing with the headboard that lights up like fireworks and plays music, to all the little Disney touches.  It does cost more than staying elsewhere in Anaheim but it was worth it and I'm 53 years old and just felt like I was ten again.  The hotel was the highlight of my holiday and I wouldn't stay anywhere else there.  Walt Disney would be so proud of the staff working for him!! Many many thanks Disneyland Hotel - dreams do come true.

Summary Heading: Nice to be on the property
Summary: We reserved here through Costco because we wanted the full Disney experience, and we got it! It was great to be able to walk over to the parks every morning and hear the great music that really gets you in the mood.  We had requested a premium view, which ended up being of the pool, so I don't think you need to pay for that.  Our room had a refrigerator, so we had cereal in our room everyday and saved a few bucks that way.  The room was absolutely clean, good water pressure in the shower and a very comfortable bed.  No feather pillows, which was a disappointment.  Our TV didn't work, and a maintenance person was there in 10 minutes to fix it. Would I pay to stay here again?  Yes, if we have grandkids with us, otherwise we'd probably stay at one of the Good Neighbor hotels as

My family and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel December 6-14. We were celebrating both kids b-days. Right from the start the hotel had 2 gifts for the kids at the front desk. We had stayed at paradise pier 2 years before but from now on we will stay hear . The pools are awesome for both little and big kids. The rooms were spacious and decorated classic Disney.
