I love that you walk out the hotel and your in downtown Disney. Jump on the monorail and be in the park for early magic mornings was helpful.

I was so impressed with the level of service at this hotel.  It was our first visit, and they upgraded us to a sutie, gave us a fastpass for the ride we were most excited about, and got us signed photos of characters.  Characters often hang out in the lobby, and you can take photos with them.  The room was amazingly spacious, clean, and well laid out.  The toilet is separate from the sink, which is ideal in a big group.  But honestly, cannot say enough good things about the outstanding service.  They just went above and beyond.  Easy walk to both parks and Downtown Disney.  And don't miss Trader Sam's (a bar and lounge) out by the pool!  Will definitely stay here again!

Rates have jumped for the DL Hotel since the remodel due to the pools. They are the best, but if you want to spend less and get a bigger room, stay somewhere where they have a shuttle. The monorail was down a lot so we had to walk 10 min to the gate. Might as well have stayed somewhere else. You have to balance pool desire with the cost. Our room was small and our view was if a travel office and parking lot even though we paid for resort/downtown Disney view. I was disappointed. Stay at one of those two bedroom places for way less money and get free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a family with young children, WiFi not great
Summary: We chose the Disneyland Hotel because my 5 year-old son looked at pictures/videos of it and the Grand Californian and told me that he thought the Disneyland Hotel looked like "more fun for kids." The hotel lived up to his expectations - the Disney theme is evident from the moment you check in, complete with tea cup chairs, vintage Disney cartoons on the TV, and characters walking through the lobby to entertain guests.   At the suggestion of a Disney travel representative, we initially booked at standard room. When a sale was announced, we upgraded to a premium view that ended up costing less than our standard had at a full price. I initially asked for a Downtown Disney view. When we checked in, the clerk told me we would have a pool view from the Frontier Tower and that a DD

We love Disney. We have stayed at the other Disney properties and good neighbor hotels, but this was our first stay at Disneyland Hotel. We loved it! The lighted headboard is magical - we want them at home. We all loved it! We were there to celebrate my birthday and my husband ordered pretty much all of the birthday surprises available...the room decorations and Disney present, Minnie flowers, personalized cake, personalized robes and roses petals - a new surprise every day! It was amazing and I highly recommend all of the surprises if you're there to celebrate a birthday!  We were in a premium room with 2 beds and couch - it was so nice to have a little extra room to spread out. We had a nice view of the pool. And we loved swimming in the pool at night - thank goodness it's

We stayed in the adventure tower. I liked how close you were to disney downtown. We ate at the enchanted forest cafe.They treated us great and the food was good. I would suggest taking the motorcoach from lax. It was nice not having to drive. I would stay at the disney hotel next time.

While it is the happiest place on earth, the hotel is old and tired and frankly needs to be torn down and rebuilt.  Sorry Mickey,  Lots of cute features like Mickey hands holding lights in the bathrooms, and other special touches, in general there are a lot of non functioning things in the hotel. We were there for business, this is not set up for large conventions,

Summary Heading: Giving the Grand Californian a run for everything except location
Summary: The refurbishment has made a huge difference. The rooms are now what you would expect for a good hotel. It is never going to be as convenient as the Grand Californian but I would happily stay at either hotel. Have never stayed at Paradise Pier but can say there are now two real alternatives for people who want a good standard of hotel with the the advantages of the Disney magic mornings.

Summary Heading: Make the switch to a Disney hotel!!
Summary: Stayed for 5 nights at the disneyland hotel and loved every minute of it! it was truly a disney bubble and i really did not want to leave!  I originally booked a standard room, and a sale came out so i rebooked a premium room with help from the Disney reservations over the phone. When we arrived the staff greeted us at the door and took our luggage for us- this was then delivered to our room. Such a blessing when you have 5 suitcases between 2 people (not exactly the lightest packers...)  Staff at check in were lovely, they chatted with us, we discussed our previous travels and what we were going to get up to next, and they even upgraded us to a concierge room. We had a lovely view of the pool and a large room that was beautiful. They also gave us badges for our first visit and

I think there are a lot of benefits to staying at this hotel.  We booked a package through Costco and although we paid the same price for the room and 3-day park pass, with Costco they included a free character meal (which was over a 100 dollars for the three of us), and a $40 disney giftcard (which covered another breakfast).  We stayed in the Frontier tower, which I understand is newer and the room we had on the top (14th) floor was very nice with a balcony.  It seemed there are only balconies on the top floors.  It is a short walk to the park (less than 15 minutes) or you can use the monorail to tomorrow-land in Disneyland park.    Food options include Goofy's Kitchen which was nice for character dining, but the food left a bit to be desired.  There is a small coffee shop

Stayed here for the first time in July and stayed here again at the end of January. I reserved a Premium view room again and I even requested to be in the same general vicinity of the room I had last time because it was fairly quiet (end of the hall) and had an amazing view of Downtown Disney.  When I arrived they had me in a room with 2 queen sized beds and a pullout couch. It was just me staying in the room so I asked if they had a King available instead and they accommodated that request. The other members of my group also asked for a King bed at check in and were given a complimentary upgrade. Nice, right? Well to be honest it was a little irritating. The 2nd room was reserved for a standard view but instead got upgraded to a Premium view on the top level of the Adventure

Ok, Disneyland Hotel. You win. I have stayed at Paradise Pier and inspected Grand Californian but neither can deliver what you do: a fun, easy-to-navigate, deluxe, Disney-quality property that overflows with Disney Magic.  I have waited my whole life to spend one night here and I was not disappointed. A very comfortable bed which lullabyed us to sleep with music and glowing fireworks- not to mention a great view of the real fireworks accompanied by the actual soundtrack (channel 16 on the TV). It was the perfect ending to the perfect Disneyland Resort vacation.  I love this resort; Trader Sam's for drinks and Steakhouse 55 for breakfast (where you will find the least amount of kids and a reasonably priced, high-quality breakfast- for those of you seeking some adult-only time).

Summary Heading: So much easier when you stay at a Disney Hotel.
Summary: After spending several weeks cruising Alaska on the Disney Wonder and then going through Western Canada on a train our final destination on our holiday was going to be spent at Disneyland. The last time I was at Disneyland I was about 8 years old and always wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and I'm glad I did. We got the Disneyland Express from LAX after flying in from Calgary, and it took about an hour to get to the hotel. Check in was easy and we ended up in the Adventure tower over looking the pool. The rooms are pretty basic but well appointed the Bathroom was big enough for the 4 of us and the storage was enough to store 6 medium sized bags without an issue. Now here is why its easier to stay at a Disney Hotel. The Staff really go out of their way to help you which is

We stayed here for 3 nights.  We were immediately greeted at the door by Goofy when our bus arrived.  The room was great with enchanting decor (Adventureland Tower).  It was a much closer walk to the parks than it appeared online.  Would stay here again.

I stayed in the Disneyland Hotel within the Frontier Tour.   I was with my Dad, we had a room with 2 queen beds and it worked out great. Even as a 24 yr old adult I fell in love with the special Disney touches throughout the room; I was very tempted to try to steal the decorative pillows.   For us, it worked great to wake up and head straight to the park to enjoy the extra magic hour. It was a quick 10 minute walk right to the park gate from our room.   The hotel itself was decorated INCREDIBLY beautiful for Christmas time. It was very cold while we were there, but the pools were still open and being patrolled by life guards. Unfortunately we did not go in, but it looked super fun with an awesome water slide.   We were seated instantly for breakfast at the Steakhouse within the

Summary Heading: Worth the cost for the convenience
Summary: The rooms are great with mickey and Disney features throughout. If travelling with smaller kids it's worth the extra expenses for the convenience. Purchases from Disney can be sent back to your room. Easy walk to monorail and downtown Disney. We enjoyed our stay a lot.

We loved staying at the Disneyland Hotel. The staff were superb, the kids loved it (so did the adults). It is a short work to DisneyLand and California Adventure (maybe 8-10mins), through Down Town Disney, which is a lovely walk. The Hotel is a little 'tired' but its Disneyland and full of little Disney touches. We ate at Goofys Cafe in the morning and the kids loved the character dining. We also ate at Grand Californian which had a great breakfast, and more characters to interact with. The rooms were big enough for our family of 6 we had joining rooms with a loungeroom in the middle, it was perfect! The twinkling headboard was just so fun!The pools were great fun and room service was good too! We would recommend it, made the Disney trip so easy, and the magic hour each day is

Summary Heading: Not as close as I thought it would be
Summary: Family of 4 stayed for 6 nights in a standard room the week on Jan 5th. Upon check in they upgraded us to a view of the pool as it was my daughters birthday. I found the desk help was very nice. The room was ok, like others have said do not expect this to be a 5 star place. The walk to California adventure and to the main gates of Disneyland (you can board the monirail at a shorter distance ) was longer then I expected and after getting soaked on Splash Mnt  and the River Ride I wished we would have stayed at the Grand California as they have an entrance right by the  River ride. I would stay here or at the  Grand California again just for the fact you can be back to your room in 15 minutes and for the early admission as the lines were the worst I have ever encountered in my 20

I stayed at this hotel in the 1970's as a child, when the monorail was much closer.  The magic in my mind didn't disappoint me when I stayed in September in 2013 with my three children and my wife.  There is paid parking onsite, although we had a car drop us.  The Disneyland Express bus services the hotel from LAX as well as the other hotels on the strip.  Yes the hotel is much more expensive than the hotels on the strip on Harbour Boulevarde.  But there is a reason for that.  The Disneyland Hotel is much nicer, closer and provides access to the magic hour in either Disneyland or California Adventure on an alternating basis.  As you leave the hotel towards the pool area, from the Fantasy Tower, you are told which theme park is available on the next day.  We stayed in the Fantasy

Some friends and I were visiting Disneyland, and wanting to stay somewhere central. The hotel is a five minute walk from the parks and Downtown Disney. It's convenient if you have children, as it is easy to pop back and forth from the hotel. It's totally comfortable, and the headboard is wonderful, it twinkles and plays music. It may be a bit pricier than the surrounding areas, but well worth it for the magic!

Summary Heading: A wonderful christmas at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: Perfect is this hotel in one word. We stayed in a club level room and the service was outstanding. A special thank you to Robert who looked after us so well. Food was great and the view from club level was over downtown Disney to the parks. The concierge were also outstanding and thank you to Danrique who treated us so kindly. The room had 2 beds and single fold out sofa for our family of 5. Not huge but sufficient. Pool area and slide was a lot of fun. Goofys Kitchen was a great meal and lots of fun. The location can't be beat. Timed the walk at 6 mins from room to being in the park gate. This is with our 8 yr old at a good walk. We have previously stayed across the road and have to say that the Disneyland Hotel can't be beat. If you can manage it there is no better place to

Summary Heading: the perfect way to see disneyland
Summary: I was at the Disneyland Hotel for a business conference,  and I am so glad I went.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the room was spotless, and perfectly decorated in all the Disney splendor. The grounds and pool were amazing, and you exit right into Downtown Disney and the entrance to Disneyland.   A perfect place to stay for a weekend at the happiest place on earth!

The incredible staff makes this one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Everyone we encountered was friendly, helpful, accomodating, and genuinely happy. It was a pleasure to stay here, and I look forward to more Disneyland hotel vacations. The staff have set such a high standard for customer service that I believe all hotels should model their training.

It's a gorgeous hotel, but other than that it's pretty basic for Disney hotels (having said that, I have been spoiled with DVC resorts in Orlando). I would definetly consider it, but I'm sure Anaheim has more to offer, and I would have loved to see some of it during my stay.   The best part of this hotel is that you are in the middle of everything. You are steps away from Disneyland and Califoria Adventure, and that was definetly worth it for me.

We stayed in premium pool view room for a six nights over the recent new year period. The location was excellent being close to Downtown Disney. The room itself was pleasant enough however for the price paid I don't think it is that special. In fact for the same price or less I'm pretty sure you would get the best room available at any of the nearby hotels. Overall though no complaints just no wow factor.

We just wrapped up a five night stay and the Disneyland Hotel met and exceeded expectations. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Our best meal of the week was probably room service. Why we will stay here again next time: *You get early access to one of the parks each day you stay AKA Magic Mornings. This extra hour with no lines at the park makes the premium cost worth it. *Proximity to the parks and Downtown Disney. You can walk everywhere and don't need to worry about cars or shuttles or parking. *The pool. Frankly, this was my kids favorite attraction. They have water park quality slides and heat it in winter. *Goofy's Kitchen offers character dining  *All the restaurants on Disney properties honor dietary needs *The amazing customer service they are known for. We had

Summary Heading: Great stay! Just a couple problems
Summary: I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel several times over the years, and as I was there to run the Star Wars Half Marathon, the location cannot be beat. For runners, the expo is literally in the basement of the hotel and the race start is in the parking lot of the hotel, so it truly could not be more convenient.  My 18 year old son and I were traveling together, and we thoroughly enjoyed the short walk to the monorail to enter Disneyland Park and the whole Downtown Disney area. The classic theming of the hotel and all the historic pictures are wonderful, and the customer service was great. We didn't meet a person - not at the front desk, passing in the hallway, at a restaurant or at bell services - that wasn't pleasant and helpful.  I have two small issues, however, that make me

Great place to escape to if your from Canada! Had a conference in the Disneyland hotel, stayed on site and enjoyed the pool a couple of afternoons. Surrounding area had really great range of restaurants and shopping. Didn't venture into Disneyland as it was a gross amount of money to do so, and the common amount of time to wait in line at each ride is 2 hours, absolutely ridiculous.  The hotel staff were all very good, and polite. The rooms are moderate in size, but bathrooms are small and dark. I wouldn't want to share a room with another workmate or friend.  Price was good for the time of year though. Fireworks every night, we walked to downtown Disney to watch and it was great!  Wouldn't go back unless another conference was there.

Decided to stay at the proper Disney hotel despite the cost and it didn't disappoint. Convenient for the park, magic hour saved us a few queues and the hotel was super efficient. Rooms were nicely appointed with everything working.

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel as part of a conference.  It was a wonderful place to stay, the entire staff was helpful and professional. Our room was huge, two queen beds...very clean. We have frequently gone to Disneyworld but were truly impressed with CA and the park, its size, the convenience of everything. I totally disagree with the previous posts about the condition of the hotel and the housekeeping.  Our experience was the total opposite.

It was our first trip to Disney and we decided to do it right and stay on property.  Having visited Florida many times staying at Port Orleans and Animal Kingdom Lodge, we had high expectations.  This hotel is clean, well manicured and close to Downtown Disney.  A really exceptional property.  Our room was incredible.  11th floor overlooking pool and very spacious.  The room and entire property has been extensively updated.  The only downside i woudl offer pertains to Disneyland as a whole....and that is that it's lacking that magic.  The hotel staff don't seem as happy as the Florida staff.  You are rarely wished to have a magical day and there is a lack of that Disney magic.  Howevever, everything else is really exceptional.

As first time visitors we decided to stay here so we didn't have to navigate shuttles etc. the hotel is only 3 star at best. Our room is looking very dated and in need of a refresh. The room was tiny. Two double beds but not much room for anything else.  Balancing all that is the convenience of location. On the first day we were there it was raining. Being so close it meant we could easily return during the day and dry out before returning. Given we were only there for 3 nights, saving time with location was great. We booked as part of a winter promotional rate. I wouldn't spend more than that on the room. Expensive for what it is.

Summary Heading: A 2 to 3 star hotel at best...
Summary: Shocking, dirty, lazy housekeeping, understaffed, terrible room service, dreadful rooms, and surly staff.  We will avoid this hotel from now on. Such a shame as the parks are immaculate and staffed by cheerful and lovely people. All the grumpy people in Anaheim work at the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: Somehow missed the Disney Mark, but fine in general.
Summary: We booked a two night stay at the Disneyland Hotel for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.  We have stayed at the Paradise Pier twice before and the Grand Californian three times.  This was our first stay at the flagship hotel.  It was fine.  Check in was quick but unremarkable.  Not a lot of chit chat...just a quick hello, take our credit card and off we went. Our room was nice.  It was clean which is the most important thing to me.  The beds were fairly comfortable and had the often mentioned light up headboards.  We had a view of the pool and also of the fireworks.  We had 5 of us in the room and we managed just fine.  We had two queens and a single which was nice.  I don't have any complaints I just can't come up with any good reasons why someone should choose this hotel over

Been to Disneyland a number of times and decided this would be my once in a lifetime splurge.  I am still debating whether it was worth it.  Didn't experience the magnificent customer service that several reviewers mentioned. I had requested (and needed) a room with the sleeper sofa due to having an 8 year old boy and 15 year old girl in our group. Unfortunately, when we checked in they had assigned us a room without the sofa.  Took quite a while to get that corrected. Due to that error, the room we were assigned did not have a view which was disappointing. We had very little contact with staff during our stay so couldn't really say much pro or con.  The hotel was convenient to the resort but the monorail was not convenient as advertised.  Splurged again and ordered room service

This hotel was great. The rooms were nice, very clean and spacious.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, and had plenty of room. The hotel is within walking distance of all parks and connected to downtown Disney. The pool area was great, however the service At the bar area was slow and unpleasant.

A very nice, clean room for a good convention price.  Comfortable, and quieter than I expected.  Was assigned a room in the "Frontier" tower, which was at the back of the property and not attached to the main ("fantasy") tower and the convention center where our meetings were held.  No desk or visible staff in my tower, no offer of bell service to get my bags from check-in in Fantasy tower to my room in Frontier tower, and no cover from the rain to walk from room to convention center and back!  All of that was a bit surprising for a property known for "cast" service!  Also was disappointed in the limited information I was given about transportation to and from the airport. Would recommend doing a bit more research before booking.

Absolutely loved the Disney hotel. Rooms were very clean and renovated. great for the kids firework lights over the bed. staff were exceptional. stayed for a week and the whole family loved the experience.

The only reason I don't give it a 5 is because of the price (about $500 per night after fees/taxes).   The room was spacious for 3 of us, and very nice and clean.  The two nights were quiet, I woke up only once to laughing kids running down the hallway.  Our room location was in the farthest tower and it was very convenient for us -- just a short walk to Downtown Disney.  The view from our room was of the back parking lot which didn't really matter because we only slept in the room.  The headboard lit up stars which was very cool, and if you look carefully, you can see Mickey's ears in the carpet pattern and throughout the room.  We saved on renting a locker because we walked back to our room to get waters, snacks and jackets for the evening.  If you are on the Disneyland side

From Arielle checking us in smoothly and ensuring very tired travellers got to their room to a smooth check out nothing was too much trouble special treat for the kids for Christmas thanks guys  Rooms were spacious loved the view over downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Pros and cons, but overall it's worth it
Summary: I have been to Disneyland and Disneyworld many times before but this is my first time to stay on property. I have always wondered if it was worth it and we gave it a shot on our family vacation (3 families, 9 of us total). The short answer is yes, its worth it. Now for the details.  There was the Disney Magic as we walked in and Goofy was there to great my young children. Our rooms were ready early and we went right up. We were in the Adventure tower and had a connecting room with the grandparents. My mom found a long strand of braided hair on her carpet (gross!) and I had 2 partially used water bottles in my fridge and a girls tiara under the nightstand. When I'm paying that much for a hotel and things aren't 100% clean I get annoyed. I told my mom she should call and tell them

We decided to do New Years eve at Disneyland this year! We stayed from Dec 30th-31st at the Disneyland hotel....What an awesome adventure! Service was check in to check out was outstanding! The room was clean and well furnished. Over the bed was a light display of white bulbs imitating fireworks (it was not bright, but very suttle and beautiful) When you pushed the button on the lamp, you got a musical demonstration to the lights. We were upgraded at no additional cost to a room on the 9th floor facing front with views of Disneyland including the night time fireworks! New Years was a great party and the place was packed with lots of additional activities. Would highly recommend this hotel to any adults wanting to replay their childhood or parents wanting their child to have a

Summary Heading: Expensive but location makes it worthwhile
Summary: We stayed in the Disneyland Hotel in early Jan just as the US holidays were coming to an end. Obviously an expensive time to stay here. When we booked from Australia I wondered whether we should have looked for something cheaper because we needed two interconnecting rooms for the 5 of us but having experienced the hotel and the location, I'm very glad we stayed here.   I agree with the last reviewer that being close to the Downtown Disney shops/restaurants/entertainment was very convenient. It meant we always had something interesting to look at as we walked the 10-15 mins to and from the parks every day. (As an aside, coming from Australia I underestimated how difficult it would be to hit the ground running with 3 kids the day after arrival in the US and do magic hour each day

This was the first time my family and I stayed at the redesigned DL Hotel and we loved it!  It was holiday time, so everything was decorated!  Our room for 4, was a great size with a split bathroom (toilet/shower one side, sink/closet on the other side of entry way).  You can take the monorail to DL only, not CA Adventure.  We did have an issue with the shower water turning cold, but we called the staff and it was fine the next day. Staff very nice and helpful. Would stay again for sure!

Summary Heading: Tips to save you money and time!
Summary: I am a research scientist by day and a wanna be travel writer by night.   When planning a trip to Disneyland during the busiest time of the year (Christmas/New Years), I turned on the research side of my brain and got down to serious fact finding!    First, everything is Disneyland costs more than you'd expect to pay.  Period.  Second, almost everything related to our trip to Disneyland was well worth the money.  A great value.  In other words, you get what you pay for.    The Disneyland Hotel highlights: 1. The "magic" and "wow" of being immersed in the spirit of Disney.  Walking by downtown disney vs. a string of 2 star motels/fast food dives makes a difference when you're doing this walk everyday for 5 days.  2. The monorail waterslide(s)  and super-heated pool (middle kidney

We are frequent visitors to Disneyland, but have never stayed in one of the park hotels. Although the stay was pricier than our typical accommodations, I'm not sure we will be content staying anywhere else. We had two adjoining rooms. Both were spacious and immaculate with a view of Downtown Disney. We also had a peek view of the Disneyland fireworks from our rooms in the Adventure Tower. The rooms were modern and fresh. Lots of charming, thoughtful Disney touches throughout the decor. A small refrigerator (thankfully, not a mini bar) was useful. Room service was efficient and the food was pretty tasty. One note to consider: Downtown Disney can be a bit noisy, and sound carries into the rooms that overlook the area. Proximity to the park, Downtown Disney, the monorail were very

We expected more, check-in was a bit slow but it was a very busy day and the staff were very helpful.  The room was a good size and the beds were comfortable.  The only problem with our room was the shower, there was little water pressure and the first morning we were there we had no hot water at all which put a dampner on the morning.  The rooms are clean and comfortable but it is expensive and I would only stay at a Disney Hotel for ease of access to the parks and magic hour at the parks.  We really weren't at the hotel for much of the time we were in the parks so it was fine.  They need more staff on the guest services counter.  I waited to make a booking for a restaurant and ended up walking away after 15/20 mins because I couldn't be bothered wasting any more time in line.

Our family's first time to Disneyland although we have been to Euro Disney and on a Disney cruise. I understand that you pay a premium to stay so close to Disney but the rate we paid for one night was really not worth it. Had we not been travelling with so many family members we would have opted for another hotel close by.  That being said, the hotel was clean, staff was friendly and efficient. Dinner at Goofy's Kitchen was fun but again way over priced for what we got. Although we had reservations the wait was longer than anticipated. My 2 yr old was scarred for life when Pluto "ate" her head. We all thought it was hilarious though!  Would I stay here again? Only at 1/2 the price or less.

We didn't have any of the problems other reviewers reported and loved our stay here. My husband had recently stayed at the Grand Californian, but I didn't want to pay that premium, so chose the less expensive Disneyland Hotel. He said the Disneyland Hotel is much newer inside and the Grand Californian is showing its age. He also said the room at the Disneyland Hotel was larger for less money.  Yes, both hotels are very expensive, but the convenience to the parks was worth it. We could easily go back to the room for a nap or to grab a jacket. It was wonderful being able to enter the park early. We did all the major rides and got our Fast Passes in the morning. The parks were horrifically crowded (this was over New Year's, so to be expected), and being able to get in early and do

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel - Expected more for the price!
Summary: Somewhat disappointed.  Enjoyed our stay but don't think it was worth the price we paid.   We arrived Christmas Day for 5 nights, 2 adults 4 children in a 1 bedroom suite.  2 Q beds in the bedroom and a pullout couch in the living area, we added a rollaway bed.  Space was adequate.  There was a small kitchen/bar area with a mini fridge and sink. The service is great if you need anything however I would have expected for the steep price a few more simple amenities in the room.   A Keurig is in most cheaper hotel these days and would have been nice, with proper creamers instead of chemical coffee mate.  They only had decaf coffee, once asked regular coffee was provided.  Some cutlery and dishes would have come in handy for the little bit of groceries we picked up for the kids.  We

The proximity of this hotel to Disneyland/California Adventure Park is fantastic. The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfortable so it was perfect for what we needed. Only glitches were check in was very slow (we had booked 2 rooms) & annoyingly the configuration was not what we had booked months in advance & confirmed twice by phone from Australia.  On the upside check out was a breeze!

For the money we spent, we didn't get the value.  The location is great.  The hotel looks nice, but came up short in a couple of areas.  There's a serious plumbing problem that causes the shower to be hot-cold-hot-cold.  Very frustrating and put us in a bad mood.  Other family members had the same issue in different rooms.  This can't be a new problem.  Come on Disney, it's Disneyland!  Fix it!  Also, room temperature didn't seem to control well.  Overall, didn't sleep well.  Bathroom layout was awkward.  A $100 hotel often has enough vanity/sink space for two people to get ready.  Not possible here.  Since this is a place where families gather, this is quite a gap.  If you like the option of creating some air flow or fan noise at night (we do), it's not possible here.  If we go

Good quality, standard Disney!  The aircon temperature control seemed a bit erratic (alternately too hot and too cold through the night).  Excellent views from floor 11.  Monorail about 4-5 mins walk. Tea bags were not replenished from day to day.

Of course the location is the best part of this hotel and the reason it can be so expensive. The hotel is very clean and we really enjoyed dining at Goofys Kitchen for the experience of meeting the characters for our 4yr old daughter first visit to Disney. Otherwise the hotel wasn't all that special for the price.

The Disneyland Hotel was as promised.  Updated, upscale, excellent service typical of Disney.  Added value of early entry into both Disney parks when staying at Disney property.  Room was spacious, clean and comfortable.  Will consider staying again in the future.  Only drawback is the price, there are many less expensive alternatives off site.

Tried the Disneyland Suite for 3 nights and everything was magical. The room was fantastic for 5of us, amenities were perfect, house keeping was diligent, the in room dining was very good and the hotel staffs were friendly and nice. The hotel was strategically located where Disland theme park and Disneyland California was simply a walking distance through Disney Downtown. P.S. The pool is fantastic,

Summary Heading: Beautiful room, great location, but glitches to work out
Summary: We stayed in a concierge level room on the 9th floor in the Adventure Tower. It was convenient to the park and had a fantastic view of Downtown Disney. It was more expensive than a traditional room, but having access to the E-Ticket Concierge lounge, services, and free food and beverages was great. At first I was worried about being right across the hall from the elevators, but the room was really quiet and we heard the elevators hardly at all. The glitches had to do with the room card printer not working in the lounge, our room cards not working, and guests being told one thing about their rooms but finding out what they were told was wrong.

I was amazingly surprised by my hubby with a 3 night stay in the MM penthouse & 1 night in the Pirates of the Caribbean suite. Now he's really screwed himself over, because they were so wonderful I never want to stay anywhere else! 😁  Now to the details. MM penthouse has 2 1/2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms & a sleeper sofa. Also, a living room area with incredible media area, dining room that seats 6-8 & a wet bar area that includes fridge, microwave, and large sink.  Master bedroom was truly devine. I have fibromyalgia and the bed was very comfy allowing me to have a good nights sleep. King size, so the hub and I were both comfortable. Plenty of places to put clothing & luggage. Bathroom was large & luxurious with a steam shower to die for! Completely refreshing! Extra large jetted

Well appointed, big room  overlooking the pool - comfortable for two adults and three teenage girls. We really enjoyed the Disney extras such as the magical head boards. We were made to feel like special guests from check-in throughout our entire stay with multiple magical moments such as  "running into" characters in the lobby or being given signed photos of the Frozen princesses. Easy access walking to and from the parks with early entry a bonus.  It was very expensive for a family on a budget so we only stayed two nights.  it will be a long time before we can afford to stay here again but for celebrating special milestones, it was worth it.

This is the Best Disney hotel property I have stayed at so far the beds were comfortable and you could see the park from your own hotel room🏰🎢🎡🎠 if you stayed or your going to stay on the to floor (like me and my family) you can see the Golden Gate Bridge🌉🌉🌉🌉🌉🌉 this hotel is truly magical I know you and your family will love Disneyland!!!

For my family's Disneyland vacation we decided to stay at the Disneyland hotel. Yes it was expense, because we were staying during the holiday season it was about $200 extra than the regular $300/night rate.  However its an amazing hotel. This hotel is only if you want your little ones (or yourself) to have a truly magical experience. Other than that you could stay at a very nice hotel for half the price.  Overall the hotel was very nice, clean and extremely comfortable. The beds were so relaxing, especially after a long day of walking. The rooms were always clean and no problems with the bathrooms, unlike other hotels I've stayed at(💩😕).  The benefits of staying a Disneyland hotel is that you get to go an hour early into the park. It may not seem like much but when I did it I

We just got back from four magical days at the Disneyland Hotel.  I want to go back already! We were there over Christmas and had the most wonderful family vacation we have ever had.  The hotel was wonderful.  We had a suite in the Frontier Tower of the hotel since there were 8 of us, including three grandchildren under the age of 6.  But we couldn't have been more comfortable and happy with our rooms.  Two large master suites.  Balconies!! Two large ones - facing the park!  A living area (with fold-out couch). A "kitchenette" ( I use that loosely because the only thing that made it a kitchen area was a small refrigerator and counter area with bar seats and sink.  There was no microwave - which really would have been nice. There was one in the lobby snack room, but it truly

Summary Heading: Perfect location. nice room (suite) great staff
Summary: I had arraigned something special in the room to surprise the wife. The Disney staff had it all set up & not a problem to be had. The pool area looked great but we had no time to enjoy it as we did 3 days in the parks. I wish the breakfast options at the hotel were better. Great place to stay if you are gonna spend a few days in the parks.

Disneyland Hotel is the best hotel in the world. Mickey Mouse is fantastic and spectacular. I stayed in the Mickey Mouse Penthouse Suite. It's a very nice suite with Mickey Mouse theme. Even though it's $400 per night, it's really worth the money to stay at a room with a Disney theme. I highly recommend this place for Disney fans and lovers!

We had a short stay and wished we could stay longer. It was a bit pricey but worth it. The kids loved it. It was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel.   We had an excellent view of the pools and resort area. It was really spectacular at night when we saw the fireworks show.  We enjoyed having access to Goofy's Kitchen where we celebrated our toddler daughter's birthday and the convenience of walking to Downtown Disney as we strolled to Disneyland.  The staff were friendly and courteous. Overall a good experience and looking forward to our next stay.

This used to be a bit isolated, but with development you have much more and a monorail connection to the park. Lovely and worth everything as there are some things worth the added expense and this is one. You are spoiled.

Stayed here for two nights in early December. All I can say is "WOW!" Gorgeous room, comfy bed (with a unique light-up headboard, and Disneyland right outside the back door! Does it get any better than this? If you are looking for Disney character interaction, you need to check out Goofy's Kitchen -- awesome for kids.

Summary Heading: Disney magic as far as the eye can see
Summary: Our family just returned from 3 days at Disneyland Resort. We had a lovely room at the Disneyland hotel. It was clean, well appointed and very quiet, plus we had a great view with a wall-sized window overlooking the pool! From the moment we arrived we felt very much at home. Our room was ready early, so we checked in at about noon and got settled then headed right into the park. The monorail station is just inside of downtown Disney and drops off in tomorrow land. Although when I was alone with my 2 year old the monorail was inconvenient because I had to do the stroller folding and hang onto the kiddo. We booked a standard room and requested a low floor in the adventure tower. The room was beautiful! The lighted headboard was my favorite part. The "goodnight kiss" music box was

Summary Heading: Always nice to stay at Disney for business
Summary: Was in town for a business conference right in the Disneyland convention center, so being put up in the Frontier tower was quite convenient.   Good: - Location is excellent, right next to the convention center and Downtown Disney.  - View from room is pretty and I liked the ambiance of the hotel in general. Seeing the fireworks every night was a magical touch. - Free wifi! - Bed was comfortable and TV channel selection was nice.  Misc: - Obviously there a lot of children at this hotel year-round, and they can get a little loud sometimes, but I guess that comes with the territory.  - Trying to navigate outside of the hotel property onto the main road outside is a little problematic, as there are parking lots and long roadways galore.  - You know you're staying at Disneyland for

We just spent three nights and four days in Anaheim. We had two rooms that connected which made it easy considering there were five of us. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Ten minute walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland Park and Disney California Adventure Park. The staff where all friendly would stay hear again.

Yes, the location is great. We spent a long weekend with the grandkids and had a super time of course...it's Disneyland!!. The Disneyland Hotel is wonderful for it's location...but...while the staff could not have been nicer, the "premium" room left much to be desired. Having traveled and spent time at many premium properties, I would not add this one to that list. Why?...this is an older property that has been "refurbished". The hard usage does show. Our room had worn carpet and almost thread-bare fabric on the couch. The large picture window overlooking the park was filthy...on the inside...with hand and fingerprints covering it. I understand that little ones, like our grandkids, will be touching the window but the window had obviously not been cleaned for a long time prior to

Summary Heading: Definitely the way to do Disneyland
Summary: We stayed as a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children) in the Frontier land building of the Disneyland Resort and enjoyed it very much.  It was so warm on our arrival we swam in the (heated) outdoor pool. Great cure for jetlag (arriving from Australia). The kids loved Goofy's kitchen for dinner,  unfortunately the other breakfast options are a bit unappealing and there's no good espresso coffee on site.  Room service dinner is a good option when the kids are too over excited, and the special dessert cakes really are special.   The rooms are big and clean, beautifully presented and we had a view of the fireworks from the 8 th floor.  The huge advantage is that is a 15 minute walk to the parks and only 5 minutes to the monorail.  Definitely the way to do Disneyland

My bother and I stay at the Disneyland Hotel every time that we go to Disneyland (which is 3-4 times a year, we have annual passes). It's always a great place to stay because of the proximity to the parks, the service is impeccable and the rooms are very comfortable. We have never had a stay here that was below our expectations, it is always, for lack of a better word, magical. Always look for off season rates that can save you up to 25%. My brother and I also request that we stay in either the Fantasy Land or Adventure Land towers because these are the closest to the monorail, the Frontier Land tower is quite a hike away. It is great to be able to get to the parks early and then come back in the afternoon for a nap. :)

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for our honeymoon. We booked a premium view room and ended up in a corner room in the Frontier Tower. Our room had a balcony which overlooked Downtown Disney and provided a perfect view of the fireworks over Disneyland Park.  The room was extra clean and the turn-down service was a pleasant experience. They left Disneyland Hotel chocolates and a rose to celebrate our honeymoon.  Easy access to Downtown Disney and both Disney parks. The monorail was less than five minutes to walk to from the room.  The laundry room was out of soap - contacted front desk and soap arrived in less than five minutes - great customer service overall.  Recommend this hotel to couples and families looking for a magical time. The staff was extra polite throughout the hotel.

I loved this hotel and had an amazing time! The beds are comfortable and the staff is really friendly! I loved the extra time early in the morning at the park offered by the hotel at no extra charge and I loved how close it was to everything! I could get anywhere I wanted to go in a matter of minutes.  My only complaint is the drains in the bathroom stunk really bad.

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel while in Anaheim for a convention. The rooms are beautiful and the beds comfortable.  Breakfast at Tangaroa Terrace was good and I liked the convenience of the coffee shop. You can't beat the quick access to Downtown Disney and the parks.   The staff was very nice as well. There were only a few areas of improvement.   The business center was very expensive. $5 for 10 minutes of computer access and a minimum $3 to print. I found another option than paying $8 to print the one page I needed.   The room I was in had a door to the adjoining room right next to the bathroom sink.  This was awkward every morning when my neighbor and I got ready at the same time. You could hear everything! I fought the urge to say anything when she sneezed.  Finally, the

Summary Heading: Good Hotel / housekeeping could be a bit better
Summary: We stayed here for 8 nights in December. We were a bit late booking the trip so we ended up getting a standard room in the main town with a parking lot view. At first I thought it was going to suck but it was actually great because we saw the fireworks from our room. The last two years we stayed in the adventure tower and had a view of Downtown Disney. If we go back I would prefer the Downtown Disney view as you can also see the fireworks.  Santa was at the hotel every night we were there as well as carollers in the lobby. It was very festive and my kids loved it.   I was a bit disappointed with the housekeeping this time around. Our room was neat and tidy but I wouldn't say it was "clean". There was a lot of dust on the furniture and dirt on the walls. To get our bedding

We came to Disneyland to celebrate our daughters 10th birthday...a pretty big deal if I do say so myself : ) I don't think I would call the room itself a four star room but the perks that come along with the room make the price more tolerable. I could have stayed in a five star room in London for what The DL Hotel costs but I decided not to think about that and instead dwell on what you get..EARLY ADMISSION to Disneyland and/or California Adventure for every day we stayed at the hotel! Once you go to Disneyland you will understand how precious that extra hour is..hello Cars Ride In California adventure for starters!   We were there during a November heatwave almost 90 the whole time we were there and the pool at the DL Hotel was a most welcome respite for our mid afternoon break

Everyone was wonderful, so disney friendly & the room was fabulous! We loved every minute! It rained alot so we spent every afternoon in the hot tub warming up!Fun & playful for the Disney kid in me & perfect for my adult side too!

We stayed for 6 nights and had the concierge service as well. It was well worth the extra money to have that. As others have said the extra hour you get to go into the parks is great. Right on downtown Disney this hotel was the best we stayed at whilst in the US for things to do.  The concierge service was fantastic.  The kids went up and down from there whenever they wanted and the staff were so helpful. Watching the fireworks with the accompanying music from the park was a highlight of the night up there ( 11th floor) .   The main elevator was sometimes really busy and took quite a while to get to you. If you went to the other end of the hotel the second elevator was always fast. The pools were great and the lifeguards are always on duty , kids went down there on their own a

Our family spent Thanksgiving 2014 at the Frontier Towers at the Disneyland Hotel.  The rooms were in excellent condition, the staff were all friendly and helpful.  I have no problem recommending staying there, if you enjoy crowds which Disneyland has in abundance off.  The only problem was what passed for a coffee maker and there was no microwave, but there was a small refrigerator in the room

What a great time we had!!! My daughter, son-in-law and granddaughter and I stayed at this hotel. The Disney Avengers Marathon was November 16th and it was so much fun. Yes things were a little pricey but you were at DISNEYLAND!!! Everyone was super friendly, rooms were very spacious, beds were very comfortable, room service was wonderful, pool was super nice - everyone was great!!! Had a great experience!!!

Recently spent 3 days at the hotel in late October for a nursing conference. Rooms were clean, had a deluxe room with a view of the pool. Was very comfortable for 3 adults. We had 2 queen beds and one twin bed. Loved the location, and downtown disney just a few steps away. Yes it is a little more expensive to stay there, but well worth it for the convenience. We also visited the Storyteller Cafe over at the Grand Disney Resort and it was wonderful for lunch. Overall great location, clean, friendly staff! Oh all rooms have been updated and there is even really neat lights that turn on in back of the bed, don't miss these!! Went to sleep dreaming of my next return to the Magic Kingdom.  Oh also free wifi!! Loved this, as I had to check in with my work, while at the conference.

Just recently stayed three nights at the Disneyland Hotel, Fantasy Tower. From the moment you check in the staff and surroundings take you to a real "happy." place. Never encountered any hotel staff who weren't immediately ready to deal with what ever your need was. The room was neat and very clean. Special Disney touches throughout give it that magical feel.

Visiting Disneyland can be a stressful vacation.  To avoid extra travel time and parking lot hassles, consider the Disneyland Hotel.  It's central location on Disney Boulevard and close proximity to the attractions, make it a logical choice particularly if you have little kids that need a midday break.  It also has a nice water park for kids.  The rooms are typical hotel style rooms.  The food is so-so and over priced.  Avoid the "Goofy" Brunch unless you have some kind of travel voucher.

Summary Heading: Nostalgic Hotel w/ great, new renovations & amenities!
Summary: I had last stayed in this hotel in Summer 2011 just after the newly named Frontier Tower had been completely renovated top to bottom, and loved every minute of my 5 Day, 4 Night stay. My most recent stay in June 2014, was just as wonderful as before! I was there for a 5 Day, 4 Night conference. The room rates and tickets to the parks were greatly discounted, but the experience was still just as incredible, though definitely more affordable. The rooms were spacious and the food and amenities were great. My next visit to Disney will be next May 2015, and the choice for hotel is between Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel; GC is more luxurious and cozy, but the DLH is truly classic... Tough choice to make!

I was here for a conference and it really wasn't the place.  The property is very nice, rooms are very nice, amenities very nice, but too many kids to have a conference here.  Everything is very expensive, as you would expect from a theme park hotel.  $3.50 for a bottle of water in the vending machine.  But don't worry, it takes credit cards.  The restaurants in Downtown Disney are good but very pricey.

We are ultimate Disney Aussie fans! We travel regularly to USA from Australia to holiday with kids! We have found the Disneyland hotel to be our favourite place to stay ..kids love the pool with monorail slide.. Rooms are Newley renovated and very well appointed. Beds are super comfy. Room service is very quick and staff and very helpful and accommodating at all times. Access to the parks is a short stroll through down town disney where great food, dinning &!entertaining can be enjoyed. Highly  this hotel !

It's not so much about what you see as it is about how you feel!! There is no place that has that special magical feeling like Disneyland ! Everything is so incredible however the highlights for me were, Indiana Jones ride, Splash Mountain, Tea Cups, Fantasyland, Fantasia show and the Fireworks over the castle. We ate there everyday and compared to New Zealand food prices it was not expensive at all! You can take water into the park so that's great! Don't worry about spending an hour sitting down waiting for the fire works cause you get a great view from anywhere on Main Street. Only thing I could not find at Disneyland was good coffee. But that's the same everywhere in Anaheim. Take your time and enjoy every magical moment!

Summary Heading: Tough reservation to get--GET the DISNEY Reservation #
Summary: We needed two nights over fall break at Disneyland.  We were staying late at Mickey's Halloween party and really wanted to stay on sight.  But the Disney web site kept saying they were full.  So I had heard that sometimes Expedia and Orbitz pre-purchaced a block of rooms and sold them at full price.  So I found one night here at the Disneyland hotel and one night at the Grand Californian.  One I found on Orbitz, one night was found on Expedia.  When checking in, the Clerk had NO RESERVATION on file.  At first she was very dismissive.  Sorry, we're full, can't help you.   Even after I showed her the Expedia reservation she acted helpless to change the situation.  So I asked her to review it with a manager.   I got Expedia on the phone and they just said Disney was having computer

Summary Heading: A great experience, but not without some hiccups.
Summary: We visited Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure for the Halloween-time celebration and for our four year-old's first time to the parks. We purchased everything through Costco Travel and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. It is definitely worthwhile to stay at this hotel for it's proximity to the parks and early entrance to DCA. Breakfast with Goofy in Goofy's kitchen on the hotel grounds was a definite highlight and we have so much video of our son's precious smiles. We will never forget the great times we had. The monorail pool and Tiki lounge were also super fun. The pool area was great for kiddos and big kids like me.  With that, there were a few things that could have been better. The room wasn't bad at all and had a great view, but the overall look of the inside of the

Summary Heading: Excellent we will be back again.
Summary: My kids actually thought we were in Disneyland the first time we came to this hotel.  This hotel is absolutely fabulous....it's sprinkled with magic and if you're going to Disneyland .....you should stay either here or the California Grand.  The customer service is amazing, the rooms are absolutely lovely(we learned on the last night that the headboard lights up with twinkle stars).  Beds were comfortable, everything was beautifully cleaned.  The onsite store was great..Goofy's Kitchen was great...and the pools are amazing(best pool of all the hotels).  Thanks Disneyland!

We booked the Disney Hotel for the kids,  they obviously loved it,  all they saw was the Disney Characters, etc. From my point of view,  the service was very poor,  the food was very poor.  The WiFi didn't work,  not sure why they say they offer free wifi,    all in all,  you pay a lot to stay here and the kids will love it but the adults will think i am getting ripped-off.

Summary Heading: The original "Disney" Hotel just keeps getting better!
Summary: It's been a number of years since we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and it just seems to get better with time.  The check in was very easy and quick, with the staff very pleasant and helpful.  It was my daughter's and my Birthday and her infant sons first trip to Disneyland!  The young lady assisting with our check in made badges and got autographed pictures of our favorite Disney characters for us.    Our room was very nice, clean and had a great view over the pool and play area.  The bathroom was modern and immaculate.  The room is very much in line with the Disney "magic" and so the headboard was spectacular, looking like Tinkerbell's fairy dust or stars scattered across the wall. The pool and kids play area is great and if a break is needed from the hustle and bustle of the

It was a great hotel loved it my kids and I had so much fun...breakfast was great and I love that it's so close to everything. We stayed for 3 nights and it was just amazing love to go back soon. Maybe Christmas time I heard it's a must  do around. That time and I don't want to miss a thing my kids will be so happy I can't wait!

I was the best hotel I ever visit. My famille and I went to Disney for 3 weeks and it was the best experience of all time, My son had so much fun that he cried wen we lived,my 12 year old daughter didn't love it, Even my moms love it.i love it.

Summary Heading: A gem next to the Magic Kingdom.
Summary: We stayed for three nights at the DisneyLand Hotel for the special occasion and special treat of our daughter's fifth birthday bash. Anticipation and enthusiasm were running high for this trip, but we were not disappointed one bit. Check in was super easy, polite, friendly and helpful staff throughout our entire stay at every turn in the hotel. We had a high floor room in the Fantasy Tower overlooking the pool area. The pool and jacuzzi were wonderful and we enjoyed a few hours frolicking there each afternoon in between our morning trip to the Magic Kingdom and our return early evening jaunt back to the "happiest place on Earth" as I heard one person refer to it. The room was comfortable and cosy with an appropriate amount of Disney angle in its decor but not overbearing. We had

We enjoyed a five day stay while attending a conference at the hotel. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant from the young man checking us in to the gracious lady at the gift shop but I must say our mousekeeper was fantastic. Somehow our coffee maker was not working our first day of check-in and I told her not to worry, we'd have coffee later. By the time we got unpacked she had the machine working and had left us extra coffee for morning. What a sweet young lady! The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. What a nice surprise...music and soft lighting from the beautiful headboard!  A few misses though. First, the dining options are limited after about 8-8:30pm. It would be nice to have some options for a light meal such as a sandwich to take to your room. The food

Summary Heading: Location is the reason to stay here
Summary: Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, Frontier Tower, for one night to celebrate my daughter's birthday. The staff at check-in were very friendly. They even gave her a birthday pin to wear and an autographed photo of Anna and Elsa which she loved! The lobby area is very well maintained, and Goofy was taking pictures with guests at the entrance.  Basically convenience is the best reason to stay here. It was great to walk to the parks via downtown Disney and then not worry about needing to drive back to a hotel late at night. We took the monorail into Disneyland and it was great. Not to mention it's a lot shorter line if you enter the park this  way.  With all the pluses, don't expect any freebies at this place. No room upgrade, no welcome or turn down amenity in the room, etc. It seems

The last time I went to Disneyland I stayed at the Disney Grand Californian-I wasn't that impressed by the rooms-so I decided to give this hotel a chance-as they recently had a remodel. I was traveling with my 6 and 2 yr olds solo so I truly appreciated the upgrade to a suite! The suite has a large wet bar kitchen area-with microwave, fridge and coffee maker-large counter with bar stools-open to a nice sized living room with a pull out couch and access to a nice balcony. The bedroom offered a king size bedroom, dressing area with sinks and the tub/shower and toilet in its own room-perfect for our needs. I had a full size crib rolled into the bedroom-plenty of room.  The hotel is 3 different buildings around the pool-so you don't get the grand lobby feel as you do with the Grand

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel 10/21-27 and had an amazing time.  The room was a great size, large enough for a family (though there were just 2 of us) and fun Disney touches.  The head board alone is worth the price of the room.  It really is magical.  The room was clean and well kept, and our mousekeeper did an amazing job.  One of the days of our stay, one elevator bank in our tower (Frontier) was not working.  One of the hotel staff came and got us, and took us down in the service elevator.  While it wasn't necessary, it was nice that they recognized that waiting more than a few seconds for an elevatore wasn't ideal.  My only complaints are the lack of quick food choices after 9:00 and the poor wifi.  You really are stuck with ordering from either room service, or the

The last time I stayed at this hotel was in the late 90s before downtown Disney was built and just as cailfornia adventure park broke ground.  This hotel went through a mega renovation.  Though the original building still stands, it is now only rooms and the front that used to extend by the monorail station was removed.  The marina buildings were also renovated and there is no longer any balconies on any one of the rooms.  If you visited this property before 2000, you will not recognize it.  A complete make over.  If you been to disneyworld in fla, I would compare this to the contemporary hotel.  Unlike Disney world in fla where there is no charge for parking as a hotel guest, There is a charge for parking whether you valet or self park.  Self park is cheaper. I was told very

First time staying at the hotel and my kid's first visit to Disneyland. Check in was easy (they had our travel pack ready and room was ready), we had paid extra for a pool view (not worth the money, don't recommend it), the room itself was adorable (the headboard was a total hit with my kids!) and very clean. Beds were super comfy. Shower pressure was very low (as mentioned in other reviews) and they did not replace toiletries when the room was serviced so if you need more ask before they service your room. I loved the coffee maker that made two cups at once! It also had a small fridge in the room. We were in Frontier Tower which was fine but I haven't stayed in the other ones...it was very quiet. One day we didn't have our room serviced and they called and asked if we wanted it

Location is hard to beat, adding to IN PARK convenience =) Very friendly staff! Great view from our room and easy to watch the evening fireworks with sleepy little ones right from the beds! These beds are VERY COMFORTABLE and the lights above them are a real gem**Wifi signal was terrible, as well as all cell reception. But this was true for the entire park. Bathroom lighting was a bit dark, harder to apply makeup or remove contacts.** But otherwise fantastic! Thank you so much =)

This past September, my family and I enjoyed a four-night stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  I am 24 years old and  I can honestly say that this was the best hotel I have ever stayed at while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure.  We arrived at 10 o'clock at night and were greeted by the bell hop.  As we walked into the lobby there were teacups to sit in that looked just like the one at Disneyland in the Mad Tea Party ride.  To a die-hard Disney fan, these seats were amazing.  We were assigned our tower, The Frontierland Tower, and made our way to our room.  On the way to the tower some quintessential Disney melodies were playing in the courtyard area making the walk to the tower enjoyable.  As we entered the tower there was a diorama of Big Thunder Mountain; the next

Disneyland Hotel is close to Disneyland theme parks and has a friendly welcoming vibe. The room we stayed in was comfortable with lovely outlook/views. The staff were friendly and helpful, with a Disneyland childlike optimism. A welcome change from our experiences in New York. The walk through Downtown Disneyland shops between Disneyland Hotel and theme parks is lively, exciting and welcoming with interesting merchandise and eateries. My only disappointment is that the room was not serviced and while I do appreciate that it is rather extravigant and environmentally unfriendly to provide such a service, most hotels in the USA do,  and I like it. The chap who checked us in was friendly cheery helpful and shared our childlike excitement about being in Disneyland for the first time.

Summary Heading: Nice friendly Hotel to relax and visit Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for five nights on a business trip. I didn't go to Disney but did walk (2 minutes!) over to a few restaurants in downtown Disney. Nice layout for the hotel. Lots of flowers plants and trees in the courtyard that are well maintained. We stayed in the Frontier building. The sign of a good hotel is when you have a problem. The cold water faucet was completely broken when we arrived. Within 10 minutes of calling someone was there and fixed it. Also the TV had brightness issues and when I called with in 10 minutes or so someone came and took care of that. Nice friendly and orderly for sure (just like Disneyland and how Walt Disney wants it to be). Outside fireplace is nice and relaxing. Fitness center is clean and machines I used were in working order and we'll

Summary Heading: 4 star room, 3 star service, 5 star prices
Summary: But you know what, it doesn’t matter.   The hotel is in the absolutely remarkable Disneyland park area and that is its winning feature. Wander out from the hotel and catch the monorail into the heart of the Disneyland park. So long as you have Park Hopper passes you can come and go, back and forth, as you please.  As soon as you get your head around the fact that this is the feature you’re paying for and stop expecting a 5 star hotel experience, it’s all OK.  In some ways it is a shame that they don’t have to try harder; it could be and should be a better hotel than it is.  To me, 3 star service is defined by the words, “What you’ll have to do is …” Five star service begins with, “Let me fix this for you.” When we checked in the person on the front desk forgot to give us the

My first time visiting this Disney and I love the park, the location and everything Disney themed...but   our hotel room has no water pressure, have taken cold showers, getting assistance takes us a long long long time for anything, and the service at the restaurant was even slower than than the hotel's. One more night, hopefully I have a mildly warm shower tomorrow. When we choose our next Disney vacation this is not the likely hotel choice.

Family had spent a week at Disney in 1970 but haven't been back since (we have gone to Disney World though).  Spent 4 nights here while husband was at a conference. Room was comfortable but felt a little dated.  Runner for one side of drapery didn't work. Tiles in shower area needed some good grout cleaning.  3 days our room wasn't cleaned until 4 - 4:30 which was a little late. Room was mostly quiet although could hear the toilet flushing in other rooms. We had a room that faced the parking lot but it was perfect at night when the fireworks went off.  Enjoyed having Downtown Disney right next door as there were several good eating places that could be walked to.

Summary Heading: Fantasy tower wonderful.: frontier tower.. Never again
Summary: We have stayed here before and were in the fantasy tower and it was amazing and made me want to stay there again when we came back, so we did.. But this time we got the frontier tower, but disappointment! We have a view of the car park.. The bath plug didn't work, the elevators never worked, one morning we had to wait 20 mins to get into an elevator, the hot water stopped working it was awful!  It was like the budget tower of the three even though we paid the same money, I heard many others comlalin that the frontier tower was awful and their friends said "you should have requested the adventure tower"  Never have I been so dissapointed in Disney, no composation from them either, just said all towers are the same. Nice try Disney! But all towers are not the same, I was there not

This hotel is the perfect location for Disneyland trip. You can walk down and catch the monorail to Disneyland or walk to the front gates of California Adventure. The service at this hotel is by far some of the best and friendliest you'll encounter. Everyone working at the hotel is there to make your trip more enjoyable. We always stay on the concierge level rooms, which is a great value when traveling with a large family (grandparents, parents and kids). They have a nice selection for breakfast, food all day long, drinks (be sure to grab bottled water to take to the park with you, it's very pricey there), then they have nice selection in the evening and desserts to finish off the day. The view from the concierge lounge is quite lovely for watching the fireworks. Now for the

We were very excited to visit Disneyland, after visiting Disneyworld year after year. Let me start by saying that I know it's Disney, which equals $$$$, but I was a bit disappointed with what I got for the many thousands we spent for our 4 night stay.   We booked through Costco Travel and got some nice extras like lanyards and pins, a premium character meal, a free photo at the park, a $40 Disney gift card and $10 ESPN Zone gift card. We saved hundreds over booking directly through Disney. We stayed from November 6-10 which was right after their Halloween Season and the preparation of the Christmas Season, which was their low season, and a little more affordable.  Arrival: Our flight arrived at LAX early; around 9:30 am, and we purchased the shuttle service from Disney; which

Summary Heading: Ideal for a conference or special event
Summary: I just attended a business dinner at the Disneyland Hotel.  The ambiance was outstanding in their ballroom and the food, particularly the filet, was delicious.  It amazes me how the chef can turn out 600 meals at one time and have all the food cooked perfectly.  I certainly would attend another meeting/banquet at the Disneyland Hotel.

This was my third visit to the Disneyland Hotel and each time it has been excellent. The service was exceptional and the accommodations were wonderful. I love the retro disney theme. The proximity to the parks as well as downtown Disney is easily walkable. Can't wait for my next visit.

Upon arrival we saw Goofy in the lobby. The front desk staff gave our 7 month old baby a first visit pin and an autographed photo of all of the Disney characters. It's these little things that you are really paying for. Not that the rooms are not nice. They are. They did a good job refurbishing them and we loved the headboard.all that said our main complaint is that when traveling with a baby getting the room cleaned when we were out was a bit of achieve. Half the time there was no answer when we called housekeeping. Once after several calls to finally reach someone they said sure we will clean your too roght away but when we got back three hours later our room was still not cleane but the maid was worki g accross the hall. Oh, and the free wifi is just about nonexistent.  Ok.

Summary Heading: Stayed for a conference - it was a very comfortable stay
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland hotel for a conference. It was very comfortable, clean, and spacious. Even though it was for work, I would go back there with family for the proximity to Downtown Disney and the parks themselves.

I wasn't expecting much when I brought my 13-year-old niece here for the night. I thought it'd be high prices with a Marriott or Hilton type experience. But Disney pleasantly surprised me. The rooms were fresh, updated, and well decorated. The lights on the headboard were charming and understated. My room was spacious with a great dressing area and decent bathroom. An easy property to get in and out of, very user-friendly. EXCEPT for check-in. There seemed to be no one managing the desk agents. Some were spending inordinate amounts of time with other guests, others were glued to their computers. The line wasn't long but I waited almost 30 minutes to get checked in. This was fairly unacceptable as any good manager good have reapportioned staff or planned better and upped the

Our family of five (MIL included) recently spent 2 nights here in a one-bedroom suite, to celebrate my daughter's birthday. The suite was huge, and very comfortable. And it was QUIET! The ice machine and housekeeping were right across the hall  from our room, but we never heard anything. The room had lovely Disney touches, without being cheesy. We had a perfect view of the wedding garden from our suite, where we watched a number of fairytale weddings, complete with a Cinderella carriage with footmen! However, there are no premium club-level suites, so we ended up paying quite a bit extra to get the "Eticket Lounge" service. We used it a lot--you can grab snacks, drinks, anything to take to your room or into the park with you. The breakfast is minimal, but overall it cut down a

I stayed here last week and the stay was amazing! All the staff were very friendly at the hotel. I had  to have an ADA room for my mom which had a roll in shower. So the bathroom was HUGE! I had a premium view which had an amazing view of both parks and downtown Disney. We even saw the fireworks from Disneyland a couple of nights. We had been in the Adventure tower. Loved the decor of the entire hotel. Only downside which is not the hotels fault was the walk to and from the parks. My feet were so tired and blistered from walking in the parks all day that to have to walk through Downtown Disney back to the hotel room was a killer! I was also disappointed in Goofys Kitchen. We ate here 1 morning for breakfast and the food was subpar for what I paid per person.

We (toddler and 2 adults) stayed 2 nights at this hotel.  Check in was great, the receptionist was very nice and we were able to check in super early, which was much appreciated!  Rooms extremely clean and well kept, but ours were pretty basic (no sofa).  Beds were very comfortable.  Had a parking lot view, but we didn't "splurge".  We didn't eat in the hotel or anything which on hindsight I wish I would have.  Overall, I was expecting a bit more, and I think the issue is that we spent every waking minute in the park and really just slept in the room. I think it would be worth it to pay that price and stay there if you are planning on an extended vacation where you don't spend every second in the parks and want some downtime in the middle of the day.  We have stayed at the

We stayed here for 4 nights in October. The rooms are well decorated and furnished, the hotel is clean and welcoming, check in was fast and efficient. There is a 5 minute walk to both Disney Parks from the hotel through a nice selection of bars,restaurants and shops. The hotel has 2 restaurants we ate at Goofys Kitchen, a buffet style with a good selection and lovely staff.

Loved it! Bed was amazing and the hotel was so beautiful. Cute bathroom & bedroom. Great TV aswell. Perfect holiday to LA! Definitely return & would recommend to anybody. Friendly and get to meet the characters in the hotel lobby - HEY GOOFY!

My husband and I attended a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center and got a great rate at this hotel.  The king room had every amenity except a microwave.  It was walking distance to the park and Downtown Disney with all the many restaurants and shops.  The staff was helpful and we simply loved our stay.  I now am totally spoiled and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else when visiting the Magic Kingdom.  The bonus was the huge carved headboard with Disney motif and twinkly stars and music! ;)

Stayed in the Disneyland hotel for only 1 day but the room was great.  Loved the headboard.  I woke my kids up in the morning with it.   The bed was absolutely great.... check in was easy and quick,  room was clean and very quiet... Love the robes they gave you to wear to the pool

Even though the hotel has been here since the 50's, Disney continues to make magic for the guests.  The hotel is continually updated and doesn't have the "old hotel" feeling.  There is a lot of history throughout the property.

Love this hotel! Everything about it is magical. From the light up musical headboards to the hidden Mickey's all over the room, it was perfect! The pool is great with a place even for the toddlers. They even have life jackets at the pool for use too! Can't wait to go back!

Stayed over for four days of meetings, enjoyed every moment after the day was over. Go to the House of Blues, great dinner for any budget. If you are going with kids there are ample places to go less than 3 minutes from the hotel, Downtown Disney is beautiful and very safe. Perfect place for either the family, meetings, or both. I like it more than Orlando's WDW.

Summary Heading: Definitely found a new favorite Disney hotel
Summary: I am always reluctant to stay at Disney hotels due to the prices, but I splurged this time and stayed four nights in the Disneyland Hotel. I have to admit that I think from now on I am going to save up the extra money to stay here. It really is a fantastic hotel.   We reserved a pool view room and as a result we were put on the fourth floor of the Adventure tower. I really enjoyed the Adventure tower because it seemed to be very low on noise, the lobby was never jammed, and it was the closest to Downtown Disney. There were also multiple elevator locations so that was an immediate plus over Paradise Pier which has an atrocious elevator situation.  As for the room itself, it was much larger than I expected it to be. The bathroom is spacious with a separate room with the toilet,

Summary Heading: Nice stay. Great location and trader sams!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here last month and we had a nice time. I will say the place is pretty pricey and the rooms are pretty average. Besides the lights in the headboard that look like fireworks over the castle they are nothing special. The location is great walking distance to the parks and downtown. The best part is that you can walk to trader sams and have some drinks without having to drive anywhere after. If the money doesn't bother you its worth staying here. We sat outside trader sams one night near a fire place that had some nice couches near it too overall I would recommend it.

We stayed in the 2 room suite at Disneyland Hotel - Fantasy Tower and had such a great time.
