All details were in line from  the clean room and bathrooms in the room and throughout the resort , the amazing service, and a great nights sleep in the most comfortable beds.  The level of service was great from the vallet service, bags, checkin, housekeeping and landscaping management was spectacular.  The front desk offered great insights and tips with the park activities and afternoon events at the hotel were an added bonus.  Nothing better than a heated pool to enjoy in late October and I loved that HOT HOT HOT tub too!   The rooms were well planned for space and sleeping arrangements.  Empty and cold refrigerator in each room for the snacks and drinks, the pull down murphy bed as

Summary Heading: Loved the location enjoyed the 'mouse' theme
Summary: Great location next to downtown disney and a short walk to the parks. Friendly staff, large rooms and subtle mouse themes everywhere. On the lamps, bathroom tiles, taps etc. Fun hotel, would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Great stay, plan to come back!
Summary: I was afraid to see how we (my husband & I) would like staying at The Disneyland Hotel, but it is safe to say we loved it! Our room was ready right at 3pm (check in time) & when we got to the room, I discovered that we had been upgraded from a standard view room to a pool view room!   We stayed in the Fantasy tower, which some had complained was too busy and loud because it is the main building, but I did not notice extra noise & I enjoyed being so close to the front desk, concierge services, and the Fantasia gift shop!! I am actually a little afraid we were completely spoiled on this trip & will find subsequent trips lacking!! (Because we WILL be going back here!)   I also loved being so close to Downtown Disney!! If you take the monorail from Downtown to Tomorrowland, you're

Terrible service, black mold in the bathroom, no hot water, broken elevators, etc, etc.   We also had a flood on another floor during our stay that required us to have to evacuate the hotel in the middle of the night in the freezing cold.   It was not a 'magical' experience.  Save your money and find a better hotel.

Stayed one night at Disneyland hotel and decided to stay 2 more. My son was 3 he loved it and location was perfect so close to the park. I would definitely stay again. It was great staying so close for my son's nap. The waterslides were so much fun. Watching fireworks from your room was also nice. The food at the tiki room was good also

We stayed here during our vacation and loved it.  We never encountered a single staff member that was not helpful or friendly.  Bellhops, check-in staff, room service, wait staff, room service - all were great. I am hard pressed to come up with another hotel that we could say that about.    The hotel is in a great location, attached to Downtown Disney and easy walking distance to the Parks.

Yes, this is a pricy hotel but it is totally worth the money. The hotel is newly renovated and within very close walking distance to both theme parks and Downtown Disney. It has several restaurants and a quick serve grab and go right in the middle of all the towers. Also, Trader Sam's Tiki Bar is a must visit and very close. The rooms are big and the bed is heavenly. The bathroom is on the smaller side but we didn't really mind. The attention to detail overall was very luxurious. Note, you will pay a daily fee just to park your car at the hotel. The automated check out was a breeze. I would absolutely go back.

Surprise last minute trip to celebrate our daughters birthdays (21st, 18th and 16th). We had an amazing room with easy access to Downtown Disney as well as Disneyland and California Adventure. The room was spacious and easily accommodated the five of us. The lounge/restaurant was open late and although we arrived after 11:00 we were able to sit outside and have a snack before going to bed.  The front desk staff weren't sure if it was open so good idea to check it out for yourself. This was great as we were all hungry after an evening flight and L.A. traffic. We only spent three nights but could have stayed for another week. So much to do and the perfect place to launch the adventure from!

Summary Heading: Wonderful!  A Disney fan's dream come true!
Summary: We usually travel to Walt Disney World in FL, but decided this time to change it up and head to California.    We were upgraded to a balcony room for free!  It was a city view, but we could still see parts of California Adventure park and had a parking lot view that was pretty cool at night.    For WDW regulars, the hotel is in walking distance of both parks and Downtown Disney.  It takes about the same amount of steps from the Frontier Tower in the back to the Downtown Disney entrance as you would normally take getting to the busses!    Personally, I would much rather stay at the Disney Resorts because you don't have to cross any streets like you do with the non-Disney hotels, but that's just my personal opinion.  If we get to go again, I'd love to stay at The Grand

First of all, we felt like we might have been caught in the hype of staying at Disneyland however after a few hours we couldn't beat the hotel at all. Hands down, best family holiday ever. From the check in, to walking in the room door, the small touches make it so special. It isn't tacky, but really really well done. The location for Anaheim is the same as every other park hotel, it's Anaheim so you get it right, but this stay is different. Being so close to Downtown Disney is really attractive. We would spend a most of the day at the Parks, walk back to the hotel, an hour in the pool with the kids, walk back Downtown for something to eat and soak up the atmosphere, then spend the night back on the parks. The service is second to none, they really want you to feel as though

We have stayed at the Orange County Hyatt twice before and loved it due to the family suites and space for a family of 5, the great restaurant, and upscale vibe.  The only negative was the shuttle to the park, taking away from time in the park. We decided we would pay the premium this time to stay in a Disney Hotel for the experience and ease of location to the park.  It was worth it from all accounts.  One of the things I was worried about was that the room would not be big enough for a family of 5 and we would regret not staying in the suites at the Hyatt.  I was so relieved to find the room to be very spacious with a great layout of 2 queen beds and couch that folds into a bed for the third kid.  The disney touches were great and the view of the pools were nice.  We loved

Yes, it is extra, but it puts you in Disney and in the parks early.  We stayed 3 nights.  The room was very nice.  Big and clean and even quiet.  We had a day bed and it fit our 12 year old son perfectly (he is tall).  Getting into the park an hour early allowed us to ride Radiator Springs Racers twice. The front desk was very nice.  We did not find a good place to eat at the hotel, so we used Downtown Disney.  We will stay here if we come back.

I was attending a conference at the Disneyland hotel.  Staying at the hotel, made this even more convenient.  The event staff does not miss a trick.  They are always present and extremely courteous.  The hotel itself is geared more towards families than business travel, but they still have everything you could need.  The walls are a little thin, you can hear TV's and Shower noises from adjoining rooms.

Summary Heading: It beat the Grand Californian in many ways now!
Summary: I hadn't been in years and the room changes to the Disney theme made it an amazing stay. Absolutely comfortable! The music on the headboard and lights, the Disney touches....it was great. I wish that they would make the transportation to the park less of a hassle, and I never feel the cast members are quite as amazing as in Florida. But mostly.... it's magical!

This review comes from a former cast member that worked for Disneyland and Disney Entertainment / Project Development Department for 3 years. I will never stay at the Disneyland Hotel again, and would not recommend it to anyone that values customer service.   Disneyland Hotel provides customer service that is convenient to the Disneyland Hotel.   We booked a room with a premium view over a month in advance thinking we would get a view of Downtown Disney and instead we received an elevated view of the pool... basically we paid an additional $50 a day for the same view as those who paid for the Standard view room. Over $1500 was spent to make this a special occasion (a birthday).  That money was wasted. The Disneyland Hotel decides what "premium view" that you will receive.  For

Summary Heading: Great location but 5 star price with 3 star service at best
Summary: We have stayed at every California Disney property multiple times and this was the most disappointing stay.  We were in the Adventure tower.  Previously, we were treated so well that we felt the extra $$ spent were worth it but not this time.  The view was superb and the room nice but not $500 per night nice.  We booked a king room with premium view and were told at check in that we had to choose between a king bed and premium view with no compensation.  The room did not have a microwave but did have a good sized fridge.  One of the beds was so extra firm that it was uncomfortable and the other bed was just passable.  Other normal hotel chains have far better beds and without a good nights sleep, Disneyland and California Adventure were not as much fun.  The 1st day, they left

The experience at the Disneyland hotel was far better then Disneyland's Grand. We stayed our first 2 nights at the grand then our last 3 at the Disneyland hotel. Service was amazing, great views, clean and rooms were good sized.

Hotel is nice clean with nothing spectacular about it but this is as good as you are going to get in Anaheim. It's walking distance to all the Disneyland attractions which is why you'd stay here.   The friendliness of the front desk staff has lots of room for improvement. Nothing magical about it!

This was my second stay at the Disneyland Hotel. I stayed 4 days at this hotel, and then had to change to the Paradise Pier (review coming for that place as well) as they did not have availability for my full stay.  I had a mid-level room in the Frontier Tower. The room itself was very comfortable and spacious. Then again, this was a solo trip so was not sharing the room.   The furnishings were very comfortable and did not overpower the room. No need to mention the wonderful castle headboard, if you are reading these reviews, you seen it mentioned enough. :)  Room has a nice mini-refrigerator that kept drinks nicely chilled.  A nice flat screen TV.  The coffee maker is a one or two pod type and the coffee is pretty good too.  As far as water, I never had any problems with water

Really liked the room and pool but was disappointed in the service. Pool service was non existent on Saturday and room service took over an hour. Waited over a 1/2 hr to get my new room keys. Location is great for the park.

Hotel is great, well kept, clean and very friendly staff. If we were to come back we would stay here. Swimming pool is large. Only disappointment is how expensive the dining options are, I guess because it is a resort.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but minimal Disney theming
Summary: We opted for the DL hotel over the Grand California based on TA reviews and comments on the need for room refurbishments at the Grand California.  Overall we were very pleased; hotel is very modern, good location, nice facilities although lacked the Disney theming we have come to expect based on our stays in Florida. There are subtle references including the headboard which lights up and some nice black and white retro photos of the park.   Location is good - 5 mins walk to both parks. You can enter the California adventure via the California hotel which is quicker.   We ate in Steakhouse 55 and had a lovely meal although there were a number of very tired children who made their presences known (but this is Disney!!). Would also recommend Napa Rose in California hotel which we

This hotel is VERY clean and well organized to deal with the chaos of Disney vacationers. Valet and bag check service was top notch and organized. We each got our own personalized key card- even my 18 mo son who can't use it but it will go in the scrap book. They are on their game but you pay for that service.  Also get 1 hour magic time at Disneyland as a hotel guest. We got there  on a Monday@ 11am but managed to get an early check-in. So grateful for that. We were in Frontier tower overlooking parking lot. Normal sized hotel room but very clean- big windows. Mini fridge (empty-thank goodness! not filled with expensive snack items we would never use or buy) in room- use it to fill with cheaper snacks and drinks for the kids and yourself to save money. Also a coffee maker in

Hotel is in a good location if you are going to Disneyland. It's right next to Downtown Disney, so you have to walk all the way through there to make it to the park. There are lots of families and kids here, so it's a kid friendly place. It's not a W hotel or a Westin, but they do have turn down service and staff are very friendly.

Summary Heading: Have to stay here at least once!
Summary: Ever since I could remember, I have always wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, and recently I had the opportunity to. All I can say, was that it was amazing!  The rooms and overall decor are a great mix of elegance and Disney charm, which is great for both kids and adults. The rooms are well sized, and the beds were extremely comfortable, and as an added bonus, the headboards have fireworks that light up with small LED's that are just so fun to watch. As a hotel guest, you get special perks for the park, and only have to walk for 5 min to get to the gates. If you don't feel like walking though, you can catch the monorail from a special stop just outside the hotel instead. Although it can be a bit pricey, it is worth every penny, and is something that everyone should do, if

Summary Heading: Great location if you are visiting Disneyland
Summary: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland or California Adventure land. 10 minute walk through downtown Disney to the park. 5 if you catch the monorail. Pool and facilities are great for kids and parent a to unwind in short breaks from theme park visits. Disney characters are in restaurants and in hotel lobby which the kids loved. Staff are fantastic and do there best to make it feel like the happiest place on earth! Rooms are pretty small and bathrooms are tiny, although separate dressing area was handy with a family of 4! Rooms are themed really well and if you are after a Disney experience it is really worth it!

Stayed here in October 2014 for 5 nights with a family of 5. We booked a standard view room.  2 queen size beds and a sofa. It wasn't the happiest start to the happiest place on earth - After 2 days of driving down the coast from San Francisco to Anaheim we are advised that there was no sofa bed in our room. So after much angst they finally found a room for us (it was a deluxe view room not that we cared about the view - we just didn't want to have to squeeze 3 large children into one bed!). It is just a hotel room - you can't open any windows and the bathroom is TINY!  The rooms are cute though with all the Disney touches. We were debating between the 2 hotels - California and the Disney - I think they are much of a muchness.  Maybe California a bit closer (only a bit) It is

Pleasantly surprised by the value I  received at the Disneyland Hotel.  Stayed here at a conference rate, very reasonable.  Enjoyed the Disney customer service experience, great food, clean room with comfortable beds and access to the restaurants at downtown Disney.  From my perspective I received good value for my money when I expected to be charged exorbitant prices as I would if I were visiting Disney World.

We had a nice time staying in the Disneyland hotel. The proximity to the parks and downtown Disney is extremely convenient. The room was nice, and it is fun to find the hidden Mickeys :). Its too bad there isn't a balcony in all of the rooms, I think that would've been nice to have. Also the walls are quite thin, so you can hear people next door pretty clearly if they are speaking loudly. I'd stay there again for the convenience and friendly service. The shops and restaurants on the property were also nice.

Great Motel a must do is Goofys Kitchen for breakfast, my only criticism it is a big walk to Disneyland itself, yes you can catch the mono rail but that takes you to the back of Disney land, best bet stay in the California motel that will take you almost into the California Adventure park MUST do rides BUGS LIFE, SOURING CALIFORNIA, CARS, MUPPET SHOW

This was our second time staying at the Disneyland Hotel. We have also stayed a couple of times at the Grand Californian. I prefer the DL Hotel. It has a wonderful retro Disney feel that reminds me of my childhood. My husband and kids prefer the Grand Californian. Either way, you can't go wrong staying in the "Disney Bubble".  The only thing I wasn't super excited about was even though we had concierge service, we were not booked in the Adventure Tower. We did have a nice view of the pool, not as nice as the Downtown Disney view you would get in the Adventure Tower and it would have been more convenient to be in the same tower as the concierge lounge. Not a big deal, as its about a 3 minute walk, just not as convenient.  We have another trip booked next week, hoping we can get

Stayed here for two nights and loved it! we don't have kids but love Disney. This is the cheaper of the hotels on site. I loved it. The room is lovely albeit we had a view of the car park but we could see California Adventure in the background. Knew we would be out most of the day so didn't mind. Expensive as a hotel but for the location it is great. Loved walking through downtown Disney to get to the parks! It is clean and everyone is very helpful. Had a wonderful time and would stay again!

This is our 3rd Disney trip in the last 5 years. We've stayed at the Howard Johnson and the Grand Californian in the past and even though we had great experiences on those two trips this was by far our favorite. The hotel is actually smaller than it looks in the pictures, we stayed in the Adventure tower and everything (check in, laundry, pool, restaurants) are close by. It feels more secluded than the Grand which tends to have a lot of traffic in the lobby from people that wander in from Downtown Disney.The Grand Californian is almost too big and the grounds are confusing with many dead ends. The DL hotel is only a ten minute walk from the park gates and you can still use the Grand Californian entrance to DCA.  Unless you plan on spending a lot of time in your room don't spend

My family and I loved this hotel. Its convenient location, spacious rooms, Disney theme and beautiful pool extended our Disney experience beyond the park. We ate at Goofy's kitchen, shopped and had dinner at Downtown Disney. Highly recommended!!!

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for 4 nights during Christmas 2013.  We arrived December 27 and left new years eve.  Since we were a group of adults, we had a 3 bedroom suite. This was well worth the money, our rooms were on the top floor in the frontier tower, and we could see the fireworks nightly from our balcony.  We had 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms plus a living room and small kitchenette.  Lots of room and at the end of a long day, it was awesome to come and have some space from each other.   The hotel is done right up at Christmas, lots of trees and decorations.  I love staying here just for the convenience of the hotel.  Since we were travelling at the busiest time of year, I prebooked all our meals, and that was great, since we were guaranteed meals and no line ups.

Summary Heading: As Good as it Gets! (Avoid Magic Morning Hour)
Summary: I remember going to Disneyland as a child and always wanting to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Of course, it's a completely different place now than it was then. In any case, you can't beat the location next to ESPN Zone in Downtown Disney and the short walk through Downtown Disney to Disneyland and California Adventure. The staff is completely wonderful from the moment you drive into the hotel guard gate. Goofy greeted our baby in the lobby while we were checking in and all of the little Disney touches throughout the hotel (from the tea cup chairs to the Mickey gloves holding the lamps) make this such a magical place to stay. There is so much to discover! The light up musical headboard was fun to turn on every morning and walking through the grounds is like a walk through a

Summary Heading: Not worth the expensive room rate
Summary: The hotel is not worth the expensive room rates ($487 per night including taxes for a pool view room). I thought there would be something special with the expensive price rate but there is none. Among amenities they don't even provide complimentary water bottles per day. Other hotels with similar star ratings are way cheaper and better. Some staff members are not  so friendly as well.  The bathrooms are very small.  I wish I had preferred Hyatt over this. The only advantage is the Disney town is at walkable distance from the hotel. But is it worth double the expense from other hotels?  To me it was not. If it is just about coming back to the hotel room and sleep at night after visiting the theme parks then any other hotel with similar ad better amenity is good with half or less

We stayed here for 5 days as we explored the Disney Parks and Universal Studios. Arrived in the late afternoon on Friday. Check in was very fast and easy. The front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended for family travelers.

Summary Heading: Horrible service/ Rude as can be.
Summary: You couldn't make a worst mistake than to stay or reserve at this hotel. They were absolutely rude from reservations to Erin and Rich (front desk supervisors). When a little tact and customer service where called for they chose to be absolutely rude and discourteous in manner and tact. I am so upset. You would think that for well over 500/ night they could afford you're family better service.  An absolutely horrible experience from a place that is supposed to accommodate families and little children. Control yourself, don't come here.

Summary Heading: Great way to enjoy more Disney!
Summary: We have stayed at the Disneyland hotel multiple times, in just about every room type and tower.  The hotel has many great features including easy access to Downtown Disney and the parks.  Magic Hour Early Admission is also great, especially for California Adventure with Cars Land.  The rooms are not large (smaller than Paradise Pier, but larger than Grand Californian), and can be very expensive at peak times.  All rooms have pack-n-play cribs for babies, and the large majority are set up as Double Queens.  Following a renovation a couple years ago, the hotel now features a large pool complex with waterslide and a very enjoyable Hawaiian themed dining area/lounge for limited small plate table service and cafeteria style quick bites.  On property restaurants include Steakhouse 55

Stayed at Disneyland Hotel... whatever you need these folks are more than accommodating! Clean rooms- beautiful view of the pool and grounds... easiest checking in and out ever... Would love to come back and stay again!

We stayed here for 9 nights as a family of 5 in an upper level room. Two adults and three teens. From check in they made us feel the Disney magic! Everyone was always so lovely and made us feel special. I was initially concerned that we would not have enough room for the 5 of us in one room and although two rooms would have been better we were quite ok in one room. There were two queens and a sofa bed which was big enough for my 16 year old daughter who is 5'6. The room was great with lots of special Disney touches.  The location was the absolute best part. Right at the end of downtown Disney. The parks were a short stroll from the hotel and downtown Disney was great for eating, shopping and having fun! There is a Starbucks on the walk to the parks which is very handy to grab a

Summary Heading: To keep with the theme, it's magical!
Summary: Loved every minute of our stay here. From the beginning to the end the staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was always clean and the little Disney touches made us smile, not to mention the head board which we wanted to take with us! We had a great view of the pool area and the parks are really close to the hotel, 5 mins walk about. There are two really great features included in your stay which we were not aware of when booking, firstly you get an extra "magic hour" in the parks with your hotel stay. It allows you in a whole hour before the general public and all the big rides are open at this time saving you queuing for them later. Secondly, you can send any purchases you make in the parks back to your hotel for collection the next day, provided it's 3 hours before

Great property- the grounds were impeccable. Service on all levels were top notch. Food was very good. Some of the rooms have poor views- parking lots which was not good. But- you are not in the room that much. A lot of kids.

Summary Heading: How could you not stay at the Disneyland Hotel?
Summary: We chose this Hotel mainly for the location.  It is is so handy to both the Disneyland park and California Adventure park.  The early Park access on alternate days for Hotel Guests was worth it as well.  We used the extra hour to get to a couple of the key rides that get very busy during the day.  It also helped starting early given we had a 42 degree heatwave.  The room was very Disney and was a good size for our family (2 grown ups and 3 kids under 10). We were in the Frontierland tower and had a good view of the fireworks at night.    Being close to Downtown Disney was good.  Plenty of food options as well as shops to look around in.  We also had a couple of meals at Goofy's restaurant. Good fun with the characters.   We find that Wifi is important for us for research,

My family and I spent a week at the Disneyland Hotel back in August 2014.   We stayed in the Frontier tower.  We really enjoyed the location and the decor of the rooms.  The pool is also a great amount of fun.  They have two slides that are enjoyable for the children.  The counter service food was very good as well was dinner at Steakhouse 55.    Trader Sams is a fun bar. A must for adults.  The negative is we were dropped off by our car service with 10 bags and no bell service to help.  Even when checking in there was no offer for bell service.    Overall I would recommend staying here.

We stayed at the hotel as our convention was held there. Very friendly, clean, great food. Next to all of the Disney activities. Many great restaurants in Disney downtown. Lots of shopping, plus my favourite place, Starbucks. Even a car rental on site.

I really had my heart set on the whole Disney experience, I mean it's branding is that it is the happiest place on earth!  We stayed in the frontier land tower for 3 nights.   Pro's - Disney themed bed was adorable. Beds were clean & comfortable. Close to park & downtown Disney. Great pool. Extra magic hour at the parks.   Con's - low water pressure in the shower & water was not very hot. Bathroom door frame & door had dirty marks, had to ask for extra toilet paper, no complimentary water on arrival. The wifi didn't work, it just wouldn't connect & the computer in the business room was not complimentary in fact the price was outrageous.  There are really no extras to this service to ensure you have a 'magical experience' which is disappointing in relation to the cost. We would

Summary Heading: Made all our dreams come true
Summary: Fantastic hotel, we had a wonderful stay, amazing staff, and every last detail thought of for making our Disney experience extra special.  Rooms clean and spacious with everything you could need for kids along with pretty Disney themes. Really wonderful.

We spent a week at the Disneyland Hotel and really enjoyed our stay. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and did have to wait for our room until about 3:30pm but since the room ended up being exactly what I had requested - corner suite with balcony I didn't mind waiting for awhile.  Service was good, no complaints about any of the staff that we encountered. We did eat at the hotel a few times without any major complaints. We had an early reservation at Goofy's Kitchen for the character breakfast and really enjoyed it. We had previously done character meals at WDW (princesses and Mickey's) and found Goofy's Kitchen was much quieter.  This hotel is more expensive than others in the area, is it worth it? If you can spend the money then stay, if you are really unsure about the price

Stayed at this Hotel.  Absolutely LOVED IT!  Well, it's the DISNEYLAND HOTEL!  There's just a feeling that you get when you're there.  My only complaint is that they don't really offer anything extra for the Price that you pay..... 1- No Complimentary Breakfast.... 2-The Charge for using the Computers are OUTRAGEOUS!  They charge you by the Minute   3- You think you're entering the park earlier than everyone, when really, that's just not true.  Got on the FIRST Monorail to Disneyland, and by the time this thing let us off, the park was already FULL.  Would have done us better to enter through the Front Gates. Didn't do that again.....  The pools are better, and there are 2 slides to enjoy.  The Room feels so special with the Headboard that lights up like a Firework Show.  The

If you want the full Disney experience, I highly recommend Disneyland Hotel!  The room was so whimsical and no detail left un-Disney-fied!!  We were even greeted by Goofy when we checked in!  We loved the location of the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the pool area.  It was so great to be able to walk back to our hotel and hang out at the pool after a long day in the parks.  If you are on a budget, this place may not be for you (lots of cheaper places outside the park) but if you want to immerse yourself totally in all things Disney, like my family did, then the Disneyland Hotel is the place to stay.  I can't wait to go back again someday!!

The grounds are very clean, parking, valet or self was very easy & accessible. The rooms were great, the hotel itself is antiquated, the staff is WORLD CLASS, they're all over the place to help you, our family of 17+ was overwhelmed with courteous staffers, any accomodation changes were handle quickly & professional

Overall: Good quality hotel but a bit on the pricey side. Excellent amenities, central location, and friendly and helpful staff.  Pros: Good location, minutes walk from Downtown Disney. Several large pools and a waterslide. Great amenities, including a gym and coin-operated laundry. Vending and ice machines on every level. Large, clean and spacious rooms. Guest services were excellent. They gladly swapped our coins for bills and posted letters and postcards (they provided the stamps as a courtesy). The theming of each of the three hotel towers was subtle but well done. It made for an enjoyable environment.  Cons: Cost. This hotel (despite a recent upgrade) is still quite dated and yet is expensive. The shower/bath combo was dated and cramped when trying to shower. Check-in wait

Great hotel to stay in for Disneyland and Disney California Adventure, both within short walking distance. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Lots of onsite facilities (free wifi, gym, laundry, pool open till 10pm). Lots of great food choices nearby. Would happily stay again.

I spent four nights/days here during a professional conference.  I was housed in the Frontier Tower, which is a bit of a walk from the main checkin desk.  My room was in the back, overlooking the parking lot---. When I checked in I asked about upgrades, but they were $50 per night....not what I had hoped for in a deal.  Anyway, the mousekeeping was very good, but the overall shape of the hotel left somthing to be desired.  I travelled to four floors looking for a vending machine with water, and ended up having to go to the store in the main building at 9 p.m.  Grrrrrr.  I had a room with 2 queens....TV, fridge....the ususal.  Shower only had the intermittent spray.  No choice for a normal shower spray.  Room was comfortable, though and not terribly noisy.     This hotel is just

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, if you can find it at the right price!
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is amazing, almost as good as the Grand Californian - our personal favorite.  Upon check in, we were greeted warmly by the parking staff, the front desk staff, and our room was very clean.  They made accommodations to get us a room on the same floor as our friends that we were visiting with.  Our room overlooked the pool, which was very nice.  The only complaint was our bed, it seemed to have a 'Grand Canyon' size dip in one side, which made for tough sleeping.  If the bed had been better, it definitely would have received an excellent rating.  This is a great family hotel, but was also great for a couple.  September is a great time to go, but it was definitely extremely hot.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids (Important qualifier -- 'with kids')
Summary: We just came back from two nights at the Disneyland Hotel. We live relatively locally (in the San Fernando Valley) but my wife had a conference that was taking place at the hotel and I had a concurrent event in nearby Costa Mesa...hence, we decided to give ourselves a little vacation 45 miles from home.  The Fundamental Fact about the Disneyland Hotel:  IT IS MEANT FOR FAMILIES WITH KIDS. Staying at this hotel without children may lead to angst and dismay.  In fact, we're still trying to figure out why the conference was held there (since it had nothing to do with or for kids). You are not going to be at The St. Regis Monarch Beach or similar adult-oriented resort.  This place was built for the kids.  Once we got that through our heads, we had a much better time.  THE GOOD:  1.

I actually live locally (within 2 hours) and have stayed at many area hotels that are cheaper.  Usually, we come for only one night so we don't have to make the drive twice in a day.  But this time, we stayed for three nights at the Disneyland Hotel, and I have to say the stay at the hotel was just as memorable for my kids as Disneyland was.  The entire hotel staff are so friendly and helpful.  It was so great to leave the hotel and go a short walk into the park.  Having Downtown Disney literally outside your door was great too.  Especially, as I have older kids that could come and go as they wanted.  My only complaint would be that the pool closed too early.  My kids usually like to come back from the park and take a quick swim after.  The pool looked amazing but there was no

Summary Heading: Magical hotel in a Magical place!
Summary: What a wonderful experience at the Disneyland Hotel.  Perfect location, great service, beautiful well kept grounds and clean comfortable rooms.  Absolutely delightful.  We stayed for four nights and were sad to leave!  There is just the right amount of "Disney" mixed in with first class hotel accommodations.  Truly something for everyone of all ages.  We enjoyed everything on property from Goofy's Kitchen with the characters to the very classy Steakhouse 55 and fun at Trader Sam's.  We looked forward each day to the walk through the nice grounds to Downtown Disney and the parks.  Disney does it right and especially at this hotel.  We can't wait to go back.

Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel a few weeks ago, and we just loved it.  Didn't want to leave! We usually stay at a partner hotel (Candy Cane or Carousel) and sometimes at the Grand Californian when we're feeling the need for luxury and have some extra $$ to burn, but we'd never stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and thought "Let's give it a try!" I may get some flames for this, but we actually liked this hotel better than Grand Californian.  The price was a tad cheaper, but that wasn't even a factor.  The decor of the Disneyland Hotel is just MUCH better than Grand Californian.  The rooms are so much more "Disney" and you really feel that you have a little of the park magic in your room.  Loved the LED headboard each night, white-on-white "Mickey" bedding, and even the bathroom

Had some business to attend to so my wife and I stayed here for 3 days to do so. We have older children so it had been years since we were here last at were a bit concerned since there is so many children here, as well there should be. We had a great time, the Hotel just creates a wonderful experience for all ages. Although we did not go into the parks, we strolled down Disney Street mall everyday and night and really enjoyed ourselves. Wonderful place but a bit spendy but no where near as pricey as Disney World.

Our first time to Disneyland family of 5 ... Our room was big enough ..there was no coffee or tea making facilities ...no wifi in our room called the helpline ..he tried to fix.. but no luck :( lucky it was Disneyland so we were out most of the time ..kids loved the pools adults loved the bar :) downtown Disney was a 3 minute walk with great shops and supper friendly staff.

Stayed at Disneyland Hotel with the family and very excited in my children had never been to Disneyland and I had not been since I was 6.  Booked the Disneyland hotel due to the location and to get the full Disney experience.  It did not disappoint!  For one, we were able to check in early, which was tremendous after a long flight and two children, 5 and 8. Then we were upgraded to a two room suite, with two balconies, overlooking the pool and downtown Disney.  The views were incredible and we came back each night for the fireworks and the kids loved it.  The location was great, just a short walk through downtown Disney.  We spent one entire day at the pool, which the kids thoroughly enjoyed and the kids even got to play with Goofy on several occasions at the lobby and at the

Recently stayed here for a conference & found it to be nothing less than perfect in every aspect. Friendly staff & gorgeous room. The room was extremely clean & amenities were exactly what I needed. Great fitness center, security patrol & convenient location to Downtown Disney made it a perfect location. Hope to return with family for a leisure visit rather than just a work conference. Highly recommend it for families.

Stayed at Disneyland Hotel due to a conference at the Disney convention center.  Wow.  Immersion in Disney from the start.  If this place does not start you of in the "Disney Mood" nothing will, well maybe one of the other 2 hotels.  A hop, skip, and a jump from Downtown Disney and the parks.  The room we had was nice especially when you find the hidden Mickey's all over.  Beds comfortable and hot water in the bathroom with no waiting!  Staff were awesome all over with friendly Hello's, Good Morning's, Evening, etc. Even the late night crew who you see in the early mornings.  A draw back for us, well me anyway was we were in the Frontier tower which at any other time would not have been an issue, but my back went out and it was a long walk to the room for me.  No big deal.  And

We stayed here for 5 nights recently and had a great stay. We stayed in the fantasy tower with a great view of the pool.  The rooms were a good size for 2 adults, 2 pre-schoolers and an infant in a crib. The rooms were nicely decorated with loads of special touches like the mickey head tapes and fireworks in the headboard.  We managed to get a great rate but I am not sure if it would be worth it at a full rate as it's not actually that much closer then 10 of the partner hotels that offer much cheaper rates. It certainly does have some additional magic that these other places can't match but at over twice the price normally I'm not sure I would do it again.  The kids had great fun in the pools which had multiple hydro slides. We found the Monorail to get into Disneyland didn't

We stayed here on the last leg of a California vacation August, 2014.  It's hard to say much that hasn't already been said about this hotel.  We enjoyed our 4 night stay here, when visiting the Magic Kingdom and California Adventure.  We have a family of 5, so it's nice to have a larger room, with two beds and a couch.  We stayed in the adventure tower.  We didn't upgrade, but our "city view" room had a nice view of downtown disney and the Magic Kingdom fireworks.  We felt like upgrading would be an extra expense for a room we would barely be in, and we were right.  There are two elevators in this building, and we never waited for one.  There was easy access to the pools and downtown Disney.  Our room was nice, clean, quiet, etc.  There was a huge soaking wet spot on the carpet,

Staying at the Disneyland Hotel has no many positives including never leaving the magic, a wonderful pool, great poolside service and wonderful rooms.  We particularly love the light up headboards and having a fridge in the room.  The linens are wonderful and beds are comfortable.  The staff are always professional, but not quite as friendly it seems since the remodel---particularly at the front desk.  They were very nice, but no extra chatting even though we were the only people in line.    I thought a remembered a nightly turndown service, but that did not occur this time.  The price is certainly consistent with hotels that do turn down and evening towel changes, so this was a little disappointing.  Overall however, you cannot beat the location or hotel in general.

Summary Heading: NOT the Happiest Place on Earth!!!
Summary: We booked the Disneyland Hotel based on location and amenities. We were severely disappointed with the results. Our room (The Fantasy tower) was tiny & comparable to a motel. Not a 5 star resort!! Our carpeted floors were soaked. So we could not not walk barefoot anywhere. It smelled like mildew. So, like anyone who pays $300/night for a room, I asked for our family of 4 to be moved. They accommodated immediately and put us in another similar room on different floor. Still overlooking the Disney parking lot. But it gets better. I asked for a bellhop to help with moving 6 pieces of luggage as well as groceries for the week we had just purchased. They told me it would be a 15-20min wait. Mind you, at this point, it's 9pm!! We were completely exhausted from being up at 5am and

Used this hotel as an overnight stop prior to flying home from Los Angeles airport. It brings the ease of parking, smart hotel and convenience for eating in Downtown Disney which is just a few minutes walk away. The hotel itself is quite low key by Disney standards but in a fairly refined way. We ate at Tortilla Jo's which was fine and used a Starbucks in Downtown for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again - even though we were without our children who weren't impressed that we stayed there! Reception staff not massively welcoming on arrival.

We took the kids to their first trip at Disneyland and we decided to stay on the resort property at the Disneyland Hotel. The hotel was very nice and clean. The rooms were well maintained and comfortable. The magic morning early arrival was not as great as they had advertised. Only about half of the park rides were open early and you cannot get any fast passes. I know this is a park issue and not a hotel issue, but the hotel heavily promoted it.  One of the really nice features of the hotel is their pool. They have several water slides and the boys loved it! The staff at the pool were very helpful and the number of lifeguards was impressive!  Overall we were very satisfied with our trip and the boys had a wonderful time. I would stay here again. The price is a bit steep compared

Summary Heading: Wanted the 'Disney Magic' & didnt get it
Summary: After spending 30 days travelling across the USA , wanted to finish our trip with a stay at the Magic Kingdom .....very dissapointed checked in 11am -was told room wouldn't be ready till 3pm (that was ok ) went to park came back 8pm went to room only to find half used shower gel .....no coffee ......front desk sorted the matter quickly .....came back from park the next night (LA in the middle of a heat wave ) went straight to pool ...only to be told THE POOL IS NOW CLOSED.........After all of this the staff did make it up to us by allowing us to stay in E-club before our long flight home to Australia.So thankyou ! to the staff that assisted us .  I really think Disney really need to get back to their roots & provide a 'magical 'time for all their guests ......thats what Walt

Summary Heading: the Staff was worth the extra pricing
Summary: I am a super budget minded traveler. I have stayed at the Disneyland hotel a half a dozen times, and probably a dozen more across the street. the "walking distance" from this resort doesnt drive me to stay here, because I've found others across the street that are better. We booked this hotel as part of our very long 5 day trip, so we could get a little extra pampering after the Disneyland Half marathon. BEST DECISION ever. After staying 3 nights at a friendly neighbor hotel, we booked 2 special nights at Disneyland Hotel. Our goal was to have some quality relaxing pool time. My kids are on the very short side and it was great that the Disneyland Hotel did not have height restrictions on the slides. I felt there were plenty of lifeguards around to let my little ones roam around

Summary Heading: DVC last minute great find. Classic and beautiful room facing pool.
Summary: After a first night not so great stay at Grand Californian the night before, we hotel hopped our way the following day at the Disneyland Hotel. I know my husband was nervous of my reaction since I wasn't happy with the last room at Grand Californian. Anyway, enough of that hotel. Let's just say the Disneyland Hotel made up for that. We had a great view and even though it wasn't a  villa, it was more welcoming. This is our second stay at this hotel and it was beautiful and comfortable experience at the Fantasy and Adventure tower.

I just stayed here 3 nights with a friend for a conference.  It was during a crazy heat wave and while most folks were tired and cranky, the hotel staff stayed friendly and helpful throughout.  I had read many reviews on here before the trip and got mixed messages about checking in so I will explain my experience.    We arrived about 8am on a Saturday, our check-in day. There are two check-in points driving in.  The first will verify your reservation and give you a dashboard sign/ticket to place on your dash -- we chose self-parking.  The second check-in point person will tell you where to pull up to the front to have your bags checked in.  We pulled up where he said and bell service came immediately with a cart and grabbed our luggage -- extremely friendly and helpful and of

We stayed here in September and have to say what an amazing experience.  From the moment we got off the Disney express and stepped foot in the hotel the friendliness of the staff super fast check in.  they even asked what are you celebrating and I mentioned my little sons birthday was in the park the next day, and when we returned from the park there was a birthday cake waiting for him!!  Those little extra touches make the difference.    The hotel room was bigger then I thought it would be and was well kept and clean, refreshed everyday and kept the whole stay.  Great view of the pool and perfect walking distance for us with two little ones and able to return during the day for a quick nap and return with out worry.  Pool was great and kept the little guys busy and the slides

We arrived here after a gruelling long 13 half hour flight.  It was a nice hotel but expected something really spectacular.  The staff were friendly no fridges in the room or any where to store a cold drink.  Food very pricy at the Disney shop you really expect to eat out when you stay here. Room was 2 double beds , I loved the light show from the head board at night.  The good thing about staying here was the bonus to get into the 2 parks Disneyland and Californian land early 1 hour before the public it does make a difference before the crowding happens. Also if you need a break you can come back to your hotel and rest before venturing out to the parks again.  The atmosphere and the pools were great.  We stayed at the adventure tower which was the furthest to walk with lugguage

We stayed here in the spring, prior to our stay at the Grand California. In retrospect, I wish we would have stayed here again. The rooms are up to date. The service is excellent. I'm not sure if it's recently renovated, but everything at the hotel seemed to be clean and well kept. The only downside is that it's a little further away from the park - it's on the other side of downtown disney.

Just returned from a four night stay in Adventure Tower over a Tuesday-Saturday to purposely avoid the crowds. Hotel room was pretty standard, but with Disney touches that made it feel more special than a Marriott which would have comparable quality rooms. The best part of staying in a Disney Hotel is the extra hour early enter to the parks. This perk alone is why I was willing to pay more here.   Check in was quick and pleasant and they honored my request to stay in Adventure Tower overlooking Downtown Disney (a public shopping area). We asked for an extra sheet and it was brought to our room in minutes. Room service was pricey, but good ( read the fine print on charges). The Taragoa Terrace is mediocre. Steakhouse 55 good and in line with the cost of other steakhouses. The

Summary Heading: Loved our stay at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We've just returned from a six day stay at the Disneyland Hotel. We loved our one bedroom suite. It was so spacious!! We had a room with two queen beds, two roomy closets, a dressing area, two bathrooms, kitchen and lounge / dining room. I loved that there was an empty fridge in the kitchen for us to store drinks etc. The beds were also really comfortable we all had great sleeps here. The styling is definitely a bit older - but we liked it! We were in the fantasy tower on level 10 - our room was quiet and we had a great view of the fireworks. The hotel's location is awesome - you walk right into downtown disney and its about a 7 min walk to disneyland. I can't believe some people complained about how far away it was!! Our daughter loved the pool area - was great coming back here

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in May 2014 with our 3 year old daughter. When we drove up to the hotel, the parking attendant warmly greeted us and provided us with a printed parking tag displaying our name. A small gesture, but it seriously is the small things that make you feel like a hotel is making an effort. With it being our first trip to Disney, I had lots of questions and the hotel staff was able to answer ALL of my questions. You do pay more for an 'on-park' hotel option, but what you are paying for is exceptional service. This is EXACTLY where I want my extra dollars to go. I want great service while on vacation.  Overall, the pool was fantastic and not crowded. The rooms were smaller, but clean and modernly decorated. The walk to the park was short and walking

While I have visited Disney World, Hong Kong Disneyland and Disneyland Paris, this was my first visit to Disneyland Anaheim, Disney's original park.  Firstly, if you have never been to Disneyland it is a must, it is better than any other Disney park I have visited.  However, would I stay at the Disneyland Hotel? Probably not! The Disney hotels are not cheap but they make up for the cost by the Disney experience - well, sort of.  My wife did a lot of research and chose the Disneyland Hotel as it was recently renovated. Even after its renovation it looks tired. It is a bit dated and we paid $200 extra for a room with a view and I am still trying to work out what view? Our room is sandwiched between the elevators and a noisy ice machine at the very end of a corridor.  The room is a

Stayed for 5 nights in early May with my husband, 2 kids (8 and 4) and my parents. We had booked a 2 Bdrm Suite and requested one in the Frontier Tower as this tower has the layout we wanted (all towers have different layouts of their 2 Bdrms). Got room 2168/69 on the 3rd floor.  It is basically a 1 Bdrm suite on the left and a Studio room on the right. Both rooms were incredibly spacious. My parents had the studio room which had a balcony and faced the south carpark and the Disney Grand Californian. We took the 1 Bdrm - gave our kids the bedroom with the light up headboard and my husband and I took the spacious and really comfortable pull out sofa in the lounge - I was truely amazed at how comfortable it was, I think it was queen size. Our 1 bdrm faced the Grand Californian and

We Checked in at 2 pm on the Wed before the Disney Half Marathon and our room was ready! On our way to the Frontier Tour we bumped into Goofy who was wandering thru the lobby.  The room was lovely, quite spacious and we had a view over the pool and slides and could see a bit of Downtown Disney.   The beds were super comfy and we loved the light up headboard. The lovely disney touches in the room made it feel that little bit extra special. The grounds were beautiful too.   We ate at both Goofys Kitchen and Steakhouse 55 and I recommend them both , we also had some cocktails down by the pool :).  We really enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel even though it was a little bit of a walk back at the end of the day from the parks.

Stayed at Disneyland Hotel during Run Disney Race.  Had living room area, bedroom, two baths.  View looked out on Disneyland.  Great hotel, perfect setup for family with kids, just walked out back door of hotel to Disneyland.  Pool was a great one for kids with the water slides and waterspouts.  Lifeguards were very vigilant.  Perfect!!!!,

The Disneyland hotel is very convenient to stay if doing a multiple day pass at Disney. It's a pretty nice hotel with a few good food choices. Staff have usual Disney cheer! I would like it they offered a transport option to the front gates of Disneyland & California Adventure Park as you do enough walking around the theme parks.

We booked a two bedroom suite at Disneyland Hotel for three days After Labor Day. My husband and I went with our daughter, her husband, and our 16 month old granddaughter. The suite was perfect for the five of us . We stayed in one bedroom and my daughter and family stayed in another....each with our own bathroom. The bathrooms were very clean and spacious. Plus, there was plenty of hot water for showers! The suite was spacious and quiet . The beds were so comfy that everyone slept well. We were on the 6th floor and far away from the elevator . We were somewhat displeased with the view because we faced the parking lot.....but later we really didn't mind it because we really only slept there anyway. We weren't there to gaze out the window. We stayed in the Fantasy Tower which was

Summary Heading: You don't get what you pay for.
Summary: Let me start by saying that I love Disneyland, and have had several other stays at the Disneyland Hotel that were great. However, it's been six years since we've been to the hotel, and a lot has changed...and not for the better. On a trip this past week celebrating my son's birthday and first trip to Disneyland, my family and I were less than pleased.  When we arrived at the hotel from the airport around 1pm, it took us at least 30 minutes to check in. There wasn't a line, and we had made our reservations far in advance, so I'm not sure what exactly took so long, but it was very frustrating. Then, we were told that if we wanted to, we could upgrade to "Club Level" and take advantage of the E-Ticket Lounge for $200/night. This was the first sign that all was not as it once had

Although the rooms were definitely on the more expensive end, the experience is really what you pay for. The rooms and the grounds were beautifully and meticulously maintained. All the workers were incredibly helpful and friendly, often even going out of their way to greet you or offer assistance. The beauty of the hotel is really the location.Being able to walk from the hotel, through downtown Disney and directly into the parks was great. You feel like you're in Disney, not in Anaheim. Nothing against the city, but staying within the park just enhances that magical feeling you get from the parks and resort. I would absolutely stay here again, or recommend it to anyone visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Bad Customer Service - Disneyland Hotel Guest Services
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel 9/3-9/7 and overall the stay was good except for when we arrived on Wednesday, Sept. 3. Our room wasn't cleaned when we checked in and some chips and a used tissue was left on the ground in the room. I did take pictures of the chips and used tissue on the floor. I called the front desk and a maid came to our room to clean the chips and used tissue and also vacuumed the room. I was disappointed because I spent over $3000 for a family vacation and wouldn't consider coming back since we pay over $350+ per night for a room that wasn't clean and up to standards of what I would expect from a Disney Hotel.  I sent an e-mail to guest services and received a call 24 hours later from a lady who was extremely rude about my e-mail above. I told

Summary Heading: Good location, big rooms and comfortable beds
Summary: Stayed 2 nights and overall enjoyed the experience.  We found the service was courteous and efficient from check in to the dining options and shop.    The rooms are a generous size and very clean.  The bed was very comfortable. One of my pet hates is water saving showers where you have to run around to get wet...sadly this was the case for our stay.    There was a problem with the air conditioner the first night we stayed.  Whilst it was fixed overnight, it meant a very uncomfortable night with the temperature in the room reaching 80.  Not what you want when you've just arrived, have jet lag and just want to go to bed early. We had to ring the reception desk twice to be told that there was a problem for a few rooms, so the management of this issue wasn't great.  Overall the

Well, you might have to do it once just for the experience, but it's certainly not worth going back again once you've done it one time.  My husband and I stayed 2 nights here for a getaway weekend in Sept 2014 -- we were mostly appalled at the price ($350/night base fee, over $400/night after taxes -- and we chose the cheapest option!), but for our once-in-a-lifetime experience we decided to just suck it up and do it and go and have a classical/historical weekend experience.  It wasn't quite worth it.  Cons: -COST is too high for what you get.  We paid over $400/night after taxes, and the hotel room itself was just average.  For that much money, I expected something fancier or at least more kitschy and Disney-y.  There were a few Mickey things here and there in the room, but not

Summary Heading: Looks like and priced like a five star hotel but comes up short....
Summary: After much contemplation of "Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel" I finally settled for Disneyland Hotel even though I wanted that Paradise Pier park view. I'm still not sure what the "best" option is-guess I would need to try them all. At times I was wishing I had chosen P.Pier only because we really wanted to see the amazing show at night but our extremely energetic four year old could NOT make it from Magic Hour to the end of the night (he doesn't nap) so.....Then again, we enjoyed some benefits of the higher-end Disneyland Hotel such as the convenient access to the pools and the steakhouse downstairs, Disney characters regularly playing with children in the lobby and extra clean, grown up class rooms with a pool view. Disappointingly, service is sketchy all over the

I so wanted to be blown away by the Disneyland Hotel, but I just wasn't.  It was a lovely stay with very few kinks, but I am by no means going to dream about my stay there.  We stayed with our two children (under 1 and 3.5).    Pros: It gets very dark in the room with the heavy drapes.  Essential for my kids to sleep!  Efficient check in system and my son loved the TV playing classic Mickey cartoons and the teacups in the lobby.  Very cute.  Goofy's Kitchen was really fun and we had a voucher for it from our vacation package.  The "stars" lighting up over the bed never got old for our son!  I also appreciated a "real" roll-away metal crib in the room instead of very uncomfortable pack n plays that I am used to in hotels.  We LOVED the pool area; only wish we could have spent

Great hotel, feels very Disney and is right in the heart of the action. Parks are a quick walk away, downtown disney is just outside the door. The rooms are clean, comfortable and have little disney touches throughout. Good and with a tiki bar steps away you can't really beat this place.

Staff was wonderful , our room was beautiful (love the headboard). Pools were really great , amazing, and lots of fun. Our only less than great comment is that it's a bit too far of a walk for us (especially the 4-yr old) to Disneyland itself.

The proximity of this hotel to Downtown Disney and the parks is the best thing about it. I've stayed at this hotel once or twice a year since the remodel. It's so nice to leave Disneyland or California Adventure and be able to rest and recharge. I stayed for three nights on this trip.  Pros-Trader Sam's Tiki Bar has great atmosphere, friendly staff, and tasty drinks.  The pool and water slides are well-maintained and fun.  The fireworks headboard and music are still enchanting.  The check-in staff gave my daughter an autographed photo of Anna and Elsa.  Goofy was on the lobby when we arrived.  Cons-My credit card company sent me an email about unusual activity on my card, because of some sort of hold amount the hotel placed on my card.  The wifi has only worked about 10% of the

A lovely, iconic Disney hotel. We were upgraded and had a room with extra daybed and fantastic pool view in the Adventure block. Lovely décor and furnishings, immaculately clean and vey convenient for the parks. Staff were unfailingly helpful and polite. We had a plumbing problem and this was dealt with efficiently and promptly and a significant discount was given to compensate for the inconvenience caused (it involved 4 am calls to maintenance and a flood!! So glad we stayed there. Check in was efficient and car parking very convenient.

Outstanding Hotel to be in when you're in Disneyland with your family. Super friendly staff from the entrance attendant to the housekeeping staff. Easy morning access to selected rides even before the main gates open to the public. Food and souvenirs were pricey but you're in the happiest place on earth what would you expect...family loved the three days stay. Awesome experience.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our visit to Disneyland
Summary: Disneyland Hotel exceeded my expectations.  I chose this location in order to be able to easily walk to Disneyland and also for the Extra Magic Hour (which was worth it -- kids rode Space Mountain 4 times in a row!)  We were unexpectedly upgraded to a King suite with a balcony, so perhaps that has something to do with our excellent experience.  Generally we thought the quality of the furnishings were high, the room and facility were immaculate, and the pool was nice.  The Disney touches were not as many as the Orlando Disney World hotels, but they were still there.  This hotel doesn't have a theme or resort feel to it like the two Disney World hotels I've been to, but that didn't bother me.  The location can't be beat.  Quick walk through Downtown Disney to the entrance to

Review is for Disneyland Hotel only, cannot be a positive about overall Disney Park experience which was lacking.  Hotel is older but very well maintained.  Our room was smallish but super clean and vey quiet.  We had a great view of Downtown Disney and the Matterhorn.  Honestly much cleaner hotel than many 5 star places we have visited.  We had dinner in the Steakhouse on property.  That was ok.  Disney has a very annoying method for checking people in to restaurants, etc....(even with reservations!).  System is cumbersome at best.  4 stars instead of 5 stars due being made to wait during inexplicable check ins.

The Disneyland Hotel was everything I ever hoped it would be!  I have been wishing I could stay there since I was a child and finally got to experience it with the love of my life and our daughter.  The service was excellent, the food was very accommodating to our gluten-free diets (in spite of getting very little info from any websites, they were simply amazing!).  The pools were more inviting to our 10 year old than the park at times much to our demise!  :)  The stores were fun and inviting - the clerks were very pleasant and helpful.  The photo of the little washcloth animals are from a early morning craft for the kids that was superb!  Now, getting in the park early...that was fantastic!

I stayed at the resort during my wedding weekend. The care and attention that the staff provided us was absolutely excellent. Anything we needed, the staff was right there to help us.  Our room was a club level premium view room and was spacious and nicely appointed. I really appreciated all the little Disney touches throughout the room. I did feel that the bathrooms were a little dark and wished the tub was a little larger, but over all it was a wonderful experience.  I was also amazed at how quiet the rooms are. I could hear some noise coming from Downtown Disney but none from our neighbors!  The bed was super comfortable as well! I'm not sure if I would ever pay the actual price to stay there again, but it was definitely one of my most memorable hotel stays!

Spectacular service and a wonderful room! It is pricey, but you get what you pay for. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney and a view of California Adventure. The headboard on the bed was Sleeping Beauty's castle that lit up, Mickey's hands held towels; it was all wonderful! Another benefit was being able to enter the park an hour early; that was very nice! I would not hesitate staying here, or another of their properties, again.

I give this an average rating only because of its excellent proximity to Disneyland Downtown (a pleasant 10 minute stroll to Disneyland). If it's proximity you are looking for, the Grand Californian opens right up into California Adventures, but lacks the pools. While there are several pools which are great for escaping the heat, they are very utilitarian and anything but luxurious; more importantly, the pool is probably not the reason why you are sacrificing yourself by staying in this hotel; you are staying here because of Disneyland, and you want to make good use of that, whether sweltering hot or not. The rooms are stark, small, and not very high quality. The best part is the nightlight that plays "When you wish upon a star" when you turn it on, with some twinkling lights on

The Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim is absolutely worth the price!! First, the pool is amazing (for adults and kids alike). The food and drinks are a little pricey, but that was to be expected (think park food prices). But, they have a great assortment of beer, wine and drinks - the Kahlua Pork, Lettuce Wraps, and Bacon Cheeseburger made the top of our list for food. In fact, no one had a bad meal. Our room was wonderful! If you can get a view of the park fireworks - DO!! There is a TV Channel in the room that plays the firework music so you can hear exactly what those in the park would hear. And, don't forget to turn on your firework night light (the button is on the lamp in between the beds - The headboard lights up with fireworks).  We were four adults staying in a room and had

I stayed here with my 2 year old and my newborn.  The room was spacious and already came equipped with a pack-n-play for the baby.  Each time we ventured to the lobby, there happened to be characters walking around.  We saw Pluto, the Chipmunks, the Genie, and Jasmine.  That was really fun and they were very nice.  At check-in the front desk lady was not overly nice and could not accommodate my request to have a room where we could see fireworks......bummer for my son.  The pool and watersides were great.  I asked for a late check-out and they didm not honor it, very disappointing.  Also, if you self-park a car, you have no choice but to park under the trees that drop all kinds of sap and things.  This was horrible!!!!!!  I had to have my car detailed for +$100 just to remove

Disney have built an amazing machine for extracting money from tourists while giving them the bare minimum in return!  This was the most expensive hotel by far in our five star holiday around the world and it was the second worst in terms of quality.  Everything looked tired and I have to say that I really hate shower curtains and I expect to see better in an expensive hotel.  What really finished things off for me though was that it was unrealistically expensive to be able to eat healthful food.  I'm talking about $8 per litre for drinking water!  We brought our own water purifier with us anticipating this and found that even after purification the tap water was too foul to drink in all but a survival situation. If you are going to stay here for the sake of the kids (and it is

My daughters (twins) chose to celebrate their Sweet 16 with a trip to Disneyland instead of a party.  We took two of their friends along with us and family members joined us as well but they stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  Our entire stay exceeded our expectations and was as magical as Disneyland itself.  We booked the trip this past January for our trip August 25-30.  We did lots of research before booking and after in preparation for our trip.  I was surpised to see a number of one-star reviews but it seems people don't do any research and expect to be advised of every single detail such as closed attractions, park hours, restaurant availability, etc.  Park hours are posted at various hotel exits as well as the security tables and park entrances.  Restaurants and

As long as I could remember I have always wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. My family just could never afford it we have a big family and paying for two rooms is not cheap. So when I finally had the money I took myself, my 12 year old brother, niece and nephew. And I will never forget how wonderful it was. From the moment we got there you feel the magic of Disney! From the waterslides to the wonderful acoustic music coming from the Tiki Bar we had a blast. Even when we would leave the park to head back to the hotel we never felt like left Disneyland!! I would recommend this place to anyone!!! So when you get there put away your car keys and enjoy all that Disneyland has to offer!!!!!

We always stay there for kids birthdays or just Disney weekends. They always make it extra special with Disney touches. One time we were selected as a Magic Family by Mickey and got an upgrade to beautiful suite. Great service. The best pool with 3 water slides. Kids of all ages can enjoy the pool and slides. Perfect location. Very good restaurants. You can walk to all Disney parks and you are right downtown Disney. We just love this hotel.

Summary Heading: Best!  EVER EVER EVER!  Loved our stay - better than expected
Summary: We decided to have a stay-cation this year and we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  From start to finish, it totally exceeded our expectations.  For starters the pool and slides, were the reason we decided to stay at this hotel over the other two Disney hotels and they didn't disappoint AT ALL.  I did have reservations that the price for the hotel was a bit high -- but after staying there, I would go back in a heartbeat and gladly recommend to anyone else who is on the fence that every detail is taken care of and totally worth it!    We are annual passholders so we knew we'd spend some time in the parks, but the magical hour was really nice.  Then the movies in the grass, really was a nice activity and we took advantage of 2 of the movies.  The pina colada/raspberry blendy drink

When I first started planning my visit to Disneyland Resort, I was determined to stay at a Disney Hotel. I ultimately chose Disneyland Hotel as it had recently been renovated and was cheaper than Grand California Hotel and also of a higher standard than Paradise Pier Hotel.   I could find no fault with the rooms or hotel as a whole. Rooms cleaned to a high standard everyday, tower lobbies cleaned regularly. The gardens and swimming pool area where all well kept. No swimming during my stay, to cold for me, didn't stop others from swimming though.   The Tangaroa Terrace is located near the pool and has nice freshly made food. They have an excellent range of burgers.   Staff were all friendly and did their best to have us checked into our room quickly, have our car retrieved or

We stayed here for 3 nights. The lobby is very nice and welcoming for check in. We requested a premium room with a downtown disney view. That was not possible at the time but they came with a great offer for a club level upgrade which it was one of the best decisions we ever made. Club level included breakfast and snacks, drinks and light meals throughout the day and complimentary wine at the evening.  The rooms are good size, very clean (excellent work from housekeeping) and the subtle Mickey mouse theme throughout the room and hotel is a nice touch for me. I dont rate this hotel a 5 because the pool area was impossible - we didn't managed to get 1 sun lounger the 3 times we went down to the pool, although being a big pool it felt overcrowded. And after checking out we left our

Summary Heading: Great Hotel.  Better than I expected
Summary: Was here for a business conference and expected it to be overrun with kids (not that there is anything wrong with that...it's Disney after all).  It was very in control and not as crazy as the hotels on the properties in Orlando.   Room was very big.  Overall the property is really nice. Good restaurant. Nice pool area and obviously walkable into the park.   If you can stay here I highly recommend it even if it costs a little more.   The convenience is well worth it.  At least to me.  Follow me on instagram for travel pics and more. @gma0917

We have been to D-L many times and stayed at various places, including the Grand Californian, but this was the first time we stayed at the D-L Hotel.  The hotel was spotless, the grounds immaculate, the staff were accommodating and friendly, the pool and waterslides were clean and safe.  We had a king room, not huge, but very quiet even as more guests arrived later in the week.  Good balance of restaurants, from an early morning coffee shop where you can purchase light breakfast fare, to their signature steakhouse for fine evening dining.  There is no other place we want to stay anymore!

Hotel is clean and nice , comfortable.  We did not bring our toothbrushes and slippers as they are normally provided by the hotel .  To our surprise and at this pricey room rate, we were told by housekeeping that they did not have these for guests!!

There were nine of us that stayed here. We had two connecting rooms and since they weren't able to get us a pool view they gave us some front of the line passes for a few rides. Big plus. Rooms were very clean and roomy. The kids loved the headboards that lit up and played Disney music. Pools were very nice and clean too. They provide life jackets for the little a ones if you need them. Staff was extremely friendly. You can find some of the characters walking around the lobby which my kids loved! It's about a 10 minute walk to the front gates of Disney. We will definitely be staying here the next time we come to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A perfect place to stay when taking the kids to Disneyland
Summary: This is a very comfortable hotel with spacious and well appointed rooms - not at the higher-end luxury level but certainly consistent with the better chain hotels. Entering Disneyland from the hotel complexes is very easy, either through the monorail (located very close to this hotel) or through the main gates (essential if using the "extra magic hour" admission). Driving into the hotel from Interstate 5 was very smooth, and the bellman service and valet parking made the arrival a breeze. I recommend this hotel for a visit to Disneyland with kids - the central pool area between the towers is an added attraction after a hot day at the park.

Our stay at the Disneyland Hotel was for five nights.  We had a room in the Frontier building, which was a long walk to the main building, but a very nice standard room.  It did not have a great view, but we were not in the room much.  Great pool, good restaurants and great location to go to the parks.  Security was top notch and we felt very safe there.  It has been remodeled and updated well.  Our head board was cool as it lit up and had a Disneyland scene in it! I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Classic Disney lodging at their finest.
Summary: Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel on our recent visit to Southern California.  Stayed here last time about 8 years ago and was pleasantly surprised all all that has been done to the resort to modernize and refresh this classic Disney property.    We had a fantastic room, on the 11th floor, in the Frontier Tower.  Some people prefer the other towers, but we loved the Frontier Tower.  The scale model of Big Thunder Mountain in the lobby was really cool to look at.  It was pretty close to the Monorail Pool slides, and both Tangeroa Terrace and Trader Sams.  The Frontier tower also had a nice smaller water feature and geyser in front of the hotel as a nod to Nature's Wonderland at Disneyland, and also I am guessing in a smaller way to the classic waterfalls that used to be in front of

I highly recommend staying at a Disney Resort property when visiting Disneyland, and the Disneyland Hotel is fabulous. The room is magical with hidden surprises, the pool is great fun, and being close to the park is priceless. Yes, Disney knows how to make your visit magical!

Summary Heading: Summer Fun at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: Stayed at the Disneyland hotel for our summer vacation this year.  Our room was in the Frontier Tower on a lower floor facing the pool.  The room was spacious, clean and well appointed.  There's a mini refrigerator and coffee maker in the room along with a safe in the closet and a couple of nice robes and the WIFI is free.  The headboard is a rendition of the castle with fireworks that lights up, very nice touch.  A very Disney hotel and great for kids (young and old) for that special disney feel.  The service was great everywhere we went in the complex and we love the proximity to the monorail for access to Disneyland. Guests staying at the hotels can also use the entrance to California Adventure park from the Grand Californian during early 'magic hours'.  Saves going through

The Disneyland hotel was very clean, very disney, it was so convenient to the Disneyland park, and it was so lovely walking through all the shops on the way.  The pool was fantastic, so big and the great waterside, kept my children happy for hours.
