Must have a disney character breakfast or dinner, it was just wonderful even I got excited with the characters. I am happy to answer my questions you may have.  We loved this hotel.

Our second stop for 3 nights on our LA tour.  We have been to Disneyland Paris and Disney World Florida before and a desire to see where it all began and the new Cars Land brought us here and we weren't disappointed.   The hotel is 3 blocks set around a beautiful swimming pool, slides and restaurant.  We stayed in the Fantasy block which seems to be the main block having the reception based here.  Rooms are classic, immaculate and everything you would expect from Disney.  The headboards are magical having a Disney castle theme which lights up and plays the first 30 or so seconds of "when you wish...". Entry to the Parks is about 15 - 20 minutes from the hotel through Down Town Disney.  As Disney guests there is a short cut into the California Adventure Park through The Grand

Summary Heading: Its Disnyland at its classic best
Summary: Its Supercalifragilous!  What else can I say. VERY expensive but with it.  Stayed in the Adventureland Tower (best of 3 towers for close distance to Downtown Disney, Parks, Monorail) in a PARK VIEW superior room. Its worth the extra bucks. Watched the fireworks at Disneyland from my room twice with the audio on TV channel piped into the room. FANTASTIC! The best view I have ever had of the fireworks show. Of course see them in the Park too. Highly recommend a splurge here. MUCH more worth the cost than DisneyWorld Hotels in Florida as its walkable to Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney.  Save some walking and enter CA Adventure through Disney’s Californian Hotel Special entrance. Great pool area and don't forget to visit Trader Sam's Tiki Bar and restaurant by

Summary Heading: Never Have to Leave the Magic
Summary: Stayed 4 nights June 18th – 22nd. Paid extra for a Premium View Room, it was absolutely worth it, and I highly recommend it. We were on the 7th floor and had a view of Downtown Disney. Although we were not in our room that often, it was still worth to have a great room when we WERE in our room. Our room was quite spacious. We had two queen beds and a full size couch and still had plenty of open space to walk and move about. The area in front of the widow was a large open space. All the furniture and bed spreads seemed new.   The bathroom was very good sized for a hotel room. We had double sinks and the toilet had a separate door. The floor to ceiling window is great; I loved standing right in front of it, and feeling like I was right in Downtown Disney. The only down side is

Thoroughly enjoyed our weekend stay at this hotel. Rooms are delightful. Love the headboard. Stayed in deluxe view on lower floor but had wonderful view of monorail slide area.  Our room was also positioned so that we could see the fireworks from our beds.  Super cool and totally unexpected.   Monorail slide area of the pool is awesome. Variety of slides for different ages. My four year old played in this area non stop. Lifeguards are great. Never had a problem finding a couple of lounge chairs together.  Took full advantage of early entry to both parks. Crowds seemed very low, and we walked right on everything. Easy stroll through downtown disney to and from the parks.   I really like that this hotel feels somewhat like a little resort oasis.  Lush gardens, big outdoor

Very expensive ($500 for a basic room), which will give you a nice room, poor wifi, no breakfast, great pool, and the best of all: one hour at the park (Disney on one day, California on the next) before all non- hotel-guests. This means that you will enjoy all the major attractions without spending hours on the lines. Was it worth it? Well, it's a vacation. We think it was, but taking into account you can find a very good motel for $130 or less, It's up to you.

When we first arrived to OC we spent four hours in the ER when my 19 mos old came down with a fever of 105. Naturally drained from stress and worry we were able to finally arrive at the hotel at 6pm hospital bands still grasping at our wrists.  The girl at the front desk was extremely chipper when she congratulated us on our "upgrade".  We had reserved a room that would sleep four people, and this lovely upgrade  only had a single king size bed and against the elevator.  Due to fire code restriction no roll away bed would be allowed, they would rather us trample our children to death in case of a fire, and told us we had no other alternative until the  next day.  "Is that okay," She asked.  Seriously?  Is it okay that I spent upwards of five hundred dollars for a room and my

Summary Heading: How can you do Disneyland any other way again?
Summary: Family loved it.  3 days 2 nights.  Amenities were great.  Highly suggest signing up for the DLH Concierge service.  It's a nice added bonus to your trip and perks.  The Magic Hour makes all the difference in the world.  You're practically done with all the major rides by noon.  As far as the hotel, great beds, great service all around, staff at the front desk was extremely flexible to some changes we made.  Disneyland fireworks show music is piped into the room. Premium view with pool view.  Room fit the 5 of us perfectly.  We definitely won't do this any other way.  Perhaps the Grand Californian will be next.

We have been to the Disneyland hotel several times as well as stayed at the Grand Californian. While we prefer the Grand over the Disneyland hotel the cost of the Disneyland hotel is a little less.  The Disneyland hotel is still located at the end of downtown Disney and close the monorail.  The rooms are fine and I love the headboard on the beds that have the light up fireworks while playing Disney theme music.  The pool is nice and the kids enjoyed the waterside area.  I actually like the pool at the Disneyland hotel better than the one at the Grand. I still feel that all the Disneyland hotels are overpriced but Disneyland can get the prices they demand and the memories are worth it to me.  Maybe when my kids get older we will stay somewhere off property but then again maybe

We traveled from the east coast to visit Disneyland.  Check-in was quick (6:30 pm) and the CM provided helpful information.  Our room was on the 8th floor of the Adventure Tower.  We looked right into Downtown Disney.  The room was spacious for the four of us.  We really enjoyed the light up head board, the Mickey hand lights in the bathroom, and the bath fixtures.  It was just enough Disney without going overboard.  The beds were very comfortable.  We stepped right out of our hotel and into Downtown Disney.  It is a about a 10 minute walk to the parks.  The extra magic hour is a definite plus.    The kids enjoyed the pools and the water slides.  Service around the pool was good.  Kids also enjoyed the afternoon pool party.  The kids will never forget seeing Goofy in their hotel

One of the best hotels I have stayed at. Anything Disney is great. Clean and relaxing. Room service and the morning wake up call for the kids. The bar was good as well but very busy. Goofy's kitchen was amazing and walking distance worth the 700$  we spent to eat there!

Summary Heading: Everything we hoped - and so much more
Summary: This trip to Disneyland was our first - and possibly our only trip.  We booked the hotel as we wanted to maximise the time we had in the park, and wanted to enjoy every element of the Disney experience.  From the moment we checked in, service was outstanding.  The desk staff did their best to explain everything to us, and also accommodated my mobility limitations smoothly and efficiently; arranging the hire of a mobility scooter for the duration of our stay.  The room was accessible, and large enough to accommodate our three children.  We all enjoyed the Disney touches - and were delighted to be able to view the fireworks from the room, particularly as with having a one-year old,  one adult would have had to miss out otherwise. The only slight problem we encountered was the

My family are disney junkies and having stayed in Florida and Eurodisney my first impression was of a corporate hotel with a few Disney themes. It did not feel 100% Disney but I think this is the Californian way- a bit more cynical. The room was large and clean with a lovely view over the pool. Staff were friendly and there was a shop to get snacks and drinks in. Getting a free lanyard and pin was a nice touch. On a revamp get more disney in there. There is a coffee shop next to Goofy's restaurant which serves beigels etc for breakfast. It gets hot and tired. Make sure you use the magic hour and the monorail which takes you to tomorrow land.

As disney world vets, and having just stayed at the grand Californian, we have high expectation of the franchise but were underwhelmed here, especially due to the staff.  Front desk was inconsistent and admitted management is different between the 3 land properties.  Could not get tea bags.  Rooms are nice, cleaning staff good and the pool is above average. Water slide  looks great but is poor.  Overall good hotel but not disney quality

Summary Heading: The poor relation to Orlando hotels
Summary: Tired, uninviting, boring and the poor relation of all the flagship properties at Disneyworld. This is a poor effort by Disney. There is no real theme, the hotel is very dated and the property has basic amenities on site. Not worth the money!!

Summary Heading: A perfect stay for a Disney vacation
Summary: On a hot, July summer day, we walked into the lobby of the Disneyland Hotel and there was Goofy, interacting and taking pictures with all the kids. Nice start to the Disney vacation. I actually noticed him there every afternoon around check-in time and greeting guests as they arrived and interacting with the kids as parents were checking-in at the front desk. Princess Jasmine was there one day too. You won't find this at any other hotel.   The hotel is separated into three towers. The Fantasy Tower is the tower with the lobby, shops and a couple restaurants, including Goofy's Kitchen. You can get a standard room with views of the parking lot, although you do get a good view of the fireworks at night and there is a TV channel that plays the music that is played in the park during

The Disneyland Hotel really doesn't need any reviews, but because we had an AMAZING experience I just have to review it.  We only booked one night because honestly I can't afford two nights.  We are annual passholders and have stayed at the Grand Californian last year, but this was our first time ever staying at the iconic Disneyland Hotel.  We planned to get there early in the morning so that we could hang out at the pool before our room was ready.  We were celebrating my son's birthday and he had the best time.  Upon check-in the cast member at the front desk was friendly.  I told her that we were there to check in early because we wanted to hang out at the pool and it was my son's birthday.  She gave him a birthday button.  I wasn't sure if we would be able to get a room in

My parents took me to this hotel back in 1977, when I was 10 years old and I loved it!  My only problem was the 3-Hour time difference, but I also had the opportunity to visit family members I only saw once every several years.

Summary Heading: Magic, it's Disney, but no better than Magic Kingdom
Summary: We visited Disney on Anaheim, CA, on last June, for our first time. A lot fun, excellent roller coaster, nice Cars movie attraction but others were closed. I would be back sure...! But we prefer Magic Kingdom, it's bigger and have a lot of more fun. However, both are excellent.

Summary Heading: good service but basic rooms only
Summary: The staff in this hotel offer very nice service.  But the room decoration and facilities are too basic to justify the high price. Swimming pools are good, but for kids shorter than four feet the water is too deep for safe swimming, though life vests are provided. Did not try the restaurants there because there are options in the Downtown Disney beside.  The best reason to stay here should be its proximity to the Parks so you can arrive early and avoid the queues (even without using the Magic Mornings).

Summary Heading: Stayed at all three park hotels and this is our fav!
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland hotel back in 2011 and Paradise Pier in Jan. 2014 so for this trip we did a split stay between the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel.  Even though the rooms at the Grand Californian are bigger, and have excellent access to the parks, the overall theme, ambiance and character of the Disneyland Hotel was ranked #1 by my family.  The rooms are spacious and cute, the pool area is fantastic! We rented a cabana one of the days we were there and will do it again, it took me about 8-10 minutes to get to the gates (and I'm 6 months pregnant!) so it's definitely an easy walk.  Service was great as well!

The hotel and staff were wonderful in the hotel. We had a business convention and all the business convention facilities were the best. As far as their offerings to the parks and security was ridiculous. We had a small number of people that were handicapped or unable to walk the distance to the event site Big Thunder Ranch and a cart was needed. The attendees had to pre-register great unless you have been recently hurt (not a planned event,duh). This became a major flaw in the Disney Experience! They couldn't allow our injured guest to use the cart. What are you kidding me?? We are a large group of 1000 attendee's. We needed a group ambassador from Disney to make this right. Shame on Disney, it ruined a great experience for some of our attendees

I absolutely loved staying at the Disneyland Hotel. Walking distance to the parks and the monorail. Right near Downtown Disney for food and shopping. Only problem was that the Wifi connection was not strong and not working properly. Hotel is very clean and smells very nice. The staff are absolutely wonderful and make you feel happy. The only other problem is that the laundry room is so far from the towers which would be better if they were in each tower.

We stayed here for four nights with our teenagers and were very pleased with our choice. It is only a 10 minute stroll from the hotel through Downtown Disney to the two Disney parks so you can go into a park for a few hours then go back for a rest at the hotel if you wish.   The room was extremely spacious and so was the bathroom. The teens laughed at all the Disney accessories but then said it was all great fun and they loved it. They bumped into Disney characters in the main foyer one morning and had their photos taken with them. We had a super view of the pool, which was a very nice outlook.  The pool is wonderful and is actually three pools plus three slides. Great fun for young and old. There was an impressive array of life guards, safety is obviously taken very seriously.

Summary Heading: Absolutely fabulous, this hotel made the trip of a lifetime even more amazing
Summary: Staying at Disneyland Hotel was a highlight of our once-in-a-lifetime trip to Disneyland with our family.  From the superb staff to the incredible Mickey Mouse themed rooms, very moment of our six night stay was absolutely brilliant. The staff were friendly and gave us loads of tips when it came to finding our way around Disneyland and avoiding queues.  We couldn't fault anything, it's an experience I will never forget and Disneyland Hotel played a huge part in our enjoyment of our holiday.

My family and I just recently returned from our 3 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It was not our first time but we have not been there for almost 3 yrs. The rooms were super clean and the beds were comfy. One thing to keep in mind, the walls are thin. Since it is summer time when we went the pools were crowded and really couldn't find a lounge chair so we had to wait a while. We found an easier way to access DCA is going thru DD and entering the Grand California hotel on the side and taking that and it takes you to DCA by the Grizzly area and we avoided the long lines of checking our bags. We ate at Goofy's Kitchen a little disappointed because it was not like it was before were you had the characters visit your table as frequent as before nor they perform a routine like

We stayed here on Oct 31st after spooktacular was over. We went in at around 11pm or midnight. The nice lady in the front desk informed us that they had there rooms booked. She upgraded us for no extra price and we ended staying there 3 nights 2 days. Goofies Kitchen is amazing! Their buffet is to die for!!! I would advise anyone to stay here. Well worth the money. With AAA discount we spend about 170 a night .

Summary Heading: Good and okay of the property
Summary: The good is if you can get going early you can get into the parks one hour early on select days.  Big advantage (HUGE) take advantage of it.    The pools are okay... be better if parents of the little ones would use swim diapers, pools close regularly for cleaning because of questionable substances found in the water. Not fun for everyone else.  The water slides are okay at best, not very exciting and somewhat slow but good for little ones to pre-teen.  I would not let the pool be a determining factor of where I stay.    The elevators can take a while but we did use the stairs often.  I think the location is great very convienent for Downtown disney and the parks are not too far.

We stayed here because it was out first time to Disney and it was also my birthday so I wanted to stay somewhere special. Was a little disappointed with the acommodation due to the cost. I thought it would be more disney themed and found there were a number of things that were a little frustrating. We were not given a map of how to get to the parks when we first arrived and walked a lot further then we had too. We were not allowed to use luggage carts to get our bags to the room and the lifts took forever. Once we figured out how to access disney quickly it did make a difference but I don't think I would stay there agin.

I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian a number of times and finally decided I'd write a review of the both hotels.  The Disneyland Hotel is by far my favorite hotel at the Disneyland Resort (full disclosure - I've never stayed at the Paradise Pier) because there are regular bathroom doors on at the Disneyland Hotel bathrooms, rather than a shutter-type door which is squeaky, it has better waterslides at the pool, the rooms are larger and more "Disney" themed, and there are fewer park-goers hanging around the hotel and hotel bars/restaurants which allow you to enjoy the lobby and these areas more (park-goers & Downtown Disney visitors loiter in the lobby of the Grand Californian making it more difficult to enjoy the space as a hotel guest.  The Grand

The rooms we were in at the hotel were superb...as would be expected at a Disney property. The beds were super comfy, the baths cutely decorated with "hidden Mickeys," and the light-up headboard which played a tune also made a nice nightlight for the kids. We were a little surprised that even though the hotel has been renovated and updated within the last few years, there is not a microwave in each room. There is a fridge in each room and a fairly fast wi-fi is available at no extra charge. The property is about 0.4 miles from the entrances to Disneyland and California Adventure and one must walk through all of Downtown Disney to get to the parks. (The monorail no longer goes to the hotel.) Staying at an "off-site" good neighbor hotel with a shuttle bus would probably get you to

Summary Heading: Old fixtures and rip wall papers,expected better for the price!!!
Summary: The rooms was ok, not what I expected from Disney's. The price did not fit the quality,almost felt like we where staying at a 90's hotel. With the revenue they  make the place should be better.  Nevertheless,the family enjoyed our time at the 2 park. We will try the Grand Hotel next time. Looks nicer and new when we walk around the hotel. We want to be close to the park.

I've stayed at all the hotels on the Disneyland property and this one is my favorite.  If I'm in Disneyland, I want to feel like I'm in Disneyland and this place does not disappoint.  You have to make sure you stay in the newly remodeled wing.  The room has the Disneyland castle that lights up and plays the music when you wish upon a star.  And there are Mickey thematics throughout the room and bathroom!  The pool and water slides are great and you are so close to downtown Disney and the monorail.  The Grand California is grand and closer to the park but it feels more like a ski lodge and there are no Mickeys anywhere!  When you go to the happiest place on Earth, stay at the happiest place in the park!

Summary Heading: Fun, vintage Disneyland with all the modern amenities!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was lovely, and the pool was pretty and relaxing.  The only hitch is that it's a healthy walk to the park and food choices. Next time I think I'd stay at the Grand Californian for the convenience.

My husband and I were married at the Disneyland Hotel and stayed the weekend. This hotel definitely embodies the spirit of Disney magic and makes you feel like you're smack in the middle of it for your entire stay. The location is extremely convenient to the parks and Downtown Disney. While overpriced, it is nice to stay here for a special occasion or when promotions are available.   Check out Trader Sam's Tiki Bar for delicious drinks!

We stayed 3 nights at the Disneyland Hotel and really enjoyed it.  The room is spacious and we could fit the 5 of us in a room quite comfortably.  The room has nice touches like a lighted headboard with Disney theme and music.  Also got to go an hour earlier into the theme parks each day.  Not cheap, but worth experiencing at least once!

We decided to stay at the Disney resort hotel, as we would like to have easy access to the park in the morning...and to get the "extra our of magic in the morning".  Access was indeed convenient and we did get our extra our of magic, which was nice.  However, there the hotel is far from magical. We were indeed surprised that Disney would want to have its brand attached to such a worn down hotel.   We had a suite so that we could also have the kids with us. It had a nice size, but was otherwise very ordinary.  As we came rather late to the hotel, we decided to just eat at the restaurant, so that the kids would be rested and ready for the next day. That turned out to be a bad choice. None of us (incl. the kids) ate the food served. The quality of the food was so low that any cheap

We took our daughters family to Disneyland and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. There were 8 of us using 2 rooms. The rooms were nice and spacious, with a sofa bed to handle the 5th person in our daughters room. The staff was very friendly, typical Disney. It had been over 20 years since our last visit to Anaheim. To us, the eating options on premises were limited-an expensive character buffet, an expensive steak house, coffee bar, or a self order restaurant with limited options. We chose this restaurant for breakfast. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney with many other food options which we used. The kids enjoyed the pool. There was a fire drill while we were there which seemed rather disorganized. Making an announcement for those in their rooms to stay there.

The title is a bit misleading as we haven't stayed at the Paradise Pier.  We've stayed at the Grand Californian maybe six times and this was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  The fear was quality and location vs the Grand Californian and in both cases the opposite seemed to be true.  First, it's less expensive.  The rooms are larger or at least seem quite a bit larger.  The quality of the room seemed comparabe.  The experience side seemed even more Disney and very relaxing as well.  We enjoyed the pool and the food and beverage options as well.  The location actually worked better for us in some ways.  It's just a few minutes from the Grand Californian so all of the things we liked near that hotel still applied and it brought into play some additional options.  We liked

I am a Disney finatic so of course I had to experience the Disney hotel. I have a premier pass so I saved about $100 on a 2 night stay. The room was very small but nice. Mickey touches all over.   Good:  location: It was steps away from downtown Disney. Service: boyfriend forgot his razor, called and they brought a new one up within 5 minutes Perk: magic hour into California adventure   Bad: Room: our sink leaked, the shower head rotates ( not convenient), shower drains slow, and we got woken up by room service at 8:30am when checkout is at 11.  Overall it was a very cool experience but I would not stay again. For about $900 it was not worth it.   Also, self parking is $17 a day and valet is $25

Summary Heading: Stay there at least one to experience the Magic.
Summary: The grounds are exquisite. The pools fun, It has nightime entertainment plus its attached to Downtown Disney. The room details are wonderful. We had a light up mural behind the beds that plays "when you wish upon a star."

Family enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel, great staff and service. Enjoyed the views of the park from our room.room was very clean and we had no complaints, great nights sleep.enjoyed the perk of being able to take the tram to the park an hour before it's official opening. Staying here made our vacation a wonderful time.

Location is fantastic if you want to be around downtown disney.  Rooms are spacious, comfortable beds, clean and not run down like Grand Californian.  The only drawback was the fridge... It is only a cooler that keeps thing cool - not Cold. Pools are clean and nice with plenty of lifeguards around. Front desk can be better. No additional fringes for the price you pay. Monorail takes you right into the park and is very close to the hotel. Adventure tower is the best in terms of proximity to the parks. The elevator takes a long time.  The TV did not work well... No reception on most channels with the exception of their advertisement channel. Bell desk staff are in a hurry to get you out.  Wifi ... No complaints - was good

We love staying at the Disneyland Hotel!  It is super fun for families, and we don't even need to go to the theme park to have a nice 2-3 day vacation.  The grounds are really nice, and the main pool works out super for our family because we have everything from a teenager to a preschooler, and they have waterslides for the big kids and little kids. We are able to easily fit our family of 5 in a standard room.  Each parent gets a bed, oldest kid gets the daybed, younger two bring sleeping bags. There are all sorts of little fun things to discover and Downtown Disney is right there with restaurants and shops. The on site food places are super pricey, so we just stock up on breakfast stuff and bring it with us, as well as snacks, and then eat one meal a day either at the hotel or

My family stayed at the Disneyland Hotel July 23-27.  The access to Disneyland is of course terrific.  The amenities are great the pool is a good size and the water slides are fun for the kids a nice time to relax after a day in the park.  The food is a bit pricey as you would expect but overall not bad.  The only complaint i would have is upon checkout we were running late a call to the desk to ask for 15-20 minutes I was told that we would be,"Locked out of the room and charged an additional day."  To me this was just horrible customer service.  I understand a busy day and needing to get rooms cleaned but for what we were charged over the 4 nights in addition to the huge line at checkout it seems they could have been a bit more understanding over just a few minutes?  Otherwise

Summary Heading: Great location and loved our stay!
Summary: We stayed in the Adventureland tower facing the pool.  We debated staying offsite but are all really glad we stayed here instead.  The rooms were roomy and we literally walked out the back door of our building into downtown Disney!  The short 5 min walk from the parks allowed us to take a middeay break when it got too hot with a quick hour or so of swimming.  The quick service restaurant doesn't open until 7am so if you're going to morning magic hours, bring some breakfast to keep in your room.  The best benefit was the back entrances to the park which saved walking and waiting tremendously!    We will definitely stay here on our next trip.  I have not stayed at Paradise Pier or Grand Californian, but based on what I saw, this one has the best location.  Grand Californian is

Summary Heading: celebrated 8th birthday just for the pool
Summary: The rooms were tight and pricey but it was my princess' dream.  Hotel is very old. Our room swipe cards were not working properly and none of the phones at elevator were working.  If it weren't for the pool we would have checked out ASAP.  Disneyland Hotel- your only saving grace is the POOL.  We will not be staying here ever again.  Matter of fact, we plan on staying across the bridge to the new Grand CA hotel.  Plenty things to do in resort/downtown area- that is a plus.

Summary Heading: Beat the Crowds and View the Fireworks!
Summary: Yes, this hotel is expensive, but it is worth it! The rooms are very large and immaculately kept.  The pool in the middle of the complex is so beautiful and fun-looking (we were very sad to have forgotten our swimsuits!)  It's wonderful getting the "extra magic hour" for staying on Disney property and being allowed into one of the theme parks an hour before other guests.  When we arrived, someone had arranged (and paid for, I'm sure) to have a glass of milk in the fridge and Mickey and Minnie cookies waiting for the kids- an extra service that made their day! One side of the tower (I'm directionally challenged so can't tell you which side, but you could ask when you call to reserve)had a great view of the fireworks.  We were staying across the hall, but another room in our party

Summary Heading: Large Rooms, luxury with Disney feel
Summary: I as pleasantly surprised. I have stayed at the Grand Californian twice: Very luxurious. But the Disneyland Hotel rooms are so much better (and cheaper). They are larger than the Grand. We felt cramped at the Grand. But this room was way roomier. Not the cartoony kid decor of Paradise pier. Instead, very tasteful color with wood, while still being very Disney Themed. Convenience of the monorail was great. Loved the pool and pool side food service. There is just not enough time to say everything I loved! Just go!

My family and I loved this hotel!  The rooms were beautiful and were appealing to both kids and adults alike.  The best part was the head boards of the beds--with the flick of a switch fireworks lit up  and "A Dream is A Wish Your Heart Makes" played.  We also loved the hidden Mickeys everywhere.  We were in the Frontier Tower, which was the farthest tower from the main office and Downtown Disney, but we didn't feel it was that far.  We didn't mind the proximity of the hotel to the parks.   You don't need to take the 10 minute walk to the front of Disneyland--the monorail station is right near the hotel in Downtown Disney and drops you off in Tomorrow Land--much closer than the 10 minute walk to the main entrance to the park.  While you still have to walk the full way to get to

Summary Heading: VERY EXPENSIVE, YET WE STILL COME BACK
Summary: This is our third trip to the Disneyland Hotel and while my whole family wanted to save money and stay along Harbour Blvd., I just couldn't push the button to do it.   I just like being so close to Downtown Disney and the monorail, as well as the atmosphere of remaining in the Disney bubble.  My family of boys/men didn't quite have the same strong desire to do that as I did....but, I won out!   HOWEVER, looking back after paying over $500 a night for a premium level room (it looked out over the roof of Trader Sam's and the pool--not as high of a floor as we received last time), I may head towards the less expensive hotels.  It is just hard to justify a fairly quick vacation that cost over $5000 :(

We checked in to the hotel and the kids were looking forward to a swim in the pool. As we were getting ready to enter the pool, lifeguards asked everyone to leave the pool as it was being closed. We asked why the pool was being closed and a cast member said that they could not say.  We asked another cast member the same question and was told "shark". I  asked when the pool would reopen, and was told that they had no estimated time for reopening.  We waited another half an hour and inquired again, and was told that the closure was "indefinite".  We observed as the lifeguards donned surgical gloves and worked on removing something from the pool.  I can only speculate as to the problem.  After an hour still no one was able to tell us if and when the pool would reopen.  When one

I wod much rather stay at the grad if dl hotel is going to put us in a room all the way in frontier tower with a handicap husband, too far of a walk, Was not a good stay would not accommodate us in any way I gave them options but front desk said no!!!  The kiddy pool was always shut down too, had to walk all the way to the grand to use their pool!!!!  Not a magical stay at all.

My girlfriends and I chose to stay here to celebrate 25 years of friendship. It was a great choice for us. We stayed in the Frontier Tower for 3 nights. The beds were comfortable and the room was big. The headboard was highlight for us in the room. It was beautiful when we saw it during the day and even more spectacular at night with the lights turned on it. The pool area was great. Just wished the hot tub had stayed open later than 10:00 each night. We enjoyed the location. We would leave early each morning for the parks, return mid afternoon for relaxation time, and return to the parks in the evening. It was very quiet.

The hotel is outlandishly expensive. Our (admittedly very large) family suite cost over $1100 per night. For that we received a competent hotel but it really didn't provide anything special. Even the location is of dubious merit - Disneyland entrance is a good 10-15 minute walk away and there are many closer, and far better value options. There were really no special little touches at all - for the price I would've expected gifts for the kids, free movies, a buffet breakfast, chocolates on the pillow etc. and a constant enveloping Disney vibe. None of this was in evidence.  Also, the shower pressure in our room was really very feeble. The rigidly enforced checkout time of 1100 rankled a bit. All in all, not good enough for the money.

Summary Heading: Love the Views and the Room but Pricey and a Noisey Bed.
Summary: We had three people in a superior view room in the Adventure Tower for three nights. The default for a superior room is a pool view, so make sure to ask for a Downtown Disney view (Adventure Tower) when making the reservation otherwise you likely will get the pool view. Also ask for an upper floor and you will have a perfect view of the nightly fireworks.  We got to the hotel about 1:00 in the afternoon. The check in process was seamless and very friendly. Rooms are not guaranteed to be ready until 3:30 to 4:00. Our room was not ready until 4:10. We were sent a text when it was ready, but only after approaching the desk to inquire after 4:00. The room was very nicely appointed with two queen beds and a sleeper sofa, a dresser with mini fridge and television.  There was also free

Summary Heading: Expensive and convenient but nothing special for the high price
Summary: My daughter and I took my grandson to Disneyland for his 7th birthday, his first time to Disneyland so we chose the Disneyland Hotel because we read it was recently updated and had a cool waterpark. Previously I had stayed at the California Grand Adventure which is worth the higher price, absolutely beautiful hotel. We arrived about 9 PM, tired from our flight, but excited to check in. The desk clerk was polite but not friendly and we had to pull along our suitcases and follow his directions to get to the Tower where our room was. Greeting and bell hop would have been nice but we waited patiently with a crowd of people for the only elevator in sight. The room was clean but not super impressive. We did have a huge picture window view of Disneyland, just in time to watch the

Stayed here for 4 nights on my first trip to Disneyland. The location is excellent as you can walk through Downtown Disney to get to both parks. I had reserved a Premium View room and had an amazing view! I was on the 10th floor of the Adventure building and could see DTD and numerous attractions from both parks. I also had a wonderful view of the fireworks on the 1st night there.   The 1 odd thing about the room is there was a set of double doors that you had to enter through and then there was the door to my guest room and the room next door. It was slightly awkward when trying to maneuver your luggage through the doors. My next door neighbors were so loud during the 1st day and night it was unbelievable. They treated their room like party central and constantly had both their

We loved our stay at the Disneyland Hotel this past June 2014.  While we checked in, I noticed immediately the thoughtful touches; tea cups for kids to sit in and tiny chairs with classic Mickey Mouse cartoons playing while the adults check in.  We arrived early (9 am ) and room check in isn't officially until the late afternoon.  However, they let us do the check in process and store our bags.  They took our phone number and while we were in the park they texted us to let us know our room was ready and keys we received at check in could be used in a specific room #.  The room was ready early and was clean and perfect.  It was a little small, but had lots of wonderful details and mickey touches.  I loved the wooden castle headboard with lights.  We kept it on all night as a

The rooms at this pleasant hotel have some extra little touches to make your Disney stay more magical. For instance, the bathroom fixtures are supported by Mickey's hands. Also, the headboard of the beds, which depicts the castle showered by fireworks, lights up and plays music. While not overly luxurious, the rooms are comfortable and are slightly bigger than the rooms at the Grand Californian. Most lack balconies, but the over-sized window is great to watch fireworks if your room faces the direction of Downtown Disney. The lobbies of the various buildings are decorated with artifacts used in the creation of the parks, from miniature scale models of attractions to artists renditions of the same.The hotel itself is modern with a glass & chrome exterior and it reminds me of the

We did a last minute reservation because our hotel we were staying in was not working out. The service was outstanding from the reservation line to check in to the parking attendant. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and comfy. We had an issue with our bathroom sink not draining but they sent someone up to fix it promptly. With downtown disney next door there is a ton of shopping/restaurants. The pool and water slide were nice and I like how the pools are different temperatures. They DO NOT have near enough chairs at the pool. If I'm paying $500 a night there is no way we should be sitting on the concrete ground! Other than that I enjoyed my stay.

We stayed at the disneyland hotel for 10 nights and found it to be clean and acceptable. We have stayed in disney hotels in Florida and I will have to say the friendliness of the staff is less at this hotel then others but it was great. The location is at the end of downtown disney which was convenient.  Also the entrance to the monorail is very close making the journey to disneyland quick.  It's too bad that it doesn't stop in california adventure.  The pool at the hotel was fantastic.  There is three pools two hot tubs and a couple of water slides which the kids enjoyed. The only thing that would have made it better would have been more shade options for the loungers. You are not allowed to move the umbrellas.  The rooms are beautiful.  We left the headboard turned on the

Enjoyed our stay here. Hotel was neat and clean. Pool area was great and waterslides were well monitored by hotel staff/lifeguards. Would definitely recommend. Short walk into downtown Disney for food and shopping, and into Disneyland(s). Venture into the town on opposite side of Disneyland for more restaurant options and some more general public shopping.

Summary Heading: We Come Back Twice a Year!
Summary: Yes its expensive even with a premier pass holder discount.  Yes its not the most plush resort we have stayed at for this price. Its a magical place for my grandchildren twice a year.  There is a great pool that they love and we stay there most of the day and hit the part later in the day. We get early morning entry to the parks because we are guests at the hotel and thats great to get to the high traffic rides first thing in the morning before the crowds build up.  The rooms are clean and functional. There is a fridge and I wish there was a microwave but if you get a suite they have them. The staff is wonderful.  My only complaints are they don't have pay per view in the rooms so if the kids knock out early you are on your own and they charge for parking.  I don't have to pay

Nice rooms, close to Disneyland.  Pool is big, nice design, with a slide.  Restaurants are good to very good.  One annoyance is the WiFi: I can get a much better signal at the park (CA) than I can in my room.  Another related annoyance is that I have to sign in each time.  Would consider staying here again.

Summary Heading: Overpriced Resort which is not very good
Summary: Seems if you carry the Disney name you can serve up poor overpriced amenities and get away with it...  Our room was expensive and although it had been renovated it still had a pokey bathroom with a 3 quarter sizes bath with a nozzle and plastic shower curtains... seriously!!!  I have stayed in lower tier resorts who have done away with the plastic curtain.   The restaurant options in the resort are terrible.. The food looked bad and the prices - well don't even go there.    Downtown Disney provided a range of options.  We opted for EPSN zone for the ribs and chicken which were fine. I cannot comment on the other options.  Disney Hotel gives you the option of entering the park an hour before the public.  A very big plus ( maybe the only one).  Take advantage of this coz you can

Summary Heading: Luxury pricing for a hotel that is only slightly above average
Summary: At around $500/night I expected a little more. For that price I would think that you would get at least one voucher to Goofys kitchen. Or maybe a microwave. Don't get me wrong the rooms in the fantasy tower are beautiful and super clean and the staff is nothing short of amazing but the price would stop me from staying again. Early entry is a great bonus though and so is being so close to the action young kids can return for naps and pool time before taking in the nightly festivities.

Summary Heading: The Happiest Place on Earth !!!!!! The only place to stay!!!!!
Summary: We have stayed here 17 times and it never disappoints-the staff go out of their way to help and the pool is so kid friendly-lifeguards are everywhere.  A parent has a friend with this hotel, we have had nothing but a great experience here and are clients for life!!!!!

Wonderful clean hotel, fantastic rooms with a safe, a private toilet room, roomy bathroom, hall and bedroom, big closet, lovely fun decor, great service!  Everywhere you go you are wished a magical day and asked if you need any assistance. Very attentive staff!  Very wheelchair accessible!   Right by downtown Disney! Tons of things to do right there!  I would stay there again and again!

While we had a great time at Disneyland I unfortunately can't say the same about the hotel.  Our room was positioned next to the elevator which was very noisy and scared our youngest son at night. The next day we requested to be moved which the hotel accommodated but we were positioned into a room over which did not have a view over the pool but instead a view of the roof to the next building. In addition we could not get the water in the shower to be any hotter than warm at best. The pool was heavily chlorinated which made it unpleasant to swim in. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for work and was surprised by how sophisticated and nice the room was.  Really comfy beds and linens and the castle backboard with fireworks nightlight is amazing!!! That said = the disney theme gets old fast.  You can't go anywhere outside your room without hearing a disney song playing, and you can't get anything that isn't disneyfied!! The food at the little quick service restaurant is overpriced, but tasty.

Stayed over since I attended a Charity Gala at one of the ballrooms and we had discounted pricing  $342.00. I stay in many hotels due to traveling for work so although this was nice I personally would not spend this $$$ for the small room I had but I know many people do and spend even more since typically it's a whole family. I grew up doing to Disneyland often since I lived in OC and my fathers company was generous in sending families once or twice a year to Disney. We could never afford to eat there so my mom would pack all four children a lunch. Now I can afford to stay at nicer places but I'm also picky and yes if our son loved Disney it would be something special we would do, stay at Disney but his last experience with his aunt wasn't great so he prefers Legoland-thank

The Hotel Location is ver nice just few minutes walk to Disneyland Park.rooms are also nice medium size.and expect what you need...We went with our douhters they loved hotel ...pool is also nice.serving around pool is good..I recommend this hotel...

Summary Heading: Great location but you pay for it.
Summary: This was our 5th stay at a Disney hotel but first time at Disneyland. Can walk everywhere from the hotel, that is Downtown Disney and both parks.  We are a family with 2 teenage daughters and they still got up early for early admission and were excited to be at the front of the line. Very nice room, but could use more drawer/storage space. The rooms were updated last year.  The only thing special about the hotel room was the lighted musical headboard.  The staff is very helpful and Disney friendly. Goofy was often spotted on the property. The pool and grounds were very nice and very clean.When we checked in, we asked for a nice room and were on the 12th floor of Frontier Tower, but our large window looked onto the parking lot. Frontier Tower is the furthest of the three on the

Stayed at Disneyland hotel as I was there for a convention. Requested the adventure tower and had a view of Downtown Disney. We could watch the fireworks from our hotel room on the nights we were in the room. The check-in was very late (4pm) and just arriving from Australia we were desperate to get to our room and rest.  That would be the most negative part of the hotel The room itself was nice and the musical headboard above the bed added that disney magic by playing music and lighting up. The room was an excellent size and the bathroom was huge with a separate toilet which was a bonus.   The staff at the hotel were friendly and it was very convenient being able to get into either Disneyland or disney California adventure one hour early each day for their magic mornings. I

Very good hotel next to Disneyland. Nothing special as a hotel, but everything was is good shape and working. Rooms were nice and spacy. The service was very good and that made the difference as well.

This is our second visit to Disneyland.  We are from the East - so Disney World is our usual place to visit.  We stayed last time at the Grand Californian last time, which was very nice, but this has a much greater Disney flare.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower and was on the 3rd floor facing the pool. This is a standard view and was perfect.  We had a corner room, which was very large.  Mid stay, there was a problem requiring a room move (not the fault of Disney). We were upgraded to the 8th floor with a pool view, but the room was smaller.  Honestly, our 3rd floor corner room was much nicer!  The Fantasy Tower is where the action is - very close to the pool, gift shop in the lobby, and close to the coffee shop.  It is also easier to get to Downtown Disney.  We did visit the

We try to get to Disney once a year.  We always stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  Sure it's pricey but you get so much since it was the 1st hotel at Disneyland.  You can't beat the history, the closeness to Downtown Disney, the friendly cast members everywhere, and the ability to see the fireworks and get the music piped into your room.  Staying on property also allows you to get into the parks early.  This hotel was completely redone top to bottom about two or three years ago.  This is the most dineyesque hotel at Disneyland.  Evidence of Walt's influence are everywhere.  The headboard above the beds (in the one bedroom suite) are hand carved and have Cinderellas' Castle on them with LED fireworks that go off around the castle when you turn it on.  It also play's "when you wish

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, early entry is a bonus!
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights 6/10-6/14. Check in was fast, although we had an issue with the fridge leaking in our room. It made our carpet wet and smelly. Guest relations was quick to respond to the issue, sent a whole cleaning crew to rectify it and comped us a character meal because they couldn't switch our room. Never had an issue with the smell or dampness after that. The room is a standard room (we stayed in the Frontier tower) with some extra touches. The bathroom is a little small, but we enjoyed the floor to ceiling windows. We had a great view of the slide and pool, and a relatively short walk to both. The pool and slides are fun, and were not that crowded. We also loved Trader Sam's, it's a don't miss after dinner watering hole.  It is a bit of a

I stayed here last year for a conference and they were FANTASTIC.   I've been to the Disneyland Hotel a few times with family, but coming from a business standpoint they were incredibly accommodating to our large parties, and even had a separate area for our luggage in one of their main ballrooms, organized by state, so we weren't crowding the halls, which I thought was awesome.   Very friendly staff, good pricing on extra meeting rooms, great meals at the small bar next to Goofy's Kitchen (also fun for families!).  I swore I was never going to leave. Hint: try the switch on your lamp on your bedside table. If you like light shows, you're in for a treat.

The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and I hope to return one day. The new monorail pool with water slides is incredible, and there were plenty of lifeguards there so that parents can relax with no worries. Tangaroa terrace was perfect for lunch, and any snacks needed for the room. Steakhouse 55 is incredible with tons of disney memorabilia. There is even a small world gift shop. I would give this place a 10⭐️ if I could!

This was our first time staying at a Disney resort; we've always lived where we could do day trips before.  Staying there made it so much better; the complete Disney experience.  The location was awesome, and the beds were incredibly comfortable.  We had a "standard view" room, but we could see the fireworks perfectly.  Breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen is great, so be sure to make reservations for it while you are there.  The waterslides didn't open until 11:00 am...bummer if you want to go down the slide one more time on the morning before you check out...at 11:00.  The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the price is so high it makes it almost inaccessible.  We won't be able to stay here again for awhile.  But it was great while we were there.

We planned this vacation last year so we were so excited to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It had been quite a number of years since we had stayed there and we were really looking forward to all of the upgrades that had been done. Sadly, we weren't too impressed. Our room was right next to the elevators which they were doing construction on so there was a lot of noise right at 8am!! And it lasted the whole 5 days that we were there. There wasn't a whole lot of room either. With 4 people, it was pretty cramped. We also had a water leak under part of our carpet when we arrived. It was nice to have quick access in the park and the pool area is nice, but for the money, we just were a little disappointed.

Hands down, a must stay! Disneyland Hotel is a place where the magic of Disney is evident and colorful! 5 star customer service and amazing food! Now lets talk about the beds, AMAZING! As soon as you lay your head on the pillows you will fall asleep and wake up in heaven! The headboards are adorable with light up fireworks as " A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes " plays in the background. Everywhere you look, you will find tiny designs of Mickey Mouse heads in discrete places, as well as Mickey Mouse hands holding the lights over the sink ;-) A plus to staying the any of the Disney Resorts surrounding Disneyland are Magic Mornings! Magic Morning allows guest at the Disney resorts to enter one park designated for that day, so we went to Disneyland and California Adventure at 7am

Although he hotel is historic and in a confident location, it has average rooms without now common amenities, especially considering the high cost. Some general issues are: Pool area doesn't have enough chaises. Many guests were left without a place to relax after a morning at the park.  The Internet service is horrible.  No amenities in the room (no PPV or honor bar).  Overall, much like a Sheraton.  Specific to my stay: although I reserved a King (and checked in very early), I ended up in 2 Queen room.  Front desk said they were upgrading me to a "club" floor with a fireworks view. When I got to my room in the afternoon, it was on a lower floor facing the pool.

Summary Heading: Overhyped and unusually bad service makes me regret our stay
Summary: Staying on-site is expensive at the Disneyland Resort (DLR), especially when you consider how close the off-site motels are. On our past 2 family trips to DLR, we stayed in a Kids' Suite at the Howard Johnson. I loved it our first trip: 2 rooms (1 with a comfortable king bed and 1 with bunk beds), 2 bathrooms, a microwave, and a mini-fridge all for only $99/night (back in Sept. 2011 at an amazing special rate that's no longer offered).   On our second trip, it was about $180/night, which was still a great deal for 2 rooms just 8 minutes from the Esplanade. I looked into it for our third trip but it was $244/night. That price really surprised me. On our last trip, the carpet looked dingier, the ambient hotel noise from other guests seemed louder, and I realized that the bloom was

Summary Heading: Good location.  Not worth the price.
Summary: Spent 4 nights here at frontierland with a 3 day Disney pass. Hotel location at the end of downtown Disney is nice. It is a good 10 minute walk to the park- and the frontier tower is unable to view the fireworks and situated away from most of the rest of the hotel.  The room itself was very average, except with a Disney themed headboard. The office could not bring a package (ordered from the park)up to the room for over 2 days, even claiming it had already been delivered when it had not. Pool was ok, but a child had a nosebleed a half hour before closing so the pool shut down early. Customer service was generally not good, and so I would not recommend this location.

Summary Heading: Best possible "family" location and good hotel!
Summary: We had a two nights stay in a twin room in Fantasy Tower with views to the pool. Our kids (2+6 yo) loved the pool area, the Mickey wake-up call, early entry to the parks (magic morning) and the Castle lamp and music box above the bed. Character dining is also highly recommended if you have children. The adults appreciated the short walk to the parks, the spacious and comfortable rooms, the guest laundry, the friendly service and the coffee shop. It's expensive but very convenient and comfortable for children. The short distance to the park meant we could have a time-out for the kids in the middle of the day at the pool or in the room. Had we been only adults however, we would have stayed at Indigo and saved a lot of money.   Roomtip: If you are going to stay in your room at 9.25

Summary Heading: great rooms, not so nice front desk service
Summary: stayed here from 06-15 thru 06-18-14.  Checked in and the front desk agent, Jo Ann, was not pleased at all to see us. I tried several times to talk to her and she ignored every attempt. I still kept trying but she only stated how we were supposed to have checked in the day before but only showing up now.  I apologized to her (which I shouldn't have) and did let her know that we were still charged for the first night that we didn't check in.  What should it matter that our plane was delayed and we didn't get there the night before.  I did not argue about that and being that we were checking in at 6AM, I was glad to have paid the night before so my children could have a room ready to sleep in for a little and not wait until the 3pm or 4pm check-in time.  Anyway,after many attempts

The Disneyland hotel was everything and more.  I was skeptical to spend so much money a night for a hotel room.  It was totally worth it.  We stayed on the 9th floor of the Adventure tower over looking the beautiful pools.  Our room was very clean, the hidden mickeys were fun to find, the fireworks head board, all amazing.  Elevators were great and very fast, never had to wait long for one.  Outside there were beautiful gardens and comfortable sitting areas.  My kids spent hours in the pools and going down the monorail slides.  The only complaint of the room was the air conditioning thermostat was very finicky.  It was either too cold or too hot, and seemed to control itself.   Every single cast-member was extremely polite and helpful.  Now for the extra magic hour you "pay" for

We stayed for two nights in this hotel, which is a true Disney experience.  The room was large with a very elegant wooden headboard.  The hotel is located next to Downtown Disney and it is a 10 minute walk from both Disneyland and California Adventure theme parks.  Great place to stay for a two night visit!

Summary Heading: Totally over-priced, but a little bit magic!
Summary: Rooms were surprisingly lovely with spacious bathrooms and incredibly lovely beds with nice linen and tasteful but Disney-themed pillows.   The location could not be better if you're doing disneyland as you're right on Downtown Disney. It was great to have somewhere close by to collapse for midday breaks! Magic Hour (from 7am) was ....well, magic! Even for this grown up.   The pool was a disappointment. It's strictly a kiddie affair, loud and loungers are viciously fought for.   Checkout was a goal breeze which is always nice.  There weren't any great food options, especially for breakfast. A nice, healthy and normal cafe or bar would be a nice touch -- but I'm not American and so my complaint probably applies to a great many hotels!

This hotel was so nice. We stayed here for a convention but there was so much fun things for the kids that I almost didn't want to go to the convention which was on site. My 7 year old son loved it and did not want to leave to go home. You walk across the street to Downtown Disney. The water slides are cool and they have movies in the evening on the grass. I loved the rooms with the light up headboards that play Wish Upon A Star. We hope to go here again next year. We paid for breakfast with the characters and the food was very good. We got to see quite a few characters.

Two night stay in a room overlooking downtown Disney.  Kids loved it, we were able to see the fireworks from our large window.    Big change from our previous stay here.  Rooms tasteful and large, beds and bedding comfortable and staff very helpful.    We werent able to get in california Grand where we had stayed previously and were very pleasantly suprised at the room and service here.

I loved this hotel… I'm a huge disney fan and staying here was wonderful!   Check in was quick and efficient, we were put in the Adventure tower, facing downtown disney. We quickly realised that downtown disney can be a little noisy but it always stopped at 9:30pm (when the fireworks started) so I wasn't bothered. As we were on the third floor you could see glimpses of the fireworks but not really enough. Still, can't complain because in terms of access to disneyland, it was fantastic!!! Literally, pop down the elevator, walk 10 mins and you're there. Brilliant!  The room itself was great albeit a little dark (even with the giant window!), we got 2 queen beds, a great TV, fridge, one bedside table and a chest of drawers. The wardrobe was small and as there was myself, husband

We took our children to a surprise stay at the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim, Ca. The cast members were so friendly and helpful, they helped arranged my surprise. I told them it was our first time staying at the hotel and they made sure we had a great room with a view. We stayed at the Frontier Tower we had a pool view and being in the upper floor we were as close to the corner so that we can watch the fireworks at night. The rooms were clean, and just overall a very comfortable and very nice room. We go to Disneyland every year, but never stayed at the Disney Hotel. I have to say it was worth staying here and the experience was just magical. Staying in one of the resort hotel really wraps up the whole Disney Experience.

Absolutely loved the hotel. The Disney touches were amazing and the staff was so pleasant. I also loved the location. It was a short walk to both the Magic Kingdom and California Adventure. The room was pricey compared to other hotels in the area, but you cant beat the Disney experience.

Came back to the Disneyland Hotel for my daughter's high school graduation with 3 of her friends. They all were treated like princesses and were given little treats like pins. Now that the renovation is complete the hotel is fantastic. We stayed in two rooms that connected and had a view of downtown Disney. Had a quick breakfast at Tangaroa Terrace which is perfect, the kids can place their order as they wanted... Prices were not bad. Rooms were very spacious and it wouldn't be Disney without all the Mickey touches through out!

My family of 5 (Ages 31,27,10,7,and 5 stayed here for about a week April 20-26, 2014. We booked an excellent military-rate package and ended up on the fourth floor of the Adventure Tower facing Downtown Disney.   There is little not to love about this place. I'll start at the beginning and work my way through:  1) Parking- We chose to use the valet, which was quick, friendly and helpful. They even held our bags right at the Valet Desk until our room was ready. Once we got into the room, we just called bell services and they brought it right up. The bell hop was amazingly friendly and offered some park touring and hotel tips.  2) Check-In was a breeze despite there being a large group with multiple rooms in front of us. They have not less than 10 cast members checking folks in,

We stayed here for a week. I can honestly say that if this was a personal visit and I had to pay these prices, I would have been highly disappointed.   The lifeguards are absolutely ridiculous.  They all have their own set of rules and at one point said "no splashing". They made the swimming experience miserable. I literally had to ask for the rules in writing because they all had their own rules which completely confused the kids and a good handful of the emplyees, really need to review what a disney experience is supposed to be (quite a few were rude).  If you park valet be ready for the same rudeness.  On a lighter note, the room was nice (bathroom very small but clean). There are movies, on the lawn and many activities that are worth while. Love how close it is to Disney.

The perfect location...everything is within walking distance and the decor is amazing.  You are able to view the Disneyland Park fireworks show from your room.  A few notes on housekeeping, however.  Apparently I dropped some trash on the floor one morning before going out, and it was still there after the room was cleaned.  Also, I found a comment card that had been completed by a guest at least two weeks prior and not picked up, so I noted the date that the card was still remaining in the room.  The "magical" part of housekeeping, i.e. specially folded towels, posed toys in the room, etc. is not done here the way it is in WDW.

We stayed here for one night. If you took this hotel out of the Disney area it would be just an average hotel. There are three blocks, we were in Frontierland block. The hotel rooms were ok, if it wasn't for the headboard with the castle on it  it would just be an average room. Our room was near the lift and we felt like a train was running up the side of our bedroom wall all the time we were there. Our block had no customer service desk, so we never saw any staff at all in that block. I wouldn't pay the price to stay there again, I would stay at the hotel Indigo where we stayed later in our holiday that had a much more personal service and much cheaper.

I stayed here for a conference.  Great room.  Loved the view if the pool area.  I thought it as interesting that the sign in the room talks about conservation of resources by reusing the towels.  3 of 6 days, even though I hung my towel a up, they were replaced.  Not a big deal to me, but seems like maybe a training opportunity so staff are consistent in their approach to room cleaning.  I was surprised about seeing the smoking allowed on Disney property and downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but be careful of the events that are going on
Summary: Hotel was nice and rooms were average. The usual size of a generic hotel room but the headboards have the headboards that have lights and play the when you wish upon a star song when the switch is flipped. Nice touch. Just be careful of what other events are going on at the time of your stay. On one of the stays there was a dance competition and there were hundreds of dancers and their mothers and teachers there all day and all night and they were very pushy and rude. Think dance moms but multiply by 1000. This dance event happens there 2 to 4 times a year.

The Adventure Tower on the 9th floor was our home for 3 nights.  WE LOVED IT!!!! Our check-in was quick and easy, we were even upgraded to a higher level.  Our room had a great view of the beautiful pools.  We spent 2 days at the park and one whole day exploring the hotel, spending hours in the pools and relaxing in our room.  The fireworks and star headboards were a big hit as was the pull out couch.  Our 5 year old called that as his bed as soon as we walked in the door.  The room was immaculately clean, they even made my grandsons couch/bed up and put his animals on it.  It was quiet, never had any trouble with slow elevators as we had seen posted before.  Two very little complaints:  Couldn't get the temperature regulated on the air conditioner and the shower temperature was

Loved everything about it! Except parking lot fee!   great service!! Especially to the lady in the office that helped us when we lost our travel folder! I wish I remembered her name  Expensive but it was worth it! It was our first big family trip. #yolo

Summary Heading: Old Fashioned Top Notch Disney Service!
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel still sets the bar for exceptional Disney service...too bad the park no longer offer this service or attitude!  From the moment you pull up to the the security/parking hut, you are their guest, once again! Smiles, humor, laughter, what can we do for you?, etc....it's just fantastic!  The property and grounds are immaculate as always. The rooms are small and pricey, but worth it if you're looking to splurge a tad.  We always gave such a great time at the Disney Hotel!

We stayed at the disneyland Hotel, and got locked out of our room on one afternoon, it took them 5 hours to get to our door to open it to enable us to get back in.  They apologized and for compensation for their tardiness we were given a 'fast pass' and the way it was explained was that it was good for the whole family for many different rides . It was actually good for the whole family for one ride..........(not really impressed....so they gave a couple more) Part of the family decided to stay longer in Anaheim, and asked if they could extend their stay at the hotel by one day. They were assured they could and that they could also stay in the same room, no problem.  When they got back from the park that day, they could not get into their room.  Housekeeping was cleaning inside

We stayed here for a business conference otherwise I wouldn't have been able to afford it. You feel like you're at the parks the moment you walk in to register and the staff (cast members) were very helpful. The pool was great for the kids with the newer water slides and lounge area.  We'll be back (when the next business conference is planned there of course).

Overall a very good stay . . . everyone was friendly, welcoming, great service. Rooms were very nice with lots of Disney/Mickey "magic" around. Characters visited the lobby often as well as to Goofy's Kitchen for the character breakfast. Walk to Disneyland was a little far going through Downtown Disney but still very convenient and for shopping, they deliver to your room! Lot's of other benefits.  Only issue in May, the elevators, one was down and the others were slow and small so not a lot could fit. Especially when strollers go in. Oh, and the doors close really fast.

Truly enjoyed our week at the Disneyland Hotel the first week of June 2014. We stayed in a pool view room and had an awesome view in the Fantasy Tower. The room had two queen beds and really cool LED "fireworks" on the headboard that we used nightly as a night light for our daughters. We ate at Tangaroo Terrace twice and enjoyed both meals. My favorite was the Ahi Tuna Poke. 10 minute walk to Disneyland through Downtown Disney or take the Monorail. Monorail took longer but greatly reduced the walk. Also enjoyed breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen. The pools are all together and the slides are set up great for parents to be able to watch small children. Lifejackets are offered for free and are available to be grabbed at the pool.

I had a fantastic three night stay here. I checked in at about 7 pm on a Monday night. Check in didn't take too long and I was surprised with an upgrade to a pool view twin queen room on a higher floor. The room was clean and comfortable. I thought the bed was too hard at first but I found that I was quite comfortable sleeping in it.. I loved the Disney touches - the light up head board on the bed and the Mickey light fixtures. Bathroom was clean. The bath was a bit on the small side. Toiletries were a nice citrus grapefruit scent. All staff that I dealt with were pleasant and courteous. I used the self park option, which was an extra $15 a day on top of the room rate. I did not get a chance to explore the grounds much as I was in the park all day. I would have loved to check

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel, but Magic Hour was only Half Magical
Summary: We stayed here from June 2 through June 6, and this is our third stay at this beautiful resort hotel.  The rooms are spacious and inviting, the vanity is separate from the shower and toilet area, the beds are comfortable, housekeeping does an outstanding job of keeping the rooms clean, the furnishings and decorations are nice, and I really enjoy coming back to these rooms after a day in the parks.  We paid a bit more for a room with a pool view, and the view was really pretty. The hotel's grounds are beautiful and meticulously kept, and I enjoy roaming around and exploring the grounds peacefully and quietly away from the crowds.  The pool area is lush.  My son loves the nifty slide.  It is difficult to find lounge chairs, however, and I think management should brainstorm a way

We stayed 2 nights at $430 a night. Rooms were average at best. Toiletries were below average. The queen size beds were a little on the firm side. The pools were nice with 2 spas 2 water slides. My recommendation would be to rent a suite at any of the hotels across from the park and save half your money.

Unlike everywhere else on our trip to Disneyland Resort, the employees at the Disneyland hotel seemed to be very unconcerned with providing good customer service.  Whereas every employee I interacted with in either park seemed very eager to help on this visit, the people at the Disneyland hotel were almost perverse in their lack of helpfulness.   It took us nearly 45 minutes to get checked in, and even then, it felt like they were tossing our packet at us and couldn't get rid of us fast enough.  This compares very unfavorably with our stay at Paradise Pier four years ago, where the desk clerk gave us a special folder filled with princess photos for our young daughter, a balloon, and button that said "first time visitor," etc, and could not have been nicer.   We ate at the

Summary Heading: Our Favorite of the 3 Disney Properties!
Summary: We just returned from a little over a week at Disneyland, of which we checked out all three of the Disney properties. (I'm also doing reviews of the Grand Californian and Paradise Pier)  This was hands-down our favorite!! We loved every part of our stay and plan on staying here every time we come back for a little more of the Disney magic!  Location- Although the farthest walk of the three, it usually took us about 10 minutes to get from the hotel to the main gates of either park. (If a long walk from the park to your hotel, does not sound as "magical" to you, I suggest looking at the Grand.) The monorail is also available to guests from the Downtown Disney area to the Tomorrowland area of Disneyland if you prefer. The Downtown Disney area (numerous shops and restaurants) is

We stayed in this hotel , over the gates to Disneyland in an amazing Disney themed room. As we checked in the music started and the characters of Disney came down the stairs. What a great start to the holiday. The delight in the eyes of my daughter and nephew (and my wife) was worth every cent paid for the room.  all facilities in the hotel were excellent but best of all was the location.  The magic of Disney lasted 24/7

First off I would like to say my family had a wonderful time. Staff were very friendly and pools were clean and nice. Gym was good as was washing facility. The location is superb in being so close to Disneyland. The negatives were when we arrived from a 20 hour flight at the designated check in time the room was not ready for a further 2 hours. This hotel is very busy and since the lifts had maintenance problems we had several long queues for the lift which was a bit of a problem for the young children. It is a 4 star hotel and this shows in the room quality and the general amenity. Overall we loved it the people on the front desk were delightful. Tip - eat at the rainforest cafe great food and amenity the ESPN sports bar too.

Okay, First off, I have stayed at The Grand Californian a few times and let me tell ya: NOTHING is nicer than this one. Yes, the Grand Californian has a BEAUTIFUL lobby...but the rooms...nothing to write home about.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE Disneyland! Yes, I'm one of those. It doesn't matter - I know I'm coming here and spending outrageous amounts of money on bottled water, pretzels shaped like MIckey's, and yes: HOTEL ROOMS. So, get used to it. However, when I come back from The Magic Kingdom, I want to relax LIKE AN ADULT~ and I'M SO GLAD that I gave this hotel a try. The shape of the actual hotel is cubic and streamlined. I loved the minimalist approach to the hotel lobby with classy hints and touches that are pure Disney: Tea Cups for seats in the main lobby, a framed old map of

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel overnight so that we can take our grandchildren to the park and take advantage of the extra Magic Hour early in the morning. We checked into the hotel and it was a mad house. We had to wait for over 20 minutes just to pre-register for the stay.  It is a week day and summer has not even begun yet!  They did have a nice waiting area for the little ones to watch TV shows while adults wait in line just to talk to someone at the counter.  The hotel is in a great location. It only took us 5 minutes to walk out of the hotel through downtown Disney to take the monorail directly into Tomorrowland.  Again, it's not summer yet and the park is already very crowded.  The wait for Dumbo was over 30 minutes.   We came back to the hotel after a long day at the

Overall, I was pretty disappointed by the Disneyland Hotel, given the exorbitant price.  We had been encouraged to stay at one of the much cheaper suite hotels close by, but we thought being close to Disneyland would be really key.  But, you're not really that close. I had thought, given the price, that the hotel would be very nice.  It's quite average, outdated.  I thought it was going to be a very "Disney experience" - characters all around, etc.  Only saw Goofy.  The pool was not that exciting.  I mean, it's nice, but I've certainly seen better pools.  Plus, on the weekends there are NO seats available.  So if you're getting this hotel in part because of the pool, you can't even really use it!   When we were checked in, the person at the front desk told us not to bother with

Summary Heading: one night stay more than enough.
Summary: I've been a disney fan for years. Held a premium annual pass for over 10 years my family has gone to disneyland atleast monthly. My daughter was celebrating her 9th birthday this past weekend and the only thing she wanted for her birthday was to stay one night at a disneyland resort.   On arrival the front desk clerk who checked me in took over 30 minutes. There was a girl scout group that arrived after I did checked into 4 ROOMS and was done before I was. At this point I was irritated.Our room wasnt ready being that this was 8am in the morning we wanted our room keys for the early magic hour experience at disneyland.  But she came out saying, " Congratulations you have been chosen as the MAGIC FAMILY". I was excited so was the kids thinking hey this is cool she gave us a

I took my daughter here when she was 7! Prior to the trip, she was so excited and so happy. We had 3 nights in this hotel, and everything was just "Perfect". Great rooms, very comfortable, great friendly service. The happiness I saw on my daughter's face all those 3 days were amazing. She was crying the last night because she did not want to go. So this hotel will always be a very special place for us as this was the first Disneyland experience. I am grateful that I was able to take my daughter there. I hope to take her back there next year. I would highly recommend it as we have throughly enjoyed our stay there. It was " Magical ". Memories created to last a life time...  Ken
