Summary Heading: Destination Wedding - This Venue Can't Be Beat!
Summary: A One of a Kind Location and Experience. There is no Place on Earth Like a Disneyland Wedding. From the Outside "Rose Garden" To the Food, Not to Mention seeing Your Daughter Arrive Like Cinderella in a Horse Drawn Crystal Coach (including glass slipper). You can stay at any of the Three Hotels. We Stayed at the "Disneyland Hotel", and were very impressed From the valet to housekeeping, All staff members were swift and courteous. Don't pass up the opportunity to sample room service offerings, all our meals arrived hot and the prices are very reasonable. This Particular hotel has a great pool area with slide and kids were in it day and night. Lifeguard service was ever vigilant and present.

My husband and I decided to take our children (3 yrs and 9 month, respectively) and my mother in law to Disneyland over Memorial Day weekend.  We were able to book one of the last rooms at this hotel.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.   Pros:  Proximity to Disneyland, Disney CA Adventure, and Downtown Disney-This is very important as we had small children and a double stroller. Disney Characters present- My 3 year old loved seeing some the Disney Characters that visited the hotel lobby.  We went to Goofy's Kitchen for Breakfast with the Characters and the shear fact that it was in the hotel made it SUPER easy! Pool-We didn't get a chance to swim but we walked through the grounds prior to checking in and the pools and water slide looked very well maintained and a lot of fun! Noise

We have stayed at this hotel as well as the Grand Californian Hotel many times. This one has always been our favorite until now. What a bummer. It took us three hours to check in. They gave us the worst rooms, in the worst tower (frontier), facing a generator. We had made reservations a year ahead of time for a three bedroom suite and included the E ticket lounge for $250extra/night. Luckily a cast member named Garrett saved us by finally moving us to the Fantasy Tower facing the pool like we had asked. Even though we paid the extra for the E ticket lounge they still put us in a different tower which meant down one elevator, walk outside and up another elevator. Strange. It's just a bummer when you are told there are no options and then later find out there are options but you

Yes, it is very expensive, but you are paying for the experience and the magic that goes with it. Spent 3 nights with my husband and 3 kids.  I upgraded to the Concierge Level, and was very nice  to able to sit and have a glass of wine to watch the fireworks show.  I found the entire staff very nice, and very helpful.

Disneyland Hotel, besides being the happiest place on earth may also be the busiest.   They did a really nice job with our family check in and check out.  The rooms were fine.  By that I mean clean, quiet and comfortable.   I would do it there again.

This is my second visit in the last 6 months. This review is only based on this visit. My previous visit is November was great so I was expecting more of the same.  Checking in was slow as there was a group of dance moms checking in. I had talked twice to reps concerning my reservation and requested the Fantasy tower. We stayed there on the last visit and my kids wanted to stay there again. We were a little disappointed we were given the Frontier tower. It probably worked out as the Fantasy tower was swarming with dancers during our stay. I booked under the AP special were you got free fast passes   The clerk helping us had no idea until I mentioned it while she was trying to help the next guest Our room was noticeably smaller and had a view of a parking lot. We checked in

No doubt there are less expensive and even nicer hotels in the area, but if you are going to have a Disneyland vacation, there is no better way than staying at the Disneyland Hotel. From the moment you walk into the lobby, you are immersed in the Disney experience. The details in the room: Mickey's hands holding the bathroom lamps and the beautiful headboard that has the castle, complete with fireworks and music, add so much to the overall experience (Mickey will even call you for your wake up call). We had a family reunion and had adjoining rooms, which was really lovely. I have stayed at all three of the Disney hotels. Grand California is more grand and more conveniently located (and definitely has a superior lobby), but much more expensive and less "magical". Paradise Pier is

Summary Heading: not worth cost, preferred staying at Portofino, more convenient
Summary: This hotel is perfectly fine, close in to the parks, clean, pool is nice and the early morning hour is a nice perk.  Having said that, we've stayed at the Anaheim Portofino for less than half the price.  It is about 20% further by actual foot to the gate of Disneyland or California adventure. Almost no difference when getting back to the hotel for nap times, etcetera.  Staying at Disneyland hotel means you trek through downtown Disney to get to your hotel whereas staying at any of the hotels by Portofino (Harbor Blvd intersection) means trekking down a regular street.  On the one hand, staying at Disneyland hotel means you never leave the Disneyland bubble-- the piped in music!  the atmosphere!  On the other hand, there are negative aspects to never leaving the bubble--

I took my kids and my parents to Disneyland for a family vacation, and we had a fantastic time.  I booked a one bedroom suite at Disneyland Hotel, and we could not have had a better room.  It was actually two rooms that make up the suite.  When you walk in, the first room is the living room, it has a half bathroom, wet bar with fridge and coffee maker, and table and chairs, and sofa that pulls out to become a bed.  The other room has a full bathroom and two queen sized beds.  We checked in early at 1pm, and our room was ready, which was really nice since we had been in the car for six hours.  Also, another nice touch was fresh carnations in the bathrooms.  That sweet, spicy smell reminded me of when we came to Disneyland when I was a child.  The pool was great, my boys loved the

If location is everything, then the Disneyland Hotel certainly has that featured down-pat!    Adjacent to Downtown Disneyland, shopping, restaurants, and cinema are very close at hand.  It's also a very short walk from the tram to Disneyland and about a ten minute walk to the entrance of either Disneyland or California Adventure.  If you stay here and your plans primarily include the Disneyland parks, you'll have no need for a rental car or any contact with the world outside of the Disney experience.    The rooms are spacious and charming with the Disney decor.  The service is top notch (as expected from Disney hotels,) and the views are very pleasant.  Swimming area is ample and well designed to hold a crowd.  My sons (11 and 13) enjoyed the monorail slide, but had more fun

My fiancee and I stayed at the disneyland hotel for a mini vacation. Let me just say, I was not prepared for such a great experience. When we first arrived we arrived pretty early, at about 11:30ish and check in time was at 3pm. As soon as we walked in one of the cast members check on his Ipad to confirm our reservation.  He found it and directed me to the front desk. The girl at the desk found us a room immediately and send us on our adventure, thankfully we didn't have to wait until 3 to check in. We stayed in the frontier tower and it was so quite. We enjoyed every minute of it. It is the farthest tower but we are not the complaining type. The room was gorgeous! We had two queen beds even though we only used one bed. Room was clean and stocked up. And the house keepers were

Summary Heading: Lots of good, a little bad
Summary: We've stayed at the Grand Californian, but this time we wanted to experience the magic of the original Disneyland Hotel.  I booked a room on the concierge level, and requested a king bed since it was just my husband and myself.  When we arrived at the hotel, we were bummed not to have a concierge greeter like we did at Grand Californian (we were told the person was on a break), but even after waiting a while the check-in staff was still very nice and gracious, and we even managed to get the king bed this time (these rooms just seem crazy hard to get at Disney).  We were also very grateful to be able to check-in immediately even though it was only noon.  The room was nicely furnished, clean and the view was to die for (10th floor, great vantage of Downtown Disney and the parks).

We loved the hotel and amenities (pool, waterslide, parking to midnight on day of checkout). Was very pricey though and could only afford to stay one night ($550 approx. with fees and taxes for cheapest room). Room was beautiful, view of pool too. Only real complaint is minor but were not made aware of the 'perks' (early entry to park, etc) when we checked in and so were unaware until AFTER we checked out. Otherwise was very nice.

Summary Heading: If you are staying on-site at Disneyland, pick this hotel!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for one night in May as part of a split stay with the Grand Californian.  We very much enjoyed the Disneyland hotel and highly recommend it.    This hotel was completely updated/renovated in 2012 and it shows.  My wife and I were very impressed with our room, which was a standard room with two queen beds on the 6th floor.  The bathroom was a highlight of the room.  The main section included a large sink, mirror, and cabinet space below the sink for towels and what not.  To the right is another door/room which has just the toilet (note, there is another door to the main entrance of the bathroom as well).  Back in the main bathroom area, to the left of the sink is the shower/tub combination.  Everything in the bathroom looks very new and clean, like the

Summary Heading: Very expensive but worth the experience!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights last week. Check-in was friendly and fast. We were given a 2 queen bed room on the top floor (11th) of the Fantasy Tower which had a lovely view of the swimming pools. The room was very quiet and peaceful. My 2-year-old loved the headboard lights and music. The tower was right next to downtown Disney so location-wise it was perfect! Getting all the luggage from the car in the self-park lot involved several long trips though.  My daughter was greeted by Goofy when we checked in so that was very special and exciting for her. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job. The only complaint I have is the shower and how the water kept rotating back and forth between hot and cold temperatures throughout each shower. It was not ideal. The elevator

Great experience. Loved the presentation of the room with all the special Disney extra's eg. fairlights above the bed, mickey mouse toilet roll holders etc.  added to the whole experience.  Easy walking distance to Disneyland and down main street.  Close to ESPM for the sports lovers in the family.  Would stay again.

Just returned from a 3 night stay the second week in May.  I was pleasantly surprised with our stay.  I had heard that the rooms had been remodeled but was skeptical.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower, and were upgraded to a pool view.  We don't spend much time in our room so I wouldn't necessarily pay for the pool view but it was nice and we could see some of the fireworks, but the Adventure Tower blocked the majority of them.  The room was much larger than I expected.  Two queen beds and a large pull out sofa with small fridge and coffee maker.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Only issue was it was a connecting room and the lady next door to us was a loud talker, especially at 6 in the morning.  I could barely hear her husband or kid, but could hear her clear as a bell. Next

We stayed here for one night in May with my daughter's best friend & her mom to celebrate my daughter's birthday, and it was delightful.  Super clean rooms & grounds, and all the staff were very friendly.  Incredibly comfortable beds, and the girls loved the light-up firewworks/musical headboards and all of the other Disney touches (Mickey hands holding the lights, Mickey heads in the tiles, etc.)  Only downsides: (a) the Tiki bar at the pool needs to be about 4 times bigger -- it was super packed, and we waited forever to order drinks, even though the pool itself was not that crowded; (b) you will spend a fortune on food; (c) room service also took forever (we ordered only dessert, and it took 2 hours).  That said, we would (and probably will) do it again -- the girls had the

Summary Heading: The Disneyland Hotel is very accommodating to young families so you can truly feel comfortable and have fun.
Summary: Best part staying at the hotel was the new pool/ slide area. My 2 year old loved the shallow beach entry area by the warerslides. The hotel provides baby and children water vests and baby swim  diapers for free.

We stayed here in the Fantasy Tower, for four nights in May. The weather was UNUSUALLY hot, and the air-conditioned room and chilly pool were all that saved us from the heat. Despite the high temperatures and apparent crowds, the staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, were all extremely polite, professional, and friendly. I loved the classic decor of our room; it was obviously Disney without being cartoon-y or childish. The Small World-themed carpets, teacup chairs, and giant animated map in the lobby were also on my list of favorites for this hotel. My preschooler loved the fireworks headboard! Make sure to visit the Trader Sam's tiki lounge if you visit. It's an incredible experience and surprisingly family-friendly (until 8 p.m.)! We also ate at Goofy's Kitchen, which

We really enjoyed our stay at the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim, CA. The rooms were very comfortable, and the grounds beautiful. Restaurants available inside the main building, as well as outside in the pool area.

We stayed here for a few days to enjoy Disneyland and Calif Adventure.  The hotel was very clean and comfortable.  The staff was also very attentive.  We dined on property at a couple of the restaurants and were pleased with the experience.  We also enjoyed the pool area.  The location is, of course, very convenient to both theme parks.  We went to the parks early and then came back to the hotel in the middle of the afternoon to rest and use the pool (thus avoiding the busiest part of the day at the parks).  We then went back to the parks in the evening.  My overall rating would be a 4.5.

Summary Heading: In a class of its own
Summary: It was my birthday weekend, and this time, we chose to do something very fun and, to us, very "luxurious". Since we were going to Disneyland, it was decided to begin our experience at the Disneyland Hotel. We had been there once before in 1972, when we paid $59.00 a night for the room (yes, I still have that receipt!). This time, we had four rooms total, and each room averaged out to about $485 a night. Very expensive for us, but if one is to splurge, this is the place.  Everything, but everything is immaculate here. With so many people (we were there 5/1-5/5), it is beyond understanding that we did not see a single scrap of paper anywhere. Not on the grounds, nor the lobbies, hallways or elevators. No gum stuck anywhere, no candy wrappers blowing around, no Kleenexes, no

We loved the disneyland hotel, the look on the kids faces when the headboard lit up and played music was priceless. It is so nice been able to easily walk to disneyland. The pool area was great, we utilised it a lot. The reception staff were lovely, and were able to answer any questions we had. The rooms are not huge, esp when you have been away for 4 weeks and have a lot of luggage, it can get a bit cramped!  It would be great to have some pillow choices, we all had trouble with the extremely large pillows and woke with sore necks.

Our family of 7 just stayed on the 10th floor in the Disneyland Hotel.  We all paid the said price for our rooms. Two of our family members arrived earlier and were given the VIP treatment to the 11th floor facilities (gold card).  When the rest of our family arrived, the check-in clerk gave us a regular blue card and did not tell us about the 11th floor amenities (which we were entitled to and paid for).  It took several hours to straighten out.  This was NOT the way we wanted to start out our birthday/Mother's Day celebration.  Our travel agent made all the reservations for us, so this absolutely should not have happened.

This was our first time staying at a Disney property in Anaheim. Because of costs we found it cheaper to stay on properties outside of the resort, which actually are closer by foot. However, the monorail is in close walking distance of the resort. Disneyland Hotel is a really cool spot. The pool is great and was the major selling point for us. We wanted a pool with character and cabanas. The rooms are large and the site lines are great. We stayed in the Fantasy Tower which was great, however there was an elevator that was not working which caused major back up. This was a bummer with hopes they are going to fix it very soon for the next guests. In the room we had two queen beds with a head board that lit up with fireworks which our daughter truly loved, a very nice shower and

We celebrated my daughters birthday with a surprise visit to Disneyland and stayed one night at the Disneyland Hotel.  The hotel did not disappoint as far as service was concerned.  We arrived in the late afternoon and the check in process was easy and there was virtually no wait.  We purchased our theme park tickets at check in as well which was a nice time saver.    During check in the representative who was helping us let us know she would be showing us to our room, which was something I had never experienced in any of my earlier stays.  I just figured it was something new....but to our surprise they upgraded us to a suite as part of a magical experience promotion they were doing.    We were upgraded to the Pirates of the Caribbean Suite, a beautiful 2 bedroom, 4 bath, suite

Summary Heading: It's Disney run...what's not to love?
Summary: We travel to Disneyland/CA Adventure several times a year and stay at one of the hotels at least once a year. We love the predictability of good service, kid activities and general Disney wonder.   The hotels are more about location and early park entrance than amenities and room quality.  We sleep in the room and use the pools for a break in park visits.  You cannot go wrong at the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel.

I just have one word to describe my visit overall:  SUPERB!!!  Staff friendly and polite, very caring about the children. Everything clean and good looking. The beds were extremely comfortable that if I wasnt @ Disneyland, i should've spend more time resting!  Absolutely a 200% value!!

We got a fabulous military discount for this hotel 5 weeks before we arrived.  We got in at 6:30 a.m. and were allowed to check right into a room in the Fantasy Tower, for which we were so thankful.  The room was beautiful, overlooking the pools.  The headboard lights up with "fireworks" and plays music.  Comfy robes in the closet, 4 pillows to a bed, reading lights on each bed. The only issue was two of the three elevators were not working. A cast member had to escort guests to the service elevator and ride up with them. There are no stairs that lead to the lobby or we would have used to stairs, as we were only on the 2nd floor.  Cast members went out of their way to help.  We were even allowed a late check out with no additional charge. It was a bit of a walk to the parks, and

Summary Heading: Perfect, if you can afford it!
Summary: There are cheaper options in Anaheim I've stayed at and liked, but if you can afford to stay in the Disney bubble, I think it adds to the experience. We loved being able to walk through Downtown Disney or ride the Monorail to the parks. We loved the floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the pools and palm trees and the classy Disney decor in our room. We especially loved the big kiddie wading pool that kept our toddler happy for hours. We loved the magic morning access to the parks before the huge crowds hit. I've never stayed at Grand Californian, but we did eat there, and I like the Disneyland Hotel atmosphere better. I prefer lots of sunlight, and the GC lobby seems kind of gloomy by comparison.

Summary Heading: Easy and magical with young kids
Summary: Expensive and not a luxury hotel.. But  Mickey themes, bed head and proximity are amazing. We had a 2 bdrm suite which was just a 1bdrm suite with adjoining room on the 2nd floor. Problems with elevators but all forgotten when taking my 4 yr old on the water slide and early access to the park for frozen princesses.

I satyed at this resort whilst i was there doing a training course. I didn't pay for it so i can't comment on the price but i thoroughly enjoyed my stay. There are 3 towers and i satyed in the middle one and had a room that overlooked Downtown Disney. It had 2 beds and was just lovely. I was next to the staff service elevator which was annoying but it would not stop me from staying there again, i'd just request a room not near any elevators. All the staff were very friendly and my room was made up beautifully everyday. To be honest i couldn't fault the place whilst i was there. I would definately recommend this hotel for anyone.

Summary Heading: Have a Magical Stay at Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim
Summary: Disneyland Hotel is one of the on- property hotels/resorts at Disneyland Anaheim, California. It is located just steps away from Downtown Disney and the Disneyland theme parks for convenience that is second to none. This large resort hotel features three large towers, hundreds of rooms, multiple pools, several restaurants, and loads of meeting space for conferences and more.  I had never visited Disneyland in California until recently so the Disneyland Hotel was my inaugural lodging experience in this magical land. And I have to say that, all things considered, this is a first- class hotel all the way. The rooms are not gigantic, but they are larger than your typical hotel room and they do have extra features to make your visit a memorable one. The lighted headboards, small

Summary Heading: Always a Piece of Disney Magic!
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel has been my standard for excellence since I first became a returning guest in 2000.  I travel the world and stay at many fine hotels, but I am still convinced that the Disneyland Hotel outshines them all.   In January we stayed to celebrate my Mom's 91st Birthday.  The rooms have magical blinking castle headboards that play the tune, "A Dream is a Wish your Heart Makes."  The room was spotless, as usual, and had a fresh aroma. The beds and pillows were cushy.  We could see the Matterhorn from our window!    We always take advantage of room service, either for breakfast or a late night snack.  This time we ordered breakfast, which was wheeled in on a crisp linen-draped table.  The hot food was hot and the cold food was cold; and so delicious. I mentioned to

We debated where to stay on our recent trip to Disneyland and settled on staying at a resort hotel. If affordable, this is the best option in our view. For all that is written on this site, we found the staff great, the rooms large and well maintained with plenty of room for 4 (including a 12 year old and 15 year old) and an excellent bathroom. But our stay was made by the extra concierge service. It included a good breakfast, all day food, a place to escape the heat and a brilliant way to watch the fireworks in comfort with the music piped into the lounge. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and encouraged us to take some water and food for our day in the parks. My 12 year old particularly liked Robert who tended to her every need. Overall, if returning we would

we had christmas here and money could not have been better spent! gorgeous hotel, massive rooms! super clean, the staff..  lovely! go out of their way to make children welcome, beautiful pools, very convenient laundry room.. just perfect! i would and am going to stay here again, we will be back in october! can't wait! their cleaners were exceptional too… left her a massive tip for christmas <3

When we arrived at the  Disneyland Hotel our room wasn't ready so we stored our luggage and went to the park. That night I went to take a shower and there was no shower curtain. No big deal just an inside joke the rest of the trip. The hotel is nice, the staff friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't huge but I only need a bed while visiting Disney. I wish the hotel had a quick, cheap grab-n-go for breakfast. I didn't want to eat with goofy, or have a full-on sitdown meal.I went to White Water Snacks in the Grand Californian and then right into California Adventure instead. Now the bad stuff. Why do I have to pay so much to stay here and then pay $15 a day for parking? Come on Disney. The elevators are a joke. There are three small, slow elevators for the hotel guests. I gave up

My husband and I came to Disneyland to celebrate our first wedding anniversary- and magical doesn't even begin to describe this hotel!  This was my husband's first stay at the Disneyland Hotel, but I had stayed here back in 2008 with family.  It was a nice resort then, but the renovations that they did are fantastic.  It has a very classic feeling the minute you walk in- like you could picture Walt himself spending a night or two here.  Upon check-in, we learned that our room had been upgraded to a corner king room, in the Frontier Tower.  It was MASSIVE, complete with a wrap around patio!  It was definitely a comfortable stay!  The vintage Walt touches were just a real treat.  From the black and white photos of Walt and the park, to even black and white stationary with pictures

We took our 2 1/2 year old here for the first time and ❤️. It was magic. The hotel is just as it appears online. The rooms are beautiful (love the backboard behind the beds!). When we checked in, we were given an upgrade! Only complaint is the $15 parking fee, ouch!

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for a business conference and was pleasantly surprised. Truth be told, I'm not big into Disney theme parks...I feel too claustrophobic and impatient to wait in lines. However, I did enjoy the jovial atmosphere of the hotel and thought it was well organized and clean. I was even amused by the fireworks display headboard and subtle Mickey Mouse references in my room. The hotel is just a stone's throw away from Downtown Disney where you can find a decent cup of tea or coffee and pretty good food. I think my favorite part of the experience was being able to watch the fireworks show happening outside my window while laying in the comfort of my bed.

Summary Heading: Great location, nice rooms, headboard lights up!
Summary: Pools are nice with neat water slides that shoot through mock monorails. The rooms are nice. The beds have headboards that light up with stars and fireworks.  The location is great with a short walk either to the monorail (5 min) or straight on to the park (10 min).  There is a little market/restaurant in the center with decent food and Downtown Disney is literally steps from your room with lots of shops and restaurants.  We saw Goofy in the lobby upon our arrival and walked right up to him! Yay!  Perfect for trip with a 2 year old that needed to come to and from the park during the day for naps.

Stayed here a week ago over Spring Break. This is my third time at the Disneyland hotel, and it has always exceeded my expectations. It is a fairly steep price for 3 nights, so I would recommend staying 2 nights if you're flying into L.A. (arriving afternoon at the spectacular pools, next 2 days at the parks which is all you need if you pack a lot in). Obviously the highlight of the hotel isn't the rooms (which are still very nice and clean) but the experience. Everything from the Monorail waterslide to Trader Sam's Enchanted Tiki Bar is amazing. This hotel completely immerses you in Disneyland. You feel transported from the freeways and the rest of Anaheim that's only feet away.

Our family stayed at the Disney Hotel for 6 nights from the 18th of April 2014. The Hotel's location is great but we were extremely disappointed with every other aspect of our stay. For the ridiculous room rate (we paid over $500 USD per night for a standard room with pool view) we expected so much more. The rooms are small (you couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom), have poor lighting, poor ventilation and are dated (despite Disney's 2010 renovations). The entrance foyer lacks wow factor and looks dated (although our children did enjoy the somewhat tired looking teacup seats). We were initially assigned a room right next door to the elevator and had to request a move due to the noise.  One of the elevators in the Hotel was not working the entire time we were there, which

I would not stay in this hotel again based simply on value for the money.  We decided to splurge on our 4th trip to Disneyland with our kids, ages 7, 9, and twin 11 year olds.  Very disappointed since the suite that sleeps 6 cost us about $850 a night for 2 nights.  Rooms were clean and nice, upscale with some Disney touches. But, location to Disneyland itself actually farther than the hotel we moved to on our 3rd day ( part of our plan - Camelot Inn & Suites) and over $600 more a night.  I have no idea why this hotel is priced this way.  The water slides on site were not such a great hit for my kids - liked them ok, and other than that, I don't get it.  We only splurged here because we had a trip to aulani in Hawaii planned but had to cancel because we couldn't afford the

We spent 6 nights at the Disneyland hotel at the end if March with our 3 children. This hotel is great, it's close to the parks and Downtown Disney, the staff are very friendly and the renovations have created a truly magical environment. The Disneyland Hotel knows how to make the small details count!! From Beautiful music as you stroll the gardens to themed foyers in each tower. It's all been thought of. We loved this hotel and look forward to returning in the future.  We did however have one negative comment that needs to be addressed. Upon arriving from an overnight flight from Australia we were told the hotel was full and housekeeping was running behind. We therefore, could not get into our room on time and had to spend an agonizing 6 hours deliriously tired with our

This review is for our family's stay last year.  Now can compare to Grand Adventure.  The "original" is still the best.  Front desk was courteous.  Parking close to the hotel.  Room nice although small.  Renovated swimming pools were fun for all.  Short walk to the monorail with shorter line than at the park if you time it right.

Summary Heading: The Most Magical Stay Of My Life
Summary: My most recent trip was to California, USA. I did many things there but the Disneyland  Hotel in Anaheim, California was the best part. It was just like a normal resort but with hints of Disney, which I enjoyed a lot. Staying at the Disneyland Hotel in California, was my dream.  To me, it was the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The hotel was separated into 3 towers, the Fantasy tower, Adventure tower and Frontier tower. They all were very short walking distance from Downtown Disney, which was very convenient.        The rooms were amazing. The rooms were spacious, well-maintained and had many Disney touches which my family loved. The walls were sound proof and not once did I hear anyone outside. The housekeeping was very attentive too and always asked if we needed anything to

For the third year in a row, my husband and I picked the Disneyland Hotel.  With a perfect locale at the edges of Downtown Disney and its retro styling, the hotel keeps us coming back.    As we were staying for 7 nights, we were upgraded to a king corner firework room.  When we walked into the room, I ran over to the window and squealed "We can see the Matterhorn!  The tower of Terror!  The Pier!"  With the great view, we spent almost every firework viewing from our room, coordinated music coming through on the television.    With 8 days at the park, we didn't feel any big hurry to do anything so we experienced a bit of it all.  Of course, the biggest benefit of staying on property is the early magic hour that gets you into the park one hour before it opens.  In that hour, we'd

I stayed here for 4 nights over spring break. I checked in around 10:00 not expecting a room to be ready but the friendly front desk agent called housekeeping to ask if my room was ready and it was. I was placed in the Adventure Tower on the 5th floor overlooking the courtyard area but below was the roof of the restaurant/bar but that was okay. I really didn't mind the view. I requested a king-sized bed and my request was met. It seemed to be one of the smaller rooms but again I didn't mind since I was traveling solo. The bed and pillows were comfortable and it still had the same light display on the headboard. The bathroom was very clean and spacious as well. Mini-fridge came in handy. The best part of the room though is the floor-to-ceiling window. It just brings so much more

Summary Heading: Close to the theme parks but could do with a little more magic
Summary: This was the first time my family of 4, with 2 teenage children, stayed in a Disney resort hotel. We all loved the ability to leave the park during the day and take a couple of hours to relax by the pool. Having said that, there wasn't enough seating by the pool, which was disappointing.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower with a view of the car park! That tower lacks that famous Disney magic. The lobby area was sparsely themed and I think they could give those with a car park view something nicer to look at (even just a billboard). You could pay more and get a view of the park, but for the little time we spent in the room, it wasn't worth it.  The room itself was spacious and the beds were comfortable. The water pressure was low, but not a problem. I don't like interconnecting

I was really unimpressed with the Disney Hotel.  It was probably my fault when I booked that we didn't get what we were expecting but the staff were not interested in assisting us at all, even for an additional fee.  Would not stay here again it was old and tired and really small rooms.

We were really disappointed with the Disney Hotel. Its tired, the staff seem to have lost interest and it was difficult to get assistance.  We were unhappy with our small room, which was probably my fault on booking, however we were unable to get any assistance in paying for an upgrade or moving to one of their other hotels even though we thought we booked with them. Will not stay again.

Summary Heading: Excellent location with very sub class service.
Summary: Came for my son's 2nd birthday.  1st day here and wish for better already.  Nothing special to celebrate my son's second birthday.  Saw a much better service at disneyworld for my nephew's birthday.  Went to the pool and asked about cabana rates.  After speaking with 1 person, he asked me to wait in a corner until the cabana manager comes which would be in 2 mins.  After 10 minutes, I speak with 2 other people who also try to contact him and say he is coming.  Finally I walk towards my things to setup on the available chairs and as I'm walking one of the guards excuses himself and for the cabana manager for not appearing and mentions it was expensive anyway and I would probably not want it.  Finally I saw someone who was not in uniform but well dressed with a badge and claimed

Summary Heading: Fun place to stay, great for kids
Summary: The service at this hotel is excellent. We showed up before check in and the let us check in anyway. They put us in the tower where the reception desk is which was great. We got our park tickets at check in too, which I had purchased in advance on Orbitz. That way we were able to put our suitcases in the room and head straight for the monorail without having to go to the front gates.  The business office is in that tower also and I was able to print our boarding passes the night before we checked out. Only problem was that one of the elevators wasn't running which slowed things down in the mornings.

Just home from a two night stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  The location is excellent.  Everything else is not.  Service is poor, pool side service is very slow, when you get service.  TV in room wouldn't work, two of the three elevators broken during our stay.  No one answers the phone at the valet desk.  I expressed concern to the front desk and got "I'm sorry...have a magical day!"  Location is great, but if you're kids are old enough to not need a room on property I'd stay at a different hotel near by.  Disappointed.  We continued our trip in another city and were relieved to arrive at a reputable chain hotel with excellent customer service.

We had a superb stay for three nights. Fairly basic hotel but in good condition and adds to the whole disneyland experience.  Good pool for kids, although a little chilly, and we were in the frontier and block that had a great model of the thunder mountain ride in the entrance hall

The last time I went to Disneyland in 2009 I said to myself "next time I come here I'm going to stay at the Disneyland Hotel," so when I signed up to run the Tinkerbell Half Marathon in Jan 2014 I made sure I kept that promise. And I was not disappointed.  Like everything else Disney-related, it comes with a huge sticker shock. But from the moment we walked in, everything went so well.  Check-in was a breeze, finding our room was a sinch.  The room itself was adorable, since they have refurbished the rooms there were subtle Mickey Mouse touches EVERYWHERE, from the rugs to the light fixtures to the shower tiles.  Our favorite part of the room, hands down, was the fireworks display you could play above the beds.  We even kept the firework lights on while we slept to serve as a

Summary Heading: Frontier Village - great place to stay with family, business or couples.
Summary: Stayed at Frontier Village - very nice hotel.  Loved the fire pit right outside of the hotel entrance - it was cool in the evenings and so nice to sit outside by the firepit with a drink.  The room was comfortable and had the neatest over the bed light feature that played "When you Wish Upon a Star" - kids would go crazy over this!  Close to everything - Disneyland Hotel Conference Center, Downtown Disney and both parks. I'd recommend it to anyone.

We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Maybe we read too many reviews about the age of the hotel, about "Disney overload" with Mickey bathroom fixtures, Mickey hands sconces, etc. But the hotel didn't feel aged at all. The outside looked like a boring federal government building but the lobby was modern, and our Fantasy tower 4th floor pool facing room was all updated. Everything was very clean, and nothing looked worn out at all. It came with all the amenities you would expect and the Disney castle wood carving with light up fireworks with a 20 second song when you first turn it on is a nice touch for the kids.   The staff is also incredibly helpful, and very understanding and sympathetic of the parents. The pool is a great escape from the craziness of the Disney parks. It

I was not impressed by the room quality for $300 a night. Yes it close to Disneyland, but I rather stay across the street and pay less and get the same type of room. The pool is nice but I'm not there to swim. Disney theme is nice but I can see all that at the park. If you have the money knock yourself out.

Summary Heading: What a wonderful resort even for adults
Summary: Stayed here for one week and highly recommend it, the staff are so friendly and accommodating with everything you need. We arrived at 7am from a long flight and our room was ready, we had advised them and they couldn't be more obliging. Every member of the staff were so friendly. Our room was very good, had everything you needed. They replaced the bathroom amenities daily and if you needed more no problem. The guest services were so helpful in advising us of activities etc.  the only complaint I have is no adult pool. Hard to have a quiet swim. But plenty of chairs to sunbake in.

Summary Heading: Stay here over the other hotels!
Summary: We stayed at the Hilton 2 nights before we came here and it had a bad odor and the water was white chalky coloring when u used the sink and shower. We mived over to the disneyland hotel which had excellance in customer service and the room was the best room i have ever stayed in! I will always stay here when i come back. The hotels across from disnryland didnt look maintained/clean. U can tell the difference between who cared about the hotels property. I felt safe with all the security cars drving around at night.

We stayed for three nights in the Adventure tower on the fourth floor. Great location and nice and close to Disneyland, at least it feels that way until after you have been walking around that parks all day, then it feels like it's miles and miles away. Paid for a deluxe view which meant we were supposed to have a view of the fireworks according to our travel agent, but didn't. Our room over looked the pools which was nice anyway. Room was clean, beds were super duper comfortable, wasn't overly impressed with the range of TV channels, seemed to have more of the resort channels and kids stuff, which is not really a biggie coz we weren't in our room much, but is kinda nice to kick back after a big day with a movie. Staff were friendly and the little Disney touches like the

Summary Heading: Excellent Disney hotel experience in Adventure Tower
Summary: Staying here for 8 days with a conference.  Everything about the hotel is CLEAN.  Housekeeping staff is very friendly as are all of the staff that we have encountered.  We are staying in the Adventure Tower 5th floor with a view of Downtown Disney.  I noticed that someone else said "tired hotel" but they must have stayed in another tower.  We are DVC members and have stayed in every Disney property over multiple years.  This was our first time back here in 14 years but it was completely renovated since prior time.  Very convenient to Downtown Disney, which while token sized when compare to Orlando, has some jewels worth enjoying.  Steakhouse 55 for breakfast or dinner...Starbucks a short walk away in Downtown Disney.  Would definitely come back again for this experience.

This was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  We stayed for one night in a premium view room, located on the 7th floor in the Adventure Tower.  This room had 2 queen beds and a couch/daybed.  It worked out well for my family of 4.  The room was very spacious, nicely decorated with Disney touches (think Mickey-shaped faucet handles).  We liked the light-up headboard very much, and were able to see the fireworks from our room.  This was a huge bonus for us.  The staff was generally nice and friendly.  Proximity to the parks was also very convenient.  While it's not as close to the parks as Grand Californian, it's definitely close enough.  We would definitely stay here again, even though it is quite expensive.  We felt that the extra magic hour, proximity to the parks,

I stayed here for a business conference. I was pleasantly surprised by the room. Upper floor of the adventure tower with panoramic windows and view of the pool. I thought the room was nicely done, spacious, very clean and comfortable. The convention center and conference facilities were very nice. I loved how Downtown Disney is just steps away. It was so convenient for shopping and dining. And of course the Monorail access makes it so easy to get to the parks. I did splurge on room service and I have to say the pizza was delicious if you get a late night craving. :)  Cons-I was disappointed that you cannot rent movies in the room. However, for the kids, there are lots of stations, like Cinderella bedtime stories, Disney music, etc. Also, we went to the "Enchanted Tiki Bar" on

Needs update badly. Rooms are old and tired. Convenient to downtown disney, right at the end but unable to view fireworks from hotel rooms. Very difficult to get balconies. Most of the employees I encountered were unhelpful. Downtown Disney in California can't hold a candle to Orlando. Don't think I'll be back.

The Disneyland Hotel is worth every penny.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower and we were able to walk right off the elevator into downtown Disney.  However, the best treat is always the light up headboard with "when you wish upon a star" playing when my kids go to bed.  The staff was amazing and paid special attention to my kids.  Look for deals during the off season and you will love your stay even more!

Just had to add sharing with the grand kids a trip to Disneyland after three Spring Breaks at Disney World.  So glad we did this.  The Hotel is different and better than the Disneyland Hotel visited in the 80's.  I had mixed feelings about moving the hotels back away in the resort away from the parks, but by the time we left we realized how much we enjoyed the casual walk though Down Town Disney at night with the shops, but especially all of varieties of live music worth stopping and listening to.  It felt so very safe for the kids and yet surrounded by the city.  The hotel room was as promised with a day bed and two queens that were extraordinarily comfortable.  The teens enjoyed the headboards and all of the various Mickey touches throughout the room and the grounds.  Helpful

Ok so i have never stayed at a Disneyland resort hotel, only Walt Disney World but i must say it was an amazing experience. I only wish i had more money because i will never enjoy myself at any other hotel unless it's Disney.  My whole experience was fantastic. The rooms were spotless, the beds were extremely comfortable, bathroom, shower and water pressure were all top notch! What i really fell in love with was the new headboard with fiber optic fireworks display about a machined out Sleeping Beauty castle. The attention to detail not only in the rooms but the entire hotel is fantastic. In the rooms the contrast between the blue windows, carpets and decorative pillow goes beautifully with the tan wallpaper and white sheets. the furniture and all handles in the room are of top

It's been a life-long dream to stay here. I only stayed one night (Adventure Tower), but really enjoyed the experience. The place is beautiful, simply beautiful. You are totally immersed in all things Disney when you stay here, as opposed to a hotel offsite. It's expensive, but you are paying for the location and the amenities. If you are a true Disney fan, you need to stay here at least once.

Summary Heading: Expensive and always rising but need to experiencebatleast once in life!
Summary: Amazing! Like I said you have to try this hotel at least once in your life to get the true Disney experience! I have stayed a few times here and love it.....I've been pre and post renovations. The new monorail slides are a favorite with my son!

The only reason I did not rate this experience as a 1 is because of the convenience of being able to travel back and forth between our hotel room and the parks, however with that being said, I was VERY disappointed in what we received in relation to what we paid. First off, on the web-site they lead you to believe that you will enjoy a Disney experience that is second to none. WRONG, the rooms are not THAT much different than any other nearby hotel other than the decorative pillows on each bed and the shampoo and conditioner having Disney on the label. It took us over and hour for us to have our luggage brought up, even though my 27 year old son told the bell service representative that he could bring our things up at the time we loaded them on the cart. We were told that the

our vacation was magical!! we got a great deal online for 2 night and 3 days with hopper tickets for both parks, premium dinner, extra magical hour for both parks every day and souvenirs for all five of us $2300 dlls.. It was  worth every  dime spend!!! the hotel, the convenience to the park entrance and the restaurant , exceeded our expectations. Despite that it was a very busy spring break weekend we had a very easy access to the parks without having to wait long lines... we really enjoy the extra Magical hour before the park opens to the public. the staff were  great and helpful.. In the hotel we stayed at the adventure tower facing the pool.. not a big deal after spending all day at the park...the room was spacious and Super clean (which was my main concern as a mom).. we

Summary Heading: A Great Way to Experience Disneyland
Summary: If you really want to experience being in a magical place for a few days, then spend a bit more and stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The accommodation is as good as you could want – beds comfortable, clean rooms and prompt service and help from the staff – but it is the outside world you really came to see and experience. The pool area is a great start; with Trader Joe’s at its centre providing the adult drinks should you require them. It is a short walk to Downtown Disneyland where you can find all manner of eateries and shops. You can take the monorail from there to the theme parks or walk to them in a matter of minutes. Better still, you can go back to the hotel for a nap or a swim and return to the parks for some of the special events such as the World of Colour or the

I will preface this by saying I have little patience and dislike mob like crowds - so Disneyland is probably not the place for me - but we decided to take our young kids to Disneyland and give it a shot.  We got a one bedroom suite in the frontier tower - we got on the top floor which is great - on the frontier tower you have a great view of the fireworks which has been the highlight of our trip.  Big cons - absolutely no customer service here.  I spent 50 minutes on hold trying to call for room service.  I called the front desk, the dining line, the room service line - and I didn't speak to one live person.  Everything automated.    Not very Disney like in the rooms.  Rooms Are very spacious and nicely updated - but it looks like a hilton.  No significant decorations or feel to

Summary Heading: Way over rated and over priced
Summary: My husband was here for work and we (myself and our 3 kids) came along.  First off I must say that I'm glad that we didn't pay to stay at this hotel because I would be highly disappointed and feel ripped off.  Check in was easy and they were very informative and polite.  The outside and inside of the Hotel are impressive and beautiful and it makes you feel all excited and happy inside because you know you're about to enjoy Disneyland.  Our room was in the Frontier Tower which was the furthest Tower from the hotel entrance and our window faced a parking lot so the view wasn't good at all. The room was small, clean, and quite.  The beds were full size but comfortable especially after 11 hour days at Disneyland (maybe I was just exhausted).  The mini fridge was a mini mini fridge

We didn't spend much time in the room, but it was clean and spacious. Check in was incredibly slow and the person helping us was not particularly friendly. We were down graded in view and ended up with a parking lot view. No apologies or explanations. No wiggle room either. That's just the way it was. No big deal as, I mentioned, we didn't spend that much time in the room, however the outside windows were really dirty and made our parking lot view even worse! That being said, the location and proximity to Downtown Disney was worth it. Would we go back? Maybe.

Summary Heading: There is a reason why you have to pay upfront
Summary: We booked a 2 bedroom suite and had to prepay the very expensive rate, as are the rules ($5,000 for 3 nights and a 4 day hopper pass for 2 adults and 1 child). I now understand why. Once they have your money they don't care at all. We arrived at 4pm to our room not ready yet and when it finally was, we were in a back corner overlooking a carpark (the furthest room away from Disneyland park even though I requested to be close months ago) After speaking with 2 very unhelpful people on reception, another guy showed us two standard connecting rooms, next to the vending and ice machines but closer to the park. We took these, due to their closer proximity to the park, however all we were refunded was $300 total.   I cannot fault the cleanliness of the room, the cleaning staff do a

Summary Heading: Clean and quiet room in an ideal location
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for one night in March 2014. The bed and pillows in the room were extremely comfortable, and I was impressed by how quiet the room was. We were right next to an ice machine, but the bedroom area was set so far back from the door that we didn't hear a thing all night. The room was clean, the toiletries nice, and the staff was friendly. The hotel is very convenient to Downtown Disney and all the restaurants there, as well as the parks. We'd definitely stay here again!

My recent experience at the Disneyland hotel truly exceeded expectations. The room was a pool-view King room in the tower closest to Downtown Disney.  It appeared to be newly-remodeled and was small, but comfortable,.  It was immaculately clean, with a TV, fridge, coffee-maker, safe, and various Mickey toiletries.  The bed was so comfortable, I am on a quest to find out how to buy a similar mattress.  They have turndown service, which I have never understood, but I guess that's a sign of a classy hotel.  The housekeepers did a nice job, and even left extra coffee packets after the first day when they must have noticed how many cups I used.  A nice surprise was that it was very quiet in the area around my room throughout the stay---not a single screaming child was heard.  If the

My husband and three daughters (ages 8,7 & 2) absolutely loved our stay at the Disneyland Hotel. We upgraded to a Downtown Disney view so we could enjoy the fireworks and it was well worth it! The little Disney touches in our room from mouse ear patterned carpet, to the light up headboard made our stay even that much more magical.  Our oldest girls loved the pool and spent every day there after a long day in the park...and if you forget a swim diaper for the baby... no worries! They are provided. A huge bonus for me was how clean the resort and parks were. Traveling with little kids and dealing with diaper changes can be problematic, but Disney has mult diaper changing stations in all their restrooms and they were always clean. (even saw a 'cast member' spraying down station

Summary Heading: Regal Suite at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We stayed here several years ago in one of the basic rooms, which was cramped for a family of four. However, we decided to make a spur of the moment trip with my daughter and her four month old (Yes, four months old. We are grandparents now......what can I say?). Thanks to an abundance of Amex points and my husbands wish to stay somewhere that had everything we needed without leaving, we booked a regal suite. The cash value on the suite was $1800 - not a bargain, by any means, but I gotta say we were extremely pleased with what we got. It's a 2 room suite, with one and a half bathrooms, 3 vanity areas, 2 closets, and a kitchenette with refrigerator, coffee maker, sink, and small countertop bar area with seats. The living room had a large couch/sleeper sofa, two large armchairs,

Second trip to Disney in the last few years.  Stayed at the Grand Californian last time and liked it, but wanted to try something new.  The Disneyland Hotel is less ritzy but a better choice if traveling with kids because it has a more kid friendly pool and just feels more Disney.   Paid a little extra to get a higher view room overlooking the pool which was nice with only complaint being the music from the Tiki bar which got annoying on nights we wanted to turn in early, but was nice when we went down to the bar to enjoy it - so basically a "push".  Room was a good size, clean and convenient with little Mickey touches here and there.  Highly recommend it.

Pricey, but otherwise a lovely stay. Disney themed, but not tacky. Moderately sized room, good sized bathroom, quiet, clean, and great location. Parked in self-park and it was nice and close. Short term parking was nice to have. Valets were friendly and helpful (unlike those at the Grand Californian).  Staff were friendly and helpful and eager to please and make the stay positive and enjoyable.  Pool area was great (two hot tubs so not overcrowded). Close to Downtown Disney. Good restaurants (coffee shop on ground level opens early). Early access to the parks was worth it.  I would stay here again.  Better than the Grand Californian (except the Lobby and Storytellers Cafe, but if that matters to you, walk over to the Grand Californian!).

I booked a room for my son and his wife so that they could take my 2 year old Granddaughter for her birthday to Disneyland.  The rooms were standard fare, not sure if they were just given a dull room of if they are all like that.  For nearly $400.00 per night one would expect something a little special no?  They wanted to at least have breakfast with the characters in the morning but the line was monstrous, especially when waiting with a toddler.  They had to give up!  Just an overall disappointment and I am sorry I booked it for them when I could have done so much better.

Summary Heading: We found this hotel to be great!
Summary: As first timers to Disneyland, I read hundreds of reviews it seemed on TripAdvisor. It was hard to choose a hotel because they seemed to vary so much from person to person. Here's the deal, yes, the Disneyland hotel is expensive. Let's just assume that to be the case. But the location is impeccable, it was so, so CLEAN and well maintained, the pools were great for "down time" from the parks, and it just was nice to be on site for Disneyland.  We only stayed for two days so I could see how this would be tough to pull off for a week's vaca, but we were really happy with the accommodations.

We were fortunate to stay at the Disneyland Hotel in March, 2014.  I originally had a reservation at the Grand Californian, but decided that I really wanted to experience the Disneyland Hotel as that was always my dream since childhood to stay here.  We booked a standard room.  We didn't arrive at the hotel until 9pm.  My husband dropped us off with the luggage at valet before driving the car to self park.  Valet came quickly to the car and offered to help with luggage but we only had one bag and I was able to take care of it myself.  I walked right to the check in desk and there was no one in line with two receptionists working!!  As soon as I gave her my name she checked on her computer and said "It looks like you have been upgraded to a one bedroom corner suite in the

Spent 2 nights in the Fairytale suite at the Disneyland Hotel..Way overpriced!   We were expecting a large room with lots of Disney Animation and fun items..There were a few like the music when you entered and Tinker Bell floating on the wall..For over $1000 a night we surely were expecting more..There was only one sete in the room so if another person wanted to watch TV they had to sit on the bed.What a waste..The Bathroom was the highlight with a large tub, separate shower and double sinks..Clearly the nicest part of the suite. Food on the Concierge level was adequate for breakfast and snacks if you ate at off hours..If you came at busy times it was standing room only..The concierge staff was full of apologies and wrong information.We were told the fireworks began at 9:30.

Disneyland Hotel will always be a fun place to stay with my family!  We've been staying there for quite a few years now.  From pulling up to the entrance and being greeted by the valet staff, to checking in, to the magical lights and lullaby above the beds, to the fun pool and slides, shops and Disney atmosphere. We love it!  The price of rooms however does not match the quality of the rooms.  But that's the way it is if you want to stay on property.  I like the Adventure Tower rooms facing Down Town Disney.  You can watch the fireworks at Disneyland from your room and tune in on the television to hear the music!  Ask for a room at the end of the building, more towards Paradise Pier Hotel, to avoid the noise from Down Town, as it can get loud on busier weekends.  Enjoy a fun

Late hotel review...  My fiance & I were in Disney for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon in January. Hotel was great. We spent most of our time in the parks, so we did not get to enjoy the pool. The room was great. Very clean and spacious. The decor has Disney magic, but it's not overbearing. Since we didn't have a car, Disneyland Hotel was a great location for the parks. It's less than a 10 minute walk to the parks, and after my half marathon, it was a 5 minute walk back to the room (great after tired legs!). The staff was always very attentive and nice. We told them we just got engaged, and they were able to upgrade our room. For the runDisney events, I would recommend this hotel because of the proximity to the registration, convention and race. It is very pricey though. Next time,

I love the Disneyland Hotel. I have been staying at it with my family since it was one tower and garden apartments. It has always had that special feel that there was magic in the air. But alas, it has been redone and the Magic is gone. Gone is the underwater arcade, the "Dancing Waters" and the "Koi Pond" and her now, except for a lame gesture at keeping something Disney, the faux Monorail near the pool, you might as well be in a Marriott. It is sterile corporate architecture. Oh sure, the lobby by the business center still has some Disney photos and memorabilia, but that's about it. It seems that they "upgraded" it just to charge more and forgot the Disney part. I guess it's a great place for a corporate meeting, but as far as a Disney vacation, Mickey has "left the building".

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but happy we got it at a discount!
Summary: We spent three nights here for Dapper Day, so got conference rates, which was the only way we could afford this hotel. Loved the decor, the Disney touches and having Magic Mornings/ Early entry was great, especially for California Adventure Park. But that's about all you get for your money compared to other hotels. The pool area looked lovely but we did not use it as it was too cold for us, also we had no time as we were in the parks all day.    I would have been disappointed had I paid full price, we had the worst nights sleep out of the three hotels we stayed in. The beds were extremely hot, where you lay it felt like a furnace underneath. A lift was out and the other two backed up with people a lot, even though we were only 1 flight up we could not take stairs up, down yes

I stayed here for four night and was surprised by how much it was like most other hotels.   There was no characters walking the lobby or halls, like I had always imagined as a kid.   The hotel was nice and very clean with very attentive staff.  It was nice being so close to the parks and just strolling back through downtown Disney.  It has a very nice pool with a couple of fun slides.  There are kids everywhere and plenty of life guards around the pool.    The big question is would I stay here again.  Most likely not.  Although it was nice to be so close, the price difference just isn't justifiable.  It almost double the price of high quality hotels just across the street.

Summary Heading: Magical wonderland for our honeymoon stay
Summary: Our stay at the disneyland hotel was fantastic. The check in staff made us feel special and more excited than 5 year olds! They gave us celebration badges (1st visit, let's celebrate, just married just to name a few) to wear on our lanyards which was wonderful. The room was lovely and had just enough disney touches to make it fun but not tacky and the light up headboard was amazing! Staying at the disneyland hotel meant that we were just a short walk away from the park. Walking there was so much fun as we got to experience downtown disneyland which was wonderful in its own right. With restaurants, shops, an ice skating rink and a cinema we found lots to do both in the mornings and at night. Another great bonus about staying on site was that we could shop at disneyland during the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for adults too
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here during a recent three day visit to the park. Hotel was clean, nice, well appointed with Disney decor and convenient to the park. If you have a short trip, the magic hour can be beat! Magic Hour: if you stay at one of the hotels, you can get into one of the parks an hour before they open. The Magic Hour is only at one of the parks each day.   I wished the room had more than two coffee pods /k-cup things. We needed to order coffee up via room service every day.   Also, the TP is really rough and thin.

Summary Heading: It's Disney, of course its magic!
Summary: I had the chance to stay here for a conference. What fun, great service & lovely accommodations. The catering was amazing, it was well organized & every cast member was beyond wonderful. From the musical bed to the Mickey pretzels, it made the conference a great experience. If I was traveling with family, I would totally splurge to stay here again.

You will pay 2-3X what you ought to for a standard hotel room with basic ammenities. Hotel is old but remodel was very helpful. Decor is cute and fun. Our room was clean, but wear and tear visible despite remodel. Room ammenities basic. They make it hard to prepare any food in room (on purpose.) No fridge and coffee maker makes one cup at a time.  But...Pool was fun! Service was great! Convenience is the biggest reason to stay here. It is so close to the parks that it really relieves some of the stress and commotion of a trip to Disneyland. You have one less hassle to start and end your day and for us it was so worth it! The monorail is just a short walk from the hotel to downtown disney. You can then take the monorail right into Disneyland  or escape back to your room midday

Summary Heading: The Disney cast was working hard to make the trip special
Summary: This older property is showing very little in the way of wear. The hotel was spotless and every aspect worked well. The reservation staff went above and beyond to accommodate my need for an operable window in my room. Most of the rooms are without any opening windows and the few they have with balconies are hard to come by. After discovering this, I called the front desk and they fixed the problem within an hour. The service was great and the staff is top notch.

I stayed here in this hotel for 3 days. It was a walking distance from all the parks. Staff was very helpful. The rooms were nice. The rooms offered a nice view of the pool and the California Adventure. Beds were soo comfortablex. The lounge on the 6th floor was very nice. Very good food. We could even take food into our rooms! I didn't go to the pool but that would be something I would like to try. I would definitely come here again!

Summary Heading: It's definitely Disney!  Very pricey but you get what you pay for.
Summary: My fiance and I wanted to do something special on our short stay in Disneyland, so we splurged and finally got the opportunity to stay at the infamous Disneyland Hotel.  If it wasn't for the military discount and being a big fan of Disney, I probably wouldn't stay at this hotel.  That's probably the only negative thing I'd have to say is it is VERY expensive!  But let's move onto the positive stuff.  The Disneyland Hotel is beautiful and offers all the magic that is truly Disney.  From the carpet to the monorail pools and even the headboard magically lighitng up the room, it's incredible how this hotel adds magic to your Disneyland experience.  Here are a few items that stand out to me:   1.  When you turn on the headboard light (Showing fireworks and the castle), the lamp plays

My husband and I had a king size room with a connecting door to the room of our friends and their baby.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay.  We flew into LAX and took Super Shuttle which was $32 for the two of us, versus a $90 cab ride.  Once landed, it took around 2 hours to get to the hotel.  The pickup for our return flight was much more efficient and took 45 minutes to get back to LAX.  The hotel’s location to the Disneyland Parks was a wonderful perk as it was less than a 10 minute walk through downtown Disney making it easy to get back to the room quickly.  And we loved having so many restaurants to choose from!   Our room was absolutely lovely with new furnishings and an extremely comfortable bed.  We had a wonderful view of the pool area.  We were located right next to the

This was our first Disney experience and we loved it. On checking in we were upgraded to a 1 bed room suite which gave our family of 5 a little more space which was great, we were also able to check in early so another bonus. The room was nicely appointed & clean but had no minibar facilities. The kids loved the lights on the headboards & the tapware! Dinner at Goofy's kitchen was fun although waiting staff on the night were not particularly attentive. The location to both the parks was great and we especially liked the early "magic hour" entrance into the park.

We had a great vacation and staying at the Dusneyland hotel made the trip so much better. We have a nine month old son and he loved the kiddie pool! The price is a little steeper than the hotels across the street from Disneyland but you get what you pay for.   We had an awesome pool view. Stated in the adventure tower which was super nice!  Reasons to stay here:  1. The resort feels like a destination of its own  2. Proximity to downtown Disney (literally steps away)   3. Characters are in the lobby from time to time   4. If you have little ones and need to take a break from the park, its a super close walk back especially from California adventure  5. Really accentuates the comfort and experience of the trip.   6. At night the hotel feels like a tropical destination   7. Disney

We have stayed at the other two properties and decided to give the disneyland hotel a try. It is our new favorite property. Before even getting there I called the hotel because the disney vacation planners kept messing up our reservation. Violet answered the phone and handled everything beautifully and cheerfully.  The next day check-in was smooth and the room was ready. We stayed in the fantasy tower on the 10th floor in room 2835 and had a view of the fireworks.  The kids loved the lightup headboard.    It was cold while we were there but my 3 and 5 year old still loved the pool. The life guards were awesome, they watched them like hawks but also interacted well with them.   The room was bright and spacious. We had problems with the heating going off too much at the grand

Loved staying at Disneyland Hotel for latest trip to Disneyland but first at a Disney property. Five of us in one room. Three adults and two teenagers. Had a pullout sofa that was actually quite comfortable.  Room was large enough for all five. Perfect location to both parks and Downtown Disney.  Rooms were comfortable and clean.  Good pool. Would stay here again. More reasonably priced that the disney hotel in Disney California.

We have stayed a couple of times at the Disneyland Hotel when going to Disney and it is by far one of our favorites. Everything is clean and fresh, the spray in the shower spins around while you shower (the kids loved it) and over the bed is a "nightlight" that plays a little disney song and blinks like stars and tinkerbell.  The only issue we had was only 1 elevator, sometimes the wait took a bit with so many people bringing strollers etc,. but overall, a magical experience.

After having been to Orlando more times than I'd like to admit, we headed west this Jan. to Disneyland.  This is our family's new FAVORITE Disney hotel... it's a classic!  We arrived on a Sunday and were given a room prior to check-in time.  Great service!  We love the nostalgia, large-sized room, light-up headboards and everything else.  We are a family of swimmers and we loved the pool more than any other FL property.  We had so much fun just at the hotel... we even had dinner at Goofy's and it was good fun for all.   After staying two nights here, we moved for the last night to the Grand Californian.  While the Grand CA is a little closer to the parks, we still liked the Disneyland Hotel because we thought the room was bigger and the pool was better.  Our youngest is 6 and

First if you fly into LAX and want to get to Disney use Super Shuttle, they have a van service that rocks! Just did Disney, and tried a Disney Hotel for the first time. It was nice and I think if you can swing it that this is the way to go. The staff is really friendly and accommodating, They answer all of your questions in a friendly Disney way! The room was nice, nothing super special but the bed was comfy and the linens and pillows were top notch, important after a long day. We stayed on the parking lot view which is fine you can still see the park and the "mountains". It would probably be a good place to watch the fire works, but it was rained out while we were there. The pools were nice and the hot tub was welcome. It would be nicer if the access was better, its about a

First time staying here. Cast members were awesome. Rooms were amazing. Very nice/high quality finishes. Beds very comfy. Fireworks in headboard are a very nice touch. Nice floor to ceiling windows. Good restaurant options on hotel property.

This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  We normally stay at the Grand, but wanted to try something different.  The DLH was great. We had a standard room on the 11th floor in Fantasy Tower, which overlooks the parking lot, but we did have a partial view of Disneyland. The Front Desk check in was smooth and quick, our room was ready at 10:30 am!  The light-up headboard is just adorable and the room looked fresh and very clean.  Mousekeeping (as usual) does a great job and our room was spotless every day of our stay.  Bell staff and valet parking was also efficient and professional.  Our stay was truly magical.  There is not quite the level of elegance as at the Grand ('real' coffee cups and nightly turn down) , but we really have no complaints as far as service goes.

Summary Heading: Everything we could have wanted with a minor exception
Summary: My family and I are Disneyland veterans going usually twice a year for more years then I can count. This is our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel, however, we have stayed at the Grand Californian before.  We arrived a little after 3pm on Sunday the 23rd. The valet and bellmen were quick to assist us and courteous in their attitude. The check in line was long, probably 30 or so people deep but was being move along very efficiently. We were probably only waiting in line about 10 minutes which wasn't a problem at all.  During the check in we had a minor hiccup of our reserved room type not being what we were blocked into, but the front desk agent quickly amended it and offered us an upgraded room for the trouble.  Our room was in the "adventureland tower" and my wife actually like

We've stayed at the Disneyland twice in the last two years, and enjoyed our stay both times. We had rooms in the Adventure Tower overlooking Downtown Disney, which gave us a terrific view of the fireworks. The beds were comfortable, the rooms spacious (though you get a lot more space in a room with 2 queens than with a king) and were quiet. If you have small kids, the light up head boards are pretty spiffy; heck, even if you don't, you're going to have to turn them on just to see.  We used valet parking on the last trip; it costs a little more but is worth it. They unloaded our car and put our luggage on a cart, then held it until we checked it; all we had to do was call from our room, and they delivered it 10 minutes later.   In all honesty, the only downside to the trip was

Summary Heading: Be aware- nice enough hotel but very expensive for what it is!
Summary: Let me preface this by saying I love Disneyland and I have been several times.  That being said, I will give the most honest review I can about this hotel in particular and the Disneyland experience in general.  I just finished reading a review by an exhausted and disappointed mom and I SO felt for her that I am going to address the whole Disney kit and kaboodle so that other families don't have the same experience.  First of all, I NEVER EVER stay in a Disneyland resort hotel unless I get a HUGE discounted rate (family member discount).  This hotel is around 400 dollars a night without a discount (the Grand California is almost 500 a night!) and neither hotel is ANYWHERE NEAR DESERVING of that price.  There is ONE REASON to stay at a resort hotel- you have a castmember discount

Summary Heading: Service Almost lives up to the Decor
Summary: It is great fun for sure being next door to the Happiest Place on Earth.  The valets were attentive and helpful, but the front desk could use some efficiency updates.  After a slow check in, the luggage arrived quickly.  The room décor is beautiful and the theme is great.  Housekeeping was good, but more attention to the little details are needed.  The room was dusty but overall acceptable.  The convenience of the locations outweighed any negatives.  Comfortable beds, and lots to do outside of the theme parks.  Restaurants were good, and the pool was fun.  Ours was a romantic/fun getaway weekend, also recommended for family's.  Pricing is steep, but occasional deals can be found in off season.

We stayed at this hotel almost a decade ago when the Grand was full.  The hotel rooms are much larger than the Grand but the decor was a bit long in the tooth.  The hotel has been renovated and we decided to stay there again to see the new decor.  We stayed on the 9th floor of the Adventure tower, facing the pool.  We never heard a single sound from the hallway or from other rooms.  We occasionally heard running water but nothing else.  This is a solidly-built hotel from the 1960's.  We had a double sink in the large bathroom.  There is a lot of floor space despite the two queen beds.  There are 2 comfortable stuffed chairs in addition to the desk/chair combo.  One of the stuffed chairs opens into a single bed.  The TV was great---good reception.  The water pressure was good and

We stayed in the Adventure Tower, this is the tower closest to Downtown Disney that has the "E-Ticket floor" (previously the "concierge floor" that had the special theme rooms). We checked in rather early so the registration staff confirmed our room, gave us our room number and keys, had the bell desk store our luggage, and promised to page us if the room was ready prior to the normal 3pm check-in time. It was. Our single king bed room was spacious, well appointed, and the "Disney Touches" were elegant. Above our headboard was a carved wooden panorama of Sleeping Beauty's Castle that had pinpoint LED lights within it to represent the fireworks. The soft glow made a lovely nightlight and did not disturb our sleep. If you need true darkness to sleep, don't worry, you can turn the

Summary Heading: Steps from fun, and the "World" at your steps....
