Summary: Disneyland resort for me was everything a Disney hotel should be! It should be an experience wrapped in Disney Magic and Disney service. We were greeted by a Great Cast member named Byson he was courteous and kind. (my fellow vacationers show them the same kindness after all you're in Disney, and they can hold the keys to beginning of a wonderful experience). So we checked I nearly and was able to get a room rather shortly. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room(this one had the sofa bed) and the view of the pool. Although that is great info it is more important to know that the Disneyland hotel lends itself at least to us the most convenient in getting to and from the parks. We have little ones who would need naps and it was hassle free to travel back and forth

We booked the Disneyland Hotel as our favorite Grand California was unavailable. this is how the visit started..a 45 minute wait to check into a room which was nice but covered in cob webs on the walls to a TV that lost signal..water pressure in the shower that was barely coming out to and here is my all time favorite..the pool was constantly being closed for what they called a little Tinkerbell accident (more like a Winnie the POO accident) UGH!!! The only thing that was good about this hotel was the Manager who helped us get booked into The Grand California at our request...were I'm happy to say...the rest of our trip was WONDERFUL!!!

Summary Heading: Pleasantly surprised that is a nice hotel, not cheap & cheesy :)
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised that the Disneyland Hotel is very nice.  I thought it would be cheaply constructed as the Disney hotels are in WDW.  I do not know if this hotel is more solidly made because it has actually been here since the 50s (and not built by the Disney Company) and they have just remodelled it.  But the outcome is wonderful.  The rooms are spacious and richly decorated.  (Again, unlike WDW where the rooms are bare and minimalistic.)  Flip the switch for a "Goodnight Kiss" and the headboards light up with fireworks over the carving of the castle. There is a real bathroom complete with sink, toilet, and bath/shower.  (The sink is not exposed to the sleeping area as at WDW.)  There are large picture windows to view the lushly landscaped hotel resort or the parks

I rarely take the time to write reviews as I'm a busy mom of 3 boys but as I cried this morning unpacking from our trip to Disneyland I knew I needed to make the time and will be posting the same review to TripAdvisor, Blogs and anywhere else I can so other families know what they're in for. This was the most financially and emotionally draining vacation I have ever been on and an incredible disappointment.  We are just a "normal" family and saved for several years to bring our 3 kids to Disneyland. We researched the best time to go and chose a Mon-Tues in February. The park was so busy each ride was a 45-60 minute wait and my one and 3 year olds just couldn't do it so we maybe ended up doing less than rides in 2 days. Over 10 RIDES WERE CLOSED including Thunder Canyone, Nemo's

all I'm going to say is that, I can't wait to go back, talk about beautiful, clean and excellent service... I wish I could have stayed a week or two.  thank you for the wonderful hospitality.  Okay, to say that the rooms were clean is an understatement.  I'm the kind of person that checks everything like it's a my paying job... I even bring my own sheets and pillow.  I felt like a kid again,and being on the 11th floor and the view was spectacular... I loveeeeeeeeeeeeee it.  Thank you.  we bought a family package that included entrance to Disney and Disney Adventure... pretty cool.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel - FAR from the Disneyland entrance
Summary: Beautiful hotel with great amenities.  Friendly staff even with a sold out hotel.  Loved the special headboards.  The only problem is the hike with little ones.  Really wish they had a shuttle service so at least you ended up as close as the folks who get to ride the tram from the parking lot next door.  Stay at the Grand Californian if you can so you are right there for California Adventure and not too far from Disneyland.  Extra magic hours are totally worth it so I would always stay on the property.   Note to Disney - buy up some of the hotel properties across the street from Disneyland and spruce them up.

We stayed in the Disneyland hotel, and asked for a room facing the park higher up so that we could see the fireworks at night, and they accomodated our request. The room was amazing, with little touches here and there that made the stay enjoyable.  The soaps, shampoos and such were in little bottles with mickey ears on top, and the artwork in the room lit up with shimmering lights that made it look like fairy dust.  I was very impressed with the staff and how professional everyone was while also catering to the younger crowd.  I would have given the hotel a higher mark if they did not require disabled parking to be so far from the hotel entrance, this made the use of our car very hard and getting to and from the hotel more of a chore then we would have wanted.

Been meaning to review this hotel. It was a great experience my me and my nephews. I'm back and forth between Huntington Beach and Las Vegas and I've been promising nephews trip to Disneyland. Picked this place due to convenience and it sure was. Great location and easy access to Disneyland. The staff and rooms were great and the property is really kept up. Definitely what I would expect from disney. loved it!

We had one of the smaller rooms in the south tower but 90% of the time we were just sleeping in it anyway. The walk through Downtown Disney is not that bad and much more convenient than the shuttles as we had 2 strollers and to ride the shuttles you have to fold them up which can be a pain after awhile especially the way my wife shops:)  I really enjoyed the poolside tiki bar. It was a great place to unwind with other adults and the bartenders were top notch and made us feel very welcome there.

The perfect place to start your trip into Disneyland and resorts. Very friendly and helpful staff! Also the rooms offer all you need in good quality and perfect cleanness!  However, the prices are a bit high and if you require room service or want to get any support at "rush hours" you will be held in waiting line for decades. This point has to be improved, as to wait on the phone for about 10min for a room service call or to get an operator on the line for help is unacceptable!  Besides of this; get the elevator fixed. As sharing one elevator for so many guests for 3 days is also out of acceptance for such a high price!  All others is a nice experience. For all... Big and small!!!  Make sure you get some drinks and snacks before check in, as the hotel is off anything and all

Summary Heading: Must stay at an ON-SITE resort at least once!
Summary: It is such a different experience staying at an on-site Disney Resort, vs offsite and driving in every morning (even vs across the street or within walking distance.  The Early Entry on crowded days allows you to get on a couple extra rides and get Fast Passes ahead of general public, so you end up with at least 3-4 extra rides on crowded/popular rides.  While more expensive, the perks can be worth it! The extra hour, plus not having to deal with walking, parking, or shuttles (which can delay you an hour later getting in). You can send your purchases back to the room and not have to carry them around (or put them in a locker)...

Our family of four stayed in January 2014 for 3 nights. We were given adjoining rooms in the frontier tower high up with a lovely view of the pool area. The rooms were perfect for us. 1 King bed for us and 2 queens for our 2 teenage girls. Checkin and checkout were very efficient and courteous. On finding out it was our first Disney experience we were given lots of information that helped plan our stay. The Disney touches in the room and around the grounds really enhanced the magic for us. Whilst we didn't get around to using the pool, plenty of people were using it at night and the grounds were lovely to walk through. An easy walk through Downtown Disney gets you to the parks very quickly and taking advantage of the extra magic hour makes the day a lot more relaxed and easy to

Met Goofy in the lobby as we checked in!  The desk attendant that checked us in asked us if we were celebrating...Only that we were there - she gave us each an "I'm celebrating" souvenir button.  All the staff members we spoke with were very friendly.  We were in a standard room in the Frontier Tower.  Nice and clean with fun Disney touches.  Comfy beds and a couch that folded into a bed.  Pretty clean bathroom with lots of Mickey fun.  Light up headboards that played music from Cinderella.  Great view of the pool area.  Pool area was lots of fun for the kids.  Water slides, activities, cabanas for rent, life jackets for the little ones, friendly life guards, hot tub - all great.  We used the laundry facility that is near the pool area.  We did not eat at any of the hotel

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel last week for our first trip to Disneyland (having stayed at over a dozen Disney properties in Florida.) Yes, you are paying more to be on Disney property and it was well worth it. We stayed in the adventure tower and we could walk into the park in about 15 minutes. No car, no tram, easy! There is something to be said for spending the extra money on the hotel to not have to mess with a shuttle from an outside hotel. We took advantage of the Extra Magic hours every day which saved us loads of time in line for rides. Time is money.The hotel is older, but the upgrades were beautiful. Definitely recommend it for the true Disney fan because there are touches of Walt himself all over the place. I think the comments that it is just a "basic" hotel is

Summary Heading: Nice stay but not worth the premium price
Summary: Do you want to be immersed in the Disneyland Resort atmosphere and have an extra hour in the parks each day? If so, then you probably don't care about the high cost for what is a very basic hotel at its core. We decided to give it a try as we had only stayed at locations on Harbor and wanted the full experience at least once. Unfortunately the extra magic hours didn't include Radiator Springs Racers two of the days due to tech problems, the exclusive resort guest turnstiles into DCA were closed for refurbishment and the corner king room we were assigned was oddly shaped and very cramped as a result. None of which made the stay worth $200+ a night when decent harbor motels could offer rooms for $50. Two plusses would be the great dining options and a wonderful pool area with a

I had a 5 night stay here starting January 18th with my best friend and her twin 2 year olds.  The room was spacious and clean. An added special touch was the Cinderella castle musical headboard!  What stood out was the amazing service - if we needed something - whether it be extra towels or any extra 'pack n play' - the staff was right there to help out. No sooner would we call the front desk for something- they would be knocking at our door!  The short walk through Downtown Disney to the park entrance was a huge bonus.  The pool area was fantastic - tons of lifeguards and staff to ensure safety and service. Boy! Were we pleasantly surprised to see Disney characters walking around the pool to interact with the kids!  Overall great place to stay! If you want top notch service,

We stayed during the busiest time of the year--between Christmas and New Years.  As per usual, the service was fabulous and the new remodel is great!  We loved the "fireworks" in the head board.  Nothing beats the location of the Disneyland Hotel.

Now that I've stayed at all three hotels at the Disneyland Resort, I am happily surprised to admit that the Disneyland Hotel is my new favorite!  The Paradise Pier was nice, with a great view of Disney's CA Adventure Park, and the Grand Californian was super-convenient to that same park, if overly expensive.  The Disneyland Hotel is the oldest hotel on the property, so I expected it might show its age.  I was wrong.  Disney smartly refurbished the entire place, but kept a nod to its 1950's roots with a cool, streamlined retro-feel.    There are three towers (we stayed in the "Fantasy" tower), all surrounding a beautiful pool and garden area.  There are two water slides, which emphasize the 1950's retro-feel with a Disneyland Monorail theme.  Steps outside the hotel area is

Even though I live in Los Angeles and really don't need to stay at the Disneyland hotel for a trip to Disneyland, I do, because it makes the experience that much more pleasant. We always take advantage of the extra magic hour at the parks - why, by the time the park is open to the public we've crossed at least 4 - 5 rides off our list - usually the ones that have the longest lines later in the day!  From the comfortable rooms to the ease of entry into Disneyland (just take the monorail from Downtown Disney and bypass the hectic crowds at the main gate) it really makes our trip far much easier.    Additionally for the past few months, aside from the discount you normally get at the hotel for being an Annual Passholder, the Disneyland Hotels group has extended a great promotion

We loved staying here.  We had a guest that has to be in a wheelchair at all times and this place is set up right.  There's even a lift to get you in and out of the hot tub.  Amazing!  My only issue is the short hours for the pool with the slides.  We went off season so the Disneyland park has short hours which made it hard to find the right time to use the pool (which of course the kids really wanted to do).  I didn't want us to miss park time for the pool.  The pool is open 8a-5p.  The park doesn't open until 10a so we thought we would let the kids do the slides from 8-10.  Wrong!  For some reason the hotel decided to do lifeguard training from 8a-10a while we were there so no way around loosing time at the park for this kids to slide.  They have another pool that's open

As a small family of 2 I decided to take my son to Disneyland for 10 Days where he could experience the enjoyment and magic I love about everything Disney. So January we made the journey, a 14 hour flight to Disneyland!  I have been to Disneyland 3 previous times but never to the Disneyland hotel. For this special occasion I decided to stay at a neighbouring hotel for half the trip then on his birthday we would stay at the Disneyland Hotel. We ended up staying there for 4 nights.  On arrival we were greeted extremely warmly, everyone was happy and helpful. We even got a room before 10am! (Thanks guys)  The room was in the fantasy tower!! I LOVED IT searching around the room for hidden mickeys was a cool welcome, then above our bed was a wooden head board with the castle on it!!

My friend and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel on the 22nd January- 25th January, 2014. We were so excited to stay here being our first time at Disneyland and staying at one of their hotels. The staff were happy to help with any questions we had, went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable as possible and made our very first time at Disneyland a fun and relaxing time. I strongly recommend anyone who is looking to stay near Disneyland to stay here. It is an amazing hotel with great staff, clean rooms, and so much fun!

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel the summer of 2013. We had 4 adults and 3 children with is and stayed in a two bedroom suite. The hotel is made up of 3 towers and a fourth building that contains meeting rooms and Goofy's kitchen. Our room was very nice, if not a little sterile. We were in the Frontier Tower and it was quite a hike to the main building and an even further hike to downtown disney. We had reserved a suite that was supposed to have 2 rooms, one with two queens and one with a king. We ended up with two kings, which was inconvenient with 3 kids and 4 adults. My youngest ended up sleeping on a makeshift bed from the couch cushions, as he did not want to be out on the fold out bed in the living room with his brother (understandable, he was 3). Having 2 queens in our

Amazing. Cant wait to go back with our girls. Friendly helpful staff, beautiful views, easy access to parks and downtown Disney restaurants. Also early morning access to disney land. Room service is delicious as well as Goffys kitchen.

We love this hotel!  Check in was quick and the cast members were helpful and courteous.  The pool area is so nice and the restaurant by the pool has good food.  My kids love the beds with the lights and music--it just adds a little bit of Disney magic to your stay.

The Disney hotel is in a great location for exploring the Disney parks. With a 3yr old it was easy to come and go from the parks as needed. And the pools offer great relief from the long days exploring Disneyland.

Our family of 4 stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights from January 5-9. Disney knows what they're doing! Walking into the lobby, we were greeted with Christmas carolers, as we were there for the end of the holiday season. The teacups in the lobby were a nice touch too. As first time visitors, we were given "1st Visit" pins to wear. All the cast members we encountered at both parks always had us leaving their attraction with a "enjoy your 1st visit!" comment. We stayed in the Frontier Tower which is the furthest of the 3 towers from the entrance. But don't be fooled; it is not by much. Maybe a 1 minute walk? Hardly noticeable at all. Our room overlooked the pool area. The "Happiest Place on Earth" really became our very own once we saw our room. Disney touches are evident

Summary Heading: The Happiest Place on Earth - Definitely
Summary: Visited  Disneyland with three of our children and the Disneyland Hotel was an excellent choice and we will be returning very soon.  If you are considering where to stay for a trip to Disneyland do yourself a favour and book this Hotel.  Yes it is very convenient to Disneyland, California Park and the various shops and restaurants located outside Disneyland but the Hotel itself makes the stay extra special.  The rooms are a good size with quality fittings and furniture.  The lovely Disney theme that is continued throughout the Hotel and rooms is magical and makes it fun.  The Hotel amenities such as good quality onsite food and bars along with the fantastic pool and convenience of an onsite coin operated laundry make for an easy and relaxing stay where the whole family can enjoy

Summary Heading: AMAZING...this is part of the experience
Summary: This hotel was definitely what made the holiday.  The attention to detail is amazing, down to the head board lit up in fairy lights, Mickey Mouses head on the taps and towel holders.  Amazing....  Our room looked out onto the pool which was the best pool in a hotel I have ever had.  They have a number of sections of the pool for different age groups.  The water slides were an absolute hit with my 4 year old who wanted to keep going back to the pool and water slides rather than visit the theme parks.  The cabanas are like no other cabana I have ever seen with TV, fridge, IPod docking station, fruit platter, water, curtains, safe, comfy sun beds and couches.  The staff are over the top friendly but this is not in a bad way at all, this really helps with experience.  The rooms are

This was a great choice! Walking distance to parks, driving distance to other Anaheim spots.  The head board on all the beds have a castle/fireworks that lights up and has music.  Kid and adult friendly.  Great restaurants within the hotel, poolside also nice with special monorail surprise by the children's pool.   Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great location, nice large, renovated rooms!
Summary: Ideal location near the monorail station and Lego store in Downtown Disney.  Better value than the Grand Californian, with large, nicely renovated rooms.  Large pool is a great spot to wind down after a long day in the parks (no shortage of life guards!)  We had a 66 year old first-time visiter with us and the staff at the front desk did a great job of making it a memorable introduction to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: My New Hotel of Choice when going to Disneyland
Summary: My Company was having a conference on the Disneyland Hotel Property.  I stayed at the hotel for a total of 3 nights, and was quite pleased with my experience here.  Customer Service: Check in starts at 3, however I arrived at 9 am and they promptly gave me my room in the main Fantasy tower which was great.  A few minutes after I got to my room, housekeeping knocked on my door to ask if everything in the room was ok.  For the most part, customer service was great and the cast members are courteous.  There was one day however when I thought my room wasn't cleaned thoroughly.  Glasses were still left on the counter and sheets were not tucked in all the way.  Otherwise, service was great  Facilities: Facilities are great!  I love Disney, so the extra touches such as the artwork,

Great hotel stayed there in December and loved it. Had a downtown disney/theme park view which was incredible especially at night. The rooms are huge we had 4 people and more at sometimes but never felt crowded. Of course the headboards were a hit. The hotel is beautiful and spotless with friendly staff. The concierge lounge was awesome food and drinks were fresh and plenty of it. Watched the fireworks one night in there and loved it. I would not go to Disneyland and not stay at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Just a business hotel- no Disney experience at all
Summary: We wanted to stay at a Disney hotel and were willing to pay extra to get the full Disney experience. So disappointed - there are no characters, no Disney touches, at all. Just a business hotel a long way from the Park. Also they put us in the wrong room and check in was difficult. I reserved through Disney Travel and will never do so again. Far too much money for too few services.

We stayed here for 3 nights whilst visiting the Disneyland Resort.  Check in was very efficient and friendly and we were given a pool view room in the Frontier tower which was clean and well maintained with some nice Disney touches.  We liked being in the Frontier tower as it was the nearest to Downtown Disney and thus the walk to the parks.  The room was large and the bed comfortable; we did not experience any issues with noise.  The pool area is large and clean with a number of slides although the water was a little cold for us in October.  The biggest benefit, and what made it worth the extra cost over non-Disney hotels, is the Extra Magic Hour we received each day giving us a head start over non-resort guests each day.  This is particularly beneficial for California

We stayed 3 nights at Disneyland Hotel and with our package deal we had 3 days entry to the park, $10 ESPN vouchers, a free photo and a pin and lanyard each.  When we checked in the cast member, as they call themselves, was friendly and helpful.  Our room was spacious and the fireworks lights on our bed head that played music was a special touch. We even saw the fireworks from our room on Saturday night, but for some reason there were no fireworks Sunday night even though the brochure said there would be.  When I asked for some cotton wool, I was told they didn't have any on the phone, when I asked guest relation I was told they didn't have any; when people are travelling for days, or in our case weeks, having these things makes a difference. When I tried to leave the park to go

Really a nice redo on the hotel. I brought my family for a couple of days to Disney and I was very impressed by the quality of the room.  It was of course very expensive for a room. Not unexpected during Christmas week. There was a kind of mixed Disney crowd which for better for worse was what we came for. It was very convenient to the park and early entry was nice.   A positive place for sure and other than the price I was very happy.

Summary Heading: The best it has ever been...
Summary: We planned our New Years Eve trip on short notice so we couldn't get into the CA Adventure Hotel where we've stayed before.  We were pleasantly surprise how great this remodeled hotel turnout to be.  We've stayed here several times over the past 40 years.  This is by far the best this place has been in its' life.  The bed mattresses were extremely comfortable.  As with all Disney properties, the place is in always  super clean condition.   The location of this place, relatively close to the monorail stop makes it a great place to stay, though not as convenient as the CA Adventure Hotel.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in early Dec 2013. We came out (from MN) for my son's 5th birthday and it was our first visit to Disneyland (we have been to Disney World several times). The Hotel was awesome. The lobby was modern and beautiful and since we were there during the Christmas season it was fully decked out. During check in they asked if we were there for a special occasion, we told them it was our son's Birthday and the person checking us in took note and gave our son a Happy Birthday button, asked who was his favorite Disney character and then got an autographed picture for him. It was a great way to start off the visit. Our room was on the 6th floor of the Fantasy Tower overlooking the pool area. The room was large, VERY CLEAN, modem and looked like it was just

Stayed Christmas week, 3 nites.  None of the common complaints factored into my stay.  I arrived at 7am to check in. They had a room available.  I asked for some kind of view, and they gave me one no problem.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower, on the 6th floor, facing the Matterhorn (and parking lot), and we had a great view of the fireworks.  The elevators were NEVER slow (another common complaint in these reviews).  The room was good enough for our purposes. Beds very comfortable.  Room clean.  Self parking not too far from the lobby.  The monorail is a 3-4 minute walk.  The Grand Cal DCA entrance was more like 10, and the front gates 15.  I was worried that the hotel would be too far, but it was great.  The pools were heated, but not enough for our liking.  Probably 78

Met all of my expectations and more. The staff was marvelous. They even decorated our room at turn down for our anniversary! The room was wonderful. Room service was prompt and good. Try the Mickey Waffle with the bananas foster---Yummm!  My only pout is that I couldn't buy the robe so that I could pretend I was back in the "Happiest Place on Earth."

Summary Heading: Great room, walking distance from theme parks
Summary: While it is walking distance to Disneyland, California Adventure, Disney's Grand Californian Resort, Paradise Pier Hotel & Downtown Disney, you are definitely going to get a workout if you plan to stay here & go to the parks for more than a couple days. We were there for 6 days and we're completely worn out at the end of each day. Unlike Disney World where they have busses to take you from the entrance of the hotel to the entrance of the parks, you will be walking everywhere. The monorail is a fairly short walk from the Disneyland Hotel and will take you to Disneyland, however the drop off point ins inside the park (Tomorrow Land) not the park entrance. The only way to get to California Adventure is to walk.   I will also note the "meal plan" program at Disneyland is completely

Disneyland hotel was as expected. Our room was a basic, clean, 2 queen bed hotel room with a few disney "flares" that were cute but nothing spectacular. It would be nice if they offered more suites in a place where families dominate. We checked in at 4:15 and our originally assigned room was not ready, however the nice staff seemed to "find" us something which was nice. Our view was of he pool which was no big deal. It is really convenient to buy tickets from the desk and also have entrances to the parks via the monorail and to the Adventureland park via their other nearby property. It would be nice if there was not as long as a wait for the hotel guests as we certainly paid premium prices compared to other nearby hotels. It is disneyland so EVERYTHING is overpriced.

Summary Heading: Loved the Mickey details, but terrible housekeeping!
Summary: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so we had to wait 30 minutes with 2 toddlers while they prepared a room.  The 1st room was by a noisy service elevator, so we were upgraded to  different room.  The room was roomy enough for the pack n play and had space for our one year old to crawl.   We loved the Mickey details, our upgraded view of Downtown Disney and the Magic Mornings.  What we didn't like was the TERRIBLE house-keeping!  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so we had to wait 30 minutes to clean it.  One of the days we came back after 2 pm to put the kids down for a nap and our room wasn't vacuumed and the beds were only partially made!  The following day, we came in and the room again was poorly cleaned.  Having a crawling baby on a dirty floor was very upsetting.

Booked a room for 1 night for my daughter's 12th birthday and it was well worth the price.  Arrived several hours early and they had a room ready for us.  She brought 3 friends along to enjoy the pool and water slide on Sunday afternoon, then had a meal and cupcakes in the room.  The friends went home early evening and we enjoyed some time in the park that night, then used the Magic Morning early entry and also got a Passholder bonus of 2 Fastpass tickets each for any ride.  Monday morning we were able to ride California Screamin' 3 times, Toystory Mania 2 times, and Radiator Springs Racers 2 times in about 40 minutes!  After that the park got crazy busy and wait times for some rides were 110 minutes during the day, so we really appreciated that we could ride what we wanted very

We have stayed several times over the years. The hospitality is always the best. Spend the extra money and pay for the E Ticket club. You have snacks, desserts, drinks, and best of all, firework from the 11 floor - no crowd hassles. Eat at Steakhouse 55, it is very good.

Hello!  We just attended a wedding at the Disney hotel in late December. Surprisingly, it didn't seem too busy, and there didn't appear to be any other weddings.  Now, we had all kinds of problems, many of them involving the hotel. I was part of the groomsmen party, but the girls have their entire own list of terrible things that happened. I'll let the girls do their own perspective - but this is from my own perspective of the guys side.  Groom, groomsmen, and groomsguests arrived to the Disney hotel. When we asked where we were to go and change, we were immediately sent to the Nile room. Grabbed all our stuff, headed that direction, and found that was actually the girl's changeroom - and the bride was there. Had to return to the front desk and ask for a separate Guys changroom,

I recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, as expected the service was excellent and friendly at Disney.   They were able to get me into my room right away even though I arrived very early.  The room was a good size with a view of the pool and all those little Disney decor touches you'd expect at a Disney property including fiber optic fireworks in the artwork over the bed.   The hotel is just steps from Downtown Disney and a quick Monorail ride or walk into the park.    Also, the Magic Morning hour for being a hotel guest is also a major plus!

Summary Heading: Quite a few blunders but they more than made up for it!
Summary: We booked three rooms and arrived after a very long and tiring flight from Europe to find our room was not ready till after 8pm and spent 30 minutes standing with all our suitcases outside the room as it was being cleaned. When it finally was, there were a few issues- minibar not filled, no shower curtain etc but the staff were great. They were extremely responsive to our dissatisfaction and went above and beyond what was needed to correct this. This has made our stay pleasant (& we are still here!)  It's the perfect place to stay if you want to take full advantage of being in Disneyland.

Decided to splurge and stay at The Disneyland Hotel for our daughter's 18th birthday. What an amazing experience. Service was exceptional, with an autographed Mickey photo for my daughter and room upgrade on check-in. Loved all the Disney touches in the room and everything spotless as expected. We had premium pool view room in the Frontier Tower. Gorgeous view of resort and fireworks. Loved the ability  to tune in the music from the park while the fireworks were shot off. Will be returning.

Stayed for two nights - had a great time.  Hotel was nice. Rooms are sufficient for what it is- a place to stay when you are not in the park.  Everything here is within walking distance. Tiki bar and coffee shop were great.  Pool is nice but crowded. Steakhouse 55 was cool "vintage" restaurant.

Stop now if you are a light sleeper because you can easily hear people in the other rooms, book the Grand Californian you won't regret it.   If you are going to be tired or don't care... read on.     We are Disney fans and previous stayed at the Grand Californian. Staying as a Disney guest is excellent, personally you can't beat walking to the parks, home delivery of your in park shopping and entry into DCA (Yep Cars land an hour before other visitors).  We come along way and therefore stay for a week, so all this counts to offset the $.   After initially booking the Grand Californian we decided to try the recently renovated Disneyland Hotel.  The experience is very good from the first walk in to leaving.   The new room decor is very nice and balanced Disney with modern well.

Close to facilities, great access to park & great pool, close to Orange county for shopping, plenty of food options, Character restaurants, close to hire cars and easy to LAX. The kids slept well everyday 3 days was plenty infact, hotel stay enables fast passes - which are a must for popular rides- Disneyland California Adventureland was my favourite: Cars & California flying were a highlight, tower of terror was frightening for our 9 yr old but the staff support was awesome. Aladdin show was theatrically brilliant for all ages.

Summary Heading: Pay the money and stay here
Summary: We took our 4 year old granddaughter for her first visit to Disneyland with the rest of the family and this is the only place to stay.....the personnel from the front desk to the servers, valets, to the housekeeping staff, are awesome, so concerned about your experience.  Staying here you get a "magic hour" to get into the parks early, and this is worth the price.  There are good options for dining, just expect that it is a resort, so you will pay for it....we had dinner at the Steak House and it was impressively good (I wasn't expecting much and was very surprised at the quality of the food and the healthy options both for children and adults)  The monorail which used to leave from the hotel to go into the park, now leaves from Downtown Disney a short walk from the hotel.  This

Summary Heading: The best way to do Disneyland
Summary: We visited Disneyland with 3 kids under 10 and stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel/room were fine - spacious and clean. The winning feature is that you are so close to the park (10 min walk) and thus can come and go as you please. Taking advantage of the magic hour to get in at 8am for the general public is great but we needed to come back for a few hours over lunchtime to rest and for the kids to go in the pool (which is great).  For breakfast avoid Goophys Kitchen which was gross (pizza and chocolate cake for breakfast?) and eat next door at Steakhouse 55 which was actually much cheaper and a proper civilised restaurant with great service to boot (other than taking 10 minutes and 3 staff to make a reservation when it was mostly empty every morning).

This hotel is right near the disneyland park. It's kind of expensive but worth it if you are going to the parks. The pools and restaurants are very nice , great for kids . The room was very clean and the service was very good. Everyone was very " happy"!

Summary Heading: Worth it if you can afford it.
Summary: Visiting Disneyland for the 4th time but had never stayed here before. It was my dream to stay here but coming from Australia and having lots of other expense I just couldn't justify the price over the hotels on Harbour. This time I bit the bullet and I'm glad I did. We stayed a week so quite and expense but the convenience of being right by Downtown Disney and a huge array of restaurants etc. couldn't be beat! The monorail into Tomorrow land was also only about 3 mins away.  We stayed In the Adventure tower overlooking the pool area which was fabulous. Really there is nothing else like it in Anaheim and during the afternoon heat it was certainly a welcome relief to come back to to freshen up. Tricky to get sun lounges or chairs especially on weekends though. The pools are

Summary Heading: Crappy. Do not stay here. If you want great service, go to The Grand Floridian in Orlando.
Summary: The worst concierge service I have ever had. Do not stay here. If you must, do not spend the money for the club floor. Rachel is great, but YIKES!!! The view is nice. Our room had been unoccupied for I don't know how long based on the dust, but they made us sit around and wait until "time." Go to The Grand Floridian. Avoid California at all costs!!!

while very expensive this hotel is awesome.Extremely close to the park-our car stayed parked & the decorations & the nostalgia in the lobby were amazing!The Monorail pool was superfun-my daughter loved it & my teenage daughter loved the coffee shop.

I  think this place is loosing its touch. We used to stay here every year when kids were small and stayed here last year with kids and grand kids. But this year stay was very disappointing. They charge for bags of tea but not for coffee. Worse than any place I have been to. Took long time for to get response to calls. The price for the Disneyland keeps on going up and the wait time at each ride anywhere from 30- 60- 120 minutes ,figure how many rides you can get a day . Not worth it. Next year taking Grandkids elsewhere. Exorbitantly overpriced hotel .

Most comfortable bed ever! Location perfect, 5 mins to both parks down through Disney Way with shops and restaurants. Clean rooms, good size.  Pool area sheltered. My kids 11 and 10 so the hydro slide a bit tame for them. Front desk, shop assistants at the hotel always happy and helpful but the pool staff seemed aloof and a bit miserable all the time. We were high in Frontierland and had a great view of fireworks from disneyland. Drinks from machine available on all floors but you could not use cash, had to use credit card.  Although the shop down at reception does sell drinks for the same price. If you want to order birthday cakes etc you do need to give 3 days notice.  Espn and earl of sandwich restaurants within 1 minute. Espn is a sports bar and restaurant whereas we had

Pro - location Con - overpriced If convienence is what you are seeking being close to park then yes, but otherwise hotel is way overpriced for what you are paying for.  No help from bell desk when checking in, front desk service was ok, but not "Disney" special.  You can save a few hundreds of dollars a night by staying at a "neighbor"hotel and would be better off in my opinion.

It's all about the children when you stay here, and perfection was everywhere as far as they were concerned! So while you might notice a thing here and there, it's all good.  We got the least expensive room, so that means a parking lot view at the Frontier Tower. Warning: you will hear other people's children next door as you try to sleep. The hotel complex has been renovated, so most everything has more current look. A crib is available to you in the closet, and there are many fun Disney details in the room. The grounds are well manicured and clean, the staff is friendly, and the proximity to the park/shops is priceless.

Summary Heading: It might be Disney but save your money for something else
Summary: After waiting 30 years to finally afford a stay at the Disneyland Hotel I was sadly disappointed.  The rooms are a good size and comfortable but not having hot water the entire stay was a downer.  They did explain that they were having some type of issue adn were working on it but I found it odd that the water from the sink was hot but not the shower.  Finally on day three when I called again and expressed my complete displeasure in spending $350 a night for no hot water they discounted the room price.  The hotel is no closer than the ones on Harbor Blvd such as the Ramada Inn Maingate so it is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  I've been going to Disneyland every year around the same time for the last several years and stayed at several different hotels and although this is

I can't say enough good about the Disneyland Hotel!!  They go above and beyond in their service and hospitality.  From the moment we were greeted at the front desk, we were whisked into the Disney Magic. The hotel is beautiful as are the grounds.  We had a beautiful room with a balcony on the top floor of the Frontier Tower that looked into Cars Land at California Adventure.  The staff is so friendly and the pool is awesome.  Our 9 year old couldn't get enough of the water slides and our 6 year old liked the smaller water slide and the shallower water for smaller kids.  The pool has life vests for kids of all ages and plenty of hot tubs and lounge chairs for moms and dads and the mai tais are delicious.  It's a short walk from the hotel to the Disneyland and California Adventure

On arrival we where surprised that no one would help with bags, so we took our bags to check in and was told our room was not available, come back later, fair enough I thought as we where a few hours early, so we dropped bags off at bell desk which where happy to help store bags,  Returned later in the afternoon and our room was ready, pleasantly surprised with the room, great view of the pool, I did pay extra for that. spent two nights. Overall a good stay, great character buffet breakfast. The only issue was a lumpy bed and the chaos at reception with huge queues. Had previously stayed at the grand Californian, I think we would go back there in the future for that little extra disney magic.

Overall the hotel and staff were excellent.  We had a fabulous stay at Disneyland Hotel many years ago and this trip did not disappoint either.   Staff was friendly. Rooms were clean and well-appointed. The walls were paper thin and I could hear the family next door quite often, but it didn't bother us too much.  I would recommend Disneyland Hotel over the Grand Californian if you are trying to choose between the two. The experience is much friendlier at the Disneyland Hotel and the rooms more spacious and better furnished.

This hotel is expensive.  I know.  What a way to start a review.  But why mince words?  About 10 years ago, my family stayed at the Paradise Pier because it was only about $10 more per night than the Best Western that my parents stayed in when we did a multi-family trip.  But since then the hotels owned by Disney have gone up in price... considerably!  We haven't stayed in a Disney hotel at Disneyland since, just because of the cost.  But my daughter and I decided to splurge this time because she was celebrating her 16th birthday, and I was celebrating my 40th (yes, on the same day... no, it wasn't planned, the birthday-sharing, not the trip).  Anyway, even at that, we couldn't have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel the whole time.  It was just too expensive.  So we did a

Summary Heading: What A Great Hotel and Staff
Summary: Just returned home from a great vacation.  The hotel was in tip top form, and the staff were great.  Every one of the employees went out of their way to make sure your stay was what you expected.  The only thing that was missing in the hotel room was a microwave.  We were there when they experienced a wind storm and there were leaves all over that night, but by the next morning, you couldn't tell there was anything going on.  On our last day before we left, we went to Goofy's Kitchen for breakfast and our 6 year old son was upset because we had to leave.  He received a hug from Pluto and he even wiped his eyes.  By the time Pluto walked him to the front of the restaurant, he was smiling and laughing, so that alone has made us want to come back.  This hotel and all it's employees

We're visiting our daughter and 2 grandchildren in Santa Barbara for pre-Xmas and decided to take them to Disney - we're we going for them or us??? We were created at the hotel by a wonderful happy hand waving doorman who set things off well and put us all in a good mood. The hotel is excellent and the staff are as you would expect, very friendly. We had adjoining rooms on the 9th floor overlooking Downtown Disney (and the fireworks) which were great. If certainly recommend the hotel to anyone coming to Disneyland!!

We've stayed at the Grand Californian and the Paradise Pier and I think this is right in the middle. The service was good, we stayed in the Dreams tower, which has been recently renovated. The headboard has an etching of Sleeping Beauty's castle and above that are fireworks lit up with LED lights. When you push a button on the bedside lamp, it plays "when you wish upon a star." The room was very spacious especially in comparison to the rooms we've had at the Grand Californian. The bathroom has two sinks and a separate room for the toilet. Awesome! We'll definitely be back.

First the customer service line that took my call was spot on about everything when he recommended this hotel over paradise pier. This hotel is attached to downtown disney so walking the area is easy. Walking to the disney parks is short, and the area is like a big festival. I'll leave that review for the park. As for this hotel, the rooms are well designed and clean, typical of what you'd expect of a high dollar resort. The decor is nice and the rooms comfortable, and quiet which is a must for me. The rooms are not of cheap design, especially when considering its only the midrange hotel, there is still a higher end hotel in the park. I found this was worth the money and didn't need to fork out more for a room we didn't spend a lot of time in. The pools were nice and apparently

Had good stay at hotel.  Travelled with sister and 3 year old who was visiting Disneyland for the first time. Room large and clean. Had pool view, but paid for it. The Holiday decorations were lovely. Distance to park not a problem even with a three year old. Was disappointed in the lack of magical ( Disney) experiences . It was no better or worse than any generic hotel I have stayed at. No special greeting at check for the little one an no towel animals when room attended too though this had happened when we stayed at Disneyworld ( with no children).  Overall a good stay but considering the price would not choose to stay here again unless I was lucky enough to get a great deal. I will be in the area again in march and had considered changing my booking at a hotel outside of

Live like 40 minutes away but decided to come here and stay with my family from out of town. It was cool to stay at an actual Disney hotel. I didn't pay, so I can't comment on the pricing, but it is definitely a great place to stay if you want the whole Disney experience. It's not really right next to the park, but you feel like you are still involved which makes you feel close. I know there are tons of hotels around Disneyland, but this one is the real deal! I'll hopefully be able to take my kids here someday!

Keep in mind as i say this I'm aware that you are paying for location.   Plus side is it's right at the edge of downtown Disney. Has a character dining in the hotel (goofy) and has recently been updated.    Negatives.   Expensive and again its near downtown but i felt not worth it even with a military discount.   Old decor and feel. Recently renovated but they forgot to update some of the door rugs.   Elevators take way too long ended up just taking the stairs after i couldn't wait any more.   Still pretty far away from Disney. Takes a good 15 min to get into tomorrowland and if you want to go to ca adventures walk.

Amazing for kids, an absolute must for everyone who visits! The room was large and clean, and the headboard with lights was amazing! We were able to watch the fireworks at night, and had easy access to the parks by day. Pure magic!

Summary Heading: Gave up on Disney properties at Anaheim, but glad I changed my mind!!
Summary: Hi, this family trip to Disneyland we were going to stay with another chain outside the park, which we had not done before, as we always stay on a Disney property, the reason why we were looking outside was that our last experience at The Grand Californian (see previous review) was so disappointing that we felt for all the $$$ Disney costs it was not worth it.  But after long hours of reading reviews of other hotels etc, we decided to give it one more shot and chose the Disneyland hotel, which we had not been to since the renovations, and boy did we make the right choice, as pass holder members we were upgraded to a better room, with a "little view" of Disneyland, but at night we could see the fireworks, staff were all very accommodating and the pool (which we spent a lot of

The hotel was perfect for our family outing (Dec. 2 - 6). The property is beautifully landscaped and maintained, with three buildings set around a huge swimming pool. The rooms were spotless and large, with Disney touches on the walls, carpets, and faucets. The kids were delighted with the lighted castle above the bed. A small refrigerator is in the room.The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms a bit small, but perfectly adequate. My only disappointment were the sealed windows; while the heat/AC unit was quiet and efficient, you wake up dry-mouthed without fresh air.  As at Disneyland, the hotel staff all seemed genuinely pleased to help, answer any questions, or respond to any request. They were especially good with the kids (ages 5 and 8) and Disney characters are likely to

I visited the park a couple of weeks ago with family on the way down to San Diego and I must say I was very impressed.  I don't usually write reviews but the service I received was amazing. During our visit our daughter got sick and we had to cut our trip short after only 2 hours. We figured that we were out of luck and would still have to pay for our room and tickets but everyone from the hotel staff to the Disney park were amazing!! No questions ask, they offered to reimburse our hotel stay and not charge us a cancelation fee and also helped us to communicate with the park and arrange to have our tickets reissued for a future time or receive a full refund. We opted to come back another time because of the experience we've had so far.

Fairly expensive but a great hotel with children. My granddaughters love the headboards that light up with fireworks and play music.  If you plan to stay later in the park on your check out day, the Bell Desk keeps all your luggage and you can retrieve it at the end of the day. Very quick and efficient service.  Valet service always fantastic. Goofy's kitchen fun for young kids and old, who doesn't want to do the Makarena with Goofy??.  Service in all areas of the hotel is always topnotch!! Not a long walk from the hotel to either park. Downtown Disney has many great shops.

I think when the hotel was remodeled a few years ago, they removed the magic.  Staff were pleasant and accommodating, just not crisp.  Valets greeted everyone.  Bellmen watched people schlep bags and did not offer to help.  Shuttle Express was an added cost but a valuable service.  Rooms were clean.  Prices were typically touristy and overpriced.  Convenient location to the park. Convention staff need to be re-educated to the Disney way.  And if you are in a hurry the elevators are very slow and you will usually wait a few cycles to get onto the elevators.  Go  the stairs if you are healthy enough.

Although expensive it was well worth the price we paid.  The staff were super friendly and helpful.  We were walking distance to the Disneyland parks and Downtown Disney.  The room was super clean roomy and full of hidden mickeys.  The hotel pool and water slides were fantastic.  We enjoyed every minute of being there and even at 4am the staff wore a smile and were extremely helpful.  I highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here several nights for a conference.  Have been here many times.  Apparently has been remodeled a few years ago and the rooms are much improved.  Plenty of space, beds comfortable, LCD TV, refrigerator.  Has an interesting large wooden backboard of the Disneyland castle that lights up and plays a bit of music.  Obviously very close to the parks and also Downtown Disney.  Service was very good.  Noise was not a factor.

Stayed here 3 nights for a conference. Hotel is fine. Staff are all very nice and are obviously well trained in the Disney corporate behaviour. Room was fine, clean, and the bed was comfortable. My room had a small refrigerator, which was nice to have. This is more affordable than the other hotel at Disneyland, so if you are visiting the park it will save you money. Everything around in the "Disney Town" (which is just an outdoor mall) is expensive--actually quite overpriced, in my view. My biggest complaint is that they play music outside all the time and every morning if I woke up early, I would here the incessant music, which made it hard to get back to sleep. No reason to stay here unless you are visiting the theme park or attending a meeting, as there are many hotels in the

We have not stayed at the Disneyland Hotel since the remodel.  I am so happy with the changes!  It makes a world of difference.  We loved our stay this last weekend.  We booked a standard view room but ANDREW from the Front Desk was very nice to upgrade us to the Adventure Land Tower with a Downtown Disney view.  We were given a corner room on the 7th floor.  It was wonderful!  Very big!  Very nice!  Our room just topped the Mickey hat on the side of the building.  The walk through Downtown Disney didn't seem so bad from this tower and the monorail was running when we needed it.  My son loved the new monorail waterslides!  I unfortunately got very sick during our stay.  The Front Desk was nice enough again to extend a late check out for the day since our flight was not leaving

We had stayed at the Disneyland Hotel years ago before the renovation. The property was perfect in every way for the five of us. Be sure to take advantage of the (Early Entry) Magic Hours, too. You can even ride the Monorail with early entry which drops you off by the Matterhorn. We shuttled in from the airport, so no rental car, but none was needed for the four days we stayed. Looking forward to our next stay there already.

Excellent whimsy hotel for the whole family.  The hotel and the rooms are well appointed and are very clean.  High quality and excellent service - you surely get what you pay for! The lighted headboards (fireworks & the castle) were a hit with the kids!  Conveniently located within a short walking distance to Downtown Disney and Disneyland/California.  Beds are very comfortable - Bathrooms are sparkly clean.  They do a good job maintaining their facilities and everything seems to be in good working order.

We stayed for three days at the Disneyland Hotel in August. It is a pricey stay, but well worth it. We only got our rooms because Hotels.com was running a deal that allowed for 13% off the rate. So, understandably we had a very basic room on the second floor and overlooking the parking lot. Sounds terrible, right? WRONG! The room was gorgeous with all the Disney touches that make it so special including Mickey Mouse faucet, wall paper and sconces. It also had a beautiful headboard with pin lights imitating the fireworks show. The best surprise of all is that our room had a great view of the fireworks. We traveled with our four year old (for his birthday) and four month old so fireworks were too late at the park. But, what to our wondering eyes should appear but the fireworks

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for two weeks, it was excellent, check in was a breeze, our room was excellent, very roomy, after reading reviews on here I was concerned the rooms would be a little small, however that was not the case at all.  We were pretty much left to ourselves for the entire two weeks. The pool was fantastic, the lifeguards were amazing, and there was plenty of them.    We ate at various restaurants throughout all three hotels and they were great, we went to Goofy’s Kitchen three times as my children loved it there, yes it is expensive, which is why we only went three times, but the kids absolutely love it!    The only complaint I had, was housekeeping left our room unlocked not once, but twice, both times I contacted the front desk and they advised me

Coming to Disneyland Hotel just made the whole Disney experience even more fantastic! The room was wonderful. We stayed in the Fantasy Towers and our room had the headboard carved with the castle and if you pressed a button something special would happen! You have to try it to find out :). The food was amazing and the service impeccable! We would certainly come back.

I must say I had my doubts at first simply because Disneyland has been around so long. After a two-day conference, I must say it is still first-class. Beds are great, service is great and rooms could not be cleaner. Although the property has been around a long time, it is still at the top of Disney's standards.

We had just left a very miserable stay in Las Vegas and drove to Disneyland for 2 nights at this hotel.  Checked in and were surprised to get a beautiful room with a balcony with a view of the parks!  The headboard had a LED fireworks pattern on it that was very nice mood lighting and played "A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes."    The room definitely showed its age but was still a great experience after the previous days in Vegas.  We also got the 2 day park hopper tickets and since the hotel is right at the edge of Downtown Disney it was an easy walk to the monorail for Magic Kingdom or to the front gates.  Hoping we can do this trip again sometime soon!

This is my first visit to the Disneyland Hotel since they remodeled the hotel.  Service is still first rate.  Don't miss the special effect they have placed on the headboard of the beds.  It is nice to stay close to the parks too.  While it is the oldest of the hotels, it is still magical and majestic.

I haven't stayed here since I was a kid and they had Villas! I knew this was going to be a great stay. Especially with knowing they had refurbed recently. We got our stay for a steal (I am not at liberty to say how though). The rooms are Disney with elegance. The rooms are beautiful in every way possible. We had our room in the Fantasy Tower facing the fireworks. The rooms are larger from what I remember. The famous head boards above the bed are (what else?) impressive! We used the switch to turn on the lights and hear "A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes" every night before crashing out after a long day at the parks. Everything down to the carpet was elegance with that perfect Disney touch. The bathrooms weren't anything overly spacious, but then again we weren't in a suite. The

I think I’m in love with a hotel.  You read that right—I am in love with a hotel, and it’s name is Disneyland Hotel.  This sexy beast is the original hotel in Disneyland Resort but was recently renovated for a better room experience.  We spent many nights at the Grand Californian, so the Disneyland Hotel was a new experience.  When we entered the room it was lovely.  The room was very Disney-oriented, quite different from the Grand Californian where the theme is wood.    The beds were pretty and that backboard lit up when I pressed a switch on the light in-between the bed.  It also had a music box sound that played the Cinderella song chorus of “A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes”.   I loved the pillows on each queen bed.  I wanted to stuff those pillows in my luggage.  The

Summary Heading: Worth it to be on resort
Summary: We checked in at 1am, and the night staff was very upbeat, which started off a great holiday. We were told we were upgraded to Concierge, but had to turn it down because our whole family wouldn't fit in the 1 king bed it came with. We had to be downgraded to get 2 queen beds and a day bed. That was fine, it's what we had paid for. The room was nicely updated and the beds were comfortable. The thing that made this hotel worth the $$ was the location. I have stayed at the Grand Californian, and didn't find the extra 2 minute walk to the parks to be a big deal. I actually liked the "feel" of this hotel better. I used the room delivery for purchases quite often, and was well informed that the would not be available until the next day. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great convenience when going to disney parks.
Summary: Great hotels that put you in the thick of the parks. Easy walk that's closest to parks. You can use bell service buying souvenirs at the park that will be sent to the front desk. Make sure you bring your picture ID with you because although you can buy most anything with your room key but they verify who you are every time with a photo ID. Pool looked amazing with water slides. Pack and plays in every room. You also get 1 hour early entry to the parks. Well worth it to stay at the disney hotels.

Great for kids, pricey, clean, well-staffed.  No microwaves in rooms (every other hotel in area offers these). TV channels don't include many basic cable channels, like Comedy Central, etc. $15 per day parking on top of expensive room charges.

Summary Heading: Good to be on Property...but not necessary
Summary: I have been to Disneyland over a dozen times and this is the first time I've stayed on property. The hotel is a short walk (about 10 minutes) from the front gates. The hotel was nice, not anything superb, but nice. My favorite part was the wood carving with twinkling lights and fireworks over the beds. Our room in the frontier tower did have a view of the fireworks, but not the castle.   I dont think I'll stay on property at Disneyland again. There are not as many benefits as there are at Disney World for hotel guests. Staying off property is much cheaper and doesnt seem to dim any of the magic for me.  I'd rather stay and a hotel across the street, with free parking and free breakfast than pay a premium to be on property.

Summary Heading: A great hotel at a great location
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland hotel because we wanted to stay on property at the Disneyland resort but we didn't want to pay the prices at the "Grand Californian" hotel.  The hotel has a great location at the end of Downtown Disney.  You can walk from the hotel to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and California Adventure.  The water slides (monorail themed) were great for the kids.  The pools were also very spacious.  Even their 2 hot tubs were rather large and could accomodate alot of people.  While there we ate ALL the restaurants (Steakhouse 55 was our favorite!).  We also enjoyed having drinks outside and listening to the live Hawaiian music.  My husband and I enjoyed the alcoholic drinks (you have to try a "Uh Oa!" that is made for 2) while our kids enjoyed "Shirley Temples".

Summary Heading: So fun!! So close to park!!!
Summary: This hotel was so great! The pool was really nice and fun. It was so great to be so close to the park so we could go back and forth throughout the day! The room was roomy and clean. We could watch the fireworks from our room they even pipe the sound in  during the fireworks show. We came with friends but my kids would love it here!

Summary Heading: Great additions, enjoyable stay and service.
Summary: This is the original hotel at Disnyland and it is a treat. The hotel has been renovated and the additions are impressive, from the lobby which is fun for the kids, to the rooms and quality of the beds for a good nights sleep.  We arrived and were greeted by a friendly porter. We realized that one of our wallets was on the loaded luggage and she gladly helped us obtain it before the luggage went to our room.  Handicap parking is tricky depending on when you go.  We would sometimes get a close spot and then other times, had to park further away.  The only negative was when we arrived, our requests for joining rooms was not in the computer and could not be accommodated. With a person with us who requires special needs, this was going to be difficult. I think the blame could be on

I chose the Disneyland Hotel based on reviews here and because it was the original hotel.  We've stayed at the Aulani and were blown away by the level of service.  We upgraded at check in and got access to the Eticket lounge which serves snacks, beverages and breakfast.  We really enjoyed the hotel, the room was spacious and comfortable with a view of Downtown Disney and the fireworks. The Eticket lounge was a blessing!

I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during a conference and was not disappointed. The Disney organization is a very well-run machine, and it shows. I was very impressed by the service of all their "cast", even the guy who took my garbage at lunch thanked me! The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, and the pool area was big and inviting, but a little too cold to enjoy. My room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The only complaint about the room I has was the door to the adjoining room let in a LOT of noise. I love that the rooms have floor to ceiling windows. Initially I was in the Adventure tower on a lower floor, but could hear the music from Downtown Disney booming through the window, so I requested to be moved. I was then placed on a high floor of the Frontier Tower, which

We have stayed at various Disney Vacation Club hotels at Disney World in Florida - which we find to be generally very nice. This was our first trip to Disneyland and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.   Everything seems to run very efficiently and all staff encountered were extremely friendly and helpful.  The pool area is well maintained and the poolside waiter service is an excellent bonus.   Room was clean and we'll maintained throughout our stay.

As a family, we go to Disneyland at least once a year. This was our first time staying on property. For the cost of just this hotel stay, we can usually pay for an entire vacation (including food). I'm a big Disney fan and I was super excited when my husband surprised me with a Disneyland Hotel for our entire vacation!  We booked through priceline.com and paid extra for a "preferred room" and called the hotel to request a view of Down Town Disney so we could see the fireworks from our room. Well, we checked in around 10am and our room wasn't ready. We had tickets for the Halloween Party that day and we needed our room by 1pm at the latest in order to get ready. The guy at the front desk said he'll try to get us a room to see the fireworks & the pool. I thought he was doing us a

We stayed for 1 night for my daughter's birthday. It was trully a magical stay. My daughter (and our family) was so happy with the accomodations, guest services, amenities, etc. We got a complimentsry upgrade with a room facing the pool area. The room was very spacious and had a couch that transformed into a single bed. This sofa bed was the most comfy sofa bes there is! We will look forward to staying here again!

I went to Disneyland's Magic Kingdom with my 18 month old son for the first time with him. I was nervous about bringing him to a big place when he's still fairly young, but as soon as I entered the park, his eyes lit up from the rides, there are changing tables at all restrooms, and I can let him run around Toontown without worrying. We left tired but happy

Stayed 4 nights and really splurged with a 2 room suite.  Since my bedroom had 2 queen beds I took turns with each of the kids.The parents had their own bedroom and there was a pull out couch in the living room   The kids (5&7) loved the musical lights they could turn on in each bedroom. There is a refrigerator and we did bring bowls and spoons so we could have cereal and oatmeal 3 of the mornings.  (It would have been nice to have a microwave too)  The coffee machine in the room was one of the worst i've ever seen and we never got a really good cup of coffee.  If you are there in the off-season or leave the hotel early there is no line at the Monorail so that is a good way to get to Disneyland.  Didn't find a short-cut to Adventureland however. There are 3 outdoor pools and one

We spent four nights at the Disneyland Hotel at the end of October. We met our son and his family and stayed as part of his military rate. The hotel staff was wonderful, and gave us two rooms connected by a foyer —  closing the outside door, and keeping the two inside doors open we had a suite and our two and four year old granddaughters were able to wander back and forth. It is expensive to stay on-site at Disney, but the visit is so much nicer and more fun when you do.

We spent 4 nights at the Disneyland Hotel in September and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a room on the top floor of Fantasy Tower which overlooked the carparks, but as we were so high up our view was predominantly of the hills beyond that. There was also a partial view of Disneyland, and although we weren't in the room for the fireworks, I'm pretty sure you would be able to see them from there room. The room was adequate, not large but comfortable. Our girls, aged 6 and 2, were thrilled with the room, particularly the bedhead once they discovered the switch to turn on the lights and music. They turned it on every night before they went to bed. There are Disney motifs everywhere, from the Mickey Mouse hands wrapped around the lamps in the bathroom, to the carpet design

Summary Heading: A LOT of fun, with a few hick-ups
Summary: This was our first time staying in a resort hotel.  We booked through Costco and got lots of freebies with our room (free ride pic, $20 gift card & free Character Dining for everyone in our party).  THAT alone was $200 worth of stuff.  We picked DH because our kids are young (8 & 4) and we were celebrating the youngest turning four.  We figured it would be the most "magical" for them.   We stayed four days & had a great time.  We arrived EARLY (8:30 am).  We were so excited when we pulled into parking, that parking attendant gave us a Most Excited Car (or something) certificate that gave us free valet parking the whole trip!  Awesome!  Check in was easy, our room was ready & they gave my son an autographed pic of Mickey for his birthday.   Our room: got a pool facing upgrade

The recent renovations make a huge difference!  Room was clean and modern.  In fact, because most of the hotels in Anaheim look quite dated, this hotel seems to be one of the most modern ones.  Recommend!

Summary Heading: As good as anywhere in Disney World
Summary: We go to Walt Disney World multiple times throughout the year and always stay in Deluxe hotels on property.  Our first time at  the Disneyland Hotel was in July 2013 and it is as good or better than the best at WDW, including the Grand Floridian!  The pools at the Disneyland Hotel are great, Trader Sam's is wonderful, and our family had so much fun that when my wife and I went to Las Vegas for a conference in September, we decided to leave Vegas early and go to Disneyland and stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  We weren't disappointed!  Just wish it was closer to Michigan :)

Summary Heading: A few letdowns, but overall can't beat the Disney Magic
Summary: Firstly, I was completely aware I was going to be fleeced for every cent when visiting the Disneyland resort, but I was a little surprised at the $3.50 charge because we asked for a few bowls and spoons (the room does not hold any cutlery or crockery).  This obviously was a daily occurrence as housekeeping would remove them during their clean up.  Goofy's Kitchen on the grounds of the hotel was fun for the kids, and the food wasn't too bad.  Just be aware of the charge as it is expensive.  The Tiki bar was far more affordable, but the food was pretty average.  As for the hotel, there weren't many complaints.  From check in which was efficient and helpful. The staff brought my daughter's buttons when they mentioned their birthday's which was a nice touch. We also received our

Summary Heading: After 25 years, this place STILL has the magic!!!
Summary: I stayed here from OCT. 6 thru the 11th.  I went with my wife and two daughters ages 6 and 7.  We flew in from Hawaii and landed in LAX at 4, Sunday afternoon.  Disney's magical express was waiting right outside our baggage claim area which made the airport transition so smooth.  My girls loved the ambiance of the motor coach with all its Disney charm.  Arriving at the hotel was simply a jaw dropping feeling.  To see that sky blue windows and know that your in Disneyland made it so special and exciting for me and my family.  Check in went super smooth and super fast.  The customer service that greeted us in the lobby was superb.  They had keys for all 4 of us, including the names on them which made it that much more magical for my girls when they saw their names on their own

This was a wonderful vacation with my family. We were celebrating my birthday as well as my grandsons 5th. We requested my grandsons room be decorated to celebrate his special day. It was so much fun watching his delight at all of the decorations. The rooms were great and we were able to watch the fireworks from the room.

Summary Heading: Want to feel like a princess/prince stay here!
Summary: I had studied this hotel for months before our trip. My father wanted to stay as close to the park as we could because of age issues my parents and my 3 year old daughter. We had so much fun! My only regret is that we didn't get to enjoy the amenities as much as I would have liked, like the water slide and the pool and the hot tub. My daughter and parents loved the water slide and the pool.   Now here is the deal, I had studied this hotel for months before our trip. I have seen the bad and the good reviews  for this hotel. I will admit that we upgraded our one bedroom to a concierge room and our other room (we had 9 people) was a suite. We got the best of this hotel I think as the concierge lounge was perfect for our needs. I will also admit that the last time we went to

Checking in at the Disneyland Resort Hotel is one of the worst experiences I've had with any hotel and surprising for Disney.  I waited in line for about 20 mins. when I arrived at around 2:30PM. Finally, I advance to the desk.  Room not ready.  I am asked for my cell # so a text can be sent to me when my room is ready.  I was not offered for my bags to be held, thus, I had to haul everything with me as I prowled around the lobby, shops and outside.  Given the I had just traveled from the east coast I might have liked to put my feet up and enjoy a beverage while I waited.  There was no way that I could migrate around with my bags in tow.  Finally, I returned to the line and then the desk after waiting an hour and a half.  Amazing!  The clerk was able to find a clean room for me.

Upon our arrival to the front desk, Meredith offered us a magical upgrade to a room with a view of the pool.  We really enjoyed the view from the 9th floor of the Adventure tower, especially at night.  I was impressed with the layout of the property as everything is within short walking distance.  My two daughters and I enjoyed a buffet breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen and visited with several Disney characters.  Our room was comfortable, tastefully decorated and very clean.  This visit exceeded my expectations and I would definitely recommend this hotel to any family who wants the Disney experience.

I have mixed feelings. We were very excited about staying here we had been planning for a long time. We have stayed at the Grand Californian and have always had a great time and was always well treated by all the castmembers there.When I booked and prepaid for the entire stay 6 months in advanced I had requested 2 beds as I was going with a friend. I was told at time of booking that it should not be a problem, however by the time we arrived there was a convention going on and all that was left was a room with one bed, which I did not understand as I had prepaid but the lady at the front desk explained that it was not guaranteed. When we called and asked for the sofa to be made up we had to wait for three hours!! I had to call several times and it was almost midnight by the time

Overrated, Overpriced are two words that come to mind when thinking of our trip. Our room was next to the elevators and they keep me awake all night. There was no access to a microwave. The people were very friendly and ready to help, but then I can get that from Jolly Roger at a very  reduced price, oh yes and I don't have to pay for parking at the J. Roger. and I don't have to pay 135.00 for breakfast.

Summary Heading: It really is the happiest place on earth!
Summary: A great experience!!! The conference facilities are comfortable and accessible, once you get the lay of the land. The rooms are lovely and magical, with enough outlets and lighting. The cast members are extremely attentive and actively involved in your comfort and care. And then you are right there at Disneyland!!! What more could a person wish for?

This was our first time staying at the Disneyland Hotel & I had great expectations, but unfortunately it lacked the luster & magic I was hoping for.  I would have rather saved several hundreds of dollars and stayed at a neighboring hotel for what received.     From the moment of arrival at the front desk, service was blah. Visiting the gift shop, I felt like a bother every time I went in.  The last time, I purchased some popcorn for the movie night in the lawn.  I had asked which lawn the movie was playing & the lady was very nice, but didn't have a clue that they did movies in the lawn. My son and I wondered around until we found it.  Upon unloading our luggage, my husband wanted to open a bottle of wine to celebrate the kick off of our trip.  I realized I had forgot to pack

Fun themed wings, pretty renovated room. My daughter was absolutely thrilled with the lighted castle headboard and the view looking down on the waterslide and Mickey pool. It is a little farther afield than the Grand Californian and Paradise Pier but only by a little bit. The room was comfortable and very quiet considering how busy the place was. We had a character breakfast in Goofy's Kitchen at the hotel which was also a huge hit with my little girl.  Next time I might stay at the Grand Californian just because of its location but I don't really go in for the lodge motif since I have stayed at many actual National Park lodges in my time and the GC just feels weird and fake. I think the Disney Hotel is better for those who want a more "Disney" theme to their stay.

We stayed in the Adventure Tower on the 7th floor overlooking Downtown Disney.  The view was beautiful!  We absolutely loved the wall of windows that cover your outside wall!
