The renovations are wonderful.  The room was always clean and the housekeeping staff did an amazing job!!  The linens on the bed were amazing, crisp white and clean!!  We all had a wonderful sleep.  The carpets are new and not stained.  The bathroom was huge and sparkling.   The pool area was wonderful, and the lifeguard staff was incredible!!!  I have NEVER in my life seen a lifeguard staff like this!!!  VERY attentive, which is what you need and want!  The serving staff around the pool are fun and friendly while being attentive.  Also, the towels are available in the pool area and there was always an

Renovated room was spacious. The grand kids loved the lighted headboard. Replaced towels everyday even though we left them hanging.😞 single serve coffee maker, even after telling housekeeping we had 3 adults she left only 2 coffee packets 1 decaf, NO DECAF! Desk staff was pleasant but whomever answers the phone from the rooms was not ! I feel that the GC just has more to offer with more customer service .

Having stayed at over a dozen Disney resorts, my family and I decided we had to give the original a try. Last time we were at Disneyland the refurb was going on at the Disneyland hotel and we stayed at the Grand Californian. We were tempted to stay at the Grand Californian again since the experience was so positive, but we were all glad we gave Disneyland resort a try.   We stayed 4 nights in a preferred view in the frontier tower on the 11th floor. The view included the full pool complex, the two other towers and many of the visible peaks of Disneyland (Splash, Big Thunder, Matterhorn and Space mountains). The room is slightly larger than a standard studio, except for the bathroom which was tight. The headboard with the lights and music is a nice touch and overall the decor is

People REMEMBER this when you check in at Disneyland hotel and you sign for your room GET a copy of your signed receipt !!   I know like the nose on my face I signed for a $351.00 charge, and  I did not get a copy of my receipt. Well,, I get home and check my credit card account I am charged $386.00.  They added money to my charge for what ??  I did not add anything , but am charged more money. that is the absolute last time I pay so much for one night stay, next time I will go back across the street where I usually stay.

Summary Heading: My Favorite of the Disney Properties
Summary: This hotel is everything you could want for a disney trip. I'm huge on cleanliness and the Disneyland did not disappoint. There are Disney touches everywhere and it really keeps you feeling like you're still in the park. The staff is great and the pool is way better than any other. The headboards light up and play "a dream is a wish your heart makes" which is a perfect end to any Disney day. I highly recommend staying at the Disneyland if you can.

We stayed here on 9/25 - 9/29. It was our birthday gift for our 4 yr old daughter. Checking in was a breeze. Booked 2 adjoining rooms for our stay. Our family was a party of 5 plus grandpa & grandma. One room was a deluxe 2 queen bed & the other was a deluxe 1 king. Both rooms was on the 7th floor, Adventure Tower, clean & faced the pool area. Hotel was a short walking distance to the monorail & not quite that far from front gates of Disneyland. Pool area for kids are great with fun water slides for them to enjoy while taking a break from Disneyland.  Yes, price is a bit expensive, but worth the convenience if you have little ones. Would definitely stay here again IF we come back to Disneyland.

Booked a 1 night stay for my boyfriend's surprise birthday this past weekend. We were in the Frontier Tower on the 5th floor overlooking the pool area which was nice. Our room came with 2 queen beds and a twin size sofa bed. Accommodated 5 adults comfortably. We didn't get to enjoy the hotel too much cause we got in early Saturday morning. Did a pre checkin-in, left our bags with the bell desk and took off to the parks. Check-in was fairly easy and quick. Leaving our bags with the bell desk was easy as well. About 2 hours after check-in, I got a text from the hotel telling me my room was ready and it had the room number but didn't say which tower so I had to call front desk as we were walking back to the hotel from the parks late at night. It was about 12:30am and we were

Summary Heading: Great for the price I paid!
Summary: I opted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for a discounted rate since I was attending a conference there.  I had hoped for a room on the upper floors, but got a room in the Fantasy Tower on the second floor facing the pool.  It's not a bad view, just not what I had asked for.  Was incredibly jet lagged after my trip so took quite a long nap and ended up waking up at 4 am.  Kept hearing music playing and couldn't quite figure it out, nobody was at the pool.  Then I realized it was likely coming from Downtown Disney which is just a short walk away.  Ridiculous to play music that loud in the middle of the night.  Glad my hotel room didn't face Downtown Disney, could you imagine how loud it would be then!?  Anyways, regarding the actual hotel room, I was impressed.  Spacious, well

We stayed here again for a meeting, and the renovations have been completed since our unfortunate visit 2 years ago. The front desk check-in was prompt, but they clearly did not want us to linger and ask questions. The room was clean, spacious, and updated. I love the twinkle lights on the headboard. The cleaning service was variable -- why bother to put up signs about saving the planet by hanging your towel up, if they're going to replace it anyway? Single serve coffee packs were stocked 2 at a time (one decaf), so only one of us could be caffeinated one any given morning. The new pool area was lovely, and it was fun to watch the lifeguards do a safety drill with backboards one morning. It remains a very anonymous place to stay, albeit quieter.

Only good thing is early entry to parks.  The only reason we opted for the hotel was having an infant.  Would I stay there again - no!  But I don't intend to go to Disneyland again - totally crowded (even on a week day in October.)  I'm sure every parent of young children feel a need to take them - fortunately I am no longer in that category.

We always knew Disneyland Hotel would be good, but this far exceeded our expectations. We were on the 11 th floor in the Frontier tower which was quiet and relaxing. We overlooked the pool area and had a great view. The room was big enough for five, one on the fold down lounge.  Nothing was a problem, everything was magical. We especially loved the light up bed heads. It was wonderful to experience this with the children. We will definitely come back!

Transfered from the Grand Californian ( who were full) as wanted to stay one more night around Disney. We were not disappointed . My 3 young boys & Husband all preferred the pools, Restaurants at the Disney Hotel. The check in was great, room immaculate with a great view over the pools. The highlight was a breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen, which was very exciting, for my 6 yr old twins who got a cupcake and Happy Birthday song from the Staff. If we were to return this would be our first pick. Much more family orientated than other places we stayed.

Summary Heading: Great Way to Start a Holiday
Summary: The first three nights of our Disney holiday were spent here. And what a wonderful way to start the holiday! Check in was a breeze, though I should have used the porter service (still had my cheap kiwi hat on and didn't want to tip...)  Our room was on the 6th floor in the Frontier tower, furthest from everything, and overlooking the carpark. We had a standard 2 queen room. The room was really nice, everything to a high standard, and the light up bedhead was the icing on the cake.  The pool area was awesome, though they wouldn't let us use the inflatable ring we brought for our 4yo. Fortunately they had plenty of life vests she could use. We had lots of fun in the pools and the slides, and would have loved to have spent more time there if it wasn't for the real reason we were

Summary Heading: Best Disneyland Hotel for the money!
Summary: I've now stayed at all 3 Disneyland Resort Property Hotels and can say without a doubt that this is the best of the 3.   The set-up of the hotel is 3 separate towers, Fantasy, Adventure, and Frontier. Fantasy and Adventure are closest to Downtown Disney. I would suggest either of these two.   An upper level room is always best as it will provide you with better views. However, not all face the pool or Downtown Disney. Some face parking lots. Be sure to ask upon arrival.  Rooms are very clean and since their remodel, are really nice. Anyone will tell you the headboards with fireworks are awesome! Kids love it!  One of the best restaurants is Trader Sam's. A must visit! Also, a little known secret amoung Cast Members: the best breakfast in the entire resort is at Steakhouse 55.

Summary Heading: An Essential Part of the Disneyland Experience
Summary: I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel with some friends over the weekend for our friend's birthday.  We were staying on a regular floor (double room), but had opted to take advantage of an upgrade which allowed usage of the concierge level club room.  The staff at check in were very friendly and informative.  The staff in the concierge level were INCREDIBLY helpful and even tried to accommodate our request for a reservation in Club 33.    The room itself was very spacious, with two comfortable beds, and a large arm chair that pulled out into  an additional twin bed.  The bathroom was huge, with two sinks, and plenty of fresh towels.  The room has a huge headboard that both beds share, with an ornate carving of Sleeping Beauty's castle, and is complete with music and twinkle lights

This hotel was great.  It is closer than they make you think.  They say 8-10 minute walk, but it really only took about 4-5 minutes.   The gift shop within the hotel is very helpful, as well.  We had purchased a jacket, but by the next day, it was already coming apart at the seams.  No problem to exchange it for a new one.   Goofy's kitchen is a good buffet, and the characters come around to each table.  No fighting other guests for some one-on-one time and photo ops.   Room service breakfast was on time and good.  Lots of food.  Don't get a 3 year old her own plate of pancakes.  2 could easily eat it.

Is it expensive, yes.  If you do some research you should know that going in.  We were prepared for it and saved for it, so it turned out to be a great time!  The place is very clean, the kids (adults too) had a great time on the waterslides and pool area.  We ate dinner each night in Downtown Disney and had fun in the parks.  We are a family of 5 (kids are 9, 6, 6) and had budgeted $200 a day for food etc.. for 5 days.  It worked out well and we spent almost all of it.  There are cheaper places to stay and we don't always stay on property at DLR but this time we splurged and really enjoyed it.  the only mark down was for value - I don't think Disneyland - Disneyland Hotel and "value" really go together.  You know ahead of time that your going to overpay.  If you plan and accept

Summary Heading: Family trip to Disneyland...so glad we stayed at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: I grew up in So California but have since moved away.  I wanted the Disneyland experience for my children and staying at the Disneyland Hotel was a very good decision.  Disney has gotten VERY expensive to say the least.  If you are going to stay local I highly recommend this hotel.   Reasons:  1. Can walk in and out of park: this is very useful if you have toddlers that either nap or get overwhelmed and may need to go back to the room and relax or use the pool. Also adjacent to downtown Disney so lots of food/shopping choices. 2. Part of Disney experience: they do a god job of extending the Disney experience.  Disney cartoons upon check in, Disney character hedges and statues, Disney character breakfast on site. 3. Very tasteful and quiet rooms: nice touches like Disney etching

Summary Heading: Very Impressed by our 2 day stay
Summary: Had 2 nights here (family of four) and we loved it. Great check in (loved the kids area) with lots of staff on. Zach checked us in and was very informative and friendly. Loved our room overlooking the pool. Had a 1 bedroom suite and the room was huge (was upgraded) - loved it. Was super impressed by the pool area and the lifeguards and cleanliness. Could have spent all day by the pool.   Staff went above and beyond at 2am when my 4 year old was screaming with an ear ache - opening the shop for pain relief etc.  So close to Downtown Disney (and the monorail station to Tomorrowland - so handy).

Staying at the Disneyland Resort was an amazing experience for my husband, our children & I. We loved it. They have water slides, and a wonderful pool area for both children & adults. Life guards are always on duty so that's a plus. When we checked right in the front desk staff was so wonderful & gave us an upgrade for no extra charge. We were overall very pleased with their service. It is right at the beginning of Down Town Disney so we didn't have to use our car at all during our whole stay. The rooms was beautiful with a beautiful view of the pool are and some of Down Town Disney. They headboard play a lullaby and light up with the outline of DISNEY. Goofy's kitchen is also located here at this hotel. We went to breakfast here and it is a little pricey for the buffet, but

My husband and i have gone to disneyland every year for the last 8 years. But this year was the first year as husband and wife. We stayed at the disneyland hotel for our 1 year anniversary. It was wonderful!!! From start to finish, when we checked in the staff was very friendly the girl asked what we were there for and then gave us anniversary pins to wear. Close walk just through down town disney. Or you can catch the monorail, (sometimes there is a wait and it was quicker to walk to the main gate).  Loved being able to get in through the grand California entrance in to California adventure.   Beautiful hotel. Nice pool area. Room was amazing, we stayed on the tenth floor of the adventure building the view was nice you could see over down town disney and California adventure,

We stayed 4 nights at the Disneyland Hotel.  Our last visit was in 2000 and it has really changed!  Upon arrival you can drop your bags at Bell Services and the hotel will text you when your room is ready - very nice service.  We had requested a king and our first room had two doubles.  We call the front desk and they moved us pronto.  We had a king room in the adventure tower.  It was renovated and quite nice.  The headboard lights up with music and made the room very festive.  It was very clean and the bed was comfortable.  The location is so convenient to downtown Disney and a 7 minute walk to DL and CA parks.  The grounds are well kept and we had no problems going to and from the parks.  Much improved from our last stay in 2000.    Makes it very easy to take advantage of the

I have wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel since I was 12, and although I have visited the park many times, the Disneyland Hotel was never on our budget, this time it really wasnt either, but decided to just do it, and so very glad we did. Checking in was a breeze about 3pm on a Sunday, and after travelling most of the day I asked for a room in the Fantasy Tower (where check in is at) and they honored my request. Goofy was hanging around in the lobby as well that day. We were given a room on the 5th floor with a view of the Matterhorn mountain top, and we could easily see the fireworks from the room. Room was adorable with the lighted headboard, we had that on pretty much all the time.Beds comfortable. Nice Disney touches all over.Pool was very well supervised. Staff super

When visiting the Disneyland Resort, I normally stay at one of the motels on Harbor. This trip, I found a really decent deal on rooms at the Disneyland Hotel and decided it was time to try a bit of an upgraded experience.   Because I had such a good deal, I really was expecting to be given one of the lower level rooms near a service elevator in the Frontier tower. Well . . . I was partially right. I was assigned a room in the Frontier tower. But the room was on the top floor and not in a noisy portion.  And because it was on the top floor, it had a balcony too! Granted, there was no view of the parks or fireworks, but there was a great view of a parking lot . . and a terrific view across the valley. (I enjoy seeing the lights of a city at night).  The room itself was very

You shouldn't look past this hotel.  The staff at the front desk are knowledgeable and friendly.  It is only a short walk to Disneyland and California Land and to get there you have to walk through Downtown Disney with heaps of restaurants and shops.  This place buzzes 7 nights a week.  The swimming pool and spas are fabulous and safe.  The two restaurants are expensive but worth it for a treat.  One of them has people dressed as Disney characters and they come to your tables for photos and a cuddle.  Make sure when booking that you insist on a seperate room for the adults....we had one room with two queen beds and then a fold away bed in lounge so my husband and I had to share a room...that is our only gripe.

If you can afford it, this is a must-stay.  Check in took longer than was probably necessary, but they gave us all of the information we could ever need.  My husband attended a conference here and the family tagged along.  Without his company paying for the bulk of the stay, and the conference rate for the remaining nights, we could not have afforded to stay here.  I'm glad we were able to have the experience.  Room: Very clean and well appointed.  We had a room with 2 double beds and a sofabed.  It was also a connecting room to my parents, who stayed next door.  The staff was not only able to connect us, they were able to do it when my parents made 2 separate stays (we were there from Fri-following Sat, so, 8 nights, and my parents stayed Fri-Mon, and then returned Thurs-Sat).

HIGHLY RECOMMEND My family is used to Disney World in Florida, but this trip was a nice change and the hotel had a lot to do with it.  We had a nice room with two queen beds and a huge hit was the headboard for the kids (6 & 9).  It lit up and played music and had fun little fireworks that lit up so each night we had a little show. Everything was clean and a pretty good sized room for four. The bathroom had the sink in one area and the toilet and shower in another.  This was a little different, but it worked fine. The location was great.  The walk to Downtown was easy and much different than taking transportation in Disney World. The pools were nice, however when we visited in July the big slide (a big attraction) kept getting closed. It closed since the pool itself got closed,

Summary Heading: Amazing...I didn't hate this place! I think I LIKED it!
Summary: Over the years visiting Disneyland we have stayed at multiple hotels both in and out of the Disney resort area. In general I have disliked every single hotel. Of the Disney resort hotels--IMO the Disneyland Hotel is by far the best especially when you take into account value for money spent. The Grand Californian is a total ripoff and the rooms aren't nearly as nice as the Disneyland Hotel and pool is not remotely as nice. The Paradise Pier Hotel is basically a 2 star rat hole. We've also stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge at Disney World which was really really disappointing.  So we finally decide to try the Disneyland Hotel and I had very low expectations going in having been so jaded by bad Disney hotel experiences.  It was refurbished not too long ago, and when we got to our

Al Davis first created the famous quote” Commitment to Excellence” unfortunately the Disneyland hotel does not understand the word Commitment. In simplest definition is a promise to do or give something. When your family is treated so badly by staff at the hotel and management does not care about you as an individual but rather than a bunch of dollar signs then it’s time to leave. We left our family vacation 2 days early because of the piss poor negative attitudes we received from the hotel staff. Furthermore the happiest place on earth is their catch phrase. I can honestly confirm that they are full of crap! They ruined our family vacation in which we will NEVER stay at a Disneyland hotel again. Some friendly advice to everyone go stay at a good neighbor hotel they will treat

Summary Heading: The Disneyland Hotel, a magical place to stay !
Summary: We arrived early before our room was ready. The bell service checked our luggage so that we could go directly to the parks. Later when we returned to the hotel our luggage was promptly delivered to our room. What wonderful friendly service! Just newly renovated, we were impressed by the new decor, the hallway carpets and the attention to detail, especially all of historical elements including Walt Disney and Disneyland. They have some amazing photos at every corner, on every wall, a time capsule of how it all started and how the legacy continues on. We had a room with a nice view of the surrounding area but our favorite thing was the headboard of the bed, as silly as it sounds, it has a light-up castle and a miniature firework show that lit up with music playing "When you wish

I have to say, I've wanted to stay here for over 20 years (since I was 11 years old) and finally got my dream this week!  The renovations are wonderful. The pool area and lobby made the hotel a true resort experience.  The pool area was better than going to a water park: clean, orderly, towels, life vest floats for the little ones, lifeguards who actually were a lot of fun and kind. And nice bathrooms, floral areas and trees, and lighting. The whole area is gorgeous. The spa at night was not to be beat. I especially loved looking at the tikki torches at the restaurants above. Very lovely. Nicer than the Polynesian resort at WDW FL.   The headboards were really pretty, but unfortunately, ours looked like it wasn't dusted in a week. Same with the other dark woods in the bath.

Summary Heading: great part of our magical vacation
Summary: we started our Disney vacation at a cheaper family hotel in Anaheim which was great.  I had always wanted to stay at the quintessential Disney Hotel - it just seems so authentic & magical.  We were not disappointed.  Our reasons for staying here were to - * have a few days of full Disney immersion * pay homage to the 'origins' of Disney * treat ourselves to a slightly more luxurious property * enjoy the benefits of staying in a Disney hotel (ie early entry)  We found the staff to be excellent.  Sure the restaurant prices were too high for us to justify; but by this time we knew some great places to eat nearby & our kids are old enough that a photo of Goofy is just as good as sitting in his restaurant ;) That was fine by us.  The room was lovely & spacious, with enough Disney

So I booked my stay for August for 2 days and my parents were with us.  I paid about 400 bucks so 200 a night to be closer to the park and not to mention it was half the price of the grand hotel.  The rooms are old, junky and Honestly, The motels across the street are nicer. Like the knights inn and the carousel.  The beds were hard and the rooms small. Room service food was crappy and well, it was just a waste!  I took my girls to the spa at the Grand Hotel which was gorgeous. I'm sure the rooms were worth it, but I was being cheap.  I wish I just spent the money because I had it, but I try to be money savvy because after all you just sleep in the room right?  Well if you can call sleeping on beds that feel like rocks and I'm in the Flinstone era.. I say stick with outside

This is our second stay at the Disneyland Hotel. It was big decision, because I wanted to try The Grand Disneyland Hotel, its closer, it just looks very nice. I ended up choosing The Disneyland Hotel, we had such a great visit in 2011, and I really wanted to stay again. It was worth it, we made the right choice. As we checked in, it was fast, the gentleman who checked us in was great, we got upgraded to an upper level with a great view of the park, we could see the fireworks at night.  I have to tell you it was my granddaughter birthday, so that may have helped us get a upgrade. We continued to get such excellent surprise’s, next he bought out, to my granddaughter a picture that Meredith signed (Brave), she just turned four and she was so excited.  The size of the rooms are very

Stayed with my wife and two sons recently. Our room was in the adventure tower, I was impressed with the size of the room, very spacious.   My sons really enjoyed the pool and the water slides. It was nice to relax out there after a long day of wandering around the parks. The hotel was clean and the grounds were well taken care of.  The hotel is a good walk away from the park entrances, however the monorail has a stop fairly close to the hotel that will drop you off in tomorrowland.   The only parts of our stay that was less than ideal was our checkin and a mix up with our dinner reservation at Goofy's Kitchen. At check in there was a rather long line and only a couple desk agents to process everyone.  With our dinner reservation there was a mix up and we were not given the

Summary Heading: Good choice if wanting to stay in Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights with our 3 kids aged 12, 9 and 3 along with my mum-in-law in 2 rooms. Standard rooms are large, clean and spacious with plenty of storage space. Room with 2 queen beds easily fit 2 adults and 2 kids comfortably. Room has a fridge but no microwave. Kids loved the light up bed head which acts perfectly as a night light. There is also a guest laundry onsite which was very convenient. The pools were a hit with the kids but the line up for the big slide did become quite long. The hotel is very close to Downtown Disney but a little further away from the parks than the other 2 hotels. In saying that, the kids and mum had absolutely no problems with the scenic 10 minute walk through Downtown Disney to the theme parks. All in all a great experience

Summary Heading: A bunch of criminals that make he mafia look like nice guys
Summary: A bunch of criminals that make the mafia look like nice guys run Disney now, no kidding, up to 500 per night for hotel that should be 100 per night and no complimentary bottled water and room service wants to charge 8.00 per bottle plus rip off fees, gratuity and taxes!  Walt Disney is rolling in his grave!

This hotel is at the end of Downtown Disney so is a bit of a walk from the park (though you can get the monorail nearby). Rooms are great (I love the firework lights above the bed - so cute), and the pools are nice, big with a couple of slides for all ages. Steakhouse 55 is great for a nice dinner, though Goofy's kitchen is right next-door too. We were surprised that the coffee shop isn't open early, but other than that, everything was great (check out the tikki-like bar by the pool - fun drinks and staff)

I've stayed here a few times this was my first time since the remodel. It's even better now. Everyone is so happy the new bar is great! Concierge is so worth it. I can't say enough amazing things about this hotel.

The hotel is all part of the experience, the detail is to a level you would expect from Disneyland. Check in could have been handled better but we got there in the end.  Kids love it, hopefully we have time for the pools.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon. The room was lovely and spacious, with a touch of luxury. Really nice.  We didn't arrive until late so we got a room opposite the elevators (they were fully booked). You could hear the 'ting' of the elevator in the morning because the extra external door that we shut each night was propped open. Not sure if this was Disney staff or the room next door that shared that door.    The location of the hotel was perfect: it was a short walk to the parks through Downtown Disney & you can take the monorail straight into Tommorowland.  This is a massive & well organised operation so it can feel a bit like being on a treadmill: they had oversold the entire allocation of kingsize rooms for our entire stay & check out is early (11am).

Summary Heading: surprisingly not saturated with disney characters, and a high quality hotel
Summary: I stayed here for a week on a work conference. I was expecting this place to be saturated with Disney and have a statue of Goofy in my room or something, but actually the place was very understated (the taps in the bathroom were in the shape of mickey mouse but that's about it). The rooms were spotless, and the bed sheets were nice and comfortable :) Disney really knows how to put on a show. The staff is also fabulous, they treat you like an honored guest. The pools are nice and they have 2 lifeguards per pool! I want to give this place 5 stars except there is not one good cup of coffee on the resort (I am a coffee snob). They have a little cafe by the pool but honestly don't bother. If you leave the resort and go to "downtown disney" the food is still hit and miss. Otherwise it

I have stayed at disneyland hotel many times. I usually i get the adventure tower this time i got the fantasy tower.  i like the theme of the diffrent towers. the hotel was sold out and i heard no noises in the hall. the room size was nice there were 4 adults in our party and plenty of room for everyone.  its expensive no doubt about it with an annual pass my rate before tax and parking it was going to be 460 for one night midweek of season. i got a WAY better deal from Expedia. with the better price the hotel was way more enjoyable. We utilized all the hotel had to offer early park entrance, the pools and spas. i do wish they had an adults only spa. yes i understand its amid at kids. but, after a long day at the park or relaxing on your first night at the hotel. a spa with no

I had stayed at the Disneyland hotel once as a child (in the 70's!) and hoped one day to be able to stay with my children.  Yes, I could have stayed at an economy hotel to save a little money, but it wouldn't have been the same.  We traveled to Disney for my son's 5th birthday.  I let them know this ahead of time.  We were traveling from Alaska and had to take a red eye which has us flying all night then landing at LAX around 6:45am.  They shuttle was there waiting to take us to our hotel and the guy was very friendly and helpful.  When we got to the hotel to check in, they told us check in wasn't until 3pm.  We were exhausted from flying all night with 3 kids.  They did however, take our baggage to the hold area and told us we were welcome to have breakfast and even use the

My family and I stayed at the Disneyland hotel for 6 days at the end of August. We had planned to stay at another hotel close to Disneyland but chose this one because of the resort type pool area and the fact it was recently renovated.   Our room was on the 5th floor of the Frontier tower. This tower is farthest from the main lobby. We parked in the main lot about a 5-minute walk from our tower but there is a smaller lot closer to the rooms. Wish we would have known about that. There is a nice water feature – a geyser that goes off every now and again near the tower entrance. The hotel grounds were nicely landscaped and we appreciated it. Mickey shaped shrubs and flower gardens were a nice touch.  The room was tastefully decorated with Disney themed elements throughout. Our

It was a 50th Birthday present from my parents. They treated my sister, her daughter and myself along with mum and dad to The Disneyland Hotel. When we arrived the tower we had booked was not available, they had put us in the furthest tower possible away from Downtown Disney. With two elderly parents this was not good. We had been up since 4am and arrived at 6:30am. Finally when we got into room right on 3pm we found there was not enough beds or towels. The next morning I went to shampoo my hair there was only one bottle of shampoo & conditioner for 5 people!! I called house keeping but they did not come, I had to go down to reception to get it myself. For the money we paid it was very disappointing. I recommend - find somewhere else to stay.

this is the place to stay if you are a first timer to Disneyland like my wife and kid was. Are room was in the Adventure Tower and looked right into down town Disney, in was just steps away. Loved the headboard and the lights in it. we used it like a nightlight for my kid. The staff was grate and very helpful, we lost all of are tickets to the park and they helped us find them, and get new ones. Really saved are trip. The charge for parking is a bit much at $22 a day for valet and self parking isn't much better, but still cant beat location. We walked into the park everyday and you can even ride the monorail into the park from DTD if walking is too fare for you. DTD has grate places to eat too.

The Disneyland Hotel offers the golden opportunity of gaining early access into the Disneyland Park each day........and with so much to do at Disneyland, you really need it.   We hardly spent anytime at the hotel itself, but enjoyed every opportunity when we were there.  The room was large and comfortable, the beds were dreamy. They haven't forgotten any detail.........from the gorgeous light-up, musical headboard above the bed to the mickey taps in the bathroom. The pools were lovely and clean and very safe..........lots of lifeguards watching every child. A themed character dinner with Goofy was definitely a highlight...... the food wasn't anything special, but the look on our son's face when he saw all the characters was good enough for us.   The only downside is that the

It's the Disneyland Hotel and costs hundreds of dollars, but I kept expectations low, just in case.  THe new remodel is wonderful.  I literally danced around and clapped excitedly (FYI:  I'm the 40 year old mother, not the kid)  The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the view was lovely (of course, that's relative) I didn't bother with my own photos because, honestly, the room looked just like the photos on the website.  It really was that nice. We were given chocolates for our pillows and roses on our first night because we were celebrating. Let them know if you're celebrating ANYTHING and they'll likely do something special for you.  Also, they have fun "scavenger hunt" sheets for various rides at the front desk if you ask for them. They have life vests at the pools

Summary Heading: Amazing pool. Brilliant staff. Drab hotel. Eye-popping price.
Summary: For $800 a night, we expected more from the hotel (this price doesn't include food or park entry). We couldn't fault the staff, or the amazing pool and slides (though even the slides sometimes had a 25 minute queue).  The hotel itself was very disappointing though. Other than a few Disney touches (Mickey shower control and Micky bathroom light fittings), The Frontier Tower was little more than a functional airport style hotel. We really expected some Disney stardust sprinkled around, but it was very plain. And for the price, you expected some kind of personalised touches to welcome you into your room, but there was nothing. (And no bottled water, no china cups/mugs for coffee - just paper ones etc.)  So my advice would be, save some money (you'll need it for the parks and food)

One night only, but first impressions were good. The service was excellent, the rooms were of good size with all that you need for a good  clean comfortable stay. Good position, next to downtown Disney with lots of shops and restaurants and a few minutes walk to the entrance of both Disney parks.  Top class restaurant in the hotel. Fabulous pool area with water slides etc,  We were lucky to see a wedding ceremony with Cinderella's coach and horses. Hotel well recommended

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but overpriced and farther than expected
Summary: We stayed at the disneyland hotel with our 3 kids. We chose this hotel thinking it would save time if we needed to return to the room with our youngest for naps. It turns out the hotel is a lot farther than we expected and it wasn't feasible to go back to the room during the day.  The hotel has wonderful decorations and the rooms are very roomy.  The best part of the room by far was the headboard! My kids also liked the hidden mickeys in the carpet.  The service was beyond exceptional and everything Disney is expected to be! We just had to try out the pools and they were nice and clean.  I'm sure we will be back, but I'll wait til the kids appreciate the cost a little more.   So for now, we stay across the street at ramada or the castle.

Rooms are way bigger and nicer than they used to be. As much as I love The Grand, It is way more roomy compared to the standard rooms there. I think next time I will try the concierge package as it is well worth the extra expense to me having 5 children. The cafes and restaurants are a little spendy, but the food was enough.

This was one of several trips to Disneyland we have taken with the grandkids, and one of the easiest for sure.  The hotel is very nice, the swimming pool fantastic. and in the room, the headboard was a very special surprise.  The location was important as it is hard to walk all day, and also have a long walk in or out.  We stayed in the Adventure tower, which was very close to the monorail which will take you right to Tomorrow Land.  This hotel was well worth the extra cost!

Well we have finally made it to Disneyland, we are both around "50" so was wondering if it would seem like everything you have grown up with.  I am pleased to say it was everything we had hoped for, the hotel was excellent, from the security gate to valet to check in, all went smoothly and with out a problem.  We had asked for a resort view room and were allocated a room in the Adventure Tower, the room was very spacious, huge window with great views of Downtown Disney and both parks.  The restaurant in the Hotel complex called Steakhouse 55 was a standout , the food, service and decor were perfect.  The theme parks were everything we had hoped for, we bought a two park pass and spent all day enjoying both.  The pools were excellent, except at the end of the second day, a

We had another wonderful stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  Every staff member was perfection, all went out of their way to accommodate us and make our stay magical.  We love the pool at mid- day breaks from the parks.  We love the light up headboards, the hidden Mickeys in the carpet, the smell of the shampoo....pretty much everything.  This year the kids did lots of pin trading at the front desk and at the pin traders shop right as you enter downtown Disney.  We also had fun character dining at Goofy's Kitchen.  We wish we could come every year!

Booked this hotel through a travel agency for the Disneyland half-marathon weekend. It is more expensive than I usually pay for a hotel, but it was totally worth it! It's nice to splurge on a nicer hotel every once in a while. The location was perfect for Downtown Disney, the parks and the start and finish lines! It was nice not to have to walk very far after finishing the race to get back to our air conditioned room and a shower (and it was HOT that weekend!).  The room itself was large and welcoming. I loved all of the little "Disney" touches and don't want to give them away because they were fun to look for with one that was amazing surprise when we found it! Beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows (in case you're like I am and use multiple). The utopian feel of

Summary Heading: Retro "old school mad men" feel at Disneyland Hotel
Summary: Background: 5 adults & 1 five year old spend 1 night in the hotel - booked the concierge level and asked if we could have rooms close together.   As we arrived we used the Valet parking - easy, fast, friendly. We walked the very short walk to the front desk and immediately were helped. The front desk called a concierge for us, whispering into the phone "We have a VIP here" (haha) and then the Concierge took us to sit down in some really cute tea cup seats to do our very fast check in. They also had packets for us that we asked to be sent to the room when ready so we didn't have to carry them around. As we arrived around 9 am we signed up for the "pre registration" where they can text or call you when your room is ready. They provided our room key cards already - that are

We booked this hotel last year as our family of four travelled to Anaheim with the grandparents.  What a great hotel.  It was very clean and the staff were exceptionally professional and willing to help in anyway possible.  Since we were only there for a few nights, the kids only managed to get to the pool area once.  Disneyland is such a huge park.  It was quiet a walk from this hotel tho - even tho its probable closer than any of the other hotels we were looking at.  We all really enjoyed staying in this hotel, but there is a hotel that is actually closer to the park, if you don't enjoy the walking.  You can walk to the monorail as well, which we didn't do, and then catch that into Disneyland.  So this could be another option.  But well worth the stay!!

Loved our stay at Disneyland Hotel and it made it so much easier to enjoy our vacation with little ones. The rooms were large and nicely furnished and we were right off Disney Downtown to get meals or access to the parks. The pools are great for kids. Room service was prompt and tasty. Will most certainly stay here again when we come back to Disneyland.

Our family travelled to Anaheim for our first stay at The Disneyland Resort.  We had a wonderful stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Though the price is a bit steep for the type of room, the disney magic and service makes up for it.  From the moment you arrive on property you know you are at Disney.   Every cast member we came into contact with was happy and helpful.  The refurbished rooms are comfortable and the light up headboard was a nice touch.  My kids had fun shining the little reading lamps on the opposite wall and making shadow puppets.   We were in a premium room and could just see the fireworks over the adventure tower.  Had a great view of the pool.  The walk was not bad from the Frontier tower.... About 10-15 min to the main gates with 2 strollers.  It was only a few

Summary Heading: Decent location, clean rooms but be prepared to get little to no sleep because the walls are paper thin.
Summary: Service: My family and I stayed at this hotel during our vacation for 4 nights. We paid extra to do the Mickeys Grand Welcome ($335) to have a surprise waiting for our kids when we got there. When we checked in I specifically asked if the room was already set up and they said yes it was. Upon getting to our room to our disappointment the room was not set up. We called the front desk which was kind enough to adjust the bill and give us the grand welcome free when we left for dinner that evening.   Check in: as every other guest was checking in they got an overly friendly welcome from someone who seemed like they cared enough yo actually smile and give them some tiny details to make their stay a little better. However when I checked in I got a guest services person who seemed to

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights right after we got married. The whole resort and park seriously know how to treat honeymooners. We got buttons when we first checked in that said "Just Married" and tons of staff members congratulated us as we walked through the resort and park everyday we were there. The first night they put rose petals on our bed and gave us rice crispy treats in the shape of mickey's head dipped in chocolate. The rooms themselves since the remodel are gorgeous. The headboard has the castle and when you flip a switch on the nightstand, led fireworks show up on the headboard and the song "a dream is a wish your heart makes" plays. For Disney-lovers on their honeymoons, this is a wonderful place.

Summary Heading: My new favorite hotel at Disney
Summary: My family and I usually stay at California Grand (which we love).  We ended up booking at the Disneyland hotel because it was 100 degrees out and heard the pool was better for kids.  I feel the whole hotel was a bit nicer than the Grand and the service was a bit more friendly.  From the moment we checked in with the help from Taua to the checkout with Titia the stay was seamless. We loved the design of the rooms with all the plugs for iPhones, iPads, etc. Don't miss having a Mai Tai at the rum bar by the pool.  Disney characters everywhere for great photos with all our kids.

Summary Heading: Great Stay, Great Time, Need a Vacation from my Vacation!
Summary: Stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, Frontier Tower, from August 26 through August 28.  When we arrived our room was not ready yet but the Disney staff took our luggage and put it into storage.  Check in was quick and the staff was very friendly!  I then went to guest services to check on our dinner reservations and make them aware of my daughter's peanut allergy.  They were more than helpful.  We went to the park and a few hours later received a text that our room was ready.  After dinner we went back to the hotel for some rest and within 5 minutes of calling for our luggage it was delivered to our room.  The room is very roomy, we are a family of five!  I think it is more roomy than the Grand Californian rooms.  Everything was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The kids

Summary Heading: Bring your credit card ( and your ID )
Summary: We booked a very nice room with two double beds overlooking the pool. The rooms are very clean with comfortable beds and very good bathrooms. Service at front desk up to Disney standards. Location to Downtown Disney and parks are hard to beat. Breakfast room service is ridiculously expensive for the small serving and quality of food. Sandwich place at start of downtown Disney is definetly a better option. Pool is very nice but they keep closing it which we never quite understood. Also snack shop is extremely expensive so consider bro go g snacks and maybe a few beers with you. Overall though I would recommend this hotel but just remember to bring your credit card. ( and your ID )

We stayed here for five nights whilst visiting Disneyland.  The room was adequate (2 double beds for a family of four [7 and 9 year old kids]).    The big winner for us was the pool area, especially since when we went it was unseasonably warm at 35 degrees at beginning of September.  The waterslides are great and the other pools are big and very well guarded during lifeguard hours (I mean very well guarded, it makes NZ pools look positively unsafe).    The eating options in the hotel are of course ridiculously expensive, as are Downtown Disney for the most part, and there are no kitchen facilities, so be prepared to shell out coin to eat here, but if you were looking to save money this isn't the hotel to stay in anyway.  We did eat one night at Goofy's Kitchen which the children

We arrived late, close to 1 AM. Our kids were asleep, but the front desk people still took the time to give us stickers, and Disney character photo for our kids. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The room was clean and spacious. The headboards light up and give your stay that extra Disney touch. The pool was nice. We were able to get in the park an hour early for staying here and that was well worth it. We were able to ride the new cars ride twice and the toy story ride several times before the park opened to the general public. I'm typically a lite sleeper, but had no troubles sleeping here. The rooms were quiet. I can't wait to stay here again.

Summary Heading: The Happiest Place on Earth... the pool....
Summary: We are AP holders and come to Disneyland often, but rarely stay at the hotel because of the cost. Since we were there because of the DisneyRun we stayed at the hotel after the run, we played at the pool all day long, lounged in 88 degree weather and enjoyed the drinks. I have to say the water at the pool that is part salt is so nice on your skin and children! We enjoyed the pool and we went to the park the next day. Nice to be able to not have to catch a shuttle and was worth it having that extra hour in the morning, we did a ton in that first hour! The only down side was there was some problems with Valet, (they lost my car...and then said it was might fault for not taking the  ticket-when we had two cars and only one valet ticket) it worked it self out, but no apology or

Absolutely loved staying at the Disneyland Hotel, and would go back in a heartbeat!  We were on the 10th floor with a view of the Monorail pool (which closed quite early I thought, but that could be the season).  The bathroom was nice and large, complete with Mickey's (hidden and obvious).  But the best part was the headboard - it covered almost the whole wall with a picture of the castle - and when you turned on the nightlight: ta da!!  **Fireworks**  Steakhouse 55 is a terrific restaurant and you could easily walk to the parks, shopping, and other resorts.

We stayed at this hotel to have the total Disney experience. The location was perfect. Couldn't have asked for a better location for convenience. It was over priced compared to other hotels but I'm glad we stayed there. No car was needed. We were right next to downtown Disney and had a private entrance to the park. We could easily run back to the hotel if we wanted jackets or something else. Rooms were beautiful and the light up musical headboard was a nice touch. Kids loved the pools and service was great. Would recommend to anyone if you can get past the price.

We booked three standard rooms here through cheaptickets for 20% off rack rate.  We had two connecting rooms for our family of four and one room for my inlaws.  We were pleasantly surprised to be located on the top floor of the Adventure Tower.  Our rooms had full balconies.  We overlooked a parking lot, but if you looked to the left from the balcony we had a good view of Tower of Terror and the exterior of Radiator Springs Racers.  The renovated rooms are so lovely:  classic Disney style and everyone loved the light up headboards.  The beds were very comfortable.  The resort is a convenient to the parks, though not quite as close as Grand Cailfornian Resort where we stayed last time.  The pools and slides were nice though lacked enough seating for the size of the hotel.  There

I have stayed here many times, and have never been disappointed.  This visit turned out to be extra special though, because they gave me one of the highly sought after corner balcony rooms in the Frontier Tower.  I have booked the resort view rooms in the past, but never had been given one of the park view BALCONY rooms.  I thought maybe they were reserved for VIPs, or aging mousekateers, but apparently it is just the luck of the draw according to the nice woman checking me in.  They can be requested, but apparently never guaranteed, unless you are booking one of the larger suites.   The room was beautiful, with floor to ceiling windows with 180 degree views of the Disneyland, California Adventures and the other hotels at the resort.  The balcony was furnished with a couple of

Summary Heading: Location, location, but lousy pool hours, and worse for the slide.
Summary: We stayed 3 nights here last minute, it was great to get in. Rooms are expensive but worth it for a few nights. Alarm was set by cleaning staff and went off at 4am on the second night. Check it! Water slide closed too early, but Trader Sam's lounge was amazing and took kids, so it all worked out :)

Summary Heading: If you can get a reasonable rate this hotel is really worth it...
Summary: There was a screaming deal on rooms so it was time to give it a try. It really made our vacation so much better. Usually we stay at a nearby hotel and take art to the parks. It was so stress free not to worry about catching a shuttle. So neat to be right where all the action was in downtown disney.  Not sure if I would recommend taking the monorail for early entry. Long line that killed most of the hour.  Also nice to know that if you are at the parks but need to run back to your room..its not a big deal. The pool area has a tropical feel with a convenient hawaiian restaurant with yummy muffins..fruit plates and really good burgers. The rooms have a disney flair but not over the top. We ended up going to the parks one day..spending a day by the pool the next and then back to the

We had stayed here many times years ago, and I can tell you what an improvement the renovations have been to the property.  They completely gutted the old building, making the rooms and bathrooms bigger.  We had a great, big room, with a nice bathroom.  Pretty decor.  The air conditioning worked great and was quiet, which was another great improvement.  Great view of the pool from a high floor, so very quiet.   The pool itself is a child's dream come true.  The food is good.  The park is very close.  The early entry was great for getting through the Fantasyland rides that usually have long lines and no fast passes.  What more could you ask for?

This was our first stay at a Disney Hotel. We tried it because we found it on sale. When we arrived, the front desk staff was friendly, check in was easy, and our kids loved that they each got a disney room key with their name on it. The room was beautiful and spacious with touches of Disney everywhere. The headboard was the coolest. We loved having the hour early to get into the park. The coffee shop was perfect for breakfast with yogurt, muffins, bagels and juice. We also took a day to swim and enjoy the pool and waterside which we all enjoyed. When we were leaving, check out was easy, the bell hop helped us with our luggage and got us a taxi. We would definitely stay here again.

The resort is broken into three towers-Fantasy is the main building, Adventure and Frontier, pools in the middle. Make sure you ask for a room with a view of the pool or you will be looking at one of the parking lots and for what they charge that would be a disappointment. Also the Frontier Tower is the farthest walk from Downtown Disney and the parks. It may seem not that bad initially but if carrying a tired child or you are exhausted from the days activities it feels like forever. When possible take the monorail from DD into Disneyland to avoid walking through DD. The monorail doesn't go to California Adventure so you have to walk. The food at hotel is nothing special and overpriced. Now that we have been there we won't go back. We have stayed at much nicer 4 star hotels for

We recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights.  We stayed in a Standard View room, which was a view of a parking lot, which was fine, because we didn't spend much time in the room.  The Disneyland Hotel is made up of 3 Towers - Fantasy, Adventure and Frontier.  We stayed in the Frontier tower, one side overlooks a parking lot and the other side overlooks the pools.  The Adventure Tower overlooks Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure and the other side overlooks the pools.  The Fantasy Tower has the same views as the Frontier Tower and is the busiest tower as it has the stores, main lobby, and Check-In.  The Frontier Tower is the furthest away from the Fantasy Tower and that was fine with us because it was quieter and a lot less people.  The rooms were

The convenience of this hotel is unbeatable.  The short drive to John Wayne Airport (or LAX) and short walk to the parks is really nice.  We were lucky to take advantage of our military discount, so the prices were a little more reasonable, but if you can swing it, pay the price!  We stayed in the adventure tower.  Beautiful carved/lighted headboard added to the room's charm.  The nearby restaurants at the hotel & downtown Disney are also great.  I love that your hotel key serves as your "charge card" on the property at the stores & restaurants but be sure to carry your ID because they were very good at checking.  The pool and slides were really nice especially in the heat.  The pool is a salt water pool which was a nice surprise.  The staff was so friendly everywhere we went.

We as a family had a great time at the Disneyland Hotel, we immersed ourselves in all things Disney and had the time of our lives!  The hotel has been refurbished and the rooms are lovely, our room had an amazing view of Downtown Disney and the fireworks every night not to mention California Adventure and the World of Colour.  The rooms are nicely decorated in a modern Disney theme with the highlight for the kids being the lit up bedhead that sang when you wish upon a star when illuminated, I must admit I thought it was pretty cool too.  The Disneyland Hotel is one of three DLR hotels on the property, mid range as far as cost goes and it would be the furthest away from either theme park but nicely positioned at the end of Downtwon Disney with quick access to many restaurants and

I expected to find a clean room and a friendly staff but it was the oposite.  Front desk could not find our reservation even do we had all the information.  We wanted and requested a top floor to enjoy a better view but ended up on the first floor with a view to the parking lot.  Not a good experience.  The bath tub was dirty.  I called the housekeeping department to talk about my concern about the cleaninless of my room and the manager arrived to my room with one of the housekeepers only to tell me that the bath tub was clean it was just that the tub was old and it looked like it was dirty?!  Really!  I told them that either they fix the problem or I was to request another room where I could take a decent shower...guess what? the housekeeping with some miracle cleaner was able

Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland. The rooms are good sized beds comfortable.  It's convenient the cast members are always wonderful!  One of our favorite places. Never go wrong staying here.

My family and I had the best trip ever to Disneyland. The Disneyland Hotel was amazing!! The rooms were updated, clean and we had a wonderful view of Downtown Disney! Downtown Disney was a few steps away and even Disneyland was a short walk. The slides, lifeguards all the rerestaurants there were perfect.  Cant wait to go back!

We had a great stay and the service was excellent. Close to the things we wanted to see. Our room was very comfortable and we had a nice view.  We would recommend this to others. It made our 5th anniversary a very much success.  We would come back here again.

We recently stayed at this hotel for three days and even with it being a little more pricey than others in the area - you can't beat the location and the hour early perks (especially if you happen to have a fan of Cars/Carsland in your room).  Besides how easy it was to access the parks, the hour early access (GREAT for the Radiator Racers Cars ride), it was a nice break in the middle of the day to come back and spend some time at the pools and then return to the park.  I have a four year old and loved that they had life jackets in the pool area and allowed the kids to go down the slides wearing them.  The only minor issue I have is that the service at the pool was VERY slow.  As others have said this is a nice hotel - but not luxury - think newly renovated Hampton Garden Inn,

I was dreading the whole disneyland experience but staying here made all the difference. From the efficient check in (who were completely understanding of the over excited child) to the bedroom with cute little mickey touches the experience was great. We even had a room that we could watch the fireworks from. Even though it was a bit more expensive  it was totally worth it to be able to enter the park early and go home for a nap when ever we needed to.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for business or pleasure
Summary: I stayed here for a conference in mid-August as I have done now for several years. My earlier stays were not very good simply due to the noise levels, particularly in adjoining rooms. However, my room on my most recent stay was much better. I was in the Adventure Tower, on the 10th floor, and adjacent to the elevator. While I thought the nosie from the elevator would be a problem, the room ended up being very quiet. I faced the newly upgraded pool area and found that the variety of restaurants, to include the newer snack bar, was helpful. With Downtown Disney just steps away, and the parks next door, the location can't be beat!

It goes without saying that this hotel is very expensive, so if cost is a significant issue, DLH probably isn't for you. However, if you can afford it you will get an absolutely first rate hotel that, very importantly for my family, keeps you immersed in the "Disney bubble" for the length of your stay.  Service is outstanding in every way. Check-in was fast and seamless - we showed up at 10 a.m. and were able to check right into our room! Every employee was courteous, helpful, and friendly.  We had a standard view room in the Adventureland tower. If you are booking a standard view room I highly recommend this tower as you will be facing Downtown Disney rather than a parking lot. On the fourth floor, where we were, we looked out over a beautifully landscaped courtyard and could

This hotel was the last leg of our honeymoon around the U.S. and could not have been more perfect. Rooms were very modern and clean. Checkin lobby was very efficient! We were stoked with a room upgrade for the last hotel in our honeymoon. Loved every minute here and very convenient location to Downtown Disney and the parks! Loved walking through Downtown Disney everyday to get to the parks :) The location was also convenient for shuttles to the outlets - only a short walk to the other Disney resort!

The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. It was great having all that you need just steps away from your hotel. The parks were a short walk through Downtown Disney or a tram ride away. Downtown Disney has plenty of places to eat and shop. I was a little disappointed that I did not see more characters walking around. We ordered room service for breakfast. While everything was good we did not like the waffle. It is fun to get a waffle shaped like Mickey but was definitely not worth the money. Make sure you turn on the switch by your bed to see the headboard light up and hear the music play. We figured that one out the day we were leaving. This hotel and location is great for kids and adults. It was great being able to have all that we needed just

We booked our vacation through AAA travel, and got a premier view room so we could have a fireworks view. When we got to our room in the Adventure tower I noticed a high pitched whining noise that didn't seem to end, turns out we were right by the service elevator and with it frequently being in use the noise never ends. (ALL KING BEDS ARE BY THE ELEVATOR). I called to ask for a new room and they literally couldn't find one for us with a single bed, and they kept on asking if we would be ok with two queens or perhaps downgrading the room. When I pointed out that it was our anniversary  so two beds wouldn't be ok and that I would take they downgrade if they could reimburse us for the cost difference. I was put on hold for a few minutes and when the girl came back on the phone she

Summary Heading: Worth the Extra Cost to Stay Here
Summary: I stayed there for four nights.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The renovation has made it feel more like an upscale - not luxury! - hotel.  The best part is the convenience to Downtown Disney. Lots of very good restaurants provide excellent gastronomical experience for all price ranges and they are all within a short walk.  BTW if it was not for the price and a bossy checkout supervisor (charged me for 5 nights parking and behaved as if it was my fault) I would have given this hotel an Excellent rating.  The Conference facilities were excellent and the conference wait staff's attitude was fantastically positive and cheerful.

Loved this hotel! Perfect for families. Super comfortable beds and the best part was the headboard. We stayed here at Grand California and while that is also lovely I just loved this hotel. Bathroom is larger with deeper tub and toilet has separate room. Felt we had more space at that is was cleaner and newer than Grand California.

We were looking for a "stay-cation" with our kids and I would definitely recommend going to the Disneyland Hotel. No Cons, just Pros:  - We checked in early, around 1pm, and front desk was very friendly. - Pool is great. 2 swim pools plus 1 pool with 3 slides (large, medium, small) and shallow pool. Tons of lifeguards, kid's life vests available, and food/drink service. - Room was in Adventure Tower. Great room with very large windows. - Of course, great location. But it would be a great stay even if you don't go to the Parks. Downtown Disney is just outside the doors of the hotel with plenty of entertainment and dining options.  Extra great service:  1) We tried to book an extra night, but the hotel was sold out. We explained the main reason was to use the pool. The front desk

Summary Heading: Magical stay, however, do not go expecting luxury
Summary: Please note my rating for this hotel was based on bang for the buck overall.   I think this hotel is a bit confusing to some of its guests. Anywhere else on earth, spending this much for one night would usually mean staying in a luxury hotel. Even in Walt Disney World, this price level would mean staying in one of there more luxurious hotels. (and if you are looking for it at Disneyland, you should head to the Wilderness Lodge.) However, this is CA and this is Disneyland and this is what it costs. We were very fortunate to stay at a great rate for my husband's business meeting there. I am not sure I'd pay to stay there at full price (unless it was a really good deal.)   I loved the hotel. It was really really really nice but not what I'd call luxury (especially in the bathroom

We stayed here for two nights recently in a room on a higher floor overlooking the parks/downtown disney area. It was wonderful. We could see the fireworks from our room and listen to the musical accompaniment on the tv in our room. The staff are wonderful and are eager to engage the little ones. We had fun hunting for all the hidden mickeys throughout the hotel. The pools are lovely and the location cannot be beat - you are right at the entrance to downtown disney and a 10 minute walk from both parks - no trams or shuttles necessary.

Summary Heading: Disneyland a magical place to spend Christmas
Summary: We checked into this hotel on Christmas Eve as we were on a four week holiday in the USA and thought that many things would be closed Christmas Day but that Disneyland would not be. How right we were.  I think Disneyland is in fact the busiest place on earth on Christmas Day but it was a truly memorable Christmas.  We were on the 17th floor so we had fabulous views of the pool and grounds. The hotel room was large with two double beds.  The hotel room was well furnished and very clean.  One of the swimming pools was open but the other was closed for refurbishment but to be honest it was December so we were not going to be using the pool.  We had pre booked breakfast on Christmas Day in the nicer of the two restaurants in case they were busy but they weren't so we could have

Amazing trip for the whole family!  We stayed in the tower closest to Downtown Disney and had beautiful views of the fireworks, California Adventure & Downtown Disney.  We usually walked to both parks because it was faster than riding the monorail.  Restaurants in Downtown Disney were a nice break from the Disney food.  You have to walk through DD to get to parks from hotel.  The room was very nice and clean.  Cute Disney touches all around.  The light up headboard to music was a favorite.  Even the pullout sofa for my third child was like a twin bed.  Getting into the parks early was very nice - we went straight to Fantasyland in Disney and did all the rides.  In CA we went straight to Cars Land and was able to do it with only a 10 minute wait.  The usual wait was 70 minutes!

This was our first time staying in a Disney branded hotel, and it was one of our best Disney experiences yet. It is pricey, but the military discount for those that can get it makes it more affordable. I liked how we could park our car (you have to pay for parking) and not have to touch it the rest of the trip. We initially planned to stay for four nights but stayed a fifth when we were offered to stay for only another $100/night, probably to fill empty rooms and to possibly spend more money in the parks. We didn't get that offer until the last day. The hotel upgraded us to a pool facing room, sharing a door with our friends and across the hallway from my parents. It was nice, but it only meant that we had to endure our 2-year-old's cries for "water!" Luckily there were

We stayed in a standard room with a view (Downtown Disney) and loved it.  We were able to watch the fireworks from our room with the TV tuned into the music of classic Disney songs.  Our kids were tickled pink and didn't take their faces off the window the entire time.  The rooms are elegantly decorated and very comfortable beds and linens. The walk through  Downtown Disney to the parks was very easy but a little more challenging at night with tired children but we made it.  We rented a stroller each day but they do not allow you to take them into Downtown Disney or the hotel. The monorail ride from DTD into the park was great to start the day.  As guest of the DL resort you get to go into the parks early (Magic hour 7am) and they alternate days between DL and California

Close to both parks, short stroll through Disney downtown. Nice room, good bathroom, nice Disney touches. In fantasy tower, best if you self park as closest. Expensive, but if you have a package, you reasonable considering cost of tickets to get in. You. Can see fireworks from front of hotel.

Summary Heading: Fun to stay so close to the parks
Summary: We love Disneyland and CA Adventure, it's so convenient to stay a with in a quick walk of all the fun,  the rooms here are very comfy and decorated with loads of Disney magic.  It's pricey to stay on property but for the added connivence and total emersion in the Disney experience we think it's worth the price.  We are trying Paradise Pier on our next trip it's a little less expensive and closer to CA Adventure.

Celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary! My husband called and asked for "something special". Our room was lit by "candles", bed was covered in roses and chocolates, we were given robes with our names, and a special treasure chest of bath amenities. Beautifully done. I still prefer the Grand Californian, especially since the Disneyland Hotel has increased it's rates. But the DH provides a classic Disney experience. Rooms have been updated nicely. The pools are great. My kids loved the monorail slide. Staff was friendly and helpful.

We stayed in a two bedroom suite in the Frontier Tower and were pleasantly surprised at how great our accommodations were.  We think that the rooms were recently updated.  The extra touches like having the headboard on the beds light up like fireworks when you press a switch on the light on the nightstand which the kids thought that was so cool as well as the Disney candies left on the bed each day.  Having a mini kitchen was also a big help as we could eat a quick cereal breakfast before rushing out to the parks or keep drinks & stuff cold during our stay.  Although it is more expensive to stay at one of the Disney hotels, we feel it is worth the extra money to be within walking distance of the Disneyland, California Adventures & Downtown Disney but the best perk is the early

Hotel was classic in appearance. Nice pool area again like a typical high end hotel. No mickey shaped pools etc like you might see in Disneyworld.  Great location as one could walk to the parks in about 10 minutes and pass through downtown disney on the way.  We ate at character palce on site for breakfast and had great variety and mickey waffles.  Characters came around and spent some time with each table.  Food was pricey, but so are stuffed costumes of Baloo.  Overall a great experience but you pay for convenience of proximity to parks.

We took our granddaughters-age 8 & 9- this past week.  We were upgraded to a suite in the Frontier Tower- not sure why but no argument here.  We stayed in room 5770.  The girls were able to watch the fireworks from their bed- it was magical.  Lots of oohs and ahhs.  The headboard had carved designs of fireworks and shining stars- a very subtle night light- the girls thought it was very cool. We had a very slight snafu with the room key- Erin L made the girls' stay magical by bringing up signed character photographs.  Disneyland is always spectacular.

Check in to check out and everything in between was such a wonderful stay. Check in was quick and easy and we were off to our rooms. This was a surprise for my son and granddaughter and it was better than expected. We arrived at our room and we were pleasantly surprised. The room was awesome with lots of touches of Mickey and Disney. The new headboard was wonderful.  The beds were super comfortable. Housekeeping was the best I ever seen. You would think we were the only ones on the floor. We never heard any noise the whole visit. Our view was fantastic. We could watch the fireworks from our room with the music piped in through the television. Every cast member we encountered was always pleasant and helpful. The pool was fabulous and my granddaughter loved loved the monorail

Our family was debating whether to stay on property or off.  I am glad we did.  The hotel and rooms are exeptionally nice after their recent renovation. The beds were comfortable and the room was spacious enough for our party of 5.  Our room was very clean also, which is very important.  One thing which they went over the top was they left roses on our bed because we would have celebrated our anniversary during our stay.  The only reason I am giving this hotel 4 stars is because of price.  It is a bit pricey but you do get the comfort and convenience of a Disney Hotel.

My grandchildren chose this hotel and although pricey thoroughly enjoyed our stay there!  Location was great and close to downtown Disney.  Pool area was great and customer service excellent!  We could see the fireworks from our room each night and the ice machine on our floor was well used!

As frequent travelers to Walt Disney World, this was our first visit to Disneyland Hotel.   We were unsure on what to expect on the west coast, but were happy with our stay in the Fantasy Tower.  We booked a two-bedroom suite: there was a king bed in the “master” bedroom, two queen beds in the second room, plus a pull-out couch and pull-out twin bed (under the TV!) in adjoining living area, complete with a working mini-fridge.    The hotel and room is reminiscent of the overall scheme at WDW’s Bay Lake Tower, but with many more “Disney-specific” elements: a tea-cup table in the lobby, an assortment of photos of important visitors to Disneyland in the elevator vestibule, and assorted Disney-themed items throughout the room itself (the headboard, the light fixtures and the faucets

I normally do not review hotels, but I felt like it would be unfair of me not to review my recent weekend stay at the Disneyland Hotel, if only to help to prevent people from throwing their hard earned money away.  I use Tripadvisor for research for every one of my hotel stays, and I'm wishing I would have followed the advice of others in this case.  My wife and I do an annual trip to Disneyland each year, normally staying at an off-property hotel (Sheraton or Hilton), and taking a shuttle into the park.  This year, I decided to spend the additional $700+ to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, just because we wanted to splurge a bit.  What did that additional $700 buy me?  Upon reflection, not much.  If you're going to stay at this hotel for any of the following, I urge you to look

Summary Heading: Loved Our Stay at the DLR; wish it were a little less expensive
Summary: We enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel, last week of July/first week of August. The rooms were beautiful; everything was clean and the rooms were quiet. We stayed in the Fantasy tower and had views of the fireworks. We had a working fridge (I heard there had been issues with the fridges being replaced in the hotel but not a problem for us).  For such an expensive hotel, we would have expected a little more extras, such as the towel animals the maid service makes for you in Walt Disney World in Florida. My children missed that small touch. But overall the service was excellent and everyone was very friendly. One of the CMs even gave my daughter a pin when we went to trade at the front desk (my husband traded a pin but not the one my daughter liked best so the CM gave

My husband insisted for our first Disney experience we stay at the total. I'm so glad he did. We loved the whole Disney fell right from check in. The location was excellent walking up downtown Disney making you feel part of the park. The room in frontier tower had superb views over the pool and we could see the fireworks at night. Loved the full length windows. Also loved the rooms and special features, room was plenty big for 5 of us too.  We spent quite a bit of time just chilling at the hotel with our kids as they loved the pools. Disney was extremely bury so we made use of the magic hours and then returned to hotel early afternoon to relax. Was great to be Able to do this so easily.  Only complaint would be getting in to goofys kitchen. We had a 6.30 reservation but were not

Wonderful hotel and could not be any closer to the action!  We felt very much part of Disney, yet the hotel was an oasis and not noisy or crowded at all.  Wonderful pool area and fantastic customer service.  Our only complaint would be that it was very expensive.

Having traveled to Disneyworld many times, we had big expectations. We had requested to be in the Adventure tower however this request was not met. We were slightly disappointed in this but the Frontier tower was not bad. We had booked a standard room with 2 queen beds. We had the extra day bed which was nice. We had a slight theme park view and were able to see some of the fireworks at night. The room décor was nice. Our favorite part was the headboard with the lights and music. One of the major cons is the dining that is offered at this resort. Every morning we were there, the breakfast place was not open until after the park was open. This made it impossible to eat before we went into the park. Another thing we missed was the Resort Refillable mugs that Disneyworld offers. We

The hotel was very nice and the staff very kindly , they ask about every thing and also advice about many things . The room very nice very Cousy and clean . The view over the swimming pool very good and nice .  But the one thing is the room services , it's not good at all we order dinner and took 60 minutes and no body come when we called them , they bring it after 35 minutes more . And the dinner were not tasty at all we can't eat it , what room services not have French fries!!  That's all.
