We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights and loved it.  The room and bathroom area were plenty spacious for our family of 5 - we never felt crowded.  Had a theme park view so we were able to see the fireworks on the nights we weren't still at the park.  Very expensive but we were able to get 30% off and that made a huge difference so that we were able to use our Extra Magic Hours.

I cannot say anything bad about this hotel-except that it is a bit pricey. We loved our stay. Everyone was very nice and friendly. Our room was perfect. It was cleaned everyday. We had a great view of the pool area. The check in and out were very easy. It was great being walking distance from the two parks.

The Disneyland Hotel was very nice! The subtle Disney touches in the room like the hidden Mickey heads in the carpet and on the shower tile were cute! And don't miss flipping the switch on the bedside lamp to see your headboard light up and play music! We were in a wedding at the Disneyland Hotel and it was just phenomenal. The best part was the Cinderella Carriage they brought the bride in on, it was definitely magical. The only negative I have, is that the hotel rooms are overpriced. I paid more for my stay there per night than I did at the Beverly Wilshire, and the Beverly Wilshire was definitely nicer, although if you are looking for the magical Disney touch, I have nothing bad to say about the Disneyland Hotel!

If you can afford it, there is just nothing that tops Disney. The new light up head boards are magical even for adults. If you can stay a couple of days without the park to actually enjoy the hotel, you'll find great little hide aways  like the outdoor fire place by the tiki snack bar. Their room soaps by H2o is one of my favorites!!

As DVC owners at Old  Key West for the past 10 years, and numerous visits to I think all DVC hotels at WDW we had  expectations. The Disneyland Hotel,didn't disappoint. It is definitely not a DVC, in either accommodation set up or overall experience however it is a fine 4/5 star hotel. We were in the Frontier tower furthest from the main desk, but the room was great. We had a 9,11, and 15 year old with us. We did bring a blow up air mattress just to eliminate the I'm not sleeping with him debate and it was still comfortable. The flip out bed was a bonus. We did make sure to request a room that sleeps five in advance.   Granted We spent little time in the room over the course of our 3 nights. Pools are comparable to any WDW resort, and newly redone monorail slide is the best if

My family spend a few days at the Disneyland Hotel for vacation. When arrived the front desk staffs are friendly & helpful. The rooms are elegant, the headboard are carved with the Castel and Fireworks lights up & music when you press the button on the lamp. The room are spacious and clean. The only problem is the water pipes or the wall thickness cause you can hear other guests flushing toilet and kids screaming very clear. On the plus side only a 1 minute walk to Downtown Disney and Monorail station. We went to Goofy's kitchen for dinner average food on the buffet, plus side lots of Characters walking around from tables to tables so you snap lots of photos with them. The Hotel pools are very nice with 3 pools and slides for the kids & adult.

We spent a few days at the Disneyland Hotel for the D23 Expo.   We checked in early at 9:00 am  and the front desk staff was very nice.  We went to the expo and waited in the worst lines ever (not the hotel's fault obviously but Disney needs to do a better job on the Expo as it gets bigger and more popular).  Friday and Saturday nights the hotel hosted  a D23 after party shindig  on the lawns outside the towers.  My children had a difficult time falling asleep and the hotel should have been more sensitive to the number of younger guests and stopped the loud music earlier.  The next day we went to Goofy's kitchen for the brunch and the food was horrendous.  On the plus side the location of the hotel next to Downtown Disney and the monorail station is awesome and I liked the pools

We arrived to the Disneyland Hotel expecting a decent, clean hotel and were completely surprised once we opened the door to our room.  The hotel entrance is clean, friendly, yet average.  The property is what you would expect of a Disney property, nothing spectacular, yet clean and very nice.  The room, however, was wonderful!  We reserved a 1 bedroom suite for our family of 6 (2 teens, 11 year old and a 3 year old), this room was beyond expectations.  The 2 queens were super comfy and the sofa bed was the best we have ever had (we've had several!).  The view from the room was CRAZY!  Our 3 year old is deathly afraid of fireworks, so this was so handy, having a view from the room without the noise.    I was so happy with this hotel, I can't think of why we would not stay here

We made a last minute booking at the DL hotel after being very disappointed in our original hotel (Annabella). We thankfully switched to the DL hotel for the last four nights of our stay and it made our vacation!! The rooms are beautifully redecorated...very modern yet with a few special whimsical Disney themed touches. We were lucky enough to be able to watch the nightly fireworks from our room when we weren't still at the parks. There is a channel on the TV that plays the accompanying music to go along with the fireworks. Check in was efficient and any dealings we had with the staff were very positive. The pools and pool area is fantastic and the poolside food and beverage service was efficient. Just steps outside the lobby is the entrance to Downtown Disney and you felt like

We had an awesome room!  The staff was very friendly and 'the' magic was certainly around us.  Our room had a large window were the whole family (four of us) could sit at night and see the fireworks and listen to the music/storyline that they played in the park over the TV.  Our children LOVED the magical headboard!  Not only did it play music, but appeared as if their were fireworks in the sky.  Only at Disney.  We didn't have one complaint about this room, the hotel itself, or the staff.  I will say, if this is your first time going to the original "Happiest place on earth" you better be packing some cash, because the food is NOT cheap.  I'll admit, if we have to compare - we LOVE WDW in comparison.

Summary Heading: Overpriced the hotels outside are a better choice
Summary: The family was terribly disappointed with this venue, The check in was swift and the staff were excellent, the room was clean, the linen good quality,beds good. Though for $600 approx per night we expected a fridge in our room, gratuities included in the costs and perhaps even breakfast etc. Can you believe that the staff are paid minimum wages here and the hotel literature even recommends what gratuities should be paid to their various staff. We were astounded that we were not compensate for the fact that 2 of us had to go twice a day to the bell boys to get our medication from the fridge, not to mention 2 of us had our name incorrectly spelt on our room cards etc

We stayed for 1 week in a 3 bedroom suite.  We had 10 people.  Check in was easy.  The hotel is clean.  The rooms are well maintained and comfortable beds.  We ate at Goofys kitchen which was good and Steakhouse 55 which was over rated.  Daily housekeeping was average at best.  The concierge lounge is highly recommended.  Great beer and wine selections all day plus decent continental breakfast.  The pool was nice if not a bit cold.  Kids loved the water slides.  A few issues with the front desk.  We were on hold for over 15 min one night wanting to ask a question.  We hung up.  Additionally they told us they never charge to a credit card until the last day.  Well we wanted to change the card we used but by day 5 they had already charged everything to the first card and refused

Once again, Disney attends to every detail. This hotel is worth every penny. The staff are helpful, the rooms and main areas are spotless, beds are very comfy and the location is perfect at the end of Downtown Disney. The monorail access saves you from the extra hike/wait at the main gate and it's fun! We would stay again in a heartbeat.

We stayed here for 4 nights this week.  We had our travel agent book a suite, which is actually two connecting rooms.  We are a family of 6.  We loved the beds and the headboards that light up.  Our children liked the pool, but noticed the pool water was very salty.  We had a suite in the Fantasy Tower which had an excellent view of the fireworks at night.  (If you can actually stay at night to watch the fireworks in front of the castle, do so.)  The hotel is located at the opposite end of Downtown Disney away from the parks.  It is only a 10 minute walk or so to the parks.  At night, Downtown Disney is hopping, and it is really fun to see all the activity that is going on when you walk back to the hotel.  We had one meal at the hotel, the Tangaroa Terrace, which we liked.  They

Stayed at the hotel for three nights and upgraded to the concierge service. Well worth the extra cost. The rooms are very spacious and the beds were fantastic. I liked that the bathrooms had a separate room for the sink. We had an infant with us and there was no need to take a travel bed as they are provided, saved room for the car. The internet speed was very quick too. We stayed in the Adventure tower, with is the closest to Downtown Disney. Our room overlooked the pool but used the E-Club upgrade to watch the fireworks at night.The pools were not very crowded and the hot tubs were very large to accommodate lots of people. The E-Club also had an expanded continental breakfast, afternoon snacks and appetizers, along with beer and wine, and deserts in the evening. This was well

I hadn't been since I was ten so I was excited to go for graduation.  The hotel was nicer than I had expected.  The bathroom was very nice.  The pools were clean and pleasant, and the water slides were cool.  Disneyland is ten minutes away so the location is nice.  The gift shop has everything in case you forget something, but cookies were seven dollars.  There are lots of places to eat near by.  The bar located by the pool has good drinks and food, but like the gift shop it's a bit pricey compared to back home.  My favorite part about the room was the mickey stuff everywhere.  Using the free wifi, I watched a disney movie every night before bed.  I went with someone who had never been before so it was fun to watch her be amazed for the first time.

Stayed 3 nights on the concierge level with 3 fairly young children. Property couldn't have been more convenient to Disneyland. Grounds including pool were immaculate. Life guards at pool were great. Concierge level added a great deal of convenience. "Cast members" in concierge club were gracious, although unable to upgrade our tickets as requested and provided us with incorrect information with re: to cost of upgrade. Complaints were few and minor, smoking area at entrance to hotel and very limited food menu at pool. Cost of rooms with concierge upgrade was astronomical, but with multiple young children ? worth the cost.

Summary Heading: Without the Disney sign I wouldn't have known it was Disney
Summary: The hotel wasn't bad, but for the cost, I expected a lot more.  We were put in the Frontier tower and just finding a parking space was ridiculous.  We ended up parking in the Paradise Pier Parking Lot, as our lot stated it was full.  The room seemed very small to us and quickly we realized that there was no fridge in the spot for one.  Luckily, they sent one right up.  I found out later that others tried the same thing and were told they were all out.  My understanding is that they are in the process of replacing all of the fridges, but haven't yet.  There was also a strange sewage smell the entire time that we were there, I have no idea what was causing that.  The front desk crew was very helpful when we had questions and easily fixed an issue that we had with our park tickets.

I will first start off saying my family is a Disney Family- our yearly vacation for the last 5 yrs has and will continue to be Disney World in Orlando Fl.  We had to travel to San Diego CA this summer for a family wedding so we decided to go a few days early and visit Disneyland Resort.  We booked a 4 day stay in the Disneyland Hotel.  We were extremely disappointed with our vacation choice.  The hotel was nice- we stayed in the Adventure Tower and were close to DownTown Disney, the room was delux view and nice but really just that- a hotel room.  The incorporation of the hotel with the park and the optional dining plan in DisneyWorld really makes into into an "all inclusive" resort while Disneyland is fragmented into the parks having a separated feeling from the hotel- the lack

Our whole family accompanied my husband to a medical conference at the Disneyland Hotel.  We stayed 2 nights for the conference and added an additional 2 nights for a family vacation.  It was a lovely hotel, beautifully maintained, and very clean.  Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and Disney California Adventure are all within walking distance.  The pool area was beautiful and a great place for our children to spend time.  The lifeguards were plentiful and very attentive.  Goofy frequented the hotel lobby during our stay.  Our room had 2 queen beds and a poolside view.  My kids were delighted with the fireworks that lit up on the headboard over the beds. There were nice Disney touches all over the suite. Prices at the hotel for drinks and necessities were high, but that's not

Only one word describes this hotel...MAGICAL! From the moment you walk into the lobby you are greeted with this overwhelming feeling that is no ordinary hotel. My family of 7, ( myself, husband, 3 boys under the age of 6, and my parents), stayed our last night of our trip here. It was all that we could afford this time around. The amazing cast member at the front desk set up with adjoining rooms and not just any rooms. My parents wanted a king room and obviously we wanted 2 queens. Well, they found 2 rooms for us that matched exactly what we wanted. We arrived there about 11am and our room was already ready for us. So nice! When we walked into the room, even though I looked it up online, nothing could prepare us for how beautiful and lovely the rooms were. We asked for a

We checked in at the hotel on July 18, for a 4- night stay.  Upon arrival,we had a couple of bumps in the road.    Bell service was slightly overwhelmed and we were passed over several times before we were assisted with our luggage.   It was frustrating, especially when others cars arrived, and they were assisted before us.    I even asked for help while holding my one year old and four year old hands.    At check in, the room we requested ( 2 queen beds) was not available.   They tried to give us a king bed for our family of 4.   The cast member at the front desk eventually was able to find us a room and upgraded us to a pool view room in the frontier tower.   It took over 30 minutes to check in.  We were blessed with a family member discount from my cousin.    The front desk

Summary Heading: Great Fourth of July stay. Concierge/Guest Services NOT knowledgeable!
Summary: Went with my husband and three teenagers to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for the Fourth of July. We checked in early and left our cell number so that we could enjoy the pool and have them call us when our room was ready. They called us at 3:30pm to get our room number. We stayed in the Adventure Tower (Hotel is comprised of Fantasy, Adventure and Frontier Towers) The Adventure Tower has views of Downtown Disney on one side and the pool on the other. We paid extra to get a Downtown Disney view to enable us to see the Fourth of July fireworks from our room that evening. We had a great view and were able to turn on the music on the television that went along with the fireworks. Standard Disney rooms sleep 5 which is a great option for larger families. We received an offer the next

We stayed in a 1 bedrm suite with a family of 2 adults and 3 children for 3 nights. Included was a 4 day 1-park-per-day pass and 1 character dining experience. We came in late July; the hotel was very busy. The check-in process was the worst part of our stay. There were long lines and the room was not cleaned until 330pm despite our checking in at midday (we arrived from overseas that morning, making it a very long, tiring check-in experience).   The room configuration was not ideal with 2 double beds in 1 room and a pull-out sofa bed in the living room. Also, the room was a little dusty. The decor and hotel were relatively new, however. Wifi is included in the tariff, which is good. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Disney parks, so location was good. There is both valet

Loved staying at this iconic hotel! Everyone was very friendly and helpful, room was well appointed, clean and tidy, everything you will need, considering you spend most of your time at the parks! What makes staying onsite a must is that you can come back to the hotel via Downtown Disney mid afternoon when everyone needs a breather and have a great swim in the pool, slide down the Monorail watersides, grab a meal or a snack at the poolside eatery, rest, get cleaned up, and go back to the park for the nightlife! You will love the double long light up headboard at night that is a wooden cutout silhouette of the park, and with the press of a button it twinkles and plays "when you wish upon a star"! The perfect touch to end the day ;)

I booked a room with 2 queen beds 4 months before my family arrived. When I checked in I was told that my room was "being cleaned" and they would place me in another room. I went to this room and there was a single double size bed for 4 people. When I returned to the desk to tell them there was a mistake and this is not the room I booked and PAID for in advance. During my 2 hours of arguing at the front desk, I was told that they would provide sleeping bags to put on the floor but the hotel was completely overbooked. During my argument, I personally witnessed 5 other families have the EXACT same argument. We had all booked rooms they could not provide. When I asked for the money returned to my card so I could stay somewhere else, they told me that since my trip was booked

After years of staying at good neighbor hotels we decided to actually stay on the property this time around.  The Disneyland Hotel did not disappoint.  Yes, it is not cheap...but you get what you pay for.  Our room was very clean and in good condition.  The Disney decorations were great.  The headboard actually lit up and played music box style music. The hotel has 3 pools to pick from, as well as 2 water slides.  The gym is medium sized and it contains several cardio machines, a universal set-up, dumbbells, and yoga mats.  There is a small coffee shop near the pool.  The monorail is a short walk from the hotel and will take you straight into Tomorrow Land.  In a nutshell...we loved this hotel.  It was fun, convenient, and definitely worth the price.

My husband and I have stayed here a couple of times, once before the most recent remodel and once after. Wow! The rooms are so lovely now since the remodel! I really do love this hotel anyway, especially with all of its history. But now its chic and the headboard that lights up and plays music makes me want to have one at home! :) The beds are comfy and the sheets aren't loud like a lot of hotels. We checked in early before a room was ready, and it was really easy to check our bags while we went to play. The pool and new slides are so fun and we even did them in December while it was too cold to do them! I love the models of the rides they have in each building as well. I really like where its located and easy to get to the monorail if necessary. I can't wait to stay again!

Just came back from a whirlwind vacation at Disneyland and stayed at the Disneyland hotel. The room was clean, beds very comfortable-two queens and a hide-away bed for my daughter, her friend and me. Monorail is a convenient way to access the part as you catch it in Downtown Disneyland and it will take you right by Space Mountain. The room was very quiet-we were on the 6th floor, 2455. Double sinks in the bathroom and the toilet was accessible though the bathroom/shower. No complaints-we picked up bottled water from the downstairs shop-never ventured to the second tower where the coffee shop was..too busy!

The Disneyland Hotel definitely carries a premium price - but, for the location, pool and perks (Magic Mornings) it was awesome. The light up headboard and old-time music box in the room were really fun. The boys (7 and 9) loved the monorail pool. We loved the pool side drink and food service. Just a short walk from Downtown Disney and the monorail to Disneyland. The boys had dinner at Goofy's Kitchen with a host of characters. Trader Sam's has a wonderful outdoor patio and fun tropical drinks. You can cut through the Grand Californian and into their separate entrance to/from California Adventure...this is only for resort guests of any Disneyland property and is a real time saver. This entrance is between Condor Flats (by Soarin' and Grizzly Peaks). You might be thinking the

Amazing!  That's one word to describe my stay! From the minute we pulled in, our experience was amazing!  Valet and luggage was prompt and easy. We arrived at 8am, and I expected to just do an express check-in and go straight to the park, and have them put my luggage in my room while I was away, but a room was already ready for us!  Rooms were beautiful.  All renovated, they were magical..  The kids loved the singing and lighting headboard.  I had just a standard view room, but I was able to see some of Disneyland, and best of all- got to watch the firework shows at night!  The hotel and rooms were all very very clean.  The elevators were fast, and there were enough to occupy the many guests coming and going all day.  It is located a short walk from Adventure Park, we caught the

Summary Heading: Need better service at the pool
Summary: Lovely hotel and very close to the park entrance. Staff could be a bit more friendly. Rooms very clean and the kids loved the light up bed head. The only thing that is not good would be the staff or lack of staff around the pool. The staff are not at all friendly or helpful. In fact I would say quite rude. It took us 30 mins just to order a drink then it took another 40 mins for it to come and it wasen't the correct drink. Then it took another 15 mins to get the correct drink. It wasen't even that busy around the pool. So we ended up giving up on ordering food or drinks around the pool.

Summary Heading: Three star hotel, five star price
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is on par with an airport Marriott at five star price. It is clean but generic with little character. The two towers outside the main building have zero amenities - have the feeling of a dorm. The big draw for the hotel used to be that the monorail came right into the hotel - it no longer does and you now have to walk to the station and the monorail now only has one stop in Disneyland, this can create long lines (40 mins). Service at the hotel was uneven - people are nice but we ordered breakfast via room service and fourty minutes later is arrived without the coffee. Ditto at the pool, we waited nearly an hour for a drink server after asking twice for assistance and finally gave up and went to the bar - which limits you to two drinks - so we had to go back

Summary Heading: Fun First Stay at the Disneyland Resort!
Summary: I am a travel agent and typically stay at Deluxe resorts at Walt Disney World. Since this was my family's first trip to Disneyland, and this seemed to be the "moderate" resort, I set my expectations somewhat low. I was not impressed with the hotel lobby... definitely underwhelming and lacking that Disney magic. However, our room (Frontier Tower) was ready at 11 am, so this pleased my family. At first, we were skeptical as the Frontier Tower  is farthest from the main lobby, but this turned out to be great as the location was quiet and it was convenient to the pool and Tangaroa Terrace/ Trader Sam's.  Our room was a deluxe pool view, located on the 5th floor. Upon entering the room, I was pleased with the size ( comparable to Contemporary, etc at WDW).  The room had a large entry

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay with Kids for a true Disney Experience
Summary: This location cannot be beat when it comes to having a complete Disney experience.  It is NOT cheap and you definitely pay a premium for being this close to the parks as well as Downtown Disney.  Great pool, nicely landscaped areas and fun activities for kids!  Rooms here a little bigger than the ones at Grand Californian which is nice if you have kids with you.  Only downside is that the windows in the standard rooms do not open.

Summary Heading: Location at a premium price point
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is an average property with a small touch of Disney. While the service and cleanliness are acceptable, you can pay about 1/3 of the price for a similar hotel without the Disney name. If you are willing to pay a premium for being a little bit closer to the theme parks while staying in an average hotel room, this is the place for you.

Summary Heading: The "Disney magic" is lacking, and isn't worthy this much anyway
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is a fun and convenient place to stay during any visit to the Magic Kingdom. The primary benefit of staying here is convenient access to the theme park via monorail, tram, or Downtown Disney, and to extended the Disney ambience to every part of your stay. It's a nice idea but the execution falls short. In every area it is clear that you are paying too much for too little in return.   While the rooms are clean and comfortable, the property feels a bit run down, even after the remodel. The fitness room is tacked on, the restaurants are chaotic and loud with average food, and the service--while good--isn't really what you would expect when spending as much as you do to stay here. This place just feels like a cynical attempt my Disney to take more of your money

I have to admit that I may have inflated expectations of Disney service.  So, when I arrived and was told that my reservations had been cancelled (and it wasn't Disney's faulty, according to Disney), you know that I was very disappointed.  It took a couple of days, and some real cajoling by my travel agent, but the folks at Disney came through with a very nice comp package.  As for the hotel, I was not disappointed.  The room was magnificent and was really special for the kids.  We took a two-room suite, which is a bit pricey, but you make that decision before you arrive.  Everything about the room -- bed, make up service, concierge, bellmen, and valet parking is fabulous.  On-site accommodations is the only way to go.

Hotel was overbooked for queen beds when we stayed not just us several people were waiting. We had two queen beds reserved got a small room with a king bed and rollaway. Supervisor told me my son could sleep with me. We were told we booked a standard room and up to Disney if we got a king or two queen beds and we booked a pkg with two queen beds through Disney also took us an hr and half to check in as they kept leaving and making me stand at the front counter. After the great room and customer service at legoland the happiest place on earth was disappointing.

I cant say enough about this hotel. We loved, loved, LOVED it. The rooms were beautiful, even the bathroom was a dream. I dont understand the negative reviews. Its expensive but you know that going in, its Disney. The grounds are beautiful. The pools and hot tubs awesome. The hot tubs fit 20 people. My kids enjoyed the pools and waterslides. We had poolside service at one point. You can get drinks and food. You just cant eat or drink in the water. Being able to just hop on the monorail to get to Disneyland, everything is so convenient. There are several restaurants on site. My husband doesnt want to stay anywhere else and thats based on a scary experience upon arrival. Our first day right after check in, I went to the room, my husband went down to get the kids, my mom and the

Glad they renovated, but having stayed at other Disney Hotels and taken Disney Cruises, I was surprised there was no turn down service! No chocolates on the pillow! No origami towel! No magical Disney good night note! Absolutely no sweet dreams magic, other than the light up headboard. Bathroom is too small - they didn't expand it in the renovation and they could have as there is wasted space when you enter the room. Wifi did not work in our room and room service took 1 hour!   Hotel Cast Members don't try to improve your stay, so don't bother asking them for anything. They seem to resent having to serve hotel guests. One Cast Member even complained to me about how difficult it is to work there with all the screaming kids. Overall - very disappointed with my stay. Not the

It's expensive yes, but worth it?  YES!  They have it down here.  My three small children didn't want to leave.  The pool area is fantastic, the service is great, and the rooms are clean, comfortable, cozy, and cute.  Each room has a headboard that lights up with fireworks and plays music with the push of an button.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower, which is the furthest tower, which is the quietest, however no front desk there so if you need anything you have to head to the main tower.  Also, I would have preferred one of the other towers as they have a better view of the fireworks.  Next time :)  Also, this hotel is so convenient to everything Disney has to offer!

Staff was awesome from the start and it kept getting better as the week went on..The closeness to the parks made getting back and forth a breeze.. The account setup with the hotel made charging items and food to the room very simple (no cash or extra credit cards to worry about)... We will be back to the hotel in the future, thats a promise !

Summary Heading: Loved our stay and was pretty happy with hotel
Summary: First off, let's list the positives: 1. Great proximity to the parks and Downtown Disney 2. Kids loved the pool 3. Castle mural in room that has light up fireworks and plays music is awesome 4. Fantasy tower room that overlooked fireworks in Disneyland was nice! 5. Great service and interaction with hotel staff  Overall, really liked this hotel and would definitely stay here again.  However, make sure you buy snacks/drinks elsewhere because Disney is expensive!  The gift shop, restaurants, and everything else is brutal.  It is very easy to over extend your travel budget here.  But I guess we expect that when we come to Disneyland.  If you have kids, and are coming to Disneyland then this is the place to stay for sure!

It's big, it's blue, it blows a huge hole in your trip budget, but it is oh-so-worth it. I mean, seriously, where else can you find a headboard with a light-up castle in it? The furnishings and décor were all top-notch.   The real reason to go here is just all the whimsical touches-and you have to look for some-from the Mary Blair Paintings to the teacup chairs. It's a more sophisticated version of the Disney whimsy that you'd see in other hotels. Even the duvets have Mickey heads woven into them. The theme of Disneyland is everywhere in the room. My advice would be this: do it once if you can. It makes the trip all that much more special if you are doing it as a once-in-a-lifetime thing.  I can't comment on any of restaurants because I ate at Downtown Disney or the parks. It's

Summary Heading: Poor Customer Service - Walt Would Be Disappointed!
Summary: The pillow on the bed reads, "A dream is a wish your heart makes, when you're fast asleep." Well, if you stay at The Disneyland Hotel, you better plan to stay asleep, because the unaccomodating staff will not be eager to make your dreams come true! On-site employees seem trained to obstruct everything your heart desires. We found that the Disneyland Resort call-center employees are much more helpful than any of the on-site staff. Don't expect to be pampered during your stay. You'll have to go get it yourself or be frustrated as you wait, because the on-site employees will not help you in a timely or satisfactory fashion at this hotel.  *At check-in, we were told we "had a reservation in their computer", but we "did not actually have a room for the night" as they "over-sold the

Stayed at the Frontier Tower. We had a premium room with a view of the pool. The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. It's a great location because it is so close to Downtown Disney and the parks. The Goofy's Kitchen breakfast was expensive but my son enjoyed meeting the characters. I wish the smaller restaurant beside the pool offered more choices for a quick breakfast.

A basic functional hotel, which offers convenient family rooms for 2 adults and 2 children.  Bathrooms very small, and also wardrobe space way too small for 4 people.  But you're here to go to Disneyland, so you will spend very little time in the room.  Nice stroll from the hotel to the park, or show your room key and catch the monorail.   Buffet breakfast with characters works out to be about $150 for a family of four - exorbitant - think you need to be pretty desparate to eat with Disney characters to pay that.  The steak place next door also serves breakfast, much cheaper, but the food always gets to you lukewarm and the toast strangely comes out after the food rather than with it, so its never hot.

I stayed here for a conference. The rooms were nicely decorated, but not particularly large. The grounds were well landscaped and the pool area was a lot of fun. Standing in the bathroom you could occasionally hear noise from the adjacent room, that was bothersome. The staff was incredibly helpful. At one point I was in a gift shop looking for a snack and the employee figured out that I wanted a healthy snack and redirected me to a different shop in the compound.  Staying here you get to go into the park early, this was absolutely worth it! Other than that though, I wouldn't stay here for more than a few nights- just too pricey.

Stayed here for 4 nights with my family. We had connecting rooms which was fantastic since the grandparents came too. Loved having 2 queen beds instead of the usual 2 doubles. A tip for those with connecting rooms. 1 room can have up to 2 cars for the same fee.

Summary Heading: Comfortable room close to the action
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for a meeting and vacation. Our room was in the Adventure tower overlooking the pools. We reserved a room with 2 beds plus a daybed that was perfect for letting my 6 & 8 year old kids have their own sleeping area. The room was nicely furnished with lots of Disney touches. Headboard that lights up was my favorite part. Bathrooms are modern, but a little tight, lots of counter space. Bath tubs are child sized, water pressure for showering is horrible. The room was super quite - all of the doors are very solid and heavy, I only heard some hall noise once of twice. Beds were comfy and we enjoyed all of the extra pillows. We found the food to be not very good at the hotel, but it wasn't good in downtown Disney chain restaurants or the parks either.

The rooms are so magical and just Disney! They have very decorative rooms. The beds have a light up castle with fireworks above, and they have pictures hanging all over the place. There are 3 buildings/towers (the Fantasyland, Adventureland, and Frontierland Towers) each with their own theme. The pool is very cool and decorative, especially the slides, which are shaped like the monorail. The food at Goofy's Kitchen is scrumptious, and the atmosphere is very colorful and playful. It makes you think that you are in a cartoon. It is so neat and fun when Disney characters come up to your table. Overall the Disneyland Hotel is a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Excellent Facility but Poor Customer Service
Summary: After staying at The Howard Johnson Hotel for the first few days of our trip, we decided to stay at The Disneyland Hotel for the remaining 3 days. While the facility was clean and the pool was great their customer service was lacking (especially after paying over $600/night) as they had the following issues:  - All Refrigerators were not working in the hotel rooms - Subpar Valet Service  As previously mentioned, after staying at the Howard Johnson hotel, you expect that the customer service at the Disneyland Hotel would be a step up, considering the price difference. This is definitely not the case. We are a family of four with a 5 year old and a 10 month old. As the 10 month old is still receiving breast milk, it's vital that a refrigerator is available to store breastmilk.

Lovely room with comfortable beds. Great light up display with music for the headboards. Terrible noise control - could hear the elevators go up and down all night and every peep from the people next door. Toilet ran all night and with an intense high whine one night. When called to report it was fixed immediately - great attentiveness!

My mom and I go to Disneyland every July for a little mother/daughter vacay and we have always stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  This year we decided to splurge and stay at the Disneyland Hotel and we are glad we did!  The proximity to Downtown Disney and the parks is great and the decor is stylish with nice touches of vintage Disney.  Check in was easy and we were upgraded to a room with a view of the pool.  We stayed in the Adventure Tower in a room right next to the elevators, which was handy.  We could hear the elevators from time to time, but it wasn't a distraction for us.  We stayed for 7 nights and only had to share the elevator 3 times...we rarely saw other guests and we definitely didn't hear any.  Every aspect of our stay was wonderful and we have decided to stay at

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel, with added cost
Summary: This hotel was built with kids in mind 100%.   * Room had headboard that would light up and play the Disney theme, kids fell asleep to it every night. Sadly, we could hear EVERYTHING in the room next door. The hotel seriously needs to invest in better door / walls for a little bit of privacy.  * Food was to be expected, cheap and simple. For kids was perfect though, as they ate and loved every basic meal they had. Don't expect anything fancy.  * Customer service was excellent, the front desk staff helped us with anything we needed. The elevators in the morning were always full, like rush hour traffic. You would have to wait for several sometimes to go past before you (in lineup) would be able to get on.  * The worth of this experience came from the convenience of getting into

Not a fan. Stayed in the Adventure Tower. Rooms about the quality of a Holiday Inn without a breakfast bar...with apologies to Holiday Inn. This place has nothing to commend it. It makes Vegas look attractive. And I don't much like Vegas.

We recently returned from a trip of a lifetime.  Our trip included a four night stay in Disneyland before a week and a half in Hawaii.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel during our Disneyland portion.  Our friends had arrived prior to us and had arranged for us to get a room with a balcony and view of the parks.  WOW!  These rooms are amazing.  We had stayed here prior to all their refurbishments and this hotel has kept with the nostalgic feel but takes advantage of all the modern conveniences and technologies.  We loved the decor and the rooms were spotless.    Staff were extremely friendly, helpful and courteous during our entire stay.  The convenience of being "in the magic" cannot be stressed enough!  Walking from the shopping/food area and to either park is quick, efficient

Summary Heading: Magical- what you expect from Disney
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights during our 10 day California vacation. It was amazing. Loved the Disneyland hotel. Even being there the week of 4th of July, it was so quiet!  No noise, never ran into other guests In the hallways or elevators. We were able to see the Disneyland fireworks from our room, so great when you have young kids who can't stay awake that late. The room felt so spacious and had an excellent size fridge. We were able to keep cold drinks so we didn't have to spend a fortune on drinks at the parks. Love every single minute of our first stay at Disney, would not do Disney any other way. So close to the parks!  Amazing!!  Lastly I have to mention the light up headboard, carved like the castle with fireworks over it that light up and play the music "a dream is a wish your

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay when visiting Disneyland parks
Summary: We have made several trips to Disneyland in the past 5 years but always stayed off site. This time we decided to splurge and stay at one of the resort properties and we were not disappointed.  While check in was very busy we still felt like the staff treated us like we were special guests and took the time to point out different amenities in the resort.  Our mini fridge was on the fritz and not working but was replaced by a new unit by the next morning.  We loved being so close to the parks and being able to go to the parks in the am and then come back and relax at the resort pool and then go back and forth to the parks so easily.  We all loved the LED light display on the headboards that played "When You Wish Upon a Star".  The kids got to meet many different characters at the

Summary Heading: A great way for the family to enjoy Disneyland
Summary: Of course it was very expensive, but staying in a 1-bedroom suite here was great - so comfortable, convenient, and fun. I don't give it the very highest rating because it was not perfect and, at this price, it really should be. For example, suite had fridge but no microwave, kitchen cabinets but no dishes. Also, master bath door did not stay closed and could not be locked and on our first morning there was no hot water. But space was excellent, we could see the fireworks from our room even tho we did not pay extra for view, and housekeeping was wonderful. Also, the pool area was first rate.

We could only stay at the  Disneyland Hotel for 4 nights, but they were the BEST 4 nights we had! We knew it was going to be expensive, but after travelling so far from Australia, it was worth every cent. What an experience. We were feeling slightly jet lagged after flying for so long to get there, but all that disappeared as soon as we walked into the lobby and were greeted by cheery smiles and..GOOFY!! My 13 and 11 year old forgot all about the long flight as soon as they were engulfed in Goofy's big hug. From then on, our stay became magical each day.  As soon as we got to our glorious room we were enchanted. The musical headboard and all the little Mickey touches just highlighted the fact we were at Disneyland at last!! Each day, we got back from LOTS of walking to find our

First off: To everyone complaining about how expensive the hotel is. DUH?! It's Disney! You're there because its wonderful, the parks are RIGHT there and you can take advantage of Magic Mornings! You aren't there because it's a "good value". You CHOSE to stay there, don't complain.   We stayed April 20-23rd 2013 Now, the only reason I did not give this place 5/5 is because the front desk staff needs an attitude adjustment. Me and my man stayed here for our two year anniversary. We go to Disneyland  a lot being Northern Californians with annual passes, figured its a very special day why not do it right? The young gentleman at the check-in desk shrugged off my friendly greeting and had absolutely no sense of humor. Being an ex-cast member the behavior just kinda sucked.

We visited Disneyland in June 2013 with my 5 year old twins and was a truly magical experience for the kids, we all had a wonderful time. The hotel was great in every respect except one area.Tthe beds were fantastic and large rooms to really spread yourself out. Unfortunately we struck a member of staff who was simply the most unhelpful individual when we were checking out. I asked for the bell service to be called and meet me at the room to have our bags collected and was told to go back to the room and call them myself. I also asked to have a shuttle called to collect us and was told I could do this myself when calling the bell service. Totally and utterly unacceptable behaviour.  Luckily this didn’t impact the experience the kids had, but was a complete shock to me that

Summary Heading: Well worth the money for a safe environment and short walk to Disney California Adventure, land and Down town Disney.
Summary: My 22 year old daughter and I usually go to Disney World in Florida during Spring break, so we did compare the hotels during our visit to Disneyland in California. This hotel would probably be considered deluxe accomodations if it was in Disney World. The headboard lighting up with fireworks and music, plus the white gloved hands holding the light fixtures on the wall definitely made us smile. Our room was spacious and had a small refrigerator. The Frontier Tower lobby had a fantastic model of Big Thunder railroad. We never got to try the food at the hotel because the restaurants were never open early enough to be able to eat and to enter the parks during early entry and they closed before the parks closed. The hotel is located right next to Downtown Disney with several late

Stayed here for 4 days visiting from Australia.  Wonderful staff and hotel and beautiful rooms that scream Disney in a chic way.  Pool is excellent but crowded late afternoon.  Our little one loved watching the fireworks from the room.

This was the third time my family had stayed at the Disneyland hotel.  All three times now we have been satisfied with the room, the service and the location of the hotel relative to the park.  Staying at this hotel helps you to feel that you are inside the 'Happiest Place on Earth'.  It was fun to be able to walk to the park or take the monorail that is close to the hotel.  Coming back in the middle of the day to go swimming in the huge pool was nice.  That was one of the hotel's great points - to be able to go back for just a swim or a rest and then be able to go right back.  We had a great view of the pool, which glows in Disney colors at night as well.  The nearby restaurants, while expensive, served very good food and had great service.  The only real downside to staying at

Second time at Disneyland but first time staying in the resort. Absolutely lovely hotel, great staff and charming rooms. Despite the swarms of people that stay on at the Disney resorts during the 4th of July, our hotel was a quiet retreat.  We checked in at 9am and our room was already ready- parking was just outside the tower- downside was the $15.00 per day parking charge. Staying in the Frontier tower was pleasant - NO NOISE AT ALL. The room had all of the Disney charm you would expect; the pools weren't crowded, hot tubs were relaxing, the slides were awesome...at night you get a view of the Disneyland fireworks while swimming too

We had 8 in our party so we rented a 2 bedroom suite. Newly renovated, great pool and slides.  We took an extra day and reserved a cabana by the pool prior to arrival.  Well worth it. We also paid extra for the concierge level. Approx: 125.00 more a day per room.  Again well worth it. Free breakfast, afternoon wine, beer and cheese, evening desserts, and all day box juice, soda, bottled h2o. Can juices.  Saved so much money by taking a backpack into park daily with drinks from the E lounge (concierge level) I also had small disposable containers with their homemade cookies and Rice Krispie treats that my teenage kids ate like crazy. You can eat in lounge or bring back to your room. You can also watch fireworks nightly from lounge with piped in music.

Summary Heading: Super fun place to have a conference!
Summary: It's the ultimate Disney experience!  From the time you check in (love the sitting areas which are shaped like tea cups!) to your room (with Mickey hands holding the lights, or the fireworks that light up your wall!), everything is top notch!!  The concierge even helped me get the Ethernet cable out of my laptop!  The personnel in the stores are so friendly; they love to chat!!  Rooms are clean; we had a refrigerator in our room.  Free Internet, which, for a business traveler, is usually not 'free'!  The beds were sooooo comfortable!    Enjoyed seeing the fireworks from our room at night.  Walking around the hotel grounds is so pretty; the seating area with the fireplace was a fun gathering spot!   We were able to take advantage of the Twilight passes, which got us plenty of

Summary Heading: Motel 6 Maingate is better - Do not stay here and waste your money
Summary: Where do I begin, since we are still here,  We will be checking out sooner than planned.  The room was ok, not overly clean, the bathroom needed a good scrub down, gunk on the mirrors, and dust on everything throughout the room.  THE NOISE, if you want to relax or sleep forget it, kids running up and down the halls until after midnight. The family upstairs from us has a kid that screamed non stop and pounded on the floor continually, We tried to contact the front desk, and guest services never, and I mean never answered the phones, we held on today for over an hour and no answer, this was typical.  This was a second honeymoon for us and it has been a nightmare, Spent all of our savings for a year to stay here and what a horrid experience.  We have visited before and stayed at

My family and I stayed here in June.  It was the secon time for my husband and myself and it didn't disappoint.  The staff were amazing and we got to the hotel and checked in at 7am.  The kids got 1st visit badges an my niece got a birthday badge.  The rooms were a good size and lovely.  We were lucky an got a room with a view of the park and the fireworks that go off at 9.30pm every night.  My kids especially loved this as you turn your tv to the fireworks channel and you have the same music as in the park.  I find the location perfect.  You can either catch the monorail into the park or walk through Downtown Disney.    We had my nieces birthday dinner at Goofy's Kithen.  The food was great and all the kids loved seeing all the Disney characters.  The Monorail pool is also good

Summary Heading: Maybe Good, Maybe Bad, Definitely Expensive
Summary: One needs to look at other options and then just go for it. For the price we could have stayed at one of the other nice close hotels, took a limo or taxi to the park and still saved money. But if this is maybe someones once in a lifetime vacation, or money is not an option, then maybe it's worth the expense.   Fun for the kids to have the characters around. The pool was nice.  Hotel food was poor to average but the restaurants just outside have a variety of choices.   It was nice to be practically on the Park grounds. Makes it easy to get there as the gates open and easy to get back to the room 16 hours later at closing.  One poor bit of planning is having the Monorail close 1/2 hour before the park. What a stupid thing! It should close 1/2 hour AFTER the park so it can be used

We stayed here for a few nights at the end of a 3 week vacation to California with our daughter and grandson. We moved here from the Park Vue Inn which I previously reviewed. Because we were already in the area, I was able to go to the hotel early in the morning to check us in and hopefull get the type of room we wanted. Even by the time we got there at 10 am, the rooms were being taken, and we ended up having a handicap access room, not in the building we wanted, but we were very happy with the room and enjoyed staying in a different building this trip. We were up on the 6th floor of the main tower with the lobby, facing out over the pool. The renovations to the hotel since our last stay are amazing, and our grandson loved the light up headboard that played music at bed time.

Disney does staffing right. Whether Anaheim or Orlando a tip of the hat to their HR people because they seem to find impossibly happy people to work for them. We stayed three days at Disneyland Hotel in concierge level and from check in to check out had a great experience. Super friendly staff. Clean rooms. Great service for anything you need. Concierge staff were welcoming and pleasant. Pool area was great (though the kids thought the water slide was kind of old). Stones throw from either park. All round positive experience.

Summary Heading: Comfortable Resort Hotel in A Magical Location
Summary: My wife and I just stayed at the Disneyland Hotel as our focal point for exploring the tiki culture of Southern California. What a great location! The event we booked our trip around, the 50th anniversary of The Enchanted Tiki Room, was hosted in the hotel's grand ballroom and meeting rooms. We were within walking distance to Downtown Disney and Disneyland, and our tower was adjacent to Trader Sam's tiki bar and 3 nice pools. We were a 30-minute drive from Whittier and Hollywood.  Although our room was a little smallish (wasted space in the entry hallway), we couldn't have picked a more convenient and comfortable hotel for the two of us.

My family and me are very flexible travelers and rarely complain about hotels,  but I am so disappointed by our recent stay at the Disneyland Hotel...yes, rooms are spacious, ridiculously overpriced and one doesn't get any "extras" like a nice breakfast or a microwave...and Disney's goal is obviously to squeeze every dime from you, but that's not my complaint! We knew that going in.  My 18 yo son was in the shower/tub (the design of the fixtures while cute, are sharp edged, and not suitable for younger children) when the ENTIRE ceramic soap dish broke in half and badly cut his palm. He is a tall kid, but very slender. He was sharing a room with grandpa, who was walking around the grounds with grandma when it happened. Anyway, he found my adult daughter who then called the front

We were attending a convention here at the end of the week, so we were offered the EXTREMELY affordable convention rate, which included theme park tickets too, so we went ahead and booked for the week prior to the convention to make a family vacation out of it. We saved hundreds...although, I would still recommend staying here even without the convention rate...this place is wonderful. We are a family of 2 adults and 3 boys who are 10, 7, and 2, and this was the perfect place for us.  Checking in on Sunday morning was a breeze and they even had a room ready for us at 11am when we checked-in which was great! Even if they didn't have it ready, they could hold our luggage and allow us to use the pools until one became ready. We stayed in the Frontier building which is the farthest

We stayed in a suite at the Disneyland Hotel this time. After our horrible experience at the Grand Californian we were hoping for at least a decent time. We were completely amazed at the difference between the two hotels. The funny thing about it is when we went into our room this time we were actually looking for things to be wrong with the room because of our last experience. Unbelievably we could not find anything wrong with the room. No dust, dirt, smudges, cobwebs and everything actually working. We were completely surprised with how nice the suite was from the space to how extremely clean it was. The staff inside of the hotel was completely knowledgeable about anything and everything we had questions about and always offered suggestions. For example, we wanted to take the

We surprised our daughter with a trip to Disneyland. I chose this hotel after doing lots of research and we work hard so spending the extra to stay here was justified. I love how close it is and our view from our room was fantastic. We were in the frontier tower, which most complained was farthest, but it isn't that bad. The pool area can get a little cramped with people piling their towels on the chairs and leaving so you don't know if they are gone, wish the workers there would keep it better organized but I'm sure they are over worked. We loved the early entrance into the parks and would stay at the disney hotels again just for that. We did use the entrance into calif. adventures thru the calif. grand hotel, but the bellhop don't like it especially if you go the wrong way,

We just stayed at the DL hotel and it was fantastic! I looked at the rooms on you tube to help me decide if this was a good fit for my family of four. It was excellent, nothing fell short of magical. It's true you really do stay immersed in the Disney magic! After staying here, I don't think our family will stay off- site again. It just made the entire trip Pure Disney. If you can swing it, do it! It's completely worth it!!

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to stay, so close to Disneyland and Disney Town
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed here for 5 days in May 2013. Check in was easy and we were upgraded which was nice. The room, although not massive, is very clean and serviced well each day. The kids (5, 10, 11) loved the pools and the waterslide at the hotel. It's certainly a huge advantage being so close to Disneyland that you can come back to the hotel and swim and then return when you like. We ate at Disney Town each night  which has many different eateries to choose from. We got breakfast at the hotel or at Earl of Sandwich. One of the other major advantages of staying at this property is you get "Magic Hour" at Disneyland from 8am till 9am every day. Would recommend a stay here.

I just returned from a birthday trip to Disneyland, and the Disneyland Hotel made it absolutely magical. We normally stay at the Grand Californian, but wanted to try DLH after the renovations- not to mention, the $100 increase in price to stay at GCH wasn't worth it! And after this stay, I think we're hooked on Disneyland Hotel and won't be returning to GCH unless they significantly drop their prices.  Upon checking in, I notified the receptionist, Jacqueline, that we were celebrating a birthday, and I asked if there might be any chance of an upgrade. I was absolutely amazed when she upgraded us from our standard-view room to a CONCIERGE room overlooking Downtown Disney and the theme parks! Wow! Thank you so much, Jacqueline, for making my birthday so special with this kind

Summary Heading: Where to stay if minimizing chaos is the goal.
Summary: Staying here is a good thing for a hassle-free Disneyland trip. Hour earlier admittance to the park. Not having to arrange for transportation since it's right next door. Special entrance into the park via monorail. Pool is cool. Even though it was booked full it didn't seem crowded.

Loved this hotel. From the minute we went through the gates we were amazed. Trying to spot all the Mickey's, looking at the hedges that had been crafted and created into characters, it was a experience in itself. The room was beautiful, clean, comfy beds, had a headboard of the Disney Castle which sang and lit up and even the wall lights were Mickey themed. Helpful staff, a beautiful pool which played music, had themed restaurants and most importantly a washer and dryer onsite. This was so helpful and handy so you could enjoy your holiday without having to worry where is the nearest Laundromat? Close to Disneyland and Disney Californian Adventure, just a short walk through Downtown Disney. Loved it. Would stay there again.

Excellent hotel within walking distance of Disneyland and California Adventure. Plentiful restaurant choices nearby and Goofy Breakfast at hotel worthwhile. Loved the remodel with an excellent twin bed hidden in the couch. Room was very clean and well appointed. Staff was helpful with any questions about the facility or Disney attractions The swimming pools and slides are staffed with cheerful, attentive life guards and offer lounge chairs, table and chairs, towels and bar service.  Worth every penny for convenience and well run property.  Shuttles to airports easy and reasonably priced. No need for a car.

We are a family of 5, that USUALLY goes to Disney World every year.  We decided to break the norm this year, which was difficult for me. I am used to the Disney Deluxe bracket and while looking here I was at a mist about this hotels.  All I have to say I am extremely impressed.  The staff was awesome, received an upgrade at no charge, and our room was available before noon.  The rooms were clean, and I love that the toilet is separate from the shower.  My kids loved the lighted headboards, and the pool, monorail slide.  The fact the characters were wandering around the hotel, makes it a plus, but could do more recognizable characters as in Mickey.  The beds were spacious.  It is a bit pricey, but the location cannot be beat.  You walk out the door and  you are 200 feet from

Summary Heading: Hotel got a facelift,but needs more, especially for the price
Summary: Rooms very nice, moderately spacious, but ungodly overpriced.  But that's Disney.  Squeeze every possible dime out of you, because of your kids.  Paid well over $400 per night per room, for a room and hotel which should barely cost $100 if it was not on Disney property.  That's the price of a room at the Four Seasons, which this certainly is not.  For that money, they could have at least had clean pads on the pool lounges, but they were all grossly stained and discolored.  Other portions of property also in need of repair.    Staff was very attentive, which is a Disney hallmark.  The problem is that if you want to stay on property, they have you cornered and they screw you every way possible, another Disney hallmark.  All things being equal, I'd rather pick another vacation

Summary Heading: Fantastic, Gorgeous!! -  Beautiful Hotel, Well Done Disney!!!
Summary: This Hotel Made The Whole Disneyland Adventure Complete!!!!!!! I am so Glad we made the decision to stay at this hotel. We have been wanting to stay here ever since they remodeled. We stayed there for 10 nights and it was the best hotel experience we ever had. The grounds were enchanting, you feel like you are walking through a jungle, the tropical feeling you get as you're walking to your room you hear the music from the Jungle Book as well as Hawaiian music. Every detail of the grounds has been perfectly manicured, you can smell the aroma of the flowers in the air as you walk towards the beautiful Monorail pool, the way they arrange the lighting at night is spectacular, you feel tike you're at an island retreat with the smell of honeysuckle and jasmine in the air. Once you

This was our first trip to Disneyland so we decided to stay in the Disneyland Hotel.  We were not disappointed.    From the grounds to the interior decorations, the hotel is pure Disney.  The rooms are huge and are beautifully decorated.  We were in the Adventure Tower on the 6th floor and had a view of Downtown Disney and parts of both parks.  We could see the DL fireworks each night.  There were performances going on each night in Downtown Disney but the rooms are sound-proofed very well so the sound was minimal.  The pool was incredible...it's still cool in California but the pool is heated.  The worst part is getting out into the air...other than that, the pool and water slide were great.  My favorite part of the hotel, though, was Trader Sam's...and I don't even drink.  The

We are disney fans, with over ten trips to disney world.  This hotel is the most beautiful place I have ever stayed, The detail in every room is outstanding, as is the property and cleanliness.  I could have lived in our lobby at the the Frontier tower...the music, decor it is all calming and uplifting and wonderful.  I could not have been happier in the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: Ok hotel, but Disneyworld hotels are better
Summary: We had booked the Mickey Mouse Penthouse Suite for 5 nights.  The room was very well done and maintained.  it has 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and a powder room.  Room service was average.  My main problem was the service and inefficiency both at the hotel and the park.  I switched credit cards mid-trip and this completely messed up there system.  I was unable to charge anything to the room for the rest of the trip.  I would recommend this room and hotel if you want a great room and an excellent view of the parks and fireworks, but service has some improving to do, especially compared to there Florida counter part.

We stay at the Disney hotels each time we go to Disneyland.  The updated Disneyland Hotel didn't disappoint.  The location is so convenient to the park and Downtown Disney, the rooms are very nice and the beds are comfortable.  The staff, as always, does an excellent job.  We didn't have a view room, but were in the Fantasy Tower and were able to watch the fireworks from our room.  It can be a little pricey but for us the extra cost is worth the added convenience and comfort!!

On checking in we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite for 5 nights. Thank you Disneyland for spreading some magic. The room was in the Frontier Tower, which was a littler further over than the other two towers, but really wasn't a problem.  We were located on the 5th floor and our balcony looked out over Downtown Disney with view to fireworks and occasionally we could see World of Colour. Open entry there is a kitchen area (which we didn't use), a large lounge area, then off that is a spacious bedroom and bathroom. The bed was large and comfortable, with view to the pool.  The Disney touches were lovely, with Mickey Mouse imprints on the sheets.  Hidden Mickeys in the carpet.  Bathroom also had gentle reminders of exactly where we were.  Trader Sam's bar was a lot of fun.  With

One of my greatest memories of all time was staying at the Disneyland Hotel. You start living the Disney magic the second you walk through the front door. The lobby is both beautiful, as well as entertaining.   While the big kids (the parents) are checking in, the younger kids can sit in teacups, watch a movie while sitting in their own royal throne, or even check out the gift shop.The rooms are an experience of their very own; Walt Disney's legacy is in ever corner.    The staff is absolutely amazing! It was definitely worth every penny. Thanks Disney for every happy memory. Can't wait to go back!

Summary Heading: A great hotel at the happiest place on earth...
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for 3 nights.  The location is the best part of the hotel.  As a family with two kids the ease of being able to walk through Downtown Disney and back to our room was worth the money.  The rooms are spacious, clean, and have a very cool light up headboard.  There are characters that walk through the lobby at certain times.  For little kids seeing characters in the lobby didn't make having to go back to the hotel during the day a bad thing.  There was always the excitement of possibly seeing one of the characters.  The pool has been remodeled and was very nice.  It's 4 feet deep in the family pool.  Perfect for little swimmers.  We never made it over to the slides.  The only downside to the hotel is the price.  In the summer it can cost as much as

Newly refurbished hotel is fresh and inviting to families and conference attendees alike. Room decorations are whimsical and disneyesque - I like it, even though I am here for work. There are ample amenities in the room re: fridge, coffee maker, safe, good size TV etc. Wifi is free - hooray! and the gym is well-stocked with a variety of machines/equipment. Location is conveniently located adjacent to the disney theme park and downtown shops/restaurants. If possible ask for a room facing the park to view the nightly fireworks. Hotel offers a good range of food choices/prices - including with disney characters.Conference facilities are above par and very well managed. Hotel and conference-support staff were courteous, attentive, charming and professional. No complaints from me.

Summary Heading: Great stay if you can afford it
Summary: We stayed at Disneyland hotel for 3 nights. Came to Disneyland to celebrate my little girl's 4th birthday and very happy we did.   We stayed in a premium room in the Adventure Tower facing downtown Disney.   Pros: - great view - can see fireworks from your window - Outstanding pool area with 3 separate pools for adults to soak and kids to splash, including a couple of water slides. Also, 2 hot tubs came in handy when using the pool later in a day. - staff was friendly and helpful throughout the hotel, but room service can take sometime during "peak" hours (no big deal)  Cons: - loud music from downtown Disney live bands some night lasted until 11 pm. Sounds isolation is rather poor - no fireworks on weekdays during "off" season. We specifically asked the hotel for a room with

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel but crazy expensive
Summary: Hotel has a very large pool, room was clean and very quiet and had the Disney vibe.  Loved the location but best part of staying in the Disneyland Hotel was the Extra Magic Hour admission to the parks.

Summary Heading: Fun times for the entire family
Summary: My husband and I plus our two children aged 1 and 3 recently had a 2 night stay here. My in-laws also stayed here. It was our children's first trip to Disneyland and we wanted to splurge a bit to make it special. The hotel is nicely renovated and, as other reviewers noted, there are nice Disney elements in the rooms, including the castle headboard that plays music and lights up. We left the lights on the headboard on all night as a night light of sorts for our children.  There are at least two guest shops in the hotel to buy souveniers and the hotel has an excellent steakhouse and access to Goofy's Kitchen, a character buffet. Depending on which tower you stay in, you hear more of the fireworks than you might want to hear. We were in the Adventure tower facing Downtown Disney

Hotel has apparently been renovated. The guest rooms, new courtyard, restaurant, bar, pool and water play area with slides have been redone and look great. We enjoyed pretty much everything about our stay. one minor thing is water pressure in shower was weak. staff was very nice. Price of stay is expensive and there are plenty of budget hotels around but nothing that compares to the Disneyland Hotel!

we stayed here June 2-6th with our 2 grandchildren   we could not have been happier.  The staff from beginning to end was fabulous, courteous and most helpful.  Our room was on the 11th floor of the adventure tower with a view of downtown disney and both parks  Getting to view the fireworks from our room was a bonus since the little ones never would have lasted that late in the park (9:30).   I have not one bad thing to say about this hotel   Thank you very much for making our trip truly magical

Summary Heading: No Disneyland Experience is Complete Without it!
Summary: We had the opportunity to stay for two nights during my four-year-old's first trip to Disneyland. It was a great hotel with a lot of extra Disney touches. Parking was easy, the check-in process was fast and the room was perfect. We had a view of the new pool from the Fantasy Tower. It was not cheap, but worth every penny. I arranged in advance to have princess items delivered to our room when we arrived and they came exactly when promised.  The pool and water slides were also great. We ate at Goofy's Kitchen and my daughter got to meet a bunch of characters and princesses. She was in heaven! The light up castle on the headboard and princess bedtime channel on the TV were also great. And, the extra magic hour allowed us to go on Radiator Springs and other rides with very little

We do like the location of Disney Cal Adventure hotel more but we like the pools better at this one so we usually stay here.  The character dinner in Goofy's kitchen was fabulous!  Since they renovated the rooms here, it's one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in a long time.  The bedding and bathrooms are 5 star quality.  We will definitely be back next year.    My only wish is that the pool area was more Disney oriented.  It's pretty boring to look at as far as nothing is Disney inside the pool area but the slides keep us coming back!

We stayed here over the New Year's holiday and had a great time. Our family enjoyed the resort immensely. My kids loved the lighted/singing headboard more than anything. We also had a room that overlooked the Park so we got to see the fireworks from our room without the loud noise that normally scares my little ones to death.   Breakfast at nearby Goofy's Kitchen was also a nice treat. We can't wait to come back during the summer and enjoy the pool!

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel from 5/20-5/23. We really enjoyed the  hotel itself. The room was spacious, had a mini fridge and just enough 'Disney' with the fireworks headboard a highlight; the pools are large with lots of seating (could use more umbrellas); and the proximity to the attractions (parks and DTD) is worth the cost.   HOWEVER, we were extremely disappointed in the service we received from staff. The  check-in process was a disaster. The line was back past the second set  of glass doors (about 20 parties ahead of us) and it took forever to reach the counter with only half of the stations manned. The agent who checked us in was very gruff and  never looked up or made eye contact and never once apologized for the  extremely long wait. Since the room wasn't ready,

After staying offsite in the past, this trip we decided to stay close to the park to have the convenience of heading back to the hotel during the day if things got too hot or tiring.  Let me say that it was definitely worth it to have this convenience!  The hotel is literally steps from the Disneyland Monorail which will take you right into Tomorrowland and operates until 30 minutes before the park closes.  We chose to upgrade to the Club Floor which gave us access to the lounge and a decent continental breakfast (cold cuts, bread, cereal, hard boiled eggs) all day soft drinks, snacks (fresh veggies and dip, chips and salsa, pretzels, pre-wrapped sandwiches, and a varying rotation of hot hors d'oeuvres) and coffee (Nespresso!) and tea.  Really great place to unwind and recharge

i went to this resort with my family..the rooms are beautiful...girls and teens ...princesses will wake up and will fall asleep listening to heavenly music..cinderella's music...pools are relaxing..food is great...one thing is for sure...i will return with my family....

I could not fault the Disneyland Hotel!  We paid the extra for a 1 bedroom suite, and was well worth it.  The kids could go to sleep in the bedroom and the adults could stay up in the living area.  The beds were comfortable...loved the musical light up headboard, listened to it every night.  Everything in the room and around the whole resort was spotlessly clean, all the time!  The pool and waterslide was a huge hit with the kids (not that you have much time to do that with so much to do in the Parks).  All the character breakfast were awesome as well.  Food was excellent quality, service was fabulous.  Being able to meet the characters at the breakfasts saved time doing this in the parks.  The 1 hour early entry certainly is a bonus with kids, you can do a few rides without the

This is a good hotel with it's greatest asset being its location right on the Disney property.  It's a little bit of walk through Downtown Disney, but beats the hassle of parking if you're not on property.    We didn't stay long, so I didn't experience a lot of the hotel.  We were in the Frontier Tower which is the furtherest one from the lobby, which makes it a bit of hike.  If you have little ones, I would try to get in the main building.    The pool area looked great.  Lots of things to do, and a lot of activity.  It is a very buys hotel - especially on the holiday weekends.    The room is typical disney room - nice, but not luxurious.  They all are kind of the same from top to low end it seems.  They have ben renovated, which is nice.  So they are clean and well laid out.

I love the Disneyland Hotel!  Our room was spacious and special with the musical headboards.  The hotel staff is very attentive.  The character breakfast was great each time.  And the California weather is much better than Disney World!

My family of four stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 5 nights just before Memorial Day, 2013. We have always stayed at the Grand Californian but decided to try the DH this year because we knew it had been remodeled and the pool area looked fun for our kids (8 and 10 yrs).  There are several towers (buildings) in this hotel which surround the pool and restaurant (Trader Sam's). The grounds are lush and include a nice outdoor fireplace with comfy couches, a fitness center, and a cute coffee house which sells lots of bakery items plus cereal, yogurt, etc. The hotel room itself was beautiful. It had clearly been recently remodeled- very clean, beautiful dark wood, cool framed photographs of Walt Disney, and my kids' favorite...a cool light up/ music playing headboard (Disney magical

As a family of four (myself, husband and two children aged 5 & 6), we couldn't have found a better place to stay whilst celebrating our children's Birthdays.  The room was beautifully made up for us on arrival with birthday balloons and gifts for the kiddies (at our cost). The room itself was very clean and modern and the bed's were amazing, especially after a long day at the Parks. Seeing all the Mickey Mouse decor around the room also gave the room a nice touch without being overboard. We were given an upgrade as we were celebrating which over looked the pool area (was beautiful at night).  We also dined at Goofy's Kitchen on the evening of my son's 5th Birthday and we were blown away at the amount of kindness each character showed by taking time to aknowledge that we were

Summary Heading: Nice hotel. Very decent service. Front desk staff was as good as it gets. Can't beat the location.
Summary: Nice place. Clean, comfortable, well appointed rooms. Cant beat the location. Right in downtown disney.  A 10 minute walk through downtown gets you to both parks.  The room is very comfortable other than the shower. Read below. However, the rest of the bathroom is nice. Our Premium View room had a separate room for the toilet which is nice. Also had two double sinks. Unbelieveabl soundproofing on these rooms. Our neighbors had young rambunctious boys and we never heard them once. We have a very loud 4 year old and our neighbors said they never heard her once. This is an awesome feature that is usually only found at 5 star hotels.   The bad- Probably the worst shower I've ever been in. Low pressure shower head, very cramped. It was clean however but very uncomfortable. After a

Disneyland Hotel ...wow !! What A Wonderful experience Staying At The Disneyland Hotel Anaheim USA... I Recently Enjoyed A Ten Night stay Along With 5 Family Members, The Rooms are Really Nice, spacious With A Luxurious Feel , Excellent Views, friendly staff,  Special Mention Of Our Housekeeper Pilar Who Did A Great Job Keeping Our Rooms Clean and Tidy And Also Was Extremely Helpful And friendly. . We thoroughly Enjoyed meals at Goofys Kitchen, The disney character's adding That Extra Special experience especially For My Two little Nieces !!!
