The Hotel Grounds Are spacious Lush And Green , The Swimming Pools And water slides Excellent!,  To Be In The Disney Resort Grounds absolutely fantastic , Just A Stroll To Disneyland And California adventure! ! Such A Magical Time Enjoyed

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for four days during a work conference event. I found the hotel to be nicely appointed, clean, modern and perfect for adults and children alike. I do not have children and fully expected this to be crowded with screaming children and cartoons everywhere. I was pleasantly surprised to find the resort to be geared toward both older and younger crowds. This was an excellent location for business conferences and we had fantastic meeting spaces. The food was well prepared and our conference was excellent. The staff were so helpful and eager to assist.  The swimming pool grounds are nice and I very much enjoyed drinks by the pool.  It was convenient to spend time in Downtown Disney with all of the attractions. This was a very nice trip and I was

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, convenient and remodeled rooms
Summary: The hotel is in a good location at the entrance to downtown Disney.  The rooms, at least in the main tower, have been remodeled.  I like staying in the main tower as the other towers are a bit of a hike.  Try to get a pool facing view as its better than the parking lot.  Although the front facing view has a peek of the Matterhorn and other Disneyland rides.

I live close to Anaheim and enjoy coming to the Disneyland parks often. Although the hotels are a bit pricey most of the year, I always manage to get at least one stay every year because it is too much fun. It is cleverly located its pools (perfect for families) with, in my opinion, awesome water slides and hardly seems crowded. It is also a short distance from the restaurants and the famous Disneyland Park itself. The rooms are spacious and include a display of "fireworks" in the middle of the room by the beds which I thought was just too cool. The concierge is also highly recommended because of the up to par snacks/and resting lounge perfect for after all of that fun at the park. All my life I have been exposed  Disney and these hotels (including the Grand Californian and

We stayed here over Thanksgiving 2012 in the Fantasy Tower.  We opted for a 2Q room for our family of four - slightly cramped but I just didn't want to pay for the larger suite options.  The pool area was fantastic, of course Goofy's Kitchen is a favorite, and they actually have a coffee shop that makes a decent latte (without the huge line at the only coffee shop in Downtown Disney).  Being able to take advantage of early entrance/Magic Hours is why we stay onsite (especially during a holiday season), but you have to get up pretty early to be walking through the gates an hour before opening - 7am in November.  We were happy with our stay and will probably stay there again.

Summary Heading: I really wanted to love this place
Summary: As most travelers to Disneyland, I came in with the expectation to have a nice time in a comfortable hotel. Check in started out wonderfully. The front desk attendant, Karen, was very warm and accommodating.  We entered our room and I called room service to order lunch. I was on hold for twenty minutes. I called from my mobile phone and was placed on hold as well, got exasperated and hung up my cell phone, and waited and waited. Finally someone picked up and said there were a lot of people calling, which was a lie at 11 am on a Friday. I think whoever answered that phone was just on a mental break.  I found a lot of that here, people on mental breaks. It was annoying. Service was slow. The room service attendant dropped the cart off at the front of the door and said I could roll

We were in for a seminar and although we usually stay at the Grand Californian, I read that the Disneyland Hotel had renovated their rooms, and since our event was in the Disney Resort we decided to give it a try.   Nice surprise! We sprang for a suite in the Adventure Tower. The rooms (living room and bedroom) were very generously sized, and there was a “powder room” in the living area as well as a full bathroom with both a tub/shower combination AND a separate shower. There were lots of towels to spare, which was a refreshing change from the usual towel rationing that hotels seem to be hung up on lately. The bathrooms were very clean and not a spec of mold in the shower, which sadly, given the invention of bleach, is surprisingly rare anymore.  A sweet vase with real

We spent five nights at the Disneyland Hotel in May 2013.  The hotel itself is a short walk from Downtown Disney, with direct access to Disneyland Park via the monorail.  As a guest of the Disneyland Resort, you also have access to California Adventures through the Grand Californian.    The hotel has recently undergone renovations and has a “new” feel to it.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower (Room 2717) where the main reception/check in is located and found this tower to be very centrally located.  We were steps away from DTD, the pool and all the restaurants within the resort (note:  Frontier Tower is the farthest tower from DTD).  Our room was clean and, as there were only three of us, spacious enough.  The bathroom is small, with the toilet in a separated room from the shower

Summary Heading: Great service & such the whole Disney experience!
Summary: I can't say enough of how wonderful of a time we had. The rooms we great & the pool was wonderful. Pricey, but we had saved for it knowing what we wee in store for! All the staff were most accommodating from the bell service to housekeeping!

Summary Heading: A great choice, though too expensive
Summary: You get early entry to one of the parks by an hour every day.  Which means if you can drag yourself out of bed early enough you'll get a LOT of rides in when you otherwise wouldn't be able to.  And you get to use the monorail.  And the pool at the Disneyland hotel is just great for kids.  And its really close.  And access to Downtown Disney is pretty great.  And ...  And its just crazy expensive.  Crazy expensive.  Can't imagine many people can afford to keep coming here over and over again.  We're going to have to try other places nearby which are just W-A-Y cheaper.  We do love staying here though, its just so damn convenient!

When our children were small (they are all grown adults now) this was the ONLY Hotel ON site. Of course we stayed there it was very nice and convenient. Now there are 3 site Hotels, we have stayed at Grand California in the past when it was new. The last time we stayed there two years ago it had become a little worn. So last year we decided to try the newly renovated "Disneyland Hotel" BEAUTIFUL! The Disneyland Hotel is very convenient only steps away from the Monorail to enter the park.  Our room was ready when we arrived at 11:00 A.M. Check in was a little busy but I watched and as the line got longer they would have a new receptionist come right out and attend to guests, it was a quick check in! When we reached the 10th floor the maids in the hallway were so sweet smiling,

We loved our stay here.  We arrived on a Tuesday morning around 8:30.  Because we wanted to stay in the Adventure tower our room was not quite ready yet.  We were able to check in and receive our key cards so that we could have early entry to the Disneyland resort.  We recived 1st visit pins from the front desk as well as autographed pictures with several of the characters.  At 11:30 we received a text letting us know our room was ready.  We loved our room on the 4th floor with a pool view.  The beds were comfortable and our son loved the headboard.  Our son also loved the hidden mickey tiles in the bathtub.  The only noise we ever heard was the pool music (which goes all night, even after the pool closes but is quiet) and we slept well.  We ate at Tangora Terrace for breakfast

Stayed in Frontier Tower, 9th floor, facing pool. Great view, comfy bed, lumpy pillows, decent shower and water pressure. Pool gets crowded so adults may want to take a dip later in the evening like we did. Comfy loungers at the pool, if you can snag one.  Room service was prompt,  food ok. Had breakfast in bed one morning- food was good, including the coffee (coffee snob here).  Room was cleaned daily. We did encounter only one stained towel and one stained pillowcase - we just put them in dirty pile in tub next morning.  We never heard another guest from our room, though shower and toilet water could be heard rushing through pipes overhead.  Staff were all friendly. Location is at the end of downtown disney which we loved. If you are feeling lazy you can ride the monorail with

It is very, very near from Disneyland and California Adventure parks. The restaurant Goffy's Kitchen is very cool and you can take pictures with the Disney characters! Downtown Disney is also in the way from the hotel to the parks. A lot of stores and restaurants. The pool of the hotel with it water slides ar also fun. The beds are very comfortable. A really must-do!

Summary Heading: Great First Stay at Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: We arrived on a Thursday afternoon.  We flew into John Wayne Orange County airport.  The airport was not far from the hotel.  It took about 20 minutes on the Disneyland Express bus.  The bus was convenient since we didn't bring a car seat for our 2 year old.  The first stop for the bus is the Disneyland Hotel.  Though the bus stop is a short walk to the entrance of the hotel.  The path there wasn't so easy with roll luggage due to the many curbs and elevated walk path.    Check in was okay, I tried requesting for a room in the Adventure tower, due to recommendations from other tripadvisor reviews.  But the only room they had available was in the Frontier tower (furtherest tower to downtown disney.  Though the closest tower to the entrance to the water slide part of the pools.

I say worth every dollar and not penny because this has become a very expensive hotel to stay at. But having the hotel right there on Disney property helps make it worth it. The most important thing about staying at the Disneyland hotel is the magic never stops. Once you leave Disneyland the hotel is just as magical. The lights hidden in the head boards of the bed to the pixie dust across the top of the wall, all make this a special hotel to stay at. You can ask Mickey to give you your wake up call and sometimes special guest get autographed pictures from the characters. The rugs and fixtures are all pure Disney. Put this all together and it's the best place to stay when going to Disneyland

Summary Heading: A high 3, perfect for what it is.  The food is an issue.
Summary: How many people actually go to the Disneyland Hotel for business?  Not so many, I'm guessing.  I joined my wife for a conference.  So I'll first say if you're considering the Disneyland Hotel for, say, a vacation with your kids to the park then this is more of a high 4 rating.  And if you're looking for a real world showroom for baby strollers, also excellent.  The Disney service is really everything it's cracked up to be.  Being able to get so many people on board all doing a great job is really impressive. The rooms are recently renovated and are quite pleasant I think.   THE shortcoming that makes the whole less than the sum of the parts-- even with a great many food choices in the immediate 'downtown Disney' area-- it was very difficult to get a fresh healthy affordable

Just returned from a Disneyland trip and I have to say that this hotel was great. We stayed in the frontier tower on the 9 th floor . The beds are incredibly comfortable, the room was very spacious and made me feel at home. The pool is huge and the kids have a blast on the water slides.

Summary Heading: Way too much money for an average stay
Summary: My husband and I decided to pay the extra money to take our girl to the Disney hotel ( we had both stayed when we were younger) and frankly I was really disappointed. The rooms were small, they didn't even play disney movies or cartoons for when it's bedtime/naptime and you are in the room. Anyone can walk through hotel or sneak into pool. They don't even offer a kiddie pool. Everything is over priced and there is nowhere normal to eat at a decent price.  The service is great though, the rooms are really clean but if I were to do it again I would stay somewhere else for less money and spend my extra money at park. And whatever happened to the boats they use to have? I would not recommended wasting your money and stayin here.

This hotel is nice, relaxed place - not top end. The rooms and clean and comfortable. I would say the staff is superb; friendly and attentive. You can tell who likes kids and who doesn't. There was a nice young gentleman, Jeremy, I think who was manning the slide who was especially kind and friendly to my little kiddo. One late afternoon my daughter stepped on a bee and was screaming and screaming like I had never heard before. I random staff member stopped and asked if he could help. We told him what happened and he suggested we call for a nurse. I can't tell you how impressed we were with the promptness and care we got from this wonderful nurse. She was up to the room almost immediately, and was thorough and so kind to our daughter. (My daughter would have been just fine

Summary Heading: Nice place for a more relaxed Disneyland trip
Summary: The rooms really are the star attraction here. The beds and decor really are beautiful and very comfortable. The pool was a lot of fun and we really enjoyed the tiki lounge restaurant  This place is good if you are looking for a more vacation experience versus just an amusement park visit. Great for relaxing and taking a nap, then going back to the park for the evening. The slides are great for the small and big kids alike. Plenty of hot tub space as well. While i preferred our Grand California experience, this one still ranked very high.

Everything about the hotel is Disney. It is expensive but if you are looking for service and location and Disney atmosphere then this is your place  Disney service is the best and if you are on the Club Level like we were it's even better. The hotel was a full capasity and our room was still ready at 11:00. Couldn't get a late check out because of that but that was ok. The Club Level is good value if you have a family. Best part was waters, sodas, juices and snacks all day long. Rooms have DVD players with free rentals in the Club Lounge. The room headborads are priceless. Lots of places to eat and drink.  It is a walk to the park but jump on the momorail and it's great. we have stayed here many time and will keep coming back!

I first stayed in the newly remodeled room which I was pleasantly surprised  The headboard lites up like fireworks and a music box comes on  Then after two nites I switched to the fairy tale suite which was like living in a dream state for the additional two nites. When u walk into the foyer of the Disneyland suite tinker greets u every time and flys around the walls and then lites up the castle made of glass imbedded in the wall.   I can't say enough good things about this room and overall experience  I have posted 2 videos and pics  Just staying at hotel u get in 1 hour before they open to public

travelled to Disneyland with family of 4, 2 small children.  Stayed at Disneyland Hotel in the Fantasyland tower.  Rooms and Hotel are in great condition, service is good, hotel is busy and can wait for lifts etc but this is not a big hassle.  Location is excellent, only 5-10min leisurely walk to main gates.  We got a pool view room and we were hardly in our room as we were in the park for full 3 days.  Pool area is great and kids enjoyed the pools and watersides, provides a good break from the park.  Staying at the hotel gives you access to the park 1 hour early which is a blessing and you can actually get a lot done with less crowds, this is worth the extra money.  Overall great stay and recommend staying there .

Summary Heading: Pick the Right Room at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We just finished up a 5 night stay and the Disneyland Hotel.  I concur with what most of the others have said about the hotel, so let me add some information about the rooms.  Our group stayed in the Frontier tower.  The even-numbered rooms overlook the beautifully remodeled pool area and face the Fantasy on the other side of the pool.  To the right is the Adventure tower.  Some of these rooms have a peek a boo view of DIsneyland and the Matterhorn. The odd numbered rooms overlook the Downtown Disney parking lot, but you don't have another tower blocking your view so the higher floors have a nice, expansive view of the surrounding neighborhoods.  Our standard room was relatively small, with two queen beds, and a split shower/toilet and sink area.  It had a fridge and

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but not worth the $$$$
Summary: The hotel itself is very nice however I would say its worth the $1400 we spent to stay for three nights. We reserved a higher up room facing the park/ DT Disney as we thought it would be nice to view the fireworks at night however we came to find that Disney doesn't have fireworks during the week so we put out some extra money for nothing which was disappointing. Since our room faced DT Disney it was a bit noisy at night as we could hear he loud music from our room however we were all so died tired at the end of the day we were able to fall asleep anyway. FYI - we asked what time they shut down the music at night and they said 11 pm. The rooms are very spacious and clean and we're always made up quickly. The kids loved the headboard which lite up with fireworks. Every night we

This is a great Hotel, perfect for the children, everyone was so kind and friendly. We had a wonderful time here, i wouldn't change a thing, looking forward to our next visit, I hope we shall be able to stay longer next time. Thank you.

No tourist trip to so-Cal is complete without hitting Disneyland at least once. Or in the case with my friends, twice. So we decided to splurge and book a room at the Disneyland hotel. That way we could take on a full day of Disneyland, drag ourselves back to the room, and awaken ourselves to the character breakfast and enjoy another full day of Disney and perhaps California Adventure.  Being so close to Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney is the hotel's greatest advantage. The place is clean and the service is friendly. We didn't notice the spa.  The character breakfast buffet is perfect for kids and the kids in all of us. My main complaint is how bloody expensive it was, but it's a rare trip so why not?

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel vs Grand Californian = Disneyland Hotel x 1,000,000
Summary: We travelled from New Zealand for the Disneyland experience "First timers" not knowing what to expect. We spent hours reading reviews, trying to decide the what would be the best acoomadation for our family " 2 kids 8 and 5" finally booked the  Grand Californian after reading about how great the Hotel was with the direct park entry and all the goodies blah blah blah. Finally got there after months of planning, hour of review reading. After the YouTube videos and the google images it felt like we had been coming here for years.  The arrival! Amazing. I would never ever bag this hotel, purely based on it's structure. This hotel is amazing. It's like being in a luxury ski lodge. It's grand lobby reaching out to all 6 floors is a life changing experience on it's own. The service is

This was the first time we stayed at this hotel and as far as location it was perfect. I expected to see more Disneyland Motive throughout the hotel, and although the rooms were a little dated (bathroom)the view was awesome to the pools etc. I thought with a three year old in the room there may have been a few surprizes for him but the light up headboard was all there was. A mentioned before, the wow factor wasnt really there. The lobby especially. I know there had been renovations done but again thought it may have had more atmosphere.

Lovely hotel, great location for the Disney parks and excellent rooms. Light up headboard was a nice touch! Make sure you head to Trader Sams tiki bar for great cocktails and atmosphere! Would definitely stay again, also good for extra magic hour in the parks

Hotel was in a good location with easy walking distance to Downtown Disney and the two parks. The room was quite a good size for a family of four and we had a good view of the pool.  The lightup headboard was a nice touch.  Guest services were helpful.  Whilst this was a good hotel, there was no wow factor and for this reason I think the accommodation is overpriced.  Being our very first visit to Disney in Anaheim it would have been good to have been told at checkin that its best to book your dining with characters well in advance and other restaurants as we had trouble booking as they were well booked.  Whilst the character breakfast and character dinner were quite good only for seeing the characters as the food was average for what you paid.  I didn't like the fact that you

My husband, four year old and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for two nights in April.  We weren't sure at first about spending that much money when we could stay at a neighboring hotel for less.  We were very glad that we decided to stay here.  We checked in with Cynthia and she was fantastic!  She told our son that Mickey had left him a special delivery and she gave him a signed photo of MIckey.  She also gave him his own room key, which of course he thought ws the greatest thing ever and a 1st Visit button, which was also a big hit!  They had a room for us even though we were checking in early.  We were in the Adventure Tower overlooking Downtown Disney.  We had just gotten to the room when Goofy called to talk to our son.  He was so excited about everything it almost

Our family of 4, a 13 year old girl and 16 year old boy, stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of April.  One of the reasons that I chose this hotel is the location and being able to go into Disneyland 1 hour earlier than it opens to the public.  The location was great!  We could walk to both parks, downtown Disney or take the monorail.    The pool was quite nice but busy and there weren't many loungers around the pool. We waited until someone left and got a lounger later in the day.  It was nice to have a server around the pool taking orders for drinks.    The rooms were not very big, especially for 4 people.  Luckily we found a spot for all of our suitcases.  I didn't like the shower room much either because there was nowhere to put my clean clothes

Summary Heading: A Good Choice for Disneyland Visit
Summary: We picked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor.  The overall experience was very good.  We did Valet parking & checked in quickly at 4:30pm.  We had a 10th floor Concierge Level Room in the Adventure Tower with a Park View.  In my opinion, the room was very small for the price but it was clean enough. The view was great – you could see right into Downtown Disney with a view of both parks and the mountains in the distance.  Unfortunately, there are no fireworks during the week - only weekends.  We were very disappointed – especially on the first night when very loud, blaring music came from Downtown Disney until 10pm.  If you have small children, this will be a problem - we had 2 sound machines going and it didn't make any difference...we could not sleep until the

My husband and I recently attended a week-end business conference headquartered at the Disneyland Hotel.  We knew the meetings were going to be long and opted to stay at the hotel for convenience rather than fight LA freeway traffic.  We have never stayed at any Disney property before.  I had my doubts but was pleasantly surprised.  We were assigned a room in the Frontier Tower - a short walk across the pool area from the Main Tower.  Our room was immaculate, the bathroom separated into Shower/Commode in one room and Sink/Mirror another.  Very convenient when two people are trying to get ready for meetings!  The hotel was quiet (I had been expecting screaming and/or noisy kids/families) and the staff friendly.  The bed was very comfortable, big windows for nice light, desk to

My wife and I stayed here 2 nights in April.  Loved it!  Although we were next to the elevator, I only heard it when in the bathroom.  There were no sleep interruptions (I'm a light sleeper).  The location is super convenient to Disney parks and shopping.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel for a young family
Summary: We stayed at Disneyland Hotel in March 2013 for 4 nights. The room was clean and of a good standard with nice Disney touches which didn't go unnoticed by the kids. We have three kids, 7 & 6 who shared a queen bed and the 4 y/o was on the fold out couch.  Although a large hotel l didn't feel overwhelmed by the number of guests, partly because we spent most of our time in the parks and not at the hotel and essentially came back for respite (everyone needed afternoon naps to make it through to the fireworks!) and food but the property was three different buildings which was good.  The room provided a fridge which we used for our own supplies and a pod coffee machine but no kettle or crockery other than glasses for water.  The hotel was expensive compared to others which were

Summary Heading: A letdown for a conference location
Summary: This was a comfortable and clean hotel, but the overall service was so underwhelming. The front desk staff seemed like they could care less if you stayed there or not. For a resort hotel, this had the most underwhelming staff I've encountered in a long time. For some reason, most of the staff did not seem very welcoming and/or friendly. Even in the little hotel convenience/gift shop, the employees really seemed to care less if you stayed there or not. Maybe with a family with kids things might have been different, I don't know. At any rate, this hotel did not impress me to want to stay there again.

Summary Heading: one of the best Disney hotels!
Summary: Great hotel - very large rooms and beautiful grounds. It's nicer then the other two resorts on property!  The restaurants are good and actually have healthy items on the menu.  And Trader Sams bar is awesome.  It's a quick walk to DL and CA and a nice walk too. The concierge was very helpful and all in all we had a great time!

Disneyland Hotel is our first Disney hotel experience. We were thrilled! The hotel offered us a military discount (my husband is an active duty service member), early check in was available to us, and Mickey and Minnie called us to wish us a happy anniversary! The desk clerk was very helpful and gave us good directions and tips. We stayed at the adventureland tower and the rooms were so spacious and clean. The castle on our headboard would light up and play music. When taking a hot shower, a hidden Mickey would appear on the tiles in the shower with the steam and disappeared once the bathroom door opened. I loved the Mickey hand lamps over the sink and the wall length window from ceiling to floor where we cold see down town Disney. We called room service for breakfast at 6:30

Our last trip was in 2009, at the "old hotel" with it's Peter Pan themed pool and old gift shops and arcades.  Luckily, I'm a local, so I was able to see the awesome transformation of this hotel into a highly themed resort, much more so than our last trip.  We stayed in the Fantasy Tower, with a nicely renovated room and cute headboard with a light show.  The check in was very fast, friendly, and efficient.  Right away, as we headed to our room, Goofy came out for a visit in the lobby, which was a huge suprise for my four year old. Our stay was only for a weekend, with one half day, and one full day in the parks.  (We have annual passes.)  We passed on dining at Goofy's Kitchen, but instead went to Steakhouse 55 and had a great time with excellent food and service.  Even though

We stayed her for 10 nights in February on a stay 5 pay 3 deal - so the price we paid was super cheap being February.  We loved that this hotel had been freshly renovated. It was super clean and fresh during our whole stay. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and nothing was a bother to any of them at all. We can't compare to others in the area except Disney's Paradise Pier, as this was out first visit to DL. Paradise Pier was very tired looking, so thankfully we chose DLH instead.  Upon arrival at 9am after a 15 hour flight, we were told that we couldn't check into out room as it was not ready (we were disappointed at the time as we needed to shower and freshen up). They did offer to organise our checkin, take our bags and call us as soon as our room was ready -

As one would expect, there's plenty here to appreciate for all Disney fans. We particularly enjoyed the attention to detail, such as with the Disney-themed faucet, a fine backboard (with great, Magic Kingdom-themed night lights), and shower lever. Our room was spacious and the service was really quite good. We especially enjoyed breakfasting at Goofy's Kitchen, the menu was splendid although the service there, while good, was a victim of more guests than the number of wait staff could effectively accommodate.

Summary Heading: Nicely renovated and a respite from the assault of branding
Summary: Wow am I glad they've done a recent renovation because the last time I was there was over 20 years ago and I was a wee bit afraid that the brown shag carpet was still on the floor.  There's an elegant serenity about the hotel in the midst of all the surrounding craziness that I like.  Others think that it's missing the "Disney Magic and Excitement". But I think that's a good thing.  The Magic and Excitement is in the parks...here you can escape and play "find the hidden Mickeys".  They need more restaurants and bars here in the hotel. I know they want to drive traffic to DT Disney, but conventions needs gathering locations in the headquarters hotel.

Summary Heading: Didn't hit the target for Disney's magic I have experienced elsewhere, but it was still good
Summary: My family LOVES Disney, and we love every detail of magic at the parks and hotels, so we are usually happy to splurge a little more to experience more magic with our two kiddos. I guess we have been spoiled at the resorts in Florida, because our California experience was not as magical. The desk staff (and actually all staff) were friendly from the beginning to end. The room had all sorts of Disney special touches (I loved the light up headboard and music), and the proximity to downtown Disney and the parks is amazing! It definitely made it easier to get around. The grounds were all clean and nicely manicured. The only thing I was disappointed in was the size of the laundry room. I had the unfun task of laundry (which is usual for our trips) and was bummed to find the place

I stayed at the Disneyland hotel for a business event. I stayed in Paris Disney hotels before, which are not great, so my expectation was not really high. I must say the rooms are good, prefect beds, well maintained. Large working desk. The hotel contains of 3 towers. They look like office towers. Not only the outside, but also the entrance and the corridors. Nothing magical about it. The hotel has a nice swimming pool for kids (a bit dated). Service is average, I did not feel like a guest, more like a number. Many things were very inefficient. If you try to call guest services from your room, you first need to go through a Disney option menu, before you are connected to the guest services and than have to wait for 10 minutes before you get actually anyone at the phone. Another

Summary Heading: Great rooms, service not so good.
Summary: We just stayed here for 4 nights in the adventure tower with a view of downtown disney.  We decided to stay here instead of the Grand Californian due to the fact that their rooms are starting so age, so we wanted to try the renovate rooms. Let me tell you the good parts of this hotel. Rooms really do feel like disney. The view from our room was amazing, downtown disney and fireworks.  Now onto the bad, upon checking, we waited 20 minutes for bell hop and valet, and when we finally tracked one down, he seemed annoyed the whole time. Not to mention he claimed he gave us a ticket for our car when he did not, to which he says, I guess I have to start all over again and rolled his eyes. Then I peeked of his card for our bags and it said the wrong last name. I said it was not our name

checked into the disneyland hotel for one night.i had 4 rooms for my family...we had to check out at 11 and had a function that night, so i reserved one room for 2 nights...the best thing about it, was that when i checked out early from the 2 room night, they only charged me half price...other than that...it's fun to see the hotel and characters... i actually  like the disneyland hotel better than grand california...it doesn't seem as 'cookie cutter'....the main issue we had was the service...we drove to valet...waited, finally i went up to the desk...the valet guy was chatting with the girl at the desk...they asked if i needed anything?  i said, i would like to valet park my car...they seemed surprised...didn't help with luggage, didn't ask for keys, so i ended up forgetting

This was our second stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  My grandchildren, aged 7 and 5 loved the light-up headboard, swimming pool and Goofy's Kitchen.  We stayed in the Adventure Tower in a room overlooking the pool.  It was larger than the same type of room we stayed in at the Grand Californian a few years ago and much cleaner.  Room service was prompt and courteous as was Bell Services (used to pick up packages purchased in the parks, to pick up the strollers we rented, and to handle our luggage).  The Grand Californian may be closer to the parks, but the Disneyland Hotel makes you feel like you never left the parks.

It was close to the park so if the kids got tired you could easily walk back to the hotel.  Clean and the restaurants are geared for the kiddies!! The staff is very helpful and the lobby is geared for the kids to be occupied with coloring and tv with disney programs running.

Great location, very clean, and cute decor. However for the price tag, the service was not up to par. For paying $700 a night I would have expected better service.  Also our premium view room looked over the rooftop of some other building. I wouldn't exactly call that a premium view.  We would probably stay here again just because of it's proximity to the park.

We spent four nights at the Disneyland Hotel in a Theme Park View Concierge room. We were supposed to be in a Pool View room and received a surprise upgrade. The view of Downtown Disney and the theme parks was amazing, and we could watch the Disneyland fireworks right from our room at night! Our room had many magical touches including the magical Disneyland headboard, hidden Mickeys in the carpet and lamp, and the gloved Mickey hands holding the light sconces in the bathroom. The "mousekeeping" was impeccable, and the customer service was wonderful. We are used to staying in Disney World and relying on Disney transportation in order to visit the theme parks, so having everything within walking distance was a huge plus!

After many trips to Disneyland over the years I remain impressed by their commitment to quality.  Although the Disneyland Hotel is an old property,  they continue to update and keep everything in great shape.  Keep in mind this is not overly impressive or elaborate but there's something about it that just makes the visit that much more "Disney".   True to Disney form,  everything is clean, neat and in working order.  The staff is friendly,  competent, and very accommodating.    If you prefer a more luxurious experience,  the Grand California is phenomenal albeit expensive.

This hotel is superb. Disney touches everywhere, excellent service, beautiful rooms and tons of kids activities. All 3 of the hotels in the Disneyland resort are close together and guests can use all 3 pools and amenities. We used Pinocchio's workshop(childcare) in the Californian Grand and it was excellent. Our room in the frontier tower had a decent view of the parks and we could see the fireworks from our room on nights where we were not in the park. The pools are fabulous and a welcome break from the parks in the middle of the day! We loved being able to walk to everything and the extra magic hour alone was worth staying here! The parks were so busy during our stay that without that we wouldn't have got on some rides. It is expensive though but I guess you get what you pay

Had always wanted to stay at the Disneyland hotel & finally managed it on a girls trip away! Had a fantastic room in the Adventure Tower which overlooked Downtown Disney plus the 2 Parks....even the dreaded ferris wheel at California Adventure Park (never again....reminder to self regarding being scared of heights.)! We also paid for access to the club lounge which was so worth it & I would recommend this to anyone.   A nice continental breakfast laid out every morning plus afternoon teas (we never made it to these) & drinks & nibbles in the early evening plus late evening.  Always a friendly face to greet you & bring you your beverage of choice (bubbles please). The check in at this hotel made me think I was at the happiest place on earth already!  So helpful & friendly. The

The price is steep, but seriously, there is nothing like staying at the Disneyland Hotel and being walk only 5 minutes to go straight to the Disneyland Theme Park and California Adventure. I loved my stay here and the rooms are quite nice.

Summary Heading: I would never want to stay anywhere else, (Well maybe the California Grand) but its a tough choice :)
Summary: For me, Truly the Happiest Place on Earth. I have gone to Disneyland 4 times a year my whole life. I am 43 now, and it is still the only place I feel at home.  I have only been able to afford the DL Hotel a few times in my life, but it is worth every penny. My husband and I have decided we will go half as often, just to stay there.  The difference is this... When I am at Disneyland, no one in my family can get me to leave (from an hour before the open I am at the gate, and in the park until they kick me out after closing ;)  It is the my Happy Place! However, when we stay at this Hotel, I feel like I am ALWAYS in my Happy Place. I could just lay in bed and look up at the Headboard, lighting up with fireworks and playing a Disney melody, and stay there all day. Every detail is

We took a family trip with kids and grandkids - 12 of us in all for a Disneyland/CA Adventure on Easter.  We booked the 3 bedroom suite for one night and it was perfect.  The suite was clean, the linens wonderful. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet.  the living area between the rooms was just right for kids to hang out together between trips to the park. The staff could not have been nicer and more accommodating from the bell hop who stored our four cars worth of bags until we could check in later in the day, to the front desk people who gladly answered all questions.  I had called the day before to find out about parking all of our cars ahead of check in and they said no problem and comped all four cars for that day and the following day.  After check out

Summary Heading: It's what you expect from Disney
Summary: A bit pricey of course but you get great service, support and accommodations. Premium views are great but I am not sure that they are worth the $100 extra per night. Overall, everything is clean and well appointed. The rooms are spacious and have the Disney flare without being to childish.

Summary Heading: A magical stay in magical surroundings!
Summary: I had an excellent stay at the Disneyland Hotel during my visit between February 28 and March 5 2013. There is nothing I could fault with the trip, everything was spectacular.  As I was arriving late at night, I thought it was best to e-mail the hotel in advance just to inform them of my expected arrival time and any preferences I had to the room etc. After a 11+ hour flight from London, a long wait in immigration and a slow-moving journey from Los Angeles to Anaheim I was glad to arrive at the hotel and experience an expedited check-in service. In total, it took me ten minutes from the moment I arrived at the front desk to opening the door of my room.  I was staying in the Adventure Tower on a high-floor in a Concierge-level room with a view of the Downtown Disney District. I

I would never have paid to stay here, but our trip was a treat from my sister for my twins' 5th birthday. She bought a AAA package, hotel and tickets to Disneyland, and I think she got about as good a rate as you can get. As a child, I had always wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, so it was fun to finally get to do it. Overall it was a great experience.  We were on the 4th floor of the Adventure Tower facing Downtown Disney and could watch the fireworks each night, though the view would have been better from a higher floor. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The kids loved the light-up headboard, and we used it as a nightlight. I particularly liked the little spotlights on the far sides of the beds -- I could read without waking up my kids. Would have been nice

Staff was great and helpfull, room was clean and quiet, and it was also a great location to be able to make a quick escape from the crowds and get some rest.  The pool areas were clean and well maintained and made for a fun distraction for the kids.  On-site food choices could have been better, but with all the resturants just down the street, no biggie.  Also, the early park entrances were the only non- hectic time in the parks.

We had a great stay.  Clearly you are paying for the experience and location and not the room.  We had a level 8 room overlooking the pools and were very happy with the view.  The room was very clean and modern.  The size was pretty good for a regular room, bed was comfortable and we didn't have any noise issues.  The walk is fine to the parks and the fact you almost step onto Downtown Disney puts you right into the action.  The overall experience is great, the staff are super friendly.  Overall it is hard to describe other than staying at the DL Hotel makes for a great experience.  If you have the spare dollars to do it ... then do it.

Summary Heading: Close, convenient, but not up to par
Summary: We've stayed at all three towers in the past, last time was about 7 years ago.  The rooms are very small and sink area is difficult for 4 people to get ready in the mornings.  Clean though.  I know they remodelled recently, but the amenities seemed trimmed down quite a bit from last time.  The front desk staff is still and always has been very accommodating and customer service oriented.  However, there was an older woman at the gift store in the Fantasy Tower who imposingly asked me, "can I help you?" with a stern face and voice; not the typical demeanor of someone at the "Happiest Place on Earth"!  We decided to stay at the Grand Californian next time; a bit higher in price, but nicer staff, closer to Downtown Disney and the entry to the California Adventure park.

We had a great room in the Adventure Tower with a fabulous view of Downtown Disney and could see both parks. There was two of us twin sharing and we had a generous amount of room for suitcases and shopping bags - nice layout and the Mickey Mouse taps and lamp holders made us smile and remember we were in the happiest place on earth.   Access to the Club Lounge was a fabulous benefit - thanks to my roomy who organised it. A fabulous way to start the day with quiet brekkies overlooking the parks (dressed in our sensible walking gear and runners ready for the big adventure days ahead).  Evening drinks and nibbles was a great way to unwind before the evenings ahead. Service was fabulous and the Lounge Managers were so helpful when planning your days around timings and special park

Each time we makes plans to go to Disneyland, I carefully shop all of the nearby hotels, read reviews, etc.  In the end, I always book a Disneyland Resort hotel. And, the Disneyland Hotel is our favorite. The recent renovation gave the resort a much needed face-lift, and we truly had a "magical" stay. My daughter was celebrating her 18th birthday, and Rudy at the front desk took several extra minutes to make sure her stay would be a true celebration.  Autographed pictures, a birthday button (which elicited "Happy Birthdays" throughout our stay), and Disney trivia pages just for fun.   The rooms are lovely and clean. The beds were not to our liking, but I think that may be personal preference and not because they are uncomfortable. The pool area is very nice, but we were wishing

I took my two boys to Disneyland this past weekend. We originally had booked a room at the Hotel Ménage and that was a huge mistake. It was so filthy we ended up checking out the same day at 1 a.m. No rooms were available anywhere since it was Saturday night in the middle of the night. We called the Disneyland hotel and they did have availability. It was the most expensive price I'd ever paid for a night but I can see why people pay to stay there. The rooms were extremely clean and decorated so nicely. I especially enjoyed the lighted headboard. Their staff was very accommodating and friendly. Anette and Jennifer at the front desk were amazing! My kids really enjoyed the pool and my 4 year old was so happy about them having a supply of life vests available since he can't swim,

The rooms are a pretty standard hotel room. but it was very very clean which is a big thing. we were in a premium veiw room. which ment we got a view of the pool. not really a big deal for us. the beds were very comfortable, or maybe it was the fact that i was just exasuted from walking around all day long. but i'm going with they were comfortable. the desk staff was very helpful and polite. i would stay again if it was affordable. but its disney nothing is cheap.

This is our first time at the Disneyland Hotel.  With 11 of us (7 adults, 3 kids, and one under 2 yrs old) the three bedroom suite in the Adventure Tower was more than enough for our needs. We loved the additional touches - the castle picture above the bed with the fireworks that lit up; the hidden Mickeys on the bathroom tiles, sheets, and carpet; kids liked the "Snow White" mirror in our room (they said that it looked like it would answer if you asked a rhyming question).  The service was outstanding.  When I had problems making our reservations with Super Shuttle back to the airport, Guest Services was right there with the solution.  We went to two character breakfasts - one at Paradise Pier and the other at the hotel.  Loved them both, but "Goofy's Kitchen" in the DL Hotel

Summary Heading: Love this place, but bring your wallet
Summary: This hotel is very, very nice.  I love staying here and especially with the updated rooms they have really improved the value of the room compared to a few years ago.  The rooms are very clean, the service is fantastic, and you are really close to the Magic Kingdom and California Adventure.  I have three things that people should think about before booking a room though.  The first is that you may have a bit of a hike depending on which tower you end up having your room located.  The check-in location is only one of three towers.  Not the end of the world, but it does bother some people.  The second is that if you end up with a room that faces the parks, the fireworks can wake up the little ones that turn in earlier than the scheduled fireworks.  Lastly there is a gentle sucking

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but a good distance away from the parks
Summary: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights on March 6 and 7th before going on to Hawaii.  The Disney hotels in California are pricey (more expensive for what you get at Disneyworld in Florida) but decided to try the Disneyland Hotel as we were celebrating my daughter's graduation from law school.  I booked a regular view room and used the AAA rate which is a little less than the regular rate.  It takes some patience to get the AAA rate because they never post it.  You have to ask for it specifically when you call Disneyland reservations and sometimes it is not available. We flew into Orange County and used Mickey's Space Shuttle to pick us up and also drove us over to LAX when we left.  Their prices are good and I would recommend this service.  We had no problems checking in a little

We stayed 3 nights at the Disneyland hotel in the Fantasy tower.  Pros:  nice pool with tons of hovering lifeguards.  Bellcap service was really top notch.  Very professional.  Fast check- in.  Room was very clean - and I'm picky.  theming was nice in the lobby.  room furniture was very good.  they gave us a decent view room for free.  Cons:  Goofys kitchen food was good, but in a 60 minute period only two characters came to our table (dinner).  Aurora and Minnie were it, leaving our son feeling left out.  Chip and Dale were there as were Aladdin and Pluto but they skipped our area.   The water in the hotel shower was not hot at all.  It varied depending on time of day, but it was tepid most of the time.  With no heat lamp in the bathroom we were forced to crank the room heat to

Hotel location is important when visiting Disneyland. Right at the end of Downtown Disney the hotel is a quick walk to the parks. Downtown Disney offers shops and dining so you have more options along the way to the park.   It is a safe trek from the park to the hotel so families with teens can feel pretty comfortable letting them stay late at the park and walk back to the hotel on their own. The hotel pool is large and comfortable when you need a break. The hotel staff are very helpful, friendly and accommodating. The rooms are comfortable and spacious enough for the family.

We spent 5 nights at the Disneyland Hotel this past March.  Overall, we really enjoyed our stay.  There really is something magical about Disney and this hotel carries the magic throughout their hotel.  Customer service is top notch and everyone seems to really enjoy working there.  This hotel is at the beginning of Downtown Disney, which was great when by the end of the day our son who is 6 years old, got tired, it was a short 10 minute walk back to our sanctuary... i don't think i would have enjoyed grabbing a shuttle back to a hotel when all you want to do is get back to your room ... fast.  the location is superb as well for catching the fireworks.  we stayed in a club level, downtown disney view room which was perfect for watching the fireworks in your room.  you can turn

We stayed here for 3 nights before moving to another hotel.  It was a special birthday treat to stay here and we really enjoyed it.  To be honest the rooms and hotel are the same as any nice hotel that you'd stay in, but it's the Disney touches that make it special.  The furnishings with the Mickey heads are cute and the headboard that lit up and play music was just magical for my daughter and she loved the way her toys were arranged each time we came back to our room.   We didn't swim in the pool because it was too cold but it looked gorgeous. The hotel was clean and there were plenty of restaurants and shops so we had everything we needed.  It's a further walk from Disneyland than some of the off site hotels but if you can afford it, the pure Disney magic of this hotel is well

You can't beat the location of this hotel. Our room overlooked Downtown Disney in the Adventure Tower. We walked from the lobby to the parks in 5-10 minutes past restaurants and shops. Then you could turn left to enter Disneyland or right to enter CA Adventure. We hopped from one park to the other. We were in both 2 times in one day to see shows etc.Literally a 5 min walk from one entrance to the other. We LOVED the World of Color show at CA AD, Get your fastpass to it in the morning to have a great viewing spot that night. The lines for rides were long (Sunday) because there were tons of cheerleaders there competing.That made it tough to see it all but with the extended hours, we did well. Not sure if this is usualy the case.The hotel was recently redone and the rooms are

Summary Heading: Great place for the family and kids! Superb location!
Summary: The convenience of the hotel to the Theme park is naturally something a family would consider. Great location and walking distance to Disneyland! The services were personalized and very well integrated for less hassle. The service staffs were helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were old but well-furnished and properly maintained. The sound proofing for the toilet ought to be improved as I could hear people talking in the adjacent toilet from another room. The decorations are fabulous and the bed is soft and comfortable. The price is worth if you have a family of kids or elderly. Although there are not really much shopping and restaurant food around. Sometimes we would need to wait pretty long for a taxi to arrive; perhaps it would be good to have shuttle services to the popular

The renovated room is just great for girls. My daughters are really enjoyed the headboard with light at night. The view from our room can see the fireworks at night. Great for family with kids! The location is good too. Very convenient for us to go the park and downtown disney. My kids also enjoy the pools there.

We loved the Disneyland Hotel, we have previously stayed at Grand California & loved it. The kids loved this one more, The Disney elements to it really stand out for example the Lamps in the bathroom were mickeys hand! The taps were all carved to Mickey's ears. The kids loved the pool especially the Monorail waterside, Character Dining was the best breakfast the kids had they got to meet all the Disney characters which they loved. Overall this is a great hotel especially for the kids!

It's a Disney hotel.  It's very retro at some parts, but clean all around.  I love the little Disney touches inside the room (headboards, carpeting, etc.).  We got a great view of the park.  The park!  We came back from park-hopping for some wine break, and waited for the fireworks, but the girls and I got antsy to go back to the park again, so we only saw a few sparks.  We got a better glimpse when we were riding the monorail, which was a few steps away.  Not as convenient as the Grand California, but still a good way to enjoy the parks at all times of the day.  If you could spring it, pay extra to get the full Disney experience, and book a Disney hotel.  If not just for the sheer convenience of it all.  We self-parked, which was right in front of the hotel.  A good walk when

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel with my husband and daughter.  The rooms were average with a couple cute Disney touches.  The headboards lit up and played music box type music and the bathroom had Mickey ear fixtures.  The pools were amazing. Not many lounge chairs though.  The location was great.  We had to walk through Downtown Disney to get to the park which was fine because there were a few restaurants we choose to eat at.  Being able to get into the park an hour earlier than other Disneyland guests was fabulous.  The price was very high for what I considered an average hotel room but the pools and location made up for it.

This is a beautiful hotel, newly renovated with lots of special Disney touches (e.g. huge Mickey hands holding the lamps in the bathroom) without losing a sophisticated ambiance for the adults. I was there for a 5 day conference and was fortunate to qualify as a VIP.  There were a few problems with the room, but when I called about them they were fixed immediately.  Except for the saga of the tea bags.....The kitchen area of the suite had a coffee maker and packets of coffee, but no teabags.  When I asked the maid to leave me a couple of bags she replied "No tea, only coffee.  You want tea, call room service."  This seemed incongruous with the high level of customer service I had experienced, so the next morning I called the "VIP hotline."  The gentleman was very gracious and

Asked for view room as my wife attended a convention (great price).  Saw fireworks each night, lovely.  Rest of view nothing spectacular, but the whole area is so groomed it was, nonetheless, quite pleasant.  Fantasy Tower in great shape.  Loved our stay.

Summary Heading: Our return to the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We just left the Disneyland  Hotel and loved our 2 bedroom suite.  I haven't been to the hotel for almost 10 years so the renovations were really nice.  I call it Four Seasons meets Mickey Mouse.  It is a huge splurge to stay here but the location and the rooms were worth it for us.  We had 2 huge bedrooms, livingroom with bar area for dining, 2.5 baths.  The one caution I would have is that it is really 2 seperate suites with an entry way. Make sure you have housekeeping leave you doorstops so you can keep bedroom doors open- they are incredibly heavy and the first night our 2 1/2 year old grandaughter could have lost her fingers trying to pry the door open.  Roomservice saved us the first morning as we were all tired from traveling and did not want to sit down at a resturant.

Our family of 4 stayed at Disneyland Hotel January 22-26 2013.  It was by far the best Disney experience we've ever had! The kids loved the pools and water slides, and our room was large and very clean. Staff was very friendly. Our building was steps away from Downtown Disney, and a 5 minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland and California Adventure Park. We felt completely immersed in the magic! Our rental car was not used during our entire stay as everything we needed was within the Disney area.  When we first started planning our trip the cost of staying at Disneyland made us reluctant, but you get what you pay for, in this case location, as well as beautiful hotel, and history.   We purchased California City Passes from Disney when we booked, which included 3 day park

I took my fiancee' and daughter last year for a little vacation, we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel with a club level room and it was absolutely amazing. I wish we had stayed longer, we were only there for a 2 day park hopper and a 1 night stay. I loved it so much I actually booked my reservation for later this year, this time we're staying in a 2 bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel with a 6 night and a 5 day park hopper package. Can't Wait!:)

Fantastic! Almost 5 stars. My husband and I honeymooned at the Disneyland Hotel last week and were so sad to leave. Our deluxe room with a pool view was spacious and very clean. The housekeeping service was awesome. The check-in staff was very friendly and full of Disney spirit :-) They sent a rose up to our room on our first night... sweet. Very family-friendly hotel, so unless you're okay with rooming next door to loud, excited children, you may want to check in elsewhere. We didn't personally have any problems but saw some older guests by the pool who seemed a little put off by the children splashing in the jacuzzi.  The one downside was the elevator. There are only 11 floors but each time we wanted to go up or down, we were stuck waiting for 5 minutes at least. We got to

My husband and I and our daughter and 2 year old granddaughter stayed at the Disneyland Hotel on February 24th and 25 celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. We had never stayed before and were excited to be there. We LOVED the kind of retro but modern hotel and the service was phenomenal.  My husband and I were walking out of the hotel to go to Disneyland and a very well dressed lady and gentleman were outside the hotel. We had our Happy Anniversary buttons on that the hotel gives you when you check in. The lady, who we later found out was the hotel manager, congratulated us and asked us our last name and how many years. When we came back to the hotel that evening, we were amazed and delighted to see rose petals and roses on the bed with a 40 made from towels. There were also

Booking the Disneyland Hotel was a hard decision with us to begin with. We had stayed at the Grand Californian the year before and absolutely loved the service as well as the common areas of the hotel (not to mention location!) but the rooms were very dated. So this year we decided to give the DH a chance since it is newly renovated, and we had heard they were comparable.    Check in was extremely average. At the Grand they had given us balloons, autographed pictures of the characters as well as buttons. At DH they didn't acknowledge the kids. Rooms were fine, VERY small but the musical/light up headboards were super cute. I felt the bathroom was much nicer than those at The Grand. Locations was significantly further than the Grand which was a bummer and the monorail requires

Summary Heading: A decent place, but not great...
Summary: The atmosphere is typical Disney, the entire staff seems overwhelmed by the number of people staying there so its hit or miss if you can get your concerns taken care of...the rooms are fine and I have no problems with that, the restaraunt was fine. The best part of the whole thing was the hotel's proxiemity to the park....its the 3rd time staying there, it fine, dont have really bad things to say...

We arrived at 11am Wednesday morning...had paid for a night (Tuesday) that we didn't use so that we could be assured early entry to the room should we need it.  We put our bags in the room, went to Disneyland to meet the grandchildren and did not return until a little after 5pm...at which time, there was a band was setting up in front of the hotel.  They began to play at 6pm.  We were on the 9th floor and literally could not hear the TV over the band.  We requested a room change as soon as the band began to play.  I made the first call then...and a 2nd call at 7pm.  I was told that they would check availability for a change of rooms and get back to me.  They did not.  I called back an hour later and was told that the hotel was fully booked and we could not move.  Grandchildren

Central location in Disneyland, great pool and super friendly staff!!!  The only downside is that there is no real store close to the hotel, so you are very dependent on the shops of disney downtown. I think that a wider assortment of goods at the hotel store would be a good addition.

Summary Heading: Don't think we can ever stay anywhere else!
Summary: We stayed 4 nights at the Disneyland Hotel over Thanksgiving 2012.  The location is perfect and so was the whole experience.  We stayed the first 3 nights of our trip at the Paradise Pier, and moved to the DLH halfway through to get the experience of both Disney properties.  The Paradise Pier is a little less expensive, so we compromised to make the trip more affordable.  We did splurge on "Club Level" rooms at both hotels, and the experiences were very similar.   But the location of the Disneyland Hotel is a huge factor in comparing the two.  It may not look closer on the map, but it is SO close to the monorail station!  And you can use the monorail entrance on early entry days.  It's very convenient!    As far as the Club Level goes...it was nice, but I would probably not do

Summary Heading: The epitome of a Disney experience
Summary: If you love Disney... This is the only place to stay!!! You are embraced by the true Disney Experience the moment you get out of you car.  The little Disney touches make it magical!  Like Mickey hands holding your towels in the bathroom and the Fabius five hidden in the carpet on the floor.  Without a doubt this most magical way to spend the night if your Disney vacation.  You feel like you a part of the Disney family!  And don't get me started on how amazing the pool is!

My wife, 2 kids, and I stayed at Disneyland hotel in late February.  We booked a premium view room (Downtown Disney) on a high floor.  When we checked in, I found out that HP had booked the top 3 floors of the hotel.  That seems like a nice way to reward HP shareholders.  I had requested a non-connecting room, but they only have 1 on each floor, so got a connecting room. Too bad for the people in the next room.    We had stayed at this hotel about 2 years ago, or just after it had been redone.  This time we noticed the following: 1)  No turn down service 2)  No chocolats at night 3)  No towel animals. 4)  No light fixture on at night above the bed. 5)  On arrival, no bellman to greet out taxi and help with the bags. 6)  We would have ordered room service, but there was no table

Simply loved staying here! I celebrated my 50th birthday in Disneyland and stayed at the wonderful Disneyland hotel for 4 nights. The staff were friendly, helpful and cheerful; they went beyond the usual service for us. The room was just lovely - we got a (FREE) upgrade and had a recently renovated room with the light up and musical headboard.  Felt like Tinkerbell sprinkled pixie dust on us each night. The convenience of being able to walk to both parks was invaluable. I would love to stay here again!

Summary Heading: Worth the "24/7 Disney Experience" BUT really ONLY that....
Summary: We stayed 4 nights with a 3 day park hopper on a short getaway with our two youngest boys aged 6 and 8. We had a 10th floor room in the fantasy tower facing the city / park.....we had a great view of the fireworks our first night there!  The hotel has a Disney TV channel (several actually) that you can tune to for music synchronized to the fireworks show - that was fun.  The reason I made a reservation at the Disneyland hotel was to have the "24/7 Disney Experience" since our trip was a short one and to take advantage of a generous military discount offered by Disney which is substantial from the published rates online - I want to say somewhere in the range of 35% less.  The gift shop, coffee shop, pool area, reservations desk are all adequate and the staff all friendly - I have

Summary Heading: A business trip that was magical!
Summary: This freshly updated hotel had beautiful rooms, very comfy beds, exceptional grounds and unbelievable service. Unlike Disney World hotels in FL, this one was quiet and so nice. Everything is beautiful, from the lush landscaping to the beautifully appointed rooms with subtle, classes touches of Mickey. This hotel is super convenient and everything was only a few minutes walk away. Amazing and magical!  I highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Fun, expensive, close to the parks
Summary: We live close to Disneyland but we like to spend the night so that we can enjoy the nightlife without having to drive under the influence and we can get to the parks early for the Early Morning Entry offered only to individuals staying "on property" meaning 1 of the 3 Disnelyland hotels.  We usually stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel, but felt like splurging on a stay at the hotel.  There are 3 towers: Fantasy, Frontier and Adventure.  We were in the Frontier tower facing the pool.  Rooms are newly remodeled and the light-up Sleeping Beauty Castle headboard is great!  You can get one king-size bed or 2 queen-size beds; view options ar:e standard, pool or Disneyland Resort.  Make sure you arrange for a wake-up call (done by Mickey!).  We ate at Steakhouse 55 and had amazing,

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel in Feb for 4 nights,we got a room in the fantasy tower,on the 8 floor facing the pool and it was very magical.I loved the light up castle head board that played music.I loved the pool and the tropical surroundings of the grounds...they also have to great work out room.but I wish the rooms were a little bigger for the price you pay.maybe they are bigger in the adventure building I'm not sure.I would stay at the Disneyland hotel again,however I would get the top floor because it was a little noisy above us.

Stayed 4 nights with a 3 day park hopper for our Family of 4. We have a 2 and 4 year old and were excited about the convenience of the location. Unfortunately they closed the Monorail our first day and we walked the 1/2 mile through Downtown Disney with the kids on our shoulders 4 times....that was horrible. Found Citystrollerrentals.com and on short notice they got us a double jogger stroller, delivered to our hotel- it was awesome! So easy to push and steer, saved our lives and was great to have that convenience - recommend them! Stayed in the Fronteer tower, pool view. Nice room. Had a mini fridge, comfy beds, nice and clean. Goofys Kitchen was expensive but so fun, kids loved it and all the characters milling around. Nice pools, good service, will definately stay here again!

Everything about Disneyland was magical and indeed the happiest place in the world,the room was so clean and spacious ,the view was amazing transfer from the the airport to the hotel ,breakfast with the characters was so magical we were so happy with everything

We have been to Disneyland numerous times and stayed at other cheaper hotels in the vacinity.  This trip we splurged and decided to take advantage of the military discount offered by Disneyland Hotels.  THIS WAS THE BEST DECISION WE EVER MADE!  Once we arrived, the front desk was very appreciative of my husband's service to our country, multiple deployments and bumped us for FREE to one of their best suites!  This property was a lot of fun to be on and we enjoyed everything here!    PRO's: 1. Close walk to the parks or ride the monorail. 2. Nice pool, but our little one was sick, so we didn't get any use of it :-P 3. Fitness room was better than most hotels I have been at to complete my exercise regiment. 4. Laundry self-service on site was easy and not outrageously priced and

We've stayed at all three Disneyland hotels. In the past, Paradise Pier has been our favorite one but in our last couple of visits, we all agreed that Disneyland Hotel is a much better choice.   Pros ==== - Location. It's so nice to be able to walk through downtown Disney or take the monorail and then within minutes be right at your hotel.  - New remodeled rooms: The new interior is very nice and makes it so pleasant to go back to your room after a long day at the park. - The staff was much nicer this time. In the past, I didn't feel that the staff was as friendly as Paradise Pier but this time, we definitely saw an improvement. - Nearby restaurants (in downtown Disney or the resorts)  Cons ===== - The price. We were able to get a discount with our annual pass but I'm not sure

Stayed for six nights.  Pricey but excellent.  I would not say the price paid was value for the money, but saying that, if you can afford it, you must stay here at least once if you are in the Anaheim area.  The location is great at one end of Downtown Disney with all the shops and restaurants on your doorstep, within a short walk to the parks. The room was spacious and we were lucky enough to have views across Disneyland and California Adventure so were able to see the fireworks at the weekend.    Very nice Disney touch’s around the Hotel from the Mickey Mouse hands lights in the bathroom to the vintage pictures on the walls.  Our boy loved the Hotel pool with its water slides and we were happy to let him run free knowing there were plenty of life guards to keep him out of

My family of 5 debated staying here or off site for a while but finally bit the bullet and booked Disneyland Hotel.  It was well worth it in the end. The walk to the parks is not bad and there is a shortcut for each park if you don't want to trek thru downtown Disney. We upgraded to the concierge so we could have snacks throughout the day and check out a movie for the kids at night.  The room we had was 2 queens and a fold down couch (a bit tricky to figure out at first) plus a playpen in the closet if needed. The adventure tower was a great location b/c that is where the E ticket lounge is.  Our room overlooked downtown Disney and we had a great view of fireworks at night. All the staff I came in contact with was excellent. The pool is heated and there are 2 hot tubs so you can

The middle of the road on-site hotel gives you all of the luxurious comfort that you want at a quasi-reasonable price.  Everything was clean with lots of special Disney touches in the decor.  You can even see the park fireworks from the couch!  Awesome amenity!  Valet parking was easy, very friendly, and very fast; totally worth the cost.    The front desk staff cannot be beat.  I feel like I got my money's worth while checking in.  I noted that we were celebrating a birthday, the receptionist disappeared for a moment and returned with signed 8x10s of Mickey and Friends and the princesses.    Great location, vaguely near the monorail stop.  Pool looked like fun, but we spent all our time in the parks.  Maybe next time.

Summary Heading: Rooms are meh, service is stiff
Summary: It may be worth the $300+ a day you will sink on the room and being gouged at its variety of restaurants and gift shops, if you have kids who've never been to Disneyland and want them shrouded by Mickey 24/7.  Maybe.   But for the rest of us, this is clearly a swindle. The size of the rooms (standard king), the cheapness of the furnishments and thinness of the walls is akin to a Motel 6. The musical headboard is cute, but not $300 cute.    As for the hotel staff, they're stiff and stressed out. The animatronics on Pirates are less robotic.    On a positive note, however the security at the hotel monorail station was very lax and we were able to sneak copious amounts of booze into the park without issue.

Summary Heading: great for kids big ones too
Summary: we stayed here as a family , and my daughter couldnt sleep , all she wanted to do is visit the restaurants on site and eat with the disney characters , the place is great , new rooms freindly staff , and next door to the park

We just got back from a 2 night vacation at the Disneyland Hotel. We stayed at the Grand Californian last year and were pretty disappointed. For the price, we expected an amazing room with special Disney touches. The room was no different than what you would find at an average Best Western without any magic. The lobby was very beautiful and the location was convenient but it was nothing special. So our expectations were not much for the Disneyland Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. Our room was a standard view room but we asked at check-in if there were any upgraded views available. The girl checking us in seemed a little bit annoyed but she went ahead and changed our room to the Adventure Tower facing Downtown Disney on the 6th floor. She said that the view was obstructed but

Summary Heading: Great location and nice, clean rooms.
Summary: Spent 5 days at the Disneyland hotel beginning Feb. 8, 2013.  We stayed in a pool view room.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The kids loved the little details, such as the Mickey design on the carpet, the "handy helpers" that held the lights in the bathroom, and of course the light up fireworks headboard.   The location was great with young kids.  We could take the monorail back from the park in the early afternoon for a rest, and then return to the park after a few hours.  The extra hour that hotel guests receive every morning before the park officially opens was also a great benefit. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Overall a wonderful experience!

Summary Heading: Convenient location and helpful staff. Comfortable and clean rooms.
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for 3 days 2 nights. The location was perfect to visit both disneyland and California adventure. We could easily walk back to the room for a nap and recharge before heading back to the parks. It was worth the expense for the convenience of the location. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and pool area was fantastic.  We could even see the fireworks from our room. The only negative was that our tower was the closest to downtown Disney and the bands that played until 10pm. It wasn't too loud but if you have children who aren't used to a little noise, you may want to request a tower away from downtown Disney. (But no firework view if you do that!). We also had breakfast at goofy's diner located at the hotel. It was terrific! We met

Summary Heading: Go West for the best Disney park!
Summary: After NUMEROUS (over 30) visits to WDW we headed west to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in a concierge room and LOVED everything about this hotel.  The rooms are new and bright and the lounge has a great view of Disneyland.  We are headed back in July and will splurge this visit for a cabana around the pool-- Great time for all and walking distance to the monorail, downtown Disney area or California Adventure entrance.

My wife, my son and myself enjoyed 4 great nights in the Adventure Tower facing down town Disney. Rooms were clean and met all our needs. It was fun trying to find all the hidden Mickeys. All the cast members made us feel welcome. Goofy's kitchen was our 9 yr olds favorite. Pricey, food was average. He thought everything was awesome. Smile's on his face worth it. Every afternoon we would leave the park to go swimming, which gave my wife a chance to rest. ESPN ZONE was great. The price is good, food good, Margarita's really good according to my better half. This was my vacation for my son, my wife would rather have gone somewhere else. By the last night she was planning our next trip. Although next time we will not get a room facing Down Town Disney, the band is extremely loud

We just returned from our Valentines weekend at the Disneyland Hotel. Overall we had a Magical stay but this hotel had some shortcomings.  We stayed Club Level in the Adventure Tower, Room 2866.  We had a late check in and we were greeted by a very friendly CM who could not do enough for us, Thank You Judy! We overlooked the pool area and were very content with our view and the order in which we found our room.  We had a King bed and the room was immaculate BUT...SMALL!  The sink area outside the bathroom was very tight.  Two people could not fit in this area at the same time even one person manouvering the area with the sink and closet was interesting but, it really did not put a damper on our stay.    The E-Ticket Lounge was located on the 11th floor, we were on 10.  The staff

Summary Heading: It really is a 3 star hotel
Summary: For what you pay, and what you get, this place is a rip off.   BUT, it is right on Disney property and if you have never stayed on property before and you have cash to burn, then try it.   Otherwise, not worth it....we stayed at the Hyatt Regency Orange County the trip before this and we will be back to the Hyatt in the future.

Second time staying at the Disneyland Hotel, had to bring the little brother and sister to experience it with my girls and I.  Check-In wasn't as fun as last time (we were not asked what visit # it was, or whether we were there for special occasion), however, the cast member who checked me in DID an EXCELLENT job at fixing my ticket mishap, therefore saving me time and the headache of standing in line at the ticket booths to fix it.  I love that you can check-in early and love express check-out.  I did have to go back to the counter, since they ended up changing the room #.  We stayed at the Fantasy Tower in a standard room on the 5th floor, view of the parking lot.  Did not get a chance to visit the pools this time, since we only stayed one day, yet all the kids and teenagers
