I didn't enjoy the majority of the Disneyland Hotel as much as I should have given my one-night stay, but our room was really nice and clean, and service was exceptional. I felt the shower in our room was a bit off, it's a bit of a walk to the parks, and I wished I could have used the pools. Did appreciate them keeping our luggage while we were in the second park over the day.

Summary Heading: The most magical way to experience Disneyland Resort.
Summary: I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Disneyland Hotel at the Disneyland Resort.  It was an amazing and magical experience.  I had the opportunity to stay in the Adventure Tower which was closest to the Downtown Disney area.  The rooms were comfortable and nicely decorated.  The handles at the sink had Mickey Mouse touches and Mickey was holding up the lights beside the mirror.  The standard view I was provided with overlooked the garden which was themed like Adventureland in the park.  The headboard was really cool with music and lights (Fireworks) all with the click of a switch.  A great benefit was the room charging privilege and the Extra Morning Hour at the parks daily.  With no doubt, I will stay on Disneyland property again during my next visit.

The room was nice, but small and not up to the standards we were expecting.  We ended up requesting an upgrade the last two nights because the room was way too small for our family.  The employees at the front desk weren't very friendly, which was most disappointing since you think at Disney they would pride themselves on going above and beyond in the customer service areas.  When we arrived the room had some old buttons (they give the kids) under the bed, another piece of random trash that obviously didn't belong to us and wasn't cleaned well before our arrival and when I called the front desk to inform them the housekeeping manager avoided talking to us.  They just said it must have been an oversight.  These rooms are way too expensive to be checked in dirty!

First of all, being built many years ago, the rooms seem enormous compared to newer hotels.  You cannot beat the location, within walking distance to both parks and in the center of Downtown Disney.  Love the new pools, even though it was too cold to enjoy them at the time of our visit. Friendly, service oriented as you would expect Disney to be.  Back to the rooms a moment.  The headboard that lights up with music is charming.  The subtle mouse ears in the beautiful linens and carpet is very tasteful.  The only thing I can say I didn't like was the coffee and coffee maker.  It didn't quite work in my room.  Water spilled everywhere.  I also miss having the newspaper delivered directly to my door.  Other than that, a very nice stay.

The location is excellent for a young family (Children are 4 & 9). It's right at Downtown Disney and close to the Monorail to Disneyland Park & the California Adventure Park entrance at the Grand Californian.  The hotel itself looks nice and clean. The staff member who greeted us at the door & guided us to the check-in desk was very warm, friendly, & helpful. The staff member at the check-in desk was somewhat comatose & disinterested. I had to keep asking him to repeat himself, as I had trouble hearing him. No questions about if the trip was a special occasion or first time visit. We had called a number of times in advance & our booking included a request to add on Concierge Room access. However, they changed their rules around the same time of our arrival and that access was

Recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in an upper resort/pool view room.  We had a view of Downtown Disney and parts of both parks including the nightly fireworks display.  The rooms are beautiful with the recent renovations...comfortable beds and soft towels and linens.  We enjoyed the pool and had a great meal with the characters at Goofy's kitchen...highly recommend this hotel.

We just came back home from an amazing stay at the Disneyland Hotel celebrating our anniversary and I honestly can't say enough about how well taken care of we felt and what a great time we had.  We traveled from 2/7/13 - 2/9/13, had two rooms and traveled with myself, my husband and our two adult (20 & 21) sons.  Our rooms were both very clean, large and had a great view of the pool for our "kids", we were across the hall and had a beautiful view of Downtown Disney (we literally sat on the bed and watched the fireworks).  The only (very minor) bumps in the road were when we arrived, no bellhops came to help us with our luggage, even though I very clearly saw one guy leaning up against a luggage rack just standing there, and it was slow when we arrived, but the four of us were

Summary Heading: Disney could do better for the price
Summary: Just stayed at the Disneyland Hotel last week Tues.-Thurs.. We normally stay at a motel nearby that is less than half the price of this hotel and offers free parking, breakfast, and shuttle service to Disneyland. Normally when we go to Disneyland it is a family vacation so we are together all of the time and safety is not such an issue. This time my husband was going for business so he felt better about us staying on property since he wouldn't be with us for one of the days. We are also annual passholders this year so we got a little bit of a discount on the room. This was our first stay at any Disney resort so we were excited about our stay. Upon arrival at the hotel the young lady who checked us in was as one reviewer put it indifferent. She did ask if it was our first time

Summary Heading: Poor service tips the already small rooms and high price over the edge.
Summary: Reading through TripAdvisor reviews after our trip, we find kindred spirits who have experienced the remarkably lacking Disneyland Hotel service. Our experience included indifferent valets and front desk staff, as well as impossibly-long phone hold times, and a room service staff incapable of creating an ice cream sundae from the limited room service menu (which includes ice cream).  We were already prepared for the small rooms and had paid the high price, but we will explore alternatives before returning to a hotel that doesn't care about our patronage.

I visited with a friend and our daughters so we were in a 2 bedroom suite. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, the service was amazing. The room itself had two balconies and a separate loungeroom and was big and spacious. We all loved the litlle Disney touches like the Mickey lights and taps and the castle headboard.

Summary Heading: It was like we never left the park!
Summary: My husband and I have two kids, ages 7 and 10 and we've taken them to Disneyland several times now.  I finally convinced my husband to pay a little extra to try the Disneyland Hotel and I'm glad we did!  Especially since all the remodeling and construction are done now.  It was amazing!  I loved, loved, loved it and I was sad when it was time to leave.  Staying at the Disneyland Hotel made me feel like I never really left the park.  I've tried many other hotels in the area, but the newly remodeled Disneyland Hotel has them all beat in my opinion.  The staff were all Disney friendly and the service and quality of everything was excellent.  I've stayed a lot of places and I've never been more happy or comfortable in a hotel.  It also helps that I'm a big Disney fan though.    The

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel. Not the best bang for the buck.
Summary: I recently suprised my kids by flying them on Christmas morning to Disneyland for a week of vacation. After months of online research we decided to spend the money to stay at a Disneyland property. I did not get the suite, which I should have. But for the money the room was clean but very small. 5 people with luggage gave us no room to move. The bath was the smallest I've seen with one sink. Trying to get ready or shower was impossible. If you do stay here stay the Grand Californian in the park. Much nicer and not that much more expensive. Loved the park but if we go again I'll find somewhere out of the park.

This is the second time my family of 5 has stayed here in the last 6 months.  First - yes - it is expensive- but it's Disney.  I fully expect that coming here and so should you. Pluses: the location can't be beat - the monorail is a short walk away as in no more than 2 blocks away - we hop on this and get right into the park or back to the hotel for a swim break.  The rooms are all upated and nicely furnished. The beds now have LED lights for fireworks around the ornate headboard and music. Our even had a large balcony. Kids had room service one morning with Mickey Mouse pancakes.  The staff is very helpful and kind.  There's a laundry mat in the hotel which we of course used and a cafe for fresh coffee and pastries in the am.  One evening, we had a drink just us adults, in the

This hotel is expensive...BUT... It has so many little touches that will make your trip amazing. The light up bed head plays music, the Mickey Mouse hands holding light and all the old photography from years gone by at Disneyland make this place special.

We decided to immerse our family of 4 in the whole Disney experience & stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The whole resort complex is beautiful & clean. The hotel is only a 15 minute stroll through Downtown Disney to the front gates of either Disneyland or California Adventure Park & worth the extra cost compared to some of the cheaper hotel options. At the end of a long day you know you don't have far to go to get back to your room & the pool area was great. We went to Goofy's Kitchen for dinner & played charades with all the characters which our kids are still talking about. Also our 8 year old had fun counting all the Mickey Mouse touches in our room when we arrived.  The attention to detail is amazing. Just a couple of minor negatives. We stayed in the Adventure (middle) tower on

Summary Heading: If u can't get California adventure get this one
Summary: We picked this because it has more Disney charms than the beach theme one. We have view of the pool . I think we would prefer California adventure IF we got the room their . Walk is a bit far ... As we are thai ... We are not used to walking a lot hahaha. Bathroom tub is so shallow and over flow easily. Nice firework imitation on the bed rest

If you go to Disneyland this hotel is worth the splurge. It is more expensive than the other adjacent 5 star properties, but it is the Location, the wonderful service and very friendly staff. Plus you get to enter the park one hour prior to the public. Highly recommend the Fantasy Tower this newly renovated property is a delight for all ages. Everyone loves the Lighted Headboard and Mickey's white gloves holding the lamps. A treat with a coffee maker and refrigerator as well.

We had a great 6 night stay in a 1 bedroom suite, the early entry to the Disney Parks is a real bonus. Our room was large and comfortable and the pool and spa area just great for a late night calm down. Best of all is the laundry facility which allows families on long trips with lots of washing time to do this at a very reasonable cost. We felt really at home here and the suite has lots of quirky Disney touches that add to the atmosphere.

Just came back from a wonderful stay @ Disneyland Hotel.  Decided to take my daughter last minute for her bday, so because of short notice I booked another hotel on Priceline which we only stayed 1 night & slept maybe 4 hrs. So we arrived at Mickey & friends parking structure@ 7:15 am to start our day & I wasn't feeling our other hotel, so I asked her do you want to see if they have anything & DLH. So we walked over there & were so glad we did!  Jon @ the front desk was who helped us & what a help he was. Lucky for us they had rooms available as a walk up.  W were put in Frontier Tower on the 14th floor & was all about Walt Disney himself, wish was really wonderful to see!!!  The room had 2 double beds with the black & white picture of Walt walking through Sleeping Beatuys

My first visit to LA as I usually bypass the place. This hotel was nominated due to its proximity to the Anaheim Convention Centre. From that perspective it worked out well....a 15 minute walk to the convention centre. The room I was in was well set up only issue was the connecting door to the next room. A family with a young, noisy (make that whining) child tended to disrupt the quiet of the place. My room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was also well designed so no issues at all. Dining options are okay but all tend to be associated with Downtown Disney. A major flaw from a business travellers point of view was there was no dedicated bar for a quiet drink after work. Overall not a bad hotel for a few nights. Certainly a great spot if you're a

Location, location location.  Stayed here for the weekend, the proximity to Disneyland and California Adventure is great.  Walk through Downtown Disney on the way. A little pricey I agree, however, how about the firework headboard, only in a Disney hotel! Our view was of the parking lot, not so great, but that's where the start and finish line were, so, kind of cool. Will for sure be back next year and do it again!

Summary Heading: Has it's charms BUT WAAAY OVERPRICED!
Summary: Although I'm writing this review 3 months too late, I figure better late than never. For YEARS I've been wanting to stay @ the Disneyland Hotel being that I'm a MAJOR Disneyland geek;-) However, my boyfriend and I have an annual vacation fund we set aside in which we take several vacation trips throughout the year. Yet, due to some of the bigger splurging trips we take around spring and summer, our hotel budget by the time we take our 2 four day Disneyland trips in October and December is pretty limited. However this time the clouds parted and Angels began to sing as a friend of mine who works for a major software company was going to be holding an Expo in Anaheim and she was able to book a block of rooms at The Disneyland Hotel from their ususal $387+ rate to a discounted rate

We stayed in a premium room at the Disneyland Hotel over New Year's and were very pleased with the amenities and convenience.  Dis always pays such attention to detail, from the embroidered throw pillows and firework headboards to the Mickey hands holding the lights in the bathroom, it was a real extension of the spirit of the parks.  Service and housekeeping was great and it was so nice to be able to walk a short distance to/from the hotel and parks without waiting for shuttle busses or taxis.  Pool area was under construction so we "only" got to go on the waterslides and use 2 hot tubs and 1 large pool.  Plenty to keep our 10 year old busy, even if it was super cold outside.   Trader Sam's Tiki Bar was fun but the service there was a bit slow, probably because there were so

Summary Heading: Worth the extra money to stay here
Summary: We recently stayed at this location during the Tinkerbell 1/2, it was close to the race start and finish line. Our room was spacious for the two of us - we stayed in the Frontier Tower. We did not have a view of much but a parking lot but for how much time we spent in the room it was fine.  The pool was wonderful to laze by during the day, the downfall is the price of the drinks, but everything Disney is pricey it seems!

Summary Heading: A Stay Makes Everything More Magical
Summary: We stayed four nights in the refurbished Disneyland Hotel in December of both 2011 and 2012 (in the Frontier and Adventure Towers, respectively).  Obviously, our stay in 2011 was enough to bring us back again in 2012.  Upon check-in this year, we were offered a truly magical experience...two tickets to the Candlelight Processional.  Not being familiar with it, we turned it down.  We were floored when we walked into Disneyland that night to a chorus of hundreds singing Christmas carols complete with a full band (with trumpeters dressed as angels atop Main Street Station) and immediately regretted not taking them up on an offer for the seated section.  When we asked if we could get tickets for the next night, we found out that the tickets had sold out in October.  We really did

Summary Heading: Still the best place to stay
Summary: Talk about being treated right. The hotel might cost a few more dollars but the service, convenience and experience is worth every penny! My children are now in their 20's and for Christmas last year we bought them a family vacation to Disneyland. What a great time. 5 days with the Mouse and 1 day at Universal. We all felt like kids again. Even though the kids are grown up we stll did the character breakfast. What a great family getaway... for any age.

Stayed January 13,2013 - January 17.  Loved our stay.    We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite.  4 adults and 3 children.  Pros:  Rooms - First bedrrom had 2 queens and a bath which connected to the living room.  LR had a pull out queen bed in the couch and a pull out bed under the TV.  Second bedroom had a king with a spacious bathroom.  Suite also has a large entry way with an area sized perfectly for a crib.  We easily slept  7, could have slept another 3 without any problems.  Rooms were very quiet.  Beds were very soft.  Location - so nice to ride the monerail home each night.  We didn't mind the 10 minute walk through Downtown Disney in the morning.  Lots of shops and great eating spots in Downtown Disney.  Room was close enough and park lines short enough that we didn't mind

Five of us stayed in two connecting rooms for the Neverland 5K this past weekend. It was my first time at the Disneyland Hotel, their first time staying at the park ever.  None of us were disappointed. In fact, we all raved about the hotel all weekend. From the time we pulled up to valet parking, it was nothing but stellar service from the valet, bell hops, maids, check-in, shops and restaurants. The rooms were lovely, comfortable and well stocked with towels and toiletries. We loved that the rooms had refrigerators (at no extra cost like some hotels). The hotel is also very well situated, just steps from Downtown Disney. The pool area is very nice. It can be a little pricey, but at the end of the weekend we were so happy we didn't stay someplace else.  Will definitely go back!

I just took one my daughters to a surprise trip to Disneyland.  She is 14 but this is still her favourite place to go!  We stayed in a newly renovated room overlooking downtown Disney with a view of the parks (and therefore the fireworks!)  We have stayed in this hotel many times pre and post rennovation - we have also stayed off sight and at the Grand California.  $ for $ this is still the best hotel for location and Ambience.  I love the california feel on the grounds with the fruit trees still in the gardens and I love the big nod to Mickey etc in the decoration of the rooms.  The Grand California made me feel I was at a hotel in Whistler.  The service is exceptional in all aspects - from check

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for our 5th year wedding anniversary.  I had not been to Disneyland since the early 90's and my husband had never been there.  What a change to the place!  It was great that the hotel was just steps away from the downtown area and then right intot the park.  Since are stay was in October some maintenance work was in place on some of the attractions but we were aware of this from visiting tour guide sites before hand and it was really too chilly to be in the water anyway.  (We did stick a toe in the pool, and it was supper chilly at night) It was still sad that we had to see the pool slide being worked on....STILLLLLLL... our room was beautiful and the view was excellent.  The huge windows let in the sun and we were high enough to get a great

Following what we were told was a 1 billion dollar renovation there is only one word to describe this hotel experience - divine!! My mom, my two sons age 11 and 7 and myself stayed here for five wonderful days and when we left my 7-year-old literally sobbed. Our standard view room had an amazing view out over the palm trees toward downtown Disney and we could watch the fireworks in Disneyland Park. When you walk into the reception area the Mary Blair paintings on the walls and the way their colour palette and designs are incorporated into the rugs and furniture is breathtaking. We stayed in the Adventure tower and I would recommend requesting this one as it is the closest to the parks and there are simply no bad views! The new rooms are gorgeous and although the children

This was our first trip to Disneyland and we absolutley loved the hotel and the Disney experience. Neing experienced Disney travelers, we rate this hotel and their rooms amongst the best. We've stayed at a number of Disney World properties and we consider this amongst the best in all of Disney. From the beautifuly decorated rooms and hotel lobbies to the head board that lights up and plays music, we could not have asked for a more magical experience.  Within walking distance of both Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure, as well as Downtown Disney, this is a perfect hotel for a Disneyland stay.

This Hotel was Awesome.  The service - excellent!  I wasn't sure what to expect with all the mixed reviews, but i am so glad i stayed here and will DEFINITELY stay at the Disneyland Hotel again.  I am already planning my next trip!!  Can't wait.  I celebrated my daughters 10th birthday at Disneyland.  I ordered ballons to be in the room when we arrived.  They were all over the room and came with little personalized cards.  I highly recommend doing this if you're celebrating any occasion! It's a really in-expensive way of surprising someone and making them feel special.  My daughter was so happy and they lasted the whole time we were there.  The hotel even had a special photo autographed for her from all the princesses wishing her a happy birthday.  So adorable.  I couldn't have

If you're staying on property at a Disney resort, be prepared for everything to be outrageously pricey - eg, $1.99 + tax for a single banana or apple at the coffee shop.  But if you're looking for convenience, you can't beat this location - a 2-minute walk to the Downtown Disney shopping & dining district and only about another 5 minutes to the park gates.  Guests are entitled to an "Extra Magic Hour"  - typically an hour before the park opens to the public - each day.  The view of the fireworks from my warm, cozy room in the Frontier Tower made it all worthwhile; room service has been prompt and delicious. The room is very clean and surprisingly quiet, and the bed is very comfy.

My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for three nights in December.  We had never stayed there before and splurged for our Christmas trip.  We had a room with a view of Downtown Disney and the parks and Concierge Service.  The room itself was nice, clean, and comfortable, but much smaller than it looks in the photos on their website.  The view was amazing.  It was nice to be able to walk a short distance to the monorail to enter the park in the morning.  Concierge service is a very pricey add on that was not worth the money.  Basically you get access to a special lounge where they have different snack items throughout the day and beer and wine.  You can also borrow dvds from the lounge which was nice.  The food offered seemed to be different every day but breakfast was

Summary Heading: Nice but not worth the cost..
Summary: The service at Disney is outstanding...but remember, it comes at a huge cost!  Nothing is included, everything is extra.  $22.00 per day for valet parking, $15.00 per day for self parking that is way far from the hotel.   Room was very nice. Beds were great, cleanliness outstanding, very small though.  We had a standard room and it was very small for 3 adults and a baby. We were here for our company kick off and had a very nice time.   It is so expensive that I don't know how middle America can afford to go to Disneyland? Even with our convention discount the tickets were way out of reach.  So sad we couldn't enjoy the park. Hotel is very nice though...Just way expensive?

Summary Heading: A Bit Pricey - But Worth It for the Extra Magic Hour
Summary: This was our first time on a Disney property and we were not disappointed. We stayed for 2 nights during the New Year's week when the hotel was completely sold out, yet we never felt crowded at all.   We got to the hotel at 6 am on the day we were to check in and the front desk pre-checked us in and held our bags. When you are a guest of the hotel, you get to enter both parks an hour earlier than ticket holders and believe me, when it is crowded that extra hour is worth its weight in gold. Even though we didn't officially check in until 3 pm that day, the front desk got us set up so that we could take advantage of the extra hour that morning and texted us in the park when the room was ready.  You can tell that the room had recently been redone. Plush bedding, thick walls,

Summary Heading: The Magical Kingdom can do some real magic!
Summary: I presented at Starwest 2012, a conference on software automation, held at Anaheim. We live in Malaysia and had a travel of nearly 16 hours to reach LA and then from there, Anaheim was about 1 hours drive. Upon reaching the Disneyland hotel, the welcome was really good and they made us really feel at home... The best part about the hotel is that it's backdrop is Disneyland itself! Wow, that's something really really cool.... everyone seems to have returned back to their childhood days and there's cheer all around!  The front office and housekeeping staff are all pretty good. We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and then moved to the other Disneyland hotel (Paradise Pier) which is also on the same lane, and spent another 2 nights there. Everything seemed great except for for one

From the friendly valet parking attendant to the lobby hostess, the friendliness and happy atmosphere is unequaled. We recieved a "package" for Christmas from a family member's employer: two days at the resort and one night in a beautiful hotel suite on the 10th floor consisting of two rooms and two bathrooms. To the delight of my two granddaughters, ages 4 and 7, the headboard in the bedroom lights up and plays music. Room service breakfast was excellent, the fruit plate with generous proportions, pancakes, etc., and good hot coffee, and no more expensive than most hotels. The proximity to the parks, California Adventure and Disneyland, could not have been better. We walked out the door of the hotel and right into the park. If there is a negative to report, it would be that,

It had been over 30 years since my last stay at a Disney property.  As a special treat, my husband and I chose to stay at the Disneyland Hotel for New Years Eve.  I chose the DH over the other two Anaheim properties because of the nostalgia.  Strangely enough the worst part of the whole stay was finding the hotel parking entrance!  Once we did find the self-parking lot there was plenty of room--even on New Year's Eve.  The hotel has been beautifully updated and the front desk service was excellent.    One of the goals of our stay at the hotel was to be able to see the fireworks from our room and I didn't quite comprehend what the front desk clerk said when I asked her if our room would be able to see them--she said not to worry, that we had been upgraded--THAT was an

The Disneyland Hotel is a very nice. It's located close to downtown Disney and the park. You can enter California Adventure park through the Grand Californian hotel, with your Disneyland Hotel key, which is nice.   The rooms have recently been renovated and they look very nice!   My only critique... We got a two bedroom suite, which is of course pricey, but not nearly as pricey as a suite at the Grand Californian, which we also really enjoy.  At the Disneyland hotel, our suite consisted of a one bedroom suite that shared a common hall (that is key operated, not open access) with a basic hotel room, which doubles as the second bedroom. So, essentially our kids were across a hall. We had to keep both (hotel room) doors open with door stops. To the maintenance and cleaning crew,

Summary Heading: High Rate but Well Worth It - Nice New Touches
Summary: You're going to pay a lot for this hotel yet it's worth it to get the full Disney experience. If you stayed here before the renovations you'll be impressed with some of the new touches. The hotel is very classic Disney and has been updated to be even better then before. The new pools are great and include some impressive slides. The location is good and very close to the monorail or you can walk the 5 minute walk through the Grand Californian Hotel into the California Park. The entrance to Disney, if you don't take the monorail is a 15 minute walk through Downtown Disney. It can be a tough walk after a long day at the park with little ones. The monorail is not always reliable so the walk sometimes has to be done. Definitely take a stroller if you have kids that need them. The

Booked through Disney vacations and got a decent deal for New Year's. guest services was always reachable by phone and helpful prior to departure. Arrived and was helped to find a room on New Year's Eve although it was not check in time yet. We actually got upgraded. The hotel was clean, room was in a quiet wing, had a very nice view from the 10th floor that overlooked the pool area. Bathroom was big and lavatory section had its own door. Bathroom had its own door as well which works really well for privacy if more than one/two persons are in the room. Of course the hotel was only a short stroll away from Downtown Disney. Most staff at all amenities were friendly and helpful. How can they not when this is the "happiest place on earth".

Summary Heading: Worth the extra expense if you're not a frequent guest
Summary: We stays on the property for the early entry to Disneyland and California Adventure. It worked out great, we were able to ride many rides in that hour, before the public was allowed in. The hotel pool was 78 degrees, which is awful in December when the weather is only 62 degrees out. You would think for $435 dollars per night they could afford to heat the pool to 88 degrees because of course the kids demand to swim anyway. If you're a Disney regular or live nearby, I would stay across the street and save some big bucks. In Orlando there are nonstop character sightings in the common areas of the hotels. Not so in Disneyland, we never saw one in 3 days.

Summary Heading: The updates are very nice, but it was an older hotel.
Summary: We stayed 4 nights on the concierge level of the Disneyland Hotel in a room with 2 queen beds overlooking Downtown Disney.   The room itself is very clean and comfortable.   We had no issues with the cleanliness of the room, but the bathroom needed some work.  The sink was fine, but the shower had no water pressure although being hot and the shower head itself looked like it had a few years of mineral deposits on it.  The bottom of the tub also had some dirt, but it looked like you would need some heavy duty scrubbing to get that off.  The other issue we had was that the room AC unit was not working for either heating or cooling.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and there was one of the pluses of the hotel.   Being so close to the parks was also a big plus along

An average score for what could have been an amazing stay. Its lacking that attention to detail which you come to expect from Disney, that special je ne sais quoi .... On the plus side, it is safe and comfortable for a short stay and although not incredible value for the cost, it is Disney and our family all enjoyed the vacation.

My family stayed at the Disneyland Hotel 4 days and 3 nights during mid-December and it was truly magical. The rooms and hotel itself have been refurbished within the last year or two and they did a great job of embracing the past of the resort while adding modern touches. The headboard is charming and a hit with kids and adults alike. There's a switch on the bedside lamp that when turned on plays a Disney tune and lights up fireworks that appear over the carved castle...Disney magic. One of the best parts about staying at the Disneyland hotel is being able to take advantage of the early entry into the parks and the use of the monorail right into Tomorrowland in Disneyland. Do I wish the hotel were more reasonably priced?? Absolutely! However, it is special to be able to stay so

Price was high for a normal hotel with normal operating costs.  Small room.  Convenient to park.  Always put on hold with hotel operator for things like dining reservations and valet.    Next time will stay off-sight.  Enjoyed Goofy's Kitchen, but photography service was very expensive and we opted out.

Had a great Christmas stay at the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim.  We have been there many times and the staff are always friendly and helpful.  The hotel, as any Disney property, is clean and nicely appointed.  The towels are plush and bathroom amenities good.  Great view of Downtown Disney and the parks from the Adventure Tower.  Nice restaurants and early morning fare in multiple locations.  Easy, easy access to parks with early admission a perk of staying at Disney property.

This was my family vacation to Disneyland for the first time. Due to Hurricane Sandy, we ended up staying 5 days longer. This hotel was amazing!!! Friendly staff, characters in the lobby, and a few skips to the parks. I am sure there are other hotels that are just as nice, but no matter what, I will be staying at this hotel for EVERY visit. I went for the Halloween Party and had the time of my life! I was more excited than my 4yr old... The pool area was open and beautiful, the shops in the hotel were staffed with great help, and Downtown Disney was literally across the street from the hotel, just walk out the back entrance and you were there. Hands down, the BEST time of my life!!

We had so much fun here that my daughter keeps asking when we can go back. The hotel is a little old but for me it just added to the character. The staff were so friendly and helpful that it was a delight. They tried to sell us the Disney membership which, for someone who doesn't live in the US, is an absolute rip off. Nevertheless they made up for wasting our time with some passes so it was all good.   Can't wait to go back.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in the Adventure Tower for 4 nights in December (there were 4 of us in our party).  The renovations were an improvement, however it is still way overpriced. We visit Disneyland every other year and have stayed at various establishments.  We would choose to stay elsewhere in the future due to the fact that we can easily have a Disney view suite for less than the price point we paid for staying at the Disneyland Hotel.    We did enjoy the water slide and renovated pool area.  The headboards in the rooms were nice as well but this does not equate to the high per night room cost for us.  The showers water pressure was one of the worst we have experienced in our travels, not sure what the problem was. We also kept hearing the music that was in the

Summary Heading: A dream is a wish your heart makes.
Summary: The happiest place on earth ~I LOVE Disneyland.Especially at X-Mas,ON Christmas eve & day. The Disneyland Hotel-ehh-okay ! From the Disney-esque smiles of the valet,bellman,greeters to the lobby decor that let's you know fun is now at your fingertips-It's a good experience. The check in -easy peasey.The staff-So helpful,friendly and courteous . I rented a electric wheel chair for someone with MS and they got it straight away. The room-: /  First room-next to the ice machine/vending and an elevator.Never even saw the King Room. Went back down-got a 2 queen room-that was all they had left.ok cool. Room size -fine.Just fine for getting in ,getting out .Not anything special except for Disney art & a wood wall size carving that you don't notice until....You turn off the lights and

Once again staying at the Disneyland Hotel made the trip to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure extremely enjoyable. We entered an hour before Disneyland opened on Saturday and rode over 15 rides, including Space Mountain, Indiana Jones, Splash Mountain before 10:30 am.  Then we went back to the hotel rested;had lunch, worked out and went to Calfornia Adventure in the pm.  The next day, we entered California Adventure an hour before the park opened. We were the first ones to ride Cars that morning.   The staff is fantastic. We checked in at 6:30 and got a late check out of 1:00 pm.

We decided to splurge this time on our trip to Disneyland and to pick up our college daughter who goes to school nearby--stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  Didn't get much of a discount, even with our annual pass, but we bit the bullet and did it anyway.  Now we are spoiled for life!  We hadn't stayed here since all the renovation, and I must say they've done a fabulous job.  The rooms are lovely, large and filled with little surprises like Mickey head faucet handles and Hidden Mickeys in the shower tiles and on the carpet.  I loved the "magic" headboard and just the whole ambience of the room.  It wasn't very crowded while we were there, and because we mentioned that we'd had our 25th anniversary recently and that our son had just finished his finals at his college and our

The view from the room is amazing you can see the fireworks from the room while the hotel is close to Disneyland it's pricey if you don't mind the cost. Our girls had so much fun here . It's really close to the park and you get early admittance into the park.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel from December 12th to the 14th.  We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  We arrived early at around 11am and they were able to check us into our room right away.  The check in process was very smooth and quick and they had a lobby attendant there to answer any questions and give tips to those who needed it.  We were in the Fantasy tower which is the main tower where the main desk and gift shops are located.  I have seen people who say the Fantasy tower and Adventure tower are the best, but I do not think which tower you are located in makes much of a difference.  To get to Adventure or Frontier, you do have to exit the main lobby and walk outside.  The Frontier tower is closest to the entrance to

Spent our last night in USA on vacation from Australia at the Disneyland resort. I had high expectations of the room and the resort and I was not let down. My only complaint was that we didn't have more nights there. Beautiful room, very friendly and helpful staff, and great access through Downtown Disney to the Parks.

Summary Heading: Trader Vic's-- you'll think you're in Hawaii
Summary: The large re-hab of D-Land Hotel brought some sadness.,.. but Trader Vic's makes it a bit bearable.... It is a combo of the Tiki-Room, Jungle Cruise and a local bar...all on a jungle island  It's a little small, but the drinks and atmosphere are very good and you expect Humphrey Bogart to walk in any minute, to sit down and cool off at the bar.

We had a 4 night stay here in the Adventure Tower and have zero true complaints.  The room was exactly as described by others here, in very well maintained condition.  It was serviced efficiently each day with the maid being generous in restocking the products.  We faced the pool side so there was no noise noticeable from Downtown Disney.  Of course, it costs more than equivalent accommodations.  But all real estate is priced by location so some folks need to get past the price premium issue.  Having a very nice room in a "historic" property and being able to access both parks and downtown easily made it very worthwhile for us.  But I will confirm that trying to call the front desk services is a tiresome process.  They really need a big dose of the usual Disney efficiency which

Stayed here for 4 days/ 3nights. This hotel really lived up to Disney's reputation of style, class, and cleanliness. The room was fantastic with all the modern amenities and a great view of the (not so close) park. The kids loved the pools complete with a monorail slide. To go along with the Disney theme, everything here is very expensive, so be prepared. You can walk to the downtown Disney monorail station which is only a few minute walk, and board there if you have your passes. It drops you off in Tomorrowland.

We recently enjoyed a three night stay at the Disneyland Hotel and came away very impressed.  It was our first stay at this property and we were very pleased with the proximity to Downtown Disney, Magic Kingdom and California Adventure.  The room was spacious and clean with the new LED headboards that play a tune and light up fireworks over Sleeping Beauty's castle.  The walk to the shopping and theme parks was under 10 minutes and it was safe and well lit.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland!

We had a perfect room overlooking the pool in the Fantasy tower on the 9th floor. Our room was spotless. The beds comfortable and the nightlight Disney scene on the head boards was Disney Magic. We walked everywhere. And the location is perfect. We did do "Breakfast with Goofy" expensive but a memory. I did visit the tiki bar twice and the service was awful. Actually left the 2nd time without getting a beverage. It was not that the bar was busy, I guess I was just invisible. We also made all of our dinner reservations prior so we had no problem getting a table. My daughter played in the pool and on the water slides for about an hour as the water was cold. The pools are beautiful. I am sure there are less expensive ways to do Disney. We did the Southern California City Pass which

What this hotel has going for it, aside from being the iconic original Disney hotel and thus possessing a bit of nostalgia, is location.  Based on my experience, that is the only reason you would stay here. Room quality, service, comfort....all somewhat lacking.   I was originally checked into a room in the adventure tower that was located directly beside the elevator. As a sound sleeper, this is not ideal. As such, I asked for a new room and was moved to a room in the Frontier tower.  This second room was dirty upon checking in - used towels in the sink and bathtub, and the toilet had been used. Disgusting!  I asked for a third room, and was moved back to a room in the Adventure tower, overlooking downtown Disney. If you intend to sleep before 10:30pm, this is a very bad

The recently remodeled hotel is great. The rooms were spacious and with full amenities, close to the parks, and with attentive staff. The tiki bar is fun too.  Beds were great.  Not as architecturally interesting as the Grand Californian, but highlyvrecommended.

Third time staying at the Disneyland Hotel and the room was clean, great size, location fantastic. In three trips we have not used the pool yet - weather was not great. We always stay at the Adventure Tower so we are close to the park and can see the fireworks for our room (sort of). Big complaint with the noisy air/plumbing. We are in a room right across from the elevator and I am not sure if this is why. I would change roomsnexttime - was not until after the first night of waking up all night that I realized our room was so noisy. Otherwise, this is my hotel of choice. Magic mornings every day and proximity to the park make the extra cost worthwhile.

Summary Heading: Perfect location and magical Disney experience!
Summary: We just got back from 4 days at the Disneyland Hotel. We stayed in the Fantasy Tower on the 4th floor facing the pool and had a standard room 2 queens. The view wasn't spectacular but it wasn't horrible either. The room itself was perfect size-wise for our needs. It seems hotels are doing away with big fluffy comforters and going the way of thin ones instead which I'm not a fan of. I wish they had more than 3 drawers to put your clothes in. We had to leave some things in a suitcase for our stay. The mini fridge was perfect. My biggest issue was the hot water was inconsistent. Half the time we had luke warm water at best. Nothing like taking a cool shower when you're trying to warm up after being out in the cool rain.   Overall I would recommend this hotel. For the price I'm not

This was our third time staying at the Disneyland Hotel and we had a wonderful time as always.  We have stayed at all 3 of the hotels of the Disneyland Resort and we like the Disneyland Hotel the best.  The kids love the night light on the head board and the lullaby it plays when you turn it on. The hotel is a very short walk to the downtown disney Monorail station, which takes you right into Disneyland.  Of all the hotels at the Disneyland Resort, we find that there are more Disney characters walking around the Disneyland Hotel than the other 2 hotels on site.  Our room was cozy and the bed very comfortable.

Hi.  I know I have already done my review of this hotel but one thing I wanted to add is that if you have a late flight (ours left at 9.45pm) you can leave your luggage in storage just outside the hotel for no charge.  Just sign a form and get your ticket and pick your luggage up when your bus for the airport arrives.  This way you can spend the day at the parks (if you haven't already used up your passes!!) or roam around Downtown Disney doing last minute shopping, etc.  Or do whatever you like basically.  We found this an awesome thing to have available as we didn't have to cart our luggage around with us for the whole day.

By far this has to be my favorite of the three resort hotels.     Over the years i have had the opportunity to stay in all three towers at one point.    The staff is friendly, the grounds are small enough to be cozy but large enough where you are not shoulder to shoulder with other guests.       Over the past several years the towers have undergone renovations, the pool now has the Monorail water slide and they have the fairly new Trader Sams Lounge for that night-cap under the tiki torches.   Of course there is Goofys Kichen also for the Character Breakfast which i enjoy, especially the PB&J Pizza.    Yeah, yeah, you know your crinkling your nose, as i did, but its sooooo tasty :)    WIth Disneyland Hotel, being so close to Downtown Disney,  you can choose to eat off the hotel

This hotel is on the resort property adjacent to the main Disneyland Park. You can walk to the entrance through the shops and restaurants in about 10-15 mins or you can take the monorail which leaves every few mins across from the hotel. Overall the hotel has been remodeled, so it is quite nice. Now for the price, it could be better. But part of the price is the whole Disney experience and convenience to the park. The restaurants on site were okay, if not a bit overpriced, but that is all of Disney really.  All of the staff was very helpful for the most part. The rooms were always clean and stocked when we cam back from a day at the parks. Overall, if you want to save money, you could stay at another hotel nearby, but if you want the full Disney experience 24 hours a day, then

Summary Heading: Love finding all the hidden Mickeys
Summary: First off let me say I love this hotel! Our flight came in kinda late so we didn't arrive until about 9:30pm on a Saturday night on a holiday weekend.  They had a governors ball going on that night, it was so nice to see all the young service men in their dressy attire with their dates in beautiful ball gowns. After I saw that I thought of boy we aren't gonna get upgraded for free this time. BUT Disney didn't disappoint, they upgraded us to a premium view room which worked perfect for my family of 4, both kids got their own bed!  So our room had 2 queens and a daybed and overlooked the pool in the Frontier Tower on the 8th floor.  I love the room decor with all the hidden Mickey's everywhere in the tiniest details. The headboard is just beautiful. The room is very spacious as

Our family consisting of one toddler, two adults and two teens stayed here for 6 nights in August 2012. We were put in the Adventure Tower with a view of the pool (and partial view of the fireworks). To put it simply, we loved every bit of our stay at this hotel and can not wait to go back. The best part was the early entry to the parks. We made good use of this extra every morning allowing us to ride on many of the new Cars Land attractions more than once, or every Fantasy Land ride well before regular park opening. We would take a mid morning break back at the hotel pool, have lunch and then head back to the park later in the afternoon until closing.  The beds were very comfortable and we loved all of the little Mickey touches. As expected, every level of service from the

Disneyland is a classic destination for any family with children.  We decided to stay at the Disneyland hotel for a couple of reasons... The perks associated with getting into the park early and proximity to the parks were high on the list.  We stayed in a one bedroom (2 Queen beds).  The decor was contemporary and the lit headboard was a smash hit with our 7 year old.   Disneyland is not cheap... nor are the hotels but there is value in the price. - The Hotel was very clean and well maintained - The room was clean and tid, beds comfortable and none of the linens or towels appeared "tired" as so often happens. - Free Wifi was an unexpected bonus  We stayed in the "Frontier" tower and the scale model of "Big Thunder Railroad" in the lobby was a big hit as it was a favourite ride.

Our family recently returned from our annual Disneyland trip here in California. It started 28 years ago with our first born and now is a new tradition with our first born grand baby who is now  4 years old, by the way it was his second trip and was tall enough last year to ride ALL the rides except Indiana Jones AND he rode them all "the big white mountain" (Matterhorn) was his favorite last year this year it was Star Tours :-) When we started our tradition 28 years ago it started with the "Disneyland Hotel" over the years we have stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel as our family grew we also tried the Hyatt Hotel down the road both very nice.  However this year We decided to go back to the original "Disneyland Hotel" AMAZING!!! The rooms were recently newly renovated, one of

Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which is actually a 1 bedroom suite with an adjoining room.  The living room was very spacious with plenty of room for all of us (5 adults) as well as pack n play for baby.  Bathrooms were super clean with great smelling bath products and great plush towels.  Adorable Mickey fxtures added a special touch to the elegant rooms.  Beds and bedding were very comfy and nice.  Light up firework headboards were a special touch.  Stayed in fantasy tower and had great view of the evening fireworks from our room.  Easy walk to Disneyland or California Adventure.  Many restaurants and lots of shopping.  Only minus is there is not much lighting (but there is plenty of space) for putting on makeup outside of bathroom.  Highly recommend.

Pros:  Proximity to parks and monorail, perks, early entry everyday of your stay,  recently refurbished, nice pools, outstanding service.  Cons: Price  For those of you who hesitate between the Grand Californian and the Disneyland hotel:  We stayed at both and perfer the Disneyland hotel simply because the rooms are larger and newer.  Also, the Disneyland hotel is closer to the monorail.  The only thing "grand" at the Grand Californian is the lobby.    For those of you who hesitate between a good neighborhood hotel or one of the 3 official Disney hotel:  Splurge and go for the Disney hotel if you can afford it!  Well worth the extra cost.  This was our 4th visit to Disneyland and we stayed in good neightborhood hotels before which are advertised to be "across the street".  They

I have not stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for about 6 years.  It was a surprise to see all the updates to the hotel that had been made.  The hotel now looks new, clean and bright.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower, in a suite on the 9th floor and had a spectacular view of the parks and the to the east.  We watched the fireworks display every night from our balcony, with the music channel on the TV.  The headboard in our bedroom was carved with disneyland and lights that looked like fireworks and music that would play when you turned it on. All the fixtures in the bathroom had some Mickey design, such as the handle on the tub, tiles, lights, etc. The first night turn down service included a plate of mickey & minney cookies with a carafe of milk.  The following nights with

Summary Heading: Perfect spot with plenty of amenities
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is a great spot to stay when visiting the theme parks.  It's convenient to EVERYTHING - parks, Downtown Disney - but the best part is having early access to the theme parks on alternating days.  Service was very Disney-friendly; staff was courteous and efficient.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location or the room
Summary: We spent two nights here in early November.  We were able to check in at 7am with no problem so we could have early access to California Adventure that day.  The rooms were recently re-done, and the lights over the beds (like fireworks) were a big hit with the kids.  Our room faced Downtown Disney (Adventure Land) and was very accessible to walk to the parks in the morning (about 5 minutes).  We slept 5 comfortably with the 'transformer' bed.  We would stay here again, but we definitely paid for the convenience with little discounts available (that we could find anyway).  The one disappointment was that the monorail slide was closed :( and the park openings were a bit late for this east coast family.

Summary Heading: Great Stay in the Heart of the Magic!
Summary: While the Disneyland Hotel price is much more then the many other surrounding "good neighbor" hotels for us this was the perfect place to stay!  We are frequent visitors to Walt Disney World and love being "immersed in the magic."  Being able to walk every where and being on Disney property the whole time is exactly what we were looking for.  The rooms were very nice, contemporary/modern and plenty of space for us.  We loved the little design touches in the rooms and throughout the buildings.  We were in the Frontier Building, while it is probably easier to be in the main building we did not mind the walk, although did not eat at the hotel restaurants and only stopped in the gift shop twice.  If you are looking for a wonderful place to stay and have the entire Disney experience

We visited the Disneyland Hotel for a long weekend and had a ball!  We had a larger party so we had a "2 room suite" which was a bedroom with a living room and a connecting standard bedroom.  Room was very clean, had a refrigerator, microwave and kitchenette.  The decor was amazingly beautiful and the headboards play when you wish upon a star and have LED's on it that look like fireworks.  Great place to stay! The food at Disneyland Hotel, however, left a lot to be desired unless you want to pay a lot for a character breakfast, you are better off going to Downtown Disney.

Wendy at check-in was fabulous! Very informative and took the time to tell us about the resort and Disneyland.  There are 3 Towers at Disneyland Hotel.  We stayed in the Frontier Tower, room 2593.  The view wasn't that great. We backed onto the parking lot....but how long are you really in your room?  The queen size beds were very comfy and the kids adored the sleeping beauty headboard that light up fireworks.  Separate shower/toilet area from the sink which was great when you have 4 in the room.  Not as many hidden Mickey's as I was expecting though.  Kids loved the pool but the slides and one hot tub was down for maintenance so we never got to try the slide out.  I cannot recommend the onsite restaurant next to the pool.  We had dinner there first night. BBQ chicken sandwhich

This is my family's 7th visit to Disneyland and our first stay at a Disneyland Resort Hotel.  We were not disappointed.  Yes, it was considerably more expensive than the neighbouring hotels, yet we swallowed the expense to experience it - if only once.  Well, now it's hard to go back to a neighbouring hotel.  We've been spoiled.  The rooms were very quiet.  When in our room, we heard no hallway noise or noise from other rooms. The newly renovated hotel is really, really nice.  We stayed in the Adventure Tower.  Particular detail is payed to the bathroom faucets the Mickey's white gloved hand holding the light fixtures.  My favorite of all was the giant sized headboard of the beds that would light up with twinkling lights.  The room was large and extremely comfortable.  It had a

Summary Heading: Disneyland Resort Hotel no "Mickey Mouse" operation
Summary: I enjoyed my visit and stay at the DRH. The organisers of the FIVB Congress had problems with allocating rooms with DRH but after a long flight with a missed connection I was able to sustain my good humour thanks to the brilliant reception staff who got me a room which was excellent. Unfortunately I had to move the following lunchtime but this was to a slightly smaller room but of top class quality. The Congress facilities and accommodation were top class. I enjoyed the food and choices although some fellow-members were disappointed at the range offered being too repetitive and limited. I cannot agree. Facing another 24 hr flight I had room service the night pre-departure and it  was excellent and good value. My first time in USA and this was the highlight.

Summary Heading: The BEST hotel ! Thank you Disney !
Summary: We wanted to treat our daughter a great 7th birthday present by flying to Disneyland. We stayed at Disneyland hotel for 6 days and 5 nights and I can tell you the money & time planning this was worth it !! I purchased the package when booking the hotel and that alone was great ! All 3 of us got free lanyards, luggage tags & Disney pins. My daughter got a free signed picture from Mickey & Minnie, those little touches made my daughter so happy.  We also got to experience magic hour twice for both Disneyland Park & California Park. This is when they open the park to hotel guests only an hour before the general public is due which was so great as we got to go to all the rides which usually has a long line during the day :)  With the package you also get priority seating on some

We've stayed at the Disneyland on occasion over the years. It's always a good experience, but one you definitely pay for.  This trip was a surprise for our sons 7th birthday. This was the first time we have stayed in one of the remodeled rooms.  The room was very well done, clean, big and modern. The light/musical headboard was awesome.  The service was great and the room service food was awesome, highly recommended! The new pool was also great, the kids loved the new slides. We paid to have a special birthday surprise waiting in the room for our son. He loved it. It was a basket with some Disney stuff (Picture frame, Mickey stuffed animal, candy, Ears hat). Had a great time.

Summary Heading: Great place for families but EXPENSIVE!!!
Summary: I stayed here one night in October.  We had the premium room because that is all that was available.  I paid around $535 for that and no it didn't include tickets to Disney or a meal.  In fact, that price included a annual pass holder discount.  The price changes throughout the year and as you an imagine it doesn't get much higher than that.    Since we paid such a large amount I was happy that the service was amazing.  Everyone from the valet, service desk, and bellman.  Just great top notch service.  The pools are wonderful- though we didn't get to swim.  We had a wonderful view of the pools though.  They are gorgeous as family friendly.  The rooms have Mickey and Disney details everywhere.  A delight for the kids and adults too!  Many places to eat on site - like Goofys

I stayed here when I was child and was happy to see when I came as an adult was still a great lace. I love the fact that they still have the character themed restaurants and the Customer service was still great. I stayed here for just one night but I will return I really enjoyed laying by the pool and getting into the jacuzzi.

To start with, everything was sparking clean, the room was spacious, & the bathroom lovely and perfect in every way. Then there was the Disney magic: the musical fire-works headboard, the hidden Mickeys everywhere, the great service at check-in, and last but not least the VIEW! I looked out over Downtown Disney, and was able to see Magic Kingdom fireworks at night. The hotel was beautifully landscaped, including the pool area. Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Expected more from the infamous disneyland hotel : (
Summary: The rooms were disney themed but were in desperate need of remodeling and for how much they charge they can afford it! The location was convienent but still a good walk! Forget eating by the pool or the restaurant its crazy expensive....

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel for location and ambiance
Summary: Choose this hotel over the Grand Californian because I had heard that the renovations were really great and they were!  Of course this iconic hotel is a big draw but loved the reno's especially nice rooms and bathrooms.  Location is great and only a few minutes from the monorail which is a big deal at the end of the day when your feet are sore.

It was two of us with no kids except our own inner children.  Who immediately cheered when we entered the Disneyland Hotel lobby to the sight of characters signing autographs with kids.  We had never stayed at the Disneyland Hotel (or any of the Disneyland properties) before, so we didn't have a basis of comparison.  But we had a blast, and were sorry we couldn't stay longer than a weekend.  We knew ahead of time that Adventureland Tower was the tower to be in, so when we checked in early and they had a room ready in the Frontierland Tower, we opted to wait until any room in Adventureland Tower opened up.  This was so so wise at the end of a long day at the parks, you are trudging back through Downtown Disney (even if you're taking the monorail, which we did once, there's still

My husband and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in the Fairy Tale suite. It was amazing! We had a great room with a great view of Disneyland, Downtown Disney, and CA Adventure. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful it made our stay quite amazing. The concierge services were great with food throughout the day. We had an excellent vacation.

My husband attended a conference here last month. It happened to be our 15th anniversary so I tagged along with 2 of our children ages 4 and 17 months. The hotel lacked the wow factor you get in WDW. However the rooms were nice and the view was spectacular. The quick service restaurant was okay. It was very small compared again to WDW. The pool was very cold, which was not all bad since it was over 100 degrees when we went. We stayed here 3 nights and then changed to the Grand Californian due to availability. When compared side by side, LOVED the Grand Californian! I will post a review on that as well. We did go to Goofy's Kitchen and it was very similar to Chef Mickey but.......you get to take your time and you see a lot more characters.

I stayed at the Disneyland hotel for thre night while attending a convention. The Hotel was very accomodating from eberything to Taxi's and shttle busses. The room I had was clean and had a great view. the room service was terrific and the beds were confortable and had plenty of room, they were also quiet. I would stay here again rather vacation or business purposes.

We go to Disneyland a couple of times a year and have generally stayed at the Paradise Pier or the Grand Californian.  This was my first time at the Disneyland Hotel in 30+ years and I wasn't particularly impressed.    Good:  We were just going to leave a bag at the hotel and go to the park around 11am when we arrived, but they encouraged us to check in early and they had a room available.  The room had a great view of the fireworks, and like everything else at Disney was perfectly clean.  No complaints about room condition.  The free internet was great.  The pool was good.    Bad:  The desk has a glass top, so computer mice don't work without a mousepad or magazine.  Why do hotels keep using glass tops for desks given this limitation?  Also, the shower was terrible - barely any

We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel several times over the past 20 years, but more recently we've chosen the Paradise Pier or Grand Californian for a more updated hotel experience.  The Disneyland Hotel was tired, dingy, and no longer worth the price.  However, after reading about all of the recent upgrades to the Disneyland Hotel, I booked my family of three there for four nights.  "Remodels" are often overhyped and simply boil down to new bed coverings and shower curtains.  This truly is not the case at the Disneyland Hotel.  To begin, each tower is now themed to coordinate with Disneyland's three main areas- Fantasy, Frontier, and Adventure.  Upon entering your room, you will be dazzled with new Disney touches, both subtle and over-the-top.  Every surface and furnishing has

Please remember Disneyland is not for everyone (including this world-traveling grandmother).  The Disneyland hotel was nice great pool for a 5 year old.  We planned the trip so as to not have "hot" weather nor children out of school.  October 1st and 2nd - 104 and 102.  The weather was very hot and the park VERY crowded what helped is staying at the Disneyland hotel, a must with young children.  The monorail is a easy walk back to the hotel.  We had a very nice room on the 10th floor (Frontier Land) facing the pool and the Matterhorn.   The pool setup is great for familes and adults.  Remember all of the restaurants in the area server very mediocre food with lots of caleries!  We are very glad to have given our 5 year old granddaughter the Disney experience once.

Summary Heading: Treat Yourself to this Gorgeous Hotel, Excellent Staff, Fabulous Location, and Total Disney Magic!
Summary: This trip consisted of my husband, 3 kids, and myself.  We flew into John Wayne (HIGHLY recommended) and took the Disney Express to the hotel.  If you go this route, the Disneyland Hotel is the second stop, the first being the Grand Californian.  Our bus was late by about 20 minutes, but traffic is traffic, so just be aware that it might happen.  It's still less than 20 minutes to the hotel.  Upon arrival, we were checked right in, by a friendly man named Garret.  They knew that we were celebrating our daughters' 10th and 14th birthdays, and believe me, they CARE about their guests.  Our daughters were given autogrpahed 8X10 glossy photos of their favorite Disney characters (they don't have photos of ALL characters), they were also given personalized "Happy Birthday" buttons to

Summary Heading: Very nice, but not as magical as I thought it would be
Summary: I booked the Disneyland Hotel with the hopes of "staying in the moment" for every second that my family and I were at Disneyland.  We took the Supershuttle from SNA (Orange County airport) wish I would NOT recommend.  They were unorganized and a couple of their drivers got into an argument right before we boarded the shuttle.  They were also late picking us up for the airport, which added unnecessary stress to trip.  Disneyland has a bus transport that looked nice and seemed much more efficient.  The hotel lacks that WOW factor when you pull up.  It looked like any other hotel and I couldn't see anywhere the name of the hotel from the outside.  There are 3 towers, Frontier (more for the convention crowd), Fantasy and Adventure.  If you want to see Disneyland park and/or the

this property is old although renovated. the queen rooms were lovely and the highlight, literally. is the headboard with led fireworks! great pillows. all the amenities (robe, frig, flat screen tv, duvet, etc) little disney touches without being cartoonish. best feature is extra magic hours, saw more in one hour then i did the rest of the day at the park! if you fly in. try to avoid long beach, although close. taxi was pricey despite the alleged flat rate!

I was hesitant about staying here, because of some of the negative reviews I had read on other websites.  I really wanted the convenience of staying close by to downtown disney and the theme parks.  It was great! Especially being able to take the monorail into the park and avoiding the long walk thru downtown disney and then having to wait in line at the park entrance.    The check-in experience was excellent and the hotel was remarkable inside and out! Disney did a great job renovating this hotel.  I had booked a upper level resort view room located in the Frontier tower on the 11th floor.  I highly recommend this tower because you have a view of the pool and a partial view of downtown disney.  Also, you get a front row fireworks show from your room! What surprised me the most

It's location, location, location, Folks!   May be pricey, but worth it to us, we are seniors who have stayed here before, and are still able to walk up and down the whole Disneyland Hotel area, around the pools and to the Monorail, Downtown Disney.  Room was clean as a whistle, had a view of some of the fireworks, everything was in tip top shape in the room.   They came at night to turn down the covers and leave some chocolate on the bed, so when we returned at night, it was cozy and just comfortable.   We don't mind the walking, in fact, we look forward to and need to do the walking, at this stage of our lives.

We stayed here over fall break. The hotel was pricey since you are spending your time at the parks and not in the room. Room was clean and had a cool fireworks headboard and we did see fireworks from the park in the room. Lobby of our tower had nothing. No sundries shop in the tower. It was quite a distance walking to the park as the monorail no longer goes to the hotel. I actually ended up dropping my mom and kids off at the room and then driving all the way aroound to where you valet since it was a major trek. Not very convenient valet at all. There was handicap parking near our tower but that was it.

Just back from a one night stay at the Disneyland Hotel with my family.  We had an amazing time and would go back in a heartbeat if we ever visit the Magic Kingdom again.  The Good...  Disney does hospitality well.  From the very start, everything was easy...the staff member greeting us at the parking lot for check in was wonderful.  No hassle, no problem with parking.  Check in was a breeze...someone came up to the kids and had them write a letter to Goofy while I took care of the check in.  Everyone got personalized card kesy to the room.  This was a great touch.  The man at the desk wouldn't let me leave when my wife's name was not spelled correctly.  He immediately fixed it.  Not only that but he gave my wife a speacial button that identified her as someone who had come to

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for 2 nights and had a wonderful experience with our two young daughters. The rooms are beautiful and are top notch in terms of design and detailing. I expected some Disney cheesiness but is was so beautifully and magically decorated.  We were amazed at how solid the hotel is. We expected lots of noise from the excited kids and families heading to and from Disney at early and late hours (like the off-site hotel we stayed at previously), but it was SUPER quiet. The pools were  fun for our 6-year old (loved the water slides) and we really enjoyed the restaurant right by the pool (especially the take-out). Very high quality food compared to the junk we ate at the parks. Dinner with Goofy was decent, with the best part being the characters. I had

Summary Heading: Unique experience but is it worth the price
Summary: We are locals and stayed here to check it out.  The weekend we came the hotel was overbooked due to the Utah teacher's association having their annual 4 day conference (So Cal is flooded by folks from Utah that weekend looking to do a quick Disneyland visit).  The staff was a bit flustered and everything from the bell service to the restaurant staff seemed strained.  Yes, the hotel is very close to the parks.  The little extras, such as the extra magic morning hours are nice, particularly if you are looking to ride Radiator Springs Racers first thing.  The rooms were clean, nicely decorated (loved the fireworks nightlight backboard they have for the little ones), and have those great disney/mickey mouse extra touches.  The pool is interesting, has a fun water slide though was

The D-Land hotel is remodeled and greatly improved. The rooms/buildings/grounds greatly needed TLC, and they seem to have received it.   Now it's worth the $$, and a much better value than the Grand Californian.   The rooms have new furniture, wall decor (nice: think twinkling lights). Central pool area is redone also.   We paid additional $$ for a higher, view room facing the parks. It's worth it,while others may be satisfied with a "resort" (internal pool) view. We did not pay for the concierge level, but may try it in the future.

Summary Heading: Great overall experience however not as close to the parks as you think
Summary: Terrible review only because the family resort can be like a over aged CLUB MED with late nights, bands, alcohol and smokes.   Firstly, the $380 a night for a pool view room IS NOT the drama I have for the hotel. Loved the thought of staying there from the moment I knew they completed the remodeled. The thought that you are right on the park is completely untrue. Frankly, after the first night of 5 in Oct '12 I thought not another trek throught downtown disney (15 minutes to the park is about right). the deal is if you spend 12 hours at the parks why pay $380 a night for a resort you dont use. Your call but remember there are great hotels (I stayed also Mariott Suites Garden Grove for $88 a night in a 2 room suite) nearby. Believe me the time you walk to Disney you can bus in.

We stayed at the hotel for four days.  The location is perfect.  We didn't need to drive anywhere.  The staff was great and provided great service.  The grounds were immaculate.  We will stay there again next time we visit.

This is by far the best hotel experience we've ever had ... this place has it TOGETHER!  The rooms are large and clean and absolutely perfect in every way. The bathrooms are luxurious, the bathtubs are huge with big waterfall faucets. The showers are HOT with super water pressure. The amenities are everywhere in this room, from the grapefruit bergamot toiletries to the concierge/TV to the lighting. We all loved the light-up "twinkle" headboard and the lullabye. We paid for a Deluxe room with a Resort/Pool view, and were on the 4th floor with a perfect view of the pool, which is out-of-this-world beautiful for kids and adults. The lifeguards at the pool never take their eyes off the water and the kids, and the water slide is monitored every 20 steps by a lifeguard who makes sure

Came here for a business trip, conference was held at the DisneyLand Hotel Conference Center.  The hotel has recently been renovated.  Everything is modernized.  Rooms are spacious, clean.  Everything you expect from Disneyland.  The staff are friendly and polite.    If you have kids, this is the place to stay.  Costumed mascots come and visit the hotel quite a bit.  You have a very good chance to see quite a few from the Disney family.  I don't recommend eating at the hotel though, it will end up costing quite a bit, especially for a family.  Goofy's buffet is alright, not quite worth the $45 for peanut butter and jelly pizza and maconni and cheese pizza BUT that being said, you aren't going to this restaurant for the food.  You are going for the atmosphere, your kids will be

We stayed 3 nights at another hotel, and moved for our final night to the Disneyland Hotel for the "experience".  Got into our room around 9:00 pm after the park closed, and the room was very nice, what is expected from a major hotel.   Tried to order room service, and the phone rang for approximately 5 minutes without being picked up.  Ended up going through the front desk to get connected to the room service desk.  They said the order would be there in 35-40 minutes, took over an hour.....food was fine.  Just know that if you get in that late, and all the restaurants in Downtown Disney have an hour wait.....it won't be any faster at the hotel.  We also used a couple of restrooms at the actual hotel, have to say they were the dirtiest we went in.  Amazing that they can keep the

Summary Heading: We will stay at The California Grand next time.
Summary: Honestly I wasn't impressed with this hotel. Yes the rooms were nice enough and clean but I expected more as far as service goes for a hotel in this price range. We took the kids on a holiday to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary and we stayed in the Fantasy Tower for 8 nights from Sept 29-Oct 7th of this year (2012). In February of 2011 we spent 11 nights at The Disneyland Grand California and were so impressed. It was amazing all around. We would have stayed there again this trip but I had heard The Disneyland Hotel was renovated and had new pools and thought it would be fun to give it a try. If I could relive this experience I would have stayed at The Disneyland Grand California again. Disneyland Hotel doesn't compare. We arranged transportation from the airport and when

We recently spent 5 nights on the 9th floor of the Fantasy Tower and could see a fantastic fireworks display each night without leaving our room: perfect for small children already in their pj's. Not all rooms have this view so you should mention this if it's something you'd like. As you'd expect with Disney, the housekeeping was impeccable and the room decor was very Disney, with a full wall mural that lights up above the beds. Just a 7-minute walk to the parks through Downtown Disney, it's quite conveniently located. Surprisingly, though, you won't find a microwave in your room, although there is a small refrigerator and coffee maker. And don't forget the added perk of Early Entry to the parks on selected days for resort guests. This will save you hours of waiting in lines at

Summary Heading: Good size room for family of 4 and great service
Summary: Good size room for family of 4 and great service. We loved it here. Pool is a very large area with water slides that our daughters loved. It is a bit of a walk to Disneyland from this hotel and the Montreal was not working the days we stayed here. If that was working it would have been nice.

Visited Disney over the July 4th holiday.This was the best hotel we have ever stayed in.The room was clean with a view overlooking the park.Easy access to the park and early admission.We had a wonderful time at this beautiful hotel.The beds were great.The staff was wonderful!

Summary Heading: Beautiful location to share family time
Summary: This hotel was a very special place to share time with family. The pools were great for all ages in our group. The ease of walking directly on to Disney Main Street or hopping on the Mono Rail into Tomorrow land suited us to T. Staff were very accessible through out our stay to assist us in any way they could. We appreciated that they recognized my husband's veteran status even as Canadians.
