We would not consider staying anywhere else should we return.

Disney does everything right it seems.  We had a very nice stay for six days.  There were eight of us (4 adults 4 kids) and we had two rooms that were connecting.  Second floor in the Frontier Tower.  Our rooms were very small for four people and the connection between then was through the bathroom which made it difficult to keep those doors open.  If the connecting door was open there was no room to stand near the sink.  Besides being smaller than we liked, the rooms was clean and well maintained and the mousekeeping was exceptional.  Staying that close to the parks and never having to leave the magic is worth every penny, which is why we always stay on site.  :)  The beds and linens were clean and comfortable.  We rarely heard anything from other rooms or the hallway.  The

Summary Heading: We have never been treated better
Summary: From the moment we arrived until we left with a late checkout we were treated like royalty.  We had stayed before and had some issues.  They treated us to this stay for our inconvenience. It was really incredible.  From the hotel to the parks it truly is all about making you happy. It is nice to go to a place where customer service really is the most important thing.

There's nothing like staying at a Disney property. Although they are considerably more expensive, it really is worth it (if you can swing it!) The Disneyland Hotel has recently been updated and is now even more beautiful. The pool area is awesome - lots of water slides and different pools. My 2 year old had a blast. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We were even upgraded to a Premium View room upon arrival, which had an amazing view of the fireworks. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, with floor to ceiling windows. My daughter loved the headboards, which lit up with fireworks. There were always characters walking around the lobby, so we were able to get some great pictures with them - beats standing in line in the park to get those pics! Chip even played with my

Summary Heading: GREAT PLACE TO STAY--even for the extravagant price!
Summary: Yes, yes & yes...this place is expensive.  But, I figured we will only be going to Disneyland while the kids are young a couple of times, so why not splurge!  And this is a splurge, but worth it! Rooms were nicely decorated and we were on the 11th (Adventure Tower) floor facing the pool area, so we could look down on our 11/12 year olds from our room (if they went down early).  Lifeguards are everywhere and they know how to swim, so that was REALLY nice!  We got a lot of use out of the awesome pool area, because the park closed early a couple of evenings.   The other thing that I liked is that you just walk around the corner and you are in Downtown Disney.  You do SO much walking in the park, that that extra closeness to dinner, etc. is great!  ALSO, loved the large Disney Store

I had to stay at this hotel for a conference and was terribly disappointed from the moment I arrived. First I spent 20 minutes waiting to even get to valet to unload my boxes because a tour bus was blocking the entrance. This was extremely frustrating because I was late setting up. The rooms were OK minus the screaming child in the next room. The worst was when I woke up the next morning and needed my car pulled up and to pick up something from the Bell desk. I tried to call down from room to every extension, but all I got was automated machines. Then when I finally got to the bell desk it took them 20 minutes to get me my package. I was very disappointed with this hotel and would not recommend it.

Loved Our recent stay at the hotel! We specifically requested a room that had a view of the fireworks at night for our 3 yr old twin boys...knowing after a big day at the parks they probably would be too tired to watch at the park. The staff member at check in accommodated our request without a problem.   The Disney room key's given to each family member at check in is a nice touch.. The boys thought they were very important with their own key ( unbeknown to them,their keys are pretend and don't actually do anything). Our room was spacious, clean and my husband and I both thought the beds were soooo comfortable! I loved the detail in the rooms.. Wooden headboard with firework mural and the music it played.. Nice touch!   Pool area great, didn't have trouble getting a lounge..

Very nice hotel that Disney does a great job maintaining and cleaning.  The rooms are very nice, and the grounds are perfect.  I stayed at the hotel for a conference, and the food Disney provided for breakfast and lunch was very, very good.  They do a great job all around!

It was my husband and our 6 year old's 1st time to Disneyland and I wanted it to be the wonderful magical experience I have had. Our room had a view of Downtown Disney on the 8th floor. We had an excellent view of the fireworks on Friday Oct 5th. You could kind of see the World of Color show but obviously not the same as being there. The Disney touches were much appreciated (fireworks on headboard, Mickey hands on bath fixtures, tile in shower, light shades, etc..). My only complaints were very minor, no light in closet to see safe and low water pressure. At first we thought the noise from Downtown Disney would be too loud but after spending many hours at the parks during the day, none of us had any problems falling asleep despite the noise. Staff was awesome and very friendly.

We flew from Australia to LAX and went straight to Disneyland Resort for two nights. I would strongly urge if you are going to Disneyland and its a one off event STAY IN THE RESORT!! it may cost a bit more but the early entry into the park makes it worthwhile on its own. We were at the gates for the 7am entry both mornings. What a pleasure not to queue for any rides. We did the "cars ride" first both mornings without the need for a fast pass or queue! The room was spacious and clean.  We burnt our fingers the first night because we did not book anywhere for dinner so we had to content with some very average fast food somewhere in Disneyland, the second night we booked ahead at the Steakhouse below the hotel, it was upmarket and delicious.  The staff were helpful and friendly,

Our DLH room was upgraded to a deluxe pool view in the frontier tower, fourth floor, great view ...kind of half of the fireworks ,then the water slide and the water Geyser. Really nice room , very spacious and very quiet. Loved the headboards. Fridge was a decent size but no freezer. Shower water pressure was the bomb, no water saver there, blissfull after a Long park day. Coffee maker did two cups or one at a time, no carafe just put the cups under and it dripped right in. Will say the wifi is super spotty and slow, dropped in and out all the time. We really enjoyed our stay and the rooms were super quiet without the noise from road traffic that is typical of many other hotels in the area.

Summary Heading: Make sure you know where your room is located!
Summary: We just returned from spending three nights at the Disneyland Resort Hotel.  The redecorated rooms are creatively done and esthetically pleasing; the pools and location are both fantastic. HOWEVER, check where your room is located. All rooms are the same price - over $400/nite (at least that is what we were told)) - no matter the size of the room or number of people staying. Our room was located next to the service elevator which ran from very early morning to very late at night; it also decreased the size of the room by 25%.  When we brought this to the attention of the manager, he very grudgingly gave us a $50 deduction on our bill of over $1500. NOT happy with the service!

We just spent three days with our 4 year old granddaughter and stayed on the 14th floor of the Frontier tower.  Good and bad about the stay.  Pros:  the headboard on the bed was very cool.  The room was comfortable.  The Mickey details on the light fixtures and faucets were cute.  The hotel personnel were very nice and helpful.  Cons:  The room was near the elevator backside which was noisy all night and day.  The view from the balcony was over the back parking lot...boring.  The shower water temperature ran hot and cold.  We came back to the room at 1pm to give the little one a nap and the room had not been cleaned yet.  Overall...I have spent less money for rooms just as nice in lower rated venues.  Expected a little better for the money we spent.  Save your money to spend in

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel just because: #1 It's rooms are recently restored, #2 Our daughter wants to stay at Disneyland #3 Refer to #2.  We are a well traveled family and have visited "Disneylands" all over the world.   The Disneyland Hotel Anahiem is not the best Disneyland hotel we have stayed nonetheless it has some saving grace as well as an equal amount of pitfall.  Good stuff: #1 It's near Disneyland and Downtown Disney and not too near like the Grand California Hotel where some rooms face the noisy streets of Downtown Disney.  #2 Their rooms are recently refurbished #3 There is a good pool area and slides and hardworking lifeguards.  Bad Stuff: #1 The lobby is boring and bare, reception looks overworked and tired, Rooms are not good value for money, the rooms are

Disneyland remains a mecca and this original theme park hotel hotel, newly renovated, is perfect for visiting all the attractions. We booked a standard room and unfortunately could not see the fireworks, but the incremental increase in price for a premium room really was not worth it. Lovely pool area, Goofy around several times a day, very helpful concierge staff. By no means a cheap hotel option but the early entry to the theme parks and easy access to the monorail are a big plus, especially when the weather is as hot as it was.

Summary Heading: It's all about the location and magic hour early park entry
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights in the adventure tower 8th floor overlooking downtown Disney with a view of the fireworks and a peek at the world of colour water show. Just Cant fault the location and view. We had booked a high floor with fireworks view but when we checked in they said only a pool view was available so we just said we'd go to the park and wait till one was available and luckily one was. It's not a flashy Vegas hotel, it's a little 80's but you aren't in the hotel to worry too much about it. Would stay here again as it is good value for money and downtown Disney is fantastic and it's right at your doorstep!

We just spent the night at Disneyland Hotel after Mickey's Halloween Treat. If you haven't heard, they just completed a major renovation at the hotel, and it is like a new place. There are beautiful firework light murals behind the bed headboards, and our view of the pool from our room was amazing. We rented a cabana, and spent the next day at the pool with the new Monorail style waterslides. The kids had a blast all day. What a great way to star Columbus Day holiday weekend. We had room service with Turkey burgers, and club sandwiches in the evening, and breakfast with pancakes, and omelettes, and their food was delicious all around. :)

Book a premium room to get the great Downtown Disney view of fireworks.  I booked a deluxe room with the understanding we could get a view of Downtown Disney (6th floor or above). I booked six months in advance and thought we were covered. It turns out the only way you are guaranteed that view is when you book a premium room. That was not explained to me up front. It can be a disappointment if you are not aware.

I recently stayed at the Disneland Hotel for 3 nights in a standard, 2 queen bed room. I booked a standard room.   We were given a room in the main tower, Fantasy, that looked out toward the parking structure, but had a great view of the fireworks. We were on the 8th floor, but I think that if you had a room on the 5th floor or higher, you could view the fireworks from your room. Great when you have a little person who wants to see the fireworks, but is tired from a day in the park.   I had stayed at the hotel 4 years ago and the renovation did upgrade the rooms, lobby and pool area. The new headboards are great for kids and play a little song when turned on. The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is nice, with a tub/shower combo, sink and seperate toilet.   The re-done pool

Summary Heading: No park, we came for the pool!
Summary: We came to enjoy the new pool area, our five year old loved the matterhorn slides and we could relax and watch him from poolside easily. The rooms are rennovated and very clean, our son liked the light up feature on the bed, low tech but magical. On the expensive side but we all enjoyed the poll, slides and a magical experience at the hotel. We had access to the park but chose to enjoy the pool instead.....

Yes this is not a cheap place to stay but you really cant put a price on the moment your 3 year old walks into a room that plays 'when you wish upon a star' and has the whole back wall displayed as stars and fireworks.  His smile and his happiness were priceless.  This place I found was fantastic for us with a small child. We were footsteps away from Downtown Disney which catered for restaurants, shopping and no taxi's or travel. You are basically in the park so everything is so close. If you have never been to Disneyland and you want to have the full experience with the Mickey Mouse toiletries and themed room then I highly recommend splashing out and staying here.

Summary Heading: The Good, The Bad, & The Ugly
Summary: We haven't stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in awhile, but have stayed at the Grand Californian several times instead in previous year's.  We thought we would try the newly decorated rooms and see what the improvements were like.  Beginning with our check-in we were told that we would have a "pool view".  This immediately was in conflict with the reservation I made for a Downtown Disney view.  The reservation was made 6 weeks in advance.  The phone reservation agent assured me that we could get 2 adjoining rooms with that view.  At check-in we were advised that all those rooms were assigned and there were no vacancies.  Unfortunately, this wasn't the first time the Disney properties have done this to us.  There was a time in the Grand Californian where I reserved a room several

A friend and I decided to take a girl's trip to Disneyland and stay at the hotel. We were on the 14th floor in the Frontierland Building. Check in was quick and Gene was friendly and helpful. Our room was great! The atmosphere of this hotel is what you would expect from Disney. There were only a few disappointments, mainly because of the price one is paying for the room. The towels are not what I would expect for Disney. This isn't a big deal to me, however, for Disney and for the price I would expect luxurious towels. Ours were not. The room service was great and reasonable, which allowed us to enjoy the room more as we sat out on our little balcony and ate as we enjoyed the view. The only problem was we did not have a menu in our binder in the room. We walked down to the front

Summary Heading: Right In The Middle Of The Magic
Summary: The location is fantastic being right next to Downtown Disney and about 15 or so minutes walk to Disneyland and the California adventure. The pool area is nice with loads of room when we stayed. Never had any trouble getting sunbeds with shades. Pool service quite good. Lots of lifeguards on duty. The hotel itself is good but dont expect it to be like a 5 star. Although its very expensive your paying for the location and the Disney experience/ambiance. The room was very good with the themed headboard being the main feature. We stayed in the Adventure Tower with a view over the pool and the pleasant gardens. Have lost count of how many times we have been to Disneyland but this was our first stay in a Disney Hotel. Overall we enjoyed the stay and would go back again without

We enjoyed five memorable nights at the Disneyland Hotel. Our apartment on the 12th floor was amazing. We had wonderful views over Disneyland and could see the nightly fireworks from our picture windows or large balconies. We had  two rooms and were able to leave our doors open and close the double doors at the end of the passage making one large extremely spacious apartment. Decor was lovely and everything spotless. There were coffee dripolator machines in the rooms, though they only supplied sachets for one cup each adult per day, and that was forgotten a couple of times. Room service meals were well presented and delicious. The swimming pools were fun with water slides, fountains and climbing things. We had breakfast in Goofy's kitchen one day where the blurb said we would

We stayed on the Top floor of the Adventure tower, the resort view is amazing! Can't beat it! You never feel like you are leaving the parks! The location is great, it takes like a minute to walk to the monorail station that takes you right into Disneyland. We went through the gate at the grand Californian to get the the California Adventure Park. The new pool is very nice and relaxing. Best place to watch the fireworks out of the park is in the concierge lounge here.

We stayed during the first week of July and were surprised (and relieved) that it was not as crowded as expected, minus 4th of July of course.  Downtown Disney was shoulder to shoulder but that did not matter.  We lounged at Trader Sam's enjoying the Hawaiian guitar music while my kids made friends with other kids on the patio.  In the evening, shared a priceless moment watching the fireworks from our hotel room with the music piped in from the t.v. not worrying about sitting for hours for a prime seat and dealing with crowds.  The rooms were clean, comfortable, well insulated, spacious...up to Disneyland standards.  Convenience of vicinity is well worth it especially having small children we went back to the room frequently and the resort itself provided plenty of entertainment

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Customer Service Need Improvement
Summary: It was expensive but worth the price to be near the parks and get enjoy the park one hour before the general public. However, the customer service was a complete disappointment. After traveling all day, we were ready to settle into our room, only to discover that we were given the wrong room keys to another room with someone already in it at the Frontier tower. Once we got the correct keys, we had asked for a king bed with a view, but instead got two standards with a view of a parking lot. Not happy. We called the manager and she made it right but it already left a sour taste in our mouth. We placed the express room service breakfast door hang outside our door and they never showed up to take it so we didn't have breakfast the second morning. Overall nice hotel, but staff and

Let me start out saying that I had wanted to stay at this hotel since I was a little girl.  That is the reason that I picked it.  The check in was good but after that it was just another hotel.  I wish that they would have told us that the gym was being remodeled as one person in the party wanted to use it and when he went there, no work out equipment was there.  Plus they also advertise about the characters being in the lobby and I didn't see one there ever.  The air in the room was working properly and I stopped someone in housekeeping and asked about it and she told me to call housekeeping. Hmmm I thought I was talking to someone in housekeeping. I have been waiting for a survey from them but no survey.  The only good thing about staying here is getting into the parks early.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and it was magical. A childhood dream coming true. Service, staff, hotel, everything was just like I had imagined it would be. We loved it so much we are going back in December to stay from Christmas Eve to New Years Eve. Excited so much. Beds in the rooms are so comfy and there was coffee making facilites in the room. We could see the Disneyland Park from our room and on the nights we were not in the park could still see the fireworks display. Bathroom was clean and good size. Housekeeping staff were very good and room was always ready when we returned from our days out. Lots of things to do and see just at the hotel but with downtown disney right at your door step so many things to do.

Great customer service upon check-in. Quick, friendly. Room was on the four floor right next to the elevator at the Adventure tower. Did not hear a sound from the hallway both nights. Had a great view of the pool. The room is fairly small but had a lot of nice touches. The Hotel is located right next to Disney downtown and the monorail to Disneyland is a five minute walk. The pool was crowded with unsupervised kids, but then again, it's Disney. Since it was just me and my wife, would probably stay at the California Spa next time.

We love the DLand Hotel and always enjoy our stay. Super Pricey? Yes. We justify it because 1. It's relaxing for us to stay on property and not have to deal with carseats and driving back and forth.  2. Best Pool in Anaheim. Our family likes to go to the parks for a few hours in the morning, swim and eat by the pool and return to parks for another few hours in evening.   The only silly bummer: they no longer provide the cute mouse ear toiletries. They are standard hotel ones now.

Summary Heading: First time there, and WILL return...
Summary: My husband and I, with 3 children decided to do a vacation package with hotel and park hopper passes to Disneyland this year. We stayed in the Frontier wing at the Disneyland Hotel, it was the first time staying there for either of us. The experience was wonderful! Good choices for food, and beautiful, convient pool, and easy access to the Monorail for the park. The hotel was clean, the staff was happy and helpful and this place gave the kids just as much to discover as the park did. The nightlight and song were surprising and delightful!

Although this hotel is pricey, we had a great stay. Prior to arriving, we requested a high floor, and they did fulfill our request. The hotel has 3 (or 4) different buildings, and in the middle is the pool. The pool was cute and fun, and has a few water slides for the kids. Heck, my husband went down them a few times, so they aren’t just for the kids! There is also a quick serve type restaurant by the pool, which has a bar that will bring you drinks. Our room was nice, and we didn’t have any problems or complaints. We did have a joint room to the room next door, and we could hear their baby crying in the middle of the night, but not much you can do about that. The view from our room was awesome, and we could see the other hotels, downtown Disney, part of the adventure park, and

The stay at this hotel was great!!  Our daughter, son-in-law and grandson were with us.  The hotel had nice pack and plays in both rooms which worked out well.  The convenience of staying right at the park is well worth the cost!  We parked our rental car when we got there and didn't need it until we checked out of the hotel.  We hadn't been to Downtown Disney or California Adventure before, and really enjoyed both.

We have to go to Anaheim every year for a conference. We always stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The first year was magical, and every year after that it has gotten worse and worse. I think they get so much business that customer service just isn't a "must".   We have a large family and need to book two rooms that connect to each other. When we called to book the room, we were promised a room with a view. This years view: trees and a parking lot. They were doing renovations on the parking lot (something they didn't share when I called). We had to park FAR away from the hotel and with a baby and many children this was a HUGE pain. The staff behind the desk were not very pleasant- wasn't this supposed to be a "magical" place for my children? The pool was luke warm and was only usable

Summary Heading: I get why they call it the "Happiest Palace on Earth"
Summary: I was a little concerned about paying so much for a room a the DLH. So I booked a cheaper hotel off site for our first night in town.  BIG MISTAKE.  However, once we got to the DL hotel it quickly erased any negative thoughts I had.  The check in process at the Disneyland hotel was simple and fast. They knew it was for my daughter's birthday and quickly gave her balloons and a birthday pin.  Our room us clean, beautifully decorated and quite.  We were at the very end of the building so we only had one neighbor.  We could here when our neighbor would turn on their water, but that was it.  We were at the park half of the day and spent the other half down by the pool.  Beautiful, relaxing and fun for all.  We had poolside service for lunch.  It was good. Dinner at the hotel, very

We booked a last minute family vacation and with 2 little ones (8 months and 3) we wanted something close so we didn't have to rent a car and we could walk to the parks and come back during the day if we needed to. The hotel was nice, but the only reason to stay here is the convenience.  Our first night was HORRIBLE! We were right next to the service elevator. There was constant noise all night long and around 5 or 6 am it sounded like we were staying below a weight gym. The noise kept the kids up all night (not even mickey could pull all of us out of our sleep deprived bad mood). The following morning I spoke with the manager and he apologized. He credited us for one night and offered us a different room when we came back that afternoon. We headed to the parks and came back for

We've always stayed at hotels that are nearby, but off property.  This time we wanted to try the Disneyland Hotel since it has recently been renovated.  We were not disappointed! What a treat to be immersed in the magic of Disney.  There are hotels that are as close or closer to walk to, but none help you continue in the feeling and service that Disney has to offer its guests.  Some would complain that all things Disney are pricey compared to other hotels and amusement parks, but I am here to tell you that you get what you pay for.  Nothing compares.... Our room was beautifully decorated and clean.  If you are one who appreciates details, then these rooms will delight! We will most certainly be back.

Just returned from staying at the Disneyland hotel w/ our 3 small boys (ages 9,7, & 2 1/2) from Wed. thru Friday. Had not been to Dland hotel since the early '90's. KEEP IN MIND: Disneyland is an experience, it is costly but WORTH it.  You get what you pay for there, and more!! LOVED their new renovations.  Having been in the hospitality business with a five star hotel chain, I was impressed w/ the attention to detail on all levels!  Check in, valet, bell service smooth, welcoming, friendly.  Room clean. Design clever.  Room-Service, prompt, good & reasonable, considering typical cost of room service at all hotels.  Pool view was worth the extra money as it was beautiful to peer down at during the night.  The employees were competent, friendly the property was abundantly

Summary Heading: Great hotel, not so good food
Summary: We just got back from visiting this hotel and let me tell you it was great!  From the time we entered the hotel to the time we left everyone was very nice and super friendly.  The staff is really great.  The rooms were good.  It was nice to have 2 sinks and the toilet in it's own closet so we could be in the bathroom getting ready if somone needed to visit the toilet.  We are a family of 5 and that definately helped out.  We had a pool view that was really fun.  The stay was great, but the food was terrible.  We ate most of our meals from the tangaroa terrace because that was quick and right by our room.  The food was really bad.  Very pricy and not much food for the little ones.  They are picky eaters and wasted a lot of food. We ate at Goofy's kitchen and did the character

I recently stayed here for a weekend trip to Disneyland.  The recent renovations to this hotel are stunning.  The rooms are immaculate and the beds are oh so comfortable.  The room is modern yet has very beautiful Disney touches.  From the fixtures to the bedding all the way to the magical headboard.  You are surrounded by Disney and it really gets you in the spirit for your trip.  We had to visit the hottest weekend of the year so the pools were a hot ticket item.  There are 3 water slides and 2 pools for everyone's enjoyment.  Even though it was crowded, we had plenty of space to lounge and swim.    We were placed in the Frontier tower which is the furthest tower but just as lovely.  We didn't mind the walk and it only added a total of maybe a minute or so to reach Downtown

This was our third visit to Disneyland in California. We have stayed off property the other two times, but this time we wanted to be close to where my husband would be starting and ending the Half Marathon.   We were given a room in the Frontier building, which was a longer walk than I was expecting. I would say if you are booking to be close the parks, then Grand Californian is much closer, although at a higher price tag. The Frontier building is actually further to walk to than Paradise Pier.  The room was really beautiful and my kids loved the fireworks and song on the headboard. The beds are incredibly comfortable and we all really slept well every night. Rooms were always cleaned really well, although late in the day. Often when I would bring my daughter back for her nap

I was very surprised and disappointed by our last experience with the Disneyland hotel, especially after staying there numerous times before.  We have taken a break from purchasing the Annual Passports for the last couple of years because they keep raising the prices and now they are insanely expensive. Our oldest child will be leaving for college next year so we decided to suck it up and buy them this year.    At check in we were told our room wasn't ready and were given the keys and pin number to call in and check on the room.  Check in is listed as 3:00 but our room wasn't available until 4:00,which is upsetting when you're staying only one night and can't get in the room at the promised time.    While waiting for the room I went to the Trader Sams bar to see the menu and

We just returned from a 2nd trip to Disney in the past 3 months. Both times we stayed at the Frontier Tower. Rooms were clean. We decided to bring our tea kettle with us for our coffee packets. (Big coffee drinkers here.) Room accommodated 2 adults, 17 and a little one. Only thing is the sofa bed we got was a bit small. The little one slept in bed w/me but the sofa bed was a bit small for my guys. The 17yr old is 6 foot 2 and was too big for it. We didn't request a room with view as we didn't plan on staying in the room much but were upgraded to a pool view. It was nice. We could hear the awesome singers at Trader Sam's in the evening. The light up head boards are magical. Love this place!

There are definitely less expensive places to stay while visiting the Disneyland Resort, but then again there are more expensive places to stay as well. The reason to stay at the Disneyland Hotel is to get the complete Disney experience. It may cost more, but it is proof of the old saying “You get what you pay for”.  Days before you arrive at the hotel the Disney treatment starts. You get reservation confirmations, planning tips and guides, helpful recommendations, park schedules and even packing check lists. There is so much helpful information provided to help make your stay enjoyable.  The attention and the service you receive from the staff from the time you pull up to the reception area until you leave is pure Disney. Plus the attention to detail is exceptional. There has

I read and re-read reviews to pick the right hotel for our family trip to Disneyland. We were traveling with mother-in-law and our five kids in September 2012. We decided to try out the remodeled Disneyland hotel.   We loved the hotel! We had two connecting rooms in the Frontier tower. The rooms were lovely (kids loved the character wake up call and the fun headboards). They fit our large group just fine, but they are not overly large rooms. Our rooms were very clean. We had a great view of the pool. The beds were very comfortable.  All the cast members were very gracious. They checked us in four hours early, which we didn't expect, and our check-in experience was very quick and convenient. When my 12 year old realized he forgot underwear--don't you love kids--we went to the

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel on our most recent Family Reunion...we loved it...we arrived early and our room was not ready ...this is always a bit annoying but I guess it is a risk one takes when attempting to check in earlier than 3pm ...but we were driving and we could not wait to get into our rooms...we loved the newly renovated pool with the monorail slide...the rooms are awesome with the twinkling head words that lullaby you to sleep...we could walk thru downtown disney on our way to the parks or we could hop on the monorail which made our arrival to the magic that much quicker...I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Disneyland only gets more magical here!
Summary: I am a huge Disney freak so I'll admit, I am a little biased here. Anywho, I absolutely loved this property and can't wait to go back. I took a trip several months back and had a room overlooking the pool. Unfortunately for us, the hotel was still under renovation and half of the pool was closed off (I have since been back and the finished product is awesome). The slides were still open and were surprisingly really fun to ride.   The grounds were impeccable, as was the service. Our room was also kept spotless and I loved the light-up headboard in our room. The bed and pillows were super comfy and were a joy to return to at the end of a long day or walking/standing.   I will definitely return here in the future.

Summary Heading: A beautiful hotel, but lacking some Disney magic in areas.
Summary: We spent three days at this hotel and LOVED the room. They are super clean, very pretty with good amenities, comfy  beds, and nice bed linens and pillows. The bath towels are not good quality and are scratchy and seem a little old in my opinion though. The housekeeping staff were very nice and brought us extra towels and shampoo immediately when we asked for it and did a great job cleaning our room everyday. We were very impressed with their level of professionalism. The front desk cast member that checked us in was NOT friendly at all and didn't smile the entire time he spoke to us, so this was disappointing and didn't start off our mini vacation very well. The food at the Terrogora Terrace was delicious, served hot and was a great deal for the price. This hotel is in a great

This was our last stop on our early family summer vacation and our third visit to Disneyland.  Our family (2 adults, 12 year-old, 6 year-old) stayed for four nights in the Fantasy Tower which is where the main lobby is located.  Upon initial check-in, they had us booked in the Frontier Tower but I asked for a change and they were able to accommodate us in the Fantasy Tower with a pool view.  (I learned to always kindly request for a change if I am not satisfied with what is initially presented if the prices I pay are premium.)  It was our first stay at the DL Hotel and we've previously stayed at the Grand Californian, off-site, and the Wilderness Lodge at WDW.  The two queen beds were comfortable, the bathroom was small but beautiful, the view of the pool area was good, and the

We chose to stay here on the night of our engagement (surprise!). The hotel was under construction at the time, but we were fortunate to be upgraded to one of their newly redone suites. Very large and well appointed and my favorite thing of all, a headboard with fiber optic fireworks that plays music. Really, it may sound cheesy, but was precious. Disney magic at its finest. My boyfriend requested to have strawberries and champagne waiting in the room when we returned from the proposal at Disneyland but the hotel had sparkling cider waiting instead. He was really upset, given how much he paid and the fact that it was a huge celebration for us. The next day they removed the charges and were very apologetic, but still a bit of a disappointment. They gave us "just engaged" buttons

Summary Heading: Lacking the standard of Disney service I expected
Summary: We ended our West Coast trip here, staying here for four nights (2 Adults, 2 kids, 9, 11), booking a pool/resort view room  Having stayed at the Beach Club at WDW a couple of times as well as several Disney hotels at Disneyland Paris, I have a fair idea of the high standard of service one should expect from a Disney-run hotel.  Whilst the service at the Disneyland Hotel was generally acceptable, there were enough instances of poor service to leave me feeling disappointed with the experience.  Our arrival at the hotel was somewhat chaotic.  The valet area is extremely large (six long lanes almost like a car-hire return lot).  There was absolutely nobody there directing traffic or helping guests to figure out what they should do.  I stood around for 10 minutes until finally a lone

Summary Heading: Spacious rooms, convenient location, great pool facility
Summary: This was my first trip to DL and I travelled with two young children (3 & 5) and they loved the hotel and I loved the conveniences it provided. The hotel is a 20 mins walk from the entrances of the two parks. The hotel rooms are spacious and linens are nice quality. There was a small fridge which was great for keeping leftovers.  There updated pool area is great with a number of pools and water slides for both older kids and younger ones.  Life jackets and towels are conveniently provided. The hotel offers extras like a movie out on one of the lawns, and characters in the hotel lobby to greet the kids.  Goofy's Kitchen, one of the restaurants on site was a great way for the kids to interact with a number of characters, which spend a few minutes with each table.  Although the

Location, location.  It cannot be beat.  I have always enjoyed staying at the Disneyland Hotel.  Location is great, rooms are big and pool area is great.  I was a little disappointed at my recent stay.due to light fixtures not working and refrigerator not cool enough.  I immediately reported problem to guest services and refrigerator was replaced but light fixtures were not fixed during our stay.  On the day before we checked out housekeeping did not replace used hand towels.  We still enjoyed our stay but found that the hotel was slipping from great service we always expect from Disney.

Stayed here for a long weekend, and could have stayed longer. Preferred this hotel to the Grand Californian as it was very easy to get around compared to walking miles to/from your room. The more intimate size is nice and even though there are a lot of people staying there, we never felt the crowds.  We at lunch a couple of times at the cafe near the pools and also tried the coffee shop a couple of times. It is pricey......but equivalent to anything in the parks or Downtown Disney.  No need for a car while staying here as everything is very conveniently located.  Great stay!

Summary Heading: Refurbished rooms very nice, beware logistics of 1/2 Marathon weekend
Summary: First and on a positive note, they did a nice job updating the rooms.  We like the ambiance and decor better than the Grand Californian now.  My wife and I were given a king room near the elevators, and be warned that these rooms are very small compared to the standard rooms. We almost asked to be switched to a 2 queen room.  I participated in the September 1/2 marathon, and there was / is no easy way for spectators, or runners, to return to their room at this hotel from the finish, besides a roughly 1/2 mile walk.  OK, but unlike Disneyworld, no logistical information was provided to hotel guests, staff members simply stated "you have to go around." Not real intuitive to my wife.  Just some communication would help. But all in all a good value hotel (for Disney).

Summary Heading: Adds a little magic to your stay
Summary: From the very first person you encounter (typically the valet attendant) to the last face you meet when checking out, the entire staff is happy and friendly and helpful. Everything one would expect from a Disneyland property. It was my birthday, and when the front desk found out she immediately provided me with my free birthday button (the ONLY free thing you'll ever get out of this company) and disappeared for a minute to "get me some magic". She returned with an autographed black and white photo of Disney princesses. At 31 I'm obviously beyond their usual age for this sort of thing, but such is the timeless magic of Disney.  Room was clean and lovely. There are Mickey Mouse style accents everywhere, but not so much you get sick of him and want to punch him in the face. Their

Great hotel.  It is a bit expensive, but I guess that is to be expected for the Disneyland area.  Super easy access walking to Disneyland.  My kids loved the pool area and especially the monorail water slides.  The rooms and grounds were immaculate.

My husband and I spent part of our 20th wedding anniversary extravaganza at the Disneyland resort and hotel.  The hotel was wonderful!  It has been recently updated in a style that is both adult and kid friendly.  The room had a restrained decor in a mature palette, but the carved, lit headboard complete with fireworks and castle would delight any child.  We paid for a view of the fireworks, and each night we'd turn the in-room chair around and tune in the accompanying Disneyland firework music that appears on the tv channel line-up.  Our nightly in-room fireworks viewing is one of my favorite memories of our whole trip!  Pay for the view, and save yourself the hassle of leaving the park in the crowd at night.

We just stayed here last week and it was wonderful!  The staff was so nice!  The grounds are amazing from the landscaping to the pool area, etc.  The rooms are large and decorated so nicely.  Everything was clean.  This is a top of the line hotel and we will definitely stay here again next time we visit California!  We loved that we could walk to Downtown Disney and hang out there every night.

What a wonderful hotel! The room was a good size and absolutely spotless. The bath was actually gleaming.  Lovely comfortable beds. The headboard lights up with fireworks and Tinkerbell plays music. So sweet. The pool and slide are great fun. Loved the Tangoora Terrace. The giant tea cups in reception are fun too. Had an excellent breakfast in Goofy's kitchen.   Only negatives- very slow check in and we had a faulty hot water tap that was not mended through out our stay.

My husband and I decided to surprise our daughter's with an "End of Summer mini-vaca" before school starts and we chose the Disneyland Hotel since we live in SoCal and have DL season passes. From check in to check out we (as always) loved every second of our stay. The Standard room were huge, clean and accommodating.  The staff was wonderful, tons of things to do which included a huge water slide tower and several pools that allowed alot of people to be in at one time without feeling like you were at your neighborhood community pool on a hot Summer day. They had tons of ctivites to do which cost $$$ which we were unfortunately not able to do since we live on a tight budget. Amazinglky though the night we stayed they had a FREE Movie Night under the stars and we got to end the

Summary Heading: Great stay for a family of five
Summary: We debated between this hotel and the California Grand.  We chose this one because we wanted the "traditional" type of Disney experience versus the "lodge" resort.  Check-in was easy.  We got right into our room at 11AM.  Room was nice and fit our family of five (two adults, 6, 12, and 16 year old) just fine.  Bathroom was spacious.  We chose to add the concierge package to our stay which allowed us to go up to the 11th floor E-ticket area for breakfast/snacks/pop/wine/beer, etc....  Versus going out for breakfast and looking for a place to stop and get snacks and drinks for the kids along the way.  They also have piped in music during the fireworks so we could sit up there and watch the evening fireworks versus being "in" the park.  Pool was alot of fun for the kids.

Easy access to the parks, especially close to the monorail perfect for early morning entry. We had a great stay.  Coffee shop opens at 6 so you can get a bite to eat and go straight on to the parks. This hotel is expensive, but well worth it for the convenience. The pool is lots of fun.

This hotel is great in many ways! First, it has great pools, my favorite one containing slides shaped like monorails. I also liked the restaurants that are there, especially Goofy's Kitchen. The hotel rooms are pretty nice. Mickey Mouse's hands hold the lamps in the bathroom, the sink handles have Mickey heads, and the headboard lights up with firework lights while it plays "A Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes". There are also pillows with the first few lyrics to the song on them. The first pillow says "A dream is a wish your heart makes..." and the second pillow says "...When you're fast asleep." It is also a short walk to Downtown Disney, and about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland/California Adventure. I would stay here again if I would.

The hotel was great! We stayed on the 4th floor of the newly renovated Fantasy Tower with a complimentary upgrade to a room with a view of the pool, restaurants and other towers. The room was done in blue and gold. The head board lights up and plays music...very disney...mickey heads everywhere. Very clean. Would stay here again.

we stayed @ this hotel for our son's 8th birthday. It was a fabulous vacation. We loved everything about this hotel. we had a one-bedroom suite. It was awesome. The cleanliness (which I am very picky about and always concerned!) the decor, attention to details, you name it. Everything was perfect. We are so glad that we stayed there. So convenient as far as walking to both parks. The kids had a blast. Due to hot August weather, the kids loved and enjoyed the beautiful pools and had so much fun. Great hotel! Definitely , worth the money, if you want the comfort and convenience and service !

We are season pass holders and have always loved Disneyland. so when we got married (in our 50s) we decided that we should stay at a place where dreams do come true. From the moment we entered the hotel everyone was happy and smiling,and when checking in we were greeted with balloons and pins to celebrate our wedding day. Breakfast at Goofy's kitchen was a blast and Cinderella brought a tear to my new brides eye as she felt her childhood dreams coming true.  Thank you to all the Disney cast and crews!

Pros:  Rm has mini-frig, Pool with big & small slides, Extra Magic Hr (must for Cars Land), Short walk to Monorail, Free Wi-Fi in room, Free morning Power Walk (gives insider info), Free classes/movies, Meet characters in lobby Cons: Self Park is $15/nt, Low water pressure, Bathrm storage/racks

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel this past August. Even though they just finished doing extensive renovations, there's a few things they left out. Because the stairways on either end of the buildings are only for emergency use, guests on the lower floors who would ordinarily use the stairs are instead forced to wait for the elevators. This leads to crowded, slow elevators. Also, the self-service laundry is a disgrace. There are only six washers and dryers available for a hotel that has about 900 rooms. And it's in a tiny building where guests have to carry their clothes across the courtyard and then hope there is an available washer. Why aren't there state of the art washers in each individual tower? Many families prefer to wash their own clothes and don't want to use the hotel

We stayed at the Disneyland hotel for 8 nights. It provide to be a great base to visit the two parks. We even ducked back to the hotel a couple of days for a reast during the day due to the heat. The rooms were comfortable but basic as it is not what you go there to experience. Our 5 year old was enthralled by the musical headboard in the room. For five of us in the room it was a bit tight but ok. While the property had a laundry (which we used a lot) it did not have a mini market or independent convienence store which left us having to shop/eat at their stores. Goofy's kitchen was expensive as the only buffet at the hotel. The hotel and grounds were extremely well kept and clean. The stray cats did seem out of place but apparently keep vermon down. The pools were also very

We just returned from 3 days at Disneyland Hotel.  We had a wonderful time.  The resort was very clean and met all our needs.  It was in a perfect location.  It my opinion it was worth the extra expense.  I did a lot of research on other hotels and I'm glad we picked Disneyland Hotel.  My only complaints would be that the drinks and food was a little over priced and we all got stuffed up the first night from the air conditioning but other than that it was absolutely perfect.  I will definetely choose this hotel in the future.

We just returned from a five day stay. We had a suite that was clean and magical. Our grandchildren loved the lighted, musical headboards and the early admission to the parks. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We will return.

We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel several times with our girls, and will continue to stay there each time we go to the park. For the past three years, Disney has continued to offer huge military discounts for their hotels, and we take advantage of it as often as we can. We are die hard Disney fans and from the minute you enter the lobby you are immersed in total magic. The service, the rooms, the proximity, the comfort... it can't be beat. We typically choose the DLH for the fact that it's more Disney themed and only steps from the Monorail. We have yet to stay at the Grand Californian, but we have no desire to stay somewhere else.

We stayed here in June/July and absolutely loved it.  Magical to me.  Will stay here when we come back with grandchildren in a few years time.  Want a special princess room for them!! Love the fact that you can get early admissions to the parks every day.

Summary Heading: Nothing special - I had higher expectations
Summary: I stayed at DLH for three nights due to a conference at Disney resort. There was actually nothing wrong with the hotel, but I strongly feel that the hotel did not match the expectation of being "the place to stay" for a Disney visit.   Getting to DLH from LAX is quite expensive if you take a taxi (100 USD), so do take the shuttle service the hotel recommends in their confirmation email.   Check-in was uneventful and everything was as requested in the room and with the rates. Hotel staff was polite and helpful, my room was clean, wireless worked sufficiently and the beds were comfortable. Yet, nothing fancy. I might as well have stayed at any national hotel chain facilities that are spread around the Disney resort and saved a few bucks for the company.  Only one minor annoying

Stayed 2 nights 8-12 / 8-13 while in CA for a wedding in San Diego. Decided to make a 9 day vacation out of this trip and had promised my granddaughter we would drive up to Disney for a couple of days after the wedding. The Disneyland Hotel was expensive but so worth the money.  I wished we had stayed and extra day.  Walking distance to parks and right outside of Down Town Disney which has great dinning and shopping.  The rooms were newly remodeled and in great condition.  My granddaughter loved the light up headboard and music. Staff was friendly and very helpful.  Pool and waterslides were awesome.

Summary Heading: Just ok.  Not worth the money
Summary: We go to Disneyland at least once year.  We have stayed at various hotels in the area.  This was our first stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  The room was small, but for the three of us, was fine for a few days.  The staff at the bell desk was extremely rude every time we had an interaction with them.  The housekeeping and room service staff were extremely efficient and pleasant, however.  The rest of the staff was certainly not friendly, but they weren't rude.  My daughter (7 years old) LOVED the pool.  The proximity of the hotel to the front entrance gates is no closer than, and possibly further than, some of the off-resort hotels.  The hotel is not very "Disney", surprisingly enough.  It doesn't have the feel of the parks.  It is very clean, though.  All-in-all it was not a

We spent 5 nights in the Disneyland Hotel in early July, 2012.  While I do understand that the cost has more to do with the entire "Disney experience" than the hotel room itself, I do feel that costwise we definitely didn't get our money's worth.  We have gone to Disneyland five times in the last six years, and we have always stayed somewhere on property.  This is the third time we've stayed at the DLH and the last time we were there was prior to the renovations to the pool area.  Don't get me wrong, there were definite pluses.  The newly renovated pool area is great - my kids really enjoyed the new slides and the pool itself.  This was the first time we've ever really been lured into swimming while at a Disney resort hotel - after all, we're coming from Hawaii.  We can swim at

Summary Heading: Came for a conference and stayed!
Summary: My husband was attending a conference at the Disneyland Hotel so I joined him for a few days.  The rooms were spacious, the bathroom nice size and great in room amenities.  Considering the age of the hotel, it was nicely kept up and appeared to be recently renovated.  The only complaints we had were the extraordinary prices for food ( captive audience ) and the cement drilling that I listened to for a couple days.  It was so annoying that I couldn't be in the room during the day, nor ake a nap.  It was hot out so this was a big inconvienence.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The beds were very comfortable too, I usually miss my sleep number bed, but this was just as comfortable!!  We also had a great view of the fireworks every night out our window.

We spent 4 nights in Disneyland Hotel. It was amazing!!! We checked in 3 hours early and the room was prepared.  The hotel staff from the time we checked in was extremly friendly, helpful and fullfilled all of the request we had. (Stephaine)  The housekeeping did a great job in our rooms. The room are slightly larger than a normal size hotel room with beautiful headboards & plays a short tune. We had a view of downtown Disney and could see some of California adventure. Nice at night! The bathrooms are very good size. Toilet in seperate area. Water preasure in the shower was GREAT  :) We paid extra for the concerege / snack service on the 11th floor.   We had turn down service in the evening. You can borrow movies for the kids, games and the snacks in the room were extremly good.

We stayed at the DLH last month-We got the adventure tower (closest to dtd),  After staying 5 days at the park vue we spent our last two at the Disneyland hotel for the first time.  We checked in early, we got there about 3 hours early but no room was ready for us. They said they would call if it became avail before 3. We never got a call so went back at 3. They said their systems were down so they could not call.?. Hmm...  We drove around for a while then came back and walked around the grounds waiting. My husband did not feel comfortable leaving our luggage at the check in for 3 hours, we went back at 2 and checked it in then for an hour so we could go to dtd and walk around.   Coming from the PVI with a microwave and close parking it was quite a switch to the DLH. The

Summary Heading: Room Not Exactly What We Thought
Summary: Disneyland Hotel was in a great location though our room was not what we were expecting. We booked a 3 bedroom suite, which in Australia & most other places it is a lounge room in the middle with 3 rooms off it. We had 2 rooms off the main lounge & our 3rd room could access from the corridor to the lounge room area or enter via an external door & through one of the bedrooms to the lounge room. Service was poor & not very accommodating. The only great service we had was in Goofy's Kitchen for breakfast one morning. Would not recommend this hotel to friends. Kept on getting fobbed off & we'll get back you everytime. I need to speak with the supervisor out the back & would disappear for 20 minutes..

Summary Heading: Father and 9 year old Daughter trip
Summary: Our room over looked the pool from the 9th floor and was fanatastic, it had a really nice feel about it. Like a lot of other reviewers though, I thought this Hotel is very pricey but for our short three night visit it was a life long memory for my daughter. We walked to the parks which took 10 to 15 minutes so was an easy stroll through Dowtown Disney, the location couldn't be better. The pool area is very nice although busy! I would highly recomend this hotel if the budget allows.

First, the remodeled rooms are very nice. Ours was large and easily fit 5 of us because it had two queens and a couch that folded down to a twin, so everybody was comfortable.   The bathroom had two large sinks, and the toilet area had a door separating it from the sink/tub area, which made getting ready in the morning quite easy.  We loved staying on Disney property. The walk to the parks was not bad at all, and much better than driving. The "bubble" effect means you never leave the Disney feeling which is fun for us.   The price is a bit high for what you get, but we are used to visiting Disney World and therefore know the Disney drill, which is that you will pay extra for that Disney magic.   Also, this summer, staying on property was well worth the price. We used the early

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel worth the extra money
Summary: Having debated long and hard about whether to stay on site or off site and having booked and cancelled two other Hotels ( Park Vue inn and Residence inn ) we decided to have a break from driving and wanted more than a motel! We originally booked for 3 nights but ended up staying 5 as we liked it so much. The room we had (2365 in the adventure tower )was super comfy and the sofabed ( day bed )was very comfortable so was ideal for our family with a 19 yr old boy and 16 year old girl. Had a proper fridge in the room so could store breakfast stuff easily. We were concerned about being opposite the lift and next door but one to the ice machine and vending machine. However my concerns soon disappeared and found the room and our block to be extremely quiet and never heard anyone once

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel was a good choice
Summary: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  We didn’t have a good view at all but I also didn’t opt to pay for the better view. This hotel is a good choice but I wish I would have stayed at the Grand Californian.    The D land hotel is very convenient and my kids did like the pool better than the pool at the grand.  The monorail is close and even if you do walk it’s really not that far to the front of the park.  The new rooms were nice but I felt that they could have done more with them considering the amount of money Disney makes.  You pay the same price for these rooms that you would for a nice room in Hawaii.  I did like the light up head boards and the music that was played when you turned it on.  Very peaceful watching the kids sleep with the back ground

Summary Heading: Review of 3 bedroom/3 bathroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We decided to treat and take members of our family to stay at the Disneyland hotel, there were about 12 of us.  If you have a large group going, it's worth it to book the 3 bedroom suite at the Disneyland Hotel. The layout that we got was a 2 bedroom + living room, and then the 3rd bedroom is connected to the 2nd bedroom. There were 3 full bathrooms and one 1/2 bathroom by the living area. It's pricey but if you're going to book 3 separate rooms, this ends up to be cheaper and much more spacious. Plus you have a common area to socialize with the rest of the family, in the living area.  The 3 bedroom suite can accomodate up to 14 people, but our host mentioned it's spacious enough to fit 17 people. We also added the concierge level(or e-ticket club), which cost a little less if

This is a fine hotel, beds were fine.  Ask for room where you can see fireworks.  I do not think it is worth extra price unless you  have small kids.  Then the ease of returning in the day, and the extra hour you get for early entrance might be worth it.

Summary Heading: 5 Stars for Everything, EXCEPT for The Coffee House (2 Stars)
Summary: Truly a pleasure to lodge here, as I did for 4-days. Wonderful service, and the remodel of the resort is a lot more than just a face lift. But tell me Disneyland: Why do you serve such horrific coffee at the Coffee House? Most everyone I spoke with who purchased coffee straight up, found it to be . . . well, to be kind - not very good at all. OK, enough complaining  . . .   Everything else, was impressively conducive to a very happy experience. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

We had a park view room on the 7th floor of the Adventure Tower. Well worth the extra dollars because early entry into the parks allows you to get a jump on the most popular attractions. Also, it is really nice to be able to get back to the room in under 15 min. to shower and change for dinner or cool down in the pool. Park view room is great as we could head home and watch the fireworks while in bed and nibbling on cookies. Only 2 downsides: cast member who checked us in scrambled our ticket order and charged us too much. Disney finally corrected this when our planner went to bat for us and then sent us up plates of cookies and milk for our trouble.mOther downside was that service at the pool was very slow so that the chances of actually getting a poolside drink or snack was

Summary Heading: Our family has outgrown this overpriced hotel.
Summary: It's clean enough and the staff is pleasant but you pay 4 star prices for the privilege of staying in a room that offers minimal space and no special amenities at all. It's a hike to Disneyland or California Adventure, with the noisy crowds of Downtown Disney between you and your hotel -- a walk that loses its charm at the end of a long day. You get over the proximity of a few restaurants and the movie theater real fast. The improvements and remodeling from the last few years you're paying (more) for are Mickey inspired bathroom fixtures and a nice headboard. TV is still drab with the assumption being only children will be watching so don't expect to unwind there -- or in the hot tub which closes down (along with the pool) just when you need it after all that walking. Parking is

I visit Disneyland annually and have always stayed in Good Neighbor Hotels. I thought the Disneyland hotel wasn't worth the extra cost since it seemed just as far away as those across the street and didn't offer much more as far as amenities. I thought this, that is, until I decided to stay there on my last trip, and now I fear I may never be able to go back. The Disneyland Hotel is more definitely more convenient, and their little Disney touches make for a magical stay. The Monorail station at the end of downtown Disney is just a short block from the lobby. It comes every 5 minutes and it drops you off right inside Tomorrowland . Taking the monorail in and out of the park allows you to skip those long entrance lines at the front gate and the mass exodus through main street at

Pros: location, pool, room with a minifridge,Goofy's Kitchen, free parking for guest The location is at the end of Downtown Disney shopping center which is a 10min walk to get to the theme parks. 4ft multiple pools were enjoyable for the oldies and the young ones... yes it can get crowded but what do you expect... The room, just how you see it on the picture... a little outdated but clean and stylish. Now for Goofy's kitchen: make sure you get to seat 4 hours before they close. My family has been there twice and both times we have seen no more than 5-6 characters... I am assuming because we got there 3 hours from closing time... who knows.

We stayed at the DL Hotel in October of 2011. It was during the construction phase so I was really worried that it would affect our experience.   When we checked in we were upgraded to a room that overlooked the pool. We were moved away from the construction and our stay was quite lovely. The rooms were really nice. The beds were extremely comfortable. I don't think I've slept on a more comfortable mattress in my life.   The decor was subtle but very pretty. There are little touches of Mickey but nothing extreme. The view from our room was gorgeous. It overlooked the pool and the new restaurant. it was nice to walk back each night listening to the music from the restaurant.   The staff was very friendly and very helpful. Every day when we came back from the park the maid service

We are here every year and love this hotel. Spend the extra money and stay there. It's well worth it. The restaurants the staff we can't say enough about it. We are now blessed to be able to experience it with our grand kids now and it just keeps getting better and better.

thanks e stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in July and loved it. The room was a nice size and plenty large for our family of four. We loved the headboard on the bed with the fireworks and music. Having stayed in MANY Disney resorts, this one is equally comparable with deluxe resorts at Disney World. The pool is nice and the...

We were a little worried about the hotel having read various reviews on it. I can't understand some of the bad reviews, couldn't be further from our experience. We arrived in the morning and our bags were whisked away. The check-in does take a little while but then it's not your normal check-in, there is a lot of information to impart. We thought it was great how they offered to text us when our room was ready. We have stayed in the Californian before and the woman behind the desk came across as a bit looney to be honest.  Perhaps some Disney afficionados like that kind of behaviour and although we didn't mind it and it gave us something to talk about, we didn't mind not having it.  The woman was efficient and not at all miserable.  We did not take her up on the VIP lounge thing

Summary Heading: Loved being in the middle of the magic!
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in July and loved it.  The room was a nice size and plenty large for our family of four. We loved the headboard on the bed with the fireworks and music.  Having stayed in MANY Disney resorts, this one is equally comparable with deluxe resorts at Disney World.  The pool is nice and the location can't be beat!!  We loved hopping on the monorail and ending up in the middle of Fantasyland.  I highly recommend this hotel!!

The magic of when "15" minutes really means 2 hours at check in 'Disney-speak'! Miserable check in and changing rooms experiences, caused a lot of wasted time and unpleasant vacation anxiety for the whole family :(

This was our first experience of the ridiculously awesome level of hospitality that is typical of the USA and sadly deficient in Australia. It was so nice to be welcomed in such a lovely way and given a balloon for my son. We had a lovely room overlooking the pool. Room service was great, the pools were lovely, and the location was excellent. My son unfortunately vomited in the hallway just as we left our room to check out! The wonderful member of housekeeping staff who passed by rushed to get him a towel and treated us with such comasssion and respect.  Excellent spot to walk to downtown disney shops and to catch the monorail into disneyland. We loved the USA, and I am just astounded by how polite and nice people are.

We loved the Disneyland Hotel.  I took my two nieces ( 21 and 14) and my 11 year old nephew to celebrate their respective birthdays.  We were treated like royalty from the moment we checked in and we were upgraded to a higher floor with a view of the pools.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was spacious.   We also loved the 7:00am early entrance into the Disney Resort Parks.

Check in process was a miserable experience! It took 30 minutes to check in although we are here attending a business conference.  Our front desk attendant was rude and unfriendly. We requested connecting rooms 3 months before our stay. I checked and received an email confirmation regarding connecting rooms one week prior to our arrival. Upon arrival, our large family was placed in rooms "close by" due to inability to fulfill our initial request. After we demanded connecting rooms, the unhelpful staff miraculously found connecting rooms on another floor.  The supervisor did not help, nor did she seem interested in helping.  Upgrading the rooms, pool, and lobby is nice but good customer service is really what counts! C'mon Disney...you should already know this!!!

Check in Was slow ?? Lobby was big enough.  Hotel was nice and we thought we have should stayed more. We have booked for Deluxe Rooms and we were given a lower category. We called them the change were immediate. Deluxe Rooms were enough for 4 people. 2 Adults and 2 Children. There are many breakfast cafe's in the down town and small canteen within the hotel. We have tried their breakfast once it cost 40 $ per person Goffy kitchen. Self-Laundry Room available within the Resort. Swimming pool was great !!!

Summary Heading: Renovations have restored the Disney magic
Summary: My family and I last stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in 2006.  We enjoyed the nostalgia, the proximity to the parks and Downtown Disney but it was in dire need of a makeover.   The renovation cost was well spent.  They probably could have spruced up the exterior a little more other than blue energy efficient windows but the focus was on the rooms and the pool area and it paid off.  The headboard with the wood carved castle and the light up fireworks are exactly what I would expect from Disney.  My kids thought it was really cool and asked to keep it lit throughout the night.  Some of the decor at Disney hotels (mainly in Florida) can be on the cheesy side but this was classy with cool vintage photography of Walt Disney and the parks in the earlier years.  It's about a 10-15 min

The newly remodled Disneyland Hotel is beautiful, it's fun just to walk around the grounds, and the the quality of the restaurants, pools, and service is good and consistant.  My husband and I came for a few days for our 25th anniversary - we stayed here for our honeymoon - so it was neat to come back to the same place.  While we loved it before, and through all the years of changes and remodles, this current improvement is fantastic.  It's nice to have the large pools, the outdoor fire pit, the beautiful lobbies, and improved restaurants.  The staff is very friendly - from the front lobby to the lifegaurds!  Although I will always miss the original Tram that pulled in front of the hotel for a ride to Disneyland, and the Olympic sized adults-only pool, the new Disneyland Hotel,

Summary Heading: Best hotel experience of my life!
Summary: I could only afford two nights but I wish we could have stayed forever! I stayed there once way back when I was 14 or 15 (I'm 30 now) and I wasn't impressed. They really, really hit it out of the park with the renovations. There are Mickey's everywhere. The best part is the musical, light up headboard. Everything is just gorgeous. We stayed in the middle tower and had a lovely view of the pool. We did an "in room celebration" for my son's 4th birthday and everything was set up before we got there, just as planned. It was very clean and I did not see any signs of creepy crawlers of any kind (I checked, I'm super paranoid about hotels since the whole bb panic). I slept like a baby. We ate dinner at Goofy's Kitchen and they brought out a pirate's treasure chest and dessert for my

I come here once a year and love it. If you stay at the hotel you get to ride the monorail into the park and its about a 3 minute ride. Lines can get long so you should go early in the morning around 7:30. The waterslide is new and pretty cool. Kids will love it. You are able to go eat breakfast with Goofy at his restruant. And at night it is right next to downtown disney so you can walk through and have fun. And if your kids get tired at the park just take the monorail back to the hotel so they can sleep or just rest.

We just returned from our three night stay at the new Disneyland Hotel and I was so disappointed. We go to Disneyland at least once or twice a year and usually stay at one of the three Disneyland Hotels. This year we wanted to try out the newly renovated Disneyland Hotel.  We were greeted by the most uptight, mean spirited woman at the front desk. She rushed us through and brushed off my questions.There wasn't even anyone else in line behind us. My aunt was supposed to be on the same floor as us so that she could watch our kids while my husband and I went to a nice dinner but they were unable to help us. The gal was so nasty and rude to us that one of my twin 7 year old daughters asked, "Why is that lady so mean to you, mommy?" Upon check out, I noticed that we did not get the

Summary Heading: Great location. Better than Grand Floridian.
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were updated, clean & location very convenient. I found the room better than the Grand Floridian. We could see the fireworks from our room. My 21 month old boy loved the fireworks. My five-year-old daughter loved the firework mural lights and bedtime stories on hotel channels. Would stay here again.

Even if I prefer Walt Disney World there is nothing negative I can say about our stay at this hotel.  The room was great and with all the Mickey items in it, such as the faucets and lights.  Great location with walking access to the two sites.  Would highly recommend for anyone visiting this location.

We recently spent two nights at the newly remodeled Dsneyand Hotel.  We were so impressed with the contemporary, modern vibe yet at every turn we found a hip bow to the head Mouse!  The updated rooms are spacious, as always, and have a bit more functionality with streamlined, multi-purpose furniture. The carved wood headboard that features a lighted castle scene is just magical!  I also loved the decorative plumbing handles with the silouhette do Mickey's head.  I'll leave the bathroom sconces as a surprise.    Of course, the property is next door to the parks and the staff are Disney trained!  We enjoyed the extra hour in the parks that hotel guests are given.    Bottom line?  Love the hotel and can't wait for our next visit!

Summary Heading: Loved it so much can't wait to stay here again
Summary: We were excited to stay here since the recent renovations. The location can't be beat for going to the park with little ones. It's very close to the monorail station (especially if you stay in the Adventure Tower) so it's easy access to the park and you avoid the lines at the main gate. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated in typical Disney style. Our 2 year old loved the light up/musical Tinkerbell headboard. We were concerned about where our 2 year old would sleep because he is too big for a crib and not quite ready for a big bed. It turned out the room had a couch that folded down into a twin bed. It was perfect. We lined the side with chairs to keep him from rolling out and it worked great. We had 3 adults, 1 child, our luggage, and a stroller and we still had plenty

When planning our first trip to Disneyland California we were not going to stay onsite but after looking at all our options we decided to splurge on the Disneyland Hotel and I am so glad we did. This is a beautiful hotel. We were in the Fantasy tower overlooking the pool. The pool was great (a little cold for us but still lots of fun). Trader Sams is a must. We loved being able to take advantage of the extra hour in the mornings and use the monorial when going in and out of Disneyland. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We truly felt like we were in Disneyland the entire time by staying here.

We had already done Disney World in Florida twice and my children are older now, so we stayed at the hotel and used the pool.  The pool was very well maintained & my kids loved the monorail water slides!  I would recommend this hotel to anyone with children.

We had a great stay 4-night stay here. Love the pools, the staff, the location, the large rooms, and especially the Tiki Bar. We traveled with our 4 kids (ages 20, 17, 14, 10) & we all had a wonderful experience. We usually stay at the Grand California, which is also a nice hotel, but if you want the real "Disney" experience (complete with characters, glitz, magic, etc.) you can't beat the Disneyland Hotel.

I took my 4 year old boy to Disneyland last week.  I booked a Standard Room with Standard view, which, I believe was a room with a view of Anaheim.  Our arrival experience was OK, nothing to complain about, nothing spectacular.  Apparently, we got upgraded to a room in the Adventure Tower which had a view of Downtown Disney.  The room was nice and clean.  I had not expected to care about the view, but being able to see the fireworks from our room was great.  I will definitely pick the same view next time.  The fact that we could walk a very short distance to the Monorail was very convenient.  The pools are great for the kids, although not so much for adults, as there is no way to really swim.  My boy loved the slides.  I can't comment on the restaurants there because we didn't

Summary Heading: Not a 4-star hotel in my opinion
Summary: This hotel has been recently renovated and is conveniently located in Downtown Disney.   We were there for 9 days and the substandard cleaning of our room made me vow to myself I will never forget to pack lysol wipes and windex again.  One day our bathroom was completely overlooked by housekeeping and when I mentioned it to guest services they didn't even apologize.  What we loved about this hotel:  Located in Downtown Disney Close to Alamo rent-a-car Our room had a great view of the fireworks Room was very large  Beds were very comfortable and the linens were nice quality Large flatscreen tv Beautiful head board that lit up Tastefully decorated Nice waterslide Laundry facility Nice pool area Fire pit was nice at night when it got cool H2O toiletries smelled nice, especially the

Summary Heading: Wish I could have stayed longer!
Summary: I was only there for two nights, so I didn't get to enjoy many of the benefits of staying on-site at Disney.  It was beautiful and right next to the parks.  Guest room was lovely, with lots of nice Disney touches.  They had a pack-and-play in the closet without us asking which is nice.  Gorgeous pool, friendly staff, can't wait to go back :)

We really enjoyed the hotel, especially being in the dream tower facing the Disneyland and the fireworks. Loved walking through downtown Disney everyday as well. We stayed there prior to the refurbishments but was pretty dull besides the view. We loved Goofys kitchen though, highly recommend!

Summary Heading: A great place to stay - First visit to Disneyland
