Summary: We were very impressed from the start with this resort, check in was a breeze and the staff were wonderful and helpful in assisting us with a lost bag from the airport!  The resort was immaculately presented and our room in Frontier Tower was a great size for our family of 5. The pool area was great (its a shame the water slide closed so early) although it was very popular and it was first in best dressed for deck chairs. The early park entry was the highlight, this allowed us to get in early to California Adventure Park and onto the newly opened Radiator Springs Ride! The cafe had a pretty good choice of meals and take away items, and the cocktails were great too.

Summary Heading: Super clean!!!!  Really nice new rooms and the pool area is Killer !
Summary: My 2 kids and I were on the water slides in the  pool area for hours. We swam under the little bridge , and the whole family walked to down town Disney (2 minutes away) and shopped and ate surprisingly good food at several restaurants at the down town area.  We ate at blue bayou ( strong drinks ) :)).  The rooms were really attractive and unbelievably clean. The beds were a little too firm for me - but it didn't keep me up or anything. Pricey ------ but always go the best when it's a special trip.

I have been going to Disneyland all of my life (50 years now), and stayed at the Hotel a great many times but not since the renovation - until this week.  If you have a child that likes to eat, don't stay here.  There is absolutely no way to get food in under an hour.  If you call the front desk, bell captain, housekeeping or just try to talk to ANYONE, you will be on hold for at least 25 minutes, only to be put on hold for another several minutes while they find a manager.  I will say, they apologize very nicely, with a smile, but that's all they do.  They kept telling me they were behind in their schedule.  I ask Disney - with all the money you charge for this hotel, you can't hire more people?   My daughter was starving most of the time we were here.   Another huge problem

I love this hotel more and more each time I stay here. Customer service is wonderful. Rooms are beautiful and the pool area can't be beat. I just wish they had basic snacks in the pool area fries, chips etc and that they didn't stop pool side service so early. Otherwise top notch.

The hotel was the nicest I have stayed in and I frequently stay at fairmonts and westins. The location and ground was perfect, our room although quite small was well decorated and immaculate.  I don't haveuch to say about service because we only had one interaction with the front desk but that went smoothly. I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay!!

We checked in last weekend for 2 nights . We got there very early but the rooms were available by lunchtime. We asked for a standard room and we were placed on the 10th floor at the Fantasy Tower. The room was really clean and the beds were comfortable. At night, we could view the fireworks which was pretty awesome.  We were a party of four so I asked for extra toiletries from the housekeeping and they gave us a bagful of them! The walk from both the parks were short. If you want to go to California Adventure, you can take a short walk from the Grand Californian Hotel. To Disneyland, a ride from downtown monorail train will get you there in minutes.  Overall, it was really a awesome experience. Thanks Disney for the wonderful and prompt service!

My family of five stayed at the Disneyland Hotel June 20-23rd.  We loved the room.  My daughter was fascinated with the Sleeping Beauty castle mural above the beds which has fireworks that light up and play music.  What was nice was that the music can be turned off and it then serves as a night light at bedtime.  The beds were very comfortable and we all slept well.  The pool area had slides for the kids and 2 large pools to swim in.  I loved the fact that there were lifevests for my youngest to wear so she could easily keep up with her older siblings and be safe at the same time.  The best part of staying here was the convienence to the Park.  It was a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the Monorail station in Downtown Disney.  The Momorail then takes you directly into Disneyland.

My sister and I, both in our 20s, revisited our childhoods by staying at the Disneyland Hotel and Resort on the 29th and 30th of June. Staying at the hotel was much more pricey that others in the area, but the location could not be beaten. It was great to be able to go back to our room and change after a wet ride, and then jump back on the monorail again and be back in the park. The Cast Members (staff) were all so friendly, and we got a free upgrade to a room overlooking the park which we really appreciated. Our room was wonderful, with the headboard with the castle on it, and other hidden Mickey details.  Didn't have a chance to use the pool or many of the other hotel facilities, except for having a great breakfast at Goofy's Kitchen, so I can't comment on them, but the common
This hotel is well kept, clean...and the staff is friendly. It is very very expensive, so it is not for the budget minded guest. If you have the means to stay here it is an absolute must!

Summary Heading: A good hotel filled with nostalgia throughout
Summary: It's not the best of the three Disney hotel options, but I'd still recommend it.  The decor throughout is classic Disney (even character wallpaper in the bathroom!), and the framed art shows lots of concept drawings of what the park and some of the rides were designed to look like from back in the 50s (I geek out on that kind of stuff, so I thought it was interesting).  Pool was good, especially for young families.  Didn't eat at Goofys but seems a bit on the pricey side.  Location is really convenient to Downtown Disney, and you can wander over to Compass Books in the morning to pick up some great coffee to jump start your day!

Summary Heading: A lot of great offerings in the area.
Summary: I was staying here because of a conference at the conference center I was attending. Lobby, rooms, staff, everything was great! Plenty of things in walking distance with DowntownDisney so close. I was very pleased with the hotel in several aspects!!

Very nice hotel, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located literally right across from Downtown Disney which was very convenient. It was a short walk to the parks and because we stayed at a Disney hotel we got into the parks an hour earlier than they let in those staying at non-Disney hotels. The only complaint I have is that when we checked in, we were told to go to the wrong tower, so we were searching for our room only to find out we were sent to the wrong building. The pools were nice, "mouse"keeping was great and the beds were comfortable. Also, the double sinks in the bathroom were awesome to have.

Summary Heading: Nice Stay in the Adventure Towers
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel June 11th-14th for three nights in the Adventure Towers.  We had a high floor with a poolview room category, which my son really enjoyed.    The only complaint I had was the front desk in the Fantasy lobby for check in.  The front desk clerks were not knowledgable in their jobs.  When we went to check in, we had a $1,000.00 in gift cards to pay for our room.  The girl didn't want to swipe all the cards and kept on telling me to save the gift cards for the parks.  Why would I want to have to worry about losing the gift cards, when you can charge everything to your room key back to the room.  The whole process of her complaining the whole time took about 40 minutes.  I then asked if I could purchase the Disney tickets at the front desk and she

We stayed in the frontier building at the Disneyland Hotel on the tenth floor. Our room was very clean and faced the amazing waterpark in the center of the complex. Every night at 9:30pm we could lay in bed and watch the fireworks out the window coming from Disneyland! It was magical to watch from the comfort of our room after being on the go all day. The food was great and the service was first class.

Went to Disneyland/ California adventure for the opening of Cars Land. Had a great time. We stayed  in a Club level room  concierge.  This is a Must weather you have kids or not. Friendly staff good appetizers and of course wine or beer. See you in December.

Summary Heading: It was what I expected for a Disney Resort (Disney tips included)
Summary: My daughter and I stayed at this resort in late June of 2012, just after Cars Land opened. We're annual pass holders and stay in the area every few months.  General-  It is newly refurbished and clean. The Headboards were very nice with the lights and music.  Rooms are tasteful, clean, although small There are multiple Disney details throughout the room and hotel common areas Staff is ample and generally friendly, they were everywhere They had portable cribs in the room  Pro's for staying at the resort Magic morning entry on select days You can walk easily to the park via downtown Disney and use the monorail to shorten the distance Certain level rooms have firework views   Cons Very over priced, $350 plus per night plus parking is excessive for what you get. Rooms are somewhat

We loved staying at the Disneyland Hotel. The Room was so beautiful and comfortable. It was the usual Disney standard. Check in was nice. We got there a little early and the room wasn't ready so they called us as soon as it was while we shopped in down town Disney.   The Location was perfect, such a close walk to the monorail that took us into Disneyland. I just cant say enough about how perfect the room was Mickey mouse touches every where. My Stay was Magical.

This hotel is a must if stopping in Anaheim, situated just next to down town Disney with all the restaurants and shops you need. Plenty of parking   The rooms are amazing, mickey themed really clean and modern.

Summary Heading: We had a blast at the Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: We loved the Disneyland Hotel! My husband, our almost 3 year old daughter and I stayed 4 nights at the Disneyland Hotel and had a blast. The location is great, the amenities were perfect and the renovated pools are excellent! Room service seemed a bit over priced for the quality, but that is pretty standard at all hotels in my opinion. We loved all the little Disney touches, especially the night light musical headboards. It made our daughters first trip to Disneyland a great one! The room was comfortable and the location allowed us to go back in the afternoons for nap time, so we were re-energized to spend the evening and night back at the park. Will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: All that we wanted in a family vacation!
Summary: This hotel was in the process of renovating, but was still one of the nicer hotels we have stayed in.  The rooms were so neat for us and the kids.  We only got a basic room, but the service of the hotel staff and cool features like the lighted headboards & pictures.  It is close walking distance to the tram to get you into Disneyland.

We recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  Line was long at check in but it was smooth sailing after that.  The room was spacious, clean and modern.  We could see the nightly fireworks from our balcony.  Pool was nice, kids really liked it.  It's a few steps away from Disney downtown, not as close as the Grand California.  We will probably try the Grand Californian next time.  Still we were pleased with our stay at Disneyland Hotel.

The room was not ready at the required 3pm check in time which was very disappointing for a room of this caliber. The room was ready at about 3:30pm, the front desk lady did her best to make the wait with 3 kids pleasant.  She brought us up to the snack area and she had the kids load up on cookies and what not, which they loved.  The room itself is huge I believe something like 1800 sq ft.  Great views of DisneyLand and California Adventure! It has a bar, 8 seat dining table, 3 TV's in living room, 3 bathrooms, kids room had a LARGE Mickey head shaped bed that 3 kids could sleep in together.  The kids room also had a PS2 game system...come on Disney it's 2012 upgrade that to a PS3! The main bedroom was average size but had a beautiful bathroom and large walk in rain head shower

We stayed at the Grand Californian last year and decided to try this since it was just redone. We were not disappointed AT ALL! In fact, I find the Disneyland Hotel a much more exciting place to stay. The new headboards with the lights that play music were so fun. The layout of the hotel is better and the pool was AWESOME.

Up until this year, we stayed at the Grand Californian every year.  But because we heard about the renovated Disneyland Hotel we decided to save a few bucks and give it a try.  Well, I guess we were expecting too much.  Not worth staying in a concierge-level room because the concierge lounge was pretty lame.  The cast members there were unfriendly and slow.  The platters of food didn't measure up to the photos in the hotel website.  The platters were small and almost always, empty.  The food selection was also ho-hum---you don't get what you paid for.  Had to always wait for someone to refill the platters and sometimes we had to knock on their kitchen door for someone to come out so we can ask for bottled water.  Why is it that they choose to fill the refrigerator with sodas but

Summary Heading: Awesome part of Disney history and a very nice hotel
Summary: This was my first visit to Disneyland, something I had dreamed of all my life. My 5-day stay at this hotel was everything I expected in terms of service, comfort and attention to Disney detail.   The front desk staff was warm and welcoming.  They managed to give me a room right away even though I arrived at 9 am.  I was right next to the 8th floor elevator but never heard a thing.  Wall art throughout the hotel depicts nostalgic photos and memorabilia of Walt and the parks.  The wake-up call made me laugh (Mickey's energetic voice telling you, "Up-and-at-'em!).  Ask for the Adventure Tower for a slightly shorter walk to the parks.  Although I have no complaints, if I were to come again I would stay at the Californian.  The decor is much more elegant, especially the lobby area,

Summary Heading: Great Spot . .Plus early entrance to parks!!!
Summary: Okay, I know the price is a bit steep, but after 4 full days with a 3 & 5 year old we were more than happy to have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel!!   Early Entrance . . as long as this promotion is going on and you have to do Disney in the Summer, there is no reason not to stay on property.  By getting in an hour early, we had the run of the park.  We only stood in line for 45min to ride Cars and we didn't get there till 7:30.  The average wait was over 2 hours and the fast passes had lines for over an hour each morning for regular admission.  This was our opportunity to get the kids on any ride we wanted, most with absolutely no lines.  It also meant we didn't feel bad about taking the kids back to the room for a nap at the hottest and most crowded part of the day from 1-4pm

We have been going to Disneyland for years and have always stayed at Howard Johson's directly across the street.  We booked late this year and so we decided to splurge and stay at the Disneyland Hotel (a dream of mine since I was a kid).  It was recently remodeled and you could tell.  The rooms were average size and nice.  The positives were:  Disney touches with Mickey's all over the place and the headboard lighting up with the castle/fireworks/music was touching and my 8-year daughter loved that.  Upon check-in the staff asked each child what their fav ride was and then gave them a fast-pass to get on that ride.  They also gave us an extra fast-pass for almost any ride (except Cars of course). That saved us a lot of time as well as the early entries.   Last, they gave them a

Summary Heading: Is DLH concierge level worth it?
Summary: We decided to take a quick trip to Disneyland to take in the new cars land in California Adventure. It is great, but the park was extremely busy. We always stay at the Disneyland Hotel. We find it to be the best of the bunch and we enjoy the short walk to the monorail, which takes us directly to Tomorrowland and the favourite rides (space mountain, star tours and toy story astro blasters). The room was pleasant, had a great view of the fireworks. The kids enjoyed the upgrades that have been made to the DLH pool.  I wanted to make a few comments on the concierge level room and lounge. We felt it was worth the extra cost. Every morning, if you stay at a Disney hotel you get early access to the parks. So we had early access to California Adventure and were able to get a fast pass

I love Disneyland!  For my sons 3rd birthday we decided to stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  I will admit that the price is high, but it was so worth it.  Very convient to the parks, food, and shopping.  I think my kids liked the pool as much as the parks?  Plus with ammenties such as a fridge in the room (which is very important with children that allergic to everything), I don't mind paying a little extra for the comfort and excitment of staying at Disneyland.

My wife and I decided to stay at the Disneyland hotel because we wanted to splurge on our son’s first visit to the magic kingdom.  We are so glad that we did, because it was such an amazing experience and really made our days a lot more relaxing when we didn’t have to worry about getting into a car at the end of a long hot day, and head back home.  From the moment that we checked in, we were all greeted with such warmth and Disney flair that we immediately felt comfortable checking in.  Debbie, the front desk agent, was so nice and would pretend to sprinkle “pixy dust” on the computer after she found a room.  Our room was clean and spacious, with a view of the enormous pool complex that was recently renovated.  The monorail pool was so spectacular, that we would come back to the

It was nice to stay here at least one time but I would not stay here again.  It's just not worth the money.  First there are other hotels that are closer to Disneyland and don't charge for parking.  $400.00, no continental breakfast, early check out and a fee to park your car...I mean "come on".  The worst part was that the room was not the cleanest.  The bath tub still had hair and residue from the previous occupants.  The coolest thing about staying at the Disneyland Hotel is pool area.  The pool is awesome and it was like being at small water park.  The kids loved it.  Other then the pool area, the hotel isn't really family friendly if you have smaller little ones.  It had a small fridge but no microwave making it difficult to warm my baby's food or milk.  Like I said, the

Compared to most hotels we have stayed near Disneyland, the Disneyland Hotel is way overpriced by double anywhere else. Although the hotel and rooms were nice, the long walk from the self park where everyone parks is far and the worse is the late check in at 3pm and early check out policy at 11am. They didn't get us checked in till 5 and when we asked for a late check out at noon, they said "no". Being Disneyland, don't expect any complementary anything, no free continental breakfast not even at over $400 per room per night. if you have kids, there is no microwave for reheating left overs, just a small fridge. We will stay at AnnaBella, Hyatt or one of the many hotels nearby next time.

Great hotel, totally refurbished. pool was like a tropical resort. friendly staff. Room incredibly clean. Location is great. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. 5 to 10 minute walk to the parks, can't beat it!

We weren't sure whether to book at Disneyland Hotel, there are so many other accommodation choices in the area, but we eventually decided to book four nights there at the end of our US trip as a treat, and we're so glad we did.  It was the best hotel we stayed in during our US holiday and we didn't want to leave!  So comfortable, clean, spacious... I could have stayed another week easily to enjoy all the hotel had to offer.  We paid for a two room suite with concierge and it was fantastic.  Only negative is the pools, you can't get a seat down there!  People claim their sun lounge early in the day by putting a towel on it, then you don't see them for the rest of the day!  Our room was overlooking the pool and I watched empty sun lounges sitting there all afternoon, unable to be

I did not want to love this hotel.  I am not a Disney person.  I do not do magic kingdoms, princesses, mouse ears, or cartoons.  So why did I LOVE this hotel?  The staff were flawless.  The room was so beautifully and tastefully decorated and so clean.  The bed was so comfortable, the room service menu so thoughtfully put together and well delivered, the Mai Tais by the pool so tasty.  Even I couldn't resist the "Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes" headboard.  I almost resent that I am so much looking forward to returning to this hotel next year.

The hotel and grounds are beautiful - in true Disney style! BUT!  Don't expect to walk out the door and right into the Parks...  it is quite the stroll even to the monorail station (which can be busy and/or have delays) - and if you hoof it all the way, you have to go through the entire length of Downtown Disney back and forth.  I love the hotel - but sure wish they had transportation (like those on Main Street would be AWESOME!) other than the unreliable (and not so close) monorail...

Stayed here three nights during a convention in Anaheim.  Customer service at check in, restaurant, room service and shops was very good.  The remodeled room was nicely done with bedspreads replaced by duvets and quality sheets and cases (don't miss the Mickeys in the weave).  Attractive carpeting and drapes and the headboard was a charming addition.  We also had a sofa in addition to two queen beds.  Our room was in the Fantasy tower which was most convenient to the shuttle for the convention center and to Downtown Disney.  Black and white photos of Walt and Disneyland decorated the walls.  We also had a view of the fireworks and could listen to the music via the television.  The counter with outlets, mirror and lighting outside the bathroom was convenient for a family getting

Disney has just completed a huge remodel here and they were able to bring that Disney magic to the property and rooms. While they brought back a retro feel the rooms are up to date and modern.The main attraction is the pool. They offer cabanas which we rented one for my daughter Birthday at a very reasonable price. The host even brought in Balloons and stuffed animals for our kids. they have different water slides for different ages. They have several hot tubs and offer beverage and food service throughout. We went into Disney int he morning with magic Mornings and spent the afternoon at the pool. We then went back to the parks for the night. You are steps from Downtown Disney and may great shops/restaurants. The breakfast in Goofy's Kitchen was a ton of fun. all of the

Summary Heading: Some renovation pixie dust worked wonders!!!
Summary: While we were not overly impressed with the dated decor when we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel four years ago,  it had its charms, especially for anyone that grew up watching the Wonderful World of Disney. When my conference returned to Anaheim this June, we decided to book a room again at the Disneyland Hotel primarily for its proximity to Downtown Disney and Parks. Wow! Totally missed the stories about the renovations and we were pleasantly surprised by the updated decor which features a fabulous headboard with a relief of Sleeping Beauty's Castle that has embedded tiny lights in the shapes of fireworks and plays a "Dream is a Wish Your Heart Makes" music box style from the bedside table. Comfy bed, updated bath, refrigerator, FREE wifi and our room included a couch and

My niece turned 5 last year and for her birthday we booked 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel and each bought 3 day hopper ticket to Disneyland Park and California Adventure. (5 adults + 2 kids total)  Rooms: Disneyland is magical as is so to my surprise, the hotel was even more magical!! Early check in was available/free without having prior request. Our room was automatically upgraded for free to poolside views. My niece had her own room with her parents and brother and it didn't take much sweet talking for them to get a free upgrade THAT joined ours. The kids (2 and 5) had a blast running around both of our rooms.  The rooms were gorgeous!! Mickey mouse ear touches everywhere. We had 2 queens in each room and the headboard was an entire wooden panel with the castle and

Summary Heading: Glad we stayed on-property at this historic Disney hotel.
Summary: I waffled between staying at Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel.  As eastcoast Disneyers, we normally visit Disney World and stay at the Grand Floridian.  I knew the massive remodeling project was completed and thought it best to stay at Disney's first hotel.  Glad we did.  Most of the reviewers do a great job of describing the property, so I won't rehash it.  Just provide you some of our observations.  It has been mentioned that the bed was uncomfortable and we somwhat agree.  Compared to the Grand Floridian beds, this one was not the softest we have ever experienced, but after a day in the parks we could sleep just about anywhere and they were fine.  I have a fussy back and had no discomfort the next morning.  We checked in around 10:30 pm and found valet, the bellman, and

Recently stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for conference. Didn't stay there last year because of all the construction. This year the construction is finished and remodels are very nice. Check-in service was very good, maid service was spotty and check out was quick however I discovered later there was a mistake on the bill. They did correct this by telephone. Overall pretty good and you can't beat the location.    As a side note, check out Trader Sams it's pretty cool inside. Only negative is service is extremely slow. Lots of bartenders bumping into one another. I'm sure management will take care of that.

I recent stayed here the first week of June, and all I can say is you get what you pay for. The location is so convenient with Downtown Disney right there as well as the monorail into Disneyland. The location, nostalgia, and pretty much everything this hotel offers is worth every penny.

After months of research, I decided to forgo my reservations with Park Vue Inn and Fairfield Inn and chose the Disneyland Hotel. It was my sons (ages 3 &5) first time to Disneyland and my daughter's (7) second time. We decided to bite the bullet and splurge since this was supposed to be a rare in a lifetime trip for the kids. We stayed at tower where the lobby is located. I found  the walking distance to park bearable especially since it was always a nice stroll via Downtown Disney.   Kids loved that Goofy greeted them at the lobby upon arrival. They also got to see Chip and Dale, Rafiki and Pluto on separate occasions. That was a real treat. So it's true. You never lose the Disney feeling.   Most of the comments have been mentioned already. So it's true. Rooms are news.

Summary Heading: One of the Better Disney Hotels
Summary: I stayed here recently for a conference and the hotel managed to house over a 1000 people, yet, it did not feel crowded and they were efficient at check-in and check-out.   The rooms were very large, which I would assume is because it caters to mostly family.  The service was good of which I used the coffee shop in the mornings, the bar and one of the restaurants for the launch.  The bar was very cool in the fact that depending on which drink you ordered the building would shift and the bartenders played various roles.   Was a nice distraction from being in the parks during the day.  They also had a large outdoor fireplace with chairs and couches to relax.   I did not use the pool complex but looked great and wish I had time to use it while I was there.   Was pleasantly

Hotel is located a brief walk to the Disney parks. A wander down the main street is the start of the adventure. The hotel has three blocks and only one has a receiption which is a bit of a drag. A realy nice pool (or pools) and bar area in the middle of the complex. Goofey's kitchen is a must for breakfast.

Summary Heading: Magical time at The Disneyland Hotel
Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel. Planned to stay at the hotel for 2 nights saved for the experience and was not dissapointed at all. The check in staff were fantastic, as we arrived at 10am we understood our room wouldn't  be ready but they still checked us in gave us our keys. We were able to store our bags at the front lobby and spent half the day at the pool which was so relaxing. A great pool area 2 waterslides which my 6 y/o loved, 2 huge pools, 2 spas and lots of deck chairs to relax on. We checked on our room about 2pm and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a larger room with a pool view, great start to the holiday.  Walk to Disneyland about 5 mins which is very relaxing another benefit staying at the resort you are able to enter Californian Adventure Park an hour

Summary Heading: This is a must stay hotel if you are going to Disneyland !
Summary: This hotel is fantastic .the staff is impecable and is always there to serve you no.matter what . They are so.friendly and make you feel so welcome . The food is  very good and they have many different options when it comes to dining . They have fun gift shops on.site . Also there is a newly remodeled pool that is a ton of fun and a workout center.  There is also a business center for any needs you might have . I love this hotel and i am posotive that you will too . The location is great and is within walking distance to downtown Disney , disneyland , and california adventure ! So so wonderful

Summary Heading: It's a splurge, but worth it.
Summary: Yes, I will be the first person to admit that the price of the Disneyland hotel is not cheap.  We have visited the Disneyland Resort 4 times this past year and decided on this most recent trip to go ahead and stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  It was well worth the money, but I would consider it a "special trip" type of place if you plan on enjoying all that the resort has to offer.  If you are looking for a quick trip hotel just to sleep in between visits to the park, then this isn't the hotel for you.  You can find reasonably priced great hotels in the area, but you can't replace the Disney vibe, convenience or comfort of staying at one of the resort hotels.  We had to book 2 rooms because we had a party of 6.  The rooms were connecting.  I was surprised that one of the rooms was

Awful experience! Woke up after the first night with a cluster of bites on the right side of my waist (very itchy!). Went to the reception to ask for a new room, but they told me they were fully booked and had to stay in the same room for the next night as well. Had to buy my own anti-histamine gel at the shop near by. Staff was very unhelpful and seemed neither surprised or willing to deal with these type of occurrences. Will try to never stay there again. Just hope I didn't bring any of the insects with me back.....

I went with my family last April (2012) and we stayed for 4 days in Disneyland Hotel.  Compared to other places close to the park, it was more expensive, but definitely worth it in terms of convenience.  The rooms and bathrooms are well kept, and the convenience of getting to and from Disneyland is worth it.  Whenever the kids would get tired, it would be easy to take them back to the hotel for a nap while the grownups could easily go back to enjoy.  The best part was that even though you had already left the park, you could still feel that you were in Disneyland because of Downtown Disney, the characters in the hotel and the very friendly staff.  It was truly a magical experience!

One of the best hotels I have ever been to. Everything was amazing. In our room their were hidden mickeys and a castle that light up and played music on the wall. There was a tv and a great view of paradise pier and the employee parking lot(which was actually a lot of fun to watch) The beds were perfect. I didn't feel too hot or cold, too hard or soft, it was perfect.       There was a replica of one of my favorite rides Thunder Mountain in the lobby. The pool was both fun and relaxing. Steakhouse 55 was a MUST eat restaurant. The food and service was impeccable and delicious! It was a great location, next to downtown Disney and near the monorail into Disneyland.         If I could I would give Disneyland Hotel a 6 out of 5. I am definitely coming back!!!

OK so we were first really skeptical because of the high pricetag!! We assumed it was alot of money for a regular hotel room!!   But we honestly have never been treated with so well! Every time we needed anything they bent over backwards. All the cast members were so nice . They had a way of making you feel so special!!            We now know why people would pay so much to stay there! A truely magical experience!!

We have not stayed at the Disneyland Hotel since the renovation began several years ago.  On this last trip we booked a standard room and were assigned to the Frontier tower.  The Frontier tower has a western style themed lobby that includes a model of the Big Thunder Mountain Railroad ride.  The music surrounding the tower is Copland style themed music.  The rooms itself is not western but is a stylish classical Disney themed room.   The sink area is separate from the shower/tub and toilet area. The room has a desk/chair, a small refrigerator, sitting chair, dresser drawers and a nightstand.  The neat thing in the room is the lamp on the nightstand.  It has two switches on it one for the lamp and the other switch which is sort of a night light which also play music for approx.

We stayed May 2012 at the Disneyland Hotel with out 2, 4year old twins. The biggest thing with this hotel in my opinion is the convenience of getting to the Disneyland parks. I´m sure there are better deals in the hotels near by. With us we decided that the convenience with the 2 boys was worth the extra expense. The hotel was clean and friendly staff, but it does take a while to check in since it´s very busy. We tried to get an extra hour for the check out it´s at 11 am and they coulden´t do it, this was a bit disappointing since all we needed was 30 minutes more of time. If our kids were bigger where moving them is easier we would probably use another hotel and save the $$.

We had a great experience at the Disneyland Hotel.  Check in was at the main desk, but we had a special Concierge folder with information about Concierge services and the E-ticket lounge waiting for us there.  There was also a personalized itinerary with all of our dinner and activity reservations listed. The cast member checking us in gave each of the kids a signed character picture.    The rooms were lovely.  They were comparable in size to deluxe rooms at Disney World...actually, they seemed larger.  The floor to ceiling windows gave us an amazing view.  We could actually watch fireworks from bed!  We were always able to get right on an elevator.  The E-ticket lounge was well staffed and well stocked.  We stayed on the 9th floor and the lounge was on the 11th floor, so it was

Summary Heading: This hotel is in a rapid decline
Summary: The service we experienced was  terrible. The bell boys watched and laughed at us as we struggled to take our bags to checkin counter upon arrival after a 15 hr flight. The rooms are nothing special considering what you pay and for them. Admittedly they are clean but we had problems with our toilet...it smelt and when you flush it, it sounds like an airplane toilet! Our supposed  pool view was only a glimpse of the pool, as all we could see from our room was predominantly an ugly tin roof from some unknown structure below. What a rip off!

Spent LOTS of extra money staying at the Disneyland Hotel and in the end I was left feeling underwhelmed.  The beds were very firm, which meant lousy sleep.... this was not helpful after many marathon days around the parks.  Our "mini-frig" wasn't cold after 24 hrs, so we called housekeeping and they told us it wasn't an actual frig, just a "cooler."   Ok???  After more inquiry, we got the unit swapped out for one that worked.   Service was hit or miss.  This was our 6th time staying on property and I think we will be exploring other options next time.  For $350+ a night, I expect a comfortable bed, working frig and great service.     On the up side, the new pool area was nice and we were able to get chairs both days we went.

Stayed at Disneyland Hotel for 5 nights (May 21 - 26). Three adults and one 3yr old in two adjoining rooms, one room 2 queens and sofa, one king room. Room and beds were very comfortable. Rooms were clean and well kept. We were in Adventure Tower on the 3rd floor facing Downtown Disney but below the wall so our view was trees and lawn. The room was quiet except one night when we could hear the music from a band in Downtown Disney until 10pm. The weather was cool some days but we used the water slide and pools most days. Lots of towels and good service for a drink at the pools. Ate at the quick service restaurant one night for dinner. It was OK, a bit pricey like all Disney food. The vending machine on our floor was vandalized one day and had to be replaced. That could happen

Summary Heading: Our Second Time Around - Better Than the First!
Summary: The last time we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel was in 2010, during the hotel's massive renovation project.  Now that the renovation is complete, we decided to stay a night to experience the hotel again.  We were not disappointed.  We arrived at 2:00 PM on a Sunday afternoon - check-in was a breeze and our room, overlooking the pool, was already ready.  Ours was a king-sized room on the fourth floor of the Adventure Tower.  Though some reviewers claim that the rooms in the Disney Hotel lack "Disney-iss," I must disagree!  The room was awash in Disney themes, if you knew what you were looking at.  The headboard above the bed features a light up Disneyland background.  The welcome book, in room stationery, coasters, even the TV-line up guide are all decorated with classic

The last time we stayed at this hotel it was under construction. I was looking forward to it being better since the construction is now complete. The new lobby is more modern but we stayed for 5 days and never saw a Disney character in the lobby, so they must of discontinued having them greet the guest which the kids loved.  We stayed in the Fantasy tower, the rooms were average size the only special feature is the Disney lights on the wall behind the beds. The Disney products in the bathroom were replace with spa products that were just average, no shampoo with mouse ears. This hotel has a chance to be a 4 star hotel but loses alot in the details. In one of the bathroom the wallpaper was splitting off the wall. Housekeepiing was sometimes good and sometimes not so good. We left

I feel a bit unhappy about writing this review because there is certainly nothing tconcrete to complain about in terms of what we experienced.  My only issue is that for the price we paid to stay at the Disneyland Hotel I was expecting it to be a bit more "Disneyfied".  The lightup headboard was lovely and the mickey hand light in the bathroom was cool but that was the extent of the Disney theming.  I was hoping to feel totally immersed in the Wonderful World of Disney by staying there and unfortunately we just didn't feel it. The children enjoyed the waterslides.  The frozen cocktails from the Tiki Lounge were very nice (the food was terrible though).  Highly recommend doing the dinner at Goofy's Kitchen to have the character interaction, but you don't have to be a guest in

True hospitality! Each touch from each employee was welcoming, and sincere-really creating a magical experience (even for the skeptical parents) The rooms are gorgeous and serenely cozy after a long day at the park. The location alone is a big reason to stay. We loved the pools with the slides, the bedtime stories on the tv read aloud by the princesses, and the sweet surprises from turn down service. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Our family stayed at the Disneyland hotel over Mothers Day Weekend.  It is a nice hotel with three towers.  The rooms were very nice and newly remodeled.  It is in a great location to Downtown Disney and while you are staying at the hotel there are days that you can get into the park an hour early.  It is so worth waking up early and taking advantage of that feature.  We got on about 8 rides before the park opened.  The best part of the hotel was the pools.  The kids loved them especially the water slides.  They spent a full day playing in the water.  The poolside service was a little slow it looked like they only had 2 people working on each pool.  So you could get food and drinks but you had to wait awhile.  The food at the hotel or even downtown Disney is really mediocre.

Stayed here for 3 nights in May.  A bit off season so we were upgraded to a pool view mini suite before we even got to hotel.  Not a huge room but the addition of the day bed was perfect for a family of four. Our 4 1/2 yr old took to it as her little nest.  Very nicely remodeled rooms. Smaller bathroom let only one person at a time get ready, but very nicely done.  Complimentary toiletries were actually nice to use. Hotel towers are spread out a bit, but it is an enjoyable walk through the pool area. We were in Frontier tower which was furthest from check in and parks but found it to be a very doable walk. Staying on resort was worth the price as it afforded the chance to take a little down time in the afternoon when needed as well as early entry and better seats at some

My husband and I stayed at The Disneyland Hotel for the first time March 19th-21st 2012,  with our two kids 3 & 5 yrs old. The Hotel was Awesome very nice and Clean! I have worked at two 5 Star Hotels in Las Vegas and I expected it so be nice, but this was very nice and Very Convenient to Disneyland & California Adventure Parks We went to both. It is well worth the extra money to stay here instead of staying at any other hotel where you have to walk down the street from especially when the kid's were tired from being at the park's all day.  The Disneyland Hotel's pools were awesome!!  I will always stay here every time we come back to Disneyland. Restaurant's & Shopping right out side your Hotel at World of Disney!  We ate lunch at Ariel's Grotto that was a little disappointing

I had been to Disneyland several times, but this was the first staying at the Disney Hotel. The room had character, and that would be the reason to pay for it.  The handles in the bathroom had Mickey's shape, the toiletries also were more than just a simple bottle of shampoo. At night, if you turn on the switch next to lamp, the back of the bed lights up beautifully and nice music starts playing.  I think kids would really enjoy that.  It's very convenient if you want to stay in the Disney Downtown District, but you pay very high prices at those restaurants too.  They know you are limited (walking distance) so they charge what they want.  If you like a cute room, this is unique.  You'll enjoy it.

The hotel has recently been renovated and is very nice.  The floor numbering system does not make sense as we stayed on the 6th floor and our room number was in the 2400's.  when you step off the elevator there is no signs indicating which way your room is.  Maybe they did not get around to it.  Driving into the hotel was very control by security.  Almost to the point of feeling questioned for being there.  from a safety stand point this was very good.  The room was nice but our shower was horrible.  No pressure.  This was our first time here and it was so convenient to get to Disneyland.  More relaxing.  The workout facility was adequate, Overall very satisfied and would stay there again.

I don't normally stay at "destination" hotels but I had a conference that took me to Disneyland.  The Disneyland hotel (Fantasy Tower) is a wonderful property.  Spectacularly clean, quiet and excellently maintained.  The E-Ticket Club in the Adventure tower was very nice with plenty of drinks and snacks and a great view of the park.  The staff seemed as though there was nothing they wouldn't or couldn't do to make the stay more "magical".    I was worried that a busy, family oriented hotel would be noisy and difficult to get real work done in but the trip was productive.  Two "business person" improvements I could suggest:  1) The rigid wooden chairs at the desks are too uncomfortable to sit in for long periods of time.  A more ergonomic desk chair would be helpful. 2) WiFi was

If only we had spent our whole trip here instead of wasting 4 nights at the Sheraton Anaheim! Staying at the Disneyland Hotel was like a dream come true. The check where we were met by Pluto and Chip & Dale was fun - and the waiting area with the teacup seats was great!  The Twinkle Star head board was a hit with the children.  And the Pool Complex! Wow.   The staff were first class. The tiny details - the Mickey Mouse taps, lamp bases, all tiny things that overall made it magical. I guess if I had to say anything, I would ask that they think a little more about children when decorating the rooms - my little ones couldn't reach the sink/taps, and the beds were very high. I've found this true of all hotels the world over, but surely in the Disneyland Hotel, consideration should

the rooms are a bit pricey, but the service, and conveince of being right on the park was very nice. my husband and i stopped here on our west coast road trip, for our honeymoon. they were able to get us a room at last minute, and the property is very clean! we did not use the pool, which we wish we had, but we walked to downtown disney which was a ton of fun, and being able to use the valet service, and store our luggage while we played at the parks was very nice and easy! ... thanks!
Great hotel, very comfortable and they renovated it nicely.  Staff was very friendly too.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May, 2012 while attending an IT conference.   Room was very large, nice amenities including a small refrigerator.  Found the room to be updated and modern although my room was located in the original Disneyland Hotel. I was concerned it was close to the elevator but no noise although I did hear children upstairs in the room above me a few times.   Just steps off of Downtown Disney, lots of stores, restaurants and close to the Monorail.   Loved the the bedside lamp that had a both a light and a lulabye that would play once just wished the headboard lights would have automatically shut off but the headboard was a great touch even this adult smiled at the Magic.  The couch converted to a bed, too.  Plenty of lighting, large flat screen TV with a

I stayed there for three days this week on business.  There were about 1000 of us attending a conference and thousands of others with kids going to Disneyland.  The last time I was at Disneyland, my kids were small, had a great time and they were the reason for the trip.   Disney did quite the job renovating. Everything looked new and very clean.  My room was on the 2nd floor. My only complaint is that all of the food on the property was over priced and not all that good.
Enjoyed the hotel and location!! The food was the  best and I would stay here again.

We stayed here for 4 nights attending a IT convention adjacent to the hotel. The hotel, pool, restaurant buildings & landscaping maintenance was the best. All plants and walkways were always tidy with no signs of neglect. Never saw any workers during the day time. Everything must be done at night. The rooms were slightly above average. Everything worked. No issues like poor water drainage, poor water pressure or toilet problems. Disney people were always polite & friendly. Lucky we got convention rates otherwise it would not be a good value considering all the fees added to the room rate. Would not stay here if regular room rates were charged. Not a good value.

My mom and I go to Disneyland every year and usually stay at the Paradise Pier, but when there was no availability there we decided to try the Disneyland Hotel. We booked at their lowest rate with a parking lot view, but when my mom told them I was being surprised by my boyfriend for him to propose to me, they upgraded us to a larger room with an amazing view (hidden in the trees with a view of the old waterfall area) at no extra charge!  We got engaged at the rose garden, which was quite private first thing in the morning :)  The new room renovations were great and made the hotel feel a lot classier and cleaner than it used to. Although none of the Disney hotels feel upper end, this one is by far the most modern feeling.  The only annoyance was that the farthest tower is a

Summary Heading: Too noisy for an adult kid...
Summary: First let me explain that Disneyland hotel was very clean and had great service.   My main complaint is that Disney spent millions of dollars remodeling this hotel but didn't bother to put any type on noise proofing inside of the walls. The family next door was loud. I could hear a kid screaming and I suppose the parents didn't do anything. I finally banged on the wall with my fist and things suddenly got a bit more quiet. At 3 a.m. I heard the couple arguing in the bathroom. Also, I could hear everyone use the toilet because I could hear the toilet flush every time it was used. I could also hear everytime somone left their room because you could hear the door when it would close.  The pool was supposedly heated but I suddenly realized why all the kids weren't swimming and were

We visit Disneyland several times a year and decided to splurge and spend one night at the Disneyland Hotel. It was pure magic! The hotel was beautiful and impeccably clean! I was disappointed to have to pay $15 a night for parking. We were paying $300 a night, get free parking at Disneyland for being annual pass holders but still had to pay hotel parking???  Due to the weather we didn't use the pool, but enjoyed the ambience of the hotel. I'm happy we finally spent the money to stay on property. If we found a good deal we would return, but wouldn't pay $300 a night again.

I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for a conference and was pleasently surprised by the overall property.  The rooms were recently renovated and very clean and comfortable.  The property was very close to all the dining and shopping in Downtown Disney and the pool looked great although I did not try it.  Most only complaint is that the walk from self parking to my room took 5-10 minutes, but valet was available if you didn't want to walk for only a few bucks more.

The newly remodeled (as of Christmas 2011) Disneyland Hotel is an absolute gem-- forgetting for one moment that my wife and I are big Disney fans, this hotel complex simply meets every possible expectation for a first class hotel.  Amazingly helpful staff that go the extra mile; excellent rooms with the nicest possible furnishings-- everything from high thread count sheets to an assortment of pillows to Egyptian cotton bathrobes.  Special note goes to the soundproofing upgrades-- the building itself dates to the 1950's, but aside from the architecture, you wouldn't know it-- our room was next to the elevator and facing the pool, but we did not hear a thing-- the soundproofing is that good.  On-site restaurants are generally very good, and we plumped for the "character breakfast"

We travel to disneyland 2-3 times a year. It is expensive for a family of four to stay at the disneyland hotels but if you want conveinience then this is your place. My family and I spent alot of time at the pool. We had poolside service, we love our cocktails while the kids swim so that was awesome. I can honestly say we spent more time at the pool than disneyland. Highly reccommended for more than a 4 day stay where you don't mind spending a day at the hotel and not the park. At the end of the day if price is not an issue and you want something family friendly this is your place. I would rather save our money and stay here than a cheaper hotel on the strip next time.

Let me start by saying they could provide better signage to actually find the hotel (and we even had a GPS).    We stayed for three nights in the Adventure Tower.  The room looked brand new from the remodel.  We were a little concerned that we were only on the second floor overlooking the pool but we didn't hear anything and slept in every day until 10 a.m. with no issues.    The turndown service was nice each day (or maybe the maid just left it that way in the afternoon as each day we were gone until evening).    The location is great because you basically walk outside right into Downtown Disney.    Our only complaint is we ordered room service at midnight and they brought the wrong soda (even though it was on the receipt correct) and skipped out on requested condiments and it

My wife and I have always been Disney enthusiasts, from our 20's now into our 50's, although my wife just turned 50.  I'll pay for that.  We've always stayed at other hotels on our trips to Dland, always wishing to stay at the classic Disneyland Hotel.  So, after much thinking, we booked a stay at the hotel.  We were almost as excited about staying there then going to Disneyland.  We weren't disappointed one bit, just the opposite.  It was a wonderful experience.  Everyone there was beyond friendly and helpful; I know that is a major trait with Disney, but it's still a great feeling.  We stayed in the Fantasy tower.  Our room wasn't huge, but we didn't need one where we could get lost.  But it was beautiful and bright.  The cleaning staff was excellent.  My wife loved the

Summary Heading: Small rooms, very expensive, but so close to the park and downtown Disney and great Disney vibe
Summary: The room was very clean, but smaller then what I expected, especially for the price 1200$ for 3 nights. what you are paying for is the direct access to downtown Disney and the Disney vibe. We are annual pass holders to the park I think the discount should be more then what it is. But all in all it was not a bad stay just expensive for the size of the room.

We booked a suite room with 4 day park passes. The arrival and check in was super fast. We took the kids down to the pool area, and they had a great time. There are 3 pools. The kiddie pool is the furthest away from the main tower of the hotel, and also has the water slides. The pool side drink service is a bit spotty, so best to grab the server when you can. Once you actually order, the service is quite prompt and very friendly.   Our room was on the 10th floor with a view of Downtown Disney and over looking the parks. We got a suite so that our family of 4 plus two grand parents could stay in the same room. The suite was an excellent choice. Slightly cheaper than 2 rooms, and there was no problems with the set up. The main bedroom has two queen beds with a head board that

This is the middle of the road hotel-The Grand Californian being the priciest, Paradise Pier being the least expensive-on the premises at Disneyland. The new pool area is fabulous. The room is very, very spacious, and they all either have sliding glass doors with an overlook. It's also a very short walk to Downtown Disney, and the monorail to take you into Disneyland.

Summary Heading: We liked it as much as Disney Grand CA for 1/2 the price
Summary: The remodel lived up to expectation.  We have traditionally stayed at the Disney Grand, but wanted to give the historic Disneyland Hotel a try.  The room was wonderful with great big window view and very quite.  In turn, we found the Disney Grand CA Hotel to be too loud and busy (though a bit nicer).  However, the Disneyland Hotel is a hidden jewel for a much better price.  They also typically offer another night for 1/2 the price in the morning; slipped under our door (weekday).  We also found room service to be good.

From the moment we arrived the atmosphere was happy and friendly. You pay a bit more for the location but it is worth every cent, the rooms are fantastic and very spacious and the pool area is sensational. With early park access (magic morning for disney accomodation guests) and the ability to walk back to the hotel for a break or a swim is great for kids and  parents!! We loved the place and our kids will remember this for ever.

Were do you start, from teh characters greeting you upon check in, to the beautifly themed rooms and hallways. There are three towers within the Disneyland Hotel, I definitley prefer the fantasy tower, as most girls would! The room was massive, and loved how the headboard lights up at night and plays lullabys (if you want it to). The staff were so happy, as you would expect. The other towers were nice to but i think little princess would love this one most. Definitley do a character breakfast! But beware, Mickey and Minnie dont go to goofy's kitchen, they are at Paradise Pier. Being so close to the park, its just a short stroll through gorgous boutiques etc to the entrance, no hassle. Kids and big kids at heart would all love this hotel, i would highly reccomend a stay here,

Fantastic location, good food and a great pool. The beds were the most comfortable of our 4 week trip. Would recommend to families with young children as you can pop home from Disneyland and go back later.

We found Disneyland hotel a fab place to stay. Staff were fantastic, courteous and lovely to the children. We were upgraded at no cost to a theme park view room and our daughter was given presents from the cast as it was her birthday. It made Disneyland an even more enjoyable experience.

We celebrated my daughter's birthday this past weekend at the Disneyland Resort. We arrived at 9am and was told we could store our bags at the bell desk until our room was ready. Check in wasn't until 3pm so we decided to hit the parks right away. Just outside of the Disneyland Hotel is Downtown Disney. They have a monorail depot station that takes you right into Disneyland. Since we all had our passes, it was a breeze getting to the park! After a few hours, I decided to check to see if our room was ready. We booked a 1 bedroom suite to make it extra special for my daughter and her 2 friends. Unfortunately, the room was not ready at 3pm. The girls decided to go swimming in the pool. We had no problem getting their swimsuits from the bell desk.   We were a little upset that our

As a family of 5 it's hard to find a room that can fit us all comfortably but Disney has managed that. We had three comfortable beds (couch flips to a twin), magical headboards, and plenty of room to move around.   There was a cheerleading competition going on and the mothers (Not the cheerleaders) were making a ruckus in the hall past 10pm called security and they quickly came so my kids could go to sleep.  Talk about great service!  Pool looks inviting though we didn't use it and the quick service restaurant nearby the pool was good and convenient.    Over all an enjoyable get away with the family.

I stayed at the hotel with a large group in relation to a training programme provided by the Disney Institute. The hotel is large but because of the four buildings around the pool it does not feel that large. Rooms are spacious, nice and with some Mickey ear details here and there. It's a bit frustrating that you cannot open the window. Staff everywhere is always smiling, hospitable and is very friendly which is really nice. Disney music is played in all common areas which makes you relax and at times annoyed.  This is the perfect place to stay if you're visiting Disneyland besides that the area has not much to offer. For families the pool area must be really nice - was a bit cold for the season we visited. The bar next to the pool area makes awful breakfast but really nice

Summary Heading: Great time at the Disneyland Hotel
Summary: We (myself, husband, mother, friend, and 11 year old daughter) visited the Disneyland Hotel for the first time for 3 nights in April.  We had a fabulous time!  The rooms are spacious (even for 4 adults and 1 child) and beautiful.  Loved the headboard that lit up and played music!  Location is wonderful - just a few minutes walk to both parks and Downtown Disney.  The newly renovated pool was a big hit with my daughter!  It is laid out very nicely - separate area for the cool new monorail slides, then a smaller, rectangluar pool, and a larger pool.  Poolside service was great also!  We had wonderful service from checking in at the front desk to housekeeping.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

We had a great trip to Disneyland with friends.  The hotel was really nice and the location is great.  The only problem we had was a very limited supply of warm water for showers.  This made for uncomfortable showers.  Not sure staying here is worth the money as there are plenty of shuttles from nearby hotels for free.  Well worth it if you have children who need a break from the park to swim or rest.  I would recommend staying here at least once for the experience.

Summary Heading: Rough Start But It Turned Out Well
Summary: We knew going in that Disney was charging a premium for the hotel, so we were wary of whether we would be walking into a disaster for our first time stay in DL for 3 days.  The first evening was not a good start.  We ordered room service very late at night (10:30).  We were told it would come in 30 min.  It came an hour later.  My son was having trouble eating the food, so we asked if we could get some instant rice heated -- they said they could not do so for health risk issues.  Nor could they bring us a hot pot for the same reasons.  So beware all guests who come from outside the US.  Once you stay here, it is extremely difficult to escape typical American fare -- basically anything with French Fries as a side dish...  After we started getting to know the area and learned to

Summary Heading: The Disney experience, and the feeling of the South Pacific all in one!
Summary: I had the opportunity to stay at the Disneyland Hotel twice in April 2012.  The first time was with my family (husband and daughters age 8 and 14) and the second on business.  There are three towers.  On the family vacation I stayed in the Frontier Tower facing the newly-remodeled pool area.  My 8 year old enjoyed the pool and water slides so much that she wanted to give up a day at Disneyland for it.  I didn't mind because there is a cool South Pacific vibe to the pool area, with the music, palm trees, plenty of seating (and this was Spring Break week).  The room with two queens was spacious for the four of us, very clean, and had the added Disney touch of a headboard that played a song and had "fireworks" (you have to see it).  There are two restaurants, a quick service

The newly remodeled rooms here are amazing! The headboards of the beds light up with fireworks over Sleeping Beauty Castle as A Dream is a Wish plays. Rooms are comfortable and the hotel is just minutes from both DisneyLand park and Disney California Adventure.

Summary Heading: REally worth the extra $'s what a buzz for the family !!
Summary: Disney delivered the goods. We stayed in the Adventure hotel which faces downtown Disney for 9 nights originally booked for 7 nights extended the extra 2 nights with a 4 and 5 year old in a 2x queen bed room. The check in was quick and the staff were very keen to help. The room was very clean beds  firm but soft great bed-head display with sound and lights, bathroom smaller but works well ,shower head very good. Room cleaning done extremely well , turn down service was a added sparkle to the boys finish of an evening. Best postion for the walk to Disneyland as the days there turn out to be quite long and tiresome,with the added Disney character themes in the room better for a younger family than the California down the street which is more suited to a older crowd. Was just a

A 'B' Hotel. The lobby is barren except for some seating near the windows. Nothing Disney about the lobby or the rooms. Rooms are simple, small and clean. Not worth the premium cost unless you like the convenience of walking to the park. It is nice to walk back to the room for a midday rest.

Summary Heading: Fresh and new but still classic
Summary: The rooms are still on the small side, particularly for what you pay, but the renovated hotel is just beautiful.  A modern look with the familar classic theming.  Love the wonderland chairs in the lobby, Goofy hanging around to greet the kids, and the very friendly customer service.  The pool area is beautiful, the monorail slides a big hit with the kids - although I do wish the water was a little bit warmer!  Our favorite new addition to the hotel is Trader Sam's.  Fabulous tiki bar, great themed drinks menu and music.  We stopped in several times, and had friendly, attentive service each time.  We loved taking the monorail to and from Disneyland, and the nice stroll through downtown Disney.  We had an amazing stay at the hotel and can't wait to go back.

We decided to make our 6-day trip special with reservations at the Disneyland Hotel. I stayed here when I was young and remembered the magic. I was excited to stay at the remodeled hotel. I have a family of 5 so I pay attention to room size and location. We had 2 queens and a pull-down sofa with 1-bath. The room was nice and big enough for us we knew we would compromise our accommodations for location and for us it was worth it. It was nice to walk to Downtown Disney, walk to the monorail and have a car rental company across the street for our off-site excursions to San Diego and Universal. My kids are older so it was nice to have them go to Jamba Juice on their own and know they were close by. There's also a movie theatre if you have time to catch a movie. As for the hotel, the

Summary Heading: Disneyland Hotel Made This the Best Trip Ever
Summary: Have only stayed at Disneyland Hotel for a night once before, in early 80's, but visited Disneyland several times in the past 50+ years.  Was not impressed with the hotel back then. But this was different.  Went with son, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter (5) and grandson (2).  The rooms delighted me.  We stayed  5 nights, 4 days.  The rooms were wonderfully large and comfortable to spend time in.  The housekeeping staff was wonderful.  The treatment of the children by the staff was incredible and endearing.  Everything went right.  When we went to the front desk the first night to find a local drug store, we were helped to perfection.  Goofy's Kitchen was astronomically expensive, but we all loved it; the food was really good, and the kids were thrilled by the way the
Excellent location within Downtown Disney, with a short walk to the monorail into Disneyland- amazing overall experience and beds so comfortable could have stayed forever!

Summary Heading: Expect to be downgraded if your room choice is "unavailable".
Summary: And expect to be stuck on a pull-out sofa if your room has been given away!   I was so excited to try out this newly renovated hotel and to get away for a couple days with the whole family.  Due to the number in our party (8 total) we are always sure to reserve rooms with double/queen bed configuration.   For this trip, we decided to opt for the extra half bathroom and we booked a 2 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds in each room.  The reservation assistant on the phone was very helpful and thorough.   However, upon check-in, we were told at the front desk that their suites were popular and they only had ONE suite left and it was a King suite.  When I asked how they expected 8 people to sleep on 2 king beds, I was told that the suites have pull-out sofas.   I was appalled.  I have

Summary Heading: Right next door to Trader Sams
Summary: We stayed 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel, which has beautiful remodeled rooms, is very close to downtown Disney, the monorail, and best of all is next door to the fairly-new and awesome Trader Sam's Bar (DEFINATELY A MUST SEE). My only disappointment is that this hotel has VERY NOISY plumbing. Both nights I could hear the people next to us showering and flushing the toilet. The heater is also VERY LOUD and woke me up several times during the night. Rooms were remodeled but obviously not plumbing. We went during spring break so the price was ridiculously high (almost 500.00 a night) which was not worth it! If you pay the regular nightly fee and do not mind loud noises then this is a great hotel.

I will first preface this review with, we didn’t stay here, but attended a wedding and wedding reception at the Disneyland Hotel (we stayed at another hotel).  First, the wedding was beautiful and WELL coordinated by the hotel staff, since it was an outdoor wedding (including Cinderella’s horse drawn carriage) .  The wedding was efficient and beautiful.  The reception, held in one of the banquet rooms, was excellent.  The food served was beyond expectation.  Usually at hotel events, that are catered by the hotel, the food is “run of the mill”.  Not the case here.  The Filet Mignon was one of the finest I’ve had at any restaurant.  Can’t say enough about the food and staff that supported the reception.

This is our fourth visit to a Disneyland hotel (Grand, Paradise Pier, Aulani) and our second favorite (Hard to beat Aulani)! My daughter was charmed by the headboard fireworks and music, and played it many times during our two day stay. Fireworks visible from the park in our bedroom were perfect, since we did not go into the park our first day. The pool was enjoyed by all! Just a short wait on the "super cool" waterside (in the words of a 9yr old non-adventurist). LOVED all the retro Disney touches, which is my absolute favorite era of Disney. From the huge original map in the entrance, the tea cup seats in the lobby, disney carpets and lamps, it was classically displayed. Thanks to early entrance (both parks - make sure to get your fast pass to WOC), monorail and Downtown

Disney has recently remodeled the Disneyland Hotel and it is great!  The rooms are large, clean and have many great details classic for Disney.  The hotel is steps away from Downtown Disney and the Monorail.

We just returned from 4 nights at the Disneyland Hotel and couldn't be happier.  Normally we stay at the Grand California but I feel that the rooms there are a bit tired.  Was reticent about the Disneyland Hotel as it is a bit further from the Park.  In the end, the walk through Downtown Disney or taking the Monorail into Disneyland was no big deal.  The pools at the hotel are amazing.  MUCH better than the Grand California.  My 4,10 and 12 year old children all had something to do at the pool.  Also,  the new casual restaurant was excellent.  The Chinese  chicken salad as well as the kid's salmon were great.  Highly recommend the Disneyland Hotel. My only complaint was that the air vent blew directly on the bed which was a problem.

My husband and I stayed at the DL hotel a couple of years ago and absolutely love the decor, ambiance and location! The rooms have these amazing pictures that light up and are animated and we would fall asleep looking over the park and "turn our pictures on" which doubled as night lights. It is TOTALLY worth it to stay on property-- as long as you get a room when they are not $400/night. ;)   The pool is great, the restaurants are great and the location can't be beat for Disney. I wouldn't want to stay anyplace else! (and unfortunately have, which is why I know this hotel trumps every other.)

We stayed at the Disneyland Resort during our trip to Disneyland. The hotel and staff were exceptional! They made you feel like you were their most important guest even though there were hundreds of our people there. Also, by staying at the resort we had the advantage of getting into the park early and also the convenience of coming back during the day if we needed something. Definitely worth exploring if you are considering going to Disneyland.

First and foremost, we would like to Thank you Yvette(I hope it's the right person)whom helped us retrieved our yr old back pack that hold hs beloved Teddy bear and it left behind in the Blue Super Suttle bus from Lax airport when the driver dropbus off at the Hotel after a14hrs long flight from Sydney... Upon check in, we were greeted by a lovely receptionist and got our room right away, we even had a photo with Goofy..Mickey must ave been still asleep hahaha.. We were in the Fantasy tower rm 2620 facing the pool and the room were immaculate.. From the details to the cleanliness..very impressed..most of all, we couldn't even hear the nightly fire works nor the elevators that just next to our room!!.. The newly renovated pool was a dream come true for a family traveling with an

My husband, 3 year old son and myself have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel twice now.  First off, it is expensive for those not accustomed to paying over a certain amount of money.  I'm not saying that to offend anyone, because I consider myself to be in that group of people and I generally try to find the cheapest room possible when we go to Disneyland.  With that being said, we saved our pennies the last two years to be able to experience this resort hotel just once.  And I am so glad we did.  Our first stay was in September of 2011 for my birthday and my son's birthday.  We generally go Labor Day weekend because of our work schedules and the resort is crowded due to the 1/2 marathon.  The hotel was still under renovation, but we never experienced any problems due to this.  The

One morning, before we went to the park, we hung out at the pool.  It was wonderful.  Not to busy but enough children for my granddaughter to meet a new friend.  My daughter and I sat under a umbrella at a table and had a drink.  At least three lifeguards on duty and they were paying attention to the kids.  Private cabanas you could rent by the hour , they looked lovely.  Several table and chair sets and plenty of chaise loungers to enjoy.  Our room had two queen size beds and a couch that pulled out to make a double size bed.  Good size bathroom.  Very quite except at 9 oclock or so every evening the fireworks would go off.  (In the park)  We just walked out the front door and we were on Disneyland Main Street.  Well worth the money, just having not to drive into the park and

Summary Heading: What's new and updated seems old and sad...
Summary: I love Disneyland and I use to dream of growing up and being able to stay at the Disneyland Hotel. Now after it's so called extensive renovation I was sadly disappointed. We stayed in a concierge level room and the NEW look just seems very dated and simple. Why can't this hotel try a 4 star standard and take it up a few notches?? The new pool area is clean but lacks any Disney magic...the monorails as a center piece???? The food at the concierge lounge was horrible and I spent one night hurling after what was some strange mushroom pastry. The new Trader Vics was also a bad experience with the worst service ever. I will tell you that check in was a snap, the rest of the staff other than Trader Vics was great. I miss the magic of the hotel, the koi are gone, the fun is gone, and

coming from a 12 hour flight and arriving 9am, i was surprised to find the room ready. What a beautiful hotel. the room overlooked the pool and was quite large. very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

too expensive to do very often but staying in the disney hotel is a great oncer particularly with our young child. The easy access to the parks enabled us to go early, return to the pool during the heat of the day and then go out again in late afternoon. The newer parts of the hotel are much better than the older parts that look a bit tired.

I stayed here in January 2012 and was surprised at how, well, "ordinary" it was.  That is, in spite of the "mice" everywhere (bathtubs, lamps, the mouse is watching you), the room was just not that big a deal.  Woops--forgot that headboard, though, that lights up and plays music.  I suppose some kids would find it a hoot, but I figure for the money you're shelling out, there are other ways to spend it.  Service was great, but like I said, it's just sorta average.  If you're going to spend your money--SPEND IT ON THE GRAND CALIFORNIAN, from my perspective.

Our room was large with two queen beds and a portable crib.  Their rooms sleep five.  The headboard lights up and plays music.  Our room faced the parking lot, but we could see the fireworks at night.  The lobby had drinks and snacks out each time we passed through.  There were multiple restaurants and two gift shops.  The location is perfect, steps away from the monorail.  The pool is heated year round.

One of only 3 Disney Resorts, this is the mid-priced choice.  It offers the Disney theme that is expected from the Disney World resorts.  Hidden Mickeys, Mickey shaped faucet handles, and an UNBELIEVABLE Disney themed headboard.  The headboard has built-in LEDs and is wood carved.  Very clean room and a large, practical bathroom.  There are 3 towers of hotels, very large heated pool with a slide.  Nice Tiki Bar with great theme.  Only a 15 min casual walk thru Downtown Disney to get to the parks.  Is not as big as the Californian, but you don't feel lost either.

I took my 4-yr old grandson, my 2 daughters and husband for a little trip to Disneyland and decided to spend the night. I was so glad that we did and I am glad we chose the Disneyland Hotel vs the Grand Calfornian and Paradise Pier. I carefully researched all 3 before making my decision. What I liked about the hotel when I arrived was the customer service from the front desk agent. He was very detailed about the hotel amenities and answered all of our questions thoroughly. The room was more than adequate for our party of 5. There were 2 queen beds and a pull out trundle. The bathroom was a little small but it was not a deal breaker. The room was clean. The headboard had a nice little lighting feature that my grandson loved. It had fireworks over the Disneyland palace. (cool) I

the location is obviously great, the pool is well structured but extremely crowded, the rooms were not disney clean and they were extremely noisy, with sounds from the outside, the adjacent elevator and upstairs

Wow- I was so impressed! I'm a convert- wont be staying anywhere else . Normally we stay at the Marriott or Hyatt when we visit Disneyland, CA. I didn't realize the benefits to this resort: very close- quick walk to monorail and voila! We took short breaks from the crowds and jumped in their pools and headed back for fun minutes away. Newly refurbished rooms were very nice. Lots of Mickey touches throughout.  Kids met at least four characters in the hotel lobby- no wait- before we even checked in!  Biggest unknown bonus- 24 hour nurse on call- I got an allergic reaction to who knows what while at the park and the first aid staff informed me that because I was at a Disney resort I have full access to them if needed. With children this is a huge bonus!  Very impressed with all

Summary Heading: They paved Neverland and put up a Marriott
