Summary: I fell in love with the Disneyland Hotel the first time I stayed there 12 years ago and since then would only stay there when we went to Disneyland twice a year. With a heavy heart we realized we probably won't stay there again now. The hotel was always pricey but you go to Disneyland to be in the magic, and staying at the hotel let you stay in the magic so it was worth it, but sadly that's not true anymore. Since the remodel all the warmth and charm and magic are gone, the prices are double, and the look now is antiseptic and charmless. A friend of mine (a lifelong Disney fan for 52 years) came to meet us there and summed it up this way, "It could be anywhere. It just looks corporate." They don't even have coffee out in the morning anymore. The night before we spent $50 at a

Summary Heading: A Great Event at a Terrific Resort
Summary: I coordinate an educational seminar for a non-profit association two times yearly - one in Southern California and the other in Northern California.  We have had our event at the Disneyland Hotel for 4 years now, with the last event being March 12th and 13th of this year, 2012.  It was truly magnificent.  The banquet staff is amazing and the food quality wonderful and fun!  Imagine a snack of Mickey chocolate rice krispy treats!  The AV group is very responsive and we've had the same av tech for the 4th time and he anticipates all of our needs.  They've remodeled since our event last year, and everything is gleaming.  Of course, we're right at Downtown Disney, so restaurants for meals surrounding our event are easy and good quality, too! Our event Manager, Rich, is always easy
This is a great hotel. We stayed during construction which was a bit difficult as far as getting between the buildings but it was manageable. The kids had a great time in one of the renovated rooms.

We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for three nights at the end of Feb. 2012.  It has been many years since we stayed at this hotel, and we were not sure what to expect.  Our kids 14 years, 13 years and 9 years all had a great time.  Our room was updated and magically decorated with Tinkerbell lights and music, a really cute touch which our 9-year-old loved.  The room was clean and spacious.  We had two queen beds and a sofa bed.  No complaints from anyone.  The kids enjoyed the pool and waterslide.  The kids only complaint was that the waterslide has somewhat limited hours so you can't really go to a park and enjoy the waterslide in the same day.  Also, we weren't able to eat at Goofy's Kitchen on the hotel property because I didn't knnow to book ahead.  Not a huge deal for my

Summary Heading: Awesome family hotel, wish the rooms were a little bigger
Summary: We just returned from a four night stay at Disneyland hotel.  It was a must stay if you are going with kids to the theme park.   It is worth the extra money for the location and between 1 pm and 4 pm the characters are in the hotel lobby.  The kids loved it.   I have a 6 and 2 year old and the pool area is very well supervised with life jackets for the smaller ones who want to venture down the monorail slide.  We went to goofys breakfast one morning and it was great.  The characters come to your table.    The only thing that is an issue is the size of the rooms.  There is not enough closet space to store luggage and the rooms are small for a family of four.  Beds were very comfortable.   I stayed in the frontier tower upper floor and every night we were able to see the fireworks

We just returned from a 3 night stay at the DL Hotel and could not have been more pleased.  Our family has been to WDW numerous times and stayed at many of the resorts there.  I have to say the renovated DL Hotel is my new favorite.  The Disney theme of this hotel is carried out perfectly and if you are a Disney history buff you will really enjoy it.  Everything is modern and clean.  The pool is fantastic for kids.  We loved being able to walk right out of our room in the Adventure tower and be in Downtown Disney and a short stroll to DL and DCA.   We ate at Goofy's Kitchen for breakfast on our last morning and it was great also.  Highly recommend the DL Hotel.

Summary Heading: Small room, nice to have everything new.
Summary: My husband, two children and I stayed three nights in February.  The rooms have recently been renovated and are clean and comfortable.  Our room was very small but fortunately we didn't spend much time in it.  The pool is great and heated.  The hotel is farther than we expected from the entrance and was quite a trek at the end of the day! (the monorail was out of service while we were there so perhaps it's easier when it is running?) Considering the distance and the price for such a small room we probably won't stay here next time.

Summary Heading: Worth the price! Great for kids!!!
Summary: I have wanted to stay at the Disneyland hotel for years. Yet I would see how much more it cost vs. value hotels and would decide to save the money. However this year after much debate & reviews we decided to give it a try. I am so glad we did. We ended up spending $800 more for a 3 night stay vs. the cost of a value brand hotel- but it was totally worth it.   We checked in on a Sunday. They were 100% booked, but when I checked in I was upgraded because they had availablility.  Our room wasn't ready until 5:00 p.m. which was a little inconvient because we had dinner reservations at 5:20 at Goofy's kitchen & we wanted to get cleaned up ahead of time.  They did however issue our key cards & allow us to use pool etc.   We brought our 10,8 & 3 1/2 year old. They loved the pool. My 3

My husband, 8 year old daughter and I stayed one night at Disneyland Hotel in March 2012. In short, the hotel lived up to our expectations and delivered reasonable value for money. Given we only stayed a night we wanted a hotel that was well positioned to the theme parks, clean, comfortable beds and had that DIsney feeling...and it did! The renovation has hit the mark in terms of offering contemporary amenities and facilities.  The hotel upgraded our room, offered us extra fast passes and was obliging in every sense. While we prefer a more intimate style of hotel normally (the hotel is large), Disneyland Hotel serves its purpose well. While we didn't use the pool -the weather was cold and raining, I can imagine it would be wonderful if the weather was fine and you were staying

Great to stay so close to the park. We paid for upgrade to deluxe room. Nice room, but smaller than appears in pictures, and no table for in room meals. Regardless, the service and staff (cast members) are exceptional! If you can swing it, it's worth staying in the Disney complex.

Summary Heading: Very nice but far from the parks
Summary: We stayed in a refurbished room here. The room was fantastic; a real treat for my daughters. Loved teh bedtime stories for kids on the TV. Pool area was great. It was a surprisingly long trek to the parks though, and for that reason, we now choose to stay at a closer hotel on Harbor Blvd. given the price of this hotel. But if you want some Disney magic, it certainly has that in spades. If the prices were close, I would advise that people stay at the GCH due to its proximity to the parks.

The updated room was very stylish and spacious, and the beds were incredibly comfortable.  The amenities allowed for the perfect marriage of my business trip with a fun get away for the kids (the pool and waterside were a big hit).  The staff was very attentive and helpful.  We will definitely be staying there again!

Summary Heading: Looks can be deceiving! Disneyland Hotel has a lot to learn from Bigger Hotel chains!
Summary: We live in Chicago, and my husband had a conference in Feb at the Anaheim Hilton Convention Center and I thought it would be nice to combine his business trip with a family vacation (we have 3 & 5 year old girls.) We stayed 3 nights and I went there expecting the best of the best staying at the Disneyland Hotel-mind you, I grew up in Los Angeles but had never stayed at the resort.   When we first arrived at the hotel, we were NOT greeted or approached by any bellman/valet attendant.  In fact, after checking into the hotel, I had to search for someone to help us with our luggage (10 minutes too long!)  Our room was beautiful and recently updated and we had a great view of the swimming pool but looks can be very deceiving!  Since My husband was there for work, he couldn't be more

I stayed here while attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.  The hotel is in a wonderful location for family vacations as it's at the entrance of Downtown Disney.  The room was updated, clean, and spacious (I stayed in the Frontier building).  For those traveling with babies, a Pack-n-Play was provided automatically (left in the closet).  My purpose of travel was business.  The only place to get a full breakfast was "Goofys Kitchen", which is character dining.  This would have been great if I wasn't on business and with my children.  With that said, the dinner options are good-- Steakhouse was really nice.

The recent renovation has really brought this hotel back to its former glory.  The rooms are beautifully furnished and the redesigned pool area is terrific.  We loved all the Disney touches - the much talked about headboard, the Mickey faucet handles, the Mickey and Goofy chocolate coins at turn down, etc.  But we most loved the two major benefits that came with the room - the proximity to the parks and early morning entry.  On a day that the crowds are 10 out of 10, being able to get in early and then easily escape for a little afternoon rest were priceless.  Now about price, this all does not come cheap.  But surprisingly since Disney rarely loses out on an opportunity to make money, there were some nice free benefits.  (And let me revise this to be fair to Disney, I think

Had a two night stay at this newly renovated property in the Adventure tower.  Had a 5th floor room with two queen beds.  This hotel is very comfortable and beautiful, I've stayed here several times ages ago with family for Disneyland visits but I didn't realize how perfect it is for business travelers as well.  We just finished a corporate retreat here and it couldn't be more perfect.  You can easily and safely walk to several nightspots in Downtown Disney and the hotel itself has some great options for socializing in the evening.  With all the families and small children in the hotel, I couldn't hear anything from inside my room.  Of course, if you do have children, this is the perfect hotel to stay at for visiting the Disney parks.  The pool area is wonderful.

Summary Heading: Classic Disney hospitality in a beautiful setting!
Summary: Just got back from a wonderful stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. The pool area is awesome and service is unmatched! All this comes at a steep price, but is definitely worth it if you can afford to stay there.

Summary Heading: The Best place to stay in the Area
Summary: You want to stay close to Disneyland so that you can get the best out of your time, so the Disneyland Hotel is the best choice. You get magic hours- early entry. You get walking distance to the parks. Stay in the premium tower on the Concierge level with a resort view and you will see the fireworks (If they have them - there were issue in December when we were there - and New Year's Eve had a Pea Soup fog that allowed us to hear the fireworks, but not see them! Ask anyone who was there it was black humour at its best considering Disney had been saving money and not having fireworks for the week in the lead up!)  The New decor is gorgeous. There is a castle on the bed head with a light and music attachment to the light switch - very cute. The colours are way better. The "A Dream

Just completed our first stay at the Disneyland Resort Hotel in CA 3/5/12 to 3/7/12 2 adults, 2 children(3yrs and 6months) Hotel Staff was great from the moment we stepped from our vehicle. We booked the Standard room and asked for an upgrade if possible and was given a DOUBLE upgrade to 9th floor with pool view in Fantasy Tower #2712. Room had 2 Queen even though I had asked for a King but that was the trade off for the upgrade and we were glad we did it. Loved the decor and slight Disney(Mickey) touches around the room. Kids(and Mom and Dad) loved the headboard. Complaint..Complimentary soap and lotion were nearly impossible to get out of bottle...and could they possible get a louder toilet? It was impossible to flush at night unless we wanted to wake up the kids!  Would

Stayed at The Disneyland Hotel in February and it was great.  The location was perfect, rooms were nice and the food was good.  I highly recommend staying on property at Disneyland, as opposed to a good neighbor hotel.  There are lots of great perks and you don't spend all day going back and forth on a shuttle.  The theming at this hotel is great, especially if you are a fan of Disney!!

Arriving at the Hotel we were greeted warmly and professionally, check in was efficient and speedy.  My room was comfortable.  It looks to me like they must have just renovated because the room was really fresh.  I was attending a meeting during my visit and I would say that for a corporate meeting it was fine.  The meeting room was well organized and the staff was inconspicuous.  I had asked for vegan options for my meal and it they didn’t make an adjustment to the offerings, so I was a bit hungry throughout the two day event.  I am confident the meeting planner had asked for this because we talked about it during the meeting and she said she wasn’t sure why they didn’t make accommodations for this, it happened both morning for breakfast, but lunch went okay.  Other than that

Awesome!! We decided to take the kids (again) overnight to Disneyland. Booked this hotel over the Calif Grand due to the last two (very disappointing) visits to Calif Grand Hotel.  From the minute we pulled in, we were excited to be there. The staff was so accommodating, the room was fabulous,  new and super clean! Beds comfy as well. Easy access to Disneyland and a plus with monorail right there. Got extra fast passes from hotel which was really a plus when visiting on a weekend. Self parking easy, and check in and out so simple. Will def be back to stay again. Great, great service!!!
Stayed here for the 24 hour Disney day. It was so great. Everything you'd expect. Loved it. Would stay again.

We decided to participate in the One More Day Celebration on Leap Day. Considering that we planned to stay in the park till 6am, choosing this hotel was worth every penny. One of the member in my party is disabled and has limited ambulation. We called the hotel before arriving and they had a scooter ready for us at check in. The monorail is currently down so considering the walk required to the main gate would have not been possible without the scooter. The rooms are clean, well kept, and the staff went over the top to make our one night stay memorable. We had a basic room on the 8th floor facing the parking lot and it did not make a difference in my opinion. The toiletries are of good quality and plenty of towels were supplied.
